excerpts: so we ended up ordering Tempura Style Coconut Prawns, Thanh Long Mussels, the Roast Crab and Garlic Noodles.
The Prawns were ok.
Nothing that blew me away.
The Mussels; however,  were delicious.
I would definitely order that again for an appetizer.
The Roast Crab...
O M G!
That was the BEST crab I have ever had!
I'm not really too sure what all the spices they use
but it was heaven.
The crab meat was so tender and flavorful.
tempura style coconut prawns.author: Kevin G.
tempura style coconut prawns.review:
So, last week I was planning on driving to Austin, Texas for some barbecue and I get a phone call from my sister asking me what I was up to.  She asked me if I wanted to take a one day trip to San Francisco.  "Heck yea!", I told her.  I haven't been to SF in years.  Now, I had my heart set on going to House of Prime Rib but they were booked a month in advance.  But, I had remembered seeing Thanh Long featured on either the Travel or Food Channel weeks beforehand so I tried booking a reservation online.  Sadly, there was nothing available so I called the restaurant and got a reservation!

I viewed the menu online and browsed through the photos on Yelp beforehand.  I knew I wanted to order the Thanh Long Mussels and An's Famous Garlic Noodles.  I was up in the air on the Dungeness Crab because I knew it would be rather pricey.

We arrived at 5:30 that night and was promptly seated to our table.  We looked around and noticed that every table was having the crab so we asked our server what the market price was ($53.95 as of October 8th).  We figured we would not be back to SF for awhile so we ended up ordering Tempura Style Coconut Prawns, Thanh Long Mussels, the Roast Crab and Garlic Noodles.  The Prawns were ok.  Nothing that blew me away.  The Mussels; however,  were delicious.  I would definitely order that again for an appetizer.  The Roast Crab...O M G!  That was the BEST crab I have ever had!  I'm not really too sure what all the spices they use but it was heaven.  The crab meat was so tender and flavorful.  And the Garlic Noodles may not look like much when it arrives to your table, but once you take a bite you will not be able to stop slurping those noodles.  Mix it with the sauce from the crab and it tastes even better!  

The service here is top notch!  They kept checking back with us to see how everything was and constantly refilled our drinks (soda and iced tea).  I would definitely recommend and come back here for dinner.  Anyone who has rated this place below 5 stars is absolutely nuts.  Thanh Long is on point!

excerpts: Tempura Style Coconut Prawns (3/5).
These were not so much the Japanese style tempura (corn starch batter) that you might have had but more coconut shaving encrusted large prawns.
There were 5 and were good
tempura style coconut prawns.author: Glenn H.
tempura style coconut prawns.review:
4.5 stars. Minus a half a star for the value of some of the items but overall a terrific night out.

This is a prize of a place. Comfortable setting, great service, excellent quality food and, while maybe spend-y, is worth a look.

For our New Years eve dinner there we four had reservations (needed given the size of the place) at 8 PM. We started the night with two appetizers:

1. Tempura Style Coconut Prawns (3/5). These were not so much the Japanese style tempura (corn starch batter) that you might have had but more coconut shaving encrusted large prawns. There were 5 and were good but, if I had to go again, not a must have.

2. Dungeness Crab Puffs (4/5). These were 6, small, perfectly deep fried, wonton-skin wrapped pillows of Dungeness crab filling that were so much better than the typical Crab Rangoon's that you might have had elsewhere. They came with two dipping sauces, the better one was the sweet mustard. This was a nice, if pricey, treat and a good start to the entrees. 

Four entrees:

1. Roasted Crab (4/5): this smelled wonderful as it came out and was a large, already cut up Dungeness crab, with the carapace shell. It was meaty and perfectly done with the garlic sauce. Really glad we tried this. I like crab but it isn't a must have for me. My table-mates really like it. Market price was almost $40 each.

2. Shaken Beef (5/5): very tender tasty cubes of beef (not well done, if that's important to you) that was marinated in a lightly sweet sauce, served with potato cubes that had also been marinated in the same dark sauce and grilled; all of this served over tender bay greens. Delicious! Everyone liked this dish. The Rice and Roll's Hunan Grilled Butter Beef was very comparable (and less expensive) than this dish but this was still a winning dish. And I need to mention the tender-crisp cuts of sweet Vidalia (that's my guess) onions that were served with this dish, they were great in their own right and really added dimension to the beef.

3. Seafood Combination (Scallops, prawns, Dungeness crab) Fried rice (6/5): if there was one dish that stood out from all of them, it was this dish. A simple, (even unimpressive) looking fried rice dish that just blew people away with its wok-seared taste and awesome flavors. Fried rice, yes. But extraordinary? For a mere $16 Absolutely!

4. Colossal Royal Tiger Prawns (5/5): 4 large butterflied and perfectly grilled in the shell prawns that were served over a bed of their famously delicious garlic noodles. Yeah this was a splurge, at almost $10 a prawn, this was expensive but very (very) good and to be served over the deservedly vaunted garlic noodles, this was a plus. We didn't have to order the Garlic Noodles as an entree because of this, and the waiter was smart enough to understand this by ignoring our order for these Prawns PLUS a Garlic Noodle order. The prawns did have a tendency to stick to their shells, but they were perfectly done and marinated in some fantastic sauce to make them outstanding.

The Garlic noodles had the perfect consistency of Yee Noodles, http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yi_mein, which gives them an extra nice bite and appear to absorb the flavors better. They are also pricey. The Garlic Noodles by themselves were $9.50 an order, which seems a bit high for lo mein noodles and garlic, but if they are Yee noodles, they would be more fairly priced. Everyone at the table loved these. 

Three deserts: 

Creme Brulee (3/5): this was an OK rendition of Creme Brulee, not bad but not up to the standards of the rest of the meal. Nothing really special.

Chocolate Lava Cake (5/5): Oh yeah! This chocolate delight was the size of a very small hockey puck served with a large scoop of vanilla ice cream over a pool of Grand Marnier & melted vanilla ice cream. It was pricey ($9) but oh so very wonderful to have that rich oozing chocolate goodness.

Fried Banana Fritters a la Mode. (5/5): 2 fritters (your choice of pineapple or banana) served with that same scoop of dense vanilla ice cream. Love, Love, Love this simple but wonderful desert.

It was almost a perfect amount of food for 4 with each of us full to the neck and almost giddy from the great food experience.

While the restaurant was crowded, it never seemed loud or noisy and the service was spot-on: unobtrusive, available, and very polite.

With tip we were at about $50 per person without drinks (which included one modestly iced tea for $2.50).

Loved it and would eagerly go again for a special occasion!

excerpts: That's how I felt because I wanted to venture out and try their TEMPURA STYLE COCONUT PRAWNS.
It was very "ehh".
I've definitely had better.
The BANANA CAKE we had for dessert was good though!
tempura style coconut prawns.author: AngeLin V.
tempura style coconut prawns.review:
ROAST CRAB + GARLIC NOODLES

So simple yet soooo mouth-watering delicious! They're only famously known for this combo! Don't mess with the formula or you'll want to kick yourself in the buttocks for ordering something else.

That's how I felt because I wanted to venture out and try their TEMPURA STYLE COCONUT PRAWNS. It was very "ehh". I've definitely had better. The BANANA CAKE we had for dessert was good though! It was a nice modern twist on a traditional Vietnamese dessert.

We went here last Valentine's Day and was squished in like sardines because the tiny place was packed! You'll feel like you're eating and chatting with the neighboring tables. Making a reservation and arriving early is a must! Eating crab can also get pretty messy so dress for the occasion.

Oh how I miss the taste of garlicy goodness and daydream of the moment we shall meet each other again...

excerpts: We also had the Tempura Style Coconut Prawns appetizer which was fantastic.
We were out of season in May for crab (apparently crab season is only during months that have an "R" in them), but it was still fresh tasting with large pieces of meat.
Too pricey for me at $35 a crab, but spouse would do it again in a heartbeat.
In fact, she is arranging to get her crab fan family up there asap.
tempura style coconut prawns.author: Thighmaster M.
tempura style coconut prawns.review: If you are a crab fan. Must go. We tried the Roast Crab and the Drunken Crab. The former was both our favorite - heavy on the garlic, quite tasty. We also had the Tempura Style Coconut Prawns appetizer which was fantastic. We were out of season in May for crab (apparently crab season is only during months that have an "R" in them), but it was still fresh tasting with large pieces of meat. Too pricey for me at $35 a crab, but spouse would do it again in a heartbeat. In fact, she is arranging to get her crab fan family up there asap.

excerpts: Next time I need to try the shaking beef and the salmon carpaccio.
Save room for dessert if you can...the creme brûlée was a nice last touch on an amazing dinner!
Don't forget to reserve a table through the trusty Yelp Ap!
They also have valet parking.
salmon carpaccio.author: Maea B.
salmon carpaccio.review:
First Time....but definitely NOT the last time! A simple yet complex menu with Vietnamese inspired dishes ranging from seafood, beef, chicken and pork. The main event is their roasted crabs. One giant gorgeous crustacean carefully prepared for you and brought out in a plate and served with a bib. It's a truly a beautiful sight! The garlic noodles are another big hit, soft and garlic pungent. Tiger prawns are butterflied and delightfully seasoned with spices. My pork and shrimp dish was elegant and hearty. It paired with green onions and spinach in a soy broth. The Fried calamari was lightly battered and tender. 
Next time I need to try the shaking beef and the salmon carpaccio. Save room for dessert if you can...the creme brûlée was a nice last touch on an amazing dinner! Don't forget to reserve a table through the trusty Yelp Ap! They also have valet parking.

excerpts: I ordered their mussels as a starter too since they ran out of the salmon carpaccio and they were ok.
salmon carpaccio.author: Shelly W.
salmon carpaccio.review:
I never thought I could eat an entire crab by myself, that is until I came to Thanh Long! Thanh Long makes me remember why I am such a huge seafood person. 

We came here as my brother was celebrating a promotion!  Get here early though, they can get pretty busy and when I got here at 6:30, we took one of their last open tables. This is with being open for only an hour and a half on a Saturday! 

All I can say is GET THE ROAST CRAB WITH THE GARLIC NOODLES!! I ordered their mussels as a starter too since they ran out of the salmon carpaccio and they were ok. The crostini was probably the best part because it was perfectly toasted. 

Now, onto the crab ($50)....it melts in your mouth and pairs extremely well with the garlic noodles. I honestly didn't even talk during dinner because I was too busy enjoying the food. 

Service was good and fast. They also give you warm towels to wipe your hands after the meal. Total bill with 2 crabs, an order of garlic noodles, mussels and shaking beef came out to $170! Until next time

excerpts: Salmon Carpaccio, you can probably skip on, it's definitely not the best
but it's not terrible either.
salmon carpaccio.author: CJ B.
salmon carpaccio.review:
I love this restaurant! We came here when we were in town and loved almost everything we had. The mussels are done to a perfection and the crostini adds a bit more to the dish that complements the mussels. 

The garlic noodles....oh where do I start, it seems so simple yet its probably one of the best items on the menu. It's literally a plate of noodles, nothing else on the plate, but that's pretty much all you need.

Salmon Carpaccio, you can probably skip on, it's definitely not the best but it's not terrible either. Then the shaken beef....it's not bad either but I definitely not worth $25.95 at all. The portion is rather small....we ordered that thinking we could share it but definitely not enough for more than one adult. 

I'm pretty sure there were 3 different ways you can get the crab done, make sure you get the roast crab! And get ready to get all greasy and dirty! It will be worth every bite!

excerpts: We started with the salmon carpaccio and the shrimp toast.
The salmon was sliced thinly enough to hold full flavor and the citrus hit was perfect.
The shrimp toast was pillow goodness.
salmon carpaccio.author: Truc N.
salmon carpaccio.review:
On the night of the full moon, we ventured out of the city. We drove towards the setting sun, passing many other good lookin' eateries, promised a crab coma experience...

We entered a simple door. The garlic pervaded everything. It was the kind that made you hungry, newly fried garlic that makes your mouth water. All around, people sat with plastic bibs! The group of diners to my left were happily passing around the famous noodles. The couple in front of me finished ordering and started to tie back their hair. An odd thing to do, but soon I'd fully understand.

I glanced down at the menu and inhaled the garlic permeating the air, agreeing it was worth the trip from downtown to the other side to eat at Thanh Long. My hometown, Nha Trang, was even labeled on the menu cover. :-) Then, the waiters tied a bib on me and walked away with a knowing look. We started with the salmon carpaccio and the shrimp toast. The salmon was sliced thinly enough to hold full flavor and the citrus hit was perfect. The shrimp toast was pillow goodness. The topping reminded me of the shrimp paste around sugar cane.

Then the garlic noodles! So good! Best when eaten hot, so get it on your plate then into your belly fast. The noodles were a nice chewy texture and a subtle garlic flavor that was nothing as powerful as its garlic aroma. Then again, you're hit with garlic the moment you walk in.

Then...THE CRAB! Some of the best Dungeoness crab I've ever eaten. My table ordered the roasted crab and tamarind crab. Very different. Very satisfying. I paused for a split second to be thankful all my hair was already tied up. No one at my table ate their crab carapaces, so this Vietnamese gal was in heaven with five all to herself! Then, we went garlic crazy and ordered garlic fried rice. The tamarind crab went great with it.

After all this, I had a disappointing fried banana. Others had the orange sherbet and the molten lava cake and enjoyed their desserts. My fried banana had no hint of a sugar finish...brown, white, nor palm. The banana was no where near sweet enough to carry it. 

But, I went for the crab, not the dessert. So, high ratings from me.

excerpts: For the 3 of us we ordered salmon carpaccio, Royal prawns, garlic noodles and 2 garlic roasted crabs.
Salmon Carpaccio:
It was served over the garlic noodles so you would think it is purely a fork and knife dish.
Garlic Noodles:
salmon carpaccio.author: Kate A.
salmon carpaccio.review:
I wish I could dig deep down and give Thanh Long 5 stars, but I just can't. 

For the 3 of us we ordered salmon carpaccio, Royal prawns, garlic noodles and 2 garlic roasted crabs. 

Salmon Carpaccio: Amazingly fresh, but the raw red onions kind of overpowered the entire dish. 

Royal Prawns: The prawns were delicious, but I didn't expect to have to peel the shell off the shrimp. It was served over the garlic noodles so you would think it is purely a fork and knife dish. 

Garlic Noodles: Tasted great the second they hit the table, but as they cooled down they did get a bit bland. 

Roasted Garlic Crab: I can not personally attest to this, as I am allergic to crab, but from what locals/patrons say it is overpriced. Keeping in mind how much crab legs cost at a restaurant makes it seem fairly priced, but I am eager to try other similar restaurants with my family. 

Service was prompt and friendly but nothing to write home about.

excerpts: We had the salmon carpaccio, and dungeness crab puffs to start.
Both were very yummy but the salmon carpaccio was my favorite dish of the whole night.
Perfectly seasoned and very light.
salmon carpaccio.author: Joanne L.
salmon carpaccio.review:
I've heard so many good things about Thanh Long so it's been on my list of places to try for a very long time. 

Called in around 8:30 on Friday night to make reservations because I knew there would probably be a wait, super last minute but worth the try! Luckily they had an opening at 9:30 so we took it. Once we arrived we immediately got seated. 

I know they're known for their crabs, but my friend and I didn't feel like getting our hands dirty so we opted for their other dishes. We had the salmon carpaccio, and dungeness crab puffs to start. Both were very yummy but the salmon carpaccio was my favorite dish of the whole night. Perfectly seasoned and very light. We then had the shaken beef and colossal royal tiger prawns. Again, both were so flavorful and good. The shaken beef was tender and the potatoes and bed of lettuce was a nice touch. The tiger prawns comes with a bed of their garlic noodles. Personally it wasn't the best I ever had but it was still good. 

Service was top notch. We ordered a bottle of wine and they were always making sure our glasses weren't empty. I'll definitely be back to try their crabs soon.

excerpts: For appetizers, we had the chicken satay (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/z9CN58fSrA46ggyb6OnCnQ?select=XH78FALuoyCY-PemWsm18g) and salmon carpaccio (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/z9CN58fSrA46ggyb6OnCnQ?select=g2SQ3ayDT3W9Fm9seQQEVw).
The chicken satay was pretty disappointing--three skewers of grilled chicken came out on a plate with no dipping sauce.
The chicken was a little on the dry side and it tasted really bland.
Usually when I eat chicken satay, it is always served with a side of satay peanut sauce for dipping.
Oh well, the tasty salmon carpaccio made up for the disappointment.
I love refreshing dishes like the salmon carpaccio, as the flavors of the simple ingredients are truly highlighted.
salmon carpaccio.author: Lien T.
salmon carpaccio.review:
Yep, you've guessed it...my boyfriend and I came to Thanh Long because we heard about their famous roast crab and garlic noodles!

We arrived shortly after they opened at 5pm and there was no wait. Once we were seated, we noticed the full bar and decided to order a couple of drinks to start off our night. I ordered the fleur de mango and the boyfriend ordered the Hanoi sunset (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/z9CN58fSrA46ggyb6OnCnQ?select=5AnN3N7w7JTwsWHvz8rcug). The fleur de mango was really good. The rum flavor was subtle and masked by the freshly blended orange juice and sweet mango puree. I had a sip of the Hanoi sunset and it tasted ridiculously strong. It tasted as though I was sipping on a straight shot of alcohol. My boyfriend shared the same feelings--he had to force himself to chug down the alcohol laden martini.

For appetizers, we had the chicken satay (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/z9CN58fSrA46ggyb6OnCnQ?select=XH78FALuoyCY-PemWsm18g) and salmon carpaccio (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/z9CN58fSrA46ggyb6OnCnQ?select=g2SQ3ayDT3W9Fm9seQQEVw). The chicken satay was pretty disappointing--three skewers of grilled chicken came out on a plate with no dipping sauce. The chicken was a little on the dry side and it tasted really bland. Usually when I eat chicken satay, it is always served with a side of satay peanut sauce for dipping. Oh well, the tasty salmon carpaccio made up for the disappointment. I love refreshing dishes like the salmon carpaccio, as the flavors of the simple ingredients are truly highlighted. The buttered-bread, capers, and lightly lemon-marinated salmon all combined deliciously.

And of course, for our entrees, we shared one roast crab and an order of garlic noodles (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/z9CN58fSrA46ggyb6OnCnQ?select=1bMAC3tQqYuN0JkIZRKVqQ). To be perfectly honest, I wasn't that impressed with the roast crab. It was definitely juicy, meaty, and big, but the flavors weren't that great. It definitely didn't live up to all the hype. On the other hand, the garlic noodles were to-die-for! I'm a huge fan of garlic and the garlic noodles were sooo soft and garlicky. I've tried garlic noodles once before and the garlic flavor wasn't as distinct as the garlic flavor in Thanh Long's garlic noodles. I give their garlic noodles 5 stars!

My boyfriend and I had an overall good experience. We enjoyed the intimate, but comfortable ambiance. The customer service was excellent and extremely attentive. I'll probably try the colossal royal tiger prawns with garlic noodles next time.

P.S.
Cheers to my 100th review! :D

excerpts: * Salmon Carpaccio: My favorite appetizer from Thanh Long!
The lemon-cured salmon was perfectly marinated and not at all "fishy.
* Salt & Pepper Calamari: Calamari usually all tastes the same at different restaurants.
However, here, they go easy on the batter and oil to give an overall light taste.
salmon carpaccio.author: Judy C.
salmon carpaccio.review:
My all-time favorite San Francisco restaurant is situated right here in Outer Sunset.  Thang Long, known for their French-inspired Vietnamese cuisine, serves some of the BEST garlic crabs and BEST garlic noodles.

Once in awhile I get to splurge here, and luckily for my birthday -- my thoughtful friends brought me here to celebrate.  Together, we shared:

* Salmon Carpaccio: My favorite appetizer from Thanh Long!  The lemon-cured salmon was perfectly marinated and not at all "fishy."
* Salt & Pepper Calamari: Calamari usually all tastes the same at different restaurants.  However, here, they go easy on the batter and oil to give an overall light taste.
* Mango Salad: This is was my least favorite dish.  Warm mango slices and seafood on top of cold salad is not appetizing whatsoever. 
* Roast Crab & Garlic Noodles: If you love overdosing on garlic and butter, you will love the crab and garlic noodles here.  Their infamous secret sauce really makes Thanh Long what they are. 

Other noteworthy dishes I've tried and loved: Shrimp Toast, Shaken Beef, and Colossal Royal Tiger Prawns. 

Love, love, love.

excerpts: We got seated and ordered 3 roasted crabs, garlic noodles, mussels, salmon carpaccio, and some shrimp rolls that came with a little bit of bacon.
salmon carpaccio.author: M W.
salmon carpaccio.review:
Thanh Long is a sisterly restaurant to Crustacean, located on Polk Street. 

There were 5 of us who decided to swing by on a Saturday night around 9PM. There were still people waiting in line when we got there. We got seated and ordered 3 roasted crabs, garlic noodles, mussels, salmon carpaccio, and some shrimp rolls that came with a little bit of bacon. For dessert we ordered creme brulee and also a warm chocolate cake with icecream- to die for!

The roasted crabs were fabulous. I am a huge crab fan and it totally satisfied my craving. I can eat an entire crab to myself (minus the brain). I also LOVED the mussels- definitely a must try. Customer service was excellent, as always!

excerpts: We shared the salmon carpaccio to start, which was delicious.
salmon carpaccio.author: Roxane W.
salmon carpaccio.review:
Thanh Long was a great experience for my family and I. Yes, it's pricey. At $38 per crab, you have to be prepared to spend a large sum - but I think it's worth it. Luckily, we made reservations. I would recommend you do the same.. The front area was constantly packed during our meal.  We shared the salmon carpaccio to start, which was delicious. The spring rolls were good too, but nothing special. 

The waiter was kind enough to let us know that we could easily share crab (instead of ordering one per person) and share the noodles. Both were very, very good. Definitely the best items on their menu. And since not everyone in my family is as big of a fan of crab as I am, we also ordered a combo fried rice and their shaken beef.  The rice knocked it out of the park; the shaken beef - not so much. It was a bit rubbery and much too sweet.

Overall, a great experience at a high cost.

excerpts: We also had the boulliabaisse, the salmon carpaccio, the soft shell crabs, the mixed seasonal vegetables and the sea bass.
The soft shell crabs are a definite miss.
They lacked seasoning.
The batter was not that crispy.
The salmon carpaccio was tasty.
The shallots added a nice contrast to the sweet salmon.
salmon carpaccio.author: Andrew W.
salmon carpaccio.review:
This place serves some very incredible food and some very good food, but it is very pricey.  For $38 dollars, you get one crab in a variety of styles.  The best here is the roasted crab.  It is delightfully buttery and peppery.  The sauce is so good, it inspired my sister to toss her entire bowl of rice into what was essentially a whole lot of crab flavored butter.  Calories be damned.  So, this dish was good.

I was less impressed by the drunken crab.  It was a little on the bland side.  I was expecting a bit more flavor, but the broth was kind of dull and watery.  It could have used a lot more flavor.  The crab was fresh, so it wasn't all bad.

We also got the shaken beef, which is beef marinaded in a sweet, salty sauce served with vegetables.  It was very tender.  The meat was cooked perfectly.  The vegetables complimented the meat very well.  But, the fried potatoes were a bit weird.  I would get this dish again.

The other good thing here is the garlic noodles.  FYI, it tastes like it has some fish sauce or oyster sauce or crab broth in it.  So, if you are vegetarian beware.  The presentation is really poor.  They come out looking like very ordinary tan noodles.  But, the flavor is salty and sweet with a nice garlic flavor.  It is a bit more on the sweeter side than I expected.  But, it was very good.

We also had the boulliabaisse, the salmon carpaccio, the soft shell crabs, the mixed seasonal vegetables and the sea bass.  The soft shell crabs are a definite miss.  They lacked seasoning.  The batter was not that crispy.  It was a below average dish.

The boulliabaisse was a nice fish broth with vegetables floating in it and some rock shrimp that were cooked well.  It was ok.  Just think Tom Yum soup.  Nothing really special.

The salmon carpaccio was tasty.  The shallots added a nice contrast to the sweet salmon.  But, the portion was very small.

The mixed seasonal vegetables were well cooked, but ultimately they were just roasted vegetables.  Nothing special.

Finally, the sea bass was a little overcooked.  The sauce was nice and mild.  It was ok.  But, nothing special.  It came with some vegetables in a light sauce.  

I also had a mixed drink.  It was a bit on the sweet side.  FYI, the food here is not spicy, so fruity drinks do not pair well.  It is better to go with one of the dry white wines.  For a Vietnamese place, they don't use a lot of sour flavors, so the dry wine brings a little acidity to the food and makes the flavors come out.

The dessert menu was not very exciting.  Deep fried banana, chocolate molten cake.  All the standard stuff.  Nothing unusual or complicated.  We skipped it.

The service was typical for an Asian restaurant.  Not very attentive.  But, everyone was well dressed.

The atmosphere is clean and surprisingly modern inside.  Outside, it looks like a dumpy Chinese restaurant in the Sunset.  But, there are some nice silks and figurines decorating the interior of the restaurant.  This is a good place for a special occasion meal or for a date although the clientele is a bit on the older side (mid to late 40s).  So, it is not exactly hip.  But, your date will appreciate the decor and the high quality food.

A word about parking.  Come early.  Parking in the Sunset is horrible.  You might have to walk a few blocks.  Our reservations were for 6 and we had to walk 2 blocks.  If you eat around 7, be prepared for a hike.  They have valet car service.  So, you have that option.

excerpts: 4 people, we ordered 4 crabs, 2 garlic noodles (still yum), 2 appetizers (love their salmon carpaccio), 2 desserts (orange sorbet and creme brulee are yum), hot tea, and 1 round of drinks came out to $91pp, tip included.
It just seems overpriced to me.
I'm into R&G Lounge's salt & pepper crab
now - tastes so much better!
salmon carpaccio.author: Freckles H.
salmon carpaccio.review: I came here SO many times throughout the past decade (once I was able to afford it), but my last visit in Nov. was lacking. Crab was overcooked! It was probably a fluke, but I'm over it. 4 people, we ordered 4 crabs, 2 garlic noodles (still yum), 2 appetizers (love their salmon carpaccio), 2 desserts (orange sorbet and creme brulee are yum), hot tea, and 1 round of drinks came out to $91pp, tip included. It just seems overpriced to me. I'm into R&G Lounge's salt & pepper crab now - tastes so much better!

excerpts: We order the salmon carpaccio and Thanh Long mussels as starter dishes.
Capers give the fresh salmon a nice, salty hint.
The mussels practically melt in your mouth.
Mop up the remaining juices with your bread.
salmon carpaccio.author: Ines C.
salmon carpaccio.review:
On the outside, Thanh Long resembles a small, quiet family restaurant. You don't realize the bustling nature and star power of this restaurant until you enter the door.

I notice a crab (or two) on everyone's table as I walk to my seat. The room is fragrant with garlic and spices. This is the real deal, I say to my parents.

We order the salmon carpaccio and Thanh Long mussels as starter dishes. Capers give the fresh salmon a nice, salty hint. The mussels practically melt in your mouth. Mop up the remaining juices with your bread. Perfection.

Garlic noodles are delicious, but they're nothing special without the crab. Isn't that why you came in the first place? So we order one roast crab. By itself the crab is meaty and fragrant, but the sauce is the extra level. It's like instant gratification when you drizzle that over the noodles.

The flavor's slightly more subtle in comparison to Boiling Crab, of course---especially if you love the whole sha-bang---but that's where the sophistication lies. That, and the customer service makes Thanh Long worth the price and visit.

excerpts: I've tried the salmon carpaccio, lemongrass chicken satay, and mango salad.
I wasn't really impressed.
salmon carpaccio.author: Laina T.
salmon carpaccio.review:
If you're a crab lover like I am, you'll love Thanh Long.  Skip the appetizers.  I've tried the salmon carpaccio, lemongrass chicken satay, and mango salad.  I wasn't really impressed.  Order the roasted crab and garlic noodles!!!  They're to die for.  The crab is fresh and big.  The flavor of butter and cracked pepper just explodes in your mouth.  I'm a big eater so I always have to have my own crab and another entrée.  Stick to the roasted crab instead of the tamarind crab.  The sauce on the tamarind crab is a little sweet for my taste buds.  The Thanh Long spicy eggplant is good, but nowhere near spicy.  As for dessert, don't get the bread pudding.  The orange sorbet was good and the presentation was clever.  It's a frozen orange sliced across the top with orange sorbet inside.  It's nice, light, and a good ending to any meal.  

At about $40 per crab, it's not cheap.  It's a good place for special occasions or if you just want to satisfy your craving for really good crab.  The atmosphere is casual so there's no need dress up.  Get your hands dirty and enjoy!

excerpts: Two of us shared a roast crab, garlic noodles, salmon carpaccio, some garlic toast (because i love carbs) and the chocolate molten cake.
the garlic noodles are perfect too.
You know how some places don't have that exact garlic flavor... this one is on point.
The salmon carpaccio was such a surprise! and a delight!
It blew our minds away how good it was.
It's kind of disgusting how we ate the chocolate molten cake
but everything was so good
we thought WHY THE HELL NOT!
AND IT WAS WORTH IT
TOO!
I will definitely order my own crab next time!
I could eat this for daysssss!
salmon carpaccio.author: Anna C.
salmon carpaccio.review:
YES. MMMM. MORE. 

LITERALLY THE ONLY WORDS/SOUNDS I MADE WHILE I WAS EATING.

Two of us shared a roast crab, garlic noodles, salmon carpaccio, some garlic toast (because i love carbs) and the chocolate molten cake. We most definitely finished every last bit of everything on our plate.  

The crab is just.. MMMMMMMMMM can't even describe. it's soooo good!!! the garlic noodles are perfect too.  You know how some places don't have that exact garlic flavor... this one is on point.  The salmon carpaccio was such a surprise! and a delight! It blew our minds away how good it was.  It's kind of disgusting how we ate the chocolate molten cake but everything was so good we thought WHY THE HELL NOT! AND IT WAS WORTH IT TOO!  I will definitely order my own crab next time! I could eat this for daysssss!

excerpts: We ordered the salmon carpaccio, roasted crab and garlic noodles.
- Salmon Carpaccio: pretty good portions, came very thinly sliced on bread.
- Garlic Noodles:
delicious, but be prepared to have garlic breath for the rest of the night and into the next day.
salmon carpaccio.author: Alvina W.
salmon carpaccio.review:
HO.LY GARLIC!

Came here with a friend for my second dinner of the night.  Yes, fatty double booked for the evening.

We ordered the salmon carpaccio, roasted crab and garlic noodles.
- Salmon Carpaccio: pretty good portions, came very thinly sliced on bread.  If you're trying to save room, I would maybe skip out on this.

- Roasted crab: I suppose this is what the bibs are for (if you've never been here before, everyone gets a bib put on them).  It was good, but overly salty.

- Garlic Noodles: delicious, but be prepared to have garlic breath for the rest of the night and into the next day.  well worth it.

Tips: CALL ahead (we made reservations for 8:15 and didn't get seated for another 10-15 min. later); pray to the parking gods because parking is horrible; ask for moist towels to clean your hands (I didn't know this was an option until I saw the table next to us request it).

excerpts: Apps included calamari, mussels and salmon carpaccio.
Awesome calamari - hot, crispy and a hint of heat in the seasoning.
The mussels were a bit tough but seasoned well and served with piping hot, crispy crostini.
salmon carpaccio.author: Trish K.
salmon carpaccio.review:
OH.MY.GOD. I have died and gone to heaven.

I'm from NC. I'm here in SF on a business trip and my boss (SF native) strongly suggested I have the roasted crab and garlic noodles, so I didn't argue. Apps included calamari, mussels and salmon carpaccio. Awesome calamari - hot, crispy and a hint of heat in the seasoning. The mussels were a bit tough but seasoned well and served with piping hot, crispy crostini. The carpaccio was amazing - perfectly sliced with capers and a hint of lemon.

But let's talk about this freaking amazing roasted crab. 

They tell me it's locally caught Dungeness. Holy cow. This East Coast chick obviously doesn't know how good Dungeness can be. After the obligatory plastic bib was tied on, they brought me the crab. HUGE. FRESH. Smothered in a pepper garlic seasoning that made me lick my fingers, in public, numerous times. I laid waste to this beautiful creature in about 30 minutes. The staff was awesome - exchanged my shell bowl numerous times and did not comment on all of the bits of shell that were flying off my plate. Seriously, that's how good it was. 

I guess I should say something about the garlic noodles. The al dente, gnocchi like flavor was delicious, and if I haven't formed such a meaningful relationship with the crab, I probably could say more.
I finished up with an orange cream sorbet served in an orange shell. Hints of  rose? lavender? I'm not sure, I was still garlicking over the crab. 
Also finished with a green oolong since they were out of the rose tea. Only "boo" I have to this dining experience.

Thank you Thanh Long and the An family. This is one of the best meals I've ever had.

excerpts: A fantastic meal starting with a couple of  tasty Passion Teas (carefully, these sneak up on you!), the super fresh Salmon Carpaccio, and a unique-tasting dish of Thanh Long Mussels.
salmon carpaccio.author: Dave W.
salmon carpaccio.review:
It's been a few years since my last visit to Thanh Long.  But the food and service of last night's visit were as good as ever!

A fantastic meal starting with a couple of  tasty Passion Teas (carefully, these sneak up on you!), the super fresh Salmon Carpaccio, and a unique-tasting dish of Thanh Long Mussels.   The toasted French baguette crostini for the latter two dishes was a perfect textural pairing.

Next, we chose the Roast Crab and Garlic Noodles from the "Secret Kitchen Dishes", which for anyone who's ever visited Thanh Long, can clearly see that almost every table has ordered.  Haha!  "Secret"...  yeah.  Everyone knows these are the two destination items of this restaurant!  These two complimenting dishes bring me back again and again. 

Attentive service, mouth-watering dishes prepared consistently to perfection.  All in all, another great dining experience!

excerpts: The drunken crabs were awesome and the Salmon Carpaccio is to die for!
There are some items that I was interested in, but didn't get the chance to try em'...
salmon carpaccio.author: Marc E.
salmon carpaccio.review:
GARLIC NOODLES HERE I COME! 

The drunken crabs were awesome and the Salmon Carpaccio is to die for! There are some items that I was interested in, but didn't get the chance to try em'...oh well, maybe next time!

Good luck with parking!

excerpts:
the salmon carpaccio
2.
salmon carpaccio.author: Anh V.
salmon carpaccio.review:
2.5 stars for an old family  business which has lost it's way along the years.

at first glance, i was so excited.  i had already tried crustacean which is near my place but i made a trek out here to where it all began.

the downstairs area with more natural lighting is nicer than the upstairs seating. but overall, the place is big and great for groups. 

there were naive vietnamese art on the walls, a majority of asians eating here...but as i peered closer, i had a wait-a-minute moment.

the servers were nice and quick but none spoke vietnamese.  the uniforms were not traditional as well.  but the killer was no authentic fish sauce.

highlights:
1. the spicy veg soup was better than the asian bouillabaise (lacked spice for the sour taste).
2. of course! drunken crab
3. the garlic rice was tastier than their famous noodles
4. the fried tofu and veggies is a good option for non-meat eaters.

don't order:
1. the salmon carpaccio
2. the soft shell crab - it was so small, they threw in a random extra claw

the 33 beer is a oldie but goodie beer but if you want something heavier go for the saigon beer.

despite being less authentic, it was plenty full on a sunday with happy bib wearing customers crackin' and eating crab and i was one of them.

excerpts:
So this is what I remember from the night's festivities, once the food coma wore off:
Salmon carpaccio, the Buddha roll, the prawn bouillabaisse, garlic noodles, the roast crab, tiger prawns and the steamed sea bass.
In a word, YUM.
Come hungry though, because you will want to indulge in all kinds of different flavors, and the menu is versatile enough to do so.

I got my salt from the yummy carpaccio, "fresh" from the spring roll-esque Buddha roll, tang from the bouillabaisse (though I will say I did not expect such a seemingly random selection of different veggies/fruit to taste good together...
I was kinda like, "um...why are there tomatoes and pineapple together to complement my seafood soup?
but it was actually pretty enjoyable), bitter (in a good way, though my breath was banging after all the garlic!)
from the noodles, and boredom from the main entrees.
the sea bass and the crab...
i guess i just wanted more flavor?
salmon carpaccio.author: Danielle D.
salmon carpaccio.review:
When my girls and I go out to eat, we EAT.
So this is what I remember from the night's festivities, once the food coma wore off:
Salmon carpaccio, the Buddha roll, the prawn bouillabaisse, garlic noodles, the roast crab, tiger prawns and the steamed sea bass. In a word, YUM. Come hungry though, because you will want to indulge in all kinds of different flavors, and the menu is versatile enough to do so. I got my salt from the yummy carpaccio, "fresh" from the spring roll-esque Buddha roll, tang from the bouillabaisse (though I will say I did not expect such a seemingly random selection of different veggies/fruit to taste good together...I was kinda like, "um...why are there tomatoes and pineapple together to complement my seafood soup?" but it was actually pretty enjoyable), bitter (in a good way, though my breath was banging after all the garlic!) from the noodles, and boredom from the main entrees. the sea bass and the crab...i guess i just wanted more flavor?... i ended up switching entrees with a friend though, and enjoyed her tiger prawns and a dish i don't recall for sure, but it was definitely chicken with veggies (now looking at the menu it must have been the lemongrass chicken), and it was like the comfort food I needed to end the meal in a happy place. 
I would head back though, and repeat my starters again, though the next time, I would probably try the drunken beef or crab to appeal my palate, which I tend to ignore in favor of the "safer" stuff.
Very good service as well, which always adds to the meal!

excerpts: Also had the mussels and salmon carpaccio appetizers and that was great also.
Everything was really good here, including the service - attentive, but not annoying.

If you order anything with shells, i.e. mussels or the crab, they put some bowls on the table for you to put the shells in and they change or take away the bowls on such a consistent basis that we never had a bowl full of shells on our table.
Loved it & would definitely return.
salmon carpaccio.author: A W.
salmon carpaccio.review: Yummy Garlic Noodles and Roasted Crab!! Also had the mussels and salmon carpaccio appetizers and that was great also. Everything was really good here, including the service - attentive, but not annoying. If you order anything with shells, i.e. mussels or the crab, they put some bowls on the table for you to put the shells in and they change or take away the bowls on such a consistent basis that we never had a bowl full of shells on our table. Loved it & would definitely return.

excerpts: I really enjoyed the garlic noodles, salmon carpaccio, and the Lychee Martini!
I could drink like 100 of those!!!
It's sooo good!
salmon carpaccio.author: Truc N.
salmon carpaccio.review: Came here the other night for dinner and I was pretty impressed.  You wouldn't expect a restaurant like this to be located in this area.  I hope all the local San Franciscans know about this place and how good it is.  I really enjoyed the garlic noodles, salmon carpaccio, and the Lychee Martini!  I could drink like 100 of those!!!  It's sooo good!  Anyway, our party also ordered the tamarind crab, asparagus soup, shrimp toast and either the Saigon beef or the shaken beef, I can't remember.  Those were ok.  I would not order the tamarind crab or the asparagus soup again though.  The beef was super tender and delicious, but it lacks some flavor.  It doesn't really taste like shaken beef.  I've had the marinade better at other places, but the tenderness here beats them all!!!  I'd definitely come back here and recommend this place to my friends.  It's better than the generic Asian foods in Chinatown!

excerpts: Can never go wrong with their salmon carpaccio, roasted crab and garlic noodles.
I heard ppq crab is good too but never got a chance to try them.
Their dessert is terrible though, i tried their creme brulee and fried banana and they are not up to standard
salmon carpaccio.author: fourevindo h.
salmon carpaccio.review: Can never go wrong with their salmon carpaccio, roasted crab and garlic noodles. I heard ppq crab is good too but never got a chance to try them. Their dessert is terrible though, i tried their creme brulee and fried banana and they are not up to standard

excerpts: For six of us, we ordered 2 of each of the following, unless noted otherwise:  Salt & pepper calamari ($11.95); Soft shell crab ($12.25); Garlic toast ($3.75); Spicy eggplant w/ shrimp (19.25); Lemon grass chicken ($19.25); Saigon beef ($24.95 - one); Bo luc lac ($25.50 - one); Garlic noodles ($10.95 - three); and Roasted crab ($48.95 - market price).
Secondarily, the soft shell crab was a tad overcooked and overpriced.
Nonetheless, is tasted good:  3 Stars.
Thirdly, the garlic toast was OK.
It didn't taste that garlicky.
TL's version of garlic noodles are the best I have had.
The noodles were al dente, weren't drowned in sauce, and the amount of garlic flavor was perfect.
No wonder so many places try to copy this dish:  5+++ Stars.
Secondarily, the roasted crab was excellent.
I used the head as a bowl.
The meat was moist and wonderfully seasoned.
I'd definitely come back here, but I'd stick to the seafood and garlic noodles that are excellent.
The turf dishes are not that good.
Lastly, most of the prices are high, but I was pretty full without the chicken, eggplant and soft shell crab that we added later.
soft shell crab.author: Joe P.
soft shell crab.review:
HTF does Thanh Long open in 1971, but I never came here when I lived in the Bay?  Just ignorant, I guess.  This place started the Viet seafood craze before it became fashionable.  TL is located on Judah b/t 46th & 47th in the Outer Sunset (3 blocks from beach).  Sister restaurants are Crustacean on Polk in SF and in Beverly Hills.

For six of us, we ordered 2 of each of the following, unless noted otherwise:  Salt & pepper calamari ($11.95); Soft shell crab ($12.25); Garlic toast ($3.75); Spicy eggplant w/ shrimp (19.25); Lemon grass chicken ($19.25); Saigon beef ($24.95 - one); Bo luc lac ($25.50 - one); Garlic noodles ($10.95 - three); and Roasted crab ($48.95 - market price).

First of all, the calamari was very good.  It had excellent flavor and was not greasy.  The only downside was the price:  4 Stars.  Secondarily, the soft shell crab was a tad overcooked and overpriced.  Nonetheless, is tasted good:  3 Stars.  Thirdly, the garlic toast was OK.  It didn't taste that garlicky.  We would have been better off with the mussels served on toast:  3 Stars.

For our main courses, the spicy eggplant was very good.  The eggplant was firm and not overcooked like many restaurants.  Downsides were there wasn't much shrimp and the price:  3 Stars.  Secondarily, the chicken was colorful, but the lemongrass really didn't stand out.  It too was overpriced:  3 Stars.  Our first beef dish didn't really do anything to excite us.  The flavor was OK, but like the other dishes, it was overpriced:  3 Stars.  On the other hand, the second beef dish was tender and nicely seasoned.  The only downside was the price:  4 Stars.  

Our last two dishes, were the best.  TL's version of garlic noodles are the best I have had.  The noodles were al dente, weren't drowned in sauce, and the amount of garlic flavor was perfect.  No wonder so many places try to copy this dish:  5+++ Stars.  Secondarily, the roasted crab was excellent.  I used the head as a bowl.  The meat was moist and wonderfully seasoned.  It wasn't as good as R & G in Chinatown, but it still was one of the two best dishes of the evening:  5 Stars.

Regarding the service, it was outstanding.  Our waitress was excellent, and took very good care of us.  She didn't write any of our orders down (inc drinks), and didn't miss anything.  The food came out quickly, and we were constantly given new bowls for our crab shells:  5 Stars.  On the other hand, the ambiance was just OK.  This place is a quaint cozy place.  However, the bathroom was kinda dirty, and the valet was expensive at $12:  3 Stars.

I'd definitely come back here, but I'd stick to the seafood and garlic noodles that are excellent.  The turf dishes are not that good.  Lastly, most of the prices are high, but I was pretty full without the chicken, eggplant and soft shell crab that we added later.

excerpts: Perfect Garlic Noodles, Roasted Crab, Shaken Beef, Soft Shell Crab, Calamari, Imperial Rolls, and Fried Rice-I'm still craving it all even after I just had it!
I should just order like 10 orders of the Garlic noodles and tell them to put it all in one big bowl for me!
soft shell crab.author: JP P.
soft shell crab.review: Perfect Garlic Noodles, Roasted Crab, Shaken Beef, Soft Shell Crab, Calamari, Imperial Rolls, and Fried Rice-I'm still craving it all even after I just had it! I should just order like 10 orders of the Garlic noodles and tell them to put it all in one big bowl for me!

excerpts: We also had the soft shell crab and jumbo shrimp wonton starters.
Make sure to wear stretchy pants!!!!
Yummmmmmy!
soft shell crab.author: Sophia R.
soft shell crab.review: Food and service was amazing. Crab and garlic noodles is a must. We also had the soft shell crab and jumbo shrimp wonton starters. Make sure to wear stretchy pants!!!! Yummmmmmy!

excerpts: We always order as starts the soft shell crab and calamari
soft shell crab.author: Tiffany K.
soft shell crab.review:
I've been coming here for years and Thanh Long never changes! 

The good and workers are great and quick to get your order down and food comes out fairly quick. We always order as starts the soft shell crab and calamari , I always (its a must) order two or more orders of the garlic noodles, and two crabs if your with 3-4 people that is. 

I usually order the roasted crab and drunken crab. I preferably like the roasted crab vs the drunken crab. I usually order one order of the jasmine rice, and dip the rice in the roasted crab sauce.  I feel that the drunken crab doesn't have too much taste to it, and its more watered down. 

Also I usually order the beef cub dish, and its super good and flavorful.  The sea bass was pretty good too , although Im not a huge fan of fish it was good. 


Anyways this place gets packed quick, so I high advise to make a reservation. Parking is crazy there too, so I usaully valet so its easier but if oyu decide to find street parking good luck !

excerpts: Soft shell crab appetizers perfectly crispy and Buddha rolls delicious their peanut sauce is the best!
so I ordered another soft shell crab
instead this place never disappoints
soft shell crab.author: Wendy M.
soft shell crab.review: Love this place my favorite Ahn family restaurant.  Soft shell crab appetizers perfectly crispy and Buddha rolls delicious their peanut sauce is the best!  Shaken beef tender with salad, my favorite sea bass with orange sauce and of course garlic noodles and prawns and this time not the crab which I regret not ordering so I ordered another soft shell crab instead this place never disappoints

excerpts: Appitizers of dumplings, and the one with soft shell crab very small.
Annapolis, MD.
and Virginia have much larger and better.
Over priced.
soft shell crab.author: Clifford D.
soft shell crab.review:
My 2 sons, daughter, and me had dinner there lest night. Appitizers of dumplings, and the one with soft shell crab very small. Annapolis, MD. and Virginia have much larger and better. Over priced. Roast crab was good, but not for @54.95. Go elsewhere! Service was good. Noodles also great tasting. Try Kiron and D and A café in SF. Great food for better prices. These owners are greedy, will not go back!!!!!!
Clifford R. Den Otter, 80 year old navy veteran

excerpts: Inauthentic, Maine style soft shell crab, but not meaty.
soft shell crab.author: Rem K.
soft shell crab.review:
I have traveled across South East Asia multiple times and consider myself a gourmand when it comes to the cuisine of that region. The food at Thanh Long was sub-par at best, especially considering the prices. I didn't get the crab because none of the three offered preparations were authentic (Garlic, Drunken and Tamarind- westernized versions of a mash-up of a variety of SE Asian flavors) and it was mid-May, which means Dungeness crab was approaching the tail end of its season. I decided instead to try their other seafood offerings-

Soft Shell Crab- Minuscule portions, looked like the chef took absolutely not time or effort in preparing them. They would have tasted better if they were sold on a street cart by the beach and I had some sandy grit in my mouth to go along with them. Inauthentic, Maine style soft shell crab, but not meaty.

Prawn Toast- This was passable, but how can you go wrong with bread smothered with garlic and cheese with some shrimp. Probably the easiest thing to make. Again, completely inauthentic. No sesame, soy or scallion flavors. White bread and cheese? WTF? Fail.

Red Snapper- Where do I start. I expected this dish to be prepared with a whole fish wrapped in some sort of banana leaf, but it instead arrived in the form of two limp, overcooked fillets. The sauce was too thin and not flavorful, it lacked a sense of completion. The only redeeming quality of the plate were the garlic noodles everyone here is raving about. They were flavorful, albeit slathered with garlic and sesame oil, so how can you go wrong. The nature of this type of noodle preparation is to be a little soft, but these were overcooked and did not hold their texture/ collapsed on my fork.

Thanh Long- Don't do it, take your money elsewhere.

excerpts: We ordered two roasted crabs, an order of garlic noodles, tiger prawns served over garlic noodles, two appetizers soft shell crab, some type of wonton and hot jasmine tea.

Lets break this down, the crab were good but not worth 40 bucks each, the garlic noodles were cold and lumped together almost like they microwaved them, the hot jasmine tea was not hot it was warm at best..
Grand total $167 and change.
Lets just say I was really disappointed.
soft shell crab.author: Rita A.
soft shell crab.review:
Wow I had not been here in years and the taste and quality of the food has gone downhill.  I guess once the one in beverly hills opened and they became well know catering to the decor and less on the quality of the food.  We ordered two roasted crabs, an order of garlic noodles, tiger prawns served over garlic noodles, two appetizers soft shell crab, some type of wonton and hot jasmine tea.

Lets break this down, the crab were good but not worth 40 bucks each, the garlic noodles were cold and lumped together almost like they microwaved them, the hot jasmine tea was not hot it was warm at best..  Grand total $167 and change.  Lets just say I was really disappointed.

excerpts: $11.75 Soft shell crab appetizer: only one crab with some not so fresh cabbages with not much seasoning.

$4.95 a bottle of 33 bear: glass smelled like chlorine
$4.50 hot tea :
soft shell crab.author: Andy R.
soft shell crab.review:
Another Yelp disappointment.  Overall ripoff.  Overly hyped.  Much better deal elsewhere.  Very hard to find parking spot.  They take advantage of the situation by offering $10+ valet parking.

$37.95  Roasted crab: a ripoff with small size for the price.  Too salty and oily.  Not much left in the shell which was pre-opened.  Almost no meat in the body.  Only good news was that leg shells were soft and easy to crack.
$9.50 garlic noodles:  another ripoff.  Plain wheat noodle with nothing much but garlic bits.  Hints of butter, sugar and salt. Small portion.
$11.75 Soft shell crab appetizer: only one crab with some not so fresh cabbages with not much seasoning.
$4.95 a bottle of 33 bear: glass smelled like chlorine
$4.50 hot tea : low quality tea leaf and luke warm water

Had to get used to urine like odor when entered.  Service was responsive and fast.  But, I wouldn't come back for food.

excerpts: we had vegetable soup, soft shell crab, curry shrimp, sautee veggies, roasted crab, tamarind crab, and garlic noodles.
the vegetable soup is basically swansons with diced vegetables.the curry shrimp was spicy but the shrimp was fresh.
i liked the roasted crab better than the tamarind crab.
im not a huge fan of garlic noodles,  they can be dry but oily.
soft shell crab.author: claudia y.
soft shell crab.review:
we came here on a thursday night and all tables were full.  they dont seat you until most of your party is here.  

we had vegetable soup, soft shell crab, curry shrimp, sautee veggies, roasted crab, tamarind crab, and garlic noodles.

overall the food was decent though not exceptional.  the vegetable soup is basically swansons with diced vegetables.the curry shrimp was spicy but the shrimp was fresh.  i liked the roasted crab better than the tamarind crab.  

i think overall im not a huge fan of garlic noodles,  they can be dry but oily.

excerpts: We shared a Soft Shell Crab starter, which was very fresh and juicy- not quite as fantastic as the same starter at House, but still very good.
soft shell crab.author: Elaine T.
soft shell crab.review:
The boy and I drove waaaay the heck out to 46th and Judah one evening to fill our bellies with freshly buttered seafood and garlic noodles. Yum. 

Being that I am reviewer #626, you might guess that we were served some pretty amazing food. We shared a Soft Shell Crab starter, which was very fresh and juicy- not quite as fantastic as the same starter at House, but still very good. The boy ordered a whole crab with garlic noodles and I had the Colossal Royal Tiger Prawns served on a bed of.. you guessed it- more garlic noodles. We thoroughly enjoyed our carb/ butter/ protein filled meal. I never thought I'd find myself eyeing some lettuce garnish carelessly left on a plate from the table next to us..

The crab was bathed in steaming butter- what looked like perfection, if I were a fan of crab meat, which I am not. I am also not a fan of lobster. And I don't drink. I am the ultimate cheap date, but despair not; what I refuse in seafood and wine, I more than make up in desserts and starters!! 

I am, however, a SUPERfan of shrimp. Especially tiger prawns. Yummy yum yum. As for my order, I'd have to say that the 'Colossal' in the menu name might be a little misleading- they are Jumbo prawns at best. The prawns are splayed open when served, but if you put them back together (like I did) just to gauge their actual size: I'd say they were Jumbo, not Colossal. Size aside, the meat was tender and moist. So, so good.

Side comment on valet parking:
Not sure where exactly they took the car once we handed over the keys, but we ended up waiting like fifteen minutes with no line when we were leaving. Seriously- we made a quick trip across the street to the liquor store because they were taking so damn long. Really makes me question where they take the cars. Back home to the An Family garage, perhaps? I'm sure they can fit a few dozen cars on their property with all the money Crustaceans rakes in.

excerpts: Soft Shell Crab.
soft shell crab.author: Vince H.
soft shell crab.review:
I came here for the first time because I had a friend in town who wanted some seafood. Instead of taking him to Fisherman's wharf, we decided to do something different. We are so glad we came here. There's nothing like the bone breaking sound of crab while wearing a plastic bib. 

Furthermore, the service is impeccable. I shall return!

Things to get:

The Roast Crab is absolutely delectable. I'm not sure what the "secret spices" are, but mixed with the garlic, I was tempted to eat everything down to the shell.

Garlic Noodles. There is a reason why everybody talks about it. 

Shaken Beef. Yummy.

Soft Shell Crab. Yes, we couldn't get enough crab

Tip: We had a good ole time ordering drinks. Let me tell you, they are VERY heavy handed with their vodka.

excerpts:
Ok, so here is the down-low on this place:

Soft shell crab was enh - not so great, just decent

----------------
soft shell crab.author: Jerome, Jerome T.
soft shell crab.review:
Ok, so here is the down-low on this place:

Soft shell crab was enh - not so great, just decent

----------------

The garlic noodles are simple, delightful, and a perfect pairing for any of the dishes 

The roast crab is one of the most memorable dishes

Beyond the two above dishes, there really isn't a reason to go to this place except for the drinks

Havanah Cafe dessert drink is killer good - almost like drinking with Castro and Ho Chi Minh on summer's night

the bibs are classic, but not for me ...

excerpts: We also had the Soft Shell Crab.
This was just deep fried soft shell crab with a tamarind-chili sauce on the side.
soft shell crab.author: Ring K.
soft shell crab.review:
Hopefully my heart will still be pumping by the time I'm done with this review...

We had reservations at 6:30 on a Sunday night and we were seated immediately.  

We started off with Thanh Long mussels in Asian pesto sauce with bread.  The bread was buttery and the sauce was oily (since it's pesto), but it was pretty good.  We also had the Soft Shell Crab.  This was just deep fried soft shell crab with a tamarind-chili sauce on the side.

Of course we had to order the roasted crab and garlic noodles (I'm a huge fan of garlic noodles, so we had to each get our own order).  It was delicious.  The crab was drenched in butter and garlic and black pepper.  

We finished with Grandma An's Banana Bread Pudding.  This was delicious.  The bread pudding is more like a slice of super soft bread pudding with lots of bananas, but that paired with the hazelnut ice cream was a nice finish to our fattening meal.  We spent about $140 (inc. tax & tip) for 2 appetizers, crab, 2 orders of garlic noodles, and dessert.

excerpts: This included 2 beers, a grape juice spritzer, the dungeness crab puffs and soft shell crab for appetizers and for dinner the drunken crab  and the villager dish (cant remember name) it had prawns and pork and lava cake with vanilla gelato dessert.
The appetizers were average, the drunken crab was lacking in flavor,
bland...
I have had better for way cheaper.
The other prawn and pork dish had so much salt, it was barely edible.
Its been 24 hours
and I am still craving water because of the salt.
The one star is for the service which was good.
The wait staff is very friendly and accomodating.
The food showed up very fast.
Probably an indication as to why the food isnt all that great or fresh tasting.
As for the decor, for a restaurant charging these prices, the decor needs an overall.
The chairs are dirty with old food stains and need a good wiping.
the carpet looks musty and towards the back where its dark, smells a bit musty.
Will never be back.
Not worth the time or money.
I have to say the dessert was amazing.
I wanted to lick my plate, thus the 2nd star.
But i didnt go for dessert
i was there for the seafood which came up short.
soft shell crab.author: RoastNBoil L.
soft shell crab.review: What a rip off...I have been wanting to try this place for sometime. After trying Crustaceans I was told the food is better here. My table of 2 spent $120. This included 2 beers, a grape juice spritzer, the dungeness crab puffs and soft shell crab for appetizers and for dinner the drunken crab  and the villager dish (cant remember name) it had prawns and pork and lava cake with vanilla gelato dessert. The appetizers were average, the drunken crab was lacking in flavor, bland...I have had better for way cheaper. The other prawn and pork dish had so much salt, it was barely edible. Its been 24 hours and I am still craving water because of the salt. The one star is for the service which was good. The wait staff is very friendly and accomodating. The food showed up very fast. Probably an indication as to why the food isnt all that great or fresh tasting. As for the decor, for a restaurant charging these prices, the decor needs an overall. The chairs are dirty with old food stains and need a good wiping. the carpet looks musty and towards the back where its dark, smells a bit musty. Will never be back. Not worth the time or money.I have to say the dessert was amazing. I wanted to lick my plate, thus the 2nd star. But i didnt go for dessert i was there for the seafood which came up short.

excerpts:
the soft shell crab - it was so small, they threw in a random extra claw

the 33 beer is a oldie but goodie beer
soft shell crab.author: Anh V.
soft shell crab.review:
2.5 stars for an old family  business which has lost it's way along the years.

at first glance, i was so excited.  i had already tried crustacean which is near my place but i made a trek out here to where it all began.

the downstairs area with more natural lighting is nicer than the upstairs seating. but overall, the place is big and great for groups. 

there were naive vietnamese art on the walls, a majority of asians eating here...but as i peered closer, i had a wait-a-minute moment.

the servers were nice and quick but none spoke vietnamese.  the uniforms were not traditional as well.  but the killer was no authentic fish sauce.

highlights:
1. the spicy veg soup was better than the asian bouillabaise (lacked spice for the sour taste).
2. of course! drunken crab
3. the garlic rice was tastier than their famous noodles
4. the fried tofu and veggies is a good option for non-meat eaters.

don't order:
1. the salmon carpaccio
2. the soft shell crab - it was so small, they threw in a random extra claw

the 33 beer is a oldie but goodie beer but if you want something heavier go for the saigon beer.

despite being less authentic, it was plenty full on a sunday with happy bib wearing customers crackin' and eating crab and i was one of them.

excerpts: Between the 4 of us, we had the soft shell crab appetizer, a roast crab, a drunken crab, 2 orders of garlic noodles, and the "peasant's favorite.
The soft shell crab was tasty with the tamarind sauce, but it was a bit small for $12.
The roast crab was garlicky & buttery, with the meat juicy and fresh.
The drunken crab was unfortunately on the bland and dry side, despite its wet-sounding name.
The garlic noodles were a hit all around, and our hands got so greasy from the crab that we just ate the noodles with our hands as well.
Good thing we were seated in a back corner, far way from the disapproving eyes of polite company.
P
The pork in the "peasant's favorite" clay pot was tender and well-marinated.
Everything was tasty but on the pricey side.
Market price for crab that day was ~$40, and the small portion of pork was $17 or so.
We dropped $40 each and walked out satiated but not stuffed.
soft shell crab.author: Lillian L.
soft shell crab.review:
This was where I brought my bff and our respective bfs for the bachelorette party I planned for my teeth. I wanted to be able to savagely chomp into luscious limbs of crab (who needs crustacean crackers when you've got bicuspids?) while my teeth were still free of metal fetters.

Between the 4 of us, we had the soft shell crab appetizer, a roast crab, a drunken crab, 2 orders of garlic noodles, and the "peasant's favorite." The soft shell crab was tasty with the tamarind sauce, but it was a bit small for $12. The roast crab was garlicky & buttery, with the meat juicy and fresh. The drunken crab was unfortunately on the bland and dry side, despite its wet-sounding name. The garlic noodles were a hit all around, and our hands got so greasy from the crab that we just ate the noodles with our hands as well. Good thing we were seated in a back corner, far way from the disapproving eyes of polite company. =P The pork in the "peasant's favorite" clay pot was tender and well-marinated. Everything was tasty but on the pricey side. Market price for crab that day was ~$40, and the small portion of pork was $17 or so. We dropped $40 each and walked out satiated but not stuffed.

excerpts: the garlic noodle and the soft shell crab was good as usual.
soft shell crab.author: Xing L.
soft shell crab.review: after the first time around we decided to try a different type of crab which was the roasted crab. it was wayyyyyy better than the drunken crab. the garlic noodle and the soft shell crab was good as usual.

excerpts: all i tasted was cream cheese), and soft shell crab (YUM!
i just wish they gave us more).
all of the appetizers  were really good.
but for $10 a pop,  fuck that!
i better be getting some big ass portions!!
the appetizers were a bit overpriced for what it was.
we also had  salad.
i think it was the vietnamese salad.
the salad was just 'okay.'
and lastly, dessert!
we ordered the fried banana w/ mango sorbet.
the mango sorbet was delicious!
soft shell crab.author: B B.
soft shell crab.review:
[one of] my last meal(s) on earth: CRAB WITH GARLIC NOODLES

so i'm getting my wisdom teeth pulled out tomorow. and this actually feels like one of my last meals on earth. i am NOT looking forward to eating soft foods for one week! but i AM looking forward to the vicodin! hahah. jk. i love crab so i knew i had to eat it before my wisdom teeth extraction.  i made sure i stuffed myself the whole night. i ate as if i were a starving child from a third world country! i made sure i ate EVERYTHING we ordered! actually, i lied. we ordered dessert and i couldnt finish it all. i left some fried bananas and mango sorbet. i bet those starving children would be throwing rocks at me if they heard me say that.

the crab here was off the heezay!!!  i loved it! we had the roasted crab. i think it actually taste better than PPQ. as for the garlic noodles, i think PPQ's taste better. we also ordered these appetizers: shrimp rolls (they were really good. you only get like 5 or 6), crab puffs (they were good too!! but i couldnt really taste any crab. all i tasted was cream cheese), and soft shell crab (YUM! i just wish they gave us more). all of the appetizers  were really good.  but for $10 a pop,  fuck that! i better be getting some big ass portions!! the appetizers were a bit overpriced for what it was. we also had  salad. i think it was the vietnamese salad. the salad was just 'okay.' and lastly, dessert! we ordered the fried banana w/ mango sorbet. the mango sorbet was delicious! the fried banana had too much breading.

if thanh long had a dinner special, i'd be here every week. i think i'd rather go to PPQ where its cheaper. c'mon, broke people cant afford this place! one crab was frickin $35.00!! shiiiiiiiiiet, thats hella expensive! AND you have to buy garlic noodles?! i can just go to PPQ and get a dinner-for-2 special! for $50 you get one crab, garlic noodles, dessert, a salad, and egg rolls! now thats a fucking deal! but  i really like this place. their food is very tasty and their service is great. i'll definately be back.

excerpts: I had the infamous crab, garlic noodles, grilled shrimp, salmon appetizer, crab filled wontons, and soft shell crab.
I will definitely be back.
soft shell crab.author: amber p.
soft shell crab.review: Yummy!!   What a great seafood place.  It was challenging to get here, but it was well worth it.  We had reservations for 10 people and although the place was jammed packed, with a wait, they had our table ready and waiting.  Once we were seated, food and drinks were served very quickly.  Service was excellent and the food was just delicious, every single bite.  I had the infamous crab, garlic noodles, grilled shrimp, salmon appetizer, crab filled wontons, and soft shell crab. I will definitely be back.

excerpts: But their fillet mignon dish served on lettuce with a tasty sauce, butterfly tiger prawn served with garlic noodles ($31.95), and soft shell crab were so delicious!
soft shell crab.author: Alan K.
soft shell crab.review:
We should've ordered the roasted crab! Every table had it, and they were sooo huge! And they looked so delicious.

But their fillet mignon dish served on lettuce with a tasty sauce, butterfly tiger prawn served with garlic noodles ($31.95), and soft shell crab were so delicious! My girlfriend and I felt totally satisfied.

Their lava cake with vanilla gelato is a MUST. perfectly proportioned. 

100 bucks out the door is pretty pricey, but I LOVED it. So good. Would definitely come back with some friends.

excerpts: We ordered the soft shell crab and salt and pepper calamari for appetizers and  the roast  crab and garlic noodles for the entree.
The soft shell crab was very good.
They give you one small deep fried soft shell crab with sweet & sour dipping sauce.
The salt & pepper calamari was decent.
I thought it was a little too salty for my taste.
It left me wanting to take a sip of H2O every time I took a bite.
Every one there seemed to be eating the garlic noodles.
We were curious and ordered it as well.
I  personally wasn't impressed.
It was a pretty simple dish.
I think I could have gone without it.
Overall, I give this place 4 stars due to the fact that it was expensive, the lack of parking, and the buttery greasy taste it left in my mouth for the rest of the day.
soft shell crab.author: Cynthia S.
soft shell crab.review: I was excited to eat here especially after finding out that they share the same owners as crustaceans. I honestly didn't know what to expect because my friends from Hawaii who were visiting suggested to go to this place. Apparently this place has a reputation even in Hawaii. I was pleasantly surprised to find this place in my own backyard. I wasn't expecting this restaurant to be in the suburbs in the outer sunset. Parking was terrible so my friends and I opted for  valet. I think it was $10. We ordered the soft shell crab and salt and pepper calamari for appetizers and  the roast  crab and garlic noodles for the entree. The soft shell crab was very good. They give you one small deep fried soft shell crab with sweet & sour dipping sauce. The salt & pepper calamari was decent. I thought it was a little too salty for my taste. It left me wanting to take a sip of H2O every time I took a bite. The roast crab was DELICIOUS!! It was really good. I didn't enjoy it as much when the crab became cold. It's served in a puddle of butter that started to congeal at the end of the meal. It wasn't a pretty site. I felt like my arteries were clogging instantly. Every one there seemed to be eating the garlic noodles. We were curious and ordered it as well. I  personally wasn't impressed. It was a pretty simple dish. I think I could have gone without it.  Overall, I give this place 4 stars due to the fact that it was expensive, the lack of parking, and the buttery greasy taste it left in my mouth for the rest of the day.

excerpts: Instead we went for the tiger prawns with garlic noodles, grilled calamari, and garlic rice.
We love garlic!
The calamari was very tender
and it was actually pretty good.
The tiger prawns were juicy and so garlicy!
The garlic rice was ok, maybe because everything else had so much flavor and garlic, the rice wasn't as strong.
I enjoyed my visit here
and now i'm a fan!
grilled calamari.author: Belinda C.
grilled calamari.review:
I had friends that used to live in SF during college and moved back to Asia.  After a few years, they decided to visit and the FIRST thing they wanted to eat was at Thanh Long.  They were craving for their garlic noodles.  I'm usually not a huge seafood fan, so my excitement wasn't as crazy.  We made reservations for 7 and it was so jammed packed when i arrived.  I highly recommend making a reservation.  

For the course , we didn't get the crab.  Yes, can you believe we were the only table that didn't get crab.  Instead we went for the tiger prawns with garlic noodles, grilled calamari, and garlic rice.  We love garlic! The calamari was very tender and it was actually pretty good.   The tiger prawns were juicy and so garlicy! I can see why everyone loves the garlic noodles.  It was delicious! The garlic rice was ok, maybe because everything else had so much flavor and garlic, the rice wasn't as strong.  I enjoyed my visit here and now i'm a fan!

excerpts: We also got the grilled calamari and the filet beef.
Those were okay
but I would stick with the crab and noodles.
grilled calamari.author: Allison S.
grilled calamari.review:
I loved this place!! Really impressed with both the crab and garlic noodles. The roasted crab was buttery and the crab meat just fell off the shell because it was so fresh. It was so good that we decided to get the drunken crab too. Although that one was good as well, I think I still prefer the roasted crab. To me, it just had a better flavor. I was apprehensive that the garlic noodles would be dry but they were moist and garlicky. Yum. We also got the grilled calamari and the filet beef. Those were okay but I would stick with the crab and noodles. I should also note that it's probably a once in a while kind of meal because it is so buttery and rich, but it's worth it!

P.S. We saw two girls each order a whole crab when we sat down... and they both packed half to go! WEAK! I could eat a whole crab myself. :)

excerpts: We ordered a few appetizer which was fried calamari, grilled calamari, and baked mussels.
The fried Calamari was too salty but everything else was good.
grilled calamari.author: Julie N.
grilled calamari.review: First impression when coming to this restaurant was this is a small restaurant but packed with a lot of people. We ordered a few appetizer which was fried calamari, grilled calamari, and baked mussels. The fried Calamari was too salty but everything else was good. We also ordered garlic noodles and baked crab. The garlic noodles were good but they kept breaking on us. The baked crab was literally baked crab but they put a little butter and rub salt and pepper all of it. I would say the portion of salt and pepper was good on it but I was expecting a lot more since everyone was raving about it. Overall the food was good but service was bad. I had to ask 5 times for my soda to be refills. I would had given it 4 star but the service is bad and that's why I give it a 3

excerpts: Next time we'll try the Grilled Calamari
grilled calamari.author: Cat G.
grilled calamari.review:
My brother and sisters decided to come here for Mother's Day. I called on the Thursday before to make a reservation, made it for 5:30pm on Mother's Day. Perfect. They called on Saturday to confirm, awesome. They reminded me to make sure everyone was on time because we wouldn't be sat until our entire party was there. 

Typical of our family, one of my siblings was running late - therefore they wouldn't seat us. My Mom was mad and irritated because to her it didn't make sense because we knew what they wanted to order. After practically yelling at the hostess, they still didn't seat us - I was embarassed. The hostess remained calm and tried to explain to my Mom why they wouldn't seat us. I used to work in the restaurant industry and I know why they won't sit full parties - it puts their entire reservation schedule off track - if two people of a seven party table is late, it extends their duration at the table once the two LATE people do get there, and causes the table who will be using that table next a delay, and so forth throughout the evening.
