30 minutes after our reservation time, my late sibling and her guest arrived, I kindly let the hostess know that we were finally all there, she told me that the only table available that sits 7 is currently paying and as soon as they leave, she'd be able to sit us - this was "the best that she could do at this time." - I thanked her nicely and proceeded to apologize for my mom's reaction and that I understand why they couldn't seat us. 

5 minutes later - she came to me and said that she had another table available and we could be seated right away. While following her she told me that she appreciated my apology and to enjoy my meal. 

Food: 
Dungeness Crab Puffs - delicious - a great appetizer for a larger group, there were 6 in one serving. 

Salt & Pepper Calamari - a little too much salt on this one, still good though!  Next time we'll try the Grilled Calamari 

Shaken Beef - HOLY MOLEY DELICIOUS - Meat was SO tender and so flavorful - definitely recommend this. 

Siagon Beef - Not my favorite - the rest of my family like this but unfortunately this dish did NOT please my taste buds - I felt as though maybe the ingredients were way above my appreciation but it tasted too bitter for me. 

Drunken Crab - this was delicious - a whole crab, dunked in a secret sauce of Chardonney... 

Roasted Crab - this was EVEN better than the Drunken Crab - amazing. 

Garlic Noodles - MUST HAVE AT THE TABLE. These are the staple dish of every visit, in my opinion. 

I really like this place - I've had the Garlic Noodles before on their An The Go mobile food truck. Definitely will come back here. 

PS. Parking is a pain - but they do offer Valet for $12.00 - valet guys are funny.

excerpts: was the grilled calamari, it was delicious.
Walking away from a restaurant still hungry after a big bill is not a good thing.
Compared to PPQ, Thanh Long loses by price, taste, and quantity.
However, their setting and service is much better than PPQ.
grilled calamari.author: Karen L.
grilled calamari.review:
I was excited to try this since people were saying how good it was, however, it's not that good.  We got the Boiled and the Drunken crab, and I wouldn't have known the crab was drunken if it weren't for the different coloring of the crab and the saltiness.  While the Shaken Beef was pretty tasty, there were only several pieces, and twice the amount of potatoes.  Garlic noodles wasn't great either.  The only great dish we had that was really good was the grilled calamari, it was delicious.
Walking away from a restaurant still hungry after a big bill is not a good thing.  Compared to PPQ, Thanh Long loses by price, taste, and quantity.  However, their setting and service is much better than PPQ.

excerpts:
Foods that we ordered:
- Grilled Calamari for starter - pretty tasty and good.
A good dish to start off with.
In fact, most of their starters looks good too.
grilled calamari.author: Gordon L.
grilled calamari.review:
Yelp have done it again! Great recommendation!

Came here after doing a search around my neighborhood. The place was nearby and it had crabs and garlic noodles, so we gave it a try.

Finding the place wasn't hard, but looking for a parking spot is another story! I saw them offering valet parking for $10, but I didn't think it was worth it. Found a spot (lucky) after 5 mins of circling around. Went in and the place was PACKED! They told us that we might have to wait about 30-40 mins... I was tired so I waited. 15 minutes later we got a table (lucky x2!)

Foods that we ordered:
- Grilled Calamari for starter - pretty tasty and good. A good dish to start off with. In fact, most of their starters looks good too.
- Roasted Crab (originally I planned to order the drunken crab, but the waiter asked if this was my first time here or not and told us that people recommended the roasted crab over the drunken crab). The crab was delicious, huge, and good for both my girlfriend and I. (GF is a small eater, so probably you might wanna order 1 crab per person). However, I did find it a bit dry.
- Garlic Noodles, first time eating such delicious garlic noodle! I wonder if they do take-outs? If they do, I think I would drop by from time to time and just get this to go!!! YUMMMM!!

The price was on the expensive side! My total came around 70ish to 80? I forgot... but it was well worth it in my opinion.

SUMMARY:
Pros - great food, cosy atmosphere, and some nice services!
Cons - hard to find parking, might need to make reservation since it is a small place, packed (our table were very close to the other customers), and expensive.

5 STARS in my book!

excerpts: We ordered 2 Roasted Dungeness Crab, 1 Steam Sea Bass, Villager's Favorite, 2 orders of Garlic Noodles, Grilled Calamari and the Buddha Roll.
The Buddha Roll was average.
On top of all that, our "smart" waiter gave us the crab, without our garlic noodles.
And lastly, the garlic noodles.
Average.
It came out cold.
grilled calamari.author: F S.
grilled calamari.review:
This is not my first time at Thanh Long.  My first experience dated back to 2001.  Back then, I was hooked and would have given it 5 stars and more if I could.  I have been back to Thanh Long many times through the years and brought many of friends and family.  But, my last two times have been a disappointment which is what led me to write this review.

We ordered 2 Roasted Dungeness Crab, 1 Steam Sea Bass, Villager's Favorite, 2 orders of Garlic Noodles, Grilled Calamari and the Buddha Roll.  

The best dish from this selection was the Villager's Favorite, sadly.  The sauce was not salty and a perfect balance of black pepper and fish sauce.  The meat and the shrimp came out very tender.

The Buddha Roll was average.  The roll was poorly rolled and fell apart the moment we touched it.

The Roasted Crab came out too quickly.  We barely wiped our lips from the appetizers (10 minutes max), then out came the crabs.  Okay-- my first reaction was wow, they really want to turn their tables around.  Then my second reaction was these crabs were pre-roasted.  Then I wanted to hurt someone.  We did not drive all the way to the outer sunset for frozen crab!!!!  On top of all that, our "smart" waiter gave us the crab, without our garlic noodles.  So the fool had us eating the crab without any complementing food.

And lastly, the garlic noodles.  Average.  It came out cold.  Usually, these noodles do no retain heat, so I do not expect it too be hot, however cold is unacceptable.  

If Thanh Long is dishing out fast-food version of their food and service, they should dish out those same prices, so expectations will be lowered.  It will be a long time until I would try or recommend T.L.

excerpts: For starters, I usually get grilled calamari and a cocktail!
Their roasted crab is a good size and comes to your table piping hot with melted butter spilled all over it--finger lickin good!
To accompany my crab (yes I said MY crab because I order my own!)
grilled calamari.author: Jackilyn B.
grilled calamari.review:
Thanh Long (and Crustacean's) are the best restaurants to go to if you are a crab fiend!  

For starters, I usually get grilled calamari and a cocktail!  Their roasted crab is a good size and comes to your table piping hot with melted butter spilled all over it--finger lickin good!
To accompany my crab (yes I said MY crab because I order my own!) I like to get a bowl of garlic noodles. 

I've had my birthday here before and we occupied a whole section of the restaurant. They handled my party of about 30 people very well. 

I come here often and will continue to come here often. Someone once recommended this other restaurant to me because "it is cheaper and tastes just like Thanh Long"----ok, yes it is significantly cheaper, but NO it does not taste anything like TL! We will leave the restaurant name out to spare them! 

Anyway, HIGHLY recommend this place, gO gO gO! After writing this review, I think I'll head there tonight too...

excerpts: We had the roast crab (of course!), colossal royal tiger prawns over garlic noodles, shaken beef (YUM!), grilled calamari, and the seafood combination fried rice.
I was looking forward to having leftovers of this feast, but we cleaned our plates.
Haha.
grilled calamari.author: Jenn C.
grilled calamari.review:
LOVE this place! It's not cheap, but it's so worth it to splurge once in a while.

We had the roast crab (of course!), colossal royal tiger prawns over garlic noodles, shaken beef (YUM!), grilled calamari, and the seafood combination fried rice. I was looking forward to having leftovers of this feast, but we cleaned our plates. Haha. Oh my god that was the best dinner I've had in a while.

We made reservations for a Saturday night. I'd suggest doing that since it gets pretty packed here.

excerpts: and I really enjoyed the food and you must try the grilled calamari!!!
grilled calamari.author: fiyodor m.
grilled calamari.review: Best crab and garlic noodles ever----My wife and I really enjoyed the food and you must try the grilled calamari!!!

excerpts: The Grilled Calamari was good but salty which I hate salty foods.
grilled calamari.author: Ge I.
grilled calamari.review:
I have been to this restaurant a several times. My first experience was not so good. I didn't really like there food. I can't even really remember what I ate. Another time I remember going there was for a friends birthday dinner. It was about 12 people for dinner. The place is very nice but the service it not. The treatment that we got was eat and get out. maybe because we were such a big group? They told us that we had a 2 hours. (Time limit) Never heard of that for a restaurant. I thought that was rude. The waitress was looking at us and giving us the evil to hurry up and leave. Which was not nice. 
Otherwise the food is Good, not great. 
The Grilled Calamari was good but salty which I hate salty foods. My sister had the steamed Sea Bass. it was OK. The Shaken Beef was good. Of course the crab is good. I think everyone might go there for that. I would go back there but not any time soon.

excerpts: #Thanh Long Mussels:
B.
It came with 5 mussels and each with a piece of bread at the bottom.
While the garlic and green onion smelled and tasted pretty good - it was too buttery.
Way too much butter
that after 3 minutes when it got a little cooler a layer of fat from the butter formed around the shell of the mussels.
thanh long mussels.author: Simon C.
thanh long mussels.review:
I had always been curious about Vietnamese seafood (especially crabs) cuisine - my friends talk about it, my relatives talk about it, never had a chance to try it. Finally it's my turn for a friend's bday dinner at Thanh Long, and to my surprise, it was NOT that good.

On a Wednesday night, didn't make reservations, was ready for a long line but luckily we grabbed the last 2-seat table.

#Thanh Long Mussels: B.
It came with 5 mussels and each with a piece of bread at the bottom. While the garlic and green onion smelled and tasted pretty good - it was too buttery. Way too much butter that after 3 minutes when it got a little cooler a layer of fat from the butter formed around the shell of the mussels. The mussels themselves were pretty fresh though.

#Roasted Crab: B.
This was the main dish and I had high expectation, but ended up in disappointment. Again there was a lot (not excessive this time) in the sauce, but problem was this roasted crab lacked black pepper or whatever that should have made the crab more "roasted". And if it was lack of taste on the outside already, needless to say the meat inside was pretty bland. At least the meat was fresh though.

#Garlic Noodles: B-.
This was the biggest disappointment of the night. I was very looking forward to that as I heard so many good things about this dish from this place.... but there was like almost zero garlic taste..... like 1% and I'm not even exaggerating. It did taste okay, the noodle was springy, it just shouldn't be called "garlic" noodle though.

We also got a banana foster as dessert at the end and it was alight. Service on that night was good, a little pricy for that quality of food. Not planning to come back again, but would down to try PPQ which is supposedly another good one, hopefully it will be better there.

excerpts: Wait, there's also the Thanh Long mussels, which are delicious and have a slight sweetness to the savory butter!
We only come here for birthdays and special occasions because of the price, and let's face it, the oily artery-clogging butter.
So much flavor and worth working out for in the gym every day.
I just can't believe there are people on here saying PPQ is better?!?!
Blasphemy!
Thanh Long is known for the generations guarded secret recipe and secret kitchen within the kitchen so the recipe is only kept within the family!

This place is an ultimate indulgence and you can tell by the way this place is always pack filled with people on a nightly basis and even more people waiting by the host table for their turn to be seated and bibbed for a delicious dining experience.
Valet parking is about $12, $13 per car.
It's always hard to find parking here, so we always do valet.
My mouth is watering right now just thinking about this place!
thanh long mussels.author: Sabrina D.
thanh long mussels.review: Roasted crab and garlic noodles! Enough said! Wait, there's also the Thanh Long mussels, which are delicious and have a slight sweetness to the savory butter! We only come here for birthdays and special occasions because of the price, and let's face it, the oily artery-clogging butter. So much flavor and worth working out for in the gym every day. I just can't believe there are people on here saying PPQ is better?!?! Blasphemy! Thanh Long is known for the generations guarded secret recipe and secret kitchen within the kitchen so the recipe is only kept within the family! This place is an ultimate indulgence and you can tell by the way this place is always pack filled with people on a nightly basis and even more people waiting by the host table for their turn to be seated and bibbed for a delicious dining experience. Valet parking is about $12, $13 per car. It's always hard to find parking here, so we always do valet. My mouth is watering right now just thinking about this place!

excerpts:
Fried calamari
Thanh Long mussels

***
Coconut fried shrimp
Roasted crab
thanh long mussels.author: Yvette B.
thanh long mussels.review:
I've been here 2 times in 2 weeks! the second time I've came here I came to a realization that thanh Long has given me one of the best meals of my life. I would highly recommend this place to anyone and everyone! 
These are all items I've ordered and was not a disappointment at all! 

Fried calamari
Thanh Long mussels****
Coconut fried shrimp
Roasted crab ****
Garlic noodles****
Seafood garlic rice
Garlic rice

I have yet to explore more of the menu but just those few items was a game changer! On the plus, service is just as great as the food!

excerpts: Thanh long mussels were served in a group of 5 served on a crostini with lots of garlic and butter.
Mussels were fresh and the crostini was tasty.
thanh long mussels.author: Maria A.
thanh long mussels.review:
The hype is real my friends. The garlic noodle with roasted crab is to die for. We went for my boyfriends birthday and had a memorable experience there filled with tons of seafood. 

Thanh long mussels were served in a group of 5 served on a crostini with lots of garlic and butter. Mussels were fresh and the crostini was tasty. Beware those with high cholesterol though, this dish is covered in buttery goodness!

Crab puffs were minced crab, peanuts and herb cheese served with a dipping sauce. Pretty good, but not floored by the flavors. 

The main event of the night was the roasted crab with garlic noodle which came out piping hot. The crab was fresh and the noodles, which are big enough for several people to share were amazing. The huge crabs are big enough for two people to share, one of you're extra hungry. We went on a Sunday night and there were plenty of tables. But I can imagine it could get crowded here on the weekends. Parking here is difficult so be prepared to use the valet service out front.

excerpts: I knew I wanted to order the Thanh Long Mussels and An's Famous Garlic Noodles.
so we ended up ordering Tempura Style Coconut Prawns, Thanh Long Mussels, the Roast Crab and Garlic Noodles.
The Prawns were ok.
Nothing that blew me away.
The Mussels; however,  were delicious.
I would definitely order that again for an appetizer.
so we ended up ordering Tempura Style Coconut Prawns, Thanh Long Mussels, the Roast Crab and Garlic Noodles.
The Prawns were ok.
Nothing that blew me away.
The Mussels; however,  were delicious.
I would definitely order that again for an appetizer.
And the Garlic Noodles may not look like much when it arrives to your table, but once you take a bite you will not be able to stop slurping those noodles.
thanh long mussels.author: Kevin G.
thanh long mussels.review:
So, last week I was planning on driving to Austin, Texas for some barbecue and I get a phone call from my sister asking me what I was up to.  She asked me if I wanted to take a one day trip to San Francisco.  "Heck yea!", I told her.  I haven't been to SF in years.  Now, I had my heart set on going to House of Prime Rib but they were booked a month in advance.  But, I had remembered seeing Thanh Long featured on either the Travel or Food Channel weeks beforehand so I tried booking a reservation online.  Sadly, there was nothing available so I called the restaurant and got a reservation!

I viewed the menu online and browsed through the photos on Yelp beforehand.  I knew I wanted to order the Thanh Long Mussels and An's Famous Garlic Noodles.  I was up in the air on the Dungeness Crab because I knew it would be rather pricey.

We arrived at 5:30 that night and was promptly seated to our table.  We looked around and noticed that every table was having the crab so we asked our server what the market price was ($53.95 as of October 8th).  We figured we would not be back to SF for awhile so we ended up ordering Tempura Style Coconut Prawns, Thanh Long Mussels, the Roast Crab and Garlic Noodles.  The Prawns were ok.  Nothing that blew me away.  The Mussels; however,  were delicious.  I would definitely order that again for an appetizer.  The Roast Crab...O M G!  That was the BEST crab I have ever had!  I'm not really too sure what all the spices they use but it was heaven.  The crab meat was so tender and flavorful.  And the Garlic Noodles may not look like much when it arrives to your table, but once you take a bite you will not be able to stop slurping those noodles.  Mix it with the sauce from the crab and it tastes even better!  

The service here is top notch!  They kept checking back with us to see how everything was and constantly refilled our drinks (soda and iced tea).  I would definitely recommend and come back here for dinner.  Anyone who has rated this place below 5 stars is absolutely nuts.  Thanh Long is on point!

excerpts: Thanh long mussels with garlic crostini- $12 for 5 pieces of mussel and 5 pieces of garlic crostini.
At first I was like, uh wth, a box of mussels cost only $3.99 and a baguette is $1 and you are only going to give me five pieces of each?!?!
But this stuff is off the hook, has a pesto sauce on top of the mussel.
I usually take the mussel with the pesto/buttery goodness and top it on my crostini..
MmMMm...
thanh long mussels.author: Jennifer D.
thanh long mussels.review:
MAKE A RESERVATION.

Awesome service + Awesome food= Happy camper.

Been here a few times and the food is consistant. Ordered the same thing each time.

1. Thanh long mussels with garlic crostini- $12 for 5 pieces of mussel and 5 pieces of garlic crostini. 
At first I was like, uh wth, a box of mussels cost only $3.99 and a baguette is $1 and you are only going to give me five pieces of each?!?! But this stuff is off the hook, has a pesto sauce on top of the mussel. I usually take the mussel with the pesto/buttery goodness and top it on my crostini..MmMMm...a must try!!

2. Roasted crab- $37-40
Waiter usually recommends that one crab per person. First time bf and I tried that and two garlic noodles. Next time we decided to eat like Kings and get two crabs and 1 garlic noodle since I can make garlic noodle at home. This is a must try if you are a first timer! The peppery, buttery sauce is to die for!! I dip every piece of lump crab meat into the sauce, the clogged arteries will just have to understand.

3. Tamarind crab- $37- $40
OMG OMG OMG I freaking love this one. Yes, the roasted crab is good, but this one has sooooo much flavor. If you like sweet/sour stuff, this is a must try. When I ordered this, not only did I dip each piece of crab meat into the sauce, I LICKED the sauce on the shell and everything, NO SHAME AT ALL. When there was no more crab left, I even dipped my fingers in the sauce just to taste the sauce for the last time. lol

4. GARLIC NOODLES- $12
BELIEVE THE HYPE. This stuff is so addicting, I wish my plates were bottomless. Whiling stuffing my face with all this garlic and buttery goodness, I contemplate how many more plates I should order and how many more I should togo. The noodles here are like no other, you can replicate the flavor, but you can't replicate the texture due to the noodles, believe me, I have tried! Recently found out from a friend that they order their noodles specially from a private owner, so I have stopped searching.

5. Fried banana with iced cream- Always a hit. Two scoops of ice cream with two fried bananas and chocolate syrup.

Service here is awesome- You'd think that eating crab at a fancy place like this would be awkward, but they have it down to a science: Waiters are constantly changing out your garbage bowl, they put on a bib FOR YOU, and they even bring out two rounds of piping hot towels so that you can clean your hands.

I HIGHLY RECOMMEND YOU TRY THIS PLACE IF YOU GET THE CHANCE. GREAT FOR INTIMATE BIRTHDAY DINNERS/ SPECIAL OCCASIONS.

excerpts: Between two people, we ordered Thanh Long Mussels, Roast Crab, and Garlic Noodles.
thanh long mussels.author: Jenny T.
thanh long mussels.review:
I love this restaurant because the food is so good!

My suggestion is to come here early for dinner (around 6pm) to find good parking and to beat the crowd. I made reservations for 2 at 6:30pm but we actually got to the restaurant about 15 minutes early. We were seated right away.

Our server was friendly and checked in on us at the right times.

Between two people, we ordered Thanh Long Mussels, Roast Crab, and Garlic Noodles. I recommend trying out all three of these dishes because they were so delicious.

I will definitely return.

excerpts: You might need a coronary bypass after going through the Thanh Long Mussels, Roast Crab, and Garlic Noodles, but it's worth every cent of your health insurance deductible if you have it.
You see the oil on the plates,  but with every bite, your senses don't register it as "just" oil.
Instead, a bite of the garlic noodles dressed with some drippings from the roast crab feels like your mouth is being coated in silken, mouth-filling luxury.
Instead, a bite of the garlic noodles dressed with some drippings from the roast crab feels like your mouth is being coated in silken, mouth-filling luxury.
thanh long mussels.author: Sam W.
thanh long mussels.review:
When this place was recommend to me, I was unassuming and figured, "Oh, ok, Vietnamese seafood joint...should be the usual family-style Asian restaurant."  So, we went on ahead and made reservations for the day before.  The day of, I see this sort of hideous, unassuming exterior--it looks like any generic abandoned Richmond/Sunset shop/boutique.  When we enter, it's a completely different story--dimmed lighting, modern decor, tablecloths, etc.  We are ~10 minutes late (parking was a pain in the neighborhood), yet they seat us promptly.  

The staff is friendly and helpful (they helped us pick out items for our group and make recommendations based on our party size). I order a bottle of wine that ends up being a twist-cap, but our waiter still makes the motions and lets me sample first.  When it comes time for eating, the staff helps us put on our bibs, brings extra napkins without having to be asked, and replaces our plates and bowls whenever things started to get messy.  Oh yeah, and brownie points on attentiveness--my water never goes empty.  (Sort of silly, but small gestures like these make for a good impression with me.)

The food itself, in summary, is rich and filling in the most gluttonous fashion. We had the Mango Salad (warm with a perfect hint of charred flavor), and the Traditional Vietnamese Salad (it was good, but the other dishes overshadow this one). You might need a coronary bypass after going through the Thanh Long Mussels, Roast Crab, and Garlic Noodles, but it's worth every cent of your health insurance deductible if you have it.  You see the oil on the plates,  but with every bite, your senses don't register it as "just" oil.  Instead, a bite of the garlic noodles dressed with some drippings from the roast crab feels like your mouth is being coated in silken, mouth-filling luxury.  As you swallow, you are overwhelmed with a noise in your head--that noise is your brain screaming, "MORE MORE MORE!!!"

Pure crack.

When the bill comes, we see gratuity tagged on, but it's pre-tax and pre-alcohol (as with everything else, Thanh Long gets it right).  When you divide everything up for the type of service and food we experienced here, it comes to about $40-ish per person, and worth every darn penny.  

Thanh Long, we'll definitely be back.

excerpts: Thanh Long Mussels were perfect appetizers, succulent and buttery paired with toast.
thanh long mussels.author: Cindy L.
thanh long mussels.review: Thanh Long Mussels were perfect appetizers, succulent and buttery paired with toast. Sadly, Garlic noodles and Roasted Crab (what we really came for) left much to be desired, disappointing. We also ordered the Vegetarian Delight just to have a veggie dish, can't say much for stir fried frozen veggies. That being said, ambience was warm and welcoming and the service was excellent. As one might expect, we left with mixed feelings.

excerpts: We ordered the salt and pepper calamari, thanh long mussels, roast crab, and garlic noodles.
The salt and pepper calamari was the first dish to reach our table.
I didn't really enjoy the dish because the batter made some pieces taste stale while other pieces were crispy.
I sat at the table thinking, OMG
I hope this place gets better or else
I'm going to scream at all my cousins for this shizz.
The second dish we received was the thanh long mussels.
It was mussels with a pesto sauce on top of a slice of buttered bread.
YUMMY!!!!
By this time I thought a good dish canceled out a bad and was feeling better about Thanh Long.
thanh long mussels.author: Anna K.
thanh long mussels.review:
I have been hearing about Thanh Long for several years now ever since I started flying to the bay. All of my cousins that have visited the city have eaten there and have loved the garlic noodles and roast crab. Now that I'm here in the bay, I finally got to try it and I now know why my cousins won't  stfu about this place. I can now join my cousins as we can't and won't stfu about Thanh Long.

Thanh Long is slightly far from the heart of the city, near 46th street. My friends and I were lost and almost gave up, since we were traveling from Mission. However, we finally found it and were relieved that our trek to the restaurant was over. We ordered the salt and pepper calamari, thanh long mussels, roast crab, and garlic noodles. The salt and pepper calamari was the first dish to reach our table. I didn't really enjoy the dish because the batter made some pieces taste stale while other pieces were crispy. I sat at the table thinking, OMG I hope this place gets better or else I'm going to scream at all my cousins for this shizz. The second dish we received was the thanh long mussels. It was mussels with a pesto sauce on top of a slice of buttered bread. YUMMY!!!! By this time I thought a good dish canceled out a bad and was feeling better about Thanh Long. We later got the garlic noodles and roast crab and OMFG SOOOOO GOOD. The garlic noodles are spaghetti noodles (or so I think) but in a nice blend of garlic, salt, and crack. The roast crab is even more delicious than the noodles. It was garlicky and peppery with probably more crack. I now understand why each table setting has crab crackers. Who goes to Thanh Long without trying their roast crab?!?!?!?!?! 

I probably stunk of garlic when I met up with my friend Shad and his friend Erin after dinner. But would I change my restaurant plans knowing that I would be meeting up with them? HELL NO!! SORRY!!!! I come in (garlicky) peace. =]

excerpts: Thanh Long Mussels: served on a slice of baguette with pesto sauce.
this was pretty good, although I didn't appreciate how it was swimming in butter, but
thanh long mussels.author: Thanh N.
thanh long mussels.review:
Actually more like a 3.5... 

I fell in love with their garlic noodles and roasted  crab a few years ago and luckily my family has somehow PERFECTED this meal at home. So when I came back recently for a birthday dinner, every single person ordered garlic noodles and roasted crab and a bunch of appetizers. Sad to say, it wasn't as good as I remembered. 

Lychee Martini: for the price, probably not worth it. I was able to thoroughly enjoy it which isn't a good thing for all of you alcoholics out there, seeing as how I can easily k.o. after 1/3 a beer bottle.

Thanh Long Mussels: served on a slice of baguette with pesto sauce. this was pretty good, although I didn't appreciate how it was swimming in butter, but hey if you're going to eat at Thanh Long, the last thing you should do is count calories right?

Traditional Vietnamese Salad: i'm glad we ordered some sort of veggie dish. for the most, it was tasty but the fish sauce was overly sweet and not salty/savory enough. it really needs more of a kick that "Vietnamese vinaigrette" usually has. 

We also ordered a few more appetizers, but I can't seem to recall them, I guess they weren't too memorable in my book. Oh well!

Roasted Crab: still freakin delicious. I love how no matter what time of the year you come here, the crabs are always ginormous and fresh! 

Garlic Noodles: Such a sad disappointment! What happened to the garlic in garlic noodles?? You can smell it, but for some reason you can't taste it at all. *sigh* what a tease! For the most part, it was pretty bland, and tasted like they only used garlic powder, so there wasn't any real, fresh, authentic garlic bite to it. So, so sad. 

For dessert, we all shared a bunch, in case you go thinking my belly is some sort of bottomless pit (I wish). 

Fried Banna a la Mode: It tastes exactly what it sounds like. it was good, but nothing mind blowing.

Orange Sorbet: it was served in a frozen orange shell and was rock hard. Whatever shavings of this sorbet I manage to get before giving up, was light, and refreshing. If only it was easier to eat. 

Traditional Banana Cake a la Mode: Okay, I don't even know how to contain myself on this one. I'm not a crazy fan of bananas, but omg. This has become one of the best desserts I've ever had in my whole entire life. I dream of the day that I go back to Thanh Long just for this orgasmic worthy dessert. I might be over hyping it, but it was pretty damn good. The bananas in the cake added a nice caramelized texture, and when you eat it with a spoon of ice cream, the mixture of hot and cold, sweet and savory all just mixes in your mouth, making it a perfect ending to any meal.

So to conclude my dining experience, here's your take home message: do NOT forget to order the banana cake a la mode. or else you're just shooting yourself in the foot. Happy eating!

excerpts: We order the salmon carpaccio and Thanh Long mussels as starter dishes.
Capers give the fresh salmon a nice, salty hint.
The mussels practically melt in your mouth.
Mop up the remaining juices with your bread.
thanh long mussels.author: Ines C.
thanh long mussels.review:
On the outside, Thanh Long resembles a small, quiet family restaurant. You don't realize the bustling nature and star power of this restaurant until you enter the door.

I notice a crab (or two) on everyone's table as I walk to my seat. The room is fragrant with garlic and spices. This is the real deal, I say to my parents.

We order the salmon carpaccio and Thanh Long mussels as starter dishes. Capers give the fresh salmon a nice, salty hint. The mussels practically melt in your mouth. Mop up the remaining juices with your bread. Perfection.

Garlic noodles are delicious, but they're nothing special without the crab. Isn't that why you came in the first place? So we order one roast crab. By itself the crab is meaty and fragrant, but the sauce is the extra level. It's like instant gratification when you drizzle that over the noodles.

The flavor's slightly more subtle in comparison to Boiling Crab, of course---especially if you love the whole sha-bang---but that's where the sophistication lies. That, and the customer service makes Thanh Long worth the price and visit.

excerpts: A fantastic meal starting with a couple of  tasty Passion Teas (carefully, these sneak up on you!), the super fresh Salmon Carpaccio, and a unique-tasting dish of Thanh Long Mussels.
thanh long mussels.author: Dave W.
thanh long mussels.review:
It's been a few years since my last visit to Thanh Long.  But the food and service of last night's visit were as good as ever!

A fantastic meal starting with a couple of  tasty Passion Teas (carefully, these sneak up on you!), the super fresh Salmon Carpaccio, and a unique-tasting dish of Thanh Long Mussels.   The toasted French baguette crostini for the latter two dishes was a perfect textural pairing.

Next, we chose the Roast Crab and Garlic Noodles from the "Secret Kitchen Dishes", which for anyone who's ever visited Thanh Long, can clearly see that almost every table has ordered.  Haha!  "Secret"...  yeah.  Everyone knows these are the two destination items of this restaurant!  These two complimenting dishes bring me back again and again. 

Attentive service, mouth-watering dishes prepared consistently to perfection.  All in all, another great dining experience!

excerpts: I get the Roasted Crab, Tiger Prawns with garlic noodles, calamari, Thanh long mussels, and a side of Jasmine rice..
by then
I'm stuffed but cant pass up dessert..
Chocolate LAva cake with hazelnut gelato ice cream!!
thanh long mussels.author: Shirl C.
thanh long mussels.review:
When ever I want crab I have to go to Thanh Long! Um mm oh so good! I get the Roasted Crab, Tiger Prawns with garlic noodles, calamari, Thanh long mussels, and a side of Jasmine rice.. by then I'm stuffed but cant pass up dessert..  Chocolate LAva cake with hazelnut gelato ice cream!! Umm Umm good!

8/9/09 Watch out Thanh long! Jasmine Gardens Wok Roasted Crab is ummm ummmm GOOOOD! its more flavorful and affordable! for all you crab lovers its a must to try! 
JASMINE GARDEN 708 14TH STREET @ CHURCH SF

excerpts: Thanh Long Mussels to start with freshly toasted baguette crostini.
thanh long mussels.author: Kimberly-Alexis N.
thanh long mussels.review:
Love, love, love this place...  I eat here once a month, need I say more?! :P  The food is fantastic!  Thanh Long Mussels to start with freshly toasted baguette crostini.  Next, roast crab and garlic noodles.  Lastly, fried bananas with choice of ice cream (usually vanilla).  

Oh, BTW...  Did I mention that this is one of my favorite restaurants?!

excerpts: We started off with Thanh Long mussels in Asian pesto sauce with bread.
The bread was buttery and the sauce was oily (since it's pesto), but it was pretty good.
thanh long mussels.author: Ring K.
thanh long mussels.review:
Hopefully my heart will still be pumping by the time I'm done with this review...

We had reservations at 6:30 on a Sunday night and we were seated immediately.  

We started off with Thanh Long mussels in Asian pesto sauce with bread.  The bread was buttery and the sauce was oily (since it's pesto), but it was pretty good.  We also had the Soft Shell Crab.  This was just deep fried soft shell crab with a tamarind-chili sauce on the side.

Of course we had to order the roasted crab and garlic noodles (I'm a huge fan of garlic noodles, so we had to each get our own order).  It was delicious.  The crab was drenched in butter and garlic and black pepper.  

We finished with Grandma An's Banana Bread Pudding.  This was delicious.  The bread pudding is more like a slice of super soft bread pudding with lots of bananas, but that paired with the hazelnut ice cream was a nice finish to our fattening meal.  We spent about $140 (inc. tax & tip) for 2 appetizers, crab, 2 orders of garlic noodles, and dessert.

excerpts: we ordered the thanh long mussels which came with crostini.. and omg.. it was so good! =
P
thanh long mussels.author: Heather C.
thanh long mussels.review: Its soooo packed here! I came on Saturday and boy was it packed me and the boyfriend got a table upstairs.. (thank god) we ordered the thanh long mussels which came with crostini.. and omg.. it was so good! =P We also ordered the roasted crab and garlic noodles.. and just like the mussels it was so good! I really can't wait til i come back to this place..next time i'll order a drink! =) Really good service here oh and of course good food! I'll be back soon!

excerpts: For appetizers we ordered the Thanh Long mussels, which came with little toasted crostini, the mussels were cooked really well and were not chewy at all  and the salt and pepper squid was lightly battered and not overcooked.
thanh long mussels.author: carebear l.
thanh long mussels.review: My bf brought me here for a birthday surprise romantic dinner here.  We kind of have this unfinished business/ past history thing at this establishment. For appetizers we ordered the Thanh Long mussels, which came with little toasted crostini, the mussels were cooked really well and were not chewy at all  and the salt and pepper squid was lightly battered and not overcooked. For soups we ordered asian bouillabaisse, which was tasty, with just the perfect amount of tamarind. For entrees we ordered the steamed sea bass, which I thought was just a tad overcooked, but the sauce was good. The colossal royal tiger prawns were really nothing to brag about, but the garlic noodles.....wow they were delicious. I would come back here, just for the garlic noodles. The drunken crab tasted like soapy dishwater to me, I guess I should have ordered the Roasted crab. The service was great, but the silverware was dirty. I would come back here, but the food is just too overpriced. A lot of these dishes you can definitely order at another restaurant for half the price and will taste just as good if not better. It's kind of funny how some of the dishes are home style type of dishes, but the names are changed to sound a lot more sophisticated so that they can charge an arm and a leg. Overall , I give the food and service a 4 stars, but they get 3 stars for overcharging for the dishes that are home style and can be found in many Vietnamese kitchens. I do know I'll be back for the garlic noodles though.

excerpts: Love the tamirand crab, Thanh long mussels, mango salad, actually everything that I tried.
My favorite actually the Godiva Lava cake with grand marnier sauce...it is to die for and you can only get it at Thanh Long.
thanh long mussels.author: Eva E.
thanh long mussels.review: Best spot for roasted crab!! I have never been disappointed from this place.  Yes, it is a bit overpriced but you get what you pay for.  Love the tamirand crab, Thanh long mussels, mango salad, actually everything that I tried.  My favorite actually the Godiva Lava cake with grand marnier sauce...it is to die for and you can only get it at Thanh Long.

excerpts:
Appetizers - Thanh Long Mussels
2.
thanh long mussels.author: Violet N.
thanh long mussels.review:
I've been going to Thanh Long for as long as I can remember. Over 5 years for sure and because of my frequent visits, majority of the staff knows my name and most of them know exactly what I'd usually order... scary I know, but I love it.

I'm giving Thanh Long 5 stars because I feel that the overall experience is great. With a casual atmosphere, cozy modern Asian decor, a wide variety of French/Vietnamese inspired dishes and an amazing friendly staff, it is always a joy to come here. 

Must Haves: 
1. Appetizers - Thanh Long Mussels
2. Entree: Roasted Crab and Garlic Noodles. 
    (Large enough portion for two)
3. Dessert: Vanilla Creme Brulee

Pros: This place might look small, but it can seat a ton of people so if you are looking for a great place to host your birthday dinner or celebration dinner, they can accommodate you. Make sure you make reservations at least a month ahead of time.

Cons: Parking is horrible, but that's because everyone wants to eat here. To save yourself from wanting to hit every car that is already parked with the bat that is in your trunk because you're annoyed from circling around for the 500th time... Park valet. Make sure you tip the valet guys good because these guys are outside in the cold, for who knows how long, to park your car while you're inside the warm restaurant ready to eat some amazing crab. Another con would probably be that the bar area is extremely small and since it's pretty much combined with the waiting area, being as crowded as it is, you'll feel like you're in a packed dance club trying to get a drink.  Better to wait outside.

Advice: Make sure you have a reservation, especially during weekends and holidays. It's just for convenience because you don't want to go to the restaurant with a group of people or a date after it took you about an hour or so to find parking and then find out that you would have to wait another hour and half before you get sat. Walk-ins do exist and if you do decide to go that route, you'll probably be waiting around for quite awhile drooling as you watch other people enjoy their meal.

Major Advice: If you don't like getting your hands dirty, you'd probably want to skip this restaurant. This place is known for their roasted crab and with that being said people... you eat crab with your freaking hands!! So for you dainty girls who are scared to get dirty... this place isn't for you! Eating the crab here is the whole fun experience because you can be in a nice restaurant and still be able to get down and dirty without feeling embarrassed. If you decide to come to this restaurant to dine on anything else but the crab... than you should just choose another freaking restaurant. By you doing that, it's like you deciding to go to a burger joint to order a salad... What the heck!? Don't get me wrong, all of their other dishes are great, but you have to at least order the crab... any crab. If you've already tasted the crab and came back to try the other dishes... please do so because they're just as delicious.

excerpts: I absolutely love their fried salt and pepper calamari, it's hands down the best kind I've tried and trust me almost everywhere
I go
salt and pepper calamari.author: Marissa G.
salt and pepper calamari.review:
I can't ever get over this place, its my absolute favorite. 

I come here often and even more often do I order take out. I absolutely love their fried salt and pepper calamari, it's hands down the best kind I've tried and trust me almost everywhere I go I order calamari. 

Parking is really hard to find, so I suggest paying valet if it hasn't changed it's about $13 and they park it a few blocks over in a lot and usually have it ready for you outside when you come out. 

*Calamari - 5/5 
SO BOMB! I can't say that enough. Its salt & pepper calamari served with onions, green onions and red chopped peppers.

*Roasted Garlic Crab - 5/5
AAAMMMMAAAZIIING. I suggest getting a crab per person, mainly because it's so good and I wouldn't want to share this with anyone. Its so flavorful and the butter sauce is a great sauce to dip the cracked crab in.

* Garlic Noodles - 5/5
Best garlic noodles I've come across. Garlic noodles is becoming very "hyped" up and a lot of places are starting to serve them however none are as flavorful and spot on for the garlic as these. 

*Garlic Toast - 5/5
You can't really go wrong with a side of garlic toast, lets just say I think garlic is my favorite flavor. 

The service is great, they're very on point when it comes to everything and get your food out quick. If I could eat here once a week I would, but for now once every 2 weeks will have to do.... UNLESSSS, I can some how magically find out how to make the calamari and noodles just like them.

excerpts: like I was expecting..) and we ordered the salt and pepper calamari, mango salad, and Vietnamese salad (both salads had very little vegetables and just a lot of fluff / fruit) as appetizers.
For entrees, we got colossal tiger prawns
salt and pepper calamari.author: Leslie T.
salt and pepper calamari.review:
I had heard good things about Thanh Long but was disappointed in how expensive everything was, how small the portions were and how rude the customer service was. Upon entering, I had 3 out of a party of 5 and there is a strict rule saying that parties that are more than 10 minutes late  will automatically be put on the waitlist. That's normal - totally OK with that - but there were so many open tables and so many people in the waiting area, it made me think "are all these people waiting really just partial parties?" The waiting area is super small; we were all shoulder to shoulder with each other and bumping elbows. The other 2 in our party came within the 10 minutes (we made a reservation via Yelp! but didn't get any Cash Back rewards for it like I was expecting..) and we ordered the salt and pepper calamari, mango salad, and Vietnamese salad (both salads had very little vegetables and just a lot of fluff / fruit) as appetizers. For entrees, we got colossal tiger prawns (yes they were big but only enough for 1 prawn per person o.o), Roast Crab, Thanh Long Fish and Spicy Eggplant. Portions were PUNY and off-putting... furthermore, our waiter got a little sassy with us and when I reminded him we had a birthday, he snapped back and said "Yeah, you tell your waiter which is ME and you already told me". Sheesh - didn't seem like you got it the first time so sorry for double checking... 

I prefer garlic noodles with lobster. There are so many places in LA where you can get garlic butter noodles with lobster for half the price, double the quantity and even more delicious. Yes, we're not in LA but even Perilla and Cajun House's prices are more reasonable, portions are justified and quality of food is even better. I wouldn't come back.

excerpts: Salt and pepper calamari, roasted crab, and garlic noodles were good.
Make reservations!
salt and pepper calamari.author: Letitia L.
salt and pepper calamari.review:
Great Mango Salad!  That was my favorite dish.  Salty and sweet, warm salad.  Delicious!  Unfortunately I didn't take a pic of it.
Salt and pepper calamari, roasted crab, and garlic noodles were good.
Make reservations!

excerpts: The roasted crab and salt and pepper calamari were awesome.
I had never ever tasted crab that was seasoned completely that good.
The salt and pepper calamari was over the top also.
Definitely would eat here again when I am in town.
salt and pepper calamari.author: Robert W.
salt and pepper calamari.review: Out here visiting my son and grand baby And wanted some seafood and Vietnamese food and he told me about this place and needless to say wasn't disappointed.  The roasted crab and salt and pepper calamari were awesome. I had never ever tasted crab that was seasoned completely that good. The salt and pepper calamari was over the top also. Definitely would eat here again when I am in town.

excerpts: Also had the salt and pepper calamari appetizer, 2 orders of garlic noodles, shakin beef and villager's special.
One crab was perfect but small
, 2nd crab was skinny (light weight and the tiny meat fell away from the shell), and the 3rd crab was not fresh (meat no longer had the fresh texture, mushy).
I may have not come here the last 2yrs, but we used to get a fat plump and juicy crab...
2lbs minimum on each order.
There was no comparison with any other restaurant when it comes to crab.
Prime rib is to House of Prime Rib as Roasted Dungeness Crab is to Thanh Long.
They certainly was a huge disappointment tonight.
I use to say don't worry about price, it's worth the experience to have Thanh Long Roasted Crab if you haven't had it.
The 3 disappointing crabs we had was not worth the $170 that we paid.
Garlic noodles is still what it is, to die for.
Overprice crab was a total failure.
Sorry, but my wife, my daughter and I love crab.
Tonight was the most disappointing crab dinner we've ever had.
What was interesting is
I read other 3 star reviews saying the quality of their has fallen last few visits.
salt and pepper calamari.author: Kmaintl L.
salt and pepper calamari.review:
Sorry, I have to change my rating down from 5 stars from the time we first started coming here around 1976 till now 2018. Thanh Long is known for their Vietnamese Roasted Crab for the over 40yrs we've been coming here, but tonight was a big disappointment celebrating our youngest daughter's graduation dinner here. We ordered 3 roasted crab tonight for 4 adults and 2 kids. Also had the salt and pepper calamari appetizer, 2 orders of garlic noodles, shakin beef and villager's special. One crab was perfect but small, 2nd crab was skinny (light weight and the tiny meat fell away from the shell), and the 3rd crab was not fresh (meat no longer had the fresh texture, mushy). I may have not come here the last 2yrs, but we used to get a fat plump and juicy crab... 2lbs minimum on each order. There was no comparison with any other restaurant when it comes to crab. Prime rib is to House of Prime Rib as Roasted Dungeness Crab is to Thanh Long. They certainly was a huge disappointment tonight. I use to say don't worry about price, it's worth the experience to have Thanh Long Roasted Crab if you haven't had it. The 3 disappointing crabs we had was not worth the $170 that we paid. It wouldn't be even worth half as they just lossed the wow factor tonight that what made Thanh Long famous for crab.

Service was great as usual and the dishes met our expectations. Garlic noodles is still what it is, to die for. Overprice crab was a total failure. Sorry, but my wife, my daughter and I love crab. Tonight was the most disappointing crab dinner we've ever had. What was interesting is I read other 3 star reviews saying the quality of their has fallen last few visits.

excerpts: I will say there are some good appetizers like the salt and pepper calamari and the shrimp toast.
salt and pepper calamari.author: M. H.
salt and pepper calamari.review:
If you know me, you know how much I LOVED Thanh Long! This use to be my go to place whenever I felt like splurging on a good meal. Three years ago I would've given this place 5 stars. But as the years went on, I'm becoming less impressed with this place. 

The last two times I've been here, the service has been subpar. On my previous visit before tonight, I had a waitress who was not very friendly and lacked social skills. I want to feel welcomed, especially if I'm paying a crap load of money on a great meal. Tonight I had a waiter who would only talk to me and would not acknowledge my grandma (can we say awkward and weird). 

On my previous visit, I received my crab way before my garlic noodles. Uhhhhh I would like to eat my HOT crab with my HOT garlic noodles. I don't want COLD crab with HOT garlic noodles. Tonight after my grandma and I ordered, we literally received our food 5 minutes later. Either the chef was able to whip up 2 roasted crabs and 2 orders of garlic noodles in under two minutes or they just reheated our food and served it to us (hmmmm). 

As far as the food, it does not excite me as much as it use to. My roasted crab was pretty good, but it lacked garlic and was more peppery and salty (and greasy af). My garlic noodles were good but not as good as I remember them being. I also want to mention that my food went cold pretty quickly (that's what happens when you reheat food...let me stop lol).

I will say there are some good appetizers like the salt and pepper calamari and the shrimp toast. I also like their fried rice and heard their mango salad is delicious as well. I've had the Tiger Prawns on garlic noodles and it was really good (it was my very first meal here).

I would definitely recommend this place to someone who has never experienced the infamous roasted crab and garlic noodles or just want to say they've been here. I personally don't see myself coming back here, unless its for a special event. I also want to mention that although they are the same family, Thanh Long is better than Crustaceans only because Crustaceans taste differently...and not in a good way.

excerpts: plus, it was $58 per person for crab!), but the items we got were good: garlic noodles (but probably a bit overpriced at about $12 for basically spaghetti with garlic oil, butter, and parmasan), eggplant entree (very delicious, and served with chicken and prawns), and salt and pepper calamari (excellent and probably more reasonably priced than the other two dishes.)
salt and pepper calamari.author: Matthew G.
salt and pepper calamari.review:
Good food, but a little bit of a wait (45 minutes without a reservation, at 6:00 on a Tuesday), and rather pricey.

No, we didn't order the crab (it appears we may have been the only people in the establishment who didn't? We love crab -- and their roast crab looked good -- but we were looking for Asian food, not crab per se... plus, it was $58 per person for crab!), but the items we got were good: garlic noodles (but probably a bit overpriced at about $12 for basically spaghetti with garlic oil, butter, and parmasan), eggplant entree (very delicious, and served with chicken and prawns), and salt and pepper calamari (excellent and probably more reasonably priced than the other two dishes.)

It was pretty astounding to look around and realize that basically ever other person in the room was spending $75+ per person for dinner (considering the $58 plus a drink and, in many cases, an appetizer.)

But everything we got was tasty, and the crab did look good, so if you're willing to shell out the $$$...

excerpts: We got the roast crab, along with garlic noodles, spicy eggplants, shaken beef, salt and pepper calamari, and catch in citrus.
The catch is citrus and shaken beef was my favorite.
The beef was very tender and juicy.
The sauce on the fish was delicious!
The sauce combination was very unique.
salt and pepper calamari.author: Michelle T.
salt and pepper calamari.review:
I don't understand the hype of this place. The crab seems really popular so that was a must get when my friends and I came for dinner. We got the roast crab, along with garlic noodles, spicy eggplants, shaken beef, salt and pepper calamari, and catch in citrus.

The crab was underwhelming. It tasted like it was just boiled in water. I didn't taste any garlic. 

The rest of the food we ordered was good. The catch is citrus and shaken beef was my favorite. The beef was very tender and juicy. The sauce on the fish was delicious! The sauce combination was very unique. I've never thought about using orange sauce with fish. 

I'd come back to try other stuff on their menu but will definitely opt out of their crab. If you want good crab, let me introduce you to this one restaurant on Noriega called New Hing Lung. The crab is fried with egg yolk and pumpkin. It's amazing.

excerpts: My coworkers and I ordered salt and pepper calamari and the shrimp toast for appetizers.
The calamari I could just not get enough of!!!
The mixture of the salt and pepper is just right, not too salty nor spicy.
The shrimp toast
I wasn't really into it, it's just a fried shrimp
and I thought the pieces were really small.
salt and pepper calamari.author: Vanessa L.
salt and pepper calamari.review:
Definitely need to make a reservation for this place. Once in a lifetime I'd eat here just cause of the price and because I prefer meat over seafood. 

My coworkers and I ordered salt and pepper calamari and the shrimp toast for appetizers. The calamari I could just not get enough of!!! The mixture of the salt and pepper is just right, not too salty nor spicy. The shrimp toast I wasn't really into it, it's just a fried shrimp and I thought the pieces were really small. 
Now for the real deal, I ordered a roast crab which has the restaurant's secret spices and garlic sauce on it. It's humongous and I'm still in awe. This taste good with the garlic noodles too! I put the garlic noodles in the big shell of the crab to give it more flavor. Everything about the crab was juicy and the butter mixed with the crab is tasty. 
Dessert: I got the creme brulee cheesecake which was rich, thick, and creamy. I'd rate it 3/5. The crust is the best part though.

Service: our waiter was really slow and preferred to take care of other smaller tables. He ignored a lot of our requests and seems to not be paying attention most of the time. For dessert, he asked everybody what they wanted EXCEPT my boss... He's standing right next to him and just skipped him and forgot about him. Dumb!

excerpts: We think the salt and pepper calamari was dried and no flavor but was still fresh.
I'll come back next time!!
salt and pepper calamari.author: Peter A.
salt and pepper calamari.review: If you are a fan of crabs, this is a right place to go. My friend and I enjoyed eating 2 crabs and garlic noodles. We think the salt and pepper calamari was dried and no flavor but was still fresh. I'll come back next time!!

excerpts: Ordered the mussels, salt and pepper calamari.
Those are a must !
Thank you to our server Sean he was great !!
salt and pepper calamari.author: Elena G.
salt and pepper calamari.review: First time here, came from Sacramento. Best crab I've ever had ! Ordered the mussels, salt and pepper calamari. Those are a must ! Thank you to our server Sean he was great !!

excerpts: Start with the salt and pepper calamari and soft shell crabs and cruise into the whole crab and garlic noodles for the main.
Eat the crab and noodles as you go, or shell all the crab and combine with the noodles and drizzle pepper butter over it all.
A bottle or two of a nice white
and you've got a great date night!!
salt and pepper calamari.author: Marty C.
salt and pepper calamari.review: You want the best garlic noodles and whole crab in the city?  Thanh Long has it!!  Start with the salt and pepper calamari and soft shell crabs and cruise into the whole crab and garlic noodles for the main.  Eat the crab and noodles as you go, or shell all the crab and combine with the noodles and drizzle pepper butter over it all.  A bottle or two of a nice white and you've got a great date night!!

excerpts:
For starters, I had the salt and pepper calamari, which was good, but some were too salty! 
Overall, I think this small popular, two bathroom stalls, is totally, totally, overrated and overpriced.
One good thing about this place is the service was good, which should be expected at such an overpriced and overrated restaurant!!!!!!
salt and pepper calamari.author: Nadine S.
salt and pepper calamari.review:
Went here yesterday for my birthday dinner. I had heard about this place for years. Totally overrated and overpriced. I had the jumbo prawns and garlic noodles. Prawns were jumbo, but dry and hard. Not good. Garlic noodles were ok. I am not a pasta, top ramen eater, so to me the noodles were not that great. One of my daughters had the eggplant dish which I tasted and it was good. My other daughter had the shrimp and pork medallions, which was good. 
For starters, I had the salt and pepper calamari, which was good, but some were too salty! 
Overall, I think this small popular, two bathroom stalls, is totally, totally, overrated and overpriced.
One good thing about this place is the service was good, which should be expected at such an overpriced and overrated restaurant!!!!!!

excerpts: The salt and pepper calamari is the perfect appetizer
so I would highly recommend that for sharing.
Overall, good place for dinner, though on the pricier side.
salt and pepper calamari.author: Betty T.
salt and pepper calamari.review: Honestly, the crab is a little too hyped. Everyone says the roasted crab is good but I think I enjoy good old fashioned steamed crab better. All you need is a little lemon and pepper and it will taste just as good, plus it won't break your bank. My favorite dish here is the shaken beef. The pieces of beef were the right size, tenderness, and flavorful. I'd take that over the crab anytime. My friends really enjoyed the garlic noodles although I don't really like them that dry. I tend to like my noodles on the wetter/saucier side. The salt and pepper calamari is the perfect appetizer so I would highly recommend that for sharing. Overall, good place for dinner, though on the pricier side. I'm drooling just thinking about the shaken beef.

excerpts: Salt and pepper calamari
: this was very good.
salt and pepper calamari.author: Lilly W.
salt and pepper calamari.review:
I was excited to try this out. This is supposed to be the best Viet food in SF. And my friends are raving about the garlic noodles. We were at a friend's that's nearby. So put our name down and came back 45 mins later for a table of seven and got seated right away Sat around 8pm. 

The food was definitely good. But it wasn't the best Viet food that I ever had. The crabs from PPQ is definitely better (comparing the roasted crabs). Here is the list of food that we ordered. 

Mango salad: Only okay. It's too warm for a salad. Even the lettuce felt cooked, which is weird for me. 

Steamed Sea Bass: again very general. The sea bass tasted overcooked. It wasn't very tender. The House's sea bass is 10x better. 

Spicy eggplant: this was tasty. It also had chicken and shrimp. But something you can get at every chinese restaurant. 

Roasted crab: not as good as PPQ. Very oily and not as tasty. 

French beef: the beef is very tender. Definitely one of the better dishes. The portion is not very big as it is served on a big bed of lettuce. 

Salt and pepper calamari: this was very good. It didn't have a lot of breading. 

Grilled prawn over garlic noodles: it's good but nothing too special. The prawn was big but only four pieces. 

Garlic noodles: this is very good. Not too buttery. But I think the garlic noodles from The Kickin Crab is better.

excerpts: We also ordered the salt and pepper calamari which is a great appetizer.
I'll deff be back again
salt and pepper calamari.author: Crystal R.
salt and pepper calamari.review: I LOVE this place.  This is my second time eating here and it is just as good as the first time, maybe even better. The service is great. My bf and I get each get our own crab and share noodles. Its pricey but you get what you pay for and that's deliciously fresh seafood. We also ordered the salt and pepper calamari which is a great appetizer. I'll deff be back again

excerpts: We had the salt and pepper calamari.
salt and pepper calamari.author: Belinda L.
salt and pepper calamari.review:
It's been 21 years since we ate at this restaurant. The occasion then was my husband asking my parents for my hand in marriage. My sister wanted to celebrate my twin daughters' 18th birthday here. My husband made the reservation. There were only 2 reservations available a 5:30 p.m. or 8:30 p.m. We took the later one because of other obligations. There was a little bit of a wait for our table when we arrived.
Alex was our server. He got our water and hot jasmine tea going and answered questions about our menu choices such as how much roast crab and garlic noodles to order for our party of 10, which fish was the better choice, ... We went with 2 roasted crabs and 2 garlic noodles because Grandpa's dish of tiger prawns came with garlic noodles. There were 4 tiger prawns in the dish. The prawns were excellent. There weren't enough for everybody at the table. The garlic noodles always a hit with everybody especially the younger ones in the party. We had to order another garlic noodles and a large bowl of steamed rice. We had the salt and pepper calamari. We ordered the lemongrass chicken for Grandma. The dish was so tasty and the vegetables so tender that the grandchildren ate a good portion of the dish. We wonder if Grandma got enough to eat. The younger twin chose the steamed sea bass. It was a very good dish leaving everybody who had a chunk of the fish wanting more. The older twin enjoyed her shaken beef. The younger twin and her father thoroughly enjoyed the roasted crab and the big chunks of meat they got out of every leg.
The twins received complimentary desserts of ice cream in recognition of their birthday. The older twin shared a fried banana a la mode with her mother. Aunt and uncle also ordered another fried banana a la mode. The older twin liked the way the banana was fried. The fried layer was not thin. The vanilla ice cream tasted very natural. Little cousin ordered the lava cake with ice cream. We'll have to come back another time to try the homemade sorbet which is on the list of foods the younger twin can have not being able to tolerate milk products.
The roast crabs cost $55 each. We probably should have ordered another dish of lemongrass chicken and steamed sea bass.
Alex and another server helped us take group pictures to commemorate the occasion. We enjoyed our dinner tremendously.

excerpts: We had roasted crab, garlic noodles, salt and pepper calamari, coconut shrimp, and egg rolls.
Best of the appetizers: salt and pepper calamari.
Generous serving and cooked perfectly.
Crab was fantastic, garlic noodles a tad over cooked but in a tasty sauce.
Service was excellent.
We'll be back!
salt and pepper calamari.author: Babs P.
salt and pepper calamari.review: First time we've been here. We had roasted crab, garlic noodles, salt and pepper calamari, coconut shrimp, and egg rolls. Best of the appetizers: salt and pepper calamari. Generous serving and cooked perfectly. Crab was fantastic, garlic noodles a tad over cooked but in a tasty sauce. Service was excellent. We'll be back!

excerpts: For the appetizer, we ordered the salt and pepper calamari.
When I tell you this is the besttttttttttttt Vietnamese cuisine that has touched my pallet, this food was amazing.
We were literally seated and served w/n 15 min.
The food was piping hot and amazing.
We went and 5 pm and this place was packed by 6pm.
It's a definitely
a must try!
They also have a very large bar selection!
salt and pepper calamari.author: Lesley B.
salt and pepper calamari.review: So, I'm not a huge fan of vietnamese food, when I first walked in this place it had a bad seafood stench.  We were seated, and waiters came to our table immediately. I don't remember the official name of my dish but I had the garlic noodles and prawns. For the appetizer, we ordered the salt and pepper calamari. When I tell you this is the besttttttttttttt Vietnamese cuisine that has touched my pallet, this food was amazing. We were literally seated and served w/n 15 min. The food was piping hot and amazing. We went and 5 pm and this place was packed by 6pm. It's a definitely a must try! They also have a very large bar selection!

excerpts: This time we visited we also ordered the salt and pepper calamari as an appetizer which was seasoned beautifully.
I love this place but go home and shower after bc you will smell afterward.
salt and pepper calamari.author: Angela D.
salt and pepper calamari.review: Excellent garlic crab and noodles. The crab will run you about $60 including tax and the noodles are somewhere around $12. If you are looking for a cheaper alternative order the tiger prawns, you get 4 prawns over the garlic noodles which are a nice size but they don't compare to the crab. This time we visited we also ordered the salt and pepper calamari as an appetizer which was seasoned beautifully. I love this place but go home and shower after bc you will smell afterward.

excerpts: Don't forget the salt and pepper calamari appetizer.
salt and pepper calamari.author: Oddette A.
salt and pepper calamari.review:
If you are a lover of crab, then savoring on the secret recipe roasted crab at Thang Long is a must.  Any crab roasted in their oven has been privileged to be there. I have been dining there for over 20 years and I have never been disappointed. The service equals the food.  If I lived closer I'd have a table with my name on it.  Then there is the garlic noodles.  OMG!  Don't forget the salt and pepper calamari appetizer.  I recently tried the drunken crab, if I had never had the roasted crab, it would be my favorite.  Since I am in love with the roasted, drunken crab is a very respectable second.

Make reservations and use the valet parking for a stress free experience.

I love Thang Long!

excerpts:
Salt and pepper calamari
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/thanh-long-san-francisco?select=t68CRJfgQs6m9rXDVE1ILA#YObSBlVLpUxggUIv7yf9Jg
A little bit salty for my tastes but was pretty good in general. 
The crab was seasoned with salt, pepper, and oil very similar to the salt and pepper calamari.
salt and pepper calamari.author: Lily L.
salt and pepper calamari.review:
Decent food and really fast service. 

Salt and pepper calamari
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/thanh-long-san-francisco?select=t68CRJfgQs6m9rXDVE1ILA#YObSBlVLpUxggUIv7yf9Jg
A little bit salty for my tastes but was pretty good in general. I think I was expecting too much out of this dish due to the great reviews on here. 

Roasted Crab
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/thanh-long-san-francisco?select=t68CRJfgQs6m9rXDVE1ILA#UyRe9fVncOmyicAdGrl5Ig
This was really good. One of the few non-spicy crabs I've had where you can taste the seasoning/sauce. The crab was seasoned with salt, pepper, and oil very similar to the salt and pepper calamari.

Shaken Beef
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/thanh-long-san-francisco?select=t68CRJfgQs6m9rXDVE1ILA#DDbMAZwyv_gOBXaciovKGQ
I really liked this dish, the beef was really tender and the sauce was delicious. Wasn't a huge fan of the salad/vegetables that came with the beef though. There wasn't enough sauce to flavor the vegetables.

Banana Cake with Vanilla Ice Cream
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/thanh-long-san-francisco?select=t68CRJfgQs6m9rXDVE1ILA#t68CRJfgQs6m9rXDVE1ILA
Never had banana cake before. This was pretty good. The cake was warm so went really well with the ice cream. There were slices of bananas in the cake =)

Overall the food was pretty good and the service was pretty fast. We got our first dish about five minutes after we ordered it. It was a little pricy but I wouldn't mind going back some time to try their other dishes (really want to try the garlic noodles next time).

excerpts:
We ordered:

*Salt and Pepper calamari - not your typical calamari at American restaurants and they don't provide any dipping sauces.
salt and pepper calamari.author: Michelle L.
salt and pepper calamari.review:
It really doesn't get any better than this when it comes to crab!    I called a couple days in advance to make a 7pm reservation on a Sunday night.  They offer valet service outside the restaurant for $12.  Highly recommended since parking is a B!  There is no parking lot, only street parking in the surrounding neighborhood.

Got there 10 minutes before our reservation and they were able to seat us downstairs right away! We ordered:

*Salt and Pepper calamari - not your typical calamari at American restaurants and they don't provide any dipping sauces.  This was almost too peppered, but still delicious nonetheless.
 
*Garlic Noodles - THE BEST garlic noodles I've ever tasted, hands down.  1 order is enough for about 3-4 people.  ($10)

*Roast Crab - this is what everyone gets!  A whole crab in their special garlic sauce. They gut the inside of main body for you so the head you get is nothing but the shell. The plate is buttered for your for your dipping pleasure.  (Market price ~$40 each crab)

*Fried banana with ice cream - so delicious and really hits the spot.

The service was really fast, we never waited long for anything to come out.  They give you bowls to put your crab shells in.  They refilled our water like 5 times; they were on point with checking up on our table the whole night. And at the end of your meal, they give you hot towels to wipe all the crab guts off your hands.

I always recommend this place to anyone looking for good crab places in the city!

excerpts: We ordered the crispy fried rice paper rolls, the salt and pepper calamari, the roasted Dungeness crab, the garlic noodles and the garlic noodles with the colossal tiger prawns.
We loved the crispy fried rice paper rolls, the salt and pepper calamari was a little overdone for our taste.
We then put on our bibs and started cracking the Dungeness crab.
We loved the crispy fried rice paper rolls, the salt and pepper calamari was a little overdone for our taste.
We then put on our bibs and started cracking the Dungeness crab.
OMG - this was really good and then dug into the garlic noodles and tried the colossal tiger prawns.
Everything was really good
and now I think we'll make it a plan to come in for meals in SF more often.
salt and pepper calamari.author: Susan C.
salt and pepper calamari.review: I've been told by numerous parties to come and visit this place. Since I live in the San Jose area, it's not easy to go in just for dinner.  Today was the day since we had plans to be in SF for the day.  I made a reservation and showed up and was ready to go.  We ordered the crispy fried rice paper rolls, the salt and pepper calamari, the roasted Dungeness crab, the garlic noodles and the garlic noodles with the colossal tiger prawns.  We loved the crispy fried rice paper rolls, the salt and pepper calamari was a little overdone for our taste.  We then put on our bibs and started cracking the Dungeness crab.  OMG - this was really good and then dug into the garlic noodles and tried the colossal tiger prawns.  Everything was really good and now I think we'll make it a plan to come in for meals in SF more often.

excerpts: I ended up with the salt and pepper calamari, jumbo prawn wontons, and the infamous garlic noodles.
salt and pepper calamari.author: Lauren S.
salt and pepper calamari.review:
Thanh Long might be in the Outer Sunset of SF but it's more like Outer Space.. 

Between the ride and the parking I was just about to be thru. Thankfully I was happily satisfied by the attention given and wonderful meal prepared for me and my friends.

If you are a crab lover( which I am allergic) then this is the place for you...If not you have some wicked good alternatives. I ended up with the salt and pepper calamari, jumbo prawn wontons, and the infamous garlic noodles. Then I washed it all down with this smooth drink called a "Flying Dragon". 

Of course my companions had the Drunken crab, which even looking at, was making me sick ( I could see their boiled eyes...gross!) All-in-all was a good night, pricey, but worth the trip.

excerpts: Our party of 6 ordered the salt and pepper calamari, mango salad, crab puffs, roasted crabs, rice (why is this not included for a $20 entree!!!), spicy eggplant, and garlic noodles.
salt and pepper calamari.author: Tia D.
salt and pepper calamari.review:
I'm going to start this review off by first stating how excited I was to be coming here after reading all the rave about the crab and garlic noodles. I made it a point to stop by here on our trip to SF. Aside from the reviews, I was also impressed by the story of the An family and empire. I'm Vietnamese so of course Vietnamese food is always an excellent choice in my book. The food here was good, but so ridiculously overhyped in my opinion. The garlic noodles tasted bland to me with not enough garlic and the crab was tasty but how can you ever go wrong with butter, crab, and pepper? You can really save yourself the $$$ and buy yourself crab, steam it, and make a dipping sauce using lemon and pepper (that's a traditional way to eat it in Vietnam). The food was good but not worth the effort or hype and our party was seriously disappointed. To further disappoint, this place really doesn't offer authentic Vietnamese cuisine. I personally think people need to venture to some hole in the wall Vietnamese place if they're handing out 5 star reviews to Thanh Long. At some point, I hope to try Crustacean to see if maybe the hype is limited to that brand in the An empire because Thanh Long is underwhelming and disappointing. 

Our party of 6 ordered the salt and pepper calamari, mango salad, crab puffs, roasted crabs, rice (why is this not included for a $20 entree!!!), spicy eggplant, and garlic noodles. We ordered two plates of garlic noodles and ended up eating only one. We got a doggy bag for the leftovers to donate to the homeless (because why not).

excerpts: We also ordered the salt and pepper calamari appetizer which was so yummy too.
Our dear friends recently introduced us to this place and we are already addicted and planning on when we can return!
Delish!
salt and pepper calamari.author: Nancy C.
salt and pepper calamari.review: If you are a crab lover you have to come to Thanh Long and order their most delicious whole roasted crab. It was the BEST crab we've ever had... and we eat lots of crab! We also ordered the salt and pepper calamari appetizer which was so yummy too. Our dear friends recently introduced us to this place and we are already addicted and planning on when we can return! Delish!  ;-)

excerpts: We had the salt and pepper calamari to start.
salt and pepper calamari.author: Michelle I.
salt and pepper calamari.review:
I love me some roasted crab. MMM MMM 

I have one complaint and I am not sure if it is even legitimate but I have to speak my mind...

We put in our order with the waitress. Our food comes out in five minutes flat. Now, I am not one to complain about not waiting but- 5minutes? We had the salt and pepper calamari to start. It should take five minutes just to prep, no??

Then when we placed in an order for a second plate of garlic noodles. Again, it comes out in like 2 minutes. No joke. Leaves me to believe that they just have pans and pans of this food sitting there waiting to be ordered. Fast yes. Good yes. Fresh- mmm maybe not so much...

I love this place but that last trip kind of rubbed me the wrong way...

excerpts: As appetizers, one of us ordered the salt and pepper calamari while my partner and I split the shrimp rolls.
All of us were delighted.
The calamari was perfectly sauteed and not rubbery at all.
The shrimp rolls were fresh and the bean dip was a great addition.
salt and pepper calamari.author: Philip C.
salt and pepper calamari.review:
Three of us came here Sunday evening for dinner.  It was my first time, but I could smell garlic as soon as I walked in.  We did not have reservations but were seated in less than 3 minutes.
As appetizers, one of us ordered the salt and pepper calamari while my partner and I split the shrimp rolls.  All of us were delighted.  The calamari was perfectly sauteed and not rubbery at all. The shrimp rolls were fresh and the bean dip was a great addition.
