For entrees, I chose the garlic noodles while my partner chose the roast crab with garlic sauce.  Our friend chose the Villager's Favorite which was prawns and pork medallions cooked in a clay pot with soy and herbs.
All of us enjoyed our meals.  I think the garlic noodles were the best I've ever had.  I tasted the crab and it was great with lots of garlic flavor.  The others finished their meals but I could eat only half the noodles so I got the remainder to take home for lunch.
The wait staff is large, but they were all busy and did well in serving a large crowd.
My only quibble is that the crab came quickly while the noodles and Villager's Favorite took a long time to arrive.
I would return again to try other dishes

excerpts: I also ordered the salt and pepper calamari as an appetizer, and the Dungeoness Crab as the main course.
Salt and pepper calamari always has that perfect fresh crunch to it.
It tastes as if it's always fresh out of the fryer.
The Dungeoness crab is my favorite, but all the crabs tend to have Thanh Long's crabby, unique, yummy, smooth taste.
I LOVE it!
If I could afford Thanh Long every week, i'd definitely go.
salt and pepper calamari.author: Trinity N.
salt and pepper calamari.review:
The food here was amazing! Such true and quality taste. The food tastes homemade, 
I loved the garlic noodles, the noodles tend to be the highlight going to Thanh Long for me. It's absolutely delicious. I also ordered the salt and pepper calamari as an appetizer, and the Dungeoness Crab as the main course. Salt and pepper calamari always has that perfect fresh crunch to it. It tastes as if it's always fresh out of the fryer. The Dungeoness crab is my favorite, but all the crabs tend to have Thanh Long's crabby, unique, yummy, smooth taste. I LOVE it! If I could afford Thanh Long every week, i'd definitely go. :)

excerpts: We regret ordering appetizers: salt and pepper calamari and the shrimp toast.
The toast was very stale and made for a hard and chewy appetizer.
salt and pepper calamari.author: Mae D.
salt and pepper calamari.review:
Friendly hostess took my "dinner for 2" reservation over the phone.  We arrived half hour early and were able to be seated right away. 

Our server was courteous and upbeat. 

We regret ordering appetizers: salt and pepper calamari and the shrimp toast. 
The toast was very stale and made for a hard and chewy appetizer. and the calamari was nothing special.

The roast crab was very flavorful and we enjoyed every last piece. We shared 1 roast crab and 1 garlic noodle dish. and it was enough. we were very close to ordering a second round of food, but then just like that it hit us that we were full.  (But had we not ordered the appetizers, i honestly think we could have been satisfied ordering 2 crabs and maaaaybe 2 garlic noodle dishes)

so would i come back here? yes, but strictly for the crab and garlic noodles... and if i happen to just have $50 in my pocket to spend on ONE crab.

excerpts:
[ 
-Our go to dishes: Mango Salad, Salt and Pepper Calamari, Garlic Noodles, and Roast Crab.
Sure, other things look tasty on the menu, but these are so good that I refuse to waver!
We did try the drunken crab once, but the roast crab wins hands down.
-The Lava cake is to DIE for!
Amazing!!!
I also tried the Irish Coffee, but meh..
salt and pepper calamari.author: Debbie T.
salt and pepper calamari.review:
I only come here for "special" occasions with the bf. So..this means:

-We share an entire bottle of sparkling wine. Yep, we'll finish the whole bottle. Champagnes are for snobs..or really pretty people who have lots of money. =[ 
-Our go to dishes: Mango Salad, Salt and Pepper Calamari, Garlic Noodles, and Roast Crab. Sure, other things look tasty on the menu, but these are so good that I refuse to waver! We did try the drunken crab once, but the roast crab wins hands down. 
-The Lava cake is to DIE for! Amazing!!! I also tried the Irish Coffee, but meh..I rather just stick with my sparkling wine and Lava Cake. 

With tip, I say our meal averages at least $150-200, depending on the bottle of wine and market price of the crab. Very expensive for cheapies like us, but every once in awhile, we like to spoil ourselves and eat ramen for the rest of the month.

excerpts: Salt and pepper calamari was good, but kind of a dish you can find at many other restaurants.
The spicy eggplant dish had good flavor and lots of vegetables.
salt and pepper calamari.author: Danielle G.
salt and pepper calamari.review:
I was finally able to knock this off my bookmarks list. We came on Jan 1 and the wait for a table of 6 was 30-45. I think if I would have had Thanh Long prior to PPQ and Crustacean I would be much more impressed. But I can't help but make comparisons. 

PPQ has the best value for the food. Thanh Long is definitely cheaper than Crustacean, but by no means a casual dining option. The roasted crab runs at market price and happened to be $40 on this particular night. 

As far as the garlic noodles, I have to rank Crustacean's as the best, PPQ in second and Thanh Long 3rd. However, that being said, all three are fantastic and worth a try.

Crustacean obviously wins in the ambiance category, but Thanh Long is a very nice, quaint place. I like that Thanh Long impresses and is appropriate from anything from a romantic date to a fun family dinner.  

Enough comparisons, let's talk about Thanh Long's food. The mango salad was a nice surprise. It was warm and I wasn't sure what to think about that, but it was good. Salt and pepper calamari was good, but kind of a dish you can find at many other restaurants. The spicy eggplant dish had good flavor and lots of vegetables. We had chicken fried rice (mostly for the baby) which was your typical chicken fried rice. The shaken beef was a definite stand out dish. It was super tender and the flavor was wonderful.

My only gripe about the crab was they didn't leave the shell with all the juices and good stuff. The shell was turned over and we had to dig around to find some fat (which of course is one of the best parts!).

By the way, skip the drinks here. They come in tiny glasses that are much overpriced. 

All in all I will probably stick with PPQ as my go to, but Thanh Long is definitely a good option for a special occasion.

excerpts:
We had the:

Salt and Pepper Calamari: Pretty good
Prawn Wontons: Pretty good
Garlic Noodles: Very good (egg noodles)
Villager's Favorite (Pacific prawns and pork medallions simmered in a caramelized reduction of soy and herbs): I wasn't crazy about the pork but the prawns were good and the sauce tasted amazing, especially with the garlic noodles
salt and pepper calamari.author: Sonya Z.
salt and pepper calamari.review:
Wow, everything on this menu is very eye catching. 

The food was good but not incredible - I would love to come back and try every single dish. 

We had the:

Salt and Pepper Calamari: Pretty good
Prawn Wontons: Pretty good
Garlic Noodles: Very good (egg noodles)
Villager's Favorite (Pacific prawns and pork medallions simmered in a caramelized reduction of soy and herbs): I wasn't crazy about the pork but the prawns were good and the sauce tasted amazing, especially with the garlic noodles

Would appreciate a slightly larger wine selection! The service is white napkin and very nice. We got seated quickly for a table of two on a Sunday night. 

There is valet parking for $12 or you can look around the neighborhood - the block the restaurant is on was packed, but we found a spot across from the 7-11 that's on the opposite corner.

excerpts: Our dinner consisted of one of each of the soups, salt and pepper calamari, collasal tiger prawns over garlic noodles, lemongrass chicken, vegetarian entree, chicken fried rice, and an extra order of garlic noodles.

The salt and pepper calamari was good as well, served sizzling hot, with a good combination of salt AND pepper, but for a couple of the outlying pieces, there was definitely a lot more salt than pepper.
The main dish I liked the most was the collasal tigerl prawns over garlic noodles.
The noodles were seasoned to perfection and it got my whole family scooping for more.
The prawns were pretty good as well, although I could definitely taste the layer of butter in between those suckers.
However, I'm not too sure how to justify 4 pieces of prawn over a bed of garlic noodles for 37 bucks.
salt and pepper calamari.author: Ada C.
salt and pepper calamari.review:
Mixed feelings about Thanh Long, after reading all the awesome reviews about this place, I had high expectations as I made reservations for a party of 5 on a Friday night. 

Upon arrival, we were immediately greeted and seated. Customer service was pretty on point, the waiter was friendly and attentive. He memorized our order (which was quite a few items) without writing it down, but sadly forgot one of the appetizers. All good, since I'm sure we over ordered anyways.

Our dinner consisted of one of each of the soups, salt and pepper calamari, collasal tiger prawns over garlic noodles, lemongrass chicken, vegetarian entree, chicken fried rice, and an extra order of garlic noodles. Although the serving size wasn't as big as we had pictured, this was more than enough for the 5 of us, so in retrospect, the serving size was pretty decent.

Out of all the soups, we all voted that the vegetarian soup was the best. Something about the clear broth and the assorted veggies just made it more refreshing versus the creamy aspargus chowder or the chicken vermecelli soup.

The salt and pepper calamari was good as well, served sizzling hot, with a good combination of salt AND pepper, but for a couple of the outlying pieces, there was definitely a lot more salt than pepper. 

As for the entrees, it was pretty mediocre, not fabulous, but not disgusting or unedible. There was just nothing outstanding about the meal. The main dish I liked the most was the collasal tigerl prawns over garlic noodles. The noodles were seasoned to perfection and it got my whole family scooping for more. The prawns were pretty good as well, although I could definitely taste the layer of butter in between those suckers. However, I'm not too sure how to justify 4 pieces of prawn over a bed of garlic noodles for 37 bucks. Seems a little bit outrageous.. pretentious to some.

Again, like I said, the meal wasn't bad, but for the price of the dishes, I was expecting something more amazing. Overall, a good dining experience, food was pretty good, glad I tried it once, but nothing coaxing me to be back for another round.

excerpts: I've also tried their salt and pepper calamari which were very delicious!
salt and pepper calamari.author: Danielle L.
salt and pepper calamari.review:
This place will always be one of my top favorite places to eat. Probably top 3. I've been here for special occasions and I've been here for a "just because I was craving for it" kind of meal. I always get the garlic noodles and roasted crab. Always. It's just a must have combination when coming to a place like this. My boyfriend loves their tiger prawns which already comes with a plate of garlic noodles. The prawns are huge and delicious. I've also tried their salt and pepper calamari which were very delicious! Maybe the best calamari ever.

Make sure you get you're own plate of garlic noodles! You will regret it if you choose to share with someone, trust me. And also make sure to make reservations. If you come right when they open there may be open seating. Since this place is so popular, I always make reservations just to be safe. 

The service of course is always great and surprisingly fast! I ordered once and went to the restroom to wash my hands and when I came back, my crab and noodles were already on the table! 

I can't wait to go back!

excerpts: Roasted garlic crab, garlic noodles, salt and pepper calamari, garlic toast, sea bass and sautéed veggies were amazzzzing!
I can never get tired of this place.
pineapple lychee martini is a creeper but so delicious!
Can't go wrong with anything.
Only downside is the parking but that doesn't take away a star.
salt and pepper calamari.author: Monica M.
salt and pepper calamari.review: Love love love! We try to come here at least once a year sometimes more depending if we feel like coming into the city. Roasted garlic crab, garlic noodles, salt and pepper calamari, garlic toast, sea bass and sautéed veggies were amazzzzing! I can never get tired of this place. pineapple lychee martini is a creeper but so delicious! Can't go wrong with anything. Only downside is the parking but that doesn't take away a star.

excerpts: We had the roast crab and salt and pepper calamari.
Very flavorful.
salt and pepper calamari.author: Marilyn C.
salt and pepper calamari.review: Best customer service. We had the roast crab and salt and pepper calamari.  Very flavorful.

excerpts: We had the salt and pepper calamari and crab puffs to start.
Both were okay (and relatively cheap, ~$10 each).
The salt and pepper calamari was good but doused in spices, which made the actual seafood flavor lessened - a quality that some might not enjoy.
It's also tossed with some veggies, which our family also happily munched on.
Not the best calamari we've ever had but also not the worst.
The crab puffs were ordered on our waiter's suggestion and they were good, too - soft on the inside with the outside perfectly golden and crunchy.
salt and pepper calamari.author: Therese Jane R.
salt and pepper calamari.review:
Went here the past weekend with my family as a treat to our parents for Christmas.  Thank God my sister made reservations because dinnertime on a saturday was packed!  People who didn't make reservation were told the wait could be up to 2 hours long.  We, however, were sat within 10 minutes of our reservation time.  

We had the salt and pepper calamari and crab puffs to start.  Both were okay (and relatively cheap, ~$10 each).  The salt and pepper calamari was good but doused in spices, which made the actual seafood flavor lessened - a quality that some might not enjoy.  It's also tossed with some veggies, which our family also happily munched on.  Not the best calamari we've ever had but also not the worst.  The crab puffs were ordered on our waiter's suggestion and they were good, too - soft on the inside with the outside perfectly golden and crunchy.  Did not try to sauce that came with it but by my mom's continuous dipping, I'm going to assume that it was good.  

For our meal, we ordered 2 roast crabs and 2 orders of garlic noodles.  We are a family of five - this, plus the two appetizers, were not enough for us (we went for ice cream after).  The garlic noodles (~$10 an order) were delicious but, seriously, tasted very similar to Red Crawfish's garlic noodles (a.k.a., if you want a delicious, but in a more casual setting, similar meal, perhaps think of RC as an alternative).  The Roast Crab was delicious and our family destroyed it within about 15 minutes.  Seriously do not remember the exact taste because we were inhaling our food.  My sister said that both dishes were a little too garlic heavy for her to have together but they were fine with me.  Each crab was about $42.  

All in all, the ambiance was great but if you like seasoned seafood and want to eat without any reservations (pun intended) you should probably visit one of the less bougie places that dot the bay area.  If you are trying to impress a significant other (or potential significant other) do not go to this place, where you're tempted to pull apart crabs with your hands and suck the meat out from the shell.

excerpts:
Pros
- Garlic Noodles
- Roasted Crab
- Salt and Pepper Calamari

Cons 
- None
Some of the best garlic noodles and crab that I've ever had.
It's not cheap and it's messy but for special occasions, this place is great.
Good service and even better food.
salt and pepper calamari.author: Andrew S.
salt and pepper calamari.review:
Pros
- Garlic Noodles
- Roasted Crab
- Salt and Pepper Calamari

Cons 
- None
- Wait? 
- Reservations Required?

Some of the best garlic noodles and crab that I've ever had. It's not cheap and it's messy but for special occasions, this place is great. Good service and even better food.

excerpts: They have the best salt and pepper calamari!
salt and pepper calamari.author: Siavash N.
salt and pepper calamari.review:
The garlic carb is the best. I think most of the people go there for the crab. And the garlic noodle is fabulous. Make sure you order them together. It depends how hungry you're, but I think one crab and one noodle is enough for two. 

Oh! They have the best salt and pepper calamari!

excerpts: Salt and pepper calamari: definitely a lot of salt and pepper.
i'm not too big of a fan of calamari
but it came out nice and hot.
1 Salt and Pepper Calamari + 2 Roast Crabs + 2 Garlic Noodles + 1 Shaken Beef + 1 Fried Banana
salt and pepper calamari.author: Samantha L.
salt and pepper calamari.review:
My family and i made reservations for 4  for a sunday night.  As usual, it took us a while to find parking.. and had to make several rounds. But Thanh Long has a valet service right out front if you don't want to go looking for your own space. I'm not sure where they park the cars though. Down by the beach?!

The moment you walk in you smell the amazing aroma from all the highly seasoned dishes!  You may dress anywhere from casual - dressy. There really is no dress code here.

Salt and pepper calamari: definitely a lot of salt and pepper. i'm not too big of a fan of calamari but it came out nice and hot. i was really waiting for the crab though..

Roast crab + garlic noodles: WOWOWOW! I like wearing the bibs they give us =) makes me feel like i can dig in properly. BRING GUM. the garlic is strongggggg.

Fried Banana a la mode: the  vanilla bean ice cream is just sooo good with the fried banana. The banana is warm and oozing deliciousness. Get a spoonful with a little bit of ice cream and a bit of the frozen banana = heaven.

1 Salt and Pepper Calamari + 2 Roast Crabs + 2 Garlic Noodles + 1 Shaken Beef + 1 Fried Banana a la mode= $148 + tax and tip

I left so full that i fell asleep when i got home. Uh yeah, i ate that much..

excerpts: Salt and Pepper Calamari: It was delicious.
They were big pieces, but my boyfriend
salt and pepper calamari.author: Michelle C.
salt and pepper calamari.review:
my boyfriend heard about this place from one of his co-workers, so he decided to take me. When we first drove by we thought it was close because the lights were dim and we did not see anyone in there.  

The setting was romantic, which is a nice place for and anniversary or a date.

Food: Salt and Pepper Calamari: It was delicious. They were big pieces, but my boyfriend and I finished it really quick.

Garlic noodles: They were so good, it is one of my favorite garlic noodles I have tried so far! It is a must if you come here. It even out shines the crab. 

Drunken Crab: When we received it there was one body, but two crabs worth of claws and legs. The pieces were pretty big too, so if your not really a crab person 2 people can share.  However, the flavor was kind of bland. To us it just tastes like boiled crab, but it was still delicious.

Dessert- Chocolate Lava Cake: Dessert is my favorite part of any meal. This dessert made me smile, after the first bite. The chocolate just melts in your mouth. It was so delicious! It makes my mouth water by just thinking about it.  Also, the next day my boyfriend was still thinking about how good this dessert was.

excerpts: We share garlic noodles, the shaken beef, and salt and pepper calamari.
It was a little pricey, but so worth it.
Everything was so flavorful
and I don't know...
salt and pepper calamari.author: Patricia Q.
salt and pepper calamari.review:
I went to dinner at Thanh Long with my boyfriend Friday night...Kind of a strange place for me to go considering that I am allergic to seafood. But hey, we made it work.

We share garlic noodles, the shaken beef, and salt and pepper calamari. It was a little pricey, but so worth it. Everything was so flavorful and I don't know...damn good? 

I think people in the know make the trek out to Thanh Long for the crabs, but the non-seafood items are great too FYI for people who are allergic to seafood like me.

Will definitely come back again whenever the boyfriend and I feel like treating ourselves after a long week of work. Great date spot, nice interior, fast service, and delicious food. Parking can be a bit of a nightmare in this area sometimes, but that pretty much goes with living in SF.

excerpts: For starters, we ordered the salt and pepper calamari.
The calamari was good, though I'm usually used to having some sort of dipping sauce with it.
Lightly breaded.
salt and pepper calamari.author: Krystine D.
salt and pepper calamari.review:
My family was visiting from San Diego so we wanted to wanted to indulge and heard about the crab here. Fortunately, we set reservations because this place was packed!

Superior service. We were told our table would be ready by 8:30 and our name was called right on the dot. For starters, we ordered the salt and pepper calamari. The calamari was good, though I'm usually used to having some sort of dipping sauce with it. Lightly breaded. Then we ordered to the Vietnamese traditional salad, which was the perfect starter to a heavy meal; it was light and refreshing. 

As for the entree, each of us had one roast crab each. Previous reviews definitely reflected well; the roast crab is delicious. It seems as though they must marinade the crab ahead of time (probably why the restaurant doesn't open until 5) because the crab came out quickly but was still tasty. We paired the crab with two orders of the garlic noodles - great combo. The noodles are rich - garlic-y and buttery YUM - and went well with the crab.

For dessert, we had the fried banana with ice cream. Each order comes with two fried banana portions and one scoop of vanilla ice cream. Yum! 

Ultimately one of the best meals I've had since moving to the Bay. I would absolutely come here again if the budget permitted. My mom even dared to say that was the best crab she has had her whole life - now that's bold :)

Can't say enough about the service here. They were friendly, fast and extremely attentive. Awesome staff.

excerpts: I always like ordering the Roasted Crab, Garlic Noodles, Salt and Pepper Calamari and the Shaken Beef - All my Faves!
salt and pepper calamari.author: Jennifer N.
salt and pepper calamari.review:
This is byfar one of my top 5 places to eat!  Their dining area is simple yet classy and everything I order is always made perfect, just how I expected.

Every Birthday or get together Event held here has always been accommodated with no issues whatsoever.  The Service is always great.

I always like ordering the Roasted Crab, Garlic Noodles, Salt and Pepper Calamari and the Shaken Beef - All my Faves!  The price is worth spending because the serving is just perfect and they are all flavor filled.

Definitely Recommended!!

excerpts: We ordered the salt and pepper calamari, thanh long mussels, roast crab, and garlic noodles.
The salt and pepper calamari was the first dish to reach our table.
I didn't really enjoy the dish because the batter made some pieces taste stale while other pieces were crispy.
I sat at the table thinking, OMG
I hope this place gets better or else
I'm going to scream at all my cousins for this shizz.
The second dish we received was the thanh long mussels.
It was mussels with a pesto sauce on top of a slice of buttered bread.
YUMMY!!!!
By this time I thought a good dish canceled out a bad and was feeling better about Thanh Long.
salt and pepper calamari.author: Anna K.
salt and pepper calamari.review:
I have been hearing about Thanh Long for several years now ever since I started flying to the bay. All of my cousins that have visited the city have eaten there and have loved the garlic noodles and roast crab. Now that I'm here in the bay, I finally got to try it and I now know why my cousins won't  stfu about this place. I can now join my cousins as we can't and won't stfu about Thanh Long.

Thanh Long is slightly far from the heart of the city, near 46th street. My friends and I were lost and almost gave up, since we were traveling from Mission. However, we finally found it and were relieved that our trek to the restaurant was over. We ordered the salt and pepper calamari, thanh long mussels, roast crab, and garlic noodles. The salt and pepper calamari was the first dish to reach our table. I didn't really enjoy the dish because the batter made some pieces taste stale while other pieces were crispy. I sat at the table thinking, OMG I hope this place gets better or else I'm going to scream at all my cousins for this shizz. The second dish we received was the thanh long mussels. It was mussels with a pesto sauce on top of a slice of buttered bread. YUMMY!!!! By this time I thought a good dish canceled out a bad and was feeling better about Thanh Long. We later got the garlic noodles and roast crab and OMFG SOOOOO GOOD. The garlic noodles are spaghetti noodles (or so I think) but in a nice blend of garlic, salt, and crack. The roast crab is even more delicious than the noodles. It was garlicky and peppery with probably more crack. I now understand why each table setting has crab crackers. Who goes to Thanh Long without trying their roast crab?!?!?!?!?! 

I probably stunk of garlic when I met up with my friend Shad and his friend Erin after dinner. But would I change my restaurant plans knowing that I would be meeting up with them? HELL NO!! SORRY!!!! I come in (garlicky) peace. =]

excerpts: Their Salt And Pepper Calamari is like the best ever!
Their Mango Warm Salad is great, too.
I love their Sea Bass, although it isn't really different than how other restaurants prepare it.
End your dinner with their House Special Orange or Lemon Sorbet.
Definitely one of my favorite restaurants in San Francisco!
salt and pepper calamari.author: Bella B.
salt and pepper calamari.review: This is a local area restaurant in the Sunset It does not get better than Thanh Long. This is definitely one of my favorite resteraunt ever. The best Crab you ever want to eat. Crab and Garlic noodles are must-have, no doubt, but Oh My God, try their Calamari! Their Salt And Pepper Calamari is like the best ever! Their Mango Warm Salad is great, too. I love their Sea Bass, although it isn't really different than how other restaurants prepare it. End your dinner with their House Special Orange or Lemon Sorbet. Definitely one of my favorite restaurants in San Francisco!

excerpts: Ordered salt and pepper calamari for appetizer, nicely flavored and fried without any grease on the plate at all!
salt and pepper calamari.author: Shirley H.
salt and pepper calamari.review:
Came here just before my "no seafood diet", and I'm so glad I did!

Being a somewhat upscale seafood restaurant of this quality, the location really threw me off because it's in the Sunset residential district and really has nothing else interesting around but this. Also, don't forget to make reservation because it gets packed all. the. time. 

Ordered salt and pepper calamari for appetizer, nicely flavored and fried without any grease on the plate at all! 

Not so much of a big fan of the garlic noodles although all yelpers rave about it. It was a little overcooked and greasy. 

The highlight is the roast crab, which, i can say, is by far the best Dungeness crab I've had in San Francisco!! The crab is huge and fresh, cooked with the "finger-licking good" garlic sauce. The meat was juicy and tender marinated with the delicious sauce. I could finish the entire thing by myself! 

Prices are a bit high, but it definitely is an awesome place to splurge for some seafood amazingness once in a while...would be back for sure!

excerpts: The salt and pepper calamari was very good.
We had their famous baked crab which was cooked to perfection with lots of butter and an excellent black pepper unlike anything we've had.
Peppery yet not hot.
The crabs were very good but at $42 for a not very meaty crab I would probably not order it again...
more noodles please.
A great dining experience
salt and pepper calamari.author: scott s.
salt and pepper calamari.review:
Wandered into this very non descript in the Outer Sunset District. Nicer on the inside than the outside. Immdeiately seated (we called ahead). Very nice waiter answered all our questions and brought us some wine and martinis right away.
We ordered the "popular" items. The garlic noodles were something we never experienced in a noodle. Unbelievable the texture and flavor of this simple dish. We would be considered semi-foodies having traveled the world eating but this dish was incomparable. How they do it I don't have a clue but worth traveling for ($9.95). The second recommended dish was the cubed New York Steak marinated dish. Absolutly mouth watering and so tender. The salt and pepper calamari was very good. We had their famous baked crab which was cooked to perfection with lots of butter and an excellent black pepper unlike anything we've had. Peppery yet not hot. The crabs were very good but at $42 for a not very meaty crab I would probably not order it again...more noodles please. A great dining experience

excerpts: We also get the salt and pepper calamari (not as crunchy as it use to be and less flavorful, but still one of the better tasting ones out there), combo fried rice (another winner), added on mixed vegetables and the stuffed calamari (both of the sauces tasted similar but was still tasty).
salt and pepper calamari.author: Carol H.
salt and pepper calamari.review:
Was here with some family today and realized we have been coming here for almost 20 years already.  Wow! Out of all of their establishments, this is still my favorite location, even if parking can be a beast, unless you valet, or just come early. You can always expect an attentive waitstaff who will give you good service.
 
My all time guilty pleasures is the roasted crab and garlic noodles.   This is a guarantee to be on point and for us, usually get individual crabs instead of sharing for left overs.

We also get the salt and pepper calamari (not as crunchy as it use to be and less flavorful, but still one of the better tasting ones out there), combo fried rice (another winner), added on mixed vegetables and the stuffed calamari (both of the sauces tasted similar but was still tasty).

excerpts: We got Shrimp toast, salt and pepper calamari, two drunken crab, and a couple of orders of garlic noodles.
The drunken crab are simmered in Chardonnay, Sake, Brandy and seasoned with scallions, chives and black pepper.
salt and pepper calamari.author: Mike K.
salt and pepper calamari.review:
Ok so my brother and his friend from the East Coast were in town visiting and looking for a place specific to SF. I had been to PPQ and had gotten high recommendations for Thanh Long's crab and garlic noodles. The food did not disappoint!

We got Shrimp toast, salt and pepper calamari, two drunken crab, and a couple of orders of garlic noodles. As others have mentioned I wouldn't recommend this for a first date as it's pretty messy and full of garlic!

The drunken crab are simmered in Chardonnay, Sake, Brandy and seasoned with scallions, chives and black pepper. They were absolutely delicious and went perfectly with the garlic noodles. I'd highly recommend Thanh Long. It's worth the drive and cheaper than crustacean.

excerpts: I have had the salt and pepper calamari, roasted crab, the giant prawns, garlic noodles, creme brulee, and fried banana with vanilla ice cream.
Everything is delicious and the service is impeccable.
The kitchen times everything perfectly so that as soon as your done with your appetizer, you entrée arrives and so forth with the rest of the meal.
salt and pepper calamari.author: Nga D.
salt and pepper calamari.review:
First off, There are people who line up before this restaurant opens to eat here, you know its one hell of a restaurant when you see that.
Second, don't come here unless you have money to burn on good food.

With the above being said, this place is super super yummy. Me and my bf came here to eat on a Friday and it was packed. I have had the salt and pepper calamari, roasted crab, the giant prawns, garlic noodles, creme brulee, and fried banana with vanilla ice cream. Everything is delicious and the service is impeccable. The kitchen times everything perfectly so that as soon as your done with your appetizer, you entrée arrives and so forth with the rest of the meal. The waiters pay attention to you and constantly checks on your water, tea, etc. without being annoying. 

I would definitely come back here whenever I have garlic noodle and crab cravings :)

excerpts: The waitress also recommended their salt and pepper calamari and rice rolls.
All of it was extremely delicious.
All of the dishes we ordered were full of flavor and extremely delicious.
salt and pepper calamari.author: Sherene L.
salt and pepper calamari.review:
WOW!  As sad as I sound, I can't wait until go back here...

This place was recommended from my aunt.  She only lived the block down from Thanh Long.  (Yay! Within walking distance of great parking...)  OMG!  If i could only use one word to describe the food here...orgasmic!  Since they were famous for their garlic noodles and roasted garlic and butter crab...of course we got that!  The waitress also recommended their salt and pepper calamari and rice rolls.  All of it was extremely delicious.  All of the dishes we ordered were full of flavor and extremely delicious.  It was like my taste buds were on a never ending high...

The atmosphere is decent.  The table seemed too close together, but maybe that just me. You can also make reservations in advance so that you don't have to wait.  Granted, I didn't pay  for the meal and the prices did seem a bit expensive, but I would highly try this place as least once before making an opinion.

excerpts: The dinner started off well enough with the salt and pepper calamari and the mango salad.
My fleur de mango mixed drink was decent but tasted more like banana and coconut than mango.
salt and pepper calamari.author: Elaine L.
salt and pepper calamari.review:
Seriously, I don't get it.  Is it because I am Vietnamese, or is it because I've made crab better at home myself?  To say that I was greatly, nay sorely, disappointed would be putting it lightly.  

I had heard from 2 different friends who also love food that I should try this restaurant, so I finally went with great excitement and anticipation.  I even schlepped out on a rainy, windy miserable night where I could've just sat at home eating ramen and been happy.

The dinner started off well enough with the salt and pepper calamari and the mango salad.  My fleur de mango mixed drink was decent but tasted more like banana and coconut than mango.  Boyfriend's pineapple ginger-infused vodka was better.

Surprisingly, though, the biggest disappointments were the restaurant specialties that have seemingly made this restaurant famous:  the roasted crab and garlic noodles.  The crab was small and mealy, and once you suck away the tasty salt and pepper sauce from the outer shell, you're left with bland, crumbly crab that did not taste fresh or well-cooked.  There was not much crab fat under the shell either. Perhaps they aren't sourcing their crab from a good provider.

Then the garlic noodles arrived.  My impression can be summarized as the following:  meh.  I'm pretty sure I can reproduce the same dish with some spaghetti and a lot of butter and garlic.

Boyfriend thinks that I should come back and give them a second chance because any restaurant can have an off night, but given how sad it was and given that the highlight of the meal was when said boyfriend sent a crab leg flying, barely missing the lady sitting next to us when he tried to pry it off the crab body , I'm gun shy to say the least.  His response actually was, "Well, as least it's one less leg we have to eat."  If that doesn't speak volumes, not sure what else would.

I'd rather blow all of my money on the salt and pepper crab at R&G Lounge.  I know that Andrew Zimmern spotlighted the An family on his show, but Bourdain went to R&G.  By my tally, it's Bourdain 1 versus Zimmern 0.

excerpts: Appetizers: I've only ventured as far as the salt and pepper calamari.
Solid.
Delicious.
salt and pepper calamari.author: Michael T.
salt and pepper calamari.review:
Oh wow.

This place is great. Believe the hype.

Appetizers: I've only ventured as far as the salt and pepper calamari. Solid. Delicious. Only wish they gave more.

Entrees: ROAST CRAB. The tiger prawn dish is also pretty good. But back to the crab. Wow! It's really good. For a dish that seems so simple (whole crab, butter, seasoning) they must do SOMETHING to make it so enticing. I don't know what that is. Until I find out so I can cook this at home, I'll keep coming here. The butter noodles are also delicious. Again, believe the hype.

The service is great. Polite and honest servers. If your beverage is looking empty, the moment you think about asking for a fill-up, your cup is refilled. Great service.

Everybody should try this place. I'm not big on feeding hype machines, but this is well deserved. 5 stars, easily.

excerpts: the salt and pepper calamari appetizer was the best for me.
salt and pepper calamari.author: alinna s.
salt and pepper calamari.review:
we heard about this place via check please, bay area so we went for our anniversary dinner.  it is the fanciest vietnamese restaurant i have ever been to and the waitstaff was great.  make a res -- the line is long but DAMN, they can turn tables here.

everyone in the restaurant was eating two things: roasted crab and garlic noodles.  given that it was just after xmas, i thought we should eat salad ... bad plan.  they didn't have the mango salad and the regular salad was bleah.  i will say they did not skimp on the shrimp, which was fresh, but it didn't taste like anything.

the salt and pepper calamari appetizer was the best for me.  it was salty, crispy and most excellent with lots of lemon.

as for the famed roast crab and noodles ... LET. DOWN.  it's gd crab season in california, so i cannot fathom why our crab, while large, WAS. NOT. FRESH.  i have eaten a crapton of crab in my life as a good chinese person do, and this crab had clearly been dead for some time and no amount of delicious seasoning can hide that.  as for the noodles, if you like your noodles sweet (my japanese husband did), then maybe you will be okay.  they certainly give you a lot of it for $9.95. for me, it was way too sweet and way overcooked.  i tried to save it by dipping it into the crab seasoning.  

overall, it was meh.  the portion sizes are good, but the dead crab didn't do it for me.  if it's $41.95 (it's a market price dish) at the height of dungeness crab season, i cannot stand the idea of paying God knows how much in july.  a nice experience, but i wouldn't escape 3 babies and drive an hour into the city for this.

excerpts: We still ordered the salt and pepper calamari.
Very good.
salt and pepper calamari.author: Laura A.
salt and pepper calamari.review:
I am really sorry

About that baby. Crying inconsolably because his parents was too focus devouring their crab that I wonder if they were even listening to him. 

About the old lady; logically rejected after offering herself to take care of the baby once the mum finally clean her hands and carry him until he stops crying. This old lady already knew how good and addictive is eating those crabs. She had good intentions, she understood.

About the Dungeness crab in the Bay Area. This poor things finish their life as stars in a runway one after another over a plate carried by the servers; continuously, like in a sad crab march. Roasted, garlic-ted, buttered, spici-ted and too delicious to be pro-crab.  And also because they must be confuse about what Green dragons means, or the corresponding Vietnamese words, Thanh Long, as I bet one of the first things this crabs learn is to be afraid of them when is in fact they are a symbol of Good Luck and the reason for the owner to keep this name after a typing mistake, as she thought it was a good omen, instead the original Thang Long (in honor to Vietnam's first capital city)
 
Really sorry for myself, as crustaceans are not my favorite seafood to eat. But also because its a fact that they taste naturally good without any addition other than salt in the boiling water. And roast them with garlic and 5 spices sauce sounded like a crime to me. And also because messiness wearing white clothes sounded like a crime as well. And even more. A multi-million dollar restaurant empire, was uninviting too as superstars can be disappointing sometimes. And because to pray for a table would have decide me to turn back automatically. 

But I didn't .. And I'm so sorry .. I think? ..  about how much I enjoyed the crab. 

But sorry about the crab too because when I tasted the garlic noodles ...  I had a favorite already

And sorry about you, the one who I shared the crab with, as you didn't have enough patient to take out as much meat as you can and mixed it with the garlic noodles. Because the crab is amazing but crabs are born tasting good already. And ok, I admit roasted in this way with the secret sauce makes them much better. But the noodles, that is all Thanh Long's work, and are incredible in texture, al dente and a bit chewy too. And flavor; juicy, comfortably greasy and very tasty. Add some crab meat. An improvement of what already taste incredible.

I'm also sorry about the rest of the menu since the crabs and the noodles are everywhere. I'd love to go with a group as looks like is the only way to try more items. We still ordered the salt and pepper calamari. Very good. Lightly battered, soft texture but firm too with a hit of black pepper. 

And I am also sorry.. very very much.. as we couldn't avoid to order their Fried ice cream. A huge ball of warm, tasty, soft and light dough filled with a cold ball of creamy vanilla ice cream. Sorry because this was already too much food. But more sorry because I had space for just 2 bites. 

But If I am really sorry. Really.. is about all of you that haven't taste this crabs and the noodles, yet.

excerpts: I ALWAYS order Roasted Crab, Garlic Noodles and Salt and Pepper Calamari.
salt and pepper calamari.author: WS P.
salt and pepper calamari.review:
My favorite place for crab. I ALWAYS order Roasted Crab, Garlic Noodles and Salt and Pepper Calamari. Mango Salad is amazing, too. Warm saute mango chunks, shrimp, scallop and shallot on fresh greens... Yam...

Their steam Chilean Sea Bass is great, too. 

For dessert, I love the orange sorbet. A light dessert is a perfect end note for a buttery meal in this place. 

This is the restaurant I bring all my out-of-town guests to. :)

excerpts: We had salt and pepper calamari for starters
and I thought it was really good, but wish the portion was bigger.
My boyfriend wish there was ranch for him to dip it into (LOL-- hes a ranch lover when it comes to calamari)
salt and pepper calamari.author: Lynda L.
salt and pepper calamari.review:
I gave this place a 4 star because the service was spectacular!  The food was fast, and everything was on point.  

However, parking was horrible.  We drove around several blocks 20-30 minutes trying to look for parking.  I've already anticipated the food to be expensive, so valet was not an option.  

From the outside, Thanh Long looked really small, but when you walk in, it was a little bigger than you have expected. However, it was still relatively small compared to other restaurants.  I thought the table arrangements were all packed together.  My boyfriend and I had one of the better tables, but we were still relatively close to the table next to us.  I felt like we had to whisper so they wouldn't eavesdrop on our conversation.  It was a really loud type of environment.  Everyone is talking among each other so you can hear constant talking in the background.  (which i didnt bother me as much)

The food came out in a quickness!  We had salt and pepper calamari for starters and I thought it was really good, but wish the portion was bigger.  My boyfriend wish there was ranch for him to dip it into (LOL-- hes a ranch lover when it comes to calamari)  Then we ordered shaken beef with a side of jasmine rice and tiger prawns with garlic noodles.  I was going to order another side of garlic noodles, but my boyfriend told me to taste his first.  Boy, am I glad that I didn't order a side of garlic noodles.  I'm a big garlic noodles kinda gal.  Their garlic noodles weren't so bad, but it was really buttery.  I love my garlic noodles to be more of on the garlic side.  But, I've had better garlic noodles.  Their prawns, to me, personally was too salty.  But my boyfriend thought it was perfect.  The dish was 36$ bucks and I personally wouldn't have ordered if it was 36$ bucks. I would have gotten crab or something.  As for the shaken beef, it was 23.95$ with a side of jasmine rice 2.75 and i thought the shaken beef was perfect.  They included potatoes and they were perfectly cooked. I loved how the beef just melted in my mouth. From the outside, it looked like they were overcooked, but it was just right.  However, I probably wouldn't order it again only becuase I feel like the shaken beef was overpriced.  

I would def come back another time, for another special occasion -- it was our anniversary yesterday-- to try the crab.

excerpts: After reading a few yelp reviews from my blackberry, we ordered  the salt and pepper calamari, roasted/garlic crab, and garlic noodles.
Everything was DELISH.
The conversation at the table came to a complete stop because we were so engrossed in our meal.
I really wish that they would've given more calamari but the crab and garlic noodles were enough for me and my bf to share.
salt and pepper calamari.author: Meryl P.
salt and pepper calamari.review:
I am not a fan of crab, but Thanh Long has definitely made me a fan!  

My bf and I came here with some friends on a Saturday night and we were were seated within a few moments.  The ambiance inside is comfy and welcoming and people were dressed nicely -- so I felt a little out of place in my shorts -- so note to self and all others, don't wear shorts.  The wait staff was pretty nice and very attentive and our food came out with a quickness!

After reading a few yelp reviews from my blackberry, we ordered  the salt and pepper calamari, roasted/garlic crab, and garlic noodles.  Everything was DELISH.  The conversation at the table came to a complete stop because we were so engrossed in our meal.  I really wish that they would've given more calamari but the crab and garlic noodles were enough for me and my bf to share.  

I would definitely come back again.  I love Thanh Long!

excerpts: We ordered two crabs, some garlic noodles, lemon grass chicken, Salt and Pepper Calamari, and Shaken Beef.
The crabs were very flavorful and tasty!
I was eating like a savage, trying to get all the crab meat I can get!
By the end of the meal, there were crab shells all over the table..
LOL!
Eating the crabs with the garlic noodles made the meal almost perfect!
The chicken and shaken beef were also tasty.
salt and pepper calamari.author: Anthony N.
salt and pepper calamari.review:
Wow!! I heard so much great stuff about this place that I wanted to try it out for myself. When we first got there, the place was packed! My friends and I waited for 45 mins to get seated, but the food was worth the wait. We ordered two crabs, some garlic noodles, lemon grass chicken, Salt and Pepper Calamari, and Shaken Beef. The crabs were very flavorful and tasty! I was eating like a savage, trying to get all the crab meat I can get! By the end of the meal, there were crab shells all over the table.. LOL! Eating the crabs with the garlic noodles made the meal almost perfect! The chicken and shaken beef were also tasty. The beef was very tender. 

If you're not looking to spend a lot you should turn back now because this place is a little pricey. If you do come, I recommend making some reservations ahead of time if you don't want to wait 45+ minutes. 

If you're craving for some crab that melts in your mouth and gives you happy smile, Thanh Long is the place to be!

excerpts:
Right amount of spices, peppers

Salt and Pepper Calamari
salt and pepper calamari.author: Sandra P.
salt and pepper calamari.review:
My bf took me here for the first time on my birthday.. ONE WORD= MAGICAL!

Garlic Noodles ***** Excellent! Delightfully flavored! Not too garlicy or buttery

Shaken Beef ***** Heaven on a platter! (hope i didn't offend anyone) Right amount of spices, peppers

Salt and Pepper Calamari ***** I am very picky when it comes to calamari. I want  it fried to perfection. These are crispy breaded rings of joy! Who said $10.95 for this appetizer could not buy happiness?

The bar made delightful cocktails. Only $7.50!

Servers are courteous and always pay attention to your every need.

I'm getting hungry just thinking about it.. *sighhhhs*

Try to get reservations. This place was crowded with both small and large parties.

excerpts: My boyfriend, my son, and I had an order of the Roasted Crab, Garlic Noodles, Shrimp Fried Rice, Salt and Pepper Calamari, and Chicken Satay.

Garlic Noodles= OKAY
Shrimp Fried Rice
=GOOD...simple and not greasy
Chicken Satay=
salt and pepper calamari.author: S. B.
salt and pepper calamari.review:
I went there for the first time last night and I must say I was super excited.  The only other restaurant I've been to like this was PPQ's, and I've only been there one time.

I LOVE CRAB AND I LOVE GARLIC NOODLES.

Based on my experience at PPQ's, I ordered what I knew to be good or what I thought would be awesome.  My boyfriend, my son, and I had an order of the Roasted Crab, Garlic Noodles, Shrimp Fried Rice, Salt and Pepper Calamari, and Chicken Satay.

Roasted Crab= OKAY
Garlic Noodles= OKAY
Shrimp Fried Rice=GOOD...simple and not greasy
Chicken Satay= OKAY, talk about charbroiled (for my 2yr old)
Salt and Pepper Calamari= GREAT

Don't get me wrong I still got down with the crab and noodles, but my tastebuds were so much more excited at PPQ's.  Honestly, in my opinion, so much better at PPQ's and I've had better Garlic Noodles at home.  

I wouldn't choose to come back unless I got invited to go there again.

excerpts: The salt and pepper calamari appetizer was divine as well!
Will definitely be back here soon
salt and pepper calamari.author: Kym L.
salt and pepper calamari.review:
Greaaaat roast crabs! The garlic noodles were great but i felt like it would have been a lot better if they just threw in some of those yummy crab juices. Definitely requires reservations if arriving after 5:45pm on weekends. I did however get seated immediately without a reservation when I got there at 5:15pm (80% of the restaurant was occupied by then though)

The salt and pepper calamari appetizer was divine as well! Will definitely be back here soon

excerpts: What we ordered was the roasted crab, garlic noodles, salt and pepper calamari, fried banana with ice cream & mango&strawberry parfait.
Mhmm....
everything there was delicious.
Roasted crab
; it was delicious but at the same time it was a little bit salty.
Garlic noodles; that was mucho good!
Salt and pepper calamari; yummmmmm.
Okay so for dessert, I ordered the fried banana with ice cream and my boyfriend ordered the mango&strawberry parfait.
Lol what was funny was that my boyfriend ordered the parfait
but he thought it was actual parfait where it has flakes and
all that
but it was like a smoothie with some rum!
Haha.
Anyways, they didn't even check our ID's and I guess they assumed we were 21 lol which was great haha.
Pricing wise, it's kinda expensive but the crabs were market price which was $39 ish, garlic noodles were around $10, salt and pepper calamari was like maybe $8?
Overall it was great service, delicious food
and I definitely would love to go back there!!!
Pricing wise, it's kinda expensive but the crabs were market price which was $39 ish, garlic noodles were around $10, salt and pepper calamari was like maybe $8?
Overall it was great service, delicious food
and I definitely would love to go back there!!!
salt and pepper calamari.author: Monica W.
salt and pepper calamari.review: Oh man....this restaurant is AWESOME! :) I've been here in the past but I don't really remember but anyways, my boyfriend and I went to eat here last night for our early 3 years anniversary. We had reservation at 7:30 and we didn't even have to wait which was good. What we ordered was the roasted crab, garlic noodles, salt and pepper calamari, fried banana with ice cream & mango&strawberry parfait. Mhmm....everything there was delicious. Roasted crab; it was delicious but at the same time it was a little bit salty. Garlic noodles; that was mucho good! Salt and pepper calamari; yummmmmm. Okay so for dessert, I ordered the fried banana with ice cream and my boyfriend ordered the mango&strawberry parfait. Lol what was funny was that my boyfriend ordered the parfait but he thought it was actual parfait where it has flakes and all that but it was like a smoothie with some rum! Haha. Anyways, they didn't even check our ID's and I guess they assumed we were 21 lol which was great haha. Pricing wise, it's kinda expensive but the crabs were market price which was $39 ish, garlic noodles were around $10, salt and pepper calamari was like maybe $8? Overall it was great service, delicious food and I definitely would love to go back there!!! :)

excerpts: An appetizer of salt and pepper calamari was a bit rubbery but nicely spiced and was OK.
The Vietnamese salad was mainly cabbage with some stray shrimp and strange tasting chicken that was best forgotten.
salt and pepper calamari.author: David D.
salt and pepper calamari.review:
Thanh Long has a menu.  A pretty extensive one.  But there are two reasons to come here, the garlic noodles and the roast crab.  Making a meal of anything else here would be like doing chicken at a steakhouse.  

Yes we did get a few additional things.  An appetizer of salt and pepper calamari was a bit rubbery but nicely spiced and was OK.   The Vietnamese salad was mainly cabbage with some stray shrimp and strange tasting chicken that was best forgotten.  Likewise the Mango salad composed of tasteless mango and some stray shrimp.  The scallops described on the menu as being in the salad were undetectable.  Also best forgotten were mains of stringy steamed sea bass and shaken beef marinated to the point where the beef had lost texture and taste.  

The saving graces here were the roasted whole crab, which had obviously been done in garlic and some pepper.  Not a wondrous dish but fresh crab that was properly prepared.  The garlic noodles were nice as well.  Nothing remarkable about this plate, just noodles with oodles of garlic.   

So come.  Get your fix of crab and noodles.  Avoid the rest of the menu and you will do well for yourself.

excerpts: salt and pepper calamari was too salty.
salt and pepper calamari.author: Rob C.
salt and pepper calamari.review:
probably 3.5, esp. when considering value which pushes this place down.  hmm, TL vs. PPQ vs. R&G.  all crabs approx. $35-40.  I vote for PPQ, and overall I prefer R&G type preps over butter/garlic.
the family business story is impressive.
here the crabs seem to be steamed/boiled longer, so the shell is softer?  didn't quite like the meat as much but the sauces were fine.
had the roasted crab and tamarind crab with garlic noodles and shaken beef.  $10 garlic noodle is a money maker, oily.
nice pepper on the roasted crab.
the shaken beef is priced very high, but it's quite tasty.  such soft and nicely flavored meat mixed with potatoes and lettuce.  salt and pepper calamari was too salty.

excerpts: we ordered the salt and pepper calamari and spring rolls.
Calamari was good - light crispy batter and fresh squid - but it could have been seasoned a tad more.
The spring rolls were good - but SMALL - they only gave you a few pieces
salt and pepper calamari.author: T M.
salt and pepper calamari.review:
So I was really excited to try to this place since I love garlic noodles and you can't go wrong with crab.    I was surprised to see this place located on the far end of Judah practically near the water.. a bit random but they definitely seem to have a loyal following.    

FOOD:
we ordered the salt and pepper calamari and spring rolls.   Calamari was good - light crispy batter and fresh squid - but it could have been seasoned a tad more.  The spring rolls were good - but SMALL - they only gave you a few pieces and I've had my fair share of big, cheap, good spring rolls so although this place was fancier, they could have been a bit more generous with that appetizer.

onto the main event.. Crab & garlic noodles:   With our bibs on and ready for some messy eating I would warn people not to come here on a blind date as you have horrible breath afterward and it is MESSY.   The roasted crab was good and definitely had a lot of flavor but when I think of all the times I've had crab - I think that grabbing fresh crab from a market down near LA tasted slightly better.  The crab meat was a solid 4 but it could have been just a tad bigger/juicier.  Yes I'm going to be a crab nazi/food critic since I can be on yelp ;)  The garlic noodles were very tasty and more on the soft/sticky side than I anticipated but I liked them.

Dessert:  FRIED BANANA - yum yum yum.  can't go wrong.

DECOR:  nice but kind of weird in the back near the bathrooms where they have these bright colored walls.. to me it looked a little tacky but the rest of the restaurant looked nice.

overall - yummy, garlicky dining experience.   ii'll have to try the shaking beef next time!

excerpts: We ordered a roasted crab, two plates of garlic noodles, eggplant, garlic rice (more like white fried rice with a hint of garlic), crab puff appetizer, salt and pepper calamari (yum), and a vegetarian garlic dish.
We also got the banana cake and creme brulee for dessert.
Came out to be about $25pp, 8 of us (one didn't make it).
salt and pepper calamari.author: qirk z.
salt and pepper calamari.review:
Made reservations early in the week, 5ppl, 7pm, Sunday.

Thur, changed reservations to 7ppl, 7pm, Sunday; "oh no problem, we'll make the change".

Sunday 2pm, changed reservations to 9ppl, 7pm, today; "oh no problem, we'll make the change, thanks for calling".

Sunday 5pm, changed reservations to 9ppl, 6pm, today; 'oh sure, we'll make the change, see you soon".

Arrive at 6pm, found parking just around the corner, place was still empty (maybe three groups of diners), we get seated upstairs. I've eaten here before, but never upstairs. We were the second large party upstairs.

By the time we finished eating, maybe 8pm? Both upstairs and downstairs was packed.

We ordered a roasted crab, two plates of garlic noodles, eggplant, garlic rice (more like white fried rice with a hint of garlic), crab puff appetizer, salt and pepper calamari (yum), and a vegetarian garlic dish. We also got the banana cake and creme brulee for dessert. Came out to be about $25pp, 8 of us (one didn't make it).

excerpts: I also ordered their salt and pepper calamari.
To my suprise, it wasn't as good either.
salt and pepper calamari.author: Anne K.
salt and pepper calamari.review:
This review is solely based on a take-out order.  Since there was so much hype with these Garlic Noodles, had to try.

My take: pretty good. Not as I expected, maybe because I was anticipating more.  I also ordered their salt and pepper calamari.  To my suprise, it wasn't as good either.  A bit overpriced for the amount given.

OH WELL...

excerpts: Could have done without the fake grill marks; and Salt and pepper calamari....
the actual salted and peppered parts were tasty.
salt and pepper calamari.author: Minty O.
salt and pepper calamari.review:
GOOD capitalization off the "secret family recipes"... the food is good, delicious... expensive though... and Viet food shouldn't be...

but it's as "secret" as anyone's grandama's secret recipe for oatmeal cookies or your "secret" ingredient to your own spaghetti sauce...

I loved the food and highly recommend it if you live near by, but i made the trek from south san jose (had friends that highly recommended it) and enjoyed the food and company, but with gas being $4.00+ a gallon, I'd rather make my own, CUA RANG MUOI (minus all the frickin' butter) aka "Secret" Roast Crab or NUI TOI, aka "Secret Garlic Noodles"

Clever gimmick...clever marketing...but seems shady.

Other delicious dishes we tried were the Sea Bass with a pineapple-ginger dipping sauce. Could have done without the fake grill marks; and Salt and pepper calamari....the actual salted and peppered parts were tasty. Unevenly salted and peppered, obviously.

Again, I recommend it if you live nearby...would i go back? Probably not. 

I guess I'm quite particular when it comes to Viet food...because I do a lot of the cooking of it myself...haha sorry if i sound snotty.

excerpts: Instead he orders the salt and pepper calamari with rice.
The calamari is very flavorful and the perfect appetizer!
salt and pepper calamari.author: Eegnam A.
salt and pepper calamari.review:
Garlic noodles, crab, and calamari!

Get ready to get your hands dirty for this one!  The garlic noodles are a must have with the crab.  We usually order the tamarind and roasted crab.  I personally prefer the roasted crab, but the tamarind is good too.  Mix the sauce in with your noodles!

My husband is allergic to the crab shells so he cannot enjoy the goodness.  Instead he orders the salt and pepper calamari with rice.  The calamari is very flavorful and the perfect appetizer!

excerpts: The salt and pepper calamari and the shaking beef were very good.
Watch out for the gangster types hanging out across the street in front of the church.
salt and pepper calamari.author: Alan T.
salt and pepper calamari.review: Five stars for the service; three stars for the food; two stars for value.  The frozen tasting crab at $40 was a big disappointment.  The salt and pepper calamari and the shaking beef were very good.  Watch out for the gangster types hanging out across the street in front of the church.

excerpts: The Salt and Pepper calamari rocks!
Valet park and save yourself the headache.
It is a little pricey
so make sure someone else is paying.
salt and pepper calamari.author: Nicholas H.
salt and pepper calamari.review: One of the best places in San Francisco for crab! It is at the end of Judah, by Java Beach. Make sure to get an order of garlic noodles - but remember it comes with every crab as well. The Salt and Pepper calamari rocks! Valet park and save yourself the headache.  It is a little pricey so make sure someone else is paying.

excerpts: the bouillabaisse soup wasn't to die for, but the salt and pepper calamari was!
salt and pepper calamari.author: Ameer N.
salt and pepper calamari.review:
first of all, i'm biased... my friend works here.

we got the royal treatment on our visit to "the place that serves vietnamese crab".  strange, i've eaten plenty of vietnamese food before and never saw anything soaking wet with beautifully glistening buttery pepper garlic goodness -until i came to this spot and ordered a crab!

the bouillabaisse soup wasn't to die for, but the salt and pepper calamari was! 

PPQ is the lower price imitation thanh long. crustation is the white person name for thanh long (both owned by same people).

excerpts: For a simple appetizer I suggest the salt and pepper calamari and dessert is the fried banana.
If you're on a date and both of you are hungry
I suggest a crab for each, but one is definitely enough.
salt and pepper calamari.author: rae m.
salt and pepper calamari.review: GARLIC ROASTED CRAB!!!! What else is there to say...oh wait the GARLIC NOODLES!!! For a simple appetizer I suggest the salt and pepper calamari and dessert is the fried banana. If you're on a date and both of you are hungry I suggest a crab for each, but one is definitely enough.

excerpts: We ordered salt and pepper calamari for an appetizer, got shaking beef, sea bass, garlic noodles, and roasted crab.
Then came the garlic noodles - which was served along with the shaking beef and sea bass.
The noodles were outstanding - perfectly cooked and seasoned, tons of garlic (almost too much for my taste) and full of flavor.
The shaking beef was extremely "Americanized", if you will, being entirely too sweet for my palate, but it was good beef and went nicely with the noodles.
Sea bass, in my opinion, is a hard fish to mess up as it basically tastes great however
you cook it as long as it's not overdone.
It does, however, need to be dressed up to really make the flavor stand out, or it risks being a bland fish.
While there was nothing wrong with how they cooked it - -  it was one of the few times
I thought sea bass to be boring.
salt and pepper calamari.author: Grace K.
salt and pepper calamari.review:
I have heard about Thanh Long forever, but had never been until this night.  I knew they were a sister restaurant to Crustacean, but I have never been there either - though I have eaten their crab.

This restaurant is known for their "roasted crab" - and on this evening, Rob and I ordered an exorbitant amount of food.  As I gawked at what he was ordering, he said, "Well we will reheat the leftovers for tomorrow."

Made perfect sense to me!

First, we ordered a bottle of Duckhorn Sauvignon Blanc ($50).  We thought it'd pair nicely with all the dishes, and it did.  

We ordered salt and pepper calamari for an appetizer, got shaking beef, sea bass, garlic noodles, and roasted crab.

I thought the calamari was excellent - lightly breaded, fried perfectly and while it's a deep-fried item, you don't feel like a hog eating this up.  Then came the garlic noodles - which was served along with the shaking beef and sea bass.  The noodles were outstanding - perfectly cooked and seasoned, tons of garlic (almost too much for my taste) and full of flavor.  The shaking beef was extremely "Americanized", if you will, being entirely too sweet for my palate, but it was good beef and went nicely with the noodles.  Sea bass, in my opinion, is a hard fish to mess up as it basically tastes great however you cook it as long as it's not overdone.  It does, however, need to be dressed up to really make the flavor stand out, or it risks being a bland fish.  While there was nothing wrong with how they cooked it - -  it was one of the few times I thought sea bass to be boring.  It needed a kick of some sort - desperately.

The crab arrives - and we dug right in.  The flavor was good, and it was served piping hot in a soup which consisted basically of butter.  Can't ask for more.  The crab itself was covered in pepper.  To say one will have to get messy is an understatement.  

Having said that - I don't consider this to be any better than Crustacean's crab.  Furthermore, perhaps because I have gone crabbing myself and had the freshest Dungeoness Crab one would eat straight out of the ocean and steamed alive on the spot - - it never crossed my mind that this was "THE BEST" I have had.  Very good - yes.  The best - - not quite!

It almost embarrasses me to report that not only did we finish every single thing we ordered - we hemmed and hawed over whether we should order one more crab.  After a few minutes, we did, and therein lied our mistake - - we waited too long to order and got fuller by the minute.  We ate about one leg each off the crab and packed the rest for home.  Well, at least we did have leftovers, like we intended.

Service was what was exceptional at this restaurant.  In particular, I am referring to our server - a young man who was the epitome of polite, attentive, friendly but professional all at the same time.  The few times we asked for anything - he got it immediately, and the rest of the time, we never needed a thing because he took such good care of us.  I was also impressed when he didn't bat an eye at how much food we ordered.

Yes, we ordered dessert.  (Don't forget, it's Rob and Grace here...)  Initially, Rob declined dessert but seriously, how does one refuse this:

"FRIED BANANA A LA MODE"?

We ordered that and two Vietnamese Iced Coffees - - both were OUTSTANDING and a perfect grand finale to a gluttonous feast.

The meal was not cheap by any means - but it was a lot of food and we left happy.  The total bill closed in on $300 by the time we tipped.  

We had some plans to check out a few bars after dinner, making it a full date night.  The food comas that followed the meal prevented any outings and we headed straight home.  

In summary, Thanh Long is worth trying at least once.  While the ambiance is not "romantic" by any means, it's not grungy either.  It's ideal for a Sunday night family dinner (if you have reservations) or dinner with close friends.  It's nice for a casual date, but not quite up to "impress the socks off" level, if you know what I mean.  But with great service and good food, not to mention a pretty nice wine list, I am declaring that Thanh Long makes it onto my date list on Yelp.

excerpts: roasted crab is amazing, salt and pepper calamari, and garlic noodles.
I went here last night with my bf
and now I totally have a food hangover!
Well priced, be aware you will consume a lot of butter!
salt and pepper calamari.author: Rebecca W.
salt and pepper calamari.review: SO GOOD!  roasted crab is amazing, salt and pepper calamari, and garlic noodles.  I went here last night with my bf and now I totally have a food hangover!  Well priced, be aware you will consume a lot of butter!

excerpts: Also, we ordered the salt and pepper calamari and it was so overcooked we didn't touch it after the initial taste.
After 25 years of enjoying great meals here, I'd done.
I won't return.
salt and pepper calamari.author: Rainey M.
salt and pepper calamari.review: This used to be one of my favorite places to eat. I would eat here several times a year, but haven't been here is about four years until this week. The roasted crab-still amazing. Not so much anything else.  I always have the crab, garlic noodles and fried bananas, These were my all time favorites hands down--DELICIOUS! However, I was so disappointed this time I will never return. So sad!  Don't get me wrong the crab was amazing! The garlic noodles were not. Very disappointing! I used to order a plate for myself and a plate to go, but they have gone down hill. The fried bananas had a really thick batter and the bananas seemed to be picked green right off the tree-kind of chewy and earthy tasting. They added whipped cream and chocolate sauce to the dish and destroyed it. Also, we ordered the salt and pepper calamari and it was so overcooked we didn't touch it after the initial taste. After 25 years of enjoying great meals here, I'd done. I won't return.

excerpts: i'm sure the other things on the menu are tasty (the salt and pepper calamari are a favorite if we come w/ friends), but you can't come all the way out here and not have the roast crab AND garlic noodles.
salt and pepper calamari.author: Carol O.
salt and pepper calamari.review:
order the roast crab and the garlic noodles.  that's all you really need to know.  i'm sure the other things on the menu are tasty (the salt and pepper calamari are a favorite if we come w/ friends), but you can't come all the way out here and not have the roast crab AND garlic noodles.

i prefer thanh long over crustacean for the slightly more relaxed atmosphere, especially bc i don't like to feel like i have to get dressed up if i'm going to be licking butter & garlic off my fingers at dinner.

my best friend from So Cal swears that the only reason she really comes up here to visit me is because she wants to eat at thanh long.  matter of fact, the few times i've been with her, she's refused to share a large dungeness roast crab w/ anyone.  what a punk!

parking is terrible.  i used to live two blocks away and parking was still bad but it is definitely worth it.

excerpts: We ordered the salt and pepper calamari as an appetizer and it was really good, not too salty and not too spicy.
The crab and garlic were really good, very nice flavor, seasoned just right.
salt and pepper calamari.author: A N.
salt and pepper calamari.review: It was my first time here and I've heard good things about their garlic noodles and crab. I have to say that I was not disappointed! We ordered the salt and pepper calamari as an appetizer and it was really good, not too salty and not too spicy. The crab and garlic were really good, very nice flavor, seasoned just right. There were a lot of other things on the menu that I didn't get to try such as the Tamarind crab...I'll definitely be coming back for those items!

excerpts: garlic noodles are a must-have as well...but the real surprise here is that pretty much everything else i've tried is fantastic, like the salt and pepper calamari, and the tender beef cubes.
perhaps my favorite thing about this place though is served at the bar: the pineapple/lychee-infused vodka martinis.
you can't even taste the booze.
dangerous!
salt and pepper calamari.author: dusty d.
salt and pepper calamari.review: thanh long has some of the best crab in the city. garlic noodles are a must-have as well...but the real surprise here is that pretty much everything else i've tried is fantastic, like the salt and pepper calamari, and the tender beef cubes. perhaps my favorite thing about this place though is served at the bar: the pineapple/lychee-infused vodka martinis. you can't even taste the booze. dangerous!

excerpts: Our table of five shared the famed roast crab ($36/crab), the garlic noodles, the jumbo prawns, spicy eggplant, salt and pepper calamari, Asian bouillabaisse, and banana cake for dessert.
The roast crab was a good size (about 2-2.5 lbs) so three of us shared one (alongside the other food).
Although pretty basic in theory, the garlic noodles were my favorite.
The roast crab was a close second - great flavor and juiciness.
Prawns weren't bad and calamari and eggplant were pretty standard (calamari was lukewarm).
Service was great, and the crowd inside was incredibly diverse (black, white, asian, everyone).
Although pricey, it's super closeby
salt and pepper calamari.author: Melinda C.
salt and pepper calamari.review: I'd been wanting to try this place for a long time, and at long last, I finally went this past Friday night.  What a random location for a pretty nice, high ambiance restaurant.  Per yelp recommendations, I made a reservation in advance so seating was easy.  Our table of five shared the famed roast crab ($36/crab), the garlic noodles, the jumbo prawns, spicy eggplant, salt and pepper calamari, Asian bouillabaisse, and banana cake for dessert.  The roast crab was a good size (about 2-2.5 lbs) so three of us shared one (alongside the other food).  Although pretty basic in theory, the garlic noodles were my favorite.  The roast crab was a close second - great flavor and juiciness.  Prawns weren't bad and calamari and eggplant were pretty standard (calamari was lukewarm).  Service was great, and the crowd inside was incredibly diverse (black, white, asian, everyone).  Although pricey, it's super closeby so I would go and try the drunken crab next time.

excerpts: We ordered the soft shell crab and salt and pepper calamari for appetizers and  the roast  crab and garlic noodles for the entree.
The soft shell crab was very good.
They give you one small deep fried soft shell crab with sweet & sour dipping sauce.
The salt & pepper calamari was decent.
I thought it was a little too salty for my taste.
It left me wanting to take a sip of H2O every time I took a bite.
Every one there seemed to be eating the garlic noodles.
We were curious and ordered it as well.
I  personally wasn't impressed.
It was a pretty simple dish.
I think I could have gone without it.
Overall, I give this place 4 stars due to the fact that it was expensive, the lack of parking, and the buttery greasy taste it left in my mouth for the rest of the day.
salt and pepper calamari.author: Cynthia S.
salt and pepper calamari.review: I was excited to eat here especially after finding out that they share the same owners as crustaceans. I honestly didn't know what to expect because my friends from Hawaii who were visiting suggested to go to this place. Apparently this place has a reputation even in Hawaii. I was pleasantly surprised to find this place in my own backyard. I wasn't expecting this restaurant to be in the suburbs in the outer sunset. Parking was terrible so my friends and I opted for  valet. I think it was $10. We ordered the soft shell crab and salt and pepper calamari for appetizers and  the roast  crab and garlic noodles for the entree. The soft shell crab was very good. They give you one small deep fried soft shell crab with sweet & sour dipping sauce. The salt & pepper calamari was decent. I thought it was a little too salty for my taste. It left me wanting to take a sip of H2O every time I took a bite. The roast crab was DELICIOUS!! It was really good. I didn't enjoy it as much when the crab became cold. It's served in a puddle of butter that started to congeal at the end of the meal. It wasn't a pretty site. I felt like my arteries were clogging instantly. Every one there seemed to be eating the garlic noodles. We were curious and ordered it as well. I  personally wasn't impressed. It was a pretty simple dish. I think I could have gone without it.  Overall, I give this place 4 stars due to the fact that it was expensive, the lack of parking, and the buttery greasy taste it left in my mouth for the rest of the day.

excerpts: Had the salt and pepper calamari to start, which to me was the hit of the night.
Don't bother ordering the dumpling appetizer.
Yuck!
salt and pepper calamari.author: Mystic C.
salt and pepper calamari.review: I don't get why people rave about this place.  Parking was really difficult.  We circled around for 15 minutes before finding a spot.  Came here with friends on a Tuesday night with an 8pm reservation.  The place was packed and we were seated within 10 minutes.  Had the salt and pepper calamari to start, which to me was the hit of the night.  Don't bother ordering the dumpling appetizer.  Yuck!  We also ordered the tamarind crab and the original roasted crab.  The tamarind crab was definitely the more tasty and interesting one.  The roasted crab had disappointing flavor and was a bit dry.  We also ordered a combination noodle dish which was good.  Passed on the garlic noodles.  Everyone else around us seemed to have it on their tables but we didn't feel that $10 was worth a small plate of noodles with garlic.  Overall we were expecting something really delicious but it sure did fall flat.  Plus, they celebrated 4 birthdays that night in a one hour time span.  Seemed not so special after the 2nd birthday song.  Won't be going back.

excerpts: Then last weekend I went in there with my boyfriend, and we ordered their Salt and Pepper calamari, garlic noodles and roasted crab...
my
oh my, it was
REALLY good!
And their bartender, Peter was very nice and friendly.
He made my drink (Pinacolada) just the way I like it.
I would definitely come back again in this restaurant...
Now I know why this place is always packed.... their servings are so good!
