And not only that, I like the fact that after eating crabs the waiters/servers would give you a HOT (and I mean REALLY hot) damp towel to wipe your hands...
I strongly recommend anyone to go to this place and try it themselves, it's worth the long line of waiting although they make up by serving your food faster and efficiently.
salt and pepper calamari.author: Christina Z.
salt and pepper calamari.review: I LOVE THIS PLACE!!!  Ok, so I'd pass by this place EVERY DAY before and after I go to work and when I would get home (which is around 8:30pm) the place is already busy and packed with people (especially on the weekends).  So I tried it with a friend, Wendy to celebrate our birthdays and I ordered their Mango Salad and let me tell you.. it was HEAVENLY!!! I normally don't eat scallops but theirs was THE BOMB! it was DELICIOUS! I LOVE their dessert as well, their chocolate dessert was rich and creamy... mmm, yummy! Then last weekend I went in there with my boyfriend, and we ordered their Salt and Pepper calamari, garlic noodles and roasted crab... my oh my, it was REALLY good!  And their bartender, Peter was very nice and friendly.  He made my drink (Pinacolada) just the way I like it. :-D  I would definitely come back again in this restaurant... Now I know why this place is always packed.... their servings are so good! And not only that, I like the fact that after eating crabs the waiters/servers would give you a HOT (and I mean REALLY hot) damp towel to wipe your hands... I strongly recommend anyone to go to this place and try it themselves, it's worth the long line of waiting although they make up by serving your food faster and efficiently.

excerpts: I ended up with the salt and pepper calamari, jumbo prawn wontons, and the infamous garlic noodles.
jumbo prawn wontons.author: Lauren S.
jumbo prawn wontons.review:
Thanh Long might be in the Outer Sunset of SF but it's more like Outer Space.. 

Between the ride and the parking I was just about to be thru. Thankfully I was happily satisfied by the attention given and wonderful meal prepared for me and my friends.

If you are a crab lover( which I am allergic) then this is the place for you...If not you have some wicked good alternatives. I ended up with the salt and pepper calamari, jumbo prawn wontons, and the infamous garlic noodles. Then I washed it all down with this smooth drink called a "Flying Dragon". 

Of course my companions had the Drunken crab, which even looking at, was making me sick ( I could see their boiled eyes...gross!) All-in-all was a good night, pricey, but worth the trip.

excerpts: The jumbo prawn wontons are not jumbo by any account (granted, I had eaten at Anchor Oyster Bar earlier that day, so my sense of proportion may be completely skewed), and you can barely taste the pancetta at all, a very forgettable dish.
jumbo prawn wontons.author: Gene C.
jumbo prawn wontons.review:
I came here with a friend from out of town looking for a competitor to PPQ Dungeness Island. The restaurant is situated in a fairly residential area, but then again, I guess most restaurants in the Sunset/Richmond area qualify.  The restaurant's layout is a little interesting, as the back portion of the restaurant was walled off leaving a nook for 6 tables and gave the restaurant a closed-off feel.  The frozen cocktail my friend ordered was mostly sweet without much alcohol, disappointing even for her.

The jumbo prawn wontons are not jumbo by any account (granted, I had eaten at Anchor Oyster Bar earlier that day, so my sense of proportion may be completely skewed), and you can barely taste the pancetta at all, a very forgettable dish.  The Buddha roll, on the other hand, was like a slight variation on a traditional Vietnamese spring roll filled with tasty daikon and black mushrooms to give it a more earthy flavor.  The Dungeness crab puffs were like crab rangoons on crack, filled with delicious herb cheese and a large quantity of crab, only limited by their size.

The garlic noodles here have somewhat more of a bite and stronger garlic flavor compared to PPQ Dungeness Island. However, I have to say the crab, albeit meatier, was not nearly as flavorful.  We ordered the roast crab which, although mildly peppery and actually with a good amount of sweet meat, otherwise was not as heavily seasoned.  Strangely enough, our crab was actually a little cool by the time it got to our table.  Also, the seafood fried rice was lacking in salt.  Thankfully, they brought some chili sambal to our table upon request.  Our server was really very nice and attentive.

Overall, based on pure food comparisons, PPQ Dungeness Island wins in my book purely based on the crab's flavoring, but Thanh Long may actually serve a better crab and definitely has better garlic noodles.  If you're looking for crab on a Tuesday, this is your place... (cuz it seems everywhere else is closed!)

excerpts: Salt & Pepper Calamari, Jumbo Prawn Wontons,  roasted crab and garlic noodles.
I mixed the crab into my garlic noodles and added some of the butter sauce from the crab....
jumbo prawn wontons.author: Judy c.
jumbo prawn wontons.review:
Everything we ordered was delicious. Salt & Pepper Calamari, Jumbo Prawn Wontons,  roasted crab and garlic noodles.  I mixed the crab into my garlic noodles and added some of the butter sauce from the crab.... To die for. 

Had an hour wait but standing at the bar trying  their chambord & sparkling wine helped the time to pass by faster. 

As soon as we were done with dinner and walking towards the front door I could see our car being brought to valet. Valet recommended $12. Parking near by is crazy. 

I think next time I will make reservations. The waiting near the bar can get a bit crowded depending on the wait of the crowd. No bar stool its so compact in with the waiting area.

excerpts: Jumbo prawn wontons ($10.50) and the lemon grass beef ($8.95) is also pretty good.
If you want to have a few starters.
The alcohol beverages are not bad as far as taste, but for nearly $10 a drink they could be better.
jumbo prawn wontons.author: Lina D.
jumbo prawn wontons.review:
Do not leave with out trying the garlic noodles($9.50).... Simply delish! Drawback- you'll taste the garlic for hours on end! So worth it though. The roast garlic crab around ($40) is to die for, believe me.......
Jumbo prawn wontons ($10.50) and the lemon grass beef ($8.95) is also pretty good. If you want to have a few starters. The alcohol beverages are not bad as far as taste, but for nearly $10 a drink they could be better.  I have come to luvvvvvv the wok egg noodles with chicken ($13.95) I'd walk in and get those noodles to go! Drive to the beach and watch the sun set........  
Customer service, as usual is always on point. Oh and I always find parking. I know there's a parking problem in the sunset area. Especially if you go on the weekends. I would use valet.  You'll be walking those long San Francisco blocks, or be driving around for a awhile.
 Happy Eating!!!!!

excerpts: My bf and I ordered an app, jumbo prawn wontons, one roasted crab, and garlic noodles.
We were satisfied at the end, leaving nothing to-go.
I saw the couple next to us that did order individual crabs couldn't finish their own.
All-in-all, I would say I had better, pertaining to the crab.
I was just too oily/buttery and for the price I could of bought two on my own n
made it my self, but it was v-day right?!?
The GARLIC NOODLES are ssooo good!
That would probably be the only reason to go back there.
jumbo prawn wontons.author: michelle m.
jumbo prawn wontons.review:
My bf and I came here on V-day.  No reservations, but got seated within 10 mins; they were great at accommodating everybody!!  
It was so crowded, but  man did the place look great from the lobby.  After the hostess called my name we got escorted through the beautiful restaurant, through a hallway, passing the bathroom, up a flight of stairs, and into a red-walled room filled with families and couples.  It was like they took us to the reject room.  

Anyways, the waiters were really polite and attentive.  The crabs that day were going for almost $40 a crab, ouch! My bf and I ordered an app, jumbo prawn wontons, one roasted crab, and garlic noodles.  We were satisfied at the end, leaving nothing to-go.  I saw the couple next to us that did order individual crabs couldn't finish their own.  
All-in-all, I would say I had better, pertaining to the crab.  I was just too oily/buttery and for the price I could of bought two on my own n made it my self, but it was v-day right?!? The GARLIC NOODLES are ssooo good! That would probably be the only reason to go back there.

excerpts:
Im also a fan of their seasonal veggies and jumbo prawn wontons. 
Their food is just great. 
The only thing I would change is their seating. 
OMG I would like to have dinner with my boyfriend and 
not the waiters ass because the tables are so close. 
Oh P.s...
The neighborhood is NOT what you expect.
Lock your doors.
jumbo prawn wontons.author: Toya R.
jumbo prawn wontons.review:
Whoaaaaaa. MAJOR kudos to the An family for having those super cool top secret kitchens that produce the most ummm....amazing freakin' garlic noodles EVER.
Im so confused. 
Like really?!
How are they so good??
It just boggles my mind but any who, 
their garlic crab is also a winner.
Super fresh. Very well seasoned. 
Im also a fan of their seasonal veggies and jumbo prawn wontons. 
Their food is just great. 
The only thing I would change is their seating. OMG I would like to have dinner with my boyfriend and not the waiters ass because the tables are so close. 
Oh P.s...
The neighborhood is NOT what you expect.
Lock your doors.

excerpts: We also ordered the jumbo prawn wontons which literally was a shrimp w/ its tail stil on it inside a fried egg roll wrapper.
So when you eat the "wonton" you get a big bite of a crunchy tail.
Gross.
It had no flavor.
I thought I would get something more interesting for the exorbitant price.
jumbo prawn wontons.author: amanda c.
jumbo prawn wontons.review:
I think the only 3 things that are good here are the roast crab, garlic noodles, and the colossal tiger prawns. We also ordered the jumbo prawn wontons which literally was a shrimp w/ its tail stil on it inside a fried egg roll wrapper. So when you eat the "wonton" you get a big bite of a crunchy tail. Gross. It had no flavor. I thought I would get something more interesting for the exorbitant price. Also ordered the vegetable soup. It was Meh..

I thought the service was ok. I felt like they were just trying to get us out of there. I was still eating some crab and the bus boy came and cleared the crab bowl and crab plate away. I was like..hello! i'm still eating here!

So, I'd stick with the 3 items mentioned above and wouldn't deviate from them. Overall, 4 stars for the garlic noodles and crab.

excerpts: I will say there are some good appetizers like the salt and pepper calamari and the shrimp toast.
shrimp toast.author: M. H.
shrimp toast.review:
If you know me, you know how much I LOVED Thanh Long! This use to be my go to place whenever I felt like splurging on a good meal. Three years ago I would've given this place 5 stars. But as the years went on, I'm becoming less impressed with this place. 

The last two times I've been here, the service has been subpar. On my previous visit before tonight, I had a waitress who was not very friendly and lacked social skills. I want to feel welcomed, especially if I'm paying a crap load of money on a great meal. Tonight I had a waiter who would only talk to me and would not acknowledge my grandma (can we say awkward and weird). 

On my previous visit, I received my crab way before my garlic noodles. Uhhhhh I would like to eat my HOT crab with my HOT garlic noodles. I don't want COLD crab with HOT garlic noodles. Tonight after my grandma and I ordered, we literally received our food 5 minutes later. Either the chef was able to whip up 2 roasted crabs and 2 orders of garlic noodles in under two minutes or they just reheated our food and served it to us (hmmmm). 

As far as the food, it does not excite me as much as it use to. My roasted crab was pretty good, but it lacked garlic and was more peppery and salty (and greasy af). My garlic noodles were good but not as good as I remember them being. I also want to mention that my food went cold pretty quickly (that's what happens when you reheat food...let me stop lol).

I will say there are some good appetizers like the salt and pepper calamari and the shrimp toast. I also like their fried rice and heard their mango salad is delicious as well. I've had the Tiger Prawns on garlic noodles and it was really good (it was my very first meal here).

I would definitely recommend this place to someone who has never experienced the infamous roasted crab and garlic noodles or just want to say they've been here. I personally don't see myself coming back here, unless its for a special event. I also want to mention that although they are the same family, Thanh Long is better than Crustaceans only because Crustaceans taste differently...and not in a good way.

excerpts: Shrimp toast ($12) was the worst dish of the night.
The toast wasn't toasted enough.
It was really bready.
shrimp toast.author: Andy W.
shrimp toast.review:
Wanted to try this place for a long time. Like everyone else, I've heard lots of good things so I was really looking forward to it. Maybe I got my hopes up too high but I was underwhelmed. The outrageous prices also didn't help. One crab for $56 bucks. 4 prawns and noodles for $39. If it was mind blowing maybe it would justify the prices but my mind nor my socks were blown off.

The roasted crab ($56) was the best dish of the night. It was good, not great. 
Prawns ($39) were under seasoned compared to the crab. The noodles that came with it were ok.
Garlic rice ($9) was better than the garlic noodles IMO. It also went better with the crab.
Calamari ($13) was good but under seasoned.
Shrimp toast ($12) was the worst dish of the night. The toast wasn't toasted enough. It was really bready. Would recommend skipping this.  

There is a mandatory 18% tip for all party sizes. It doesn't bother us since we tip regardless but service might be better if it wasn't mandatory. Service was fine but for the prices they charge, I expected better. They did their job but it lacked care, warmth and friendliness. 

With the taxes and tip the bill came close to $200 for two of us. No drinks, we only had two sodas (no refills).

They do have valet for $12 but if you circle around, you might find street parking.

excerpts: The raspberry lemon drop martini, shrimp toast, chicken satay, shaken beef, garlic roasted crab, colossal shrimp with garlic noodles...
ALLL soo good!
Happy tummy, happy wife, happy life ...
Right ?!
lol !
Our waitress was so cute & sweet.
I just wanted one cocktail
shrimp toast.author: Cynthia C.
shrimp toast.review:
We had a reservation at 845pm and the host told us "don't worry just be here before 9pm" so we got to the restaurant at 855pm... And everything is amazing. The raspberry lemon drop martini, shrimp toast, chicken satay, shaken beef, garlic roasted crab, colossal shrimp with garlic noodles... ALLL soo good! Happy tummy, happy wife, happy life ... Right ?!lol !
Our waitress was so cute & sweet. I just wanted one cocktail but she was too hard to resistant to tell her no. 

Overall great experience & great food

excerpts: One other kids favorite is the shrimp toast.
Use to be crispy, now the bread is chewy and no flavor.
Ordered the coconut shrimp appetizer and the shrimp was over cooked and chewy, no flavor.
shrimp toast.author: Shirley S.
shrimp toast.review: My kids love crab and garlic noodle from here  although I find that the quality of food isn't gone down after our last several visits.  We just went today and the crab was a hit s d miss one crab was perfect while another crab the meat was mushy didn't even taste like crab to me.  One other kids favorite is the shrimp toast.  Use to be crispy, now the bread is chewy and no flavor.   Ordered the coconut shrimp appetizer and the shrimp was over cooked and chewy, no flavor.

excerpts: My coworkers and I ordered salt and pepper calamari and the shrimp toast for appetizers.
The calamari I could just not get enough of!!!
The mixture of the salt and pepper is just right, not too salty nor spicy.
The shrimp toast
I wasn't really into it, it's just a fried shrimp
and I thought the pieces were really small.
shrimp toast.author: Vanessa L.
shrimp toast.review:
Definitely need to make a reservation for this place. Once in a lifetime I'd eat here just cause of the price and because I prefer meat over seafood. 

My coworkers and I ordered salt and pepper calamari and the shrimp toast for appetizers. The calamari I could just not get enough of!!! The mixture of the salt and pepper is just right, not too salty nor spicy. The shrimp toast I wasn't really into it, it's just a fried shrimp and I thought the pieces were really small. 
Now for the real deal, I ordered a roast crab which has the restaurant's secret spices and garlic sauce on it. It's humongous and I'm still in awe. This taste good with the garlic noodles too! I put the garlic noodles in the big shell of the crab to give it more flavor. Everything about the crab was juicy and the butter mixed with the crab is tasty. 
Dessert: I got the creme brulee cheesecake which was rich, thick, and creamy. I'd rate it 3/5. The crust is the best part though.

Service: our waiter was really slow and preferred to take care of other smaller tables. He ignored a lot of our requests and seems to not be paying attention most of the time. For dessert, he asked everybody what they wanted EXCEPT my boss... He's standing right next to him and just skipped him and forgot about him. Dumb!

excerpts: Great food and service had the crab, garlic noodles and shrimp toast, and the chocolate lava cake with ice cream.
Carol
our server was on point
so was the food though I felt everything was coming out to fast, but
because there were hot wet towels you really felt clean after eating because of
you order the crab you have to use your hands to get the experience.
shrimp toast.author: Ahmed H.
shrimp toast.review: Great food and service had the crab, garlic noodles and shrimp toast, and the chocolate lava cake with ice cream. Carol our server was on point so was the food though I felt everything was coming out to fast, but because there were hot wet towels you really felt clean after eating because of you order the crab you have to use your hands to get the experience.

excerpts: I would try either the shrimp toast, calamari or something else.
shrimp toast.author: Stormy B.
shrimp toast.review:
Wow! Pictures do this food no justice! The taste is life changing. Things to order when it's your first time!

- the garlic noodles are a must. If they don't come in your order make sure to add on a side. Pictures do these noodles no justice. They are packed with so much flavor your going to have to brush your teeth 5x's after... but it is worth every brush!

- shrimp - the taste is amazing cooked to perfection and easy to peel out of shell. Looks of seasoning! Comes on a plate of garlic noodle. 

- drunken crab- very good. Messy but they give you a bib. Recommend 1 crab per person. They look big but when you take the top off it's actually pretty small. I held out first time but the 2 me time coming I shared this with an order of garlic noodle and an app. I was just right but could've handled my own crab  

- appetizer I had shrimp rolls- they were okay. I would try either the shrimp toast, calamari or something else. 

Can't wait till next trip. It is a little pricy here, but the taste is well worth it.

excerpts: Shrimp Toast was rubbery & baguette was not toasted...
AT ALL!
At least they took this off our bill.
Roasted Crabs came super quick...
Too quick?
The top shell of one crab was smaller than the body... & came with 1 extra loose leg...

Strange...
Crab did not taste sweet like a fresh crab should...

Frozen?
5)
shrimp toast.author: Amen C.
shrimp toast.review:
Hummmmm... What has happened to Thanh Long...
They used to be so good! We've been coming here every now & then for the last 25 years. I guess nothing stays the same forever. 

Pros:
1) you could get a table without too much wait since they don't seem to be as wildly popular as in the past
2) menu is familiar 
3) Pros list is short

Cons:
1) specialty cocktails not too special
     Hanoi Sunset: bland
     Green Dragon: where's the Midori?
     Ohio Punch: couldn't feel the punch... HaHa
 They all strangely taste like cough medicine.
2) Crab Puff looked store bought, like from the frozen section of Safeway... Too gooey, & where is the crab?
Maybe they should be called Cheese Puff!
3) Shrimp Toast was rubbery & baguette was not toasted... AT ALL! At least they took this off our bill.
4) Roasted Crabs came super quick... Too quick?
The top shell of one crab was smaller than the body... & came with 1 extra loose leg... Strange...
Crab did not taste sweet like a fresh crab should...
Frozen?
5) Garlic Noodle was kind of dry & not exactly yummy

Too bad... I guess no good thing last forever

excerpts: We started with the salmon carpaccio and the shrimp toast.
The salmon was sliced thinly enough to hold full flavor and the citrus hit was perfect.
The shrimp toast was pillow goodness.
shrimp toast.author: Truc N.
shrimp toast.review:
On the night of the full moon, we ventured out of the city. We drove towards the setting sun, passing many other good lookin' eateries, promised a crab coma experience...

We entered a simple door. The garlic pervaded everything. It was the kind that made you hungry, newly fried garlic that makes your mouth water. All around, people sat with plastic bibs! The group of diners to my left were happily passing around the famous noodles. The couple in front of me finished ordering and started to tie back their hair. An odd thing to do, but soon I'd fully understand.

I glanced down at the menu and inhaled the garlic permeating the air, agreeing it was worth the trip from downtown to the other side to eat at Thanh Long. My hometown, Nha Trang, was even labeled on the menu cover. :-) Then, the waiters tied a bib on me and walked away with a knowing look. We started with the salmon carpaccio and the shrimp toast. The salmon was sliced thinly enough to hold full flavor and the citrus hit was perfect. The shrimp toast was pillow goodness. The topping reminded me of the shrimp paste around sugar cane.

Then the garlic noodles! So good! Best when eaten hot, so get it on your plate then into your belly fast. The noodles were a nice chewy texture and a subtle garlic flavor that was nothing as powerful as its garlic aroma. Then again, you're hit with garlic the moment you walk in.

Then...THE CRAB! Some of the best Dungeoness crab I've ever eaten. My table ordered the roasted crab and tamarind crab. Very different. Very satisfying. I paused for a split second to be thankful all my hair was already tied up. No one at my table ate their crab carapaces, so this Vietnamese gal was in heaven with five all to herself! Then, we went garlic crazy and ordered garlic fried rice. The tamarind crab went great with it.

After all this, I had a disappointing fried banana. Others had the orange sherbet and the molten lava cake and enjoyed their desserts. My fried banana had no hint of a sugar finish...brown, white, nor palm. The banana was no where near sweet enough to carry it. 

But, I went for the crab, not the dessert. So, high ratings from me.

excerpts: The shrimp toast was okay too, but i prefer calamari.
I had creme brulee cheesecake for dessert.
The crust was the best part.
shrimp toast.author: Isabella D.
shrimp toast.review:
I've only been here twice. I would give them 4 stars but the service on my second visit wasn't really up to my liking. Our server was kinda slow and most of the time, we were left waiting for him to come back to either take our orders or bring the bill. We are a party of seven so gratuity was already included in our bill. So to me it felt like he wasn't trying anymore to service us. 
 
Anyway,  roast crab was really good (both times i visited) especially when paired with garlic noodles. It was really good but too big that I couldnt finish and had to take some to go. As for the starters, my fave is still salt & pepper calamari. The shrimp toast was okay too, but i prefer calamari. I had creme brulee cheesecake for dessert. The crust was the best part. The chocolate lava is also recommended if you're not a fan of cheesecake.

They are closed on Mondays and open for dinner time only. The restaurant gets really busy (and it's not that big). We had to make a reservation just to make sure that we can get seats and don't have to wait. We arrived on time and our table was ready when we came in. Parking is really hard to find, one of the reasons why I dont frequent this place. They have valet parking but they charge extra if you have a large size car.

excerpts: I also recommend the Shrimp toast, it's only open 3 1/2 hours
but and bit expensive.
But it's so worth the money
and the time to get down there and get that food
shrimp toast.author: Foteche M.
shrimp toast.review: I love this place, it has the best calamari and garlic noodles I've ever had. I also recommend the Shrimp toast, it's only open 3 1/2 hours but and bit expensive. But it's so worth the money and the time to get down there and get that food

excerpts: Shrimp toast was rich and buttery but not very crispy...which suggests they premake it and keep it in a warmer until someone orders it.
shrimp toast.author: Vy B.
shrimp toast.review:
I'm just going to cut to the chase and agree with everyone that the salt and pepper crab is really good. However, similar to R&G lounge, it was grossly over priced and people really over hyped those garlic noodles. Maybe as a vietnamese person I've grown up eating similar noodles so it wasn't life changing when I tried these at the restaurant. The prawns were nicely cooked, though also very over priced. Shrimp toast was rich and buttery but not very crispy...which suggests they premake it and keep it in a warmer until someone orders it. 

We also ordered the garlic rice, shaking beef, and Thit kho. I would say the shaking beef was my favorite. I have no idea how they got it to be so tender but it was definitely the highlight of the night. The other items were really not that special...again, i grew up eating all these foods so I cannot say this place has blown my taste buds. 

The restaurant itself was a cute place but the service was slow. There's valet parking available but muni stops right by there.

excerpts: Shrimp toast , wonton wrapper shrimp crisp and fresh...
shrimp toast.author: Sh J.
shrimp toast.review: Was looking forward to my favorite garlic crab at my favorite place on Valentine's Day,. First off the Appetizers were excellent! Shrimp toast , wonton wrapper shrimp crisp and fresh... Next the fried rice seafood  combo was the bomb!! Sizzling hot , fresh and flavorful... Now to the roasted garlic crab..... So disappointing!!! The crab presented was doused in pepper, lemon and butter. I was expecting GARLIC CRAB!!! The crab did not taste fresh and some of the legs had a frozenesque taste to it.... WHAT THE HECK!!!if I wanted frozen crab I could have stayed in Stockton... Sooo disappointed I informed the waiter, he apologized and said they were busy yesterday and ran out of food. What does that have to do with my crab tasting old and I fresh????  Needless to say to add more insult he offered the fabulous chocolate lava cake to make up for the lackluster 54.95 crab I had.  Unfortunately it too was a slap in the face as it was boxed cake that was microwaved and a scoop of ice cream added. Took one spoonful and wanted to spit it out!!! Was absolutely horrible and I know what it is supposed to taste like and that wasn't it!!!! I was just here 2 months ago, so what the heck happened Thanh Long???? Hmmmmm I may need to go check out PPQ !!!! Smh ruined V day!!!!

excerpts: The shrimp toast and seafood fried rice were delicious!
shrimp toast.author: Angelic L.
shrimp toast.review:
Oh my... Thanh Long sure is expensive!

I came here with some family and we spent a good chunk of money. We had two crabs, one drunken and one roasted. I definitely preferred the roasted crab over the drunken one, but both were cooked well and were fresh! The crab meat didn't stick to the shells and the shells were really easy to crack. We also had two orders of garlic noodles. Yummy! They were extremely garlic-y, which I loved, but I would have liked it a little saltier. The shrimp toast and seafood fried rice were delicious!

Overall, I really enjoyed Thanh Long, but did not like what it did to my wallet. Haha...

excerpts: As an appetizer, I ordered the shrimp toast, which was AMAZING (best part of the meal, even my friend commented on it, after trying a piece).
shrimp toast.author: Dom J.
shrimp toast.review:
I went to Thanh Long for the first time last night to celebrate a friend's birthday, and I must say that the outside doesn't do the inside's decor justice. It's a really beautiful restaurant.

The menu had what looked like so many amazing choices, but I had checked out a few Yelp reviews beforehand, and already knew I wanted to order the garlic noodles. As an appetizer, I ordered the shrimp toast, which was AMAZING (best part of the meal, even my friend commented on it, after trying a piece). The toast was a perfect blend of crispy, soft, and buttery, with chunks of shrimp integrated well.

They also had delicious plum wine.

For an entree I ordered the Thanh Long Fish (sauteed red snapper) with garlic noodles. The restaurant loses a star for the garlic noodles, which were sorely disappointing. They didn't taste bad, but definitely looked like they were the leftover noodles at the end of a long day. The fish was delicious, and a perfect compliment to the wine.

As for the service, everyone was extremely kind and accommodating. My friend and I plan to go back to try other dishes. Thumbs up, Thanh Long!

excerpts: We regret ordering appetizers: salt and pepper calamari and the shrimp toast.
The toast was very stale and made for a hard and chewy appetizer.
shrimp toast.author: Mae D.
shrimp toast.review:
Friendly hostess took my "dinner for 2" reservation over the phone.  We arrived half hour early and were able to be seated right away. 

Our server was courteous and upbeat. 

We regret ordering appetizers: salt and pepper calamari and the shrimp toast. 
The toast was very stale and made for a hard and chewy appetizer. and the calamari was nothing special.

The roast crab was very flavorful and we enjoyed every last piece. We shared 1 roast crab and 1 garlic noodle dish. and it was enough. we were very close to ordering a second round of food, but then just like that it hit us that we were full.  (But had we not ordered the appetizers, i honestly think we could have been satisfied ordering 2 crabs and maaaaybe 2 garlic noodle dishes)

so would i come back here? yes, but strictly for the crab and garlic noodles... and if i happen to just have $50 in my pocket to spend on ONE crab.

excerpts: Loved the Roasted crab, garlic noodles, steamed sea bass, shrimp toast...
the dumplings were just okay
but that's not too bad considering the amount of food we had.
We came here for a birthday and the bill came to about $80 per person.
We also tried the shaking beef and the clay pot.
Service was great, food was delicious.
Our party and the birthday girl were very happy!
shrimp toast.author: Jennifer B.
shrimp toast.review:
YUMMY! 

Lives up to the hype.  Loved the Roasted crab, garlic noodles, steamed sea bass, shrimp toast...the dumplings were just okay but that's not too bad considering the amount of food we had. We came here for a birthday and the bill came to about $80 per person.  We also tried the shaking beef and the clay pot.  Service was great, food was delicious.  Our party and the birthday girl were very happy!

excerpts: I absolutely love the shrimp toast and fried calamari!
shrimp toast.author: Mary S.
shrimp toast.review: Delicious food & cool ambiance.  Everyone loves the garlic noodles but there are many tasty dishes.  I absolutely love the shrimp toast and fried calamari!

excerpts: The second time we had both dishes again and splurged and got the shrimp toast appetizer.
Again an amazing meal.
While we enjoyed the mussels, it was not our first choice as they were out of the shrimp toast.
They were also out of Jasmin tea (??).
Not sure how you run out of tea.
The service was very good.
Or waiter was patient (maybe because he had to tell us they were out of items was wanted) and they cleared empty dishes quickly from the table.
The water service was prompt (maybe because we weren't drinking tea).
We want to chalk it up to going on a Tuesday night, but that's not a good excuse for running out of items or over cooked crab at market prices.
shrimp toast.author: Ren A.
shrimp toast.review: This visit was our third.  The first time tasting the roast crab and garlic noodles was amazing.  The second time we had both dishes again and splurged and got the shrimp toast appetizer.  Again an amazing meal.  The third time we ordered roast crab, garlic noodles, shaken beef and mussels.  The garlic noodles were great as were the mussels.  The roast crab however was completely disappointing.  It tasted over cooked and very rubbery, as if it was sitting in the pot too long.  While we enjoyed the mussels, it was not our first choice as they were out of the shrimp toast.  They were also out of Jasmin tea (??).  Not sure how you run out of tea.  The service was very good.  Or waiter was patient (maybe because he had to tell us they were out of items was wanted) and they cleared empty dishes quickly from the table.  The water service was prompt (maybe because we weren't drinking tea).  We want to chalk it up to going on a Tuesday night, but that's not a good excuse for running out of items or over cooked crab at market prices.

excerpts: It was the shrimp toast.
We made a reservation and were seated right away.
I do suggest arriving early.
Parking is very hard.
They do have valet for additional 12$.
It is a bit pricey but the food is well worth it!!
shrimp toast.author: Felicia W.
shrimp toast.review: April 18th was my first visit to Thanh Long!! My husband surprised me for our wedding anniversary. It was everything that everyone said it was.....AMAZING!! I had garlic noodles and the roasted crab!! The noodles were good but a bit dry. The crab was good. My husband hand the tiger prawns and fried rice. It was good. I loved our appitizer. It was the shrimp toast. We made a reservation and were seated right away. I do suggest arriving early. Parking is very hard. They do have valet for additional 12$. It is a bit pricey but the food is well worth it!!

excerpts: Other noteworthy dishes I've tried and loved: Shrimp Toast, Shaken Beef, and Colossal Royal Tiger Prawns.
shrimp toast.author: Judy C.
shrimp toast.review:
My all-time favorite San Francisco restaurant is situated right here in Outer Sunset.  Thang Long, known for their French-inspired Vietnamese cuisine, serves some of the BEST garlic crabs and BEST garlic noodles.

Once in awhile I get to splurge here, and luckily for my birthday -- my thoughtful friends brought me here to celebrate.  Together, we shared:

* Salmon Carpaccio: My favorite appetizer from Thanh Long!  The lemon-cured salmon was perfectly marinated and not at all "fishy."
* Salt & Pepper Calamari: Calamari usually all tastes the same at different restaurants.  However, here, they go easy on the batter and oil to give an overall light taste.
* Mango Salad: This is was my least favorite dish.  Warm mango slices and seafood on top of cold salad is not appetizing whatsoever. 
* Roast Crab & Garlic Noodles: If you love overdosing on garlic and butter, you will love the crab and garlic noodles here.  Their infamous secret sauce really makes Thanh Long what they are. 

Other noteworthy dishes I've tried and loved: Shrimp Toast, Shaken Beef, and Colossal Royal Tiger Prawns. 

Love, love, love.

excerpts: The best bite of the night was the weird shrimp toast.
If you're an East Coaster, this is NOT what you expect when you order shrimp toast.
This was on a round baguette slice!
But hey, it tasted like it should, so that worked for me.
shrimp toast.author: Karen Z.
shrimp toast.review:
Never again. Icky garlic noodles. WHAT is the hubbub about? They're gross. Not a word I use much. But I said it: gross. And they absolutely RUINED a crab. I wanted decent crab, but they put, literally, about half a tablespoon of PEPPER on a CRAB. WTF! I'm done with this place. Also, they screwed up my side dish order (garlic bread) and brought it as an appetizer. So we had to order a second platter. The best bite of the night was the weird shrimp toast. If you're an East Coaster, this is NOT what you expect when you order shrimp toast. This was on a round baguette slice! But hey, it tasted like it should, so that worked for me. =) Interesting dessert cocktails.

Parking wasn't too bad, AND they have valet.

excerpts: My family and I enjoy eating at Thanh Long, we start off with crab puffs ,shrimp toast and the house fried rice, then we finish out with a crab and garlic noddles...
we love the atmosphere ,customer service and cleanliness....
We go back and forward to Thanh Long and their sister restaurant...
we visit at least 20 times a year and never disappointed...
shrimp toast.author: Shannon H.
shrimp toast.review:
My family and I enjoy eating at Thanh Long, we start off with crab puffs ,shrimp toast and the house fried rice, then we finish out with a crab and garlic noddles...we love the atmosphere ,customer service and cleanliness....We go back and forward to Thanh Long and their sister restaurant...we visit at least 20 times a year and never disappointed...We drive from Tracy to San Francisco and it's worth the drive....

Enjoyable

excerpts: We got Shrimp toast, salt and pepper calamari, two drunken crab, and a couple of orders of garlic noodles.
The drunken crab are simmered in Chardonnay, Sake, Brandy and seasoned with scallions, chives and black pepper.
shrimp toast.author: Mike K.
shrimp toast.review:
Ok so my brother and his friend from the East Coast were in town visiting and looking for a place specific to SF. I had been to PPQ and had gotten high recommendations for Thanh Long's crab and garlic noodles. The food did not disappoint!

We got Shrimp toast, salt and pepper calamari, two drunken crab, and a couple of orders of garlic noodles. As others have mentioned I wouldn't recommend this for a first date as it's pretty messy and full of garlic!

The drunken crab are simmered in Chardonnay, Sake, Brandy and seasoned with scallions, chives and black pepper. They were absolutely delicious and went perfectly with the garlic noodles. I'd highly recommend Thanh Long. It's worth the drive and cheaper than crustacean.

excerpts: The shrimp toast was DEFINITELY reheated and served hours later....yuck!
And what should be the a great prelude to the grab, coconut shrimp, was stale as a dead bug.
UH!
I will never come here again.
I used to frequent this place a plenty, but after last nite....
it's over!
You're all washed up..close shop please!
shrimp toast.author: Elle L.
shrimp toast.review: OK, this place USED to be Great - now it has dwindle down to a commercial  reheat the regular dishes and serve, except for the crab! I was aghast when I ate there last nite, and to boot I could have had a better meal at McD's, at least it would have been when I ordered it! Argh! How do these people stay in business? The garlic noodles were dry with little taste. The shrimp toast was DEFINITELY reheated and served hours later....yuck! And what should be the a great prelude to the grab, coconut shrimp, was stale as a dead bug.  UH! I will never come here again. I used to frequent this place a plenty, but after last nite....it's over! You're all washed up..close shop please!

excerpts: Began the meal with two starters:  the seafood dumplings and the shrimp toast.
The dumplings: pleasant, light, delicate.
More a tease than filling, but a nice tease.
The shrimp toast:
wow.
I've had countless versions as an former ny-er
but this was a whole new trip.
shrimp toast.author: John Z.
shrimp toast.review:
File this review under the "interesting" or "odd" folders at your discretion ... but I may be the only reviewer of Thanh Long who didn't have the crab or garlic noodles. 

All the more reason to go back. The place is great, the meal the most memorable I've had in months.

To begin with: a full bar, which was nice for us martini-files. Began the meal with two starters:  the seafood dumplings and the shrimp toast. The dumplings: pleasant, light, delicate. More a tease than filling, but a nice tease.  The shrimp toast:  wow.  I've had countless versions as an former ny-er but this was a whole new trip. Lighter but still flavorful -- on slices of biegnet, a nice tip of the hat to the French influence of Vietnamese food.

Then the main meal: Shaken beef, tender and succulent in its not-too-sweet sauce with a surprisingly perfect compliment of potatoes. Spicy eggplant, just spicy/savory enough to let the eggplant shine through.  Seasonal vegetables: mostly sugar snap peas, lots of mushrooms, absolutely wonderful. Now mind you I don't like mushrooms as a rule but I would have been happy to scarf these down anytime. Garlic rice: just pungent enough, wonderfully textured and sticky, enhanced all the other dishes.

Yes a little on the pricey side... and valet service is ten bucks, not five (thankfully we got street parking). Service was gentle and professional.

I relished every bite and look forward to returning to see about those crabs and garlic noodles.

excerpts: Price was pretty steep for the food we ordered - shrimp toast, shaken beef, roast crab, drunken crab, and garlic noodles.
To be honest, all the food didn't stand out for the price we pay - it wasn't bad, but it wasn't that good etiher.
For the wait and price, I should have gone to somewhere else.
shrimp toast.author: edgard k.
shrimp toast.review: Went there since few friends raved about how good the garlic noodles. Went around dinner time without reservations and our party had to wait for about 45 minutes before being seated. No private parking lot, so parking can be hectic - but might as well go around looking for parking while dropping 1 of your party to book a spot if you don't have any reservations since you have to wait for a while anyway. Price was pretty steep for the food we ordered - shrimp toast, shaken beef, roast crab, drunken crab, and garlic noodles. To be honest, all the food didn't stand out for the price we pay - it wasn't bad, but it wasn't that good etiher. For the wait and price, I should have gone to somewhere else.

excerpts: Their version of shrimp toast was good, but too pricey for the serving size.
shrimp toast.author: John R.
shrimp toast.review:
We came here for my birthday dinner and had a great experience...as have so many others!

We had the requisite and excellent garlic noodles and roast crab.  We decided to split a couple of appetizers, rather than getting a second crab or more noodles.  The seafood dumplings were fine but really forgettable.  Their version of shrimp toast was good, but too pricey for the serving size.  Next time we'll go for the extra crab!

And if you like wine with your dinner, try a riesling --- we had a delicious Alsatian riesling and it went great with the food!

excerpts: the shrimp toast was okay I would have rather spent the money that I did on those on more garlic noodles.
shrimp toast.author: Katie M.
shrimp toast.review:
Best garlic noodle ever!
omg its soo good. totally worth the $10. a must order.

Roasted crab it was good but it wasn't as good as the hype that my friend built  up for me.

royal prawns were pretty good. I liked it more than the crab.

the mussels were really good too, my friend liked it so much she ordered another plate right away.

the shrimp toast was okay I would have rather spent the money that I did on those on more garlic noodles.

The wait can be really long without reservations so call ahead. Service was good.

excerpts: I also liked their shrimp toast, as an appetizer but the calamari was forgettable.
shrimp toast.author: Dorothy F.
shrimp toast.review:
Long been a fan of their sister restaurant Crustaceans so I was eager to see what the differences were, if any, between the two places.  

Turns out there's quite a few.  

Thanh long is vey, very crowded and the waiting area is cramped to say the least.  It's also very loud and chaotic.  Feels more like a neighborhood eating joint with the cramped tables and noisy atmosphere.  

The service was kinda lacking.  I think the amount of patrons coming in and out ( and yes you do feel rushed) makes it hard for the servers to give you the same level of attentiveness you'd get at Crustanceans.  

As for the crab, somewhat disappointing.  It was still good but right off the bat I noticed mine was room temperature.  Unlike Crustaceans at Thanh Long the crab comes out of the kitchen in record time.   All night servers came out literally by the second, with the roast crab.  With as fast as they were bringing it out, it's easy to assume they were cooked before you ordered it. 

The garlic noodles were great though, not overly greasy and great garlic flavor and portion.  I also liked their shrimp toast, as an appetizer but the calamari was forgettable.  

The main disappointment was in their dessert selection.  I was undecided and the waitress suggested I try the fried banana, which of course every other Asian restaurant offers.  At Thanh Long was probably the worst (and I've never had a fried banana I didn't like).  The banana- to-dough ratio was waaayyy off.  Too much dough.  I ate more of the ice cream because I could barely eat two bites of the fried banana.  

Now that I've tried it there, I won't be going back.  Not a horrible experience but dims in comparison to Crustaceans.

excerpts: We ordered the Shrimp Toast (fabulous...you can actually taste the shrimp and its rich), Garlic Noodles (don't need to say much.. everyone knows how good it tastes), Drunken Crab (also another favorite of most patrons who come here),  and the Shaken Beef (DELICIOUS!!!
It was so tender and juicy
shrimp toast.author: Linda X.
shrimp toast.review:
Okay.. this is fresh off the press. I just got home from dinner at Thanh Long. I brought my bf here for his birthday dinner. We ordered the Shrimp Toast (fabulous...you can actually taste the shrimp and its rich), Garlic Noodles (don't need to say much.. everyone knows how good it tastes), Drunken Crab (also another favorite of most patrons who come here),  and the Shaken Beef (DELICIOUS!!! It was so tender and juicy and the potatoes were great). 

Last but not least... our dessert (I'm not sure how I found enough room to cram all that good food into my tummy but I did haha) Creme Brulee (flavor of the day Green Tea) which I have to admit amazed me.. I wasn't sure what to expect but it was creamy with a hint of green tea. I don't know how they managed to capture the green tea taste in this creamy dessert but they did and they did an excellent job of it as well. 

Ahhh -pats my tummy- delicious. 

**Side note: I happen to be allergic to shellfish (crab, lobster, shrimp, etc.) So needless to say even knowing I'd break out in hives it was totally worth it because now I'm sitting at home hiding from people but completely satisfied with my dinner. -big sigh-

excerpts: I ordered the Shrimp Toast for an appetizer.
It wasn't bad
but I wouldn;t get it again.
I just wasn;t thrilled with it..
hmmmm, maybe too much breading, not enough shrimp?
shrimp toast.author: Christine C.
shrimp toast.review:
This place is awesome! The heading says reservations required but I have just walked in before. Depending on the time, you may have to wait  a little while but I've always gotten seated. They make some delicious fruit infused vodka that is wonderful to sip on while waiting at their bar. The wait area is small and can get quite crowded. Garlic Crab and Garlic Noodles are a MUST! Their Vietnamese Seafood Soup, in a light sweet broth is WONDERFUL too! Appetizers have been delicious.. I don;t think I've had anything here I didn;t like! Can be a bit pricey but so worth it. If you are not a garlic fan, do not go here. Garlic is a staple.. and it is fabulous!

6/9/07: One update.. last time I was here I ordered the Shrimp Toast for an appetizer. It wasn't bad but I wouldn;t get it again. I just wasn;t thrilled with it..hmmmm, maybe too much breading, not enough shrimp?

excerpts: We ordered our usual appetizers: mussels and the shrimp toast.
Mussels were great.
The Shrimp Toast was garbage.
shrimp toast.author: Stella M.
shrimp toast.review:
What happened to this place??? I've definitely experienced better at this place.

For years our family and friends enjoyed coming here. We have our regular dishes that we always order and have never been let down...year after year.

Recently, we came for dinner mid-week, anticipating the same great experience and meal we usually get but had  a very rude awakening. 

First, we witnessed the male host/manager (whom we never seen before) treat a customer very rudely. A pregnant lady had let the male host know that they had a reservation and provided the name. He looked up the name and asked if she had a reservation, she said "yes". And he asked again, she said the name, he affirmed the name and asked AGAIN if they had a reservation. She again replied "yes". It was so bizarre that I was tempted to intervene and maybe help the host understand that she said "yes, she has a reservation". We were at the bar and could clearly hear him asking the same question over and over. And she was clearly saying yes they have a reservation under the name he said. Then he told her to wait until her husband showed up. WTF. Strange that he didn't just seat them. The place was not crowded nor was there anyone waiting to be seated. He definitely lacked basic customer service skills. And the owner should be ashamed that their host yelled a pregnant lady who was just wanting to be seated. 

That was them. Now us...
Service was decent. It was not busy at all so we got our food quickly.
We ordered our usual appetizers: mussels and the shrimp toast. Mussels were great. The Shrimp Toast was garbage. Toast was not toasted and the shrimp was like rubber. 

Main course: Roasted crabs for everyone. The crabs were dry and the flavor was slightly off. All of us felt the same disappointment with our crab. Not the juicy succulent crabs they used to have. Could it be it was out of season? But that never affected the quality of their crabs in past years.

Garlic Noodles: This is always a winner, except for this day. The noodles used to be flavorful, tasty and long. The noodles we got were shorter than usual (or cut up) and the flavor was not evenly distributed. It's like the noodles weren't mixed thoroughly and the sauce was missing something. Never in my wildest dreams would I expect them to mess up their signature Garlic Noodles. Another WTF moment. 

It was a night of disappointments. I'm so sorry we had come out of our way to go here for dinner. The front was as poorly managed as the kitchen. Hopefully they bring back the former GM or change the one there last night. This place used to be a special place for us but I am hesitant to go back any time soon.

excerpts: We have ordered three appetizers: crab puffs, buddha spring role and shrimp toast.
All of them charge at least  $7.95+ , but I was so surprise when the waiter delivered us the plates, the buddha rice role has only one thin veggie rice role and cut into four pieces, for 8 bucks?
this is insane, the crab puffs plate came with 6 fortune cookies with crab paste.
And the shrimp toast came with 5 slices of shrimp pate over bacquets.

We also ordered roasted crab which is market price on the menu, the crab tasted pretty good, but it wasn't difficult dish to make, after all it is only roasted with salt, black pepper and butter, and it is about 1.5 lb, the restaurant charged us $37.95, consider a live crab from supermarket is $4 a lb, they are charging 6x market price, but the decoration and ambience of this place is that high-end.
shrimp toast.author: Daniel H.
shrimp toast.review: We went to this place because of the good reviews, I think I really should have paid attention to the negative reviews. In short, the flavors of the food are pretty good, the price of the dishes are comparable to the high-end Chinese restaurant but the portion are ridiculously small. We have ordered three appetizers: crab puffs, buddha spring role and shrimp toast. All of them charge at least  $7.95+ , but I was so surprise when the waiter delivered us the plates, the buddha rice role has only one thin veggie rice role and cut into four pieces, for 8 bucks? this is insane, the crab puffs plate came with 6 fortune cookies with crab paste. And the shrimp toast came with 5 slices of shrimp pate over bacquets.  We also ordered roasted crab which is market price on the menu, the crab tasted pretty good, but it wasn't difficult dish to make, after all it is only roasted with salt, black pepper and butter, and it is about 1.5 lb, the restaurant charged us $37.95, consider a live crab from supermarket is $4 a lb, they are charging 6x market price, but the decoration and ambience of this place is that high-end. The Shaken beef has pretty good flavor, but with $21.95, similar dish from R&G lounge will come double the portion, and R&G lounge is considered high-end and expensive. The Garlic noodle is very so so, the noodle itself was overcooked and kind of sticky. All in all, this is an overpriced restaurant with slightly above average food.

excerpts: Anyway, our party also ordered the tamarind crab, asparagus soup, shrimp toast and either the Saigon beef or the shaken beef, I can't remember.
Those were ok.
I would not order the tamarind crab or the asparagus soup again though.
The beef was super tender and delicious, but it lacks some flavor.
I would not order the tamarind crab or the asparagus soup again though.
The beef was super tender and delicious, but it lacks some flavor.
It doesn't really taste like shaken beef.
I've had the marinade better at other places, but the tenderness here beats them all!!!
I'd definitely come back here and recommend this place to my friends.
It's better than the generic Asian foods in Chinatown!
shrimp toast.author: Truc N.
shrimp toast.review: Came here the other night for dinner and I was pretty impressed.  You wouldn't expect a restaurant like this to be located in this area.  I hope all the local San Franciscans know about this place and how good it is.  I really enjoyed the garlic noodles, salmon carpaccio, and the Lychee Martini!  I could drink like 100 of those!!!  It's sooo good!  Anyway, our party also ordered the tamarind crab, asparagus soup, shrimp toast and either the Saigon beef or the shaken beef, I can't remember.  Those were ok.  I would not order the tamarind crab or the asparagus soup again though.  The beef was super tender and delicious, but it lacks some flavor.  It doesn't really taste like shaken beef.  I've had the marinade better at other places, but the tenderness here beats them all!!!  I'd definitely come back here and recommend this place to my friends.  It's better than the generic Asian foods in Chinatown!

excerpts: If you're a fan of egg rolls (they called it crispy rice paper roll) then don't order this...
I've had better.
rice paper roll.author: Trang L.
rice paper roll.review: Love that I was able to make a quick reservation over yelp. Super convenient. I thought the food was meh... not too special. If you're a fan of egg rolls (they called it crispy rice paper roll) then don't order this... I've had better. I also did not think the roasted crab was worth $60... garlic noodles was pretty simple, almost too simple. The food overall didn't hit the spot for me, I was honestly excited about this place. Felt like I over paid for not so authentic Vietnamese food. Our server was very on top of checking in on us. I like the fact that they had  valet so I don't have to circle around looking for parking... but I had an SUV so instead of paying $13 I've had to pay $20... that's a big difference. Not cool...

excerpts: Crispy Rice Paper Roll (too dry for me
, I wouldn't order this again)
rice paper roll.author: Amy D.
rice paper roll.review:
Came in a group of 6 on a Saturday night, so we got to try a lot of dishes. Making reservations is definitely recommended, and parking in this area is tough- the $10 for valet is well spent. 

Ordered-
Salt & Pepper Calamari (nice and peppery, but calamari could've been a bit more crisp)
Dungeness Crab Puffs (good, but def not authentic)
Seafood Dumplings (only ok and 5 pieces- wouldn't recommend for the price)
Crispy Rice Paper Roll (too dry for me, I wouldn't order this again)
Curry Lotus Prawns (good taste but the "jumbo prawns" were teeny!)
Shaken Beef (really good flavor, imo better than at the Slanted Door and cheaper. however, they mix in potatoes pieces to trick you into thinking there is more meat)
Roast Crab (good, but wasn't super flavorful)
Tamarind Crab (wasn't very flavorful, but both crabs were cooked perfectly)
Garlic Noodles (good, but could've been more garlicky)
Fried Rice with Shrimp (your standard fried rice, I wouldn't order again)
Fried Banana & Fried Ice Cream (both were good but I like the banana a lot more)

Overall, the dinner was good, but not amazing. I actually liked the crab I ordered at Three Seasons better (taste wise). My favorite dishes were the shaken beef and garlic noodles, but this restaurant is worth a try for the crab. We paid $57pp including tax and tip, which isn't bad at all, but we didn't get that much crab.

excerpts:
start off with the Coconut Prawns = the bomb
soft shelled crab, mussels, crispy rice paper roll = the bomb.
rice paper roll.author: Nic C.
rice paper roll.review:
U BETTER BELIEVE IT!!!!!
I love this place, have been here ALOT.  
this is the bomb, the food and the ambiance is EXCELLENT.  The service is EXCELLENT.  Parking is not the best, but once you get inside you forget u drove around for 10-15 minutes looking for a spot, unless you valet.

start off with the Coconut Prawns = the bomb
soft shelled crab, mussels, crispy rice paper roll = the bomb.
garlic noodles = the bomb
ROASTED CRAB = THE SUPER BOMB
ROYAL TIGER PRAWNS = the bomb

This is a must go to place before you die.  THE END

excerpts:
We were seated immediately, and looked over the menu, and ordered the following:

Crispy Rice Paper Roll ($7.50) - your standard Vietnamese Egg Roll.
rice paper roll.author: Daniel M.
rice paper roll.review:
I've been here before and I thought it was great (and still do!), but after eating at Crustaceans, Thanh Long only gets 4 stars...

Took my parents and Anhie T. here for Chinese New Years dinner, and reservations were made at 8.30, but at 7.15 we were able to move it up to 7.45 with no problems.  We got there, and it was pretty empty...with maybe 20 diners at about 5-6 different tables.  Barren compared to when Anhie T. and I came about 2 yrs ago.  We were seated immediately, and looked over the menu, and ordered the following:

Crispy Rice Paper Roll ($7.50) - your standard Vietnamese Egg Roll.  But here you get once egg roll cut into four pieces.
Thanh Long Mussells ($10.95) - five mussells served with five slices of thin garlic bread.  This dish was delicious.
Steamed Sea Bass ($24.95) - sea bass was flaky, moist, and really good.  The sauce was sweet and gingery.
Stuffed Calamari ($15.95) - lots of calamari stuffed with minced meat in a tomato based sauce.  Parents didn't like it so much, but I thought it was okay.
Shaken Beef ($20.95) - very flavorful, and a dish that everyone loved.  The beef was tender and potatoes were flavorful.
Garlic Noodles (2 orders at $9.50 ea) - Garlicky and delicious! 
Roast Crab (I think it was $38) - really good crab...but compared to Crustaceans, it's not the same.  Not as flavorful, but still very, very good nonetheless. 
Creme Brulee (2 orders) - My dad and Anhie T. thought this was the best dessert dish.
Banana Cake - I liked this dish and everyone else didn't like it.  Served with a scoop of Vanilla ice cream, a dallop of whip cream, this cake seemed to be made out of only bananas.  Anhie T. said it was bland.  I disagree.
Hot Chocolate Cake - served with Vanilla ice cream...this was good.  Really rich though.
Coke (2 glasses) - served from their bar in a tall, slim glass.  No free refills.

Total bill with tax + tip came out to $218.

This was my parents first time here and they loved the crab, and garlic noodles.  They did say it was a bit oily, but c'mon, roasted crab and garlic noodles anywhere is a bit oily.  But here's a good sign.  As they left, they took some business cards.  That means they liked their food and they'll be back...probably with some family friends!

Depending on my the mood (and thickness of the wallet), I would come back.  

But other substitutions are very comparable:  PPQ is cheaper and quality isn't far behind, while Crustacean is a tad more expensive, but swankier....

Tip 'o the day:  Avoid the valet parking outside.  Parking isn't too difficult in the Sunset.  And even if you had to walk one block after dinner, it may clear up your arteries after all the butter used in cooking the crab!

excerpts:
We ordered the
- dungeness crab puffs for starters.
Absolutely delicious.
Really hot in temperate so be careful!
The cheese and sweet & sour dippig sauces were phenomenal.
Just the right amount of puffs (4) so we dont get too full, as well as a good amount of stuffing inside the soft shelled puffs.
- garlic noodle with prawns on top.
Delicious and nicely seasoned prawns.
No fishy taste.
Garlic noodle has butter and "secret spices" that were great!
dungeness crab puffs.author: Angel N.
dungeness crab puffs.review:
Parking is so hard to find in this area and I also dont trust any valet. Luckily, on our 4th loop around Judah, we found a parking spot right in front of the corner store across from 711.

Wait took about 15 minutes when they said could be about 30. Theyve got chairs and a couch for you to sit and wait.

Now, the food... every single plate was delicious. This is coming from a vegan who sometimes cheats and eats seafood and dairy. We ordered the
- dungeness crab puffs for starters. Absolutely delicious. Really hot in temperate so be careful! The cheese and sweet & sour dippig sauces were phenomenal. Just the right amount of puffs (4) so we dont get too full, as well as a good amount of stuffing inside the soft shelled puffs.
- garlic noodle with prawns on top. Delicious and nicely seasoned prawns. No fishy taste. Garlic noodle has butter and "secret spices" that were great! I often taste garlic noodles that are super oily and bland but this was definitely not it. It tasted very flavorful and I ate every bit of it. Good size for 2 adults. I'm glad we shared it and didnt get separate plates.
- my favorite - dessert! We ordered the chocolate lava cake and I'm so glad we did. The brownie is baked to perfection: crispy on the ends and soft and crumbly in the inside topped with vanilla ice cream and whipped cream. I seriously took this plate from my bf and ate the whole thing myself lol

Bill came out to $88 before tip. We ordered a garlic noodle togo and it retained a great taste even when eating it the day after. Bf also ordered 2 lemonades.

Service was ok, nothing spectacular but we werent frustrated having to flag down the waitress.

Bathrooms are tucked in the back. Poor men - yall only have 1 stall and a line can form pretty quick. Us ladies have an actual bathroom with 3 stalls, one big mirror and one sink. Pretty clean.

Despite the parking being an issue and living far, I would give this place a 5 star!

excerpts: We had the salmon carpaccio, and dungeness crab puffs to start.
Both were very yummy but the salmon carpaccio was my favorite dish of the whole night.
Perfectly seasoned and very light.
dungeness crab puffs.author: Joanne L.
dungeness crab puffs.review:
I've heard so many good things about Thanh Long so it's been on my list of places to try for a very long time. 

Called in around 8:30 on Friday night to make reservations because I knew there would probably be a wait, super last minute but worth the try! Luckily they had an opening at 9:30 so we took it. Once we arrived we immediately got seated. 

I know they're known for their crabs, but my friend and I didn't feel like getting our hands dirty so we opted for their other dishes. We had the salmon carpaccio, and dungeness crab puffs to start. Both were very yummy but the salmon carpaccio was my favorite dish of the whole night. Perfectly seasoned and very light. We then had the shaken beef and colossal royal tiger prawns. Again, both were so flavorful and good. The shaken beef was tender and the potatoes and bed of lettuce was a nice touch. The tiger prawns comes with a bed of their garlic noodles. Personally it wasn't the best I ever had but it was still good. 

Service was top notch. We ordered a bottle of wine and they were always making sure our glasses weren't empty. I'll definitely be back to try their crabs soon.

excerpts: Dungeness Crab Puffs (4/5).
These were 6, small, perfectly deep fried, wonton-skin wrapped pillows of Dungeness crab filling that were so much better than the typical Crab Rangoon's that you might have had elsewhere.
They came with two dipping sauces, the better one was the sweet mustard.
dungeness crab puffs.author: Glenn H.
dungeness crab puffs.review:
4.5 stars. Minus a half a star for the value of some of the items but overall a terrific night out.

This is a prize of a place. Comfortable setting, great service, excellent quality food and, while maybe spend-y, is worth a look.

For our New Years eve dinner there we four had reservations (needed given the size of the place) at 8 PM. We started the night with two appetizers:

1. Tempura Style Coconut Prawns (3/5). These were not so much the Japanese style tempura (corn starch batter) that you might have had but more coconut shaving encrusted large prawns. There were 5 and were good but, if I had to go again, not a must have.

2. Dungeness Crab Puffs (4/5). These were 6, small, perfectly deep fried, wonton-skin wrapped pillows of Dungeness crab filling that were so much better than the typical Crab Rangoon's that you might have had elsewhere. They came with two dipping sauces, the better one was the sweet mustard. This was a nice, if pricey, treat and a good start to the entrees. 

Four entrees:

1. Roasted Crab (4/5): this smelled wonderful as it came out and was a large, already cut up Dungeness crab, with the carapace shell. It was meaty and perfectly done with the garlic sauce. Really glad we tried this. I like crab but it isn't a must have for me. My table-mates really like it. Market price was almost $40 each.

2. Shaken Beef (5/5): very tender tasty cubes of beef (not well done, if that's important to you) that was marinated in a lightly sweet sauce, served with potato cubes that had also been marinated in the same dark sauce and grilled; all of this served over tender bay greens. Delicious! Everyone liked this dish. The Rice and Roll's Hunan Grilled Butter Beef was very comparable (and less expensive) than this dish but this was still a winning dish. And I need to mention the tender-crisp cuts of sweet Vidalia (that's my guess) onions that were served with this dish, they were great in their own right and really added dimension to the beef.

3. Seafood Combination (Scallops, prawns, Dungeness crab) Fried rice (6/5): if there was one dish that stood out from all of them, it was this dish. A simple, (even unimpressive) looking fried rice dish that just blew people away with its wok-seared taste and awesome flavors. Fried rice, yes. But extraordinary? For a mere $16 Absolutely!

4. Colossal Royal Tiger Prawns (5/5): 4 large butterflied and perfectly grilled in the shell prawns that were served over a bed of their famously delicious garlic noodles. Yeah this was a splurge, at almost $10 a prawn, this was expensive but very (very) good and to be served over the deservedly vaunted garlic noodles, this was a plus. We didn't have to order the Garlic Noodles as an entree because of this, and the waiter was smart enough to understand this by ignoring our order for these Prawns PLUS a Garlic Noodle order. The prawns did have a tendency to stick to their shells, but they were perfectly done and marinated in some fantastic sauce to make them outstanding.

The Garlic noodles had the perfect consistency of Yee Noodles, http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yi_mein, which gives them an extra nice bite and appear to absorb the flavors better. They are also pricey. The Garlic Noodles by themselves were $9.50 an order, which seems a bit high for lo mein noodles and garlic, but if they are Yee noodles, they would be more fairly priced. Everyone at the table loved these. 

Three deserts: 

Creme Brulee (3/5): this was an OK rendition of Creme Brulee, not bad but not up to the standards of the rest of the meal. Nothing really special.

Chocolate Lava Cake (5/5): Oh yeah! This chocolate delight was the size of a very small hockey puck served with a large scoop of vanilla ice cream over a pool of Grand Marnier & melted vanilla ice cream. It was pricey ($9) but oh so very wonderful to have that rich oozing chocolate goodness.

Fried Banana Fritters a la Mode. (5/5): 2 fritters (your choice of pineapple or banana) served with that same scoop of dense vanilla ice cream. Love, Love, Love this simple but wonderful desert.

It was almost a perfect amount of food for 4 with each of us full to the neck and almost giddy from the great food experience.

While the restaurant was crowded, it never seemed loud or noisy and the service was spot-on: unobtrusive, available, and very polite.

With tip we were at about $50 per person without drinks (which included one modestly iced tea for $2.50).

Loved it and would eagerly go again for a special occasion!

excerpts: Loved the Dungeness crab puffs.
dungeness crab puffs.author: Syreeta H.
dungeness crab puffs.review: Roasted crab was amazing. Loved the Dungeness crab puffs. Colossal prawns and garlic noodles were delicious and the bartender is awesome. I never would have thought from looking at the outside

excerpts:
Tasty 
Dungeness crab puffs:
$11 Very good but portion size was smaller than I expected.
Orange Sorbet:
$8 Old and texture was weird (probably, it was kept in a freezer for more than half year).
Very disappointed.
Fried Banana & Pineapple: $8 each  Awesome!
dungeness crab puffs.author: apple p.
dungeness crab puffs.review:
Food:
Roast/Dranken Crab: $54 each.  This was a lot more expensive than last time I went.  Liked Roast better but greasy.  
Shaken Beef: $25  Tasty 
Dungeness crab puffs: $11 Very good but portion size was smaller than I expected.
Orange Sorbet: $8 Old and texture was weird (probably, it was kept in a freezer for more than half year).  Very disappointed.  
Fried Banana & Pineapple: $8 each  Awesome!  The batter was good : )

Interior:
Wait area couch: Nasty
Entrance door: Made a loud noise every time when closed.
Table: Okay
Bathroom: Good

I probably won't go back there for a while.

excerpts:
Dungeness Crab Puffs (good, but def not authentic)
Seafood Dumplings (only ok and 5 pieces- wouldn't recommend for the price)
dungeness crab puffs.author: Amy D.
dungeness crab puffs.review:
Came in a group of 6 on a Saturday night, so we got to try a lot of dishes. Making reservations is definitely recommended, and parking in this area is tough- the $10 for valet is well spent. 

Ordered-
Salt & Pepper Calamari (nice and peppery, but calamari could've been a bit more crisp)
Dungeness Crab Puffs (good, but def not authentic)
Seafood Dumplings (only ok and 5 pieces- wouldn't recommend for the price)
Crispy Rice Paper Roll (too dry for me, I wouldn't order this again)
Curry Lotus Prawns (good taste but the "jumbo prawns" were teeny!)
Shaken Beef (really good flavor, imo better than at the Slanted Door and cheaper. however, they mix in potatoes pieces to trick you into thinking there is more meat)
Roast Crab (good, but wasn't super flavorful)
Tamarind Crab (wasn't very flavorful, but both crabs were cooked perfectly)
Garlic Noodles (good, but could've been more garlicky)
Fried Rice with Shrimp (your standard fried rice, I wouldn't order again)
Fried Banana & Fried Ice Cream (both were good but I like the banana a lot more)

Overall, the dinner was good, but not amazing. I actually liked the crab I ordered at Three Seasons better (taste wise). My favorite dishes were the shaken beef and garlic noodles, but this restaurant is worth a try for the crab. We paid $57pp including tax and tip, which isn't bad at all, but we didn't get that much crab.

excerpts: The Dungeness crab puffs were like crab rangoons on crack, filled with delicious herb cheese and a large quantity of crab, only limited by their size.
dungeness crab puffs.author: Gene C.
dungeness crab puffs.review:
I came here with a friend from out of town looking for a competitor to PPQ Dungeness Island. The restaurant is situated in a fairly residential area, but then again, I guess most restaurants in the Sunset/Richmond area qualify.  The restaurant's layout is a little interesting, as the back portion of the restaurant was walled off leaving a nook for 6 tables and gave the restaurant a closed-off feel.  The frozen cocktail my friend ordered was mostly sweet without much alcohol, disappointing even for her.

The jumbo prawn wontons are not jumbo by any account (granted, I had eaten at Anchor Oyster Bar earlier that day, so my sense of proportion may be completely skewed), and you can barely taste the pancetta at all, a very forgettable dish.  The Buddha roll, on the other hand, was like a slight variation on a traditional Vietnamese spring roll filled with tasty daikon and black mushrooms to give it a more earthy flavor.  The Dungeness crab puffs were like crab rangoons on crack, filled with delicious herb cheese and a large quantity of crab, only limited by their size.

The garlic noodles here have somewhat more of a bite and stronger garlic flavor compared to PPQ Dungeness Island. However, I have to say the crab, albeit meatier, was not nearly as flavorful.  We ordered the roast crab which, although mildly peppery and actually with a good amount of sweet meat, otherwise was not as heavily seasoned.  Strangely enough, our crab was actually a little cool by the time it got to our table.  Also, the seafood fried rice was lacking in salt.  Thankfully, they brought some chili sambal to our table upon request.  Our server was really very nice and attentive.

Overall, based on pure food comparisons, PPQ Dungeness Island wins in my book purely based on the crab's flavoring, but Thanh Long may actually serve a better crab and definitely has better garlic noodles.  If you're looking for crab on a Tuesday, this is your place... (cuz it seems everywhere else is closed!)

excerpts: Dungeness Crab Puffs - delicious - a great appetizer for a larger group, there were 6 in one serving.
dungeness crab puffs.author: Cat G.
dungeness crab puffs.review:
My brother and sisters decided to come here for Mother's Day. I called on the Thursday before to make a reservation, made it for 5:30pm on Mother's Day. Perfect. They called on Saturday to confirm, awesome. They reminded me to make sure everyone was on time because we wouldn't be sat until our entire party was there. 

Typical of our family, one of my siblings was running late - therefore they wouldn't seat us. My Mom was mad and irritated because to her it didn't make sense because we knew what they wanted to order. After practically yelling at the hostess, they still didn't seat us - I was embarassed. The hostess remained calm and tried to explain to my Mom why they wouldn't seat us. I used to work in the restaurant industry and I know why they won't sit full parties - it puts their entire reservation schedule off track - if two people of a seven party table is late, it extends their duration at the table once the two LATE people do get there, and causes the table who will be using that table next a delay, and so forth throughout the evening. 

30 minutes after our reservation time, my late sibling and her guest arrived, I kindly let the hostess know that we were finally all there, she told me that the only table available that sits 7 is currently paying and as soon as they leave, she'd be able to sit us - this was "the best that she could do at this time." - I thanked her nicely and proceeded to apologize for my mom's reaction and that I understand why they couldn't seat us. 

5 minutes later - she came to me and said that she had another table available and we could be seated right away. While following her she told me that she appreciated my apology and to enjoy my meal. 

Food: 
Dungeness Crab Puffs - delicious - a great appetizer for a larger group, there were 6 in one serving. 

Salt & Pepper Calamari - a little too much salt on this one, still good though!  Next time we'll try the Grilled Calamari 

Shaken Beef - HOLY MOLEY DELICIOUS - Meat was SO tender and so flavorful - definitely recommend this. 

Siagon Beef - Not my favorite - the rest of my family like this but unfortunately this dish did NOT please my taste buds - I felt as though maybe the ingredients were way above my appreciation but it tasted too bitter for me. 

Drunken Crab - this was delicious - a whole crab, dunked in a secret sauce of Chardonney... 

Roasted Crab - this was EVEN better than the Drunken Crab - amazing. 

Garlic Noodles - MUST HAVE AT THE TABLE. These are the staple dish of every visit, in my opinion. 

I really like this place - I've had the Garlic Noodles before on their An The Go mobile food truck. Definitely will come back here. 

PS. Parking is a pain - but they do offer Valet for $12.00 - valet guys are funny.

excerpts: The Dungeness Crab Puffs was good for a first try, but would not order again.
It actually tasted better without the accompanied sauce.
For dessert, we tried the Lemon Sorbet, that was yummy, but I hope it really is homemade!
dungeness crab puffs.author: Jennifer L.
dungeness crab puffs.review:
My good friend kept telling me how delicious this restaurant is, and do I believe him?  YES, I do!  

However, please note that the Roast Crab deserves 5 stars.  The other dishes I ordered deserve a 4 star.  Also, since there was only 2 of us, we did not get to order a large variety as I would have liked.

What we ordered:

-Dungeness Crab Puffs
-Roast Crab
-Garlic Noodles
-Lemon Sorbet 
-Jasmine Tea

MUST-TRY!  The minute the Roast Crab came, it looked amazing.  My mouth started watering as I started to eat my first bite of the crab.  What seemed like the most simple of spices - salt, pepper, garlic, butter (of course I don't know the "secret  spices" haha), made the meat perfect, not overpowering in any spice.  It might be a challenge to crack the shell, but that's the fun of eating seafood!  

On to the other dishes now,  the Garlic Noodles was so-so, it was tasty, but not all that as others have raved.  The Dungeness Crab Puffs was good for a first try, but would not order again.
