It actually tasted better without the accompanied sauce. For dessert, we tried the Lemon Sorbet, that was yummy, but I hope it really is homemade! Jasmine tea was a nice touch, but $5 for that was not worth it!

A plus for this restaurant is the customer service, all servers were attentive and provided good service.  There is even valet parking service, strange for me since I rarely see this in the Sunset neighborhood.

The only thing now is I need to go back again and try more dishes.  And, maybe it will get a 5 star.

excerpts: The delicious items we chose for our meal were the drunken crab, dungeness crab puffs, buddha roll, shaken beef, and of course their famous garlic noodles.
After tasting garlic we definitely wanted dessert and settled for their creme brulee which was very rich but satisfied our sweet tooth.
dungeness crab puffs.author: Emy B.
dungeness crab puffs.review:
I likey!  The food here is very yummy.  If you like crab this is the place to come have it, and be prepared to work at getting all the succulent meat out of the shells.  The delicious items we chose for our meal were the drunken crab, dungeness crab puffs, buddha roll, shaken beef, and of course their famous garlic noodles.  After tasting garlic we definitely wanted dessert and settled for their creme brulee which was very rich but satisfied our sweet tooth.  Next time we'll have to order their fried banana dessert with ice cream which we kept staring at on the other tables.

Parking is not easy to find, but they offer valet service for $10 if you get impatient.  Will definitely be back...yee!  If you're curious check out their website at anfamily.com, click on Thanh Long and download the menu.

excerpts: We had the Dungeness Crab Puffs, not worth it for $10.50.
I expected to be a bit bigger and more of it.
There was only 6 dinky pieces of it.
dungeness crab puffs.author: Mandy D.
dungeness crab puffs.review:
3.5 stars

I passed by here so often that I finally gave it a chance. 
We had the Dungeness Crab Puffs, not worth it for $10.50. I expected to be a bit bigger and more of it. There was only 6 dinky pieces of it. Although the cheese tasted so good inside the wonton, I wonder if there was even any crab meat in it.

We had the garlic noodles, it's yummy and I want more of it.
The stuffed calamari wasn't bad either because of the sauce.
Dessert was fried banana ice cream, I love this stuff. 

This place isn't bad overall, but it's a bit pricey for me. Service is good. It's worth a try.

excerpts: Dungeness crab puffs - I was disappointed...couldn't taste any CRAB in the fried wontons at all because it was overpowered by the cream cheese/mayo filling.
Seriously, all you tasted was the creamy filling and crunch of the wonton.
dungeness crab puffs.author: Cathe T.
dungeness crab puffs.review:
"Oh, I've died and gone to crab heaven."

So the Bf & I got here around 430 pm, not knowing that it didn't open till 5pm...so we walked around and 15 minutes later - there was a line FORMED ALREADY!?! (I was thinking, this place must be good then!)

The outside of the restaurant isn't fancy and appears slightly run-down. The inside of the restaurant, however, isn't ghetto-looking. I would have to say its table setting is above a sit-down restaurant with and below a fine-dining restaurant. The waiters come out and place the bibs on for you and they're really quick with cleaning out finished plates, re-filling your drinks, and check-up on how everything is going. AWESOME personable staff!

We started off with two items from the "Starters" list:

1) Tempura Coconut Shrimp - it was alright. You can definitely taste the coconut shavings on there, so that was good, but i wasn't WOW'ed by the overall taste. Wasn't bad, wasn't great!

2) Dungeness crab puffs - I was disappointed...couldn't taste any CRAB in the fried wontons at all because it was overpowered by the cream cheese/mayo filling. Seriously, all you tasted was the creamy filling and crunch of the wonton. Boo! 

Now on to what REALLY MATTERS!

We ordered a plate of garlic noodles and roasted crab. The garlic noodles were DELICIOUS!!!!!!!! Perfect blend of all the ingredients - garlic, Parmesan cheese, olive oil, and whatever else they have in it. I could have seriously eaten a whole plate to myself! The roasted crab ----DRROOOL! it's soooooooooo good! These two items are a definite try if you come to the restaurant. 

Next time we'll skip the starters and dig straight into the crab and garlic noodles! The tab does come out a bit pricey [about $90], but it's not like you eat crab everyday! =D (that's the only justification I can make for the prices of the dishes). I'm craving it already! *sigh!*

excerpts: We ordered a DUNGENESS CRAB PUFFS as a starter, it was very delicious dipped in peanut-mustard sauce.
dungeness crab puffs.author: Lulubear L.
dungeness crab puffs.review:
We ordered a DUNGENESS CRAB PUFFS as a starter, it was very delicious dipped in peanut-mustard sauce. 
For entree we ordered GARLIC NOODLES and TAMARIND CRAB. The garlic noodle was very good although it is a little pricey for the portion, and the tamarind crab with an open mind tasted very interesting, although not as a common favorite taste as the roasted crab, it was good and I do recommend it. 
The reason this restaurant is missing a star in book is because the parking was hard to find on the streets, and the valet costs $10.

excerpts: This included 2 beers, a grape juice spritzer, the dungeness crab puffs and soft shell crab for appetizers and for dinner the drunken crab  and the villager dish (cant remember name) it had prawns and pork and lava cake with vanilla gelato dessert.
The appetizers were average, the drunken crab was lacking in flavor,
bland...
I have had better for way cheaper.
The other prawn and pork dish had so much salt, it was barely edible.
Its been 24 hours
and I am still craving water because of the salt.
The one star is for the service which was good.
The wait staff is very friendly and accomodating.
The food showed up very fast.
Probably an indication as to why the food isnt all that great or fresh tasting.
As for the decor, for a restaurant charging these prices, the decor needs an overall.
The chairs are dirty with old food stains and need a good wiping.
the carpet looks musty and towards the back where its dark, smells a bit musty.
Will never be back.
Not worth the time or money.
I have to say the dessert was amazing.
I wanted to lick my plate, thus the 2nd star.
But i didnt go for dessert
i was there for the seafood which came up short.
dungeness crab puffs.author: RoastNBoil L.
dungeness crab puffs.review: What a rip off...I have been wanting to try this place for sometime. After trying Crustaceans I was told the food is better here. My table of 2 spent $120. This included 2 beers, a grape juice spritzer, the dungeness crab puffs and soft shell crab for appetizers and for dinner the drunken crab  and the villager dish (cant remember name) it had prawns and pork and lava cake with vanilla gelato dessert. The appetizers were average, the drunken crab was lacking in flavor, bland...I have had better for way cheaper. The other prawn and pork dish had so much salt, it was barely edible. Its been 24 hours and I am still craving water because of the salt. The one star is for the service which was good. The wait staff is very friendly and accomodating. The food showed up very fast. Probably an indication as to why the food isnt all that great or fresh tasting. As for the decor, for a restaurant charging these prices, the decor needs an overall. The chairs are dirty with old food stains and need a good wiping. the carpet looks musty and towards the back where its dark, smells a bit musty. Will never be back. Not worth the time or money.I have to say the dessert was amazing. I wanted to lick my plate, thus the 2nd star. But i didnt go for dessert i was there for the seafood which came up short.

excerpts: The dungeness crab puffs were filled with mayonaise that you can't really taste any crab meat and they weren't 'puffy".
dungeness crab puffs.author: Evelyn L.
dungeness crab puffs.review:
We had reservations and yet, we were made to wait. 

The garlic noodles were garlicky enough... and the roast crab was pretty decent, but other than that, I really do not understand why people rave about this place. Seriously.

The mango salad was kinda bland, totally un-Vietnamese... romaine lettuce with bits of mango and shrimp. I could have tossed it myself at home. The dungeness crab puffs were filled with mayonaise that you can't really taste any crab meat and they weren't 'puffy". They were basically mayonnaise wrapped in wanton skins.

The only saving grace was the molten chocolate cake, but served without much flair. The vanilla ice-cream served on the side weren't scoped out properly, it came out all mushed up with the whipped cream. So, I understand that Asians don't do desserts well, but a little imagination on presentation won't hurt. Afterall, we do eat with our eyes first, don't we?

Nothing much to talk about.  And, it burned a little hole in my wallet.  For that money, I could have a very decent meal at The Slanted Door and have no complains whatsoever. Or, perhaps a few meals at Vung Tau in San Jose. ;-)

A big disappointment.

excerpts: We ordered the mango salad, Dungeness crab puffs, ginger calamari, Drunken Crab, Roast Crab and the garlic rice.
so the Boyfriend and I again followed the advice of our friend and ordered some garlic rice.
In terms of food, Thanh Long gets five stars.
The Parents loved the food.
The ginger calamari was well-seasoned, not too gingery and not too salty.
It was particularly yummy with the pineapples.
The mango salad was delicious (it has shrimp and scallops as well) and the garlic rice was flavorful without being overpowering.
The mango salad was delicious (it has shrimp and scallops as well) and the garlic rice was flavorful without being overpowering.
The Dungeness crab puffs were a big hit but pricey.
It was basically a tastier version of crab rangoon.
Now for the crab: right before ordering, the Boyfriend and I faithfully checked Yelp and some had said that the Roast Crab was too salty.
The Dad isn't too fond of wine-reduction
so we tried the Roast Crab first.
It was delicious and not too salty at all.
The waiter comes over with plastic bibs and you get to cracking (well...
the Boyfriend and the Dad got to cracking and then fed the Mom and me bits and pieces).
One crab is about enough for one person to be full.
One crab is about enough to make two grown men half-full so calculate accordingly.
We ordered the Drunken Crab to mix things up and it was also good.
It tastes much more Asian in that the wine reduction really saves the flavor of the crab - it's much more crabby than the Roast crab which is more seasoned.
The Dad and the Boyfriend liked the Roast Crab a little better, though, so if you want to choose one, I'd advise the Roast Crab.
Don't worry about messy/crabby hands.
The waitstaff comes by with hot (caution: extremely hot) warm towels for you to towel off between and after crab eating.
Finally, for dessert, we ordered orange sorbet.
It's really cute - it comes in a frozen orange that's been beheaded and the lemon sorbet comes in a frozen lemon that's been beheaded!
The only reason I won't give Thanh Long is that the prices are a bit high.
The crab is market price (which meant $37.50 each crab as of June 7, 2009) and the other dishes are pricey as well.
dungeness crab puffs.author: Christine P.
dungeness crab puffs.review: The Dad loves crab so when the Parents came up for the weekend, the Boyfriend and I decided to follow a friend's advice and take them to Thanh Long. The Parents are notoriously picky about food and the Dad is particularly so when it comes to crab. It has to be fresh, can't be over-seasoned and has to be meaty. Thank goodness for Thanh Long. We ordered the mango salad, Dungeness crab puffs, ginger calamari, Drunken Crab, Roast Crab and the garlic rice. The Boyfriend and I had heard that people loved the garlic noodles but the Parents didn't like the looks of it so the Boyfriend and I again followed the advice of our friend and ordered some garlic rice. In terms of food, Thanh Long gets five stars. The Parents loved the food. The ginger calamari was well-seasoned, not too gingery and not too salty. It was particularly yummy with the pineapples. The mango salad was delicious (it has shrimp and scallops as well) and the garlic rice was flavorful without being overpowering. The Dungeness crab puffs were a big hit but pricey. It was basically a tastier version of crab rangoon. Now for the crab: right before ordering, the Boyfriend and I faithfully checked Yelp and some had said that the Roast Crab was too salty. The Dad isn't too fond of wine-reduction so we tried the Roast Crab first. It was delicious and not too salty at all. The waiter comes over with plastic bibs and you get to cracking (well...the Boyfriend and the Dad got to cracking and then fed the Mom and me bits and pieces). One crab is about enough for one person to be full. One crab is about enough to make two grown men half-full so calculate accordingly. We ordered the Drunken Crab to mix things up and it was also good. It tastes much more Asian in that the wine reduction really saves the flavor of the crab - it's much more crabby than the Roast crab which is more seasoned. The Dad and the Boyfriend liked the Roast Crab a little better, though, so if you want to choose one, I'd advise the Roast Crab. Don't worry about messy/crabby hands. The waitstaff comes by with hot (caution: extremely hot) warm towels for you to towel off between and after crab eating. Finally, for dessert, we ordered orange sorbet. It's really cute - it comes in a frozen orange that's been beheaded and the lemon sorbet comes in a frozen lemon that's been beheaded! The only reason I won't give Thanh Long is that the prices are a bit high. The crab is market price (which meant $37.50 each crab as of June 7, 2009) and the other dishes are pricey as well.

excerpts:
But instead I'd rather talk about their other their other dishes:
- Go-to Appetizer: Seafood dumplings.
The beautiful shrimp and whitefish dumplings are served with a yummy tamarind-ginger sauce.
I could just slurp that whole thing up.
- Best side:
seafood dumplings.author: Elena C.
seafood dumplings.review:
I could write a lengthy review about it their crab just like everyone else. But instead I'd rather talk about their other their other dishes:
- Go-to Appetizer: Seafood dumplings. The beautiful shrimp and whitefish dumplings are served with a yummy tamarind-ginger sauce. I could just slurp that whole thing up.
- Best side: Get the garlic noodles and the garlic rice, mix those two together and prepare for the incredible flavor. The rice tames the sweetness of the noodles. So good!
- Skip: Hella expensive veggie side dish. How can vegetables we the same price as your signature garlic noodles. That's cray!

Now that you the t, get that get that roasted crab and make sure to drink plenty of water with it.

excerpts: Of course that doesn't mean I can't start off without the seafood dumplings, or finish the meal with one of their yummy desserts, but the star is the crab, with all of its buttery, garlic goodness.
seafood dumplings.author: Keith C.
seafood dumplings.review:
I've been coming to Thanh Long for years. Why? The Roasted Crab experience!!!!!

While the other items on the menu look delicious, I just can't come here without ordering the roasted crab. Of course that doesn't mean I can't start off without the seafood dumplings, or finish the meal with one of their yummy desserts, but the star is the crab, with all of its buttery, garlic goodness.

If you haven't tried Thanh Long, believe the hype. It is that good. And the messier you get while tearing into your crab, the better! (Don't worry, you'll get a hot towel for your hands afterwards).

Tips: Make reservations ahead of time, and get there a little early if you expect to find street parking. If you drive around the block a few times without any luck, no worries, they do have valet service.

excerpts: As for the food I would say a good 3.5 stars: seafood dumplings appetizer were tasty but too little filling.
seafood dumplings.author: Magda C.
seafood dumplings.review:
We went on a Sunday at 5pm at it was already half occupied. Nice cozy restaurant, upscale from your regular Asian place.
As for the food I would say a good 3.5 stars: seafood dumplings appetizer were tasty but too little filling.
The fish with garlic noodles were good but nothing to say 'wow' about. The fried ice cream was disappointing, too much dough.

excerpts: Came here with family for an early dinner and ordered roasted crab, fried rice, seafood dumplings, eggplant dish, chicken curry and garlic noodles.
Overall the food was just okay.
The garlic crabs were not as flavorful as I thought they would be.
My BF said he knows who makes the best one still....
Ahem.....
Anyway service was good and prompt.
Ordered also deep friend pineapple and they were good as I got a small bite of it.
I would suggest to ask for honey to go along with it.
Brings out the better flavor of the dessert.
I will probably not come back here again as the food is okay
and it could be quite pricy for the mediocre food.
Off to the next best thing...
seafood dumplings.author: Claudine V.
seafood dumplings.review:
The hype to get into this place made me so excited to come and try this place. 
Came here with family for an early dinner and ordered roasted crab, fried rice, seafood dumplings, eggplant dish, chicken curry and garlic noodles. 
Overall the food was just okay. The garlic crabs were not as flavorful as I thought they would be. 
My BF said he knows who makes the best one still.... Ahem.....
Anyway service was good and prompt. Ordered also deep friend pineapple and they were good as I got a small bite of it. I would suggest to ask for honey to go along with it. Brings out the better flavor of the dessert. 
I will probably not come back here again as the food is okay and it could be quite pricy for the mediocre food. 
Off to the next best thing...

excerpts: Seafood dumplings were good as were the wontons.
seafood dumplings.author: Art L.
seafood dumplings.review: Tried the roasted prawns with garlic noodles. Pricey but excellent.  The garlic noodles are super.  Seafood dumplings were good as were the wontons. Even the fried rice was excellent for those with more traditional tastes. Service was really good and friendly.  Definitely would recommend it.

excerpts:
Dungeness Crab Puffs (good, but def not authentic)
Seafood Dumplings (only ok and 5 pieces- wouldn't recommend for the price)
seafood dumplings.author: Amy D.
seafood dumplings.review:
Came in a group of 6 on a Saturday night, so we got to try a lot of dishes. Making reservations is definitely recommended, and parking in this area is tough- the $10 for valet is well spent. 

Ordered-
Salt & Pepper Calamari (nice and peppery, but calamari could've been a bit more crisp)
Dungeness Crab Puffs (good, but def not authentic)
Seafood Dumplings (only ok and 5 pieces- wouldn't recommend for the price)
Crispy Rice Paper Roll (too dry for me, I wouldn't order this again)
Curry Lotus Prawns (good taste but the "jumbo prawns" were teeny!)
Shaken Beef (really good flavor, imo better than at the Slanted Door and cheaper. however, they mix in potatoes pieces to trick you into thinking there is more meat)
Roast Crab (good, but wasn't super flavorful)
Tamarind Crab (wasn't very flavorful, but both crabs were cooked perfectly)
Garlic Noodles (good, but could've been more garlicky)
Fried Rice with Shrimp (your standard fried rice, I wouldn't order again)
Fried Banana & Fried Ice Cream (both were good but I like the banana a lot more)

Overall, the dinner was good, but not amazing. I actually liked the crab I ordered at Three Seasons better (taste wise). My favorite dishes were the shaken beef and garlic noodles, but this restaurant is worth a try for the crab. We paid $57pp including tax and tip, which isn't bad at all, but we didn't get that much crab.

excerpts: My favorites include the roasted dungeness crab (market price), seafood fried rice, pancetta wrapped butterfly prawns, fried calamari, seafood dumplings, and fried bananas with ice cream.
seafood dumplings.author: V F.
seafood dumplings.review:
Thanh Long has been my favorite restaurant for too many years to remember. So much so, they could easily find my name in the reservation system just by telling them my first name.

Over the years, the portions have gotten a lot smaller and the quality of ingredients has slowly gone down hill also. It's probably due to the economy, but I feel for the prices they charge, you should get what you pay for.

I have heard great things about a competitor restaurant in the area so I'm thinking I may have to try it the next time just to see how they stack up.

If you have never been, I think its something you should experience once. My favorites include the roasted dungeness crab (market price), seafood fried rice, pancetta wrapped butterfly prawns, fried calamari, seafood dumplings, and fried bananas with ice cream.

Plan to spend about $150 for two people (depending on what you order and whether you consume alcohol).

Great, expedient service and reasonably priced valet parking. Good for a special occasion.

excerpts: The seafood dumplings are delicious, too.
seafood dumplings.author: Leanne G.
seafood dumplings.review: Like many reviewers have already said, the crab is amazing here. The seafood dumplings are delicious, too. We also ordered the garlic noodles. Although they were good, the flavor was strong and over powered the delicate crab. Not sure I would order them again. I recommend having some nice appetizers and the focusing on the crab for your entree. The service was great - they paid attention to the details such as providing a bib and warm wash cloths to wipe your hands.

excerpts: Along with the seafood dumplings -- another thing I would recommend.
seafood dumplings.author: Kyla G.
seafood dumplings.review:
Okay.  From first glance it doesn't look like a place that you want to be eating seafood at.. don't be fooled.

When we got there, the inside was warm and cozy looking, and the staff was on top of things.

We ordered the baked crab with the garlic noodles. Which I would recommend both -- this was, by far, the best seafood I have had in this area.  The crab was meaty and the seasoning was spectacular.  My boyfriend and I had more fun cracking these crabs with our hands than any other fancy dinner.

We also ordered the mango seafood salad -- wonderful.  Along with the seafood dumplings -- another thing I would recommend.

All in all, this place was AMAZING.  I would recommend it to everyone and anyone.

excerpts: Began the meal with two starters:  the seafood dumplings and the shrimp toast.
The dumplings: pleasant, light, delicate.
More a tease than filling, but a nice tease.
The shrimp toast:
wow.
I've had countless versions as an former ny-er
but this was a whole new trip.
seafood dumplings.author: John Z.
seafood dumplings.review:
File this review under the "interesting" or "odd" folders at your discretion ... but I may be the only reviewer of Thanh Long who didn't have the crab or garlic noodles. 

All the more reason to go back. The place is great, the meal the most memorable I've had in months.

To begin with: a full bar, which was nice for us martini-files. Began the meal with two starters:  the seafood dumplings and the shrimp toast. The dumplings: pleasant, light, delicate. More a tease than filling, but a nice tease.  The shrimp toast:  wow.  I've had countless versions as an former ny-er but this was a whole new trip. Lighter but still flavorful -- on slices of biegnet, a nice tip of the hat to the French influence of Vietnamese food.

Then the main meal: Shaken beef, tender and succulent in its not-too-sweet sauce with a surprisingly perfect compliment of potatoes. Spicy eggplant, just spicy/savory enough to let the eggplant shine through.  Seasonal vegetables: mostly sugar snap peas, lots of mushrooms, absolutely wonderful. Now mind you I don't like mushrooms as a rule but I would have been happy to scarf these down anytime. Garlic rice: just pungent enough, wonderfully textured and sticky, enhanced all the other dishes.

Yes a little on the pricey side... and valet service is ten bucks, not five (thankfully we got street parking). Service was gentle and professional.

I relished every bite and look forward to returning to see about those crabs and garlic noodles.

excerpts: The seafood dumplings were fine but really forgettable.
seafood dumplings.author: John R.
seafood dumplings.review:
We came here for my birthday dinner and had a great experience...as have so many others!

We had the requisite and excellent garlic noodles and roast crab.  We decided to split a couple of appetizers, rather than getting a second crab or more noodles.  The seafood dumplings were fine but really forgettable.  Their version of shrimp toast was good, but too pricey for the serving size.  Next time we'll go for the extra crab!

And if you like wine with your dinner, try a riesling --- we had a delicious Alsatian riesling and it went great with the food!

excerpts: Seafood dumplings that were cold from not being ran out to our table after they were plated....
seafood dumplings.author: Jay P.
seafood dumplings.review:
Thanh Long, you are lucky I love the crab so much!

The service here was ridiculously disappointing.  I guess I had my hopes up from Crustaceans, but they were shattered when I came here for the second time.  

The first time I came here, service was pretty quick and personable.  Food came out quick, but since we did not have crab dishes they did not taste very good.  I got the sea bass, but  I guess I should have known better....money not well spent :(

Second time.  Our apps took an eternity to come out and they weren't exciting at all: Seafood dumplings that were cold from not being ran out to our table after they were plated....

The entrees took even longer.  

One of our wine glasses had a little "swimmer" and when I addressed this with my waitress she promptly took away the glass :) ...BUT then did not bring back another to replace full glass of wine! Aurgh!  Our server never did any check backs and we were neglected for the entire course of the meal...no wine for me for the remainder of the meal...it took another eternity to obtain our check...

Spoke with the manager and he offered an app next time we return...that will not happen, because I will not return.

excerpts: 10 dollars for seafood dumplings with mushy, sticky, thick skin and icky dipping sauce = DO NOT WANT!
I've had frozen shu mai that tasted better.
seafood dumplings.author: Mona N.
seafood dumplings.review:
DISASTER !!
 
I used to be SUCH a fan of Thanh Long when the interior was a rickity wicker MESS with sticky tables, and no elbow room. Since they 1. renovated and 2. spawned the upscale counterparts (been to the Bev. Hills and SF Crustaceans... the only memorable thing was the aquarium walk way from the entrance into the dining hall in the BH location) I heard both Crustacean and Thanh Long went downhill but decided to give it a few tries before reaching any sort of conclusions. 

Two of my recent Thanh Long visits were average / below average but  during the most recent dinner:

1. The bartender (some dude with braided long hair) was rude, dismissive, and a jerk!! I've NEVER been treated this way at a bar. EVER. And I've lived in NYC, one of the most pretentious and snobby cities in the world as well as Tokyo, where a lot of the places are 10 times busier =(

2. The appetizer was below average. 10 dollars for seafood dumplings with mushy, sticky, thick skin and icky dipping sauce = DO NOT WANT! I've had frozen shu mai that tasted better. No joke.

2.The server spilled our beers on us and instead of immediately bringing napkins and or hot towels for our clothes, he disappeared towards the bar to clean himself up. We sat there covered in beer for a while before the hostess finally brought us extra linens =/ When he came back with extra napkins (5 min. too late) he didn't even apologize for spilling and said "I have slippery fingers haha" Um hello? This IS a fine dining establishment, correct? Am I mistaken to expect WAY more professional service?

3. The crabs were fresh and meaty but WAY too salty

4. The garlic noodles were not al dente and WAY salty  =(

I was with a first time Thanh Long-er who seemed to enjoy his food but I was NOT happy. I almost complained but didn't want to ruin my date's dinner.

I will never dine here again. Frankly, I'd rather go to a Chinese supermarket, pick up fresh crab, and season it myself.

note: I gave it two stars because zero is not possible. The 2nd star is for sentimental reasons. I frequented Thanh Long before it blew up and have quite fond memories of that place. I may be ultra picky, know what I want with high expectations, but I have feelings too !! =)

excerpts: We excitedly ordered the seafood dumplings to start, garlic noodles and roasted crab as the main entrees, and the molten lava chocolate cake w/ "gelato" as dessert.
- seafood dumplings - were terrible.
Mushy, overcooked.
Something you would imagine a college student boiling frozen dumplings and putting out.
One order has five pieces.
seafood dumplings.author: Peter H.
seafood dumplings.review:
I actually hadn't heard that much about this place prior to going. Just something about garlic noodles and crab.

We excitedly ordered the seafood dumplings to start, garlic noodles and roasted crab as the main entrees, and the molten lava chocolate cake w/ "gelato" as dessert.

- seafood dumplings - were terrible. Mushy, overcooked. Something you would imagine a college student boiling frozen dumplings and putting out. One order has five pieces. Garnished with carrot slices and a dipping sauce.

- garlic noodles - were every bit as garlicky and oily as other reviewers as presented. What they haven't mentioned was that it's presented as a dull lifeless dish. Looks like chowmein with nothing on it, on a drab white plate as if it was prepared in bulk. Tasted like it too. One plate will serve two.

- roasted crab - I don't know if it was just our crab, but this thing was looked like it was rolled in black pepper. Sure, the description says salt and pepper, but this was ridiculous. I think the top of the pepper shaker fell off? Once you got past that, the crab was moist and succulent with garlic and butter. Again, one order will serve two.

- molten lava chocolate cake - Everyone knows that dessert is the last thing you remember about a meal, because it's the last thing served. The menu mentioned "molten lava chocolate cake" with "gelato". For one, there was no gelato. Vanilla ice cream was served. The waiter did not bother mention that until after it was served. Secondly, there was no "molten lava" anything. The cook must have taken the no-bake approach with a cold cake cup, hollowed out, and poured cold chocolate syrup into the hollow. This is a total disservice to the restaurant/menu.

excerpts: The roasted crab, garlic noodles with tiger prawns, saigon beef, and seafood dumplings and some sauteed veggies would be my choice of a great dinner for 2.
seafood dumplings.author: Marcus Y.
seafood dumplings.review: Went there for my 10th Anniversary. I always loved this place MUCH better than Crustaceans on Polk. I think the atmosphere/decor/people/service makes it better.......the only downside is trying to find parking. The roasted crab, garlic noodles with tiger prawns, saigon beef, and seafood dumplings and some sauteed veggies would be my choice of a great dinner for 2.

excerpts: for appetizers, we had the seafood dumplings (nothing special or fancy) and jumbo prawns wonton (good).
seafood dumplings.author: sandra l.
seafood dumplings.review:
i love crab. i love garlic. i love noodles. but, i didn't love thanh long. it was good but not great. i still prefer PPQ's food any day. 

for appetizers, we had the seafood dumplings (nothing special or fancy) and jumbo prawns wonton (good). entrees: roasted crab (yummy - almost ate a whole crab by myself!), garlic noodles (kinda bland, not enough garlic), shaken beef (ok at best, much better at slanted door), seasonal vegetable saute (good, firm string beans), steamed rice (rice is rice). for dessert, we had chocolate cake and fried pineapple, i think. i don't have a sweet tooth so desserts will always just be ok for me.  

oh, the bathroom was gross! they need to clean it more often. yuck. 

the service was excellent. very attentive. the ambiance was cute...not fancy like the sister restaurant crustaceans of course but still nice.

excerpts: BUDDHA ROLL is ONE ROLL CUT IN 4.
buddha roll.author: Lady K.
buddha roll.review:
BUDDHA ROLL is ONE ROLL CUT IN 4. 

The Roasted Crab sauce is still on point, but was dry.

Their Family Style is enough for 2.

The Valet guys wear too much cologne and it stays in your car til the next day. 


I dont love you Long time anymore.

excerpts: Lastly, we also had the buddha roll.
It was unique in terms of the different veggies they used in it, but like many other kinds of spring rolls, definitely something you can make at home yourself.
buddha roll.author: Sylvia N.
buddha roll.review:
I think I have FINALLY tried all major crab joints in SF.  

Thanh Long is commonly compared to PPQ Dungeness & R&G Lounge.  Between the three, I have to give it to Thanh Long.  Their roasted salt & pepper crab was perfect!  I thought I might've felt that way because I haven't had PPQ in awhile, but I went back there recently & Thanh Long wins by far.  

PPQ's roasted crab is drenched in complete butter & garlic.  Trust me, I love butter way more than the average person but there was just no other dimension of flavor in PPQ's crab.  My stomach wasn't loving it that night either.  I enjoyed the fact that it's cheaper & you get a bigger piece of crab, but the flavor's just not doin it for me.  

R&G has great crab as well, but it's hard to compare them to Thanh Long & PPQ when their crab is battered (the others aren't).  

Anyways, Thanh Long has a great mixture of salt, black pepper, butter & what we believed was maybe garlic salt?  I'm not sure exactly but it was the perfect amount.  I think maybe because I love the buttery/salty kind of mix over the plain butter like others might enjoy at PPQ.  

Their tiger prawns are a MUST.  I've never had such flavorful & juicy tiger prawns in my life.  I'm usually not a prawns person either!

Lastly, we also had the buddha roll.  It was unique in terms of the different veggies they used in it, but like many other kinds of spring rolls, definitely something you can make at home yourself.

excerpts: We also tried the shaken beef, buddha roll (vegetarian spring rolls), mussels on a crostini (tender, flavorful and succulent), salt and pepper fried calamari (tender), and stir fried green beans.
buddha roll.author: Jeannie C.
buddha roll.review:
Buttery garlicky goodness of noodles and their roast crab...ENOUGH said! I really felt like garlic was coming out of my pores after the dinner.

We also tried the shaken beef, buddha roll (vegetarian spring rolls), mussels on a crostini (tender, flavorful and succulent), salt and pepper fried calamari (tender), and stir fried green beans.

The service was attentive and friendly. If you have the money to splurge, love garlic and don't mind butter, and especially love to eat crab, give this place a try. I have tried Crustaceans and AnQui but this place will always be my favorite.

excerpts: The Buddha roll, on the other hand, was like a slight variation on a traditional Vietnamese spring roll filled with tasty daikon and black mushrooms to give it a more earthy flavor.
buddha roll.author: Gene C.
buddha roll.review:
I came here with a friend from out of town looking for a competitor to PPQ Dungeness Island. The restaurant is situated in a fairly residential area, but then again, I guess most restaurants in the Sunset/Richmond area qualify.  The restaurant's layout is a little interesting, as the back portion of the restaurant was walled off leaving a nook for 6 tables and gave the restaurant a closed-off feel.  The frozen cocktail my friend ordered was mostly sweet without much alcohol, disappointing even for her.

The jumbo prawn wontons are not jumbo by any account (granted, I had eaten at Anchor Oyster Bar earlier that day, so my sense of proportion may be completely skewed), and you can barely taste the pancetta at all, a very forgettable dish.  The Buddha roll, on the other hand, was like a slight variation on a traditional Vietnamese spring roll filled with tasty daikon and black mushrooms to give it a more earthy flavor.  The Dungeness crab puffs were like crab rangoons on crack, filled with delicious herb cheese and a large quantity of crab, only limited by their size.

The garlic noodles here have somewhat more of a bite and stronger garlic flavor compared to PPQ Dungeness Island. However, I have to say the crab, albeit meatier, was not nearly as flavorful.  We ordered the roast crab which, although mildly peppery and actually with a good amount of sweet meat, otherwise was not as heavily seasoned.  Strangely enough, our crab was actually a little cool by the time it got to our table.  Also, the seafood fried rice was lacking in salt.  Thankfully, they brought some chili sambal to our table upon request.  Our server was really very nice and attentive.

Overall, based on pure food comparisons, PPQ Dungeness Island wins in my book purely based on the crab's flavoring, but Thanh Long may actually serve a better crab and definitely has better garlic noodles.  If you're looking for crab on a Tuesday, this is your place... (cuz it seems everywhere else is closed!)

excerpts: As an appetizer, we had the Buddha Roll.
It was small, and the "peanut sauce" was basically intensely garlicy soy sauce with a couple other ingredients.
buddha roll.author: ken w.
buddha roll.review:
Some places don't deserve their popularity. My friend brought me here--he had previously had the garlic noodles and some crab soaked in butter, and he wanted to try the full crab.

Hearing the price of $45 for the crab, my friend changed his mind and ordered the noodles again and some squid. 

The menu is tiny. Mainly a few seafood dishes and some odds and ends. I ordered the Vegetarian's Delight, and it was the most flavorless dish I can remember ordering at any restaurant for years, the worst vegetarian's delight I've had. The sauce was watery tomato juice, basically unseasoned, hardly even any salt (no salt on the tables). 

When the waiter came to ask whether everything was OK, I told him, No the dish has basically no flavor. He offered to steam the vegetables. Strange! Does this waiter know anything about food? This is the point where most waiters would offer to replace the dish, but no, this waiter seemed quite clueless. So I asked for some condiments (many Vietnamese restaurants have LOTS of different condiments). All he had was hot sauce and soy sauce, so I had to make the dish edible (barely) with those. This was a tasteless plate of 30 cents worth of ingredients, priced at $14,95, way more than I've ever paid for veggie delight. I call it Vegetarian's Despair.

As an appetizer, we had the Buddha Roll. It was small, and the "peanut sauce" was basically intensely garlicy soy sauce with a couple other ingredients. Disappointing also, though not terrible.

This place apparently just throws gobs of garlic and butter at most of their dishes, and people flock to it. Lame. Why would anyone go here when there are literally hundreds of amazing, inexpensive East Asian restaurants in SF? 

The decor has a dingy feel, with uninspired decorations. 

The only reason this place gets more than one star is that my friend liked his garlic noodles again (an easy dish to make at home). Save your money and go to one of the many better, cheaper Vietnamese restaurants in town.

excerpts: We also tried the Buddha roll as a started, lacking in size but excelling in taste, i would definitely recommend it.
http://media1.px.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/RRbjQc-TiIc9VU9BYS-wWw/l
buddha roll.author: Jonathan W.
buddha roll.review:
OMG.....I'm having a carb attack.....must have carbs!! Yes even i have carb cravings too!  oh snaps Thanh Long's garlic noodles!!!!! om nom nom nom  http://media2.px.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/Gr8HdUlQkj3BroRCbgYFTg/l
The gf and decided that roasted crab and garlic noodles sounded the best for a cheat day! Why not stuff yourself with carbs and buttery goodness! ;)  

The roasted crab was amazing, very buttery and peppered and went well with the amazing garlic noodles. The garlic noodles had just enough garlic flavor without being overpowering, so one order between two people was not enough. Yes! I just had to order a second one ;)  We also tried the Buddha roll as a started, lacking in size but excelling in taste, i would definitely recommend it. http://media1.px.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/RRbjQc-TiIc9VU9BYS-wWw/l Being a Protein fiend, i wanted more protein with our dinner so we decided to get the Saigon beef too. http://media1.px.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/td1A4gpMLMU2VIIIfjEp0g/l The beef was very tender and had marvelous flavoring to it on top of a bed of salad. Perfect! it came with veggies! ;). Thanh Long was definitely worth the 30min wait but I know next time to MAKE RESERVATIONS!!!  Also its probably best to go during crab season, it can be steep when crabs are not in season. Thanh Long won my heart and my stomach with their amazing garlic noodles, sorry PPQ but you are my second favorite now.

excerpts: The delicious items we chose for our meal were the drunken crab, dungeness crab puffs, buddha roll, shaken beef, and of course their famous garlic noodles.
After tasting garlic we definitely wanted dessert and settled for their creme brulee which was very rich but satisfied our sweet tooth.
buddha roll.author: Emy B.
buddha roll.review:
I likey!  The food here is very yummy.  If you like crab this is the place to come have it, and be prepared to work at getting all the succulent meat out of the shells.  The delicious items we chose for our meal were the drunken crab, dungeness crab puffs, buddha roll, shaken beef, and of course their famous garlic noodles.  After tasting garlic we definitely wanted dessert and settled for their creme brulee which was very rich but satisfied our sweet tooth.  Next time we'll have to order their fried banana dessert with ice cream which we kept staring at on the other tables.

Parking is not easy to find, but they offer valet service for $10 if you get impatient.  Will definitely be back...yee!  If you're curious check out their website at anfamily.com, click on Thanh Long and download the menu.

excerpts: We ordered 2 Roasted Dungeness Crab, 1 Steam Sea Bass, Villager's Favorite, 2 orders of Garlic Noodles, Grilled Calamari and the Buddha Roll.
The Buddha Roll was average.
On top of all that, our "smart" waiter gave us the crab, without our garlic noodles.
And lastly, the garlic noodles.
Average.
It came out cold.
buddha roll.author: F S.
buddha roll.review:
This is not my first time at Thanh Long.  My first experience dated back to 2001.  Back then, I was hooked and would have given it 5 stars and more if I could.  I have been back to Thanh Long many times through the years and brought many of friends and family.  But, my last two times have been a disappointment which is what led me to write this review.

We ordered 2 Roasted Dungeness Crab, 1 Steam Sea Bass, Villager's Favorite, 2 orders of Garlic Noodles, Grilled Calamari and the Buddha Roll.  

The best dish from this selection was the Villager's Favorite, sadly.  The sauce was not salty and a perfect balance of black pepper and fish sauce.  The meat and the shrimp came out very tender.

The Buddha Roll was average.  The roll was poorly rolled and fell apart the moment we touched it.

The Roasted Crab came out too quickly.  We barely wiped our lips from the appetizers (10 minutes max), then out came the crabs.  Okay-- my first reaction was wow, they really want to turn their tables around.  Then my second reaction was these crabs were pre-roasted.  Then I wanted to hurt someone.  We did not drive all the way to the outer sunset for frozen crab!!!!  On top of all that, our "smart" waiter gave us the crab, without our garlic noodles.  So the fool had us eating the crab without any complementing food.

And lastly, the garlic noodles.  Average.  It came out cold.  Usually, these noodles do no retain heat, so I do not expect it too be hot, however cold is unacceptable.  

If Thanh Long is dishing out fast-food version of their food and service, they should dish out those same prices, so expectations will be lowered.  It will be a long time until I would try or recommend T.L.

excerpts: 1 Buddha Roll $7.95.
This was the only OK thing we ordered.
buddha roll.author: Erika B.
buddha roll.review:
This place is disgusting. 

1 Buddha Roll $7.95. This was the only OK thing we ordered. Descent, but only 2 rolls. 

1 Garlic Noodles $9.95. This was the most ridiculous waste of money. It is literally, a giant plate of greasy spaghetti covered in a butter-like substance with sugar and powdered garlic. It was so greasy that I could not even finish half of it. I have no clue how people eat a whole plate of this stuff, let alone with their greasy seafood on top. Yuck. Not to mention, should this really cost 10$? Not worth it, at all. 

1 Colossal Tiger Prawns $34.95. The shrimp were splayed in half to make them look larger than they actually were and served on top of a giant bed of greasy garlic spaghetti. The shrimp themselves, were also covered in greasy butter stuff. They tasted OK, but also were very oily. 

1 Vegetarian Delight $14.95. This was possibly the last mistake we made: ordering vegetables at this grease-hole. This was inedible. They came covered in a sauce which reminded both of us of Chief Boyardee tomato sauce. Gross. We did not eat any of it, and they did not even ask if any thing was wrong with the food. This place sucks. 

We will NOT be returning, and would never recommend this to anyone. The only remaining thing I can add is that we did NOT order the crab (their specialty); this must be god-awful amazing, because otherwise I have no idea how anyone eats here. Yuck.

excerpts: We ordered the Buddha Roll (vegetarian spring roll), Garlic Toast, Roast Crab, Garlic Noodles, and the Thanh Long Spicy Eggplant.
The Buddha Roll had good flavors but one order of it is just one roll cut into 4 pieces and for $7.50 is so not worth it!
The Garlic Toast was also a rip off.
It was just half a baguette like the ones you get at Lucky's/Safeway, smothered with butter with hardly any garlic.
You could easily make your own garlic bread at home that tastes a whole lot better for half the price.
Their famous Roast Crab was alright.
The crab was a decent size with a good amount of meat, but they could have gone a bit lighter on the seasoning.
I don't know if we got a bad batch but the crab was a bit too salty.
It definitely tasted better when paired with simple plain white rice.
The Garlic Noodles were quite tasty and scrumptious, but the portion was small.
The best dish by far was the Thanh Long Spicy Eggplant.
The eggplant was cooked to perfection...
the outside with just the right amount of crunch, with a soft inside.
It went really with the prawns, chicken, and mushrooms that were mixed in with it.
buddha roll.author: Karen C.
buddha roll.review:
Came here with family to celebrate my husband's birthday. When we walked by the restaurant it did look pretty run down and ghetto at first glance but whatever was cookin' smelled absolutely delicious =)

Upon entering, I felt like I had been transported into another place. I guess it's true when they say "don't judge a book by it's cover." The inside was clean, beautifully decorated, filled with lots of people, and had great ambiance. Their service was amazing...exceeded all expectations. We had about 4 different servers which made everything flow very nicely. Our orders were taken promptly and properly, plates cleared instantly, and our water glasses were always filled without us having to ask. They were all really nice and polite.

We ordered the Buddha Roll (vegetarian spring roll), Garlic Toast, Roast Crab, Garlic Noodles, and the Thanh Long Spicy Eggplant. The Buddha Roll had good flavors but one order of it is just one roll cut into 4 pieces and for $7.50 is so not worth it! The Garlic Toast was also a rip off. It was just half a baguette like the ones you get at Lucky's/Safeway, smothered with butter with hardly any garlic. You could easily make your own garlic bread at home that tastes a whole lot better for half the price. Their famous Roast Crab was alright. The crab was a decent size with a good amount of meat, but they could have gone a bit lighter on the seasoning. I don't know if we got a bad batch but the crab was a bit too salty. It definitely tasted better when paired with simple plain white rice. The Garlic Noodles were quite tasty and scrumptious, but the portion was small. The best dish by far was the Thanh Long Spicy Eggplant. The eggplant was cooked to perfection...the outside with just the right amount of crunch, with a soft inside. It went really with the prawns, chicken, and mushrooms that were mixed in with it. The portion was small too and it definitely left me with wanting more!

Overall this place is just okay. The decor and service was awesome but the food was just okay in terms of taste, portions, and price. Very overpriced for the amount you get. It was about $40/person for us but I felt like I ate $20 worth of food. I would agree with some of the other reviewers that Boiling Crab is better for the price and value.

excerpts: We usually start out with a Buddha Roll and several side orders of noodles to take home.
It's great after a long day in the park.
Go for an early dinner to beat the reservation line.
Or make a reservation and plan to have a drink at the cute little bar while you wait to be seated.
buddha roll.author: Stephanie B.
buddha roll.review:
GARLIC NOODLES!!!
You've never had them like this before...so simple, so good.
I always get the Thanh Long Fish and let it melt in my mouth savoring the perfect texture and dill spices. Everyone else goes there for the King Crab...which looks good if I wasn't religiously against eating things with legs. My boyfriend likes the Clay pot, the spicy eggplant, and taking a piece of my fish ;). We usually start out with a Buddha Roll and several side orders of noodles to take home. It's great after a long day in the park. Go for an early dinner to beat the reservation line. Or make a reservation and plan to have a drink at the cute little bar while you wait to be seated. This place is hot. 

According to our friends from LA this restaurant spawned a series of chain restaurants called Crustacean and those ones have a dress code and less flavor.

excerpts:
So this is what I remember from the night's festivities, once the food coma wore off:
Salmon carpaccio, the Buddha roll, the prawn bouillabaisse, garlic noodles, the roast crab, tiger prawns and the steamed sea bass.
In a word, YUM.
Come hungry though, because you will want to indulge in all kinds of different flavors, and the menu is versatile enough to do so.

I got my salt from the yummy carpaccio, "fresh" from the spring roll-esque Buddha roll, tang from the bouillabaisse (though I will say I did not expect such a seemingly random selection of different veggies/fruit to taste good together...
I was kinda like, "um...why are there tomatoes and pineapple together to complement my seafood soup?
but it was actually pretty enjoyable), bitter (in a good way, though my breath was banging after all the garlic!)
from the noodles, and boredom from the main entrees.
the sea bass and the crab...
i guess i just wanted more flavor?
buddha roll.author: Danielle D.
buddha roll.review:
When my girls and I go out to eat, we EAT.
So this is what I remember from the night's festivities, once the food coma wore off:
Salmon carpaccio, the Buddha roll, the prawn bouillabaisse, garlic noodles, the roast crab, tiger prawns and the steamed sea bass. In a word, YUM. Come hungry though, because you will want to indulge in all kinds of different flavors, and the menu is versatile enough to do so. I got my salt from the yummy carpaccio, "fresh" from the spring roll-esque Buddha roll, tang from the bouillabaisse (though I will say I did not expect such a seemingly random selection of different veggies/fruit to taste good together...I was kinda like, "um...why are there tomatoes and pineapple together to complement my seafood soup?" but it was actually pretty enjoyable), bitter (in a good way, though my breath was banging after all the garlic!) from the noodles, and boredom from the main entrees. the sea bass and the crab...i guess i just wanted more flavor?... i ended up switching entrees with a friend though, and enjoyed her tiger prawns and a dish i don't recall for sure, but it was definitely chicken with veggies (now looking at the menu it must have been the lemongrass chicken), and it was like the comfort food I needed to end the meal in a happy place. 
I would head back though, and repeat my starters again, though the next time, I would probably try the drunken beef or crab to appeal my palate, which I tend to ignore in favor of the "safer" stuff.
Very good service as well, which always adds to the meal!

excerpts: If you're a fan of egg rolls (they called it crispy rice paper roll) then don't order this...
I've had better.
crispy rice paper roll.author: Trang L.
crispy rice paper roll.review: Love that I was able to make a quick reservation over yelp. Super convenient. I thought the food was meh... not too special. If you're a fan of egg rolls (they called it crispy rice paper roll) then don't order this... I've had better. I also did not think the roasted crab was worth $60... garlic noodles was pretty simple, almost too simple. The food overall didn't hit the spot for me, I was honestly excited about this place. Felt like I over paid for not so authentic Vietnamese food. Our server was very on top of checking in on us. I like the fact that they had  valet so I don't have to circle around looking for parking... but I had an SUV so instead of paying $13 I've had to pay $20... that's a big difference. Not cool...

excerpts: Crispy Rice Paper Roll (too dry for me
, I wouldn't order this again)
crispy rice paper roll.author: Amy D.
crispy rice paper roll.review:
Came in a group of 6 on a Saturday night, so we got to try a lot of dishes. Making reservations is definitely recommended, and parking in this area is tough- the $10 for valet is well spent. 

Ordered-
Salt & Pepper Calamari (nice and peppery, but calamari could've been a bit more crisp)
Dungeness Crab Puffs (good, but def not authentic)
Seafood Dumplings (only ok and 5 pieces- wouldn't recommend for the price)
Crispy Rice Paper Roll (too dry for me, I wouldn't order this again)
Curry Lotus Prawns (good taste but the "jumbo prawns" were teeny!)
Shaken Beef (really good flavor, imo better than at the Slanted Door and cheaper. however, they mix in potatoes pieces to trick you into thinking there is more meat)
Roast Crab (good, but wasn't super flavorful)
Tamarind Crab (wasn't very flavorful, but both crabs were cooked perfectly)
Garlic Noodles (good, but could've been more garlicky)
Fried Rice with Shrimp (your standard fried rice, I wouldn't order again)
Fried Banana & Fried Ice Cream (both were good but I like the banana a lot more)

Overall, the dinner was good, but not amazing. I actually liked the crab I ordered at Three Seasons better (taste wise). My favorite dishes were the shaken beef and garlic noodles, but this restaurant is worth a try for the crab. We paid $57pp including tax and tip, which isn't bad at all, but we didn't get that much crab.

excerpts:
start off with the Coconut Prawns = the bomb
soft shelled crab, mussels, crispy rice paper roll = the bomb.
crispy rice paper roll.author: Nic C.
crispy rice paper roll.review:
U BETTER BELIEVE IT!!!!!
I love this place, have been here ALOT.  
this is the bomb, the food and the ambiance is EXCELLENT.  The service is EXCELLENT.  Parking is not the best, but once you get inside you forget u drove around for 10-15 minutes looking for a spot, unless you valet.

start off with the Coconut Prawns = the bomb
soft shelled crab, mussels, crispy rice paper roll = the bomb.
garlic noodles = the bomb
ROASTED CRAB = THE SUPER BOMB
ROYAL TIGER PRAWNS = the bomb

This is a must go to place before you die.  THE END

excerpts:
We were seated immediately, and looked over the menu, and ordered the following:

Crispy Rice Paper Roll ($7.50) - your standard Vietnamese Egg Roll.
crispy rice paper roll.author: Daniel M.
crispy rice paper roll.review:
I've been here before and I thought it was great (and still do!), but after eating at Crustaceans, Thanh Long only gets 4 stars...

Took my parents and Anhie T. here for Chinese New Years dinner, and reservations were made at 8.30, but at 7.15 we were able to move it up to 7.45 with no problems.  We got there, and it was pretty empty...with maybe 20 diners at about 5-6 different tables.  Barren compared to when Anhie T. and I came about 2 yrs ago.  We were seated immediately, and looked over the menu, and ordered the following:

Crispy Rice Paper Roll ($7.50) - your standard Vietnamese Egg Roll.  But here you get once egg roll cut into four pieces.
Thanh Long Mussells ($10.95) - five mussells served with five slices of thin garlic bread.  This dish was delicious.
Steamed Sea Bass ($24.95) - sea bass was flaky, moist, and really good.  The sauce was sweet and gingery.
Stuffed Calamari ($15.95) - lots of calamari stuffed with minced meat in a tomato based sauce.  Parents didn't like it so much, but I thought it was okay.
Shaken Beef ($20.95) - very flavorful, and a dish that everyone loved.  The beef was tender and potatoes were flavorful.
Garlic Noodles (2 orders at $9.50 ea) - Garlicky and delicious! 
Roast Crab (I think it was $38) - really good crab...but compared to Crustaceans, it's not the same.  Not as flavorful, but still very, very good nonetheless. 
Creme Brulee (2 orders) - My dad and Anhie T. thought this was the best dessert dish.
Banana Cake - I liked this dish and everyone else didn't like it.  Served with a scoop of Vanilla ice cream, a dallop of whip cream, this cake seemed to be made out of only bananas.  Anhie T. said it was bland.  I disagree.
Hot Chocolate Cake - served with Vanilla ice cream...this was good.  Really rich though.
Coke (2 glasses) - served from their bar in a tall, slim glass.  No free refills.

Total bill with tax + tip came out to $218.

This was my parents first time here and they loved the crab, and garlic noodles.  They did say it was a bit oily, but c'mon, roasted crab and garlic noodles anywhere is a bit oily.  But here's a good sign.  As they left, they took some business cards.  That means they liked their food and they'll be back...probably with some family friends!

Depending on my the mood (and thickness of the wallet), I would come back.  

But other substitutions are very comparable:  PPQ is cheaper and quality isn't far behind, while Crustacean is a tad more expensive, but swankier....

Tip 'o the day:  Avoid the valet parking outside.  Parking isn't too difficult in the Sunset.  And even if you had to walk one block after dinner, it may clear up your arteries after all the butter used in cooking the crab!

excerpts: The Asian bouillabaisse soup was good too.
asian bouillabaisse.author: Jen O.
asian bouillabaisse.review:
This is the sister restaurant of Crustaceans. Crustaceans is one of my ultimate favorite restaurants in SF. 
The food is exactly the same, just a more casual place compared to crustaceans. 

We ordered the Roasted Crab, it was a decent size and of course not to miss are the Garlic noodles. 
We also got mussels, it was delicious. The salt and pepper squid didn't seem freshly cooked tho so you can skip that. 
The Asian bouillabaisse soup was good too. It's my favorite soup with pineapple. 

I would recommend you just focus on the crab and garlic noodles. Yes the crabs are expensive, ours was $55 per crab but it's worth it. One crab can be good for 2 people. 


Service was fast, I think everything is pre-cooked already for the day. 
For the same price I would go to Crustaceans because it's not as busy and noisy as Thanh Long. 

Valet is expensive tho.

excerpts: Asian Bouillabaisse (soup) -
This soup tastes like Canh chua, but it was very sweet.
Not the best soup i've tried.
Roasted Crab - This crab was just average.
There wasnt much flavor to it, and it was quite oily.
The way it was cooked was perfect, but the flavor?
It was okay.
Garlic Noodle -
I actually like
PPQ's garlic noodle a lot better.
asian bouillabaisse.author: Mimi V.
asian bouillabaisse.review:
After a long day of bike riding through the Golden Gate Bridge, my bf and I wanted to end the day with Thanh Long due to it's raving reviews. We called in advance to make reservations around 2pm on a saturday and the only opening spot they had was 9pm, so we took it. Walking into this restaurant, it was jam packed! This Vietnamese restaurant is nothing like any other typical Vietnamese restaurant that i've been to. They are very modern and service was awesome. However, the food? I must say it was just okay and ive experienced better. 

Things i tried: 
Mussel Appetizer - I enjoyed this appetizer. Every Bite i took was great and the flavor of it was just right. 
Asian Bouillabaisse (soup) - This soup tastes like Canh chua, but it was very sweet. Not the best soup i've tried. 
Roasted Crab - This crab was just average. There wasnt much flavor to it, and it was quite oily. The way it was cooked was perfect, but the flavor? It was okay. 
Garlic Noodle - I actually like PPQ's garlic noodle a lot better.  It was okay and nothing was really special about it. 

All in all, service was great, food was okay. Parking sucks and it may take you a long time to find parking! Tip: Make reservations. 

Stars: 2.5

excerpts:
Asian Bouillabaisse - Bowl of Soup for one : 4/10
Really really sweet with a slight sour.
The taste was there 
but it was so sweet that it wasn't appetizing.
asian bouillabaisse.author: Sunny L.
asian bouillabaisse.review:
Thanh Long is quite an established restaurant. With lots of loyal customers, i found it difficult to eat here without reservations. Upon entering, me and my gf faced a barrage of sardines [people] in a packed waiting area. The other patrons waiting were quite rude. The bar area was big enough to fit about 5 people max. Expect to wait when coming here. Always make reservations, that's the most important tip here ever. Things we tried.

Mussel Appetizer: 9/10
Really good and delicious. 5 mussels on top of slices of french bread only but quality over quantity.

Asian Bouillabaisse - Bowl of Soup for one : 4/10
Really really sweet with a slight sour.
The taste was there but it was so sweet that it wasn't appetizing.
It was really a turn off.

Roast Crab - A whole crab: 5/10
It was expecting a good flavor to this. I was thinking about it all day actually.
It was just crab that was roasted. I felt like this could have been improved in so many small ways. It was just okay to me. Nothing special.

Garlic Noodles: 5.5/10
The GN was okay, nice hint of flavors but I also didn't feel this was lip smacking good. It could have been better.

The Service was locked down on everything. 
Water here and questions here. 
Very good good good service.

Ambiance was okay; more so, it was loud and noisy.

Overall, I would recommend this place to try but I wouldn't expect to be blown away.

Pros: Service, Mussels
COns: Improve on the items listed above. [IMO]
STars:3

excerpts: Asian Bouillabaisse soup - [http://s3yelp3-a.akamaihd.net/bphoto/f0y0v-Gcch7aYUPq_G94Zg/l.jpg]
This was a very interesting item to tangle.
I ordered this for my girlfriend because she was feeling under the weather.
I also had some for myself and well, among all the different soups I've drank before, this one was.. unique.
It had the characteristics of a tomato soup, packed with hearty pieces of shrimp, and with an overwhelming sweetness due to the chunks of pineapple.
asian bouillabaisse.author: Albert L.
asian bouillabaisse.review:
The hype is true.

So, my boss told me that he went to Crustacean's on Polk and had a unbelievable experience there. The crab and garlic noodles changed his whole perspective on seafood and when I found out that Thanh Long was actually the original establishment, you bet I was excited to check this place out first. 

To be on the safe side, I wanted to make reservations. There wasn't any OpenTable option (damn, no points) so had to call in after 2:30PM to confirm (and reservations are a must!).

Anyways, on to the food: 

Salt & Pepper Calamari - [http://s3yelp2-a.akamaihd.net/bphoto/no1TYaWrdFk5yVshdo3Uvg/l.jpg]
I.. definitely had better, much better. This was pretty mediocre, especially since it was our first dish and there was much praise from the Rising/Green Dragon restaurant. It tasted overcooked, under seasoned (ironic how it's called Salt & Pepper calamari..), and chewy.. in a negative way. Yeah.. I still ate it anyways, but it was out of hungry (and my Chinese blood will not allow me to waste food).

Asian Bouillabaisse soup - [http://s3yelp3-a.akamaihd.net/bphoto/f0y0v-Gcch7aYUPq_G94Zg/l.jpg]
This was a very interesting item to tangle. I ordered this for my girlfriend because she was feeling under the weather. I also had some for myself and well, among all the different soups I've drank before, this one was.. unique. It had the characteristics of a tomato soup, packed with hearty pieces of shrimp, and with an overwhelming sweetness due to the chunks of pineapple. The concoction did blend well, but personally, I don't like my food sweet-tasting.

Original Roasted Crab - [http://s3yelp3-a.akamaihd.net/bphoto/Zp98Zwn0ERFIwck6PkwMCQ/l.jpg]
At last, the moment we've been waiting for! Our crab was beautiful; all buttered up and peppered to perfection! Keep in mind that TL doesn't take it easy on the butter now. All I can say is, the crab was delicious! Oh, and be prepared to get ridiculously messy!

Garlic Noodles - [http://s3yelp1-a.akamaihd.net/bphoto/QORekDXzM0tSCTw58gj9FA/l.jpg]
After taking the first bite, my mouth salivated for more! Hands down, the best garlic noodles I've ever had. It was so good, I devoured the first place (which I was sharing with my girlfriend) and had to call in for seconds! It was thattt good. Just keep in mind that you gottaaa eat it while it's still hot and fresh.

Old-fashioned Banana Cake - [http://s3yelp1-a.akamaihd.net/bphoto/KMontrvWMCv4VSkrDRBLWA/l.jpg]
It was a nice warm and chewy contrast to end our meal. It was heavy, for I was already stuffed, but still nice. I only recommend that TL consider serving coconut ice cream, rather than the standard vanilla, but that's just me.


So in the end, my boss was right. It was an impeccable service and experience! (I had all forgotten about the sub-par calamari after sinking into the crab.) All the food came within a ten minute difference from one another, our glasses were never empty, and my favorite part was the hot towel service -- very refreshing and cleansing! (How come other pig-out spots don't offer this!? A tiny paper wet-nap ain't gonna do nothing!)

FYI: the seasonal price for the roasted crab was 38.95, which is a tad more pricey than other restaurants, but well worth it.

excerpts: We had the roasted crab, garlic noodles, and the Asian Bouillabaisse soup.
I didn't try the soup, but I tried the roasted crab and garlic noodles which were both okay.
The crab didn't have as much flavor as I wanted it to.
The garlic noodles were too..
garlic-y?
I like Perilla's garlic noodles better.
asian bouillabaisse.author: Joyce E.
asian bouillabaisse.review:
I came here with family on a Saturday night. Parking is difficult! Ayiyi if the parking gods aren't with you, give yourself at least an extra 30 minutes to find parking!

This place was just alright. We had the roasted crab, garlic noodles, and the Asian Bouillabaisse soup. I didn't try the soup, but I tried the roasted crab and garlic noodles which were both okay. The crab didn't have as much flavor as I wanted it to. The garlic noodles were too.. garlic-y? I like Perilla's garlic noodles better.

The prices are ridiculous, too.

excerpts: The Asian bouillabaisse is not authentic either, not enough herbs, but has scallion instead, which is a little odd.
Authentic dish normally doesn't have green onion.
asian bouillabaisse.author: A N.
asian bouillabaisse.review: We had tamarind crab. The crab itself is pretty fresh but the overall dish is not authentic tamarind crab at all. We could barely taste the tamarind in the sauce, it mostly had tomato sauce which is quite unexpected. If you Google "tamarind crab" you will see this is very different than the authentic one. The sauce is too wet for typical tamarind crab. The Asian bouillabaisse is not authentic either, not enough herbs, but has scallion instead, which is a little odd. Authentic dish normally doesn't have green onion. The mango salad was quite unexpected as well. Mango is not shredded but chunky instead, which might not be that big of a deal. However, the fried ice cream dessert had too much batter, very little ice cream while the ice cream is also melted quite a bit. And, it doesn't look very appealing either. It's a sort-of flatten dark looking ball rather than a nice round ball we normally see. It looks like it got overburned. The waitresses wear traditional clothes, which is kind of nice. That is about the only thing that is traditional at this restaurant. If you're looking for authentic Vietnamese food, this is not the place to go. The dishes are quite expensive too. A tamarind crab (market price) is for $48 and it's not that huge either. I think the restaurant is overrated because of its owners' fame and history.

excerpts: For soups we ordered asian bouillabaisse, which was tasty, with just the perfect amount of tamarind.
asian bouillabaisse.author: carebear l.
asian bouillabaisse.review: My bf brought me here for a birthday surprise romantic dinner here.  We kind of have this unfinished business/ past history thing at this establishment. For appetizers we ordered the Thanh Long mussels, which came with little toasted crostini, the mussels were cooked really well and were not chewy at all  and the salt and pepper squid was lightly battered and not overcooked. For soups we ordered asian bouillabaisse, which was tasty, with just the perfect amount of tamarind. For entrees we ordered the steamed sea bass, which I thought was just a tad overcooked, but the sauce was good. The colossal royal tiger prawns were really nothing to brag about, but the garlic noodles.....wow they were delicious. I would come back here, just for the garlic noodles. The drunken crab tasted like soapy dishwater to me, I guess I should have ordered the Roasted crab. The service was great, but the silverware was dirty. I would come back here, but the food is just too overpriced. A lot of these dishes you can definitely order at another restaurant for half the price and will taste just as good if not better. It's kind of funny how some of the dishes are home style type of dishes, but the names are changed to sound a lot more sophisticated so that they can charge an arm and a leg. Overall , I give the food and service a 4 stars, but they get 3 stars for overcharging for the dishes that are home style and can be found in many Vietnamese kitchens. I do know I'll be back for the garlic noodles though.

excerpts: Ordered up a bottle of Chenin Blanc and the Asian Bouillabaisse for an app... yummy, light and fruity with pineapple, shrimp, and bean sprouts.
asian bouillabaisse.author: Tara G.
asian bouillabaisse.review: Made it in there on a busy Sunday night, but got lucky b/c they had a seat for us at the moment.  Ordered up a bottle of Chenin Blanc and the Asian Bouillabaisse for an app... yummy, light and fruity with pineapple, shrimp, and bean sprouts.  I couldn't resist getting the Spicy Eggplant, which was perfect and scrumptious, and the bf got the Drunken Crab... a bad-ass meal!  So good!  They bib you up, strap you with shell-crackers, put a huge crab in front of you, and make you work!  The sauce it's marinaded in is a yummy Chardonnay butter deliciousness, that goes great with the garlic noodles they recommend.  It takes a while to break that sucka, but oh so worth it!  The restaurant has a nice ambiance with high ceilings, authentic art, and succulent aromas.  It comes with a high price tag but where can you get a huge hunk o crab, done up in several different ways, on any given Sunday?  A definite must for those crustacean cravings!

excerpts: Our table of five shared the famed roast crab ($36/crab), the garlic noodles, the jumbo prawns, spicy eggplant, salt and pepper calamari, Asian bouillabaisse, and banana cake for dessert.
The roast crab was a good size (about 2-2.5 lbs) so three of us shared one (alongside the other food).
Although pretty basic in theory, the garlic noodles were my favorite.
The roast crab was a close second - great flavor and juiciness.
Prawns weren't bad and calamari and eggplant were pretty standard (calamari was lukewarm).
Service was great, and the crowd inside was incredibly diverse (black, white, asian, everyone).
Although pricey, it's super closeby
asian bouillabaisse.author: Melinda C.
asian bouillabaisse.review: I'd been wanting to try this place for a long time, and at long last, I finally went this past Friday night.  What a random location for a pretty nice, high ambiance restaurant.  Per yelp recommendations, I made a reservation in advance so seating was easy.  Our table of five shared the famed roast crab ($36/crab), the garlic noodles, the jumbo prawns, spicy eggplant, salt and pepper calamari, Asian bouillabaisse, and banana cake for dessert.  The roast crab was a good size (about 2-2.5 lbs) so three of us shared one (alongside the other food).  Although pretty basic in theory, the garlic noodles were my favorite.  The roast crab was a close second - great flavor and juiciness.  Prawns weren't bad and calamari and eggplant were pretty standard (calamari was lukewarm).  Service was great, and the crowd inside was incredibly diverse (black, white, asian, everyone).  Although pricey, it's super closeby so I would go and try the drunken crab next time.

excerpts: We were ready to go from there and went onto order the Asian bouillabaisse soup, Fresh tiger prawns on a bed of garlic noodles, Roasted crab & an additional order of garlic noodles.
The soup came out in no time and was served at a perfect temperature.
Soon after we finished our soup our entrees were making their way to us.
Every plate delish as always.
For a treat we shared a creme brulee to calm the garliciness in our systems.
I can't express how much more enjoyable our dinner was because of Eric.
These are the people that keep the customers coming back.
See yah soon Thanh Long.
I have a feeling we'll be back sooner than we even know!!
asian bouillabaisse.author: Stephanie D.
asian bouillabaisse.review: Finally had a chance recently to revisit an original fave of mine, Thanh Long.  Came here this past Saturday to celebrate yet another bday.  Arrived around 8pm, a bit of a line for valet then we were in.  We were told it would be about a 25 min wait.  Not so bad about 20 mins into the wait the people after us were told it would be a 45 min wait.  We had the bar handy and were in no hurry.  We finally were shown to our table after the crowded waiting area almost spilled out even more out the door.  Eric our server for the night was on top of his game from his first visit to our table ready to take our beverage order.  In a quick minute he was back with our tea and water.  We were ready to go from there and went onto order the Asian bouillabaisse soup, Fresh tiger prawns on a bed of garlic noodles, Roasted crab & an additional order of garlic noodles.  The soup came out in no time and was served at a perfect temperature.  Soon after we finished our soup our entrees were making their way to us.  Every plate delish as always.  For a treat we shared a creme brulee to calm the garliciness in our systems.  I can't express how much more enjoyable our dinner was because of Eric.  These are the people that keep the customers coming back.  See yah soon Thanh Long.  I have a feeling we'll be back sooner than we even know!!

excerpts: We wanted some veggies but the Buddha rolls came out cold, and the mango salad hot and somewhat lacking, and the Asian Bouillabaisse was just tomato water with some flavor and lukewarm.
Honestly only the mussels came out piping hot as most of the other foods must have  been pr-prepared and just warmed up.
It is crab season so each crab was $37, now is the best time to go!
asian bouillabaisse.author: Patty J.
asian bouillabaisse.review: I would go with the reviews and suggestions and just order their crabs (both roasted and drunken were great), garlic noodles (which were not greasy this time!) and the fantastic green mussels.  We wanted some veggies but the Buddha rolls came out cold, and the mango salad hot and somewhat lacking, and the Asian Bouillabaisse was just tomato water with some flavor and lukewarm.  Honestly only the mussels came out piping hot as most of the other foods must have  been pr-prepared and just warmed up.  It is crab season so each crab was $37, now is the best time to go!  Plan to go back and try the tamarind crab and more mussels.  Will try take out?

excerpts: The last dishes I had were the asparagus soup which was yummy, and the sea bass, which is actually "Chilean Sea Bass"
- AKA Patagonian toothfish.
That was prepared just right, albeit on the small side.
Other items were not on the small side though, so remember to order to suit your needs.
asparagus soup.author: Steven P.
asparagus soup.review:
Quality seafood, competently prepared. It's a bit on the pricey side and it's always bustling, with less than ideal acoustics, but I've come here several times over the years and have never been disappointed no matter what I order. The last dishes I had were the asparagus soup which was yummy, and the sea bass, which is actually "Chilean Sea Bass" - AKA Patagonian toothfish. That was prepared just right, albeit on the small side. 
Other items were not on the small side though, so remember to order to suit your needs.

excerpts: I ordered Asparagus soup and the Hot and Sour soup.
They tasted ok.
asparagus soup.author: Phuong P.
asparagus soup.review:
They have good chef, I agree. Food is delicious, but it's not Vietnamese style. I know their most popular item is the Crab, but it seems like casual dinner is too much to ask here. I won't write review about the Crab. I ordered Asparagus soup and the Hot and Sour soup. They tasted ok. The Saigon Beef was totally overpriced. 

But the most disappointing thing is customer service. We had 2 people, we didn't even have napkins. I could tell they might be busy taking care of other big families ordering crabs and so, but ignoring other small tables is not all right.
