We ordered food to eat with rice, but the hostess took it wrong with garlic noodle. When the rice came, our food was already cold. I mean, being Amercanized is acceptable, but this service way was totally out of Vietnamese-cuisine-scale.

It's a fancy restaurant. If you're looking for an Asian place, this place might work. If you're looking for a Vietnamese restaurant, then I would recommend moving forward to the next place on your Yelp list.

excerpts: I'd start with the asparagus soup.
Creamy with bits of crab, it was delicious.
asparagus soup.author: Lloyd B.
asparagus soup.review:
No pho served here. But you'll enjoy the best roasted crab and garlic noodles...EVER! The crab is truly amazing and oh so flavorful. The sauce that surrounds the crab is perfect over rice too. It's a bit pricey though with each crab coming in at almost $50, but...service is unbelievably attentive and the food comes out fast!

I'd start with the asparagus soup. Creamy with bits of crab, it was delicious.  The garlic noodles are the real deal and you definitely can't pass that up either. It's not as saucy as PPQ's, but still one of the best bowl of garlic noodles you'll ever have.

Make reservations ahead of time to avoid a serious wait. Parking is next to impossible but there's always the valet. Be prepared to shell out (heh heh) quite a bit at my favorite place for crab and garlic noodles.

excerpts: Our typical order for two: crab asparagus soup to start, 1 order of garlic noodle and a crab to share (sometimes we have one each if we're feeling extra fat).
Food here is amazing, even to go the next day.
You will NOT be dissappointment.
One of my favorite restaurants of all time!
asparagus soup.author: Grace H.
asparagus soup.review: If you are looking for the best roasted crab in all of California... look no further. This place tops it all. They have this amazing secret roasted crab recipe that can never be replicated by any other place! We're tried R&G Lounge, PPQ and the like and none can even compare. The crab is wonderfully seasoned and the crab meat itself is firm and comes off the shell super easy. Our typical order for two: crab asparagus soup to start, 1 order of garlic noodle and a crab to share (sometimes we have one each if we're feeling extra fat). Food here is amazing, even to go the next day. You will NOT be dissappointment. One of my favorite restaurants of all time!

excerpts: ASPARAGUS SOUP WITH CRAB $7.50:
My mom ordered this and enjoyed it.
asparagus soup.author: Tiffany N.
asparagus soup.review:
Good food, good service, and not necessarily overpriced.

Made reservations for 6 pm New Year's Eve. We got there about half an hour early, but they seated us anyways since there was room. It's a small restaurant on the corner of the street. On the outside, it doesn't look very nice but the interior is pretty upscale.  

Loved the promptness of everything. The appetizer came within ten minutes. We were bibbed and received our main course immediately after we finished our appetizer. The waiters were attentive and helpful. They also gave us New Year's calendars on our way out. 

Here's what we got:
SALT & PEPPER CALAMARI $11.95: Good appetizer. Crisp, no sauce.

ASPARAGUS SOUP WITH CRAB $7.50: My mom ordered this and enjoyed it. Hot soup is always great when the weather is cold. 

ROAST/DRUNKEN/TAMARIND CRAB: We got one of each ($41.95 per crab). My favorite was the drunken crab. The sauce actually doesn't matter unless you dip the crab meat in the sauce on the plate. 

GARLIC NOODLES $10: This was actually really good, but I wouldn't say they're to die for. It was like eating garlic bread except they were noodles, and these noodles are the same texture as the chow mein at Panda Express. They also have the less expensive option of garlic rice, fried rice, jasmine rice, or vegetables. 

LAVA CHOCOLATE CAKE $8.25: Skip it. The lava cake is mostly syrup and on the bitter side. 

FRIED BANANA A LA MODE $6.95: Skip it. It's just regular fried banana and ice cream--nothing special.

CREME BRULEE $7.50: Again, skip it. If you are dying to have dessert here, choose this one. I'm not saying the desserts are bad at Thanh Long but there are a couple dessert shops on the same street and there are better options in driving distance.

Parents also had a FLEUR DE MANGO ($9.25) with a heineken ($5) and a HANOI SUNSET ($9).

excerpts: Anyway, our party also ordered the tamarind crab, asparagus soup, shrimp toast and either the Saigon beef or the shaken beef, I can't remember.
Those were ok.
I would not order the tamarind crab or the asparagus soup again though.
The beef was super tender and delicious, but it lacks some flavor.
I would not order the tamarind crab or the asparagus soup again though.
The beef was super tender and delicious, but it lacks some flavor.
It doesn't really taste like shaken beef.
I've had the marinade better at other places, but the tenderness here beats them all!!!
I'd definitely come back here and recommend this place to my friends.
It's better than the generic Asian foods in Chinatown!
asparagus soup.author: Truc N.
asparagus soup.review: Came here the other night for dinner and I was pretty impressed.  You wouldn't expect a restaurant like this to be located in this area.  I hope all the local San Franciscans know about this place and how good it is.  I really enjoyed the garlic noodles, salmon carpaccio, and the Lychee Martini!  I could drink like 100 of those!!!  It's sooo good!  Anyway, our party also ordered the tamarind crab, asparagus soup, shrimp toast and either the Saigon beef or the shaken beef, I can't remember.  Those were ok.  I would not order the tamarind crab or the asparagus soup again though.  The beef was super tender and delicious, but it lacks some flavor.  It doesn't really taste like shaken beef.  I've had the marinade better at other places, but the tenderness here beats them all!!!  I'd definitely come back here and recommend this place to my friends.  It's better than the generic Asian foods in Chinatown!

excerpts: you have to try the chicken or crab WHITE asparagus soup which is sweet to the taste, and the crispy spicy and sweet vermicelli rolls and then on the main
asparagus soup.author: Carissa Noelle G.
asparagus soup.review:
i grew up in this restaurant- from when it started as hole in the wall with hour long waits and now has become a new city on its own...although the crab long wait to crawl into your mouth....you have to try the chicken or crab WHITE asparagus soup which is sweet to the taste, and the crispy spicy and sweet vermicelli rolls and then on the main the course...roasted garlic crab which you finish to the last drop smothered in that peppery garlic sauce paired with white rice eaten filipino style with your hands or garlic noodles that add even more richness to your crab....if you have the chance to take a sip, order a La Crema Chardonnay which adds a buttery flavor making your meal complete....

you cant leave without trying fried banana with vanilla ice cream...yes i do leave lots of room before i come to make sure i am getting everything worth my money and time...

this place is a fun laid back spot, if you want upscale try crustaceans, but you wont get a better experience than at thank long....service is always on top, but it gets really busy here so make reservations, and parking can also be a pain, but you will need the walk after a long meal....

san francisco is the place to be....

excerpts:
SOUPS

Vermicelli Noodle Consomme - Chicken, green onions, cilantro.
vermicelli noodle consomme.author: Chelsea W.
vermicelli noodle consomme.review:
Expensive Vietnamese restaurant known for roast crab & garlic noodles! You can't miss out on those here. This is not your typical place to get pho, in fact they don't have it!

Thanh Long is more of a seafood restaurant offering large dishes you can share family style. Most of the options run around $20, and the crabs will be around $50 each. Portions are on the smaller side. We shared 2 crabs, one serving of noodles, 3 large plates and a dessert between 4 people.

The restaurant is quite spacious and our waiter was very friendly. She helped clear our plates out since we practically overflowered our table! When I ordered I made sure to get all the popular dishes.

STARTERS 

Salt & Pepper Calamari - In a light salt and pepper batter, seasoned with scallions and red peppers. These were a great pick!

SOUPS

Vermicelli Noodle Consomme - Chicken, green onions, cilantro. The soup was clean tasting and good, the chicken was tender but I would've liked the noodles to have been the more traditional pho noodles rather than clear ones.

LARGE PLATES

Shaken Beef - Tender cubes of marinated New York steak flambeed in Chardonnay served with potatoes, mixed greens & cherry tomatoes. I'm not a beef person but this seemed good as well. Ours didn't come with potatoes though, but with onions.

Lemongrass Chicken - Slices of chicken sauteed with seasonal vegetables, garlic & chili. Pretty impressed by this one! Would order again for sure.

SECRET KITCHEN DISHES 

Roast Crab - A whole Dungeness crab roasted with An's garlic sauce & secret spices.

Garlic Noodles - An's famous noodles made with our special garlic sauce & secret spices. Super flavorful and very memorable. 

DESSERT 

Fried banana a la mode - With vanilla ice cream. For $8, the portions for the fried banana was tiny! The vanilla ice cream was way too frozen when served to us. There also was way too much whipped cream.

For the price point I would expect Thanh Long to be a more classy and upscale looking restaurant. It was great overall, but a bit on the pricier side for me. I would probably come on more special occasions.

excerpts: We had rice paper rolls, vermicelli noodle consomme, mango salad, and roasted crab.
The noodle consomme had a delicious broth and was just the right way to start the meal.
The mango salad, while not bad, was not what I expected as it was cubes of sweet ripened mango on a bed of greens and was served warm.
The crab, however, was wonderful - perfectly cooked and seasoned.
I'll be back with my friends and family for sure.
vermicelli noodle consomme.author: Sonia K.
vermicelli noodle consomme.review: My colleague has been going to this unpretentious hidden gem for a long time and brought me here to try the crab. We had rice paper rolls, vermicelli noodle consomme, mango salad, and roasted crab. The noodle consomme had a delicious broth and was just the right way to start the meal. The mango salad, while not bad, was not what I expected as it was cubes of sweet ripened mango on a bed of greens and was served warm. The crab, however, was wonderful - perfectly cooked and seasoned. I'll be back with my friends and family for sure.

excerpts: Vegetable soup with dumplings: bland, boring and wished I didn't order this.
vegetable soup.author: Quynh D.
vegetable soup.review:
All of these stellar reviews have me scratching my head... I honestly wanted to love this place.  I remember coming here long ago when I was in college.  I was expecting it to be top notch but I feel this was a sub par restaurant.  First, service was seriously lacking.  I was pretty disappointed.  Read on for the low down..

Vegetable soup with dumplings: bland, boring and wished I didn't order this. Pretty bad.  

Prawns with garlic noodles:  definitely could feel the garlic in this dish.  However, noodles were overcooked and prawns were too salty.  

I didn't feel there was anything special here, it was a less than average Asian restaurant, with bad service.  I also couldn't justify spending over $50 for crab, when I could go to Crustacean and get the same thing with better ambience and service.

The food came out sporadically and it took them forever to bring out a fried rice order.  I had to ask multiple times and waited for an equally long time just for a soda.  And to top it off, the waiter forgot to put in an appetizer order (after other waiters had confirmed it was on its way).  It was like being served by the 3 stooges, that's literally what it felt like.  Everybody running around, but no one was actually doing their job.  Two thumbs down!

excerpts: When I ordered the vegetable soup with seafood wontons (btw the best thing we had), I asked to split it with my dinner partner.
Not only did the waiter forget to bring a bowl, but he brought the soup
AT THE SAME TIME as all the entrees!
Who does that?
Who in their right mind brings soup at the same time as entrees?
Someone who wants cold entrees, that's who.
I asked him to bring my entree back because it was going to get cold, and he said he'd have the kitchen make another one, but he was a liar, and just put it under the lights.
vegetable soup.author: Rob C.
vegetable soup.review:
I have no idea why this place is so popular.

I went there about 10 years ago, and thought their crab expensive, about $25 for one crab, which we ordered several of and shared. I also had the prawns, wait, that's being generous, one HUGE prawn split in half and grilled, served over garlic noodles. But $25 for ONE PRAWN?!

Well I went there again against my better judgement on Saturday night and the food is not any better, but it's much more expensive. I cannot believe the pricing.

$42 for ONE CRAB. Yes, it's got some "secret spices" on it, so what? I can get better fresh crab in many Chinese restaurants for half the price. For that kind of money I expect live lobster.

$37 for FOUR SMALL SHRIMP. It's not even one huge "how did they even find a prawn this big?" prawn anymore, it's FOUR SMALL SHRIMP on a bed of garlic noodles. With "secret spices". The real secret is that they're laughing all the way to the bank getting people to pay this kind of money for something that should be $12.

The place has gone upscale, with fancy expensive mixed drinks, and better decor, but you pay for it.

Then there was the service. Constant, polite attention, but always a feeling of being rushed so they could get the next seating in. When I ordered the vegetable soup with seafood wontons (btw the best thing we had), I asked to split it with my dinner partner. Not only did the waiter forget to bring a bowl, but he brought the soup AT THE SAME TIME as all the entrees! Who does that? Who in their right mind brings soup at the same time as entrees? Someone who wants cold entrees, that's who. I asked him to bring my entree back because it was going to get cold, and he said he'd have the kitchen make another one, but he was a liar, and just put it under the lights. It was drying out when it came back.

The prawns were extremely average (and overcooked having sat under the lights while I enjoyed my soup), the crab a PITA to shell, Dungeness always is, so much work for so little meat. If you really want good crab order fresh King Crab legs from many places in Alaska and have them overnighted once crab season opens, you'll enjoy tender succulent huge sausages of meat that don't need "secret spices." Or anything, you just eat them.

I was disappointed that the prawns had shrunk, and the noodles are fine, but if you really want noodles go to a good Italian place, they do them better.

Dessert was a lemon sorbet with cream inside a hollowed out lemon. A for presentation, but they should just skip the cream. Either make ice cream or sorbet, but the mixing of the two is an unhappy marriage.

I literally have no idea why this place is popular, and how they can get away with charging what they do. The food is average at absolute best, and the pricing is ridiculous.

excerpts: my mom got the vegetable soup, I got some sort of chicken version-
vegetable soup.author: Lai-Nin W.
vegetable soup.review:
Went here a few months ago with my parents to take them out to dinner. The crab IS delicious, and the service was spectacular... Even on a busy night our waiter took good care of us.

The roasted crab and garlic noodles were great! The soups...not so much. my mom got the vegetable soup, I got some sort of chicken version- both were unfortunately bland, a bit under-seasoned.

Other than that though, if you're here for crab and noodles- you've come to the right place! Beware of parking though- esp. at the dinner hour it can get super crazy!

excerpts: we had vegetable soup, soft shell crab, curry shrimp, sautee veggies, roasted crab, tamarind crab, and garlic noodles.
the vegetable soup is basically swansons with diced vegetables.the curry shrimp was spicy but the shrimp was fresh.
i liked the roasted crab better than the tamarind crab.
im not a huge fan of garlic noodles,  they can be dry but oily.
vegetable soup.author: claudia y.
vegetable soup.review:
we came here on a thursday night and all tables were full.  they dont seat you until most of your party is here.  

we had vegetable soup, soft shell crab, curry shrimp, sautee veggies, roasted crab, tamarind crab, and garlic noodles.

overall the food was decent though not exceptional.  the vegetable soup is basically swansons with diced vegetables.the curry shrimp was spicy but the shrimp was fresh.  i liked the roasted crab better than the tamarind crab.  

i think overall im not a huge fan of garlic noodles,  they can be dry but oily.

excerpts: Also ordered the vegetable soup.
vegetable soup.author: amanda c.
vegetable soup.review:
I think the only 3 things that are good here are the roast crab, garlic noodles, and the colossal tiger prawns. We also ordered the jumbo prawn wontons which literally was a shrimp w/ its tail stil on it inside a fried egg roll wrapper. So when you eat the "wonton" you get a big bite of a crunchy tail. Gross. It had no flavor. I thought I would get something more interesting for the exorbitant price. Also ordered the vegetable soup. It was Meh..

I thought the service was ok. I felt like they were just trying to get us out of there. I was still eating some crab and the bus boy came and cleared the crab bowl and crab plate away. I was like..hello! i'm still eating here!

So, I'd stick with the 3 items mentioned above and wouldn't deviate from them. Overall, 4 stars for the garlic noodles and crab.

excerpts: We ordered the tamarind crab, Traditional Vietnamese Salad, garlic noodles, shaken beef.
The Traditional Vietnamese Salad was not authentic and consisted mostly of very thinly sliced cabbage drenched in a too sweet dressing.
The Vietnamese Salad or "Goi" should have more herbs.
The famous garlic noodles was not all that.
Saturate your noodles in butter and garlic powder and you will have the same thing at home.
The shaken beef was not tender and lack of sauce of a traditional "Bò lúc lc

"
And finally, the pièce de résistance, tamarind crab was a greasy mess served on a puddle of clarified butter.
I was not able to taste the tamarind.
Here again, I have had better versions at other restaurants without a "Secret Kitchen"
This was an overpriced and poorly executed Vietnamese food and it shows that hype and marketing of the "Secret Kitchen Dishes" can fool a lot of people, at least once.
traditional vietnamese salad.author: OngTayDen N.
traditional vietnamese salad.review:
For years I have read about the positive press about this place. We ordered the tamarind crab, Traditional Vietnamese Salad, garlic noodles, shaken beef.  The short review is everything was mediocre and any regular Vietnamese restaurant can do the dishes better. 

The Traditional Vietnamese Salad was not authentic and consisted mostly of very thinly sliced cabbage drenched in a too sweet dressing.  The Vietnamese Salad or "Goi" should have more herbs.
The famous garlic noodles was not all that.  Saturate your noodles in butter and garlic powder and you will have the same thing at home.
The shaken beef was not tender and lack of sauce of a traditional "Bò lúc lc"
And finally, the pièce de résistance, tamarind crab was a greasy mess served on a puddle of clarified butter. I was not able to taste the tamarind. Here again, I have had better versions at other restaurants without a "Secret Kitchen"
This was an overpriced and poorly executed Vietnamese food and it shows that hype and marketing of the "Secret Kitchen Dishes" can fool a lot of people, at least once.

excerpts: Traditional Vietnamese Salad: 4
It lacked the other  items I was expecting in a traditional Vietnamese salad (goi) such as crispy shallots, cilantro, etc.
traditional vietnamese salad.author: Will H.
traditional vietnamese salad.review:
Finally got to go here after a couple failed attempts due to timing. Overall it was a tasty meal. 

Traditional Vietnamese Salad: 4
It lacked the other  items I was expecting in a traditional Vietnamese salad (goi) such as crispy shallots, cilantro, etc. It was basic but tasty. 

Garlic Noodles: 5
Ah, the famous An's garlic noodles. Totally worth it. Garlicky, oily but not overly oily, and best of all the noodles were the perfect texture. Probably the best garlic noodles I've ever had.

Roast Crab: 3.5
Tasty yes, and particularly liked the butter and pepper that the crab was roasted in. I just didn't think it was worth the effort and cost. When I come back, I'd probably go for the garlic noodles again and order other entrees. 

Great wine selection.

excerpts: We started with their Traditional Vietnamese Salad, basically it was shredded cabbage, a little carrot, no cucumber as advertised and when the waitress set it down, said they were out of peanuts.
It was topped with 4 or 5 shrimp, and we couldn't taste the dressing.
If it weren't for the bowl of chili sauce would have been tasteless.
traditional vietnamese salad.author: Carole W.
traditional vietnamese salad.review:
This is a restaurant I have wanted to try for years, but I have to say it is overrated and they are living on their laurels of the past.

We started with their Traditional Vietnamese Salad, basically it was shredded cabbage, a little carrot, no cucumber as advertised and when the waitress set it down, said they were out of peanuts.  It was topped with 4 or 5 shrimp, and we couldn't taste the dressing.  If it weren't for the bowl of chili sauce would have been tasteless.  We ordered the roasted crab and garlic noodles.  The noodles were over cooked, did not have the chewy texture other Vietnamese restaurants in my hood serve.  The crab was drenched in butter, the spice was hard to determine.  All in all, not a great experience food wise.  There are better restaurants to experience roasted crab.  It was also expensive.  The only reason for two stars, ambience and service is decent.  Maybe we just hit a bad night, but I much prefer PPQ on Clement.

excerpts: The traditional Vietnamese salad and mango salad is bomb, very light but good.
traditional vietnamese salad.author: Precious Ethel P.
traditional vietnamese salad.review:
This has got to be my favorite restaurant!  I will take seafood any day than meat and this place meets my expectations continuously.  Although, they have very limited parking because it is in the city and around a residential area, they provide Valet!  I recommend valet unless you get lucky enough to park in front of the restaurant but goodluck!  Its either street parking or valet because they don't have a private lot.

When we go here, we usually dress more business casual but it totally doesn't matter, you'll get your hands dirty anyways.  The outside of the restaurant doesn't look very pleasing/fancy but the inside looks 10x better!  We ALWAYS ALWAYS make a reservation because they get very busy, especially during the weekends.  The waiting area is quite small but they have a full bar where you can sit, wait, and have a drink.  The restaurant isn't the biggest and it gets a little tight in there, but fortunately, they do have an upstairs area.

Their customer service here is perfect.  They aren't overwhelming, but they are quick to refill your water, and they're always walking around, that way if you need something they're easily accessible.  Everyone is quick, friendly, Americanized (no racial) and professional.

The food is astounding!  We start off with ordering the Salt & Pepper Calamari, sounds plain, but it's the most flavorful calamari ever.  My boyfriend and I always share 1 crab because they are HUGE with lots of meat.  There are different flavors of crab but our favorite is the Roast Crab.  We've tried the others but Roast Crab is my all-time favorite.  We order garlic noodles on the side and the fried banana with vanilla ice cream for dessert.  The traditional Vietnamese salad and mango salad is bomb, very light but good.  If you do want to order some type of meat, the Shaken beef is super tender and melts in your mouth!  EVERYTHING IS JUST DELICIOUS AND HEAVENLY.

The food is comparable to PPQ, if you've ever been there, however, Thanh Long is more expensive but you get what you pay for!  I think PPQ is more on the casual side but if you want to be a little fancier, Thanh Long is the place.

You will not walk out of here disappointed!

excerpts: We had a cocktail each, which were not memorable, and ordered the Traditional Vietnamese Salad, Garlic Noodles, and of course, the Roast Crab.
Everything was light and delightfully flavorful, as I had remembered.
The garlic noodles were al dente with enough garlic to invade your senses but not overpower.
Thanh Long was started by the An family 30 years ago and I consider this establishment a true classic cuisine staple of San Francisco.
traditional vietnamese salad.author: Dennis W.
traditional vietnamese salad.review:
It has been nearly 10 years since I had last dined at Thanh Long. Back then, the Roast Crab was literally pushed out of through a hatch in the wall(barely the size of the dish) and then the hatch was quickly closed as if they closely guarding a treasured family recipe(which they probably were).
The dining space has since expanded and the decor is tasteful if not somewhat pedestrian now. But that's ok, because Thanh Long is all about the roast crab for me and the droves of patrons that eagerly walk through their doors every day.
We had a cocktail each, which were not memorable, and ordered the Traditional Vietnamese Salad, Garlic Noodles, and of course, the Roast Crab.
Everything was light and delightfully flavorful, as I had remembered. The Roast Crab had a nicely weighted blend of black pepper, butter, garlic, and various other spices. The garlic noodles were al dente with enough garlic to invade your senses but not overpower.
Thanh Long was started by the An family 30 years ago and I consider this establishment a true classic cuisine staple of San Francisco.

excerpts:
During my visits, I've also tried the Seabass, Drunken Crab, Tamarind Crab, Mussels, Salt & Pepper Calamari, Garlic Noodles, and the Traditional Vietnamese Salad.  
I'm still not a fan of the Drunken Crab, Tamarind Crab, or the Garlic Noodles, but all the others were pretty good.

I'm still not a fan of the Drunken Crab, Tamarind Crab, or the Garlic Noodles, but all the others were pretty good.

I'm still not a fan of the Drunken Crab, Tamarind Crab, or the Garlic Noodles, but all the others were pretty good.
traditional vietnamese salad.author: Ninja H.
traditional vietnamese salad.review:
Still come for my crab fix when I can't order it from Mom, but I don't know if I've just been coming too often or if the crab quality really has gone down.  Like I said, still incredibly delish but something's a lil off...idk!

I've been more than my share of times but thought my most recent trip about a week after crab season started would've been the best visit.  Sadly, it was the same crab quality as when it wasn't crab season. Hmmm...

Well, it won't sway me!  I'm still gettin down and messy in the Roasted Crab garlic butter...and a nice stiff drink!  And still ordering the Shaken Beef when my taste buds call for it.  

During my visits, I've also tried the Seabass, Drunken Crab, Tamarind Crab, Mussels, Salt & Pepper Calamari, Garlic Noodles, and the Traditional Vietnamese Salad.  I'm still not a fan of the Drunken Crab, Tamarind Crab, or the Garlic Noodles, but all the others were pretty good.

Still recommend to others, and will still continue to patronize when Mom's kitchen's out of crustacean! ;0)

excerpts: We had the Mango Salad (warm with a perfect hint of charred flavor), and the Traditional Vietnamese Salad (it was good, but the other dishes overshadow this one).
traditional vietnamese salad.author: Sam W.
traditional vietnamese salad.review:
When this place was recommend to me, I was unassuming and figured, "Oh, ok, Vietnamese seafood joint...should be the usual family-style Asian restaurant."  So, we went on ahead and made reservations for the day before.  The day of, I see this sort of hideous, unassuming exterior--it looks like any generic abandoned Richmond/Sunset shop/boutique.  When we enter, it's a completely different story--dimmed lighting, modern decor, tablecloths, etc.  We are ~10 minutes late (parking was a pain in the neighborhood), yet they seat us promptly.  

The staff is friendly and helpful (they helped us pick out items for our group and make recommendations based on our party size). I order a bottle of wine that ends up being a twist-cap, but our waiter still makes the motions and lets me sample first.  When it comes time for eating, the staff helps us put on our bibs, brings extra napkins without having to be asked, and replaces our plates and bowls whenever things started to get messy.  Oh yeah, and brownie points on attentiveness--my water never goes empty.  (Sort of silly, but small gestures like these make for a good impression with me.)

The food itself, in summary, is rich and filling in the most gluttonous fashion. We had the Mango Salad (warm with a perfect hint of charred flavor), and the Traditional Vietnamese Salad (it was good, but the other dishes overshadow this one). You might need a coronary bypass after going through the Thanh Long Mussels, Roast Crab, and Garlic Noodles, but it's worth every cent of your health insurance deductible if you have it.  You see the oil on the plates,  but with every bite, your senses don't register it as "just" oil.  Instead, a bite of the garlic noodles dressed with some drippings from the roast crab feels like your mouth is being coated in silken, mouth-filling luxury.  As you swallow, you are overwhelmed with a noise in your head--that noise is your brain screaming, "MORE MORE MORE!!!"

Pure crack.

When the bill comes, we see gratuity tagged on, but it's pre-tax and pre-alcohol (as with everything else, Thanh Long gets it right).  When you divide everything up for the type of service and food we experienced here, it comes to about $40-ish per person, and worth every darn penny.  

Thanh Long, we'll definitely be back.

excerpts: We started off with a traditional Vietnamese salad comprising of shredded cabbage, and shrimp in a kind of sweet rice vingarette sauce.
The crab was in butter with copious amount of pepper, tasty.
traditional vietnamese salad.author: Wayne L.
traditional vietnamese salad.review:
My friend was craving Thanh Long's famous roasted crab and garlic noodles.  Since it is crab season, I was in favor of her suggestion.  I visited Thanh Long more then 20 years ago.  Back then, it was a dive with cheesy decor.  It has been up graded with a full bar and frescos on the walls.  The restaurant is well lit and comfortable.

Once you walk in, wading through the crowd in the tiny front lobby.  tip-make reservations for two or more.  there's a full bar on the right before you walk up to the host station.  

We started off with a traditional Vietnamese salad comprising of shredded cabbage, and shrimp in a kind of sweet rice vingarette sauce.  The crab was in butter with copious amount of pepper, tasty.  Ordered the garlic noodles too.  My companion added chili sauce to the already tasty noodles to, "give it a kick."  Great idea!  Add the crab meat and Ooooo.  Don't worry about messing up your clothes, they put on a huge plastic bib on you.  They also give you hot towels to wipe your hands after eating crab.

We sipped a lemon drop with Chambord.  Good.

Dinner coupled with great company and it was a nice time and meal. 

Service was very attentive, but not intrusive.  

I would give it more stars except it was not spectacular in uniqueness.  Although I noticed there are varieties of other delectable items on the menu.  Who am I to say?  There were people still coming in at 9:30 for dinner.

excerpts: We finally ordered some dishes and they were all pretty mediocre but the worst ones were the Traditional Vietnamese Salad Of Cucumbers and the Saigon Beef.
The chicken in the salad tasted like it had been cooked many days prior and thrown in the microwave a handful of times and the meat was way too chewy and lacking freshness.
traditional vietnamese salad.author: Anna P.
traditional vietnamese salad.review:
I would not wish this restaurant on my worst enemy! I don't think I have ever disliked a restaurant so much- this place doesn't deserve any stars! 

When I entered the restaurant,  I was taken completely by surprise- first time I had ever seen a Vietnamese restaurant look so fancy.  That's probably why I didn't think much of it when the staff completely looked down on us when my mom and I entered the restaurant.  We had been shopping all day so yea we did not have on our best clothes but we weren't wearing sweats either.  

Anyways, when I opened the menu, I was a little disappointed with the lack of choices they had.  I guess, that's why people love this place because it isn't your typical whole in the wall Vietnamese place hat has about 50 different choices of pho and that's pretty much it- instead they really emphasize their crab.  But because we are both allergic to crab, we didn't have many options to choose from.  We finally ordered some dishes and they were all pretty mediocre but the worst ones were the Traditional Vietnamese Salad Of Cucumbers and the Saigon Beef. The chicken in the salad tasted like it had been cooked many days prior and thrown in the microwave a handful of times and the meat was way too chewy and lacking freshness.  The prices certainly did not reflect on the quality of the food. 

Definitely do not go here if you do not plan on ordering crab!

excerpts: Traditional Vietnamese Salad
: i'm glad we ordered some sort of veggie dish.
for the most, it was tasty but the fish sauce was overly sweet and not salty/savory enough.
traditional vietnamese salad.author: Thanh N.
traditional vietnamese salad.review:
Actually more like a 3.5... 

I fell in love with their garlic noodles and roasted  crab a few years ago and luckily my family has somehow PERFECTED this meal at home. So when I came back recently for a birthday dinner, every single person ordered garlic noodles and roasted crab and a bunch of appetizers. Sad to say, it wasn't as good as I remembered. 

Lychee Martini: for the price, probably not worth it. I was able to thoroughly enjoy it which isn't a good thing for all of you alcoholics out there, seeing as how I can easily k.o. after 1/3 a beer bottle.

Thanh Long Mussels: served on a slice of baguette with pesto sauce. this was pretty good, although I didn't appreciate how it was swimming in butter, but hey if you're going to eat at Thanh Long, the last thing you should do is count calories right?

Traditional Vietnamese Salad: i'm glad we ordered some sort of veggie dish. for the most, it was tasty but the fish sauce was overly sweet and not salty/savory enough. it really needs more of a kick that "Vietnamese vinaigrette" usually has. 

We also ordered a few more appetizers, but I can't seem to recall them, I guess they weren't too memorable in my book. Oh well!

Roasted Crab: still freakin delicious. I love how no matter what time of the year you come here, the crabs are always ginormous and fresh! 

Garlic Noodles: Such a sad disappointment! What happened to the garlic in garlic noodles?? You can smell it, but for some reason you can't taste it at all. *sigh* what a tease! For the most part, it was pretty bland, and tasted like they only used garlic powder, so there wasn't any real, fresh, authentic garlic bite to it. So, so sad. 

For dessert, we all shared a bunch, in case you go thinking my belly is some sort of bottomless pit (I wish). 

Fried Banna a la Mode: It tastes exactly what it sounds like. it was good, but nothing mind blowing.

Orange Sorbet: it was served in a frozen orange shell and was rock hard. Whatever shavings of this sorbet I manage to get before giving up, was light, and refreshing. If only it was easier to eat. 

Traditional Banana Cake a la Mode: Okay, I don't even know how to contain myself on this one. I'm not a crazy fan of bananas, but omg. This has become one of the best desserts I've ever had in my whole entire life. I dream of the day that I go back to Thanh Long just for this orgasmic worthy dessert. I might be over hyping it, but it was pretty damn good. The bananas in the cake added a nice caramelized texture, and when you eat it with a spoon of ice cream, the mixture of hot and cold, sweet and savory all just mixes in your mouth, making it a perfect ending to any meal.

So to conclude my dining experience, here's your take home message: do NOT forget to order the banana cake a la mode. or else you're just shooting yourself in the foot. Happy eating!

excerpts: My sister did all the ordering; Drunken Crab/Tamarind Crab/Roasted Crab/Garlic Noodles/Salt & Pepper Calamari/Lemongrass Beef Skewers/Spicy Eggplant/Mango Salad/Shrimp Fried Rice/Steamed Seabass.
Garlic noodles were overcooked/soggy and didn't have enough garlic flavor.
All the portions were pretty small.
The crabs tasted average; nothing special.
PPQ
Dungeness is better in my opinion.
Glad
I got to finally try Thanh Long but not impressed with the food.
mango salad.author: Karen L.
mango salad.review:
Located on a corner. Looks sorta like a house from the outside. Parking was hard to find. Valet option $13. Came here for my sister's 26th birthday since we heard a lot of great things about this place. We had a party of 7; did a same day reservation. Anyway, arrived 15m early and hung out at the bar in front for a bit. Thanks bartender for the great tasting Virgin Mango Daiquiri!

We were taken upstairs to be seated. My sister did all the ordering; Drunken Crab/Tamarind Crab/Roasted Crab/Garlic Noodles/Salt & Pepper Calamari/Lemongrass Beef Skewers/Spicy Eggplant/Mango Salad/Shrimp Fried Rice/Steamed Seabass. 

All of the food was "okay." Garlic noodles were overcooked/soggy and didn't have enough garlic flavor. All the portions were pretty small. The crabs tasted average; nothing special. PPQ Dungeness is better in my opinion. Glad I got to finally try Thanh Long but not impressed with the food.

excerpts: like I was expecting..) and we ordered the salt and pepper calamari, mango salad, and Vietnamese salad (both salads had very little vegetables and just a lot of fluff / fruit) as appetizers.
For entrees, we got colossal tiger prawns
mango salad.author: Leslie T.
mango salad.review:
I had heard good things about Thanh Long but was disappointed in how expensive everything was, how small the portions were and how rude the customer service was. Upon entering, I had 3 out of a party of 5 and there is a strict rule saying that parties that are more than 10 minutes late  will automatically be put on the waitlist. That's normal - totally OK with that - but there were so many open tables and so many people in the waiting area, it made me think "are all these people waiting really just partial parties?" The waiting area is super small; we were all shoulder to shoulder with each other and bumping elbows. The other 2 in our party came within the 10 minutes (we made a reservation via Yelp! but didn't get any Cash Back rewards for it like I was expecting..) and we ordered the salt and pepper calamari, mango salad, and Vietnamese salad (both salads had very little vegetables and just a lot of fluff / fruit) as appetizers. For entrees, we got colossal tiger prawns (yes they were big but only enough for 1 prawn per person o.o), Roast Crab, Thanh Long Fish and Spicy Eggplant. Portions were PUNY and off-putting... furthermore, our waiter got a little sassy with us and when I reminded him we had a birthday, he snapped back and said "Yeah, you tell your waiter which is ME and you already told me". Sheesh - didn't seem like you got it the first time so sorry for double checking... 

I prefer garlic noodles with lobster. There are so many places in LA where you can get garlic butter noodles with lobster for half the price, double the quantity and even more delicious. Yes, we're not in LA but even Perilla and Cajun House's prices are more reasonable, portions are justified and quality of food is even better. I wouldn't come back.

excerpts: Great Mango Salad!
That was my favorite dish.
Salty and sweet, warm salad.
Delicious!
Unfortunately I didn't take a pic of it.
mango salad.author: Letitia L.
mango salad.review:
Great Mango Salad!  That was my favorite dish.  Salty and sweet, warm salad.  Delicious!  Unfortunately I didn't take a pic of it.
Salt and pepper calamari, roasted crab, and garlic noodles were good.
Make reservations!

excerpts: For starters, I decided to try the Mango Salad after seeing many Yelpers rave about it.
It has bell peppers, scallops (couldn't find any), and shrimps (previously frozen) mixed with greens.
It smelled and tasted good but was very oily!
Not your typical *healthy* salad.
mango salad.author: Trang T.
mango salad.review:
*Very long overdue review*

Came here for my 22nd birthday dinner (on a Friday.) To be honest, we only picked Thanh Long because PPQ (the actual crab restaurant we wanted to try) was unexpectedly closed. Originally, we made a reservation for 6:30PM but thought we needed more time to get there/find parking so we called at 5PM and they let us change our reservation to 7PM instead. Luckily, we were able to find parking about a block down and decided to come earlier (6:45PM). The server said that we have to wait until our reservation which is totally understandable. We were seated within 10 minutes. 

 For starters, I decided to try the Mango Salad after seeing many Yelpers rave about it. It has bell peppers, scallops (couldn't find any), and shrimps (previously frozen) mixed with greens. It smelled and tasted good but was very oily! Not your typical *healthy* salad. 
For the main courses, we got the Roast Crab and Garlic Noodles (obviously!). Ooooh my god the crab was so good! The crab was so buttery I think my heart almost gave out. How did they make the meat inside taste so buttery though!? The garlic noodles were pretty bland but drenched in butter. The menu states that the noddles were made with "secret spices"... does that mean no spice at all because it was honestly so bland. 
~ I was so full after this but my *amazing* bf decided to get me a chocolate lava cake anyway because "we have to have cake on your birthday!"~
The lava cake was way too sweet but I didn't mind because I was in such a good mood. 
Then the check came...  This restaurant is honestly reserved for special occasions only because wow... the crab itself costed about $68+? *dead* I'm sorry babe 
All in all, I was blown away by the crab (and the price tag on it) but everything else was mediocre.

excerpts: We chose to sample the mango salad as an app.
This was a great starter that was refreshing and as much as I LOVE onions (especially red onions), the onions in this dish were a bit overpowering.
But don't let this take away from the dish as a whole.
The mango salad includes chopped shrimp, bell peppers and we were pleasantly surprised to find bits of chopped scallops all tossed together in a raspberry vinaigrette.
mango salad.author: Jonathan Z.
mango salad.review:
You can't come to Thang Long and not have a full Dungeness crab and the garlic noodles. We made reservations way ahead of time but be sure to keep them or you'll get charged per head.

We started off dinner with a few drinks. The pear martini was a very well balanced drink that had a subtle hint of pear and not an overwhelming sweet aftertaste.

We chose to sample the mango salad as an app. This was a great starter that was refreshing and as much as I LOVE onions (especially red onions), the onions in this dish were a bit overpowering. But don't let this take away from the dish as a whole. The mango salad includes chopped shrimp, bell peppers and we were pleasantly surprised to find bits of chopped scallops all tossed together in a raspberry vinaigrette.

The main attraction was the garlic noodles and the full Dungeness crabs. The garlic noodles, though seemingly plain, are packed with a lot of flavor and for those who love garlic, you won't be disappointed. And while the roasted crab is the crowd favorite, we opted for the crab prepared with tamarind sauce instead. We were very happy with our selection, even after the waiter told us the roasted crab was "the most popular." The legs were all full of meat and the sauce was delicious, especially paired with the garlic noodles. Not a morsel was spared. 

I can see why this place gets busy and I'll def be back the next time I'm up in the Bay Area. It isn't a far Uber or Lyft ride from the city. If you're considering coming by, do it. You'll be glad you did.

excerpts: I've heard good things about the Charbroiled Colossal Royal Tiger Prawns and the Mango Salad
but once I get there my old faithful selection summons my soul.
mango salad.author: Sheri L.
mango salad.review:
This has been hands down my #1 Seafood spot for the last 15+ years. This place is great for a dinner date but because it's not super romantic due to the fact that they stay so busy, it also works for a small group of  friends or family. 

My number one tip make reservations! Also you can find parking if you're willing to walk a few blocks sometimes it is worth it to save that almost $20 valet parking. They open at 5 it's always easier to get in and out if you go right when they open. If not just make those reservations ahead of time. Either way, despite the crowd, once you get seated the wait for the food is never too long.

The food is definitely the highlight. I consider trying new things everytime I go. I've heard good things about the Charbroiled Colossal Royal Tiger Prawns and the Mango Salad but once I get there my old faithful selection summons my soul. My wife and I get 2 Roast Garlic Crab, Garlic Noodles and we split the Crab Puff appetizer. All the dipping butter you need for your crab is right on your plate. I swear the flavor is something special especially worth the black pepper they add to the garlic butter. And the flavor is just not in the butter or on the shell but it's in the meat of the crab. That's hard to come by.

The staff is very attentive at they keep close eye on your bowl that you place your shells in. As soon as the bowl fills up there and there to swap it out for a new one. At the end of your meal they treat you to a plate of steaming hot towels to get rid of all the excess butter on your hands. I love this place!!

excerpts: Mango salad full of mango and dressing not over powering.
Next to me they had calamari that looked delicious.
Got a parking space a block away but my friend circled 15 min.
Go to mango medley two blocks down for chinese dessert to finish off a perfect night.
I tried to do yelp reservation with credit card but it didnt work.
My friend called in her reservation without credit card.
Also, there is a sign that said if you don't show up within 15 min your reservation will be canceled.
Dont know if they will enforce this rule.
There were plenty of seats on a week night.
There is a nice bar and all kinds of concoction drinks appear.
mango salad.author: Helen L.
mango salad.review: Service was wonderful and attentive, friendly.  Roasted crab was a 2 lb about 58.00 was juicy and done perfectly.  You've got your bib, crab paraphernalia-cracker and small fork, big bowl for crab shells.  Garlic noodle was thin noodles.  Garlic rice with a hint of garlic.  Mango salad full of mango and dressing not over powering.  Next to me they had calamari that looked delicious.  Got a parking space a block away but my friend circled 15 min.  Go to mango medley two blocks down for chinese dessert to finish off a perfect night.  I tried to do yelp reservation with credit card but it didnt work.  My friend called in her reservation without credit card.  Also, there is a sign that said if you don't show up within 15 min your reservation will be canceled.  Dont know if they will enforce this rule.  There were plenty of seats on a week night. There is a nice bar and all kinds of concoction drinks appear.

excerpts: Our party of four ordered three crabs, the sea bass, an order of garlic noodles and an order of garlic rice, two appetizers (mango salad and calamari) and each of the ladies had two alcoholic beverages - the only male in our party had 4.
We had two roast crabs and the one cooked with wine.
The mango salad was very good.
The mangoes were sweet and the shrimp was very fresh.
The fried garlic rice and the garlic noodles lacked a little bit of flavor however we sopped up the sauce from the roast crab to make the rice and noodles flavorful.
The fried garlic rice and the garlic noodles lacked a little bit of flavor however we sopped up the sauce from the roast crab to make the rice and noodles flavorful.
mango salad.author: Wendy G.
mango salad.review:
The food is so freaking good! I teetered between giving Thanh Long 4 stars or 5 stars. The roast crab is so expensive but so effing good!!!

We made a reservation and were seated within five minutes on a busy Saturday evening. There's a $13 valet parking setup in front of the restaurant. We utilized the service since parking in this area can be challenging. Besides it was very cold and raining. The guys in valet were friendly. They got a little behind in the evening but to be expected with the weather and with the large number of people who left the restaurant the same time we did.

Our party of four ordered three crabs, the sea bass, an order of garlic noodles and an order of garlic rice, two appetizers (mango salad and calamari) and each of the ladies had two alcoholic beverages - the only male in our party had 4.  We had two roast crabs and the one cooked with wine. Hands-down the roast crab was everyone's favorite. 

The sea bass was tender but lacked seasoning - a little salt could have helped. The bok choy on this plate was yummy. One of my friends is a country boy from Georgia and he had his first taste of bok choy at this restaurant. He fell in love with it. 

The calamari was so good the greedy ones ‍ at the table contemplated ordering a second one. The mango salad was very good. The mangoes were sweet and the shrimp was very fresh. Everything we had that evening was fresh.

The fried garlic rice and the garlic noodles lacked a little bit of flavor however we sopped up the sauce from the roast crab to make the rice and noodles flavorful. 

We didn't order dessert because one of my friends didn't wear stretchy pants and we did not want to eat dessert in front of her. 

The service was great! Staff were friendly. Our waiter was attentive. We had a great time eating and catching up with dear friends.

Review updated to fix grammatical errors (damn autocorrect).

excerpts: It didn't take us long to decide on what classic dishes to get; the mango salad was fascinating--half cooked and half raw, it came with mango, bell peppers, and shrimp, and was a nice refreshing dish to contrast with the other heavier dishes.
Of course, we got the roasted crab, which was covered in butter and seasoning and was delicious--it was surprisingly easy to peel, as the shell seemed somewhat softer than other crabs I've had.
mango salad.author: David K.
mango salad.review:
Who could ever guess that in this little residential corner of the Sunset District would sit such an upscale restaurant that even offers valet parking? Thanh Long is a Vietnamese-fusion restaurant that serves refined Vietnamese and upscale seafood dishes, and I came with a group of four for dinner on a Saturday night. After a short wait, we were seated in the spacious, bright dining room by our friendly server.

It didn't take us long to decide on what classic dishes to get; the mango salad was fascinating--half cooked and half raw, it came with mango, bell peppers, and shrimp, and was a nice refreshing dish to contrast with the other heavier dishes. Of course, we got the roasted crab, which was covered in butter and seasoning and was delicious--it was surprisingly easy to peel, as the shell seemed somewhat softer than other crabs I've had. The garlic noodles were drenched in butter and absolutely decadent, and the shaking beef was fantastic as well--the filet cubes were tender and cooked a nice medium rare, and the sear and marinade on the beef imparted a nice umami flavor.

Overall, this was an extremely enjoyable meal in a lively setting with quick and friendly service. The only drawback was the high price point for the dishes--the moderately-sized crab was over $50, and you could probably get the other more typical Vietnamese dishes elsewhere for much cheaper. Still, this was a great experience and I would definitely recommend Thanh Long for a seafood splurge!

excerpts: We had the calamari, mango salad, garlic noodles, roast crab, eggplant dish and fried rice.
It was a feast!
Paired well with bottle of white wine.
Only minor hiccup is parking, no lot, I circled the block three times before parking three blocks away.
To find they offer valet for $13.
mango salad.author: Vee V.
mango salad.review: Stopped here for dinner on our first night in San Fran.  It did not disappoint. Everything was delicious and service was excellent, we were seated right away. We had the calamari, mango salad, garlic noodles, roast crab, eggplant dish and fried rice. It was a feast!  Paired well with bottle of white wine. Only minor hiccup is parking, no lot, I circled the block three times before parking three blocks away. To find they offer valet for $13.

excerpts: We ordered Calamari, Mango Salad, Chicken fried Rice, Saigon Beef & Lemongrass Chicken.
The food was delicious, perfectly seasoned, fresh ingredients, meat was juicy and tender!
The only suggestion I have is the calamari was good, but a little dry.
I like having some sort of sauce with my calamari.
mango salad.author: Laila A.
mango salad.review:
I was in SF and a friend of mines raved about this spot. So I decided to check it out. 

The outside of the restaurant looks like a hole in the wall but once inside the ambiance of the restaurant is classy but casual at the same time. Nice dim lights, small bar and plenty of privacy. The parking in SF is a bi%#h, and we drove around a couple times before we decided to valet our car. The valet cost $12 (a little pricey, but that's SF for you) and the guy who did the valet was not the most pleasant person. Once inside, we were greeted by the host and the manager. They were busy with large parties but we were only a party of 3 and were sat right away. The server brought water out and gave us a chance to look over the menu. 

We ordered Calamari, Mango Salad, Chicken fried Rice, Saigon Beef & Lemongrass Chicken. 
The food was delicious, perfectly seasoned, fresh ingredients, meat was juicy and tender! The only suggestion I have is the calamari was good, but a little dry. I like having some sort of sauce with my calamari. Besides that, everything was A+. 

If you are in the SF area, u have to check this place out. They will not disappoint!

excerpts: I also like their fried rice and heard their mango salad is delicious as well.
mango salad.author: M. H.
mango salad.review:
If you know me, you know how much I LOVED Thanh Long! This use to be my go to place whenever I felt like splurging on a good meal. Three years ago I would've given this place 5 stars. But as the years went on, I'm becoming less impressed with this place. 

The last two times I've been here, the service has been subpar. On my previous visit before tonight, I had a waitress who was not very friendly and lacked social skills. I want to feel welcomed, especially if I'm paying a crap load of money on a great meal. Tonight I had a waiter who would only talk to me and would not acknowledge my grandma (can we say awkward and weird). 

On my previous visit, I received my crab way before my garlic noodles. Uhhhhh I would like to eat my HOT crab with my HOT garlic noodles. I don't want COLD crab with HOT garlic noodles. Tonight after my grandma and I ordered, we literally received our food 5 minutes later. Either the chef was able to whip up 2 roasted crabs and 2 orders of garlic noodles in under two minutes or they just reheated our food and served it to us (hmmmm). 

As far as the food, it does not excite me as much as it use to. My roasted crab was pretty good, but it lacked garlic and was more peppery and salty (and greasy af). My garlic noodles were good but not as good as I remember them being. I also want to mention that my food went cold pretty quickly (that's what happens when you reheat food...let me stop lol).

I will say there are some good appetizers like the salt and pepper calamari and the shrimp toast. I also like their fried rice and heard their mango salad is delicious as well. I've had the Tiger Prawns on garlic noodles and it was really good (it was my very first meal here).

I would definitely recommend this place to someone who has never experienced the infamous roasted crab and garlic noodles or just want to say they've been here. I personally don't see myself coming back here, unless its for a special event. I also want to mention that although they are the same family, Thanh Long is better than Crustaceans only because Crustaceans taste differently...and not in a good way.

excerpts: Mango salad was so light, refreshing and totally delicious,  noodles were good but not great and the roasted crab was put of this world!!!!
Followed by lava cake...mmmmm good!!!
Service was not only with a smile, but prompt.
Recommended reservations, parking is tough but valet is $13 or $20.
You gotta have the mango salad and roasted crab
mango salad.author: Jan S.
mango salad.review: Can't rave enough about this place. Mango salad was so light, refreshing and totally delicious,  noodles were good but not great and the roasted crab was put of this world!!!! Followed by lava cake...mmmmm good!!!  Service was not only with a smile, but prompt. Recommended reservations, parking is tough but valet is $13 or $20.  You gotta have the mango salad and roasted crab

excerpts: We order a mango salad and some colossal prawns that were not colossals, but still good, and a $60 crab served with only ONE claw..
Which upper-class restaurant would dare serving that?
mango salad.author: Jean-Yves F.
mango salad.review:
Over rated
This is a very expensive restaurant that has a lot of flaws

We sat at a table and were ready to order. A waiter came, smiling. We placed our order. He left and asked his colleague to take our order. What was that?

We order a mango salad and some colossal prawns that were not colossals, but still good, and a $60 crab served with only ONE claw.. Which upper-class restaurant would dare serving that? That's like byuing a new Porsche coming only with 3 tires.

Oh... a woman was celebring her birthday. 2 waiters starting to sing for her.. Happy Birthday to you, Happy Birthday to you, Happy Birthday dear....big silent... Akward!
Ooops.. They did not know the name of the birthday girl!! Pretty lame....

excerpts: We ordered to mango salad the taste was incredible.
mango salad.author: Hicran K.
mango salad.review: This place is awesome. We ordered to mango salad the taste was incredible. After we had crab which is their famous roast crab and garlic noodle. Best crab in SF. For dessert we got chocolate lava cake and soo yummy. Pricey but worth every penny. Highly recommend this place, you will not be disappointed.

excerpts: The traditional Vietnamese salad and mango salad is bomb, very light but good.
mango salad.author: Precious Ethel P.
mango salad.review:
This has got to be my favorite restaurant!  I will take seafood any day than meat and this place meets my expectations continuously.  Although, they have very limited parking because it is in the city and around a residential area, they provide Valet!  I recommend valet unless you get lucky enough to park in front of the restaurant but goodluck!  Its either street parking or valet because they don't have a private lot.

When we go here, we usually dress more business casual but it totally doesn't matter, you'll get your hands dirty anyways.  The outside of the restaurant doesn't look very pleasing/fancy but the inside looks 10x better!  We ALWAYS ALWAYS make a reservation because they get very busy, especially during the weekends.  The waiting area is quite small but they have a full bar where you can sit, wait, and have a drink.  The restaurant isn't the biggest and it gets a little tight in there, but fortunately, they do have an upstairs area.

Their customer service here is perfect.  They aren't overwhelming, but they are quick to refill your water, and they're always walking around, that way if you need something they're easily accessible.  Everyone is quick, friendly, Americanized (no racial) and professional.

The food is astounding!  We start off with ordering the Salt & Pepper Calamari, sounds plain, but it's the most flavorful calamari ever.  My boyfriend and I always share 1 crab because they are HUGE with lots of meat.  There are different flavors of crab but our favorite is the Roast Crab.  We've tried the others but Roast Crab is my all-time favorite.  We order garlic noodles on the side and the fried banana with vanilla ice cream for dessert.  The traditional Vietnamese salad and mango salad is bomb, very light but good.  If you do want to order some type of meat, the Shaken beef is super tender and melts in your mouth!  EVERYTHING IS JUST DELICIOUS AND HEAVENLY.

The food is comparable to PPQ, if you've ever been there, however, Thanh Long is more expensive but you get what you pay for!  I think PPQ is more on the casual side but if you want to be a little fancier, Thanh Long is the place.

You will not walk out of here disappointed!

excerpts: We started with the mango salad and the Vietnamese salad.
Both were flavorful and fresh.
We shared entrees between the 8 of us.
mango salad.author: Kim S.
mango salad.review:
Great great great MEAL!!!!! From start to finish the service and food were awesome. We saw the restaurant on the travel channel and couldn't wait to taste the garlic noodles. Vacationing from New Jersey this was one of the first dinner reservations we made. We started with the mango salad and the Vietnamese salad. Both were flavorful and fresh. We shared entrees between the 8 of us. The favorite was the garlic noodles. They were extremely garlicky with a slight bite. We also had the lemongrass chicken which was full of flavor and slightly spicy. The red snapper was perfect  and the fried rice with chicken was moist and delicious.  For dessert we shared the creme brûlée cheesecake, fried banana and orange  sorbet which tasted like a delicious creamsicle. 
The service was as great as the food. Our server was attentive and efficient, paying attention to detail. We would highly recommend this restaurant and wish we could bring the garlic noodles to the east coast.

excerpts: The norm has been calamari, mango salad, lots of garlic noodle, shakin' beef and the ever famous roasted crab.
Always good with a bottle of VOS wine.
Always great
and we have a blast with the waiters!!
mango salad.author: Aileen A.
mango salad.review: Been going here for close to 20 years! Started out as a date and became our go to place for our birthdays and our children's birthdays. We always say we're going to try something new but never do. The norm has been calamari, mango salad, lots of garlic noodle, shakin' beef and the ever famous roasted crab. Always good with a bottle of VOS wine. Always great and we have a blast with the waiters!!

excerpts: Our party of four was stuffed from: roasted crab, prawns over garlic noodles, mango salad, and shaking beef.
We then stuffed ourselves some more with dessert: fried banana with vanilla ice cream and a caramel cheesecake.
Everything was amazing, but I'm definitely still dreaming of roasted crab and garlic noodles.
I would happily live the rest of my life with garlic breath if I could eat those two items everyday.
mango salad.author: Matt W.
mango salad.review: Can't believe I've lived in this neighborhood all my life and have only just dined at Thanh Long this week. I feel like this restaurant is a San Francisco institution! It was packed on a Sunday evening, but we were seated immediately thanks to Yelp Reservations. Our party of four was stuffed from: roasted crab, prawns over garlic noodles, mango salad, and shaking beef. We then stuffed ourselves some more with dessert: fried banana with vanilla ice cream and a caramel cheesecake. Everything was amazing, but I'm definitely still dreaming of roasted crab and garlic noodles. I would happily live the rest of my life with garlic breath if I could eat those two items everyday.

excerpts: Also ordered their mango salad.
One thing I noticed was that the menu stated that it comes with sautéed scallops but my plate came with sautéed shrimp.
mango salad.author: Marvin H.
mango salad.review:
This was my first time coming here. I've been to Crustaceans but I'll say this was a notch better -- especially their garlic noodles. They weren't  overly garlicky and the noodles weren't overly cooked either. It was chewy and flavorful goodness for sure.

Also ordered their mango salad. One thing I noticed was that the menu stated that it comes with sautéed scallops but my plate came with sautéed shrimp. Despite the incorrect order, the salad was still delicious.

Also ordered 2 whole dungeoness crabs which were delicious -- although I don't understand why they didn't give us more than 2 crab crackers to use (we had a party of 6). 

Oh beware for the valet parking -- it's $12 and street parking is very limited!

excerpts: Mango salad:
Only okay.
It's too warm for a salad.
mango salad.author: Lilly W.
mango salad.review:
I was excited to try this out. This is supposed to be the best Viet food in SF. And my friends are raving about the garlic noodles. We were at a friend's that's nearby. So put our name down and came back 45 mins later for a table of seven and got seated right away Sat around 8pm. 

The food was definitely good. But it wasn't the best Viet food that I ever had. The crabs from PPQ is definitely better (comparing the roasted crabs). Here is the list of food that we ordered. 

Mango salad: Only okay. It's too warm for a salad. Even the lettuce felt cooked, which is weird for me. 

Steamed Sea Bass: again very general. The sea bass tasted overcooked. It wasn't very tender. The House's sea bass is 10x better. 

Spicy eggplant: this was tasty. It also had chicken and shrimp. But something you can get at every chinese restaurant. 

Roasted crab: not as good as PPQ. Very oily and not as tasty. 

French beef: the beef is very tender. Definitely one of the better dishes. The portion is not very big as it is served on a big bed of lettuce. 

Salt and pepper calamari: this was very good. It didn't have a lot of breading. 

Grilled prawn over garlic noodles: it's good but nothing too special. The prawn was big but only four pieces. 

Garlic noodles: this is very good. Not too buttery. But I think the garlic noodles from The Kickin Crab is better.

excerpts: , then we had the Beef and Chicken Satay which sat on a huge bed of lettuce with no accompany sauce or dip but was grilled to perfection and excellent taste, followed by the Mango salad which was refreshing, but the mango could have been more ripe.
The dim sum wrap which was cold to taste.
mango salad.author: Michelle W.
mango salad.review: Went to this restaurant this evening with family and had raved to them so much about the garlic crab and garlic noodles which is what they are known for to end up being extremely disappointed  Very overrated restaurant!! The garlic noodles were a complete disappointment barely arriving luke warm the crab was decent, but very overpriced. I felt like everything was made ahead of time for how quickly it came to the table and was barely warm. Ordered 7 appetizers so that we could all share. Started with the Fried Calamari which had more onion condiment then Calamari, followed by the Won Ton wrap which was just okay, then we had the Beef and Chicken Satay which sat on a huge bed of lettuce with no accompany sauce or dip but was grilled to perfection and excellent taste, followed by the Mango salad which was refreshing, but the mango could have been more ripe. The dim sum wrap which was cold to taste. Don't bother to order the garlic toast which is tasteless, dry and cold.Dinner was the butterfly shrimp and garlic noodle and the shrimp was beautifully grilled and tasteful , but the garlic noodle was tasteless and barely warm followed by the Cubed steak which again sat on an overwhelming amount of lettuce with a few potatoes and onions. The steak was sweet and would of been better left just grilled. Then the piece of resistance the garlic crab which was nothing spectacular and the garlic noodles which were tasteless and cold. We then ordered desert hoping they could redeem themselves and that was a joke. We ordered the Chocolate lava cake accompanied with a scoop of vanilla ice cream that had no lava gushing and looked like a flat dried out brownie. The cheesecake creme brulee had no brulee. At this point, I returned both desserts out of complete disappointment. Five people and $398.00 later walked out hungry and will never return.

excerpts: The mango salad balanced the flavorful mussels on Asian pesto.
mango salad.author: Maria Jeremiah M.
mango salad.review: The food is exceptional! Pricey but worth every penny. The mango salad balanced the flavorful mussels on Asian pesto. The roasted crab & garlic noodles with colossal prawns is just the perfect pair! I find the ambiance upstairs to be too dark. It must be the lighting because it did not complement the red walls.

excerpts: For those who may not like crab or shrimp like one of my friends, the mango salad is recommended - without the scallops or shrimps, of course.
As far as libations go, they have a full bar and decent cocktails.
I only had Goose on the rocks with two limes, so I can't comment on the other drinks.
If you don't like garlic, this is not the place for you.
And if you are price conscious, this is not the place for you LOL!
They do accept walk-ins depending on how busy they are.
The place is not huge, so just phone ahead and reserve whenever possible.
Street parking is available, but the surrounding area is residential so it may be hard to come by.
Valet is $12.
Not bad for San Francisco.
For me, the only downside is living out-of-state, but I would recommend this place for special occasions.
mango salad.author: Tashi L.
mango salad.review:
As a Frisco native, Thanh Long has been a long-time favorite of mine for as long as I can remember. I had the pleasure of celebrating my birthday here on 5/26/15 and I am pleased to say that even though it had been over a decade since my last visit, the service and food have not changed! This family-owned and operated gem of a place has some of the best seafood (crab, prawns and garlic noodles - yes, please!) in the city.
 
I had an 8:15 p.m. reservation for a party of 10 (close friends and family). If you're familiar with the city, then you know this place is located allllll the way in the Avenues, so it can take up to an hour to get to in rush hour traffic. I arrived extremely late to find everyone in my party seated and waiting for me, which I appreciated, as the restaurant was pretty full. They could've bumped my table or refused to seat my guests, but they did not. Kudos for that.
 
Since it had been awhile, I wanted some of everything on the menu and my guests thankfully obliged me. We ordered several whole roast Dungeness crabs in their special garlic seasoning. I rarely order Dungeness crab anywhere else because not everyone cleans and cooks it properly, but at Thanh Long, it is a MUST. It was delicious, just like I remembered! It's also very filling with everything else. I ended up splitting half of mine with my godsister. The sides are a la carte, so we also ordered the garlic noodles, shrimp fried rice, garlic toast and the seasonal vegetable sauté to go with our crab. My mom ordered her usual tiger prawns over garlic noodles. (The four prawns come butterflied over the noodles). She refused to let me have a taste, so I assume it was as good as she remembered, too. For those who may not like crab or shrimp like one of my friends, the mango salad is recommended - without the scallops or shrimps, of course. As far as libations go, they have a full bar and decent cocktails. I only had Goose on the rocks with two limes, so I can't comment on the other drinks.
 
If you don't like garlic, this is not the place for you. And if you are price conscious, this is not the place for you LOL! They do accept walk-ins depending on how busy they are. The place is not huge, so just phone ahead and reserve whenever possible. Street parking is available, but the surrounding area is residential so it may be hard to come by. Valet is $12. Not bad for San Francisco.
 
For me, the only downside is living out-of-state, but I would recommend this place for special occasions.

excerpts: My favorite dishes were the mango salad and of course when at a lobster place, eat lobster!
mango salad.author: Junming G.
mango salad.review:
I love this Vietnamese and American based fusion luxurious dining option.

Just a short hop from my house, the exterior is pretty deceiving. A blocky green building right next to a urine infested Muni stop. Not a love at first sight location of course but the interior is dark and a bar type atmosphere. My favorite dishes were the mango salad and of course when at a lobster place, eat lobster!

This is a must-try for visitors for a taste of fresh Bay Area seafood.

excerpts: Mango salad is a hot salad with shrimp and it is great.
My friend ordered the crab which required him to wear a bib.
Good thing because he attacked that crab with gusto, hands all buttered up and seeking every shred of meat.
He says it was great and is a person who would know.
We requested an 8:00 reservation at 6:30 and it all went smooth.
We had to wait about 10 minutes or so upon arrival.
Our party was large but they accommodated us with great skill and patience, and somehow did not screw up even one thing we ordered.
Too stuffed for dessert, maybe next time.
mango salad.author: Mike N.
mango salad.review:
San Francisco, CA.

My second time here, again a good experience. First of all it is pricey, so I have accepted that. However you may find, as I have, that not all the dishes are worthy of their price. For example the long fish (red snapper) was really good, I liked the texture and seasoning. But not so gourmet that it should fetch nearly $30. It did come on a large bed of garlic noodles which I devoured.
 Mango salad is a hot salad with shrimp and it is great. 
 My friend ordered the crab which required him to wear a bib. Good thing because he attacked that crab with gusto, hands all buttered up and seeking every shred of meat. He says it was great and is a person who would know. 
 We requested an 8:00 reservation at 6:30 and it all went smooth. We had to wait about 10 minutes or so upon arrival. 
Our party was large but they accommodated us with great skill and patience, and somehow did not screw up even one thing we ordered.
Too stuffed for dessert, maybe next time.

excerpts: Mango Salad w/
Shrimp-
I was expecting a fresh salad with bold flavors.
mango salad.author: Briana H.
mango salad.review:
I had the pleasure in dining at Thanh Long to celebrate my 26th birthday! It's a great restaurant and I suggest to Bookmark it on your Yelp Page. 

Thanh Long resembles the modern cajun-style Roasted Crab Restaurants such as Boiling Crab/Kickin Crab/Cajun House/Crawstation, but this may be considered as one of the Original Grandfathers in the Crab Game. The white linen, glassware, and utensils were a nice change in my crab grubbing experience. Classy, indeed. 

Here's what our party of 5 ordered:

Garlic Noodles (x3)- I can honestly say this is the best garlic noodles I've ever tasted, great balance of butter and garlic.

Garlic Roasted Crab- Delicious garlic flavor!

Drunken Roasted Crab- w/ wine sauce. It's pretty good, but I would probably just order the Garlic Roasted Crab instead.

Prawn Coconut Curry- w/ chestnuts and green beans. I wasn't very impressed with the dish and would probably pass next time.

Shaken Beef- Very tender! I enjoyed it, but it wasn't the best. I've had better.

Mango Salad w/ Shrimp- I was expecting a fresh salad with bold flavors. However, I was disappointed that the dish was warm! 


Save some money and possible disappointment and order The Fan Favorites: Garlic Noodles, Garlic Roasted Crab, and Shaken Beef.

excerpts: I order the roasted crab, garlic noodles, and mango salad every time I dine here.
I would highly recommend dining here if you're craving some delicious crab!
mango salad.author: Carly Y.
mango salad.review: I absolutely love this restaurant. I order the roasted crab, garlic noodles, and mango salad every time I dine here. I would highly recommend dining here if you're craving some delicious crab!

excerpts: Good balance of savory and sweet, but I preferred the mango salad.
mango salad.author: Robin Y.
mango salad.review:
Soooo much love for Thanh Long's roasted crab and garlic noodles! This is me and my family's go to place for a celebratory dinner or family gathering. 

We came on a Saturday night (probably our 4th time here) with reservations and were seated quickly in 5 minutes. The service was GREAT! And my great, I mean, when we added an order of garlic noodles they came out in mere seconds! 

As for the food: 
Appetizers:
1) fried calamari: perfect combo of salty, spicy, and chewy. Not too greasy. 
2) mango salad- MY FAVE! It's served warm, with pieces of sweet, juicy mango, and roasted shrimp. Mmmm party in my mouth! 
3) Vietnamese salad: kind of like a papaya salad. Good balance of savory and sweet, but I preferred the mango salad. 

Main courses: 
1) 4 roasted crabs ($44/crab) for 7 people. (If you are only ordering crab, 1/person is good, but if you want to sample other entrees, it's a good idea to order less) MY LOVE. Their roasted crab...mind bogglingly delicious. Eat while its hot, and the juices drip all over and the flavor permeates through to the meat, instead of most crab places that can't get it right! 
2) shaken beef- tender buttery chunks of beef with roasted potato chunks soaked in the beef drippings. Scrumptious. 
3) 2 orders of garlic noodles- the best you'll find anymore. I love that the garlic flavor is present but not overpowering, and balances the flavor of the butter. Comes out steaming hot! 
3) brown and white rice to go with the roast crab juices! 

Thanh Long is the go to place for delicious crab! Do it! It's worth the splurge! You will walk out a happier person.

excerpts: Our party of 6 ordered the salt and pepper calamari, mango salad, crab puffs, roasted crabs, rice (why is this not included for a $20 entree!!!), spicy eggplant, and garlic noodles.
mango salad.author: Tia D.
mango salad.review:
