I'm going to start this review off by first stating how excited I was to be coming here after reading all the rave about the crab and garlic noodles. I made it a point to stop by here on our trip to SF. Aside from the reviews, I was also impressed by the story of the An family and empire. I'm Vietnamese so of course Vietnamese food is always an excellent choice in my book. The food here was good, but so ridiculously overhyped in my opinion. The garlic noodles tasted bland to me with not enough garlic and the crab was tasty but how can you ever go wrong with butter, crab, and pepper? You can really save yourself the $$$ and buy yourself crab, steam it, and make a dipping sauce using lemon and pepper (that's a traditional way to eat it in Vietnam). The food was good but not worth the effort or hype and our party was seriously disappointed. To further disappoint, this place really doesn't offer authentic Vietnamese cuisine. I personally think people need to venture to some hole in the wall Vietnamese place if they're handing out 5 star reviews to Thanh Long. At some point, I hope to try Crustacean to see if maybe the hype is limited to that brand in the An empire because Thanh Long is underwhelming and disappointing. 

Our party of 6 ordered the salt and pepper calamari, mango salad, crab puffs, roasted crabs, rice (why is this not included for a $20 entree!!!), spicy eggplant, and garlic noodles. We ordered two plates of garlic noodles and ended up eating only one. We got a doggy bag for the leftovers to donate to the homeless (because why not).

excerpts: Got the Garlic Noodles, Mango Salad, and Colossal Royal Tiger Prawns that came out to be about $70 dollars total (omfg).
Mango Salad was a refreshing appetizer.
The Garlic Noodles were okay; didn't think there was anything that special about the dish.
mango salad.author: Mandy C.
mango salad.review:
Pretty much overrated and expensive Vietnamese fusion food that you can get at other place for a much cheaper price. Got the Garlic Noodles, Mango Salad, and Colossal Royal Tiger Prawns that came out to be about $70 dollars total (omfg). Maybe I just eat too much, but my friend and I were confused as to why the description of the meal said "large", because there was really nothing large about it.

Mango Salad was a refreshing appetizer. The Garlic Noodles were okay; didn't think there was anything that special about the dish. We think that the damage was mostly due to the Tiger Prawns - definitely do not recommend getting it!!!

We didn't try the infamous Crab dish, but we saw many people getting it - even a couple who ordered a crab each... So maybe that's what we should have tried instead?

excerpts: So in addition, I got the mango salad and seafood dumpling.
Mango salad too my surprise had stir fried shrimp and onions on top making the salad a bit warm and welted.
mango salad.author: Kevin L.
mango salad.review:
I think the last time I was here was 6 years ago.  And this was probably the first "fancy" restaurant I went to back in high school.  And the first time for garlic noodles that was so WOW to me back then.  20 years later and many many new culinary experiences, the garlic noodles ain't no big thang.

You come here for the roast crab and garlic noodles, yes but I wanted to try something new.  So in addition, I got the mango salad and seafood dumpling.  And also the steamed sea bass entree.

Roast crab was just ok.  I prefer PPQ and the salt & pepper fried crab at R&G more.  Thanh Long's crab was flavorful but over peppered and garlic oiled at times.  The weak part was the tamale in the shell.  It seemed like it was cleaned out a bit and the crab wasn't as big as it usually is.  Maybe its not so in season now but they should still be reserving colossal size crabs for their dishes.  We had the prawns with garlic noodles.  The prawns very overdone a bit and had too much buttery/pepper smeared over it.  It was cholesterol city last night.

Mango salad too my surprise had stir fried shrimp and onions on top making the salad a bit warm and welted.

Seafood dumpling seem like it was heated in the microwave and had a dry appearance.

Both salad and dumpling came out super fast.

Sea bass was over done too and just wasn't as smooth as it should be.  Sea bass ain't suppose to taste "meaty".  I think a filet-o-fish has an even more delicate flaky texture.  I would rather had two filet-o-fish sandwiches on that big plate instead of the sea bass.

No plate presentation on anything.

Ordered a pineapple lychee martini before ordering food but it never came and the food did.  I had to ask and then they said they were all out of the infusion?  So I tried a passion tea martini which came after the entrees.  So it sat there getting warm as I started to eat and didn't feel like drinking it anymore.  It was nice when it was straight cold.  

Server who took our order never came back to ask what's up with the food.  Instead the runner asked?  Pretty whack on service.

$41.95 for the crab is totally not worth it.  I would pay 20 bucks at most.  In fact, I can make this at home and I do every time crab season starts.  Go to sunset supermarket or new may wah and get some live crabs and cook it up at home.  I could of cooked a bunch of crab for the money I spent here.

All good, it was my birthday and didn't want to cook at home and Thanh Long is about 4 minutes from my home.

excerpts: Roasted crab, garlic noodles, mango salad, shrimp cakes....what a great meal.
The bill came out to be around 130, def worth it.
Might have to come here once a month, you never know when it's safe to eat crabs, with these crab lifts.
mango salad.author: Q W.
mango salad.review: Since crab is safe to eat again, I had to come here! This probably the best place for crab, IMO. Roasted crab, garlic noodles, mango salad, shrimp cakes....what a great meal. The bill came out to be around 130, def worth it. Might have to come here once a month, you never know when it's safe to eat crabs, with these crab lifts.

excerpts: The mango salad was definitely different from what I was expecting.
Not really fresh and crisp but more so briefly stir fried to a savory soggy dish.
Even the lettuce was warm.
mango salad.author: Tammy N.
mango salad.review:
All hype and overpriced

$45 for one roasted crab and $23 for Shaken Beef?!  For $45 the crab better be fresh and of course it's good because it's soaked in butter.  The shaken beef was decent but I've had better.  The mango salad was definitely different from what I was expecting.  Not really fresh and crisp but more so briefly stir fried to a savory soggy dish. Even the lettuce was warm.  Garlic noodles I thought was a bit overcooked and mushy.  I expected more, better, an orgasmic experience but ehh it is what it is.  I am glad that I finally got to say I've been here though.  Definitely won't see me again, I actually like PPQ wayyyyyy more.  And oddly enough, even though it's in the Outer Sunset there's barely any street parking nearby.  Tip: go to Lincoln St and walk 2 blocks.  They also have valet parking for $12

excerpts: Love the garlic noodles, the mango salad and the garlic crab!!!!
Gave 4 stars because it is a bit pricey but very good.
You don't have to dress up at this location like you do at Crustaceans.
mango salad.author: S. W.
mango salad.review: Love the garlic noodles, the mango salad and the garlic crab!!!! Gave 4 stars because it is a bit pricey but very good. You don't have to dress up at this location like you do at Crustaceans.

excerpts: We started with the mango salad with seared shrimp and scallop that ended up being the highlight of the meal.
The flavors were fantastic although there could have been more scallops.
The mango salad was fantastic but
the big miss on the other dishes plus the unjustified high prices brought it back down to a 1.5 stars for us.
mango salad.author: Amy D.
mango salad.review:
We were quite excited to check out this place being huge fans of crab (and during dungeness season too)! Sadly, Thanh Long was quite disappointing with high prices and mediocre food.

We started with the mango salad with seared shrimp and scallop that ended up being the highlight of the meal. The flavors were fantastic although there could have been more scallops. The warm seafood paired with the fruit flavors of the sliced mango and raspberry vinaigrette were really fun and well worth trying!

We also had the tamarind crab and a plate of garlic noodles. The crab meat was good and well cooked but the sauce was really strange with ingredients that did not go so well together. The tamarind component of the crab did not come out strongly (this wasn't your normal tamarind sauce) and we were quite disappointed with the conflicting and unappetizing flavors of this ~$40 dish. 

The garlic noodles were also just bleh. For $10, I would really like more than a plain plate of spaghetti noodles with a some garlic seasonings. I generally love garlic noodles but at least most places present the noodles with a sprig of greens or extra sauce and charge at least 1/3-1/2 less. Really- with how expensive the food is at this place, I expect a bit more presentation if not better flavor. 

Overall, this place was mediocre to average (we count 2 stars as average). The mango salad was fantastic but the big miss on the other dishes plus the unjustified high prices brought it back down to a 1.5 stars for us.

excerpts:
[ 
-Our go to dishes: Mango Salad, Salt and Pepper Calamari, Garlic Noodles, and Roast Crab.
Sure, other things look tasty on the menu, but these are so good that I refuse to waver!
We did try the drunken crab once, but the roast crab wins hands down.
-The Lava cake is to DIE for!
Amazing!!!
I also tried the Irish Coffee, but meh..
mango salad.author: Debbie T.
mango salad.review:
I only come here for "special" occasions with the bf. So..this means:

-We share an entire bottle of sparkling wine. Yep, we'll finish the whole bottle. Champagnes are for snobs..or really pretty people who have lots of money. =[ 
-Our go to dishes: Mango Salad, Salt and Pepper Calamari, Garlic Noodles, and Roast Crab. Sure, other things look tasty on the menu, but these are so good that I refuse to waver! We did try the drunken crab once, but the roast crab wins hands down. 
-The Lava cake is to DIE for! Amazing!!! I also tried the Irish Coffee, but meh..I rather just stick with my sparkling wine and Lava Cake. 

With tip, I say our meal averages at least $150-200, depending on the bottle of wine and market price of the crab. Very expensive for cheapies like us, but every once in awhile, we like to spoil ourselves and eat ramen for the rest of the month.

excerpts: The mango salad was a nice surprise.
It was warm and
I wasn't sure what to think about that, but it was good.
mango salad.author: Danielle G.
mango salad.review:
I was finally able to knock this off my bookmarks list. We came on Jan 1 and the wait for a table of 6 was 30-45. I think if I would have had Thanh Long prior to PPQ and Crustacean I would be much more impressed. But I can't help but make comparisons. 

PPQ has the best value for the food. Thanh Long is definitely cheaper than Crustacean, but by no means a casual dining option. The roasted crab runs at market price and happened to be $40 on this particular night. 

As far as the garlic noodles, I have to rank Crustacean's as the best, PPQ in second and Thanh Long 3rd. However, that being said, all three are fantastic and worth a try.

Crustacean obviously wins in the ambiance category, but Thanh Long is a very nice, quaint place. I like that Thanh Long impresses and is appropriate from anything from a romantic date to a fun family dinner.  

Enough comparisons, let's talk about Thanh Long's food. The mango salad was a nice surprise. It was warm and I wasn't sure what to think about that, but it was good. Salt and pepper calamari was good, but kind of a dish you can find at many other restaurants. The spicy eggplant dish had good flavor and lots of vegetables. We had chicken fried rice (mostly for the baby) which was your typical chicken fried rice. The shaken beef was a definite stand out dish. It was super tender and the flavor was wonderful.

My only gripe about the crab was they didn't leave the shell with all the juices and good stuff. The shell was turned over and we had to dig around to find some fat (which of course is one of the best parts!).

By the way, skip the drinks here. They come in tiny glasses that are much overpriced. 

All in all I will probably stick with PPQ as my go to, but Thanh Long is definitely a good option for a special occasion.

excerpts: We had rice paper rolls, vermicelli noodle consomme, mango salad, and roasted crab.
The noodle consomme had a delicious broth and was just the right way to start the meal.
The mango salad, while not bad, was not what I expected as it was cubes of sweet ripened mango on a bed of greens and was served warm.
The crab, however, was wonderful - perfectly cooked and seasoned.
I'll be back with my friends and family for sure.
mango salad.author: Sonia K.
mango salad.review: My colleague has been going to this unpretentious hidden gem for a long time and brought me here to try the crab. We had rice paper rolls, vermicelli noodle consomme, mango salad, and roasted crab. The noodle consomme had a delicious broth and was just the right way to start the meal. The mango salad, while not bad, was not what I expected as it was cubes of sweet ripened mango on a bed of greens and was served warm. The crab, however, was wonderful - perfectly cooked and seasoned. I'll be back with my friends and family for sure.

excerpts: We started with a mango salad, which was totally yum.
With tip, dinner for two where we shared a mango salad, split an order of garlic noodles, and had only one crab between us with a bottle of wine was $175 with tip.
Ouch!
My wallet stings a bit.
I can buy 6 crabs this size for $50 off a boat in Pillar Point Harbor, the noodles cost next to zero and the salad was simple enough.
Honestly, this can't be a regular place at this price.
Come to think of it, the company I kept this night may have been the best part, but Ann is like that.
mango salad.author: Shaun H.
mango salad.review:
Why did it take me so long to try this place?  For a few years we have missed opportunities to try Thanh Long.  We have a friend who raves about it, but somehow we never made it.  I finally tried Thanh Long last weekend with our friend, and now I understand why she speaks so highly of this restaurant.  I am also regretting that I could have been there a few more times by now instead of just once.

Last Saturday we had a late dinner.  Driving to the restaurant my friend warned me that we would probably have to wait awhile for a table.  I don't mind waiting if the food is good.  However when we arrived we were seated immediately.  It was late, maybe 9:00PM on a Saturday, so if you can wait for a late dinner this may be the time to come.

Looking at the other tables, it was easy to see what to order.  Every table was the same -- garlic noodles and roasted crab.  We started with a mango salad, which was totally yum.  Then the real bomb -- the garlic noodles.  They are simple, I could totally make this at home, but OMG they are awesome!  We also split a roast dungeness crab, another dish that I frequently make when crab is in season, but sometimes it is nice to sit down and enjoy a good meal without having to cook it.

For the meal we ordered, the Duckhorn Sauvignon Blanc which turned out to be a PERFECT PAIRING to our food.  I was proud of myself for going past the rather large Chardonnay selection on the wine list.  I think  the buttery flavor of a California Cardonnay would have been in competition with the other flavors on the table, so I wonder why they had so many on the list?  A white with a little more acidity and fruit was just the ticket.  I had only tried Duckhorn's reds prior to this evening, but I must say the Sauvignon Blanc was remarkable and I will seek out a bottle for home next time I am serving crab.  I usually go for Voigner with shellfish, but they didn't have one to offer...why?  You are  a classy restaurant, get your wines sorted please.

I withhold the fifth star because I'm not that easy.  Thanh Long was a great meal and I will definitely take my wife here when she gets back in town, but it is really priced high.  With tip, dinner for two where we shared a mango salad, split an order of garlic noodles, and had only one crab between us with a bottle of wine was $175 with tip.  Ouch!  My wallet stings a bit.  I can buy 6 crabs this size for $50 off a boat in Pillar Point Harbor, the noodles cost next to zero and the salad was simple enough.  Honestly, this can't be a regular place at this price.  Come to think of it, the company I kept this night may have been the best part, but Ann is like that.  I am lucky to have her as a friend.

Bottom line:  garlic noodles with crab and sauvignon blanc, it's all good.  Bring your big fat wallet, cuz you're gonna need it.

excerpts: For appetizers the crab puffs and the mango salad is a great way to start out before you receive your entrees.
The customer service is superb and the food is always good.
mango salad.author: Tia L.
mango salad.review: The garlic roasted crab is fresh and delicious. The sea bass is also a great option. For those who don't want seafood the shaken beef is wonderful. For appetizers the crab puffs and the mango salad is a great way to start out before you receive your entrees. The customer service is superb and the food is always good.

excerpts: We ordered the Crab, fried rice, garlic noodles and mango salad.
The mango salad was nice.
Teased ever so gently with shrimp and thick cuts of mango.
The fried rice was delicate, delicious and just amazing.
The garlic noodles were awesome.
The next time I go to Panda and they're talking "garlic noodles," I think I'm going to just call the police.
Thanh Long's garlic noodles are by far the best I've ever had.
mango salad.author: Mark Darren W.
mango salad.review:
If you've been following my reviews you already know I don't give out 5-Stars like it's Halloween Candy.  So if a restaurant gets this rating from me, they deserve it.  Hands down, flat out, case closed, done dig-giddy dada (I know... just go with the moment).

I've heard a lot about Thanh Long and looked forward to trying it.  I got the opportunity when in the Bay area this past weekend.

I've been an advocate for "hole in the wall" restaurants over chains because 1. I think the food most of time tastes a lot better and 2. The intimacy of a small establishment caters to my "less crowd, less noise" mantra.

From the outside, Thanh Long does not look impressive.  But when you notice a flood of people going in and coming out either something illegal is happening or they have really good food.  Thanh Long has really, really, good food.

The restaurant is nicely decorated and my hats off to the bartender.  I'm not a big drinker at all.  That said, I think every person should have a signature drink.  For me, it's Drambuie.  Because it's not an average drink and only consumed by the most worldly of people (ah-em), I can tell instantly the status of a restaurant when I order it and the waiter says "huh, what's that?"  Or the bartender simply smiles and says, "I'm sorry sir, we don't have that."  He knows that you know, the sophistication of their restaurant is FOS at that point.

Thanh Long serves Drambuie.  I'm just saying.

The restaurant is small and intimate - just how I like it.  

We ordered the Crab, fried rice, garlic noodles and mango salad.

The mango salad was nice.  Teased ever so gently with shrimp and thick cuts of mango.  I didn't care for it being slightly warmed, but I didn't mind either.

The fried rice was delicate, delicious and just amazing.  The garlic noodles were awesome.  The next time I go to Panda and they're talking "garlic noodles," I think I'm going to just call the police.  Thanh Long's garlic noodles are by far the best I've ever had.

The Crab, unless you don't like getting your hands dirty, then you need to order something else.  Steamed in pepper and other seasoning with just enough of a buttery hint that I was sitting at the table licking my fingers.  Yeah, I know. No table etiquette, but at that point I didn't care.  And if you're wondering, it was so good I would have ate the shell.

I'll be going back to the Bay area in another month and I'm already making reservations for round 2 at Thanh Long.

What better way to acknowledge their food is that good.

excerpts: We had the Mango Salad (warm with a perfect hint of charred flavor), and the Traditional Vietnamese Salad (it was good, but the other dishes overshadow this one).
mango salad.author: Sam W.
mango salad.review:
When this place was recommend to me, I was unassuming and figured, "Oh, ok, Vietnamese seafood joint...should be the usual family-style Asian restaurant."  So, we went on ahead and made reservations for the day before.  The day of, I see this sort of hideous, unassuming exterior--it looks like any generic abandoned Richmond/Sunset shop/boutique.  When we enter, it's a completely different story--dimmed lighting, modern decor, tablecloths, etc.  We are ~10 minutes late (parking was a pain in the neighborhood), yet they seat us promptly.  

The staff is friendly and helpful (they helped us pick out items for our group and make recommendations based on our party size). I order a bottle of wine that ends up being a twist-cap, but our waiter still makes the motions and lets me sample first.  When it comes time for eating, the staff helps us put on our bibs, brings extra napkins without having to be asked, and replaces our plates and bowls whenever things started to get messy.  Oh yeah, and brownie points on attentiveness--my water never goes empty.  (Sort of silly, but small gestures like these make for a good impression with me.)

The food itself, in summary, is rich and filling in the most gluttonous fashion. We had the Mango Salad (warm with a perfect hint of charred flavor), and the Traditional Vietnamese Salad (it was good, but the other dishes overshadow this one). You might need a coronary bypass after going through the Thanh Long Mussels, Roast Crab, and Garlic Noodles, but it's worth every cent of your health insurance deductible if you have it.  You see the oil on the plates,  but with every bite, your senses don't register it as "just" oil.  Instead, a bite of the garlic noodles dressed with some drippings from the roast crab feels like your mouth is being coated in silken, mouth-filling luxury.  As you swallow, you are overwhelmed with a noise in your head--that noise is your brain screaming, "MORE MORE MORE!!!"

Pure crack.

When the bill comes, we see gratuity tagged on, but it's pre-tax and pre-alcohol (as with everything else, Thanh Long gets it right).  When you divide everything up for the type of service and food we experienced here, it comes to about $40-ish per person, and worth every darn penny.  

Thanh Long, we'll definitely be back.

excerpts: Mango Salad:
This is was my least favorite dish.
Warm mango slices and seafood on top of cold salad is not appetizing whatsoever.
mango salad.author: Judy C.
mango salad.review:
My all-time favorite San Francisco restaurant is situated right here in Outer Sunset.  Thang Long, known for their French-inspired Vietnamese cuisine, serves some of the BEST garlic crabs and BEST garlic noodles.

Once in awhile I get to splurge here, and luckily for my birthday -- my thoughtful friends brought me here to celebrate.  Together, we shared:

* Salmon Carpaccio: My favorite appetizer from Thanh Long!  The lemon-cured salmon was perfectly marinated and not at all "fishy."
* Salt & Pepper Calamari: Calamari usually all tastes the same at different restaurants.  However, here, they go easy on the batter and oil to give an overall light taste.
* Mango Salad: This is was my least favorite dish.  Warm mango slices and seafood on top of cold salad is not appetizing whatsoever. 
* Roast Crab & Garlic Noodles: If you love overdosing on garlic and butter, you will love the crab and garlic noodles here.  Their infamous secret sauce really makes Thanh Long what they are. 

Other noteworthy dishes I've tried and loved: Shrimp Toast, Shaken Beef, and Colossal Royal Tiger Prawns. 

Love, love, love.

excerpts: The mango salad was good
but I'm not a fan of warm/sweet salads.
The service was a bit slow but other than that, I would definitely recommend you try this place out.
mango salad.author: Ryan L.
mango salad.review: I haven't eaten here in a few years (probably like.. '09) but I must say that they have maintained their quality. I made a reservation and had to change it right beforehand and it was no problem with the staff. Everything on the menu is probably very tasty and rich in flavor. The must-try items are obviously the roast crab, garlic noodles, and shaken beef. For some appetizers, I'd recommend the tiger prawns, mussels, and salt & pepper calamari. The mango salad was good but I'm not a fan of warm/sweet salads. The service was a bit slow but other than that, I would definitely recommend you try this place out.

excerpts: Mango salad:
Did I say salad?
It came stir fried Mango.
mango salad.author: SF F.
mango salad.review:
We picked this place because I need to get my crab fixed!  That's right, not caffeine, CRAB!

Roasted crab:  Very Tasty but quite salty IMO.  And very pricy, one crab for $45 bucks. But my son loved it.  

Our waitress suggested Shaken Beef, we turned it down because it was salty, overcooked and dried the last time we ordered, a year ago.

Mango salad:  Did I say salad?  It came stir fried Mango.  What is going on?

Garlic noodle:  Bland.  Noodle are over cooked so it broke into pieces.  It is not even noodle, more like a long strand of penne pasta without the whole in between.  My teenage son said you made better garlic noodle, mom!

Village's favorite:  Overcooked pork and shrimp.  Dried and salty.

Fried banana:  Most doughy fried banana I have ever eaten in my life.  It is more of a fried doughnut IMO.

excerpts: Ordered the mango salad, garlic noodles, lemongrass chicken.
Bill came out to be $43 dollars.
My friends weren't a fan of the lemongrass because it has a strong taste, but I loved it- being a fan of lemongrass flavor all the way back from Thailand!
The garlic noodles was flavorful, but was a bit salty.
Still good and would order it!
The mango salad's dressing tasted fabulous too!
mango salad.author: Vivian L.
mango salad.review:
Finally came here last night with great company!

Ordered the mango salad, garlic noodles, lemongrass chicken. Bill came out to be $43 dollars. My friends weren't a fan of the lemongrass because it has a strong taste, but I loved it- being a fan of lemongrass flavor all the way back from Thailand! The garlic noodles was flavorful, but was a bit salty. Still good and would order it! The mango salad's dressing tasted fabulous too!

excerpts: Mango salad was probably the only tolerable dish we had that night.
mango salad.author: Tiffany L.
mango salad.review:
I rarely ever Yelp because, let's face it, unless it's a meal I'd have for my last supper, or it's absolutely atrocious, I'm too darn lazy! But the mediocre, overpriced food at Thanh Long has beat out my laziness.

I used to eat at Thanh Long as a child and absolutely LOVED it. We had reservations for 4 for my brother's birthday dinner two nights ago, and needless to say, I will NEVER return! The food was comparable to a buffet in Reno. 

Garlic Noodles were lacking. It didn't taste anything of fresh garlic. Instead, the noodles were soggy and overcooked, with the flavor of garlic salt.

Mango salad was probably the only tolerable dish we had that night. The vinaigrette was light and sweet, but the portion was pretty small.

The shaken beef was a huge disappointment. The entire bottom of the plate was covered in chopped romaine lettuce, but was hidden under beef, giving the impression that the plate was full of beef. In addition, there were ample chopped potatoes sauteed to LOOK like beef. There were maybe a total of 9 piece of actual beef on the plate, for about $20-$25. 

The sea bass was absolutely bland. It was cooked with no seasoning, AT ALL. The saving grace for this dish was the accompanying sauce on the side, which had a slight sweet, citrus flavor to it. For $25, the serving of sea bass is smaller than the average portion for one person. There was ONE bok choy cut into thirds on the side of this dish. I'm pretty sure bok choy i s$0.79/lb at the supermarket. If you're gonna skimp on the portion of the fish, you could at least use more than one bok choy.

Thanh Long has always had a special place in my heart for their crab. No more. The roast crab we ordered came out lukewarm. This would've been tolerable had the crab actually had flavor. It looked like it was covered in black pepper, but had no taste at all = pre-ground black pepper. I RARELY use salt to cook, and my usual complaint when I eat out is that the food is too salty. This crab didn't have even a pinch of salt in it! They used to use so much butter in their sauce that when it cooled, the bottom of the dish would be covered in coagulated butter. Not anymore. 

I cannot remember the last time I had a meal so disappointing. PPQ on Clement is WAY better, and I will never again patron Thanh Long!

excerpts: We did try the mango salad ($12) on this last visit and it was nice to have some veggies, even though my focus was on all the butter & garlic goodness on my plate.
mango salad.author: Gina D.
mango salad.review: I love butter, garlic, and crab..... A LOT! Maybe that's why this is one of my favorite restaurants!  Along with 99% of the other diners there, hubby & I always get 2 orders of the delicious roasted buttery, garlicky, crab and a side of buttery, garlicky noodles. There's more on the menu, but I wouldn't know... since we only order these 2 fabulous items every time. The crab entree is about $40 (per person & prices vary by season), and the side of garlic noodles is $10.. and their both worth every penny. We did try the mango salad ($12) on this last visit and it was nice to have some veggies, even though my focus was on all the butter & garlic goodness on my plate.

excerpts: Skip the mango salad (a bit bland).
mango salad.author: Bill N.
mango salad.review:
We just visited Thanh Long for the first time and look forward to returning again!

In a sentence, we agree with the reviewers, go for the roasted crab & garlic noodles!!!  Amaaaaazingly deeeeelicious!!!!  The crab at the R&G Lounge in Chinatown is very, very good but the roasted crab here is outstanding!

Skip the mango salad (a bit bland).  The shaking beef was good but not memorable.

Sticker shock.  Yes sticker shock for the crab.  ****** BUT ***** IT WAS WORTH EVERY CENT!!!  Absolutely no regret whatsoever - the product and preparation was simply incredible!  (Last word on crab pricing - because it is expensive, this may not be the best place to dine with children.)

We can't wait to try the Drunken and Tamarind crabs!!!

excerpts: We started with the rolls for appetizers, mango salad, then shaken beef & Colossal Royal Tiger prawns with garlic noodles.
Everything was excellent!
The service was great as well, and we even had children with us who were well cared for by the staff.
Will definitely be back!
mango salad.author: Steven B.
mango salad.review: A friend invited us to join them for dinner...this is one of the best Vietnamese restaurants in SF.  We started with the rolls for appetizers, mango salad, then shaken beef & Colossal Royal Tiger prawns with garlic noodles.  Everything was excellent!  The service was great as well, and we even had children with us who were well cared for by the staff.  Will definitely be back!

excerpts: We also had the crab puffs-so much better than any crab puff appetizer I've had at any other Asian restaurant- and the mango salad which was not why I expected but still very tasty.
I would order both again and again.
The service is warm and friendly and overall a really pleasant atmosphere.
Worth the trek to the outskirts of the Sunset.
It's getting hard to get really good food in the city without having to wait
mango salad.author: Bella P.
mango salad.review:
Believe the hype!
Came here for the first time recently and the garlic noodles with drunken crab are incredible together!  Having one without the other is good, but putting that crab meat into those garlic noodles takes it to the next level. Definitely lives up to my expectation.  We also had the crab puffs-so much better than any crab puff appetizer I've had at any other Asian restaurant- and the mango salad which was not why I expected but still very tasty.  I would order both again and again.  The service is warm and friendly and overall a really pleasant atmosphere.  Worth the trek to the outskirts of the Sunset.  It's getting hard to get really good food in the city without having to wait and that wasn't the case here; we were seated immediately.  

How good they are at their specialities is the only detriment to other dishes that would  probably seem better anywhere else where they wouldn't have to stand up to that crab or garlic noodles. The curry prawns smell really good and have a smoky curry flavor but aren't anything special.

excerpts: Foods' quality is just average, the taste of salted crab is not traditonal vietnamese, mango salad is definitely not vietnamese dish.
mango salad.author: Meggie N.
mango salad.review: Service is great. Foods' quality is just average, the taste of salted crab is not traditonal vietnamese, mango salad is definitely not vietnamese dish.

excerpts: I've tried the salmon carpaccio, lemongrass chicken satay, and mango salad.
I wasn't really impressed.
mango salad.author: Laina T.
mango salad.review:
If you're a crab lover like I am, you'll love Thanh Long.  Skip the appetizers.  I've tried the salmon carpaccio, lemongrass chicken satay, and mango salad.  I wasn't really impressed.  Order the roasted crab and garlic noodles!!!  They're to die for.  The crab is fresh and big.  The flavor of butter and cracked pepper just explodes in your mouth.  I'm a big eater so I always have to have my own crab and another entrée.  Stick to the roasted crab instead of the tamarind crab.  The sauce on the tamarind crab is a little sweet for my taste buds.  The Thanh Long spicy eggplant is good, but nowhere near spicy.  As for dessert, don't get the bread pudding.  The orange sorbet was good and the presentation was clever.  It's a frozen orange sliced across the top with orange sorbet inside.  It's nice, light, and a good ending to any meal.  

At about $40 per crab, it's not cheap.  It's a good place for special occasions or if you just want to satisfy your craving for really good crab.  The atmosphere is casual so there's no need dress up.  Get your hands dirty and enjoy!

excerpts: The dinner started off well enough with the salt and pepper calamari and the mango salad.
My fleur de mango mixed drink was decent but tasted more like banana and coconut than mango.
mango salad.author: Elaine L.
mango salad.review:
Seriously, I don't get it.  Is it because I am Vietnamese, or is it because I've made crab better at home myself?  To say that I was greatly, nay sorely, disappointed would be putting it lightly.  

I had heard from 2 different friends who also love food that I should try this restaurant, so I finally went with great excitement and anticipation.  I even schlepped out on a rainy, windy miserable night where I could've just sat at home eating ramen and been happy.

The dinner started off well enough with the salt and pepper calamari and the mango salad.  My fleur de mango mixed drink was decent but tasted more like banana and coconut than mango.  Boyfriend's pineapple ginger-infused vodka was better.

Surprisingly, though, the biggest disappointments were the restaurant specialties that have seemingly made this restaurant famous:  the roasted crab and garlic noodles.  The crab was small and mealy, and once you suck away the tasty salt and pepper sauce from the outer shell, you're left with bland, crumbly crab that did not taste fresh or well-cooked.  There was not much crab fat under the shell either. Perhaps they aren't sourcing their crab from a good provider.

Then the garlic noodles arrived.  My impression can be summarized as the following:  meh.  I'm pretty sure I can reproduce the same dish with some spaghetti and a lot of butter and garlic.

Boyfriend thinks that I should come back and give them a second chance because any restaurant can have an off night, but given how sad it was and given that the highlight of the meal was when said boyfriend sent a crab leg flying, barely missing the lady sitting next to us when he tried to pry it off the crab body , I'm gun shy to say the least.  His response actually was, "Well, as least it's one less leg we have to eat."  If that doesn't speak volumes, not sure what else would.

I'd rather blow all of my money on the salt and pepper crab at R&G Lounge.  I know that Andrew Zimmern spotlighted the An family on his show, but Bourdain went to R&G.  By my tally, it's Bourdain 1 versus Zimmern 0.

excerpts: they didn't have the mango salad and the regular salad
was bleah.
mango salad.author: alinna s.
mango salad.review:
we heard about this place via check please, bay area so we went for our anniversary dinner.  it is the fanciest vietnamese restaurant i have ever been to and the waitstaff was great.  make a res -- the line is long but DAMN, they can turn tables here.

everyone in the restaurant was eating two things: roasted crab and garlic noodles.  given that it was just after xmas, i thought we should eat salad ... bad plan.  they didn't have the mango salad and the regular salad was bleah.  i will say they did not skimp on the shrimp, which was fresh, but it didn't taste like anything.

the salt and pepper calamari appetizer was the best for me.  it was salty, crispy and most excellent with lots of lemon.

as for the famed roast crab and noodles ... LET. DOWN.  it's gd crab season in california, so i cannot fathom why our crab, while large, WAS. NOT. FRESH.  i have eaten a crapton of crab in my life as a good chinese person do, and this crab had clearly been dead for some time and no amount of delicious seasoning can hide that.  as for the noodles, if you like your noodles sweet (my japanese husband did), then maybe you will be okay.  they certainly give you a lot of it for $9.95. for me, it was way too sweet and way overcooked.  i tried to save it by dipping it into the crab seasoning.  

overall, it was meh.  the portion sizes are good, but the dead crab didn't do it for me.  if it's $41.95 (it's a market price dish) at the height of dungeness crab season, i cannot stand the idea of paying God knows how much in july.  a nice experience, but i wouldn't escape 3 babies and drive an hour into the city for this.

excerpts: Mango Salad is amazing, too.
Warm saute mango chunks, shrimp, scallop and shallot on fresh greens...
mango salad.author: WS P.
mango salad.review:
My favorite place for crab. I ALWAYS order Roasted Crab, Garlic Noodles and Salt and Pepper Calamari. Mango Salad is amazing, too. Warm saute mango chunks, shrimp, scallop and shallot on fresh greens... Yam...

Their steam Chilean Sea Bass is great, too. 

For dessert, I love the orange sorbet. A light dessert is a perfect end note for a buttery meal in this place. 

This is the restaurant I bring all my out-of-town guests to. :)

excerpts:
Mango Salad - fresh mango fruit sauteed with bell peppers, seared scallops & shrimp over mixed greens in a raspberry vinaigrette - this would make for an excellent  meal on it's own; the raspberry vinaigrette nicely tied the various flavors together effortlessly

3.
mango salad.author: Beth W.
mango salad.review:
We came here for a special family celebration and it was our first time dining here as well.

The food ordered for our dinner comprised of the following:

1. Salt & Pepper Calamari - delicious except for the simple overdose of coarsely ground black pepper; will definitely tell them next time to adjust the black pepper with a lighter touch

2. Mango Salad - fresh mango fruit sauteed with bell peppers, seared scallops & shrimp over mixed greens in a raspberry vinaigrette - this would make for an excellent  meal on it's own; the raspberry vinaigrette nicely tied the various flavors together effortlessly

3. Thanh Long Spicy Eggplant - eggplant sauteed with jumbo prawns, chicken, fresh basil, baby corn, shitake mushrooms, & red chilies in a tamarind & chili-soya; I like spicy but it was on the low end of the spicy spectrum on this dinner outing though the overall flavors were good ~ will order it again but tell the server to make it spicier

4. Villager's Favorite - Pacific prawns & pork medallions simmered in a caramelized reduction of soy and herbs; I liked this dish enough that I would order it again; a nice take on a "surf and turf" with pork instead of beef for the "turf" portion

5. Shaken Beef - tender cubes of marinated New York steak flambeed in Chardonnay served with potatoes, mixed greens & cherry tomatoes; delicious in flavor with fork tender beef; the greens I could do without as it seemed more a "salad" than an entree

6. Vegetarian Delight - silken tofu sauteed with asst. vegetables & shitake mushrooms; a standout as I love tofu and veggies!

7. Roast Crab - a whole Dungeness crab roasted with An's garlic sauce & secret spices in the Secret Kitchen; regardless of what others may say, this in of itself is a delectable Dungeness crab entree!  Yes it's messy but who cares?  The flavors marry very well and our entire party enjoyed this dish.

8. Garlic Noodles - An's famous noodles made with their secret garlic sauce (perhaps the one used on the Roast Crab?) & secret spices; this noodle dish is good when hot but at room temperature or worse, cold, it's not that good (something coagulates on the noodles when it's cold...butter perhaps?)

Despite the large amounts ordered per item, we had lots of left overs (crab included) for our party of 18.  Would I go back to this spot?  You betcha!  I want to try the Tamarind Crab - "simmered in a melange of Roma tomatoes & tamarind, seasoned with fresh dill & green onions & flambeed with cognac."  The ingredients for this dish make me salivate just thinking about it.

There is a full bar in case you want a drink while you wait and/or with your meal.  Two of us ordered the Fleur de Mango - pureed fresh mango, Malibu rum, a banana rum and freshly squeezed orange juice to the mix - this was the fave drink of the evening!  
 
While parking is an issue, it's located in a neighborhood folks, get there early so that you can look for parking or just valet your car.  I would also suggest booking a reservation so that you are amongst the first seating for the evening.  Overall, the service was excellent/attentive and the food was delicious.

The name of this restaurant came about due to an error at the printer's.  It was supposed to be "Thang Long" meaning "Ascending Dragon" and also Vietnam's first capital city.  As "Thanh Long" it means "Green Dragon" ~ green representing happiness and prosperity while the dragon symbol is an ancient symbol of good luck.  I would say the An Family has enjoyed this for many years serving a legion of happy customers ~ myself being a newly minted one!

Note - The An Family also owns the Crustacean group of restaurants with a Palo Alto opening targeted for this September 2010.  I can't wait till this spot opens up!

excerpts: We had mango salad for appetizer, and of course the roasted crab and garlic noodle for comparison purposes.
Presentation-wise, Thanh Long's roasted crab was more appetizing than PPQ's, which came drowning in watery butter and garlic.
Taste-wise
, Thanh Long's was more flavorful, though a tad too salty and dry for my taste.
Thanh Long's garlic noodle beat PPQ's hands down.
Not too buttery, not too garlicky, and
mango salad.author: Aldo H.
mango salad.review:
I would have never gone back to Thanh Long if it wasn't because of PPQ. Disappointed by PPQ, I got really curious how Thanh Long measured up to PPQ. According to Yelp, they are equals at 4 stars, but PPQ had well over 100 more reviews. I had been to Thanh Long as well as its sister restaurant Crustacean a long time ago, but couldn't remember how they were.

A couple of weeks after PPQ, we went to Thanh Long. We had mango salad for appetizer, and of course the roasted crab and garlic noodle for comparison purposes. Presentation-wise, Thanh Long's roasted crab was more appetizing than PPQ's, which came drowning in watery butter and garlic. Taste-wise, Thanh Long's was more flavorful, though a tad too salty and dry for my taste. Thanh Long's garlic noodle beat PPQ's hands down. Not too buttery, not too garlicky, and portion was generous. 

Now that I've determined the winner, I must say that this roasted style of crab is not really my cup of tea. I'd much prefer the salt and pepper crab of R&G Lounge. But that doesn't mean that Thanh Long doesn't deserve its 4 stars. It definitely deserves it much more than PPQ.

excerpts: ago)..two of us shared 2 orders of garlic noodles, one roasted crab, the mango salad, two beers which came out to be about $120
mango salad.author: A. A.
mango salad.review:
Awesome crab and garlic noodles! 

The last time I went there (a few weeks ago)..two of us shared 2 orders of garlic noodles, one roasted crab, the mango salad, two beers which came out to be about $120

excerpts: Also a huge fan of their Shaken Beef and Mango salad.
The Shaken Beef has so much flavor, I can't go there and not order it, even when I'm craving crab.
mango salad.author: CJ W.
mango salad.review:
My favorite restaurant in the city. I want to come here for my birthday every year. 

Seriously the most delicious crab and garlicky noodles. (And I am a crab snob.) Also a huge fan of their Shaken Beef and Mango salad. The Shaken Beef has so much flavor, I can't go there and not order it, even when I'm craving crab.

This is also a great place for small parties, although it can get really pricey if your friends eat like bottomless pits that order more and more crab and noodles throughout the evening. It is also quite the date destination. They also have a somewhat large upstairs room with lots more tables, so it's bigger than it looks. Great service too.

Must make reservations. They do take walk ins, but you'd be taking your chances on how long the wait will be. I wouldn't try it on a Friday or Saturday night. I miss the days when I could go on a whim, and when the prices weren't as expensive. Damn those dot com days that drove up the prices.

excerpts: Likewise the Mango salad composed of tasteless mango and some stray shrimp.
The scallops described on the menu as being in the salad were undetectable.
mango salad.author: David D.
mango salad.review:
Thanh Long has a menu.  A pretty extensive one.  But there are two reasons to come here, the garlic noodles and the roast crab.  Making a meal of anything else here would be like doing chicken at a steakhouse.  

Yes we did get a few additional things.  An appetizer of salt and pepper calamari was a bit rubbery but nicely spiced and was OK.   The Vietnamese salad was mainly cabbage with some stray shrimp and strange tasting chicken that was best forgotten.  Likewise the Mango salad composed of tasteless mango and some stray shrimp.  The scallops described on the menu as being in the salad were undetectable.  Also best forgotten were mains of stringy steamed sea bass and shaken beef marinated to the point where the beef had lost texture and taste.  

The saving graces here were the roasted whole crab, which had obviously been done in garlic and some pepper.  Not a wondrous dish but fresh crab that was properly prepared.  The garlic noodles were nice as well.  Nothing remarkable about this plate, just noodles with oodles of garlic.   

So come.  Get your fix of crab and noodles.  Avoid the rest of the menu and you will do well for yourself.

excerpts: We also had the mango salad or something like that
and it was ok too.
Parking sucks around this restaurant
so just suck it up and pay the valet in front of the restaurant.
mango salad.author: Dean S.
mango salad.review:
OK I finally made it here after I had heard so many good things about it...  finally got to try the Roast Crab and their famous Garlic noodles...  Everybody raves about the Garlic noodles, and they were pretty darn good but to tell you the truth, all it is is just a plate of plain noodles, skinny like spaghetti noodles with nothing else!  Maybe if there was chicken or some kind of vegetable with it I would have found it more appealing and I'd be raving about it.  
I did find that the Roast crab was amazing however!  One of the best crab dishes I have EVER had.  It is however also the messiest crab I have ever eaten.  Even messier than a crab feed. haha  The entire crab is drenched in garlic butter sauce so your hands and face are guaranteed to be slippery and completely messy with all the goodness.  You have to crack the crab yourself so be sure to wear the provided bib or else you'll get sauce or pieces of crab all over you.  I ate one and a half crabs which took me a good hour to crack and eat.  And it was totally worth it.  We also had the garlic toast, which was ok, it was just small thin pieces of sourdough bread toast with garlic butter. ha! so much garlic and butter in this restaurant your breath will be kickin' it for days!!  We also had the mango salad or something like that and it was ok too.  Parking sucks around this restaurant so just suck it up and pay the valet in front of the restaurant.  If you love crab and garlic, the Roast crab and Garlic noodles are totally worth it!!

excerpts: We started with their mango salad followed by their lemongrass chicken, eggplant dish, and of course as mentioned - garlic noodles w/ grilled shrimps.
The entire dining experience was excellent despite one of my co-workers getting served tepid coffee.
It was immediately dealt with by our server
so no harm was done.
Next time, we're going for their specialty which is their crab dinner.
Highly recommended.
mango salad.author: Chad B.
mango salad.review:
It has been several years since I last dined at this restaurant. We went here to celebrate a mini retirement party and we definitely had a one fantastic dinner. As always their garlic noodles coupled with their shrimps were just deliciously mouth-watering, that it was the first to go. We started with their mango salad followed by their lemongrass chicken, eggplant dish, and of course as mentioned - garlic noodles w/ grilled shrimps. The entire dining experience was excellent despite one of my co-workers getting served tepid coffee. It was immediately dealt with by our server so no harm was done.
Next time, we're going for their specialty which is their crab dinner. Highly recommended.

excerpts: The food was good and we ordered 2 crabs, 3 garlic noodles (so good!!!!!!!), a mango salad, and a shaken beef.
my favorite came out to be the garlic noodles, although the beef was good too.
I think I'd come back only for special occasions.
We paid $245+tax total.
mango salad.author: Junming G.
mango salad.review: I went here on my birthday and we were seated on the 2nd floor. The food was good and we ordered 2 crabs, 3 garlic noodles (so good!!!!!!!), a mango salad, and a shaken beef. my favorite came out to be the garlic noodles, although the beef was good too. I think I'd come back only for special occasions. We paid $245+tax total.

excerpts: Our best dish of the meal was the mango salad.
A must try and very different from other mango salad.
Make reservation if you don't want to wait.
mango salad.author: Marie V.
mango salad.review: Shaking beef and garlic noodle are great. Our best dish of the meal was the mango salad. A must try and very different from other mango salad. Make reservation if you don't want to wait.

excerpts: Start off your meal with the mango salad with scallops.
mango salad.author: Cathy L.
mango salad.review:
Yummy yummy I got Thanh Long in my tummy..

Start off your meal with the mango salad with scallops.  Dive into an order of garlic crab and add on the side order of garlic noodles.  You can taste the freshness of the pepper and garlic spices as you lick the sauce off your fingers.  The garlic noodles are so gooood "you'll find yourself searching for the recipe online when you get home" and pair pleasingly well with the crab.  Finish the meal with the fried banana and vanilla ice cream.  The food is sooo delicious you wouldn't want to share!

Do make reservations in advance so that you can be seated promptly upon arrival.  Do pay the $10 valet parking cause it's worth it.

excerpts: The mango salad was quite unexpected as well.
Mango is not shredded but chunky instead, which might not be that big of a deal.
However, the fried ice cream dessert had too much batter, very little ice cream while the ice cream is also melted quite a bit.
And, it doesn't look very appealing either.
It's a sort-of flatten dark looking ball rather than a nice round ball we normally see.
It looks like it got overburned.
The waitresses wear traditional clothes, which is kind of nice.
That is about the only thing that is traditional at this restaurant.
If you're looking for authentic Vietnamese food, this is not the place to go.
The dishes are quite expensive too.
mango salad.author: A N.
mango salad.review: We had tamarind crab. The crab itself is pretty fresh but the overall dish is not authentic tamarind crab at all. We could barely taste the tamarind in the sauce, it mostly had tomato sauce which is quite unexpected. If you Google "tamarind crab" you will see this is very different than the authentic one. The sauce is too wet for typical tamarind crab. The Asian bouillabaisse is not authentic either, not enough herbs, but has scallion instead, which is a little odd. Authentic dish normally doesn't have green onion. The mango salad was quite unexpected as well. Mango is not shredded but chunky instead, which might not be that big of a deal. However, the fried ice cream dessert had too much batter, very little ice cream while the ice cream is also melted quite a bit. And, it doesn't look very appealing either. It's a sort-of flatten dark looking ball rather than a nice round ball we normally see. It looks like it got overburned. The waitresses wear traditional clothes, which is kind of nice. That is about the only thing that is traditional at this restaurant. If you're looking for authentic Vietnamese food, this is not the place to go. The dishes are quite expensive too. A tamarind crab (market price) is for $48 and it's not that huge either. I think the restaurant is overrated because of its owners' fame and history.

excerpts: One of my favorites was the mango salad.
So fresh and delicious!
Their sauteed veggies were good, wine & liquor selection extensive enough and priced  right.
I ordered their Latte and Lace coffee drink for dessert and it was fab.
I normally hate liquor-laced coffee but this was fantastic.
This is a great casual restaurant for a tasty dinner.
Leave your designer anything at home if you plan to wait outside.
A mugging might ruin your appetite.
mango salad.author: Faye S.
mango salad.review:
The roasted buttery crab and garlic noodles are perfect. I ate here last night and I already can't wait to return(despite the scary neighborhood). One of my favorites was the mango salad. So fresh and delicious! Their sauteed veggies were good, wine & liquor selection extensive enough and priced  right. I ordered their Latte and Lace coffee drink for dessert and it was fab. I normally hate liquor-laced coffee but this was fantastic. 
This is a great casual restaurant for a tasty dinner. Leave your designer anything at home if you plan to wait outside. A mugging might ruin your appetite.

excerpts: With no expectation whatsoever, we ordered exactly as we were told, "mango salad, garlic noodles, and a roasted crab, please."
The mango salad came out first.
I didn't know what to expect, I've never actually had mango in my salad.
But boy was it amazing!
(It might actually be the best salad I've ever had!)
Immediately following were the garlic noodles.
I must admit, I wasn't exactly thrilled to see a slab of green noodles, but it was surprisingly quite tasty.
It definitely complemented the roasted crab-which by far was the best dish there!
Everything about the meal was perfect!
mango salad.author: Siu L.
mango salad.review:
I absolutely love, love, love this place.  I can still remember my first time at Thanh Long.  With no expectation whatsoever, we ordered exactly as we were told, "mango salad, garlic noodles, and a roasted crab, please."  The mango salad came out first.  I didn't know what to expect, I've never actually had mango in my salad.  But boy was it amazing!  (It might actually be the best salad I've ever had!)  Immediately following were the garlic noodles.  I must admit, I wasn't exactly thrilled to see a slab of green noodles, but it was surprisingly quite tasty.  It definitely complemented the roasted crab-which by far was the best dish there!  Everything about the meal was perfect!  Nice decor, good customer service, and most importantly, delicious food!  

SIDE NOTE:  I wouldn't recommend having a first date here because you really have to get hands-on with the crab.  Then there's the garlic breath from the noodles.  I'm not sure that'll be the best first impression.  At least not for the girls.  haha...

excerpts: This place is renown for several dishes which you will see raved over again and again in the reviews (garlic noodles, roasted crab, mango salad).
This is a destination neighborhood restaurant that has been around for years and has a very loyal following.
Their formula and Crustaceans (the An's family other more famous francise) is simple: not a large menu, consistently good food and a very attentive staff.
Yes, the legendary garlic noodles are everything they live up to
and yes, this place is not cheap, especially if you have the crab at market prices.
I do love bringing people here from out of town, so they can experience what the other 95% of the City is about.

Word of advice though, parking can be a pain and there really isn't any other places around here to investigate (Ocean Beach and Golden Gate Park is just a few blocks away, but hardly the places you want to go to in the dark) since this is mostly a residential area.
mango salad.author: Elkabong D.
mango salad.review:
This place is renown for several dishes which you will see raved over again and again in the reviews (garlic noodles, roasted crab, mango salad). This is a destination neighborhood restaurant that has been around for years and has a very loyal following. Their formula and Crustaceans (the An's family other more famous francise) is simple: not a large menu, consistently good food and a very attentive staff. You never feel rushed here and they can accommodate large groups, although this is not a place to go if you have claustrophobia or want an intimate quiet setting.

Yes, the legendary garlic noodles are everything they live up to and yes, this place is not cheap, especially if you have the crab at market prices. I do love bringing people here from out of town, so they can experience what the other 95% of the City is about. Word of advice though, parking can be a pain and there really isn't any other places around here to investigate (Ocean Beach and Golden Gate Park is just a few blocks away, but hardly the places you want to go to in the dark) since this is mostly a residential area.

excerpts: roasted crab, garlic noodles, calamari, and mango salad
, this is what my wifey
and I order every time we come here.
You cant go wrong here.
This is one of my top 10 favorite restaurant.
mango salad.author: Reese D.
mango salad.review: roasted crab, garlic noodles, calamari, and mango salad, this is what my wifey and I order every time we come here. You cant go wrong here. This is one of my top 10 favorite restaurant.

excerpts: We had a mango salad, garlic noodles and roast crab.
The mangoes were warm in the salad which was different but I enjoyed it.
The garlic noodles were delicious.
The crab was ok.
I requested vinegar because my Filipino side required it.
It was very noisy and busy by the time the food came out.
The experience was good
but I don't think I will be returning for their $40 crab.
Our waitress was very attentive which was great
but I prefer my mom's instead.
mango salad.author: Bianca D.
mango salad.review: My boyfriend has been dying to take me here for over a year and one day we actually found the time to go.  We arrived promptly at 5 and were seated immediately without reservations.  I let him do the ordering.  We had a mango salad, garlic noodles and roast crab.  The mangoes were warm in the salad which was different but I enjoyed it.  The garlic noodles were delicious.  The crab was ok.  I requested vinegar because my Filipino side required it.  It was very noisy and busy by the time the food came out.  The experience was good but I don't think I will be returning for their $40 crab.  Our waitress was very attentive which was great but I prefer my mom's instead.

excerpts: Other dishes like their Mango Salad and Stuffed Calamari are terrific also.
Be prepared to go to the ATM at 7-11s across the street... because those seafood "market value" prices can pinch you in the wallet.
Parking can be a bummer, but they do offer valet for $9 (as of 8/2006).
mango salad.author: Leroid D.
mango salad.review: Holy Roasted Dungeness Crab and Garlic Noodles! Some of the best I've tasted by far. Other dishes like their Mango Salad and Stuffed Calamari are terrific also. Be prepared to go to the ATM at 7-11s across the street... because those seafood "market value" prices can pinch you in the wallet. Parking can be a bummer, but they do offer valet for $9 (as of 8/2006).

excerpts:
Mango Salad
Garlic noodles
Roasted crab.
mango salad.author: L. N.
mango salad.review:
Maria you were so right!

Mango Salad
Garlic noodles
Roasted crab.

Definitely a repeat!

excerpts: We ordered garlic crab, tiger prawns, shaking beef, mango salad, crab wontons, calamari, and of course the garlic noodles.
This time around, the food came out hot and the garlic noodles definitely tasted MUCH better.
The seafood mango salad was tasty, the shanking beef was very flavorful and the drinks & service was great.
mango salad.author: Linda L.
mango salad.review:
Update: 4/4/09 2.5 stars so, I'm rounding up.

Just had dinner here again this weekend. Since I live so close by, I had to give this place another try  and I want to beleive that it can do better. The food did improve, but just marginally.

We ordered garlic crab, tiger prawns, shaking beef, mango salad, crab wontons, calamari, and of course the garlic noodles. This time around, the food came out hot and the garlic noodles definitely tasted MUCH better. The seafood mango salad was tasty, the shanking beef was very flavorful and the drinks & service was great. 

Most of the food was overall pretty good, except for the crab. This place used to be known for their crab, so I am still disappointed that the crab majorly sucked. You can tell that it was frozen because there was some blue/green frost-bite to the crab meat when you removed the shell. Also, even though the crab was doused in butter and salt & pepper, the meat was very dry and bland. 

I would go here again, but I would order anything but the crab.

excerpts: Love the tamirand crab, Thanh long mussels, mango salad, actually everything that I tried.
My favorite actually the Godiva Lava cake with grand marnier sauce...it is to die for and you can only get it at Thanh Long.
mango salad.author: Eva E.
mango salad.review: Best spot for roasted crab!! I have never been disappointed from this place.  Yes, it is a bit overpriced but you get what you pay for.  Love the tamirand crab, Thanh long mussels, mango salad, actually everything that I tried.  My favorite actually the Godiva Lava cake with grand marnier sauce...it is to die for and you can only get it at Thanh Long.

excerpts: We also got the mango salad which was also pretty good.
I guess I expected too much from this place after hearing about it from so many people, but don't get it wrong, this place is GOOD.
Oh yeah, they have some good service as well.
I forgot to talk about parking...
it wasn't too bad.
I parked a block from the place, and there was a few spaces on 46th between Kirkham and Lawton, if that isn't too far for anybody.
mango salad.author: Edgar G.
mango salad.review: I've always wanted to try this place, but never got a chance to. My sisters and I celebrated our mother's birthday here for dinner and I must say, this place is pretty damn good. We got the garlic noodles which was very tasty. We also got the famous roasted crab and the drunken crab. In my opinion the roasted crab was much better with more flavoring compare to the drunken crab. The drunken crab was ok, but there wasn't enough flavoring inside, but nonetheless it was good. We also got the mango salad which was also pretty good. I guess I expected too much from this place after hearing about it from so many people, but don't get it wrong, this place is GOOD. Oh yeah, they have some good service as well. I forgot to talk about parking... it wasn't too bad. I parked a block from the place, and there was a few spaces on 46th between Kirkham and Lawton, if that isn't too far for anybody.

excerpts: The mango salad was kinda bland, totally un-Vietnamese
... romaine lettuce with bits of mango and shrimp.
I could have tossed it myself at home.
mango salad.author: Evelyn L.
mango salad.review:
We had reservations and yet, we were made to wait. 

The garlic noodles were garlicky enough... and the roast crab was pretty decent, but other than that, I really do not understand why people rave about this place. Seriously.

The mango salad was kinda bland, totally un-Vietnamese... romaine lettuce with bits of mango and shrimp. I could have tossed it myself at home. The dungeness crab puffs were filled with mayonaise that you can't really taste any crab meat and they weren't 'puffy". They were basically mayonnaise wrapped in wanton skins.

The only saving grace was the molten chocolate cake, but served without much flair. The vanilla ice-cream served on the side weren't scoped out properly, it came out all mushed up with the whipped cream. So, I understand that Asians don't do desserts well, but a little imagination on presentation won't hurt. Afterall, we do eat with our eyes first, don't we?

Nothing much to talk about.  And, it burned a little hole in my wallet.  For that money, I could have a very decent meal at The Slanted Door and have no complains whatsoever. Or, perhaps a few meals at Vung Tau in San Jose. ;-)

A big disappointment.

excerpts: We ordered the mango salad, Dungeness crab puffs, ginger calamari, Drunken Crab, Roast Crab and the garlic rice.
so the Boyfriend and I again followed the advice of our friend and ordered some garlic rice.
In terms of food, Thanh Long gets five stars.
The Parents loved the food.
The ginger calamari was well-seasoned, not too gingery and not too salty.
It was particularly yummy with the pineapples.
The mango salad was delicious (it has shrimp and scallops as well) and the garlic rice was flavorful without being overpowering.
The mango salad was delicious (it has shrimp and scallops as well) and the garlic rice was flavorful without being overpowering.
The Dungeness crab puffs were a big hit but pricey.
It was basically a tastier version of crab rangoon.
Now for the crab: right before ordering, the Boyfriend and I faithfully checked Yelp and some had said that the Roast Crab was too salty.
The Dad isn't too fond of wine-reduction
so we tried the Roast Crab first.
It was delicious and not too salty at all.
The waiter comes over with plastic bibs and you get to cracking (well...
the Boyfriend and the Dad got to cracking and then fed the Mom and me bits and pieces).
One crab is about enough for one person to be full.
One crab is about enough to make two grown men half-full so calculate accordingly.
We ordered the Drunken Crab to mix things up and it was also good.
It tastes much more Asian in that the wine reduction really saves the flavor of the crab - it's much more crabby than the Roast crab which is more seasoned.
The Dad and the Boyfriend liked the Roast Crab a little better, though, so if you want to choose one, I'd advise the Roast Crab.
Don't worry about messy/crabby hands.
The waitstaff comes by with hot (caution: extremely hot) warm towels for you to towel off between and after crab eating.
Finally, for dessert, we ordered orange sorbet.
It's really cute - it comes in a frozen orange that's been beheaded and the lemon sorbet comes in a frozen lemon that's been beheaded!
The only reason I won't give Thanh Long is that the prices are a bit high.
The crab is market price (which meant $37.50 each crab as of June 7, 2009) and the other dishes are pricey as well.
mango salad.author: Christine P.
mango salad.review: The Dad loves crab so when the Parents came up for the weekend, the Boyfriend and I decided to follow a friend's advice and take them to Thanh Long. The Parents are notoriously picky about food and the Dad is particularly so when it comes to crab. It has to be fresh, can't be over-seasoned and has to be meaty. Thank goodness for Thanh Long. We ordered the mango salad, Dungeness crab puffs, ginger calamari, Drunken Crab, Roast Crab and the garlic rice. The Boyfriend and I had heard that people loved the garlic noodles but the Parents didn't like the looks of it so the Boyfriend and I again followed the advice of our friend and ordered some garlic rice. In terms of food, Thanh Long gets five stars. The Parents loved the food. The ginger calamari was well-seasoned, not too gingery and not too salty. It was particularly yummy with the pineapples. The mango salad was delicious (it has shrimp and scallops as well) and the garlic rice was flavorful without being overpowering. The Dungeness crab puffs were a big hit but pricey. It was basically a tastier version of crab rangoon. Now for the crab: right before ordering, the Boyfriend and I faithfully checked Yelp and some had said that the Roast Crab was too salty. The Dad isn't too fond of wine-reduction so we tried the Roast Crab first. It was delicious and not too salty at all. The waiter comes over with plastic bibs and you get to cracking (well...the Boyfriend and the Dad got to cracking and then fed the Mom and me bits and pieces). One crab is about enough for one person to be full. One crab is about enough to make two grown men half-full so calculate accordingly. We ordered the Drunken Crab to mix things up and it was also good. It tastes much more Asian in that the wine reduction really saves the flavor of the crab - it's much more crabby than the Roast crab which is more seasoned. The Dad and the Boyfriend liked the Roast Crab a little better, though, so if you want to choose one, I'd advise the Roast Crab. Don't worry about messy/crabby hands. The waitstaff comes by with hot (caution: extremely hot) warm towels for you to towel off between and after crab eating. Finally, for dessert, we ordered orange sorbet. It's really cute - it comes in a frozen orange that's been beheaded and the lemon sorbet comes in a frozen lemon that's been beheaded! The only reason I won't give Thanh Long is that the prices are a bit high. The crab is market price (which meant $37.50 each crab as of June 7, 2009) and the other dishes are pricey as well.

excerpts: We wanted some veggies but the Buddha rolls came out cold, and the mango salad hot and somewhat lacking, and the Asian Bouillabaisse was just tomato water with some flavor and lukewarm.
Honestly only the mussels came out piping hot as most of the other foods must have  been pr-prepared and just warmed up.
It is crab season so each crab was $37, now is the best time to go!
mango salad.author: Patty J.
mango salad.review: I would go with the reviews and suggestions and just order their crabs (both roasted and drunken were great), garlic noodles (which were not greasy this time!) and the fantastic green mussels.  We wanted some veggies but the Buddha rolls came out cold, and the mango salad hot and somewhat lacking, and the Asian Bouillabaisse was just tomato water with some flavor and lukewarm.  Honestly only the mussels came out piping hot as most of the other foods must have  been pr-prepared and just warmed up.  It is crab season so each crab was $37, now is the best time to go!  Plan to go back and try the tamarind crab and more mussels.  Will try take out?

excerpts: and I ordered their Mango Salad and let me tell you.. it was HEAVENLY!!!
I normally don't eat scallops but theirs was THE BOMB!
it was DELICIOUS!
I LOVE their dessert as well, their chocolate dessert was rich and creamy... mmm, yummy!
mango salad.author: Christina Z.
mango salad.review: I LOVE THIS PLACE!!!  Ok, so I'd pass by this place EVERY DAY before and after I go to work and when I would get home (which is around 8:30pm) the place is already busy and packed with people (especially on the weekends).  So I tried it with a friend, Wendy to celebrate our birthdays and I ordered their Mango Salad and let me tell you.. it was HEAVENLY!!! I normally don't eat scallops but theirs was THE BOMB! it was DELICIOUS! I LOVE their dessert as well, their chocolate dessert was rich and creamy... mmm, yummy! Then last weekend I went in there with my boyfriend, and we ordered their Salt and Pepper calamari, garlic noodles and roasted crab... my oh my, it was REALLY good!  And their bartender, Peter was very nice and friendly.  He made my drink (Pinacolada) just the way I like it. :-D  I would definitely come back again in this restaurant... Now I know why this place is always packed.... their servings are so good! And not only that, I like the fact that after eating crabs the waiters/servers would give you a HOT (and I mean REALLY hot) damp towel to wipe your hands... I strongly recommend anyone to go to this place and try it themselves, it's worth the long line of waiting although they make up by serving your food faster and efficiently.

excerpts: The succulent steamed sea bass is a must as well with that delicious ginger and citrus infused dipping sauce!
Walked in at 6pm (no reservations) and luckily was seated right away.
Since parking is a challenge here, no
5-star but the food is simply delightful!
steamed sea bass.author: Valerie K.
steamed sea bass.review: All the way from Sacramento to get our Thanh Long fix once again!  We know the crab is excellent! Drunken crab simmered in that Chardonnay, sake and brandy and dipping our garlic noodles in it is oh so good! The succulent steamed sea bass is a must as well with that delicious ginger and citrus infused dipping sauce!  Walked in at 6pm (no reservations) and luckily was seated right away.  Since parking is a challenge here, no 5-star but the food is simply delightful!

excerpts: Steamed Sea Bass: again very general.
The sea bass tasted overcooked.
It wasn't very tender.
steamed sea bass.author: Lilly W.
steamed sea bass.review:
I was excited to try this out. This is supposed to be the best Viet food in SF. And my friends are raving about the garlic noodles. We were at a friend's that's nearby. So put our name down and came back 45 mins later for a table of seven and got seated right away Sat around 8pm. 

The food was definitely good. But it wasn't the best Viet food that I ever had. The crabs from PPQ is definitely better (comparing the roasted crabs). Here is the list of food that we ordered. 

Mango salad: Only okay. It's too warm for a salad. Even the lettuce felt cooked, which is weird for me. 

Steamed Sea Bass: again very general. The sea bass tasted overcooked. It wasn't very tender. The House's sea bass is 10x better. 

Spicy eggplant: this was tasty. It also had chicken and shrimp. But something you can get at every chinese restaurant. 

Roasted crab: not as good as PPQ. Very oily and not as tasty. 

French beef: the beef is very tender. Definitely one of the better dishes. The portion is not very big as it is served on a big bed of lettuce. 

Salt and pepper calamari: this was very good. It didn't have a lot of breading. 

Grilled prawn over garlic noodles: it's good but nothing too special. The prawn was big but only four pieces. 

Garlic noodles: this is very good. Not too buttery. But I think the garlic noodles from The Kickin Crab is better.

excerpts: The younger twin chose the steamed sea bass.
It was a very good dish leaving everybody who had a chunk of the fish wanting more.
We probably should have ordered another dish of lemongrass chicken and steamed sea bass.
Alex and another server helped us take group pictures to commemorate the occasion.
We enjoyed our dinner tremendously.
steamed sea bass.author: Belinda L.
steamed sea bass.review:
It's been 21 years since we ate at this restaurant. The occasion then was my husband asking my parents for my hand in marriage. My sister wanted to celebrate my twin daughters' 18th birthday here. My husband made the reservation. There were only 2 reservations available a 5:30 p.m. or 8:30 p.m. We took the later one because of other obligations. There was a little bit of a wait for our table when we arrived.
Alex was our server. He got our water and hot jasmine tea going and answered questions about our menu choices such as how much roast crab and garlic noodles to order for our party of 10, which fish was the better choice, ... We went with 2 roasted crabs and 2 garlic noodles because Grandpa's dish of tiger prawns came with garlic noodles. There were 4 tiger prawns in the dish. The prawns were excellent. There weren't enough for everybody at the table. The garlic noodles always a hit with everybody especially the younger ones in the party. We had to order another garlic noodles and a large bowl of steamed rice. We had the salt and pepper calamari. We ordered the lemongrass chicken for Grandma. The dish was so tasty and the vegetables so tender that the grandchildren ate a good portion of the dish. We wonder if Grandma got enough to eat. The younger twin chose the steamed sea bass. It was a very good dish leaving everybody who had a chunk of the fish wanting more. The older twin enjoyed her shaken beef. The younger twin and her father thoroughly enjoyed the roasted crab and the big chunks of meat they got out of every leg.
The twins received complimentary desserts of ice cream in recognition of their birthday. The older twin shared a fried banana a la mode with her mother. Aunt and uncle also ordered another fried banana a la mode. The older twin liked the way the banana was fried. The fried layer was not thin. The vanilla ice cream tasted very natural. Little cousin ordered the lava cake with ice cream. We'll have to come back another time to try the homemade sorbet which is on the list of foods the younger twin can have not being able to tolerate milk products.
The roast crabs cost $55 each. We probably should have ordered another dish of lemongrass chicken and steamed sea bass.
Alex and another server helped us take group pictures to commemorate the occasion. We enjoyed our dinner tremendously.

excerpts: We ordered soft crab, mussels, calamari, roasted crab, garlic noodles, shaken beef, and Steamed Sea Bass.
