Out of the dishes we ordered mussels was passable.
The mussels was flavorful and delicious.
steamed sea bass.author: Kathleen U.
steamed sea bass.review:
Disappointment. Overrated.

What happened to you, Thanh Long? 
Thanh Long is/was known for their Roasted Crab & Garlic Noodles. I use to think the food here was pretty good and decent enough for "Vietnamese food" even though I don't believe garlic noodles is authentic Vietnamese food. Now, I'm just disappointed.

Recently, I went to Thanh Long for one of my friend's birthday celebration. She made reservations for 6 people and said it was super easy to make reservations. Probably, it was for a Sunday night. Back in the day, it would take awhile for reservations and if you didn't make reservations, you would have to wait for 1 hour - 2 hours to be seated. 

We ordered soft crab, mussels, calamari, roasted crab, garlic noodles, shaken beef, and Steamed Sea Bass. Out of the dishes we ordered mussels was passable. The mussels was flavorful and delicious. The garlic noodles wasn't as a good as before. The roasted crab was still good, but not great. The food seems to become just mediocre.

When I'm craving for crab and garlic noodles, I won't be coming here unless I have to.

excerpts: And also the steamed sea bass entree.
steamed sea bass.author: Kevin L.
steamed sea bass.review:
I think the last time I was here was 6 years ago.  And this was probably the first "fancy" restaurant I went to back in high school.  And the first time for garlic noodles that was so WOW to me back then.  20 years later and many many new culinary experiences, the garlic noodles ain't no big thang.

You come here for the roast crab and garlic noodles, yes but I wanted to try something new.  So in addition, I got the mango salad and seafood dumpling.  And also the steamed sea bass entree.

Roast crab was just ok.  I prefer PPQ and the salt & pepper fried crab at R&G more.  Thanh Long's crab was flavorful but over peppered and garlic oiled at times.  The weak part was the tamale in the shell.  It seemed like it was cleaned out a bit and the crab wasn't as big as it usually is.  Maybe its not so in season now but they should still be reserving colossal size crabs for their dishes.  We had the prawns with garlic noodles.  The prawns very overdone a bit and had too much buttery/pepper smeared over it.  It was cholesterol city last night.

Mango salad too my surprise had stir fried shrimp and onions on top making the salad a bit warm and welted.

Seafood dumpling seem like it was heated in the microwave and had a dry appearance.

Both salad and dumpling came out super fast.

Sea bass was over done too and just wasn't as smooth as it should be.  Sea bass ain't suppose to taste "meaty".  I think a filet-o-fish has an even more delicate flaky texture.  I would rather had two filet-o-fish sandwiches on that big plate instead of the sea bass.

No plate presentation on anything.

Ordered a pineapple lychee martini before ordering food but it never came and the food did.  I had to ask and then they said they were all out of the infusion?  So I tried a passion tea martini which came after the entrees.  So it sat there getting warm as I started to eat and didn't feel like drinking it anymore.  It was nice when it was straight cold.  

Server who took our order never came back to ask what's up with the food.  Instead the runner asked?  Pretty whack on service.

$41.95 for the crab is totally not worth it.  I would pay 20 bucks at most.  In fact, I can make this at home and I do every time crab season starts.  Go to sunset supermarket or new may wah and get some live crabs and cook it up at home.  I could of cooked a bunch of crab for the money I spent here.

All good, it was my birthday and didn't want to cook at home and Thanh Long is about 4 minutes from my home.

excerpts: Loved the Roasted crab, garlic noodles, steamed sea bass, shrimp toast...
the dumplings were just okay
but that's not too bad considering the amount of food we had.
We came here for a birthday and the bill came to about $80 per person.
We also tried the shaking beef and the clay pot.
Service was great, food was delicious.
Our party and the birthday girl were very happy!
steamed sea bass.author: Jennifer B.
steamed sea bass.review:
YUMMY! 

Lives up to the hype.  Loved the Roasted crab, garlic noodles, steamed sea bass, shrimp toast...the dumplings were just okay but that's not too bad considering the amount of food we had. We came here for a birthday and the bill came to about $80 per person.  We also tried the shaking beef and the clay pot.  Service was great, food was delicious.  Our party and the birthday girl were very happy!

excerpts: We each ordered an entree--the steamed sea bass was the perfect portion size & prepared well.
steamed sea bass.author: Tanya N.
steamed sea bass.review:
We live the neighborhood, walked by many times and decided to try it out on New Year's Eve. When we walked in, we were pleasantly surprised by the atmosphere--very open, warm, and full bar.
The infused vodka martinis were unique and pretty good.
The prawn wanton appetizer was just ok-the pancetta was a bit overpowering. We each ordered an entree--the steamed sea bass was the perfect portion size & prepared well. The roast crab was delicious, but maybe a bit overpriced at $38. We shared the garlic noodles, which definitely had a ton of garlic & maybe a bit too salty. I would have been ok skipping desert, but we tried the fried bananas, which were quite boring.
Service was great...attentive & not rushed...we were also seated quickly.
Overall--worth a try and we would go back.

excerpts: garlic noodle.(+

only coz i cant find other things +; a bit oily and at $9 only for noodle with garlic taste nothing else unique is expensive); steam bass - taste fresh(+)
Cons: expensive $$$; the garlic crab is avg taste, steamed bass... 
serving -is small; Orange sorbet fitted in a  small peeled orange fruit cup- for $7
+ so so taste..;
long queue (went on sat.
night).
steamed sea bass.author: Jerome S.
steamed sea bass.review:
We tried this place from some friends recommendation and from TV -show . Was very disappointed
What we ordered: Garlic noodle $9+, steamed sea bass $25+, roasted crab $37 ; orange sorbet
Pros: food presentation(++);  garlic noodle.(+ only coz i cant find other things +; a bit oily and at $9 only for noodle with garlic taste nothing else unique is expensive); steam bass - taste fresh(+)
Cons: expensive $$$; the garlic crab is avg taste, steamed bass... 
serving -is small; Orange sorbet fitted in a  small peeled orange fruit cup- for $7+ so so taste..; long queue (went on sat. night).;  Parking - be prepared to walk far or pay $10 for valet parking

Coming back : not sure ..will think twice
Recommending to a friend: not sure

excerpts: Also best forgotten were mains of stringy steamed sea bass and shaken beef marinated to the point where the beef had lost texture and taste.
steamed sea bass.author: David D.
steamed sea bass.review:
Thanh Long has a menu.  A pretty extensive one.  But there are two reasons to come here, the garlic noodles and the roast crab.  Making a meal of anything else here would be like doing chicken at a steakhouse.  

Yes we did get a few additional things.  An appetizer of salt and pepper calamari was a bit rubbery but nicely spiced and was OK.   The Vietnamese salad was mainly cabbage with some stray shrimp and strange tasting chicken that was best forgotten.  Likewise the Mango salad composed of tasteless mango and some stray shrimp.  The scallops described on the menu as being in the salad were undetectable.  Also best forgotten were mains of stringy steamed sea bass and shaken beef marinated to the point where the beef had lost texture and taste.  

The saving graces here were the roasted whole crab, which had obviously been done in garlic and some pepper.  Not a wondrous dish but fresh crab that was properly prepared.  The garlic noodles were nice as well.  Nothing remarkable about this plate, just noodles with oodles of garlic.   

So come.  Get your fix of crab and noodles.  Avoid the rest of the menu and you will do well for yourself.

excerpts: We also had the Steamed Sea Bass and it was wonderful too, but it just didn't hold a candle to the Roasted Crab...
sorry little Sea Bass, you were out-shined!
steamed sea bass.author: Araceli E.
steamed sea bass.review:
I had the pleasure of being treated to this last Sunday....pure heaven I tell you! Cozy little place with good ambiance and great service.

The Garlic Noodles are fantastic! They had a perfect balance of garlic, not too much, not too little, and very flavorful. We shared a plate for two, but secretly I could've scarffed the whole plate down myself...hahah!
We had a salad (forgot which one) but it had an amazing raspberry vinaigrette, very, very delicious.
And of course we ordered the Roasted Crab....to die for. Hands down the best crab I've ever had! Seasoned with pepper and cooked to perfection...I can't even verbalize it, you just have to try this!
We also had the Steamed Sea Bass and it was wonderful too, but it just didn't hold a candle to the Roasted Crab...sorry little Sea Bass, you were out-shined!
Had dessert too (hey, we had an appetitie...for destruction..lol), banana cake something with ice-cream, topped off with a Lace Latte...perfect way to end dinner.

Pricey but worth it, nice way to treat a lady to a spontaneous and romantic dinner after hanging out at Ocean Beach....LOVED IT. Only missing one star because the place is small and there isn't much privacy.

excerpts: Steamed Sea Bass was light and buttery with a delicious citrus sauce.
Roasted crab was luscious as usual.
Definitely worth the drive (and quest for parking although they do offer valet) if you want a more casual atmosphere.
steamed sea bass.author: Maren P.
steamed sea bass.review: Finally made it over to Thanh Long after being a loyal Crustacean visitor for a while. Crustacean is walking distance for me, so the trek over to the Sunset wasn't ideal, but it was well worth it. The food is amazing and the atmosphere is comfortable and relaxed. No wait at all for a table for 2. The garlic noodles (as always) are killer. I was quite full after eating half of them, but they were so delicious that they just magically jumped into my mouth until they were all gone. Steamed Sea Bass was light and buttery with a delicious citrus sauce. Roasted crab was luscious as usual. Definitely worth the drive (and quest for parking although they do offer valet) if you want a more casual atmosphere.

excerpts: My sister had the steamed Sea Bass.
it was OK.
steamed sea bass.author: Ge I.
steamed sea bass.review:
I have been to this restaurant a several times. My first experience was not so good. I didn't really like there food. I can't even really remember what I ate. Another time I remember going there was for a friends birthday dinner. It was about 12 people for dinner. The place is very nice but the service it not. The treatment that we got was eat and get out. maybe because we were such a big group? They told us that we had a 2 hours. (Time limit) Never heard of that for a restaurant. I thought that was rude. The waitress was looking at us and giving us the evil to hurry up and leave. Which was not nice. 
Otherwise the food is Good, not great. 
The Grilled Calamari was good but salty which I hate salty foods. My sister had the steamed Sea Bass. it was OK. The Shaken Beef was good. Of course the crab is good. I think everyone might go there for that. I would go back there but not any time soon.

excerpts: Steamed Sea Bass ($24.95) - sea bass was flaky, moist, and really good.
The sauce was sweet and gingery.
steamed sea bass.author: Daniel M.
steamed sea bass.review:
I've been here before and I thought it was great (and still do!), but after eating at Crustaceans, Thanh Long only gets 4 stars...

Took my parents and Anhie T. here for Chinese New Years dinner, and reservations were made at 8.30, but at 7.15 we were able to move it up to 7.45 with no problems.  We got there, and it was pretty empty...with maybe 20 diners at about 5-6 different tables.  Barren compared to when Anhie T. and I came about 2 yrs ago.  We were seated immediately, and looked over the menu, and ordered the following:

Crispy Rice Paper Roll ($7.50) - your standard Vietnamese Egg Roll.  But here you get once egg roll cut into four pieces.
Thanh Long Mussells ($10.95) - five mussells served with five slices of thin garlic bread.  This dish was delicious.
Steamed Sea Bass ($24.95) - sea bass was flaky, moist, and really good.  The sauce was sweet and gingery.
Stuffed Calamari ($15.95) - lots of calamari stuffed with minced meat in a tomato based sauce.  Parents didn't like it so much, but I thought it was okay.
Shaken Beef ($20.95) - very flavorful, and a dish that everyone loved.  The beef was tender and potatoes were flavorful.
Garlic Noodles (2 orders at $9.50 ea) - Garlicky and delicious! 
Roast Crab (I think it was $38) - really good crab...but compared to Crustaceans, it's not the same.  Not as flavorful, but still very, very good nonetheless. 
Creme Brulee (2 orders) - My dad and Anhie T. thought this was the best dessert dish.
Banana Cake - I liked this dish and everyone else didn't like it.  Served with a scoop of Vanilla ice cream, a dallop of whip cream, this cake seemed to be made out of only bananas.  Anhie T. said it was bland.  I disagree.
Hot Chocolate Cake - served with Vanilla ice cream...this was good.  Really rich though.
Coke (2 glasses) - served from their bar in a tall, slim glass.  No free refills.

Total bill with tax + tip came out to $218.

This was my parents first time here and they loved the crab, and garlic noodles.  They did say it was a bit oily, but c'mon, roasted crab and garlic noodles anywhere is a bit oily.  But here's a good sign.  As they left, they took some business cards.  That means they liked their food and they'll be back...probably with some family friends!

Depending on my the mood (and thickness of the wallet), I would come back.  

But other substitutions are very comparable:  PPQ is cheaper and quality isn't far behind, while Crustacean is a tad more expensive, but swankier....

Tip 'o the day:  Avoid the valet parking outside.  Parking isn't too difficult in the Sunset.  And even if you had to walk one block after dinner, it may clear up your arteries after all the butter used in cooking the crab!

excerpts: For entrees we ordered the steamed sea bass, which I thought was just a tad overcooked, but the sauce was good.
steamed sea bass.author: carebear l.
steamed sea bass.review: My bf brought me here for a birthday surprise romantic dinner here.  We kind of have this unfinished business/ past history thing at this establishment. For appetizers we ordered the Thanh Long mussels, which came with little toasted crostini, the mussels were cooked really well and were not chewy at all  and the salt and pepper squid was lightly battered and not overcooked. For soups we ordered asian bouillabaisse, which was tasty, with just the perfect amount of tamarind. For entrees we ordered the steamed sea bass, which I thought was just a tad overcooked, but the sauce was good. The colossal royal tiger prawns were really nothing to brag about, but the garlic noodles.....wow they were delicious. I would come back here, just for the garlic noodles. The drunken crab tasted like soapy dishwater to me, I guess I should have ordered the Roasted crab. The service was great, but the silverware was dirty. I would come back here, but the food is just too overpriced. A lot of these dishes you can definitely order at another restaurant for half the price and will taste just as good if not better. It's kind of funny how some of the dishes are home style type of dishes, but the names are changed to sound a lot more sophisticated so that they can charge an arm and a leg. Overall , I give the food and service a 4 stars, but they get 3 stars for overcharging for the dishes that are home style and can be found in many Vietnamese kitchens. I do know I'll be back for the garlic noodles though.

excerpts: The best steamed sea bass EVER.
steamed sea bass.author: Bleep S.
steamed sea bass.review: The best steamed sea bass EVER.  My friend favors the crab and garlic noodles...the bib is mandatory.

excerpts:
So this is what I remember from the night's festivities, once the food coma wore off:
Salmon carpaccio, the Buddha roll, the prawn bouillabaisse, garlic noodles, the roast crab, tiger prawns and the steamed sea bass.
In a word, YUM.
Come hungry though, because you will want to indulge in all kinds of different flavors, and the menu is versatile enough to do so.

I got my salt from the yummy carpaccio, "fresh" from the spring roll-esque Buddha roll, tang from the bouillabaisse (though I will say I did not expect such a seemingly random selection of different veggies/fruit to taste good together...
I was kinda like, "um...why are there tomatoes and pineapple together to complement my seafood soup?
but it was actually pretty enjoyable), bitter (in a good way, though my breath was banging after all the garlic!)
from the noodles, and boredom from the main entrees.
the sea bass and the crab...
i guess i just wanted more flavor?
steamed sea bass.author: Danielle D.
steamed sea bass.review:
When my girls and I go out to eat, we EAT.
So this is what I remember from the night's festivities, once the food coma wore off:
Salmon carpaccio, the Buddha roll, the prawn bouillabaisse, garlic noodles, the roast crab, tiger prawns and the steamed sea bass. In a word, YUM. Come hungry though, because you will want to indulge in all kinds of different flavors, and the menu is versatile enough to do so. I got my salt from the yummy carpaccio, "fresh" from the spring roll-esque Buddha roll, tang from the bouillabaisse (though I will say I did not expect such a seemingly random selection of different veggies/fruit to taste good together...I was kinda like, "um...why are there tomatoes and pineapple together to complement my seafood soup?" but it was actually pretty enjoyable), bitter (in a good way, though my breath was banging after all the garlic!) from the noodles, and boredom from the main entrees. the sea bass and the crab...i guess i just wanted more flavor?... i ended up switching entrees with a friend though, and enjoyed her tiger prawns and a dish i don't recall for sure, but it was definitely chicken with veggies (now looking at the menu it must have been the lemongrass chicken), and it was like the comfort food I needed to end the meal in a happy place. 
I would head back though, and repeat my starters again, though the next time, I would probably try the drunken beef or crab to appeal my palate, which I tend to ignore in favor of the "safer" stuff.
Very good service as well, which always adds to the meal!

excerpts: (yes they were big but only enough for 1 prawn per person o.o), Roast Crab, Thanh Long Fish and Spicy Eggplant.

Portions were PUNY and off-putting... furthermore, our waiter got a little sassy with us and when I reminded him we had a birthday, he snapped back and said "Yeah, you tell your waiter which is ME and you already told me".
thanh long fish.author: Leslie T.
thanh long fish.review:
I had heard good things about Thanh Long but was disappointed in how expensive everything was, how small the portions were and how rude the customer service was. Upon entering, I had 3 out of a party of 5 and there is a strict rule saying that parties that are more than 10 minutes late  will automatically be put on the waitlist. That's normal - totally OK with that - but there were so many open tables and so many people in the waiting area, it made me think "are all these people waiting really just partial parties?" The waiting area is super small; we were all shoulder to shoulder with each other and bumping elbows. The other 2 in our party came within the 10 minutes (we made a reservation via Yelp! but didn't get any Cash Back rewards for it like I was expecting..) and we ordered the salt and pepper calamari, mango salad, and Vietnamese salad (both salads had very little vegetables and just a lot of fluff / fruit) as appetizers. For entrees, we got colossal tiger prawns (yes they were big but only enough for 1 prawn per person o.o), Roast Crab, Thanh Long Fish and Spicy Eggplant. Portions were PUNY and off-putting... furthermore, our waiter got a little sassy with us and when I reminded him we had a birthday, he snapped back and said "Yeah, you tell your waiter which is ME and you already told me". Sheesh - didn't seem like you got it the first time so sorry for double checking... 

I prefer garlic noodles with lobster. There are so many places in LA where you can get garlic butter noodles with lobster for half the price, double the quantity and even more delicious. Yes, we're not in LA but even Perilla and Cajun House's prices are more reasonable, portions are justified and quality of food is even better. I wouldn't come back.

excerpts: We ordered the coconut shrimp, Thanh long fish (red snapper), tiger prawns and yummy garlic noodles, and chicken fried rice...everything was exceptional.
We frequent the city often, and this will be on our list of places to eat from now on.
thanh long fish.author: C T.
thanh long fish.review: Amazing! The food, the service, and the ambiance...it is very unsuspecting from the outside, but inside is very nice. Parking is a pain, but they do offer $12 valet service. We ordered the coconut shrimp, Thanh long fish (red snapper), tiger prawns and yummy garlic noodles, and chicken fried rice...everything was exceptional. We frequent the city often, and this will be on our list of places to eat from now on.

excerpts: I had the Thanh Long Fish - $27.50, which is a delicious pan broiled red snapper dish served with their famous garlic noodles.
The garlic noodles were good, but a little over hyped, maybe a bit on the dry mushy side perhaps.
It didn't come with any kind of a side, so I shared my garlic noodles.
We ended things with a nice creme brulee which was like $8.00.
The waitress was attentive, smiled, and didn't rush it.
Forget trying to park, just use the friendly valet service for $12.00.
Great date night, fantastic food.
Go here!
thanh long fish.author: Shane N.
thanh long fish.review: Started put with a plum martini, and a mango cocktail of some kind -$9.00 each. They were pretty sweet, maybe better as a dessert. The Dungeons Crab Puffs were AMAZING, stuffed with tons of fresh, real crab meat! - $10.50. I had the Thanh Long Fish - $27.50, which is a delicious pan broiled red snapper dish served with their famous garlic noodles. The garlic noodles were good, but a little over hyped, maybe a bit on the dry mushy side perhaps. My partner in crime had the Catch In Citrus for $25.50. It's a decadent sea bass in a grand marnier sauce. It didn't come with any kind of a side, so I shared my garlic noodles. We ended things with a nice creme brulee which was like $8.00. The waitress was attentive, smiled, and didn't rush it. Forget trying to park, just use the friendly valet service for $12.00. Great date night, fantastic food. Go here!

excerpts: The highlights: Thanh Long Fish, Shaken Beef, and Drunken Crab.
The 50-50 risk:
Thanh Long Fish (red snapper) - 4/5.
Seasoned lightly to let the fish flavor show through and act as the hero of the dish.
Fished was cooked perfectly - just on the edge of being cooked / raw giving it a very smooth taste.
Shaken Beef - 4/5.
Cubes of New York strip steak cooked medium rare.
Drunken Crab - 4/5.
Cooked very well - crab meat retained its moisture.
In this case, the crab was just on the cusp of being dried out, an unfortunate followup of the perfectly cooked Drunken Crab.
thanh long fish.author: Gabriel C.
thanh long fish.review:
TLDR: 
The highlights: Thanh Long Fish, Shaken Beef, and Drunken Crab.
The 50-50 risk: Roast crab - risk the crab meat being overcooked.
The disappointment: Skip the stand-alone garlic noodle dish.

Thanh Long Fish (red snapper) - 4/5. Seasoned lightly to let the fish flavor show through and act as the hero of the dish. Fished was cooked perfectly - just on the edge of being cooked / raw giving it a very smooth taste. Garlic noodles included here, see review below.

Shaken Beef - 4/5. Cubes of New York strip steak cooked medium rare. Nailed the cooking method, but the seasoning was heavy handed and a tad heavy on the oil.

Drunken Crab - 4/5. Cooked very well - crab meat retained its moisture. Lightly seasoned to help the crab flavor shine.

Roast Crab - 2/5. A risk for roasting crab is overcooking, leaving the meat dry. In this case, the crab was just on the cusp of being dried out, an unfortunate followup of the perfectly cooked Drunken Crab. The seasoning was well done, so I suspect that if the crab was more moist this dish would definitely shine.

Garlic Noodles - 2/5. Although very highly rated, it was a complete miss. The dish was heavy on oil and the noodles were overcooked. Ideally, the noodles would be the hero of the dish, with a seasoning of garlic to help the noodles shine.

excerpts: For an entree I ordered the Thanh Long Fish (sauteed red snapper) with garlic noodles.
thanh long fish.author: Dom J.
thanh long fish.review:
I went to Thanh Long for the first time last night to celebrate a friend's birthday, and I must say that the outside doesn't do the inside's decor justice. It's a really beautiful restaurant.

The menu had what looked like so many amazing choices, but I had checked out a few Yelp reviews beforehand, and already knew I wanted to order the garlic noodles. As an appetizer, I ordered the shrimp toast, which was AMAZING (best part of the meal, even my friend commented on it, after trying a piece). The toast was a perfect blend of crispy, soft, and buttery, with chunks of shrimp integrated well.

They also had delicious plum wine.

For an entree I ordered the Thanh Long Fish (sauteed red snapper) with garlic noodles. The restaurant loses a star for the garlic noodles, which were sorely disappointing. They didn't taste bad, but definitely looked like they were the leftover noodles at the end of a long day. The fish was delicious, and a perfect compliment to the wine.

As for the service, everyone was extremely kind and accommodating. My friend and I plan to go back to try other dishes. Thumbs up, Thanh Long!

excerpts:
w/ An's garlic sauce & secret spices
Shaken Beef: tender cubes of marinated NY steak flambeed in Chardonnay served w/potatoes, mixed greens & cherry tomatoes
Garlic Noodles
Thanh Long Fish:
red snapper pan-broiled w/a dill-turmeric essence & red onions served w/garlic noodles
thanh long fish.author: Kitty K.
thanh long fish.review:
I went here several years ago (I know, I'm catching up on my reviews) for a birthday. We ordered the following:

Roasted Crab: whole Dungeness crab roasted w/ An's garlic sauce & secret spices
Shaken Beef: tender cubes of marinated NY steak flambeed in Chardonnay served w/potatoes, mixed greens & cherry tomatoes
Garlic Noodles
Thanh Long Fish: red snapper pan-broiled w/a dill-turmeric essence & red onions served w/garlic noodles

The food was good, but nothing spectacular. Service was barely even there. The crab was the best tasting dish, but I've had better. Since I've gone, no real need to go back.

excerpts:
Not only that, we also ordered 

Thanh long fish - it was 4-5 pieces of fish,.
thanh long fish.author: Chanel L.
thanh long fish.review:
I took my family here for dinner to celebrate my daddys birthday.  They loved it,. especially the garlic noodles!  Don't make the same mistake as we did; by ordering other dishes.  

Instead of just sticking with the garlic roasted crab and garlic noodles, we ended up ordering a few other dishes; which racked up our bill and it wasn't even that good. 

Specifically : 

Shaken Beef - the beef were cubed cut and tasted rough.  Felt like I was chewing on gum.  I can't believe this dish was $20! Not worth it

Not only that, we also ordered 

Thanh long fish - it was 4-5 pieces of fish,. it tasted like frozen fish sticks! This dish was also $20.  

These two dishes were the ones that stood out to me during dinner that made me feel YUCK!! Lucky the roasted garlic crab and garlic noodles made up for the other BAD dishes.  

If you eat here, just order the Roasted Garlic Crab and Garlic Noodles!

Also, parking is tough and make sure you call in for reservations.

excerpts: As per other yelpers' reviews, my group of 5 tried the garlic noodles, the roast crab in secret sauce, the shaken beef, and Thanh Long fish.
We were all big fans of the garlic noodles and roast crab, of course, and my friends really enjoyed the shaken beef too.
We were all big fans of the garlic noodles and roast crab, of course, and my friends really enjoyed the shaken beef too.
We were all big fans of the garlic noodles and roast crab, of course, and my friends really enjoyed the shaken beef too.
The fish was bland by comparison to the rest, but was still decent and a great deal since we got more garlic noodles alongside the order.
One of my girlfriends was overwhelmed with the amount of butter in the noodles and crab, and had to lay off after a while... which meant more for us!
Yum
thanh long fish.author: Tina J.
thanh long fish.review:
As per other yelpers' reviews, my group of 5 tried the garlic noodles, the roast crab in secret sauce, the shaken beef, and Thanh Long fish. 

All dishes were amazing.  We were all big fans of the garlic noodles and roast crab, of course, and my friends really enjoyed the shaken beef too. The fish was bland by comparison to the rest, but was still decent and a great deal since we got more garlic noodles alongside the order.  One of my girlfriends was overwhelmed with the amount of butter in the noodles and crab, and had to lay off after a while... which meant more for us!  Yum :D

I'd love to come back for another special occasion. It was a fairly loud atmosphere but also a nice, refined setting for older family members to join if need be. Finding street parking was a pain (3 blocks away) for 5 separate cars, but still worth the drive to the City and the $120 tab.

excerpts: I always get the Thanh Long Fish and let it melt in my mouth savoring the perfect texture and dill spices.
Everyone else goes there for the King Crab...which looks good if I wasn't religiously against eating things with legs.
My boyfriend likes the Clay pot, the spicy eggplant, and taking a piece of my fish ;).
thanh long fish.author: Stephanie B.
thanh long fish.review:
GARLIC NOODLES!!!
You've never had them like this before...so simple, so good.
I always get the Thanh Long Fish and let it melt in my mouth savoring the perfect texture and dill spices. Everyone else goes there for the King Crab...which looks good if I wasn't religiously against eating things with legs. My boyfriend likes the Clay pot, the spicy eggplant, and taking a piece of my fish ;). We usually start out with a Buddha Roll and several side orders of noodles to take home. It's great after a long day in the park. Go for an early dinner to beat the reservation line. Or make a reservation and plan to have a drink at the cute little bar while you wait to be seated. This place is hot. 

According to our friends from LA this restaurant spawned a series of chain restaurants called Crustacean and those ones have a dress code and less flavor.

excerpts: thanh long fish was pretty good too.
Like that this location is not as formal as the crustacean
, seating is a little better.
thanh long fish.author: Anon A.
thanh long fish.review: the best garlic crab!!! thanh long fish was pretty good too. Like that this location is not as formal as the crustacean, seating is a little better.

excerpts: We ordered the Rice Paper Rolls as an appetizer, the Thanh Long fish and the roasted crab.
I would skip the Rice Paper Rolls
next time, they were good but not great.
The Thanh Long fish comes with An's garlic noodles, my first bite almost made me really mad that I had gone so long through life without tasting this.
Seriously, it was one of the best things I've ever tasted, I couldn't believe it.
The Thanh Long fish was also good, it had delicate Vietnamese flavors, very tasty.
Of course, the roasted crab was amazing!
Sweet, butter, salty, peppery and all in the right amounts.
I liked the two helpings of steaming hot towels they brought for the finger cleanup after eating the crab.
I also had a really good Brandy Alexander as my dessert.
One downside was they were completely out of the three Vietnamese beers on their drink menu.
This is going to be a new restaurant for us to take out-of-town guests.
thanh long fish.author: Kathleen Y.
thanh long fish.review: This was our first time here, on a Friday night around 9pm. It was about 3/4 full, our waiter was almost overly friendly, but that's ok. We ordered the Rice Paper Rolls as an appetizer, the Thanh Long fish and the roasted crab. I would skip the Rice Paper Rolls next time, they were good but not great. The Thanh Long fish comes with An's garlic noodles, my first bite almost made me really mad that I had gone so long through life without tasting this. Seriously, it was one of the best things I've ever tasted, I couldn't believe it. The Thanh Long fish was also good, it had delicate Vietnamese flavors, very tasty. Of course, the roasted crab was amazing! Sweet, butter, salty, peppery and all in the right amounts.  I liked the two helpings of steaming hot towels they brought for the finger cleanup after eating the crab. I also had a really good Brandy Alexander as my dessert. One downside was they were completely out of the three Vietnamese beers on their drink menu. This is going to be a new restaurant for us to take out-of-town guests. Don't go without getting roasted crab and garlic noodles!

excerpts:
Our main dishes consisted of:
SIZZLING CLAYPOT OF FISH & VEGETABLES (brothy, light, and comforting)

WHOLE ROASTED DUNGENESS CRAB W/ AN'S GARLIC SAUCE & SECRET SPICES (ate it with our hands and fully enjoyed it!)
sizzling claypot.author: Noreena M.
sizzling claypot.review:
"The food must have been amazing, for you girls to venture all the waaaay out here in Outer Sunset!", our taxi driver commented after directing him to take us back to our hotel @ The Embarcadero.

Truth be told of this long standing eating establishment of the An Family, owner of the Crustacean Restaurant line, Thanh Long is the birthplace of the famous coveted GARLIC NOODLES & ROASTED CRABS (the 2 most ordered dishes).

My friend and I started at the bar while we were waiting for our reserved table.  Fyi, the place gets packed, and be sure to wait at least 30 minutes...even if you have a reservation.  At the bar, I ordered the PASSION MARTINI, and my friend a bottle of beer.  As we were both seated, old lush me, ordered another cocktail.  This time, a glass of LYCHEE PINEAPPLE MARTINI...oooooh super yummy!  

For appetizers, we both decided on the TEMPURA PRAWNS W/ COCONUT FLAKES, & LEMONGRASS BEEF SATAY W/ PEANUT DIPPING SAUCE.  Both were sooooo good and appetizing!

Our main dishes consisted of:
SIZZLING CLAYPOT OF FISH & VEGETABLES (brothy, light, and comforting)

WHOLE ROASTED DUNGENESS CRAB W/ AN'S GARLIC SAUCE & SECRET SPICES (ate it with our hands and fully enjoyed it!)

AN'S FAMOUS GARLIC NOODLES W/ SECRET GARLIC SAUCE (the "secret garlic sauce" is C-R-A-C-K!)

For dessert, we opted for the FRIED VANILLA ICE CREAM, and the BANANA CAKE.  Both were scrumptious! 

And to retort to our taxi driver..."Yes!  The food was FANTASTIC!  I would drive there again and back, in no time!"

excerpts: We got the roast crab, along with garlic noodles, spicy eggplants, shaken beef, salt and pepper calamari, and catch in citrus.
The catch is citrus and shaken beef was my favorite.
The beef was very tender and juicy.
The sauce on the fish was delicious!
The sauce combination was very unique.
catch in citrus.author: Michelle T.
catch in citrus.review:
I don't understand the hype of this place. The crab seems really popular so that was a must get when my friends and I came for dinner. We got the roast crab, along with garlic noodles, spicy eggplants, shaken beef, salt and pepper calamari, and catch in citrus.

The crab was underwhelming. It tasted like it was just boiled in water. I didn't taste any garlic. 

The rest of the food we ordered was good. The catch is citrus and shaken beef was my favorite. The beef was very tender and juicy. The sauce on the fish was delicious! The sauce combination was very unique. I've never thought about using orange sauce with fish. 

I'd come back to try other stuff on their menu but will definitely opt out of their crab. If you want good crab, let me introduce you to this one restaurant on Noriega called New Hing Lung. The crab is fried with egg yolk and pumpkin. It's amazing.

excerpts: The "catch in citrus" and garlic noodles are the best combo ever!
catch in citrus.author: AnonX X.
catch in citrus.review: My favorite of all the An Family restaurants. Love the staff! The "catch in citrus" and garlic noodles are the best combo ever!

excerpts: My partner in crime had the Catch In Citrus for $25.50.
It's a decadent sea bass in a grand marnier sauce.
catch in citrus.author: Shane N.
catch in citrus.review: Started put with a plum martini, and a mango cocktail of some kind -$9.00 each. They were pretty sweet, maybe better as a dessert. The Dungeons Crab Puffs were AMAZING, stuffed with tons of fresh, real crab meat! - $10.50. I had the Thanh Long Fish - $27.50, which is a delicious pan broiled red snapper dish served with their famous garlic noodles. The garlic noodles were good, but a little over hyped, maybe a bit on the dry mushy side perhaps. My partner in crime had the Catch In Citrus for $25.50. It's a decadent sea bass in a grand marnier sauce. It didn't come with any kind of a side, so I shared my garlic noodles. We ended things with a nice creme brulee which was like $8.00. The waitress was attentive, smiled, and didn't rush it. Forget trying to park, just use the friendly valet service for $12.00. Great date night, fantastic food. Go here!

excerpts:
just right
Catch in citrus - very fresh tasting and delicious
garlic noodles - YUM!
Will get 2 orders next time
catch in citrus.author: Margie C.
catch in citrus.review:
This place is a busy place out in the outer sunset, known for their crabs but didn't feel like having crabs that day (I guess I was feeling lazy)...so tried some other items. ..I guess what reminded me back of this place is the garlic noodles.. now I just went to Perilla in the inner sunset .. where the garlic noodles were.. eh .. so so.. but..  I did remember that the garlic noodles at Thanh Long were so so much better.  The crab isn't the only thing this place cooks well.. the other dishes were pretty tasty as well..  next time I'll try the crab though.. 

The salt/pepper calamari - crispy / just right
Catch in citrus - very fresh tasting and delicious
garlic noodles - YUM!  Will get 2 orders next time

excerpts:
There were six of us (one was a child), this is what we ordered and how we felt about: 

Traditional Vietnamese Salad~ fresh, tasty, delicious vinaigrette, yet not overdressed 
Catch in Citrus~everyone enjoyed this dish (except for me; I found it too sweet for my liking)
catch in citrus.author: J. Julia E.
catch in citrus.review:
If I lived nearby or was in the neighborhood already, I would definitely come back. But we drove a couple of hours to eat here and the food was good, although, not "travelling hours in a car" good. 

There were six of us (one was a child), this is what we ordered and how we felt about: 

Traditional Vietnamese Salad~ fresh, tasty, delicious vinaigrette, yet not overdressed 
Catch in Citrus~everyone enjoyed this dish (except for me; I found it too sweet for my liking) 
Thanh Long Spicy Eggplant~excellent 
Shaken Beef~EXCELLENT (I might take the drive for this dish) 
Roast Crab~We ordered two of these because these were supposed to be the star of the show, and don't get me wrong, they were good. The flavor was delicious but two days later my mom pretty much replicated the dish with lobster instead of crab so why drive the two hours, right ? 
Tamarind Crab~just OK. , not the flavor that was expected from the menu description 
Garlic Noodles~again, just OK. (I really was anticipating something extraordinary with this dish because these are An's Famous Noodles and because noodles and garlic are two of my top ten favorite things of all time). 
Three Desserts: Fried Banana, Chocolate Torte, and I don't even remember the third one. I did not try any of these ( I prefer savory over sweet), but everyone else at the table seem to like them just fine. 

Service was EXCELLENT. (I don't mean to put this in the end as an afterthought because I assure you that it's not.)

excerpts: We also tried the stuffed calamari but it was meh.
stuffed calamari.author: James L.
stuffed calamari.review:
If you don't normally eat crab, I can see how this place is potentially delicious to you but getting a similar quality from any Asian market in Garden Grove for cheaper makes it seem not worth getting a crab here (only doused in garlic). We also tried the stuffed calamari but it was meh.

The garlic noodles are tasty but with crab in garlic sauce after awhile, it becomes a single monotonous note. As someone mentioned in their review, white rice probably pairs better with the crab. But yes, eater beware- garlic burps to ensue.

Great service, good ambiance, but the food is not compelling enough for me to want to be a must go to spot when I'm in SF.

excerpts: Crab Puffs, Stuffed Calamari and the Snapper.
The snapper tasted microwaved and the Stuffed Calamari had absolutely no flavor and was extremely tough, rubbery and lukewarm.
stuffed calamari.author: Amy T.
stuffed calamari.review:
Extremely disappointed with the three meals my parter and I ordered. Crab Puffs, Stuffed Calamari and the Snapper. 

Every dish came out a "little too quick." The snapper tasted microwaved and the Stuffed Calamari had absolutely no flavor and was extremely tough, rubbery and lukewarm. Crab Puffs were extremely fishy and also tasted microwaved.

We will never return.

The service was superior. That is the only positive feedback I am comfortable giving.

excerpts: We also get the salt and pepper calamari (not as crunchy as it use to be and less flavorful, but still one of the better tasting ones out there), combo fried rice (another winner), added on mixed vegetables and the stuffed calamari (both of the sauces tasted similar but was still tasty).
stuffed calamari.author: Carol H.
stuffed calamari.review:
Was here with some family today and realized we have been coming here for almost 20 years already.  Wow! Out of all of their establishments, this is still my favorite location, even if parking can be a beast, unless you valet, or just come early. You can always expect an attentive waitstaff who will give you good service.
 
My all time guilty pleasures is the roasted crab and garlic noodles.   This is a guarantee to be on point and for us, usually get individual crabs instead of sharing for left overs.

We also get the salt and pepper calamari (not as crunchy as it use to be and less flavorful, but still one of the better tasting ones out there), combo fried rice (another winner), added on mixed vegetables and the stuffed calamari (both of the sauces tasted similar but was still tasty).

excerpts: The stuffed calamari wasn't bad either because of the sauce.
stuffed calamari.author: Mandy D.
stuffed calamari.review:
3.5 stars

I passed by here so often that I finally gave it a chance. 
We had the Dungeness Crab Puffs, not worth it for $10.50. I expected to be a bit bigger and more of it. There was only 6 dinky pieces of it. Although the cheese tasted so good inside the wonton, I wonder if there was even any crab meat in it.

We had the garlic noodles, it's yummy and I want more of it.
The stuffed calamari wasn't bad either because of the sauce.
Dessert was fried banana ice cream, I love this stuff. 

This place isn't bad overall, but it's a bit pricey for me. Service is good. It's worth a try.

excerpts: I had ordered the Roasted Garlic Crab and my bf a Stuffed Calamari dish.
The Stuffed Calamari was not that great - wouldn't recommend it.
stuffed calamari.author: Elizabeth W.
stuffed calamari.review:
My first review!

I would say 4.5 stars, but I guess they don't let you give half!

My bf took me here for my birthday with two of my very good friends. It was a surprise dinner and he said it's something I wanted to eat, but haven't had for a while.  When we passed the restaurant to find parking, the only restaurant I saw was 'Thanh Long' and I thought it looked kind of rundown.  At first I was disappointed cuz I thought my bf was taking me to eat steak, but then he told me this place is known for their crab. So I was like oh ok, whew! When we walked into the restaurant it was actually very nice (next time I won't be too quick to judge). 

My bf had made reservations so we were seated right away. The food came out pretty quick too! Don't know if that's a good thing though, but it was probably less than 7 minutes.  I had ordered the Roasted Garlic Crab and my bf a Stuffed Calamari dish. Oh and of course the Garlic Noodles! The crab was delicious!! Finished the whole crab by myself..mmmm!! The Stuffed Calamari was not that great - wouldn't recommend it. The Garlic Noodles were great, but came out lukewarm. So that's where the minus half star comes from.  

I would definitely come here again!!

excerpts: The stuffed calamari is pretty darn good too.
We usually have a few other dishes, other than just crab, for variety.
Good service too.
stuffed calamari.author: Jay S.
stuffed calamari.review: Roasted crab is as yummy as ever.  Don't forget those garlic noodles.  The stuffed calamari is pretty darn good too.  We usually have a few other dishes, other than just crab, for variety.  Good service too.

excerpts: stuffed calamari (unmemorable), and fried blue crab (standard fare).
The crabs were the best, though pricey at $38/crab.
The desserts we had included the fried ice cream, fried banana a la mode, chocolate cake, and creme brulee.
I'd say to save your money on dessert and get another crab!!
stuffed calamari.author: Joy H.
stuffed calamari.review: From the outside, it doesn't look like much of a restaurant . . . it almost looks ghetto, but once you get inside, it's pretty big and elegant looking. They don't seat you until your whole party is present, so make sure everyone is there on time or else they may not hold your spot for long! We decided to do family style dining and share a bunch of dishes . . . however, looking around the restaurant we noticed that everyone had their own crab and it would've ended up being a little cheaper if we had done that. Duly noted! We got the roasted crab (the best!), drunken crab (less flavor than the roasted one), and tamarind crab (sweet sauce). We also go the garlic noodles (very plain but oh so tasty - drenched in garlic), shaken beef (almost more like a beef salad), stuffed calamari (unmemorable), and fried blue crab (standard fare). The crabs were the best, though pricey at $38/crab. The desserts we had included the fried ice cream, fried banana a la mode, chocolate cake, and creme brulee. I'd say to save your money on dessert and get another crab!!

excerpts: we also tried stuffed calamari it was only okay.
and we got the shaking beef which I've had before which was good.
stuffed calamari.author: Jay R.
stuffed calamari.review:
06.19.12 with 3 others

service here was good, make sure you make reservations when you go. 

everyone seems to come here for the roasted crab and garlic noodles, so of course thats what we ordered, not my first time here but still the same deal. expensive crab about $40 for about 2 pounds worth, good flavor and cooked well. 

we also tried stuffed calamari it was only okay. and we got the shaking beef which I've had before which was good.

excerpts: We split an order of spring rolls, then Mom ordered the Villager, roomie ordered fish fillet, and I got the stuffed calamari.
Though the flavors were good (but not astounding) with mine, the calamari was too rubbery to be enjoyable, and the stuffing lacked pizzaz.
Mom's and roomie's dishes were better, but overall I wasn't mindblown.
We ordered a creme brulee and orange sherbet for dessert; they brought us the sherbet and some pastry-looking thing instead.
We set the waiter straight and he said he'd be right back with the creme brulee, but never brought it (nor did he leave us the pastries lol).
The sherbet tasted just like a dixie cup or cremesicle--nothing special.
stuffed calamari.author: Erin O.
stuffed calamari.review:
Went here to celebrate my recent move into a new apartment with my mom (who was visiting from Oregon) and new roomie (who is my mom's age). It was Sunday night. We had a reservation and valeted the car; neither gave us a long wait (however, it was still very busy inside). We split an order of spring rolls, then Mom ordered the Villager, roomie ordered fish fillet, and I got the stuffed calamari. Though the flavors were good (but not astounding) with mine, the calamari was too rubbery to be enjoyable, and the stuffing lacked pizzaz. Mom's and roomie's dishes were better, but overall I wasn't mindblown. We ordered a creme brulee and orange sherbet for dessert; they brought us the sherbet and some pastry-looking thing instead. We set the waiter straight and he said he'd be right back with the creme brulee, but never brought it (nor did he leave us the pastries lol). The sherbet tasted just like a dixie cup or cremesicle--nothing special. When the bill came (over $100), we were charged for the creme brulee we never got, so we had to fix that too.

All-in-all, I don't think we received the customer service that should accompany such a high-priced establishment. The food was just okay--but, in all fairness, we didn't order any of what seem to be the restaurant signature/crowd favorite dishes. I may give Than Long another chance, and try out some of the higher-recommended fare.

excerpts: Stuffed Calamari ($15.95) - lots of calamari stuffed with minced meat in a tomato based sauce.
Parents didn't like it so much, but I thought it was okay.
stuffed calamari.author: Daniel M.
stuffed calamari.review:
I've been here before and I thought it was great (and still do!), but after eating at Crustaceans, Thanh Long only gets 4 stars...

Took my parents and Anhie T. here for Chinese New Years dinner, and reservations were made at 8.30, but at 7.15 we were able to move it up to 7.45 with no problems.  We got there, and it was pretty empty...with maybe 20 diners at about 5-6 different tables.  Barren compared to when Anhie T. and I came about 2 yrs ago.  We were seated immediately, and looked over the menu, and ordered the following:

Crispy Rice Paper Roll ($7.50) - your standard Vietnamese Egg Roll.  But here you get once egg roll cut into four pieces.
Thanh Long Mussells ($10.95) - five mussells served with five slices of thin garlic bread.  This dish was delicious.
Steamed Sea Bass ($24.95) - sea bass was flaky, moist, and really good.  The sauce was sweet and gingery.
Stuffed Calamari ($15.95) - lots of calamari stuffed with minced meat in a tomato based sauce.  Parents didn't like it so much, but I thought it was okay.
Shaken Beef ($20.95) - very flavorful, and a dish that everyone loved.  The beef was tender and potatoes were flavorful.
Garlic Noodles (2 orders at $9.50 ea) - Garlicky and delicious! 
Roast Crab (I think it was $38) - really good crab...but compared to Crustaceans, it's not the same.  Not as flavorful, but still very, very good nonetheless. 
Creme Brulee (2 orders) - My dad and Anhie T. thought this was the best dessert dish.
Banana Cake - I liked this dish and everyone else didn't like it.  Served with a scoop of Vanilla ice cream, a dallop of whip cream, this cake seemed to be made out of only bananas.  Anhie T. said it was bland.  I disagree.
Hot Chocolate Cake - served with Vanilla ice cream...this was good.  Really rich though.
Coke (2 glasses) - served from their bar in a tall, slim glass.  No free refills.

Total bill with tax + tip came out to $218.

This was my parents first time here and they loved the crab, and garlic noodles.  They did say it was a bit oily, but c'mon, roasted crab and garlic noodles anywhere is a bit oily.  But here's a good sign.  As they left, they took some business cards.  That means they liked their food and they'll be back...probably with some family friends!

Depending on my the mood (and thickness of the wallet), I would come back.  

But other substitutions are very comparable:  PPQ is cheaper and quality isn't far behind, while Crustacean is a tad more expensive, but swankier....

Tip 'o the day:  Avoid the valet parking outside.  Parking isn't too difficult in the Sunset.  And even if you had to walk one block after dinner, it may clear up your arteries after all the butter used in cooking the crab!

excerpts: Other dishes like their Mango Salad and Stuffed Calamari are terrific also.
Be prepared to go to the ATM at 7-11s across the street... because those seafood "market value" prices can pinch you in the wallet.
Parking can be a bummer, but they do offer valet for $9 (as of 8/2006).
stuffed calamari.author: Leroid D.
stuffed calamari.review: Holy Roasted Dungeness Crab and Garlic Noodles! Some of the best I've tasted by far. Other dishes like their Mango Salad and Stuffed Calamari are terrific also. Be prepared to go to the ATM at 7-11s across the street... because those seafood "market value" prices can pinch you in the wallet. Parking can be a bummer, but they do offer valet for $9 (as of 8/2006).

excerpts: We ordered the crab, the stuffed calamari, and garlic noodles.
The food was good but the calarmari stuffing was too salty.
The dishes are far from healthy.
The amount of butter they use on the crab and noodles would kill an ox.
You should only eat in strict moderation.
I would not recommend frequenting this restaurant more than once a year.
stuffed calamari.author: Edmund W.
stuffed calamari.review: We ordered the crab, the stuffed calamari, and garlic noodles.  The food was good but the calarmari stuffing was too salty.  The dishes are far from healthy.  The amount of butter they use on the crab and noodles would kill an ox.  You should only eat in strict moderation.  I would not recommend frequenting this restaurant more than once a year.

excerpts: We ordered An's Famous Roast Crab, Thanh Long Spicy Eggplant, and Charbroiled Colossal Royal Tiger Prawns.
However, the star of the show was the roast crab.
I don't know how they season it, but every little bit, including the shell was delicious!
thanh long spicy eggplant.author: Leana L.
thanh long spicy eggplant.review:
Oh myyy. So this is what all the hype is about. I had heard about PPQ from my roommates years ago, but the whole crab debate really started when my parents heard about Thanh Long from some of their friends. We finally made it happen for Father's Day.

Location: There's two locations, one in the Sunset and one in FiDi, but they're slightly different with slightly different menus. We chose the original, even though it's a farther drive. Parking can be a bit difficult, no surprise there. They do have valet parking, though, if you choose.

Ambiance: From the outside, this place looks like nothing special, but just after entering, you can tell that this is a special occasions kind of place. There's white table cloths, the wait staff is nicely dressed, and the host at the front is very nice and polite, ensuring that we were promptly seated. They do have a very strict policy regarding honoring reservation times, but I appreciate it. It keeps things orderly and outlines the rules very clearly.

Service: Top notch. Obviously it's not some Michelin star restaurant where the waitstaff is over the top, but everyone was very pleasant. Our water glasses were never empty, our plates were cleared promptly, and they made sure we had everything we needed. I believe they automatically included tip regardless of your party size, so while some people can be turned off by that, I think it's refreshing. The staff is obviously well compensated for their services and are treated with respect -- and it shows.

Food: We ordered An's Famous Roast Crab, Thanh Long Spicy Eggplant, and Charbroiled Colossal Royal Tiger Prawns. The prawns were just okay, but luckily they came on top of a mount of delicious garlic noodles. The eggplant was really good. However, the star of the show was the roast crab. I don't know how they season it, but every little bit, including the shell was delicious! I definitely admit to sucking on the empty crab shell bits at the end because it was so good!

Price: Definitely not cheap, but also worth it for a special occasion.

Would I return? If a celebration were in order, I wouldn't say no!

excerpts: Thanh Long spicy eggplant (jumbo prawns, chicken, basil, baby corn!, shitake mushrooms, eggplant!)
thanh long spicy eggplant.author: Cici T.
thanh long spicy eggplant.review:
Drunken crab and a garlic hangover? Yes, please!

It was a foggy summer night, the last time I came to Thanh Long for dinner. After ollaliberry picking in Pescadero and mussel hunting in Half Moon Bay, my sunkissed friends and I wanted to end the night with a bang and decided to treat ourselves to juicy, plump crab and some dressed up garlic noodles!

Here was our order:
Drunken crab (simmered in Chardonnay, sake and brandy; scallions, chives, and cracked black pepper)
Roast crab (roasted with garlic sauce and "secret" spices)
Garlic noodles (3 orders please!)
Thanh Long spicy eggplant (jumbo prawns, chicken, basil, baby corn!, shitake mushrooms, eggplant!)
Lemongrass chicken (chicken, vegetables, garlic, and chili)

Oh was it a feast! Among the five of us, we cleared our table.

Caution: The taste of garlic from the garlic noodles is potent! After your meal, brush your teeth and tongue, gargle mouthwash, and that taste and smell is not so easily ditched! Hence the garlic hangover.

excerpts: We had the garlic noodles, drunken crab, and the thanh long spicy eggplant.
Surprisingly, I liked the eggplant the best.
The crab and garlic noodles came out really fast, but were cold!
Disappointing!
And to top it off, the service was terrible.
Our waiter checked in on us only once during the whole meal.
I did however try the garlic noodles from the thanh long food truck and it was really good, so
I think I'll stick to the food truck.
You don't have to travel so far to get it.
thanh long spicy eggplant.author: Nancy H.
thanh long spicy eggplant.review:
This place was recommended to me, so I decided to try it. I wanted to like it, but it just didn't cut it. We had the garlic noodles, drunken crab, and the thanh long spicy eggplant. Surprisingly, I liked the eggplant the best. The crab and garlic noodles came out really fast, but were cold! Disappointing! And to top it off, the service was terrible. Our waiter checked in on us only once during the whole meal. At the end of it, we were trying to wave someone down to get the bill, but our waiter walked by us three times and completely ignored us.

I did however try the garlic noodles from the thanh long food truck and it was really good, so I think I'll stick to the food truck. You don't have to travel so far to get it.

excerpts: The Thanh Long spicy eggplant is good, but nowhere near spicy.
As for dessert, don't get the bread pudding.
The orange sorbet was good and the presentation was clever.
It's a frozen orange sliced across the top with orange sorbet inside.
thanh long spicy eggplant.author: Laina T.
thanh long spicy eggplant.review:
If you're a crab lover like I am, you'll love Thanh Long.  Skip the appetizers.  I've tried the salmon carpaccio, lemongrass chicken satay, and mango salad.  I wasn't really impressed.  Order the roasted crab and garlic noodles!!!  They're to die for.  The crab is fresh and big.  The flavor of butter and cracked pepper just explodes in your mouth.  I'm a big eater so I always have to have my own crab and another entrée.  Stick to the roasted crab instead of the tamarind crab.  The sauce on the tamarind crab is a little sweet for my taste buds.  The Thanh Long spicy eggplant is good, but nowhere near spicy.  As for dessert, don't get the bread pudding.  The orange sorbet was good and the presentation was clever.  It's a frozen orange sliced across the top with orange sorbet inside.  It's nice, light, and a good ending to any meal.  

At about $40 per crab, it's not cheap.  It's a good place for special occasions or if you just want to satisfy your craving for really good crab.  The atmosphere is casual so there's no need dress up.  Get your hands dirty and enjoy!

excerpts:
Thanh Long Spicy Eggplant ~
sauteed with jumbo prawns, chicken, fresh basil, baby corn, shitake mushrooms and fiery red chillies in a tamarind and chilli-soya

2.
thanh long spicy eggplant.author: Oliver D.
thanh long spicy eggplant.review:
I've heard so many good reviews on this place and had to check it out for myself! 

I'm a HUGE fan of sea food especially CRAB and I heard this place had the best roasted crab in San Francisco, so I had to get my 'YELP FACE' on and see what the hype was all about!

As I walked into the restaurant i was impressed! The exterior of Thanh  Long looks like a 'hole in a wall' establishment, but i was proven wrong. It's really cozy and professional. 

I suggest you make reservations if you decide to come with a party of 4 or more. It can get busy on the weekend.

Since this place is kinda pricey, its recommended that you skip out on the appetizers; to be honest, they are over-rated, tiny and over priced! Just get down to the nitty gritty and order the main dishes....

Here are my recommendations:

1.  Thanh Long Spicy Eggplant ~
sauteed with jumbo prawns, chicken, fresh basil, baby corn, shitake mushrooms and fiery red chillies in a tamarind and chilli-soya

2. Shaken Beef ~
tender cubes of marinated new york steak flambeed in chardonnay, served with potatoes, mixed green and cherry tomatoes

3. Colossal Royal Tiger Prawns ~
butterflied and grilled with secret spices, served on a bed of garlic noodles

4. Roast Crab ~
a whole dungeness crab roasted with thanh's garlic sauce and secret spices


NOTE: The spices used in their food are really intense, so if you don't like the after taste of garlic and spices in your mouth, then the majority of the food isn't for you.....but who doesn't like INTENSE SPICES! haha

The portion size of each dish is some what small so try to diversify your choices and order smart....


Much LOVE and eats!

excerpts: Thanh Long Spicy Eggplant - eggplant sauteed with jumbo prawns, chicken, fresh basil, baby corn, shitake mushrooms, & red chilies in a tamarind & chili-soya
; I like spicy
but it was on the low end of the spicy spectrum on this dinner outing though the overall flavors were good
thanh long spicy eggplant.author: Beth W.
thanh long spicy eggplant.review:
We came here for a special family celebration and it was our first time dining here as well.

The food ordered for our dinner comprised of the following:

1. Salt & Pepper Calamari - delicious except for the simple overdose of coarsely ground black pepper; will definitely tell them next time to adjust the black pepper with a lighter touch

2. Mango Salad - fresh mango fruit sauteed with bell peppers, seared scallops & shrimp over mixed greens in a raspberry vinaigrette - this would make for an excellent  meal on it's own; the raspberry vinaigrette nicely tied the various flavors together effortlessly

3. Thanh Long Spicy Eggplant - eggplant sauteed with jumbo prawns, chicken, fresh basil, baby corn, shitake mushrooms, & red chilies in a tamarind & chili-soya; I like spicy but it was on the low end of the spicy spectrum on this dinner outing though the overall flavors were good ~ will order it again but tell the server to make it spicier

4. Villager's Favorite - Pacific prawns & pork medallions simmered in a caramelized reduction of soy and herbs; I liked this dish enough that I would order it again; a nice take on a "surf and turf" with pork instead of beef for the "turf" portion

5. Shaken Beef - tender cubes of marinated New York steak flambeed in Chardonnay served with potatoes, mixed greens & cherry tomatoes; delicious in flavor with fork tender beef; the greens I could do without as it seemed more a "salad" than an entree

6. Vegetarian Delight - silken tofu sauteed with asst. vegetables & shitake mushrooms; a standout as I love tofu and veggies!

7. Roast Crab - a whole Dungeness crab roasted with An's garlic sauce & secret spices in the Secret Kitchen; regardless of what others may say, this in of itself is a delectable Dungeness crab entree!  Yes it's messy but who cares?  The flavors marry very well and our entire party enjoyed this dish.

8. Garlic Noodles - An's famous noodles made with their secret garlic sauce (perhaps the one used on the Roast Crab?) & secret spices; this noodle dish is good when hot but at room temperature or worse, cold, it's not that good (something coagulates on the noodles when it's cold...butter perhaps?)

Despite the large amounts ordered per item, we had lots of left overs (crab included) for our party of 18.  Would I go back to this spot?  You betcha!  I want to try the Tamarind Crab - "simmered in a melange of Roma tomatoes & tamarind, seasoned with fresh dill & green onions & flambeed with cognac."  The ingredients for this dish make me salivate just thinking about it.

There is a full bar in case you want a drink while you wait and/or with your meal.  Two of us ordered the Fleur de Mango - pureed fresh mango, Malibu rum, a banana rum and freshly squeezed orange juice to the mix - this was the fave drink of the evening!  
 
While parking is an issue, it's located in a neighborhood folks, get there early so that you can look for parking or just valet your car.  I would also suggest booking a reservation so that you are amongst the first seating for the evening.  Overall, the service was excellent/attentive and the food was delicious.

The name of this restaurant came about due to an error at the printer's.  It was supposed to be "Thang Long" meaning "Ascending Dragon" and also Vietnam's first capital city.  As "Thanh Long" it means "Green Dragon" ~ green representing happiness and prosperity while the dragon symbol is an ancient symbol of good luck.  I would say the An Family has enjoyed this for many years serving a legion of happy customers ~ myself being a newly minted one!

Note - The An Family also owns the Crustacean group of restaurants with a Palo Alto opening targeted for this September 2010.  I can't wait till this spot opens up!

excerpts: We ordered the Buddha Roll (vegetarian spring roll), Garlic Toast, Roast Crab, Garlic Noodles, and the Thanh Long Spicy Eggplant.
The Buddha Roll had good flavors but one order of it is just one roll cut into 4 pieces and for $7.50 is so not worth it!
The Garlic Toast was also a rip off.
It was just half a baguette like the ones you get at Lucky's/Safeway, smothered with butter with hardly any garlic.
You could easily make your own garlic bread at home that tastes a whole lot better for half the price.
Their famous Roast Crab was alright.
The crab was a decent size with a good amount of meat, but they could have gone a bit lighter on the seasoning.
I don't know if we got a bad batch but the crab was a bit too salty.
It definitely tasted better when paired with simple plain white rice.
The Garlic Noodles were quite tasty and scrumptious, but the portion was small.
The best dish by far was the Thanh Long Spicy Eggplant.
The eggplant was cooked to perfection...
the outside with just the right amount of crunch, with a soft inside.
It went really with the prawns, chicken, and mushrooms that were mixed in with it.
thanh long spicy eggplant.author: Karen C.
thanh long spicy eggplant.review:
Came here with family to celebrate my husband's birthday. When we walked by the restaurant it did look pretty run down and ghetto at first glance but whatever was cookin' smelled absolutely delicious =)

Upon entering, I felt like I had been transported into another place. I guess it's true when they say "don't judge a book by it's cover." The inside was clean, beautifully decorated, filled with lots of people, and had great ambiance. Their service was amazing...exceeded all expectations. We had about 4 different servers which made everything flow very nicely. Our orders were taken promptly and properly, plates cleared instantly, and our water glasses were always filled without us having to ask. They were all really nice and polite.

We ordered the Buddha Roll (vegetarian spring roll), Garlic Toast, Roast Crab, Garlic Noodles, and the Thanh Long Spicy Eggplant. The Buddha Roll had good flavors but one order of it is just one roll cut into 4 pieces and for $7.50 is so not worth it! The Garlic Toast was also a rip off. It was just half a baguette like the ones you get at Lucky's/Safeway, smothered with butter with hardly any garlic. You could easily make your own garlic bread at home that tastes a whole lot better for half the price. Their famous Roast Crab was alright. The crab was a decent size with a good amount of meat, but they could have gone a bit lighter on the seasoning. I don't know if we got a bad batch but the crab was a bit too salty. It definitely tasted better when paired with simple plain white rice. The Garlic Noodles were quite tasty and scrumptious, but the portion was small. The best dish by far was the Thanh Long Spicy Eggplant. The eggplant was cooked to perfection...the outside with just the right amount of crunch, with a soft inside. It went really with the prawns, chicken, and mushrooms that were mixed in with it. The portion was small too and it definitely left me with wanting more!

Overall this place is just okay. The decor and service was awesome but the food was just okay in terms of taste, portions, and price. Very overpriced for the amount you get. It was about $40/person for us but I felt like I ate $20 worth of food. I would agree with some of the other reviewers that Boiling Crab is better for the price and value.

excerpts:
Thanh Long Spicy Eggplant~excellent 
Shaken Beef~EXCELLENT (I might take the drive for this dish)
thanh long spicy eggplant.author: J. Julia E.
thanh long spicy eggplant.review:
If I lived nearby or was in the neighborhood already, I would definitely come back. But we drove a couple of hours to eat here and the food was good, although, not "travelling hours in a car" good. 

There were six of us (one was a child), this is what we ordered and how we felt about: 

Traditional Vietnamese Salad~ fresh, tasty, delicious vinaigrette, yet not overdressed 
Catch in Citrus~everyone enjoyed this dish (except for me; I found it too sweet for my liking) 
Thanh Long Spicy Eggplant~excellent 
Shaken Beef~EXCELLENT (I might take the drive for this dish) 
Roast Crab~We ordered two of these because these were supposed to be the star of the show, and don't get me wrong, they were good. The flavor was delicious but two days later my mom pretty much replicated the dish with lobster instead of crab so why drive the two hours, right ? 
Tamarind Crab~just OK. , not the flavor that was expected from the menu description 
Garlic Noodles~again, just OK. (I really was anticipating something extraordinary with this dish because these are An's Famous Noodles and because noodles and garlic are two of my top ten favorite things of all time). 
Three Desserts: Fried Banana, Chocolate Torte, and I don't even remember the third one. I did not try any of these ( I prefer savory over sweet), but everyone else at the table seem to like them just fine. 

Service was EXCELLENT. (I don't mean to put this in the end as an afterthought because I assure you that it's not.)

excerpts: the curry lotus prawns were ordered because dad was still hungry.
this was one big wtf.
the water chestnuts were too huge (it sounds stupid but i swear), and i found myself halfheartedly plodding away at a bunch of them.
the green beans tasted old and tough.
the curry itself was very oddly flavored-
there were a bunch of spices/herbs that i didn't recognize and didn't care for.
it almost tasted medicinal to me.
the coconut milk wasn't apparent, so there wasn't any creaminess to help save the curry.
4 stars for the food, even if the curry lotus prawns were veryyy meh and the garlic noodles didn't quite satisfy what i was looking for.
knocked down to 3 stars because i don't care how good your shrimp are, $38 is too much for 4.
curry lotus prawns.author: Heather F.
curry lotus prawns.review:
went here with my family on a saturday night at 7pm, and was seated almost immediately. don't bother coming if you don't have reservations, because it is packed. it is pretty loud, which is fine though a bit bothersome usually; however, i was with my grandma, so that made talking to her a lot harder.

grilled calamari- so tender! the bodies were chewy but yet so tender. fabulously smoky. the creamy pb sauce yummy but nothing special. 

the shaken beef was soooo tender. and like quality beef tender, not baking soda tender. really flavorful and liked that it was cubed and easy to eat. the salad underneath with sauteed onions was yummy.

the real reason we came was for the garlic noodles. i've had them from their truck, an the go, and they were amazing. my mom first had them at crustacean, and she loved them there, too. we were so looking forward to them that we got a side order, and we also got the prawns that came atop the noodles. and they were so sad.

the separate order was kind of cold, and the noodles were somewhat hard. they tasted as if they'd be on the counter and forgotten for a while, and overall didn't seem very fresh. the ones that were underneath the shrimp were a lot better thank goodness. rich and buttery and cheesy and actually hot. they still weren't as good as when i had them last, but not sure if it's because the product wasn't as good or if my expectations were too high.

and let's talk about those shrimp. the colossal royal tiger prawns consisted of four butterflied prawns atop a pile of the aforementioned garlic noodles. i didn't like the butterflied cut; while pretty, it was hard to get the shrimp out of the shell. they were well-seasoned and so smoky, and i thought they were the best morsel (okay, like 4 bites) of the night. dad was unimpressed and thought them overdone. it was marked as mp, but there's no way that four butterflied shrimp atop a pile of garlic noodles is $38. that kind of ruined the best bite of the night thing for me.

in an attempt to insert some foliage into our lives, we got the seasonal veggies. and they were meh. but what do you get for ordering stupid things? the sauce was actually pretty good though and dad sopped it up with rice.

the curry lotus prawns were ordered because dad was still hungry. this was one big wtf. the water chestnuts were too huge (it sounds stupid but i swear), and i found myself halfheartedly plodding away at a bunch of them. the green beans tasted old and tough. the curry itself was very oddly flavored- there were a bunch of spices/herbs that i didn't recognize and didn't care for. it almost tasted medicinal to me. the coconut milk wasn't apparent, so there wasn't any creaminess to help save the curry. the shrimp was crisp and tender, and that was the only good part.

4 stars for the food, even if the curry lotus prawns were veryyy meh and the garlic noodles didn't quite satisfy what i was looking for. knocked down to 3 stars because i don't care how good your shrimp are, $38 is too much for 4.

excerpts: Curry Lotus Prawns (good taste but the "jumbo prawns" were teeny!)
curry lotus prawns.author: Amy D.
curry lotus prawns.review:
Came in a group of 6 on a Saturday night, so we got to try a lot of dishes. Making reservations is definitely recommended, and parking in this area is tough- the $10 for valet is well spent. 

Ordered-
Salt & Pepper Calamari (nice and peppery, but calamari could've been a bit more crisp)
Dungeness Crab Puffs (good, but def not authentic)
Seafood Dumplings (only ok and 5 pieces- wouldn't recommend for the price)
Crispy Rice Paper Roll (too dry for me, I wouldn't order this again)
Curry Lotus Prawns (good taste but the "jumbo prawns" were teeny!)
Shaken Beef (really good flavor, imo better than at the Slanted Door and cheaper. however, they mix in potatoes pieces to trick you into thinking there is more meat)
Roast Crab (good, but wasn't super flavorful)
Tamarind Crab (wasn't very flavorful, but both crabs were cooked perfectly)
Garlic Noodles (good, but could've been more garlicky)
Fried Rice with Shrimp (your standard fried rice, I wouldn't order again)
Fried Banana & Fried Ice Cream (both were good but I like the banana a lot more)

Overall, the dinner was good, but not amazing. I actually liked the crab I ordered at Three Seasons better (taste wise). My favorite dishes were the shaken beef and garlic noodles, but this restaurant is worth a try for the crab. We paid $57pp including tax and tip, which isn't bad at all, but we didn't get that much crab.

excerpts: Lastly, because the portions are on the smaller side we had to order an extra dish for the 4 of us...the curry lotus prawns.
This had to be the worst of all our selections.
The shrimp were over cooked and tiny....
oh whoops, weren't they called "prawns" on the menu???
In any case, the curry was bland and even if you liked it, there was barely enough curry sauce to mix into you rice like many expect in a Thai type curry house.
The veggies it comes with were....eh.
Water chestnuts were ok.
The baby corn tasted like canned baby corn.
curry lotus prawns.author: Cary L.
curry lotus prawns.review:
Greetings Restaurant-goers!!!  Came here for my friend's b-day dinner.  A crab specialty restaurant in the outer...OUTER sunset next to the cold, foggy beach.  A bit of a trek with many other similar places more east on Clement St.  You walk in and you will be greeted by the host (reservations are encouraged as it is a BUSY place even during the week) with a bar on the right.  It is fully stocked and we all got a glass of Oban for a pricey number.

When seated about 10 minutes after our reservation was actually for we had a great server.  Surrounded by an interesting decor we ordered as appetizers calamari and oysters.  I didn't have the oysters but the calamari was well cooked but over seasoned if you ask me.  It was peppery which I do like but way too salty.   Because I love calamari, I ate much of the order but was invited to enjoy a long period of salty tongue and 2 glasses of ice water.  For the mains, we had crab which is the specialty, "shaken" beef, garlic noodles and seabass.   Crab was well cooked and tender.  The shaken beef was cooked medium to the "T."  The seabass also tasty with the sauce it comes with but perhaps just a touch overcooked.  Finally, the garlic noodles were also very tasty if you LOVE garlic.  If garlic is only a passing notion in your home cooking you will think this is romantic disaster when it comes to post-dinner make-out sessions.

Lastly, because the portions are on the smaller side we had to order an extra dish for the 4 of us...the curry lotus prawns.  This had to be the worst of all our selections.  The shrimp were over cooked and tiny....oh whoops, weren't they called "prawns" on the menu???
