In any case, the curry was bland and even if you liked it, there was barely enough curry sauce to mix into you rice like many expect in a Thai type curry house.  The veggies it comes with were....eh.  Water chestnuts were ok.  The baby corn tasted like canned baby corn.  All-in-all I'd leave this off your choices to order...

So in summary, a fancy, pricey Vietnamese crab house at the beach in SF.  A fun place to visit if you live locally and enjoy it.  Not something I'd cross town for though.  Plenty of better dining experiences / tastes closer to downtown.

excerpts: I have to say my favorite thing was the garlic noodles and the villagers favorite!
The flavor was absolutely AMAZING!
We also ordered the roasted crab it was delicious.
We made a reservation and were seated within 10 mins of arriving there.
The food didn't take long to come after we ordered and the service there was really good.
It is on the pricier side
but I definitely recommend it!
villagers favorite.author: Star S.
villagers favorite.review: The food here was really delicious! I have to say my favorite thing was the garlic noodles and the villagers favorite! The flavor was absolutely AMAZING! We also ordered the roasted crab it was delicious. We made a reservation and were seated within 10 mins of arriving there. The food didn't take long to come after we ordered and the service there was really good. It is on the pricier side but I definitely recommend it!

excerpts: We order 2 Garlic Noodles, fried calamari and Villagers Favorite.
Bill was $57.20, drive back to Roseville, when we opened our order, the Villagers favorite was super salty and the portion was 1 spoon worth for $19.95.
The calamari wasn't fried and for $10.95 there was only 3 small pieces.
The 2 orders of garlic noodles was just alright.
It was a total rip off.
villagers favorite.author: Teresa H.
villagers favorite.review: We went here on a Sunday, Dec.17, after a 3 hour drive from Roseville, just walk in yo check for wait time on table, because no reservations, hostess said 45 mins. So we decided to order to go. We order 2 Garlic Noodles, fried calamari and Villagers Favorite. Bill was $57.20, drive back to Roseville, when we opened our order, the Villagers favorite was super salty and the portion was 1 spoon worth for $19.95. The calamari wasn't fried and for $10.95 there was only 3 small pieces. The 2 orders of garlic noodles was just alright. It was a total rip off.

excerpts: I really enjoyed the Shaken Beef and Spicy Egg Plant.
I will definitely be back to try other dishes.
shaken beef.author: Diann U.
shaken beef.review: My first time here was a great experience. We made reservations for 7pm but they were able to seat us early 6:45pm :) Customer service was good and serving was quick. I really enjoyed the Shaken Beef and Spicy Egg Plant. I will definitely be back to try other dishes.

excerpts: Being Vietnamese, shaken beef is one of my favorite and this didn't really meet up to my standards.
It was good and flavorful but they added diced potatoes.
shaken beef.author: Kathy T.
shaken beef.review:
My boyfriend took my parents and I to eat here because he had to share how amazing this place is. Was the food amazing? YES! Was it very expensive? Why yes. Was it worth it? YES! Will I go here every weekend? Nope, because I ain't balling like that. 

Valet parking is offered for $13, and they park it on the street right out front (sometimes along the sidewalk, sometimes smack dap in the street with your emergency lights on) I'm not too comfortable with that so we tried to find parking. It was 5 blocks away and it was freezing cold. Let's just say, parking isn't easy to find. 

Reservations. I made a reservations through yelp. It was easy and convenient and I got seated right away. If you know you're coming here, make the reservation. Only downside is you must put a card down, if you're over 15 minutes late, they charge you and if you don't cancel within 24 hours they charge you $10 for each person you reserved. Only beneficial if you know you're coming FOR SURE. 

Food. 
-Oven roasted crab: 5/5
A whole crab drenched in butter, garlic, salt and pepper. Amazing! I love dipping my crab into the buttery sauce. As of 9/15/18 one crab goes for the price of $62. My boyfriend doesn't eat crab so my parents and I shared two thinking that was enough, we ended up adding another crab. So if you're coming and wanna really indulge, get a crab per person. 

-Shaken beef: 3/5
Being Vietnamese, shaken beef is one of my favorite and this didn't really meet up to my standards. It was good and flavorful but they added diced potatoes. In my opinion if i'm paying $25 I would expect more than 9-10 small diced pieces of meat, and I would prefer meat than diced potatoes. 

-Garlic noodles: 5/5
Very flavorful and delicious. Great to pair with the crab. 

-Fried rice: 3/5
It was good, but nothing special. Fried rice was fried rice. 

-Fried bananas with vanilla ice cream: 4/5
Great way to end your meal. Fried banana topped with ice cream and a hit of chocolate sauce. 

Service: 5/5
We got our food super quick. We had a server, and we had people stop by the table to fill up our water constantly and change our crab shell bowls. Let's just say my water cup was always full and my crab shell bowl didn't reach half way full. And I love after we finished cracking our crab and have oily butter fingers they handed out hot towels to clean our hands. MY FAVORITE PART.

excerpts: Order the Roast Crab, Garlic Noodles, Shaken beef and Mussels!
We love the Roast Crab so much we order one whole Crab per person!
shaken beef.author: Benjamin S.
shaken beef.review:
Our favorite Crab restaurant in San Francisco! Order the Roast Crab, Garlic Noodles, Shaken beef and Mussels!

We love the Roast Crab so much we order one whole Crab per person!

excerpts: We ordered: roasted crab, prawns with noodles, shaken beef, and spicy eggplant.
Nothing tasted all that special or stood out.
I will say that the service deserves 5 stars alone.
We had a baby and they were super caring and checking on us which I was very pleased with.
The crab meat was plentiful and tasty but again just tasted like something any of us could do at home.
It also came out surprisingly fast so that seemed a bit odd.
I'm not sure if we ever need to come back.
The An the go noodle truck is good to get if you're into food trucks.
shaken beef.author: Guisela L.
shaken beef.review: This is more of a 3.4 rating. It was good but just left us looking for more. We ordered: roasted crab, prawns with noodles, shaken beef, and spicy eggplant. Nothing tasted all that special or stood out. I will say that the service deserves 5 stars alone. We had a baby and they were super caring and checking on us which I was very pleased with. The crab meat was plentiful and tasty but again just tasted like something any of us could do at home. It also came out surprisingly fast so that seemed a bit odd. I'm not sure if we ever need to come back. The An the go noodle truck is good to get if you're into food trucks.

excerpts:
LARGE PLATES

Shaken Beef - Tender cubes of marinated New York steak flambeed in Chardonnay served with potatoes, mixed greens & cherry tomatoes.
shaken beef.author: Chelsea W.
shaken beef.review:
Expensive Vietnamese restaurant known for roast crab & garlic noodles! You can't miss out on those here. This is not your typical place to get pho, in fact they don't have it!

Thanh Long is more of a seafood restaurant offering large dishes you can share family style. Most of the options run around $20, and the crabs will be around $50 each. Portions are on the smaller side. We shared 2 crabs, one serving of noodles, 3 large plates and a dessert between 4 people.

The restaurant is quite spacious and our waiter was very friendly. She helped clear our plates out since we practically overflowered our table! When I ordered I made sure to get all the popular dishes.

STARTERS 

Salt & Pepper Calamari - In a light salt and pepper batter, seasoned with scallions and red peppers. These were a great pick!

SOUPS

Vermicelli Noodle Consomme - Chicken, green onions, cilantro. The soup was clean tasting and good, the chicken was tender but I would've liked the noodles to have been the more traditional pho noodles rather than clear ones.

LARGE PLATES

Shaken Beef - Tender cubes of marinated New York steak flambeed in Chardonnay served with potatoes, mixed greens & cherry tomatoes. I'm not a beef person but this seemed good as well. Ours didn't come with potatoes though, but with onions.

Lemongrass Chicken - Slices of chicken sauteed with seasonal vegetables, garlic & chili. Pretty impressed by this one! Would order again for sure.

SECRET KITCHEN DISHES 

Roast Crab - A whole Dungeness crab roasted with An's garlic sauce & secret spices.

Garlic Noodles - An's famous noodles made with our special garlic sauce & secret spices. Super flavorful and very memorable. 

DESSERT 

Fried banana a la mode - With vanilla ice cream. For $8, the portions for the fried banana was tiny! The vanilla ice cream was way too frozen when served to us. There also was way too much whipped cream.

For the price point I would expect Thanh Long to be a more classy and upscale looking restaurant. It was great overall, but a bit on the pricier side for me. I would probably come on more special occasions.

excerpts: We ordered the tamarind crab, Traditional Vietnamese Salad, garlic noodles, shaken beef.
The Traditional Vietnamese Salad was not authentic and consisted mostly of very thinly sliced cabbage drenched in a too sweet dressing.
The Vietnamese Salad or "Goi" should have more herbs.
The famous garlic noodles was not all that.
Saturate your noodles in butter and garlic powder and you will have the same thing at home.
The shaken beef was not tender and lack of sauce of a traditional "Bò lúc lc

"
And finally, the pièce de résistance, tamarind crab was a greasy mess served on a puddle of clarified butter.
I was not able to taste the tamarind.
Here again, I have had better versions at other restaurants without a "Secret Kitchen"
This was an overpriced and poorly executed Vietnamese food and it shows that hype and marketing of the "Secret Kitchen Dishes" can fool a lot of people, at least once.
shaken beef.author: OngTayDen N.
shaken beef.review:
For years I have read about the positive press about this place. We ordered the tamarind crab, Traditional Vietnamese Salad, garlic noodles, shaken beef.  The short review is everything was mediocre and any regular Vietnamese restaurant can do the dishes better. 

The Traditional Vietnamese Salad was not authentic and consisted mostly of very thinly sliced cabbage drenched in a too sweet dressing.  The Vietnamese Salad or "Goi" should have more herbs.
The famous garlic noodles was not all that.  Saturate your noodles in butter and garlic powder and you will have the same thing at home.
The shaken beef was not tender and lack of sauce of a traditional "Bò lúc lc"
And finally, the pièce de résistance, tamarind crab was a greasy mess served on a puddle of clarified butter. I was not able to taste the tamarind. Here again, I have had better versions at other restaurants without a "Secret Kitchen"
This was an overpriced and poorly executed Vietnamese food and it shows that hype and marketing of the "Secret Kitchen Dishes" can fool a lot of people, at least once.

excerpts: Shaken beef is tender and juicy.
I also recommend the fried calamari, which tastes awesome too.
It's a little pricy but think about eating sea food at SF, the price is within the average, and definitely worth the food.
shaken beef.author: Joey J.
shaken beef.review:
5 star service. The host is very thoughtful. This is the first restaurant that can pay attention to very details. They offer Asian customers hot water. For westerners their default drink is iced water. 
Regarding with food, there is nothing I can not like. Roasted crab taste delicious. Shaken beef is tender and juicy. I also recommend the fried calamari, which tastes awesome too. 
It's a little pricy but think about eating sea food at SF, the price is within the average, and definitely worth the food.

excerpts: Had an absolutely amazing dinner tonight of Dungeness crab, garlic noodles, coconut prawn appetizer, and some shaken beef.
Outstanding!
Great atmosphere but don't show up without a reservation.
shaken beef.author: Kelly R.
shaken beef.review:
Had an absolutely amazing dinner tonight of Dungeness crab, garlic noodles, coconut prawn appetizer, and some shaken beef. Outstanding!  Great atmosphere but don't show up without a reservation. We were able to get a table for 7:45 tonight by calling mid afternoon. 

The place is huge but homey, the staff was very attentive and the service impeccable. And the crab.......to die for. What a great evening in a booming business. We thoroughly enjoyed ourselves and would love to come back.

excerpts: All the dishes were very good here, including the shaken beef and their famous garlic rice.
Nice vibe, excellent service.
If you're in San Fran, you should check it out.
shaken beef.author: Eddie C.
shaken beef.review: The dungeness crab is huge and well worth the hefty price. You get quite a lot of crab meat out of it. All the dishes were very good here, including the shaken beef and their famous garlic rice. Nice vibe, excellent service. If you're in San Fran, you should check it out.

excerpts: We also had lemongrass chicken and shaken beef which I also found bland.
Server was OK, but the water refillers were on point!
shaken beef.author: Charlie B.
shaken beef.review: If you find yourself here I would recommend getting an order of the garlic noodles. The noodles were definitely garlicky, but also buttery and just kind of melted in your mouth - so good. The crab that everyone raves about is just OK - it's fresh but seasoning is bland. We also had lemongrass chicken and shaken beef which I also found bland. Server was OK, but the water refillers were on point!

excerpts: We also had the garlic rice and shaken beef because our friend has a severe seafood allergy.
Those items were great, too.

This original location  spread to @crustacean_sf and beyond. .
.
.

shaken beef.author: Dee d.
shaken beef.review:
These two items will change your life and rock your world. I dream of this place and these two items. It's been 5 years and it didn't disappoint. ROAST CRAB and GARLIC NOODLES. if you ever have the chance, go to #ThanhLong do so. We also had the garlic rice and shaken beef because our friend has a severe seafood allergy. Those items were great, too.  This original location  spread to @crustacean_sf and beyond. .

excerpts: Shaken beef is better in Houston.
Will be back for the crab!
shaken beef.author: Jennifer N.
shaken beef.review:
Garlic crab and garlic noodles a must! 
Pass on tiger prawns- 4 prawns and garlic noodles for $40 is not worth it to me. Calamari was good. Shaken beef is better in Houston. 
Will be back for the crab!

excerpts: Next time we'll definitely have to try the shaken beef.
shaken beef.author: Mae-Ann L.
shaken beef.review: Finally made it to their OG location and it did not disappoint! We've been to the Crustacean in BH, and we enjoyed both locations. I will say the ambiance at the BH scores higher, but who really cares when you're devouring delicious crab! The only things I would complain about is the outrageous parking fee (valet) and the small tables. Next time we'll definitely have to try the shaken beef.

excerpts: SHAKEN BEEF.
SPICY EGGPLANT.
- The shaken beef pretty much blew me away.
Every cubed piece of meat was marinated so well that the beef melted in my mouth.
And it was perfectly complimented w/ the greens & onions.
- The spicy eggplant was also well marinated.
This dish was more on the oily side but all the flavor was there.
It also took me by surprise that there were chunks of chicken & other veggies in the dish.
shaken beef.author: Olivia S.
shaken beef.review:
In a few words, the MUST orders: GARLIC NOODLES. ROAST CRAB. SHAKEN BEEF. SPICY EGGPLANT. Period.

All the dishes were pretty much amazing. There was sooooo much flavor!
- The garlic noodles were tossed in oil & garlic and you could slurp every bite.
- The crab meat was so tender & juicy. Plus, you could order different flavors.
- The shaken beef pretty much blew me away. Every cubed piece of meat was marinated so well that the beef melted in my mouth. And it was perfectly complimented w/ the greens & onions.
- The spicy eggplant was also well marinated. This dish was more on the oily side but all the flavor was there. It also took me by surprise that there were chunks of chicken & other veggies in the dish. Win win!

Just a few tips: Make reservations ahead of time. Service is quick. And everything is pretty much family style so be prepared to dig in & share!

excerpts:
Garlic noodles to share
Shaken beef to share
Mussels to share.
shaken beef.author: Lyman C.
shaken beef.review:
It's been probably about 10 years since I've been here and 10 years is too long. 

Great place for dinner date or dinner with friends. If you tend to be loud better to be seated in the back. 

You have to order these items

Crab, of course or else why would you come here. The question becomes one per person or share?  It's easy to eat one by yourself. 

Garlic noodles to share
Shaken beef to share
Mussels to share. But you may want one order to yourself. 

Your tummy will be happy and wallet probably not so much. You will still come out happy.

excerpts: We got the roast crab, along with garlic noodles, spicy eggplants, shaken beef, salt and pepper calamari, and catch in citrus.
The catch is citrus and shaken beef was my favorite.
The beef was very tender and juicy.
The sauce on the fish was delicious!
The sauce combination was very unique.
shaken beef.author: Michelle T.
shaken beef.review:
I don't understand the hype of this place. The crab seems really popular so that was a must get when my friends and I came for dinner. We got the roast crab, along with garlic noodles, spicy eggplants, shaken beef, salt and pepper calamari, and catch in citrus.

The crab was underwhelming. It tasted like it was just boiled in water. I didn't taste any garlic. 

The rest of the food we ordered was good. The catch is citrus and shaken beef was my favorite. The beef was very tender and juicy. The sauce on the fish was delicious! The sauce combination was very unique. I've never thought about using orange sauce with fish. 

I'd come back to try other stuff on their menu but will definitely opt out of their crab. If you want good crab, let me introduce you to this one restaurant on Noriega called New Hing Lung. The crab is fried with egg yolk and pumpkin. It's amazing.

excerpts:
Roasted garlic crab as good as it gets,
Shaken beef, prawns , garlic rice ,
Fried pineapple with ice cream.
shaken beef.author: Gayle G.
shaken beef.review:
I made reservations using Open table so much better
than the old way of waiting for the restaurant to open.
The only problem was we were seated on the second
floor: very noisy. Food was as good as always,
but we couldn't have a conversation.
   Roasted garlic crab as good as it gets,
Shaken beef, prawns , garlic rice ,
Fried pineapple with ice cream.

excerpts: We also got the shaken beef and fried calamari.
Both were decent but my preference would have been to have some rice with either dishes, which weren't available.
shaken beef.author: Quoc N.
shaken beef.review:
Thanh Long is apparently the mothership to a few of other well known crab-serving restaurants. Because of this rich history, I think they are slightly starting to rest on their laurels and not giving quite the effort that brought them all the attention. 

Let's start with the basics, the crabs are the things to get here. You can eat other stuff but there needs to be a crab as part of your order.  They don't come cheap either; market price for my recent visit was slightly above 50 dollars per crab.  My family got the roasted garlic and drunken one, which is a funny way of saying champagne and alcohol flavored.  I preferred the roasted garlic one but wish they had served up some baguettes or something so I could soak up the crab back juices. Sounds gross but it's delicious!  The drunken one was okay but nothing to rave about. I would not order again. For our party of 5, 2 crabs was filling enough.  We also got the shaken beef and fried calamari.  Both were decent but my preference would have been to have some rice with either dishes, which weren't available.  Oh well, blame it on my being too Asian.

Two people helped wait on our table and the service was really split.  One lady seemed like we were bothering her while the man checked on us often.  Inconsistency is probably their theme these days as evident by the other reviews on here. Five stars here with a few 1 and 2 star reviews there.  Get yourself together Thanh Long!

excerpts: The raspberry lemon drop martini, shrimp toast, chicken satay, shaken beef, garlic roasted crab, colossal shrimp with garlic noodles...
ALLL soo good!
Happy tummy, happy wife, happy life ...
Right ?!
lol !
Our waitress was so cute & sweet.
I just wanted one cocktail
shaken beef.author: Cynthia C.
shaken beef.review:
We had a reservation at 845pm and the host told us "don't worry just be here before 9pm" so we got to the restaurant at 855pm... And everything is amazing. The raspberry lemon drop martini, shrimp toast, chicken satay, shaken beef, garlic roasted crab, colossal shrimp with garlic noodles... ALLL soo good! Happy tummy, happy wife, happy life ... Right ?!lol !
Our waitress was so cute & sweet. I just wanted one cocktail but she was too hard to resistant to tell her no. 

Overall great experience & great food

excerpts: I agree with everyone, Roasted Crab is to die for, Tiger prawns over bed of garlic noodles is excellent, Shaken Beef is delicious.
The only major disappointment is the Seasonal Veggies.
shaken beef.author: Mike G.
shaken beef.review:
With over 2100 reviews, there are nothing new I can add. 

I agree with everyone, Roasted Crab is to die for, Tiger prawns over bed of garlic noodles is excellent, Shaken Beef is delicious. The only major disappointment is the Seasonal Veggies. It was really bad. 

The place is packed, so make sure you get reservation, or else you have to wait for a long time.

excerpts: If you do want to order some type of meat, the Shaken beef is super tender and melts in your mouth!
shaken beef.author: Precious Ethel P.
shaken beef.review:
This has got to be my favorite restaurant!  I will take seafood any day than meat and this place meets my expectations continuously.  Although, they have very limited parking because it is in the city and around a residential area, they provide Valet!  I recommend valet unless you get lucky enough to park in front of the restaurant but goodluck!  Its either street parking or valet because they don't have a private lot.

When we go here, we usually dress more business casual but it totally doesn't matter, you'll get your hands dirty anyways.  The outside of the restaurant doesn't look very pleasing/fancy but the inside looks 10x better!  We ALWAYS ALWAYS make a reservation because they get very busy, especially during the weekends.  The waiting area is quite small but they have a full bar where you can sit, wait, and have a drink.  The restaurant isn't the biggest and it gets a little tight in there, but fortunately, they do have an upstairs area.

Their customer service here is perfect.  They aren't overwhelming, but they are quick to refill your water, and they're always walking around, that way if you need something they're easily accessible.  Everyone is quick, friendly, Americanized (no racial) and professional.

The food is astounding!  We start off with ordering the Salt & Pepper Calamari, sounds plain, but it's the most flavorful calamari ever.  My boyfriend and I always share 1 crab because they are HUGE with lots of meat.  There are different flavors of crab but our favorite is the Roast Crab.  We've tried the others but Roast Crab is my all-time favorite.  We order garlic noodles on the side and the fried banana with vanilla ice cream for dessert.  The traditional Vietnamese salad and mango salad is bomb, very light but good.  If you do want to order some type of meat, the Shaken beef is super tender and melts in your mouth!  EVERYTHING IS JUST DELICIOUS AND HEAVENLY.

The food is comparable to PPQ, if you've ever been there, however, Thanh Long is more expensive but you get what you pay for!  I think PPQ is more on the casual side but if you want to be a little fancier, Thanh Long is the place.

You will not walk out of here disappointed!

excerpts: I've never been a fan of shaken beef anywhere, but this place's was okay.
shaken beef.author: Jennifer W.
shaken beef.review:
This place is definitely not as good as PPQ and is more expensive. I would pass on this place after trying it once. 

The roast crab is the best flavor, but even that is fairly bland. The drunken crab is pretty bland and not that great. The garlic noodles have no garlic flavor; all you can taste is butter. I've never been a fan of shaken beef anywhere, but this place's was okay. The calamari was decent/good. 

Good service at this restaurant, large space, easy to find parking. Otherwise, taste-wise, price-wise, really no redeeming value.

excerpts: I absolutely loved their garlic noodles and the shaken beef.
Other dishes are terrific too but they are a bit pricey (for instance the roasted crab) although if you can afford it you should go for it.
I ordered it once
and I loved
and whenever I get my bonus at work
I'll likely end up having seconds!
It doesn't get any better than this place, and I am not talking just about the roasted crab.
The chefs here know exactly what they're doing.
Every bite introduces a new flavour that you didn't recognise before.
It was tasty and worth it.
I recommend checking out Thanh Long if you're looking for an excellent evening.
shaken beef.author: Roxanna W.
shaken beef.review: If you're looking for a great spot for seafood with a Vietnamese flare then your best bet in the area would be Thanh Long. The restaurant decoration is absolutely gorgeous and welcoming and the staff makes you feel at home. I absolutely loved their garlic noodles and the shaken beef. Other dishes are terrific too but they are a bit pricey (for instance the roasted crab) although if you can afford it you should go for it. I ordered it once and I loved and whenever I get my bonus at work I'll likely end up having seconds! It doesn't get any better than this place, and I am not talking just about the roasted crab. The chefs here know exactly what they're doing. Every bite introduces a new flavour that you didn't recognise before. It was tasty and worth it. I recommend checking out Thanh Long if you're looking for an excellent evening.

excerpts: Will and always will be one of our go-to for roasted crab, prawn garlic noodle, shaken beef cravings!!
shaken beef.author: Rachel C.
shaken beef.review: We've always held a event dinner at Thanh Long one time or another, but I've never made a review until now. Recently, we had my mom's birthday here and per usual we were satisfied and the service is awesome! Despite being a big party with a bunch of kids they still kept their wonderful customer service throughout our dining time. Will and always will be one of our go-to for roasted crab, prawn garlic noodle, shaken beef cravings!!

excerpts: We also order shaken beef which is tender cubes of marinated New York steak flambeed in Chardonnay.
No wonder this restaurant always full.
shaken beef.author: Purwanto L.
shaken beef.review:
Thanhlong is a Vietnamese restaurant but does not serve the usual Vietnamese food.  They specialised more on seafood.  
Their Roasted Dungeness crab is a must eat. Huge crab with thick and juicy crab meat.  
The garlic noodle looks plain, but after you try it you wont stop eating.  
Another good choice is their buttery seabass.  Cooked perfectly with ginger scallion and citrus infusion.  What a great combination of flavour.  
We also order shaken beef which is tender cubes of marinated New York steak flambeed in Chardonnay.  No wonder this restaurant always full.

excerpts: Had the Shaken Beef and Garlic Noodles.
All very flavorful and well portioned.
Good wine list and bar.
shaken beef.author: Derek C.
shaken beef.review: First time here, but definitely a favorite for future SF visits. Had the Shaken Beef and Garlic Noodles. All very flavorful and well portioned.  Good wine list and bar.

excerpts: We also had shaken beef which was good.
shaken beef.author: Adam L.
shaken beef.review:
I don't understand the hype around the "roast crab". It wasn't as great as the hype makes it out to be. Also I expected a lot bigger crab for $55! The crab came out so quick, one can probably assume it was pre-made in the kitchen. First, it wasn't even hot on the inside. It appears they roast the crabs and leave the garlic oil and seasoning until its ordered. Then they pour the seasoning and oil on top of the crab to make it hot again. also the crab was 1.5 lbs or so. I can get that size crab at Ranch 99 or something for $7.99/lb. So about $12 for that same size crab that I had to pay $55 for. That seasoning isn't worth $43! 

With that said, the seasoning and taste itself was good. Just not worth the price. We also had shaken beef which was good. But again portion vs. price, not worth it. 

We also had crab puff and garlic noodles. Both of which were expensive and again portion isn't worth the price. 

So overall you get my theme here. Its not worth it to come here.

excerpts: Then the shaken beef....
it's not bad either
but I definitely not worth $25.95 at all.
The portion is rather small....
shaken beef.author: CJ B.
shaken beef.review:
I love this restaurant! We came here when we were in town and loved almost everything we had. The mussels are done to a perfection and the crostini adds a bit more to the dish that complements the mussels. 

The garlic noodles....oh where do I start, it seems so simple yet its probably one of the best items on the menu. It's literally a plate of noodles, nothing else on the plate, but that's pretty much all you need.

Salmon Carpaccio, you can probably skip on, it's definitely not the best but it's not terrible either. Then the shaken beef....it's not bad either but I definitely not worth $25.95 at all. The portion is rather small....we ordered that thinking we could share it but definitely not enough for more than one adult. 

I'm pretty sure there were 3 different ways you can get the crab done, make sure you get the roast crab! And get ready to get all greasy and dirty! It will be worth every bite!

excerpts: We ordered some of their staple dishes: Shaken Beef - 5 stars.
shaken beef.author: Anna Y.
shaken beef.review:
My BF mentioned this place as he lives around the area. It's walking distance to his apartment. So Sunday night (before Memorial Day), we didn't feel like cooking so he asked if I wanted to try this place. I first went to Yelp for reviews and famous dishes. For 3 $$$ signs, I thought - this is pretty expensive for a seafood place but maybe worth a try since we're nearby? Best decision ever made. I made a reservation (via yelp) and got a 5:30pm dinner reservation. (Yep, we eat dinner early. LOL) When we arrived, there were a few people waiting outside. We checked in (around 5:45) and got seated right away. The place was PACKED at 5:45pm!!
I got excited as I saw people enjoying their dishes. We started with their fresh spring rolls - they were light and bite size. Good and healthy start for an appetizer since we were going to have a lot of sodium later on. Ha! We ordered some of their staple dishes: Shaken Beef - 5 stars. Colossal Prawns served with garlic noodles - 4 stars. (I'm not really a shrimp person) Spicy eggplant with Chicken - 5 stars. Just enough spice with a ton of flavor. The sweet and spicy sauce was killer! We didn't order crab since we're both not into crab really. (And frankly, I'm lazy to eat that stuff) We didn't have enough room for dessert so we skipped that. Our waitress was super nice, fast and very attentive! We got our food in less than 10 minutes upon ordering. I'll definitely come back here again. For a dinner of 2, we spent about $120. Definitely worth it!

excerpts: Came here with a group of four and got the shaken beef, 2 orders of garlic noodles (obvi), roast crab, and drunken crab.
More than enough to feed four hungry hippos.
The garlic noodles were perfection, the shaken beef was tender and melted in our mouths.
The garlic noodles were perfection, the shaken beef was tender and melted in our mouths.
I preferred the roast crab over the drunken crab, but only by a little.
I preferred the roast crab over the drunken crab, but only by a little.
shaken beef.author: Selena L.
shaken beef.review:
Came here with a group of four and got the shaken beef, 2 orders of garlic noodles (obvi), roast crab, and drunken crab. More than enough to feed four hungry hippos. The garlic noodles were perfection, the shaken beef was tender and melted in our mouths. I preferred the roast crab over the drunken crab, but only by a little. You really can't go wrong.

2 floors, valet parking ($12), full bar, call for reservations if you don't want to be waiting forever.

excerpts: I've also tried the calamari appetizer and the shaken beef entree ($23) if you're craving for more food.
shaken beef.author: Corinna T.
shaken beef.review:
I've been here three times now, so a review is long overdue. Long story short, you must order the roast crab ($45) and the garlic noodles ($11)! I've also tried the calamari appetizer and the shaken beef entree ($23) if you're craving for more food. Both are amazing as well.

Pros: Amazing crab and garlic noodles, super quick service (my water was never left empty, and the dishes came out in a flash!), a warm, well decorated ambiance, and good for groups, although I prefer coming here in smaller parties

Cons: It isn't cheap! I've only come here for special occasions mostly. But trust me, it's well worth your while. It's also pretty dim in here, with the dark red ambiance. It gets crowded, so please do yourself a favor and make a reservation especially for big groups!! 

Overall, I've been pleased with this place consecutively the past 3 times, and I will keep coming back.

excerpts: My favorite dish here is the shaken beef.
The pieces of beef were the right size, tenderness, and flavorful.
I'd take that over the crab anytime.
I'm drooling just thinking about the shaken beef.
shaken beef.author: Betty T.
shaken beef.review: Honestly, the crab is a little too hyped. Everyone says the roasted crab is good but I think I enjoy good old fashioned steamed crab better. All you need is a little lemon and pepper and it will taste just as good, plus it won't break your bank. My favorite dish here is the shaken beef. The pieces of beef were the right size, tenderness, and flavorful. I'd take that over the crab anytime. My friends really enjoyed the garlic noodles although I don't really like them that dry. I tend to like my noodles on the wetter/saucier side. The salt and pepper calamari is the perfect appetizer so I would highly recommend that for sharing. Overall, good place for dinner, though on the pricier side. I'm drooling just thinking about the shaken beef.

excerpts: Perfect Garlic Noodles, Roasted Crab, Shaken Beef, Soft Shell Crab, Calamari, Imperial Rolls, and Fried Rice-I'm still craving it all even after I just had it!
I should just order like 10 orders of the Garlic noodles and tell them to put it all in one big bowl for me!
shaken beef.author: JP P.
shaken beef.review: Perfect Garlic Noodles, Roasted Crab, Shaken Beef, Soft Shell Crab, Calamari, Imperial Rolls, and Fried Rice-I'm still craving it all even after I just had it! I should just order like 10 orders of the Garlic noodles and tell them to put it all in one big bowl for me!

excerpts: The older twin enjoyed her shaken beef.
The younger twin and her father thoroughly enjoyed the roasted crab and the big chunks of meat they got out of every leg.
The twins received complimentary desserts of ice cream in recognition of their birthday.
The older twin shared a fried banana a la mode with her mother.
Aunt and uncle also ordered another fried banana a la mode.
The older twin liked the way the banana was fried.
The fried layer was not thin.
The vanilla ice cream tasted very natural.
Little cousin ordered the lava cake with ice cream.
We'll have to come back another time to try the homemade sorbet which is on the list of foods the younger twin can have not being able to tolerate milk products.
The roast crabs cost $55 each.
shaken beef.author: Belinda L.
shaken beef.review:
It's been 21 years since we ate at this restaurant. The occasion then was my husband asking my parents for my hand in marriage. My sister wanted to celebrate my twin daughters' 18th birthday here. My husband made the reservation. There were only 2 reservations available a 5:30 p.m. or 8:30 p.m. We took the later one because of other obligations. There was a little bit of a wait for our table when we arrived.
Alex was our server. He got our water and hot jasmine tea going and answered questions about our menu choices such as how much roast crab and garlic noodles to order for our party of 10, which fish was the better choice, ... We went with 2 roasted crabs and 2 garlic noodles because Grandpa's dish of tiger prawns came with garlic noodles. There were 4 tiger prawns in the dish. The prawns were excellent. There weren't enough for everybody at the table. The garlic noodles always a hit with everybody especially the younger ones in the party. We had to order another garlic noodles and a large bowl of steamed rice. We had the salt and pepper calamari. We ordered the lemongrass chicken for Grandma. The dish was so tasty and the vegetables so tender that the grandchildren ate a good portion of the dish. We wonder if Grandma got enough to eat. The younger twin chose the steamed sea bass. It was a very good dish leaving everybody who had a chunk of the fish wanting more. The older twin enjoyed her shaken beef. The younger twin and her father thoroughly enjoyed the roasted crab and the big chunks of meat they got out of every leg.
The twins received complimentary desserts of ice cream in recognition of their birthday. The older twin shared a fried banana a la mode with her mother. Aunt and uncle also ordered another fried banana a la mode. The older twin liked the way the banana was fried. The fried layer was not thin. The vanilla ice cream tasted very natural. Little cousin ordered the lava cake with ice cream. We'll have to come back another time to try the homemade sorbet which is on the list of foods the younger twin can have not being able to tolerate milk products.
The roast crabs cost $55 each. We probably should have ordered another dish of lemongrass chicken and steamed sea bass.
Alex and another server helped us take group pictures to commemorate the occasion. We enjoyed our dinner tremendously.

excerpts: The shaken beef was ok, but the crab and noodles are show stopping.
shaken beef.author: Sarah P.
shaken beef.review:
Hands down best crab I've ever had - and I've been around the crab town. 

The roasted crab with the garlic noodles are both magical. The shaken beef was ok, but the crab and noodles are show stopping.

As someone who went to PPQ first, I must say, Thanh Long dominates. 

Super quick service as well!

excerpts: We ordered soft crab, mussels, calamari, roasted crab, garlic noodles, shaken beef, and Steamed Sea Bass.
Out of the dishes we ordered mussels was passable.
The mussels was flavorful and delicious.
shaken beef.author: Kathleen U.
shaken beef.review:
Disappointment. Overrated.

What happened to you, Thanh Long? 
Thanh Long is/was known for their Roasted Crab & Garlic Noodles. I use to think the food here was pretty good and decent enough for "Vietnamese food" even though I don't believe garlic noodles is authentic Vietnamese food. Now, I'm just disappointed.

Recently, I went to Thanh Long for one of my friend's birthday celebration. She made reservations for 6 people and said it was super easy to make reservations. Probably, it was for a Sunday night. Back in the day, it would take awhile for reservations and if you didn't make reservations, you would have to wait for 1 hour - 2 hours to be seated. 

We ordered soft crab, mussels, calamari, roasted crab, garlic noodles, shaken beef, and Steamed Sea Bass. Out of the dishes we ordered mussels was passable. The mussels was flavorful and delicious. The garlic noodles wasn't as a good as before. The roasted crab was still good, but not great. The food seems to become just mediocre.

When I'm craving for crab and garlic noodles, I won't be coming here unless I have to.

excerpts: I've also 'sampled' the Shaken Beef, the Sea Bass, and the Saigon Beef, all of which are very good.
I also think the calamari and mussel appetizers are very good.
shaken beef.author: Arnel L.
shaken beef.review:
Roast Crab and Garlic Noodles.  Why order anything else? Been here a dozen times in over a decade and I order the same thing EVERY time. Why?  Cause it's ALWAYS fantastic. Unhealthy as hell, but FANTASTIC!  I've also 'sampled' the Shaken Beef, the Sea Bass, and the Saigon Beef, all of which are very good. I also think the calamari and mussel appetizers are very good.  I think the calamari could be a little more crispy, but that's just me personal preference. 

They have a full bar and my wife tells me the Lychee Martini was very good. Runs about $10 a pop!

Parking sucks in the area. Valet parking is available for $12, otherwise expect to park 1-2 blocks away, and be prepared to circle the streets looking for parking. 

Reservations are a must. They get very crowded...despite the crappy parking situation.

excerpts: We had 2 crabs, shaken beef, colossal shrimp with garlic noodles and another garlic noodle.
2 lychee martini and two Navarro spritzer.
Check came to $280 with tips for 4 people.
The crabs were $54 each.
I haven't been here for awhile as I don't live in SF
so was a bit shocked to see the huge jump in prices.
But as they say, if you have to ask for the "market price", you shouldn't eat there.
My friends and I are here for a weekend girls trip.
They said it's the best meal they had here.
So it's worth the price.
By the way, the service was great too.
shaken beef.author: Elaine W.
shaken beef.review:
This Yelp reservation feature was great.  Reservation was honored and we got our seats right away.  Love it and therefore, highly recommend.
We had 2 crabs, shaken beef, colossal shrimp with garlic noodles and another garlic noodle.  2 lychee martini and two Navarro spritzer.  Check came to $280 with tips for 4 people.
The crabs were $54 each.  
I haven't been here for awhile as I don't live in SF so was a bit shocked to see the huge jump in prices.  But as they say, if you have to ask for the "market price", you shouldn't eat there.
My friends and I are here for a weekend girls trip.  They said it's the best meal they had here.
So it's worth the price.  By the way, the service was great too.

excerpts: The shaken beef was pretty good as well.
Though, I'd have to say I was a bit parched after eating everything due to the saltiness.
I still recommend this place, if you can dish out on a $40-50 crab ahh!
shaken beef.author: Crisgel B.
shaken beef.review: Came here with a big group for my friend's birthday. Great experience overall and loved the food. We ordered and the food came out really quick ready for us to devour! Been wanting to eat here for forever and I'll def come back. Loved the roasted crab, garlic noodles and mussels. The shaken beef was pretty good as well. Though, I'd have to say I was a bit parched after eating everything due to the saltiness. I still recommend this place, if you can dish out on a $40-50 crab ahh!

excerpts: We then had the shaken beef and colossal royal tiger prawns.
Again, both were so flavorful and good.
The shaken beef was tender and the potatoes and bed of lettuce was a nice touch.
shaken beef.author: Joanne L.
shaken beef.review:
I've heard so many good things about Thanh Long so it's been on my list of places to try for a very long time. 

Called in around 8:30 on Friday night to make reservations because I knew there would probably be a wait, super last minute but worth the try! Luckily they had an opening at 9:30 so we took it. Once we arrived we immediately got seated. 

I know they're known for their crabs, but my friend and I didn't feel like getting our hands dirty so we opted for their other dishes. We had the salmon carpaccio, and dungeness crab puffs to start. Both were very yummy but the salmon carpaccio was my favorite dish of the whole night. Perfectly seasoned and very light. We then had the shaken beef and colossal royal tiger prawns. Again, both were so flavorful and good. The shaken beef was tender and the potatoes and bed of lettuce was a nice touch. The tiger prawns comes with a bed of their garlic noodles. Personally it wasn't the best I ever had but it was still good. 

Service was top notch. We ordered a bottle of wine and they were always making sure our glasses weren't empty. I'll definitely be back to try their crabs soon.

excerpts: Shaken beef tender with salad, my favorite sea bass with orange sauce and of course garlic noodles and prawns and this time not the crab which I regret not ordering
shaken beef.author: Wendy M.
shaken beef.review: Love this place my favorite Ahn family restaurant.  Soft shell crab appetizers perfectly crispy and Buddha rolls delicious their peanut sauce is the best!  Shaken beef tender with salad, my favorite sea bass with orange sauce and of course garlic noodles and prawns and this time not the crab which I regret not ordering so I ordered another soft shell crab instead this place never disappoints

excerpts: The Fan Favorites: Garlic Noodles, Garlic Roasted Crab, and Shaken Beef.
shaken beef.author: Briana H.
shaken beef.review:
I had the pleasure in dining at Thanh Long to celebrate my 26th birthday! It's a great restaurant and I suggest to Bookmark it on your Yelp Page. 

Thanh Long resembles the modern cajun-style Roasted Crab Restaurants such as Boiling Crab/Kickin Crab/Cajun House/Crawstation, but this may be considered as one of the Original Grandfathers in the Crab Game. The white linen, glassware, and utensils were a nice change in my crab grubbing experience. Classy, indeed. 

Here's what our party of 5 ordered:

Garlic Noodles (x3)- I can honestly say this is the best garlic noodles I've ever tasted, great balance of butter and garlic.

Garlic Roasted Crab- Delicious garlic flavor!

Drunken Roasted Crab- w/ wine sauce. It's pretty good, but I would probably just order the Garlic Roasted Crab instead.

Prawn Coconut Curry- w/ chestnuts and green beans. I wasn't very impressed with the dish and would probably pass next time.

Shaken Beef- Very tender! I enjoyed it, but it wasn't the best. I've had better.

Mango Salad w/ Shrimp- I was expecting a fresh salad with bold flavors. However, I was disappointed that the dish was warm! 


Save some money and possible disappointment and order The Fan Favorites: Garlic Noodles, Garlic Roasted Crab, and Shaken Beef.

excerpts: We had garlic noodles, roasted garlic crab, crab wontons, and shaken beef.
It was phenomenal from start to finish.
It was a bit pricey at $56/crab market price
but it didn't disappoint.
I would highly recommend it.
I will definitely go back.
shaken beef.author: Leah R.
shaken beef.review: We had garlic noodles, roasted garlic crab, crab wontons, and shaken beef.  It was phenomenal from start to finish.  It was a bit pricey at $56/crab market price but it didn't disappoint.  I would highly recommend it.  I will definitely go back.

excerpts: Had the shaken beef this time and
it was
almost (dare I say) better?
shaken beef.author: Gabrielle P.
shaken beef.review:
This is such a homey, awesome restaurant!  Been here 6+ times and will continue to come back.  Always order the roasted crab and garlic noodles no matter what.  Had the shaken beef this time and it was almost (dare I say) better?  Can't wait to try a new dish every time we come back to discover new favorites.

It's a little bit of a hike out to the sunset, but totally worth it!

excerpts: Make your dinner surf 'n turf by adding the Shaken Beef.
Meat is so tender and full of flavor.
shaken beef.author: Michael G.
shaken beef.review: The best crab in town. The toast crab and drunken crab is very good. Not so much the tamarind crab. Why order that when roast crab is right above it on the menu. Make your dinner surf 'n turf by adding the Shaken Beef. Meat is so tender and full of flavor. Goes well with garlic noodles, roast crab and any wine.

excerpts: I recommend the Shaken Beef or an order of their Fried Spring Rolls.
shaken beef.author: Mari A.
shaken beef.review:
One of my ABSOLUTE favorite restaurants. Maybe its a nostalgic from an old time family childhood staple. Maybe its the hour long wait if you don't make a reservation or miss your reservation. Maybe it's the GINORMOUS crab or INCREDIBLY garlicky noodles that I dream about at night. Whether it's come one, come all: Top 5 All Time Favorites hands down.

So that little spiel alone should have been enough. But ill spell it out in a little more detail: 

1. Make a reservation and don't be late. It's hard to find parking keep in mind. 

2. Order the roasted crab. 

3. Order the garlic noodles. That's all you need. Well and alcohol. Duh. 

4. If you MUST order more: most dishes are 5 stars. I recommend the Shaken Beef or an order of their Fried Spring Rolls. 

5. Don't pack your own BIB. They've got you covered. 

THE END. Now do the happy dance.

excerpts:
Shaken Beef
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/thanh-long-san-francisco?select=t68CRJfgQs6m9rXDVE1ILA#DDbMAZwyv_gOBXaciovKGQ
I really liked this dish, the beef was really tender and the sauce was delicious.
Wasn't a huge fan of the salad/vegetables that came with the beef though.
shaken beef.author: Lily L.
shaken beef.review:
Decent food and really fast service. 

Salt and pepper calamari
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/thanh-long-san-francisco?select=t68CRJfgQs6m9rXDVE1ILA#YObSBlVLpUxggUIv7yf9Jg
A little bit salty for my tastes but was pretty good in general. I think I was expecting too much out of this dish due to the great reviews on here. 

Roasted Crab
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/thanh-long-san-francisco?select=t68CRJfgQs6m9rXDVE1ILA#UyRe9fVncOmyicAdGrl5Ig
This was really good. One of the few non-spicy crabs I've had where you can taste the seasoning/sauce. The crab was seasoned with salt, pepper, and oil very similar to the salt and pepper calamari.

Shaken Beef
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/thanh-long-san-francisco?select=t68CRJfgQs6m9rXDVE1ILA#DDbMAZwyv_gOBXaciovKGQ
I really liked this dish, the beef was really tender and the sauce was delicious. Wasn't a huge fan of the salad/vegetables that came with the beef though. There wasn't enough sauce to flavor the vegetables.

Banana Cake with Vanilla Ice Cream
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/thanh-long-san-francisco?select=t68CRJfgQs6m9rXDVE1ILA#t68CRJfgQs6m9rXDVE1ILA
Never had banana cake before. This was pretty good. The cake was warm so went really well with the ice cream. There were slices of bananas in the cake =)

Overall the food was pretty good and the service was pretty fast. We got our first dish about five minutes after we ordered it. It was a little pricy but I wouldn't mind going back some time to try their other dishes (really want to try the garlic noodles next time).

excerpts: I also enjoyed on of my favorite Vietnamese dishes, shaken beef (or Bo luc lac).
I will definitely come back to revel in this deliciousness.
shaken beef.author: Amy E.
shaken beef.review: YUM.  Best place to get crab.  The crab is roasted so beautifully and has great flavor.  Garlic noodles, of course, must go with your meal as well. I also got the drunken crab which was delicious as well.  The crab can get pricey, but you do get what you pay for. I also enjoyed on of my favorite Vietnamese dishes, shaken beef (or Bo luc lac). I will definitely come back to revel in this deliciousness.

excerpts: One order of crab, one garlic noodes, one order of Shaken Beef and Fried Ice
Cream- one beer and a diet coke...
$105.00 without the tax.
shaken beef.author: Monica H.
shaken beef.review:
How can i Not have written a review for Thanh Long yet?

I have eaten here several times in the past; have recommended this non-stop; and just recently -took my husband here for his post birthday dinner.

All the reviews probably have given you the Roasted Crab and Garlic noodles rundown...
So this review is just for me to confirm those Facts. YES, the crab is VERY tasty and just flaky and that buttery pepper oil on the platter for dipping? Divine.
Garlic Noodles? I can eat that all day errday... seriously.

WONDERFUL.

So here's a few tips to enjoy your Thanh Long experience.

1.) Be Ready to spend money. Example? One Crab last week cost about $46.
One order of crab, one garlic noodes, one order of Shaken Beef and Fried Ice Cream- one beer and a diet coke... $105.00 without the tax. That was good for two people. 

2.) One Crab can be shared by two people max... But one can easily have a crab to themselves. I mean.. It's just CRAB.

3.) Garlic Noodles -- if you're like.. eeeew my breath will stink.. NO.. it won't. Just do IT. It's more of a butter garlic taste.

4.) Make reservations.

5.) Have some cash for valet parking. Coz parking could be a pain in the residential area.

----
other than that.... enjoy your foodgasmic meal. 
Amazing and Fast service.

excerpts: The Shaken beef was outstanding!
It was not too oily and it tastes just right.
Parking was a challenge but the have Valet.
We will come back to this place.
shaken beef.author: Tony B.
shaken beef.review: We didnt have to wait long for the food. It was delicious! It's expensive but worth it. My wife loved the roasted crab. The Shaken beef was outstanding! It was not too oily and it tastes just right. Parking was a challenge but the have Valet. We will come back to this place.

excerpts: We ordered the roast crab and shaken beef since we weren't that hungry.
Bf's shaken beef wasn't bad.
We got chocolate lava cake and crème brûlée to cheer me up from the crab disappointment...
first world problems ftw!
I'll have to say that dessert was the best part of our dinner
PPQ Dungeness Island does it better.
shaken beef.author: Jenny Q.
shaken beef.review:
I had this place bookmarked for a good 3 months after seeing it on Travel Channel and hearing coworkers rave about it.

Bf and I made reservations an hour before arriving on a Friday night. I thought it would be a little harder to get a reservation so I was happy about that.

The place was packed when we got there and we waited a little past our reservation time to get seated. No biggie. We ordered the roast crab and shaken beef since we weren't that hungry. 

When I tried the crab my tongue curled in repulsion..the thing was literally covered in grease and black pepper! Seemed more like a fried crab than a roasted crab lol..I asked our waiter if I ordered the right thing and she ended up bringing me another crab 2 minutes later with less pepper. I appreciate the service but the crab just wasn't good no matter how much pepper is on it. 

Bf's shaken beef wasn't bad. We got chocolate lava cake and crème brûlée to cheer me up from the crab disappointment...first world problems ftw! 
I'll have to say that dessert was the best part of our dinner :)
PPQ Dungeness Island does it better.

excerpts: Must eat: Garlic Noodles, Shaken Beef and Crab of course!
We opted to try the crab with tamarind sauce since we have had the roasted crab before.
It was a great choice but a bit messy.
Thanks for giving us a stack of napkins!
We needed that.
Call us napkin monsters.
I looked around and it seemed like almost every table got at least the same three dishes.
The garlic noodles are sooo good!
The noodles are chewy and the perfect texture.
The garlic isn't super overpowering but very flavorful.
Simple yet so yummy!
Shaken beef was tender and delicious.
It was served on a bed of mixed greens with cooked potatoes and onions.
shaken beef.author: Liv A.
shaken beef.review:
It's crab season! Is Thanh Long ever not crowded? There were people all packed by the front door and outside waiting for a table yesterday evening. I don't blame them. They know where to eat! Kudos to bf for making a ressie. We were seated right away and already knew what we were going to order.

Must eat: Garlic Noodles, Shaken Beef and Crab of course! We opted to try the crab with tamarind sauce since we have had the roasted crab before. It was a great choice but a bit messy. Thanks for giving us a stack of napkins! We needed that. Call us napkin monsters. I looked around and it seemed like almost every table got at least the same three dishes. The garlic noodles are sooo good!  The noodles are chewy and the perfect texture. The garlic isn't super overpowering but very flavorful. Simple yet so yummy! Shaken beef was tender and delicious. It was served on a bed of mixed greens with cooked potatoes and onions. The tamarind sauce on the crab was a tomato based but had a hint of sweetness to balance the acidity.

The wait staff was very prompt. They kept removing our bowls of crab shells and giving us fresh bowls. Our water glasses were always full throughout our meal as well. 

Because the restaurant is crowded and the tables set very close together, it was a bit difficult to carry a conversation in normal voice level. I caught myself asking bf to repeat himself a few times and vice versa. I could literally hear what the tables next to us were saying too. 

Minus a star for the upkeep of the restroom. I went to wash my hands prior to my meal and noticed that there were paper towels and tp strewn on the floor. There was also a used wedge of lime (from a cocktail?) on the sink counter....odd. After my meal, I went to wash my hands again. The restroom was in the same condition, except with more paper towels on the floor this time. Doesn't seem like the restroom was maintained during service.

excerpts: the shaken beef was soooo tender.
and like quality beef tender, not baking soda tender.
really flavorful and liked that it was cubed and easy to eat.
shaken beef.author: Heather F.
shaken beef.review:
went here with my family on a saturday night at 7pm, and was seated almost immediately. don't bother coming if you don't have reservations, because it is packed. it is pretty loud, which is fine though a bit bothersome usually; however, i was with my grandma, so that made talking to her a lot harder.

grilled calamari- so tender! the bodies were chewy but yet so tender. fabulously smoky. the creamy pb sauce yummy but nothing special. 

the shaken beef was soooo tender. and like quality beef tender, not baking soda tender. really flavorful and liked that it was cubed and easy to eat. the salad underneath with sauteed onions was yummy.

the real reason we came was for the garlic noodles. i've had them from their truck, an the go, and they were amazing. my mom first had them at crustacean, and she loved them there, too. we were so looking forward to them that we got a side order, and we also got the prawns that came atop the noodles. and they were so sad.

the separate order was kind of cold, and the noodles were somewhat hard. they tasted as if they'd be on the counter and forgotten for a while, and overall didn't seem very fresh. the ones that were underneath the shrimp were a lot better thank goodness. rich and buttery and cheesy and actually hot. they still weren't as good as when i had them last, but not sure if it's because the product wasn't as good or if my expectations were too high.

and let's talk about those shrimp. the colossal royal tiger prawns consisted of four butterflied prawns atop a pile of the aforementioned garlic noodles. i didn't like the butterflied cut; while pretty, it was hard to get the shrimp out of the shell. they were well-seasoned and so smoky, and i thought they were the best morsel (okay, like 4 bites) of the night. dad was unimpressed and thought them overdone. it was marked as mp, but there's no way that four butterflied shrimp atop a pile of garlic noodles is $38. that kind of ruined the best bite of the night thing for me.

in an attempt to insert some foliage into our lives, we got the seasonal veggies. and they were meh. but what do you get for ordering stupid things? the sauce was actually pretty good though and dad sopped it up with rice.

the curry lotus prawns were ordered because dad was still hungry. this was one big wtf. the water chestnuts were too huge (it sounds stupid but i swear), and i found myself halfheartedly plodding away at a bunch of them. the green beans tasted old and tough. the curry itself was very oddly flavored- there were a bunch of spices/herbs that i didn't recognize and didn't care for. it almost tasted medicinal to me. the coconut milk wasn't apparent, so there wasn't any creaminess to help save the curry. the shrimp was crisp and tender, and that was the only good part.

4 stars for the food, even if the curry lotus prawns were veryyy meh and the garlic noodles didn't quite satisfy what i was looking for. knocked down to 3 stars because i don't care how good your shrimp are, $38 is too much for 4.

excerpts:
I thought that was too much for a plate of chow mein with shrimp , it's nothing fancy

the Shaken Beef
shaken beef.author: Mr Bolo B.
shaken beef.review:
the prices are too high, the Tiger Garlic Prawns with garlic noodles is $35 a serving! I thought that was too much for a plate of chow mein with shrimp , it's nothing fancy

the Shaken Beef [Thit Bo Luc Lac] is also over priced at $21 a plate, I just had the same thing at another vietnamese restaurant for $8

I think this place is Over-Hyped because of Diners, Drive ins & Dives

this is not a traditional Vietnamese restaurant it's mostly for Yuppies or rich people that like to waste their money

I wont be comming back anytime soon when there are so many other better places with  more reasonable prices

dont need the fancy table cloths or wine glasses

excerpts: Shaken Beef (5/5): very tender tasty cubes of beef (not well done,

if that's important to you) that was marinated in a lightly sweet sauce, served with potato cubes that had also been marinated in the same dark sauce and grilled; all of this served over tender bay greens.
Delicious!
Everyone liked this dish.
The Rice and Roll's Hunan Grilled Butter Beef was very comparable (and less expensive) than this dish but this was still a winning dish.
shaken beef.author: Glenn H.
shaken beef.review:
4.5 stars. Minus a half a star for the value of some of the items but overall a terrific night out.

This is a prize of a place. Comfortable setting, great service, excellent quality food and, while maybe spend-y, is worth a look.

For our New Years eve dinner there we four had reservations (needed given the size of the place) at 8 PM. We started the night with two appetizers:

1. Tempura Style Coconut Prawns (3/5). These were not so much the Japanese style tempura (corn starch batter) that you might have had but more coconut shaving encrusted large prawns. There were 5 and were good but, if I had to go again, not a must have.

2. Dungeness Crab Puffs (4/5). These were 6, small, perfectly deep fried, wonton-skin wrapped pillows of Dungeness crab filling that were so much better than the typical Crab Rangoon's that you might have had elsewhere. They came with two dipping sauces, the better one was the sweet mustard. This was a nice, if pricey, treat and a good start to the entrees. 

Four entrees:

1. Roasted Crab (4/5): this smelled wonderful as it came out and was a large, already cut up Dungeness crab, with the carapace shell. It was meaty and perfectly done with the garlic sauce. Really glad we tried this. I like crab but it isn't a must have for me. My table-mates really like it. Market price was almost $40 each.

2. Shaken Beef (5/5): very tender tasty cubes of beef (not well done, if that's important to you) that was marinated in a lightly sweet sauce, served with potato cubes that had also been marinated in the same dark sauce and grilled; all of this served over tender bay greens. Delicious! Everyone liked this dish. The Rice and Roll's Hunan Grilled Butter Beef was very comparable (and less expensive) than this dish but this was still a winning dish. And I need to mention the tender-crisp cuts of sweet Vidalia (that's my guess) onions that were served with this dish, they were great in their own right and really added dimension to the beef.

3. Seafood Combination (Scallops, prawns, Dungeness crab) Fried rice (6/5): if there was one dish that stood out from all of them, it was this dish. A simple, (even unimpressive) looking fried rice dish that just blew people away with its wok-seared taste and awesome flavors. Fried rice, yes. But extraordinary? For a mere $16 Absolutely!

4. Colossal Royal Tiger Prawns (5/5): 4 large butterflied and perfectly grilled in the shell prawns that were served over a bed of their famously delicious garlic noodles. Yeah this was a splurge, at almost $10 a prawn, this was expensive but very (very) good and to be served over the deservedly vaunted garlic noodles, this was a plus. We didn't have to order the Garlic Noodles as an entree because of this, and the waiter was smart enough to understand this by ignoring our order for these Prawns PLUS a Garlic Noodle order. The prawns did have a tendency to stick to their shells, but they were perfectly done and marinated in some fantastic sauce to make them outstanding.

The Garlic noodles had the perfect consistency of Yee Noodles, http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yi_mein, which gives them an extra nice bite and appear to absorb the flavors better. They are also pricey. The Garlic Noodles by themselves were $9.50 an order, which seems a bit high for lo mein noodles and garlic, but if they are Yee noodles, they would be more fairly priced. Everyone at the table loved these. 

Three deserts: 

Creme Brulee (3/5): this was an OK rendition of Creme Brulee, not bad but not up to the standards of the rest of the meal. Nothing really special.

Chocolate Lava Cake (5/5): Oh yeah! This chocolate delight was the size of a very small hockey puck served with a large scoop of vanilla ice cream over a pool of Grand Marnier & melted vanilla ice cream. It was pricey ($9) but oh so very wonderful to have that rich oozing chocolate goodness.

Fried Banana Fritters a la Mode. (5/5): 2 fritters (your choice of pineapple or banana) served with that same scoop of dense vanilla ice cream. Love, Love, Love this simple but wonderful desert.

It was almost a perfect amount of food for 4 with each of us full to the neck and almost giddy from the great food experience.

While the restaurant was crowded, it never seemed loud or noisy and the service was spot-on: unobtrusive, available, and very polite.

With tip we were at about $50 per person without drinks (which included one modestly iced tea for $2.50).

Loved it and would eagerly go again for a special occasion!

excerpts: The crab was lukewarm, the noodles were okay, and the only redeeming dish was the Shaken Beef which was still tender and delicious.
shaken beef.author: Nette T.
shaken beef.review:
Oh Thanh Long, how I loved thee.

I went there ages ago (like during the early 90s), and remembered the crab being AH-MAH-ZING.

I went with out of town friends and was underwhelmed. The crab was lukewarm, the noodles were okay, and the only redeeming dish was the Shaken Beef which was still tender and delicious.

Service was dodgy too - I made reservations and called back twice to confirm, but when I got there on time they couldn't find my name? What is going on?!!!

Even though my friends enjoyed the meal, I knew better and hid my disappointment. Did I go on an off day? Please tell me I did.

excerpts:
Two orders of Garlic Noodles
(http://bit.ly/1vNfkkq)

Shaken Beef
(http://bit.ly/1rYhton)

Seasonal Vegetables
(Sorry No Pic)

Bowl of rice (
The Garlic Noodles were OMGYUM!
I would definitely splurge on more of them for next time!
The Shaken beef was pertty good too, but I wished they had served a bigger portion.
shaken beef.author: Rodney H.
shaken beef.review:
We treated my mom at Thanh Long for Mother's Day as she had a huge craving for really good crabs.  And even though it's been more than 10 years since I've been here, their crabs are still top notch!

We arrived a little late for for our reservation but they managed to hold our table which was cool on their part considering that it was for Mother's Day.

We ordered quite a spread:

Roasted Crab
(Sorry no pic)

Drunken Crab
(http://bit.ly/1vOrEzI)

Two orders of Garlic Noodles
(http://bit.ly/1vNfkkq)

Shaken Beef
(http://bit.ly/1rYhton)

Seasonal Vegetables
(Sorry No Pic)

Bowl of rice (why not?)
(No pic needed)

And their Banana Cake for Dessert
(http://bit.ly/12nUpsi)

All in all, for 4 people it was the perfect amount of food.  Those were some of the best crabs I've had in a had.  Very flavorful, especially the Roasted Crab which I liked the best between that and the Drunken Crab.  The Garlic Noodles were OMGYUM!  I would definitely splurge on more of them for next time!  The Shaken beef was pertty good too, but I wished they had served a bigger portion.  I also tried their Pineapple Lychee Martini and it was seriously refreshing!

I'm glad that Thanh Long still hasn't lost their touch.  It's an awesome spot for any special occasion.

excerpts: Drunken crab, roasted crab, coconut prawns, garlic noodles, shaken beef and a sea bass dish.
shaken beef.author: Rich N.
shaken beef.review:
We ordered a few different dishes to try out. 

Drunken crab, roasted crab, coconut prawns, garlic noodles, shaken beef and a sea bass dish. 

Atmosphere was just ok. The crowd next us was super loud quite rude. 

Food came out cold. Crab was over cooked. Mediocre at best. 

Service took a bit longer than what we expected. 

Way better crab at the kitchen in millbrae.

excerpts: The garlic noodles were completely unmemorable (barely tastes like anything) and the Shaken Beef was good, but both items were way way way overpriced.
shaken beef.author: Ben C.
shaken beef.review:
The garlic noodles were completely unmemorable (barely tastes like anything) and the Shaken Beef was good, but both items were way way way overpriced. $11 for literally a plate of just noodles and a sprinkle of garlic, plus $24 for a plate of little beef cubes over a plate of dull, frozen lettuce. 

My water glass came to me with a large brown mark on one side of the rim that my friend later explained to me was dried lipstick. The fact that nobody noticed something so obvious speaks volumes about their attention to detail in both their food and decor.

I would give this place four stars if the prices were more like $6 and $10, but at these gouging prices, I would certainly not come back or tell anyone else to.

excerpts: but this time I had the Shaken Beef
and it was excellent!
Good service too!
shaken beef.author: Bettina S.
shaken beef.review: Been here a few times had the crab and it's the best but this time I had the Shaken Beef and it was excellent! Good service too!

excerpts: Garlic Noodles and Shaken Beef!
Other people might recommend you to go and try the Garlic Noodles from the Anh Food Truck for a better price, but it's just does not come close.
I've eaten at several places and attempted to make my own version
yet nobody comes close to Thanh Long's - Highly Recommended!
shaken beef.author: Jan R.
shaken beef.review:
I don't even have to look at their menu to have a great time with food while dinning here! Garlic Noodles and Shaken Beef! 

Yes, this place is known for their crabs yet I go here for these two. I prefer Thanh Long rather than Crustacean, first because of the location and next due to a better atmosphere. There is valet parking available because street parking is almost impossible during nights.

Other people might recommend you to go and try the Garlic Noodles from the Anh Food Truck for a better price, but it's just does not come close. I've eaten at several places and attempted to make my own version yet nobody comes close to Thanh Long's - Highly Recommended!

excerpts: We ordered the shaken beef, roast crab and garlic noodles.
I really liked the shaken beef and garlic noodles.
I really liked the shaken beef and garlic noodles.
The shaken beef was cooked nicely with lots of flavor.
The garlic noodles were great, way better than PPQ, plus it didn't dry out while we were enjoying other foods.
The roast crab was good but not good enough in my opinion.
shaken beef.author: Mabel Y.
shaken beef.review:
Thanh Long has received a lot of recognition and I know my friend really loves this place.

Came here last Friday night with my boyfriend for dinner, luckily I made a reservation the night before because it was quite packed after we were seated.

We ordered the shaken beef, roast crab and garlic noodles. I really liked the shaken beef and garlic noodles. The shaken beef was cooked nicely with lots of flavor. The garlic noodles were great, way better than PPQ, plus it didn't dry out while we were enjoying other foods. The roast crab was good but not good enough in my opinion. It lacked flavor and finesse.

The service was friendly and no nonsense. I'll be back!

excerpts: We had the coconut prawns and New Zealand mussels for appetizer, garlic noodles, roast crab, tamarind crab, and shaken beef for main course.
I remember having the coconut prawns at their home before
and I absolutely fell in love with this dish.
Crispy from the tempura, sweet from the coconut flake, a little tangy of their signature orange sauce.
It was such a balanced dish and a great start of the meal.
Onto the main dish, garlic noodles, I thought I liked it better when I ate at their house, but my boyfriend loved the noodle served at the restaurant.
It was garlicky, but a little sweet for me.
The crabs were very fresh and the color looked amazing.
Roast crab, which seem to be every Yelper's favorite, yet not me.
Tamarind crab was okay, the sauce was not thick and tangy enough for a Vietnamese like me who technically grow up eating tamarind crab every other weekend in Vietnam.
Lastly, shaken beef was perfectly medium rare, juicy and full of flavors.
shaken beef.author: Chau V.
shaken beef.review:
Thanh Long has been on my bookmark for quite some time now, so we couldn't miss a chance to have dinner at Thanh Long on our most recent visit to the City by the Bay.

Holy crabs!

My boyfriend's mom is a close friend of one of the daughters of the An family's and we have tried all the signature dishes at the home of the chef before, but dining at their restaurant was a different experience. If you plan to have dinner at weekend, it is essential to make reservation ahead and arrive promptly because the wait can get hectic (about 1-1:45 hours). Also, don't come like 30 minutes early for your reservation since they will make you wait until your whatever time you reserve.

We had the coconut prawns and New Zealand mussels for appetizer, garlic noodles, roast crab, tamarind crab, and shaken beef for main course. I remember having the coconut prawns at their home before and I absolutely fell in love with this dish. Crispy from the tempura, sweet from the coconut flake, a little tangy of their signature orange sauce. It was such a balanced dish and a great start of the meal. Mussels were fresh, the Asian pesto was flavorful and the crostini accompanied really well with the other two.

Onto the main dish, garlic noodles, I thought I liked it better when I ate at their house, but my boyfriend loved the noodle served at the restaurant. It was garlicky, but a little sweet for me. The crabs were very fresh and the color looked amazing. Roast crab, which seem to be every Yelper's favorite, yet not me. Tamarind crab was okay, the sauce was not thick and tangy enough for a Vietnamese like me who technically grow up eating tamarind crab every other weekend in Vietnam. Lastly, shaken beef was perfectly medium rare, juicy and full of flavors. Strange, but I would recommend this meat dish at a seafood restaurant. 

Overall, great dining experience.

excerpts:
All hype and overpriced

$45 for one roasted crab and $23 for Shaken Beef?!
The shaken beef was decent
but I've had better.
shaken beef.author: Tammy N.
shaken beef.review:
All hype and overpriced

$45 for one roasted crab and $23 for Shaken Beef?!  For $45 the crab better be fresh and of course it's good because it's soaked in butter.  The shaken beef was decent but I've had better.  The mango salad was definitely different from what I was expecting.  Not really fresh and crisp but more so briefly stir fried to a savory soggy dish. Even the lettuce was warm.  Garlic noodles I thought was a bit overcooked and mushy.  I expected more, better, an orgasmic experience but ehh it is what it is.  I am glad that I finally got to say I've been here though.  Definitely won't see me again, I actually like PPQ wayyyyyy more.  And oddly enough, even though it's in the Outer Sunset there's barely any street parking nearby.  Tip: go to Lincoln St and walk 2 blocks.  They also have valet parking for $12

excerpts: Get the shaken beef and calamari if you want somehting delicious in your mouth
shaken beef.author: Vince L.
shaken beef.review:
The garlic noodles were just ok, nothing too special.  The roasted crap was WAY better than the drunken crap but both were overpriced.  

Get the shaken beef and calamari if you want somehting delicious in your mouth

excerpts: We also got shaken beef.
The crab was a little dry but pretty delicious otherwise.
However, if I am going to be charged $44 for one Dungeness crab I expect it to be perfectly juicy.
The food came out a little too quickly, which made us think the crab was cooked ahead of time then reheated, which probably resulted it from being a little overcooked.
shaken beef.author: Melody N.
shaken beef.review:
Overhyped and overpriced for me.  We came here for the roasted crab and infamous garlic noodles.  We also got shaken beef.  The crab was a little dry but pretty delicious otherwise.  However, if I am going to be charged $44 for one Dungeness crab I expect it to be perfectly juicy.  The food came out a little too quickly, which made us think the crab was cooked ahead of time then reheated, which probably resulted it from being a little overcooked.  The garlic noodles were tasty but nothing overwhelming exciting.   The beef was tender and tasty, but being Viet I have had this dish at other places where they would given more beef for the same price.  

Overall disappointing, especially with all the four star reviews I saw on yelp.

excerpts: Ordered the popular roast crab and tamarind crab, garlic noodles and of course shaken beef.
The crabs are so fresh and succulent in their special herbs and sauce that we lick up every little bit of sauce and oil on the platter.
Shaken beef is so tender moist and sweet
that again we finish the salad that holds the famous beef.
Garlic noodles were the right touch to complete the meal.
Service was efficient and we were happy that the wait may be long
but after you're seated the food comes in 10 mins.
Excellent.
Overall it's pricey but so worth it.
Will be back
shaken beef.author: Nelle L.
