shaken beef.review:
Took us 3 years and finally made the reservation for Saturday dinner. And yes reservation is a must so as not to wait for than an hour to be seated. 
Ordered the popular roast crab and tamarind crab, garlic noodles and of course shaken beef. 
The crabs are so fresh and succulent in their special herbs and sauce that we lick up every little bit of sauce and oil on the platter. 
Shaken beef is so tender moist and sweet that again we finish the salad that holds the famous beef. 
Garlic noodles were the right touch to complete the meal. 
Service was efficient and we were happy that the wait may be long but after you're seated the food comes in 10 mins. Excellent. 
Overall it's pricey but so worth it. Will be back

excerpts: Here's what to get: salt/pepper calamari, shaken beef, roast dungeness crab, garlic needles.
shaken beef.author: John M.
shaken beef.review:
This place is SOOOO money, it's not even funny. 

Here's what to get: salt/pepper calamari, shaken beef, roast dungeness crab, garlic needles.

The fact that I now live 1/2 block away and I've been here literally 3 times in last week is insane - bodes really well!!

excerpts: For our main dishes we ordered the roast crab and the jumbo prawns with garlic noodles and the shaken beef.
The crab and prawns were really tasty.
I personally love garlic noodles
so I couldn't get enough of that!
The shaken beef was also very good and the meat was tender.
For dessert we ordered the fried banana with ice cream.
it was SOOOO GOOOD!
I hadn't had this dessert in years and it definitely was satisfying.
The service was great.
The waiter was always attentive and checking in on us, the table was never cluttered with unused plates and our water was always filled.
Over all we had a great experience.
I will definitely be coming back for seconds!!
shaken beef.author: Gabrielle C.
shaken beef.review: Took my mom here yesterday as a late birthday dinner and it was so good! We ordered the mussels and seafood dumpling as an appetizer. The mussels were really good. they were drizzled with olive oil that you can use to spill on the slice of bread that comes with it. The seafood dumpling was good but I could do without next time. For our main dishes we ordered the roast crab and the jumbo prawns with garlic noodles and the shaken beef. The crab and prawns were really tasty. I personally love garlic noodles so I couldn't get enough of that! The shaken beef was also very good and the meat was tender. For dessert we ordered the fried banana with ice cream. it was SOOOO GOOOD! I hadn't had this dessert in years and it definitely was satisfying. The service was great. The waiter was always attentive and checking in on us, the table was never cluttered with unused plates and our water was always filled. Over all we had a great experience. I will definitely be coming back for seconds!!

excerpts: *Shaken beef - Shaken, not stirred...
I didn't taste the "shaken", but the cubes of meat were very tender.
Served on a bed of green and mixed in with some potato, the meat has a sharp peppery taste.
I recommend this for people with seafood allergies that come here.
shaken beef.author: Arnold T.
shaken beef.review:
"500 hundred crabs will be served in one night..."...yada yada yada...we being first time customers were given the usual spiel.  My mind wondered, 'are cokes refillable?'...'where are the restrooms?'...'how much is 'market price'?'...'does the waiter know I'm not really paying attention?'

Back to reality...'did he say 500 hundred crabs?'  Where do they even keep that many crabs laying around I thought.  At that point, I wasn't sure if he mentioned it already, so to save some possible embarrassment I didn't inquire about the crabs, nodded, and just asked...'where are the restrooms?' 

Parking was more difficult than I expected as street parking sucked that day.  My laziness within grew with valet parking available tempting me.  The outrageous cost of $12 bucks and the thought of someone joy riding in my valuable antique of a Corolla didn't sit well with me.  The Sunset weather by the water was its usual half dreary self.  Contrast to the outside, inside the restaurant was vibrant and warm.  Aroma of good times filled the place; passing each table we saw at least one crab on the table.  Hold those horses...part of the waiter's yada yada yada included "90% of people order the crab".  

If it were me, our order would have consisted of all crab and garlic noodles.  Due to food allergies and cholesterol consciousness at the table, a full spectrum of dishes was chosen.  

OUR ORDER:     
*Lemongrass chicken satay - These grilled chicken skewers come numbering around three or four.  This was the first item that came out and everyone was hungry.  Playing the disappearing act in a poof, I only ate a sliver of a sliver sized piece.  My taste buds do not recall anything negative.  There were no complaints either.  

*Salt & pepper calamari - One of my sister's go to dishes no matter where, when, and how.  How can you go wrong with deep fried calamari?  You can't; unless they were soggy which these were not.  Salt and pepper were abundantly prevalent throughout.  The chunks of calamari were a larger size calamari than usual.  Bigger means more calamari meat and less batter.  Less batter is typically good thing.  

*Shaken beef - Shaken, not stirred...I didn't taste the "shaken", but the cubes of meat were very tender.  Served on a bed of green and mixed in with some potato, the meat has a sharp peppery taste.  I recommend this for people with seafood allergies that come here.    
  
*Lemongrass chicken - Didn't I order something with lemongrass as an appetizer already?  I repeated "lemongrass" a couple times under my breath unsure of this when ordering.  We needed another dish for the non-seafood eaters at the table anyway.  Consisting of probably all dark meat, the chicken was very simplistically lemongrass-ed.  There were more bell peppers than I would have liked.  The noticeable echo of pepper flavor popped up again.  I wonder how much pepper this restaurant uses in a day.   

*"Colossal" royal tiger prawns with garlic noodles - My main chagrin about this plate was the adjective "colossal" attached to the prawns.  All the pictures I saw, they looked humongous.  I bet the picture I took even look gigantic.  Truly, it is an optical illusion.  While unexpectedly smaller they were also a smidgen on the salty side for me.  Overdosed on seasoning, the prawns sat on top of garlic noodles.  The spillover of seasoning into the garlic noodles unassumingly enhanced the noodles.  The garlic noodles are good by themselves; the extra touch of seasoning really made the whole that much better.  If I go again, I'll pass on this one, but was decent. 

*Roast crab - Presentation is absolutely photogenic.  I'm talking about super model level.  The crab was very meaty and a nice size.  They really saved the best for last, as this was the last entrée to be served.  Cut down the middle with all the legs intact, the shell of the crab is ornamentally placed on top of the legs.  Their "garlic sauce and secret sauce" fully cooked into the crab meat and needless to say, I started to dip some noodles in the dressing.  It was good stuff.  To nitpick, freshness rating of the crab wasn't A+, rather an A-.    
 
*Steamed rice - That's how my dad rolls.  Can't go anywhere without it.  I had to add this one or it wouldn't be a complete review.  The white rice came in a bowl and tasted...rice-like.  My dad thoroughly enjoyed it with a big smile.

Thanh Long is an Americanized Vietnamese restaurant that is versatile enough to draw even the most Asian of Asians.  If you read the articles down the hallway to the restroom, there's a feel good story behind restaurant's owners (Remember that question about where the restrooms were?  Yeah...there was a line and I had some time to read.).  The main attraction is their crab and garlic noodles.  Get it, and be one of the daily 500!

excerpts: Soft, melt in your mouth shaken beef and the crab!
Ohhhh the crab!
I could eat here everyday!
shaken beef.author: Donnabelle C.
shaken beef.review: Best garlic noodle ever! Savory food! Soft, melt in your mouth shaken beef and the crab! Ohhhh the crab! I could eat here everyday!

excerpts: She was smitten with the garlic noodles, roasted crab and shaken beef, so I decided to give this well-reviewed place a try.
We ordered and our garlic noodles and crab came out almost immediately.
My dining companion and I are no strangers to crab so immediately we could taste the mediocrity of the over salted $40 crab.
The garlic noodles were fine, though a bit too dry.
We thought it a bit expensive  (at $9.50) for buttered Chinese style noodles.
The shaken beef came out much later than the other two dishes, but was very tasty!
Overall, 2.5 stars for the high prices and ridiculously over hyped crab/OK garlic noodles.
The shaken beef was a saving grace, though a smidge salty.
Glad
I went to check out the hype, but will not return in a hurry.
shaken beef.author: Angela L.
shaken beef.review:
I came here a few weeks ago on the recommendation of my friend who has lived down the block of Thanh Long her entire life. She was smitten with the garlic noodles, roasted crab and shaken beef, so I decided to give this well-reviewed place a try. 

We were seated immediately upon entering on a Saturday night as we had a reservation, and found the ambiance charming and romantic. I did think it an odd place to dress up since you would be eating the crab with your hands and you get plastic bibs... not some place I'd prefer to have a first date or anything (though the couple next to us seemed to be doing well on theirs). Our waitress was nice, though not was welcoming as some of the waiters who might have been associated with the family (?). We ordered and our garlic noodles and crab came out almost immediately. My dining companion and I are no strangers to crab so immediately we could taste the mediocrity of the over salted $40 crab. The garlic noodles were fine, though a bit too dry. We thought it a bit expensive  (at $9.50) for buttered Chinese style noodles. The shaken beef came out much later than the other two dishes, but was very tasty! It was over salted, as the theme seems to be here, but the beef was very tender. 

Overall, 2.5 stars for the high prices and ridiculously over hyped crab/OK garlic noodles. The shaken beef was a saving grace, though a smidge salty. Glad I went to check out the hype, but will not return in a hurry.

excerpts: Garlic noodles, shaken beef, crab and the tiger prawns!
Must orders!
Finding parking can be kinda crappy though, but not as bad as other parts in the city.
shaken beef.author: Michelle K.
shaken beef.review: Garlic noodles, shaken beef, crab and the tiger prawns!  Must orders!  Finding parking can be kinda crappy though, but not as bad as other parts in the city.

excerpts: The shaken beef is a delicious second entree to accompany the crab and the garlic noodles are top notch.
Everything else on the menu looked so good it was hard not to get everything.
We had some very tasty appetizers; especially the mussels which were rich and buttery.
From the moment we sat down to the minute we left, the service was top notch, fast and efficient, and never felt rushed.
This was by far one of our best meals and the best service we've had all year.
shaken beef.author: Ian S.
shaken beef.review:
Definitely get a reservation because this place is popular for a reason.  The crab is a must!  So absolutely delicious.  The shaken beef is a delicious second entree to accompany the crab and the garlic noodles are top notch.  Everything else on the menu looked so good it was hard not to get everything. We had some very tasty appetizers; especially the mussels which were rich and buttery. 
From the moment we sat down to the minute we left, the service was top notch, fast and efficient, and never felt rushed.  This was by far one of our best meals and the best service we've had all year.

excerpts: Shaken Beef: $25
shaken beef.author: apple p.
shaken beef.review:
Food:
Roast/Dranken Crab: $54 each.  This was a lot more expensive than last time I went.  Liked Roast better but greasy.  
Shaken Beef: $25  Tasty 
Dungeness crab puffs: $11 Very good but portion size was smaller than I expected.
Orange Sorbet: $8 Old and texture was weird (probably, it was kept in a freezer for more than half year).  Very disappointed.  
Fried Banana & Pineapple: $8 each  Awesome!  The batter was good : )

Interior:
Wait area couch: Nasty
Entrance door: Made a loud noise every time when closed.
Table: Okay
Bathroom: Good

I probably won't go back there for a while.

excerpts: The Buddha rolls were great, the shaken beef was my least favorite (but it was fine), and the vegetable/tofu entree was delicious!
Go early to avoid the rush, but don't go on Mondays because they're closed!
shaken beef.author: Katie V.
shaken beef.review: Now I realize why all of the Yelp photos are of garlic noodles and crabs - DELICIOUS!! I wasn't happy about them charging $12 for valet, until a server put a crab bib around my neck and served up some garlic/buttery crab and those melt in your mouth noodles!!! The Buddha rolls were great, the shaken beef was my least favorite (but it was fine), and the vegetable/tofu entree was delicious! Go early to avoid the rush, but don't go on Mondays because they're closed!

excerpts: Garlic noodle, roasted crab, shaken beef, are a must have.
No other restaurants have this kind of meal they have here.
So flavorful and cooked to perfection!
I am crazy about dungeness crab, I would say If you love dungeness crab and you're in San Francisco, you got to try this one the roasted crab.
Almost everybody trying to copy theirs.
shaken beef.author: Vischa S.
shaken beef.review:
Garlic noodle, roasted crab, shaken beef, are a must have.
No other restaurants have this kind of meal they have here.
So flavorful and cooked to perfection! I am crazy about dungeness crab, I would say If you love dungeness crab and you're in San Francisco, you got to try this one the roasted crab. Almost everybody trying to copy theirs.

excerpts: The highlights: Thanh Long Fish, Shaken Beef, and Drunken Crab.
The 50-50 risk:
Thanh Long Fish (red snapper) - 4/5.
Seasoned lightly to let the fish flavor show through and act as the hero of the dish.
Fished was cooked perfectly - just on the edge of being cooked / raw giving it a very smooth taste.
Shaken Beef - 4/5.
Cubes of New York strip steak cooked medium rare.
Drunken Crab - 4/5.
Cooked very well - crab meat retained its moisture.
In this case, the crab was just on the cusp of being dried out, an unfortunate followup of the perfectly cooked Drunken Crab.
shaken beef.author: Gabriel C.
shaken beef.review:
TLDR: 
The highlights: Thanh Long Fish, Shaken Beef, and Drunken Crab.
The 50-50 risk: Roast crab - risk the crab meat being overcooked.
The disappointment: Skip the stand-alone garlic noodle dish.

Thanh Long Fish (red snapper) - 4/5. Seasoned lightly to let the fish flavor show through and act as the hero of the dish. Fished was cooked perfectly - just on the edge of being cooked / raw giving it a very smooth taste. Garlic noodles included here, see review below.

Shaken Beef - 4/5. Cubes of New York strip steak cooked medium rare. Nailed the cooking method, but the seasoning was heavy handed and a tad heavy on the oil.

Drunken Crab - 4/5. Cooked very well - crab meat retained its moisture. Lightly seasoned to help the crab flavor shine.

Roast Crab - 2/5. A risk for roasting crab is overcooking, leaving the meat dry. In this case, the crab was just on the cusp of being dried out, an unfortunate followup of the perfectly cooked Drunken Crab. The seasoning was well done, so I suspect that if the crab was more moist this dish would definitely shine.

Garlic Noodles - 2/5. Although very highly rated, it was a complete miss. The dish was heavy on oil and the noodles were overcooked. Ideally, the noodles would be the hero of the dish, with a seasoning of garlic to help the noodles shine.

excerpts: As for the shaken beef, I am not a fan of it.
The beef was mixed in a bed of veggies and fried potatoes.
That was $25.
Service is quick and good.
Crab price is $50 .
It may still be worth a try for the curious ones.
shaken beef.author: Elly G.
shaken beef.review: We went here due to the positive reviews. I think that this restaurant  is overrated. Garlic noodles and roasted crab are good but nothing better than the other bay area restaurants serving almost the same dish. As for the shaken beef, I am not a fan of it. The beef was mixed in a bed of veggies and fried potatoes. That was $25. Service is quick and good. Crab price is $50 . It may still be worth a try for the curious ones.

excerpts: Our friend and his girlfriend ordered the roasted crab, garlic noodles and the shaken beef.
Skip the shaken beef.
Although it was tender, I've had better for a third of the price.
We had the lava chocolate cake and crème brûlée for dessert.
shaken beef.author: Michelle T.
shaken beef.review:
Food:  My husband ordered the highly recommended roasted crab while I ordered their tiger prawns over their infamous garlic noodles which is just enough for a serving for two.  The roasted crab did not disappoint.  It was very flavorful especially when you hit the notes of fresh cracked pepper.  A little heavy handed on the pepper, but I didn't mind.  Expect to fork over market value price and then some.  The garlic noodles were simple tasty yellow noodles, forgettable tiger prawns.  Our friend and his girlfriend ordered the roasted crab, garlic noodles and the shaken beef.  Skip the shaken beef.  Although it was tender, I've had better for a third of the price.  We had the lava chocolate cake and crème brûlée for dessert.  I would pass next time.  

Service:  It was impeccable.  Food was prompt.  Arrived within a few minutes after our order was placed.  Staff were very attentive.  

Ambiance:  Located in a quiet neighborhood.  Restaurant was dimly lit.  A lively bar and a quaint (tight) waiting area welcome guests.

excerpts: Ordered Thanh Long's highest recommended dishes for pick-up (garlic noodles, shaken beef etc.
shaken beef.author: Kevin G.
shaken beef.review:
Overdue review.

Ordered Thanh Long's highest recommended dishes for pick-up (garlic noodles, shaken beef etc. Arrived and was greeted by friendly staff, namely Will, settled up and was on my way.

Got home ~10 blocks away and discovered my order had been botched (favorably in terms of item count, just not what I had originally ordered). No big deal, things happen. Contacted the restaurant more just to provide an FYI (I really didn't want to leave the house again) and Will was super apologetic, offered to make it right, and bring my [corrected] order out to my car if I came back.

I agreed, hopped back in the car and headed back over. Will was ready and outside with my order, and, included some great samplers as well (calimari and others). 

The food tasted great, no doubt. But I wholly appreciate the team there going the distance to make sure I, as a customer, was satisfied with my experience. So, kudos - and thank you. I'll be back soon.

excerpts: Their bo luc lac (shaken beef) was ~$23---ummm
..it was good, but definitely not worth $23.
The most I've had for bo luc lac was around $10 (same meat).
So yeah..not worth it.
Make reservations or hope you don't have to wait too long (especially if you're with a big group)---we waited almost an hour for 4 people.
This place is packed!
shaken beef.author: Michelle H.
shaken beef.review: As you can see from the tons of photos and reviews---order the garlic crab ($40) and garlic noodles (forgot how much)!  Most popular items.  You can request extra butter as well.  It was pretty darn good.  Their bo luc lac (shaken beef) was ~$23---ummm..it was good, but definitely not worth $23.  The most I've had for bo luc lac was around $10 (same meat).  So yeah..not worth it.   Make reservations or hope you don't have to wait too long (especially if you're with a big group)---we waited almost an hour for 4 people.  This place is packed!

excerpts: Despite An's amazing crab and noodle dual performance, I advise against the Shaken Beef.
shaken beef.author: Nick W.
shaken beef.review:
It's pretty rare that I make my way all the out to this neck of the woods. That being said...

If you do see me here, you'll see a guy elbows propped and face-deep in a heaping portion of garlic noodles and shredding through crab like one ninja turtle menace. I'm not ashamed to say that I dragged my noodles through the pool of butter and black pepper resting at the bottom of the roasted crab plate completely ignoring trivial matters like high cholesterol or blood pressure.

Despite An's amazing crab and noodle dual performance, I advise against the Shaken Beef. For some reason, my mind kept thinking I was eating Lay's BBQ chips.

Come here for the 1-2 crab-noodle punch and then call it a night. :)

excerpts:
Items tried: 
Tiger prawn on garlic noodles
Drunken crab
Shaken beef

Known for their garlic noodles and crab, the place gets really busy even for late dinner.
shaken beef.author: Romella J.
shaken beef.review:
Items tried: 
Tiger prawn on garlic noodles
Drunken crab
Shaken beef

Known for their garlic noodles and crab, the place gets really busy even for late dinner. The noodles were cooked just right, not oily but garlicky. Garlic taste was not too intense. However, it got cold really fast. Also, I would recommend a strong drink to match it. 

Prawns were grilled and seasoned right. Large crab were fresh but was not as meaty. Beef was tender but well-flavored. 

Overall, I already recommended this place as a must try. 

Also same menu as Crustacean in the city.

excerpts: everything was really good, from the crabs (my uncle said the crabs are all soaked beforehand, so the shells were very soft and not at all hard to crack into!), garlic noodles, shaken beef, chicken, and vegetarian dishes.
the eggplant was good but extremely oily.
shaken beef.author: Sabrina L.
shaken beef.review:
Had a great experience here! Make sure you come early and make reservations -- the place was already crowded at 5:30 pm on a thursday night! we had reservations for our party of 10 and were seated upstairs. service was very fast -- we started receiving our food maybe ten minutes after ordering! everything was really good, from the crabs (my uncle said the crabs are all soaked beforehand, so the shells were very soft and not at all hard to crack into!), garlic noodles, shaken beef, chicken, and vegetarian dishes. the eggplant was good but extremely oily. the ambiance of the restaurant is also very nice and more upscale than i was expecting, and they even have a valet option for your car!

my only critiques are that there is a limited ways your crab can be prepared -- the original roast crab with pepper, the drunken crab, and the tamarind crab. i would have liked to try a garlic-prepared crab. their fryer was also broken that night, so we were unable to enjoy any fried bananas :(

overall very good experience! i would love to come back!

excerpts:
w/ An's garlic sauce & secret spices
Shaken Beef: tender cubes of marinated NY steak flambeed in Chardonnay served w/potatoes, mixed greens & cherry tomatoes
Garlic Noodles
Thanh Long Fish:
red snapper pan-broiled w/a dill-turmeric essence & red onions served w/garlic noodles
shaken beef.author: Kitty K.
shaken beef.review:
I went here several years ago (I know, I'm catching up on my reviews) for a birthday. We ordered the following:

Roasted Crab: whole Dungeness crab roasted w/ An's garlic sauce & secret spices
Shaken Beef: tender cubes of marinated NY steak flambeed in Chardonnay served w/potatoes, mixed greens & cherry tomatoes
Garlic Noodles
Thanh Long Fish: red snapper pan-broiled w/a dill-turmeric essence & red onions served w/garlic noodles

The food was good, but nothing spectacular. Service was barely even there. The crab was the best tasting dish, but I've had better. Since I've gone, no real need to go back.

excerpts: Shaken Beef (really good flavor, imo better than at the Slanted Door and cheaper.
however, they mix in potatoes pieces to trick you into thinking
there is more meat)
My favorite dishes were the shaken beef and garlic noodles, but this restaurant is worth a try for the crab.
We paid $57pp including tax and tip, which isn't bad at all, but we didn't get that much crab.
shaken beef.author: Amy D.
shaken beef.review:
Came in a group of 6 on a Saturday night, so we got to try a lot of dishes. Making reservations is definitely recommended, and parking in this area is tough- the $10 for valet is well spent. 

Ordered-
Salt & Pepper Calamari (nice and peppery, but calamari could've been a bit more crisp)
Dungeness Crab Puffs (good, but def not authentic)
Seafood Dumplings (only ok and 5 pieces- wouldn't recommend for the price)
Crispy Rice Paper Roll (too dry for me, I wouldn't order this again)
Curry Lotus Prawns (good taste but the "jumbo prawns" were teeny!)
Shaken Beef (really good flavor, imo better than at the Slanted Door and cheaper. however, they mix in potatoes pieces to trick you into thinking there is more meat)
Roast Crab (good, but wasn't super flavorful)
Tamarind Crab (wasn't very flavorful, but both crabs were cooked perfectly)
Garlic Noodles (good, but could've been more garlicky)
Fried Rice with Shrimp (your standard fried rice, I wouldn't order again)
Fried Banana & Fried Ice Cream (both were good but I like the banana a lot more)

Overall, the dinner was good, but not amazing. I actually liked the crab I ordered at Three Seasons better (taste wise). My favorite dishes were the shaken beef and garlic noodles, but this restaurant is worth a try for the crab. We paid $57pp including tax and tip, which isn't bad at all, but we didn't get that much crab.

excerpts: The shaken beef was delicious as well.
The chunks of beef were so tender.
Make sure to make a reservation.
The wait can get long around dinner time.
Good customer service.
I can't wait to go back.
shaken beef.author: Arielle D.
shaken beef.review: It's expensive but you get what you pay for. The food is astounding! Everything we ordered was delicious. This is my go to place in SF for delicious crab  and vietnamese food. I love seafood so I'm a fan of their roast crab, so buttery and tasty. The mixture of pepper, garlic and butter is so perfect. Roast Crab and garlic noodles is a perfect combo. The shaken beef was delicious as well. The chunks of beef were so tender. Make sure to make a reservation. The wait can get long around dinner time. Good customer service. I can't wait to go back.

excerpts: The shaken beef was a definite stand out dish.
shaken beef.author: Danielle G.
shaken beef.review:
I was finally able to knock this off my bookmarks list. We came on Jan 1 and the wait for a table of 6 was 30-45. I think if I would have had Thanh Long prior to PPQ and Crustacean I would be much more impressed. But I can't help but make comparisons. 

PPQ has the best value for the food. Thanh Long is definitely cheaper than Crustacean, but by no means a casual dining option. The roasted crab runs at market price and happened to be $40 on this particular night. 

As far as the garlic noodles, I have to rank Crustacean's as the best, PPQ in second and Thanh Long 3rd. However, that being said, all three are fantastic and worth a try.

Crustacean obviously wins in the ambiance category, but Thanh Long is a very nice, quaint place. I like that Thanh Long impresses and is appropriate from anything from a romantic date to a fun family dinner.  

Enough comparisons, let's talk about Thanh Long's food. The mango salad was a nice surprise. It was warm and I wasn't sure what to think about that, but it was good. Salt and pepper calamari was good, but kind of a dish you can find at many other restaurants. The spicy eggplant dish had good flavor and lots of vegetables. We had chicken fried rice (mostly for the baby) which was your typical chicken fried rice. The shaken beef was a definite stand out dish. It was super tender and the flavor was wonderful.

My only gripe about the crab was they didn't leave the shell with all the juices and good stuff. The shell was turned over and we had to dig around to find some fat (which of course is one of the best parts!).

By the way, skip the drinks here. They come in tiny glasses that are much overpriced. 

All in all I will probably stick with PPQ as my go to, but Thanh Long is definitely a good option for a special occasion.

excerpts: Calamari was ok, Shaken beef and crab were good.
shaken beef.author: Rebecca M.
shaken beef.review: Calamari was ok, Shaken beef and crab were good. Garlic noodles were cold. Wasn't as good as the last few times I've been there.

excerpts: We got the roasted crab as well as crab wontons, as well as garlic noodles and shaken beef.
(Why not stick with what the place is known for).
My view is that this place is definitely worth going for but best to stick with their specialities given the pricing - crab and garlic noodles.
If you want to get other things on the menu, there are cheaper equivalent options elsewhere.
shaken beef.author: Harper B.
shaken beef.review:
Fine - I'm hopping on the bandwagon here.

Read reviews before coming and my opinion is simple:  The prices are high, but the food is worth it - I wouldn't hesitate going again.

We got the roasted crab as well as crab wontons, as well as garlic noodles and shaken beef.  (Why not stick with what the place is known for).  All of the food was delicious, particularly the noodles and crab.

Service was prompt and friendly - no issues there.  They also had our reservation and immediately seated us upon arrival.

My view is that this place is definitely worth going for but best to stick with their specialities given the pricing - crab and garlic noodles.  If you want to get other things on the menu, there are cheaper equivalent options elsewhere.

excerpts: I tried the roasted crab, garlic noodles, shaken beef, fried rice, and vegetarian delight.
Everything just seemed so average, nothing special.
The crab was tasty, but because the shells weren't cracked, I had to work hard to get the meat out.
The garlic noodles were kind of dry, and the shaken beef was pretty tough.
I'm glad I tried this place out, but I probably won't be eating here again.
The garlic noodles were kind of dry, and the shaken beef was pretty tough.
I'm glad I tried this place out, but I probably won't be eating here again.
shaken beef.author: Rachel H.
shaken beef.review: I know I'm in the minority, but I really don't get what the hype is about. I think this place is overrated. I tried the roasted crab, garlic noodles, shaken beef, fried rice, and vegetarian delight. Everything just seemed so average, nothing special. The crab was tasty, but because the shells weren't cracked, I had to work hard to get the meat out. The garlic noodles were kind of dry, and the shaken beef was pretty tough. I'm glad I tried this place out, but I probably won't be eating here again.

excerpts: For those who don't want seafood the shaken beef is wonderful.
shaken beef.author: Tia L.
shaken beef.review: The garlic roasted crab is fresh and delicious. The sea bass is also a great option. For those who don't want seafood the shaken beef is wonderful. For appetizers the crab puffs and the mango salad is a great way to start out before you receive your entrees. The customer service is superb and the food is always good.

excerpts: Shaken beef:
wowowoowwoow such incredibly soft beef that it was amazing how soft it was the next day after it had been microwaved (yup all 3 dishes for 2 people can be a bit much haha).
shaken beef.author: Monika-Bianca T.
shaken beef.review:
Come here please.

The food: 5/5 - As a tourist visiting with my boyfriend, this place came up as a highly recommended not only by fellow yelpers, but from friends as well. Bejeezus... so good.

Roasted dungeness crab: Simple, but fantastic. It's so meaty, and the seasoning just topped it off with every bite. You'll have lotsa of fun scouring for the meat, and every bite will motivate you to keep at the cracking,  digging, and picking for even the tiniest bits and pieces between the shell :)

Shaken beef: wowowoowwoow such incredibly soft beef that it was amazing how soft it was the next day after it had been microwaved (yup all 3 dishes for 2 people can be a bit much haha). I especially enjoyed the fact that it had been served with a side of spring mix and tomatoes + potatoes which lightened up the entire dish and kept it level in all aspects of taste. 

Garlic noodles: I liked these, but they have been a bit dry for me? Not something I'd recommend ordering as a dish on its own, but to eat betweem bites of other mains like we did during our meal :)

Cost: 4/5 - you're going to have to expect to pay a premium here for not only their food but there service as well which was some of the best service I've had while visiting SF.

The service: 5.5/5 - (that score is not a mistake, the service here is that good) With a restaurant as packed as this was, we were still greeted with a smile by the front of house and quickly granted a seat for the two of us. Afterwards we were promptly attended too by a waiter who quickly took our order of drinks while we browsed the menu. We were able to flag him down as soon as we made up our and then barely into a full conversation with my boyfriend, all 3 dishes mentioned above appeared at our table! It was also very kind of our waiter to tie the plastic bibs around our neck as well. I found that I was never out of water, and that there was always a fresh bowl to be used to discard our shells. Empty plates were taken before we knew it and it was great that they had provided a personal shell cracker for each seat at the table already. The staff here is well trained and in numbers that are able to attend to all the patrons of the restaurant while providing a delightful experience where we didn't have to "understand" how busy they were. True class.

The ambience: 4/5 - Your typical family run asian restaurant! A welcoming place for families and adults alike. Sure the place can be renovated to feel more modern (feels alittle old), but as it stands right now, it's completely fine the way it is :)

If you would like to splurge on good eats, here is the place to do it.

excerpts: Three roasted crabs, 3 orders of garlic noodles, 2 orders of shaken beef and a large order of FOODCOMA!?!?!?!
shaken beef.author: Patricia G.
shaken beef.review:
Never a disappointment, EVER.

Kept it simple for a party of 7 last night - dinner for my uncle arriving from the motherland.

Three roasted crabs, 3 orders of garlic noodles, 2 orders of shaken beef and a large order of FOODCOMA!?!?!?!  DE-FREAKING-LICIOUS.

Parking is a royal pain in the ass that's for sure and they rape you for valet ($12).... 

Worth every penny... :)

excerpts: Shaken Beef? - the beef was perfectly cooked but the sauce made the whole dish too sweet!
shaken beef.author: Nawee S.
shaken beef.review:
Roast crab good - tasty and not too dry. 
Shaken Beef? - the beef was perfectly cooked but the sauce made the whole dish too sweet!
Garlic noodles - felt too cheezy

excerpts: The shaken beef is made with filet mignon!
shaken beef.author: Anthony N.
shaken beef.review:
Vietnamese cuisine at its finest. Thanh long is my go to restaurant when I'm in San Francisco. The garlic noodles are to die for. The shaken beef is made with filet mignon! And my all time favorite has to be the Tamrind crab! 

Definitely a great place for date night and special occasions. Parking is tough but the dining experience is well worth the patience. 

5 stars without a doubt!

excerpts: We also had the shaken beef med-rare, that was decent as well..
shaken beef.author: Art L.
shaken beef.review: Roasted Crab was fantastic and the garlic noodles is of course a must try. We also had the shaken beef med-rare, that was decent as well..

excerpts: And still ordering the Shaken Beef when my taste buds call for it.
shaken beef.author: Ninja H.
shaken beef.review:
Still come for my crab fix when I can't order it from Mom, but I don't know if I've just been coming too often or if the crab quality really has gone down.  Like I said, still incredibly delish but something's a lil off...idk!

I've been more than my share of times but thought my most recent trip about a week after crab season started would've been the best visit.  Sadly, it was the same crab quality as when it wasn't crab season. Hmmm...

Well, it won't sway me!  I'm still gettin down and messy in the Roasted Crab garlic butter...and a nice stiff drink!  And still ordering the Shaken Beef when my taste buds call for it.  

During my visits, I've also tried the Seabass, Drunken Crab, Tamarind Crab, Mussels, Salt & Pepper Calamari, Garlic Noodles, and the Traditional Vietnamese Salad.  I'm still not a fan of the Drunken Crab, Tamarind Crab, or the Garlic Noodles, but all the others were pretty good.

Still recommend to others, and will still continue to patronize when Mom's kitchen's out of crustacean! ;0)

excerpts: the shaken beef that everyone seems to rave about is nothing special in my opinion.
i think newport seafood in LA has better french style beef.
shaken beef.author: Heejin L.
shaken beef.review:
it's been so long since i've been to crustaceans, so i can't really compare.
but their garlic noodles are delicious. the shaken beef that everyone seems to rave about is nothing special in my opinion. i think newport seafood in LA has better french style beef.
the drunken grab was yummy, but i love all kinds of crab, prepared any which way.
ordered two orders of garlic noodles because the server couldn't really recommend anything better.

1 crab, 2 orders of garlic noodles, 1 beef for about 90$ excluding tip.
glad we made reservations because there was a lot of people waiting.
the area seems shady to me, just because i saw there were many loiterers across the street at the 7-11.

excerpts: The third time we ordered roast crab, garlic noodles, shaken beef and mussels.
shaken beef.author: Ren A.
shaken beef.review: This visit was our third.  The first time tasting the roast crab and garlic noodles was amazing.  The second time we had both dishes again and splurged and got the shrimp toast appetizer.  Again an amazing meal.  The third time we ordered roast crab, garlic noodles, shaken beef and mussels.  The garlic noodles were great as were the mussels.  The roast crab however was completely disappointing.  It tasted over cooked and very rubbery, as if it was sitting in the pot too long.  While we enjoyed the mussels, it was not our first choice as they were out of the shrimp toast.  They were also out of Jasmin tea (??).  Not sure how you run out of tea.  The service was very good.  Or waiter was patient (maybe because he had to tell us they were out of items was wanted) and they cleared empty dishes quickly from the table.  The water service was prompt (maybe because we weren't drinking tea).  We want to chalk it up to going on a Tuesday night, but that's not a good excuse for running out of items or over cooked crab at market prices.

excerpts:
The crab is amazing, best shaken beef ever.
Also, the cocktails are great along with the apps. 
Can't go wrong with anything here...
shaken beef.author: F.f. Durst D.
shaken beef.review:
LOVE!!!!!!! Ahh, the garlic noodles- best in the city
The crab is amazing, best shaken beef ever.
Also, the cocktails are great along with the apps. 
Can't go wrong with anything here...

excerpts: The Garlic Crab, Garlic noodles, & Shaken Beef are all AMAZING!
The crab is always perfectly drenched in buttered garlic.
The beef is so soft & tender it pretty much melts in your mouth.
A lot of places try and duplicate their noodles but whatever the "secret ingredient" is makes theirs the best garlic noodles in the Bay!
shaken beef.author: Melanie P.
shaken beef.review: If you like garlic & butter, you will LOVE this place!  It's definitely pricey BUT so worth it!!  The Garlic Crab, Garlic noodles, & Shaken Beef are all AMAZING!  The crab is always perfectly drenched in buttered garlic.  The beef is so soft & tender it pretty much melts in your mouth.  A lot of places try and duplicate their noodles but whatever the "secret ingredient" is makes theirs the best garlic noodles in the Bay!

excerpts: Do go for the shaken beef.
shaken beef.author: Vanessa K.
shaken beef.review:
Definitely the roast crab any other crab is not worth your time and money. The garlic noodles are good, but not as orgasmic as everyone describes it to be. They are garlicky, but I didn't like the choice of noodles, I'm sure there are better options out there.  Appetizers are good (stay away from dumplings, better at Kingdom of Dumpling) but expensive for the price. Stuffed squid was surprisingly delish! The calamari/squid was cooked perfectly, there was a crunch and not chewy at all. Great tomato sauce flavor and the stuffing was simple yet balanced. 

Stay AWAY from the saigon beef, worse dish ever! Do go for the shaken beef.

Desserts are nothing to wow about - creme brulee, fried banana with ice cream and molten chocolate cake. Pretty standard.

excerpts: The shaken beef here is just off in so many ways.
The meat quality is good but the flavor is nothing like how the traditional shaken beef should be.
The iced coffee was too sweet.
shaken beef.author: Lien H.
shaken beef.review:
First off I would make a reservation because it's always packed for dinner. Arrive at least 10-15 minutes ahead of time to find parking unless you're willing to fork over $12 for valet parking.  

My friend and I went here for dinner last week on a weekday and the wait was super long, good thing we made reservation.  I heard so many good things about this place so I decided to give it a shot since I was in the area.  

Pros: Excellent service and the setting was nice.  The garlic crab is honestly the only thing worth getting on the menu. The crab was roasted in garlic, salt and pepper. It was fresh and melts in your mount but I wouldn't come back for it. 

Cons: Everything was overpriced and parking is difficult.  The shaken beef here is just off in so many ways.  The meat quality is good but the flavor is nothing like how the traditional shaken beef should be.  The iced coffee was too sweet.  You can't really taste the coffee in it. 

It was a good experience due to the service but I wouldn't come back here for the food.

excerpts: 1 Salt and Pepper Calamari + 2 Roast Crabs + 2 Garlic Noodles + 1 Shaken Beef + 1 Fried Banana
shaken beef.author: Samantha L.
shaken beef.review:
My family and i made reservations for 4  for a sunday night.  As usual, it took us a while to find parking.. and had to make several rounds. But Thanh Long has a valet service right out front if you don't want to go looking for your own space. I'm not sure where they park the cars though. Down by the beach?!

The moment you walk in you smell the amazing aroma from all the highly seasoned dishes!  You may dress anywhere from casual - dressy. There really is no dress code here.

Salt and pepper calamari: definitely a lot of salt and pepper. i'm not too big of a fan of calamari but it came out nice and hot. i was really waiting for the crab though..

Roast crab + garlic noodles: WOWOWOW! I like wearing the bibs they give us =) makes me feel like i can dig in properly. BRING GUM. the garlic is strongggggg.

Fried Banana a la mode: the  vanilla bean ice cream is just sooo good with the fried banana. The banana is warm and oozing deliciousness. Get a spoonful with a little bit of ice cream and a bit of the frozen banana = heaven.

1 Salt and Pepper Calamari + 2 Roast Crabs + 2 Garlic Noodles + 1 Shaken Beef + 1 Fried Banana a la mode= $148 + tax and tip

I left so full that i fell asleep when i got home. Uh yeah, i ate that much..

excerpts: The Shaken beef is utterly ridiculous.
shaken beef.author: Nick J.
shaken beef.review:
Have been to Thanh Long many times over the years and each time it is better than the last. Obviously the reason to go there is the crab, and it IS fantastic. Probably one of the best preparations of crab I have ever had. Granted, you will waft garlic from every pore for the next 3 days, but it is TOTALLY worth it, especially if you love Garlic.

All the other dishes I have had their are fantastic as well. The Shaken beef is utterly ridiculous.

Highly recommend, it's a very unique and wonderful restaurant!

excerpts: I did recently try the shaken beef, which was absolutely delicious.
shaken beef.author: Jeani L.
shaken beef.review:
I know. I know. I'm not going to say anything new. All the other reviewers before me have already pointed out the obvious. This. Place. Is. Good. I always always always get the roasted crab. I've had friends try the other varieties, such as the drunken crab, and it's good, but there's a reason they're FAMOUS for their roasted crab. And frankly, I'm not one to rock the boat when it comes to sticking to what I know won't disappoint. 

They're actually the sister restaurant to Crustacean. I believe both are owned by the same family, and it's apparent in their cuisine. The decor differs a bit. Thanh Long is just a tad less pomp and circumstance than its counterpart, but the food and service are just as good. I did recently try the shaken beef, which was absolutely delicious. Tender, juicy, and wonderfully flavorful, it's a tad sweet and perfect with rice, it would be a good alternative if you're allergic to seafood or just not in the mood for crab (for shame). 

Overall, the roasted crab and garlic noodles just can't be beat when you're eating here. I would, however, say that both dishes are drenched in oil, so you should consider that it's not the most ideal place to eat if you happen to be trying to lose weight. But if you're like me, which means either you're on a diet and you have no self control OR anything delicious does not count as something "bad for you" in your book, then seriously get your butt over there and eat to your heart's content. I mean, honestly, it's well worth it. Delicious crab, great service, AND a plastic disposable bib? Uhhhh... YES PLEASE.

excerpts: We also tried the shaken beef, buddha roll (vegetarian spring rolls), mussels on a crostini (tender, flavorful and succulent), salt and pepper fried calamari (tender), and stir fried green beans.
shaken beef.author: Jeannie C.
shaken beef.review:
Buttery garlicky goodness of noodles and their roast crab...ENOUGH said! I really felt like garlic was coming out of my pores after the dinner.

We also tried the shaken beef, buddha roll (vegetarian spring rolls), mussels on a crostini (tender, flavorful and succulent), salt and pepper fried calamari (tender), and stir fried green beans.

The service was attentive and friendly. If you have the money to splurge, love garlic and don't mind butter, and especially love to eat crab, give this place a try. I have tried Crustaceans and AnQui but this place will always be my favorite.

excerpts: Other noteworthy dishes I've tried and loved: Shrimp Toast, Shaken Beef, and Colossal Royal Tiger Prawns.
shaken beef.author: Judy C.
shaken beef.review:
My all-time favorite San Francisco restaurant is situated right here in Outer Sunset.  Thang Long, known for their French-inspired Vietnamese cuisine, serves some of the BEST garlic crabs and BEST garlic noodles.

Once in awhile I get to splurge here, and luckily for my birthday -- my thoughtful friends brought me here to celebrate.  Together, we shared:

* Salmon Carpaccio: My favorite appetizer from Thanh Long!  The lemon-cured salmon was perfectly marinated and not at all "fishy."
* Salt & Pepper Calamari: Calamari usually all tastes the same at different restaurants.  However, here, they go easy on the batter and oil to give an overall light taste.
* Mango Salad: This is was my least favorite dish.  Warm mango slices and seafood on top of cold salad is not appetizing whatsoever. 
* Roast Crab & Garlic Noodles: If you love overdosing on garlic and butter, you will love the crab and garlic noodles here.  Their infamous secret sauce really makes Thanh Long what they are. 

Other noteworthy dishes I've tried and loved: Shrimp Toast, Shaken Beef, and Colossal Royal Tiger Prawns. 

Love, love, love.

excerpts: Can't vouch for the crab (i'm allergic), but the garlic noodles and shaken beef are both well seasoned and delish.
I'm officially a fan of this place!
shaken beef.author: Krystal C.
shaken beef.review: We've been back several times since my last review.  I have to say, service never dissapoints! The staff is quick, on point and accommodating. Parking is hit or miss, but they offer valet for $12. Crab / Garlic noodles is their business and they do it well! Can't vouch for the crab (i'm allergic), but the garlic noodles and shaken beef are both well seasoned and delish. I'm officially a fan of this place!

excerpts:
Garlic noodles - delicious
Shaken beef - a bit pricey for the lack of beef
Sea Bass
shaken beef.author: Albert L.
shaken beef.review:
Came here for my birthday dinner with my family.  I was able to get reservations a few days in advance.  Parking wasn't as bad as people made it out to be.  I was able to find parking about 2 blocks away.  Was seated about 10 minutes after checking in with our entire party.

Ordered (main courses 2 stars)
VIetnamese Salad - fresh 
Beef Satay - nothing out of the ordinary
Roast Crab - came out cold
Garlic noodles - delicious
Shaken beef - a bit pricey for the lack of beef
Sea Bass - it had good flavor to it and was not over cooked

Desserts (5 stars)
Banana cake - delicious
Chocolate lava cake - melted in your mouth, not too heavy

When we got home, I had to drink a bottle of water because of all the MSG.  -1 star

Overall, I'm not sure we would come back here as the crab was not extraordinary.  I've had better crab in Singapore and Boiling crab.  It's pretty expensive for what it is.  It is aight and would recommend everyone to try it once.

excerpts: SHAKEN BEEF is a must to order.
shaken beef.author: Nina T.
shaken beef.review:
Service was decent enough. SHAKEN BEEF is a must to order.

But over all, WAY too expensive for the quality.

excerpts: Crab, noodles, spicy eggplant, shaken beef, asparagus, salt pepper squid, Vietnamese salad.
shaken beef.author: Ron L.
shaken beef.review:
It's already been said!

Crab, noodles, spicy eggplant, shaken beef, asparagus, salt pepper squid, Vietnamese salad.

I really don't get the hype on the garlic noodles, but even after I had them at Crustacean, I just had to give it a second chance.  Next time maybe I'll do rice instead, as it goes good with the crab fat.  Next time I'll also skip the squid, as it was more pepper and a bit soggy for me.

Crab does live up to the hype.  Splurge and get one for each person, and walk it off after dinner.  I'll be back for sure.

excerpts: Shaken Beef, Fried Calamari, Banana Cake, and Fried Pineapple.
Well, as Porky Pig would say, "That's all folks!"
This is one of those "will try soon" spots for me.
My friend from the 808 chose this restaurant for a weekday dinner.
He'd been to Crustaceans, but, after a horrendous service experience, insisted on trying this, the original location.
For me, the crab (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/z9CN58fSrA46ggyb6OnCnQ?select=XofCPzceEnZS1dKdCvP5iQ) rates a 3.5 star as I'm not a huge black pepper and butter fan.
The waiter recommended the Shaken Beef (stir

fried Filet Mignon cubes, fried potato cubes, and onions on a bed of lettuce, garnished with halved cherry tomatoes) cooked medium, but, preferring a more tender texture, we requested medium rare (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/z9CN58fSrA46ggyb6OnCnQ?select=AJoZPi_TbmkRazShdSX5FQ).
This was my favorite of the meal.

The desserts were also okay as the Banana cake tasted like a bread pudding (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/z9CN58fSrA46ggyb6OnCnQ?select=ph8LCE3wLbB9GsbhrolD8A) while the Fried Pineapple reminded me of sweet, Fried Onion Rings (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/z9CN58fSrA46ggyb6OnCnQ?select=BiEG4_CWYHz0aYTCPqPgmg).
My friend also had a mission of delivering two roasted crabs back to Oahu a few days later.
Asking the waiter for his advice and the reheating details, my friend successfully completed his task with flying colors.
The greeter, the waiter, and the busboy were very amicable and gave us an "at home" feeling while we were here.
The water and iced tea glasses were constantly filled and empty plates quickly removed.
Having a 6 pm reservation, we also secured a parking space 0.5 block away.
There is valet parking available for $10.00.
The food rates 3 stars in my book, but the service and atmosphere boosted it up 1 additional star.
shaken beef.author: Mike C.
shaken beef.review:
Roasted Crab.  Need I say more?  Garlic noodles.  Not enough?  Shaken Beef, Fried Calamari, Banana Cake, and Fried Pineapple.  Well, as Porky Pig would say, "That's all folks!"  This is one of those "will try soon" spots for me.  My friend from the 808 chose this restaurant for a weekday dinner.  He'd been to Crustaceans, but, after a horrendous service experience, insisted on trying this, the original location.  
For me, the crab (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/z9CN58fSrA46ggyb6OnCnQ?select=XofCPzceEnZS1dKdCvP5iQ) rates a 3.5 star as I'm not a huge black pepper and butter fan.  The crab is fresh and meaty while the garlic noodles are a great accompaniment to this dish; the noodles were a bit on the sticky/starchy side (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/z9CN58fSrA46ggyb6OnCnQ?select=UVMpGevOAtNkI5csC8LdpQ).  My friend even ordered an extra container of the garlic butter sauce for dipping (later taking the rest home).  The Fried Calamari appetizer came hot, but the flavor was okay... nothing spectacular (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/z9CN58fSrA46ggyb6OnCnQ?select=CLaIPDlObi1_v5ACPPQ1NA).  The waiter recommended the Shaken Beef (stir fried Filet Mignon cubes, fried potato cubes, and onions on a bed of lettuce, garnished with halved cherry tomatoes) cooked medium, but, preferring a more tender texture, we requested medium rare (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/z9CN58fSrA46ggyb6OnCnQ?select=AJoZPi_TbmkRazShdSX5FQ).  This was my favorite of the meal.  The desserts were also okay as the Banana cake tasted like a bread pudding (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/z9CN58fSrA46ggyb6OnCnQ?select=ph8LCE3wLbB9GsbhrolD8A) while the Fried Pineapple reminded me of sweet, Fried Onion Rings (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/z9CN58fSrA46ggyb6OnCnQ?select=BiEG4_CWYHz0aYTCPqPgmg).  
My friend also had a mission of delivering two roasted crabs back to Oahu a few days later.  Asking the waiter for his advice and the reheating details, my friend successfully completed his task with flying colors.  The greeter, the waiter, and the busboy were very amicable and gave us an "at home" feeling while we were here.  The water and iced tea glasses were constantly filled and empty plates quickly removed.  Having a 6 pm reservation, we also secured a parking space 0.5 block away.  There is valet parking available for $10.00.  The food rates 3 stars in my book, but the service and atmosphere boosted it up 1 additional star.

excerpts: Shaken Beef - HOLY MOLEY DELICIOUS - Meat was SO tender
shaken beef.author: Cat G.
shaken beef.review:
My brother and sisters decided to come here for Mother's Day. I called on the Thursday before to make a reservation, made it for 5:30pm on Mother's Day. Perfect. They called on Saturday to confirm, awesome. They reminded me to make sure everyone was on time because we wouldn't be sat until our entire party was there. 

Typical of our family, one of my siblings was running late - therefore they wouldn't seat us. My Mom was mad and irritated because to her it didn't make sense because we knew what they wanted to order. After practically yelling at the hostess, they still didn't seat us - I was embarassed. The hostess remained calm and tried to explain to my Mom why they wouldn't seat us. I used to work in the restaurant industry and I know why they won't sit full parties - it puts their entire reservation schedule off track - if two people of a seven party table is late, it extends their duration at the table once the two LATE people do get there, and causes the table who will be using that table next a delay, and so forth throughout the evening. 

30 minutes after our reservation time, my late sibling and her guest arrived, I kindly let the hostess know that we were finally all there, she told me that the only table available that sits 7 is currently paying and as soon as they leave, she'd be able to sit us - this was "the best that she could do at this time." - I thanked her nicely and proceeded to apologize for my mom's reaction and that I understand why they couldn't seat us. 

5 minutes later - she came to me and said that she had another table available and we could be seated right away. While following her she told me that she appreciated my apology and to enjoy my meal. 

Food: 
Dungeness Crab Puffs - delicious - a great appetizer for a larger group, there were 6 in one serving. 

Salt & Pepper Calamari - a little too much salt on this one, still good though!  Next time we'll try the Grilled Calamari 

Shaken Beef - HOLY MOLEY DELICIOUS - Meat was SO tender and so flavorful - definitely recommend this. 

Siagon Beef - Not my favorite - the rest of my family like this but unfortunately this dish did NOT please my taste buds - I felt as though maybe the ingredients were way above my appreciation but it tasted too bitter for me. 

Drunken Crab - this was delicious - a whole crab, dunked in a secret sauce of Chardonney... 

Roasted Crab - this was EVEN better than the Drunken Crab - amazing. 

Garlic Noodles - MUST HAVE AT THE TABLE. These are the staple dish of every visit, in my opinion. 

I really like this place - I've had the Garlic Noodles before on their An The Go mobile food truck. Definitely will come back here. 

PS. Parking is a pain - but they do offer Valet for $12.00 - valet guys are funny.

excerpts: The must-try items are obviously the roast crab, garlic noodles, and shaken beef.
For some appetizers, I'd recommend the tiger prawns, mussels, and salt & pepper calamari.
shaken beef.author: Ryan L.
shaken beef.review: I haven't eaten here in a few years (probably like.. '09) but I must say that they have maintained their quality. I made a reservation and had to change it right beforehand and it was no problem with the staff. Everything on the menu is probably very tasty and rich in flavor. The must-try items are obviously the roast crab, garlic noodles, and shaken beef. For some appetizers, I'd recommend the tiger prawns, mussels, and salt & pepper calamari. The mango salad was good but I'm not a fan of warm/sweet salads. The service was a bit slow but other than that, I would definitely recommend you try this place out.

excerpts: I shared one crab with the Hub and could only poke at the Shaken Beef.
There's at least one stick of butter in there.
Fried ice cream was more like a donut with ice cream in the middle but who's complaining?
shaken beef.author: East West Coast Girl C.
shaken beef.review:
Yelpers, I went to Thanh Long on your recommendation.

I can never consider a crab the same way again. What can I say that hasn't been said about the roasted crab?  Garlicky, buttery, peppery deliciousness. I shared one crab with the Hub and could only poke at the Shaken Beef. There's at least one stick of butter in there. Fried ice cream was more like a donut with ice cream in the middle but who's complaining? Food came out fast and furiously. 

They make one of the best Mai Tais around. I'd make the trek to this funky 'hood in the name of a big, garlicky meal again.

excerpts: Tried the roasted crab (the original goodness), and drunken crab (very juicy), shaken beef (pretty good), mussels (plump and tasty), and the chicken satay (ok) for appetizers.
shaken beef.author: Lawrence L.
shaken beef.review:
Delicious dungeness crab served here everytime!  It's been over 10 years since I have been here, and a few things have changed: they now have valet parking, the menu has more options...  But the crab and garlic noodles are always awesome.

Tried the roasted crab (the original goodness), and drunken crab (very juicy), shaken beef (pretty good), mussels (plump and tasty), and the chicken satay (ok) for appetizers.  Ended the night off with fried ice cream, which the kids devoured!

Definitely recommend coming here to satisfy your crab cravings...

excerpts: Second time, I got shaken beef and garlic noodles to go.
A little pricy for a dinner, but I made it into like 2 or 3 meals.
shaken beef.author: Nina Y.
shaken beef.review:
So weird that I didn't review this place after the first time I came. I live right by this place.

First time, it was some special occasion, ordered the crab, garlic noodles so delicious. It was quite a mess, but my boyfriend and I enjoy being together and if it meant being messy, so be it.

Second time, I got shaken beef and garlic noodles to go. A little pricy for a dinner, but I made it into like 2 or 3 meals. Definitely really good. 

romantic ambiance with dimmed lighting, but there are still families which makes it a little more casual.

excerpts: The Shaken Beef was good.
It is New York steak cut into small cubes marinated in a very yummy sauce, served with the mixed greens, cherry tomatoes and potatoes.
This was my favorite.
Why?
I didn't have to cut through cow hide to get to my meat.
shaken beef.author: Thy L.
shaken beef.review:
Does anyone else think classy Vietnamese restaurant is an oxymoron? Maybe it's just me. This sounds awful, but I like my Chinese, Vietnamese and Thai food in dingy restaurants. It gives the illusion that you're actually in that country eating! :X 

Anyway, this is my second time eating this. The first time, I had it at PPQ. I ordered the roasted crab,which was tossed in garlic sauce and some kind of secret spices (according to the menu). I think my biggest problem with the idea of Asian crabs is, you cook the entire thing, shell included, how are the sauces/spices suppose to get to the meat? I end up having plain crab meat that I have to dip into the sauce. Fail! Garlic noodles were good, but a bit too oily for me.The Shaken Beef was good. It is New York steak cut into small cubes marinated in a very yummy sauce, served with the mixed greens, cherry tomatoes and potatoes. This was my favorite. Why? I didn't have to cut through cow hide to get to my meat. Plus, I love potatoes!

The restaurant was good, but I don't think I'm going to come again. I'm going to stay away from crabs unless someone takes the meat out for me :)

excerpts: I've also tried the Shaken Beef which is tender cubes of marinated new york steak flambeed in chardonnay, served with potatoes, mixed green and cherry tomatoes.
shaken beef.author: Steven O.
shaken beef.review: Thanh Long! What can I say? This place is on my top lists for garlic noodles. The dungeness crab is delicious and just right. The garlic noodles is what separates this place from other places who serve garlic noodles. I've come here just to buy the garlic noodles. It's that good! Me and my cousins had a seafood night and I bought 6 orders of the garlic noodles. It's a good place to celebrate anniversaries or a birthday for 2. I've also tried the Shaken Beef which is tender cubes of marinated new york steak flambeed in chardonnay, served with potatoes, mixed green and cherry tomatoes. The beef was good and I recommend it to anyone who loves meat or wants to try something else at Thanh long besides the garlic noodles and crab. Parking is hard to find. This place is located in the sunset district. Make reservations if you can or come by early before people start to show up. If you want the more upscale restaurant, go and visit Crustaceans which is owned by the same owners. It's pretty much the same menu but more on the upscale side.

excerpts: Our waitress suggested Shaken Beef, we turned it down because it was salty, overcooked and dried the last time we ordered, a year ago.
shaken beef.author: SF F.
shaken beef.review:
We picked this place because I need to get my crab fixed!  That's right, not caffeine, CRAB!

Roasted crab:  Very Tasty but quite salty IMO.  And very pricy, one crab for $45 bucks. But my son loved it.  

Our waitress suggested Shaken Beef, we turned it down because it was salty, overcooked and dried the last time we ordered, a year ago.

Mango salad:  Did I say salad?  It came stir fried Mango.  What is going on?

Garlic noodle:  Bland.  Noodle are over cooked so it broke into pieces.  It is not even noodle, more like a long strand of penne pasta without the whole in between.  My teenage son said you made better garlic noodle, mom!

Village's favorite:  Overcooked pork and shrimp.  Dried and salty.

Fried banana:  Most doughy fried banana I have ever eaten in my life.  It is more of a fried doughnut IMO.

excerpts: We share garlic noodles, the shaken beef, and salt and pepper calamari.
It was a little pricey, but so worth it.
Everything was so flavorful
and I don't know...
shaken beef.author: Patricia Q.
shaken beef.review:
I went to dinner at Thanh Long with my boyfriend Friday night...Kind of a strange place for me to go considering that I am allergic to seafood. But hey, we made it work.

We share garlic noodles, the shaken beef, and salt and pepper calamari. It was a little pricey, but so worth it. Everything was so flavorful and I don't know...damn good? 

I think people in the know make the trek out to Thanh Long for the crabs, but the non-seafood items are great too FYI for people who are allergic to seafood like me.

Will definitely come back again whenever the boyfriend and I feel like treating ourselves after a long week of work. Great date spot, nice interior, fast service, and delicious food. Parking can be a bit of a nightmare in this area sometimes, but that pretty much goes with living in SF.

excerpts: Tiger prawns over garlic noodles was really good so was the shaken beef.
All the seafood dishes tasted really fresh.
shaken beef.author: Mandeep G.
shaken beef.review: Tiger prawns over garlic noodles was really good so was the shaken beef. All the seafood dishes tasted really fresh. Have to try the Drunken crab next time.  Smart to have a reservation beforehand it gets really crowded in here.

excerpts: the dungeness crab makes your mouth water, the garlic noodles goes well with it, but my favorite is the SHAKEN BEEF!
it was so tender, it melts in your mouth.
shaken beef.author: Kurt N.
shaken beef.review: went here for my 6 year anniversary and it was great.  parking is hard to find, expensive valet parking, and the restaurant setting is not the best.  HOWEVER, the food makes up for it.  the dungeness crab makes your mouth water, the garlic noodles goes well with it, but my favorite is the SHAKEN BEEF! it was so tender, it melts in your mouth.

excerpts: I always like ordering the Roasted Crab, Garlic Noodles, Salt and Pepper Calamari and the Shaken Beef - All my Faves!
shaken beef.author: Jennifer N.
shaken beef.review:
This is byfar one of my top 5 places to eat!  Their dining area is simple yet classy and everything I order is always made perfect, just how I expected.

Every Birthday or get together Event held here has always been accommodated with no issues whatsoever.  The Service is always great.

I always like ordering the Roasted Crab, Garlic Noodles, Salt and Pepper Calamari and the Shaken Beef - All my Faves!  The price is worth spending because the serving is just perfect and they are all flavor filled.

Definitely Recommended!!

excerpts: We ordered their Roasted Crab, Garlic Noodle, and their Shaken Beef.
They gave us bibs to wear so we won't dirty our shirts.
Oh man,  their Garlic Noodle is SOOOOOO GOOOOD!
I don't know how else to say it.
SO FREAKIN' GOOOOOD!
LOL.
Place is a bit pricey, but dude, totally worth it!
shaken beef.author: Thao A.
shaken beef.review:
I don't think I'd have to say much since 600+ yelpers already said all of the nice & great things about this place. 

It was my first time in San Francisco & my boyfriend and I really wanted some Vietnamese food. Right when we got to Frisco, he turned over to me and said, "babe, yelp up some good Vietnamese place!" LOL, we're such yelp whores :) Sadly, it was Monday, so we had to wait to go eat the next day because they're not open on Mondays. 

This is place is hella nice. The food is great and the service is also great. We ordered their Roasted Crab, Garlic Noodle, and their Shaken Beef. They gave us bibs to wear so we won't dirty our shirts. Oh man,  their Garlic Noodle is SOOOOOO GOOOOD! I don't know how else to say it. SO FREAKIN' GOOOOOD! LOL. Place is a bit pricey, but dude, totally worth it!

excerpts: We also got the shaken beef
but I could have done without it.
I've tried better versions of the vietnamese "bo luc lac".
shaken beef.author: Raquel C.
shaken beef.review:
My boyfriend and I came to Thanh Long to celebrate Valentine's day. We got the roasted garlic crab and trust me, this is the best crab I ever had and I'm a crab aficionado. I think it's even better than the crab at R&G lounge. My mouth is watering just thinking about the buttery goodness. YUMM! 

We also got the shaken beef but I could have done without it. I've tried better versions of the vietnamese "bo luc lac". But be sure to get the garlic noodles! The flavor reminds me of little caesar's crazy bread but still definitely tasty!

Also, make sure to make a reservation or easily you can be waiting for an hour+

excerpts: While the Shaken Beef was pretty tasty, there were only several pieces, and twice the amount of potatoes.
shaken beef.author: Karen L.
shaken beef.review:
I was excited to try this since people were saying how good it was, however, it's not that good.  We got the Boiled and the Drunken crab, and I wouldn't have known the crab was drunken if it weren't for the different coloring of the crab and the saltiness.  While the Shaken Beef was pretty tasty, there were only several pieces, and twice the amount of potatoes.  Garlic noodles wasn't great either.  The only great dish we had that was really good was the grilled calamari, it was delicious.
Walking away from a restaurant still hungry after a big bill is not a good thing.  Compared to PPQ, Thanh Long loses by price, taste, and quantity.  However, their setting and service is much better than PPQ.

excerpts: And since not everyone in my family is as big of a fan of crab as I am, we also ordered a combo fried rice and their shaken beef.
The rice knocked it out of the park; the shaken beef - not so much.
shaken beef.author: Roxane W.
shaken beef.review:
Thanh Long was a great experience for my family and I. Yes, it's pricey. At $38 per crab, you have to be prepared to spend a large sum - but I think it's worth it. Luckily, we made reservations. I would recommend you do the same.. The front area was constantly packed during our meal.  We shared the salmon carpaccio to start, which was delicious. The spring rolls were good too, but nothing special. 

The waiter was kind enough to let us know that we could easily share crab (instead of ordering one per person) and share the noodles. Both were very, very good. Definitely the best items on their menu. And since not everyone in my family is as big of a fan of crab as I am, we also ordered a combo fried rice and their shaken beef.  The rice knocked it out of the park; the shaken beef - not so much. It was a bit rubbery and much too sweet.

Overall, a great experience at a high cost.

excerpts: Roast Garlic Crab, Garlic Noodles, Shaken Beef, nice bottle of wine, handsome date.
Garlic noodles were the perfect partner to the crab and highly recommended!
shaken beef.author: Sarah A.
shaken beef.review:
Roast Garlic Crab, Garlic Noodles, Shaken Beef, nice bottle of wine, handsome date. All checks!

Definitely a place to check out at some point- especially during crab season. Crab was delicious and fresh and had just the right amount of extra seasonings and flavor. Garlic noodles were the perfect partner to the crab and highly recommended!

excerpts: Also ordered the garlic noodles and shaken beef, both of which were just sublime.
I particularly liked the depth of flavors in the shaken beef.
This dish is complex, and oh so pleasing to the palate.
I cannot recommend this restaurant highly enough.
Amazing food, really friendly, attentive and knowledgeable service, solid wine list (always a plus for me).
One of my favorite restaurants in California.
shaken beef.author: Orlando G.
shaken beef.review: Came here with my wife on our anniversary.  This is the perfect place to celebrate ANYTHING, or just to come for an amazing meal anytime!!  It is a little pricey, but very much worth it.  We ordered the whole Dungeness crab in An's special pepper/garlic/butter sauce.  To DIE for.  Also ordered the garlic noodles and shaken beef, both of which were just sublime.  I particularly liked the depth of flavors in the shaken beef.  This dish is complex, and oh so pleasing to the palate.  I cannot recommend this restaurant highly enough.  Amazing food, really friendly, attentive and knowledgeable service, solid wine list (always a plus for me).  One of my favorite restaurants in California.

excerpts: The Shaken Beef though.
Wow.
So tender.
Just simply the best Shaken Beef I've ever had.
I'll come here again for this.
shaken beef.author: Norman P.
shaken beef.review:
Garlic Noodles are so-so. Its more like garlic pasta. Not really asian or vietnamese. But it does go well with the crab.

The roasted crab is very peppery. I do have to say that somehow the meat stays together in more solid chunks than when I've cooked it at home. 1 crab would be good enough to share between 2 people as long as you order another main or a few appetizers.

The Shaken Beef though. Wow. So tender. Just simply the best Shaken Beef I've ever had. I'll come here again for this. And its cheaper than the crab.

Parking is a pain, so you might want to factor in/come mentally prepared to valet your car. I hate valeting my car, so I end up driving around in circles til I find a spot in this crowded residential neighborhood.

excerpts: The shaken beef was a huge disappointment.
The entire bottom of the plate was covered in chopped romaine lettuce, but was hidden under beef, giving the impression that the plate was full of beef.
In addition, there were ample chopped potatoes sauteed to LOOK like beef.
shaken beef.author: Tiffany L.
shaken beef.review:
I rarely ever Yelp because, let's face it, unless it's a meal I'd have for my last supper, or it's absolutely atrocious, I'm too darn lazy! But the mediocre, overpriced food at Thanh Long has beat out my laziness.

I used to eat at Thanh Long as a child and absolutely LOVED it. We had reservations for 4 for my brother's birthday dinner two nights ago, and needless to say, I will NEVER return! The food was comparable to a buffet in Reno. 

Garlic Noodles were lacking. It didn't taste anything of fresh garlic. Instead, the noodles were soggy and overcooked, with the flavor of garlic salt.

Mango salad was probably the only tolerable dish we had that night. The vinaigrette was light and sweet, but the portion was pretty small.

The shaken beef was a huge disappointment. The entire bottom of the plate was covered in chopped romaine lettuce, but was hidden under beef, giving the impression that the plate was full of beef. In addition, there were ample chopped potatoes sauteed to LOOK like beef. There were maybe a total of 9 piece of actual beef on the plate, for about $20-$25. 

The sea bass was absolutely bland. It was cooked with no seasoning, AT ALL. The saving grace for this dish was the accompanying sauce on the side, which had a slight sweet, citrus flavor to it. For $25, the serving of sea bass is smaller than the average portion for one person. There was ONE bok choy cut into thirds on the side of this dish. I'm pretty sure bok choy i s$0.79/lb at the supermarket. If you're gonna skimp on the portion of the fish, you could at least use more than one bok choy.

Thanh Long has always had a special place in my heart for their crab. No more. The roast crab we ordered came out lukewarm. This would've been tolerable had the crab actually had flavor. It looked like it was covered in black pepper, but had no taste at all = pre-ground black pepper. I RARELY use salt to cook, and my usual complaint when I eat out is that the food is too salty. This crab didn't have even a pinch of salt in it! They used to use so much butter in their sauce that when it cooled, the bottom of the dish would be covered in coagulated butter. Not anymore. 

I cannot remember the last time I had a meal so disappointing. PPQ on Clement is WAY better, and I will never again patron Thanh Long!

excerpts: Shaken Beef.
the shaken beef...
*drool.
Its a prime cut of meat sautéd w/ a sauce that makes this dish DELISH.
You will usually see the shaken beef dish in higher-end Vietnamese restaurants, and Thanh Long's Vietnamese influence mos def shines through with this dish.
Although a bit pricey ($20 at the time of review), its a trete de force for the red meat enthusiast.
shaken beef.author: Ed P.
shaken beef.review:
While everyone writes and sings praise over how good the food is here, I am going to do the complete OPPOSITE!  No, not really. This place is great. The locals know it. Tourists may end up at Crustaceans (Thanh Longs' downtown SF location), instead of the original location - but one truth remains the same: the food is good.

Now we all know that the garlic noodles are Gewd. We all know that the Roasted Crab is GEWD! But what about the rest of the menu? I have this firm belief that if you deem a restaurant a good place to eat, and I mean OHSOGOOD to eat, its menu HAS to be delicious. Its what keeps us coming back, right? So into my foray into the deeper regions of the menu I found: Shaken Beef.

Now coming to Thanh Long, the goto items are naturally the crab and garlic noodles, but if you accompany your meal w/ the shaken beef...*drool. Its a prime cut of meat sautéd w/ a sauce that makes this dish DELISH. You will usually see the shaken beef dish in higher-end Vietnamese restaurants, and Thanh Long's Vietnamese influence mos def shines through with this dish. Although a bit pricey ($20 at the time of review), its a trete de force for the red meat enthusiast.

excerpts: The coconut prawns, satays, salt pepper calamari, and shaken beef are worth trying.
shaken beef.author: Jermaine R.
shaken beef.review:
I love Dungeness crab. I know it's a lot of work cracking the shells, but it's just soooo satisfying when you chuck out a savory nugget of meat from a chunky claw. It's like discovering buried treasure. I've tried all three of their crab dishes: roast, drunken, and tamarind. They're all amazing, but I like the tamarind the best because it has the most flavor.

If you're not a crab fan, the other dishes are also pretty amazing. The garlic noodles are always a must-order. The coconut prawns, satays, salt pepper calamari, and shaken beef are worth trying.

Their service is spot on. If you have crab, they'll put the bib on for you and regularly take away the empty shells. The only drawbacks for this place are It's not cheap and parking is a pain. Otherwise, I'd order a 10 course crab meal and spend half a day just cracking legs.

excerpts: But if you must, order the shaken beef.
shaken beef.author: R C.
shaken beef.review:
