Thanh LONG is short for Me Love You LONG Time! 

"What should I order?" 
-- Order the roasted crab!!! Don't bother with the drunken crab.
"But we're really hungry and we need another one, can't I order the drunken crab for variety?" 
-- NO! Order ANOTHER roasted crab!!!!
"But we're really hungry and we have a large group, maybe someone in the group will like the drunken crab?" 
--NO! They'll like the roasted crab more!!! But if you must, order the shaken beef.

excerpts: Garlic noodles, roasted crab, shaken beef and asparagus crab soup!
Man, I can just lick the whole crab
cause it has so much flavor!
That pepper is sooooo good!
Even brought my parents here who are really picky eaters and don't like to eat at fancy restaurants - but they love it here!
Can even take home leftovers and still it taste fresh.
When feeling in the mood for crab and garlic noodles, this is the first place that comes to mind.
shaken beef.author: Nicole M.
shaken beef.review: Garlic noodles, roasted crab, shaken beef and asparagus crab soup!  Man, I can just lick the whole crab cause it has so much flavor!  That pepper is sooooo good! Even brought my parents here who are really picky eaters and don't like to eat at fancy restaurants - but they love it here! Can even take home leftovers and still it taste fresh.  When feeling in the mood for crab and garlic noodles, this is the first place that comes to mind.

excerpts: We also shared a plate of Shaken Beef, 2 plates of Garlic Noodles and 1 plate of seasonal vegetables.
Everything was very good.
The crab was messy but tasty
but I especially liked the Shaken Beef.
Very sweet and tasty, similar to the Mongolian Beef at PF Chang's which
I LOVE.
I even liked the garlic noodles.
shaken beef.author: Darien G.
shaken beef.review:
We took my wife's mother here for dinner last Saturday night for Mother's Day.  This was my first time at Thanh Long, but I have eaten at Crustacean's before which I am told is owned by the same people.  I don't know much about Vietnamese food, other than Pho so I was a bit surprised that a restaurant known for crab was a Vietnamese place.  I never knew that crab was such a staple of the Vietnamese diet, but the An's can cook the hell out of a crab!

There were 4 of us so we split 2 crab, 1 roasted crab and 1 drunken crab.  We also shared a plate of Shaken Beef, 2 plates of Garlic Noodles and 1 plate of seasonal vegetables.  Everything was very good.  The crab was messy but tasty but I especially liked the Shaken Beef.  Very sweet and tasty, similar to the Mongolian Beef at PF Chang's which I LOVE.  I even liked the garlic noodles.

The only downside was the price of the crab, $40 each!!!! Yikes.  It felt like getting robbed without a gun.  But what are you gonna do?  I guess that's the market price for crab these days.

excerpts: Instead, I found myself thankful that we ordered the Shaken Beef (of course only after I got over my outrage at the crack price of the dish..
$23 for beef wtf?!).
shaken beef.author: Spring L.
shaken beef.review:
I must admit that I'm a lazy person. This is unfortunate when I eat crab because after the first couple of pieces I move onto something easier to eat. Despite the raving review on their Roast Crab... I didn't find it amazing enough for me to work past the second piece. 

Instead, I found myself thankful that we ordered the Shaken Beef (of course only after I got over my outrage at the crack price of the dish.. $23 for beef wtf?!).  
I also found myself wishing that they offered de-shelling services because the garlic noodles would have been that much more amazing if it had chunks of crab in it. Why couldn't I have done that myself and mixed it together after, you ask? Because my crab eating skills are so poor that I usually lose 30 percent of the meat in the shell and by the time I'm done getting the 70 percent out of the shell it is usually mangled and cold. And at that time I feel that I deserve to eat that tiny bite of meat that I so desperately pried out of the unforgiving shell.

-____-  I once said I loved interactive dining in another review but this is my breaking point.

excerpts: We ordered the garlic noodles and shaken beef and lots of people say it was the best shaken beef they ever had.
The beef was very succulent and full of juice -- perfecto!
Garlic noodles are not bad, but it just goes really well with the crab.
shaken beef.author: Emily C.
shaken beef.review:
The food is amazing. Although the neighborhood was not great and parking was hard to find, it was definitely worth the trek out here. 

The roast crab is sublime. The crab was very well seasoned with pepper and garlic and I love how it was dunked in buttery goodness. Maybe that's what makes the crab taste so good. We ordered the garlic noodles and shaken beef and lots of people say it was the best shaken beef they ever had. The beef was very succulent and full of juice -- perfecto! Garlic noodles are not bad, but it just goes really well with the crab.

As for dessert, I highly recommend finishing off with the fried ice cream. It's pretty big so you can split it with two or three people. Basically it's ice cream encased in sweet yummy fried dough. 

I don't know if this is a great date place, because you guys will end up smelling like garlic (might kill the romance), but it's definitely a good place to go with friends!

excerpts: We started with the rolls for appetizers, mango salad, then shaken beef & Colossal Royal Tiger prawns with garlic noodles.
Everything was excellent!
The service was great as well, and we even had children with us who were well cared for by the staff.
Will definitely be back!
shaken beef.author: Steven B.
shaken beef.review: A friend invited us to join them for dinner...this is one of the best Vietnamese restaurants in SF.  We started with the rolls for appetizers, mango salad, then shaken beef & Colossal Royal Tiger prawns with garlic noodles.  Everything was excellent!  The service was great as well, and we even had children with us who were well cared for by the staff.  Will definitely be back!

excerpts: Pepper crab, shaken beef (very unique texture).
Not many has mentioned about the dessert, so if you love banana pudding/pie try their banana desert with ice cream.
It's fabulous.
We loved it -- Unlike any other places we tried.
We ordered 3 entrees (skipped appetizers), two drinks and a dessert and two coffees.
Bill including tip was $185.
So you get the picture.
All worth it from our experience.
shaken beef.author: Tony P.
shaken beef.review: I think everyone else said it all.   We made a excellent decision going here.   Garlic noodles obviously fantastic.  Pepper crab, shaken beef (very unique texture).    Not many has mentioned about the dessert, so if you love banana pudding/pie try their banana desert with ice cream.  It's fabulous.  We loved it -- Unlike any other places we tried.   We ordered 3 entrees (skipped appetizers), two drinks and a dessert and two coffees.   Bill including tip was $185.  So you get the picture.   All worth it from our experience.

excerpts: Must oder roasted crab n garlic noodles everytime, salt&pepper calamari n shaken beef r delicious n yummy!
And my favor Creme brulee, i think its the best in sf for me.
of coz plus a bottle of white wine, the whole dinner is perfect!
Never get tired of these food.
shaken beef.author: Sanly L.
shaken beef.review:
One of my regular restaurant. Must oder roasted crab n garlic noodles everytime, salt&pepper calamari n shaken beef r delicious n yummy! And my favor Creme brulee, i think its the best in sf for me.  of coz plus a bottle of white wine, the whole dinner is perfect! 
Never get tired of these food.

excerpts: We had the roasted crab, garlic noodles, shaken beef, and an order of rice.
I always need my rice when I eat crab!
The food was really tasty as usual, and I left feeling very satisfied.
shaken beef.author: Libby L.
shaken beef.review:
I was craving some crab so my BF took me here Friday night.  It was crazy packed, and we didn't make a reservation so we waited by the bar.  I tried one of their signature cocktails that had midori in it, but it tasted like cough syup.  Blech.   The next drink I tried was their pineapple lychee vodka infusion drink and that was deleesh!!!   

A drunken urine smelling homeless man wandered in and made his way up to the bar.  He was muttering animatedly and everyone quickly scattered away from the bar to avoid him.  To my surprise, none of the staff asked him to leave.  

We had the roasted crab, garlic noodles, shaken beef, and an order of rice.  I always need my rice when I eat crab!   The food was really tasty as usual, and I left feeling very satisfied.

excerpts: We also got the shaken beef, which is beef marinaded in a sweet, salty sauce served with vegetables.
It was very tender.
The meat was cooked perfectly.
The vegetables complimented the meat very well.
But, the fried potatoes were a bit weird.
shaken beef.author: Andrew W.
shaken beef.review:
This place serves some very incredible food and some very good food, but it is very pricey.  For $38 dollars, you get one crab in a variety of styles.  The best here is the roasted crab.  It is delightfully buttery and peppery.  The sauce is so good, it inspired my sister to toss her entire bowl of rice into what was essentially a whole lot of crab flavored butter.  Calories be damned.  So, this dish was good.

I was less impressed by the drunken crab.  It was a little on the bland side.  I was expecting a bit more flavor, but the broth was kind of dull and watery.  It could have used a lot more flavor.  The crab was fresh, so it wasn't all bad.

We also got the shaken beef, which is beef marinaded in a sweet, salty sauce served with vegetables.  It was very tender.  The meat was cooked perfectly.  The vegetables complimented the meat very well.  But, the fried potatoes were a bit weird.  I would get this dish again.

The other good thing here is the garlic noodles.  FYI, it tastes like it has some fish sauce or oyster sauce or crab broth in it.  So, if you are vegetarian beware.  The presentation is really poor.  They come out looking like very ordinary tan noodles.  But, the flavor is salty and sweet with a nice garlic flavor.  It is a bit more on the sweeter side than I expected.  But, it was very good.

We also had the boulliabaisse, the salmon carpaccio, the soft shell crabs, the mixed seasonal vegetables and the sea bass.  The soft shell crabs are a definite miss.  They lacked seasoning.  The batter was not that crispy.  It was a below average dish.

The boulliabaisse was a nice fish broth with vegetables floating in it and some rock shrimp that were cooked well.  It was ok.  Just think Tom Yum soup.  Nothing really special.

The salmon carpaccio was tasty.  The shallots added a nice contrast to the sweet salmon.  But, the portion was very small.

The mixed seasonal vegetables were well cooked, but ultimately they were just roasted vegetables.  Nothing special.

Finally, the sea bass was a little overcooked.  The sauce was nice and mild.  It was ok.  But, nothing special.  It came with some vegetables in a light sauce.  

I also had a mixed drink.  It was a bit on the sweet side.  FYI, the food here is not spicy, so fruity drinks do not pair well.  It is better to go with one of the dry white wines.  For a Vietnamese place, they don't use a lot of sour flavors, so the dry wine brings a little acidity to the food and makes the flavors come out.

The dessert menu was not very exciting.  Deep fried banana, chocolate molten cake.  All the standard stuff.  Nothing unusual or complicated.  We skipped it.

The service was typical for an Asian restaurant.  Not very attentive.  But, everyone was well dressed.

The atmosphere is clean and surprisingly modern inside.  Outside, it looks like a dumpy Chinese restaurant in the Sunset.  But, there are some nice silks and figurines decorating the interior of the restaurant.  This is a good place for a special occasion meal or for a date although the clientele is a bit on the older side (mid to late 40s).  So, it is not exactly hip.  But, your date will appreciate the decor and the high quality food.

A word about parking.  Come early.  Parking in the Sunset is horrible.  You might have to walk a few blocks.  Our reservations were for 6 and we had to walk 2 blocks.  If you eat around 7, be prepared for a hike.  They have valet car service.  So, you have that option.

excerpts: but I personally like their shaken beef better.
It was with vege salad
w/ New York steak strips.
It was refreshing and yummy.
I also like their banana cake w/ vanilla ice cream.
You will leave this place with full and satisfied belly.
shaken beef.author: Jennifer P.
shaken beef.review: Other than having to wait, this place is great. Next time I have to remember to make resevation. Everyone already commented on their delicious garlic noodles w/ tiger prawns but I personally like their shaken beef better. It was with vege salad w/ New York steak strips. It was refreshing and yummy. I also like their banana cake w/ vanilla ice cream. You will leave this place with full and satisfied belly.

excerpts: Shaken beef was awesome.
Shaken beef was awesome.
shaken beef.author: Mike H.
shaken beef.review:
Shaken beef was awesome. The garlic noodles are good too and definitely worth the price considering.  The crab was decent although I've had better, and cheaper. The calamari was awesome but the lava cake was way overpriced but tasted great.  Overall it was pretty decent but pricey.

Shaken beef was awesome. The garlic noodles are good too and definitely worth the price considering.  The crab was decent although I've had better, and cheaper. The calamari was awesome but the lava cake was way overpriced but tasted great.  Overall it was pretty decent but pricey.

excerpts: Five spiced chicken that was overly sweet; dry beef for shaken beef that was $21.95; greasy garlic noodles for $10 and not very fresh crabs for $38 a piece.
At these prices, I would expect at least 3 stars for the food.
shaken beef.author: Vitamin C.
shaken beef.review:
For once, Yelp has let me down. 4 stars based on 900+ reviews???? WHAT? Well, perhaps I went to the wrong Thanh Long...

I found the dishes to be extremely overpriced. Five spiced chicken that was overly sweet; dry beef for shaken beef that was $21.95; greasy garlic noodles for $10 and not very fresh crabs for $38 a piece. At these prices, I would expect at least 3 stars for the food. I was sorely disappointed 

Service was just so-so. Thanh Long is a wannabe upscale restaurant that was not very upscale and the food was very mediocre... NEXT!

excerpts: I always have the garlic crab, but have also tried the shaken beef salad, and garlic noodles, both of which were great.
shaken beef.author: Bernard N.
shaken beef.review:
Whenever I'm in San Francisco, I always make sure to visit Thanh Long, home of the best dungeness crab in the world!

Same owners as Crustaceans, Thanh Long is their first restaurant.  Located in the hood (Judah Street) with valet parking, this restaurant is always busy, and with good reason.  I always have the garlic crab, but have also tried the shaken beef salad, and garlic noodles, both of which were great.

My crab during this visit was huge.. over 2 lbs.  Must be a good crab season in the Bay Area, as all 5 crabs that we ordered were of similar size.  A little bit pricey at $38, it was well worth it!

The only rule we have at the table is NO TALKING.  If you talk (and take too much time), the butter will turn cold . .and who wants to eat great crab with cold butter, LOL.

I've been coming here for over 10 years and will continue to enjoy their crab for years to come!

excerpts: Roasted crab, shaken beef and garlic noodles!
So good.
Pricey, but it was good.
shaken beef.author: Cristie S.
shaken beef.review: Roasted crab, shaken beef and garlic noodles! So good. Pricey, but it was good.

excerpts:
Ordered the roasted crab, prawn with garlic noodles and shaken beef.

Garlic noodles - errr... overhyped I feel, and you don't feel too good after eating this as it really tastes like it was cooked with loads of butter and lard.

Shaken beef - not too bad but nothing spectacular.
shaken beef.author: Rossini P.
shaken beef.review:
Maybe I came here with too high expectations.  I actually want to give it 3.5 stars but can't figure out how to do it.

Ordered the roasted crab, prawn with garlic noodles and shaken beef.

Roasted crab - tasted plain at first but it GROWS on you.  So by the end of it, you actually want more!!!  Very good.

Garlic noodles - errr... overhyped I feel, and you don't feel too good after eating this as it really tastes like it was cooked with loads of butter and lard.

Prawns that were on top of the garlic weren't good at all.  Roasted too dry and the edges were burnt and they actually scratched my throat when I ate them.

Shaken beef - not too bad but nothing spectacular.

The restaurant was really packed.  Also, it had a sort of funky smell like carpet thats been damp and not dried for a long time...

Also was a little shocked at the bill which was over $100 when we ordered sort of the same stuff at R&G (crab, veggies, rice, beef) and it cost us both $90

On a side note, the valet guy was really nice :-)

excerpts:
Shaken Beef ~
tender cubes of marinated new york steak flambeed in chardonnay, served with potatoes,
shaken beef.author: Oliver D.
shaken beef.review:
I've heard so many good reviews on this place and had to check it out for myself! 

I'm a HUGE fan of sea food especially CRAB and I heard this place had the best roasted crab in San Francisco, so I had to get my 'YELP FACE' on and see what the hype was all about!

As I walked into the restaurant i was impressed! The exterior of Thanh  Long looks like a 'hole in a wall' establishment, but i was proven wrong. It's really cozy and professional. 

I suggest you make reservations if you decide to come with a party of 4 or more. It can get busy on the weekend.

Since this place is kinda pricey, its recommended that you skip out on the appetizers; to be honest, they are over-rated, tiny and over priced! Just get down to the nitty gritty and order the main dishes....

Here are my recommendations:

1.  Thanh Long Spicy Eggplant ~
sauteed with jumbo prawns, chicken, fresh basil, baby corn, shitake mushrooms and fiery red chillies in a tamarind and chilli-soya

2. Shaken Beef ~
tender cubes of marinated new york steak flambeed in chardonnay, served with potatoes, mixed green and cherry tomatoes

3. Colossal Royal Tiger Prawns ~
butterflied and grilled with secret spices, served on a bed of garlic noodles

4. Roast Crab ~
a whole dungeness crab roasted with thanh's garlic sauce and secret spices


NOTE: The spices used in their food are really intense, so if you don't like the after taste of garlic and spices in your mouth, then the majority of the food isn't for you.....but who doesn't like INTENSE SPICES! haha

The portion size of each dish is some what small so try to diversify your choices and order smart....


Much LOVE and eats!

excerpts: On top of the that...the shaken beef and the Vietnamese salad.
Yum!
shaken beef.author: Dimps I.
shaken beef.review:
One of my all time favorite restaurant.  I can't get enough of their garlic noodles, crab, and colossal royal tiger prawns.  On top of the that...the shaken beef and the Vietnamese salad.  Yum!  Best garlic noodles I've ever had and believe me...I've tried many.

I love you Thanh Long!

excerpts: Shaken Beef, it was okay, didn't like it as much as other reviews.
shaken beef.author: Tom P.
shaken beef.review:
Had the crab. Awesome. There was flavor in every bite of the crab and it was very meaty.

Garlic Noodles, flavorful, almost overpowering but didn't, did it's job.

Shaken Beef, it was okay, didn't like it as much as other reviews.

Eggplant/Chicken - very delicious

Sea Bass - great complimentary sauce for it

of course, a bit on the expensive side but worth it.

excerpts: Get the crag,garlic noodles, shaken beef and Salt N Pepper Calimari.
shaken beef.author: Ro M.
shaken beef.review:
Great place when you wanna spend a little money and be a little fancy and have garlic on your breath and in your pores for at least 3 days.

It's a great place for a date or a birthday group outting.Get the crag,garlic noodles, shaken beef and Salt N Pepper Calimari.

Be prepared to find parking.It gets hard here sometimes.

excerpts: Then the main meal: Shaken beef, tender and succulent in its not-too-sweet sauce with a surprisingly perfect compliment of potatoes.
Spicy eggplant, just spicy/savory enough to let the eggplant shine through.
Seasonal vegetables:
mostly sugar snap peas, lots of mushrooms, absolutely wonderful.
Now mind you
I don't like mushrooms as a rule
but I would have been happy to scarf these down anytime.
shaken beef.author: John Z.
shaken beef.review:
File this review under the "interesting" or "odd" folders at your discretion ... but I may be the only reviewer of Thanh Long who didn't have the crab or garlic noodles. 

All the more reason to go back. The place is great, the meal the most memorable I've had in months.

To begin with: a full bar, which was nice for us martini-files. Began the meal with two starters:  the seafood dumplings and the shrimp toast. The dumplings: pleasant, light, delicate. More a tease than filling, but a nice tease.  The shrimp toast:  wow.  I've had countless versions as an former ny-er but this was a whole new trip. Lighter but still flavorful -- on slices of biegnet, a nice tip of the hat to the French influence of Vietnamese food.

Then the main meal: Shaken beef, tender and succulent in its not-too-sweet sauce with a surprisingly perfect compliment of potatoes. Spicy eggplant, just spicy/savory enough to let the eggplant shine through.  Seasonal vegetables: mostly sugar snap peas, lots of mushrooms, absolutely wonderful. Now mind you I don't like mushrooms as a rule but I would have been happy to scarf these down anytime. Garlic rice: just pungent enough, wonderfully textured and sticky, enhanced all the other dishes.

Yes a little on the pricey side... and valet service is ten bucks, not five (thankfully we got street parking). Service was gentle and professional.

I relished every bite and look forward to returning to see about those crabs and garlic noodles.

excerpts: Shaken beef, dungeonous crab, and garlic noodles are some of the things you'll be seeing on the menu.
shaken beef.author: Linh P.
shaken beef.review:
Thanh Long is one of my FAVORITE restaurants. Although I admit, it is a bit pricey, the quality of the food and the excellent service keeps me coming back. 

Even though the restaurant's name clearly shows that its a Vietnamese restaurant, I have to say, the food isn't quite Vietnamese. Its more Vietnamese fusion, or Vietnamese inspired. They do not serve Pho or Bun or anything like that. Shaken beef, dungeonous crab, and garlic noodles are some of the things you'll be seeing on the menu. 

The food is REALLY good, but the service that you'll be getting is TO DIE FOR. I am very picky about restaurant service, especially if I'm paying for a $100+ meal. But with this kind of service, it makes me not feel so bad spending so much money on some food. 

If youre looking for some place to take your date, or just feel like eating a nice dinner, you definately should eat here. Its casual dresss, so you dont have to worry about looking all fancy, theres a full bar, and the food is amazing. 5 stars from me.

excerpts: We also tried the shaken beef dish, and it was pretty delicious as well.
Very tender, juicy, and well-seasoned beef.
Juiciness/tenderness is often a factor that goes wrong in this dish at many restaurants, because if you pan-saute small cubes of meat, they often get dry and stringy.
No such problem here!
If you have any people in your company who don't like crab or seafood, there are many options, including the shaken beef, available for delicious dining besides crab.
shaken beef.author: Anh D.
shaken beef.review:
Roasted crab and garlic noodles. 

The garlic noodles are amazing. The sauce on them is something miraculous -- very salty and savory (defines quintessential umami). 

Crab is their specialty. You want to try a crab dish when you're here. They only have three kinds of crab: Drunken crab (white wine sauce/cooking liquid), tamarind crab, and roasted crab (We've tried both the tamarind crab and the roasted crab (butter and garlic sauce). 

The tamarind crab was okay, but the tamarind sauce was good but so overpowering compared to the delicate taste of the crab meat. You can't even taste the crab with the tamarind sauce laced throughout this dish. It is so tangy, sweet, and sour. It was good for the first few bites, but I couldn't eat much  of this. 

The roasted crab, however, was divine. Garlic and butter -- what could be better? Not much more to be said than that. The crab meat was very light and tasted fresh. Very rich, though, from the butter and garlic so definitely not something to eat too regularly. 

We also tried the shaken beef dish, and it was pretty delicious as well. Very tender, juicy, and well-seasoned beef. Juiciness/tenderness is often a factor that goes wrong in this dish at many restaurants, because if you pan-saute small cubes of meat, they often get dry and stringy. No such problem here! If you have any people in your company who don't like crab or seafood, there are many options, including the shaken beef, available for delicious dining besides crab. 

The calamari appetizer is something else that we've had here, and it's delicious as well. 

Great food, okay prices (crab dishes are all "market price"), and a great spot in the city. You will have to get valet parking unless you want to walk a couple blocks, so bring cash!

excerpts: We had a couple crabs, some garlic noodles and the shaken beef.
shaken beef.author: Ryan B.
shaken beef.review:
I was visiting family for the week. They are new to the area and it was my first time in the city. We found Thanh Long on Yelp and went for it since it was nearby. We had a couple crabs, some garlic noodles and the shaken beef. It was all great!

I recommend it and will be a returning customer the next time I'm in the city.

excerpts:
Shaken Beef - tender cubes of marinated New York steak flambeed in Chardonnay served with potatoes, mixed greens & cherry tomatoes; delicious in flavor with fork tender beef; the greens I could do without as it seemed more a "salad" than an entree

6.
shaken beef.author: Beth W.
shaken beef.review:
We came here for a special family celebration and it was our first time dining here as well.

The food ordered for our dinner comprised of the following:

1. Salt & Pepper Calamari - delicious except for the simple overdose of coarsely ground black pepper; will definitely tell them next time to adjust the black pepper with a lighter touch

2. Mango Salad - fresh mango fruit sauteed with bell peppers, seared scallops & shrimp over mixed greens in a raspberry vinaigrette - this would make for an excellent  meal on it's own; the raspberry vinaigrette nicely tied the various flavors together effortlessly

3. Thanh Long Spicy Eggplant - eggplant sauteed with jumbo prawns, chicken, fresh basil, baby corn, shitake mushrooms, & red chilies in a tamarind & chili-soya; I like spicy but it was on the low end of the spicy spectrum on this dinner outing though the overall flavors were good ~ will order it again but tell the server to make it spicier

4. Villager's Favorite - Pacific prawns & pork medallions simmered in a caramelized reduction of soy and herbs; I liked this dish enough that I would order it again; a nice take on a "surf and turf" with pork instead of beef for the "turf" portion

5. Shaken Beef - tender cubes of marinated New York steak flambeed in Chardonnay served with potatoes, mixed greens & cherry tomatoes; delicious in flavor with fork tender beef; the greens I could do without as it seemed more a "salad" than an entree

6. Vegetarian Delight - silken tofu sauteed with asst. vegetables & shitake mushrooms; a standout as I love tofu and veggies!

7. Roast Crab - a whole Dungeness crab roasted with An's garlic sauce & secret spices in the Secret Kitchen; regardless of what others may say, this in of itself is a delectable Dungeness crab entree!  Yes it's messy but who cares?  The flavors marry very well and our entire party enjoyed this dish.

8. Garlic Noodles - An's famous noodles made with their secret garlic sauce (perhaps the one used on the Roast Crab?) & secret spices; this noodle dish is good when hot but at room temperature or worse, cold, it's not that good (something coagulates on the noodles when it's cold...butter perhaps?)

Despite the large amounts ordered per item, we had lots of left overs (crab included) for our party of 18.  Would I go back to this spot?  You betcha!  I want to try the Tamarind Crab - "simmered in a melange of Roma tomatoes & tamarind, seasoned with fresh dill & green onions & flambeed with cognac."  The ingredients for this dish make me salivate just thinking about it.

There is a full bar in case you want a drink while you wait and/or with your meal.  Two of us ordered the Fleur de Mango - pureed fresh mango, Malibu rum, a banana rum and freshly squeezed orange juice to the mix - this was the fave drink of the evening!  
 
While parking is an issue, it's located in a neighborhood folks, get there early so that you can look for parking or just valet your car.  I would also suggest booking a reservation so that you are amongst the first seating for the evening.  Overall, the service was excellent/attentive and the food was delicious.

The name of this restaurant came about due to an error at the printer's.  It was supposed to be "Thang Long" meaning "Ascending Dragon" and also Vietnam's first capital city.  As "Thanh Long" it means "Green Dragon" ~ green representing happiness and prosperity while the dragon symbol is an ancient symbol of good luck.  I would say the An Family has enjoyed this for many years serving a legion of happy customers ~ myself being a newly minted one!

Note - The An Family also owns the Crustacean group of restaurants with a Palo Alto opening targeted for this September 2010.  I can't wait till this spot opens up!

excerpts:
Must Haves:
Garlic Asian Noodles
Drunken Crab

Tried:
Shaken Beef
Roast Crab
The most stellar items on the imenu that I tried were the garlic asian noodles and the drunken crab.
The garlic asian noodles just burst with flavor.
Each bite has such wonderful garlic  and other spices that make this dish outstanding.
Dare I say, even more memorable than the crab!
The drunken crab was the better of the two.
Simmering alcohol into any food just makes it all the better in my book.
They cook the crab with chardonnay, sake, and brandy which makes it even more spectacular.
(Secret, I could have easily slurped up the sauce/juice/au jus or whatever it's called.
The shaken beef was tender, juicy, tasty, and all that jazz, but Thanh Long is famous for crab and there is a reason for that.
It is a good sized portion.
Great beef quality and very, very tasty, but I was just in the mood for MORE CRAB
The roast crab was also good, but I found it to be a little too dry.
It is less messier than the drunken crab, but you already eating crab and it is is bound to look messy.
I mean really, is there any real proper way to eat a crab in public?
I think not.
shaken beef.author: Tawny A.
shaken beef.review:
Yummy to my tummy.

Must Haves:
Garlic Asian Noodles
Drunken Crab

Tried:
Shaken Beef
Roast Crab

The most stellar items on the imenu that I tried were the garlic asian noodles and the drunken crab. The garlic asian noodles just burst with flavor. Each bite has such wonderful garlic  and other spices that make this dish outstanding. Dare I say, even more memorable than the crab! MUST EAT.

The drunken crab was the better of the two. Simmering alcohol into any food just makes it all the better in my book. They cook the crab with chardonnay, sake, and brandy which makes it even more spectacular. (Secret, I could have easily slurped up the sauce/juice/au jus or whatever it's called. Actually, I probably did).

The shaken beef was tender, juicy, tasty, and all that jazz, but Thanh Long is famous for crab and there is a reason for that. It is a good sized portion. Great beef quality and very, very tasty, but I was just in the mood for MORE CRAB PLEASE.

The roast crab was also good, but I found it to be a little too dry. It is less messier than the drunken crab, but you already eating crab and it is is bound to look messy. I mean really, is there any real proper way to eat a crab in public? I think not.

excerpts: The delicious items we chose for our meal were the drunken crab, dungeness crab puffs, buddha roll, shaken beef, and of course their famous garlic noodles.
After tasting garlic we definitely wanted dessert and settled for their creme brulee which was very rich but satisfied our sweet tooth.
shaken beef.author: Emy B.
shaken beef.review:
I likey!  The food here is very yummy.  If you like crab this is the place to come have it, and be prepared to work at getting all the succulent meat out of the shells.  The delicious items we chose for our meal were the drunken crab, dungeness crab puffs, buddha roll, shaken beef, and of course their famous garlic noodles.  After tasting garlic we definitely wanted dessert and settled for their creme brulee which was very rich but satisfied our sweet tooth.  Next time we'll have to order their fried banana dessert with ice cream which we kept staring at on the other tables.

Parking is not easy to find, but they offer valet service for $10 if you get impatient.  Will definitely be back...yee!  If you're curious check out their website at anfamily.com, click on Thanh Long and download the menu.

excerpts: Ordered the garlic noodles of course, and also the shaken beef.
We skipped out on the roasted crab even though everyone else around us had that because we wanted some protein...
$37 crab will have to be for another time.
Simply said, the food was awesome.
Noodles were nice and garlicky and I practically inhaled them.
Beef was probably some of the best beef I've had in quite a while served in that style.
My only complaint is that the portion sizes aren't huge but we walked away comfortably full.
Regardless, I loved the food and will be back!!
shaken beef.author: Janey L.
shaken beef.review:
OMG! I'll probably sound just like every other reviewer, but that's just a testament to how yummy the food is, right? 

I wanted to try this place because I passed the An-the-go food truck on the highway on the way to work and the thought of garlic noodles made me drool the rest of the day. We called ahead for 2 on a Friday night probably 1.5 hours before we planned to get there (it was a last minute thing), and had no trouble getting a reservation... cool! Finding parking took awhile though. Ambiance is pretty nice. 

Ordered the garlic noodles of course, and also the shaken beef. We skipped out on the roasted crab even though everyone else around us had that because we wanted some protein... $37 crab will have to be for another time. Simply said, the food was awesome. Noodles were nice and garlicky and I practically inhaled them. Beef was probably some of the best beef I've had in quite a while served in that style. My only complaint is that the portion sizes aren't huge but we walked away comfortably full. Regardless, I loved the food and will be back!!

excerpts: Also had the shaken beef, which is spicy and delicious and the garlic noodles -a
tasty fix for those of us who love our carbs.
Service was slow and hit or miss, even though we got there as soon as the doors open.
shaken beef.author: Djipopo S.
shaken beef.review: Went after hearing the rave reviews about the crab - which is good, but didn't quite live up to the hype.  Also had the shaken beef, which is spicy and delicious and the garlic noodles -a tasty fix for those of us who love our carbs.  Service was slow and hit or miss, even though we got there as soon as the doors open.

excerpts: Shaken Beef - the beef were cubed cut and tasted rough.
Felt like I was chewing on gum.
I can't believe this dish was $20!
shaken beef.author: Chanel L.
shaken beef.review:
I took my family here for dinner to celebrate my daddys birthday.  They loved it,. especially the garlic noodles!  Don't make the same mistake as we did; by ordering other dishes.  

Instead of just sticking with the garlic roasted crab and garlic noodles, we ended up ordering a few other dishes; which racked up our bill and it wasn't even that good. 

Specifically : 

Shaken Beef - the beef were cubed cut and tasted rough.  Felt like I was chewing on gum.  I can't believe this dish was $20! Not worth it

Not only that, we also ordered 

Thanh long fish - it was 4-5 pieces of fish,. it tasted like frozen fish sticks! This dish was also $20.  

These two dishes were the ones that stood out to me during dinner that made me feel YUCK!! Lucky the roasted garlic crab and garlic noodles made up for the other BAD dishes.  

If you eat here, just order the Roasted Garlic Crab and Garlic Noodles!

Also, parking is tough and make sure you call in for reservations.

excerpts: We ordered the "must haves": salt 'n pepper calamari (not bad), coconut shrimp (OK), shaken beef (too sweet and oily), roasted crab (fishy and bland), garlic noodles (oily), and stir fried vegetables (not bad).
For dessert, we had the banana cake (not wow) and chocolate lava cake (nice flavor, but there was no chocolate oozing out of the center.
It was more like a round brownie.
shaken beef.author: Irene L.
shaken beef.review:
Highly overrated.  The food was meh and did not live up to all the glowing reviews on yelp.  We ordered the "must haves": salt 'n pepper calamari (not bad), coconut shrimp (OK), shaken beef (too sweet and oily), roasted crab (fishy and bland), garlic noodles (oily), and stir fried vegetables (not bad).  For dessert, we had the banana cake (not wow) and chocolate lava cake (nice flavor, but there was no chocolate oozing out of the center.  It was more like a round brownie.  The bill for 3 of us was $165 without alcohol.

The wait staff was wonderful however.  They were attentive, but not hovering.

excerpts: Then we ordered shaken beef with a side of jasmine rice and tiger prawns with garlic noodles.
I was going to order another side of garlic noodles, but my boyfriend told me to taste his first.
Boy, am I glad that I didn't order a side of garlic noodles.
I'm a big garlic noodles kinda gal.
Their garlic noodles weren't so bad, but it was really buttery.
I love my garlic noodles to be more of on the garlic side.
But, I've had better garlic noodles.
Their prawns, to me, personally was too salty.
But my boyfriend thought it was perfect.
The dish was 36$ bucks
and I personally wouldn't have ordered if it was 36$ bucks.
I would have gotten crab or something.
As for the shaken beef, it was 23.95$ with a side of jasmine rice 2.75 and i thought the shaken beef was perfect.
They included potatoes and they were perfectly cooked.
I loved how the beef just melted in my mouth.
From the outside, it looked like they were overcooked, but it was just right.
However, I probably wouldn't order it again
only becuase
I feel like the shaken beef was overpriced.
shaken beef.author: Lynda L.
shaken beef.review:
I gave this place a 4 star because the service was spectacular!  The food was fast, and everything was on point.  

However, parking was horrible.  We drove around several blocks 20-30 minutes trying to look for parking.  I've already anticipated the food to be expensive, so valet was not an option.  

From the outside, Thanh Long looked really small, but when you walk in, it was a little bigger than you have expected. However, it was still relatively small compared to other restaurants.  I thought the table arrangements were all packed together.  My boyfriend and I had one of the better tables, but we were still relatively close to the table next to us.  I felt like we had to whisper so they wouldn't eavesdrop on our conversation.  It was a really loud type of environment.  Everyone is talking among each other so you can hear constant talking in the background.  (which i didnt bother me as much)

The food came out in a quickness!  We had salt and pepper calamari for starters and I thought it was really good, but wish the portion was bigger.  My boyfriend wish there was ranch for him to dip it into (LOL-- hes a ranch lover when it comes to calamari)  Then we ordered shaken beef with a side of jasmine rice and tiger prawns with garlic noodles.  I was going to order another side of garlic noodles, but my boyfriend told me to taste his first.  Boy, am I glad that I didn't order a side of garlic noodles.  I'm a big garlic noodles kinda gal.  Their garlic noodles weren't so bad, but it was really buttery.  I love my garlic noodles to be more of on the garlic side.  But, I've had better garlic noodles.  Their prawns, to me, personally was too salty.  But my boyfriend thought it was perfect.  The dish was 36$ bucks and I personally wouldn't have ordered if it was 36$ bucks. I would have gotten crab or something.  As for the shaken beef, it was 23.95$ with a side of jasmine rice 2.75 and i thought the shaken beef was perfect.  They included potatoes and they were perfectly cooked. I loved how the beef just melted in my mouth. From the outside, it looked like they were overcooked, but it was just right.  However, I probably wouldn't order it again only becuase I feel like the shaken beef was overpriced.  

I would def come back another time, for another special occasion -- it was our anniversary yesterday-- to try the crab.

excerpts: In the beginning...we ordered the garlic noodles and the Shaken Beef.
We weren't sure if we were ready to share a crab that night but quickly changed our minds after we saw crabs being served to surrounding tables.
We called our waiter over and asked if we could change our order and without hesitation he said it was no problem.
As he turning around to head to the kitchen...the Shaken Beef was on
it's way out!
Along with the garlic noodles, I felt like I was in butter heaven.
Both dishes were superb and hands down the best crab and garlic noodles I've ever had in my life.
We devoured every bit of it!
shaken beef.author: Helen V.
shaken beef.review:
My friend and I came here on a random night for dinner.  Of course we had heard about the roasted crab and garlic noodle hype so we wanted to try it for ourselves.  

In the beginning...we ordered the garlic noodles and the Shaken Beef.  We weren't sure if we were ready to share a crab that night but quickly changed our minds after we saw crabs being served to surrounding tables.  We called our waiter over and asked if we could change our order and without hesitation he said it was no problem.  As he turning around to head to the kitchen...the Shaken Beef was on it's way out!  We felt bad about switching our order at that point but he insisted it was no problem and continued his way back to the kitchen with the beef.

Ordering the crab was definitely the better choice and it wasn't too much at all.  Along with the garlic noodles, I felt like I was in butter heaven.  Both dishes were superb and hands down the best crab and garlic noodles I've ever had in my life.  We devoured every bit of it!

excerpts: The shaken beef was cooked medium to the "T."
The seabass also tasty with the sauce it comes with but perhaps just a touch overcooked.
shaken beef.author: Cary L.
shaken beef.review:
Greetings Restaurant-goers!!!  Came here for my friend's b-day dinner.  A crab specialty restaurant in the outer...OUTER sunset next to the cold, foggy beach.  A bit of a trek with many other similar places more east on Clement St.  You walk in and you will be greeted by the host (reservations are encouraged as it is a BUSY place even during the week) with a bar on the right.  It is fully stocked and we all got a glass of Oban for a pricey number.

When seated about 10 minutes after our reservation was actually for we had a great server.  Surrounded by an interesting decor we ordered as appetizers calamari and oysters.  I didn't have the oysters but the calamari was well cooked but over seasoned if you ask me.  It was peppery which I do like but way too salty.   Because I love calamari, I ate much of the order but was invited to enjoy a long period of salty tongue and 2 glasses of ice water.  For the mains, we had crab which is the specialty, "shaken" beef, garlic noodles and seabass.   Crab was well cooked and tender.  The shaken beef was cooked medium to the "T."  The seabass also tasty with the sauce it comes with but perhaps just a touch overcooked.  Finally, the garlic noodles were also very tasty if you LOVE garlic.  If garlic is only a passing notion in your home cooking you will think this is romantic disaster when it comes to post-dinner make-out sessions.

Lastly, because the portions are on the smaller side we had to order an extra dish for the 4 of us...the curry lotus prawns.  This had to be the worst of all our selections.  The shrimp were over cooked and tiny....oh whoops, weren't they called "prawns" on the menu???  In any case, the curry was bland and even if you liked it, there was barely enough curry sauce to mix into you rice like many expect in a Thai type curry house.  The veggies it comes with were....eh.  Water chestnuts were ok.  The baby corn tasted like canned baby corn.  All-in-all I'd leave this off your choices to order...

So in summary, a fancy, pricey Vietnamese crab house at the beach in SF.  A fun place to visit if you live locally and enjoy it.  Not something I'd cross town for though.  Plenty of better dining experiences / tastes closer to downtown.

excerpts: We ordered two crabs, some garlic noodles, lemon grass chicken, Salt and Pepper Calamari, and Shaken Beef.
The crabs were very flavorful and tasty!
I was eating like a savage, trying to get all the crab meat I can get!
By the end of the meal, there were crab shells all over the table..
LOL!
Eating the crabs with the garlic noodles made the meal almost perfect!
The chicken and shaken beef were also tasty.
shaken beef.author: Anthony N.
shaken beef.review:
Wow!! I heard so much great stuff about this place that I wanted to try it out for myself. When we first got there, the place was packed! My friends and I waited for 45 mins to get seated, but the food was worth the wait. We ordered two crabs, some garlic noodles, lemon grass chicken, Salt and Pepper Calamari, and Shaken Beef. The crabs were very flavorful and tasty! I was eating like a savage, trying to get all the crab meat I can get! By the end of the meal, there were crab shells all over the table.. LOL! Eating the crabs with the garlic noodles made the meal almost perfect! The chicken and shaken beef were also tasty. The beef was very tender. 

If you're not looking to spend a lot you should turn back now because this place is a little pricey. If you do come, I recommend making some reservations ahead of time if you don't want to wait 45+ minutes. 

If you're craving for some crab that melts in your mouth and gives you happy smile, Thanh Long is the place to be!

excerpts:
Not too garlicy or buttery

Shaken Beef
shaken beef.author: Sandra P.
shaken beef.review:
My bf took me here for the first time on my birthday.. ONE WORD= MAGICAL!

Garlic Noodles ***** Excellent! Delightfully flavored! Not too garlicy or buttery

Shaken Beef ***** Heaven on a platter! (hope i didn't offend anyone) Right amount of spices, peppers

Salt and Pepper Calamari ***** I am very picky when it comes to calamari. I want  it fried to perfection. These are crispy breaded rings of joy! Who said $10.95 for this appetizer could not buy happiness?

The bar made delightful cocktails. Only $7.50!

Servers are courteous and always pay attention to your every need.

I'm getting hungry just thinking about it.. *sighhhhs*

Try to get reservations. This place was crowded with both small and large parties.

excerpts: Of course we ordered roasted dungeness crab (one is enough for two people), garlic noodles and shaken beef.
Needless to say, our table was loaded to the gills!!!
I'm not much of a fan for eating things with my hands, like crab, but their roasted crab is delicious!
I think they steam it first and break it apart, then bast it with their "secret" sauces and spices and roast it.
It comes to you very hot!
They give you bibs too for those of us who are messy eaters, like me, so you won't have to worry about looking silly when you leave and go into town or something...
Or, maybe you could bring an extra shirt...
hehe...
As for the garlic noodles, well, I'm not really a fan.
I just am not a garlic person, let alone having it cooked with noodles.
Everyone else enjoyed it though.
As for the shaken beef, it was cubes of ribeye or tenderloin sautéed with onions and potatoes.
It was very good, very tender.
For desert, we ordered the lava cake which was so good.
I love chocolate and this dessert hit the spot!
I would go back again to eat crab and to enjoy the great, friendly service that we received...
shaken beef.author: Dave F.
shaken beef.review: Had to try this place, a bunch of people told me about it and now I can say I tried it. Of course we ordered roasted dungeness crab (one is enough for two people), garlic noodles and shaken beef. Needless to say, our table was loaded to the gills!!! I'm not much of a fan for eating things with my hands, like crab, but their roasted crab is delicious! I think they steam it first and break it apart, then bast it with their "secret" sauces and spices and roast it. It comes to you very hot! They give you bibs too for those of us who are messy eaters, like me, so you won't have to worry about looking silly when you leave and go into town or something... Or, maybe you could bring an extra shirt... hehe... As for the garlic noodles, well, I'm not really a fan. I just am not a garlic person, let alone having it cooked with noodles. Everyone else enjoyed it though. As for the shaken beef, it was cubes of ribeye or tenderloin sautéed with onions and potatoes. It was very good, very tender. For desert, we ordered the lava cake which was so good. I love chocolate and this dessert hit the spot!  I would go back again to eat crab and to enjoy the great, friendly service that we received...

excerpts:
+ Shaken beef was the favorite
+/-
shaken beef.author: Angel L.
shaken beef.review:
The ambiance was great and there were some stand out dishes.

The food came out quick!
+ Shaken beef was the favorite
+/- Sea bass was also good though not amazing, and I put the sauce on everything
+ Garlic noodles were tasty
+ Sauteed veggies were fresh
- Roasted crab didn't live up to the hype or to the competition
+ Combo seafood fried rice was satisfying

Overall worth a try, and maybe we came on an off night.

The wait staff was attentive, with minor hiccups.

excerpts: The shaken beef is good as well.
The only reason why I didn't give 5 stars is because of the service.
If i'm going to spend over $100 for dinner, I expect better service than what was given to me and my bf.
The service doesn't always suck but on one particular rainy evening, I had reservations but there were plenty of empty tables
so it wasn't very busy throughout dinner service.
Each time I needed the server, I had to flag him down, literally waving my hands like an idiot.
Apparently saying "excuse me" wasn't going to work.
Maybe if he wasn't too busy lifting his nose in the air, he would have heard me all four times.
Any ways, can't wait to go back for the crack crab!
shaken beef.author: Yien S.
shaken beef.review: Every time I have a craving for crab, I think of this place.  The roast crab is sooooo delicious.  Honestly, I'm not too impressed by their over-priced garlic noodles (for the portion and cost, it's like a 90% mark-up.)  I"ve had it at so many other places and it's just ok but the crab is def. worth the trip and money. The shaken beef is good as well.  The only reason why I didn't give 5 stars is because of the service.  If i'm going to spend over $100 for dinner, I expect better service than what was given to me and my bf.  The service doesn't always suck but on one particular rainy evening, I had reservations but there were plenty of empty tables so it wasn't very busy throughout dinner service.  Each time I needed the server, I had to flag him down, literally waving my hands like an idiot.  Apparently saying "excuse me" wasn't going to work.  Maybe if he wasn't too busy lifting his nose in the air, he would have heard me all four times.  Any ways, can't wait to go back for the crack crab!

excerpts:
if you share it your going to want to order another haha

Garlic noodles
Crab
Shaken beef 
Eggplant dish
shaken beef.author: Ms.s F.
shaken beef.review:
Love this place! My recommendations below! BTW I suggest you get your own crab and noodles lol if you share it your going to want to order another haha

Garlic noodles
Crab
Shaken beef 
Eggplant dish

excerpts:
Vegetarian Delight - broccoli, cauliflower and tomatoes in a tomato-based liquid (really?)...
Shaken beef - delicious, but precious little of it.
shaken beef.author: G L.
shaken beef.review:
I'm torn...I want to give TL 5 stars, but I can't.  TL is a two-trick pony...here's why:5 Stars for efficiency, 5 for crabs and garlic noodles, 3 for customer service (our service person was great but host and the reservation clerk were cold but efficient), and 1 for the other entrees.
We had a table of 8 for a birthday dinner.  Ordered a bunch of apps, 3 entrees, 3 crabs, 3 garlic noodles...over $400! Would not have been a problem if the entrees were better.
The worst offenders - a LOT of orange glop on top of a small but beautiful piece of fish (Fish in Citrus - why would you do that to the fish?  Hold the corn-starch!)... Vegetarian Delight - broccoli, cauliflower and tomatoes in a tomato-based liquid (really?)...
Shaken beef - delicious, but precious little of it.
If you go, bring your wallet and ONLY go for the crabs and garlic noodles.

Remember - two-trick pony.

excerpts: Price was pretty steep for the food we ordered - shrimp toast, shaken beef, roast crab, drunken crab, and garlic noodles.
To be honest, all the food didn't stand out for the price we pay - it wasn't bad, but it wasn't that good etiher.
For the wait and price, I should have gone to somewhere else.
shaken beef.author: edgard k.
shaken beef.review: Went there since few friends raved about how good the garlic noodles. Went around dinner time without reservations and our party had to wait for about 45 minutes before being seated. No private parking lot, so parking can be hectic - but might as well go around looking for parking while dropping 1 of your party to book a spot if you don't have any reservations since you have to wait for a while anyway. Price was pretty steep for the food we ordered - shrimp toast, shaken beef, roast crab, drunken crab, and garlic noodles. To be honest, all the food didn't stand out for the price we pay - it wasn't bad, but it wasn't that good etiher. For the wait and price, I should have gone to somewhere else.

excerpts: The fricking shaken beef.
Now THAT is some good stuff.
shaken beef.author: Jennifer Q.
shaken beef.review:
It's been awhile, maybe a year since i've been here. I'll do an update when i come back.

The roasted crab was eh. My dad makes it a lot better, but my sister likes it enough here to buy it sometimes. It's pretty pricey. I remember having garlic rice and it was a little dry but good. The garlic noodles were tastey but i've had better.

Now, what makes me want to come back here? The beef. The fricking shaken beef. Now THAT is some good stuff. I don't come for the crab or garlic noodles. i come for the beef.

excerpts: For the four of us, (in-laws, hubby and I) we ordered one Roasted Garlic Crab, one Drunken Crab, two orders of the Garlic Noodles and one shaken beef.
For dessert, we had their deep fried pineapple
a la mode - mmm, delicious.
The shaken beef was also very flavorful and tender served over pieces of lettuce covered with some dressing.
Although this place is known for their Roasted Garlic Crab, I personally favored the Drunken crab for it's more natural flavor cooked with the perfect complimenting wine.
shaken beef.author: Ivy P.
shaken beef.review:
My in-laws wanted to try this place since they heard this place makes the best garlic noodles and crab.  When we arrived, parking was hard to find, even for a Tuesday evening! Luckily we got to the restaurant early (around 6 pm) b/c by 7 pm, the place was packed with lots of customers at the door waiting to be seated.  

The ambiance of this place was really nice and dimly lit, the perfect place for a date if you're ok with getting down and dirty with some crabs.  The service here was just as good as the food - very attentive, fast and professional. 

For the four of us, (in-laws, hubby and I) we ordered one Roasted Garlic Crab, one Drunken Crab, two orders of the Garlic Noodles and one shaken beef. For dessert, we had their deep fried pineapple a la mode - mmm, delicious. The shaken beef was also very flavorful and tender served over pieces of lettuce covered with some dressing.  

For Garlic Lovers, this is the place to go.  Everything was incredibly flavorful.  Although this place is known for their Roasted Garlic Crab, I personally favored the Drunken crab for it's more natural flavor cooked with the perfect complimenting wine. I would love to know how they are able to infuse the flavors so well into the crab meat.  

Warning: the Garlic flavor lingers in the mouth (and breath) hours after you're done eating. Also, it's kind of a splurge to eat here b/c of the cost (we paid $38 per crab - seasonal price) It is more expensive to go during the non crab season.  

Final Verdict: This is a MUST TRY place if you love good flavorful crab and garlic.  It's a good thing I live so far away otherwise, we'd be making this a regular stop on my list of places to eat.

excerpts: The shaken beef was however better than most restaurants.
shaken beef.author: Trynh K.
shaken beef.review: Can't say that it was the best crab ever, it was ok...butter galore.  The shaken beef was however better than most restaurants.  Nothing special about the garlic noodles tho they claim its made of secret stuff (that I can make at home).  Yes, I cook.

excerpts: Example, Shaken beef, $25,  literally 12 pieces of med sized cut beef and some mixed veggies, no sides.
Lets just say the garlic noodle and rice is what got most of us full and our kid sister was sleeping so it was really only 7 of us eating.
shaken beef.author: Tommy M.
shaken beef.review:
Lets cut all the bs and get to what you need to know.

1. You basically have to valet your car bc there's no parking anywhere.  $12.
2. They accept reservations so use it, it wasn't too busy but my family of 8 were sat the instant we were greeted.
3. Place looks crappy on the outside, classy in the inside.
4. This place aint cheap.  For appetizers, think 4 skewers of chicken satay for about $12 and their dinner plates range front $20-40.  Crab, market price. 
5. Portions suck, its quite pricey so your like ok hope portions are good.  Its prob about 1/2 to 3/4 of what you'd be expecting.  Think I'm lying..... lol nope
6.  Service was good, and food tasted great.
7.  Recommendations, roasted crab, garlic noodles, lemon grass chicken.
8.  Bill: 2Roasted dung crabs, 2Garlic noodle, 1Garlic noodle with prawns, 1Lemon grass chicken, 1shaken beef, 1chicken fried rice, 3steam rice, 1chicken satay, 2 beers, 1assorted vegetable, 1small fish dish.  $342 Grat included. 

Overall this place has mediocre service and great food, but not going to lie, Imo its overpriced.  Example, Shaken beef, $25,  literally 12 pieces of med sized cut beef and some mixed veggies, no sides.  Lets just say the garlic noodle and rice is what got most of us full and our kid sister was sleeping so it was really only 7 of us eating.

excerpts: Shaken beef:
for those not into crab or seafood this is really good alternative.

the cubes are always tender and the flavor really pairs well the rice or noodles

Broiled chicken: not as good as the shaken beef with the chicken a bit harder to chew on (almost jerky like).
shaken beef.author: Arbel D.
shaken beef.review:
3 times I've been here (1 with Yelp) and 3 times I've devoured and enjoyed their Garlic Roasted Crab and Garlic Rice. That's right Garlic Rice! Although they are more known for the Noodles, it's the rice that keeps me happy, the noodles are an excellent alternatives.

Shaken beef: for those not into crab or seafood this is really good alternative. the cubes are always tender and the flavor really pairs well the rice or noodles

Broiled chicken: not as good as the shaken beef with the chicken a bit harder to chew on (almost jerky like). flavor wise it was pretty good even without the rice or noodles.

dessert: foregoing the chocolate molten cake which is a favorite, i tried something different and chose the deep-fried ice cream.  glad i did, because it was very very good. I expected a globe of breading that was so thick and so hard. Instead it was a light breading, like tempura yet the ice cream was not completely melted. with a drizzle of chocolate and whip cream and paired with vietnamese ice coffee it was a good way to end the dinner

the only bad was the seating location, our party ended up below the air vents, so a constant blast of cool air was making me a bit chilly

if you're don't mind splurging a bit for the family, Thanh Long is excellent place to go

excerpts: Also a huge fan of their Shaken Beef and Mango salad.
The Shaken Beef has so much flavor, I can't go there and not order it, even when I'm craving crab.
shaken beef.author: CJ W.
shaken beef.review:
My favorite restaurant in the city. I want to come here for my birthday every year. 

Seriously the most delicious crab and garlicky noodles. (And I am a crab snob.) Also a huge fan of their Shaken Beef and Mango salad. The Shaken Beef has so much flavor, I can't go there and not order it, even when I'm craving crab.

This is also a great place for small parties, although it can get really pricey if your friends eat like bottomless pits that order more and more crab and noodles throughout the evening. It is also quite the date destination. They also have a somewhat large upstairs room with lots more tables, so it's bigger than it looks. Great service too.

Must make reservations. They do take walk ins, but you'd be taking your chances on how long the wait will be. I wouldn't try it on a Friday or Saturday night. I miss the days when I could go on a whim, and when the prices weren't as expensive. Damn those dot com days that drove up the prices.

excerpts: We ordered the usual items: crab, garlic noodle, shaken beef, vegetable delight, shrimp on garlic noodle.
They were all very expensive.
The crab was $41!
each and wasn't anything special.
We have better crabs elsewhere with cheaper price.
Noodle was $10 and basically just noodle plus garlic.
I was so disappointed!
It is unlikely we will go back.
shaken beef.author: Elena H.
shaken beef.review: Overpriced and so so food.  I came here based on friends' recommendation.  We ordered the usual items: crab, garlic noodle, shaken beef, vegetable delight, shrimp on garlic noodle. They were all very expensive. The crab was $41! each and wasn't anything special. We have better crabs elsewhere with cheaper price. Noodle was $10 and basically just noodle plus garlic. I was so disappointed! It is unlikely we will go back.

excerpts: Also best forgotten were mains of stringy steamed sea bass and shaken beef marinated to the point where the beef had lost texture and taste.
shaken beef.author: David D.
shaken beef.review:
Thanh Long has a menu.  A pretty extensive one.  But there are two reasons to come here, the garlic noodles and the roast crab.  Making a meal of anything else here would be like doing chicken at a steakhouse.  

Yes we did get a few additional things.  An appetizer of salt and pepper calamari was a bit rubbery but nicely spiced and was OK.   The Vietnamese salad was mainly cabbage with some stray shrimp and strange tasting chicken that was best forgotten.  Likewise the Mango salad composed of tasteless mango and some stray shrimp.  The scallops described on the menu as being in the salad were undetectable.  Also best forgotten were mains of stringy steamed sea bass and shaken beef marinated to the point where the beef had lost texture and taste.  

The saving graces here were the roasted whole crab, which had obviously been done in garlic and some pepper.  Not a wondrous dish but fresh crab that was properly prepared.  The garlic noodles were nice as well.  Nothing remarkable about this plate, just noodles with oodles of garlic.   

So come.  Get your fix of crab and noodles.  Avoid the rest of the menu and you will do well for yourself.

excerpts: Cant beat their garlic noodles, shaken beef and garlic crabs.
Delish!
shaken beef.author: Kent P.
shaken beef.review: Cant beat their garlic noodles, shaken beef and garlic crabs. Delish!

excerpts: Garlic noodles and Shaken Beef.
AND Roasted crab?
Come on, even my grandma loved it
and she's a picky eater.
Great date place, nicely lit, intimate feel.
Best place to dine in the Sunset.
shaken beef.author: Rosavida C.
shaken beef.review:
Consumer beware: You're breath'll be kickin'.

But, it's worth it. Garlic noodles and Shaken Beef. AND Roasted crab? Come on, even my grandma loved it and she's a picky eater. 
Great date place, nicely lit, intimate feel. Best place to dine in the Sunset.

excerpts: The food was good and we ordered 2 crabs, 3 garlic noodles (so good!!!!!!!), a mango salad, and a shaken beef.
my favorite came out to be the garlic noodles, although the beef was good too.
I think I'd come back only for special occasions.
We paid $245+tax total.
shaken beef.author: Junming G.
shaken beef.review: I went here on my birthday and we were seated on the 2nd floor. The food was good and we ordered 2 crabs, 3 garlic noodles (so good!!!!!!!), a mango salad, and a shaken beef. my favorite came out to be the garlic noodles, although the beef was good too. I think I'd come back only for special occasions. We paid $245+tax total.

excerpts: had the roasted crab and tamarind crab with garlic noodles and shaken beef.
$10 garlic noodle is a money maker, oily.
nice pepper on the roasted crab.
the shaken beef is priced very high, but it's quite tasty.
such soft and nicely flavored meat mixed with potatoes and lettuce.
shaken beef.author: Rob C.
shaken beef.review:
probably 3.5, esp. when considering value which pushes this place down.  hmm, TL vs. PPQ vs. R&G.  all crabs approx. $35-40.  I vote for PPQ, and overall I prefer R&G type preps over butter/garlic.
the family business story is impressive.
here the crabs seem to be steamed/boiled longer, so the shell is softer?  didn't quite like the meat as much but the sauces were fine.
had the roasted crab and tamarind crab with garlic noodles and shaken beef.  $10 garlic noodle is a money maker, oily.
nice pepper on the roasted crab.
the shaken beef is priced very high, but it's quite tasty.  such soft and nicely flavored meat mixed with potatoes and lettuce.  salt and pepper calamari was too salty.

excerpts: We ordered the roasted crab, garlic noodle, and the shaken beef.
You MUST try the shaken beef.
It's hella good!
Overall, it's one of the best restaurants I've ever had here.
shaken beef.author: Owen S.
shaken beef.review: Went here last Saturday with my friends. We reserved a table of four few hours earlier, but then I came late and they wrote off our reservation. However, we waited only for 10 minutes before we got our table. We ordered the roasted crab, garlic noodle, and the shaken beef. You MUST try the shaken beef. It's hella good! Overall, it's one of the best restaurants I've ever had here.

excerpts: Shaken Beef.
shaken beef.author: Vince H.
shaken beef.review:
I came here for the first time because I had a friend in town who wanted some seafood. Instead of taking him to Fisherman's wharf, we decided to do something different. We are so glad we came here. There's nothing like the bone breaking sound of crab while wearing a plastic bib. 

Furthermore, the service is impeccable. I shall return!

Things to get:

The Roast Crab is absolutely delectable. I'm not sure what the "secret spices" are, but mixed with the garlic, I was tempted to eat everything down to the shell.

Garlic Noodles. There is a reason why everybody talks about it. 

Shaken Beef. Yummy.

Soft Shell Crab. Yes, we couldn't get enough crab

Tip: We had a good ole time ordering drinks. Let me tell you, they are VERY heavy handed with their vodka.

excerpts: We also decided to order the shaken beef which many folks raved about but boy was I dissappointed!
shaken beef.author: Tina D.
shaken beef.review:
4 star for the crab and garlic noodles only!

After going to Crustaceans for so long, I decided to give Thanh Long a try and see which place I like better.

We ordered 2 crabs (1 garlic butter, 1 tamarinde)  along with 2 orders of the garlic noodles and it was SOOOO good!  I prefer the garlic butter crab over the tamarinde crab as it was more flavorful and didn't leave that bittersweet tamarind aftertaste.

The garlic noodles wasn't as greasy as the ones I've had at Crustaceans so it works better for me!

We also decided to order the shaken beef which many folks raved about but boy was I dissappointed! 

The steak  was so bland and over cooked...for $23 bucks you would think they'd use mixed baby greens for a more upscale touch but instead they used chopped head lettuce!  Not my cup of tea there...and definitely not worth the money.

As for the drinks, they recommended lychee martini's and that was dissappointing too...tasted like sugar water. 

Sevice was okay, nothing impressive.  Overall, I was able to quench my cravings for the crab and garlic noodes,  and probably won't try anything else nexttime around.

excerpts: garlic noodles are ridiculously overpriced...and shaken beef and pork medallions were pretty good.
shaken beef.author: Adrienne C.
shaken beef.review:
It's ok - essentially it's Crustaceans in the Outer Sunset, but with less butter. The crab is pretty good but small (liked the Drunken versus the Roasted version)...garlic noodles are ridiculously overpriced...and shaken beef and pork medallions were pretty good.

Overall, I really don't see how this place can justify the price with its food - it's abs ridics...

excerpts: The roast crab, shaken beef, and garlic noodles have a ton of flavor.
If you usually eat white rice every meal and you think that the garlic noodles can serve as the main carb dish, you're wrong.
Don't think twice.
shaken beef.author: Evs K.
shaken beef.review:
The roast crab, shaken beef, and garlic noodles have a ton of flavor. If you usually eat white rice every meal and you think that the garlic noodles can serve as the main carb dish, you're wrong. Don't think twice. Order the white rice even though it's outrageously expensive.

Dishes are on the saltier side. Every time I eat here, I come out dying of thirst. Other than that, the food is good.

excerpts: Shaken beef was excellent.
PPQs roasted crabs are fresher and larger, but their pho is not so good.
Parking's very difficult.
shaken beef.author: Nestor T.
shaken beef.review: Never order Prawns over garlic noodles, basically four (4) medium sliced shrimps for $36. Overpriced and dry. We ordered  2 Roasted crabs and they were not fresh. (slightly mushy) Shaken beef was excellent. PPQs roasted crabs are fresher and larger, but their pho is not so good.   Parking's very difficult.

excerpts: We ordered crab puffs as an app, with garlic noodles and shaken beef as mains.
Presentation of the beef was pretty weak.
As Tina D. notes they serve it with chopped head lettuce, not something worthy of the $23 charge.
Pretty lame.
shaken beef.author: Nate A.
shaken beef.review:
Last night we ended up in the outer sunset on an adventure.  When looking for food near by we ran into Thanh Long and, on the recommendation of their garlic noodles, decided to have a bite to eat.  Service was fantastic.  We were seated quickly, even without a reservation.  Our waiter was spot on, didn't unnecessarily interrupt us, took our order promptly and returned with our app quickly.

The food was good but spectacularly overpriced. We ordered crab puffs as an app, with garlic noodles and shaken beef as mains.  Presentation of the beef was pretty weak.  As Tina D. notes they serve it with chopped head lettuce, not something worthy of the $23 charge.  Pretty lame.  I was also surprised that both mains were rich with garlic, not just the garlic noodles; I like garlic quite a bit but it felt like they were hiding their food with the amount they used.  Garlic is one of those ingredients that is easy to overuse because it tastes so good at first.  It's like eating cookies, the first couple bites taste great then after some point you start to have a stomach ache from eating too many.  Well after all that butter and garlic I ended up leaving with Thanh Long with a stomach ache.

Total dinner without drinks was $45. Ouch.  I was torn between giving Long 3 or 4 stars but ultimately they loose a star for food quality which was good but not sublime and they loose a star for not living up to my subjective quality / price metric.  That doesn't mean it's not a good restaurant, it is, with outstanding service and tasty food; just don't expect an enlightening meal.  (disclaimer: I didn't have any seafood aside from the crab puffs, perhaps the real reason to go to Thanh Long)

excerpts: Then our two orders of crab with garlic noodles and an order of shaken beef showed up....
we 4 split all the dishes and were STUFFED!!
plus we all had 2 drinks each (beer and rum drinks)
The bill was $200; about $150 less than we were prepared to pay for 4 people for a crab meal!
Everyone was pleasant, fast and efficient ... will be back to work on the rest of the menu!!
shaken beef.author: Ange W.
shaken beef.review: My husband & I went on a double date to this wonderful gem of a restaurant. I was skeptical due to some of the Yelp reviews stating that service sucked, prices were high and so on.... but to my delightful surprise, we were completely taken care of and had a wonderful night. My husbands brother went before and said for 2 he spend $150... so we were prepared. We got there at 6, our friends were there early so they stopped in at the bar where Peter took excellent care of them offering them samples of his concoctions (which they loved). When my husband and I got there we just paid the $12 for valet and were done with it!! Still cheaper than a ticket or towing!! When we went in we were seated right away with our friends (we did have a reservation). They were prompt and courteous. We ordered a started dish of fried calamari... I don't eat calamari but I did this night!! it was AWESOME! cooked PERFECT!! Then our two orders of crab with garlic noodles and an order of shaken beef showed up.... we 4 split all the dishes and were STUFFED!! plus we all had 2 drinks each (beer and rum drinks) The bill was $200; about $150 less than we were prepared to pay for 4 people for a crab meal! Everyone was pleasant, fast and efficient ... will be back to work on the rest of the menu!!

excerpts: The shaken beef is - to me - the best beef dish on the menu.
Soooo tender and flavorful!
Seasonal veggies are good too, although sometimes they taste just like the beef.
shaken beef.author: Teri T.
shaken beef.review:
If you love crab and aren't afraid of garlic, this is definitely THE place to go. As everyone else has already said, the crab and garlic noodles are the best! When dungeness is out of season, it can be pricey (I think we've paid as much as $54 once - when we were desperate) but otherwise, on price (usually about $27 - $37), it's comparable to other places while beating the pants of other places in terms of flavor.

I love the garlic roasted crab and hubs loves the drunken crab. I've made the garlic roasted for us at home but it never quite measures up. There must be a secret ingredient of some sort. Maybe the secret is those plastic bibs they give you. (BTW, is it my imagination or have those bibs gotten smaller?  Or is it just that my belly has gotten bigger??) Oh- and a tip for those who don't eat the crab but are dining with someone (or next to someone) who is: request a bib for yourself. Otherwise, beware flying crab juice, crab meat pieces, or droplets of garlic sauce. 

The garlic noodles (also impossible to duplicate at home!) are delish and there's enough in one order to share between two - unless you're with a pregnant woman and then beware any who dare approach the plate until she's finished. I don't care if it's hubs or the waiter - hands off my noodles until I'm done!

The seabass is yummy too, but not nearly as fun or as filling as the crab. It was cooked perfectly and accompanied by vegetables that complimented the flavor just right.  The shaken beef is - to me - the best beef dish on the menu. Soooo tender and flavorful!  Seasonal veggies are good too, although sometimes they taste just like the beef. Must use the same sauce or at least the same spices.

Parking is definitely the only sucky part. But as others have recommended, go during off-peak hours and it should be easier to find a spot. Otherwise, at least there's valet. Small price to pay for an hour+ of crab-eatin' heaven.

excerpts: Shaken beef was also really awful.
shaken beef.author: Wakaknee J.
shaken beef.review:
What happened to this restaurant??? 
They are not living up to their reputation any more???

The last time I came here was about 7 years ago and it was so good. 
Garlic noodle and roasted crab were really really good, I remember.

Went back recently and had really terrible meal. 
Garlic noodle had way too much garlic on it and it was awful. 
I ate garlic noodle with rice just to kill overpowering garlic taste. 
Shaken beef was also really awful. 
I thought both dishes were like really bad Chinese food rather than great Vietnamese food.

It could have been an off night for the chef, since it was on a weekday, but the restaurant like Thanh Long should not have an off night. They should be serving great food every night.

excerpts: We also get the shaken beef which is delicious
shaken beef.author: Abby N.
shaken beef.review:
My friends and I have an annual dinner to Thanh Long to celebrate the holidays and the opening of crab season. I CRAVE the roasted crab from Thanh Long.  I CRAVE a side order of the garlic noodles.  Yum!  Let's talk about other things on the menu that I love.  We also get the shaken beef which is delicious and we've had the calamari, which is also very good.

One thing I usually ask with my roasted crab is a side of the tamarind sauce from the tamarind crab, which is so good but it's just way too messy for me.  I drizzle the sauce on the garlic noodles and dip the roasted crab in it as well...oh boy, I'm getting hungry.

BTW, check out the small freight elevator in the kitchen.  I heard that in order to keep the recipe a secret,  they make the roasted crab in a secret kitchen and send the crab up to the restaurant level for the waitstaff to pick up.

excerpts: dont get the shaken beef or lemon grass beef.
its one of the worst I have ever had.
shaken beef.author: Beach L.
shaken beef.review:
