best garlic noodles I have ever had. Better than crustacean. I think there is garlic butter, and soy in them.. and somehow the flavors just mesh really well. 

Im allergic to seafood so I cant comment on their drunken crab but my roomates said that the suauce is amazing. the crab itself is good they said, but they have had fresher crab which has tasted better.

dont get the shaken beef or lemon grass beef. its one of the worst I have ever had. Their traditional salad was also not very impressive.


My friend had the orange sherbert and liked it but said you didnt get much since it came in a frozen orange. I had the fried ice cream and it was okay. I have had better though.

All in all I would come back for the garlic noodles and my friends for the drunken crab... BUT I WOULD NOT ORDER ANYTHING ELSE.

excerpts: Recommended - crab (any one), garlic noodles, shaken beef.
I can't wait to come back to SF just so I eat here again.
shaken beef.author: D Z.
shaken beef.review:
I cannot rate this place high enough. Every item we got was so tasty.
Recommended - crab (any one), garlic noodles, shaken beef.
I can't wait to come back to SF just so I eat here again.

excerpts: the garlic noodles and shaken beef were overcooked.
shaken beef.author: Diana B.
shaken beef.review:
i grew up on fresh crab either cooked in chinese/vietnamese restaurants or cooked at home by my dad. i was very excited to try thanh long and couldn't decide between the roast or tamarind crab so i went with the server's suggestion that roast is better. the roast crab was bland. i couldn't detect "an's special sauce" or the fresh crab taste (i think it's a frozen crab) and resorted to dipping the crab meat in the oil-butter mixture. my friend went to crustacean a few days ago and told me that they tried both and the tamarind was a lot better. she also told me that my $35 thanh long crab cost her $50 at crustacean.

i did enjoy the sea bass (the only not heavy tasting dish we ordered but it was small), mussels with asian pesto (although i was expecting a bowl of mussels rather than five) and the garlic rice. the garlic noodles and shaken beef were overcooked.

excerpts: As per other yelpers' reviews, my group of 5 tried the garlic noodles, the roast crab in secret sauce, the shaken beef, and Thanh Long fish.
We were all big fans of the garlic noodles and roast crab, of course, and my friends really enjoyed the shaken beef too.
We were all big fans of the garlic noodles and roast crab, of course, and my friends really enjoyed the shaken beef too.
We were all big fans of the garlic noodles and roast crab, of course, and my friends really enjoyed the shaken beef too.
The fish was bland by comparison to the rest, but was still decent and a great deal since we got more garlic noodles alongside the order.
One of my girlfriends was overwhelmed with the amount of butter in the noodles and crab, and had to lay off after a while... which meant more for us!
Yum
shaken beef.author: Tina J.
shaken beef.review:
As per other yelpers' reviews, my group of 5 tried the garlic noodles, the roast crab in secret sauce, the shaken beef, and Thanh Long fish. 

All dishes were amazing.  We were all big fans of the garlic noodles and roast crab, of course, and my friends really enjoyed the shaken beef too. The fish was bland by comparison to the rest, but was still decent and a great deal since we got more garlic noodles alongside the order.  One of my girlfriends was overwhelmed with the amount of butter in the noodles and crab, and had to lay off after a while... which meant more for us!  Yum :D

I'd love to come back for another special occasion. It was a fairly loud atmosphere but also a nice, refined setting for older family members to join if need be. Finding street parking was a pain (3 blocks away) for 5 separate cars, but still worth the drive to the City and the $120 tab.

excerpts: We had the roast crab (of course!), colossal royal tiger prawns over garlic noodles, shaken beef (YUM!), grilled calamari, and the seafood combination fried rice.
I was looking forward to having leftovers of this feast, but we cleaned our plates.
Haha.
shaken beef.author: Jenn C.
shaken beef.review:
LOVE this place! It's not cheap, but it's so worth it to splurge once in a while.

We had the roast crab (of course!), colossal royal tiger prawns over garlic noodles, shaken beef (YUM!), grilled calamari, and the seafood combination fried rice. I was looking forward to having leftovers of this feast, but we cleaned our plates. Haha. Oh my god that was the best dinner I've had in a while.

We made reservations for a Saturday night. I'd suggest doing that since it gets pretty packed here.

excerpts: The Shaken Beef, on the other hand, was very delicious, tender, and flavorful.
Reservations for this place are high recommended and I find it bit expensive, but that's all things seafood.
At least it was fresh.
shaken beef.author: Peter L.
shaken beef.review: Famous for their butter roasted crab. When you need a bib to eat crab, you know you're in business. The crab was very good, I had the original butter roasted and the tamarind roasted, both were great. If you had Boiling Crab before, this is not as rich as the sauce in BC. Everyone raves about the garlic noodles but I thought it was just OK, I definitely had much better at other places. The Shaken Beef, on the other hand, was very delicious, tender, and flavorful. Reservations for this place are high recommended and I find it bit expensive, but that's all things seafood. At least it was fresh.

excerpts: I read the Yelp reviews and must say that the Shaken beef made of New York Steak is definitely a hit!
The aroma draws you in and the flavor is just intense!
shaken beef.author: Henry L.
shaken beef.review:
I believe this place to be the same owner(s) as that of Crustacean's Restaurant.

I read the Yelp reviews and must say that the Shaken beef made of New York Steak is definitely a hit! The aroma draws you in and the flavor is just intense! These are the most tender morsels you will ever bite into and the pepper-flavored marinade equates this dish close to perfection.

I would have to say the crab and the garlic noodles are mediocre. The other crab restaurants of its calibre (i.e. PPQ) make better crabs for less $$$. 

Also, I came here twice because the first time I had a great experience. My advice is not to go a second time because the second time never tastes as good as the first time at these crab restaurants.

excerpts: We ordered 2 roasted crab, 1 tamarind, 2 garlic noodles and 2 shaken beef as well as some drinks.
I think the food aside from the shaken beef was premade because our order came literally 5 min after we placed the order!
Oh well!
The roasted crab didn't have a strong garlic flavor but it was good when you dipped the meat in the melted garlic and butter that was left on the plate.
The garlic noodles were really good!
We ordered one to take back to the hotel for a late night snack and they were still good the next day after sitting in the fridge!
OMG the shaken beef was delish!
They cooked it to perfection and the meat was so tender.
shaken beef.author: Lilly M.
shaken beef.review:
This was probably the best place we ate at while in San Francisco!

Getting here was a task since we weren't familiar with the public transportation system but thanks to a friendly native, we were pointed in the right direction!

This place was pretty far from our hotel in Union Square but well worth the trek since we had a great meal!

We ordered 2 roasted crab, 1 tamarind, 2 garlic noodles and 2 shaken beef as well as some drinks.
I think the food aside from the shaken beef was premade because our order came literally 5 min after we placed the order!  Oh well!
The roasted crab didn't have a strong garlic flavor but it was good when you dipped the meat in the melted garlic and butter that was left on the plate.  I didn't like the tamarind crab at all.  To me it tasted slimy and the flavor was just weird.  The garlic noodles were really good!  We ordered one to take back to the hotel for a late night snack and they were still good the next day after sitting in the fridge!  
OMG the shaken beef was delish!  They cooked it to perfection and the meat was so tender.  I could go there just to eat this.  

This place is definitely worth a visit if you're in San Francisco.  It's pretty pricey but totally worth it.  I'm just sad we couldn't make it to PPQ to make a comparison!

excerpts: We ordered the Shrimp Toast (fabulous...you can actually taste the shrimp and its rich), Garlic Noodles (don't need to say much.. everyone knows how good it tastes), Drunken Crab (also another favorite of most patrons who come here),  and the Shaken Beef (DELICIOUS!!!
It was so tender and juicy
shaken beef.author: Linda X.
shaken beef.review:
Okay.. this is fresh off the press. I just got home from dinner at Thanh Long. I brought my bf here for his birthday dinner. We ordered the Shrimp Toast (fabulous...you can actually taste the shrimp and its rich), Garlic Noodles (don't need to say much.. everyone knows how good it tastes), Drunken Crab (also another favorite of most patrons who come here),  and the Shaken Beef (DELICIOUS!!! It was so tender and juicy and the potatoes were great). 

Last but not least... our dessert (I'm not sure how I found enough room to cram all that good food into my tummy but I did haha) Creme Brulee (flavor of the day Green Tea) which I have to admit amazed me.. I wasn't sure what to expect but it was creamy with a hint of green tea. I don't know how they managed to capture the green tea taste in this creamy dessert but they did and they did an excellent job of it as well. 

Ahhh -pats my tummy- delicious. 

**Side note: I happen to be allergic to shellfish (crab, lobster, shrimp, etc.) So needless to say even knowing I'd break out in hives it was totally worth it because now I'm sitting at home hiding from people but completely satisfied with my dinner. -big sigh-

excerpts: I can't remember if we ordered the Saigon Beef or the Shaken Beef, but it was pretty tasty.
shaken beef.author: YL L.
shaken beef.review:
My first time trying Thanh Long.  I thought it was decent.  I was pregnant when I tried it, so don't know if my pregnancy taste buds are kinda whack or what....

Sea bass - I love sea bass, but I'd take the baked sea bass you get at a Chinese restaurant over Thanh Long's.  Flavor was just okay. If I go back, I wouldn't order it again.

I can't remember if we ordered the Saigon Beef or the Shaken Beef, but it was pretty tasty.  I'd order it again.

Roasted crab was just okay.  Maybe because I had heard so many good things about it, my expectations were raised. I was a bit disappointed.  Husband just thought it was okay as well, though that didn't stop him for eating most of it.

Garlic noodles - yum. I would definitely order this again.

Fried pineapple with ice cream - Mmmm. A nice change from the fried banana.

excerpts: Shaken Beef is always my favorite thing there.
Ambience is nice.
Bar is too expensive but have some exotic martini's.
shaken beef.author: Cb M.
shaken beef.review:
Great place to go to for a date or dinner with friends...even family dinner (small family) because its quite pricey.

Garlic Noodles are the best but not good if you take them home. Roasted Crab is amazing! Portion is good for two people thought. 
Shaken Beef is always my favorite thing there. Ambience is nice. Bar is too expensive but have some exotic martini's.

excerpts:
My favorite things to order:
Drunken crab (duh)
Shaken beef is my very favorite!
Creme brûlée (different flavors)
the shaken beef w/
a side of rice
shaken beef.author: Cecilia M.
shaken beef.review:
Food is amazing, bottom line! Although one star off for the roast crab which is what they are famous for.. BUT.. Please order the drunken crab. The roasted crab is dry & salty. The drunken crab is simmered w wine sake brandy green onions and garlic, mmmmm! Only order the garlic noodles if you are sharing as they are so rich. Speaking of rich, its kind of a splurge, great for a date( i have had a few there).. but you will get what of pay for!! The service is top notch, we always feel welcome & apprieciated :)

My favorite things to order:
Drunken crab (duh)
Shaken beef is my very favorite!
Creme brûlée (different flavors)
Wine list is pretty decent 
Cocktail w/ mango & coconut rum
(drink 4 taste but no buzz included)

I can't stress this enough..
the shaken beef w/ a side of rice

excerpts:
Shaken Beef - the most TENDER, delicious beef you'll get with a bunch of yummy tidbits on the side (like the potatoes and cherry tomatoes)
4) Cream Cheese Crab Puffs - holy moly,
cheesey crabby melt in your mouth heavenly dream in a crispy shell.
shaken beef.author: Angela T.
shaken beef.review:
MY FAVORITE CRAB PLACE EVER!! ok, ok it's a bit pricey, but its worth it! the food here is insane - order as follows:

1) Garlic Roasted Crab - huge crab in a fountain of garlickey butter...mmMmMMmMMm
2) Garlic Noodles - salty and garlic goodness
3) Shaken Beef - the most TENDER, delicious beef you'll get with a bunch of yummy tidbits on the side (like the potatoes and cherry tomatoes)
4) Cream Cheese Crab Puffs - holy moly, cheesey crabby melt in your mouth heavenly dream in a crispy shell. only gripe i got about this, is that they only give you 6 pieces when i can eat like 25!! 

I usually hate eating crab in public bc its so messy, but here, I'll suck my freaking fingers dry. I swear to it.

excerpts: The "Shaken Beef" was super tender and flavorful, but a little too sweet for my taste.
Salt * pepper calamari was perfect with a light batter coating and quick fry with bell pepper and scallion slices.
Crab ravioli was pretty much the age old bastardized crab rangoon, so not worth the calories there.
Fried ice cream was sent back b/c the shell was undercooked and the ice cream half melted; happily replaced with the choco lava cake.
shaken beef.author: david l.
shaken beef.review: Oh crabbie crabbie crabs!  So so tasty, roasted with salt, pepper, and swimming in a vat of clarified butter.  A whole dining room full of people sucking on shells for good reason.  We also had the garlic noodles as they were highly recommended - simple, garlicky, and complemented the crab perfectly in a strange unexpected duet.  The "Shaken Beef" was super tender and flavorful, but a little too sweet for my taste.  Salt * pepper calamari was perfect with a light batter coating and quick fry with bell pepper and scallion slices.  Crab ravioli was pretty much the age old bastardized crab rangoon, so not worth the calories there.  Fried ice cream was sent back b/c the shell was undercooked and the ice cream half melted; happily replaced with the choco lava cake.

excerpts: For the four of us, we ordered rice rolls, 2 roasted crab, prawns on garlic noodles and shaken beef.
The Shaken Beef was tender, with perfect pieces of roasted potatoes and caramelized onion on a bed of lettuce and cherry tomatoes.
The prawns on garlic noodles - heavenly.
Four pieces of succulent roasted prawns on their signature garlic noodles, which are strangely addicting (but give you kicking breath afterward).
shaken beef.author: Deb I.
shaken beef.review:
We were starving after a full day of sun and wine. We glanced quickly at the menu and decided to order everything the restaurant was famous for. For the four of us, we ordered rice rolls, 2 roasted crab, prawns on garlic noodles and shaken beef.

The rice rolls were teeny-tiny and not particularly great. 

The Shaken Beef was tender, with perfect pieces of roasted potatoes and caramelized onion on a bed of lettuce and cherry tomatoes. It tasted so good we even ate the wilted bed of lettuce so we could get the last drops of beef juice.

The crab was ok - given that this is their signature dish, I have to say that I expected more. The roasted crab is basically a very large crab swimming in oil, salt and pepper. 

The prawns on garlic noodles - heavenly. Four pieces of succulent roasted prawns on their signature garlic noodles, which are strangely addicting (but give you kicking breath afterward).

Then we got the bill. The crab and prawns are listed as "market" price and in our hunger, we forgot to ask what the market price was. We were charged $72 for two crabs and $32 for the prawns. The price for the crabs seemed reasonable given the size of the crabs (one was perfect for two people), but the prawns - 4 prawns for $32?? Still, the prawns WERE awfully good....

The one other thing to note is that Thanh Long is deeeeep in the Sunset district. Pretty far to go, especially when Crustacean is much more central.

excerpts: Shaken beef was very good but the garlic noodles was NO Where near crustaceans.
shaken beef.author: Cynthia S.
shaken beef.review:
I came here with my mom thinking crustaceans was so good that this place should be good too.  Nah the food is NOT up to par at all.  Shaken beef was very good but the garlic noodles was NO Where near crustaceans.  

The service was decent but definitely not superb but at least the atmosphere is much more casual compared to crustacean's and I much prefer a more relaxed atmosphere when I need to go through some shells.

excerpts: The shaken beef was very tender.
We got our food surprisingly fast!...
which was great cause
I was starving!
shaken beef.author: Michelle S.
shaken beef.review:
Went here for the first time.  Maybe it was an off night because the roasted crab was just okay.  I expected just a little bit more flavor...I thought the garlic sauce was more oily than flavorful....of course still edible...it is crab!  The garlic noodles were yummy like usual.  The shaken beef was very tender.  We got our food surprisingly fast!...which was great cause I was starving!  I thought the chicken fried rice was just okay...again, a little on the greasy side than flavorful.  We also ordered the chicken satay and the mussels which were a hit.  

I would come back again, but it always sucks to go to a restaurant for your first time, expecting a certain quality with the crab and to be disappointed.  I've been to Crustaceans a few times and they've always stayed quite consistent...just thought I'd try their sister restaurant this time.

excerpts: but oh so tasty - drenched in garlic), shaken beef (almost more like a beef salad),
shaken beef.author: Joy H.
shaken beef.review: From the outside, it doesn't look like much of a restaurant . . . it almost looks ghetto, but once you get inside, it's pretty big and elegant looking. They don't seat you until your whole party is present, so make sure everyone is there on time or else they may not hold your spot for long! We decided to do family style dining and share a bunch of dishes . . . however, looking around the restaurant we noticed that everyone had their own crab and it would've ended up being a little cheaper if we had done that. Duly noted! We got the roasted crab (the best!), drunken crab (less flavor than the roasted one), and tamarind crab (sweet sauce). We also go the garlic noodles (very plain but oh so tasty - drenched in garlic), shaken beef (almost more like a beef salad), stuffed calamari (unmemorable), and fried blue crab (standard fare). The crabs were the best, though pricey at $38/crab. The desserts we had included the fried ice cream, fried banana a la mode, chocolate cake, and creme brulee. I'd say to save your money on dessert and get another crab!!

excerpts: Shaken beef, GOOD!
Mussels, OMG SO GOOD!!!!!
shaken beef.author: Dee L.
shaken beef.review:
Absolutely my favorite restaurant!!!  Garlic noodles, GOOD! Roast Crab, GOOD! Shaken beef, GOOD! Mussels, OMG SO GOOD!!!!!  Need I say more?

Make sure to go earlier because looking for parking can be a pain.  Enjoy!

excerpts:
Thanh Long Spicy Eggplant~excellent 
Shaken Beef~EXCELLENT (I might take the drive for this dish)
shaken beef.author: J. Julia E.
shaken beef.review:
If I lived nearby or was in the neighborhood already, I would definitely come back. But we drove a couple of hours to eat here and the food was good, although, not "travelling hours in a car" good. 

There were six of us (one was a child), this is what we ordered and how we felt about: 

Traditional Vietnamese Salad~ fresh, tasty, delicious vinaigrette, yet not overdressed 
Catch in Citrus~everyone enjoyed this dish (except for me; I found it too sweet for my liking) 
Thanh Long Spicy Eggplant~excellent 
Shaken Beef~EXCELLENT (I might take the drive for this dish) 
Roast Crab~We ordered two of these because these were supposed to be the star of the show, and don't get me wrong, they were good. The flavor was delicious but two days later my mom pretty much replicated the dish with lobster instead of crab so why drive the two hours, right ? 
Tamarind Crab~just OK. , not the flavor that was expected from the menu description 
Garlic Noodles~again, just OK. (I really was anticipating something extraordinary with this dish because these are An's Famous Noodles and because noodles and garlic are two of my top ten favorite things of all time). 
Three Desserts: Fried Banana, Chocolate Torte, and I don't even remember the third one. I did not try any of these ( I prefer savory over sweet), but everyone else at the table seem to like them just fine. 

Service was EXCELLENT. (I don't mean to put this in the end as an afterthought because I assure you that it's not.)

excerpts: Shaken beef is to die for... juicy, tender, tasty nibblers of beef drenched in sweet goodness...music to my mouth!
shaken beef.author: Jason S.
shaken beef.review:
WOW!

We went late on a Friday and were seated straight away, no waiting! 

Hands down the best noodles I've ever had...I don't know what they do to those garlic noodles but they are fierce!

Shaken beef is to die for... juicy, tender, tasty nibblers of beef drenched in sweet goodness...music to my mouth!

Drunken Crab is delicious, sweet, savory and good to the last drop...Definitely take the bib they offer when you order the crab or you will leave smelling like a sailor.

I can't wait to go back!

excerpts: We tried the Shaken beef.
It was ok.
I guess after all the taste explosions with the crab and noodles, the shaken beef wasn't as exciting.
shaken beef.author: Karen B.
shaken beef.review:
This place is a treat for me. The crab just melts in your mouth. I am allergic to shellfish, but I pack a bottle of benedryl and risk a major break out  just to eat here.  My suggestion is: order your own food. If there are 2 of you, order 2 crabs. If there are 4 of you, order 4 garlic noodles. You will not want to share, trust me. 

For the crab, I like the Roast Crab. You will be licking your fingers and slopping up the butter sauce. Just don't think about the pounds and pounds of butter it took to make the sauce it when you do it. It's just heaven...as is the garlic noodles.Garlic noodles seem like a pretty easy concept...but they don't make 'em anywhere else like they make 'em here. Like I said...get your own. I wasn't crazy about the Tamarind Crab. The flavor was just off for me. Plus it was too sticky. I don't like sticky crab. 

We tried the Shaken beef. It was ok. I guess after all the taste explosions with the crab and noodles, the shaken beef wasn't as exciting.  My BF who doesn't eat seafood really liked the beef. 

It's expensive, but if you stick with the great dishes, it is worth every cent.

excerpts: The Shaken Beef was good.
Of course the crab is good.
I think everyone might go there for that.
I would go back there
but not any time soon.
shaken beef.author: Ge I.
shaken beef.review:
I have been to this restaurant a several times. My first experience was not so good. I didn't really like there food. I can't even really remember what I ate. Another time I remember going there was for a friends birthday dinner. It was about 12 people for dinner. The place is very nice but the service it not. The treatment that we got was eat and get out. maybe because we were such a big group? They told us that we had a 2 hours. (Time limit) Never heard of that for a restaurant. I thought that was rude. The waitress was looking at us and giving us the evil to hurry up and leave. Which was not nice. 
Otherwise the food is Good, not great. 
The Grilled Calamari was good but salty which I hate salty foods. My sister had the steamed Sea Bass. it was OK. The Shaken Beef was good. Of course the crab is good. I think everyone might go there for that. I would go back there but not any time soon.

excerpts: For four people we also ordered the grilled squid starter which was surprisingly good (5 cooked just right with some peanut sauce), Shaken Beef (TASTEY!), and garlic rice.
shaken beef.author: J. L.
shaken beef.review:
You MUST get the Roasted Crab and Garlic Noodles.  For four people we also ordered the grilled squid starter which was surprisingly good (5 cooked just right with some peanut sauce), Shaken Beef (TASTEY!), and garlic rice.  This was perfect for 4 people (unless you are four giant guys, you might want to order more).

Highly recommend making reservations.  

Valet, or street parking which may take a few circles around the block.

excerpts: Shaken beef was quite tasty!
Next time I think I will just stick with PPQ and save a bit of money.
shaken beef.author: Quynh N.
shaken beef.review: Ambiance is nice, looks like a residence on the outside but inside is clean and roomy, but it is noisy. The food is decent, everything tastes clean. The crab and garlic noodles was not as oily as PPQ's but I like the noodles at PPQ more. We had the goi ga salad which is good but pretty basic, not very unique. Shaken beef was quite tasty! Next time I think I will just stick with PPQ and save a bit of money.

excerpts: Roasted crab, garlic noodle, and shaken beef was out of this world..!!
Make sure to make reservation the wait can be pretty long but the food comes out pretty quick so that make up for the wait!!
shaken beef.author: Kristine T.
shaken beef.review: Roasted crab, garlic noodle, and shaken beef was out of this world..!! Make sure to make reservation the wait can be pretty long but the food comes out pretty quick so that make up for the wait!!

excerpts: Lastly, we tried the shaken beef which had a lot of flavor and the meat was tender.
I like how there was salad on the bottom which goes well together.
I think it was way over priced because I'd rather eat at the one at Tasty garden, but it was all for the experience and since I was there
I might as well try all the good stuff.
shaken beef.author: Alice H.
shaken beef.review: This place is pretty expensive. A friend of mine recommended me to try it and said it's worth the price. Parking is hard to find...then again it's SF right. It's located in the corner. The outside was whatever, but the inside looks really nice and upscale. We got seated right away and the table that we got was so tiny. What I didn't' like was that we were literally right next to other people because the place is too tight & needs more room. Anyways, the waiter was very friendly. I got the garlic noodles ($10) because that's a must! It was REALLY good, but very oily and fatty. The roasted garlic crab wasn't that great for ($37) I rather eat my bf parent's crab but I gotta say it did have a lot of meat and when you use a small fork it makes you feel like your eating more? haha Lastly, we tried the shaken beef which had a lot of flavor and the meat was tender. I like how there was salad on the bottom which goes well together. I think it was way over priced because I'd rather eat at the one at Tasty garden, but it was all for the experience and since I was there I might as well try all the good stuff. I think I would only come back for the garlic noodles. Everything else isn't  worth that much. I feel like I was paying more for the atmosphere, but yes garlic noodles is a MUST! (:

excerpts: I can't resist the garlic noodles and shaken beef.
Maybe the satay and jasmine rice with a pineapple lychee martini.
If this hasn't sparked your taste buds go in and see all of the other amazing entree they have to offer.
Don't forget the fried banana or the molten chocolate grand mariner desert.
Makes me hungry just thinking about it!!!!!!!!!
shaken beef.author: Kris M.
shaken beef.review: If you haven't been here you are missing out.... I can't resist the garlic noodles and shaken beef. Maybe the satay and jasmine rice with a pineapple lychee martini. If this hasn't sparked your taste buds go in and see all of the other amazing entree they have to offer. Don't forget the fried banana or the molten chocolate grand mariner desert. Makes me hungry just thinking about it!!!!!!!!!

excerpts: entrees:  shaken beef, served w/potatoes, mixed greens, and cherry tomatoes.
...the shaken beef and the garlic noodles were amazing.
- - my leftover noodles, which would've been my lunch today, were quickly eaten as soon as i got home.
shaken beef.author: Ting A.
shaken beef.review:
there are only a few times where i can get away w/drool hanging from my mouth:
- as an infant
- as a dentist's patient w/novacaine
- while i'm sleeping
- while i'm in the presence of someone like johnny depp
- while i'm sleeping w/johnny depp
- and when i dine at places like thanh long.

hanlong bay breeze cocktail:  included vodka, a raspberry liquer,  and another ingredient which slips my mind.  this delicious concoction had a pleasant aftertaste that i couldn't quite put my finger on.
  
mussels appetizer:  broiled w/asian pesto and served w/seasoned crostini.  wow.  i wanted to roll around in this mussely goodness.  the pesto didn't overpower the dish which was good, and the crostini was a nice touch.

entrees:  shaken beef, served w/potatoes, mixed greens, and cherry tomatoes.  garlic noodles.  sea bass.  SO GOOD.  like, purposely get it under my fingernails good b/c i want to savor it later even though most of society would consider me one unhygienic b*tch good.  ...the shaken beef and the garlic noodles were amazing.  - - my leftover noodles, which would've been my lunch today, were quickly eaten as soon as i got home.  hah.

the waitstaff was very friendly and accommodating.  good thing we ate dinner early b/c there was a line as we exited.

i'll definitely try the crab next time.

excerpts: my husband ordered the roast crab while i had the shaken beef which is pretty good, although i can see the oil on the bed of lettuce it sits on.
shaken beef.author: jean j.
shaken beef.review:
I'm not a fan of seafood but i definitely am willing to take a few bites of their roasted crab which is smothered in garlic, salt, and butter (lots of it). my husband ordered the roast crab while i had the shaken beef which is pretty good, although i can see the oil on the bed of lettuce it sits on. The garlic noodles are delicious but you could see a puddle of butter at the bottom of its plate once your done.
The decor is nice but you can tell the place has been around for some time. Its sister restaurant Crustacean's definitely has better ambiance. Thanh Long is more of a family gathering type of place.
Their lava cake is absolutely yummy!! That definitely tipped the scale to a worthy dining experience for me. The only thing is that they have a $1 cake-cutting fee which put me off a bit. Either just include it in the price of the cake, or take it away altogether.

excerpts: Shaken Beef ($20.95) - very flavorful, and a dish that everyone loved.
The beef was tender and potatoes were flavorful.
shaken beef.author: Daniel M.
shaken beef.review:
I've been here before and I thought it was great (and still do!), but after eating at Crustaceans, Thanh Long only gets 4 stars...

Took my parents and Anhie T. here for Chinese New Years dinner, and reservations were made at 8.30, but at 7.15 we were able to move it up to 7.45 with no problems.  We got there, and it was pretty empty...with maybe 20 diners at about 5-6 different tables.  Barren compared to when Anhie T. and I came about 2 yrs ago.  We were seated immediately, and looked over the menu, and ordered the following:

Crispy Rice Paper Roll ($7.50) - your standard Vietnamese Egg Roll.  But here you get once egg roll cut into four pieces.
Thanh Long Mussells ($10.95) - five mussells served with five slices of thin garlic bread.  This dish was delicious.
Steamed Sea Bass ($24.95) - sea bass was flaky, moist, and really good.  The sauce was sweet and gingery.
Stuffed Calamari ($15.95) - lots of calamari stuffed with minced meat in a tomato based sauce.  Parents didn't like it so much, but I thought it was okay.
Shaken Beef ($20.95) - very flavorful, and a dish that everyone loved.  The beef was tender and potatoes were flavorful.
Garlic Noodles (2 orders at $9.50 ea) - Garlicky and delicious! 
Roast Crab (I think it was $38) - really good crab...but compared to Crustaceans, it's not the same.  Not as flavorful, but still very, very good nonetheless. 
Creme Brulee (2 orders) - My dad and Anhie T. thought this was the best dessert dish.
Banana Cake - I liked this dish and everyone else didn't like it.  Served with a scoop of Vanilla ice cream, a dallop of whip cream, this cake seemed to be made out of only bananas.  Anhie T. said it was bland.  I disagree.
Hot Chocolate Cake - served with Vanilla ice cream...this was good.  Really rich though.
Coke (2 glasses) - served from their bar in a tall, slim glass.  No free refills.

Total bill with tax + tip came out to $218.

This was my parents first time here and they loved the crab, and garlic noodles.  They did say it was a bit oily, but c'mon, roasted crab and garlic noodles anywhere is a bit oily.  But here's a good sign.  As they left, they took some business cards.  That means they liked their food and they'll be back...probably with some family friends!

Depending on my the mood (and thickness of the wallet), I would come back.  

But other substitutions are very comparable:  PPQ is cheaper and quality isn't far behind, while Crustacean is a tad more expensive, but swankier....

Tip 'o the day:  Avoid the valet parking outside.  Parking isn't too difficult in the Sunset.  And even if you had to walk one block after dinner, it may clear up your arteries after all the butter used in cooking the crab!

excerpts: The sea bass was really good, the shaken beef is flavorful  and the crabs also had a lot of varieties...
we got the tamarind, drunken and roasted... all very tasty.
I ordered creme brulee for dessert, and the waiter came back and said they were out so I got the lava cake, and he came back and told me they were out...
so I gave up on dessert.
shaken beef.author: Kymberli C.
shaken beef.review: The food here is good and the service is friendly and pretty attentive, but I think I prefer PPQ more.  This is a classier restaurant but I think the food tastes better at PPQ and better for a larger party.  We ordered appetizers... the seafood dumpling was like just won ton skin and barely any meat inside and  the crab puffs were extremely tiny and the size of a tootsie roll.  The sea bass was really good, the shaken beef is flavorful  and the crabs also had a lot of varieties... we got the tamarind, drunken and roasted... all very tasty.  I ordered creme brulee for dessert, and the waiter came back and said they were out so I got the lava cake, and he came back and told me they were out... so I gave up on dessert. :(

excerpts:
I had the roasted crab, shaken beef and garlic noodle. 
$37 for crab
$22-24 for shaken beef
$10 for garlic noodle
$4 for beer
shaken beef.author: Oby S.
shaken beef.review:
I had the roasted crab, shaken beef and garlic noodle. 
$37 for crab
$22-24 for shaken beef
$10 for garlic noodle
$4 for beer

The total come up to $80 something. I like the garlic noodle the most. It was creamy garlicky and it taste like pasta not what you expect from vietnamese noodle. 

Be warned: finding parking was hard like hell, unless you're willing to shell $10 for valet parking. I spent 15 minutes trying to find parking and got a small cramped spot at 4 blocks away next to the caltrain stops. 

Service was prompt and attentive. Price can be a little expensive. I think PPQ has similar taste for cheaper price and they have a parking lot next to the restaurant.

excerpts: Our typical order: mango/scallop/shrimp salad, shaken beef, garlic roast crab
The Ahn secret recipes of the garlic roast crab and noodles in the special little kitchen - these are a MUST.
A taste of heaven.
Seems like their shaken beef is using a different cut of beef (used to be tenderloin).
I've tried a bunch of other stuff on the menu, but haven't been blown away by them.
I've been meaning to try PPQ as a comparison...
Crustacean isn't as good in my opinion.
shaken beef.author: Cammy H.
shaken beef.review: 4.5 Stars. The food is still great here after all these years (and renovations) and they did well on service for our party of 14. Reservations needed and go early :). Our typical order: mango/scallop/shrimp salad, shaken beef, garlic roast crab***, garlic noodles*** (you have to eat these hot). The Ahn secret recipes of the garlic roast crab and noodles in the special little kitchen - these are a MUST. A taste of heaven. Seems like their shaken beef is using a different cut of beef (used to be tenderloin). I've tried a bunch of other stuff on the menu, but haven't been blown away by them. I've been meaning to try PPQ as a comparison...Crustacean isn't as good in my opinion. I'm close to reproducing the garlic noodles!!!

excerpts: When you go order the Drunken Crab, Shaken Beef, and Garlic Noodles.
If you do that you cannot go wrong!
shaken beef.author: Diane B.
shaken beef.review: Love it!  Basically it is like Nike you've just got to do it.  When you go order the Drunken Crab, Shaken Beef, and Garlic Noodles.  If you do that you cannot go wrong!

excerpts: the shaken beef was unusually too sweet
(i'm vietnamese ..
shaken beef.author: Anvy A.
shaken beef.review:
4 stars for this place? seriously? looks like a lot of the reviewers here haven't been to PPQ yet .. i'd give this place a 3.5 but can't bear to actually give it a 4 ..

the crab is good .. the garlic noodles are good .. but they're not superb .. the crabs are a lot smaller than at PPQ .. at PPQ, when you crack the shell, you can remove a big, fat morsel of juicy crab meat in all of the legs .. not so at thanh long .. and i ate at PPQ 2 weeks before so i think the comparison is fair .. 

the shaken beef was unusually too sweet (i'm vietnamese .. so i'd like to think i know what to expect) .. 

i don't think i'll be coming back here.

excerpts: That's all you need to know for Thanh Long (the shaken beef for those sadly allergic), even though you'll feel like having a heart attack after eating it due to the oil and butter.

Not as visually enticing inside as its clone Crustacean on California, but has a more laid-back vibe (you better reserve ahead of time though, unless you want to freeze in the Ocean Beach cold), although parking is somewhat of a hassle
so just pony up and valet to save 15 minutes of your life.
shaken beef.author: Ramon T.
shaken beef.review: Garlic noodles and the crab. That's all you need to know for Thanh Long (the shaken beef for those sadly allergic), even though you'll feel like having a heart attack after eating it due to the oil and butter. Not as visually enticing inside as its clone Crustacean on California, but has a more laid-back vibe (you better reserve ahead of time though, unless you want to freeze in the Ocean Beach cold), although parking is somewhat of a hassle so just pony up and valet to save 15 minutes of your life.

excerpts: (Shaken Beef) is only okay - Slanted Door and even Bodega Bistro do it better.
shaken beef.author: Jes H.
shaken beef.review: The roasted crab is pretty much insanely delicious, but pricey.  The garlic noodles indeed have some crack-like attributes, as noted by other yelpers.  The Vietnamese salad we had was fresh and tasty, but I suspect de-chile'd for the largely non-Asian clientele, and therefore not as good as it could have been.  Sea Bass was also outstanding, buttery and perfect, with a lovely ginger fruit sauce accompanying it.  Bo Luc Lac (Shaken Beef) is only okay - Slanted Door and even Bodega Bistro do it better.  The crab and garlic noodles are what really make it, though.

excerpts: The Shaken beef has pretty good flavor, but with $21.95, similar dish from R&G lounge will come double the portion, and R&G lounge is considered high-end and expensive.
The Garlic noodle is very so so, the noodle itself was overcooked and kind of sticky.
All in all, this is an overpriced restaurant with slightly above average food.
shaken beef.author: Daniel H.
shaken beef.review: We went to this place because of the good reviews, I think I really should have paid attention to the negative reviews. In short, the flavors of the food are pretty good, the price of the dishes are comparable to the high-end Chinese restaurant but the portion are ridiculously small. We have ordered three appetizers: crab puffs, buddha spring role and shrimp toast. All of them charge at least  $7.95+ , but I was so surprise when the waiter delivered us the plates, the buddha rice role has only one thin veggie rice role and cut into four pieces, for 8 bucks? this is insane, the crab puffs plate came with 6 fortune cookies with crab paste. And the shrimp toast came with 5 slices of shrimp pate over bacquets.  We also ordered roasted crab which is market price on the menu, the crab tasted pretty good, but it wasn't difficult dish to make, after all it is only roasted with salt, black pepper and butter, and it is about 1.5 lb, the restaurant charged us $37.95, consider a live crab from supermarket is $4 a lb, they are charging 6x market price, but the decoration and ambience of this place is that high-end. The Shaken beef has pretty good flavor, but with $21.95, similar dish from R&G lounge will come double the portion, and R&G lounge is considered high-end and expensive. The Garlic noodle is very so so, the noodle itself was overcooked and kind of sticky. All in all, this is an overpriced restaurant with slightly above average food.

excerpts: Anyway, our party also ordered the tamarind crab, asparagus soup, shrimp toast and either the Saigon beef or the shaken beef, I can't remember.
Those were ok.
I would not order the tamarind crab or the asparagus soup again though.
The beef was super tender and delicious, but it lacks some flavor.
I would not order the tamarind crab or the asparagus soup again though.
The beef was super tender and delicious, but it lacks some flavor.
It doesn't really taste like shaken beef.
I've had the marinade better at other places, but the tenderness here beats them all!!!
I'd definitely come back here and recommend this place to my friends.
It's better than the generic Asian foods in Chinatown!
shaken beef.author: Truc N.
shaken beef.review: Came here the other night for dinner and I was pretty impressed.  You wouldn't expect a restaurant like this to be located in this area.  I hope all the local San Franciscans know about this place and how good it is.  I really enjoyed the garlic noodles, salmon carpaccio, and the Lychee Martini!  I could drink like 100 of those!!!  It's sooo good!  Anyway, our party also ordered the tamarind crab, asparagus soup, shrimp toast and either the Saigon beef or the shaken beef, I can't remember.  Those were ok.  I would not order the tamarind crab or the asparagus soup again though.  The beef was super tender and delicious, but it lacks some flavor.  It doesn't really taste like shaken beef.  I've had the marinade better at other places, but the tenderness here beats them all!!!  I'd definitely come back here and recommend this place to my friends.  It's better than the generic Asian foods in Chinatown!

excerpts: my friend really loved it, then after being enticed by the Shaken Beef description we ended up with that and a whole roasted Crab w/ GARLIC NOODLES!!
I think I could eat 2 orders everyday for the rest of my life, which would be slightly shortened from the oil clogging my arteries, but maybe worth it!!
The bottle of wine we shared was also damn good, dont ask me the name, I was to tipsy to remember, good thing I live in the hood!!
shaken beef.author: Courtney D.
shaken beef.review: Holy garlic Noodles, I love me some crab but got seconds on the garlic noodles to go because my my friend that said he didn't want ANY noodles, ate more than half of them, cuz there so good! I have to say the crab was OK nothing amazing and mouthwatering as the last time I was here, maybe because we had a late dinner, I don't know. The place was packed, I had called about 45 Min's ahead of time to make reservation and waited literally half a nans second to be seated! Great service just for that, but everything else came out almost as fast, we had the salt & pepper calamari appetizer thought it was good my friend really loved it, then after being enticed by the Shaken Beef description we ended up with that and a whole roasted Crab w/ GARLIC NOODLES!! I think I could eat 2 orders everyday for the rest of my life, which would be slightly shortened from the oil clogging my arteries, but maybe worth it!! The bottle of wine we shared was also damn good, dont ask me the name, I was to tipsy to remember, good thing I live in the hood!!

excerpts: Aside from the garlic noodles and shaken beef (which I give both 5s), everything is over-priced.
Even with my dissatisfaction with this place, I continue to come back because you can't really get better garlic noodles or beef anywhere else.
shaken beef.author: Sally Trung N.
shaken beef.review:
Aside from the garlic noodles and shaken beef (which I give both 5s), everything is over-priced.  I've had much better crab for 1/3 the price and the portions for the appetizers and soup are ridicously small.  

Even with my dissatisfaction with this place, I continue to come back because you can't really get better garlic noodles or beef anywhere else.

excerpts: And then me and the hubs split a Roast Crab, order of Garlic Noodles and an order of the Shaken Beef.
The Crab was delicious although I didn't eat much of it....
I let my hubby have most of it.
shaken beef.author: BrElla4eva H.
shaken beef.review: I've been wanting to go here because I've heard so many good things about their crab and garlic noodles. I'm a big fan of anything with garlic....not so much a big fan of crab (mainly because it's so much work just to gather all the meat). First off, parking was a bitch....took us a lil over 30 minutes to even find a spot. We were with a couple of friends who have been there before (well actually they've been to Crustacean before which I hear has the exact same menu), so we basically followed their lead on what to order. We all shared an order of the calamari...which was good but nothing extraordinary. And then me and the hubs split a Roast Crab, order of Garlic Noodles and an order of the Shaken Beef. The Crab was delicious although I didn't eat much of it....I let my hubby have most of it. Loved the Garlic Noodles but the hubby wasn't as excited about it as I was. He thought it was kinda plain...as in it was just noodles....no veggies mixed in. As for the beef dish, I wouldn't order it again. It wasn't all that bad but just not my cup of tea. Overall, I enjoyed my dinner BUT I did think it was overpriced.

excerpts: We also had Calamari for appetizer( 2 thumbs up) and Shaken Beef ( I did not like it and sent it back)
The Shaken Beef had too much licorice/star anise flavor for my taste but the beef was really tender and cooked nicely.
You can tell they used high quality cuts of beef because it kind of melts in your mouth
it's so tender.
Maybe good for old people or babies with no teeth...
yes!
it's THAT tender.
Just wish the seasoning was a little different.
Oh yea..
I almost forgot about the drink i had..
I had a mango blended drink and it came in a tiny champaine glass.
I can't say that I will be back anytime soon because of the prices.. but it was definately worth it to try it for a special occasion!
I had the best crab ever here..
Mmmmm..
shaken beef.author: Jennifer H.
shaken beef.review: The crab was so fresh and there was so much crabmeat in one crab that it was enough for 2! Of course if you are eating here, you have to get Garlic Noodles..and Roast Crab. We also had Calamari for appetizer( 2 thumbs up) and Shaken Beef ( I did not like it and sent it back) The Shaken Beef had too much licorice/star anise flavor for my taste but the beef was really tender and cooked nicely. You can tell they used high quality cuts of beef because it kind of melts in your mouth it's so tender. Maybe good for old people or babies with no teeth... yes! it's THAT tender. Just wish the seasoning was a little different. Oh yea.. I almost forgot about the drink i had.. I had a mango blended drink and it came in a tiny champaine glass. I can't say that I will be back anytime soon because of the prices.. but it was definately worth it to try it for a special occasion! I had the best crab ever here..Mmmmm..

excerpts: When visiting, you must must must order the following dishes in order to ensure a fully satisfying meal: the roast crab, garlic noodles and shaken beef (extremely tender,flavorful beef cubes served over a bed of salad, cherry tomatoes, onions and cubed potatoes).
Follow those instructions and you'll thank me!
shaken beef.author: Liss E.
shaken beef.review: I've been a patron of this restaurant for at least 15 years. My parents used to take me to its sister restaurant Crustacean. When we discovered that there was a less expensive/casual sister restaurant, we tried it out and were hooked. Service is great, decor very mellow and quite romantic. All of their desserts are delicious so you won't be disappointed by any choice you make! My personal favorite is the lava cake. It's pretty rich so if sweet isn't your thing then pass on this. But the ice cream paired with it just makes it perfect! When visiting, you must must must order the following dishes in order to ensure a fully satisfying meal: the roast crab, garlic noodles and shaken beef (extremely tender,flavorful beef cubes served over a bed of salad, cherry tomatoes, onions and cubed potatoes). Follow those instructions and you'll thank me!

excerpts: We decided to order the Chicken Satay, Roasted Crab, Garlic Noodles, and Shaken Beef.
I'd have to say out of all four of the things we ordered, the Chicken Satay was my least favorite.
But the crab was yummy.
I loved the garlic noodles, even though they were SUPER garlic-y.
And the shaken beef was very good.
We even decided to have dessert and split the Fried Ice Cream and the Fried Pineapple with Ice Cream.
We only picked the fried pineapple because we'd never had it before, but I think we could skip it next time.
They only give you one pineapple ring and it's not that spectacular.
I'd stay with the Fried Banana.
So to round it up, still a solid 4 stars
and I'd definitely go back.
shaken beef.author: Kris L.
shaken beef.review: Visited Thanh Long again last night with Hue L. & our NYF (non-yelper friend) after three years.  We made reservations for a Saturday night at 8:00pm.  It was still totally packed, but we didn't have to wait at all because, as I said, we made reservations.  The vibe is pretty laid back here.  I mean, it really has to be when everyone is wearing a white plastic bib around their necks.  We decided to order the Chicken Satay, Roasted Crab, Garlic Noodles, and Shaken Beef.  I'd have to say out of all four of the things we ordered, the Chicken Satay was my least favorite.  But the crab was yummy.  I loved the garlic noodles, even though they were SUPER garlic-y.  And the shaken beef was very good.  We even decided to have dessert and split the Fried Ice Cream and the Fried Pineapple with Ice Cream.  We only picked the fried pineapple because we'd never had it before, but I think we could skip it next time.  They only give you one pineapple ring and it's not that spectacular.  I'd stay with the Fried Banana.  So to round it up, still a solid 4 stars and I'd definitely go back.

excerpts: So she needs to learn how to be very nice, cordial and professional, talk slowly and gently to the people who are their customers, especially the famous Roast Crab now costs $39;  the Shaken Beef is $24; and Garlic Noodles at $10 each + tax.

My bill totalled up almost $400 and I still got the feeling that they are trying to rush me out of the door after we ate the banana ala mode, which by the way had a rotten-black banana inside that thick fried flour, that is why I had to ask for another.
They all need to chill out.
The clerk needs to enroll in some telephone etiquette class real quick, otherwise, people will get upset with their piss-poor manners.
Oh BTW, does the An Family (Danny) still own and run this business
or it's been sold to those new owners?
I don't recognize anyone there anymore.
Not one familiar face anywhere.
That place is going down quite fast .
The service sucks.
It used to be nice.
shaken beef.author: Jimmie D.
shaken beef.review: Been a regular and eating at this Thanh Long since those $11.00 Roast Crab days in the mid-to late 80's.  The roast crab taste is constant, gotta luv it.  The service last night is not what it used to be.  Servers are in such a hurry that when they walk behind you, a tornado spins around and you know a server just came by.  They sure forgot to smile too and are no longer hospitable, accomodating  the way they used to be.  Even the manager is not friendly anymore.  All just straight business, all dollars and cents. They have lost that "family" atmosphere and feeling we used to get from that place.  The other bad thing about them lately?  The reservation clerk.  I called after 3pm Thursday and made a reservation and who ever answered my call made me feel like I was talking to a drill sergeant.  She was in a big hurry and just way-too harsh when she speaks.  You know, the kind that shows, "no respect" to the caller/patron?  So I asked her why she's too harsh, she said she takes in some 300 phone calls a day.  I did not want to be rude so I said, it's alright, it's ok.  I was still nice to her.  But in my mind, unless she's doing these as a volunteer for no-pay, which is out-of-the-question, it is safe to assume that she is an employee who's getting paid to answer that phone to take and cancel reservations.  So she needs to learn how to be very nice, cordial and professional, talk slowly and gently to the people who are their customers, especially the famous Roast Crab now costs $39;  the Shaken Beef is $24; and Garlic Noodles at $10 each + tax.  My bill totalled up almost $400 and I still got the feeling that they are trying to rush me out of the door after we ate the banana ala mode, which by the way had a rotten-black banana inside that thick fried flour, that is why I had to ask for another.  They all need to chill out.  The clerk needs to enroll in some telephone etiquette class real quick, otherwise, people will get upset with their piss-poor manners.  Oh BTW, does the An Family (Danny) still own and run this business or it's been sold to those new owners?  I don't recognize anyone there anymore.  Not one familiar face anywhere.  That place is going down quite fast .  The service sucks. It used to be nice.

excerpts: we ordered the roasted crab special, the garlic noodles, shaken beef, and two deserts (deep fried ice cream and molten lava cake)
sooo... it was definately not AMAZING, but it was pretty damn good!
i guess what i'm trying to say is that i really wouldnt go out of my way next time just to go there, however if im in the neighborhood, then absolutely!
the crab was delicious!
you're served a whole dungeness crab roasted in a POOL of olive oil, garlic salt and black pepper!
im almost certain my arteries are a bit clogged!
the garlic noodles are not so much of a huge deal as they are made out to be.
theyre just pretty much spaghetti noodles fried in oil and garlic salt.
boyfriend describes them as tasting like "garlic bread sticks
" i did not try the shaken beef itself
but i did try the sauteed veggies accompanying it
and it was amazing! perfectly carmelized and deliciously sweet!
yummy!
the deserts were on another level!
they were out of this world!
molten lava cake was moist and rich!
ice cream was silky and smooth!!!
the entire meal came out to $95.
its a fair price i suppose, considering the size of the crab and the rest of the meals we ordered!
the service was super quick!
we were in and
although there was a gang of people waiting, we were seated in just 10 minutes and served our meal probably another 10 minutes after ordering!
the wait staff was not very talkative but thats alright.
they were competent, thats all that matters!
P
shaken beef.author: Sandy P.
shaken beef.review: the boyfriend knows what a huge fan of crab i am so when he heard about thanh long, he knew he HAD to take me! last weekend, we made the trip from sacramento to san fransisco to see what all the fuss was about! we ordered the roasted crab special, the garlic noodles, shaken beef, and two deserts (deep fried ice cream and molten lava cake) sooo... it was definately not AMAZING, but it was pretty damn good! i guess what i'm trying to say is that i really wouldnt go out of my way next time just to go there, however if im in the neighborhood, then absolutely! the crab was delicious! you're served a whole dungeness crab roasted in a POOL of olive oil, garlic salt and black pepper! im almost certain my arteries are a bit clogged! the garlic noodles are not so much of a huge deal as they are made out to be. theyre just pretty much spaghetti noodles fried in oil and garlic salt. boyfriend describes them as tasting like "garlic bread sticks" i did not try the shaken beef itself but i did try the sauteed veggies accompanying it and it was amazing! perfectly carmelized and deliciously sweet! yummy! the deserts were on another level! they were out of this world! molten lava cake was moist and rich! ice cream was silky and smooth!!! the entire meal came out to $95. its a fair price i suppose, considering the size of the crab and the rest of the meals we ordered! the service was super quick! we were in and although there was a gang of people waiting, we were seated in just 10 minutes and served our meal probably another 10 minutes after ordering! the wait staff was not very talkative but thats alright. they were competent, thats all that matters! =P

excerpts: entrees: roasted crab (yummy - almost ate a whole crab by myself!), garlic noodles (kinda bland, not enough garlic), shaken beef (ok at best, much better at slanted door), seasonal vegetable saute (good, firm string beans), steamed rice (rice is rice).
for dessert, we had chocolate cake and fried pineapple, i think.
i don't have a sweet tooth
shaken beef.author: sandra l.
shaken beef.review:
i love crab. i love garlic. i love noodles. but, i didn't love thanh long. it was good but not great. i still prefer PPQ's food any day. 

for appetizers, we had the seafood dumplings (nothing special or fancy) and jumbo prawns wonton (good). entrees: roasted crab (yummy - almost ate a whole crab by myself!), garlic noodles (kinda bland, not enough garlic), shaken beef (ok at best, much better at slanted door), seasonal vegetable saute (good, firm string beans), steamed rice (rice is rice). for dessert, we had chocolate cake and fried pineapple, i think. i don't have a sweet tooth so desserts will always just be ok for me.  

oh, the bathroom was gross! they need to clean it more often. yuck. 

the service was excellent. very attentive. the ambiance was cute...not fancy like the sister restaurant crustaceans of course but still nice.

excerpts: We ordered Calamari, Mango Salad, Chicken fried Rice, Saigon Beef & Lemongrass Chicken.
The food was delicious, perfectly seasoned, fresh ingredients, meat was juicy and tender!
The only suggestion I have is the calamari was good, but a little dry.
I like having some sort of sauce with my calamari.
saigon beef.author: Laila A.
saigon beef.review:
I was in SF and a friend of mines raved about this spot. So I decided to check it out. 

The outside of the restaurant looks like a hole in the wall but once inside the ambiance of the restaurant is classy but casual at the same time. Nice dim lights, small bar and plenty of privacy. The parking in SF is a bi%#h, and we drove around a couple times before we decided to valet our car. The valet cost $12 (a little pricey, but that's SF for you) and the guy who did the valet was not the most pleasant person. Once inside, we were greeted by the host and the manager. They were busy with large parties but we were only a party of 3 and were sat right away. The server brought water out and gave us a chance to look over the menu. 

We ordered Calamari, Mango Salad, Chicken fried Rice, Saigon Beef & Lemongrass Chicken. 
The food was delicious, perfectly seasoned, fresh ingredients, meat was juicy and tender! The only suggestion I have is the calamari was good, but a little dry. I like having some sort of sauce with my calamari. Besides that, everything was A+. 

If you are in the SF area, u have to check this place out. They will not disappoint!

excerpts: For six of us, we ordered 2 of each of the following, unless noted otherwise:  Salt & pepper calamari ($11.95); Soft shell crab ($12.25); Garlic toast ($3.75); Spicy eggplant w/ shrimp (19.25); Lemon grass chicken ($19.25); Saigon beef ($24.95 - one); Bo luc lac ($25.50 - one); Garlic noodles ($10.95 - three); and Roasted crab ($48.95 - market price).
Secondarily, the soft shell crab was a tad overcooked and overpriced.
Nonetheless, is tasted good:  3 Stars.
Thirdly, the garlic toast was OK.
It didn't taste that garlicky.
TL's version of garlic noodles are the best I have had.
The noodles were al dente, weren't drowned in sauce, and the amount of garlic flavor was perfect.
No wonder so many places try to copy this dish:  5+++ Stars.
Secondarily, the roasted crab was excellent.
I used the head as a bowl.
The meat was moist and wonderfully seasoned.
I'd definitely come back here, but I'd stick to the seafood and garlic noodles that are excellent.
The turf dishes are not that good.
Lastly, most of the prices are high, but I was pretty full without the chicken, eggplant and soft shell crab that we added later.
saigon beef.author: Joe P.
saigon beef.review:
HTF does Thanh Long open in 1971, but I never came here when I lived in the Bay?  Just ignorant, I guess.  This place started the Viet seafood craze before it became fashionable.  TL is located on Judah b/t 46th & 47th in the Outer Sunset (3 blocks from beach).  Sister restaurants are Crustacean on Polk in SF and in Beverly Hills.

For six of us, we ordered 2 of each of the following, unless noted otherwise:  Salt & pepper calamari ($11.95); Soft shell crab ($12.25); Garlic toast ($3.75); Spicy eggplant w/ shrimp (19.25); Lemon grass chicken ($19.25); Saigon beef ($24.95 - one); Bo luc lac ($25.50 - one); Garlic noodles ($10.95 - three); and Roasted crab ($48.95 - market price).

First of all, the calamari was very good.  It had excellent flavor and was not greasy.  The only downside was the price:  4 Stars.  Secondarily, the soft shell crab was a tad overcooked and overpriced.  Nonetheless, is tasted good:  3 Stars.  Thirdly, the garlic toast was OK.  It didn't taste that garlicky.  We would have been better off with the mussels served on toast:  3 Stars.

For our main courses, the spicy eggplant was very good.  The eggplant was firm and not overcooked like many restaurants.  Downsides were there wasn't much shrimp and the price:  3 Stars.  Secondarily, the chicken was colorful, but the lemongrass really didn't stand out.  It too was overpriced:  3 Stars.  Our first beef dish didn't really do anything to excite us.  The flavor was OK, but like the other dishes, it was overpriced:  3 Stars.  On the other hand, the second beef dish was tender and nicely seasoned.  The only downside was the price:  4 Stars.  

Our last two dishes, were the best.  TL's version of garlic noodles are the best I have had.  The noodles were al dente, weren't drowned in sauce, and the amount of garlic flavor was perfect.  No wonder so many places try to copy this dish:  5+++ Stars.  Secondarily, the roasted crab was excellent.  I used the head as a bowl.  The meat was moist and wonderfully seasoned.  It wasn't as good as R & G in Chinatown, but it still was one of the two best dishes of the evening:  5 Stars.

Regarding the service, it was outstanding.  Our waitress was excellent, and took very good care of us.  She didn't write any of our orders down (inc drinks), and didn't miss anything.  The food came out quickly, and we were constantly given new bowls for our crab shells:  5 Stars.  On the other hand, the ambiance was just OK.  This place is a quaint cozy place.  However, the bathroom was kinda dirty, and the valet was expensive at $12:  3 Stars.

I'd definitely come back here, but I'd stick to the seafood and garlic noodles that are excellent.  The turf dishes are not that good.  Lastly, most of the prices are high, but I was pretty full without the chicken, eggplant and soft shell crab that we added later.

excerpts: The Saigon Beef was totally overpriced.
saigon beef.author: Phuong P.
saigon beef.review:
They have good chef, I agree. Food is delicious, but it's not Vietnamese style. I know their most popular item is the Crab, but it seems like casual dinner is too much to ask here. I won't write review about the Crab. I ordered Asparagus soup and the Hot and Sour soup. They tasted ok. The Saigon Beef was totally overpriced. 

But the most disappointing thing is customer service. We had 2 people, we didn't even have napkins. I could tell they might be busy taking care of other big families ordering crabs and so, but ignoring other small tables is not all right. We ordered food to eat with rice, but the hostess took it wrong with garlic noodle. When the rice came, our food was already cold. I mean, being Amercanized is acceptable, but this service way was totally out of Vietnamese-cuisine-scale.

It's a fancy restaurant. If you're looking for an Asian place, this place might work. If you're looking for a Vietnamese restaurant, then I would recommend moving forward to the next place on your Yelp list.

excerpts: I've also 'sampled' the Shaken Beef, the Sea Bass, and the Saigon Beef, all of which are very good.
I also think the calamari and mussel appetizers are very good.
saigon beef.author: Arnel L.
saigon beef.review:
Roast Crab and Garlic Noodles.  Why order anything else? Been here a dozen times in over a decade and I order the same thing EVERY time. Why?  Cause it's ALWAYS fantastic. Unhealthy as hell, but FANTASTIC!  I've also 'sampled' the Shaken Beef, the Sea Bass, and the Saigon Beef, all of which are very good. I also think the calamari and mussel appetizers are very good.  I think the calamari could be a little more crispy, but that's just me personal preference. 

They have a full bar and my wife tells me the Lychee Martini was very good. Runs about $10 a pop!

Parking sucks in the area. Valet parking is available for $12, otherwise expect to park 1-2 blocks away, and be prepared to circle the streets looking for parking. 

Reservations are a must. They get very crowded...despite the crappy parking situation.

excerpts: Saigon beef: This was surprisingly good.
The beef cubes were tender, and not at all chewy.
saigon beef.author: Michelle L.
saigon beef.review:
OMG I love Thanh Long.

Came here with my friend on a Thursday around 6:00 and the place was relatively empty. However, as our dinner progressed the restaurant started filling up with people. 

We ordered:

Roast crab: SO GOOD. I don't understand how they get the garlic flavor infused into the crab meat... but whatever they do it tastes delicious. I've had the drunken crab here before too, but i think I prefer the garlicky flavor of the roast crab more.

Saigon beef: This was surprisingly good. The beef cubes were tender, and not at all chewy. The sauce it was in wasn't too heavy, which i liked, and tasted good with the garlic noodles.

Garlic noodles: Definitely need to order this with the roast crab.

Between the two of us we finished almost everything, but had some noodles and a couple crab legs leftover.

Overall had a great experience at Thanh Long, and will probably come back again.

excerpts: Stay AWAY from the saigon beef, worse dish ever!
saigon beef.author: Vanessa K.
saigon beef.review:
Definitely the roast crab any other crab is not worth your time and money. The garlic noodles are good, but not as orgasmic as everyone describes it to be. They are garlicky, but I didn't like the choice of noodles, I'm sure there are better options out there.  Appetizers are good (stay away from dumplings, better at Kingdom of Dumpling) but expensive for the price. Stuffed squid was surprisingly delish! The calamari/squid was cooked perfectly, there was a crunch and not chewy at all. Great tomato sauce flavor and the stuffing was simple yet balanced. 

Stay AWAY from the saigon beef, worse dish ever! Do go for the shaken beef.

Desserts are nothing to wow about - creme brulee, fried banana with ice cream and molten chocolate cake. Pretty standard.

excerpts: I had the Saigon Beef, which was filet mignon thinly sliced to perfection with a slice of bacon and onion wrapped up and cooked perfectly.
The beef was on a bed of fresh greens, lightly grilled onions, and cherry tomatoes.
saigon beef.author: Vanessa F.
saigon beef.review:
The service here was absolutely top-notch. The staff was very kind, polite, and accommodating. We came here because a friend had recommended it. I'm not as adventurous as I'd like to think I am, so this was not a place I would have naturally gravitated towards- but I am so glad we did!

The food was great. I had the Saigon Beef, which was filet mignon thinly sliced to perfection with a slice of bacon and onion wrapped up and cooked perfectly. The beef was on a bed of fresh greens, lightly grilled onions, and cherry tomatoes. My husband had the famous garlic noodles, which I tried and they were delicious as well. My friend had the crab they are so famous for... Which I also tried. I have never had crab that was so savory and prepared so well- and I am a big fan of crab. 

Overall, this place was delicious and the service was excellent. We stayed until the place closed, and no one rushed us or made us feel unwanted. Very kind people, and that matters a lot to me. If you are ever in the area and have not tried this place out, I definitely recommend it!

excerpts: Being a Protein fiend, i wanted more protein with our dinner so we decided to get the Saigon beef too.
http://media1.px.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/td1A4gpMLMU2VIIIfjEp0g/l
The beef was very tender and had marvelous flavoring to it on top of a bed of salad.
Perfect!
it came with veggies!
Thanh Long was definitely worth
the 30min wait
but I know next time to MAKE RESERVATIONS!!!
Also its probably best to go during crab season, it can be steep when crabs are not in season.
saigon beef.author: Jonathan W.
saigon beef.review:
OMG.....I'm having a carb attack.....must have carbs!! Yes even i have carb cravings too!  oh snaps Thanh Long's garlic noodles!!!!! om nom nom nom  http://media2.px.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/Gr8HdUlQkj3BroRCbgYFTg/l
The gf and decided that roasted crab and garlic noodles sounded the best for a cheat day! Why not stuff yourself with carbs and buttery goodness! ;)  

The roasted crab was amazing, very buttery and peppered and went well with the amazing garlic noodles. The garlic noodles had just enough garlic flavor without being overpowering, so one order between two people was not enough. Yes! I just had to order a second one ;)  We also tried the Buddha roll as a started, lacking in size but excelling in taste, i would definitely recommend it. http://media1.px.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/RRbjQc-TiIc9VU9BYS-wWw/l Being a Protein fiend, i wanted more protein with our dinner so we decided to get the Saigon beef too. http://media1.px.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/td1A4gpMLMU2VIIIfjEp0g/l The beef was very tender and had marvelous flavoring to it on top of a bed of salad. Perfect! it came with veggies! ;). Thanh Long was definitely worth the 30min wait but I know next time to MAKE RESERVATIONS!!!  Also its probably best to go during crab season, it can be steep when crabs are not in season. Thanh Long won my heart and my stomach with their amazing garlic noodles, sorry PPQ but you are my second favorite now.

excerpts: We finally ordered some dishes and they were all pretty mediocre but the worst ones were the Traditional Vietnamese Salad Of Cucumbers and the Saigon Beef.
The chicken in the salad tasted like it had been cooked many days prior and thrown in the microwave a handful of times and the meat was way too chewy and lacking freshness.
saigon beef.author: Anna P.
saigon beef.review:
I would not wish this restaurant on my worst enemy! I don't think I have ever disliked a restaurant so much- this place doesn't deserve any stars! 

When I entered the restaurant,  I was taken completely by surprise- first time I had ever seen a Vietnamese restaurant look so fancy.  That's probably why I didn't think much of it when the staff completely looked down on us when my mom and I entered the restaurant.  We had been shopping all day so yea we did not have on our best clothes but we weren't wearing sweats either.  

Anyways, when I opened the menu, I was a little disappointed with the lack of choices they had.  I guess, that's why people love this place because it isn't your typical whole in the wall Vietnamese place hat has about 50 different choices of pho and that's pretty much it- instead they really emphasize their crab.  But because we are both allergic to crab, we didn't have many options to choose from.  We finally ordered some dishes and they were all pretty mediocre but the worst ones were the Traditional Vietnamese Salad Of Cucumbers and the Saigon Beef. The chicken in the salad tasted like it had been cooked many days prior and thrown in the microwave a handful of times and the meat was way too chewy and lacking freshness.  The prices certainly did not reflect on the quality of the food. 

Definitely do not go here if you do not plan on ordering crab!

excerpts: Along with an order of mussels, roasted crab, spicy eggplant, and saigon beef.
saigon beef.author: Lubs Y.
saigon beef.review:
Best garlic noodles ever. Our party of 4 devoured 3 plates of these. Along with an order of mussels, roasted crab, spicy eggplant, and saigon beef. And yet, some of us were still hungry for more!! 

Everything was delicious and I can't wait to come back!

Service was beyond exceptional...we arrived literally a minute before they stopped seating (9:45pm) and quickly put in our orders since we already decided what we had wanted on the drive up to SF from SJ. Our food came out within 10 minutes, which was perfect since we were all starving.

excerpts: I ordered the Saigon Beef, it was unassuming, and amazing.
The dish looked like large tater tots of beef sitting on a salad with dressing.
Anything but, the savory beef roll-ups were stuffed with prosciutto and swiss cheese, cooked medium rare, and smothered in a sauce that tasted like a peppery vinaigrette.
It was warm and went with the mixed salad greens surprisingly well, I would order this again, big portion too.
For dessert we had their Creme Brulee to share.
It was out in less than 5 minutes, golden brown, crisp top, and so creamy, it was delicious.
The atmosphere was great, from the outside
you think it's just a hole in the wall place, but it opens up into the huge two story restaurant that is wonderfully set up to be sound dampening.
I would go back, but not for what they are famous for, just for basically everything else.
saigon beef.author: Jared P.
saigon beef.review: Thanh Long has a great reputation, and deservedly so. My family and I recently went for Father's day. It was BUSY, I assume any holiday you want to get there early and definitely have a reservation. We got there at 5:30 and by 5:40pm when we were seated (with reservations for 6) the waiting area/bar was packed to unmovable. We were seated promptly and we had the cocktails we ordered in about 5 minutes, for 4 people that's pretty good when they are slammed. I had an Ohio Punch, this drink is like a fruit punch long island iced tea, delicious and you'll be set for the whole meal, I debated having another sincerely since it was apparently strong, good price at $8. We also ordered two garlic noodles to share ($11 each). Honestly the noodles arn't anything to write about, even though it's one of things they are famous for. A little dry, not a ton of garlic flavor, but then again if you mix it with any of the dishes it seems to come alive. The Garlic Crab we passed over, $48 for one maybe 2 pound crab, no thanks, couldn't even smell garlic when 10 of them passed by (-1 star). I ordered the Saigon Beef, it was unassuming, and amazing. The dish looked like large tater tots of beef sitting on a salad with dressing. Anything but, the savory beef roll-ups were stuffed with prosciutto and swiss cheese, cooked medium rare, and smothered in a sauce that tasted like a peppery vinaigrette. It was warm and went with the mixed salad greens surprisingly well, I would order this again, big portion too. For dessert we had their Creme Brulee to share. It was out in less than 5 minutes, golden brown, crisp top, and so creamy, it was delicious. The atmosphere was great, from the outside you think it's just a hole in the wall place, but it opens up into the huge two story restaurant that is wonderfully set up to be sound dampening. I would go back, but not for what they are famous for, just for basically everything else.

excerpts: He had crab and garlic noodles, his older daughter had prawns and garlic noodles and I had the Saigon beef (which I really thought was great!)
We all really liked the food...
my toddler loved the crab puffs and we all liked the calamari appetizers.
Server was pretty attentive
...all in all it didn't hurt to pay the bill, it's a little pricey but its worth it.
Would definitely go back for special occasions!
saigon beef.author: Diana D.
saigon beef.review: It was a good experience...fathers day with our two year old. He had crab and garlic noodles, his older daughter had prawns and garlic noodles and I had the Saigon beef (which I really thought was great!) We all really liked the food...my toddler loved the crab puffs and we all liked the calamari appetizers. Server was pretty attentive...all in all it didn't hurt to pay the bill, it's a little pricey but its worth it.  Would definitely go back for special occasions!

excerpts: Saigon beef salad.
Yum!
it's like the beef rolled up around an onion and grilled.
yum.
clean salad, with tons of flavor.
saigon beef.author: Judy N.
saigon beef.review:
dungeness Crab... So good! tons of flavor... I was the last to arrive at our dinner party (traffic and what-not...) and when I got there, they ordered more food, and my friends visiting still had room in their bellies to eat more when I arrived. (had room or the food was so good they had to eat more of it... same same... right? haha) 

Garlic noodles. tasty! but they use garlic powder. I think i can do this at home. 

Saigon beef salad. Yum! it's like the beef rolled up around an onion and grilled. yum. clean salad, with tons of flavor. :)

excerpts: I can't remember if we ordered the Saigon Beef or the Shaken Beef, but it was pretty tasty.
saigon beef.author: YL L.
saigon beef.review:
