My first time trying Thanh Long.  I thought it was decent.  I was pregnant when I tried it, so don't know if my pregnancy taste buds are kinda whack or what....

Sea bass - I love sea bass, but I'd take the baked sea bass you get at a Chinese restaurant over Thanh Long's.  Flavor was just okay. If I go back, I wouldn't order it again.

I can't remember if we ordered the Saigon Beef or the Shaken Beef, but it was pretty tasty.  I'd order it again.

Roasted crab was just okay.  Maybe because I had heard so many good things about it, my expectations were raised. I was a bit disappointed.  Husband just thought it was okay as well, though that didn't stop him for eating most of it.

Garlic noodles - yum. I would definitely order this again.

Fried pineapple with ice cream - Mmmm. A nice change from the fried banana.

excerpts: their saigon beef is also good, haven't really tried anything else cuz everytime
I go back
I always want to order the same thing.
saigon beef.author: Arthur C.
saigon beef.review:
Even though the food is a bit pricy

the food is definitly worth it the roasted garlic crab is mouthwatering the side dish of garlic noodle can not compare that to anything I've ever eaten just that it's really really really good. their saigon beef is also good, haven't really tried anything else cuz everytime I go back I always want to order the same thing. Oh by the way did I mention the garlic noodles.

excerpts: we also had the saigon beef...
let's just say that i think it's way overpriced.
saigon beef.author: Mei N.
saigon beef.review:
not as good as a remembered from years ago but it's still damn good.

of course the recommended is the crab and garlic noodles.... the garlic smell in your mouth lasts FOREVER. i brushed, listerined, brushed and listerined again... but the smell of garlic still wouldn't go away. don't let that scare you though... it's so f'ing good.

i prefer the drunken crab over the roast crab. mmm... besure to soak up the crab meat with the juices on your plate. 

we also had the saigon beef... let's just say that i think it's way overpriced. $19.95 for a few pieces of beef on top of a salad. 

and parking does get tight around that area. luckily they've got valet parking.

personal fave: drunken crab

excerpts: Anyway, our party also ordered the tamarind crab, asparagus soup, shrimp toast and either the Saigon beef or the shaken beef, I can't remember.
Those were ok.
I would not order the tamarind crab or the asparagus soup again though.
The beef was super tender and delicious, but it lacks some flavor.
I would not order the tamarind crab or the asparagus soup again though.
The beef was super tender and delicious, but it lacks some flavor.
It doesn't really taste like shaken beef.
I've had the marinade better at other places, but the tenderness here beats them all!!!
I'd definitely come back here and recommend this place to my friends.
It's better than the generic Asian foods in Chinatown!
saigon beef.author: Truc N.
saigon beef.review: Came here the other night for dinner and I was pretty impressed.  You wouldn't expect a restaurant like this to be located in this area.  I hope all the local San Franciscans know about this place and how good it is.  I really enjoyed the garlic noodles, salmon carpaccio, and the Lychee Martini!  I could drink like 100 of those!!!  It's sooo good!  Anyway, our party also ordered the tamarind crab, asparagus soup, shrimp toast and either the Saigon beef or the shaken beef, I can't remember.  Those were ok.  I would not order the tamarind crab or the asparagus soup again though.  The beef was super tender and delicious, but it lacks some flavor.  It doesn't really taste like shaken beef.  I've had the marinade better at other places, but the tenderness here beats them all!!!  I'd definitely come back here and recommend this place to my friends.  It's better than the generic Asian foods in Chinatown!

excerpts: The roasted crab, garlic noodles with tiger prawns, saigon beef, and seafood dumplings and some sauteed veggies would be my choice of a great dinner for 2.
saigon beef.author: Marcus Y.
saigon beef.review: Went there for my 10th Anniversary. I always loved this place MUCH better than Crustaceans on Polk. I think the atmosphere/decor/people/service makes it better.......the only downside is trying to find parking. The roasted crab, garlic noodles with tiger prawns, saigon beef, and seafood dumplings and some sauteed veggies would be my choice of a great dinner for 2.

excerpts: If your pockets are in the mood for spending you should also try the Saigon Beef, which is Filet Mignon over mixed greens.
They've got plenty other great things on the menu.
Parking is not so good in the area- arrive early if you had reservations or anything.
saigon beef.author: Rachel P.
saigon beef.review: I LOVE IT HERE! It is a pricey restaurant, but the food is delicious!!! Garlic noodles, and the crab are to die for!! Must order- even if that's the only thing you order there. You won't regret it at all! If your pockets are in the mood for spending you should also try the Saigon Beef, which is Filet Mignon over mixed greens. They've got plenty other great things on the menu.  Parking is not so good in the area- arrive early if you had reservations or anything.

excerpts: To our disappointment, the crab was over-cooked and served less than warm, the Saigon beef was uninspiring and the dish seem to have more potato and garnish than beef (where is the beef in this $24 dish?), the sauteed vegetables was tough, the fried ice cream was melting (sat out too long before served).
Only the garlic noodle was acceptable.
Overall a $150 tab for a plate of garlic noodle that we liked.
For a place like this, this kind of experience is simply unacceptable.
Now I feel the need to apologize to the people we have recommended this restaurant to, and I think this will be my final visit to Thanh Long.
Too bad, indeed!
saigon beef.author: S W.
saigon beef.review: We have been here often in the past and always had good experiences. As a matter of fact, we recommended Thanh Long to many of our friends here in the Bay Area and from out of town. We went back today, the place was packed, and we expected the quality to be as good as in the past. To our disappointment, the crab was over-cooked and served less than warm, the Saigon beef was uninspiring and the dish seem to have more potato and garnish than beef (where is the beef in this $24 dish?), the sauteed vegetables was tough, the fried ice cream was melting (sat out too long before served).  Only the garlic noodle was acceptable.  Overall a $150 tab for a plate of garlic noodle that we liked. For a place like this, this kind of experience is simply unacceptable. Now I feel the need to apologize to the people we have recommended this restaurant to, and I think this will be my final visit to Thanh Long.  Too bad, indeed!

excerpts: Lemongrass Chicken - Slices of chicken sauteed with seasonal vegetables, garlic & chili.
Pretty impressed by this one!
lemongrass chicken.author: Chelsea W.
lemongrass chicken.review:
Expensive Vietnamese restaurant known for roast crab & garlic noodles! You can't miss out on those here. This is not your typical place to get pho, in fact they don't have it!

Thanh Long is more of a seafood restaurant offering large dishes you can share family style. Most of the options run around $20, and the crabs will be around $50 each. Portions are on the smaller side. We shared 2 crabs, one serving of noodles, 3 large plates and a dessert between 4 people.

The restaurant is quite spacious and our waiter was very friendly. She helped clear our plates out since we practically overflowered our table! When I ordered I made sure to get all the popular dishes.

STARTERS 

Salt & Pepper Calamari - In a light salt and pepper batter, seasoned with scallions and red peppers. These were a great pick!

SOUPS

Vermicelli Noodle Consomme - Chicken, green onions, cilantro. The soup was clean tasting and good, the chicken was tender but I would've liked the noodles to have been the more traditional pho noodles rather than clear ones.

LARGE PLATES

Shaken Beef - Tender cubes of marinated New York steak flambeed in Chardonnay served with potatoes, mixed greens & cherry tomatoes. I'm not a beef person but this seemed good as well. Ours didn't come with potatoes though, but with onions.

Lemongrass Chicken - Slices of chicken sauteed with seasonal vegetables, garlic & chili. Pretty impressed by this one! Would order again for sure.

SECRET KITCHEN DISHES 

Roast Crab - A whole Dungeness crab roasted with An's garlic sauce & secret spices.

Garlic Noodles - An's famous noodles made with our special garlic sauce & secret spices. Super flavorful and very memorable. 

DESSERT 

Fried banana a la mode - With vanilla ice cream. For $8, the portions for the fried banana was tiny! The vanilla ice cream was way too frozen when served to us. There also was way too much whipped cream.

For the price point I would expect Thanh Long to be a more classy and upscale looking restaurant. It was great overall, but a bit on the pricier side for me. I would probably come on more special occasions.

excerpts: We also had lemongrass chicken and shaken beef which I also found bland.
Server was OK, but the water refillers were on point!
lemongrass chicken.author: Charlie B.
lemongrass chicken.review: If you find yourself here I would recommend getting an order of the garlic noodles. The noodles were definitely garlicky, but also buttery and just kind of melted in your mouth - so good. The crab that everyone raves about is just OK - it's fresh but seasoning is bland. We also had lemongrass chicken and shaken beef which I also found bland. Server was OK, but the water refillers were on point!

excerpts: We ordered Calamari, Mango Salad, Chicken fried Rice, Saigon Beef & Lemongrass Chicken.
The food was delicious, perfectly seasoned, fresh ingredients, meat was juicy and tender!
The only suggestion I have is the calamari was good, but a little dry.
I like having some sort of sauce with my calamari.
lemongrass chicken.author: Laila A.
lemongrass chicken.review:
I was in SF and a friend of mines raved about this spot. So I decided to check it out. 

The outside of the restaurant looks like a hole in the wall but once inside the ambiance of the restaurant is classy but casual at the same time. Nice dim lights, small bar and plenty of privacy. The parking in SF is a bi%#h, and we drove around a couple times before we decided to valet our car. The valet cost $12 (a little pricey, but that's SF for you) and the guy who did the valet was not the most pleasant person. Once inside, we were greeted by the host and the manager. They were busy with large parties but we were only a party of 3 and were sat right away. The server brought water out and gave us a chance to look over the menu. 

We ordered Calamari, Mango Salad, Chicken fried Rice, Saigon Beef & Lemongrass Chicken. 
The food was delicious, perfectly seasoned, fresh ingredients, meat was juicy and tender! The only suggestion I have is the calamari was good, but a little dry. I like having some sort of sauce with my calamari. Besides that, everything was A+. 

If you are in the SF area, u have to check this place out. They will not disappoint!

excerpts: We also tried the lemongrass chicken, which was good.
The seasonal stir fried vegetables were good as well.
Tried the orange sorbet cream for dessert- skip this.
Flavor was ok
but texture was so icy, as if it had been sitting in the freezer for too long.
Overall a good dining experience.
lemongrass chicken.author: Amelia S.
lemongrass chicken.review:
Had the go-to roasted crab and garlic noodles for dinner, and they did not disappoint.  Might want to ask about market prices on the crab, though!  We were charged $54 per crab!  Dang!
We also tried the lemongrass chicken, which was good.  The seasonal stir fried vegetables were good as well.  Tried the orange sorbet cream for dessert- skip this.  Flavor was ok but texture was so icy, as if it had been sitting in the freezer for too long.  Overall a good dining experience.

excerpts: We also had the lemongrass chicken which was full of flavor and slightly spicy.
lemongrass chicken.author: Kim S.
lemongrass chicken.review:
Great great great MEAL!!!!! From start to finish the service and food were awesome. We saw the restaurant on the travel channel and couldn't wait to taste the garlic noodles. Vacationing from New Jersey this was one of the first dinner reservations we made. We started with the mango salad and the Vietnamese salad. Both were flavorful and fresh. We shared entrees between the 8 of us. The favorite was the garlic noodles. They were extremely garlicky with a slight bite. We also had the lemongrass chicken which was full of flavor and slightly spicy. The red snapper was perfect  and the fried rice with chicken was moist and delicious.  For dessert we shared the creme brûlée cheesecake, fried banana and orange  sorbet which tasted like a delicious creamsicle. 
The service was as great as the food. Our server was attentive and efficient, paying attention to detail. We would highly recommend this restaurant and wish we could bring the garlic noodles to the east coast.

excerpts: We ordered the lemongrass chicken for Grandma.
The dish was so tasty and the vegetables so tender that the grandchildren ate a good portion of the dish.
We wonder if Grandma got enough to eat.
We probably should have ordered another dish of lemongrass chicken and steamed sea bass.
Alex and another server helped us take group pictures to commemorate the occasion.
We enjoyed our dinner tremendously.
lemongrass chicken.author: Belinda L.
lemongrass chicken.review:
It's been 21 years since we ate at this restaurant. The occasion then was my husband asking my parents for my hand in marriage. My sister wanted to celebrate my twin daughters' 18th birthday here. My husband made the reservation. There were only 2 reservations available a 5:30 p.m. or 8:30 p.m. We took the later one because of other obligations. There was a little bit of a wait for our table when we arrived.
Alex was our server. He got our water and hot jasmine tea going and answered questions about our menu choices such as how much roast crab and garlic noodles to order for our party of 10, which fish was the better choice, ... We went with 2 roasted crabs and 2 garlic noodles because Grandpa's dish of tiger prawns came with garlic noodles. There were 4 tiger prawns in the dish. The prawns were excellent. There weren't enough for everybody at the table. The garlic noodles always a hit with everybody especially the younger ones in the party. We had to order another garlic noodles and a large bowl of steamed rice. We had the salt and pepper calamari. We ordered the lemongrass chicken for Grandma. The dish was so tasty and the vegetables so tender that the grandchildren ate a good portion of the dish. We wonder if Grandma got enough to eat. The younger twin chose the steamed sea bass. It was a very good dish leaving everybody who had a chunk of the fish wanting more. The older twin enjoyed her shaken beef. The younger twin and her father thoroughly enjoyed the roasted crab and the big chunks of meat they got out of every leg.
The twins received complimentary desserts of ice cream in recognition of their birthday. The older twin shared a fried banana a la mode with her mother. Aunt and uncle also ordered another fried banana a la mode. The older twin liked the way the banana was fried. The fried layer was not thin. The vanilla ice cream tasted very natural. Little cousin ordered the lava cake with ice cream. We'll have to come back another time to try the homemade sorbet which is on the list of foods the younger twin can have not being able to tolerate milk products.
The roast crabs cost $55 each. We probably should have ordered another dish of lemongrass chicken and steamed sea bass.
Alex and another server helped us take group pictures to commemorate the occasion. We enjoyed our dinner tremendously.

excerpts: We also ordered lemongrass chicken and the taste was so bland, as if they half made the dish and didnt take cooking it seriously.
lemongrass chicken.author: Al L.
lemongrass chicken.review:
They premade everything in the restaurant so garlic rice that we ordered (the waitress came out with it like a minute after our final word on the order dropped) along w the crab that definitely was not fresh and had frozen crab attributes had to be sent back. We also ordered lemongrass chicken and the taste was so bland, as if they half made the dish and didnt take cooking it seriously.

Very disappointed by the hype and also with the fact that their roasted crab was charged 52.95$ and was not fresh at all. The restaurant overcharges a premium for a frozen crab ... .. .. I will unfortunately not be coming back and would be spreading the word of my experience here.

excerpts: Lemongrass chicken satay -
These grilled chicken skewers come numbering around three or four.
This was the first item that came out and everyone was hungry.
Playing the disappearing act in a poof, I only ate a sliver of a sliver sized piece.
My taste buds do not recall anything negative.
*Lemongrass chicken - Didn't I order something with lemongrass as an appetizer already?
I repeated "lemongrass" a couple times under my breath unsure of this when ordering.
We needed another dish for the non-seafood eaters at the table anyway.
Consisting of probably all dark meat, the chicken was very simplistically lemongrass-ed.
There were more bell peppers than I would have liked.
The noticeable echo of pepper flavor popped up again.
lemongrass chicken.author: Arnold T.
lemongrass chicken.review:
"500 hundred crabs will be served in one night..."...yada yada yada...we being first time customers were given the usual spiel.  My mind wondered, 'are cokes refillable?'...'where are the restrooms?'...'how much is 'market price'?'...'does the waiter know I'm not really paying attention?'

Back to reality...'did he say 500 hundred crabs?'  Where do they even keep that many crabs laying around I thought.  At that point, I wasn't sure if he mentioned it already, so to save some possible embarrassment I didn't inquire about the crabs, nodded, and just asked...'where are the restrooms?' 

Parking was more difficult than I expected as street parking sucked that day.  My laziness within grew with valet parking available tempting me.  The outrageous cost of $12 bucks and the thought of someone joy riding in my valuable antique of a Corolla didn't sit well with me.  The Sunset weather by the water was its usual half dreary self.  Contrast to the outside, inside the restaurant was vibrant and warm.  Aroma of good times filled the place; passing each table we saw at least one crab on the table.  Hold those horses...part of the waiter's yada yada yada included "90% of people order the crab".  

If it were me, our order would have consisted of all crab and garlic noodles.  Due to food allergies and cholesterol consciousness at the table, a full spectrum of dishes was chosen.  

OUR ORDER:     
*Lemongrass chicken satay - These grilled chicken skewers come numbering around three or four.  This was the first item that came out and everyone was hungry.  Playing the disappearing act in a poof, I only ate a sliver of a sliver sized piece.  My taste buds do not recall anything negative.  There were no complaints either.  

*Salt & pepper calamari - One of my sister's go to dishes no matter where, when, and how.  How can you go wrong with deep fried calamari?  You can't; unless they were soggy which these were not.  Salt and pepper were abundantly prevalent throughout.  The chunks of calamari were a larger size calamari than usual.  Bigger means more calamari meat and less batter.  Less batter is typically good thing.  

*Shaken beef - Shaken, not stirred...I didn't taste the "shaken", but the cubes of meat were very tender.  Served on a bed of green and mixed in with some potato, the meat has a sharp peppery taste.  I recommend this for people with seafood allergies that come here.    
  
*Lemongrass chicken - Didn't I order something with lemongrass as an appetizer already?  I repeated "lemongrass" a couple times under my breath unsure of this when ordering.  We needed another dish for the non-seafood eaters at the table anyway.  Consisting of probably all dark meat, the chicken was very simplistically lemongrass-ed.  There were more bell peppers than I would have liked.  The noticeable echo of pepper flavor popped up again.  I wonder how much pepper this restaurant uses in a day.   

*"Colossal" royal tiger prawns with garlic noodles - My main chagrin about this plate was the adjective "colossal" attached to the prawns.  All the pictures I saw, they looked humongous.  I bet the picture I took even look gigantic.  Truly, it is an optical illusion.  While unexpectedly smaller they were also a smidgen on the salty side for me.  Overdosed on seasoning, the prawns sat on top of garlic noodles.  The spillover of seasoning into the garlic noodles unassumingly enhanced the noodles.  The garlic noodles are good by themselves; the extra touch of seasoning really made the whole that much better.  If I go again, I'll pass on this one, but was decent. 

*Roast crab - Presentation is absolutely photogenic.  I'm talking about super model level.  The crab was very meaty and a nice size.  They really saved the best for last, as this was the last entrée to be served.  Cut down the middle with all the legs intact, the shell of the crab is ornamentally placed on top of the legs.  Their "garlic sauce and secret sauce" fully cooked into the crab meat and needless to say, I started to dip some noodles in the dressing.  It was good stuff.  To nitpick, freshness rating of the crab wasn't A+, rather an A-.    
 
*Steamed rice - That's how my dad rolls.  Can't go anywhere without it.  I had to add this one or it wouldn't be a complete review.  The white rice came in a bowl and tasted...rice-like.  My dad thoroughly enjoyed it with a big smile.

Thanh Long is an Americanized Vietnamese restaurant that is versatile enough to draw even the most Asian of Asians.  If you read the articles down the hallway to the restroom, there's a feel good story behind restaurant's owners (Remember that question about where the restrooms were?  Yeah...there was a line and I had some time to read.).  The main attraction is their crab and garlic noodles.  Get it, and be one of the daily 500!

excerpts: Our dinner consisted of one of each of the soups, salt and pepper calamari, collasal tiger prawns over garlic noodles, lemongrass chicken, vegetarian entree, chicken fried rice, and an extra order of garlic noodles.

The salt and pepper calamari was good as well, served sizzling hot, with a good combination of salt AND pepper, but for a couple of the outlying pieces, there was definitely a lot more salt than pepper.
The main dish I liked the most was the collasal tigerl prawns over garlic noodles.
The noodles were seasoned to perfection and it got my whole family scooping for more.
The prawns were pretty good as well, although I could definitely taste the layer of butter in between those suckers.
However, I'm not too sure how to justify 4 pieces of prawn over a bed of garlic noodles for 37 bucks.
lemongrass chicken.author: Ada C.
lemongrass chicken.review:
Mixed feelings about Thanh Long, after reading all the awesome reviews about this place, I had high expectations as I made reservations for a party of 5 on a Friday night. 

Upon arrival, we were immediately greeted and seated. Customer service was pretty on point, the waiter was friendly and attentive. He memorized our order (which was quite a few items) without writing it down, but sadly forgot one of the appetizers. All good, since I'm sure we over ordered anyways.

Our dinner consisted of one of each of the soups, salt and pepper calamari, collasal tiger prawns over garlic noodles, lemongrass chicken, vegetarian entree, chicken fried rice, and an extra order of garlic noodles. Although the serving size wasn't as big as we had pictured, this was more than enough for the 5 of us, so in retrospect, the serving size was pretty decent.

Out of all the soups, we all voted that the vegetarian soup was the best. Something about the clear broth and the assorted veggies just made it more refreshing versus the creamy aspargus chowder or the chicken vermecelli soup.

The salt and pepper calamari was good as well, served sizzling hot, with a good combination of salt AND pepper, but for a couple of the outlying pieces, there was definitely a lot more salt than pepper. 

As for the entrees, it was pretty mediocre, not fabulous, but not disgusting or unedible. There was just nothing outstanding about the meal. The main dish I liked the most was the collasal tigerl prawns over garlic noodles. The noodles were seasoned to perfection and it got my whole family scooping for more. The prawns were pretty good as well, although I could definitely taste the layer of butter in between those suckers. However, I'm not too sure how to justify 4 pieces of prawn over a bed of garlic noodles for 37 bucks. Seems a little bit outrageous.. pretentious to some.

Again, like I said, the meal wasn't bad, but for the price of the dishes, I was expecting something more amazing. Overall, a good dining experience, food was pretty good, glad I tried it once, but nothing coaxing me to be back for another round.

excerpts: Lemongrass chicken (chicken, vegetables, garlic, and chili)
lemongrass chicken.author: Cici T.
lemongrass chicken.review:
Drunken crab and a garlic hangover? Yes, please!

It was a foggy summer night, the last time I came to Thanh Long for dinner. After ollaliberry picking in Pescadero and mussel hunting in Half Moon Bay, my sunkissed friends and I wanted to end the night with a bang and decided to treat ourselves to juicy, plump crab and some dressed up garlic noodles!

Here was our order:
Drunken crab (simmered in Chardonnay, sake and brandy; scallions, chives, and cracked black pepper)
Roast crab (roasted with garlic sauce and "secret" spices)
Garlic noodles (3 orders please!)
Thanh Long spicy eggplant (jumbo prawns, chicken, basil, baby corn!, shitake mushrooms, eggplant!)
Lemongrass chicken (chicken, vegetables, garlic, and chili)

Oh was it a feast! Among the five of us, we cleared our table.

Caution: The taste of garlic from the garlic noodles is potent! After your meal, brush your teeth and tongue, gargle mouthwash, and that taste and smell is not so easily ditched! Hence the garlic hangover.

excerpts: Ordered the mango salad, garlic noodles, lemongrass chicken.
Bill came out to be $43 dollars.
My friends weren't a fan of the lemongrass because it has a strong taste, but I loved it- being a fan of lemongrass flavor all the way back from Thailand!
The garlic noodles was flavorful, but was a bit salty.
Still good and would order it!
The mango salad's dressing tasted fabulous too!
lemongrass chicken.author: Vivian L.
lemongrass chicken.review:
Finally came here last night with great company!

Ordered the mango salad, garlic noodles, lemongrass chicken. Bill came out to be $43 dollars. My friends weren't a fan of the lemongrass because it has a strong taste, but I loved it- being a fan of lemongrass flavor all the way back from Thailand! The garlic noodles was flavorful, but was a bit salty. Still good and would order it! The mango salad's dressing tasted fabulous too!

excerpts: I've tried the salmon carpaccio, lemongrass chicken satay, and mango salad.
I wasn't really impressed.
lemongrass chicken.author: Laina T.
lemongrass chicken.review:
If you're a crab lover like I am, you'll love Thanh Long.  Skip the appetizers.  I've tried the salmon carpaccio, lemongrass chicken satay, and mango salad.  I wasn't really impressed.  Order the roasted crab and garlic noodles!!!  They're to die for.  The crab is fresh and big.  The flavor of butter and cracked pepper just explodes in your mouth.  I'm a big eater so I always have to have my own crab and another entrée.  Stick to the roasted crab instead of the tamarind crab.  The sauce on the tamarind crab is a little sweet for my taste buds.  The Thanh Long spicy eggplant is good, but nowhere near spicy.  As for dessert, don't get the bread pudding.  The orange sorbet was good and the presentation was clever.  It's a frozen orange sliced across the top with orange sorbet inside.  It's nice, light, and a good ending to any meal.  

At about $40 per crab, it's not cheap.  It's a good place for special occasions or if you just want to satisfy your craving for really good crab.  The atmosphere is casual so there's no need dress up.  Get your hands dirty and enjoy!

excerpts: Dishes are very pricey: lemongrass chicken was $18.95 for a dish that would sell elsewhere for 8 to 10....
Crab is there specialty but seriously, $48 dollars??
Nevertheless, the place was packed
but I was NOT a fan and won't go back.
The staff is harried and on the run constantly.
You get the feeling they want you in and out quickly.
lemongrass chicken.author: Brent O.
lemongrass chicken.review: Overpriced, overcrowded and noisy. Dishes are very pricey: lemongrass chicken was $18.95 for a dish that would sell elsewhere for 8 to 10.... Crab is there specialty but seriously, $48 dollars?? Nevertheless, the place was packed but I was NOT a fan and won't go back. The staff is harried and on the run constantly. You get the feeling they want you in and out quickly.

excerpts: Vietnamese salad pretty good as was the lemongrass chicken.
The space is 70s chic in an unflattering way.
Nice to have a full-bar though.
Prices are a bit higher than I'd like to spend.
lemongrass chicken.author: Catherine C.
lemongrass chicken.review: Garlic noodles and roast crab are legit! Definitely worth the price and trek to the Avenues. Vietnamese salad pretty good as was the lemongrass chicken. The space is 70s chic in an unflattering way. Nice to have a full-bar though. Prices are a bit higher than I'd like to spend.

excerpts: However, the waitress has messed up my order and got me the Lemongrass Chicken dish.
As for the Lemongrass Chicken, that was also alright.
Again, I am not a fan of Lemongrass
lemongrass chicken.author: Roger C.
lemongrass chicken.review:
It was nice to actually come here. Well, I can't say too much though because my first taste of the An Family Food was at their sister restaurant Crustaceans in SF 3/4 years ago for my birthday. So it was great to finally come to the place where it sort of originally started. Thanks to my friend Edmund, as we came here to celebrate his birthday!

Note: I did not eat the crab because I was broke as a joke and market price for the crab was around 40 dollars. So I kept it light. I decided to just order the famous garlic noodles and I had also ordered the Broiled chicken which sounded delicious. However, the waitress has messed up my order and got me the Lemongrass Chicken dish. It sucked because I really wanted to try the Broiled chicken, I am not a huge fan of Lemongrass. Me, being a nice guy decided to just keep the dish because I didn't want to have the dish get thrown out and go through the trouble of making me a new one.

As for the garlic noodles, its not as good as what I remember having at crustaceans. Honestly, I felt like I could make my own garlic noodle at home that taste similar. Hmm, yea I was not too impressed. As for the Lemongrass Chicken, that was also alright. Again, I am not a fan of Lemongrass but I didn't want to have the waitress redo my order.

Overall, I give Thanh Long's 3 stars. For what I had, I did not think it was worth the 35 dollars. Again though, I didn't have the famous crab, so I guess you could say my review isn't doing much justice to Thanh Long. But again, this place is famous for the crab and garlic noodles, so DO TRY.

excerpts: We started with their mango salad followed by their lemongrass chicken, eggplant dish, and of course as mentioned - garlic noodles w/ grilled shrimps.
The entire dining experience was excellent despite one of my co-workers getting served tepid coffee.
It was immediately dealt with by our server
so no harm was done.
Next time, we're going for their specialty which is their crab dinner.
Highly recommended.
lemongrass chicken.author: Chad B.
lemongrass chicken.review:
It has been several years since I last dined at this restaurant. We went here to celebrate a mini retirement party and we definitely had a one fantastic dinner. As always their garlic noodles coupled with their shrimps were just deliciously mouth-watering, that it was the first to go. We started with their mango salad followed by their lemongrass chicken, eggplant dish, and of course as mentioned - garlic noodles w/ grilled shrimps. The entire dining experience was excellent despite one of my co-workers getting served tepid coffee. It was immediately dealt with by our server so no harm was done.
Next time, we're going for their specialty which is their crab dinner. Highly recommended.

excerpts: A friend and I ordered the lemongrass chicken and garlic noodles to share.
They both had great flavor.
The garlic noodles especially were a surprise.
I was expecting an overpowering garlic spice
but they had all the flavor and none of the bite some garlic dishes can have.
lemongrass chicken.author: Amy C.
lemongrass chicken.review: I love garlic and they are doing it right. A friend and I ordered the lemongrass chicken and garlic noodles to share. They both had great flavor. The garlic noodles especially were a surprise. I was expecting an overpowering garlic spice but they had all the flavor and none of the bite some garlic dishes can have.

excerpts: Had the lemongrass chicken and garlic noodles.
Both were very good.
Shared the two dishes between a friend and myself.
Plenty of food for a light dinner.
Maybe not the best choice for right before a plane ride.
Garlic!!!
(Totally worth it)
lemongrass chicken.author: Sarah C.
lemongrass chicken.review: Yum! Had the lemongrass chicken and garlic noodles. Both were very good. Shared the two dishes between a friend and myself.  Plenty of food for a light dinner. Maybe not the best choice for right before a plane ride. Garlic!!! (Totally worth it)

excerpts:
i ended up switching entrees with a friend though, and enjoyed her tiger prawns and a dish i don't recall for sure, but it was definitely chicken with veggies (now looking at the menu it must have been the lemongrass chicken), and it was like the comfort food I needed to end the meal in a happy place. 
I would head back though, and repeat my starters again, though the next time, I would probably try the drunken beef or crab to appeal my palate, which I tend to ignore in favor of the "safer" stuff.
Very good service as well, which always adds to the meal!
lemongrass chicken.author: Danielle D.
lemongrass chicken.review:
When my girls and I go out to eat, we EAT.
So this is what I remember from the night's festivities, once the food coma wore off:
Salmon carpaccio, the Buddha roll, the prawn bouillabaisse, garlic noodles, the roast crab, tiger prawns and the steamed sea bass. In a word, YUM. Come hungry though, because you will want to indulge in all kinds of different flavors, and the menu is versatile enough to do so. I got my salt from the yummy carpaccio, "fresh" from the spring roll-esque Buddha roll, tang from the bouillabaisse (though I will say I did not expect such a seemingly random selection of different veggies/fruit to taste good together...I was kinda like, "um...why are there tomatoes and pineapple together to complement my seafood soup?" but it was actually pretty enjoyable), bitter (in a good way, though my breath was banging after all the garlic!) from the noodles, and boredom from the main entrees. the sea bass and the crab...i guess i just wanted more flavor?... i ended up switching entrees with a friend though, and enjoyed her tiger prawns and a dish i don't recall for sure, but it was definitely chicken with veggies (now looking at the menu it must have been the lemongrass chicken), and it was like the comfort food I needed to end the meal in a happy place. 
I would head back though, and repeat my starters again, though the next time, I would probably try the drunken beef or crab to appeal my palate, which I tend to ignore in favor of the "safer" stuff.
Very good service as well, which always adds to the meal!

excerpts: I ordered: garlic noodles, dungeness crab in An's garlic sauce, Colossal Royal Tiger Prawns w/ more garlic noodles, lemongrass chicken fry dish, and a sea bass dish.
The garlic noodles were very good, but again very oily and heavy.
The lemongrass chicken is nothing special.
lemongrass chicken.author: edie t.
lemongrass chicken.review:
cleanliness: 5/5
food quality: 4/5
service: 4/5 
cost: unknown
other: parking is horrible. I spent 15 minutes looking for a resonable space until finally i parked 5 blocks away

I came here for a birthday dinner (party of 6) on a Saturday night. It was my first time here and heard positive reviews from friends/family. I'm not a big seafood person, but I'll eat it if i have to.

I ordered: garlic noodles, dungeness crab in An's garlic sauce, Colossal Royal Tiger Prawns w/ more garlic noodles, lemongrass chicken fry dish, and a sea bass dish.

I did not get to try to seabass dish so no review on that. The dungeness crab was pretty good. It was very oily and garlicy. the meat was good and the portions were well sized. The garlic noodles were very good, but again very oily and heavy. Not  garlicy to the point where you are hesitant to speak, but still you should have a mint or something to be considerate of others.

The lemongrass chicken is nothing special. It was like a chicken fry dish that you could find at most decent chinese restaurants.

The service was okay. Dishes were brought out promptly and served hot. The supporting staff could have done a better job of refreshing our shell bowls and refilling our beverages (needed a beverage to clear the oil from all the dishes).

I would probably come here again if someone wanted to, but since i'm not a big crab eater I wouldn't actively seek any seafood places. The prices were up there and it is a very busy and loud environment. if you are looking for a place to celebrate a graduation or a small birthday party this place was good. 

They take reservations, but will not seat you until your entire party arrives so tell your friends/family to be on time. Be sure to allow plenty of time to park or bring some walking shoes. Valet is available, but i opted not to use it. 

there is also a cake cutting fee of $1 per person

excerpts: and I had also ordered the Broiled chicken which sounded delicious.
It sucked because I really wanted to try the Broiled chicken, I am not a huge fan of Lemongrass.
broiled chicken.author: Roger C.
broiled chicken.review:
It was nice to actually come here. Well, I can't say too much though because my first taste of the An Family Food was at their sister restaurant Crustaceans in SF 3/4 years ago for my birthday. So it was great to finally come to the place where it sort of originally started. Thanks to my friend Edmund, as we came here to celebrate his birthday!

Note: I did not eat the crab because I was broke as a joke and market price for the crab was around 40 dollars. So I kept it light. I decided to just order the famous garlic noodles and I had also ordered the Broiled chicken which sounded delicious. However, the waitress has messed up my order and got me the Lemongrass Chicken dish. It sucked because I really wanted to try the Broiled chicken, I am not a huge fan of Lemongrass. Me, being a nice guy decided to just keep the dish because I didn't want to have the dish get thrown out and go through the trouble of making me a new one.

As for the garlic noodles, its not as good as what I remember having at crustaceans. Honestly, I felt like I could make my own garlic noodle at home that taste similar. Hmm, yea I was not too impressed. As for the Lemongrass Chicken, that was also alright. Again, I am not a fan of Lemongrass but I didn't want to have the waitress redo my order.

Overall, I give Thanh Long's 3 stars. For what I had, I did not think it was worth the 35 dollars. Again though, I didn't have the famous crab, so I guess you could say my review isn't doing much justice to Thanh Long. But again, this place is famous for the crab and garlic noodles, so DO TRY.

excerpts:
the cubes are always tender and the flavor really pairs well the rice or noodles

Broiled chicken: not as good as the shaken beef with the chicken a bit harder to chew on (almost jerky like).
broiled chicken.author: Arbel D.
broiled chicken.review:
3 times I've been here (1 with Yelp) and 3 times I've devoured and enjoyed their Garlic Roasted Crab and Garlic Rice. That's right Garlic Rice! Although they are more known for the Noodles, it's the rice that keeps me happy, the noodles are an excellent alternatives.

Shaken beef: for those not into crab or seafood this is really good alternative. the cubes are always tender and the flavor really pairs well the rice or noodles

Broiled chicken: not as good as the shaken beef with the chicken a bit harder to chew on (almost jerky like). flavor wise it was pretty good even without the rice or noodles.

dessert: foregoing the chocolate molten cake which is a favorite, i tried something different and chose the deep-fried ice cream.  glad i did, because it was very very good. I expected a globe of breading that was so thick and so hard. Instead it was a light breading, like tempura yet the ice cream was not completely melted. with a drizzle of chocolate and whip cream and paired with vietnamese ice coffee it was a good way to end the dinner

the only bad was the seating location, our party ended up below the air vents, so a constant blast of cool air was making me a bit chilly

if you're don't mind splurging a bit for the family, Thanh Long is excellent place to go

excerpts: I have come to luvvvvvv the wok egg noodles with chicken ($13.95)
I'd walk in and get those noodles to go!

Drive to the beach and watch the sun set........  
Customer service, as usual is always on point.
Oh and I always find parking.
I know there's a parking problem in the sunset area.
Especially if you go on the weekends.
I would use valet.
You'll be walking those long San Francisco blocks, or be driving around for a awhile.
Happy Eating!!!!!
wok egg noodles.author: Lina D.
wok egg noodles.review:
Do not leave with out trying the garlic noodles($9.50).... Simply delish! Drawback- you'll taste the garlic for hours on end! So worth it though. The roast garlic crab around ($40) is to die for, believe me.......
Jumbo prawn wontons ($10.50) and the lemon grass beef ($8.95) is also pretty good. If you want to have a few starters. The alcohol beverages are not bad as far as taste, but for nearly $10 a drink they could be better.  I have come to luvvvvvv the wok egg noodles with chicken ($13.95) I'd walk in and get those noodles to go! Drive to the beach and watch the sun set........  
Customer service, as usual is always on point. Oh and I always find parking. I know there's a parking problem in the sunset area. Especially if you go on the weekends. I would use valet.  You'll be walking those long San Francisco blocks, or be driving around for a awhile.
 Happy Eating!!!!!

excerpts: Vegetarian Delight-Wasn't too impressed with it.
It tasted a little bland
vegetarian delight.author: Bella T.
vegetarian delight.review:
Me and my Husband were in SF for the weekend and our relatives brought us here for dinner. Its a nice and cozy family style restaurant.
Our Orders:

1. Garlic Noodles-I've read lots of reviews about it.It was tasty, but after eating it for quite sometime you'll feel that you need to stop.Probably the garlic taste?

2. Vegetarian Delight-Wasn't too impressed with it.It tasted a little bland but it had a good amount of different veggies and tofu.

3.Colossal Royal Tiger Prawns-The prawns came with garlic noodles.Prawns were flavorful and yummy.

4. Drunken Crab-Honestly after tasting the roast crab, the drunken crab tastes a little bland.

5. Roast Crab-The best!It was so flavorful!Crab was tender and you just feel like you can't stop.

Dessert we ordered fried pineapple with ice cream and it was a great ending to our dinner.Would definitely go back for the roasted crab.Service was excellent.

Best time to come is at 5:30 or maybe a little before 6pm.After that the line starts.Or better call and reserve a place.Enjoy!

excerpts: The flavors of the roast crab is intense and I definitely recommend the vegetarian delight.
The sweet tang is a great balance to the crab.
The staff were so friendly and attentive (without being over bearing).
They are great with kids as the staff were engaging my 4 year old often.
vegetarian delight.author: Peter W.
vegetarian delight.review: Thanh Long has become my wife and I's anniversary spot.  The food like most reviews on yelp is just freaking awesome!  The flavors of the roast crab is intense and I definitely recommend the vegetarian delight.  The sweet tang is a great balance to the crab.  The staff were so friendly and attentive (without being over bearing).  They are great with kids as the staff were engaging my 4 year old often.

excerpts: I tried the roasted crab, garlic noodles, shaken beef, fried rice, and vegetarian delight.
Everything just seemed so average, nothing special.
The crab was tasty, but because the shells weren't cracked, I had to work hard to get the meat out.
The garlic noodles were kind of dry, and the shaken beef was pretty tough.
I'm glad I tried this place out, but I probably won't be eating here again.
The garlic noodles were kind of dry, and the shaken beef was pretty tough.
I'm glad I tried this place out, but I probably won't be eating here again.
vegetarian delight.author: Rachel H.
vegetarian delight.review: I know I'm in the minority, but I really don't get what the hype is about. I think this place is overrated. I tried the roasted crab, garlic noodles, shaken beef, fried rice, and vegetarian delight. Everything just seemed so average, nothing special. The crab was tasty, but because the shells weren't cracked, I had to work hard to get the meat out. The garlic noodles were kind of dry, and the shaken beef was pretty tough. I'm glad I tried this place out, but I probably won't be eating here again.

excerpts: Vegetarian Delight was described as silken tofu sauteed with assorted vegetables and shitake mushrooms.
I know this is a Vietnamese restaurant, but I am really used to eating a Chinese version of this with a crispy-fried tofu.
The tofu was a mushy-soft texture, and the vegetable selection was meager.
The dish size overall was small.
vegetarian delight.author: Jeanne L.
vegetarian delight.review:
Versus PPQ, the other dungeness crab powerhouse of SF, this place loses for both taste and price... for all dishes.

We ordered the Roasted Crab, Drunken Crab, and the Tamarind Crab.  The latter was definitely my favorite for it's very unique sweet tangy flavor. The flavoring of the Roasted crab was somewhat more oily and not as flavorful/garlicy as the one from PPQ.  (Most of all, I really missed the incredibly delicious dry flavor of the Peppercorn crab from PPQ.)

The Garlic Noodles here were on the softer side compared to PPQ, and I really prefer a nice firm al dente noodle with a bit of a chew to it.

The Colossal Royal Tiger Prawns were a huge letdown. There were .. 5 or 6 prawns only.

Vegetarian Delight was described as silken tofu sauteed with assorted vegetables and shitake mushrooms.  I know this is a Vietnamese restaurant, but I am really used to eating a Chinese version of this with a crispy-fried tofu.  The tofu was a mushy-soft texture, and the vegetable selection was meager.  The dish size overall was small.  I was not delighted.

$32 per person, group of 9 people.  It was pricey considering how unsatisfied we were for quality/quantity of food.  Sorry, this is what happens when you compare against PPQ.

http://www.yelp.com/biz/ppq-dungeness-island-san-francisco-2#hrid:yChlljno2CCweXgXWfyfpw/src:self

excerpts: I ordered the Vegetarian Delight: silken tofu with veggies and shiitake mushrooms over rice.
Y-U-M-M-M!!!
I could totally throw in a few more M's
but I'll spare you the eyesore.
This dish was truly a delight.
Platter presentation was exquisite but the satisfaction came with each bite.
There was adequate amount of tofu and vegetables
vegetarian delight.author: Cat V.
vegetarian delight.review:
Definitely coming back!

Came here for a birthday dinner; there were 12 of us.  Not only were they able to accommodate our large party, but they were able to do so with incredible ease and flair.  I was truly impressed.  

They were BUSY on this Friday night.  But delivered such excellent customer service and a memorable dining experience they truly deserve five stars.

We were seated in their dining area upstairs away from the chaos what was downstairs.  Mind you, this restaurant is known for their Roast Crab and Garlic Noodles and is often ordered and enjoyed together.  It's almost like a rule on their menu written in invisible ink visible only by black light.  In turn, 9 of 12 people in our party ordered this.  However, I along with two others heeded elsewhere on the menu.  

I ordered the Vegetarian Delight: silken tofu with veggies and shiitake mushrooms over rice.  Y-U-M-M-M!!!  I could totally throw in a few more M's but I'll spare you the eyesore.  This dish was truly a delight.  Platter presentation was exquisite but the satisfaction came with each bite.  There was adequate amount of tofu and vegetables it was just the right amount of excellence and flavor.

Be sure to call in for reservations to guarantee yourself a table as this place gets packed.

excerpts: We also ordered the Vegetarian Delight just to have a veggie dish, can't say much for stir fried frozen veggies.
That being said, ambience was warm and welcoming and the service was excellent.
As one might expect, we left with mixed feelings.
vegetarian delight.author: Cindy L.
vegetarian delight.review: Thanh Long Mussels were perfect appetizers, succulent and buttery paired with toast. Sadly, Garlic noodles and Roasted Crab (what we really came for) left much to be desired, disappointing. We also ordered the Vegetarian Delight just to have a veggie dish, can't say much for stir fried frozen veggies. That being said, ambience was warm and welcoming and the service was excellent. As one might expect, we left with mixed feelings.

excerpts: Specially the vegetarian delight,  too much sugary source.
vegetarian delight.author: Jenny S.
vegetarian delight.review: Not really like  my dinner there tonight,  everything taste so sweet. Too much sugar on every dish. Specially the vegetarian delight,  too much sugary source.

excerpts: Vegetarian Delight - silken tofu sauteed with asst.
vegetarian delight.author: Beth W.
vegetarian delight.review:
We came here for a special family celebration and it was our first time dining here as well.

The food ordered for our dinner comprised of the following:

1. Salt & Pepper Calamari - delicious except for the simple overdose of coarsely ground black pepper; will definitely tell them next time to adjust the black pepper with a lighter touch

2. Mango Salad - fresh mango fruit sauteed with bell peppers, seared scallops & shrimp over mixed greens in a raspberry vinaigrette - this would make for an excellent  meal on it's own; the raspberry vinaigrette nicely tied the various flavors together effortlessly

3. Thanh Long Spicy Eggplant - eggplant sauteed with jumbo prawns, chicken, fresh basil, baby corn, shitake mushrooms, & red chilies in a tamarind & chili-soya; I like spicy but it was on the low end of the spicy spectrum on this dinner outing though the overall flavors were good ~ will order it again but tell the server to make it spicier

4. Villager's Favorite - Pacific prawns & pork medallions simmered in a caramelized reduction of soy and herbs; I liked this dish enough that I would order it again; a nice take on a "surf and turf" with pork instead of beef for the "turf" portion

5. Shaken Beef - tender cubes of marinated New York steak flambeed in Chardonnay served with potatoes, mixed greens & cherry tomatoes; delicious in flavor with fork tender beef; the greens I could do without as it seemed more a "salad" than an entree

6. Vegetarian Delight - silken tofu sauteed with asst. vegetables & shitake mushrooms; a standout as I love tofu and veggies!

7. Roast Crab - a whole Dungeness crab roasted with An's garlic sauce & secret spices in the Secret Kitchen; regardless of what others may say, this in of itself is a delectable Dungeness crab entree!  Yes it's messy but who cares?  The flavors marry very well and our entire party enjoyed this dish.

8. Garlic Noodles - An's famous noodles made with their secret garlic sauce (perhaps the one used on the Roast Crab?) & secret spices; this noodle dish is good when hot but at room temperature or worse, cold, it's not that good (something coagulates on the noodles when it's cold...butter perhaps?)

Despite the large amounts ordered per item, we had lots of left overs (crab included) for our party of 18.  Would I go back to this spot?  You betcha!  I want to try the Tamarind Crab - "simmered in a melange of Roma tomatoes & tamarind, seasoned with fresh dill & green onions & flambeed with cognac."  The ingredients for this dish make me salivate just thinking about it.

There is a full bar in case you want a drink while you wait and/or with your meal.  Two of us ordered the Fleur de Mango - pureed fresh mango, Malibu rum, a banana rum and freshly squeezed orange juice to the mix - this was the fave drink of the evening!  
 
While parking is an issue, it's located in a neighborhood folks, get there early so that you can look for parking or just valet your car.  I would also suggest booking a reservation so that you are amongst the first seating for the evening.  Overall, the service was excellent/attentive and the food was delicious.

The name of this restaurant came about due to an error at the printer's.  It was supposed to be "Thang Long" meaning "Ascending Dragon" and also Vietnam's first capital city.  As "Thanh Long" it means "Green Dragon" ~ green representing happiness and prosperity while the dragon symbol is an ancient symbol of good luck.  I would say the An Family has enjoyed this for many years serving a legion of happy customers ~ myself being a newly minted one!

Note - The An Family also owns the Crustacean group of restaurants with a Palo Alto opening targeted for this September 2010.  I can't wait till this spot opens up!

excerpts:
Vegetarian Delight - broccoli, cauliflower and tomatoes in a tomato-based liquid (really?)...
Shaken beef - delicious, but precious little of it.
vegetarian delight.author: G L.
vegetarian delight.review:
I'm torn...I want to give TL 5 stars, but I can't.  TL is a two-trick pony...here's why:5 Stars for efficiency, 5 for crabs and garlic noodles, 3 for customer service (our service person was great but host and the reservation clerk were cold but efficient), and 1 for the other entrees.
We had a table of 8 for a birthday dinner.  Ordered a bunch of apps, 3 entrees, 3 crabs, 3 garlic noodles...over $400! Would not have been a problem if the entrees were better.
The worst offenders - a LOT of orange glop on top of a small but beautiful piece of fish (Fish in Citrus - why would you do that to the fish?  Hold the corn-starch!)... Vegetarian Delight - broccoli, cauliflower and tomatoes in a tomato-based liquid (really?)...
Shaken beef - delicious, but precious little of it.
If you go, bring your wallet and ONLY go for the crabs and garlic noodles.

Remember - two-trick pony.

excerpts: I was not that impressed with the garlic noodles, vegetarian delight, and the colossal shrimp.
vegetarian delight.author: Jennifer H.
vegetarian delight.review:
I had my birthday dinner here. The best roast crab I've ever tasted. The crab was juicy, flavorful, and tender. I was not that impressed with the garlic noodles, vegetarian delight, and the colossal shrimp. The grilled squid appetizer was excellent, crispy spring rolls too yum. 

If I were to return to this place I would order the grilled squid, crisp spring rolls and roast crab.

excerpts: 1 Vegetarian Delight $14.95.
This was possibly the last mistake we made: ordering vegetables at this grease-hole.
This was inedible.
They came covered in a sauce which reminded both of us of Chief Boyardee tomato sauce.
Gross.
We did not eat any of it, and they did not even ask if any thing was wrong with the food.
vegetarian delight.author: Erika B.
vegetarian delight.review:
This place is disgusting. 

1 Buddha Roll $7.95. This was the only OK thing we ordered. Descent, but only 2 rolls. 

1 Garlic Noodles $9.95. This was the most ridiculous waste of money. It is literally, a giant plate of greasy spaghetti covered in a butter-like substance with sugar and powdered garlic. It was so greasy that I could not even finish half of it. I have no clue how people eat a whole plate of this stuff, let alone with their greasy seafood on top. Yuck. Not to mention, should this really cost 10$? Not worth it, at all. 

1 Colossal Tiger Prawns $34.95. The shrimp were splayed in half to make them look larger than they actually were and served on top of a giant bed of greasy garlic spaghetti. The shrimp themselves, were also covered in greasy butter stuff. They tasted OK, but also were very oily. 

1 Vegetarian Delight $14.95. This was possibly the last mistake we made: ordering vegetables at this grease-hole. This was inedible. They came covered in a sauce which reminded both of us of Chief Boyardee tomato sauce. Gross. We did not eat any of it, and they did not even ask if any thing was wrong with the food. This place sucks. 

We will NOT be returning, and would never recommend this to anyone. The only remaining thing I can add is that we did NOT order the crab (their specialty); this must be god-awful amazing, because otherwise I have no idea how anyone eats here. Yuck.

excerpts: We ordered the Salt & Pepper Calamari, 2 roasted crabs, 2 garlic noodles, the Vegetarian Delight, the Villager's Favorite, and our drinks.
As we were giving him our orders, we asked for his recommendation.
All he gave us was a uninterested look, shrug, and "ehhh, they are good.
Way to be proud of your restaurant, buddy!
However, I was impressed how he took our orders without writing them down... until, he can back when he forgot our order.
It was a busy evening for them that night.
For me it's a make it or break it moment for a restaurant.
If managed correctly, it is great, you enjoy a great meal without a worry in the world.
However for me, this was not the case.

Our waiter forgot to bring us bibs & scrap bowls to eat our crab, he came with our drinks after we finished our dinner, he did not refill our water, he did not offer warm towelettes to clean our hands and he did not offer us the dessert menu.
I guess the waiter "made up" for it by saying the Salt & Pepper Calamari was on the house.
vegetarian delight.author: Pamela P.
vegetarian delight.review:
Hands down, they have good food. However, if you are going to charge me that much for the items on the menu, you better provide me with exceptionally great service. I'm just saying. 

After hearing rave reviews of this place, I had very high expectations going in. I went on a busy Saturday evening for a birthday dinner. We were seated in their upstairs dining room. Our waiter was a 30-something Asian man. Giving us a moment to look through the menu, he came back to take our orders. We ordered the Salt & Pepper Calamari, 2 roasted crabs, 2 garlic noodles, the Vegetarian Delight, the Villager's Favorite, and our drinks. As we were giving him our orders, we asked for his recommendation. All he gave us was a uninterested look, shrug, and "ehhh, they are good." Way to be proud of your restaurant, buddy! However, I was impressed how he took our orders without writing them down... until, he can back when he forgot our order. -_- It was a busy evening for them that night. For me it's a make it or break it moment for a restaurant. If managed correctly, it is great, you enjoy a great meal without a worry in the world. However for me, this was not the case. Our waiter forgot to bring us bibs & scrap bowls to eat our crab, he came with our drinks after we finished our dinner, he did not refill our water, he did not offer warm towelettes to clean our hands and he did not offer us the dessert menu. I guess the waiter "made up" for it by saying the Salt & Pepper Calamari was on the house. I could have passed on the over-salted and over-peppered calamari rings. 

The good. The roasted crab and garlic were delicious! The crab meat fell right out of the shell. It was a good size crab too. Very tasty.

excerpts: We ordered An's Famous Roast Crab, Thanh Long Spicy Eggplant, and Charbroiled Colossal Royal Tiger Prawns.
However, the star of the show was the roast crab.
I don't know how they season it, but every little bit, including the shell was delicious!
colossal royal tiger prawns.author: Leana L.
colossal royal tiger prawns.review:
Oh myyy. So this is what all the hype is about. I had heard about PPQ from my roommates years ago, but the whole crab debate really started when my parents heard about Thanh Long from some of their friends. We finally made it happen for Father's Day.

Location: There's two locations, one in the Sunset and one in FiDi, but they're slightly different with slightly different menus. We chose the original, even though it's a farther drive. Parking can be a bit difficult, no surprise there. They do have valet parking, though, if you choose.

Ambiance: From the outside, this place looks like nothing special, but just after entering, you can tell that this is a special occasions kind of place. There's white table cloths, the wait staff is nicely dressed, and the host at the front is very nice and polite, ensuring that we were promptly seated. They do have a very strict policy regarding honoring reservation times, but I appreciate it. It keeps things orderly and outlines the rules very clearly.

Service: Top notch. Obviously it's not some Michelin star restaurant where the waitstaff is over the top, but everyone was very pleasant. Our water glasses were never empty, our plates were cleared promptly, and they made sure we had everything we needed. I believe they automatically included tip regardless of your party size, so while some people can be turned off by that, I think it's refreshing. The staff is obviously well compensated for their services and are treated with respect -- and it shows.

Food: We ordered An's Famous Roast Crab, Thanh Long Spicy Eggplant, and Charbroiled Colossal Royal Tiger Prawns. The prawns were just okay, but luckily they came on top of a mount of delicious garlic noodles. The eggplant was really good. However, the star of the show was the roast crab. I don't know how they season it, but every little bit, including the shell was delicious! I definitely admit to sucking on the empty crab shell bits at the end because it was so good!

Price: Definitely not cheap, but also worth it for a special occasion.

Would I return? If a celebration were in order, I wouldn't say no!

excerpts: I've heard good things about the Charbroiled Colossal Royal Tiger Prawns and the Mango Salad
but once I get there my old faithful selection summons my soul.
colossal royal tiger prawns.author: Sheri L.
colossal royal tiger prawns.review:
This has been hands down my #1 Seafood spot for the last 15+ years. This place is great for a dinner date but because it's not super romantic due to the fact that they stay so busy, it also works for a small group of  friends or family. 

My number one tip make reservations! Also you can find parking if you're willing to walk a few blocks sometimes it is worth it to save that almost $20 valet parking. They open at 5 it's always easier to get in and out if you go right when they open. If not just make those reservations ahead of time. Either way, despite the crowd, once you get seated the wait for the food is never too long.

The food is definitely the highlight. I consider trying new things everytime I go. I've heard good things about the Charbroiled Colossal Royal Tiger Prawns and the Mango Salad but once I get there my old faithful selection summons my soul. My wife and I get 2 Roast Garlic Crab, Garlic Noodles and we split the Crab Puff appetizer. All the dipping butter you need for your crab is right on your plate. I swear the flavor is something special especially worth the black pepper they add to the garlic butter. And the flavor is just not in the butter or on the shell but it's in the meat of the crab. That's hard to come by.

The staff is very attentive at they keep close eye on your bowl that you place your shells in. As soon as the bowl fills up there and there to swap it out for a new one. At the end of your meal they treat you to a plate of steaming hot towels to get rid of all the excess butter on your hands. I love this place!!

excerpts: We got the roast crab, the colossal royal tiger prawns, calamari, and spicy eggplant.
The crab is the best crab I have ever had in my life.
The seasoning was amazing and the crab itself was fresh and delicious.
I think one person can eat the crab if they don't order anything else.
The colossal prawns were as delicious.
colossal royal tiger prawns.author: Christian A.
colossal royal tiger prawns.review: This place is incredible, amazing, and mind blowing. First time coming and already know we'll be returning. We got the roast crab, the colossal royal tiger prawns, calamari, and spicy eggplant. The crab is the best crab I have ever had in my life. The seasoning was amazing and the crab itself was fresh and delicious. I think one person can eat the crab if they don't order anything else. The colossal prawns were as delicious. The prawns are grilled with seasoning and it comes with the garlic noodles. There were four pieces and they tasted so good and fresh. The garlic noodles are so simple, yet so so good. It was so good we ordered two extra plates of it. The calamari was also excellent. It was crispy but tender and soft. The seasoning was great and the accompanying sauce was a great companion. The spicy eggplant was also amazing. It had eggplant, mushrooms, chicken, and shrimp. The sauce is sweet and spicy and goes very well with rice. I know I've described and used amazing a lot, but it's just that good. The staff is also super super friendly. They were very accommodating, friendly, and knew everything we asked them. They gave us bibs as well because the crab can get messy, which it did. Also pro tip, make sure to have a reservation to avoid very long waits. We went on a Saturday, and it was packed. We had a reservation and were seated immediately. One of the best restaurants I've been to.

excerpts: We then had the shaken beef and colossal royal tiger prawns.
Again, both were so flavorful and good.
The shaken beef was tender and the potatoes and bed of lettuce was a nice touch.
colossal royal tiger prawns.author: Joanne L.
colossal royal tiger prawns.review:
I've heard so many good things about Thanh Long so it's been on my list of places to try for a very long time. 

Called in around 8:30 on Friday night to make reservations because I knew there would probably be a wait, super last minute but worth the try! Luckily they had an opening at 9:30 so we took it. Once we arrived we immediately got seated. 

I know they're known for their crabs, but my friend and I didn't feel like getting our hands dirty so we opted for their other dishes. We had the salmon carpaccio, and dungeness crab puffs to start. Both were very yummy but the salmon carpaccio was my favorite dish of the whole night. Perfectly seasoned and very light. We then had the shaken beef and colossal royal tiger prawns. Again, both were so flavorful and good. The shaken beef was tender and the potatoes and bed of lettuce was a nice touch. The tiger prawns comes with a bed of their garlic noodles. Personally it wasn't the best I ever had but it was still good. 

Service was top notch. We ordered a bottle of wine and they were always making sure our glasses weren't empty. I'll definitely be back to try their crabs soon.

excerpts: the colossal royal tiger prawns consisted of four butterflied prawns atop a pile of the aforementioned garlic noodles.
i didn't like the butterflied cut; while pretty, it was hard to get the shrimp out of the shell.
they were well-seasoned and so smoky, and i thought they were the best morsel (okay, like 4 bites) of the night.
dad was unimpressed and thought them overdone.
colossal royal tiger prawns.author: Heather F.
colossal royal tiger prawns.review:
went here with my family on a saturday night at 7pm, and was seated almost immediately. don't bother coming if you don't have reservations, because it is packed. it is pretty loud, which is fine though a bit bothersome usually; however, i was with my grandma, so that made talking to her a lot harder.

grilled calamari- so tender! the bodies were chewy but yet so tender. fabulously smoky. the creamy pb sauce yummy but nothing special. 

the shaken beef was soooo tender. and like quality beef tender, not baking soda tender. really flavorful and liked that it was cubed and easy to eat. the salad underneath with sauteed onions was yummy.

the real reason we came was for the garlic noodles. i've had them from their truck, an the go, and they were amazing. my mom first had them at crustacean, and she loved them there, too. we were so looking forward to them that we got a side order, and we also got the prawns that came atop the noodles. and they were so sad.

the separate order was kind of cold, and the noodles were somewhat hard. they tasted as if they'd be on the counter and forgotten for a while, and overall didn't seem very fresh. the ones that were underneath the shrimp were a lot better thank goodness. rich and buttery and cheesy and actually hot. they still weren't as good as when i had them last, but not sure if it's because the product wasn't as good or if my expectations were too high.

and let's talk about those shrimp. the colossal royal tiger prawns consisted of four butterflied prawns atop a pile of the aforementioned garlic noodles. i didn't like the butterflied cut; while pretty, it was hard to get the shrimp out of the shell. they were well-seasoned and so smoky, and i thought they were the best morsel (okay, like 4 bites) of the night. dad was unimpressed and thought them overdone. it was marked as mp, but there's no way that four butterflied shrimp atop a pile of garlic noodles is $38. that kind of ruined the best bite of the night thing for me.

in an attempt to insert some foliage into our lives, we got the seasonal veggies. and they were meh. but what do you get for ordering stupid things? the sauce was actually pretty good though and dad sopped it up with rice.

the curry lotus prawns were ordered because dad was still hungry. this was one big wtf. the water chestnuts were too huge (it sounds stupid but i swear), and i found myself halfheartedly plodding away at a bunch of them. the green beans tasted old and tough. the curry itself was very oddly flavored- there were a bunch of spices/herbs that i didn't recognize and didn't care for. it almost tasted medicinal to me. the coconut milk wasn't apparent, so there wasn't any creaminess to help save the curry. the shrimp was crisp and tender, and that was the only good part.

4 stars for the food, even if the curry lotus prawns were veryyy meh and the garlic noodles didn't quite satisfy what i was looking for. knocked down to 3 stars because i don't care how good your shrimp are, $38 is too much for 4.

excerpts: Colossal Royal Tiger Prawns (5/5): 4 large butterflied and perfectly grilled in the shell prawns that were served over a bed of their famously delicious garlic noodles.
Yeah this was a splurge, at almost $10 a prawn, this was expensive but very (very) good and to be served over the deservedly vaunted garlic noodles, this was a plus.
We didn't have to order the Garlic Noodles as an entree because of this, and the waiter was smart enough to understand this by ignoring our order for these Prawns PLUS a Garlic Noodle order.
The Garlic noodles had the perfect consistency of Yee Noodles, http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yi_mein, which gives them an extra nice bite and appear to absorb the flavors better.
They are also pricey.
The Garlic Noodles by themselves were $9.50 an order, which seems a bit high for lo mein noodles and garlic, but if they are
Yee noodles, they would be more fairly priced.
colossal royal tiger prawns.author: Glenn H.
colossal royal tiger prawns.review:
4.5 stars. Minus a half a star for the value of some of the items but overall a terrific night out.

This is a prize of a place. Comfortable setting, great service, excellent quality food and, while maybe spend-y, is worth a look.

For our New Years eve dinner there we four had reservations (needed given the size of the place) at 8 PM. We started the night with two appetizers:

1. Tempura Style Coconut Prawns (3/5). These were not so much the Japanese style tempura (corn starch batter) that you might have had but more coconut shaving encrusted large prawns. There were 5 and were good but, if I had to go again, not a must have.

2. Dungeness Crab Puffs (4/5). These were 6, small, perfectly deep fried, wonton-skin wrapped pillows of Dungeness crab filling that were so much better than the typical Crab Rangoon's that you might have had elsewhere. They came with two dipping sauces, the better one was the sweet mustard. This was a nice, if pricey, treat and a good start to the entrees. 

Four entrees:

1. Roasted Crab (4/5): this smelled wonderful as it came out and was a large, already cut up Dungeness crab, with the carapace shell. It was meaty and perfectly done with the garlic sauce. Really glad we tried this. I like crab but it isn't a must have for me. My table-mates really like it. Market price was almost $40 each.

2. Shaken Beef (5/5): very tender tasty cubes of beef (not well done, if that's important to you) that was marinated in a lightly sweet sauce, served with potato cubes that had also been marinated in the same dark sauce and grilled; all of this served over tender bay greens. Delicious! Everyone liked this dish. The Rice and Roll's Hunan Grilled Butter Beef was very comparable (and less expensive) than this dish but this was still a winning dish. And I need to mention the tender-crisp cuts of sweet Vidalia (that's my guess) onions that were served with this dish, they were great in their own right and really added dimension to the beef.

3. Seafood Combination (Scallops, prawns, Dungeness crab) Fried rice (6/5): if there was one dish that stood out from all of them, it was this dish. A simple, (even unimpressive) looking fried rice dish that just blew people away with its wok-seared taste and awesome flavors. Fried rice, yes. But extraordinary? For a mere $16 Absolutely!

4. Colossal Royal Tiger Prawns (5/5): 4 large butterflied and perfectly grilled in the shell prawns that were served over a bed of their famously delicious garlic noodles. Yeah this was a splurge, at almost $10 a prawn, this was expensive but very (very) good and to be served over the deservedly vaunted garlic noodles, this was a plus. We didn't have to order the Garlic Noodles as an entree because of this, and the waiter was smart enough to understand this by ignoring our order for these Prawns PLUS a Garlic Noodle order. The prawns did have a tendency to stick to their shells, but they were perfectly done and marinated in some fantastic sauce to make them outstanding.

The Garlic noodles had the perfect consistency of Yee Noodles, http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yi_mein, which gives them an extra nice bite and appear to absorb the flavors better. They are also pricey. The Garlic Noodles by themselves were $9.50 an order, which seems a bit high for lo mein noodles and garlic, but if they are Yee noodles, they would be more fairly priced. Everyone at the table loved these. 

Three deserts: 

Creme Brulee (3/5): this was an OK rendition of Creme Brulee, not bad but not up to the standards of the rest of the meal. Nothing really special.

Chocolate Lava Cake (5/5): Oh yeah! This chocolate delight was the size of a very small hockey puck served with a large scoop of vanilla ice cream over a pool of Grand Marnier & melted vanilla ice cream. It was pricey ($9) but oh so very wonderful to have that rich oozing chocolate goodness.

Fried Banana Fritters a la Mode. (5/5): 2 fritters (your choice of pineapple or banana) served with that same scoop of dense vanilla ice cream. Love, Love, Love this simple but wonderful desert.

It was almost a perfect amount of food for 4 with each of us full to the neck and almost giddy from the great food experience.

While the restaurant was crowded, it never seemed loud or noisy and the service was spot-on: unobtrusive, available, and very polite.

With tip we were at about $50 per person without drinks (which included one modestly iced tea for $2.50).

Loved it and would eagerly go again for a special occasion!

excerpts: Got the Garlic Noodles, Mango Salad, and Colossal Royal Tiger Prawns that came out to be about $70 dollars total (omfg).
Mango Salad was a refreshing appetizer.
The Garlic Noodles were okay; didn't think there was anything that special about the dish.
colossal royal tiger prawns.author: Mandy C.
colossal royal tiger prawns.review:
Pretty much overrated and expensive Vietnamese fusion food that you can get at other place for a much cheaper price. Got the Garlic Noodles, Mango Salad, and Colossal Royal Tiger Prawns that came out to be about $70 dollars total (omfg). Maybe I just eat too much, but my friend and I were confused as to why the description of the meal said "large", because there was really nothing large about it.

Mango Salad was a refreshing appetizer. The Garlic Noodles were okay; didn't think there was anything that special about the dish. We think that the damage was mostly due to the Tiger Prawns - definitely do not recommend getting it!!!

We didn't try the infamous Crab dish, but we saw many people getting it - even a couple who ordered a crab each... So maybe that's what we should have tried instead?

excerpts: We also ordered the Colossal Royal Tiger Prawns that is served over a bed of garlic noodles M/P and If I can remember correctly (I had a few too many drinks by the end of the night)
that dish came out to $32?$35?
ERF!
I say ask before you order this because if it is that much, it's totally NOT WORTH IT.
colossal royal tiger prawns.author: Jan Y.
colossal royal tiger prawns.review:
Omg its guud! I started off with the Thanh Long mussles which was surprisingly very tasty and flavorful.   The roast crab was amazing! cooked perfectly and the mixture of spices was phenominal, I love.     We also ordered the Colossal Royal Tiger Prawns that is served over a bed of garlic noodles M/P and If I can remember correctly (I had a few too many drinks by the end of the night)  that dish came out to $32?$35?  ERF! I say ask before you order this because if it is that much, it's totally NOT WORTH IT.  If you are going to spend that money might as well get another crab!  

Enjoy!

.

excerpts: The Colossal Royal Tiger Prawns were a huge letdown.
