colossal royal tiger prawns.author: Jeanne L.
colossal royal tiger prawns.review:
Versus PPQ, the other dungeness crab powerhouse of SF, this place loses for both taste and price... for all dishes.

We ordered the Roasted Crab, Drunken Crab, and the Tamarind Crab.  The latter was definitely my favorite for it's very unique sweet tangy flavor. The flavoring of the Roasted crab was somewhat more oily and not as flavorful/garlicy as the one from PPQ.  (Most of all, I really missed the incredibly delicious dry flavor of the Peppercorn crab from PPQ.)

The Garlic Noodles here were on the softer side compared to PPQ, and I really prefer a nice firm al dente noodle with a bit of a chew to it.

The Colossal Royal Tiger Prawns were a huge letdown. There were .. 5 or 6 prawns only.

Vegetarian Delight was described as silken tofu sauteed with assorted vegetables and shitake mushrooms.  I know this is a Vietnamese restaurant, but I am really used to eating a Chinese version of this with a crispy-fried tofu.  The tofu was a mushy-soft texture, and the vegetable selection was meager.  The dish size overall was small.  I was not delighted.

$32 per person, group of 9 people.  It was pricey considering how unsatisfied we were for quality/quantity of food.  Sorry, this is what happens when you compare against PPQ.

http://www.yelp.com/biz/ppq-dungeness-island-san-francisco-2#hrid:yChlljno2CCweXgXWfyfpw/src:self

excerpts: We also ordered the colossal royal tiger prawns, served on a bed of garlic noodles.
Again, the tiger prawns were delightfully seasoned and the garlic noodles are perhaps the best I've ever had.
The roast crab and garlic noodles lived up to the hype
but if you enjoy dressing up and don't mind paying an extra ten to twenty bucks, head over to Crustacean and enjoy the delicacies there instead.
colossal royal tiger prawns.author: Evonne M.
colossal royal tiger prawns.review:
Went to Thanh Long for the first time with my boyfriend the Sunday before Valentine's Day. Didn't make reservations ahead of time so we waited approximately an hour before we were seated.

To our surprise, our orders came promptly. Their famous roast crab did not disappoint. The balance of tender crab meat with buttery pepper sauce is phenomenal. Crab cracker tools, big bowls for crab shells, and plastic bibs are provided for all patrons who choose to abandon all forms of etiquette and succumb to the delightfulness of the roast crab.

We also ordered the colossal royal tiger prawns, served on a bed of garlic noodles. Again, the tiger prawns were delightfully seasoned and the garlic noodles are perhaps the best I've ever had. My boyfriend succinctly describes the noodles as "starchy with a bite and not oily at all."   

Although we were pleased with the quality of the food, the atmosphere did not live up to the price of the check. We went knowing that it is casual attire so we did not expect anything fancy. However, we were seated in a table for two surrounded on all sides by people less than two feet away. As a matter of fact, the back of my chair was touching the chair of the person who sat with his back to me. We concluded that we rather pay a bit more at Crustacean for nicer ambiance.

All in all, reservation is highly recommended if you do not want to wait. The roast crab and garlic noodles lived up to the hype but if you enjoy dressing up and don't mind paying an extra ten to twenty bucks, head over to Crustacean and enjoy the delicacies there instead.

excerpts: I'll probably try the colossal royal tiger prawns with garlic noodles next time.
colossal royal tiger prawns.author: Lien T.
colossal royal tiger prawns.review:
Yep, you've guessed it...my boyfriend and I came to Thanh Long because we heard about their famous roast crab and garlic noodles!

We arrived shortly after they opened at 5pm and there was no wait. Once we were seated, we noticed the full bar and decided to order a couple of drinks to start off our night. I ordered the fleur de mango and the boyfriend ordered the Hanoi sunset (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/z9CN58fSrA46ggyb6OnCnQ?select=5AnN3N7w7JTwsWHvz8rcug). The fleur de mango was really good. The rum flavor was subtle and masked by the freshly blended orange juice and sweet mango puree. I had a sip of the Hanoi sunset and it tasted ridiculously strong. It tasted as though I was sipping on a straight shot of alcohol. My boyfriend shared the same feelings--he had to force himself to chug down the alcohol laden martini.

For appetizers, we had the chicken satay (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/z9CN58fSrA46ggyb6OnCnQ?select=XH78FALuoyCY-PemWsm18g) and salmon carpaccio (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/z9CN58fSrA46ggyb6OnCnQ?select=g2SQ3ayDT3W9Fm9seQQEVw). The chicken satay was pretty disappointing--three skewers of grilled chicken came out on a plate with no dipping sauce. The chicken was a little on the dry side and it tasted really bland. Usually when I eat chicken satay, it is always served with a side of satay peanut sauce for dipping. Oh well, the tasty salmon carpaccio made up for the disappointment. I love refreshing dishes like the salmon carpaccio, as the flavors of the simple ingredients are truly highlighted. The buttered-bread, capers, and lightly lemon-marinated salmon all combined deliciously.

And of course, for our entrees, we shared one roast crab and an order of garlic noodles (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/z9CN58fSrA46ggyb6OnCnQ?select=1bMAC3tQqYuN0JkIZRKVqQ). To be perfectly honest, I wasn't that impressed with the roast crab. It was definitely juicy, meaty, and big, but the flavors weren't that great. It definitely didn't live up to all the hype. On the other hand, the garlic noodles were to-die-for! I'm a huge fan of garlic and the garlic noodles were sooo soft and garlicky. I've tried garlic noodles once before and the garlic flavor wasn't as distinct as the garlic flavor in Thanh Long's garlic noodles. I give their garlic noodles 5 stars!

My boyfriend and I had an overall good experience. We enjoyed the intimate, but comfortable ambiance. The customer service was excellent and extremely attentive. I'll probably try the colossal royal tiger prawns with garlic noodles next time.

P.S.
Cheers to my 100th review! :D

excerpts: Other noteworthy dishes I've tried and loved: Shrimp Toast, Shaken Beef, and Colossal Royal Tiger Prawns.
colossal royal tiger prawns.author: Judy C.
colossal royal tiger prawns.review:
My all-time favorite San Francisco restaurant is situated right here in Outer Sunset.  Thang Long, known for their French-inspired Vietnamese cuisine, serves some of the BEST garlic crabs and BEST garlic noodles.

Once in awhile I get to splurge here, and luckily for my birthday -- my thoughtful friends brought me here to celebrate.  Together, we shared:

* Salmon Carpaccio: My favorite appetizer from Thanh Long!  The lemon-cured salmon was perfectly marinated and not at all "fishy."
* Salt & Pepper Calamari: Calamari usually all tastes the same at different restaurants.  However, here, they go easy on the batter and oil to give an overall light taste.
* Mango Salad: This is was my least favorite dish.  Warm mango slices and seafood on top of cold salad is not appetizing whatsoever. 
* Roast Crab & Garlic Noodles: If you love overdosing on garlic and butter, you will love the crab and garlic noodles here.  Their infamous secret sauce really makes Thanh Long what they are. 

Other noteworthy dishes I've tried and loved: Shrimp Toast, Shaken Beef, and Colossal Royal Tiger Prawns. 

Love, love, love.

excerpts: We started with the rolls for appetizers, mango salad, then shaken beef & Colossal Royal Tiger prawns with garlic noodles.
Everything was excellent!
The service was great as well, and we even had children with us who were well cared for by the staff.
Will definitely be back!
colossal royal tiger prawns.author: Steven B.
colossal royal tiger prawns.review: A friend invited us to join them for dinner...this is one of the best Vietnamese restaurants in SF.  We started with the rolls for appetizers, mango salad, then shaken beef & Colossal Royal Tiger prawns with garlic noodles.  Everything was excellent!  The service was great as well, and we even had children with us who were well cared for by the staff.  Will definitely be back!

excerpts:
Colossal Royal Tiger Prawns ~
butterflied and grilled with secret spices, served on a bed of garlic noodles

4.
colossal royal tiger prawns.author: Oliver D.
colossal royal tiger prawns.review:
I've heard so many good reviews on this place and had to check it out for myself! 

I'm a HUGE fan of sea food especially CRAB and I heard this place had the best roasted crab in San Francisco, so I had to get my 'YELP FACE' on and see what the hype was all about!

As I walked into the restaurant i was impressed! The exterior of Thanh  Long looks like a 'hole in a wall' establishment, but i was proven wrong. It's really cozy and professional. 

I suggest you make reservations if you decide to come with a party of 4 or more. It can get busy on the weekend.

Since this place is kinda pricey, its recommended that you skip out on the appetizers; to be honest, they are over-rated, tiny and over priced! Just get down to the nitty gritty and order the main dishes....

Here are my recommendations:

1.  Thanh Long Spicy Eggplant ~
sauteed with jumbo prawns, chicken, fresh basil, baby corn, shitake mushrooms and fiery red chillies in a tamarind and chilli-soya

2. Shaken Beef ~
tender cubes of marinated new york steak flambeed in chardonnay, served with potatoes, mixed green and cherry tomatoes

3. Colossal Royal Tiger Prawns ~
butterflied and grilled with secret spices, served on a bed of garlic noodles

4. Roast Crab ~
a whole dungeness crab roasted with thanh's garlic sauce and secret spices


NOTE: The spices used in their food are really intense, so if you don't like the after taste of garlic and spices in your mouth, then the majority of the food isn't for you.....but who doesn't like INTENSE SPICES! haha

The portion size of each dish is some what small so try to diversify your choices and order smart....


Much LOVE and eats!

excerpts: I can't get enough of their garlic noodles, crab, and colossal royal tiger prawns.
Best garlic noodles
I've ever had and believe me...
colossal royal tiger prawns.author: Dimps I.
colossal royal tiger prawns.review:
One of my all time favorite restaurant.  I can't get enough of their garlic noodles, crab, and colossal royal tiger prawns.  On top of the that...the shaken beef and the Vietnamese salad.  Yum!  Best garlic noodles I've ever had and believe me...I've tried many.

I love you Thanh Long!

excerpts: The colossal royal tiger prawns were the same as well.
Both of these dishes were most likely prep in advance for the masses.
Such a disappointment for driving all that way for this.
colossal royal tiger prawns.author: Rossi K.
colossal royal tiger prawns.review: Thanh Long came up Thanh short!  The roast crab tasted very peppery and were cold.  The colossal royal tiger prawns were the same as well.  Both of these dishes were most likely prep in advance for the masses.  Such a disappointment for driving all that way for this.  The Garlic noodles were okay except for the fact they must have put a stick of butter in it.  Overall theme were peppery and cold food.  $85+ dollars for this?  No, thanks!

excerpts: This took place a few years ago, so forgive my clouded memory, but I do remember ordering the colossal royal tiger prawns with garlic noodles and roast crab.
I actually remember informing the couple at the table next to us that the weird, green mushy stuff in the shell is actually the best part.
They were about to throw it away!
If I ruled the culinary world, the number one rule would be to NEVER discard of heads and guts of seafood and poultry.
Anyway, the crab was cooked perfectly and moist on the inside.
Somehow, they were able to get the roasted garlic essence to seep all the way through the crab without overcooking it.
Astounding.
The tiger prawns were good as well, but not as memorable as the crab.
The garlic noodles are also inimitable, even by me...for now.
My boyfriend and I have mastered our own version of roasted garlic crab based on our experiences at An-owned restaurants.
We'll actually be making it this weekend!
Nevertheless, true roasted garlic crab lies in the restaurants of An.
colossal royal tiger prawns.author: Priscilla V.
colossal royal tiger prawns.review: Thanh Long was the setting of another spontaneous adventure in the city for us. It is essentially Crustacean's with a more casual environment. This took place a few years ago, so forgive my clouded memory, but I do remember ordering the colossal royal tiger prawns with garlic noodles and roast crab. I actually remember informing the couple at the table next to us that the weird, green mushy stuff in the shell is actually the best part. They were about to throw it away! If I ruled the culinary world, the number one rule would be to NEVER discard of heads and guts of seafood and poultry. Anyway, the crab was cooked perfectly and moist on the inside. Somehow, they were able to get the roasted garlic essence to seep all the way through the crab without overcooking it. Astounding. The tiger prawns were good as well, but not as memorable as the crab. The garlic noodles are also inimitable, even by me...for now. My boyfriend and I have mastered our own version of roasted garlic crab based on our experiences at An-owned restaurants. We'll actually be making it this weekend! Nevertheless, true roasted garlic crab lies in the restaurants of An.

excerpts: The boy ordered a whole crab with garlic noodles and I had the Colossal Royal Tiger Prawns served on a bed of..
colossal royal tiger prawns.author: Elaine T.
colossal royal tiger prawns.review:
The boy and I drove waaaay the heck out to 46th and Judah one evening to fill our bellies with freshly buttered seafood and garlic noodles. Yum. 

Being that I am reviewer #626, you might guess that we were served some pretty amazing food. We shared a Soft Shell Crab starter, which was very fresh and juicy- not quite as fantastic as the same starter at House, but still very good. The boy ordered a whole crab with garlic noodles and I had the Colossal Royal Tiger Prawns served on a bed of.. you guessed it- more garlic noodles. We thoroughly enjoyed our carb/ butter/ protein filled meal. I never thought I'd find myself eyeing some lettuce garnish carelessly left on a plate from the table next to us..

The crab was bathed in steaming butter- what looked like perfection, if I were a fan of crab meat, which I am not. I am also not a fan of lobster. And I don't drink. I am the ultimate cheap date, but despair not; what I refuse in seafood and wine, I more than make up in desserts and starters!! 

I am, however, a SUPERfan of shrimp. Especially tiger prawns. Yummy yum yum. As for my order, I'd have to say that the 'Colossal' in the menu name might be a little misleading- they are Jumbo prawns at best. The prawns are splayed open when served, but if you put them back together (like I did) just to gauge their actual size: I'd say they were Jumbo, not Colossal. Size aside, the meat was tender and moist. So, so good.

Side comment on valet parking:
Not sure where exactly they took the car once we handed over the keys, but we ended up waiting like fifteen minutes with no line when we were leaving. Seriously- we made a quick trip across the street to the liquor store because they were taking so damn long. Really makes me question where they take the cars. Back home to the An Family garage, perhaps? I'm sure they can fit a few dozen cars on their property with all the money Crustaceans rakes in.

excerpts: We had the roast crab (of course!), colossal royal tiger prawns over garlic noodles, shaken beef (YUM!), grilled calamari, and the seafood combination fried rice.
I was looking forward to having leftovers of this feast, but we cleaned our plates.
Haha.
colossal royal tiger prawns.author: Jenn C.
colossal royal tiger prawns.review:
LOVE this place! It's not cheap, but it's so worth it to splurge once in a while.

We had the roast crab (of course!), colossal royal tiger prawns over garlic noodles, shaken beef (YUM!), grilled calamari, and the seafood combination fried rice. I was looking forward to having leftovers of this feast, but we cleaned our plates. Haha. Oh my god that was the best dinner I've had in a while.

We made reservations for a Saturday night. I'd suggest doing that since it gets pretty packed here.

excerpts: my friend and i shared the the colossal royal tiger prawns over the bed of garlic noodles, mmm mmm mmm!!!
colossal royal tiger prawns.author: Goldie J.
colossal royal tiger prawns.review:
my friend and i shared the the colossal royal tiger prawns over the bed of garlic noodles, mmm mmm mmm!!!  and the roast crab bathed in garlic and buttah.  how do you say "delicious!" in vietnamese?  at first i didn't think it would feed two people, but the claws had a lot of meat.  i couldn't understand how my friends hands were so clean when mine were so very dirty.  it was a lot of work, but definitely worth it.  

i took an asian seafood cooking class a couple years ago where the instructor gave us the garlic noodle recipe for what he called 'that overpriced crab place."  i have yet to try it, but i must do it soon!

the meal ended with the fried pineapple a la mode.  we chose the tahitian vanilla gelato for the ice cream.  this was fantasic, although it was very small with a tiny piece of pineapple.  my friend and i just stared at it, and then looked at each other, then looked back on the pineapple before we busted out laughing...  overall, a great meal!!

excerpts:
g

forget the colossal royal tiger prawns i ordered to sit atop this dish (though i'm sure they were delicious), the garlic noodles were the star of the show.
colossal royal tiger prawns.author: Thy N.
colossal royal tiger prawns.review:
i've heard about these famous garlic noodles for years and finally made my way to thanh long to try them.

o
m
g

forget the colossal royal tiger prawns i ordered to sit atop this dish (though i'm sure they were delicious), the garlic noodles were the star of the show. this is serious garlic, people, they're not messin' around.

roasted crab lived up to the hype as well. couldn't resist ordering the tamarind crab though because my parents make this at home with pure perfection. not fair to compare a restaurant dish to a homemade dish, but thanh long would have to pack their knives and go. their tamarind was just ok.

all in all, totally worthy of the drive to this strange location. and in response to the warnings not to go here on a first date, i'd like to add: do not go here for dinner right before heading to the orpheum theatre to see wicked. oh, and don't arrive just as the lights are dimming to start the show. not only are you the annoying latecomers shuffling past people to get to your seats, you smell filthy disgusting. yeah, sorry bout that...

excerpts: The colossal royal tiger prawns were really nothing to brag about, but the garlic noodles.....
wow
they were delicious.
I would come back here, just for the garlic noodles.
I do know I'll be back for the garlic noodles though.
colossal royal tiger prawns.author: carebear l.
colossal royal tiger prawns.review: My bf brought me here for a birthday surprise romantic dinner here.  We kind of have this unfinished business/ past history thing at this establishment. For appetizers we ordered the Thanh Long mussels, which came with little toasted crostini, the mussels were cooked really well and were not chewy at all  and the salt and pepper squid was lightly battered and not overcooked. For soups we ordered asian bouillabaisse, which was tasty, with just the perfect amount of tamarind. For entrees we ordered the steamed sea bass, which I thought was just a tad overcooked, but the sauce was good. The colossal royal tiger prawns were really nothing to brag about, but the garlic noodles.....wow they were delicious. I would come back here, just for the garlic noodles. The drunken crab tasted like soapy dishwater to me, I guess I should have ordered the Roasted crab. The service was great, but the silverware was dirty. I would come back here, but the food is just too overpriced. A lot of these dishes you can definitely order at another restaurant for half the price and will taste just as good if not better. It's kind of funny how some of the dishes are home style type of dishes, but the names are changed to sound a lot more sophisticated so that they can charge an arm and a leg. Overall , I give the food and service a 4 stars, but they get 3 stars for overcharging for the dishes that are home style and can be found in many Vietnamese kitchens. I do know I'll be back for the garlic noodles though.

excerpts: I ordered: garlic noodles, dungeness crab in An's garlic sauce, Colossal Royal Tiger Prawns w/ more garlic noodles, lemongrass chicken fry dish, and a sea bass dish.
The garlic noodles were very good, but again very oily and heavy.
The lemongrass chicken is nothing special.
colossal royal tiger prawns.author: edie t.
colossal royal tiger prawns.review:
cleanliness: 5/5
food quality: 4/5
service: 4/5 
cost: unknown
other: parking is horrible. I spent 15 minutes looking for a resonable space until finally i parked 5 blocks away

I came here for a birthday dinner (party of 6) on a Saturday night. It was my first time here and heard positive reviews from friends/family. I'm not a big seafood person, but I'll eat it if i have to.

I ordered: garlic noodles, dungeness crab in An's garlic sauce, Colossal Royal Tiger Prawns w/ more garlic noodles, lemongrass chicken fry dish, and a sea bass dish.

I did not get to try to seabass dish so no review on that. The dungeness crab was pretty good. It was very oily and garlicy. the meat was good and the portions were well sized. The garlic noodles were very good, but again very oily and heavy. Not  garlicy to the point where you are hesitant to speak, but still you should have a mint or something to be considerate of others.

The lemongrass chicken is nothing special. It was like a chicken fry dish that you could find at most decent chinese restaurants.

The service was okay. Dishes were brought out promptly and served hot. The supporting staff could have done a better job of refreshing our shell bowls and refilling our beverages (needed a beverage to clear the oil from all the dishes).

I would probably come here again if someone wanted to, but since i'm not a big crab eater I wouldn't actively seek any seafood places. The prices were up there and it is a very busy and loud environment. if you are looking for a place to celebrate a graduation or a small birthday party this place was good. 

They take reservations, but will not seat you until your entire party arrives so tell your friends/family to be on time. Be sure to allow plenty of time to park or bring some walking shoes. Valet is available, but i opted not to use it. 

there is also a cake cutting fee of $1 per person

excerpts: My three favorites: Roast Crab, Tiger Prawns, and Garlic noodles.
The Tiger Prawns already come with a bed of garlic noodles, so depending on your party size, it's bang for your buck.
If you are a party of 2, I recommend one crab and one tiger prawn entree.
Roast Crab is SO MUCH BETTER than the Drunken Crab.
The Roast Crab was $58 when I went.
roast crab.author: Nari C.
roast crab.review:
Came here multiple times. LOVE this place!

My three favorites: Roast Crab, Tiger Prawns, and Garlic noodles. The Tiger Prawns already come with a bed of garlic noodles, so depending on your party size, it's bang for your buck. If you are a party of 2, I recommend one crab and one tiger prawn entree. If you are a party of 3, I recommend minimum of two crabs. 

Roast Crab is SO MUCH BETTER than the Drunken Crab. More flavorful and savory. 

The Roast Crab was $58 when I went. 

Enjoy!

excerpts: We ordered An's Famous Roast Crab, Thanh Long Spicy Eggplant, and Charbroiled Colossal Royal Tiger Prawns.
However, the star of the show was the roast crab.
I don't know how they season it, but every little bit, including the shell was delicious!
roast crab.author: Leana L.
roast crab.review:
Oh myyy. So this is what all the hype is about. I had heard about PPQ from my roommates years ago, but the whole crab debate really started when my parents heard about Thanh Long from some of their friends. We finally made it happen for Father's Day.

Location: There's two locations, one in the Sunset and one in FiDi, but they're slightly different with slightly different menus. We chose the original, even though it's a farther drive. Parking can be a bit difficult, no surprise there. They do have valet parking, though, if you choose.

Ambiance: From the outside, this place looks like nothing special, but just after entering, you can tell that this is a special occasions kind of place. There's white table cloths, the wait staff is nicely dressed, and the host at the front is very nice and polite, ensuring that we were promptly seated. They do have a very strict policy regarding honoring reservation times, but I appreciate it. It keeps things orderly and outlines the rules very clearly.

Service: Top notch. Obviously it's not some Michelin star restaurant where the waitstaff is over the top, but everyone was very pleasant. Our water glasses were never empty, our plates were cleared promptly, and they made sure we had everything we needed. I believe they automatically included tip regardless of your party size, so while some people can be turned off by that, I think it's refreshing. The staff is obviously well compensated for their services and are treated with respect -- and it shows.

Food: We ordered An's Famous Roast Crab, Thanh Long Spicy Eggplant, and Charbroiled Colossal Royal Tiger Prawns. The prawns were just okay, but luckily they came on top of a mount of delicious garlic noodles. The eggplant was really good. However, the star of the show was the roast crab. I don't know how they season it, but every little bit, including the shell was delicious! I definitely admit to sucking on the empty crab shell bits at the end because it was so good!

Price: Definitely not cheap, but also worth it for a special occasion.

Would I return? If a celebration were in order, I wouldn't say no!

excerpts: We ordered the roast crab, Garlic noodles and the sea bass.
The garlic noodles wasnt too garlicy this time.
The sea bass was definitely overpriced for $30.
roast crab.author: Donna L.
roast crab.review:
Took my girlfriend out for her birthday. This place never disappoints. I had the pear martini - so delicious!  Too bad the martini glass is so small. We ordered the roast crab, Garlic noodles and the sea bass. 

The crab was so delicious and fresh. All the meat
Around the body part and leg was fresh and very succulent. For $57 per crab it was pricey but worth it. The garlic noodles wasnt too garlicy this time. The sea bass was definitely overpriced for $30. It was a very small piece of fish but it was cooked perfectly. 

The meal and one martini cost $120+ for two. I'm glad it was a special occasions as I couldn't afford it otherwise.

excerpts:
We ordered:
- The famous roast crab - very large, $57 each (seasonal price at the end of July), shared between 2 people and it was definitely enough
- Garlic noodles - don't know how they infuse so much garlicky goodness in!
- Calamari - a bit too chewy, verging on the side of rubbery; skippable
- Soft-shelled crab - pretty standard; small portion that only came with 1 crab; skippable
- Seasonal vegetable (green beans with mushrooms and tomatoes) - delicious

Overall, a very positive experience though I would skip the appetizers if I came again.
roast crab.author: Mary F.
roast crab.review:
Came here right as they opened at 5PM and service is very speedy.

We ordered:
- The famous roast crab - very large, $57 each (seasonal price at the end of July), shared between 2 people and it was definitely enough
- Garlic noodles - don't know how they infuse so much garlicky goodness in!
- Calamari - a bit too chewy, verging on the side of rubbery; skippable
- Soft-shelled crab - pretty standard; small portion that only came with 1 crab; skippable
- Seasonal vegetable (green beans with mushrooms and tomatoes) - delicious

Overall, a very positive experience though I would skip the appetizers if I came again.

excerpts: Super simple, order a roast crab and order prawn
Not the cheapest but SO good.the roast crab is soaked in garlic butter and pepper.
roast crab.author: David A.
roast crab.review: So this is a restaurant that focuses on two main things...crab and noodles. Super simple, order a roast crab and order prawn garlic noodles-good for two if you order a beer. A crab is around $55, the prawn noodles around $38. Not the cheapest but SO good.the roast crab is soaked in garlic butter and pepper. The prawn are filet with pepper on a bed of butter garlic noodles. How could you go wrong? Didn't eat dessert, but had 2 beers. For three people order a second crab. FYI be aware there is NO parking, so bus/Uber/lift is a must. Also it's pretty close to the ocean so bring a jacket for later...

excerpts: Order the Roast Crab, Garlic Noodles, Shaken beef and Mussels!
We love the Roast Crab so much we order one whole Crab per person!
roast crab.author: Benjamin S.
roast crab.review:
Our favorite Crab restaurant in San Francisco! Order the Roast Crab, Garlic Noodles, Shaken beef and Mussels!

We love the Roast Crab so much we order one whole Crab per person!

excerpts: (yes they were big but only enough for 1 prawn per person o.o), Roast Crab, Thanh Long Fish and Spicy Eggplant.

Portions were PUNY and off-putting... furthermore, our waiter got a little sassy with us and when I reminded him we had a birthday, he snapped back and said "Yeah, you tell your waiter which is ME and you already told me".
roast crab.author: Leslie T.
roast crab.review:
I had heard good things about Thanh Long but was disappointed in how expensive everything was, how small the portions were and how rude the customer service was. Upon entering, I had 3 out of a party of 5 and there is a strict rule saying that parties that are more than 10 minutes late  will automatically be put on the waitlist. That's normal - totally OK with that - but there were so many open tables and so many people in the waiting area, it made me think "are all these people waiting really just partial parties?" The waiting area is super small; we were all shoulder to shoulder with each other and bumping elbows. The other 2 in our party came within the 10 minutes (we made a reservation via Yelp! but didn't get any Cash Back rewards for it like I was expecting..) and we ordered the salt and pepper calamari, mango salad, and Vietnamese salad (both salads had very little vegetables and just a lot of fluff / fruit) as appetizers. For entrees, we got colossal tiger prawns (yes they were big but only enough for 1 prawn per person o.o), Roast Crab, Thanh Long Fish and Spicy Eggplant. Portions were PUNY and off-putting... furthermore, our waiter got a little sassy with us and when I reminded him we had a birthday, he snapped back and said "Yeah, you tell your waiter which is ME and you already told me". Sheesh - didn't seem like you got it the first time so sorry for double checking... 

I prefer garlic noodles with lobster. There are so many places in LA where you can get garlic butter noodles with lobster for half the price, double the quantity and even more delicious. Yes, we're not in LA but even Perilla and Cajun House's prices are more reasonable, portions are justified and quality of food is even better. I wouldn't come back.

excerpts: Expensive Vietnamese restaurant known for roast crab & garlic noodles!
You can't miss out on those here.
Roast Crab - A whole Dungeness crab roasted with An's garlic sauce & secret spices.
Garlic Noodles
- An's famous noodles made with our special garlic sauce & secret spices.
roast crab.author: Chelsea W.
roast crab.review:
Expensive Vietnamese restaurant known for roast crab & garlic noodles! You can't miss out on those here. This is not your typical place to get pho, in fact they don't have it!

Thanh Long is more of a seafood restaurant offering large dishes you can share family style. Most of the options run around $20, and the crabs will be around $50 each. Portions are on the smaller side. We shared 2 crabs, one serving of noodles, 3 large plates and a dessert between 4 people.

The restaurant is quite spacious and our waiter was very friendly. She helped clear our plates out since we practically overflowered our table! When I ordered I made sure to get all the popular dishes.

STARTERS 

Salt & Pepper Calamari - In a light salt and pepper batter, seasoned with scallions and red peppers. These were a great pick!

SOUPS

Vermicelli Noodle Consomme - Chicken, green onions, cilantro. The soup was clean tasting and good, the chicken was tender but I would've liked the noodles to have been the more traditional pho noodles rather than clear ones.

LARGE PLATES

Shaken Beef - Tender cubes of marinated New York steak flambeed in Chardonnay served with potatoes, mixed greens & cherry tomatoes. I'm not a beef person but this seemed good as well. Ours didn't come with potatoes though, but with onions.

Lemongrass Chicken - Slices of chicken sauteed with seasonal vegetables, garlic & chili. Pretty impressed by this one! Would order again for sure.

SECRET KITCHEN DISHES 

Roast Crab - A whole Dungeness crab roasted with An's garlic sauce & secret spices.

Garlic Noodles - An's famous noodles made with our special garlic sauce & secret spices. Super flavorful and very memorable. 

DESSERT 

Fried banana a la mode - With vanilla ice cream. For $8, the portions for the fried banana was tiny! The vanilla ice cream was way too frozen when served to us. There also was way too much whipped cream.

For the price point I would expect Thanh Long to be a more classy and upscale looking restaurant. It was great overall, but a bit on the pricier side for me. I would probably come on more special occasions.

excerpts: We ordered the Roast Crab, Garlic Noodles, and the veggies!
They were all awesome!
We really enjoyed the crab and it's seasoning.
The noodles mixed with the veggies and it's sauce is a magical combination!
I wish we would've ordered another crab or something because I was still hungry.
My wife was stuffed.
roast crab.author: Michael T.
roast crab.review:
Absolutely wonderful experience! The service was amazingly quick! We had reservations at 5:15pm and arrived at 5:11pm and were immediately seated. (I suggest making reservations). 
We ordered the Roast Crab, Garlic Noodles, and the veggies! They were all awesome! We really enjoyed the crab and it's seasoning. The noodles mixed with the veggies and it's sauce is a magical combination!
I wish we would've ordered another crab or something because I was still hungry. My wife was stuffed.

excerpts:
Medium

Roast Crab - Simple and straight forward.
Just the walk to your table you'll notice everyone has an order of the Roast Crab and Garlic Noodles.
For example, the Roast Crab is literally roasted crab with butter, salt, and pepper.
In my opinion, creating a simple good tasting dish is much more difficult as their is more room for error and judgment.
Thanh Long is a bit on the pricey side as you'll probably need to order one Roast Crab per person.
The food tastes great
but I feel this restaurant is meant for a special or celebratory occasion.
roast crab.author: Julian L.
roast crab.review:
Wait - Reservation

Value - ±$50 / Crab.

Dish Size: Medium

Roast Crab - Simple and straight forward. A huge grab roasted with copious amounts of butter and seasoned with salt and pepper. The meat is tender and the crab shell cracks open easily.

Garlic Noodles - It tastes exactly how it sounds. Every bite has a big garlic flavor with a touch of sweetness. My best guess is the sweetness comes from also cooking the noodles in crab juices.


You already know you're in for a delicious meal right when you open the door. An olfactory wave of butter, garlic, and seafood will flood your senses. Just the walk to your table you'll notice everyone has an order of the Roast Crab and Garlic Noodles. Thang Long keeps it simple, the dishes are straightforward and orient around shellfish. 

Thanh Long is one of those Asian restaurants that's been around the block a few times. It has a presence that feels like it stuck to it's guns and succeeded in becoming a permanent fixture in the Sunset neighborhood. There is an old school but upscale charm with Thanh Long which reminds of what people refer to as the "Golden Age" of dining. Much of the ornamentation is Vietnamese inspired, from the Lotus petal pendant lights, to the large dragon mural hanging from the wall, and who can forget the stereotypical dark red furniture. Overall, the antiquated atmosphere of Thanh Long compliments the cuisine well. 

Even though Thanh Long is a Vietnamese restaurant, the dishes we ordered did not have that signature Vietnamese flavor. Instead, the dishes are simple, straight forward, and served fast. For example, the Roast Crab is literally roasted crab with butter, salt, and pepper. In my opinion, creating a simple good tasting dish is much more difficult as their is more room for error and judgment. What Thanh Long does well is make these seemingly simple dishes taste amazing. 

Thanh Long is a bit on the pricey side as you'll probably need to order one Roast Crab per person. The food tastes great but I feel this restaurant is meant for a special or celebratory occasion.

excerpts: roast crab with garlic noodles.
roast crab.author: Lorelyn P.
roast crab.review:
Oh my Lordy! Why did it take so long for me to get here. Service was the best! From making reservations, to getting seated right away, to valet, to our wait staff! Great service all around! 

The prawn wontons were the best I've ever had! Highly recommend. Other than that, we had the basic dinner there. roast crab with garlic noodles. Amazingly delicious! 

Definitely worth the drive!

excerpts: For the main courses, we got the Roast Crab and Garlic Noodles (obviously!).
Ooooh my god
the crab was so good!
The crab was so buttery
I think my heart almost gave out.
How did they make the meat inside taste
so buttery though!?
The garlic noodles were pretty bland but drenched in butter.
The menu states that the noddles were made with "secret spices"...
does that mean no spice at all because it was honestly so bland.
~ I was so full after this
but my *amazing* bf decided to get me a chocolate lava cake anyway because "we have to have cake on your birthday!"~
The lava cake was way too sweet
but I didn't mind because I was in such a good mood.
Then the check came...
This restaurant is honestly reserved for special occasions only because wow... the crab itself costed about $68
dead
I'm sorry
babe
All in all, I was blown away by the crab (and the price tag on it) but everything else was mediocre.
roast crab.author: Trang T.
roast crab.review:
*Very long overdue review*

Came here for my 22nd birthday dinner (on a Friday.) To be honest, we only picked Thanh Long because PPQ (the actual crab restaurant we wanted to try) was unexpectedly closed. Originally, we made a reservation for 6:30PM but thought we needed more time to get there/find parking so we called at 5PM and they let us change our reservation to 7PM instead. Luckily, we were able to find parking about a block down and decided to come earlier (6:45PM). The server said that we have to wait until our reservation which is totally understandable. We were seated within 10 minutes. 

 For starters, I decided to try the Mango Salad after seeing many Yelpers rave about it. It has bell peppers, scallops (couldn't find any), and shrimps (previously frozen) mixed with greens. It smelled and tasted good but was very oily! Not your typical *healthy* salad. 
For the main courses, we got the Roast Crab and Garlic Noodles (obviously!). Ooooh my god the crab was so good! The crab was so buttery I think my heart almost gave out. How did they make the meat inside taste so buttery though!? The garlic noodles were pretty bland but drenched in butter. The menu states that the noddles were made with "secret spices"... does that mean no spice at all because it was honestly so bland. 
~ I was so full after this but my *amazing* bf decided to get me a chocolate lava cake anyway because "we have to have cake on your birthday!"~
The lava cake was way too sweet but I didn't mind because I was in such a good mood. 
Then the check came...  This restaurant is honestly reserved for special occasions only because wow... the crab itself costed about $68+? *dead* I'm sorry babe 
All in all, I was blown away by the crab (and the price tag on it) but everything else was mediocre.

excerpts: We got the roast crab and the garlic noodles.
The crab was so delicious with all the spices and the garlicky sauce.
For a group of two, if you are very hungry I recommend ordering one more dish because crab and noodles might not be enough.
We will definitely come back here.
roast crab.author: Gizem K.
roast crab.review: We got the roast crab and the garlic noodles. The crab was so delicious with all the spices and the garlicky sauce. For a group of two, if you are very hungry I recommend ordering one more dish because crab and noodles might not be enough. We will definitely come back here.

excerpts: Came here almost 10 years ago during a trip with friends and remembered the most delicious roast crab.
So I recommended it to my family on this recent trip, and the roast crab is just as good as I remember!
roast crab.author: Darlene W.
roast crab.review: Came here almost 10 years ago during a trip with friends and remembered the most delicious roast crab. So I recommended it to my family on this recent trip, and the roast crab is just as good as I remember! We got fried rice, garlic noodles, sea bass, 2 crabs, and seasonal veggies. The crab is cooked so perfectly it's easy to crack the shell and pull out plump whole pieces of meat. Not buttery, but seasoned with Asian spices and black pepper. So good!

excerpts: I absolutely LOVE their Roast Crab and Garlic Noodles.
They were like the first to ever come out with the garlic noodles before other places started copying them.
It goes so well with the buttery, peppery, fingerlickin' Roast Crab!
For those who don't know, they serve you the whole crab, head and all!
You break the legs apart and just dig in with your fingers and hands.
It's soo good!
The way they cooked it has the flavor soaked throughout the crab
and you're just busy Iickin' and peelin' and eatin'!
It's definitely messy, and time consuming to eat this, but you leave feeling so happy and satisfied!
Omg
roast crab.author: Jazz N.
roast crab.review:
One of my favorite restaurants in SF! Thanh Long is the original Crustacean restaurant, also sister restaurant to Anqi in OC. Most of you may know of the popular Crustaceans restaurant; Thanh Long has the same menu with a more casual atmosphere. Crustacean is a fancier and more romantic ambience. Great for dates and special events. Here, at Thanh Long, you can dress up and bring a date or come in jeans and be ready to dig in to your food! It's always busy, so make sure to make a reservation ahead of time!

I absolutely LOVE their Roast Crab and Garlic Noodles. They were like the first to ever come out with the garlic noodles before other places started copying them. It goes so well with the buttery, peppery, fingerlickin' Roast Crab! For those who don't know, they serve you the whole crab, head and all! You break the legs apart and just dig in with your fingers and hands. It's soo good! The way they cooked it has the flavor soaked throughout the crab and you're just busy Iickin' and peelin' and eatin'! It's definitely messy, and time consuming to eat this, but you leave feeling so happy and satisfied! Omg I already want more just thinking about it! 

My other favorites are the mussels appetizer (very buttery), fried crab cheese puffs, and salt & pepper calamari (crispy). Oh, happy belly!

excerpts: The sauce for the roast crab is everything!
So good that I could have the sauce all day with anything.
The second time I came here, my crab was lacking enough sauce
and so I definitely remembered it to be way more flavorful the first time around.
roast crab.author: Annie H.
roast crab.review: The sauce for the roast crab is everything! So good that I could have the sauce all day with anything. The second time I came here, my crab was lacking enough sauce and so I definitely remembered it to be way more flavorful the first time around. The garlic noodles are super delicious. I could probably eat the whole plate to myself, although that would not be a good idea. Also tried the combination fried rice. Didn't like it too much, for it tasted bland. But I do really love this place! Makes all that hard work for a little piece of meat worth it.

excerpts: I ordered their highly popular roast crab with garlic sauce and other spices.
This is MKT Price but is basically $55.
The crab is roasted to perfection with tons of flavor and loads of meat in each leg.
This is a must to have!
There's really no point of coming here if you don't have this.
roast crab.author: Allister D.
roast crab.review:
This place is amazing! The restaurant is clean, service is friendly and very attentive, and the food of course is fantastic. It's one of the best meals I've had in a long time.

Shout out to Evangeline for doing an excellent job with service. She is entertaining and super friendly. 

I ordered their highly popular roast crab with garlic sauce and other spices. This is MKT Price but is basically $55. The crab is roasted to perfection with tons of flavor and loads of meat in each leg. This is a must to have! There's really no point of coming here if you don't have this. I also paired my crab with their garlic noodles which is delicious. It's buttery with garlic tones. 

I will definitely be coming back for more! The food is a huge hit! I also recommend their calamari for $11. Its salty and peppery with a good crisp.

excerpts: 90% of the restaurant was eating the roast crab.
I bet that one was delicious, too but if you don't want to order crab I strongly recommend the tiger prawns.
roast crab.author: Emel M.
roast crab.review: Oh My God (in Janice's voice)! It is the most delicious noddles and tiger prawns I have ever eaten. 90% of the restaurant was eating the roast crab. I bet that one was delicious, too but if you don't want to order crab I strongly recommend the tiger prawns.

excerpts: ROAST CRAB and GARLIC NOODLES.
if you ever have the chance, go to #ThanhLong do so.
roast crab.author: Dee d.
roast crab.review:
These two items will change your life and rock your world. I dream of this place and these two items. It's been 5 years and it didn't disappoint. ROAST CRAB and GARLIC NOODLES. if you ever have the chance, go to #ThanhLong do so. We also had the garlic rice and shaken beef because our friend has a severe seafood allergy. Those items were great, too.  This original location  spread to @crustacean_sf and beyond. .
.

excerpts: Once a year we go here to have our favorite meal of the year, the rest of the time we tamper down our longing for their roast crab!
Amazing food, service and atmosphere-

you will see one of the most diverse patrons in a San Francisco restaurant- young and old, dressed up, dressed down, families and friends - more racial diversity than most - you get the feeling you are in a pre-tech SF.
roast crab.author: Deanna D.
roast crab.review: Once a year we go here to have our favorite meal of the year, the rest of the time we tamper down our longing for their roast crab! Amazing food, service and atmosphere- you will see one of the most diverse patrons in a San Francisco restaurant- young and old, dressed up, dressed down, families and friends - more racial diversity than most - you get the feeling you are in a pre-tech SF. Yes to the drinks (pear martini was fabulous), yes to the garlic noodles, YES to the plastic bib, greasy crab and hot post dinner towels. The prices are more than we can do often - but well worth the experience!!

excerpts: We got the roast crab, the colossal royal tiger prawns, calamari, and spicy eggplant.
The crab is the best crab I have ever had in my life.
The seasoning was amazing and the crab itself was fresh and delicious.
I think one person can eat the crab if they don't order anything else.
The colossal prawns were as delicious.
roast crab.author: Christian A.
roast crab.review: This place is incredible, amazing, and mind blowing. First time coming and already know we'll be returning. We got the roast crab, the colossal royal tiger prawns, calamari, and spicy eggplant. The crab is the best crab I have ever had in my life. The seasoning was amazing and the crab itself was fresh and delicious. I think one person can eat the crab if they don't order anything else. The colossal prawns were as delicious. The prawns are grilled with seasoning and it comes with the garlic noodles. There were four pieces and they tasted so good and fresh. The garlic noodles are so simple, yet so so good. It was so good we ordered two extra plates of it. The calamari was also excellent. It was crispy but tender and soft. The seasoning was great and the accompanying sauce was a great companion. The spicy eggplant was also amazing. It had eggplant, mushrooms, chicken, and shrimp. The sauce is sweet and spicy and goes very well with rice. I know I've described and used amazing a lot, but it's just that good. The staff is also super super friendly. They were very accommodating, friendly, and knew everything we asked them. They gave us bibs as well because the crab can get messy, which it did. Also pro tip, make sure to have a reservation to avoid very long waits. We went on a Saturday, and it was packed. We had a reservation and were seated immediately. One of the best restaurants I've been to.

excerpts:
The roast crab is so expensive but so effing good!!!

Hands-down the roast crab was everyone's favorite. 

The fried garlic rice and the garlic noodles lacked a little bit of flavor however we sopped up the sauce from the roast crab to make the rice and noodles flavorful.
roast crab.author: Wendy G.
roast crab.review:
The food is so freaking good! I teetered between giving Thanh Long 4 stars or 5 stars. The roast crab is so expensive but so effing good!!!

We made a reservation and were seated within five minutes on a busy Saturday evening. There's a $13 valet parking setup in front of the restaurant. We utilized the service since parking in this area can be challenging. Besides it was very cold and raining. The guys in valet were friendly. They got a little behind in the evening but to be expected with the weather and with the large number of people who left the restaurant the same time we did.

Our party of four ordered three crabs, the sea bass, an order of garlic noodles and an order of garlic rice, two appetizers (mango salad and calamari) and each of the ladies had two alcoholic beverages - the only male in our party had 4.  We had two roast crabs and the one cooked with wine. Hands-down the roast crab was everyone's favorite. 

The sea bass was tender but lacked seasoning - a little salt could have helped. The bok choy on this plate was yummy. One of my friends is a country boy from Georgia and he had his first taste of bok choy at this restaurant. He fell in love with it. 

The calamari was so good the greedy ones ‍ at the table contemplated ordering a second one. The mango salad was very good. The mangoes were sweet and the shrimp was very fresh. Everything we had that evening was fresh.

The fried garlic rice and the garlic noodles lacked a little bit of flavor however we sopped up the sauce from the roast crab to make the rice and noodles flavorful. 

We didn't order dessert because one of my friends didn't wear stretchy pants and we did not want to eat dessert in front of her. 

The service was great! Staff were friendly. Our waiter was attentive. We had a great time eating and catching up with dear friends.

Review updated to fix grammatical errors (damn autocorrect).

excerpts: We had the calamari, mango salad, garlic noodles, roast crab, eggplant dish and fried rice.
It was a feast!
Paired well with bottle of white wine.
Only minor hiccup is parking, no lot, I circled the block three times before parking three blocks away.
To find they offer valet for $13.
roast crab.author: Vee V.
roast crab.review: Stopped here for dinner on our first night in San Fran.  It did not disappoint. Everything was delicious and service was excellent, we were seated right away. We had the calamari, mango salad, garlic noodles, roast crab, eggplant dish and fried rice. It was a feast!  Paired well with bottle of white wine. Only minor hiccup is parking, no lot, I circled the block three times before parking three blocks away. To find they offer valet for $13.

excerpts:
$175 (w tax & tip) for 2 Roast Crab, 1 garlic noodle, 1 beer and 1 soft drink.  
-

Roast Crab was fine but greasy AF.  
-
roast crab.author: jihae S.
roast crab.review:
Decent crab, but overall, somewhat overrated and overpriced.  $175 (w tax & tip) for 2 Roast Crab, 1 garlic noodle, 1 beer and 1 soft drink.  
-  Roast Crab was fine but greasy AF.  
-  Garlic Noodles were way overcooked and overpriced ($12 for a medium-sized plate of mushy noodles seasoned with garlic salt). 
-  All the food came out within 5 mins of ordering, and cooled off very quickly - exactly what happens when food is pre-cooked and reheated just before serving.  

For over $55 per crab, you'd think they'd serve it fresh-cooked, but they clearly care more about maintaining quick turnover on tables.  Service staff is very aggressive about clearing your plates as quickly as possible - can make for a rushed, stressful experience. 

Overall, glad we tried this SF staple, but probably won't be back.

excerpts: Roast crab and shrimp with garlic noodle.
The crab is really fresh, and also recommend for garlic noodle.
Thanh Long is really popular, so it is best for reservation.
roast crab.author: Jenny H.
roast crab.review: Roast crab and shrimp with garlic noodle. The crab is really fresh, and also recommend for garlic noodle. Thanh Long is really popular, so it is best for reservation.

excerpts: I got the Roast Crab which was peppery and flavorful.
The crab was easy to crack and the meat was tender.
roast crab.author: Janet C.
roast crab.review: If you love crab, check out this place! I got the Roast Crab which was peppery and flavorful. The crab was easy to crack and the meat was tender. I also got the garlic noodles on the side, but would recommend skipping it if you don't want to be too full.

excerpts: Main course we ordered garlic noodles; best garlic noodles in any restaurant, combination fried rice; also good, and the roast crab; perfectly cooked but no taste or anything special about it at all.
I could've made a better roast crab at home.
So looks like the main dish of the night goes to their garlic noodles.
Oh we also ordered drinks but they seemed to be limited cuz she originally ordered a lychee martini
but they were out n settled for a pear martini instead which was actually good
and I ordered the berkley pilsner
but they were also out
and I settled for a sapporo.
All in all we'll definitely be back and maybe try one of the other crab dishes perhaps.
roast crab.author: Allen R.
roast crab.review: No parking but good thing they have valet. Got seated right away around 1830 on a Thursday night. Place gets really busy around 1930-2000 so good thing we got there early. For an appetizer we ordered coconut prawns; good but nothing special. Main course we ordered garlic noodles; best garlic noodles in any restaurant, combination fried rice; also good, and the roast crab; perfectly cooked but no taste or anything special about it at all. I could've made a better roast crab at home. So looks like the main dish of the night goes to their garlic noodles. Oh we also ordered drinks but they seemed to be limited cuz she originally ordered a lychee martini but they were out n settled for a pear martini instead which was actually good and I ordered the berkley pilsner but they were also out and I settled for a sapporo. All in all we'll definitely be back and maybe try one of the other crab dishes perhaps.

excerpts: We love crab -- and their roast crab looked good -- but we were looking for Asian food, not crab per se...
roast crab.author: Matthew G.
roast crab.review:
Good food, but a little bit of a wait (45 minutes without a reservation, at 6:00 on a Tuesday), and rather pricey.

No, we didn't order the crab (it appears we may have been the only people in the establishment who didn't? We love crab -- and their roast crab looked good -- but we were looking for Asian food, not crab per se... plus, it was $58 per person for crab!), but the items we got were good: garlic noodles (but probably a bit overpriced at about $12 for basically spaghetti with garlic oil, butter, and parmasan), eggplant entree (very delicious, and served with chicken and prawns), and salt and pepper calamari (excellent and probably more reasonably priced than the other two dishes.)

It was pretty astounding to look around and realize that basically ever other person in the room was spending $75+ per person for dinner (considering the $58 plus a drink and, in many cases, an appetizer.)

But everything we got was tasty, and the crab did look good, so if you're willing to shell out the $$$...

excerpts: ROAST CRAB.
roast crab.author: Olivia S.
roast crab.review:
In a few words, the MUST orders: GARLIC NOODLES. ROAST CRAB. SHAKEN BEEF. SPICY EGGPLANT. Period.

All the dishes were pretty much amazing. There was sooooo much flavor!
- The garlic noodles were tossed in oil & garlic and you could slurp every bite.
- The crab meat was so tender & juicy. Plus, you could order different flavors.
- The shaken beef pretty much blew me away. Every cubed piece of meat was marinated so well that the beef melted in my mouth. And it was perfectly complimented w/ the greens & onions.
- The spicy eggplant was also well marinated. This dish was more on the oily side but all the flavor was there. It also took me by surprise that there were chunks of chicken & other veggies in the dish. Win win!

Just a few tips: Make reservations ahead of time. Service is quick. And everything is pretty much family style so be prepared to dig in & share!

excerpts: All I can say is GET THE ROAST CRAB WITH THE GARLIC NOODLES!!
it melts in your mouth and pairs extremely well with the garlic noodles.
Total bill with 2 crabs, an order of garlic noodles, mussels and shaking beef came out to $170!
Until next time
roast crab.author: Shelly W.
roast crab.review:
I never thought I could eat an entire crab by myself, that is until I came to Thanh Long! Thanh Long makes me remember why I am such a huge seafood person. 

We came here as my brother was celebrating a promotion!  Get here early though, they can get pretty busy and when I got here at 6:30, we took one of their last open tables. This is with being open for only an hour and a half on a Saturday! 

All I can say is GET THE ROAST CRAB WITH THE GARLIC NOODLES!! I ordered their mussels as a starter too since they ran out of the salmon carpaccio and they were ok. The crostini was probably the best part because it was perfectly toasted. 

Now, onto the crab ($50)....it melts in your mouth and pairs extremely well with the garlic noodles. I honestly didn't even talk during dinner because I was too busy enjoying the food. 

Service was good and fast. They also give you warm towels to wipe your hands after the meal. Total bill with 2 crabs, an order of garlic noodles, mussels and shaking beef came out to $170! Until next time

excerpts: We got the roast crab, along with garlic noodles, spicy eggplants, shaken beef, salt and pepper calamari, and catch in citrus.
The catch is citrus and shaken beef was my favorite.
The beef was very tender and juicy.
The sauce on the fish was delicious!
The sauce combination was very unique.
roast crab.author: Michelle T.
roast crab.review:
I don't understand the hype of this place. The crab seems really popular so that was a must get when my friends and I came for dinner. We got the roast crab, along with garlic noodles, spicy eggplants, shaken beef, salt and pepper calamari, and catch in citrus.

The crab was underwhelming. It tasted like it was just boiled in water. I didn't taste any garlic. 

The rest of the food we ordered was good. The catch is citrus and shaken beef was my favorite. The beef was very tender and juicy. The sauce on the fish was delicious! The sauce combination was very unique. I've never thought about using orange sauce with fish. 

I'd come back to try other stuff on their menu but will definitely opt out of their crab. If you want good crab, let me introduce you to this one restaurant on Noriega called New Hing Lung. The crab is fried with egg yolk and pumpkin. It's amazing.

excerpts: Roast crab, garlic noodles, shaking beef, calamari are all delicious.
It's a little expensive
but it's worth it every once in a while.
I think we've eaten the eggplant here before
and that was cool too.
roast crab.author: Jonathan N.
roast crab.review: Took my girl out and gave her crabs. This place is fire. Roast crab, garlic noodles, shaking beef, calamari are all delicious. It's a little expensive but it's worth it every once in a while.  I think we've eaten the eggplant here before and that was cool too. Have yet to try their fried rice so I'm looking forward to that next time.

excerpts: The Garlic Noodle and Roast Crab are to die for.
The best combination that you'll ever have guaranteed.
The special seasoning on the crab is like crack too.
Super good!
roast crab.author: Eric L.
roast crab.review: This place is B-E-S-T and I keep coming back.  The Garlic Noodle and Roast Crab are to die for.  The best combination that you'll ever have guaranteed.  The special seasoning on the crab is like crack too.  Super good!  I also like the Seafood Fried Rice cause they put some real crab in it, but next time I might just get 2 orders of the Garlic Noodle.  It's that good!!! Oh yeah, did I mention that the service is awesome too?!

excerpts: I chose to try their "world famous roast crab" and was disappointed by the lack of flavor it provided.
roast crab.author: Ariel D.
roast crab.review:
The food was good but quite bland. Service was prompt and very attentive. I chose to try their "world famous roast crab" and was disappointed by the lack of flavor it provided. This place came so highly recommended I'm rather disappointed by the product I received.

The mandatory gratuity also left a sour taste in my mouth. Not as if we weren't going to tip but being forced to on top of a lackluster meal was not exactly welcoming.

excerpts:
Roast Crab: 3.5
Tasty yes, and particularly liked the butter and pepper that the crab was roasted in.
I just didn't think it was worth the effort and cost.
roast crab.author: Will H.
roast crab.review:
Finally got to go here after a couple failed attempts due to timing. Overall it was a tasty meal. 

Traditional Vietnamese Salad: 4
It lacked the other  items I was expecting in a traditional Vietnamese salad (goi) such as crispy shallots, cilantro, etc. It was basic but tasty. 

Garlic Noodles: 5
Ah, the famous An's garlic noodles. Totally worth it. Garlicky, oily but not overly oily, and best of all the noodles were the perfect texture. Probably the best garlic noodles I've ever had.

Roast Crab: 3.5
Tasty yes, and particularly liked the butter and pepper that the crab was roasted in. I just didn't think it was worth the effort and cost. When I come back, I'd probably go for the garlic noodles again and order other entrees. 

Great wine selection.

excerpts: The roast crab was delicious with the garlic noodles.
The food was great
but I thought was overpriced.
The waiter was ok, never filled my water or came by to ask me.
The place was clean but very tight space.
I'm not sure if I want to come back.
roast crab.author: Nini Y.
roast crab.review: The roast crab was delicious with the garlic noodles.  The food was great but I thought was overpriced.  The waiter was ok, never filled my water or came by to ask me.  The place was clean but very tight space.  I'm not sure if I want to come back.

excerpts: We decided to try Thanh Long because the last two times when we were at Crustacean my roast crab was served cold.
Thanh Long did not disappoint.
Our roast crab was nicely done - served hot/warm.
We will drive a bit further to enjoy our roast crab.
roast crab.author: K Y.
roast crab.review: This is our first time at Thanh Long. We usually go to Crustacean because of location. Thanh Long is a bit of a drive for us. We decided to try Thanh Long because the last two times when we were at Crustacean my roast crab was served cold. Thanh Long did not disappoint. Our roast crab was nicely done - served hot/warm. We will drive a bit further to enjoy our roast crab.

excerpts: After we had crab which is their famous roast crab and garlic noodle.
Best crab in SF.
For dessert we got chocolate lava cake and soo yummy.
Pricey but worth every penny.
Highly recommend this place, you will not be disappointed.
roast crab.author: Hicran K.
roast crab.review: This place is awesome. We ordered to mango salad the taste was incredible. After we had crab which is their famous roast crab and garlic noodle. Best crab in SF. For dessert we got chocolate lava cake and soo yummy. Pricey but worth every penny. Highly recommend this place, you will not be disappointed.

excerpts: Now for the real deal, I ordered a roast crab which has the restaurant's secret spices and garlic sauce on it.
It's humongous and I'm still in awe.
roast crab.author: Vanessa L.
roast crab.review:
Definitely need to make a reservation for this place. Once in a lifetime I'd eat here just cause of the price and because I prefer meat over seafood. 

My coworkers and I ordered salt and pepper calamari and the shrimp toast for appetizers. The calamari I could just not get enough of!!! The mixture of the salt and pepper is just right, not too salty nor spicy. The shrimp toast I wasn't really into it, it's just a fried shrimp and I thought the pieces were really small. 
Now for the real deal, I ordered a roast crab which has the restaurant's secret spices and garlic sauce on it. It's humongous and I'm still in awe. This taste good with the garlic noodles too! I put the garlic noodles in the big shell of the crab to give it more flavor. Everything about the crab was juicy and the butter mixed with the crab is tasty. 
Dessert: I got the creme brulee cheesecake which was rich, thick, and creamy. I'd rate it 3/5. The crust is the best part though.

Service: our waiter was really slow and preferred to take care of other smaller tables. He ignored a lot of our requests and seems to not be paying attention most of the time. For dessert, he asked everybody what they wanted EXCEPT my boss... He's standing right next to him and just skipped him and forgot about him. Dumb!

excerpts: The garlic noodles and the roast crab here are definitely the highlights.
Both are packed with flavor.
The coconut prawns as an appetizer was decent, but nothing special.
roast crab.author: Ali F.
roast crab.review:
The garlic noodles and the roast crab here are definitely the highlights. Both are packed with flavor. The coconut prawns as an appetizer was decent, but nothing special. However, since they charge an arm and a leg per crab, not literally lol (over $50), I'll only come here occasionally.

The place was super busy, even on a weeknight. Service was ok.

excerpts: (For reference, for a visit in December 2016, the price of the Roast Crab was $55 pre-tax)
roast crab.author: Alison L.
roast crab.review:
Yup, the crab is good. And I understand the premium put on it because of the secret recipe and seasonality and all that.  (For reference, for a visit in December 2016, the price of the Roast Crab was $55 pre-tax) 

But do the rest of the dishes also have to be that over-priced?  We ordered the spicy eggplant and prawn dish, which cost $20.  I was expecting humongous prawns. But there weren't even enough prawns to go around (and we only had four people).  This dish at any other asian restaurant would have been half the price.  

I suppose it was worth the experience, but If I'm going to pay for really expensive crab, I think I'd rather the salt and pepper version at R&G Lounge.

excerpts: There are different flavors of crab but our favorite is the Roast Crab.
We've tried the others but Roast Crab is my all-time favorite.
roast crab.author: Precious Ethel P.
roast crab.review:
This has got to be my favorite restaurant!  I will take seafood any day than meat and this place meets my expectations continuously.  Although, they have very limited parking because it is in the city and around a residential area, they provide Valet!  I recommend valet unless you get lucky enough to park in front of the restaurant but goodluck!  Its either street parking or valet because they don't have a private lot.

When we go here, we usually dress more business casual but it totally doesn't matter, you'll get your hands dirty anyways.  The outside of the restaurant doesn't look very pleasing/fancy but the inside looks 10x better!  We ALWAYS ALWAYS make a reservation because they get very busy, especially during the weekends.  The waiting area is quite small but they have a full bar where you can sit, wait, and have a drink.  The restaurant isn't the biggest and it gets a little tight in there, but fortunately, they do have an upstairs area.

Their customer service here is perfect.  They aren't overwhelming, but they are quick to refill your water, and they're always walking around, that way if you need something they're easily accessible.  Everyone is quick, friendly, Americanized (no racial) and professional.

The food is astounding!  We start off with ordering the Salt & Pepper Calamari, sounds plain, but it's the most flavorful calamari ever.  My boyfriend and I always share 1 crab because they are HUGE with lots of meat.  There are different flavors of crab but our favorite is the Roast Crab.  We've tried the others but Roast Crab is my all-time favorite.  We order garlic noodles on the side and the fried banana with vanilla ice cream for dessert.  The traditional Vietnamese salad and mango salad is bomb, very light but good.  If you do want to order some type of meat, the Shaken beef is super tender and melts in your mouth!  EVERYTHING IS JUST DELICIOUS AND HEAVENLY.

The food is comparable to PPQ, if you've ever been there, however, Thanh Long is more expensive but you get what you pay for!  I think PPQ is more on the casual side but if you want to be a little fancier, Thanh Long is the place.

You will not walk out of here disappointed!

excerpts: The roast crab is heaven.
I have never gotten something at market price,  and there are zero wallet regrets about this dining experience.
I got there a little closer to closing but they never bothered me or any other patrons abbot it.
Never hovered.
Just made sure I was enjoying everything.
Not gonna lie, taking apart a crab is messy work.
But the buttery garlic goodness was worth every crack of the shell.
I went on a Friday,  and it was crowded.
But crowded in a family style,  not a stuffy way.
roast crab.author: Bella L.
roast crab.review: The roast crab is heaven. I have never gotten something at market price,  and there are zero wallet regrets about this dining experience. I got there a little closer to closing but they never bothered me or any other patrons abbot it.   Never hovered.  Just made sure I was enjoying everything.   Not gonna lie, taking apart a crab is messy work.   But the buttery garlic goodness was worth every crack of the shell. I went on a Friday,  and it was crowded.  But crowded in a family style,  not a stuffy way.

excerpts: The roast crab is the best flavor, but even that is fairly bland.
roast crab.author: Jennifer W.
roast crab.review:
This place is definitely not as good as PPQ and is more expensive. I would pass on this place after trying it once. 

The roast crab is the best flavor, but even that is fairly bland. The drunken crab is pretty bland and not that great. The garlic noodles have no garlic flavor; all you can taste is butter. I've never been a fan of shaken beef anywhere, but this place's was okay. The calamari was decent/good. 

Good service at this restaurant, large space, easy to find parking. Otherwise, taste-wise, price-wise, really no redeeming value.

excerpts:
get the roast crab with the garlic noodles!
Pricey ($60 for crab) but its market price and seafood is expensive so it makes sense.
Lovely meal, atmosphere and wait staff.
HIGH QUALITY dining!
roast crab.author: Olivia S.
roast crab.review:
BEST CRAB IVE HAD IN MY LIFE!!!!!
WONDERFUL!
get the roast crab with the garlic noodles!
Pricey ($60 for crab) but its market price and seafood is expensive so it makes sense.
Lovely meal, atmosphere and wait staff.
HIGH QUALITY dining!

excerpts: Well, I finally cave with my girlfriends and decided to try the infamous roast crab.

Amongst 3 girls we ordered the following:

-famous garlic roast crab
roast crab.author: Diane T.
roast crab.review:
Finally got to try the infamous Thanh Long located in outer sunset in an unassuming location right next to the N-Judah Stop.

I grew up in the avenues, and Thanh Long is literally a 10 minute walk from my house. Knowing how pricey this establishment is, i've avoided the hype and thought i'll wait. Well, I finally cave with my girlfriends and decided to try the infamous roast crab.

First and foremost, yes..your wallet will empty out after eating here. Portions are small, but food.. although I don't want to admit are very flavorful and delicious. 

Amongst 3 girls we ordered the following:

-famous garlic roast crab: It was around $45-50 for the crab, but if you order anything THIS is it. The crab was perfectly infused with garlicky goodness above a bed of infused butter. This was so yummy and for 3 girls, it was enough to share.

-shaken beef: one of the dishes that lots of folks recommended on yelp. The piece of beef were very tender. Great execution, but i've definitely had better at another joint for cheaper.

-eggplant: the sauce of this was pretty damn bomb. A little more on the sweeter side, but eve my friend that normally don't like the texture of eggplant thoroughly enjoyed this dish. If you want some type of veggie, this is a good complement to the meal.

-garlic noodles: I would say besides the crab, this is the other "must order" according to all the reviewers. For me, it was good...but i really dont get the hype? hehe.

Services was on point. Make sure you make a reservation. Around dinner time the wait definitely can get long.

The 3 of us finished all the food and was quite filled.

excerpts: I don't understand the hype around the "roast crab".
It wasn't as great as the hype makes it out to be.
Also I expected a lot bigger crab for $55!
The crab came out so quick, one can probably assume it was pre-made in the kitchen.
First, it wasn't even hot on the inside.
It appears they roast the crabs and leave the garlic oil and seasoning until its ordered.
Then they pour the seasoning and oil on top of the crab to make it hot again.
also the crab was 1.5 lbs or so.
I can get that size crab at Ranch 99 or something for $7.99/lb.
So about $12 for that same size crab that I had to pay $55 for.
roast crab.author: Adam L.
roast crab.review:
I don't understand the hype around the "roast crab". It wasn't as great as the hype makes it out to be. Also I expected a lot bigger crab for $55! The crab came out so quick, one can probably assume it was pre-made in the kitchen. First, it wasn't even hot on the inside. It appears they roast the crabs and leave the garlic oil and seasoning until its ordered. Then they pour the seasoning and oil on top of the crab to make it hot again. also the crab was 1.5 lbs or so. I can get that size crab at Ranch 99 or something for $7.99/lb. So about $12 for that same size crab that I had to pay $55 for. That seasoning isn't worth $43! 

With that said, the seasoning and taste itself was good. Just not worth the price. We also had shaken beef which was good. But again portion vs. price, not worth it. 

We also had crab puff and garlic noodles. Both of which were expensive and again portion isn't worth the price. 

So overall you get my theme here. Its not worth it to come here.

excerpts: I'm pretty sure there were 3 different ways you can get the crab done, make sure you get the roast crab!
And get ready to get all greasy and dirty!
It will be worth every bite!
roast crab.author: CJ B.
roast crab.review:
I love this restaurant! We came here when we were in town and loved almost everything we had. The mussels are done to a perfection and the crostini adds a bit more to the dish that complements the mussels. 

The garlic noodles....oh where do I start, it seems so simple yet its probably one of the best items on the menu. It's literally a plate of noodles, nothing else on the plate, but that's pretty much all you need.

Salmon Carpaccio, you can probably skip on, it's definitely not the best but it's not terrible either. Then the shaken beef....it's not bad either but I definitely not worth $25.95 at all. The portion is rather small....we ordered that thinking we could share it but definitely not enough for more than one adult. 

I'm pretty sure there were 3 different ways you can get the crab done, make sure you get the roast crab! And get ready to get all greasy and dirty! It will be worth every bite!

excerpts: We had the mussels for an appetizer, the roast crab, the prawns w garlic noodles, and an extra side of garlic noodles because it's our favorite hah.
roast crab.author: Ria A.
roast crab.review:
Delicious food and amazing service! 

I made a reservation for a Saturday and it was very busy. We got there and I told the host that we had a reservation. We waited less than 3 minutes and were seated. The waiter was very prompt to taking our order and our food came out quickly. After we finished our appetizer the waiter even asked us if it was ok for the chef to start cooking our main dish. I want to say that our food came out in less than 10-15 minutes. 

We had the mussels for an appetizer, the roast crab, the prawns w garlic noodles, and an extra side of garlic noodles because it's our favorite hah. Everything was amazing, no complaints and we devoured our food and left with full bellies. 

Parking is only valet and it was $20 because we drove an SUV. It was also pay before instead of after so we had to run to the 7-11 across the street to get money from the ATM. 

But otherwise, Thanh long is still one of my favorites!

excerpts: The roast crab is also good and must to taste it!
roast crab.author: Alex H.
roast crab.review: Much better than I first time came here! Strongly recommend mussels! Too delicious not to order it more than once. The roast crab is also good and must to taste it!

excerpts:
bread was toasted perfectly
calamari - fried nicely, not oily. if you think it is under seasoned...that is what the onions and such are there for.
roast crab - yum yum yum!
both of our crabs came out clean and hot.
everyone at the table loved the whole meal.
