i found a few pieces of my meat to be a bit on the salty side
but i was the only one who felt that way.
a table right next to us had a crab each, those lucky ones!
roast crab.author: Vanessa S.
roast crab.review:
great food, excellent service and a nice ambiance. i'm not sure why people are complaining about the price? yes, it is pricey but isn't that a given going into this? if you're looking for a more budget option, try another place in the city.

we ordered the:
mussels - delicious! bread was toasted perfectly
calamari - fried nicely, not oily. if you think it is under seasoned...that is what the onions and such are there for.
roast crab - yum yum yum! both of our crabs came out clean and hot. everyone at the table loved the whole meal. i found a few pieces of my meat to be a bit on the salty side but i was the only one who felt that way. a table right next to us had a crab each, those lucky ones!
garlic noodles - these are a bit more delicate than those you find at other restaurants. they came out nice and warm. i liked that the noodles weren't quite as thick, personal preference.

for dessert we had:
fried ice cream - i was told this was excellent. it got gobbled up in about five minutes so i think they were being sincere. make sure to get the chocolate and whipped cream on top.
fried banana with ice cream - very good. we didn't get the chocolate or whipped cream, which we will definitely do the next time around.

excerpts: Garlic noodles & the Roast Crab is my family favorite.
Waiters/waitress' are always on it and taking care of you.
Definitely a hidden gem in San Francisco.
roast crab.author: Mikayla A.
roast crab.review: My family has been going here since I was in elementary. I'm 20 years old now and this is the go to place for special occasions. Don't get me wrong, it's very pricey but worth it. Garlic noodles & the Roast Crab is my family favorite. Waiters/waitress' are always on it and taking care of you. Definitely a hidden gem in San Francisco.

excerpts: *Roast crab: a whole dungeness crab roasted with an's garlic sauce & secret spices ($48.96)
Same here.
Where's the garlic flavor?
The oil infused a subtle hint of garlic along with some of their spices, but I remember their crab having a bolder flavor.
This was like eating crab dipped in seasoned oil.
roast crab.author: Elena N.
roast crab.review:
Thanh long, what happened to you?

I was craving crab and garlic noodles, so I decided to order delivery through Postmates. Got two secret kitchen dishes.

*Garlic noodles: an's famous noodles made with special garlic sauce & secret spices ($10.95)
Where was the garlic flavor? Or any flavor at all?! I had to pour some garlic oil from the crab onto the noodles. It gave it flavor, but also made the noodles oily.

*Roast crab: a whole dungeness crab roasted with an's garlic sauce & secret spices ($48.96)
Same here. Where's the garlic flavor? The oil infused a subtle hint of garlic along with some of their spices, but I remember their crab having a bolder flavor. This was like eating crab dipped in seasoned oil. Not my favorite.

I don't know what happened to the delicious crab and garlic noodles I remember having about five years ago. Now, everything is just bland and disappointing.

excerpts: We ordered crab puffs, roast crab, prawns with garlic noodles, and vegetable sauté.
Everything was delicious.
The roast crab was the best crab I've ever eaten.
roast crab.author: Ben S.
roast crab.review:
My hands have never been more buttered and I've never been more happy. 

Our server Eric was our trusted advisor from the beginning. We ordered crab puffs, roast crab, prawns with garlic noodles, and vegetable sauté. Everything was delicious. We also got a quite reasonably priced bottle of champagne to celebrate our anniversary. 

They were the best crab puffs (crab rangoon) I've ever eaten. 

The roast crab was the best crab I've ever eaten. 

We finished our meal with fried pineapple and ice cream. Amazing.

excerpts: Came here with a group of four and got the shaken beef, 2 orders of garlic noodles (obvi), roast crab, and drunken crab.
More than enough to feed four hungry hippos.
The garlic noodles were perfection, the shaken beef was tender and melted in our mouths.
The garlic noodles were perfection, the shaken beef was tender and melted in our mouths.
I preferred the roast crab over the drunken crab, but only by a little.
I preferred the roast crab over the drunken crab, but only by a little.
roast crab.author: Selena L.
roast crab.review:
Came here with a group of four and got the shaken beef, 2 orders of garlic noodles (obvi), roast crab, and drunken crab. More than enough to feed four hungry hippos. The garlic noodles were perfection, the shaken beef was tender and melted in our mouths. I preferred the roast crab over the drunken crab, but only by a little. You really can't go wrong.

2 floors, valet parking ($12), full bar, call for reservations if you don't want to be waiting forever.

excerpts: Anyway,  roast crab was really good (both times i visited) especially when paired with garlic noodles.
It was really good but too big that I couldnt finish and had to take some to go.
As for the starters, my fave is still salt & pepper calamari.
roast crab.author: Isabella D.
roast crab.review:
I've only been here twice. I would give them 4 stars but the service on my second visit wasn't really up to my liking. Our server was kinda slow and most of the time, we were left waiting for him to come back to either take our orders or bring the bill. We are a party of seven so gratuity was already included in our bill. So to me it felt like he wasn't trying anymore to service us. 
 
Anyway,  roast crab was really good (both times i visited) especially when paired with garlic noodles. It was really good but too big that I couldnt finish and had to take some to go. As for the starters, my fave is still salt & pepper calamari. The shrimp toast was okay too, but i prefer calamari. I had creme brulee cheesecake for dessert. The crust was the best part. The chocolate lava is also recommended if you're not a fan of cheesecake.

They are closed on Mondays and open for dinner time only. The restaurant gets really busy (and it's not that big). We had to make a reservation just to make sure that we can get seats and don't have to wait. We arrived on time and our table was ready when we came in. Parking is really hard to find, one of the reasons why I dont frequent this place. They have valet parking but they charge extra if you have a large size car.

excerpts: Long story short, you must order the roast crab ($45) and the garlic noodles ($11)!
Amazing crab and garlic noodles, super quick service (my water was never left empty, and the dishes came out in a flash!), a warm, well decorated ambiance, and good for groups
roast crab.author: Corinna T.
roast crab.review:
I've been here three times now, so a review is long overdue. Long story short, you must order the roast crab ($45) and the garlic noodles ($11)! I've also tried the calamari appetizer and the shaken beef entree ($23) if you're craving for more food. Both are amazing as well.

Pros: Amazing crab and garlic noodles, super quick service (my water was never left empty, and the dishes came out in a flash!), a warm, well decorated ambiance, and good for groups, although I prefer coming here in smaller parties

Cons: It isn't cheap! I've only come here for special occasions mostly. But trust me, it's well worth your while. It's also pretty dim in here, with the dark red ambiance. It gets crowded, so please do yourself a favor and make a reservation especially for big groups!! 

Overall, I've been pleased with this place consecutively the past 3 times, and I will keep coming back.

excerpts: Roast crab and garlic noodles is the only way to go when you're there.
The place was packed the whole time we were there.
roast crab.author: Gene D.
roast crab.review:
We haven't been here in ages!  Was it going to be as good as we had remembered?  Was it going to be the best we'd ever had?

Yes and Yes!  Roast crab and garlic noodles is the only way to go when you're there.  The place was packed the whole time we were there.  It can get a bit too noisy but everyone's having a great time enjoying their delicious fare.  

It's no wonder why Thanh Long has been around for so long.  Consistently great food and service.  Bravo!

excerpts: He got our water and hot jasmine tea going and answered questions about our menu choices such as how much roast crab and garlic noodles to order for our party of 10, which fish was the better choice, ...
We went with 2 roasted crabs and 2 garlic noodles because Grandpa's dish of tiger prawns came with garlic noodles.
There were 4 tiger prawns in the dish.
The prawns were excellent.
There weren't enough for everybody at the table.
The garlic noodles always a hit with everybody especially the younger ones in the party.
We had to order another garlic noodles and a large bowl of steamed rice.
roast crab.author: Belinda L.
roast crab.review:
It's been 21 years since we ate at this restaurant. The occasion then was my husband asking my parents for my hand in marriage. My sister wanted to celebrate my twin daughters' 18th birthday here. My husband made the reservation. There were only 2 reservations available a 5:30 p.m. or 8:30 p.m. We took the later one because of other obligations. There was a little bit of a wait for our table when we arrived.
Alex was our server. He got our water and hot jasmine tea going and answered questions about our menu choices such as how much roast crab and garlic noodles to order for our party of 10, which fish was the better choice, ... We went with 2 roasted crabs and 2 garlic noodles because Grandpa's dish of tiger prawns came with garlic noodles. There were 4 tiger prawns in the dish. The prawns were excellent. There weren't enough for everybody at the table. The garlic noodles always a hit with everybody especially the younger ones in the party. We had to order another garlic noodles and a large bowl of steamed rice. We had the salt and pepper calamari. We ordered the lemongrass chicken for Grandma. The dish was so tasty and the vegetables so tender that the grandchildren ate a good portion of the dish. We wonder if Grandma got enough to eat. The younger twin chose the steamed sea bass. It was a very good dish leaving everybody who had a chunk of the fish wanting more. The older twin enjoyed her shaken beef. The younger twin and her father thoroughly enjoyed the roasted crab and the big chunks of meat they got out of every leg.
The twins received complimentary desserts of ice cream in recognition of their birthday. The older twin shared a fried banana a la mode with her mother. Aunt and uncle also ordered another fried banana a la mode. The older twin liked the way the banana was fried. The fried layer was not thin. The vanilla ice cream tasted very natural. Little cousin ordered the lava cake with ice cream. We'll have to come back another time to try the homemade sorbet which is on the list of foods the younger twin can have not being able to tolerate milk products.
The roast crabs cost $55 each. We probably should have ordered another dish of lemongrass chicken and steamed sea bass.
Alex and another server helped us take group pictures to commemorate the occasion. We enjoyed our dinner tremendously.

excerpts: Roast crab and garlic noodle are incredibly delicious.
roast crab.author: L P.
roast crab.review: The outside appearance of this restaurant is just ordinary, however,  the food is great there. We will definitely come back. Roast crab and garlic noodle are incredibly delicious.

excerpts: so we ended up ordering Tempura Style Coconut Prawns, Thanh Long Mussels, the Roast Crab and Garlic Noodles.
The Prawns were ok.
Nothing that blew me away.
The Mussels; however,  were delicious.
I would definitely order that again for an appetizer.
The Roast Crab...
O M G!
That was the BEST crab I have ever had!
I'm not really too sure what all the spices they use
but it was heaven.
The crab meat was so tender and flavorful.
roast crab.author: Kevin G.
roast crab.review:
So, last week I was planning on driving to Austin, Texas for some barbecue and I get a phone call from my sister asking me what I was up to.  She asked me if I wanted to take a one day trip to San Francisco.  "Heck yea!", I told her.  I haven't been to SF in years.  Now, I had my heart set on going to House of Prime Rib but they were booked a month in advance.  But, I had remembered seeing Thanh Long featured on either the Travel or Food Channel weeks beforehand so I tried booking a reservation online.  Sadly, there was nothing available so I called the restaurant and got a reservation!

I viewed the menu online and browsed through the photos on Yelp beforehand.  I knew I wanted to order the Thanh Long Mussels and An's Famous Garlic Noodles.  I was up in the air on the Dungeness Crab because I knew it would be rather pricey.

We arrived at 5:30 that night and was promptly seated to our table.  We looked around and noticed that every table was having the crab so we asked our server what the market price was ($53.95 as of October 8th).  We figured we would not be back to SF for awhile so we ended up ordering Tempura Style Coconut Prawns, Thanh Long Mussels, the Roast Crab and Garlic Noodles.  The Prawns were ok.  Nothing that blew me away.  The Mussels; however,  were delicious.  I would definitely order that again for an appetizer.  The Roast Crab...O M G!  That was the BEST crab I have ever had!  I'm not really too sure what all the spices they use but it was heaven.  The crab meat was so tender and flavorful.  And the Garlic Noodles may not look like much when it arrives to your table, but once you take a bite you will not be able to stop slurping those noodles.  Mix it with the sauce from the crab and it tastes even better!  

The service here is top notch!  They kept checking back with us to see how everything was and constantly refilled our drinks (soda and iced tea).  I would definitely recommend and come back here for dinner.  Anyone who has rated this place below 5 stars is absolutely nuts.  Thanh Long is on point!

excerpts: One roast crab each, with that amazing crusty marinade and garlic noodles.
Decent service.
roast crab.author: James D.
roast crab.review:
Worth the mission out to the sunset. Wow, I was very impressed. One roast crab each, with that amazing crusty marinade and garlic noodles. Decent service. The meat delectable.

Great experience and I think despite being so popular its a bit of a secret.

excerpts: Roast Crab and Garlic Noodles.
Why order anything else?
Been here a dozen times in over a decade
and I order the same thing EVERY time.
Why?
Cause it's ALWAYS fantastic.
Unhealthy as hell, but FANTASTIC!
roast crab.author: Arnel L.
roast crab.review:
Roast Crab and Garlic Noodles.  Why order anything else? Been here a dozen times in over a decade and I order the same thing EVERY time. Why?  Cause it's ALWAYS fantastic. Unhealthy as hell, but FANTASTIC!  I've also 'sampled' the Shaken Beef, the Sea Bass, and the Saigon Beef, all of which are very good. I also think the calamari and mussel appetizers are very good.  I think the calamari could be a little more crispy, but that's just me personal preference. 

They have a full bar and my wife tells me the Lychee Martini was very good. Runs about $10 a pop!

Parking sucks in the area. Valet parking is available for $12, otherwise expect to park 1-2 blocks away, and be prepared to circle the streets looking for parking. 

Reservations are a must. They get very crowded...despite the crappy parking situation.

excerpts: I came here with my little family to try their infamous garlic noodles and roast crab.
They definitely met my expectations, but what didn't meet my expectations was the customer service.
roast crab.author: Irene N.
roast crab.review:
I came here with my little family to try their infamous garlic noodles and roast crab.  They definitely met my expectations, but what didn't meet my expectations was the customer service.  Although they were friendly there were just a few things that could've improved....

1. My reservation was for 4 as in if I didn't make it they would charge me $100 ($25/ person) 1 of which happens to be a very noodle-hungry toddler.  They didn't give him his own cup of water, so I gave him mine, and you bet your ass I wasn't drinking from that cup after....with all that garlic noodle back wash! 

2. When I wanted to ask for water no one came by to check on our table, which would've given me the perfect opportunity to ask for water (yeah still on that subject.....I was thirsty).

3. After a few minutes, I finally flagged someone down to get me a glass of my own water, and a dessert menu.....a few minutes passed by and I didn't get either. So when I reminded the gentleman for the dessert menu (gave up on the water) his response was "oh yes, there are only 3 kinds.....chocolate cake, creme brulee cake, and banana" uhhh do you want to be more specific about the 3rd option?  Is it a cake? Is it served with ice cream? Or are you just going to charge me $15 for some fucking fruit?!?!?! So I said forget it, and asked for the check.

4. Oh and when the host asked us if we wanted a drink my hubby asked for a "kentucky mule" the host said they didn't have that....ok but I'm sure your bar tender can confirm that! 

Overall it was an ok experience, definitely good for take out and maybe a date with just my hubby, or maybe I came at a bad time, since they automatically charge an 18% gratuity for Father's Day they didn't feel the need to work for the tip.

excerpts:
$300 for 2 roast crab, 1 drunken crab, one prawn w/ garlic noodle, stir fry squid in tomato sauce, a side of garlic rice for $8.50....wtf...and a heineken beer.  
Roast crab tasted like butter and black pepper, the drunken crab came with a big ass bowl of soup that tasted like bland chicken stock with some green onions thrown inside.

Roast crab tasted like butter and black pepper, the drunken crab came with a big ass bowl of soup that tasted like bland chicken stock with some green onions thrown inside.
roast crab.author: Cyrus P.
roast crab.review:
$300 for 2 roast crab, 1 drunken crab, one prawn w/ garlic noodle, stir fry squid in tomato sauce, a side of garlic rice for $8.50....wtf...and a heineken beer.  I also ordered the mussels in ginger sauce and asked the waitress if she'll remember everything I ordered and she said "Of course!"...never got our mussels, think we paid for it to.

The garlic noodles were disgusting....over cooked...OVER COOKED...I didn't taste any fresh garlic on there.  All I tasted was butter with powdered Parmesan cheese and most likely powdered garlic.  Roast crab tasted like butter and black pepper, the drunken crab came with a big ass bowl of soup that tasted like bland chicken stock with some green onions thrown inside.

$300.......not worth it.  This place is still alive because of it's past recognition, but so sorry to say it's well past that time for this place.

excerpts: Drunken Crab-Honestly after tasting the roast crab, the drunken crab tastes a little bland.
Roast Crab-
The best!It was so flavorful!Crab was tender and
roast crab.author: Bella T.
roast crab.review:
Me and my Husband were in SF for the weekend and our relatives brought us here for dinner. Its a nice and cozy family style restaurant.
Our Orders:

1. Garlic Noodles-I've read lots of reviews about it.It was tasty, but after eating it for quite sometime you'll feel that you need to stop.Probably the garlic taste?

2. Vegetarian Delight-Wasn't too impressed with it.It tasted a little bland but it had a good amount of different veggies and tofu.

3.Colossal Royal Tiger Prawns-The prawns came with garlic noodles.Prawns were flavorful and yummy.

4. Drunken Crab-Honestly after tasting the roast crab, the drunken crab tastes a little bland.

5. Roast Crab-The best!It was so flavorful!Crab was tender and you just feel like you can't stop.

Dessert we ordered fried pineapple with ice cream and it was a great ending to our dinner.Would definitely go back for the roasted crab.Service was excellent.

Best time to come is at 5:30 or maybe a little before 6pm.After that the line starts.Or better call and reserve a place.Enjoy!

excerpts: Get the roast crab and garlic noodles.
Simple.
So so good.
roast crab.author: Jenann P.
roast crab.review:
Crab is market price. In our case about $45 each so it's not cheap.

I used to go here as a kid and remember it being the best crab ever. Fast forward 15 years and I tried the place again recently. It is delicious still! The service is good and the food comes out fast. Make sure you make a reservation and be on time though otherwise they will not seat you without your entire party present.

The crab was really peppered and buttered. My dad who is a fisherman said the crab was not fresh but I am no seafood connoisseur and I loved it.

Get the roast crab and garlic noodles. Simple. So so good.

excerpts: The garlic noodles are good (we had 3 people and needed two orders) and we got two roast crab.
The crab was perfectly salty with a good amount of garlic and butter.
Bit on the pricey side but would definitely come again!
roast crab.author: Sara F.
roast crab.review: This was the first place I ever had crab and boy was it delicious! We got a reservation in advance and I'm glad we did as it was pretty busy, even on a weeknight. The garlic noodles are good (we had 3 people and needed two orders) and we got two roast crab. The crab was perfectly salty with a good amount of garlic and butter. Bit on the pricey side but would definitely come again!

excerpts: Why order that when roast crab is right above it on the menu.
Goes well with garlic noodles, roast crab and any wine.
roast crab.author: Michael G.
roast crab.review: The best crab in town. The toast crab and drunken crab is very good. Not so much the tamarind crab. Why order that when roast crab is right above it on the menu. Make your dinner surf 'n turf by adding the Shaken Beef. Meat is so tender and full of flavor. Goes well with garlic noodles, roast crab and any wine.

excerpts: We ordered salt & pepper calamari, garlic rice and roast crab.
Everything   tasted so good.
Specially the roast crab.
I havent found any other restaurant that can compete with their roast crab.
The service is awesome.
Our waiter was very attentive.
A bit pricey buy worth it!
roast crab.author: Ro A.
roast crab.review: DELICIOUS!!!! We ordered salt & pepper calamari, garlic rice and roast crab. Everything   tasted so good. Specially the roast crab. I havent found any other restaurant that can compete with their roast crab. The service is awesome. Our waiter was very attentive. A bit pricey buy worth it!

excerpts: 3) brown and white rice to go with the roast crab juices!
roast crab.author: Robin Y.
roast crab.review:
Soooo much love for Thanh Long's roasted crab and garlic noodles! This is me and my family's go to place for a celebratory dinner or family gathering. 

We came on a Saturday night (probably our 4th time here) with reservations and were seated quickly in 5 minutes. The service was GREAT! And my great, I mean, when we added an order of garlic noodles they came out in mere seconds! 

As for the food: 
Appetizers:
1) fried calamari: perfect combo of salty, spicy, and chewy. Not too greasy. 
2) mango salad- MY FAVE! It's served warm, with pieces of sweet, juicy mango, and roasted shrimp. Mmmm party in my mouth! 
3) Vietnamese salad: kind of like a papaya salad. Good balance of savory and sweet, but I preferred the mango salad. 

Main courses: 
1) 4 roasted crabs ($44/crab) for 7 people. (If you are only ordering crab, 1/person is good, but if you want to sample other entrees, it's a good idea to order less) MY LOVE. Their roasted crab...mind bogglingly delicious. Eat while its hot, and the juices drip all over and the flavor permeates through to the meat, instead of most crab places that can't get it right! 
2) shaken beef- tender buttery chunks of beef with roasted potato chunks soaked in the beef drippings. Scrumptious. 
3) 2 orders of garlic noodles- the best you'll find anymore. I love that the garlic flavor is present but not overpowering, and balances the flavor of the butter. Comes out steaming hot! 
3) brown and white rice to go with the roast crab juices! 

Thanh Long is the go to place for delicious crab! Do it! It's worth the splurge! You will walk out a happier person.

excerpts: The roast crab is definitely eye catching and comes out smelling deliciously like garlic.
roast crab.author: Ruth M.
roast crab.review:
We came for dinner on a Saturday night with reservations and were seated right away. Our waitress was really attentive and even brought us a dish of garlic noodles complimentary because one of our dishes was taking much longer to prepare and they didn't have the Vietnamese salad available.

All in all delicious. The roast crab is definitely eye catching and comes out smelling deliciously like garlic. The garlic noodles are a perfect accompanying dish. I got the Villager's favorite, a homey dish of sumptuous pork medallions and prawns in a salty broth reduction (definitely need a side of jasmine rice to calm that saltiness!).

I would come back for some flavorful seafood. Valet parking was offered.

excerpts: I love the garlic noodles and roast crab!!
A must try.
I crave for it all the time when I leave.
roast crab.author: Melanie J.
roast crab.review: Every time I'm in town I can't wait to eat here! I love the garlic noodles and roast crab!! A must try. I crave for it all the time when I leave.

excerpts: We ordered the roast crab and shaken beef since we weren't that hungry.
Bf's shaken beef wasn't bad.
We got chocolate lava cake and crème brûlée to cheer me up from the crab disappointment...
first world problems ftw!
I'll have to say that dessert was the best part of our dinner
PPQ Dungeness Island does it better.
roast crab.author: Jenny Q.
roast crab.review:
I had this place bookmarked for a good 3 months after seeing it on Travel Channel and hearing coworkers rave about it.

Bf and I made reservations an hour before arriving on a Friday night. I thought it would be a little harder to get a reservation so I was happy about that.

The place was packed when we got there and we waited a little past our reservation time to get seated. No biggie. We ordered the roast crab and shaken beef since we weren't that hungry. 

When I tried the crab my tongue curled in repulsion..the thing was literally covered in grease and black pepper! Seemed more like a fried crab than a roasted crab lol..I asked our waiter if I ordered the right thing and she ended up bringing me another crab 2 minutes later with less pepper. I appreciate the service but the crab just wasn't good no matter how much pepper is on it. 

Bf's shaken beef wasn't bad. We got chocolate lava cake and crème brûlée to cheer me up from the crab disappointment...first world problems ftw! 
I'll have to say that dessert was the best part of our dinner :)
PPQ Dungeness Island does it better.

excerpts:
($10)

*Roast Crab - this is what everyone gets!
roast crab.author: Michelle L.
roast crab.review:
It really doesn't get any better than this when it comes to crab!    I called a couple days in advance to make a 7pm reservation on a Sunday night.  They offer valet service outside the restaurant for $12.  Highly recommended since parking is a B!  There is no parking lot, only street parking in the surrounding neighborhood.

Got there 10 minutes before our reservation and they were able to seat us downstairs right away! We ordered:

*Salt and Pepper calamari - not your typical calamari at American restaurants and they don't provide any dipping sauces.  This was almost too peppered, but still delicious nonetheless.
 
*Garlic Noodles - THE BEST garlic noodles I've ever tasted, hands down.  1 order is enough for about 3-4 people.  ($10)

*Roast Crab - this is what everyone gets!  A whole crab in their special garlic sauce. They gut the inside of main body for you so the head you get is nothing but the shell. The plate is buttered for your for your dipping pleasure.  (Market price ~$40 each crab)

*Fried banana with ice cream - so delicious and really hits the spot.

The service was really fast, we never waited long for anything to come out.  They give you bowls to put your crab shells in.  They refilled our water like 5 times; they were on point with checking up on our table the whole night. And at the end of your meal, they give you hot towels to wipe all the crab guts off your hands.

I always recommend this place to anyone looking for good crab places in the city!

excerpts: Overall, still the best place when you're in the mood for roast crab and garlic noodles.
Note: cash only for valet parking.
roast crab.author: Cera-Lyn S.
roast crab.review: Ok now I remember why this place is still one of my all time favs! I have not been here in over 10 years and the quality and service is still the best. The roasted crab was still buttery and garlicky and the noodles. Oh. My. God. Started off at the bar and the drinks were not that strong. Reservations were easy enough over the phone but once there we still had to wait about 20 minutes. Line out the door and packed in the front like sardines. No personal space here. Ordered the appetizers: crab wontons and calamari and the shrimp salad. Everything was excellent! Roasted crab was amazing the only drawback was the body of crab was not that fat. Garlic noodles were the right amount of butter and garlic. Finished off with FBI-fried banana and ice cream was so amazing. The fried banana was heated and the cold from the coconut ice cream was such a great combination! All of the copy cats cannot compare. The only thing was the sea bass my husband ordered was late and was a bit rubbery but the server gave free garlic noodle in return. I do miss the old days when there were white tablecloths and the busboys scraping the crab and crap off your table but the heated towels still come out. Be careful tho. My brother kinda felt the burn of the towel. Overall, still the best place when you're in the mood for roast crab and garlic noodles. Note: cash only for valet parking.

excerpts: Hits - roast crab, garlic noodles.
That's it.
roast crab.author: Nat N.
roast crab.review:
I started coming here when I lived in San Fran, and even though I don't live there anymore, I'll still make it a point to come here every time I visit the Bay area.  

By now you should know that the owners of Thanh Long are the same owners as Crustaceans, and both places have the same menus and presumptively the same recipes.  But I've tried Crustaceans in San Fran and also LA, and Crustaceans is just not as good as Thanh Long.  Not only is the food tastier at Thanh Long, but the portions are more generous.  I also like how the atmosphere at Thanh Long is more casual than Crustaceans.  

The only drawback is that it's located in the outer sunset area, which is accessible via the N Judah line, or you can drive (good luck finding parking in this neighborhood).  

Hits - roast crab, garlic noodles.  That's it.  Don't waste your time ordering anything else.  

Miss - dessert

I like to end my meal with their hot Jasmine tea.  Hot tea is always soothing after a greasy, buttery meal.

excerpts: Roast crab was good, but not for @54.95.
Go elsewhere!
Service was good.
Noodles also great tasting.
Try Kiron and D and A café in SF.
Great food for better prices.
These owners are greedy, will not go back!!!!!!
Clifford R. Den Otter, 80 year old navy veteran
roast crab.author: Clifford D.
roast crab.review:
My 2 sons, daughter, and me had dinner there lest night. Appitizers of dumplings, and the one with soft shell crab very small. Annapolis, MD. and Virginia have much larger and better. Over priced. Roast crab was good, but not for @54.95. Go elsewhere! Service was good. Noodles also great tasting. Try Kiron and D and A café in SF. Great food for better prices. These owners are greedy, will not go back!!!!!!
Clifford R. Den Otter, 80 year old navy veteran

excerpts: We always get the Roast crab and garlic noodles.
If the service had been just as perfect, I would have given it a fifth star.
roast crab.author: Elizabeth D.
roast crab.review: We love Thanh Long and go there whenever my Mom or guests are in town. The food is always exquisite. We always get the Roast crab and garlic noodles. If the service had been just as perfect, I would have given it a fifth star.

excerpts: *Roast Crab (market price: $38.95) - Okay.
The crab was roasted and marinated oil and a lot of pepper.
roast crab.author: Nicole S.
roast crab.review:
Sunday marked my third time here.  PPQ is my first choice for garlic crab, but my friend had never tried Thanh Long so we planned our dinner here.  

RESERVATIONS:
We had a reservation for 3 at 5:30pm.  Two of us arrived a couple minutes after 5:30pm and checked in, however they wouldn't seat us until the entire party was present.

FOOD:
*Roast Crab (market price: $38.95) - Okay.  The crab was roasted and marinated oil and a lot of pepper.  The menu stated garlic sauce but it seemed like oil/butter and lacked the full on garlic taste I was looking for.

*Drunken Crab (market price: $38.95) - Good.  The crab is simmered with chardonnay, sake, and brandy with scallions, chives, and pepper.  The crab tasted great dipped in the broth.  Note: all the pepper does sink to the bottom of the dish so if you're going to dip your crab meat in the broth, do so in the middle.

*Garlic Noodles ($9.95) - Okay.  The noodles were soggier than I remember and a lot less garlic. I use to prefer Thanh Long's noodles over anywhere else, however it seems like they don't put as much as they use to. 

SERVICE:
Don't expect stellar service or even any service.  Our waiter simply took our order and ignored us.  The only time he came over was when my friend flagged him down to order another bowl of garlic noodles.  In my opinion, I believe Thanh Long assumes they already have their clientele and don't put the effort into customer service.

PARKING:
$10 valet or street parking.  Be prepared to circle several times if you chose to self park.

Bottom line?  Thanh Long is overrated and more expensive than other crab venues (i.e. their shaking beef was $24).

excerpts: Back then, the Roast Crab was literally pushed out of through a hatch in the wall(barely the size of the dish) and then the hatch was quickly closed as if they closely guarding a treasured family recipe(which they probably were).
The dining space has since expanded and the decor is tasteful if not somewhat pedestrian now.
But that's ok, because Thanh Long is all about the roast crab for me and the droves of patrons that eagerly walk through their doors every day.
We had a cocktail each, which were not memorable, and ordered the Traditional Vietnamese Salad, Garlic Noodles, and of course, the Roast Crab.
Everything was light and delightfully flavorful, as I had remembered.
The Roast Crab had a nicely weighted blend of black pepper, butter, garlic, and various other spices.
roast crab.author: Dennis W.
roast crab.review:
It has been nearly 10 years since I had last dined at Thanh Long. Back then, the Roast Crab was literally pushed out of through a hatch in the wall(barely the size of the dish) and then the hatch was quickly closed as if they closely guarding a treasured family recipe(which they probably were).
The dining space has since expanded and the decor is tasteful if not somewhat pedestrian now. But that's ok, because Thanh Long is all about the roast crab for me and the droves of patrons that eagerly walk through their doors every day.
We had a cocktail each, which were not memorable, and ordered the Traditional Vietnamese Salad, Garlic Noodles, and of course, the Roast Crab.
Everything was light and delightfully flavorful, as I had remembered. The Roast Crab had a nicely weighted blend of black pepper, butter, garlic, and various other spices. The garlic noodles were al dente with enough garlic to invade your senses but not overpower.
Thanh Long was started by the An family 30 years ago and I consider this establishment a true classic cuisine staple of San Francisco.

excerpts: Very good roast crab, garlic noodles.
Make a reservation.
Worth the trip to outer sunset
roast crab.author: Art-Suzanne R.
roast crab.review: Very good roast crab, garlic noodles.  Make a reservation.  Worth the trip to outer sunset

excerpts: The flavors of the roast crab is intense and I definitely recommend the vegetarian delight.
The sweet tang is a great balance to the crab.
The staff were so friendly and attentive (without being over bearing).
They are great with kids as the staff were engaging my 4 year old often.
roast crab.author: Peter W.
roast crab.review: Thanh Long has become my wife and I's anniversary spot.  The food like most reviews on yelp is just freaking awesome!  The flavors of the roast crab is intense and I definitely recommend the vegetarian delight.  The sweet tang is a great balance to the crab.  The staff were so friendly and attentive (without being over bearing).  They are great with kids as the staff were engaging my 4 year old often.

excerpts: The Roast crab was pretty good, but I like the ones at R&L Lounge more.
roast crab.author: Tina Y.
roast crab.review:
Why all the high marks??  This place was weird.  Luckily a friend of ours was able to secure a reservation for four the day of.  This place is very unassuming on the outside, you may walk past without even noticing it.  There were crowds upon entering, luckily our reservation time was honored.  Walking inside, I noticed that this place was much larger that it appears to be.

Between the four of us, we ordered two roast crabs, two garlic noodles, and an eggplant dish.   The garlic noodles were delicious, full of lard, but delicious.  Unfortunately, this dish must be consumed immediately, once it cools off the lard solidifies and becomes disgusting.

The Roast crab was pretty good, but I like the ones at R&L Lounge more.  

The eggplant dish was also soaked in oil, but nonetheless tasty.  This place didn't make it to my must visit every time I'm in San Francisco list.  Sorry, I personally think everything was a tad bit too greasy and cooked almost in a take out sort of fashion.  I think the demographics visiting the restaurant speaks for itself.

excerpts: Also, I love the roast crab.
The molten lava cake is the best dessert I've had at an Asian restaurant.
roast crab.author: Jared G.
roast crab.review: OMG -- the garlic noodles here are amazing. How do they pack all that garlic flavor into the noodles.    Also, I love the roast crab.   The molten lava cake is the best dessert I've had at an Asian restaurant.

excerpts: We loved the roast crab and garlic noodles, but the veggies were also really good.
Green beans were delicious and cooked perfectly.
roast crab.author: Sue R.
roast crab.review:
We loved the roast crab and garlic noodles, but the veggies were also really good.  Green beans were delicious and cooked perfectly.  Glad the crab season has been more successful this year.  

Started with coconut prawns which had a tasty sauce.  There was one apiece for our party of five so you will need to double order if you want more.  

It's all pricier than I remember but worth it for a special dinner, which it was.

excerpts: Had the salt & pepper calamari (amazing), roast crab and garlic noodles.
The noodles were a tad bit on the dry side but the flavor was excellent.
Would definitely come here again.
Cons are the location and parking situation but thats the SF struggle.
Highly recommend!
roast crab.author: Stacey B.
roast crab.review: Went here last night for my birthday. Excellent service, great drinks and food was delicious. Had the salt & pepper calamari (amazing), roast crab and garlic noodles. The noodles were a tad bit on the dry side but the flavor was excellent. Would definitely come here again. Cons are the location and parking situation but thats the SF struggle. Highly recommend!

excerpts: You come here for the roast crab and garlic noodles,
yes
but I wanted to try something new.
Roast crab was just ok.
I prefer PPQ and the salt & pepper fried crab at R&G more.
Thanh Long's crab was flavorful but over peppered and garlic oiled at times.
The weak part was the tamale in the shell.
It seemed like it was cleaned out a bit and the crab wasn't as big as it usually is.
Maybe its not so in season now
but they should still be reserving colossal size crabs for their dishes.
roast crab.author: Kevin L.
roast crab.review:
I think the last time I was here was 6 years ago.  And this was probably the first "fancy" restaurant I went to back in high school.  And the first time for garlic noodles that was so WOW to me back then.  20 years later and many many new culinary experiences, the garlic noodles ain't no big thang.

You come here for the roast crab and garlic noodles, yes but I wanted to try something new.  So in addition, I got the mango salad and seafood dumpling.  And also the steamed sea bass entree.

Roast crab was just ok.  I prefer PPQ and the salt & pepper fried crab at R&G more.  Thanh Long's crab was flavorful but over peppered and garlic oiled at times.  The weak part was the tamale in the shell.  It seemed like it was cleaned out a bit and the crab wasn't as big as it usually is.  Maybe its not so in season now but they should still be reserving colossal size crabs for their dishes.  We had the prawns with garlic noodles.  The prawns very overdone a bit and had too much buttery/pepper smeared over it.  It was cholesterol city last night.

Mango salad too my surprise had stir fried shrimp and onions on top making the salad a bit warm and welted.

Seafood dumpling seem like it was heated in the microwave and had a dry appearance.

Both salad and dumpling came out super fast.

Sea bass was over done too and just wasn't as smooth as it should be.  Sea bass ain't suppose to taste "meaty".  I think a filet-o-fish has an even more delicate flaky texture.  I would rather had two filet-o-fish sandwiches on that big plate instead of the sea bass.

No plate presentation on anything.

Ordered a pineapple lychee martini before ordering food but it never came and the food did.  I had to ask and then they said they were all out of the infusion?  So I tried a passion tea martini which came after the entrees.  So it sat there getting warm as I started to eat and didn't feel like drinking it anymore.  It was nice when it was straight cold.  

Server who took our order never came back to ask what's up with the food.  Instead the runner asked?  Pretty whack on service.

$41.95 for the crab is totally not worth it.  I would pay 20 bucks at most.  In fact, I can make this at home and I do every time crab season starts.  Go to sunset supermarket or new may wah and get some live crabs and cook it up at home.  I could of cooked a bunch of crab for the money I spent here.

All good, it was my birthday and didn't want to cook at home and Thanh Long is about 4 minutes from my home.

excerpts: We ordered the shaken beef, roast crab and garlic noodles.
I really liked the shaken beef and garlic noodles.
I really liked the shaken beef and garlic noodles.
The shaken beef was cooked nicely with lots of flavor.
The garlic noodles were great, way better than PPQ, plus it didn't dry out while we were enjoying other foods.
The roast crab was good but not good enough in my opinion.
roast crab.author: Mabel Y.
roast crab.review:
Thanh Long has received a lot of recognition and I know my friend really loves this place.

Came here last Friday night with my boyfriend for dinner, luckily I made a reservation the night before because it was quite packed after we were seated.

We ordered the shaken beef, roast crab and garlic noodles. I really liked the shaken beef and garlic noodles. The shaken beef was cooked nicely with lots of flavor. The garlic noodles were great, way better than PPQ, plus it didn't dry out while we were enjoying other foods. The roast crab was good but not good enough in my opinion. It lacked flavor and finesse.

The service was friendly and no nonsense. I'll be back!

excerpts: We had the coconut prawns and New Zealand mussels for appetizer, garlic noodles, roast crab, tamarind crab, and shaken beef for main course.
I remember having the coconut prawns at their home before
and I absolutely fell in love with this dish.
Crispy from the tempura, sweet from the coconut flake, a little tangy of their signature orange sauce.
It was such a balanced dish and a great start of the meal.
Onto the main dish, garlic noodles, I thought I liked it better when I ate at their house, but my boyfriend loved the noodle served at the restaurant.
It was garlicky, but a little sweet for me.
The crabs were very fresh and the color looked amazing.
Roast crab, which seem to be every Yelper's favorite, yet not me.
Tamarind crab was okay, the sauce was not thick and tangy enough for a Vietnamese like me who technically grow up eating tamarind crab every other weekend in Vietnam.
Lastly, shaken beef was perfectly medium rare, juicy and full of flavors.
roast crab.author: Chau V.
roast crab.review:
Thanh Long has been on my bookmark for quite some time now, so we couldn't miss a chance to have dinner at Thanh Long on our most recent visit to the City by the Bay.

Holy crabs!

My boyfriend's mom is a close friend of one of the daughters of the An family's and we have tried all the signature dishes at the home of the chef before, but dining at their restaurant was a different experience. If you plan to have dinner at weekend, it is essential to make reservation ahead and arrive promptly because the wait can get hectic (about 1-1:45 hours). Also, don't come like 30 minutes early for your reservation since they will make you wait until your whatever time you reserve.

We had the coconut prawns and New Zealand mussels for appetizer, garlic noodles, roast crab, tamarind crab, and shaken beef for main course. I remember having the coconut prawns at their home before and I absolutely fell in love with this dish. Crispy from the tempura, sweet from the coconut flake, a little tangy of their signature orange sauce. It was such a balanced dish and a great start of the meal. Mussels were fresh, the Asian pesto was flavorful and the crostini accompanied really well with the other two.

Onto the main dish, garlic noodles, I thought I liked it better when I ate at their house, but my boyfriend loved the noodle served at the restaurant. It was garlicky, but a little sweet for me. The crabs were very fresh and the color looked amazing. Roast crab, which seem to be every Yelper's favorite, yet not me. Tamarind crab was okay, the sauce was not thick and tangy enough for a Vietnamese like me who technically grow up eating tamarind crab every other weekend in Vietnam. Lastly, shaken beef was perfectly medium rare, juicy and full of flavors. Strange, but I would recommend this meat dish at a seafood restaurant. 

Overall, great dining experience.

excerpts: Ordered the popular roast crab and tamarind crab, garlic noodles and of course shaken beef.
The crabs are so fresh and succulent in their special herbs and sauce that we lick up every little bit of sauce and oil on the platter.
Shaken beef is so tender moist and sweet
that again we finish the salad that holds the famous beef.
Garlic noodles were the right touch to complete the meal.
Service was efficient and we were happy that the wait may be long
but after you're seated the food comes in 10 mins.
Excellent.
Overall it's pricey but so worth it.
Will be back
roast crab.author: Nelle L.
roast crab.review:
Took us 3 years and finally made the reservation for Saturday dinner. And yes reservation is a must so as not to wait for than an hour to be seated. 
Ordered the popular roast crab and tamarind crab, garlic noodles and of course shaken beef. 
The crabs are so fresh and succulent in their special herbs and sauce that we lick up every little bit of sauce and oil on the platter. 
Shaken beef is so tender moist and sweet that again we finish the salad that holds the famous beef. 
Garlic noodles were the right touch to complete the meal. 
Service was efficient and we were happy that the wait may be long but after you're seated the food comes in 10 mins. Excellent. 
Overall it's pricey but so worth it. Will be back

excerpts: For our main dishes we ordered the roast crab and the jumbo prawns with garlic noodles and the shaken beef.
The crab and prawns were really tasty.
I personally love garlic noodles
so I couldn't get enough of that!
The shaken beef was also very good and the meat was tender.
For dessert we ordered the fried banana with ice cream.
it was SOOOO GOOOD!
I hadn't had this dessert in years and it definitely was satisfying.
The service was great.
The waiter was always attentive and checking in on us, the table was never cluttered with unused plates and our water was always filled.
Over all we had a great experience.
I will definitely be coming back for seconds!!
roast crab.author: Gabrielle C.
roast crab.review: Took my mom here yesterday as a late birthday dinner and it was so good! We ordered the mussels and seafood dumpling as an appetizer. The mussels were really good. they were drizzled with olive oil that you can use to spill on the slice of bread that comes with it. The seafood dumpling was good but I could do without next time. For our main dishes we ordered the roast crab and the jumbo prawns with garlic noodles and the shaken beef. The crab and prawns were really tasty. I personally love garlic noodles so I couldn't get enough of that! The shaken beef was also very good and the meat was tender. For dessert we ordered the fried banana with ice cream. it was SOOOO GOOOD! I hadn't had this dessert in years and it definitely was satisfying. The service was great. The waiter was always attentive and checking in on us, the table was never cluttered with unused plates and our water was always filled. Over all we had a great experience. I will definitely be coming back for seconds!!

excerpts: I ordered the roast crab with garlic noodles (I know, so original).
I was expecting the crab to be more bursting with flavors...
but it wasn't although it was still really good.
I just tasted a lot more black pepper than expected.
The garlic noodle was delicious, but should be eaten hot.
It's not as tasty anymore once it cools down.
It has a buttery taste and the garlic flavor wasn't overpowering at all.
roast crab.author: Thanh B.
roast crab.review:
Food: Crabs are currently $39.99 at market price. I ordered the roast crab with garlic noodles (I know, so original). I was expecting the crab to be more bursting with flavors...but it wasn't although it was still really good. I just tasted a lot more black pepper than expected. The garlic noodle was delicious, but should be eaten hot. It's not as tasty anymore once it cools down. It has a buttery taste and the garlic flavor wasn't overpowering at all. It was perfect, especially with the roasted crab. 

Service: Excellent service, including a waiter who ties on your bib for you. Water cups always stay refilled. And not with nasty, melted-down ice! Your bowls for shells and other unwanted will never be filled for they replace it very often. I was extremely satisfied.

Others/Description of the place: IT WAS HELL ON EARTH trying to find parking (not that you should resort to shady valet service unless you're really on a time crunch). I also had trouble locating which building is Thanh Long. This place for sure did not stand out to me. It was nothing special from the exterior. So I was very pleased to see just how beautiful and classy the inside of the restaurant was. They have a full bar in the front when you first walk in. And a second story for their customers. Lighting in here is quite dim which I love. It helps to create a much more intimate atmosphere. We celebrated a friend's birthday here so we dressed to impress. But it wouldn't be totally inappropriate to show up casual. I just wouldn't suggest walking up in there with like beach wears or something. 

Tips: They DO take reservations so be sure to take advantage of that and do so. It'll save yourself a lot of time and pain waiting in line, anticipating their delicious food. And if you do have reservation, be sure to arrive early. It took me about 15-20 minutes to drive EVERYWHERE  around the neighborhood, circling the block several times before finding a parking spot. NOT just a decent parking spot, just any parking spot AT ALL. It was ridiculous. The point is, don't be late for your reservation. Not only that, but make sure your whole party is on time. Not just a few of you because that wouldn't count. And no, calling them to let them know you're on your way will not help. They may stretch it by 5 minutes, but that's about it. So to my ladies and drag queens, if you're going to wear high heels...you're about to have SOOOOO much fun walking a couple of blocks to destination. Just sayin'. 

Be prepared.

excerpts: *Roast crab - Presentation is absolutely photogenic.
I'm talking about super model level.
The crab was very meaty and a nice size.
They really saved the best for last, as this was the last entrée to be served.
Cut down the middle with all the legs intact, the shell of the crab is ornamentally placed on top of the legs.
Their "garlic sauce and secret sauce" fully cooked into the crab meat and needless to say, I started to dip some noodles in the dressing.
It was good stuff.
To nitpick, freshness rating of the crab wasn't A+, rather an A-.
*Steamed rice -
That's how my dad rolls.
Can't go anywhere without it.
I had to add this one or it wouldn't be a complete review.
The white rice came in a bowl and tasted...
rice-like.
roast crab.author: Arnold T.
roast crab.review:
"500 hundred crabs will be served in one night..."...yada yada yada...we being first time customers were given the usual spiel.  My mind wondered, 'are cokes refillable?'...'where are the restrooms?'...'how much is 'market price'?'...'does the waiter know I'm not really paying attention?'

Back to reality...'did he say 500 hundred crabs?'  Where do they even keep that many crabs laying around I thought.  At that point, I wasn't sure if he mentioned it already, so to save some possible embarrassment I didn't inquire about the crabs, nodded, and just asked...'where are the restrooms?' 

Parking was more difficult than I expected as street parking sucked that day.  My laziness within grew with valet parking available tempting me.  The outrageous cost of $12 bucks and the thought of someone joy riding in my valuable antique of a Corolla didn't sit well with me.  The Sunset weather by the water was its usual half dreary self.  Contrast to the outside, inside the restaurant was vibrant and warm.  Aroma of good times filled the place; passing each table we saw at least one crab on the table.  Hold those horses...part of the waiter's yada yada yada included "90% of people order the crab".  

If it were me, our order would have consisted of all crab and garlic noodles.  Due to food allergies and cholesterol consciousness at the table, a full spectrum of dishes was chosen.  

OUR ORDER:     
*Lemongrass chicken satay - These grilled chicken skewers come numbering around three or four.  This was the first item that came out and everyone was hungry.  Playing the disappearing act in a poof, I only ate a sliver of a sliver sized piece.  My taste buds do not recall anything negative.  There were no complaints either.  

*Salt & pepper calamari - One of my sister's go to dishes no matter where, when, and how.  How can you go wrong with deep fried calamari?  You can't; unless they were soggy which these were not.  Salt and pepper were abundantly prevalent throughout.  The chunks of calamari were a larger size calamari than usual.  Bigger means more calamari meat and less batter.  Less batter is typically good thing.  

*Shaken beef - Shaken, not stirred...I didn't taste the "shaken", but the cubes of meat were very tender.  Served on a bed of green and mixed in with some potato, the meat has a sharp peppery taste.  I recommend this for people with seafood allergies that come here.    
  
*Lemongrass chicken - Didn't I order something with lemongrass as an appetizer already?  I repeated "lemongrass" a couple times under my breath unsure of this when ordering.  We needed another dish for the non-seafood eaters at the table anyway.  Consisting of probably all dark meat, the chicken was very simplistically lemongrass-ed.  There were more bell peppers than I would have liked.  The noticeable echo of pepper flavor popped up again.  I wonder how much pepper this restaurant uses in a day.   

*"Colossal" royal tiger prawns with garlic noodles - My main chagrin about this plate was the adjective "colossal" attached to the prawns.  All the pictures I saw, they looked humongous.  I bet the picture I took even look gigantic.  Truly, it is an optical illusion.  While unexpectedly smaller they were also a smidgen on the salty side for me.  Overdosed on seasoning, the prawns sat on top of garlic noodles.  The spillover of seasoning into the garlic noodles unassumingly enhanced the noodles.  The garlic noodles are good by themselves; the extra touch of seasoning really made the whole that much better.  If I go again, I'll pass on this one, but was decent. 

*Roast crab - Presentation is absolutely photogenic.  I'm talking about super model level.  The crab was very meaty and a nice size.  They really saved the best for last, as this was the last entrée to be served.  Cut down the middle with all the legs intact, the shell of the crab is ornamentally placed on top of the legs.  Their "garlic sauce and secret sauce" fully cooked into the crab meat and needless to say, I started to dip some noodles in the dressing.  It was good stuff.  To nitpick, freshness rating of the crab wasn't A+, rather an A-.    
 
*Steamed rice - That's how my dad rolls.  Can't go anywhere without it.  I had to add this one or it wouldn't be a complete review.  The white rice came in a bowl and tasted...rice-like.  My dad thoroughly enjoyed it with a big smile.

Thanh Long is an Americanized Vietnamese restaurant that is versatile enough to draw even the most Asian of Asians.  If you read the articles down the hallway to the restroom, there's a feel good story behind restaurant's owners (Remember that question about where the restrooms were?  Yeah...there was a line and I had some time to read.).  The main attraction is their crab and garlic noodles.  Get it, and be one of the daily 500!

excerpts: If you love crab, I'd highly recommend the roast crab and garlic noodles with the fried banana for dessert...its out of this world amazing!!!
roast crab.author: Stephanie K.
roast crab.review: Such an amazing seafood experience! Be prepared to FEAST while you're there. If you love crab, I'd highly recommend the roast crab and garlic noodles with the fried banana for dessert...its out of this world amazing!!!

excerpts: For entrees, I chose the garlic noodles while my partner chose the roast crab with garlic sauce.
Our friend chose the Villager's Favorite which was prawns and pork medallions cooked in a clay pot with soy and herbs.
All of us enjoyed our meals.
I think the garlic noodles were the best I've ever had.
I tasted the crab and it was great with lots of garlic flavor.
The others finished their meals but I could eat only half the noodles
so I got the remainder to take home for lunch.
The wait staff is large, but they were all busy and did well in serving a large crowd.
My only quibble is that the crab came quickly while the noodles and Villager's Favorite took a long time to arrive.
I would return again to try other dishes
roast crab.author: Philip C.
roast crab.review:
Three of us came here Sunday evening for dinner.  It was my first time, but I could smell garlic as soon as I walked in.  We did not have reservations but were seated in less than 3 minutes.
As appetizers, one of us ordered the salt and pepper calamari while my partner and I split the shrimp rolls.  All of us were delighted.  The calamari was perfectly sauteed and not rubbery at all. The shrimp rolls were fresh and the bean dip was a great addition.
For entrees, I chose the garlic noodles while my partner chose the roast crab with garlic sauce.  Our friend chose the Villager's Favorite which was prawns and pork medallions cooked in a clay pot with soy and herbs.
All of us enjoyed our meals.  I think the garlic noodles were the best I've ever had.  I tasted the crab and it was great with lots of garlic flavor.  The others finished their meals but I could eat only half the noodles so I got the remainder to take home for lunch.
The wait staff is large, but they were all busy and did well in serving a large crowd.
My only quibble is that the crab came quickly while the noodles and Villager's Favorite took a long time to arrive.
I would return again to try other dishes

excerpts: We had the roast crab ($54), shaking beef ($26) and garlic noodles.
All the dishes were delicious.
roast crab.author: Minh N.
roast crab.review: Took my wife out to Thang Long for our anniversary. We had the roast crab ($54), shaking beef ($26) and garlic noodles. All the dishes were delicious.

excerpts: Roast crab - risk the crab meat being overcooked.
The disappointment:
Roast Crab - 2/5.
A risk for roasting crab is overcooking, leaving the meat dry.
roast crab.author: Gabriel C.
roast crab.review:
TLDR: 
The highlights: Thanh Long Fish, Shaken Beef, and Drunken Crab.
The 50-50 risk: Roast crab - risk the crab meat being overcooked.
The disappointment: Skip the stand-alone garlic noodle dish.

Thanh Long Fish (red snapper) - 4/5. Seasoned lightly to let the fish flavor show through and act as the hero of the dish. Fished was cooked perfectly - just on the edge of being cooked / raw giving it a very smooth taste. Garlic noodles included here, see review below.

Shaken Beef - 4/5. Cubes of New York strip steak cooked medium rare. Nailed the cooking method, but the seasoning was heavy handed and a tad heavy on the oil.

Drunken Crab - 4/5. Cooked very well - crab meat retained its moisture. Lightly seasoned to help the crab flavor shine.

Roast Crab - 2/5. A risk for roasting crab is overcooking, leaving the meat dry. In this case, the crab was just on the cusp of being dried out, an unfortunate followup of the perfectly cooked Drunken Crab. The seasoning was well done, so I suspect that if the crab was more moist this dish would definitely shine.

Garlic Noodles - 2/5. Although very highly rated, it was a complete miss. The dish was heavy on oil and the noodles were overcooked. Ideally, the noodles would be the hero of the dish, with a seasoning of garlic to help the noodles shine.

excerpts: The roast crab was very flavorful and we enjoyed every last piece.
We shared 1 roast crab and 1 garlic noodle dish.
and it was enough.
we were very close to ordering a second round of food, but then just like that it hit us that we were full.
roast crab.author: Mae D.
roast crab.review:
Friendly hostess took my "dinner for 2" reservation over the phone.  We arrived half hour early and were able to be seated right away. 

Our server was courteous and upbeat. 

We regret ordering appetizers: salt and pepper calamari and the shrimp toast. 
The toast was very stale and made for a hard and chewy appetizer. and the calamari was nothing special.

The roast crab was very flavorful and we enjoyed every last piece. We shared 1 roast crab and 1 garlic noodle dish. and it was enough. we were very close to ordering a second round of food, but then just like that it hit us that we were full.  (But had we not ordered the appetizers, i honestly think we could have been satisfied ordering 2 crabs and maaaaybe 2 garlic noodle dishes)

so would i come back here? yes, but strictly for the crab and garlic noodles... and if i happen to just have $50 in my pocket to spend on ONE crab.

excerpts: Roast Crab - A whole crab: 5/10
It was expecting a good flavor to this.
I was thinking about it all day actually.
It was just crab that was roasted.
I felt like this could have been improved in so many small ways.
It was just okay to me.
roast crab.author: Sunny L.
roast crab.review:
Thanh Long is quite an established restaurant. With lots of loyal customers, i found it difficult to eat here without reservations. Upon entering, me and my gf faced a barrage of sardines [people] in a packed waiting area. The other patrons waiting were quite rude. The bar area was big enough to fit about 5 people max. Expect to wait when coming here. Always make reservations, that's the most important tip here ever. Things we tried.

Mussel Appetizer: 9/10
Really good and delicious. 5 mussels on top of slices of french bread only but quality over quantity.

Asian Bouillabaisse - Bowl of Soup for one : 4/10
Really really sweet with a slight sour.
The taste was there but it was so sweet that it wasn't appetizing.
It was really a turn off.

Roast Crab - A whole crab: 5/10
It was expecting a good flavor to this. I was thinking about it all day actually.
It was just crab that was roasted. I felt like this could have been improved in so many small ways. It was just okay to me. Nothing special.

Garlic Noodles: 5.5/10
The GN was okay, nice hint of flavors but I also didn't feel this was lip smacking good. It could have been better.

The Service was locked down on everything. 
Water here and questions here. 
Very good good good service.

Ambiance was okay; more so, it was loud and noisy.

Overall, I would recommend this place to try but I wouldn't expect to be blown away.

Pros: Service, Mussels
COns: Improve on the items listed above. [IMO]
STars:3

excerpts: The roast crab was amazing!
cooked perfectly and the mixture of spices was phenominal, I love.
roast crab.author: Jan Y.
roast crab.review:
Omg its guud! I started off with the Thanh Long mussles which was surprisingly very tasty and flavorful.   The roast crab was amazing! cooked perfectly and the mixture of spices was phenominal, I love.     We also ordered the Colossal Royal Tiger Prawns that is served over a bed of garlic noodles M/P and If I can remember correctly (I had a few too many drinks by the end of the night)  that dish came out to $32?$35?  ERF! I say ask before you order this because if it is that much, it's totally NOT WORTH IT.  If you are going to spend that money might as well get another crab!  

Enjoy!

.

excerpts: The roast crab is always amazing.
This restaurant does it best the Bay Area.
roast crab.author: lauren k.
roast crab.review: The roast crab is always amazing. This restaurant does it best the Bay Area.

excerpts: my only critiques are that there is a limited ways your crab can be prepared -- the original roast crab with pepper, the drunken crab, and the tamarind crab.
i would have liked to try a garlic-prepared crab.
roast crab.author: Sabrina L.
roast crab.review:
Had a great experience here! Make sure you come early and make reservations -- the place was already crowded at 5:30 pm on a thursday night! we had reservations for our party of 10 and were seated upstairs. service was very fast -- we started receiving our food maybe ten minutes after ordering! everything was really good, from the crabs (my uncle said the crabs are all soaked beforehand, so the shells were very soft and not at all hard to crack into!), garlic noodles, shaken beef, chicken, and vegetarian dishes. the eggplant was good but extremely oily. the ambiance of the restaurant is also very nice and more upscale than i was expecting, and they even have a valet option for your car!

my only critiques are that there is a limited ways your crab can be prepared -- the original roast crab with pepper, the drunken crab, and the tamarind crab. i would have liked to try a garlic-prepared crab. their fryer was also broken that night, so we were unable to enjoy any fried bananas :(

overall very good experience! i would love to come back!

excerpts:
[ 
-Our go to dishes: Mango Salad, Salt and Pepper Calamari, Garlic Noodles, and Roast Crab.
Sure, other things look tasty on the menu, but these are so good that I refuse to waver!
We did try the drunken crab once, but the roast crab wins hands down.
-The Lava cake is to DIE for!
Amazing!!!
I also tried the Irish Coffee, but meh..
roast crab.author: Debbie T.
roast crab.review:
I only come here for "special" occasions with the bf. So..this means:

-We share an entire bottle of sparkling wine. Yep, we'll finish the whole bottle. Champagnes are for snobs..or really pretty people who have lots of money. =[ 
-Our go to dishes: Mango Salad, Salt and Pepper Calamari, Garlic Noodles, and Roast Crab. Sure, other things look tasty on the menu, but these are so good that I refuse to waver! We did try the drunken crab once, but the roast crab wins hands down. 
-The Lava cake is to DIE for! Amazing!!! I also tried the Irish Coffee, but meh..I rather just stick with my sparkling wine and Lava Cake. 

With tip, I say our meal averages at least $150-200, depending on the bottle of wine and market price of the crab. Very expensive for cheapies like us, but every once in awhile, we like to spoil ourselves and eat ramen for the rest of the month.

excerpts: Roast Crab (good, but wasn't super flavorful)
roast crab.author: Amy D.
roast crab.review:
Came in a group of 6 on a Saturday night, so we got to try a lot of dishes. Making reservations is definitely recommended, and parking in this area is tough- the $10 for valet is well spent. 

Ordered-
Salt & Pepper Calamari (nice and peppery, but calamari could've been a bit more crisp)
Dungeness Crab Puffs (good, but def not authentic)
Seafood Dumplings (only ok and 5 pieces- wouldn't recommend for the price)
Crispy Rice Paper Roll (too dry for me, I wouldn't order this again)
Curry Lotus Prawns (good taste but the "jumbo prawns" were teeny!)
Shaken Beef (really good flavor, imo better than at the Slanted Door and cheaper. however, they mix in potatoes pieces to trick you into thinking there is more meat)
Roast Crab (good, but wasn't super flavorful)
Tamarind Crab (wasn't very flavorful, but both crabs were cooked perfectly)
Garlic Noodles (good, but could've been more garlicky)
Fried Rice with Shrimp (your standard fried rice, I wouldn't order again)
Fried Banana & Fried Ice Cream (both were good but I like the banana a lot more)

Overall, the dinner was good, but not amazing. I actually liked the crab I ordered at Three Seasons better (taste wise). My favorite dishes were the shaken beef and garlic noodles, but this restaurant is worth a try for the crab. We paid $57pp including tax and tip, which isn't bad at all, but we didn't get that much crab.

excerpts: so I'm a fan of their roast crab,
so buttery and tasty.
The mixture of pepper, garlic and butter is so perfect.
Roast Crab and garlic noodles is a perfect combo.
roast crab.author: Arielle D.
roast crab.review: It's expensive but you get what you pay for. The food is astounding! Everything we ordered was delicious. This is my go to place in SF for delicious crab  and vietnamese food. I love seafood so I'm a fan of their roast crab, so buttery and tasty. The mixture of pepper, garlic and butter is so perfect. Roast Crab and garlic noodles is a perfect combo. The shaken beef was delicious as well. The chunks of beef were so tender. Make sure to make a reservation. The wait can get long around dinner time. Good customer service. I can't wait to go back.

excerpts:
We ordered:

Roast crab: SO GOOD. 
I've had the drunken crab here before too, but i think I prefer the garlicky flavor of the roast crab more.

Definitely need to order this with the roast crab.
roast crab.author: Michelle L.
roast crab.review:
OMG I love Thanh Long.

Came here with my friend on a Thursday around 6:00 and the place was relatively empty. However, as our dinner progressed the restaurant started filling up with people. 

We ordered:

Roast crab: SO GOOD. I don't understand how they get the garlic flavor infused into the crab meat... but whatever they do it tastes delicious. I've had the drunken crab here before too, but i think I prefer the garlicky flavor of the roast crab more.

Saigon beef: This was surprisingly good. The beef cubes were tender, and not at all chewy. The sauce it was in wasn't too heavy, which i liked, and tasted good with the garlic noodles.

Garlic noodles: Definitely need to order this with the roast crab.

Between the two of us we finished almost everything, but had some noodles and a couple crab legs leftover.

Overall had a great experience at Thanh Long, and will probably come back again.

excerpts: The roast crab is the best that I have ever ate.
I tried all kinds of crab, Cajun, Chinese etc, this is the best.
I also tried roast crab in other restaurant in San Francisco, they're not even close to this restaurant.
roast crab.author: Charlie D.
roast crab.review:
The roast crab is the best that I have ever ate. I tried all kinds of crab, Cajun, Chinese etc, this is the best. I also tried roast crab in other restaurant in San Francisco, they're not even close to this restaurant.

Garlic noodle is ok, I didn't see anything special of it.

excerpts: Their Roast Crab and Garlic Noodles are pretty darn good!
roast crab.author: Fenny G.
roast crab.review:
Their Roast Crab and Garlic Noodles are pretty darn good! 

Get your fingers greasy and messy otherwise you won't enjoy it! Lick you fingers because no body cares.

Enough said!

excerpts: Mind you, this restaurant is known for their Roast Crab and Garlic Noodles and is often ordered and enjoyed together.
It's almost like a rule on their menu written in invisible ink visible only by black light.
In turn, 9 of 12 people in our party ordered this.
roast crab.author: Cat V.
roast crab.review:
Definitely coming back!

Came here for a birthday dinner; there were 12 of us.  Not only were they able to accommodate our large party, but they were able to do so with incredible ease and flair.  I was truly impressed.  

They were BUSY on this Friday night.  But delivered such excellent customer service and a memorable dining experience they truly deserve five stars.

We were seated in their dining area upstairs away from the chaos what was downstairs.  Mind you, this restaurant is known for their Roast Crab and Garlic Noodles and is often ordered and enjoyed together.  It's almost like a rule on their menu written in invisible ink visible only by black light.  In turn, 9 of 12 people in our party ordered this.  However, I along with two others heeded elsewhere on the menu.  

I ordered the Vegetarian Delight: silken tofu with veggies and shiitake mushrooms over rice.  Y-U-M-M-M!!!  I could totally throw in a few more M's but I'll spare you the eyesore.  This dish was truly a delight.  Platter presentation was exquisite but the satisfaction came with each bite.  There was adequate amount of tofu and vegetables it was just the right amount of excellence and flavor.

Be sure to call in for reservations to guarantee yourself a table as this place gets packed.

excerpts: Roast crab good - tasty and not too dry.
roast crab.author: Nawee S.
roast crab.review:
Roast crab good - tasty and not too dry. 
Shaken Beef? - the beef was perfectly cooked but the sauce made the whole dish too sweet!
Garlic noodles - felt too cheezy

excerpts: Quite a few things on the menu, but you really just come for two things -- roast crab and garlic noodles, and then maybe another order of garlic noodles.
This was my first time back in like four of five years
and what did I have last time?
Roast crab and garlic noodles.
The crab meat is excellent, very tasty, slightly sweet, perfectly cooked, and definitely great quality.
Roast crab and garlic noodles.
The crab meat is excellent, very tasty, slightly sweet, perfectly cooked, and definitely great quality.
The garlic noodles are addicting.
Room for dessert?
roast crab.author: Erich D.
roast crab.review:
Quite a few things on the menu, but you really just come for two things -- roast crab and garlic noodles, and then maybe another order of garlic noodles.  This was my first time back in like four of five years and what did I have last time?  Roast crab and garlic noodles.  The crab meat is excellent, very tasty, slightly sweet, perfectly cooked, and definitely great quality.  The garlic noodles are addicting.  Room for dessert?  Try the old fashioned banana cake, you won't regret it.

In the An Family group of restaurants this is the original joint and is just as good, if not better, than Crustacean.

excerpts: Their famous roast crab did not disappoint.
The balance of tender crab meat with buttery pepper sauce is phenomenal.
Crab cracker tools, big bowls for crab shells, and plastic bibs are provided for all patrons who choose to abandon all forms of etiquette and succumb to the delightfulness of the roast crab.
The roast crab and garlic noodles lived up to the hype
but if you enjoy dressing up and don't mind paying an extra ten to twenty bucks, head over to Crustacean and enjoy the delicacies there instead.
roast crab.author: Evonne M.
roast crab.review:
Went to Thanh Long for the first time with my boyfriend the Sunday before Valentine's Day. Didn't make reservations ahead of time so we waited approximately an hour before we were seated.

To our surprise, our orders came promptly. Their famous roast crab did not disappoint. The balance of tender crab meat with buttery pepper sauce is phenomenal. Crab cracker tools, big bowls for crab shells, and plastic bibs are provided for all patrons who choose to abandon all forms of etiquette and succumb to the delightfulness of the roast crab.

We also ordered the colossal royal tiger prawns, served on a bed of garlic noodles. Again, the tiger prawns were delightfully seasoned and the garlic noodles are perhaps the best I've ever had. My boyfriend succinctly describes the noodles as "starchy with a bite and not oily at all."   

Although we were pleased with the quality of the food, the atmosphere did not live up to the price of the check. We went knowing that it is casual attire so we did not expect anything fancy. However, we were seated in a table for two surrounded on all sides by people less than two feet away. As a matter of fact, the back of my chair was touching the chair of the person who sat with his back to me. We concluded that we rather pay a bit more at Crustacean for nicer ambiance.

All in all, reservation is highly recommended if you do not want to wait. The roast crab and garlic noodles lived up to the hype but if you enjoy dressing up and don't mind paying an extra ten to twenty bucks, head over to Crustacean and enjoy the delicacies there instead.

excerpts: The Roast Crab, Garlic noodles
(I don't care for the noodles with the prawns), Mussels are all fabulous.
My favorite thing to do is peel the entire crab and eat it with the noodles - amazing combo.
It's been a while since I've tried anything else, but when I did months ago,
ALL the dishes were delicious!
Their fried banana with ice cream dessert satisfies as well.
roast crab.author: Mimi V.
roast crab.review:
This place always deliver my cravings of Garlic Noodles. I've gone here for Mother's day with the entire family, out with friends and even casual dining. This place is great for all occasions! 

The Roast Crab, Garlic noodles (I don't care for the noodles with the prawns), Mussels are all fabulous. My favorite thing to do is peel the entire crab and eat it with the noodles - amazing combo.
