It's been a while since I've tried anything else, but when I did months ago,  ALL the dishes were delicious! Their fried banana with ice cream dessert satisfies as well. They also have a good wine selection. 

The service here is fabulous, definitely not like other Vietnamese restaurants. You also get all kinds of people in - definitely pleases all crowds.

excerpts: Everyone said the Roast crab is a must try and they love it.
In my opinion I could have cooked it better at home.
The flavor was okay
but the crab was cooked well.
We had to ask for salt, pepper and lemon just to dip our crab meat in because the seasoning was only on the shells
so it wasn't that tasty.
If they had Tabasco i would have enjoyed eating the crab more.
Our tab came out to 220 dollars.
Each crab was 53 bucks!
Was not worth it.
And also the waiter was quick on refilling our waters and getting what we need very quickly.
roast crab.author: Dinh H.
roast crab.review: Couple of my friends and I went to the city to try out this restaurant because of all the good reviews. We ended up getting the roasted crab, garlic noodles, calamari and seafood fried rice that everyone was talking about. The food come out within 10 mins so we were happy about that. The calamari was kind of plain so we had to ask the waiter for chili paste. The garlic noodles is not the best in town, it was a bit over cooked! they could have done better. Also the fried rice was mediocre. Now for the main reason why we came to the restaurant, the crab. Everyone said the Roast crab is a must try and they love it. In my opinion I could have cooked it better at home. The flavor was okay but the crab was cooked well. We had to ask for salt, pepper and lemon just to dip our crab meat in because the seasoning was only on the shells so it wasn't that tasty. If they had Tabasco i would have enjoyed eating the crab more. Our tab came out to 220 dollars. Each crab was 53 bucks! Was not worth it. And also the waiter was quick on refilling our waters and getting what we need very quickly.

excerpts: We had the roast crab and salt and pepper calamari.
Very flavorful.
roast crab.author: Marilyn C.
roast crab.review: Best customer service. We had the roast crab and salt and pepper calamari.  Very flavorful.

excerpts: The Roast Crab was delicious and our family destroyed it within about 15 minutes.
Seriously do not remember the exact taste because we were inhaling our food.
My sister said that both dishes were a little too garlic heavy for her to have together
but they were fine with me.
roast crab.author: Therese Jane R.
roast crab.review:
Went here the past weekend with my family as a treat to our parents for Christmas.  Thank God my sister made reservations because dinnertime on a saturday was packed!  People who didn't make reservation were told the wait could be up to 2 hours long.  We, however, were sat within 10 minutes of our reservation time.  

We had the salt and pepper calamari and crab puffs to start.  Both were okay (and relatively cheap, ~$10 each).  The salt and pepper calamari was good but doused in spices, which made the actual seafood flavor lessened - a quality that some might not enjoy.  It's also tossed with some veggies, which our family also happily munched on.  Not the best calamari we've ever had but also not the worst.  The crab puffs were ordered on our waiter's suggestion and they were good, too - soft on the inside with the outside perfectly golden and crunchy.  Did not try to sauce that came with it but by my mom's continuous dipping, I'm going to assume that it was good.  

For our meal, we ordered 2 roast crabs and 2 orders of garlic noodles.  We are a family of five - this, plus the two appetizers, were not enough for us (we went for ice cream after).  The garlic noodles (~$10 an order) were delicious but, seriously, tasted very similar to Red Crawfish's garlic noodles (a.k.a., if you want a delicious, but in a more casual setting, similar meal, perhaps think of RC as an alternative).  The Roast Crab was delicious and our family destroyed it within about 15 minutes.  Seriously do not remember the exact taste because we were inhaling our food.  My sister said that both dishes were a little too garlic heavy for her to have together but they were fine with me.  Each crab was about $42.  

All in all, the ambiance was great but if you like seasoned seafood and want to eat without any reservations (pun intended) you should probably visit one of the less bougie places that dot the bay area.  If you are trying to impress a significant other (or potential significant other) do not go to this place, where you're tempted to pull apart crabs with your hands and suck the meat out from the shell.

excerpts: The first time tasting the roast crab and garlic noodles was amazing.
The third time we ordered roast crab, garlic noodles, shaken beef and mussels.
The third time we ordered roast crab, garlic noodles, shaken beef and mussels.
The garlic noodles were great as were the mussels.
The roast crab however was completely disappointing.
It tasted over cooked and very rubbery, as if it was sitting in the pot too long.
roast crab.author: Ren A.
roast crab.review: This visit was our third.  The first time tasting the roast crab and garlic noodles was amazing.  The second time we had both dishes again and splurged and got the shrimp toast appetizer.  Again an amazing meal.  The third time we ordered roast crab, garlic noodles, shaken beef and mussels.  The garlic noodles were great as were the mussels.  The roast crab however was completely disappointing.  It tasted over cooked and very rubbery, as if it was sitting in the pot too long.  While we enjoyed the mussels, it was not our first choice as they were out of the shrimp toast.  They were also out of Jasmin tea (??).  Not sure how you run out of tea.  The service was very good.  Or waiter was patient (maybe because he had to tell us they were out of items was wanted) and they cleared empty dishes quickly from the table.  The water service was prompt (maybe because we weren't drinking tea).  We want to chalk it up to going on a Tuesday night, but that's not a good excuse for running out of items or over cooked crab at market prices.

excerpts: I personally prefer Roast Crab and Drunken Crab.
But all are tastier than what you would get at any restaurants in Fisherman's Wharf.
The Drunken Crab is made with Chardonnay, sake, brandy, green union, chive and black pepper.
The Roast Crab is roasted with garlic sauce and black pepper.
+ It is a fine dining restaurant with nice ambiance.
They also have a sister restaurant in SF called Crustacean.
+ The place is pricey.
But it is definitely worth the visit every once in a while for special occasions.
I discovered this place through friends about 15 years ago when I lived in the Bay Area.
roast crab.author: Adam M.
roast crab.review:
Pros 
+ They have a full menu. But you'll see every table order the same thing: Crab. This is THE place to go for crab and garlic noodle. They have 3 different kinds of crab: Roast, Drunken, and Tamarind. I personally prefer Roast Crab and Drunken Crab. But all are tastier than what you would get at any restaurants in Fisherman's Wharf. The Drunken Crab is made with Chardonnay, sake, brandy, green union, chive and black pepper. The Roast Crab is roasted with garlic sauce and black pepper. 
+ It is a fine dining restaurant with nice ambiance. They also have a sister restaurant in SF called Crustacean. 
+ The place is pricey. But it is definitely worth the visit every once in a while for special occasions. I discovered this place through friends about 15 years ago when I lived in the Bay Area. Now I came with my family during my visit for Thanksgiving and it has turned into an annual tradition. 

Cons 
- The service here is not what it used to be. The waitress mixed up our soup order, and was not always available when we asked for napkins, bowls and to refill the water and tea. 
- The food is good. But I kind of expect better services for the price they are charging. If you order crab, it will average $70 per person after soup and noodle and before any alcohol and dessert. 
- Street parking only, which is typical of most restaurants in San Francisco. 
- The place is super busy. The best chance to get a table is to call ahead to make reservations or get there early at 5PM.

excerpts: I ordered the garlic noodles (delicious and very garlicky - must have, it's definitely famous for a reason!) and roast crab.
It was buttery and so good we each polished off our own crab in less than 10 minutes!
It was fun to dig in with our hands and my friend also ended up getting the fried ice cream dessert and Vietnamese coffee which I have to say was authentic and super strong.
I'd definitely come back when I'm in the mood to splurge!
roast crab.author: Lana T.
roast crab.review: I was introduced to this place by my friend and went there for her birthday several months ago (this is a super late review).  It was quite upscale and had nice ambiance.  The service was super fast and we stated with calamari which was crispy and perfect!  I ordered the garlic noodles (delicious and very garlicky - must have, it's definitely famous for a reason!) and roast crab.  It was buttery and so good we each polished off our own crab in less than 10 minutes!  It was fun to dig in with our hands and my friend also ended up getting the fried ice cream dessert and Vietnamese coffee which I have to say was authentic and super strong.  I'd definitely come back when I'm in the mood to splurge!

excerpts: Definitely the roast crab any other crab is not worth your time and money.
roast crab.author: Vanessa K.
roast crab.review:
Definitely the roast crab any other crab is not worth your time and money. The garlic noodles are good, but not as orgasmic as everyone describes it to be. They are garlicky, but I didn't like the choice of noodles, I'm sure there are better options out there.  Appetizers are good (stay away from dumplings, better at Kingdom of Dumpling) but expensive for the price. Stuffed squid was surprisingly delish! The calamari/squid was cooked perfectly, there was a crunch and not chewy at all. Great tomato sauce flavor and the stuffing was simple yet balanced. 

Stay AWAY from the saigon beef, worse dish ever! Do go for the shaken beef.

Desserts are nothing to wow about - creme brulee, fried banana with ice cream and molten chocolate cake. Pretty standard.

excerpts: Nothing can beat the roast crab and garlic noodles...especially those garlic noodles.
They're more  like crack noodles-extremely addicting.
I love how the noodles' garlic flavor is not overpowering and just a bit sweet.
Also the texture is perfect.
As for the crab it is good, however, my dad can make it just the same.
roast crab.author: Stef B.
roast crab.review:
Thanh Long has been a family favorite of ours for awhile now. We would dine here for birthdays, graduations, anniversaries etc.

Nothing can beat the roast crab and garlic noodles...especially those garlic noodles. They're more  like crack noodles-extremely addicting. I love how the noodles' garlic flavor is not overpowering and just a bit sweet. Also the texture is perfect. As for the crab it is good, however, my dad can make it just the same. Also I recommend the salt & pepper calamari. 

I have been to another one of the Anh Family restaurants--Crustacean on Polk St but I like Thanh Long a lot better. I prefer the service, food, and ambiance. 

This is one of my top 5 favorite restaurants.

excerpts: The Roast Crab and the Garlic Noodles.
When served, looks beautiful.
The whole crab resting on the platter.
The garlic noodles hot and fresh where you can smell all the garlic they used.
The crab was rubbed in a pepper/garlic sauce.
When I say rubbed, I mean RUBBED.
It was smothered in it....where my first bite was SALTY UP THE WAZOO!
Was I licking ocean water?
(Therefore, I gave it the 3 stars...plus everything is totally over priced!)
The crab was delicious, but everything started tasting really salty.
The garlic noodles were good I must say.
Not something I'd crave for, but they were good.
Also....not good enough for 10$ a plate!
roast crab.author: Jennifer C.
roast crab.review:
The anterior decor does not do the interior justice. On the outside, looks pretty ghettOO, but inside it's quite elegant and bustling. The first reaction coming here and seeing people was that it is a high-class version of Boiling Crab with people in their white bibs. 
I have to say service is AWESOME. Someone is always coming to refill water, replace napkins, take away shell bowls, etc. They also dealt with me wanting pictures.

Bro's birthday so we had to try the favorites. The Roast Crab and the Garlic Noodles. When served, looks beautiful. The whole crab resting on the platter. The garlic noodles hot and fresh where you can smell all the garlic they used. 
The crab was rubbed in a pepper/garlic sauce. When I say rubbed, I mean RUBBED. It was smothered in it....where my first bite was SALTY UP THE WAZOO! Was I licking ocean water? (Therefore, I gave it the 3 stars...plus everything is totally over priced!) The crab was delicious, but everything started tasting really salty.
The garlic noodles were good I must say. Not something I'd crave for, but they were good. Also....not good enough for 10$ a plate! Dang Longs, noodles are cheap...slap on a little more!

The eggplant dish was pleasantly delicious! I think that may have been the best bet of the meal. Crisp shell on the eggplant along with chicken, shrimp, and veggies.

We also ordered the garlic bread (got half a baguette for 8$ with absolutely no garlic flavor on it...) and the spring rolls (2 rolls cut into 4 for 8$)......can I say that it is a RIP ROLL OFF!!

Anyway, it's good to try once. The second time, go to Boiling Crab please. Half the price, much satisfying food and seafood!

AIN'T GOIN TO LONG FOR A LONG TIME!

excerpts: Roast crab + garlic noodles:
WOWOWOW!
I like wearing the bibs they give us =) makes me feel like i can dig in properly.
BRING GUM.
1 Salt and Pepper Calamari + 2 Roast Crabs + 2 Garlic Noodles + 1 Shaken Beef + 1 Fried Banana
roast crab.author: Samantha L.
roast crab.review:
My family and i made reservations for 4  for a sunday night.  As usual, it took us a while to find parking.. and had to make several rounds. But Thanh Long has a valet service right out front if you don't want to go looking for your own space. I'm not sure where they park the cars though. Down by the beach?!

The moment you walk in you smell the amazing aroma from all the highly seasoned dishes!  You may dress anywhere from casual - dressy. There really is no dress code here.

Salt and pepper calamari: definitely a lot of salt and pepper. i'm not too big of a fan of calamari but it came out nice and hot. i was really waiting for the crab though..

Roast crab + garlic noodles: WOWOWOW! I like wearing the bibs they give us =) makes me feel like i can dig in properly. BRING GUM. the garlic is strongggggg.

Fried Banana a la mode: the  vanilla bean ice cream is just sooo good with the fried banana. The banana is warm and oozing deliciousness. Get a spoonful with a little bit of ice cream and a bit of the frozen banana = heaven.

1 Salt and Pepper Calamari + 2 Roast Crabs + 2 Garlic Noodles + 1 Shaken Beef + 1 Fried Banana a la mode= $148 + tax and tip

I left so full that i fell asleep when i got home. Uh yeah, i ate that much..

excerpts: Roast Crab and garlic noodle is a great combo.

Very pricey for the Roast Crab
2.
Parking sucks unless you valet for $12 bucks
roast crab.author: Loc T.
roast crab.review:
Pros:
1. Service is good
2. Food is awesome
3. Food comes out fairly fast
4. Roast Crab and garlic noodle is a great combo.

Cons:
1. Very pricey for the Roast Crab
2. Parking sucks unless you valet for $12 bucks

excerpts: Between two people, we ordered Thanh Long Mussels, Roast Crab, and Garlic Noodles.
roast crab.author: Jenny T.
roast crab.review:
I love this restaurant because the food is so good!

My suggestion is to come here early for dinner (around 6pm) to find good parking and to beat the crowd. I made reservations for 2 at 6:30pm but we actually got to the restaurant about 15 minutes early. We were seated right away.

Our server was friendly and checked in on us at the right times.

Between two people, we ordered Thanh Long Mussels, Roast Crab, and Garlic Noodles. I recommend trying out all three of these dishes because they were so delicious.

I will definitely return.

excerpts: You might need a coronary bypass after going through the Thanh Long Mussels, Roast Crab, and Garlic Noodles, but it's worth every cent of your health insurance deductible if you have it.
You see the oil on the plates,  but with every bite, your senses don't register it as "just" oil.
Instead, a bite of the garlic noodles dressed with some drippings from the roast crab feels like your mouth is being coated in silken, mouth-filling luxury.
Instead, a bite of the garlic noodles dressed with some drippings from the roast crab feels like your mouth is being coated in silken, mouth-filling luxury.
roast crab.author: Sam W.
roast crab.review:
When this place was recommend to me, I was unassuming and figured, "Oh, ok, Vietnamese seafood joint...should be the usual family-style Asian restaurant."  So, we went on ahead and made reservations for the day before.  The day of, I see this sort of hideous, unassuming exterior--it looks like any generic abandoned Richmond/Sunset shop/boutique.  When we enter, it's a completely different story--dimmed lighting, modern decor, tablecloths, etc.  We are ~10 minutes late (parking was a pain in the neighborhood), yet they seat us promptly.  

The staff is friendly and helpful (they helped us pick out items for our group and make recommendations based on our party size). I order a bottle of wine that ends up being a twist-cap, but our waiter still makes the motions and lets me sample first.  When it comes time for eating, the staff helps us put on our bibs, brings extra napkins without having to be asked, and replaces our plates and bowls whenever things started to get messy.  Oh yeah, and brownie points on attentiveness--my water never goes empty.  (Sort of silly, but small gestures like these make for a good impression with me.)

The food itself, in summary, is rich and filling in the most gluttonous fashion. We had the Mango Salad (warm with a perfect hint of charred flavor), and the Traditional Vietnamese Salad (it was good, but the other dishes overshadow this one). You might need a coronary bypass after going through the Thanh Long Mussels, Roast Crab, and Garlic Noodles, but it's worth every cent of your health insurance deductible if you have it.  You see the oil on the plates,  but with every bite, your senses don't register it as "just" oil.  Instead, a bite of the garlic noodles dressed with some drippings from the roast crab feels like your mouth is being coated in silken, mouth-filling luxury.  As you swallow, you are overwhelmed with a noise in your head--that noise is your brain screaming, "MORE MORE MORE!!!"

Pure crack.

When the bill comes, we see gratuity tagged on, but it's pre-tax and pre-alcohol (as with everything else, Thanh Long gets it right).  When you divide everything up for the type of service and food we experienced here, it comes to about $40-ish per person, and worth every darn penny.  

Thanh Long, we'll definitely be back.

excerpts: Roast crab and garlic noodles to die for.
The crab was little pricey but totally worth it.
the garlic noodles are delicious and not overwhelmingly garlic-y like other places.
There is usually a wait so try to get there early.
roast crab.author: Rory T.
roast crab.review: Roast crab and garlic noodles to die for. The crab was little pricey but totally worth it. the garlic noodles are delicious and not overwhelmingly garlic-y like other places. There is usually a wait so try to get there early.

excerpts: and I came to Thanh Long because we heard about their famous roast crab and garlic noodles!
And of course, for our entrees, we shared one roast crab and an order of garlic noodles (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/z9CN58fSrA46ggyb6OnCnQ?select=1bMAC3tQqYuN0JkIZRKVqQ).
And of course, for our entrees, we shared one roast crab and an order of garlic noodles (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/z9CN58fSrA46ggyb6OnCnQ?select=1bMAC3tQqYuN0JkIZRKVqQ).
To be perfectly honest, I wasn't that impressed with the roast crab.
It was definitely juicy, meaty, and big, but the flavors weren't that great.
It definitely didn't live up to all the hype.
On the other hand, the garlic noodles were to-die-for!
I'm a huge fan of garlic and the garlic noodles were sooo soft and garlicky.
I've tried garlic noodles once before and the garlic flavor wasn't as distinct as the garlic flavor in Thanh Long's garlic noodles.
I give their garlic noodles 5 stars!
I'll probably try the colossal royal tiger prawns with garlic noodles next time.
roast crab.author: Lien T.
roast crab.review:
Yep, you've guessed it...my boyfriend and I came to Thanh Long because we heard about their famous roast crab and garlic noodles!

We arrived shortly after they opened at 5pm and there was no wait. Once we were seated, we noticed the full bar and decided to order a couple of drinks to start off our night. I ordered the fleur de mango and the boyfriend ordered the Hanoi sunset (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/z9CN58fSrA46ggyb6OnCnQ?select=5AnN3N7w7JTwsWHvz8rcug). The fleur de mango was really good. The rum flavor was subtle and masked by the freshly blended orange juice and sweet mango puree. I had a sip of the Hanoi sunset and it tasted ridiculously strong. It tasted as though I was sipping on a straight shot of alcohol. My boyfriend shared the same feelings--he had to force himself to chug down the alcohol laden martini.

For appetizers, we had the chicken satay (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/z9CN58fSrA46ggyb6OnCnQ?select=XH78FALuoyCY-PemWsm18g) and salmon carpaccio (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/z9CN58fSrA46ggyb6OnCnQ?select=g2SQ3ayDT3W9Fm9seQQEVw). The chicken satay was pretty disappointing--three skewers of grilled chicken came out on a plate with no dipping sauce. The chicken was a little on the dry side and it tasted really bland. Usually when I eat chicken satay, it is always served with a side of satay peanut sauce for dipping. Oh well, the tasty salmon carpaccio made up for the disappointment. I love refreshing dishes like the salmon carpaccio, as the flavors of the simple ingredients are truly highlighted. The buttered-bread, capers, and lightly lemon-marinated salmon all combined deliciously.

And of course, for our entrees, we shared one roast crab and an order of garlic noodles (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/z9CN58fSrA46ggyb6OnCnQ?select=1bMAC3tQqYuN0JkIZRKVqQ). To be perfectly honest, I wasn't that impressed with the roast crab. It was definitely juicy, meaty, and big, but the flavors weren't that great. It definitely didn't live up to all the hype. On the other hand, the garlic noodles were to-die-for! I'm a huge fan of garlic and the garlic noodles were sooo soft and garlicky. I've tried garlic noodles once before and the garlic flavor wasn't as distinct as the garlic flavor in Thanh Long's garlic noodles. I give their garlic noodles 5 stars!

My boyfriend and I had an overall good experience. We enjoyed the intimate, but comfortable ambiance. The customer service was excellent and extremely attentive. I'll probably try the colossal royal tiger prawns with garlic noodles next time.

P.S.
Cheers to my 100th review! :D

excerpts: My ginger infused vodka cocktail complimented the roast crab and garlic noodles perfectly.
roast crab.author: Deanna C.
roast crab.review:
We started with the tempura coconut prawns with orange-mustard sauce. Crunchy, tangy and a great beginning to a perfect meal. 
My ginger infused vodka cocktail complimented the roast crab and garlic noodles perfectly. My companion had the drunken crab which was also delectable. We didn't talk much over dinner because our meal was so good it makes it impossible to speak intelligently. We mostly ooo-ed and ahh-ed over the amazingly simple and delicious food. 
We ended with dessert which was also delish: chocolate lava cake and creme brulee.
The service is fast and efficient. They remove your crab shells regularily and bring you a hot towel to clean up with at the end. It's a messy business eating a whole crab but they make it easy and relaxed and it is sooo worth it.

excerpts: Roast crab, and garlic noodles!
That's it....
that's all you need.
roast crab.author: Marvella W.
roast crab.review: Always a favorite.  I've been coming here with my sister ever since they've opened.  We love coming here for birthday celebrations.  Prices have doubled since they first opened.  Roast crab, and garlic noodles! That's it....that's all you need.

excerpts: Buttery garlicky goodness of noodles and their roast crab...
ENOUGH said!
roast crab.author: Jeannie C.
roast crab.review:
Buttery garlicky goodness of noodles and their roast crab...ENOUGH said! I really felt like garlic was coming out of my pores after the dinner.

We also tried the shaken beef, buddha roll (vegetarian spring rolls), mussels on a crostini (tender, flavorful and succulent), salt and pepper fried calamari (tender), and stir fried green beans.

The service was attentive and friendly. If you have the money to splurge, love garlic and don't mind butter, and especially love to eat crab, give this place a try. I have tried Crustaceans and AnQui but this place will always be my favorite.

excerpts: We ordered the roast crab which, although mildly peppery and actually with a good amount of sweet meat, otherwise was not as heavily seasoned.
Strangely enough, our crab was actually a little cool by the time it got to our table.
roast crab.author: Gene C.
roast crab.review:
I came here with a friend from out of town looking for a competitor to PPQ Dungeness Island. The restaurant is situated in a fairly residential area, but then again, I guess most restaurants in the Sunset/Richmond area qualify.  The restaurant's layout is a little interesting, as the back portion of the restaurant was walled off leaving a nook for 6 tables and gave the restaurant a closed-off feel.  The frozen cocktail my friend ordered was mostly sweet without much alcohol, disappointing even for her.

The jumbo prawn wontons are not jumbo by any account (granted, I had eaten at Anchor Oyster Bar earlier that day, so my sense of proportion may be completely skewed), and you can barely taste the pancetta at all, a very forgettable dish.  The Buddha roll, on the other hand, was like a slight variation on a traditional Vietnamese spring roll filled with tasty daikon and black mushrooms to give it a more earthy flavor.  The Dungeness crab puffs were like crab rangoons on crack, filled with delicious herb cheese and a large quantity of crab, only limited by their size.

The garlic noodles here have somewhat more of a bite and stronger garlic flavor compared to PPQ Dungeness Island. However, I have to say the crab, albeit meatier, was not nearly as flavorful.  We ordered the roast crab which, although mildly peppery and actually with a good amount of sweet meat, otherwise was not as heavily seasoned.  Strangely enough, our crab was actually a little cool by the time it got to our table.  Also, the seafood fried rice was lacking in salt.  Thankfully, they brought some chili sambal to our table upon request.  Our server was really very nice and attentive.

Overall, based on pure food comparisons, PPQ Dungeness Island wins in my book purely based on the crab's flavoring, but Thanh Long may actually serve a better crab and definitely has better garlic noodles.  If you're looking for crab on a Tuesday, this is your place... (cuz it seems everywhere else is closed!)

excerpts: * Roast Crab & Garlic Noodles: If you love overdosing on garlic and butter, you will love the crab and garlic noodles here.
roast crab.author: Judy C.
roast crab.review:
My all-time favorite San Francisco restaurant is situated right here in Outer Sunset.  Thang Long, known for their French-inspired Vietnamese cuisine, serves some of the BEST garlic crabs and BEST garlic noodles.

Once in awhile I get to splurge here, and luckily for my birthday -- my thoughtful friends brought me here to celebrate.  Together, we shared:

* Salmon Carpaccio: My favorite appetizer from Thanh Long!  The lemon-cured salmon was perfectly marinated and not at all "fishy."
* Salt & Pepper Calamari: Calamari usually all tastes the same at different restaurants.  However, here, they go easy on the batter and oil to give an overall light taste.
* Mango Salad: This is was my least favorite dish.  Warm mango slices and seafood on top of cold salad is not appetizing whatsoever. 
* Roast Crab & Garlic Noodles: If you love overdosing on garlic and butter, you will love the crab and garlic noodles here.  Their infamous secret sauce really makes Thanh Long what they are. 

Other noteworthy dishes I've tried and loved: Shrimp Toast, Shaken Beef, and Colossal Royal Tiger Prawns. 

Love, love, love.

excerpts:
Ordered (main courses 2 stars)
VIetnamese Salad - fresh 
Beef Satay - nothing out of the ordinary
Roast Crab - came out cold
roast crab.author: Albert L.
roast crab.review:
Came here for my birthday dinner with my family.  I was able to get reservations a few days in advance.  Parking wasn't as bad as people made it out to be.  I was able to find parking about 2 blocks away.  Was seated about 10 minutes after checking in with our entire party.

Ordered (main courses 2 stars)
VIetnamese Salad - fresh 
Beef Satay - nothing out of the ordinary
Roast Crab - came out cold
Garlic noodles - delicious
Shaken beef - a bit pricey for the lack of beef
Sea Bass - it had good flavor to it and was not over cooked

Desserts (5 stars)
Banana cake - delicious
Chocolate lava cake - melted in your mouth, not too heavy

When we got home, I had to drink a bottle of water because of all the MSG.  -1 star

Overall, I'm not sure we would come back here as the crab was not extraordinary.  I've had better crab in Singapore and Boiling crab.  It's pretty expensive for what it is.  It is aight and would recommend everyone to try it once.

excerpts: and I always find that I enjoy their roast crab the most, of course
, that's what they are famous for.
The way they roast with butter, garlic and black pepper really enhances the flavor of the dungeness crab.
Their crab is always fresh, juicy and decent size; I wonder how they can get such fresh crabs during the off season?
The only way to enjoy your crab is down and dirty, hands, fingers and teeth!
roast crab.author: Tony L.
roast crab.review:
I have been here many times over many years and I am just getting around to review it.

So, for my 100th, here goes: I have had a variety of dishes here and I always find that I enjoy their roast crab the most, of course, that's what they are famous for. The way they roast with butter, garlic and black pepper really enhances the flavor of the dungeness crab. Their crab is always fresh, juicy and decent size; I wonder how they can get such fresh crabs during the off season? The only way to enjoy your crab is down and dirty, hands, fingers and teeth! That way you can taste all the juices, and enjoy cracking the shell with your teeth, how primal!

Parking is a pain, but you can valet. The wait can be long, but it's the same with all the better restaurant. But, there is no better way to overload on cholesterol!! At least once in a while.

excerpts: Roast crab and garlic noodles.
roast crab.author: Yana B.
roast crab.review:
Roast crab and garlic noodles.

enough said.


P.S. - parking sucks so get there early. :)

excerpts: I don't have much to add: delicious whole roast crab with excellent seasoning, and yummy garlic noodles.
The spicy eggplant dish was also a standout.
Don't be afraid to put on the bib and chow down on that succulent crab!
roast crab.author: Eden H.
roast crab.review:
I don't have much to add: delicious whole roast crab with excellent seasoning, and yummy garlic noodles. The spicy eggplant dish was also a standout. Don't be afraid to put on the bib and chow down on that succulent crab! Everyone else around you will be doing the same.

I went here for the first time last night with three other people, and it's a good thing we went early, because it ended up being packed!  A good place for groups and families.

excerpts: Our party always order the same thing, garlic noodle & roast crab.
One order per/couple, with exception of cousin who always has his own order of roast crab & a plate of garlic noodle.
While the roast crab was good, it's not the best I've ever had.
There's way too much oil and not enough seasonings in my opinion.
roast crab.author: Angie L.
roast crab.review:
This has been cousin's favorite restaurant for as long as he was a little boy, so whenever he's back in town, this is where we go. 

The wait can get crazy here. Our last visit was last Saturday, and we waited over 1 hour for party of 6. We waited for 2 hours once for party of 8. Reservation is recommended. Side note, they won't seat you unless your whole party is there. 

Our party always order the same thing, garlic noodle & roast crab. One order per/couple, with exception of cousin who always has his own order of roast crab & a plate of garlic noodle.  Plus this time, we had muscles as appetizer (enjoyed this a lot)

Garlic noodle is around $10 and crab is market price. The total bill for our party of 6 this time was $210 with tip.  Is it worth the price? Cousin would say yes. I only say yes because it was my uncle's treat. I probably wouldn't spend that much otherwise. While the roast crab was good, it's not the best I've ever had. There's way too much oil and not enough seasonings in my opinion. I do like the garlic noodle though. 

Service is pretty good, so no complaints there.

excerpts: Delicious roast crab with garlic noodles.
roast crab.author: Tony P.
roast crab.review:
Delicious roast crab with garlic noodles. Those noodles are even better when either dipped in the buttery oil left over from the crab or when covered with either the eggplant sauce or the mixed vegetables. 

This place can get very crowded so best to go during off hours.

excerpts: The must-try items are obviously the roast crab, garlic noodles, and shaken beef.
For some appetizers, I'd recommend the tiger prawns, mussels, and salt & pepper calamari.
roast crab.author: Ryan L.
roast crab.review: I haven't eaten here in a few years (probably like.. '09) but I must say that they have maintained their quality. I made a reservation and had to change it right beforehand and it was no problem with the staff. Everything on the menu is probably very tasty and rich in flavor. The must-try items are obviously the roast crab, garlic noodles, and shaken beef. For some appetizers, I'd recommend the tiger prawns, mussels, and salt & pepper calamari. The mango salad was good but I'm not a fan of warm/sweet salads. The service was a bit slow but other than that, I would definitely recommend you try this place out.

excerpts: their garlic noodles are fantastic; so are the crab and cream cheese wontons and the desserts, but that roast crab still haunts my dreams.
roast crab.author: Kris G.
roast crab.review:
this is no mere roasted crab... this is god, speaking to us through food. 

i'm paraphrasing jason segel here, from HIMYM, and although he's speaking of the best burger in new york, i'm here to tell you about the best crab in san francisco. 

most of you know, i'm a proud maryland gal who's been cracking blue crabs over newspaper since i was 3, thank you very much. for me, crabs come by the bushel, they're served with buckets of beer and plates of hush puppies, and it's a social thing - you spend time at the table with family and friends, talking and eating delicious morsels of old bay-seasoned crab meat. 

when i came to san francisco, i was shocked and appalled at the flat discs of fish-flavored breadcrumbs that pass for crabcakes in the bay area. the dungeness crab i found in my salad louies and crab fried rice left me underwhelmed and longing for the lump crab of my hometown. i had been in SF three years, was planning to move back to DC for a new job, and had thoroughly given up hope of finding good crab in the bay area... until i went to thanh long. 

have you ever licked your hands in the middle of a nice restaurant, trying to suck every delicious drop of flavor off your fingers, not caring who saw your atrocious manners? well, if you go to thanh long, you will. 

i tried their buttery, garlicky roasted crab exactly one week before i was set to move across the country, and literally had dreams the next two nights of tender crab meat eaten with white rice by the handful. refusing to leave california without another taste, i went to sister restaurant crustacean (thanh long is closed on mondays) before hitting the airport for my cross-country flight. 

their garlic noodles are fantastic; so are the crab and cream cheese wontons and the desserts, but that roast crab still haunts my dreams. and you better believe thanh long is the first place i'm gonna go when i'm back in the bay. 

best. crab. in. san francisco.

excerpts: I'd never had crab legs before, so I followed the majority and got the roast crab and we shared a bunch of plates of the garlic noodles.
I enjoyed everything we ate and the service was good, but I can't help to think that it is a bit overpriced, I dropped $80+ when the night was done on dinner.
I would go again, but probably for special occassions.
roast crab.author: Candace R.
roast crab.review: Was invited here for a birthday dinner with a large group. We started with the calamari and dumplings, of which I enjoyed the calamari more. I'd never had crab legs before, so I followed the majority and got the roast crab and we shared a bunch of plates of the garlic noodles. I enjoyed everything we ate and the service was good, but I can't help to think that it is a bit overpriced, I dropped $80+ when the night was done on dinner. I would go again, but probably for special occassions.

excerpts: The roast crab rocks.
The villager's favorite was also quite tasty.
A little steeply priced, but I say... GO!
roast crab.author: Andrew K.
roast crab.review: Really nice spot.  Pretty mural on the wall, cozy booths. The roast crab rocks. The villager's favorite was also quite tasty. A little steeply priced, but I say... GO!

excerpts: roast crab.
sometimes we get seafood fried rice, calamari, vietnamese salad, beef skewers, etc, but the only essentials are: roast crab.
but it's not as amazing as the roast crab.
make reservations, if you can!
and some days, parking can take awhile.
staff is really friendly, helpful, and attentive.
always a great dining experience here
roast crab.author: Anjelica C.
roast crab.review:
roast crab. garlic noodles.

that is all you need.

sometimes we get seafood fried rice, calamari, vietnamese salad, beef skewers, etc, but the only essentials are: roast crab. garlic noodles.

we've ventured to try the tamarind crab once or twice but it's not as amazing as the roast crab. make reservations, if you can! and some days, parking can take awhile. staff is really friendly, helpful, and attentive. always a great dining experience here

excerpts: As for the entree, each of us had one roast crab each.
Previous reviews definitely reflected well; the roast crab is delicious.
It seems as though they must marinade the crab ahead of time (probably why the restaurant doesn't open until 5) because the crab came out quickly but was still tasty.
roast crab.author: Krystine D.
roast crab.review:
My family was visiting from San Diego so we wanted to wanted to indulge and heard about the crab here. Fortunately, we set reservations because this place was packed!

Superior service. We were told our table would be ready by 8:30 and our name was called right on the dot. For starters, we ordered the salt and pepper calamari. The calamari was good, though I'm usually used to having some sort of dipping sauce with it. Lightly breaded. Then we ordered to the Vietnamese traditional salad, which was the perfect starter to a heavy meal; it was light and refreshing. 

As for the entree, each of us had one roast crab each. Previous reviews definitely reflected well; the roast crab is delicious. It seems as though they must marinade the crab ahead of time (probably why the restaurant doesn't open until 5) because the crab came out quickly but was still tasty. We paired the crab with two orders of the garlic noodles - great combo. The noodles are rich - garlic-y and buttery YUM - and went well with the crab.

For dessert, we had the fried banana with ice cream. Each order comes with two fried banana portions and one scoop of vanilla ice cream. Yum! 

Ultimately one of the best meals I've had since moving to the Bay. I would absolutely come here again if the budget permitted. My mom even dared to say that was the best crab she has had her whole life - now that's bold :)

Can't say enough about the service here. They were friendly, fast and extremely attentive. Awesome staff.

excerpts:
Roast crab (roasted with garlic sauce and "secret" spices)
Garlic noodles (3 orders please!)
roast crab.author: Cici T.
roast crab.review:
Drunken crab and a garlic hangover? Yes, please!

It was a foggy summer night, the last time I came to Thanh Long for dinner. After ollaliberry picking in Pescadero and mussel hunting in Half Moon Bay, my sunkissed friends and I wanted to end the night with a bang and decided to treat ourselves to juicy, plump crab and some dressed up garlic noodles!

Here was our order:
Drunken crab (simmered in Chardonnay, sake and brandy; scallions, chives, and cracked black pepper)
Roast crab (roasted with garlic sauce and "secret" spices)
Garlic noodles (3 orders please!)
Thanh Long spicy eggplant (jumbo prawns, chicken, basil, baby corn!, shitake mushrooms, eggplant!)
Lemongrass chicken (chicken, vegetables, garlic, and chili)

Oh was it a feast! Among the five of us, we cleared our table.

Caution: The taste of garlic from the garlic noodles is potent! After your meal, brush your teeth and tongue, gargle mouthwash, and that taste and smell is not so easily ditched! Hence the garlic hangover.

excerpts: My friend kept raving about this place and how great the garlic roast crab is.
I L-O-V-E crustaceans, crab legs and lobster tails rock my world.
Garlic not so much.
I of course use garlic in cooking to enhance a dish and can appreciate its use, but you're not gonna find me eating at The Stinking Rose where that shit reeks of almost raw garlic, ew.
The garlic roast crab was sooooooooo delicious, I went to town on that motha.
I kindof pride myself on my waspy crab-eating skills, I can pick every single morsel of meat out of a crab leg, which I did again that night.
Honestly it's a lot of crab meat
so many of weaklings out there might want to follow in the footsteps of the couple next to us and "split a crab.
roast crab.author: Jo G.
roast crab.review:
Allright, I'll be the first to admit that I exaggerate stuff and can be overly dramatic sometimes, but honestly- I think our dinner at Thanh Long was probably one of the best meals of my life.  Top 5 for sure.  

My friend kept raving about this place and how great the garlic roast crab is.  I L-O-V-E crustaceans, crab legs and lobster tails rock my world.  Garlic not so much.  I of course use garlic in cooking to enhance a dish and can appreciate its use, but you're not gonna find me eating at The Stinking Rose where that shit reeks of almost raw garlic, ew.   So, I was slightly skeptical as to whether I'd enjoy this garlic crab, and the garlic noodles that you can order as a side dish.

We walk into the restaurant, and I'm pleasantly surprised to find out it doesn't have an overbearing garlic smell to it.  Awesome.  I was tempted to stray from convention and try the Tamarind crab, or the Drunken crab (cooked in white wine and olive oil I think), but everyone kept stressing how legit the garlic roast one was.  Ok, I caved.

Boy, I've never been so happy to cave into peer pressure as I was Friday night.  The garlic roast crab was sooooooooo delicious, I went to town on that motha.  I kindof pride myself on my waspy crab-eating skills, I can pick every single morsel of meat out of a crab leg, which I did again that night.  Honestly it's a lot of crab meat so many of weaklings out there might want to follow in the footsteps of the couple next to us and "split a crab."  I don't know what "sharing" or "split" a meal means as I've never done it myself, but I hear some people don't experience the food coma afterward, so I guess try it if you want.

On to the noodles, which again sounded super dicey to me.  I envisioned half-cooked garlic which would make me vomit.  Ohhhh silly girl, silly naive Jo.  No no no no- the garlic noodles were exquisite.  They tasted faintly of garlic, and like McDonald's fries, had to have a touch of sugar in them b/c they were slightly sweet and addictive as fuck.  Score.

As a sidenote, this place is a nicer restaurant, you still get a bib but it's definitely not a hole in the wall crab joint.  With that said, I wouldn't recommend it for a first or second date, b/c most girls will squirm at the thought of cracking crab legs (which might mess up our outfits, God forbid our date's crab gets flung inadvertently into our hair), and the garlic factor too, just don't do it.  Wait till you guys have reached that comfort level where you just don't give an F and can school that crab in peace without any insecurity.

excerpts: All of my cousins that have visited the city have eaten there and have loved the garlic noodles and roast crab.
Now that I'm here in the bay, I finally got to try it
and I now know why my cousins won't  stfu about this place.
We ordered the salt and pepper calamari, thanh long mussels, roast crab, and garlic noodles.
We ordered the salt and pepper calamari, thanh long mussels, roast crab, and garlic noodles.
We later got the garlic noodles and roast crab and OMFG SOOOOO GOOD.
We later got the garlic noodles and roast crab and OMFG SOOOOO GOOD.
The garlic noodles are spaghetti noodles (or so I think)
but in a nice blend of garlic, salt, and crack.
The roast crab is even more delicious than the noodles.
It was garlicky and peppery with probably more crack.
I now understand why each table setting has crab crackers.
Who goes to Thanh Long without trying their roast crab?!?!?!?!?!
roast crab.author: Anna K.
roast crab.review:
I have been hearing about Thanh Long for several years now ever since I started flying to the bay. All of my cousins that have visited the city have eaten there and have loved the garlic noodles and roast crab. Now that I'm here in the bay, I finally got to try it and I now know why my cousins won't  stfu about this place. I can now join my cousins as we can't and won't stfu about Thanh Long.

Thanh Long is slightly far from the heart of the city, near 46th street. My friends and I were lost and almost gave up, since we were traveling from Mission. However, we finally found it and were relieved that our trek to the restaurant was over. We ordered the salt and pepper calamari, thanh long mussels, roast crab, and garlic noodles. The salt and pepper calamari was the first dish to reach our table. I didn't really enjoy the dish because the batter made some pieces taste stale while other pieces were crispy. I sat at the table thinking, OMG I hope this place gets better or else I'm going to scream at all my cousins for this shizz. The second dish we received was the thanh long mussels. It was mussels with a pesto sauce on top of a slice of buttered bread. YUMMY!!!! By this time I thought a good dish canceled out a bad and was feeling better about Thanh Long. We later got the garlic noodles and roast crab and OMFG SOOOOO GOOD. The garlic noodles are spaghetti noodles (or so I think) but in a nice blend of garlic, salt, and crack. The roast crab is even more delicious than the noodles. It was garlicky and peppery with probably more crack. I now understand why each table setting has crab crackers. Who goes to Thanh Long without trying their roast crab?!?!?!?!?! 

I probably stunk of garlic when I met up with my friend Shad and his friend Erin after dinner. But would I change my restaurant plans knowing that I would be meeting up with them? HELL NO!! SORRY!!!! I come in (garlicky) peace. =]

excerpts: I did prefer the roast crab to the drunken crab, but that's mainly because I'm a big fan of garlic.
roast crab.author: Mel L.
roast crab.review:
My three friends and I came here for dinner and we shared two crabs, garlic noodles, coconut shrimp, Vietnamese salad and two bowls of soup all for about $45 per person.  Food came fast, was tasty, wait staff was attentive to what we needed and always made sure to clear our table.  I did prefer the roast crab to the drunken crab, but that's mainly because I'm a big fan of garlic.  The other entrees were good, but it's going to be the crab that brings me back.  

The restaurant was really big and reservations is a must.  Even at 6 pm, there was a 45 min wait.

excerpts: Their garlic noodles and roast crab are to die for!
The servers are nice.
LONG WAIT  if you don't have a reservation.
But just the same, the food is worth the wait.
This restaurant nevers fails to impress anyone I bring along.
YUMMY FOOD!!!
roast crab.author: Donna B.
roast crab.review: Simply AMAZING!  I've been going to this restaurant since 1988. Their garlic noodles and roast crab are to die for!  The servers are nice. LONG WAIT  if you don't have a reservation. But just the same, the food is worth the wait. This restaurant nevers fails to impress anyone I bring along. YUMMY FOOD!!!

excerpts: The roast crab we ordered came out lukewarm.
This would've been tolerable had the crab actually had flavor.
It looked like it was covered in black pepper, but had no taste at all = pre-ground black pepper.
I RARELY use salt to cook, and my usual complaint when I eat out is that the food is too salty.
This crab didn't have even a pinch of salt in it!
They used to use so much butter in their sauce that when it cooled, the bottom of the dish would be covered in coagulated butter.
roast crab.author: Tiffany L.
roast crab.review:
I rarely ever Yelp because, let's face it, unless it's a meal I'd have for my last supper, or it's absolutely atrocious, I'm too darn lazy! But the mediocre, overpriced food at Thanh Long has beat out my laziness.

I used to eat at Thanh Long as a child and absolutely LOVED it. We had reservations for 4 for my brother's birthday dinner two nights ago, and needless to say, I will NEVER return! The food was comparable to a buffet in Reno. 

Garlic Noodles were lacking. It didn't taste anything of fresh garlic. Instead, the noodles were soggy and overcooked, with the flavor of garlic salt.

Mango salad was probably the only tolerable dish we had that night. The vinaigrette was light and sweet, but the portion was pretty small.

The shaken beef was a huge disappointment. The entire bottom of the plate was covered in chopped romaine lettuce, but was hidden under beef, giving the impression that the plate was full of beef. In addition, there were ample chopped potatoes sauteed to LOOK like beef. There were maybe a total of 9 piece of actual beef on the plate, for about $20-$25. 

The sea bass was absolutely bland. It was cooked with no seasoning, AT ALL. The saving grace for this dish was the accompanying sauce on the side, which had a slight sweet, citrus flavor to it. For $25, the serving of sea bass is smaller than the average portion for one person. There was ONE bok choy cut into thirds on the side of this dish. I'm pretty sure bok choy i s$0.79/lb at the supermarket. If you're gonna skimp on the portion of the fish, you could at least use more than one bok choy.

Thanh Long has always had a special place in my heart for their crab. No more. The roast crab we ordered came out lukewarm. This would've been tolerable had the crab actually had flavor. It looked like it was covered in black pepper, but had no taste at all = pre-ground black pepper. I RARELY use salt to cook, and my usual complaint when I eat out is that the food is too salty. This crab didn't have even a pinch of salt in it! They used to use so much butter in their sauce that when it cooled, the bottom of the dish would be covered in coagulated butter. Not anymore. 

I cannot remember the last time I had a meal so disappointing. PPQ on Clement is WAY better, and I will never again patron Thanh Long!

excerpts: The highlight is the roast crab, which, i can say, is by far the best Dungeness crab I've had in San Francisco!!
The crab is huge and fresh, cooked with the "finger-licking good" garlic sauce.
The meat was juicy and tender marinated with the delicious sauce.
roast crab.author: Shirley H.
roast crab.review:
Came here just before my "no seafood diet", and I'm so glad I did!

Being a somewhat upscale seafood restaurant of this quality, the location really threw me off because it's in the Sunset residential district and really has nothing else interesting around but this. Also, don't forget to make reservation because it gets packed all. the. time. 

Ordered salt and pepper calamari for appetizer, nicely flavored and fried without any grease on the plate at all! 

Not so much of a big fan of the garlic noodles although all yelpers rave about it. It was a little overcooked and greasy. 

The highlight is the roast crab, which, i can say, is by far the best Dungeness crab I've had in San Francisco!! The crab is huge and fresh, cooked with the "finger-licking good" garlic sauce. The meat was juicy and tender marinated with the delicious sauce. I could finish the entire thing by myself! 

Prices are a bit high, but it definitely is an awesome place to splurge for some seafood amazingness once in a while...would be back for sure!

excerpts: Roast crab and garlic noodles are a dream!
I haven't had anything but those two items, and really, that is all I want.
roast crab.author: Stacey D.
roast crab.review:
I have been there a few times.  It gets packed, so make a reservation.  The valet service outside is very accommodating too.  

Roast crab and garlic noodles are a dream! I haven't had anything but those two items, and really, that is all I want.  Call me a creature of habit with crustaceans...

Creme brule is a nice desert to end the night.  They have a great wine selection too...I might add.

Service has been great both times I have been there.  When the servers offer you a bib, don't be offended.  You will notice by looking around about everyone is wearing one.  I rip it off as soon as the last piece of crab is taken away...but those juicy suckers are messy!  Lastly, I love a restaurant that boxes the food up for you...especially messy crab.  Thank you servers!

excerpts: Despite the raving review on their Roast Crab... I didn't find it amazing enough for me to work past the second piece.
roast crab.author: Spring L.
roast crab.review:
I must admit that I'm a lazy person. This is unfortunate when I eat crab because after the first couple of pieces I move onto something easier to eat. Despite the raving review on their Roast Crab... I didn't find it amazing enough for me to work past the second piece. 

Instead, I found myself thankful that we ordered the Shaken Beef (of course only after I got over my outrage at the crack price of the dish.. $23 for beef wtf?!).  
I also found myself wishing that they offered de-shelling services because the garlic noodles would have been that much more amazing if it had chunks of crab in it. Why couldn't I have done that myself and mixed it together after, you ask? Because my crab eating skills are so poor that I usually lose 30 percent of the meat in the shell and by the time I'm done getting the 70 percent out of the shell it is usually mangled and cold. And at that time I feel that I deserve to eat that tiny bite of meat that I so desperately pried out of the unforgiving shell.

-____-  I once said I loved interactive dining in another review but this is my breaking point.

excerpts: Even as I'm writing this review, my mouth is watering for garlic noodles with some roast crab.
I usually don't like oily noodles, but the garlic noodles were just something else.
roast crab.author: Roxana D.
roast crab.review:
You know a place is good when over a month later, you can still remember how great everything tastes.  Even as I'm writing this review, my mouth is watering for garlic noodles with some roast crab.

Here's the thing -- if you go here, prepare to open up the wallet.  Of course, you need to get the crab.  That is obvious.  It is the best crab I've ever had, hands down, no questions asked.  If you find yourself wondering if you really need the garlic noodle side -- let me just tell you: the answer is yes.  I usually don't like oily noodles, but the garlic noodles were just something else.  Totally worth the garlic breath that it might give you.  

Service was good, despite the fact that the place was pretty packed.  Ambience is nice - could be good for a date, but be ready to spend.  Also, you may not want to get so messy on a date (yup, you gotta wear the crab bib).

excerpts: The roast crab is sublime.
The crab was very well seasoned with pepper and garlic
and I love how it was dunked in buttery goodness.
Maybe that's what makes the crab taste so good.
roast crab.author: Emily C.
roast crab.review:
The food is amazing. Although the neighborhood was not great and parking was hard to find, it was definitely worth the trek out here. 

The roast crab is sublime. The crab was very well seasoned with pepper and garlic and I love how it was dunked in buttery goodness. Maybe that's what makes the crab taste so good. We ordered the garlic noodles and shaken beef and lots of people say it was the best shaken beef they ever had. The beef was very succulent and full of juice -- perfecto! Garlic noodles are not bad, but it just goes really well with the crab.

As for dessert, I highly recommend finishing off with the fried ice cream. It's pretty big so you can split it with two or three people. Basically it's ice cream encased in sweet yummy fried dough. 

I don't know if this is a great date place, because you guys will end up smelling like garlic (might kill the romance), but it's definitely a good place to go with friends!

excerpts: The roast crab it to die for and that's actually what I usually wanna
do after the massive stomachaches I get from butter overdose, but
its oh so worth it.
roast crab.author: Irina S.
roast crab.review: I LOVE THIS PLACE. I've always hated to get my hands dirty, so I always avoided ordering the crab here and was never too pleased with the other options on the menu. BUT, after I decided to stop being such a prissy eater, I realized what I was missing. The crab and garlic noodles alone earn this place 5 stars. The roast crab it to die for and that's actually what I usually wanna do after the massive stomachaches I get from butter overdose, but its oh so worth it. I've also had the drunken crab and it's an excellent option if you wanna skip the butter and be guiltless. It was flavorful and easy on the stomach. The atmosphere is nice and they even have a large dining room upstairs which I recently discovered. Thanh Long is definitely a winner and I'm not sure whether it's a good or bad thing that it's just down the street from my house.

excerpts: We had the Roast Crab and garlic noodles for our dinner.
The Crab was fantastic.
There was enough butter, garlic, and spices to fill a big gulp at 7-11.
It was oozing with flavor.
The garlic noodles which this chain of restaurant advertises as their signature dish was good.
It went well with the crab, but on it's own, probably not the most tremendous dish.
roast crab.author: Chad O.
roast crab.review:
Disclaimer: You have to love garlic, butter and pepper. But if you do, you will be impressed.

Went her for the first time and my Yelp friend MK told me this place was good, but I was blown away. As soon as you enter you will be greeted with the scent of garlic and butter. 

We started out with the Mussels and they were fantastic. I could have had 2 plates of these by myself. The Asian pesto on these mussels was delicious and you could see everyone on the table trying to scrape as much of it off onto their bread as possible.

We had the Roast Crab and garlic noodles for our dinner. The Crab was fantastic. There was enough butter, garlic, and spices to fill a big gulp at 7-11. It was oozing with flavor. The garlic noodles which this chain of restaurant advertises as their signature dish was good. It went well with the crab, but on it's own, probably not the most tremendous dish. It was primarily noodles and garlic. 

We also had the deep fried banana and pineapple.  We were all stuff't by this point but it was good.  I prefere the deep friend banana over the pineapple.    

The only bad mark is that it is a little bit expensive. It came out to over $60 a person on this trip. Even at that price, I would still recommend it.

excerpts: Also had some other dishes that were as opulent as the Roast Crab.
roast crab.author: Lee M.
roast crab.review: Shared the same menu items on Tuesday as we did in 1978. It was fantastic. Also had some other dishes that were as opulent as the Roast Crab.

excerpts: Get the muscles, garlic noodles and roast crab
and YES it's going to break the bank
roast crab.author: David L.
roast crab.review: Get the muscles, garlic noodles and roast crab and YES it's going to break the bank

excerpts: There isn't much for me to review here as for the many trips that I've made here in the past 6 years, I've only religiously ordered roast crab and garlic noodles.
I really don't even know why they bother having anything else on the menu.
They shouldn't even have a menu at all!
I've come here with many friends who were brave enough to venture outside the roast crab garlic noodle order and all have been disappointed.

Here is what I have tasted:
-Tamarind crab: it is very saucy and sweet unlike it's roast crab brother
-Tiger shrimp prawns: equivalent market price to crab but MUCH less satisfying
roast crab.author: Krystal C.
roast crab.review:
There isn't much for me to review here as for the many trips that I've made here in the past 6 years, I've only religiously ordered roast crab and garlic noodles.  I really don't even know why they bother having anything else on the menu. They shouldn't even have a menu at all!  Simply said, it is a waste to come here to order anything else.

I've come here with many friends who were brave enough to venture outside the roast crab garlic noodle order and all have been disappointed.  Luckily for me, I stuck with my guts and have always been happy, yet got to try their mistakes.

Here is what I have tasted:
-Tamarind crab: it is very saucy and sweet unlike it's roast crab brother
-Tiger shrimp prawns: equivalent market price to crab but MUCH less satisfying

As for what others claim as equivalent restaurants to Thanh Long, here is what I have to say.

PPQ-  this place should not even be in the comparisons list.  The crab is prepared completely different than TL.  The butter tastes different, more creamy than melted.  The garlic isn't quite roasted onto the crab but more cooked and then dumped onto.

Crustaceans- as a devoted TL fan, I've only been willing to try this place out once and that one time, it was horrible.  My friends assured me it was an off thing that the crabs didn't taste the same as they say it usually does.  But my crab was burnt and not flavorful.  The building is hard to get to as you have to climb up 3 stories or take a random mini elevator.  The decor and atmosphere is trying to go for a fancy feel but seriously, it's crab- you just gotta get down and dirty with it.  You will feel more comfortable at TL.

excerpts: So we order one roast crab.
By itself the crab is meaty and fragrant, but the sauce is the extra level.
roast crab.author: Ines C.
roast crab.review:
On the outside, Thanh Long resembles a small, quiet family restaurant. You don't realize the bustling nature and star power of this restaurant until you enter the door.

I notice a crab (or two) on everyone's table as I walk to my seat. The room is fragrant with garlic and spices. This is the real deal, I say to my parents.

We order the salmon carpaccio and Thanh Long mussels as starter dishes. Capers give the fresh salmon a nice, salty hint. The mussels practically melt in your mouth. Mop up the remaining juices with your bread. Perfection.

Garlic noodles are delicious, but they're nothing special without the crab. Isn't that why you came in the first place? So we order one roast crab. By itself the crab is meaty and fragrant, but the sauce is the extra level. It's like instant gratification when you drizzle that over the noodles.

The flavor's slightly more subtle in comparison to Boiling Crab, of course---especially if you love the whole sha-bang---but that's where the sophistication lies. That, and the customer service makes Thanh Long worth the price and visit.

excerpts: For two people, we got a whole roast crab and two plates of garlic noodles.
I walked out of there feeling way crappy (or crabby?)
since I just probably ate the equivalent of a stick of butter.

I tried all the other crabs on the menu and if I were to rate it based on the taste, it would go in the order that it is listed on their menu:
Roast Crab
Drunken Crab
Tamarind Crab
roast crab.author: Heidi C.
roast crab.review:
First off, the crab puff things they sell for appetizers is a rip off. $10 for 6 pieces? No thanks. I rather spend $10 on a whole block of cream cheese at costco and eat that to my liking. 

Anyway, ONTO THE CRAB AND GARLIC NOODLES!
For two people, we got a whole roast crab and two plates of garlic noodles. I walked out of there feeling way crappy (or crabby?) since I just probably ate the equivalent of a stick of butter. BUT it was SO incredibly worth it. 

I tried all the other crabs on the menu and if I were to rate it based on the taste, it would go in the order that it is listed on their menu:
Roast Crab
Drunken Crab
Tamarind Crab

They give you a plastic bib so you don't get crab juices on you, and you pretty much eat with your hands. Make sure to eat the garlic noodles while they're hot. Doesn't taste as good when it's cooled down.

Last time we went, the market price for a crab was about $35. 

I love Thanh Long's crab!!

(Photos uploaded)

excerpts: Order the roast crab, garlic noodles, daily veggie side, and a bottle of La Crema Chardonnay.
That is all you need.
roast crab.author: Leoneidas L.
roast crab.review:
You cannot improve on perfection.  Absolute perfection.  Order the roast crab, garlic noodles, daily veggie side, and a bottle of La Crema Chardonnay.  That is all you need.  This is a must-do in San Francisco.

Restaurateurs up and down the West coast, please pay attention to the missed opportunities to do something really special with the greater region's seafood like Thanh Long does.  Crab doesn't have to be served cold in a small plastic cup.  This place is transcendental.

excerpts: Then, for our main entrees, she had the roast crab
My crab was good, but my girlfriend's roast crab had more pepper
roast crab.author: Pudgy G.
roast crab.review:
So I've been to PPQ on 25-26th ave and Clement and had their crab twice. It was pretty good there.

However, today was my very first time trying Thang Long, and I was really blown away. I had a three course meal with my girlfriend. We started with the fried calamari and mussels, which were delicious. I personally, like the mussels more.

Then, for our main entrees, she had the roast crab and I had the drunken crab. My crab was good, but my girlfriend's roast crab had more pepper and I thought hers tasted better.

In the end, we had the lava chocolate cake for dessert and it was SO SO GOOD to top off everything we ate that was so mouth watering.

5 stars for the food and excellent service from my waiter, Lai, who checked up on us more than once and brought out our appetizers and entrees quickly. Also 5 stars for the cook, host, and wait staff, including the bus boy. 

It should be noted that we ate here around 650-7pm, which was a little busy already. But, as soon as we finished, around 830-9pm, it was already super packed in terms of waiting to be seated.

The downside for this restaurant is that it is a bit expensive, roughly $40-50 for one person, if you just order crab (approximately $35-40) and a beverage. But, for special occasions, this place is totally worth it!

excerpts: I always order the same thing every time I go to this restaurant-mussels with crostini, roast crab, and garlic noodles...
super yummy!:)
roast crab.author: Berna M.
roast crab.review: I always order the same thing every time I go to this restaurant-mussels with crostini, roast crab, and garlic noodles... super yummy!:)

excerpts: We ordered several specialties such as the Roast Crab and Garlic Noodles.
However, I was unimpressed and it certainly did not live up to the hype.
The dishes majored in butter and garlic.
Those interested in Roast Crab should try R&G Lounge in Chinatown.
roast crab.author: William L.
roast crab.review:
I heard about Thanh Long from friends and from Yelp and decided to try it when my niece was in town.  Situated in a residential neighborhood, parking was street only or valet for $10, which I thought was a bit pricey.

I made a reservation for seven and was asked to arrive on time.  We were seated promptly.  I found a parking space one block away.

The menu offered a good selection.  We ordered several specialties such as the Roast Crab and Garlic Noodles.  However, I was unimpressed and it certainly did not live up to the hype.  The dishes majored in butter and garlic.  That taste stayed with me for the night.

The service was attentive but I doubt I will come back anytime soon.

Those interested in Roast Crab should try R&G Lounge in Chinatown.

excerpts:
Roast Crab ~
a whole dungeness crab roasted with thanh's garlic sauce and secret spices


NOTE:
roast crab.author: Oliver D.
roast crab.review:
I've heard so many good reviews on this place and had to check it out for myself! 

I'm a HUGE fan of sea food especially CRAB and I heard this place had the best roasted crab in San Francisco, so I had to get my 'YELP FACE' on and see what the hype was all about!

As I walked into the restaurant i was impressed! The exterior of Thanh  Long looks like a 'hole in a wall' establishment, but i was proven wrong. It's really cozy and professional. 

I suggest you make reservations if you decide to come with a party of 4 or more. It can get busy on the weekend.

Since this place is kinda pricey, its recommended that you skip out on the appetizers; to be honest, they are over-rated, tiny and over priced! Just get down to the nitty gritty and order the main dishes....

Here are my recommendations:

1.  Thanh Long Spicy Eggplant ~
sauteed with jumbo prawns, chicken, fresh basil, baby corn, shitake mushrooms and fiery red chillies in a tamarind and chilli-soya

2. Shaken Beef ~
tender cubes of marinated new york steak flambeed in chardonnay, served with potatoes, mixed green and cherry tomatoes

3. Colossal Royal Tiger Prawns ~
butterflied and grilled with secret spices, served on a bed of garlic noodles

4. Roast Crab ~
a whole dungeness crab roasted with thanh's garlic sauce and secret spices


NOTE: The spices used in their food are really intense, so if you don't like the after taste of garlic and spices in your mouth, then the majority of the food isn't for you.....but who doesn't like INTENSE SPICES! haha

The portion size of each dish is some what small so try to diversify your choices and order smart....


Much LOVE and eats!

excerpts: Garlic noodles and roast crab are legit!
Definitely worth the price and trek to the Avenues.
roast crab.author: Catherine C.
roast crab.review: Garlic noodles and roast crab are legit! Definitely worth the price and trek to the Avenues. Vietnamese salad pretty good as was the lemongrass chicken. The space is 70s chic in an unflattering way. Nice to have a full-bar though. Prices are a bit higher than I'd like to spend.

excerpts: My go to meal is the roast crab & garlilc noodles.
You can't go wrong with either.
The food is great & the service is awesome.
They do have valet parking ($10 cash) but if you go early (before 7am) parking is really easy..
Dinner is pricey but well worth every buck!!!
This is the place to go for a good "crab crackin" time... i even went here on a date once (i have no shame when it comes to crackin crab)..
roast crab.author: nicole b.
roast crab.review:
First I would like to say "Thank You" to my friends Naomi & Angel for introducing me to Thanh Long (I just love him sooo much.. LoL)...  I've been hooked ever since.  My go to meal is the roast crab & garlilc noodles.  You can't go wrong with either.  The food is great & the service is awesome.  They do have valet parking ($10 cash) but if you go early (before 7am) parking is really easy..  Dinner is pricey but well worth every buck!!!
This is the place to go for a good "crab crackin" time... i even went here on a date once (i have no shame when it comes to crackin crab).. :)

excerpts: I cannot (and have no desire to) get past the garlic roast crab and garlic noodles.
It is such a treat, and consistently good.
roast crab.author: Linda M.
roast crab.review:
Normally, I like to try different things on a menu when I revisit a restaurant.  I cannot (and have no desire to) get past the garlic roast crab and garlic noodles.  It is such a treat, and consistently good.  I barely even glance at the menu when it arrives.

I like the more casual atmosphere as Thanh Long compared to her sister restaurant, Crustacean (which is better if you're looking for a romantic date restaurant but don't mind eating messy food that makes you reek of garlic.  Does that happen?).

Service is good but not excellent.  But the crab and noodles make it five stars.

excerpts: However, please note that the Roast Crab deserves 5 stars.
The other dishes I ordered deserve a 4 star.
The minute the Roast Crab came, it looked amazing.
My mouth started watering as I started to eat my first bite of the crab.
What seemed like the most simple of spices - salt, pepper, garlic, butter (of course I don't know the "secret  spices" haha), made the meat perfect, not overpowering in any spice.
roast crab.author: Jennifer L.
roast crab.review:
My good friend kept telling me how delicious this restaurant is, and do I believe him?  YES, I do!  

However, please note that the Roast Crab deserves 5 stars.  The other dishes I ordered deserve a 4 star.  Also, since there was only 2 of us, we did not get to order a large variety as I would have liked.

What we ordered:

-Dungeness Crab Puffs
-Roast Crab
-Garlic Noodles
-Lemon Sorbet 
-Jasmine Tea

MUST-TRY!  The minute the Roast Crab came, it looked amazing.  My mouth started watering as I started to eat my first bite of the crab.  What seemed like the most simple of spices - salt, pepper, garlic, butter (of course I don't know the "secret  spices" haha), made the meat perfect, not overpowering in any spice.  It might be a challenge to crack the shell, but that's the fun of eating seafood!  

On to the other dishes now,  the Garlic Noodles was so-so, it was tasty, but not all that as others have raved.  The Dungeness Crab Puffs was good for a first try, but would not order again.  It actually tasted better without the accompanied sauce. For dessert, we tried the Lemon Sorbet, that was yummy, but I hope it really is homemade! Jasmine tea was a nice touch, but $5 for that was not worth it!

A plus for this restaurant is the customer service, all servers were attentive and provided good service.  There is even valet parking service, strange for me since I rarely see this in the Sunset neighborhood.

The only thing now is I need to go back again and try more dishes.  And, maybe it will get a 5 star.

excerpts: Two of us shared a roast crab, garlic noodles, salmon carpaccio, some garlic toast (because i love carbs) and the chocolate molten cake.
the garlic noodles are perfect too.
You know how some places don't have that exact garlic flavor... this one is on point.
The salmon carpaccio was such a surprise! and a delight!
It blew our minds away how good it was.
It's kind of disgusting how we ate the chocolate molten cake
but everything was so good
we thought WHY THE HELL NOT!
AND IT WAS WORTH IT
TOO!
I will definitely order my own crab next time!
I could eat this for daysssss!
roast crab.author: Anna C.
roast crab.review:
YES. MMMM. MORE. 

LITERALLY THE ONLY WORDS/SOUNDS I MADE WHILE I WAS EATING.

Two of us shared a roast crab, garlic noodles, salmon carpaccio, some garlic toast (because i love carbs) and the chocolate molten cake. We most definitely finished every last bit of everything on our plate.  

The crab is just.. MMMMMMMMMM can't even describe. it's soooo good!!! the garlic noodles are perfect too.  You know how some places don't have that exact garlic flavor... this one is on point.  The salmon carpaccio was such a surprise! and a delight! It blew our minds away how good it was.  It's kind of disgusting how we ate the chocolate molten cake but everything was so good we thought WHY THE HELL NOT! AND IT WAS WORTH IT TOO!  I will definitely order my own crab next time! I could eat this for daysssss!

excerpts: If I were on death row and I had to choose one last meal, it would be the Roast Crab and Garlic Noodles from Thanh Long.
Quite simply, it has been my absolute #1 favorite meal.
roast crab.author: Jose T.
roast crab.review:
If you are bothered by food that haunts your dreams, and gives you irresistible cravings, then Thanh Long isn't the place for you.

If I were on death row and I had to choose one last meal, it would be the Roast Crab and Garlic Noodles from Thanh Long.  Quite simply, it has been my absolute #1 favorite meal.  Nothing compares to it.  

Every single person I have recommended Thanh Long to has claimed to have their best dining experience there.  The food, especially the dishes named above and the Tiger Prawns are just undeniable.  

Eating here is worth every penny and much more.

excerpts: Entrees: ROAST CRAB.
The tiger prawn dish is also pretty good.
But back to the crab.
Wow!
It's really good.
For a dish that seems so simple (whole crab, butter, seasoning) they must do SOMETHING to make it so enticing.
I don't know what that is.
Until I find out
so I can cook this at home, I'll keep coming here.
The butter noodles are also delicious.
roast crab.author: Michael T.
roast crab.review:
Oh wow.

This place is great. Believe the hype.

Appetizers: I've only ventured as far as the salt and pepper calamari. Solid. Delicious. Only wish they gave more.

Entrees: ROAST CRAB. The tiger prawn dish is also pretty good. But back to the crab. Wow! It's really good. For a dish that seems so simple (whole crab, butter, seasoning) they must do SOMETHING to make it so enticing. I don't know what that is. Until I find out so I can cook this at home, I'll keep coming here. The butter noodles are also delicious. Again, believe the hype.

The service is great. Polite and honest servers. If your beverage is looking empty, the moment you think about asking for a fill-up, your cup is refilled. Great service.
