Everybody should try this place. I'm not big on feeding hype machines, but this is well deserved. 5 stars, easily.

excerpts: Ordered one roast crab, one drunken crab, garlic noodles.
So excited to eat fresh Dungeness.
Except that, it wasn't very fresh.
Both crabs had that faint ammonia taste -- like they'd been sitting around for a couple of days, or maybe they'd been frozen?
Whatever the reason, this was NOT fresh crab.
Service was good, price was a little high, but not terrible.
But not fresh?
At a place renowned for crab?
I would never go here again.
roast crab.author: Nancy S.
roast crab.review: We went to Thanh Long 3 days into Dungeness Crab season in SF.  It has great reviews on crab.  We were seated right away -- last table, so we were grateful.  Ordered one roast crab, one drunken crab, garlic noodles.  So excited to eat fresh Dungeness.  Except that, it wasn't very fresh.  Both crabs had that faint ammonia taste -- like they'd been sitting around for a couple of days, or maybe they'd been frozen?  Whatever the reason, this was NOT fresh crab.  Service was good, price was a little high, but not terrible.  But not fresh?  At a place renowned for crab?  I would never go here again.

excerpts: The roast crab and drunken crab were great!
roast crab.author: Wilson W.
roast crab.review: The roast crab and drunken crab were great! Garlic noodles were very tasty as well. We tried the sea bass and that turned out to be a little dry. But their calamari appetizer is very unique and worth a try!

excerpts: as for the famed roast crab and noodles ...
LET.
DOWN.
it's gd crab season in california, so i cannot fathom why our crab, while large, WAS.
NOT.
FRESH.
i have eaten a crapton of crab in my life as a good chinese person do, and this crab had clearly been dead for some time and no amount of delicious seasoning can hide that.
as for the noodles, if you like your noodles sweet (my japanese husband did), then maybe you will be okay.
they certainly give you a lot of it for $9.95.
for me, it was way too sweet and way overcooked.
roast crab.author: alinna s.
roast crab.review:
we heard about this place via check please, bay area so we went for our anniversary dinner.  it is the fanciest vietnamese restaurant i have ever been to and the waitstaff was great.  make a res -- the line is long but DAMN, they can turn tables here.

everyone in the restaurant was eating two things: roasted crab and garlic noodles.  given that it was just after xmas, i thought we should eat salad ... bad plan.  they didn't have the mango salad and the regular salad was bleah.  i will say they did not skimp on the shrimp, which was fresh, but it didn't taste like anything.

the salt and pepper calamari appetizer was the best for me.  it was salty, crispy and most excellent with lots of lemon.

as for the famed roast crab and noodles ... LET. DOWN.  it's gd crab season in california, so i cannot fathom why our crab, while large, WAS. NOT. FRESH.  i have eaten a crapton of crab in my life as a good chinese person do, and this crab had clearly been dead for some time and no amount of delicious seasoning can hide that.  as for the noodles, if you like your noodles sweet (my japanese husband did), then maybe you will be okay.  they certainly give you a lot of it for $9.95. for me, it was way too sweet and way overcooked.  i tried to save it by dipping it into the crab seasoning.  

overall, it was meh.  the portion sizes are good, but the dead crab didn't do it for me.  if it's $41.95 (it's a market price dish) at the height of dungeness crab season, i cannot stand the idea of paying God knows how much in july.  a nice experience, but i wouldn't escape 3 babies and drive an hour into the city for this.

excerpts: Roast Crab - a whole Dungeness crab roasted with An's garlic sauce & secret spices in the Secret Kitchen
; regardless of what others may say, this in of itself is a delectable Dungeness crab entree!
Yes it's messy but who cares?

- An's famous noodles made with their secret garlic sauce (perhaps the one used on the Roast Crab?) & secret spices; this noodle dish is good when hot but at room temperature or worse, cold, it's not that good (something coagulates on the noodles when it's cold...butter perhaps?)
roast crab.author: Beth W.
roast crab.review:
We came here for a special family celebration and it was our first time dining here as well.

The food ordered for our dinner comprised of the following:

1. Salt & Pepper Calamari - delicious except for the simple overdose of coarsely ground black pepper; will definitely tell them next time to adjust the black pepper with a lighter touch

2. Mango Salad - fresh mango fruit sauteed with bell peppers, seared scallops & shrimp over mixed greens in a raspberry vinaigrette - this would make for an excellent  meal on it's own; the raspberry vinaigrette nicely tied the various flavors together effortlessly

3. Thanh Long Spicy Eggplant - eggplant sauteed with jumbo prawns, chicken, fresh basil, baby corn, shitake mushrooms, & red chilies in a tamarind & chili-soya; I like spicy but it was on the low end of the spicy spectrum on this dinner outing though the overall flavors were good ~ will order it again but tell the server to make it spicier

4. Villager's Favorite - Pacific prawns & pork medallions simmered in a caramelized reduction of soy and herbs; I liked this dish enough that I would order it again; a nice take on a "surf and turf" with pork instead of beef for the "turf" portion

5. Shaken Beef - tender cubes of marinated New York steak flambeed in Chardonnay served with potatoes, mixed greens & cherry tomatoes; delicious in flavor with fork tender beef; the greens I could do without as it seemed more a "salad" than an entree

6. Vegetarian Delight - silken tofu sauteed with asst. vegetables & shitake mushrooms; a standout as I love tofu and veggies!

7. Roast Crab - a whole Dungeness crab roasted with An's garlic sauce & secret spices in the Secret Kitchen; regardless of what others may say, this in of itself is a delectable Dungeness crab entree!  Yes it's messy but who cares?  The flavors marry very well and our entire party enjoyed this dish.

8. Garlic Noodles - An's famous noodles made with their secret garlic sauce (perhaps the one used on the Roast Crab?) & secret spices; this noodle dish is good when hot but at room temperature or worse, cold, it's not that good (something coagulates on the noodles when it's cold...butter perhaps?)

Despite the large amounts ordered per item, we had lots of left overs (crab included) for our party of 18.  Would I go back to this spot?  You betcha!  I want to try the Tamarind Crab - "simmered in a melange of Roma tomatoes & tamarind, seasoned with fresh dill & green onions & flambeed with cognac."  The ingredients for this dish make me salivate just thinking about it.

There is a full bar in case you want a drink while you wait and/or with your meal.  Two of us ordered the Fleur de Mango - pureed fresh mango, Malibu rum, a banana rum and freshly squeezed orange juice to the mix - this was the fave drink of the evening!  
 
While parking is an issue, it's located in a neighborhood folks, get there early so that you can look for parking or just valet your car.  I would also suggest booking a reservation so that you are amongst the first seating for the evening.  Overall, the service was excellent/attentive and the food was delicious.

The name of this restaurant came about due to an error at the printer's.  It was supposed to be "Thang Long" meaning "Ascending Dragon" and also Vietnam's first capital city.  As "Thanh Long" it means "Green Dragon" ~ green representing happiness and prosperity while the dragon symbol is an ancient symbol of good luck.  I would say the An Family has enjoyed this for many years serving a legion of happy customers ~ myself being a newly minted one!

Note - The An Family also owns the Crustacean group of restaurants with a Palo Alto opening targeted for this September 2010.  I can't wait till this spot opens up!

excerpts: My fiancé is obsessed with the roast crab here!
I usually can only eat half of it, but we each end up ordering our own - since he refuses to share!
roast crab.author: Julie C.
roast crab.review: My fiancé is obsessed with the roast crab here!  I usually can only eat half of it, but we each end up ordering our own - since he refuses to share!  We did however share an order of the garlic noodles and seasonal vegetables.  I've never tried anything else here, but the crab, noodle, veggie combination is pretty much the definition of perfection!

excerpts:
Must Haves:
Garlic Asian Noodles
Drunken Crab

Tried:
Shaken Beef
Roast Crab
The most stellar items on the imenu that I tried were the garlic asian noodles and the drunken crab.
The garlic asian noodles just burst with flavor.
Each bite has such wonderful garlic  and other spices that make this dish outstanding.
Dare I say, even more memorable than the crab!
The drunken crab was the better of the two.
Simmering alcohol into any food just makes it all the better in my book.
They cook the crab with chardonnay, sake, and brandy which makes it even more spectacular.
(Secret, I could have easily slurped up the sauce/juice/au jus or whatever it's called.
The shaken beef was tender, juicy, tasty, and all that jazz, but Thanh Long is famous for crab and there is a reason for that.
It is a good sized portion.
Great beef quality and very, very tasty, but I was just in the mood for MORE CRAB
The roast crab was also good, but I found it to be a little too dry.
It is less messier than the drunken crab, but you already eating crab and it is is bound to look messy.
I mean really, is there any real proper way to eat a crab in public?
I think not.
roast crab.author: Tawny A.
roast crab.review:
Yummy to my tummy.

Must Haves:
Garlic Asian Noodles
Drunken Crab

Tried:
Shaken Beef
Roast Crab

The most stellar items on the imenu that I tried were the garlic asian noodles and the drunken crab. The garlic asian noodles just burst with flavor. Each bite has such wonderful garlic  and other spices that make this dish outstanding. Dare I say, even more memorable than the crab! MUST EAT.

The drunken crab was the better of the two. Simmering alcohol into any food just makes it all the better in my book. They cook the crab with chardonnay, sake, and brandy which makes it even more spectacular. (Secret, I could have easily slurped up the sauce/juice/au jus or whatever it's called. Actually, I probably did).

The shaken beef was tender, juicy, tasty, and all that jazz, but Thanh Long is famous for crab and there is a reason for that. It is a good sized portion. Great beef quality and very, very tasty, but I was just in the mood for MORE CRAB PLEASE.

The roast crab was also good, but I found it to be a little too dry. It is less messier than the drunken crab, but you already eating crab and it is is bound to look messy. I mean really, is there any real proper way to eat a crab in public? I think not.

excerpts: I took one bite of the roast crab.
WOW.
The peppered garlic sauce is AMAZING.
I don't think I've ever tried crab THAT GOOD.
I broke off a couple of legs and began digging in.
I dipped the crab meat into the garlic sauce and felt heaven after each bite.
I think my next trip would consist of roast crab, garlic noodles, and sapporo beer.
Keep it simple.
roast crab.author: Christian M.
roast crab.review:
THE VERY BEST CRAB PLACE THAT I'VE TASTED.

There's a statement for ya off the bat, eh?  My pareng Jimmy kept telling me about this place called Thanh Long that had amazing crabs that were decked out in a nice garlic pepper sauce.  I've heard about this place for months now.  Being from San Diego, it took awhile to try it but it was definitely worth the wait.

The place seems like a hole in the wall from the outside.  The location isn't the prettiest in the world so it made me kind of skeptical of the place.  I walked in and saw a BUSY environment filled with people waiting at the door step.  We had reservations so we got seated fairly quickly.  

There's a full menu of things to order but we went simple and went straight for the crab.  At first we decided to go with some appetizers so we started off with the cheese wontons.  They're decent.  I'm not sure I'd recommend getting them.  I'd probably say just wait for the main course.  The crabs are HUGE.  We were a party of 7 so we decided to order 4 king crabs and some garlic noodles to accompany the crabs.  We went simple with our order.  We ordered two of the drunken crabs and two of the "roast' ones that featured a nice peppered garlic sauce on it.

We got our order after about 15 minutes.  Not too shabby.  Good food takes awhile so I wasn't really concerned with the timing.  I took one bite of the roast crab.  WOW.  The peppered garlic sauce is AMAZING.  I don't think I've ever tried crab THAT GOOD.  I broke off a couple of legs and began digging in.  I dipped the crab meat into the garlic sauce and felt heaven after each bite.  What makes things even better was the garlic noodles.  They're SO GOOD.  I think I had like two plates of the garlic noodles to myself!  I ate so much food.  There's also a bunch of crab fat in the head.  Just writing this review is getting me hungry.  Unfortunately, I'm back in San Diego!!!

I also tried the drunken crab.  It's alright.  I don't think I would order it again though.  I think my next trip would consist of roast crab, garlic noodles, and sapporo beer.  Keep it simple.  I'd recommend this place to anyone and EVERYONE.  

If you are in the LA area, I believe the owner of Thanh Long also owns CRUSTACEAN.  I think it's a upper scale version of Thanh Long.  Same food but higher prices.  At least there's an option in Southern Cal.  Awesome food!

excerpts: I ordered my usual shrimp fried rice no onions & a roast crab.
my crab came 1st.
full of guts.
NOT cleaned @ all i asked the server to take it back when he brought my rice to the table which was slightly burned SMH.
I've been going to that place for @ least 8 or 9 yrs now.
i was highly disappointed. & to top it all off the valet scuffed the bumper of my car & didn't say a word....
Gonna b a while
b4 i return..
Gonna have to go to Crustaceans for a few yrs now...
roast crab.author: Bee L.
roast crab.review: This is my FAVORITE restaurant. unfortunately i had the worst experience EVER 6/23/12. I had 6:15 reservations we were promptly seated. Our server (blonde lady with a thick accent) approached the table. asked what we wanted to drink. didn't welcome us or introduce herself. asked my date all the questions. So i asked for a new server. We were moved upstairs to a cold corner. I ordered my usual shrimp fried rice no onions & a roast crab. my crab came 1st. full of guts. NOT cleaned @ all i asked the server to take it back when he brought my rice to the table which was slightly burned SMH. I've been going to that place for @ least 8 or 9 yrs now. i was highly disappointed. & to top it all off the valet scuffed the bumper of my car & didn't say a word.... Gonna b a while b4 i return.. Gonna have to go to Crustaceans for a few yrs now...

excerpts: Roast crab is just ok. .
roast crab.author: Meo M.
roast crab.review:
I had high expectation on Thanh Long because after all, it spawned Crustacean that I have heard so much about

The service is excellent but the food is so so.   Roast crab is just ok. . The tamarind crab is not sour enough. My Chinese friend hyped about garlic noodle with the secret sauce but there is nothing unique about it + serves too cold and a bit salty.  The pepper calamari is good tho.

excerpts: Dungeoness roast crab and garlic noodle were excellent, worth every penny.
I also tried the grilled prawn noodle and it is just grilled prawn on the top of garlic noodle, I believe it's not worth the money.
roast crab.author: Andrew T.
roast crab.review:
Try their "Secret Recipe" menu.

Dungeoness roast crab and garlic noodle were excellent, worth every penny. I also tried the grilled prawn noodle and it is just grilled prawn on the top of garlic noodle, I believe it's not worth the money.

excerpts: The roast crab was a bit on the--you won't believe me when i say this
but...--too buttery/ oily side.
BUT it had just the right amount of salt and pepper to give it nice little kick.
And what can i say?
i
LOVE crab and will do almost anything to eat it, including letting crab juice and grease drip down to my elbows!
wait...
roast crab.author: Bridget K.
roast crab.review:
Best garlic noodles EVER.  

Most other places...that shall remain nameless...taste like fake ramen packet garlic BLAH tossed with spaghetti.  But these garlic noodles are breath stinkin good (and addictive...) Still made with spaghetti but the noodles have absorbed all the garlic flavor and seasonings, making it extra mouth watering good!  
 
The roast crab was a bit on the--you won't believe me when i say this but...--too buttery/ oily side. BUT it had just the right amount of salt and pepper to give it nice little kick.  And what can i say? i LOVE crab and will do almost anything to eat it, including letting crab juice and grease drip down to my elbows!  wait...did i make that sound like a bad thing???

The fam also ordered the red snapper which was not at all overcooked and it came with more GARLIC NOODLES. 

I must admit, it's less pocket friendly than some of the other crab and garlic noodle places i've been too...but i'm willing to pay the price for quality.  And not to mention...parking is a pain in the behind.  They do, fortunately, have valet parking for $10 if you're desperate (and hungry!).  Or you can be patient and circle around the block a few more times and spend your $10 on another plate of garlic noodles.  your choice.  ( i'd choose the noodles of course!)

I would definitely come back here for more! Bibs AND white table cloth?  I can dig it.

excerpts: The roast crab, garlic noodles and shrimp pate on sourdough appetizer were off the hook delicious.
It's pricey but worth it.
roast crab.author: Laura K.
roast crab.review: delicious!! The roast crab, garlic noodles and shrimp pate on sourdough appetizer were off the hook delicious. It's pricey but worth it.

excerpts: ROAST CRAB + GARLIC NOODLES
roast crab.author: AngeLin V.
roast crab.review:
ROAST CRAB + GARLIC NOODLES

So simple yet soooo mouth-watering delicious! They're only famously known for this combo! Don't mess with the formula or you'll want to kick yourself in the buttocks for ordering something else.

That's how I felt because I wanted to venture out and try their TEMPURA STYLE COCONUT PRAWNS. It was very "ehh". I've definitely had better. The BANANA CAKE we had for dessert was good though! It was a nice modern twist on a traditional Vietnamese dessert.

We went here last Valentine's Day and was squished in like sardines because the tiny place was packed! You'll feel like you're eating and chatting with the neighboring tables. Making a reservation and arriving early is a must! Eating crab can also get pretty messy so dress for the occasion.

Oh how I miss the taste of garlicy goodness and daydream of the moment we shall meet each other again...

excerpts: This is FAV place 2 get CRAB-Get the Roast Crab, Noodles, & 4 appetizers the Muscles!!
2die4!!
N the fried bannana 4 Desert!!
You will THANK me later!
roast crab.author: Chanel A.
roast crab.review:
This is FAV place 2 get CRAB-Get the Roast Crab, Noodles, & 4 appetizers the Muscles!! 2die4!!  N the fried bannana 4 Desert!! You will THANK me later! lol

Every mothers day or fathers day my parents INSIST I take them back here lol!

excerpts:
Roast crab, garlic noodles, and mixed vegetables - simply amazing. 
The roast crab melts in your mouth and the garlic noodles are seasoned perfectly.

The roast crab melts in your mouth and the garlic noodles are seasoned perfectly.
roast crab.author: Lindsey S.
roast crab.review:
This is the best meal I have ever had in my life.

That's a very serious statement but I stand by my word.  Roast crab, garlic noodles, and mixed vegetables - simply amazing. The roast crab melts in your mouth and the garlic noodles are seasoned perfectly.

Driving up to the place you will think that your GPS made a mistake - it really is in the middle of nowhere. The residential streets around are empty but then you'll see a glow of light emanating from Thanh Long's front door, and inside it will be bustling with people. 

It is pricey though, so my recommendation would be to save it for a special occasion. It will definitely make whatever you are celebrating all the more memorable :)

excerpts: I have never gptten anything other than their roast crab and garlic noodles, and I dont think I ever will.
The crab is cooked perfectly and the garlicly buttery goodness is perfect to dip the crab in.
nom nom nom!
My only issue with Thanh Long is the cocktails...
I have yet to be impressed by the drinks I get here.
roast crab.author: Evan O.
roast crab.review:
Yum Long is more like it!  I have never gptten anything other than their roast crab and garlic noodles, and I dont think I ever will.  The crab is cooked perfectly and the garlicly buttery goodness is perfect to dip the crab in. nom nom nom! My only issue with Thanh Long is the cocktails... I have yet to be impressed by the drinks I get here.  I think on future visits I will stick with water.

Oh yeah... dont bother with the "garlic toast" not worth it. AT ALL.

excerpts: The roast crab tasted very peppery and were cold.
roast crab.author: Rossi K.
roast crab.review: Thanh Long came up Thanh short!  The roast crab tasted very peppery and were cold.  The colossal royal tiger prawns were the same as well.  Both of these dishes were most likely prep in advance for the masses.  Such a disappointment for driving all that way for this.  The Garlic noodles were okay except for the fact they must have put a stick of butter in it.  Overall theme were peppery and cold food.  $85+ dollars for this?  No, thanks!

excerpts: So after becoming incredibly full with the roast crab and garlic noodles and the chocolate cake, I quickly passed out in my car and slept until the next day.
roast crab.author: Bethtina W.
roast crab.review:
A year and a half ago I became allergic to all shell fish. On my birthday this past September I loaded up on Benedryl and with my epipen in hand went and ate at Thanh Long.  So after becoming incredibly full with the roast crab and garlic noodles and the chocolate cake, I quickly passed out in my car and slept until the next day. I have always loved this place and can't give it up...regardless of my allergy. 

It's the best. Everything on the menu is delicious. The wait staff are attentive, courteous, and quick. 

If you want an incredible experience this is the place to try.

excerpts: ROAST CRAB AND GARLIC NOODLES.
These should be the only things you order here.
Normally, I don't have patience to crack crab, but it's worth the labor for Thanh Long and their garlic noodles are sooo good.
It's a little pricey-
~$40 for the crab and $10 for garlic noodles, but so worth it!
I once made a mistake of ordering other dishes- don't do it!
The shaking beef was good
I guess, but everything was not worth the price.
The dessert that I've had (fried banana w/ vanilla ice cream) was just okay
too-
I've had better at cheaper restaurants.

One thing I didn't like was that I had called the night before my reservation to ask about any birthday specials since it was my bf's bday and they told me that they give one free dessert for the birthday person.
I reminded the waiter
it was my bf's bday and they put a candle on the dessert, but I was still charged?
Oh well, it was only $7, but still... principle.
Anyway, overall, a really good dining experience esp for crab lovers.

It's a little pricey- ~$40 for the crab and $10 for garlic noodles, but so worth it! I once made a mistake of ordering other dishes- don't do it! The shaking beef was good I guess, but everything was not worth the price. The dessert that I've had (fried banana w/ vanilla ice cream) was just okay too- I've had better at cheaper restaurants. Anyway, overall, a really good dining experience esp for crab lovers.

excerpts: The roast crab dish... there are no words.
We got the roast crab, the tamarind crab, and garlic noodles, all of which were amazing.
The vegetable of the day was sauteed green beans, also great, and the salt&pepper calamari, which was just okay.
Oh, and lychee vodka!
The only drawback is that the crab was about $42 each...
otherwise I would have gladly eaten another two.
Or four.
Or ten.
roast crab.author: Yaa-Lirng T.
roast crab.review:
So I had a bad day today. I was all worried about what I was doing with my life and sad about a friend moving away, and I had spent three hours cleaning the bathroom after my toilet had overflowed. Then I went to Thanh Long for dinner with a bunch of friends. The roast crab dish... there are no words. It was one of those rare moments in life where you just realize that every decision you've ever made leading up to this very instant has been correct.

No joke - it was so good that I noticed some meat left in one of the knuckles in the shell bowl and ended up literally picking through the trash for more meat. My friend is terrible at eating crab, so I basically had a handsome second dinner composed entirely of her scraps.

We got the roast crab, the tamarind crab, and garlic noodles, all of which were amazing. The vegetable of the day was sauteed green beans, also great, and the salt&pepper calamari, which was just okay. Oh, and lychee vodka! The only drawback is that the crab was about $42 each... otherwise I would have gladly eaten another two. Or four. Or ten. Seriously, the crab is really freaking good.

We went Sunday evening, and I had no problem street parking. I saw some other reviews about bad parking, so I offer this up as a data point.

excerpts: The roast crab is sooooo delicious.
roast crab.author: Yien S.
roast crab.review: Every time I have a craving for crab, I think of this place.  The roast crab is sooooo delicious.  Honestly, I'm not too impressed by their over-priced garlic noodles (for the portion and cost, it's like a 90% mark-up.)  I"ve had it at so many other places and it's just ok but the crab is def. worth the trip and money. The shaken beef is good as well.  The only reason why I didn't give 5 stars is because of the service.  If i'm going to spend over $100 for dinner, I expect better service than what was given to me and my bf.  The service doesn't always suck but on one particular rainy evening, I had reservations but there were plenty of empty tables so it wasn't very busy throughout dinner service.  Each time I needed the server, I had to flag him down, literally waving my hands like an idiot.  Apparently saying "excuse me" wasn't going to work.  Maybe if he wasn't too busy lifting his nose in the air, he would have heard me all four times.  Any ways, can't wait to go back for the crack crab!

excerpts: The best roast crab I've ever tasted.
The crab was juicy, flavorful, and tender.
If I were to return to this place I would order the grilled squid, crisp spring rolls and roast crab.
roast crab.author: Jennifer H.
roast crab.review:
I had my birthday dinner here. The best roast crab I've ever tasted. The crab was juicy, flavorful, and tender. I was not that impressed with the garlic noodles, vegetarian delight, and the colossal shrimp. The grilled squid appetizer was excellent, crispy spring rolls too yum. 

If I were to return to this place I would order the grilled squid, crisp spring rolls and roast crab.

excerpts: We ordered the roast crab and the garlic noodles (what a surprise).
Crab and noodles came out quickly drowned in butter and garlicky awesomeness.
The crab meat was very flavorful and my only regret was not getting a whole crab for myself (my wallet would not allow it).
roast crab.author: Andrew C.
roast crab.review:
I seem to get crabs every time I visit San Francisco...and it seems that I have to pay for it each time..

I heard a couple of my friends rave about this place so I wanted to give it a shot. We ordered the roast crab and the garlic noodles (what a surprise). Crab and noodles came out quickly drowned in butter and garlicky awesomeness. The crab meat was very flavorful and my only regret was not getting a whole crab for myself (my wallet would not allow it). Noodles were a good complement to the crab although they do seem pretty simple to make.

Definitely make reservations as this place gets PACKED. It is also a bit on the pricier side and I have heard of a couple places that are comparable but don't charge as much. I will have to give those a shot next time to see how they hold up to Thanh Long.

Oh and quick note: Bring gum if you decide to go to any social events after, otherwise you will be know as the garlic breathing dragon.

excerpts: Price was pretty steep for the food we ordered - shrimp toast, shaken beef, roast crab, drunken crab, and garlic noodles.
To be honest, all the food didn't stand out for the price we pay - it wasn't bad, but it wasn't that good etiher.
For the wait and price, I should have gone to somewhere else.
roast crab.author: edgard k.
roast crab.review: Went there since few friends raved about how good the garlic noodles. Went around dinner time without reservations and our party had to wait for about 45 minutes before being seated. No private parking lot, so parking can be hectic - but might as well go around looking for parking while dropping 1 of your party to book a spot if you don't have any reservations since you have to wait for a while anyway. Price was pretty steep for the food we ordered - shrimp toast, shaken beef, roast crab, drunken crab, and garlic noodles. To be honest, all the food didn't stand out for the price we pay - it wasn't bad, but it wasn't that good etiher. For the wait and price, I should have gone to somewhere else.

excerpts: I really enjoy the Calarmari and the Garlic Noodles, but although VERY Tasty, I'm beginning to think the Roast Crab is too expensive for what its worth.
Its about $40 per crab.
When we can get it at the store for $5.99/lb., its makes it hard to accept.
roast crab.author: Ping N.
roast crab.review: Been here a few times. I really enjoy the Calarmari and the Garlic Noodles, but although VERY Tasty, I'm beginning to think the Roast Crab is too expensive for what its worth.  Its about $40 per crab. When we can get it at the store for $5.99/lb., its makes it hard to accept.

excerpts: Fried Calamari, Roast Crab, Garlic Noodles, Chocolate Lava Cake.
roast crab.author: Nick C.
roast crab.review:
I hardly update my reviews, but this restaurant deserves it. I feel compelled to give credit to such an amazing restaurant. My first experience left me with a huge smile on my face and a stomach that was on cloud 9. My second experience left me with the same feeling...that's when you know that this place is legitimate. I hope everyone in San Francisco, gets to experience eating at this restaurant. 

Recommendations: Fried Calamari, Roast Crab, Garlic Noodles, Chocolate Lava Cake.

excerpts: The roast crab was delicious, but maybe a bit overpriced at $38.
roast crab.author: Tanya N.
roast crab.review:
We live the neighborhood, walked by many times and decided to try it out on New Year's Eve. When we walked in, we were pleasantly surprised by the atmosphere--very open, warm, and full bar.
The infused vodka martinis were unique and pretty good.
The prawn wanton appetizer was just ok-the pancetta was a bit overpowering. We each ordered an entree--the steamed sea bass was the perfect portion size & prepared well. The roast crab was delicious, but maybe a bit overpriced at $38. We shared the garlic noodles, which definitely had a ton of garlic & maybe a bit too salty. I would have been ok skipping desert, but we tried the fried bananas, which were quite boring.
Service was great...attentive & not rushed...we were also seated quickly.
Overall--worth a try and we would go back.

excerpts: The best roast crab, even though it's so overpriced and the prawns with garlic noodle $36...come on...
only 5 pieces of the prawns..
When we went there Aug 29, 2013 for my son's birthday, we were 6 people, the gratuity was included, but it was also taxed....never heard that a restaurant tax the gratuity also.
of course I saw it when we got home.
But I plan to show it to them next time we go there.
roast crab.author: Meta D.
roast crab.review: The best roast crab, even though it's so overpriced and the prawns with garlic noodle $36...come on...only 5 pieces of the prawns..When we went there Aug 29, 2013 for my son's birthday, we were 6 people, the gratuity was included, but it was also taxed....never heard that a restaurant tax the gratuity also. of course I saw it when we got home. But I plan to show it to them next time we go there.

excerpts: Then we ordered two each of the Roast Crab, Drunken Crab and Tamarind Crab.
roast crab.author: Dannigan P.
roast crab.review:
I had a business dinner meeting with my colleagues and wanted to get the "Real " San Francisco experience since everyone flew in from different parts of the U.S. 

This place was recommended from a good college friend and it was the BEST recommendation ever!

The drive made me nervous since we were coming from the Sir Francis Drake and if the food wasn't excellent I would have heard about  this one for quite some time.

We ordered appetizers and all were excellent. Then we ordered two each of the Roast Crab, Drunken Crab and Tamarind Crab. 

OMG! It was a Hit with everyone and I was a hero for a day ; )

Highly reccomended and enjoy a great dining experience.

excerpts: We had the requisite and excellent garlic noodles and roast crab.
We decided to split a couple of appetizers, rather than getting a second crab or more noodles.
roast crab.author: John R.
roast crab.review:
We came here for my birthday dinner and had a great experience...as have so many others!

We had the requisite and excellent garlic noodles and roast crab.  We decided to split a couple of appetizers, rather than getting a second crab or more noodles.  The seafood dumplings were fine but really forgettable.  Their version of shrimp toast was good, but too pricey for the serving size.  Next time we'll go for the extra crab!

And if you like wine with your dinner, try a riesling --- we had a delicious Alsatian riesling and it went great with the food!

excerpts: Everyone else in my party ordered the roast crab.
The food was so good.
So many interesting flavors in the soup.
I also like that this restaurant is in a neighborhood so you don't have to go through downtown traffic to get there.
If arriving from the south exit at Skyline Blvd toward Pacifica and then go down the Great Hwy (hwy 1) to Judah and 46th.
They have valet parking.
roast crab.author: Cindy O.
roast crab.review: I have wanted to try this restaurant for years. We have gone to its sister restaurant (Crustacean) many times and I had heard that Thanh Long was a more casual restaurant with the same food as Crustacean. Thanh Long is my new favorite restaurant in SF.  I ordered vietnamese salad, vietnamese soup, and garlic noodles. Everyone else in my party ordered the roast crab.The food was so good. So many interesting flavors in the soup.  I also like that this restaurant is in a neighborhood so you don't have to go through downtown traffic to get there. If arriving from the south exit at Skyline Blvd toward Pacifica and then go down the Great Hwy (hwy 1) to Judah and 46th. They have valet parking.

excerpts: This took place a few years ago, so forgive my clouded memory, but I do remember ordering the colossal royal tiger prawns with garlic noodles and roast crab.
I actually remember informing the couple at the table next to us that the weird, green mushy stuff in the shell is actually the best part.
They were about to throw it away!
If I ruled the culinary world, the number one rule would be to NEVER discard of heads and guts of seafood and poultry.
Anyway, the crab was cooked perfectly and moist on the inside.
Somehow, they were able to get the roasted garlic essence to seep all the way through the crab without overcooking it.
Astounding.
The tiger prawns were good as well, but not as memorable as the crab.
The garlic noodles are also inimitable, even by me...for now.
My boyfriend and I have mastered our own version of roasted garlic crab based on our experiences at An-owned restaurants.
We'll actually be making it this weekend!
Nevertheless, true roasted garlic crab lies in the restaurants of An.
roast crab.author: Priscilla V.
roast crab.review: Thanh Long was the setting of another spontaneous adventure in the city for us. It is essentially Crustacean's with a more casual environment. This took place a few years ago, so forgive my clouded memory, but I do remember ordering the colossal royal tiger prawns with garlic noodles and roast crab. I actually remember informing the couple at the table next to us that the weird, green mushy stuff in the shell is actually the best part. They were about to throw it away! If I ruled the culinary world, the number one rule would be to NEVER discard of heads and guts of seafood and poultry. Anyway, the crab was cooked perfectly and moist on the inside. Somehow, they were able to get the roasted garlic essence to seep all the way through the crab without overcooking it. Astounding. The tiger prawns were good as well, but not as memorable as the crab. The garlic noodles are also inimitable, even by me...for now. My boyfriend and I have mastered our own version of roasted garlic crab based on our experiences at An-owned restaurants. We'll actually be making it this weekend! Nevertheless, true roasted garlic crab lies in the restaurants of An.

excerpts: I got the roast crab and garlic noodle just like everyone else, but I was so not blown away.
I've tasted way better, way
fresher crab (even just buying from the market!!)
that is much more affordable AND tastier.
I shared a roast crab with a friend and it cost $40...tres expensive.
roast crab.author: Tiffany D.
roast crab.review:
Did I go to the right place??  I got the roast crab and garlic noodle just like everyone else, but I was so not blown away.  I've tasted way better, way fresher crab (even just buying from the market!!) that is much more affordable AND tastier.  I shared a roast crab with a friend and it cost $40...tres expensive.  plus i didn't taste anything except lots of pepper.

and the garlic noodle?  it was good, but way too salty.  also, what kind of asian restaurant charges $5 for tea?!  guess this place is too classy for me.

excerpts: The roast crab was like crack.
I loved it.
You will definitely drop a pretty penny but it's worth it.
roast crab.author: linda t.
roast crab.review:
OMG the garlic noodles were delicious. The roast crab was like crack. I loved it. You will definitely drop a pretty penny but it's worth it. Honestly, just get the crab & garlic noodles. You'll regret it if you don't because they're so damn good :)

The service is great - super fast turnout for food & amazing date-like ambiance. You will get messy, don't wear white (even though they give you a bib). You will smell like garlic for a few days - it will be wonderful. Make reservations.

excerpts: But there are two reasons to come here, the garlic noodles and the roast crab.
The garlic noodles were nice as well.
roast crab.author: David D.
roast crab.review:
Thanh Long has a menu.  A pretty extensive one.  But there are two reasons to come here, the garlic noodles and the roast crab.  Making a meal of anything else here would be like doing chicken at a steakhouse.  

Yes we did get a few additional things.  An appetizer of salt and pepper calamari was a bit rubbery but nicely spiced and was OK.   The Vietnamese salad was mainly cabbage with some stray shrimp and strange tasting chicken that was best forgotten.  Likewise the Mango salad composed of tasteless mango and some stray shrimp.  The scallops described on the menu as being in the salad were undetectable.  Also best forgotten were mains of stringy steamed sea bass and shaken beef marinated to the point where the beef had lost texture and taste.  

The saving graces here were the roasted whole crab, which had obviously been done in garlic and some pepper.  Not a wondrous dish but fresh crab that was properly prepared.  The garlic noodles were nice as well.  Nothing remarkable about this plate, just noodles with oodles of garlic.   

So come.  Get your fix of crab and noodles.  Avoid the rest of the menu and you will do well for yourself.

excerpts:
Must try (stuff your face):

roast crab

GARLIC NOODLES

huzzah.
roast crab.author: AC M.
roast crab.review:
Must try (stuff your face):

roast crab

GARLIC NOODLES

huzzah.

excerpts: This place has the BEST roast crab I've ever had.
My husband and I discovered this place when he lived in the sunset a couple of years ago
and we absolutely love it.
We always get the roast crab, garlic noodles and seasonal veggies.
We have been known to drive all the way from Sacramento for the evening JUST to eat here.
Probably my favorite restaurant ever!
roast crab.author: Andrea A.
roast crab.review:
This place has the BEST roast crab I've ever had.  My husband and I discovered this place when he lived in the sunset a couple of years ago and we absolutely love it.  
We always get the roast crab, garlic noodles and seasonal veggies.  
We have been known to drive all the way from Sacramento for the evening JUST to eat here.  Probably my favorite restaurant ever!

excerpts: I like salty foods but the roast crab and calamari was so salty/msgggggg.
I do agree with others that the noodle was good.
roast crab.author: Alma M.
roast crab.review: Crab is overrated. It's MSG to the extreme. I like salty foods but the roast crab and calamari was so salty/msgggggg.  I do agree with others that the noodle was good.

excerpts: OK I finally made it here after I had heard so many good things about it...  finally got to try the Roast Crab and their famous Garlic noodles...
Everybody raves about the Garlic noodles, and they were pretty darn good but to tell you the truth, all it is is just a plate of plain noodles, skinny like spaghetti noodles with nothing else!
Maybe if there was chicken or some kind of vegetable with it
I would have found it more appealing
and I'd be raving about it.
I did find that the Roast crab was amazing however!
One of the best crab dishes I have EVER had.
It is however also the messiest crab I have ever eaten.
Even messier than a crab feed.
haha
The entire crab is drenched in garlic butter sauce so your hands and face are guaranteed to be slippery and completely messy with all the goodness.
You have to crack the crab yourself
so be sure to wear the provided bib or else you'll get sauce or pieces of crab all over you.
I ate one and a half crabs which took me a good hour to crack and eat.
And it was totally worth it.
If you love crab and garlic, the Roast crab and Garlic noodles are totally worth it!!
If you love crab and garlic, the Roast crab and Garlic noodles are totally worth it!!
roast crab.author: Dean S.
roast crab.review:
OK I finally made it here after I had heard so many good things about it...  finally got to try the Roast Crab and their famous Garlic noodles...  Everybody raves about the Garlic noodles, and they were pretty darn good but to tell you the truth, all it is is just a plate of plain noodles, skinny like spaghetti noodles with nothing else!  Maybe if there was chicken or some kind of vegetable with it I would have found it more appealing and I'd be raving about it.  
I did find that the Roast crab was amazing however!  One of the best crab dishes I have EVER had.  It is however also the messiest crab I have ever eaten.  Even messier than a crab feed. haha  The entire crab is drenched in garlic butter sauce so your hands and face are guaranteed to be slippery and completely messy with all the goodness.  You have to crack the crab yourself so be sure to wear the provided bib or else you'll get sauce or pieces of crab all over you.  I ate one and a half crabs which took me a good hour to crack and eat.  And it was totally worth it.  We also had the garlic toast, which was ok, it was just small thin pieces of sourdough bread toast with garlic butter. ha! so much garlic and butter in this restaurant your breath will be kickin' it for days!!  We also had the mango salad or something like that and it was ok too.  Parking sucks around this restaurant so just suck it up and pay the valet in front of the restaurant.  If you love crab and garlic, the Roast crab and Garlic noodles are totally worth it!!

excerpts: The Roast Crab is absolutely delectable.
roast crab.author: Vince H.
roast crab.review:
I came here for the first time because I had a friend in town who wanted some seafood. Instead of taking him to Fisherman's wharf, we decided to do something different. We are so glad we came here. There's nothing like the bone breaking sound of crab while wearing a plastic bib. 

Furthermore, the service is impeccable. I shall return!

Things to get:

The Roast Crab is absolutely delectable. I'm not sure what the "secret spices" are, but mixed with the garlic, I was tempted to eat everything down to the shell.

Garlic Noodles. There is a reason why everybody talks about it. 

Shaken Beef. Yummy.

Soft Shell Crab. Yes, we couldn't get enough crab

Tip: We had a good ole time ordering drinks. Let me tell you, they are VERY heavy handed with their vodka.

excerpts: The main event here is the Roast Crab, the best thing on the menu and the best crab in San Francisco.
Dripping with butter and seasoned to perfection, it is absolutely magical.
roast crab.author: Steve B.
roast crab.review:
This is my desert island restaurant -- my muse -- my favorite place to get one of life's best foods.  Keep your cioppino, your sourdough bread, and your Irish coffee.  In San Francisco, where dungeness crab is the ultimate local delicacy, the An Family restaurants Crustacean and Thanh Long are the best places in town.

I have taken customers and colleagues, girlfriends and drinking buddies -- they all love Thanh Long.  This is my Cheers, and I am Norm -- because hostesses Jennifer and Lhanh always know my name when I call.

The main event here is the Roast Crab, the best thing on the menu and the best crab in San Francisco.  Dripping with butter and seasoned to perfection, it is absolutely magical.  Order it with the garlic noodles.  My favorite appetizer is the mussels -- be sure to drip any remaining sauce onto the crisp rounds of bread.  The crab puffs are always a hit as well.  Order the Navarro Gewurztraminer -- it's light and crisp with a touch of sweetness and is absolutely perfect with the rich, buttery crab.

This is not a first date restaurant or a restaurant for high maintenance customers.  After all, you're going to wear a plastic bib, get messy, and want to lick your fingers.  (Hmm... maybe it is a good place for a first date.)  But for the true crab lover, or for anyone who just wants the ultimate in San Francisco food, this is the place.

Crustacean and Thanh Long have almost exactly the same menu.  Crustacean is more centrally located and a little more hip (or cheesy, depending on your perspective).  Thanh Long has more neighborhood charm and is my favorite, but I live in that part of town so I'm biased.  Either way, the food is the same and you can't go wrong.

excerpts: Yeah, this place is pricy, and I've heard the crab is frozen, but the roast crab and garlic noodles is such an utterly blissrful marriage made in heaven that that's all that really matters to me when the cravings hit.
roast crab.author: Sharman G.
roast crab.review: Yeah, this place is pricy, and I've heard the crab is frozen, but the roast crab and garlic noodles is such an utterly blissrful marriage made in heaven that that's all that really matters to me when the cravings hit.

excerpts: It's a serious epidemic, considering how frickin' delicious the roast crab at Thanh Long is.
Look, this guy still has his plastic bib in his back pocket, he must have been a serious addict.
Nurse:
I remember the good old days when all we had to deal with was heroin ODs.

"

Doctor:  "It's a serious epidemic, considering how frickin' delicious the roast crab at Thanh Long is.  Look, this guy still has his plastic bib in his back pocket, he must have been a serious addict."

excerpts: The roast crab, shaken beef, and garlic noodles have a ton of flavor.
If you usually eat white rice every meal and you think that the garlic noodles can serve as the main carb dish, you're wrong.
Don't think twice.
roast crab.author: Evs K.
roast crab.review:
The roast crab, shaken beef, and garlic noodles have a ton of flavor. If you usually eat white rice every meal and you think that the garlic noodles can serve as the main carb dish, you're wrong. Don't think twice. Order the white rice even though it's outrageously expensive.

Dishes are on the saltier side. Every time I eat here, I come out dying of thirst. Other than that, the food is good.

excerpts: Thanh long's specialty is their garlic roast crab, which is simply seasoned but DELICIOUS giving you a perfectly indulgent savory experience.
The crab is always fresh and you have everything you need to get down to business: crab crackers, a miniature fork, bib and hot towel to clean up your filth when you're done.
roast crab.author: Jessica S.
roast crab.review:
I'm going to steal Dennis L.'s line because I completely agree: "If i were a crab, i would be honored to be cooked at thanh long." So true. Thanh long is a delicious treat and every time I go (to both Thanh long and it's sister restaurant Crustacean on Polk), I look forward to meeting and devouring my delicious little crab. 

Thanh long is one of my favorite restaurants in the city. I prefer it to Crustacean because it's less formal, which lends itself to a more cozy atmosphere. Since it's a popular spot and a smaller space, you'll need reservations before you go but it's well worth it. Thanh long's specialty is their garlic roast crab, which is simply seasoned but DELICIOUS giving you a perfectly indulgent savory experience. The crab is always fresh and you have everything you need to get down to business: crab crackers, a miniature fork, bib and hot towel to clean up your filth when you're done. While the crab is the star of the show, the garlic noodles are definitely a scene stealer. Appetizers and dessert are also great. I'm a fan of the buddha rolls and deep fried banana with ice cream. I'd definitely recommend going with a group so you can enjoy a larger variety of what Thanh long has to offer!

excerpts: The Roast Crab and Garlic Noodles is the way to go.
Hands down, the best.
Even better than at Crustacean... maybe it is the more "authentic" atmosphere.
Appetizers are ok, but nothing to write home about and really not needed if everyone has their own crab - more than enough food.
roast crab.author: Jason C.
roast crab.review:
If I could live on garlic noodles and crab, I would be a happy man! 

We've been coming to Thanh Long for over 10 years. It is really the reason we come back to SF. The location is great in that it is out of the "city" and a nice Muni ride on the N train. 

Ambiance - very warm and inviting. Nice lighting. It is best to have a booth for the coziness, but a table up front by the windows is perfect as well.

Drinks - full bar. Great Long Islands and decent prices on cocktails, which is nice considering some of the food prices. Wine corkage - $15/bottle.

Food - OH YUM! We've learned how to pare back and just stick to the basics. The Roast Crab and Garlic Noodles is the way to go. Hands down, the best. Even better than at Crustacean... maybe it is the more "authentic" atmosphere. Appetizers are ok, but nothing to write home about and really not needed if everyone has their own crab - more than enough food. One order of garlic noodles per 2 people is sufficient. The Vietnamese salad is great though, and the dressing is nice and light.

Thanh Long is a unique experience. Others may think it is overpriced, but the flavors are just magnificent. There are other places that serve garlic crab, but I'm hesitant to try it since this is my little special place. I'd hate to ruin that... Make a reservation!! If you have last minute plans, it may be hard to get a table, but for us out-of-towners, we call a couple weeks in advance to guarantee our spot. Sure beats waiting 1 hour+ for a table.

excerpts:
Secret Roast Crab Recipe:

1 Big Pot
roast crab.author: Bill P.
roast crab.review:
Secret Roast Crab Recipe:

1 Big Pot
1 Whole Dungeness Crab
50 Sticks of Butter
10 Cloves of Garlic
Salt (lots)

Directions:

Put water in pot and bring to boil.  Add a handful of salt in said pot.  Insert 1 whole Dungeness Crab in pot until done.  Remove crab and put to side.  Toss the water and return pot to stove.

Crush garlic and put in pot.  Put 50 sticks of butter in pot.  Add handful of salt.  Bring butter to near boil.  

Stick Dungeness Crab in pot of melted butter and drown the entire crab.  Let sit for 2 minutes until entire crab is saturated with butter.  Remove crab.  

Put crab on plate and put butter over top of crab.  Put butter in ramekins to serve with crab.  Serve crab.  See if patron wants more butter.  

Sell crab at $40.  

Watch money roll in.  

Repeat.  

(Buy more butter)

excerpts: Their Roast Crab is to die for.
Its just garlic, salt, pepper and butter.
I used to visit the Crustaceans in Bev Hill when I lived in LA all the time (all owned by the An Family) and Thanh Long is even better.
We started with the Coconut Prawns.
Very fresh and the sauce was delicious.
My fiancee and I split a Roast Crab with a side of garlic noodles.
The crab is huge.
My man is a big eater and even he was satisfied.
The noodles are incredible.
A perfect balance of garlic, butter, just plain and simple.
Its a little pricey but its high quality food.
I have had crab in many places in this city and its usually overcooked and stuck inside the shell.
Thanh Long and their spices are cooked just right.
Maybe one day I will stray from the usual and try the other crab choices but for now I'm set.
Call for a reservation, this place fills up very quickly.
roast crab.author: Bri R.
roast crab.review: Best place in the city for crab, hands down!! Their Roast Crab is to die for. Its just garlic, salt, pepper and butter. I used to visit the Crustaceans in Bev Hill when I lived in LA all the time (all owned by the An Family) and Thanh Long is even better. We started with the Coconut Prawns. Very fresh and the sauce was delicious. My fiancee and I split a Roast Crab with a side of garlic noodles. The crab is huge. My man is a big eater and even he was satisfied. The noodles are incredible. A perfect balance of garlic, butter, just plain and simple. Its a little pricey but its high quality food. I have had crab in many places in this city and its usually overcooked and stuck inside the shell. Thanh Long and their spices are cooked just right. Maybe one day I will stray from the usual and try the other crab choices but for now I'm set. Call for a reservation, this place fills up very quickly.

excerpts: Next, we chose the Roast Crab and Garlic Noodles from the "Secret Kitchen Dishes", which for anyone who's ever visited Thanh Long, can clearly see that almost every table has ordered.
Haha!
"Secret"...
yeah.
Everyone knows these are the two destination items of this restaurant!
roast crab.author: Dave W.
roast crab.review:
It's been a few years since my last visit to Thanh Long.  But the food and service of last night's visit were as good as ever!

A fantastic meal starting with a couple of  tasty Passion Teas (carefully, these sneak up on you!), the super fresh Salmon Carpaccio, and a unique-tasting dish of Thanh Long Mussels.   The toasted French baguette crostini for the latter two dishes was a perfect textural pairing.

Next, we chose the Roast Crab and Garlic Noodles from the "Secret Kitchen Dishes", which for anyone who's ever visited Thanh Long, can clearly see that almost every table has ordered.  Haha!  "Secret"...  yeah.  Everyone knows these are the two destination items of this restaurant!  These two complimenting dishes bring me back again and again. 

Attentive service, mouth-watering dishes prepared consistently to perfection.  All in all, another great dining experience!

excerpts: All night servers came out literally by the second, with the roast crab.
roast crab.author: Dorothy F.
roast crab.review:
Long been a fan of their sister restaurant Crustaceans so I was eager to see what the differences were, if any, between the two places.  

Turns out there's quite a few.  

Thanh long is vey, very crowded and the waiting area is cramped to say the least.  It's also very loud and chaotic.  Feels more like a neighborhood eating joint with the cramped tables and noisy atmosphere.  

The service was kinda lacking.  I think the amount of patrons coming in and out ( and yes you do feel rushed) makes it hard for the servers to give you the same level of attentiveness you'd get at Crustanceans.  

As for the crab, somewhat disappointing.  It was still good but right off the bat I noticed mine was room temperature.  Unlike Crustaceans at Thanh Long the crab comes out of the kitchen in record time.   All night servers came out literally by the second, with the roast crab.  With as fast as they were bringing it out, it's easy to assume they were cooked before you ordered it. 

The garlic noodles were great though, not overly greasy and great garlic flavor and portion.  I also liked their shrimp toast, as an appetizer but the calamari was forgettable.  

The main disappointment was in their dessert selection.  I was undecided and the waitress suggested I try the fried banana, which of course every other Asian restaurant offers.  At Thanh Long was probably the worst (and I've never had a fried banana I didn't like).  The banana- to-dough ratio was waaayyy off.  Too much dough.  I ate more of the ice cream because I could barely eat two bites of the fried banana.  

Now that I've tried it there, I won't be going back.  Not a horrible experience but dims in comparison to Crustaceans.

excerpts: Everyone suggested the roast crab and garlic noodles, but I was feeling too lazy to work for my food
so I ordered the tiger prawns.
My food was great...the prawns were seasoned well and the garlic noodles did not disappoint.
A few of my friends got the roast crab and I got a piece and...
HELLO!
I am definitely getting that next time I visit here.
I think I could eat garlic noodles every day of my life.
roast crab.author: Ruben P.
roast crab.review:
I went here for a friend's birthday and loved it.  Everyone suggested the roast crab and garlic noodles, but I was feeling too lazy to work for my food so I ordered the tiger prawns.  My food was great...the prawns were seasoned well and the garlic noodles did not disappoint.

A few of my friends got the roast crab and I got a piece and...HELLO!  I am definitely getting that next time I visit here.  Also, the beef items on the menu were very good according to other friends.

I plan on visiting here again very soon.  I think I could eat garlic noodles every day of my life.

excerpts: I downgraded my review by 1 star because although I would still go back and still enjoy the Roast Crab and Garlic Noodles, it is not the same as when I wrote my first review in 2007.
roast crab.author: MJ A.
roast crab.review:
It's been 3 years since my first Yelp review and a lot has happened in 3 years.

For one, since San Francisco's ban on trans fats, the Roasted Crab at Thanh Long does not coagulate any more.  Hmmm, coincidence?  Nonetheless, it's all good.

Secondly, the Garlic Noodles is not as garlicky anymore and the portion has become a lot smaller.  It's $9.50 an order for crissakes... the least they can do is give you a more generous portion.  Aside from the butter and spices, it's only noodles so why skimp?

I downgraded my review by 1 star because although I would still go back and still enjoy the Roast Crab and Garlic Noodles, it is not the same as when I wrote my first review in 2007.

excerpts: The raves about the roasted crab and the garlic noodles are redundant, like you can go wrong with roast crab awash in butter or garlic anything.
roast crab.author: Ed H.
roast crab.review:
The raves about the roasted crab and the garlic noodles are redundant, like you can go wrong with roast crab awash in butter or garlic anything.

And I'd totally take a first date here, if I can't score a second date after rockin' the plastic bib, well, it was never meant to be.

Last time I was there, I ordered the mussels with an "Asian" pesto.  It was served with toasted slices of baguette.  The flavors, textures, aromas, even appearance just came together, for that eye-widening, grin inducing experience.

Try it, if you don't like it, save it for me. :p

excerpts: Naturally, we had the roast crab & garlic noodles.
They were cooked well, and stood up to what all the other reviews suggest.
We also had the salt/pepper calamari for an app, and it was really tasty.
roast crab.author: Heather M.
roast crab.review:
It's such a bustling urban scene, with people spilling out onto the corner and hour long waits on Saturday night -- and it's in the outer Sunset?! What?!

This place is a lot of fun and the food, bartenders, and wait staff are top notch.

Naturally, we had the roast crab & garlic noodles. They were cooked well, and stood up to what all the other reviews suggest. We also had the salt/pepper calamari for an app, and it was really tasty. The batter is light, and I like that a lot.

Anytime I need a vibrant, tipsy, eat-with-my-hands kind of night, this is the place.

excerpts: the roast crab was bland.
i couldn't detect "an's special sauce" or the fresh crab taste (i think it's a frozen crab) and resorted to dipping the crab meat in the oil-butter mixture.
my friend went to crustacean a few days ago and told me that they tried both and the tamarind was a lot better.
roast crab.author: Diana B.
roast crab.review:
i grew up on fresh crab either cooked in chinese/vietnamese restaurants or cooked at home by my dad. i was very excited to try thanh long and couldn't decide between the roast or tamarind crab so i went with the server's suggestion that roast is better. the roast crab was bland. i couldn't detect "an's special sauce" or the fresh crab taste (i think it's a frozen crab) and resorted to dipping the crab meat in the oil-butter mixture. my friend went to crustacean a few days ago and told me that they tried both and the tamarind was a lot better. she also told me that my $35 thanh long crab cost her $50 at crustacean.

i did enjoy the sea bass (the only not heavy tasting dish we ordered but it was small), mussels with asian pesto (although i was expecting a bowl of mussels rather than five) and the garlic rice. the garlic noodles and shaken beef were overcooked.

excerpts: The only thing that was good was the Roast Crab.
roast crab.author: Christopher C.
roast crab.review:
I've been here before many moons ago.  But, I think this place has lost it's magic.  It's allure...it's draw.  The only thing that was good was the Roast Crab.  The garlic noodles were well, uh..boring.  I know that they're all the rage (or used to be) but they were just boring.

After cleaning up then looking at the coagulated butter on the crab plate, made me think, "holy $hit..that's what's gonna happen to my arteries".

Go here only for crab and that's that.  Way too much money for what you get.  But, do it every decade or so.

excerpts: Roast Crab & Garlic Noodles, what else?
Just make sure you eat it quick before the butter coagulates.
roast crab.author: Arlene C.
roast crab.review:
Remodeled many years ago, they can fit more folks in, so they can afford to take credit cards and pay the banks their percentages now (yeah, like they couldn't before)...don't miss the days when the bf would have to pack. They were 'hit' a couple days after we came one time. With the cost at about $60/person even back then, those robbers made out. 
Roast Crab & Garlic Noodles, what else? Just make sure you eat it quick before the butter coagulates.

excerpts:
, CUA RANG MUOI (minus all the frickin' butter) aka "Secret" Roast Crab or NUI TOI, aka "Secret Garlic Noodles"

Clever gimmick...clever marketing...but seems shady.
roast crab.author: Minty O.
roast crab.review:
GOOD capitalization off the "secret family recipes"... the food is good, delicious... expensive though... and Viet food shouldn't be...

but it's as "secret" as anyone's grandama's secret recipe for oatmeal cookies or your "secret" ingredient to your own spaghetti sauce...

I loved the food and highly recommend it if you live near by, but i made the trek from south san jose (had friends that highly recommended it) and enjoyed the food and company, but with gas being $4.00+ a gallon, I'd rather make my own, CUA RANG MUOI (minus all the frickin' butter) aka "Secret" Roast Crab or NUI TOI, aka "Secret Garlic Noodles"

Clever gimmick...clever marketing...but seems shady.

Other delicious dishes we tried were the Sea Bass with a pineapple-ginger dipping sauce. Could have done without the fake grill marks; and Salt and pepper calamari....the actual salted and peppered parts were tasty. Unevenly salted and peppered, obviously.

Again, I recommend it if you live nearby...would i go back? Probably not. 

I guess I'm quite particular when it comes to Viet food...because I do a lot of the cooking of it myself...haha sorry if i sound snotty.

excerpts: Roast crab is large (enough for 2 servings) and so's the garlic noodles (2 servings).
Both were HIGH-GLOSS with tons of butter and bold flavor.
The noodles were a little overcooked, starchy, and a tad on the sweet side.
BUT, it was strangely satisfying.
roast crab.author: Bibi B.
roast crab.review:
Roast crab is large (enough for 2 servings) and so's the garlic noodles (2 servings). Both were HIGH-GLOSS with tons of butter and bold flavor. The noodles were a little overcooked, starchy, and a tad on the sweet side. BUT, it was strangely satisfying. I can't really justify spending 10 bucks on a plate of noodles, but after all it's part of the TL custom.

We were so hungry when we got there we quickly ordered a plate of calamari. The waiter disappeared into the kitchen and came right back out, which means it's been made and waiting for orders. Sure enough, the temp was warm but not hot as I like it, freshly fried, so I won't be ordering it again.

Another disappointment is the Viet. Iced Coffee. It came pre-made and pre-mixed. A corner that I wished they didn't cut. I like the old school drip-drip-drip on the white layer of condensed milk with a separate glass of crushed ice. I know they're trying to be efficient, but some things just lose their charm when sped up.

The place is jumping and they're turning tables out like mad. The service is fast and friendly, but I just couldn't give it a 4-star. I remember enjoying myself a lot more when I had my first crab there years ago when it wasn't running like a machine.

excerpts: Following your strict yelp directions, I had only the roast crab and garlic noodles.
The noodles have heroin in them.
I know this, because I couldn't stop eating them, and seriously considered ordering extra to take home - for breakfast, for lunch, for a midnight snack, no matter, just to have more.
I sat through the meal next to my husband, simply repeating '
oh my god,
oh my god,
If my children complain, I will sell them for garlic noodles.
roast crab.author: Christina R.
roast crab.review:
Oh, yelpers, you've done it again.  Since I ate at Thanh Long for the first time on Tuesday this week, I find myself questioning the meaningless existance I led before - husband, children, work, world travel - all such a waste, when I had walked the earth, and not eaten at Thanh Long.

I had read the reviews on yelp, and could see the enthusiasm and delight in the food, but it gives no indication of the delights that await you here.  Following your strict yelp directions, I had only the roast crab and garlic noodles. The noodles have heroin in them. I know this, because I couldn't stop eating them, and seriously considered ordering extra to take home - for breakfast, for lunch, for a midnight snack, no matter, just to have more.  I sat through the meal next to my husband, simply repeating 'oh my god, oh my god, oh my god' throughout the meal as I delved deeper and deeper into crab and noodles.  

I'm trying to drag myself out of the reverie it induced to tell you factual things: The crab was $35, the noodles $10, the cocktails were good, the wine was good, it wasn't cheap; it was absolutely worth it.  I will go again. If my children complain, I will sell them for garlic noodles.

excerpts: I suggest the drunken crab over the roast crab because I think the meat has more flavor.
roast crab.author: Christy I.
roast crab.review:
4.5 stars.  

I ordered the drunken crab and ate the whole thing!  There was a long wait for a table but I understand because it took me about 2 hours to finish my crab.  I suggest the drunken crab over the roast crab because I think the meat has more flavor.  I shared a plate of garlic noodles because they give generous portions.  Very delicious.  I did eat one whole crab by myself but it might be OK to share with another person as they are big portions and pricey.

Eating crab is messy.  That's why I was very happy that their service was excellent, especially with clearing the table of crab shells and providing wet towels and bibs.  The host/hostess and waiters were all very friendly and helpful.

It's better to make reservations, especially on weekends, because I had to wait about 40 minutes for a table.

excerpts: Since this was our first time here, we took the bartender's advice and ordered the Salt & Pepper Calamari $10.95, Garlic Noodles $9.95, Roast Crab $35.95, and Banana Pudding cake with hazlenut gelato $7.95.
The crab was fresh and very well seasoned.
The garlic noodles were super yummy.
roast crab.author: Tom Y.
roast crab.review:
This is one of the best seafood restaurants I have dined in.  The food is comparable, if not a teeny bit better than the crab in Redondo Beach.

Since this was our first time here, we took the bartender's advice and ordered the Salt & Pepper Calamari $10.95, Garlic Noodles $9.95, Roast Crab $35.95, and Banana Pudding cake with hazlenut gelato $7.95.  The crab was fresh and very well seasoned.  The garlic noodles were super yummy.  Although I think the crab is just a bit pricey, I am extremely satisfied.

4 stars.  I'll have to tell my other friends about this place.  

**I can make these noodles easy.  Just take some egg noodles, throw in LOTS of garlic, some oil, and charge my friends 10 bucks.

[edit]
After some consideration, I have decided to downgrade the rating to 4 stars.

excerpts: You have not lived until you have tried the Roast Crab and garlic noodles.
roast crab.author: Gabriel B.
roast crab.review:
You have not lived until you have tried the Roast Crab and garlic noodles. Even if you skip everything else, in fact I suggest you do to make more room. 

If you had a last meal, make this the one.

excerpts: As per other yelpers' reviews, my group of 5 tried the garlic noodles, the roast crab in secret sauce, the shaken beef, and Thanh Long fish.
We were all big fans of the garlic noodles and roast crab, of course, and my friends really enjoyed the shaken beef too.
We were all big fans of the garlic noodles and roast crab, of course, and my friends really enjoyed the shaken beef too.
We were all big fans of the garlic noodles and roast crab, of course, and my friends really enjoyed the shaken beef too.
The fish was bland by comparison to the rest, but was still decent and a great deal since we got more garlic noodles alongside the order.
One of my girlfriends was overwhelmed with the amount of butter in the noodles and crab, and had to lay off after a while... which meant more for us!
Yum
roast crab.author: Tina J.
roast crab.review:
As per other yelpers' reviews, my group of 5 tried the garlic noodles, the roast crab in secret sauce, the shaken beef, and Thanh Long fish. 

All dishes were amazing.  We were all big fans of the garlic noodles and roast crab, of course, and my friends really enjoyed the shaken beef too. The fish was bland by comparison to the rest, but was still decent and a great deal since we got more garlic noodles alongside the order.  One of my girlfriends was overwhelmed with the amount of butter in the noodles and crab, and had to lay off after a while... which meant more for us!  Yum :D

I'd love to come back for another special occasion. It was a fairly loud atmosphere but also a nice, refined setting for older family members to join if need be. Finding street parking was a pain (3 blocks away) for 5 separate cars, but still worth the drive to the City and the $120 tab.

excerpts: We had the roast crab (of course!), colossal royal tiger prawns over garlic noodles, shaken beef (YUM!), grilled calamari, and the seafood combination fried rice.
I was looking forward to having leftovers of this feast, but we cleaned our plates.
Haha.
roast crab.author: Jenn C.
roast crab.review:
LOVE this place! It's not cheap, but it's so worth it to splurge once in a while.

We had the roast crab (of course!), colossal royal tiger prawns over garlic noodles, shaken beef (YUM!), grilled calamari, and the seafood combination fried rice. I was looking forward to having leftovers of this feast, but we cleaned our plates. Haha. Oh my god that was the best dinner I've had in a while.

We made reservations for a Saturday night. I'd suggest doing that since it gets pretty packed here.

excerpts: We ordered the Buddha Roll (vegetarian spring roll), Garlic Toast, Roast Crab, Garlic Noodles, and the Thanh Long Spicy Eggplant.
The Buddha Roll had good flavors but one order of it is just one roll cut into 4 pieces and for $7.50 is so not worth it!
The Garlic Toast was also a rip off.
It was just half a baguette like the ones you get at Lucky's/Safeway, smothered with butter with hardly any garlic.
You could easily make your own garlic bread at home that tastes a whole lot better for half the price.
Their famous Roast Crab was alright.
The crab was a decent size with a good amount of meat, but they could have gone a bit lighter on the seasoning.
I don't know if we got a bad batch but the crab was a bit too salty.
It definitely tasted better when paired with simple plain white rice.
The Garlic Noodles were quite tasty and scrumptious, but the portion was small.
The best dish by far was the Thanh Long Spicy Eggplant.
The eggplant was cooked to perfection...
the outside with just the right amount of crunch, with a soft inside.
It went really with the prawns, chicken, and mushrooms that were mixed in with it.
roast crab.author: Karen C.
roast crab.review:
Came here with family to celebrate my husband's birthday. When we walked by the restaurant it did look pretty run down and ghetto at first glance but whatever was cookin' smelled absolutely delicious =)

Upon entering, I felt like I had been transported into another place. I guess it's true when they say "don't judge a book by it's cover." The inside was clean, beautifully decorated, filled with lots of people, and had great ambiance. Their service was amazing...exceeded all expectations. We had about 4 different servers which made everything flow very nicely. Our orders were taken promptly and properly, plates cleared instantly, and our water glasses were always filled without us having to ask. They were all really nice and polite.

We ordered the Buddha Roll (vegetarian spring roll), Garlic Toast, Roast Crab, Garlic Noodles, and the Thanh Long Spicy Eggplant. The Buddha Roll had good flavors but one order of it is just one roll cut into 4 pieces and for $7.50 is so not worth it! The Garlic Toast was also a rip off. It was just half a baguette like the ones you get at Lucky's/Safeway, smothered with butter with hardly any garlic. You could easily make your own garlic bread at home that tastes a whole lot better for half the price. Their famous Roast Crab was alright. The crab was a decent size with a good amount of meat, but they could have gone a bit lighter on the seasoning. I don't know if we got a bad batch but the crab was a bit too salty. It definitely tasted better when paired with simple plain white rice. The Garlic Noodles were quite tasty and scrumptious, but the portion was small. The best dish by far was the Thanh Long Spicy Eggplant. The eggplant was cooked to perfection...the outside with just the right amount of crunch, with a soft inside. It went really with the prawns, chicken, and mushrooms that were mixed in with it. The portion was small too and it definitely left me with wanting more!

Overall this place is just okay. The decor and service was awesome but the food was just okay in terms of taste, portions, and price. Very overpriced for the amount you get. It was about $40/person for us but I felt like I ate $20 worth of food. I would agree with some of the other reviewers that Boiling Crab is better for the price and value.

excerpts: Most definitely, I will concur with the majority here:  the roast crab with garlic noodles is a must when you go to Thanh
Long
...if you don't know how or are too burnt out in the kitchen to cook crab yourself (simple recipe, really).
roast crab.author: Ric S.
roast crab.review:
Most definitely, I will concur with the majority here:  the roast crab with garlic noodles is a must when you go to Thanh Long  ...if you don't know how or are too burnt out in the kitchen to cook crab yourself (simple recipe, really).  The service is excellent, there's a full bar, and our fried bananas with the Tahitian vanilla ice cream was the perfect climax (nice with a cup of coffee and a snifter of Sambucca). 

All in all, a nice getaway.

excerpts: Highly recommend the roast crab and garlic noodles.!!!
roast crab.author: Eddie S.
roast crab.review: Went for a special birthday and it was soooo good! Highly recommend the roast crab and garlic noodles.!!!

excerpts: Went here for my boyfriend's Birthday mainly because I had been looking for a good excuse to try out the original Vietnamese roast crab and garlic noodles.
I love the version at PPQ Dungeness Island
so I figured I would love Thanh Long.
I asked our waitress if we could have an order of the garlic noodles without cheese.
She tersely replied that all the noodles were pre-made and could not be adjusted.
I am confused - are the noodles made in a factory in Iowa and then shipped to Thanh Long to be re-heated?
Is it possible that Thanh Long makes a bath tub full of cheesy garlic noodles at 4:30 in the afternoon for their entire dinner service?
Surely at some point in the evening the chef's must make a new batch of noodles.
Well turns out eating roast crab without garlic noodles really is not the same experience.
Given the high prices we were paying and the fact that we were celebrating a Birthday
I was shocked that this simple request could not be met.
Turns out I was not missing much all those times I ate at PPQ instead of going to Thanh Long.
Well turns out eating roast crab without garlic noodles really is not the same experience.
Given the high prices we were paying and the fact that we were celebrating a Birthday
I was shocked that this simple request could not be met.
