Turns out I was not missing much all those times I ate at PPQ instead of going to Thanh Long.
roast crab.author: Dana H.
roast crab.review:
Went here for my boyfriend's Birthday mainly because I had been looking for a good excuse to try out the original Vietnamese roast crab and garlic noodles.  I love the version at PPQ Dungeness Island so I figured I would love Thanh Long.  Boy was I wrong.  

The crab itself was actually quite tasty but when I went to try the noodles I noticed what looked like cheese on top.  I was fairly surprised to see such a thing since we were in a Vietnamese restaurant, so I asked the waitress to be sure.  Our waitress confirmed my suspicions.  Since I really don't like cheese I asked our waitress if we could have an order of the garlic noodles without cheese.  She tersely replied that all the noodles were pre-made and could not be adjusted.  I am confused - are the noodles made in a factory in Iowa and then shipped to Thanh Long to be re-heated?  Is it possible that Thanh Long makes a bath tub full of cheesy garlic noodles at 4:30 in the afternoon for their entire dinner service?  Surely at some point in the evening the chef's must make a new batch of noodles.  Evidently not because our waitress made it very clear that there was no way possible to have an order of noodles without cheese.  

Well turns out eating roast crab without garlic noodles really is not the same experience.  Given the high prices we were paying and the fact that we were celebrating a Birthday I was shocked that this simple request could not be met.  Turns out I was not missing much all those times I ate at PPQ instead of going to Thanh Long.

excerpts: You can try other dishes, but you MUST include the Roast Crab and Garlic noodles.
roast crab.author: Young P.
roast crab.review:
Thanh Long is good place to eat. I love Seafood and stuffing my face, so this place feels like home.

You can try other dishes, but you MUST include the Roast Crab and Garlic noodles. I tried a couple of appetizers, but only remembered the crab and noodles. 

I decided to subtract a star because Thanh Long is a bit pricey $$$. Plus, I wish the bibs were more colorful (you can look my profile picture to compare... thats what a real bib looks like!)

excerpts: Now, when I go with a group, we tend to order the Garlic Roast Crab, Garlic Noodles, Fried Rice, Daily Vegetable, and maybe some calamari or something little to start.
We may feel sick when we leave, but it's like a hangover after a great night of partying....
TOTALLY worth it.
roast crab.author: Amanda C.
roast crab.review:
This is a place you should just avoid and erase from your memory if you are on a diet because there is no avoiding the roasted crab and garlic noodles once you're in the door! Buttery Peppery Garlic? check. Freshest Crab possible? check. Best Garlic Noodles on planet earth? check! Oh how I love this place!

I too have been to Crustacean in Beverly Hills and this is just way better. It is the most authentic, unpretentious, "strap on a crab bib and get to it" kind of place. It just felt wrong to wear a bib and indulge in garlic noodles right down the street from Rodeo Dr. 

When I was a young'un and didn't like crab (we all grow up some time), I would get the chicken curry here and that is also delicious. Now, when I go with a group, we tend to order the Garlic Roast Crab, Garlic Noodles, Fried Rice, Daily Vegetable, and maybe some calamari or something little to start. We may feel sick when we leave, but it's like a hangover after a great night of partying.... TOTALLY worth it.

excerpts: Their world famous roast crab definitely lives up to the hype and it goes really well with the garlic noodles
but you have to be able to get a little messy because you have to crack open the crabs yourself.
The yummy buttery goodness of the roasted crab is absolutely bad for your cholesterol, but at least your stomach would be super happy =]!
However, it's a bit pricey.
One crab would costs about 40 bucks depending on the season, so I would recommend that you share with someone
so it doesn't make such a  big hole in your wallet.
roast crab.author: Kristin C.
roast crab.review:
I absolutely love the food here.  Their world famous roast crab definitely lives up to the hype and it goes really well with the garlic noodles but you have to be able to get a little messy because you have to crack open the crabs yourself.  The yummy buttery goodness of the roasted crab is absolutely bad for your cholesterol, but at least your stomach would be super happy =]!  However, it's a bit pricey.  One crab would costs about 40 bucks depending on the season, so I would recommend that you share with someone so it doesn't make such a  big hole in your wallet.  But then again, the food is so good that you really wouldn't want to share with anyone.  

The customer service here was really good.  The waiters were really friendly but not to the point that you're annoyed of them.  The wait for the food was pretty decent, about 30-40 minutes.  Also before the meal they put on a bib for us and after they gave us nice and warm towels to clean up our hands and faces from eating the crabs like the savages we were.  

The restaurant is fairly small and it gets pretty busy here sometimes so it's best to make a reservation before you come.  And parking anywhere in San Francisco sucks, but there's valet parking right next to the restaurant and it's pretty cheap, around 5 bucks or so.  However, my car reeked of the smell of cigarettes when it was returned, so that was unfortunate, but that isn't the restaurant's fault.  Other than that, highly recommended if you are willing to pay the price.

excerpts: The roast crab was delectable.
The other selections of dishes should please just about anyone.
(Yes, there are dishes with peanuts/nuts in them
so be sure to ask before ordering if you're allergic.)
roast crab.author: Amy L.
roast crab.review:
Definitely one of the best Vietnamese restaurants I've been to. The roast crab was delectable.  The other selections of dishes should please just about anyone.  (Yes, there are dishes with peanuts/nuts in them so be sure to ask before ordering if you're allergic.)  Save some room for dessert too!

p.s. their garlic noodles deliver a really snappy punch so be prepared!

Times visited: 1

excerpts: Delicious roast crab in garlic..ummm good!
roast crab.author: Noah K.
roast crab.review:
Delicious roast crab in garlic..ummm good!
the garlic noodles...ummm good!

I am not sure what everyone else has hen they come here, but me, 
the crab sure is ummmmm good!

could be pricey, but hey it's dining in SF.

excerpts: ROAST CRAB was seasoned much better!
I think the style of seasoning on the crab wasn't as traditional vietnamese, more or less its for anyone that likes seafood.
But if you're looking for a really seasoned crab in the vietnamese style go to San Jose.
roast crab.author: Jewls T.
roast crab.review: This was my first time going to an Asian Seafood restaurant in SF. Make reservations if you can bc the wait can be very looong. ok lets get to the food. GARLIC NOODLES were really good! I had the Drunken crab which was not seasoned well and a little dry. ROAST CRAB was seasoned much better! I think the style of seasoning on the crab wasn't as traditional vietnamese, more or less its for anyone that likes seafood. But if you're looking for a really seasoned crab in the vietnamese style go to San Jose.

excerpts: Try the roast crab and garlic noodles.
You won't be disappointed!
roast crab.author: Reid Y.
roast crab.review:
The An Family owns three of these seafood beauties in SF - The Crustacean, La Vie, and Thanh Long.  In my opinion, this one is the best.

1) A lively atmosphere - Crustacean is too quiet and dark and La Vie is too small.
2) Great portions - the garlic noodles I've had at Crustacean come in a smaller bowl.
3) Easier parking - you're pretty much guaranteed to valet if you go to any of the other restaurants, but you can find parking around the Sunset area when you come here.

Anyway, I think if you've found this review, 300+ reviews might be too much to read.  So what are you waiting for?  Try the roast crab and garlic noodles.  You won't be disappointed!

excerpts: This is the place to go for whole roast crab and garlic noodles - their prawns aren't bad either (the hubby hates crab, so when we go, he orders prawns and he says they're good...
I often dream of the garlic noodles because they are so delicious (anybody know the secret to the recipe?
I want in!!!)
roast crab.author: Amy T.
roast crab.review:
This is the place to go for whole roast crab and garlic noodles - their prawns aren't bad either (the hubby hates crab, so when we go, he orders prawns and he says they're good...I haven't actually tried them myself).

It's always packed with people and I've never eaten anything other than the crab and noodles, but it is SO GOOD and while it is expensive, I think it's worth it for a splurge every once in a while....

I often dream of the garlic noodles because they are so delicious (anybody know the secret to the recipe? I want in!!!)

excerpts: You can't go wrong with the roast crab and garlic noodles.
Brought the kids last couple of times and they tore it up.
roast crab.author: Sangorama s.
roast crab.review:
Date: June 2007 (last time)
Who: 2 adults, 2 kids
Bill: ~$100

I eat here every single visit to the Bay Area. You can't go wrong with the roast crab and garlic noodles. Brought the kids last couple of times and they tore it up. We add a bowl of jasmine rice usually b/c it mellows out the mouth a bit.

I crack crabs like a mofo so I can typically keep the wife's plate full with crab while taking some bites myself but was tough to keep all 3 fed. We usually order 2 crabs and ask they wait on bringing the second out until we're 3/4 done with the first. that way we have hot crab the whole meal. You don't really want to see what happens when the dish cools down.

Don't forget dessert. Home made orange and lemon sorbet made and put back in the original shell. Delicious - the orange has some cream in there that makes it so yummy. Fried pineapple and bananas - you can't' go wrong. The flavored vodkas are kinda neat too.

One of the few places you can see people of every race/color/age enjoying a meal.

excerpts: Although one star off for the roast crab which is what they are famous for..
roast crab.author: Cecilia M.
roast crab.review:
Food is amazing, bottom line! Although one star off for the roast crab which is what they are famous for.. BUT.. Please order the drunken crab. The roasted crab is dry & salty. The drunken crab is simmered w wine sake brandy green onions and garlic, mmmmm! Only order the garlic noodles if you are sharing as they are so rich. Speaking of rich, its kind of a splurge, great for a date( i have had a few there).. but you will get what of pay for!! The service is top notch, we always feel welcome & apprieciated :)

My favorite things to order:
Drunken crab (duh)
Shaken beef is my very favorite!
Creme brûlée (different flavors)
Wine list is pretty decent 
Cocktail w/ mango & coconut rum
(drink 4 taste but no buzz included)

I can't stress this enough..
the shaken beef w/ a side of rice

excerpts: it's quite a bit of work b) it's a fair bit of meat c) if you order the standard roast crab and you're slow, the butter on your plate will coagulate in an unappetizing manner (the drunken crab, with a wine sauce, doesn't suffer from this problem).
But a half crab alone isn't really enough for a full meal, in my opinion, so judge your own capacity accordingly.
I think the price for a crab on the night we went (early March) was $34.
Chardonnay is supposed to be the traditional wine accompaniment for crab, and I have to say, it's quite a delicious pairing.
The house chardonnay was good value.
Would happily go back.
roast crab.author: Liz O.
roast crab.review:
Crowded but efficient meant that even though we had to expand our reservation, we were still seated fairly quickly.  DEFINITELY make a reservation, though, for a weekend night.  A tasty pineapple-lychee martini (heavier on the lychee than the pineapple) took the edge off the wait, and I met quite a few people just by being practically mashed into them in the waiting area.  All part of the fun.

Now for the crab: Huge, meaty, and delicious.  You should be hungry if you order one of your own because: a) it's quite a bit of work b) it's a fair bit of meat c) if you order the standard roast crab and you're slow, the butter on your plate will coagulate in an unappetizing manner (the drunken crab, with a wine sauce, doesn't suffer from this problem).  But a half crab alone isn't really enough for a full meal, in my opinion, so judge your own capacity accordingly.  I think the price for a crab on the night we went (early March) was $34.

Chardonnay is supposed to be the traditional wine accompaniment for crab, and I have to say, it's quite a delicious pairing.  The house chardonnay was good value.

Would happily go back.

excerpts:
The roast crab is one of the most memorable dishes

Beyond the two above dishes, there really isn't a reason to go to this place except for the drinks

Havanah Cafe dessert drink is killer good - almost like drinking with Castro and Ho Chi Minh on summer's night

the bibs are classic, but not for me ...
roast crab.author: Jerome, Jerome T.
roast crab.review:
Ok, so here is the down-low on this place:

Soft shell crab was enh - not so great, just decent

----------------

The garlic noodles are simple, delightful, and a perfect pairing for any of the dishes 

The roast crab is one of the most memorable dishes

Beyond the two above dishes, there really isn't a reason to go to this place except for the drinks

Havanah Cafe dessert drink is killer good - almost like drinking with Castro and Ho Chi Minh on summer's night

the bibs are classic, but not for me ...

excerpts: Yes, I ordered the roast crab.
roast crab.author: Gordon E.
roast crab.review:
Yes, I ordered the roast crab.  Yes, I ordered the garlic noodles.  They were really quite good, but $34.95 plus $9.50 good?  Not so sure.

My friends went against advice and ordered the red snapper, which turned out to be better than my crab, and an eggplant dish which was good, not great.

The drinks from the bar were astoundingly good.  We even tipped the bartender $10 on the way out.  

I've also decided I've figured out how to make the garlic noodles at home.  The people at the table next to me said "Good luck.  We've been trying for years."

excerpts: The roast crab is artery clogging good...literally.
Believe it when at the end of your meal you see a nice solid pool of congealed buttery goodness on your plate.
roast crab.author: Jeannie C.
roast crab.review:
The roast crab is artery clogging good...literally.  Believe it when at the end of your meal you see a nice solid pool of congealed buttery goodness on your plate.  The heck with it, go for the bucket kicker all together and order the garlic noodles too b/c it's really that good.

$40 for one crab is pretty pricey but it's pretty filling and good enough for 2 along w/ the noodles.

excerpts: the ROAST CRAB.
o, it was delicious.
nice and messy.
roast crab.author: cat k.
roast crab.review:
YUMMY goodness.
alil bit pricey. but the food was yum.

this was our first time there on the suggestion of some friends.

got the sea bass, which was nicely done, the ginger sauce lightened up the heavy oily fish quite well.

the ROAST CRAB. o, it was delicious. nice and messy. i love being able to get down into it.

GARLIC NOODLES. they were good. except i think in the future, i will order the noodles after getting the crab. b/c you dig into the crab and the noodles get cold. my one thing, i thought the noodles were alil bit too sweet. but still good.

going to try a slightly cheaper place...before coming back. this new discovery is definately going to create a dent in my wallet.

excerpts: Of course we ordered the roast crab and the garlic noodles but the crab was very small and must have been quite fresh a few days earlier.
That crab which most restaurants would hesitate to charge more than $20 for was $42 dollars at Than Long.
A lychee martini for $11.50 was served in a small glass and was all lychee but very little vodka.
All in all, my girlfriend and I felt like we had been "taken".
For a ride that is.
roast crab.author: Steven A.
roast crab.review: Than Long is a classic case of a restaurant "resting on its laurels". I ate there regularly in the 80's and 90's and had not been there since the remodel. Now the prices have tripled and the quality of the food is mediocre at best. Of course we ordered the roast crab and the garlic noodles but the crab was very small and must have been quite fresh a few days earlier. That crab which most restaurants would hesitate to charge more than $20 for was $42 dollars at Than Long.  A lychee martini for $11.50 was served in a small glass and was all lychee but very little vodka. All in all, my girlfriend and I felt like we had been "taken". For a ride that is.

excerpts: Next, roast crab and garlic noodles.
roast crab.author: Kimberly-Alexis N.
roast crab.review:
Love, love, love this place...  I eat here once a month, need I say more?! :P  The food is fantastic!  Thanh Long Mussels to start with freshly toasted baguette crostini.  Next, roast crab and garlic noodles.  Lastly, fried bananas with choice of ice cream (usually vanilla).  

Oh, BTW...  Did I mention that this is one of my favorite restaurants?!

excerpts: The best Vietnamese Roast Crab & Garlic Noodles in town.
Sounds like a small niche?
Well, this place compares very well against Crustaceans on California St. and is WAY better than PPQ on Clement.
Great spot for a date - super yum.
roast crab.author: insipidphishie P.
roast crab.review:
A little out of the way, but man once you get there...

The best Vietnamese Roast Crab & Garlic Noodles in town. Sounds like a small niche? Well, this place compares very well against Crustaceans on California St. and is WAY better than PPQ on Clement. Great spot for a date - super yum.

excerpts: Roast Crab and garlic noodles are the best.
Sure, Crustacean (same family of restaurants) serve the same food, but Thanh Long is more casual.
I've never strayed from the crab and garlic noodles, so not sure how the other food is.
It would be foolish to go and NOT order crab and garlic noodles!
roast crab.author: Jennifer K.
roast crab.review:
Roast Crab and garlic noodles are the best.  Sure, Crustacean (same family of restaurants) serve the same food, but Thanh Long is more casual.  I want to eat my crab while wearing jeans and a t shirt!

I've never strayed from the crab and garlic noodles, so not sure how the other food is.  

It would be foolish to go and NOT order crab and garlic noodles!

excerpts: and the roast crab bathed in garlic and buttah.
how do you say "delicious!
" in vietnamese?
at first i didn't think it would feed two people, but the claws had a lot of meat.
i couldn't understand how my friends hands were so clean when mine were so very dirty.
roast crab.author: Goldie J.
roast crab.review:
my friend and i shared the the colossal royal tiger prawns over the bed of garlic noodles, mmm mmm mmm!!!  and the roast crab bathed in garlic and buttah.  how do you say "delicious!" in vietnamese?  at first i didn't think it would feed two people, but the claws had a lot of meat.  i couldn't understand how my friends hands were so clean when mine were so very dirty.  it was a lot of work, but definitely worth it.  

i took an asian seafood cooking class a couple years ago where the instructor gave us the garlic noodle recipe for what he called 'that overpriced crab place."  i have yet to try it, but i must do it soon!

the meal ended with the fried pineapple a la mode.  we chose the tahitian vanilla gelato for the ice cream.  this was fantasic, although it was very small with a tiny piece of pineapple.  my friend and i just stared at it, and then looked at each other, then looked back on the pineapple before we busted out laughing...  overall, a great meal!!

excerpts: We had an awesome roast crab feast with oodles of garlic noodles and delicious greens!
The mussels and calamari appetizers were great as well.
YUM to the 10th power!
roast crab.author: Jenny H.
roast crab.review:
The OG location will always be better! Maybe the 'mom' hangs out here more? hehe. 

Celebrated my '21st' birthday here with my family and I couldn't be more satisfied. We had an awesome roast crab feast with oodles of garlic noodles and delicious greens! The mussels and calamari appetizers were great as well. YUM to the 10th power! Our wonderful server was the best and was always available to our needs. 

Thanks to the valet dudes for making parking easier especially on a Friday night...it's $10 but it's hassle-free.

excerpts: Roast Crab w/ Garlic Noodles and Garlic Fried Rice.
Eat the crab while it is hot and talk before and after dinner.
Dress code here is not like Crustacean
so I am sure they do well.
roast crab.author: David F.
roast crab.review:
The original Crustacean restaurant I have been here 2 times but used to frequent Crustacean Restaurant before I moved to San Jose.  Now that I am back in the San Francisco area I am definitely going to enjoy a few more stops here.

Roast Crab w/ Garlic Noodles and Garlic Fried Rice.  Eat the crab while it is hot and talk before and after dinner.  Dress code here is not like Crustacean so I am sure they do well.

excerpts: Roast Crab & Garlic Noodles!
We go here once a year for special occasions!
It is a beautiful restaurant inside and you will not be disappointed with the food.
Be sure to go with an empty stomach, because you won't stop eating until you have completely finished the last bite.
roast crab.author: Janice B.
roast crab.review: Roast Crab & Garlic Noodles!  We go here once a year for special occasions!  It is a beautiful restaurant inside and you will not be disappointed with the food.   Be sure to go with an empty stomach, because you won't stop eating until you have completely finished the last bite.

excerpts: The Roast Crab and Garlic Noodles comes highly recommended from friends that have nothing but good praises.
The food speaks for itself.
It would have got 5 stars if the price was more on the cheaper side.
roast crab.author: Eddie I.
roast crab.review: The Roast Crab and Garlic Noodles comes highly recommended from friends that have nothing but good praises. The food speaks for itself. It would have got 5 stars if the price was more on the cheaper side.

excerpts: I love the roast crab but its like you're taking a bite of instant heart attack!
I've been going to Thanh Long for over 10 years but have limited my visits to special occasions due to price and high cholesterol.
So if your looking for health food you might want to rethink your order.
They do have others choices on the menu
roast crab.author: Mike R.
roast crab.review:
I love the roast crab but its like you're taking a bite of instant heart attack! I've been going to Thanh Long for over 10 years but have limited my visits to special occasions due to price and high cholesterol. So if your looking for health food you might want to rethink your order. They do have others choices on the menu but I go there for what they are known for.

If you've never gone before...try it. Making a reservation might help but be prepared for a 45 minute wait to be seated on the weekend.

excerpts: we ordered a roast crab and also garlic noodles (yummy)!!
The place was packed on a Tuesday night!!
crazy!!
Totally recommend people to make reservation in advance!
I'm for sure going back there soon!
roast crab.author: JenJen W.
roast crab.review: This place was so awesome! they have the best crabs ever!! we ordered a roast crab and also garlic noodles (yummy)!! The place was packed on a Tuesday night!! crazy!! Totally recommend people to make reservation in advance!  I'm for sure going back there soon!

excerpts: Roast Crab, GOOD!
roast crab.author: Dee L.
roast crab.review:
Absolutely my favorite restaurant!!!  Garlic noodles, GOOD! Roast Crab, GOOD! Shaken beef, GOOD! Mussels, OMG SO GOOD!!!!!  Need I say more?

Make sure to go earlier because looking for parking can be a pain.  Enjoy!

excerpts: Their roast crab and garlic noodles are to die for!
roast crab.author: bobo f.
roast crab.review: Oh my god! Their roast crab and garlic noodles are to die for!

excerpts: Their signature roast crab is huge.
I can't imagine eating one by myself.
roast crab.author: Jackie I.
roast crab.review:
First things first: It's out in the Boonies. We're talking smell-the-ocean right by the beach Boonies. If you happen to be early for your reservation, there's no where to kill time except for the 7-11. Gross.

I will forgive all of that because the crab is one of the best things I have ever had in this city. Their signature roast crab is huge. I can't imagine eating one by myself. Paired with another one of their signature dishes, the Garlic Noodles, it makes for one yummy but messy meal. Don't turn down the bib. They give that to you for a reason.

excerpts: The service was commendable, the roast crab (which seemed to be what 90% of people there ordered) was good.
Market Price" at the time was $36 dollars/crab.
(ouch)
roast crab.author: Kris O.
roast crab.review:
It's very messy business hollowing out crab as many of you know, and being something of a slob on top of that, my crab shell cracking resulted in a buttery garlicky crab shelly explosion that left no one within 20 feet of me butter-free. After the mushroom cloud cleared, there at ground zero was perhaps a handful of crab meat for all my effort.

The garlic noodles did a good job of filling up my belly after finishing my snack of crustacean innards.

Parking was tough for us so we ended up having to valet the car. The service was commendable, the roast crab (which seemed to be what 90% of people there ordered) was good. "Market Price" at the time was $36 dollars/crab. (ouch)

excerpts: Roast Crab~We ordered two of these because these were supposed to be the star of the show, and don't get me wrong, they were good.
The flavor was delicious but two days later my mom pretty much replicated the dish with lobster instead of crab
so why drive the two hours, right ?
roast crab.author: J. Julia E.
roast crab.review:
If I lived nearby or was in the neighborhood already, I would definitely come back. But we drove a couple of hours to eat here and the food was good, although, not "travelling hours in a car" good. 

There were six of us (one was a child), this is what we ordered and how we felt about: 

Traditional Vietnamese Salad~ fresh, tasty, delicious vinaigrette, yet not overdressed 
Catch in Citrus~everyone enjoyed this dish (except for me; I found it too sweet for my liking) 
Thanh Long Spicy Eggplant~excellent 
Shaken Beef~EXCELLENT (I might take the drive for this dish) 
Roast Crab~We ordered two of these because these were supposed to be the star of the show, and don't get me wrong, they were good. The flavor was delicious but two days later my mom pretty much replicated the dish with lobster instead of crab so why drive the two hours, right ? 
Tamarind Crab~just OK. , not the flavor that was expected from the menu description 
Garlic Noodles~again, just OK. (I really was anticipating something extraordinary with this dish because these are An's Famous Noodles and because noodles and garlic are two of my top ten favorite things of all time). 
Three Desserts: Fried Banana, Chocolate Torte, and I don't even remember the third one. I did not try any of these ( I prefer savory over sweet), but everyone else at the table seem to like them just fine. 

Service was EXCELLENT. (I don't mean to put this in the end as an afterthought because I assure you that it's not.)

excerpts: Roast Crab and Garlic noodles are soooo good.
Im baffled at how much flavor is in those noodles.
Everything on the menu is very tasty.
Yes its expensive and not good for you but once in a while shouldnt be too bad.
Dont eat the Roast Crab too slow because the butter starts solidifying.
roast crab.author: Roger C.
roast crab.review:
Roast Crab and Garlic noodles are soooo good. Im baffled at how much flavor is in those noodles. Everything on the menu is very tasty. Yes its expensive and not good for you but once in a while shouldnt be too bad. Dont eat the Roast Crab too slow because the butter starts solidifying. Then you'll realize that this is the same thing happening to your arteries.

The neighborhood is a bit ghetto. So weird to have a nice restaurant that's across the street from 7-11. But this is definitely one of my favorite restaurants.

excerpts: For the crab, I like the Roast Crab.
You will be licking your fingers and slopping up the butter sauce.
Just don't think about the pounds and pounds of butter it took to make the sauce it when you do it.
roast crab.author: Karen B.
roast crab.review:
This place is a treat for me. The crab just melts in your mouth. I am allergic to shellfish, but I pack a bottle of benedryl and risk a major break out  just to eat here.  My suggestion is: order your own food. If there are 2 of you, order 2 crabs. If there are 4 of you, order 4 garlic noodles. You will not want to share, trust me. 

For the crab, I like the Roast Crab. You will be licking your fingers and slopping up the butter sauce. Just don't think about the pounds and pounds of butter it took to make the sauce it when you do it. It's just heaven...as is the garlic noodles.Garlic noodles seem like a pretty easy concept...but they don't make 'em anywhere else like they make 'em here. Like I said...get your own. I wasn't crazy about the Tamarind Crab. The flavor was just off for me. Plus it was too sticky. I don't like sticky crab. 

We tried the Shaken beef. It was ok. I guess after all the taste explosions with the crab and noodles, the shaken beef wasn't as exciting.  My BF who doesn't eat seafood really liked the beef. 

It's expensive, but if you stick with the great dishes, it is worth every cent.

excerpts: We tried the Roast Crab and the Drunken Crab.
The former was both our favorite - heavy on the garlic, quite tasty.
roast crab.author: Thighmaster M.
roast crab.review: If you are a crab fan. Must go. We tried the Roast Crab and the Drunken Crab. The former was both our favorite - heavy on the garlic, quite tasty. We also had the Tempura Style Coconut Prawns appetizer which was fantastic. We were out of season in May for crab (apparently crab season is only during months that have an "R" in them), but it was still fresh tasting with large pieces of meat. Too pricey for me at $35 a crab, but spouse would do it again in a heartbeat. In fact, she is arranging to get her crab fan family up there asap.

excerpts: My wife and I ordered the roast crab and garlic noodles, and just devoured it.
We emerged from our feeding frenzy, shells flying, peppery butter everywhere, and deliriously settled up exactly half an hour later.
Believe the hype.
roast crab.author: Ben R.
roast crab.review: My wife and I ordered the roast crab and garlic noodles, and just devoured it.  We emerged from our feeding frenzy, shells flying, peppery butter everywhere, and deliriously settled up exactly half an hour later.  Believe the hype.

excerpts: But, I was really impressed by their roast crab, one of the best that I had.
roast crab.author: Yoshi D.
roast crab.review:
Here for our friend's birthday.
I had never heard of it (shame), so I was thinking this place is just Asian-fusion restaurant (shame, shame....).
But, I was really impressed by their roast crab, one of the best that I had.
I love the taste of garlic noodle, but no so much a fan of this sticky texture.

Overall, I will definitely come back to this place

excerpts: The Roast Crab and Garlic noodles are fantastic.
Just as good as at Crustaceans.
My wife said the crab was smaller at Than Longs
but I couldn't tell.
Besides Crabs are not all the same size.
Great meal
....service was OK...could be better
but the food is GREAT!
roast crab.author: Jeff R.
roast crab.review: Went to Than Long for our 1st wedding anniversary. The Roast Crab and Garlic noodles are fantastic. Just as good as at Crustaceans. My wife said the crab was smaller at Than Longs but I couldn't tell. Besides Crabs are not all the same size. Great meal....service was OK...could be better but the food is GREAT!

excerpts: We ordered what most people recommend "Roast Crab" and "Garlic Noodles".
Ladies don't forget to bring a hair tie if you hair is long because it can get messy... not to worry about your clothes because they put a bib around your neck.

The garlic noodles taste weird, perhaps because it's not fresh (reheat-in-a-microwave taste) we probably had the leftover noodles from the night before, and for $9.50 it's not worth ordering the second visit.
But then again it sort of compliments the Crab, which I must admit is one of the best crabs I've ever tried.
It's so big and juicy oozing with butter garlic sauce I couldn't care less about making a mess.
The menu says market price, we paid about $37.
It would seem a lot, but if you're ordering for two it's enough.
roast crab.author: Chris H.
roast crab.review: After reading reviews about how good this place is, my friend and I decided to pay Thanh Long a visit. Parking was real easy since we came early, about 5:00 on a weekend. The restaurant was more than half full with happy eaters from a large family celebrating someones birthday to couples and tourists. The seats are comfortable with new clean table cloths. We ordered what most people recommend "Roast Crab" and "Garlic Noodles". Ladies don't forget to bring a hair tie if you hair is long because it can get messy... not to worry about your clothes because they put a bib around your neck. The garlic noodles taste weird, perhaps because it's not fresh (reheat-in-a-microwave taste) we probably had the leftover noodles from the night before, and for $9.50 it's not worth ordering the second visit. But then again it sort of compliments the Crab, which I must admit is one of the best crabs I've ever tried. It's so big and juicy oozing with butter garlic sauce I couldn't care less about making a mess. The menu says market price, we paid about $37. It would seem a lot, but if you're ordering for two it's enough.

excerpts: Tamarind and Roast crab is a HIT!!!
The drunken was okay.
Prices are the same in the Crustaceans restaurant.
Again, this restaurant is okay - the atmosphere is full of locals and people not from the area of SF but it is cramped.
I really like the Crustaceans restaurant in the city way better.
I don't plan to come out here again unless I was invited to attend a party.
roast crab.author: Lyn D.
roast crab.review: This place is okay.  The price deters me from coming here again.  I'd rather pay for the fine dining experiences at Crustaceans and put up with the parking in the city.  Although it is a fact that Thanh Long and Crustaceans is a family business, I just didn't feel all the raves from the other yelp reviewers.  I guess it's my fault b/c I walked in with high expectations of this restaurant since Crustaceans lived up to my expectations.  Don't get me wrong, the service is supurb.  We got this waiter who took our order by memory...and we ordered a helluva lot of food!!!!  Tamarind and Roast crab is a HIT!!! The drunken was okay.  Prices are the same in the Crustaceans restaurant.  Again, this restaurant is okay - the atmosphere is full of locals and people not from the area of SF but it is cramped.  I really like the Crustaceans restaurant in the city way better.   I don't plan to come out here again unless I was invited to attend a party.

excerpts: next time i'm eating my roast crab with a side of white rice.
roast crab.author: Kay V.
roast crab.review:
i am usually not known for attacking a whole crab with my bare & dainty fingers...but  yes i did it! although my goal was to eat the whole crab, i was insanely full from eating half of it. 

the garlic noodles are a perfect side dish too...the texture is dry just the way i like it. i do like eat while it's fresh. next time i'm eating my roast crab with a side of white rice. there's soooo much butter & garlic left over, it would've been a treat to drizzle that over some rice.

you get a hot towel at the end of dinner to wipe off your greasy mess from your hands (& face too). the handy plastic bib they provided is a must. make sure your neighbor wears one too even if they don't eat crab. only suggestion is to provide a hot towel before dinner too.

parking was a headache...street parking (but hey, this is san francisco). but it looks like they have valet service...not really advertised well if so.

excerpts: Garlic noodle and roast crab.
Yum, yum, yum.
The healthy side of me deducted a star because the noodles are a bit too salty and you have to eat the crab rather quickly (while it's hot)
so you don't have to see the butter/fat congeal.
Painful, but true.
roast crab.author: Angie S.
roast crab.review: Garlic noodle and roast crab. Yum, yum, yum. The healthy side of me deducted a star because the noodles are a bit too salty and you have to eat the crab rather quickly (while it's hot) so you don't have to see the butter/fat congeal. Painful, but true.

excerpts: my husband ordered the roast crab while i had the shaken beef which is pretty good, although i can see the oil on the bed of lettuce it sits on.
roast crab.author: jean j.
roast crab.review:
I'm not a fan of seafood but i definitely am willing to take a few bites of their roasted crab which is smothered in garlic, salt, and butter (lots of it). my husband ordered the roast crab while i had the shaken beef which is pretty good, although i can see the oil on the bed of lettuce it sits on. The garlic noodles are delicious but you could see a puddle of butter at the bottom of its plate once your done.
The decor is nice but you can tell the place has been around for some time. Its sister restaurant Crustacean's definitely has better ambiance. Thanh Long is more of a family gathering type of place.
Their lava cake is absolutely yummy!! That definitely tipped the scale to a worthy dining experience for me. The only thing is that they have a $1 cake-cutting fee which put me off a bit. Either just include it in the price of the cake, or take it away altogether.

excerpts: Roast Crab (I think it was $38) - really good crab...
but compared to Crustaceans, it's not the same.
Not as flavorful, but still very, very good nonetheless.
Creme Brulee (2 orders) - My dad and Anhie T. thought this was the best dessert dish.
Banana Cake - I liked this dish and everyone else didn't like it.
Served with a scoop of Vanilla ice cream, a dallop of whip cream, this cake seemed to be made out of only bananas.
Anhie T. said it was bland.
I disagree.
Hot Chocolate Cake - served with Vanilla ice cream...this was good.
Really rich though.
Coke (2 glasses) - served from their bar in a tall, slim glass.
roast crab.author: Daniel M.
roast crab.review:
I've been here before and I thought it was great (and still do!), but after eating at Crustaceans, Thanh Long only gets 4 stars...

Took my parents and Anhie T. here for Chinese New Years dinner, and reservations were made at 8.30, but at 7.15 we were able to move it up to 7.45 with no problems.  We got there, and it was pretty empty...with maybe 20 diners at about 5-6 different tables.  Barren compared to when Anhie T. and I came about 2 yrs ago.  We were seated immediately, and looked over the menu, and ordered the following:

Crispy Rice Paper Roll ($7.50) - your standard Vietnamese Egg Roll.  But here you get once egg roll cut into four pieces.
Thanh Long Mussells ($10.95) - five mussells served with five slices of thin garlic bread.  This dish was delicious.
Steamed Sea Bass ($24.95) - sea bass was flaky, moist, and really good.  The sauce was sweet and gingery.
Stuffed Calamari ($15.95) - lots of calamari stuffed with minced meat in a tomato based sauce.  Parents didn't like it so much, but I thought it was okay.
Shaken Beef ($20.95) - very flavorful, and a dish that everyone loved.  The beef was tender and potatoes were flavorful.
Garlic Noodles (2 orders at $9.50 ea) - Garlicky and delicious! 
Roast Crab (I think it was $38) - really good crab...but compared to Crustaceans, it's not the same.  Not as flavorful, but still very, very good nonetheless. 
Creme Brulee (2 orders) - My dad and Anhie T. thought this was the best dessert dish.
Banana Cake - I liked this dish and everyone else didn't like it.  Served with a scoop of Vanilla ice cream, a dallop of whip cream, this cake seemed to be made out of only bananas.  Anhie T. said it was bland.  I disagree.
Hot Chocolate Cake - served with Vanilla ice cream...this was good.  Really rich though.
Coke (2 glasses) - served from their bar in a tall, slim glass.  No free refills.

Total bill with tax + tip came out to $218.

This was my parents first time here and they loved the crab, and garlic noodles.  They did say it was a bit oily, but c'mon, roasted crab and garlic noodles anywhere is a bit oily.  But here's a good sign.  As they left, they took some business cards.  That means they liked their food and they'll be back...probably with some family friends!

Depending on my the mood (and thickness of the wallet), I would come back.  

But other substitutions are very comparable:  PPQ is cheaper and quality isn't far behind, while Crustacean is a tad more expensive, but swankier....

Tip 'o the day:  Avoid the valet parking outside.  Parking isn't too difficult in the Sunset.  And even if you had to walk one block after dinner, it may clear up your arteries after all the butter used in cooking the crab!

excerpts: OMG this place is so yummy, I love the roast crab and the service is always good worth the wait.
Can't wait to go back again.
roast crab.author: Joiera C.
roast crab.review: OMG this place is so yummy, I love the roast crab and the service is always good worth the wait. Can't wait to go back again.

excerpts: Roast crab is one of the best crabs I EVER had.
Worth every precious penny !!
Plus the food is served within minutes!
I love the service.
If you like good food...
Or taking someone on date ...
This place will be somewhere someone wouldn't forget !!!!
roast crab.author: Allison N.
roast crab.review: I La La loOooove this place !!!! Roast crab is one of the best crabs I EVER had. Worth every precious penny !! Plus the food is served within minutes! I love the service. If you like good food... Or taking someone on date ... This place will be somewhere someone wouldn't forget !!!!

excerpts: order the roast crab and the garlic noodles.
that's all you really need to know.

i'm sure the other things on the menu are tasty (the salt and pepper calamari are a favorite if we come w/ friends), but you can't come all the way out here and not have the roast crab AND garlic noodles.

i'm sure the other things on the menu are tasty (the salt and pepper calamari are a favorite if we come w/ friends), but you can't come all the way out here and not have the roast crab AND garlic noodles.
the few times i've been with her, she's refused to share a large dungeness roast crab w/ anyone.
roast crab.author: Carol O.
roast crab.review:
order the roast crab and the garlic noodles.  that's all you really need to know.  i'm sure the other things on the menu are tasty (the salt and pepper calamari are a favorite if we come w/ friends), but you can't come all the way out here and not have the roast crab AND garlic noodles.

i prefer thanh long over crustacean for the slightly more relaxed atmosphere, especially bc i don't like to feel like i have to get dressed up if i'm going to be licking butter & garlic off my fingers at dinner.

my best friend from So Cal swears that the only reason she really comes up here to visit me is because she wants to eat at thanh long.  matter of fact, the few times i've been with her, she's refused to share a large dungeness roast crab w/ anyone.  what a punk!

parking is terrible.  i used to live two blocks away and parking was still bad but it is definitely worth it.

excerpts: I think the only 3 things that are good here are the roast crab, garlic noodles, and the colossal tiger prawns.
Overall, 4 stars for the garlic noodles and crab.
roast crab.author: amanda c.
roast crab.review:
I think the only 3 things that are good here are the roast crab, garlic noodles, and the colossal tiger prawns. We also ordered the jumbo prawn wontons which literally was a shrimp w/ its tail stil on it inside a fried egg roll wrapper. So when you eat the "wonton" you get a big bite of a crunchy tail. Gross. It had no flavor. I thought I would get something more interesting for the exorbitant price. Also ordered the vegetable soup. It was Meh..

I thought the service was ok. I felt like they were just trying to get us out of there. I was still eating some crab and the bus boy came and cleared the crab bowl and crab plate away. I was like..hello! i'm still eating here!

So, I'd stick with the 3 items mentioned above and wouldn't deviate from them. Overall, 4 stars for the garlic noodles and crab.

excerpts: The garlic noodles are to die for, I usually get the roast crab, quick tip, wear the bib
roast crab.author: Dizzy L.
roast crab.review: The garlic noodles are to die for, I usually get the roast crab, quick tip, wear the bib

excerpts: When the glorious roast crab and garlic noodles arrived, I forgot I was on a date and just grabbed a crab leg and started munching away!
roast crab.author: Annie L.
roast crab.review: I grew up on 48th and Judah and during my daily trips on the N-Judah, I always wondered what kind of place had a picture of a crab over the door. It was not untill I grew up and went on a date with a guy who can afford this place that I realized this is one classy restaurant that serves the best garlic roasted crab and garlic noodles. At first I was a bit embarassed when the waiter tried to put the bib on me since I was on a date with a cute guy. But, as I looked around the room, everyone had one on, so I happily let the watier put my bib on me. When the glorious roast crab and garlic noodles arrived, I forgot I was on a date and just grabbed a crab leg and started munching away! I almost bit my date's hand when he was reaching to get the last of the garlic noodles! Even though I am a bit allergic to crab, but with a few tablets of Claritin, I can eat at Thanh Long everyday! :)

excerpts: We had a mango salad, garlic noodles and roast crab.
The mangoes were warm in the salad which was different but I enjoyed it.
The garlic noodles were delicious.
The crab was ok.
I requested vinegar because my Filipino side required it.
It was very noisy and busy by the time the food came out.
The experience was good
but I don't think I will be returning for their $40 crab.
Our waitress was very attentive which was great
but I prefer my mom's instead.
roast crab.author: Bianca D.
roast crab.review: My boyfriend has been dying to take me here for over a year and one day we actually found the time to go.  We arrived promptly at 5 and were seated immediately without reservations.  I let him do the ordering.  We had a mango salad, garlic noodles and roast crab.  The mangoes were warm in the salad which was different but I enjoyed it.  The garlic noodles were delicious.  The crab was ok.  I requested vinegar because my Filipino side required it.  It was very noisy and busy by the time the food came out.  The experience was good but I don't think I will be returning for their $40 crab.  Our waitress was very attentive which was great but I prefer my mom's instead.

excerpts: Our typical order: mango/scallop/shrimp salad, shaken beef, garlic roast crab
The Ahn secret recipes of the garlic roast crab and noodles in the special little kitchen - these are a MUST.
A taste of heaven.
Seems like their shaken beef is using a different cut of beef (used to be tenderloin).
I've tried a bunch of other stuff on the menu, but haven't been blown away by them.
I've been meaning to try PPQ as a comparison...
Crustacean isn't as good in my opinion.
roast crab.author: Cammy H.
roast crab.review: 4.5 Stars. The food is still great here after all these years (and renovations) and they did well on service for our party of 14. Reservations needed and go early :). Our typical order: mango/scallop/shrimp salad, shaken beef, garlic roast crab***, garlic noodles*** (you have to eat these hot). The Ahn secret recipes of the garlic roast crab and noodles in the special little kitchen - these are a MUST. A taste of heaven. Seems like their shaken beef is using a different cut of beef (used to be tenderloin). I've tried a bunch of other stuff on the menu, but haven't been blown away by them. I've been meaning to try PPQ as a comparison...Crustacean isn't as good in my opinion. I'm close to reproducing the garlic noodles!!!

excerpts: i prefer the drunken crab over the roast crab.
personal fave: drunken crab
roast crab.author: Mei N.
roast crab.review:
not as good as a remembered from years ago but it's still damn good.

of course the recommended is the crab and garlic noodles.... the garlic smell in your mouth lasts FOREVER. i brushed, listerined, brushed and listerined again... but the smell of garlic still wouldn't go away. don't let that scare you though... it's so f'ing good.

i prefer the drunken crab over the roast crab. mmm... besure to soak up the crab meat with the juices on your plate. 

we also had the saigon beef... let's just say that i think it's way overpriced. $19.95 for a few pieces of beef on top of a salad. 

and parking does get tight around that area. luckily they've got valet parking.

personal fave: drunken crab

excerpts: get the roast crab.
roast crab.author: Mel L.
roast crab.review:
i don't think i have anything to say that hasn't been said. but i have to add my vote, right? 
get the roast crab. get the garlic noodles. love them. 

i HATE fish but my dad got the sea bass and it was surprisingly for me, good! no fishy flavor at all! it's the first time i've had anything good to say about fish. 

skip the lemongrass chicken - it's pretty tough and nothing special. MAKE reservations!!! the wait can be ridiculous. there's valet parking but it's about $10 i think. just park a couple blocks away... you'll need to walk it off after your dinner anyway :D 

yes, it's pricey... it's definitely a place that's worth a try, at the very least.

excerpts: If I was ever stranded on a dessert island I would be perfectly content eating roast crab and garlic noodles for the rest of my life.
Since I've never really deviated from the roast crab or garlic noodles, I can't speak to the other entrees on the menu-- but crab is their specialty here, so why would you go with anything else?
My husband though, stubborn as he is has actually gotten the roast tiger prawns and the orange sea bass and he has enjoyed them.
The appetizers are great.
The fresh spring rolls are always a delight and the crab and corn soup is never a miss.
Since I've never really deviated from the roast crab or garlic noodles, I can't speak to the other entrees on the menu-- but crab is their specialty here, so why would you go with anything else?

and if you order the right thing - meaning just the roast crab and garlic noodles, they are done really----well...
and if you order the right thing - meaning just the roast crab and garlic noodles, they are done really----well...

roast crab.review: Stick with the roast crab and garlic noodles - everything else is usually a disappointment.  Apps are always tiny and taste so-so.  Against my better judgment, we also ordered the drunken crab this time and it was so--- fishy.  The waiter said the wine brings out the natural fishiness - but I could tell it wasn't the reason in this case- it just wasn't fresh.  But they were really good about removing it from our bill without even mentioning it.  Good service and if you order the right thing - meaning just the roast crab and garlic noodles, they are done really----well...

I would like to go back again (on a non-birthday visit) and actually try the other delicious looking food on the menu.
But crab and garlic noodles?
That's special.
That's my birthday fare.

excerpts: I've only eaten here once... will definitely come back when craving Roast Crab & Garlic Noodles -  very good.
The waaay too peppery
I cannot emphasize how good the Garlic Noodles are - a must-have with every meal here from now on
roast crab.author: K-Y    j i L L y.
roast crab.review:
I've only eaten here once... will definitely come back when craving Roast Crab & Garlic Noodles -  very good.  The waaay too peppery Tamarind Crab disappointed, but the appetizers were great.  The place literally stinks & you leave smelling like stink, but I am very interested in trying other menu items.  I cannot emphasize how good the Garlic Noodles are - a must-have with every meal here from now on although I wish they would serve bigger portions.

The staff is friendly & attentive, the food is a bit overpriced & parking is a biatch (they have valet), but I can see why people love this place.  The Drunken Crab sounds like an interesting dish... will order next time perhaps?

excerpts: THE best roast crab in SF, hands down.
roast crab.author: Paul L.
roast crab.review:
THE best roast crab in SF, hands down.

Great, relaxed setting. Perfect for family dinners or other intimate occasions.

The Tiger Prawns and Garlic noodles are also life altering.

excerpts: roast crab and garlic noodles seem to be the main specialty here and for good reason.
food was really good.
service was excellent.
from the outside the place looks like crap but once you go in it's alright.
parking might be impossible.
make sure you put down a reservation b/c this place gets packed.
heads up: this place is a bit on the pricier side.
roast crab.author: Patrick K.
roast crab.review: roast crab and garlic noodles seem to be the main specialty here and for good reason. food was really good. service was excellent. from the outside the place looks like crap but once you go in it's alright. parking might be impossible. make sure you put down a reservation b/c this place gets packed. heads up: this place is a bit on the pricier side.

excerpts: Between the 4 of us, we had the soft shell crab appetizer, a roast crab, a drunken crab, 2 orders of garlic noodles, and the "peasant's favorite.
The soft shell crab was tasty with the tamarind sauce, but it was a bit small for $12.
The roast crab was garlicky & buttery, with the meat juicy and fresh.
The drunken crab was unfortunately on the bland and dry side, despite its wet-sounding name.
The garlic noodles were a hit all around, and our hands got so greasy from the crab that we just ate the noodles with our hands as well.
Good thing we were seated in a back corner, far way from the disapproving eyes of polite company.
P
The pork in the "peasant's favorite" clay pot was tender and well-marinated.
Everything was tasty but on the pricey side.
Market price for crab that day was ~$40, and the small portion of pork was $17 or so.
We dropped $40 each and walked out satiated but not stuffed.
roast crab.author: Lillian L.
roast crab.review:
This was where I brought my bff and our respective bfs for the bachelorette party I planned for my teeth. I wanted to be able to savagely chomp into luscious limbs of crab (who needs crustacean crackers when you've got bicuspids?) while my teeth were still free of metal fetters.

Between the 4 of us, we had the soft shell crab appetizer, a roast crab, a drunken crab, 2 orders of garlic noodles, and the "peasant's favorite." The soft shell crab was tasty with the tamarind sauce, but it was a bit small for $12. The roast crab was garlicky & buttery, with the meat juicy and fresh. The drunken crab was unfortunately on the bland and dry side, despite its wet-sounding name. The garlic noodles were a hit all around, and our hands got so greasy from the crab that we just ate the noodles with our hands as well. Good thing we were seated in a back corner, far way from the disapproving eyes of polite company. =P The pork in the "peasant's favorite" clay pot was tender and well-marinated. Everything was tasty but on the pricey side. Market price for crab that day was ~$40, and the small portion of pork was $17 or so. We dropped $40 each and walked out satiated but not stuffed.

excerpts: The roast crab is good and I love their garlic noodles!
I give it around 3.5 stars because it's overpriced.
roast crab.author: Stacey L.
roast crab.review: The roast crab is good and I love their garlic noodles!  I give it around 3.5 stars because it's overpriced.

excerpts: The Garlic Noodles and Roast Crab are the best by far.
Finish off your meal with one of the yummy desserts!
They have a fully loaded bar.
roast crab.author: Myrta H.
roast crab.review: Every menu item is delicious. The Garlic Noodles and Roast Crab are the best by far. Finish off your meal with one of the yummy desserts! They have a fully loaded bar.

excerpts: There are two things on this menu that you must order if you come here - The roast crab and garlic noodles.
Everything else on the menu pales in comparison to these items.
I have been here a couple times
and I've enjoyed it more and more with each visit.
I can definitely say that I've never had any garlic noodles that has even comes close to Thanh Long's garlic noodles.
Although you will pay the price because you will still wake up with your breath still smelling like garlic!
The price for a whole crab is also not bad compared to other places in the city.
The one thing I love about this place is that they cook the crab in simple flavors.
Nothing that will take away from the original flavor of the crabs but ingredients that will only enhance it.
Five stars for Thanh Long!
I will be coming back here for a very long time.

I have been here a couple times and I've enjoyed it more and more with each visit.  I can definitely say that I've never had any garlic noodles that has even comes close to Thanh Long's garlic noodles.  Although you will pay the price because you will still wake up with your breath still smelling like garlic!  The price for a whole crab is also not bad compared to other places in the city.  The one thing I love about this place is that they cook the crab in simple flavors.  Nothing that will take away from the original flavor of the crabs but ingredients that will only enhance it.  Five stars for Thanh Long!  I will be coming back here for a very long time.

excerpts: Roast crab and garlic noddle!!!
It worths the long drive!
roast crab.author: Mai W.
roast crab.review: Roast crab and garlic noddle!!! It worths the long drive!

excerpts:
So this is what I remember from the night's festivities, once the food coma wore off:
Salmon carpaccio, the Buddha roll, the prawn bouillabaisse, garlic noodles, the roast crab, tiger prawns and the steamed sea bass.
In a word, YUM.
Come hungry though, because you will want to indulge in all kinds of different flavors, and the menu is versatile enough to do so.

I got my salt from the yummy carpaccio, "fresh" from the spring roll-esque Buddha roll, tang from the bouillabaisse (though I will say I did not expect such a seemingly random selection of different veggies/fruit to taste good together...
I was kinda like, "um...why are there tomatoes and pineapple together to complement my seafood soup?
but it was actually pretty enjoyable), bitter (in a good way, though my breath was banging after all the garlic!)
from the noodles, and boredom from the main entrees.
the sea bass and the crab...
i guess i just wanted more flavor?
roast crab.author: Danielle D.
roast crab.review:
When my girls and I go out to eat, we EAT.
So this is what I remember from the night's festivities, once the food coma wore off:
Salmon carpaccio, the Buddha roll, the prawn bouillabaisse, garlic noodles, the roast crab, tiger prawns and the steamed sea bass. In a word, YUM. Come hungry though, because you will want to indulge in all kinds of different flavors, and the menu is versatile enough to do so. I got my salt from the yummy carpaccio, "fresh" from the spring roll-esque Buddha roll, tang from the bouillabaisse (though I will say I did not expect such a seemingly random selection of different veggies/fruit to taste good together...I was kinda like, "um...why are there tomatoes and pineapple together to complement my seafood soup?" but it was actually pretty enjoyable), bitter (in a good way, though my breath was banging after all the garlic!) from the noodles, and boredom from the main entrees. the sea bass and the crab...i guess i just wanted more flavor?... i ended up switching entrees with a friend though, and enjoyed her tiger prawns and a dish i don't recall for sure, but it was definitely chicken with veggies (now looking at the menu it must have been the lemongrass chicken), and it was like the comfort food I needed to end the meal in a happy place. 
I would head back though, and repeat my starters again, though the next time, I would probably try the drunken beef or crab to appeal my palate, which I tend to ignore in favor of the "safer" stuff.
Very good service as well, which always adds to the meal!

excerpts: I got the roast crab and garlic noodles, and it was so wonderful.
I also had some kind of lychee cocktail that was so refreshing and light.
Oh yeah
the servers were the best .....
Oh if only they  had a location in the East bay.

roast crab.review: I LOVE me some crab!!!! I got the roast crab and garlic noodles, and it was so wonderful. I also had some kind of lychee cocktail that was so refreshing and light. Oh yeah the servers were the best ..... Oh if only they  had a location in the East bay.

And they're fried banana with mango or vanilla ice cream
is delicious!
I highly suggest this restaurant.
Kinda on the pricey side, that's why my boyfriend and I only come here to celebrate anniversaries or birthdays.
MMM
I'm craving for some RIGHT NOW!

roast crab.review: My FAVORITE restaurant!  Food and service are great!  They're garlic noodles and roast crab are to die for!  And they're fried banana with mango or vanilla ice cream is delicious!  I highly suggest this restaurant.  Kinda on the pricey side, that's why my boyfriend and I only come here to celebrate anniversaries or birthdays.  MMM I'm craving for some RIGHT NOW!

god.
it was awesome taste.
just melt in my mouth. so delicious~~

roast crab.review:
i love to have roast crab and garlic noodles with hot sauce.

excerpts: we order the roast crab and drunken crab and both were overcooked.
the seasonings were complimentary, but alone the roast would have been too salty and the drunken too sweet.
roast crab.author: Rose J.
roast crab.review:
i went to thanh long's sister restaurant crustacean a little tipsy, so i needed to come here for a true comparison.

sober, the food is just ok.  i love crab and i especially love their natural flavors.  we order the roast crab and drunken crab and both were overcooked.  the seasonings were complimentary, but alone the roast would have been too salty and the drunken too sweet.  the garlic noodles are flavorful and not nearly as drenched in butter as the ones at crustacean.  the 2nd time around, i'm still not a big fan, because they come out too mushy and once you finish working on the crabs, they become too clumpy.

other than that, my infused drink was great, the service was good.  it wasn't too packed even when we went on a friday night.  for most people this place is fabulous.  for me i'm taking my money to aqua where they will never overcook my seafood.

excerpts: Ordering the roast crab one at a time saves the "extra" crab from getting cold and the butter to congeal.
Trust me, you don't want your crab to get the chills and the butter to coagulate...not too appetizing when that happens.
For appetizers, or if you're not into the whole garlic thing, try the Saigon beef!...excellent.
Think mini pieces of tender filet mignon and yummy mixed micro salad with caramelized onions and cherry tomatoes all in one plate.
I don't remember what the sauce is made of, but you've gotta try it!
The salmon carpacchio is very good also...thinly sliced salmon with capers served with sliced toasted baguette.
Yes, the portions of the appetizers (and pretty much the whole menu) are small and prices are high, but you get what you pay for...pretty darn good tasting food.
If you still have room for desert after all the crab and noodles, you've got to try the home made banana cake and chocolate cake...
oh my!!
The banana cake has got to be my favorite...big chunks of banana and the cake almost has the texture of bread pudding.
The chocolate cake is rich and creamy.
Both are served with ice cream (French vanilla) and some type of vanilla cream sauce I believe.
I don't really pay attention to the sauce because the cake itself is SO good!!
Parking is difficult to locate, hence the valet parking located on 46th for those who don't want to circle the blocks for more than 10 minutes.
I've found parking within a block of Thanh Long on 45, 46, Judah, Irving and Kirkham during dinner hours...
no biggie.
And my secret to not waiting for a table...the perfect time to go
there is 6:30pm...
any later, and you're in deep trouble trying to fight through the masses of people sitting/standing in the waiting area...
uh yah, 30+
people standing in a 10 ft by 10 ft space can make for a very aggravating experience.
roast crab.author: Carrie K.
roast crab.review:
First thing you say when waiter arrives to your table..."Roast crab and garlic noodles with prawns please."  That's pretty much all you need to know when you place your order.  Depending on the number in your dining party, order crab accordingly.  Note to self: hold off on ordering the maximum amount of crab you want all at one time.  Ordering the roast crab one at a time saves the "extra" crab from getting cold and the butter to congeal.  Trust me, you don't want your crab to get the chills and the butter to coagulate...not too appetizing when that happens.
For appetizers, or if you're not into the whole garlic thing, try the Saigon beef!...excellent.  Think mini pieces of tender filet mignon and yummy mixed micro salad with caramelized onions and cherry tomatoes all in one plate.  I don't remember what the sauce is made of, but you've gotta try it!  The salmon carpacchio is very good also...thinly sliced salmon with capers served with sliced toasted baguette.
Yes, the portions of the appetizers (and pretty much the whole menu) are small and prices are high, but you get what you pay for...pretty darn good tasting food.
If you still have room for desert after all the crab and noodles, you've got to try the home made banana cake and chocolate cake...oh my!!  The banana cake has got to be my favorite...big chunks of banana and the cake almost has the texture of bread pudding.  The chocolate cake is rich and creamy.  Both are served with ice cream (French vanilla) and some type of vanilla cream sauce I believe.  I don't really pay attention to the sauce because the cake itself is SO good!!
Parking is difficult to locate, hence the valet parking located on 46th for those who don't want to circle the blocks for more than 10 minutes.  I've found parking within a block of Thanh Long on 45, 46, Judah, Irving and Kirkham during dinner hours...no biggie.  And my secret to not waiting for a table...the perfect time to go there is 6:30pm...any later, and you're in deep trouble trying to fight through the masses of people sitting/standing in the waiting area...uh yah, 30+ people standing in a 10 ft by 10 ft space can make for a very aggravating experience.

excerpts: Ahh, on colder days I would sometime dream of eating Thanh Long's roast crab and garlic noodle.
Their tiger prawns is also quite good.
Make your reservation, then you still have to do the wait.
A good thing that I enjoy here is the fact that they do not rush me while I am eating so
is all cool.
I've never been to their sister's restaurant 'Crustacean' not interested to do so.

Make your reservation, then you still have to do the wait. A good thing that I enjoy here is the fact that they do not rush me while I am eating so is all cool. I've never been to their sister's restaurant 'Crustacean' not interested to do so.

excerpts: I liked the Roast Crab better than the Drunken Crab, but bother were good.
roast crab.author: Philip T.
roast crab.review: Excellent crab. I liked the Roast Crab better than the Drunken Crab, but bother were good. And you have to order the garlic noodles.

excerpts: I don't like getting my hands oily, but I got down n' dirty with the Roast Crab and it was worth it.
roast crab.author: Brent N.
roast crab.review: I don't like getting my hands oily, but I got down n' dirty with the Roast Crab and it was worth it.

excerpts: The roast crab just isnt the same as before... and is definitely overpriced... i prefer the way my mom makes garlic noodles now...
i definitely think this place is overrated.
My parents haven't been here in years and they dont plan on coming back anytime soon
roast crab.author: Anthony V.
roast crab.review: The roast crab just isnt the same as before... and is definitely overpriced... i prefer the way my mom makes garlic noodles now... i definitely think this place is overrated. My parents haven't been here in years and they dont plan on coming back anytime soon

excerpts: I order the roast crab and garlic noodles.
roast crab.author: Marjorie P.
roast crab.review:
This has to be one of my favorite restaurants ever!

Everytime I go there (probably about three times a year) I order the roast crab and garlic noodles.  I've tried other things, but these dishes are my fave!

The noodles cost about $10 and the crab goes for about 40 bucks each- a little steep compared to PPQ's or other similar places, but I personally taste the difference at Thanh Long's.  To me, it's more authentic.  Yeah, your breath smells like garlic the next morning, but it's so worth it. 

I usually go around 4pm, right when they open.  There's usually street parking at that time.  If you go around 7 or 8 you'll probably have to pay for valet parking.

excerpts: I love the house dishes ( garlic noodles and roast crab).
You must come to this restaurant and treat yourself to the most exquisite food in all of SF!!!
roast crab.author: Ramon M.
roast crab.review: The abosulte best in Vietnamese cuisine. I love the house dishes ( garlic noodles and roast crab). You must come to this restaurant and treat yourself to the most exquisite food in all of SF!!!

excerpts: The roast crab, drunken crab and garlic noodles are even more delicious than the rave reviews indicate.
The first bite of the roast crab had me sending up a prayer of gratitude to my higher power and the garlic noodles are viable addiction candidates.
The vanilla creme brulee and molten lava chocolate cake with vanilla gelato and grand marnier creme anglaise were fabulous.
If I could have eaten more, I would have!
A wonderful evening.
Parking is a beyotch though.
Valet is well worth it.
The first bite of the roast crab had me sending up a prayer of gratitude to my higher power and the garlic noodles are viable addiction candidates.
The vanilla creme brulee and molten lava chocolate cake with vanilla gelato and grand marnier creme anglaise were fabulous.
If I could have eaten more, I would have!
A wonderful evening.

roast crab.author: Jim A.
roast crab.review: My brother and his blushing new bride took me to dinner here tonight and it exceeded my expectations.  The roast crab, drunken crab and garlic noodles are even more delicious than the rave reviews indicate.  The first bite of the roast crab had me sending up a prayer of gratitude to my higher power and the garlic noodles are viable addiction candidates.  The vanilla creme brulee and molten lava chocolate cake with vanilla gelato and grand marnier creme anglaise were fabulous.  If I could have eaten more, I would have!  A wonderful evening.  Parking is a beyotch though.  Valet is well worth it.

excerpts: Everyone's hands were greased with garlic butter from the Roast Crab specialty, so we figured it may have slipped off while eating, or when wiping clean with the supplied towels.
The noodles are some of the best I've ever had, but the Drunken Crab was decidedly bland after being treated to the rich Roast Crab dish.
roast crab.author: Miss M.
roast crab.review:
During a family dinner at this restaurant, my brother in law lost his wedding ring.  

Everyone's hands were greased with garlic butter from the Roast Crab specialty, so we figured it may have slipped off while eating, or when wiping clean with the supplied towels.  

We asked the staff to check their laundry, dishwasher, anything in hopes that they might find the custom made ring.  Meanwhile we were scanning the floor to see if it had rolled off the table somewhere.  

Despite the upset, we went ahead and ordered dessert.  Halfway through, a waiter walked up and delivered the ring.  Turns out they actually went through the compost to find it.  

This place was already a family favorite, but the extra special attention they devoted to our problem was enough to motivate me to sign up for Yelp, just to review them.

As far as the food, ordering off the Secret Kitchen section of the menu is key.  The noodles are some of the best I've ever had, but the Drunken Crab was decidedly bland after being treated to the rich Roast Crab dish.

excerpts: I always order the roast crab and garlic noodles
and I'm always soooooo satisfied!!!!!!
YUM!
YUM!
YUM!
I'm so spoiled living so close to this place, but if I didn't I would drive to Thanh Long from anywhere just to eat there!!!!!!
roast crab.author: M R.
roast crab.review: I just ate there again last night (been going for years now).....I always order the roast crab and garlic noodles and I'm always soooooo satisfied!!!!!! YUM! YUM! YUM! I'm so spoiled living so close to this place, but if I didn't I would drive to Thanh Long from anywhere just to eat there!!!!!!

excerpts: Roast crab, garlic noodles and champagne are all you need.
Well, all I need...to enjoy the best that this place has to offer.
Superb attentive staff and your dishes are delivered so quick it's astounding.
You find yourself trying to figure out how it's all done when you know you should just sit back and enjoy that this place exists.
I even love the location away from all the scene and hustle.
People in here are friendly, chatty and happy to be there which make the experience that much better.
I don't have many tips, but know how to demolish a crab and be prepared to get messy, bibs are provided.
And, for people on dates...make sure your date doesn't eat just a salad.
That's not fun for anyone.
Pricey but well worth it and don't forget the desserts.
roast crab.author: William R.
roast crab.review: OMF! This place has the greatest delivery of crab ever. Secret kitchen style! And it really is a secret, the closest I got to any info was this past weekend when I sat next to their former food supplier rep and asked her what the secret was. She said they wouldn't tell her. As well they shouldn't. This place shows that hard work and industry secrets are a key to success, as well as great customer service. Roast crab, garlic noodles and champagne are all you need. Well, all I need...to enjoy the best that this place has to offer. Superb attentive staff and your dishes are delivered so quick it's astounding. You find yourself trying to figure out how it's all done when you know you should just sit back and enjoy that this place exists. I even love the location away from all the scene and hustle. People in here are friendly, chatty and happy to be there which make the experience that much better. I don't have many tips, but know how to demolish a crab and be prepared to get messy, bibs are provided. And, for people on dates...make sure your date doesn't eat just a salad. That's not fun for anyone. Pricey but well worth it and don't forget the desserts.

excerpts: The garlic noodles were garlicky enough... and the roast crab was pretty decent, but other than that, I really do not understand why people rave about this place.
roast crab.author: Evelyn L.
roast crab.review:
We had reservations and yet, we were made to wait. 

The garlic noodles were garlicky enough... and the roast crab was pretty decent, but other than that, I really do not understand why people rave about this place. Seriously.

The mango salad was kinda bland, totally un-Vietnamese... romaine lettuce with bits of mango and shrimp. I could have tossed it myself at home. The dungeness crab puffs were filled with mayonaise that you can't really taste any crab meat and they weren't 'puffy". They were basically mayonnaise wrapped in wanton skins.

The only saving grace was the molten chocolate cake, but served without much flair. The vanilla ice-cream served on the side weren't scoped out properly, it came out all mushed up with the whipped cream. So, I understand that Asians don't do desserts well, but a little imagination on presentation won't hurt. Afterall, we do eat with our eyes first, don't we?

Nothing much to talk about.  And, it burned a little hole in my wallet.  For that money, I could have a very decent meal at The Slanted Door and have no complains whatsoever. Or, perhaps a few meals at Vung Tau in San Jose. ;-)

A big disappointment.

excerpts: Roast crab and garlic noodles were fantastic.
They hook you up with a bib...a sign of a good meal to come.
Get the fried ice cream b/c it cuts right through that garlic.
A little spendy
but you get what you pay for.
roast crab.author: dizzle d.
roast crab.review: This place is a gem.  If there's a wait, grab a cocktail at the bar.  Coconut shrimp appetizer with dipping sauce started us on the right track.  Roast crab and garlic noodles were fantastic.  They hook you up with a bib...a sign of a good meal to come.  Get the fried ice cream b/c it cuts right through that garlic.  A little spendy but you get what you pay for.

excerpts: the roast crab and garlic noodles are yummy.
we also got the coconut shrimp which were pretty good but not stellar.
service was decent too.
i guess we came on a slow night because i didn't have trouble parking or getting seated.
definitely more convenient than crustaceans, and also a more casual feel.
roast crab.author: spiff e.
roast crab.review: what they say is true: the roast crab and garlic noodles are yummy.  we also got the coconut shrimp which were pretty good but not stellar.  service was decent too.  i guess we came on a slow night because i didn't have trouble parking or getting seated.  definitely more convenient than crustaceans, and also a more casual feel.

excerpts: i died and went to heaven eating the garlic noodles and roast crab.
roast crab.author: Michelle K.
roast crab.review: i died and went to heaven eating the garlic noodles and roast crab.

excerpts: And then me and the hubs split a Roast Crab, order of Garlic Noodles and an order of the Shaken Beef.
The Crab was delicious although I didn't eat much of it....
I let my hubby have most of it.
roast crab.author: BrElla4eva H.
roast crab.review: I've been wanting to go here because I've heard so many good things about their crab and garlic noodles. I'm a big fan of anything with garlic....not so much a big fan of crab (mainly because it's so much work just to gather all the meat). First off, parking was a bitch....took us a lil over 30 minutes to even find a spot.
