We were with a couple of friends who have been there before (well actually they've been to Crustacean before which I hear has the exact same menu), so we basically followed their lead on what to order. We all shared an order of the calamari...which was good but nothing extraordinary. And then me and the hubs split a Roast Crab, order of Garlic Noodles and an order of the Shaken Beef. The Crab was delicious although I didn't eat much of it....I let my hubby have most of it. Loved the Garlic Noodles but the hubby wasn't as excited about it as I was. He thought it was kinda plain...as in it was just noodles....no veggies mixed in. As for the beef dish, I wouldn't order it again. It wasn't all that bad but just not my cup of tea. Overall, I enjoyed my dinner BUT I did think it was overpriced.

excerpts: Of course if you are eating here, you have to get Garlic Noodles..and Roast Crab.
roast crab.author: Jennifer H.
roast crab.review: The crab was so fresh and there was so much crabmeat in one crab that it was enough for 2! Of course if you are eating here, you have to get Garlic Noodles..and Roast Crab. We also had Calamari for appetizer( 2 thumbs up) and Shaken Beef ( I did not like it and sent it back) The Shaken Beef had too much licorice/star anise flavor for my taste but the beef was really tender and cooked nicely. You can tell they used high quality cuts of beef because it kind of melts in your mouth it's so tender. Maybe good for old people or babies with no teeth... yes! it's THAT tender. Just wish the seasoning was a little different. Oh yea.. I almost forgot about the drink i had.. I had a mango blended drink and it came in a tiny champaine glass. I can't say that I will be back anytime soon because of the prices.. but it was definately worth it to try it for a special occasion! I had the best crab ever here..Mmmmm..

excerpts: We ordered the mango salad, Dungeness crab puffs, ginger calamari, Drunken Crab, Roast Crab and the garlic rice.
so the Boyfriend and I again followed the advice of our friend and ordered some garlic rice.
In terms of food, Thanh Long gets five stars.
The Parents loved the food.
The ginger calamari was well-seasoned, not too gingery and not too salty.
It was particularly yummy with the pineapples.
The mango salad was delicious (it has shrimp and scallops as well) and the garlic rice was flavorful without being overpowering.
The mango salad was delicious (it has shrimp and scallops as well) and the garlic rice was flavorful without being overpowering.
The Dungeness crab puffs were a big hit but pricey.
It was basically a tastier version of crab rangoon.
Now for the crab: right before ordering, the Boyfriend and I faithfully checked Yelp and some had said that the Roast Crab was too salty.
The Dad isn't too fond of wine-reduction
so we tried the Roast Crab first.
It was delicious and not too salty at all.
The waiter comes over with plastic bibs and you get to cracking (well...
the Boyfriend and the Dad got to cracking and then fed the Mom and me bits and pieces).
One crab is about enough for one person to be full.
One crab is about enough to make two grown men half-full so calculate accordingly.
We ordered the Drunken Crab to mix things up and it was also good.
It tastes much more Asian in that the wine reduction really saves the flavor of the crab - it's much more crabby than the Roast crab which is more seasoned.
The Dad and the Boyfriend liked the Roast Crab a little better, though, so if you want to choose one, I'd advise the Roast Crab.
Don't worry about messy/crabby hands.
The waitstaff comes by with hot (caution: extremely hot) warm towels for you to towel off between and after crab eating.
Finally, for dessert, we ordered orange sorbet.
It's really cute - it comes in a frozen orange that's been beheaded and the lemon sorbet comes in a frozen lemon that's been beheaded!
The only reason I won't give Thanh Long is that the prices are a bit high.
The crab is market price (which meant $37.50 each crab as of June 7, 2009) and the other dishes are pricey as well.
roast crab.author: Christine P.
roast crab.review: The Dad loves crab so when the Parents came up for the weekend, the Boyfriend and I decided to follow a friend's advice and take them to Thanh Long. The Parents are notoriously picky about food and the Dad is particularly so when it comes to crab. It has to be fresh, can't be over-seasoned and has to be meaty. Thank goodness for Thanh Long. We ordered the mango salad, Dungeness crab puffs, ginger calamari, Drunken Crab, Roast Crab and the garlic rice. The Boyfriend and I had heard that people loved the garlic noodles but the Parents didn't like the looks of it so the Boyfriend and I again followed the advice of our friend and ordered some garlic rice. In terms of food, Thanh Long gets five stars. The Parents loved the food. The ginger calamari was well-seasoned, not too gingery and not too salty. It was particularly yummy with the pineapples. The mango salad was delicious (it has shrimp and scallops as well) and the garlic rice was flavorful without being overpowering. The Dungeness crab puffs were a big hit but pricey. It was basically a tastier version of crab rangoon. Now for the crab: right before ordering, the Boyfriend and I faithfully checked Yelp and some had said that the Roast Crab was too salty. The Dad isn't too fond of wine-reduction so we tried the Roast Crab first. It was delicious and not too salty at all. The waiter comes over with plastic bibs and you get to cracking (well...the Boyfriend and the Dad got to cracking and then fed the Mom and me bits and pieces). One crab is about enough for one person to be full. One crab is about enough to make two grown men half-full so calculate accordingly. We ordered the Drunken Crab to mix things up and it was also good. It tastes much more Asian in that the wine reduction really saves the flavor of the crab - it's much more crabby than the Roast crab which is more seasoned. The Dad and the Boyfriend liked the Roast Crab a little better, though, so if you want to choose one, I'd advise the Roast Crab. Don't worry about messy/crabby hands. The waitstaff comes by with hot (caution: extremely hot) warm towels for you to towel off between and after crab eating. Finally, for dessert, we ordered orange sorbet. It's really cute - it comes in a frozen orange that's been beheaded and the lemon sorbet comes in a frozen lemon that's been beheaded! The only reason I won't give Thanh Long is that the prices are a bit high. The crab is market price (which meant $37.50 each crab as of June 7, 2009) and the other dishes are pricey as well.

excerpts: Took my old man for his b-day here...the roast crab was great, and the garlic noodles great...it was a great night to remember.
Great service, great food, great company.
Who could ask for more.
It's a bit on the pricy side, but it's not like we go here every week.
An indulgence every so often is necessary, and this is a great place to indulge yourself at.
roast crab.author: Ian L.
roast crab.review: Took my old man for his b-day here...the roast crab was great, and the garlic noodles great...it was a great night to remember.  Great service, great food, great company.  Who could ask for more.  It's a bit on the pricy side, but it's not like we go here every week.  An indulgence every so often is necessary, and this is a great place to indulge yourself at.

excerpts: When visiting, you must must must order the following dishes in order to ensure a fully satisfying meal: the roast crab, garlic noodles and shaken beef (extremely tender,flavorful beef cubes served over a bed of salad, cherry tomatoes, onions and cubed potatoes).
Follow those instructions and you'll thank me!
roast crab.author: Liss E.
roast crab.review: I've been a patron of this restaurant for at least 15 years. My parents used to take me to its sister restaurant Crustacean. When we discovered that there was a less expensive/casual sister restaurant, we tried it out and were hooked. Service is great, decor very mellow and quite romantic. All of their desserts are delicious so you won't be disappointed by any choice you make! My personal favorite is the lava cake. It's pretty rich so if sweet isn't your thing then pass on this. But the ice cream paired with it just makes it perfect! When visiting, you must must must order the following dishes in order to ensure a fully satisfying meal: the roast crab, garlic noodles and shaken beef (extremely tender,flavorful beef cubes served over a bed of salad, cherry tomatoes, onions and cubed potatoes). Follow those instructions and you'll thank me!

excerpts: Our table of five shared the famed roast crab ($36/crab), the garlic noodles, the jumbo prawns, spicy eggplant, salt and pepper calamari, Asian bouillabaisse, and banana cake for dessert.
The roast crab was a good size (about 2-2.5 lbs) so three of us shared one (alongside the other food).
Although pretty basic in theory, the garlic noodles were my favorite.
The roast crab was a close second - great flavor and juiciness.
Prawns weren't bad and calamari and eggplant were pretty standard (calamari was lukewarm).
Service was great, and the crowd inside was incredibly diverse (black, white, asian, everyone).
Although pricey, it's super closeby
roast crab.author: Melinda C.
roast crab.review: I'd been wanting to try this place for a long time, and at long last, I finally went this past Friday night.  What a random location for a pretty nice, high ambiance restaurant.  Per yelp recommendations, I made a reservation in advance so seating was easy.  Our table of five shared the famed roast crab ($36/crab), the garlic noodles, the jumbo prawns, spicy eggplant, salt and pepper calamari, Asian bouillabaisse, and banana cake for dessert.  The roast crab was a good size (about 2-2.5 lbs) so three of us shared one (alongside the other food).  Although pretty basic in theory, the garlic noodles were my favorite.  The roast crab was a close second - great flavor and juiciness.  Prawns weren't bad and calamari and eggplant were pretty standard (calamari was lukewarm).  Service was great, and the crowd inside was incredibly diverse (black, white, asian, everyone).  Although pricey, it's super closeby so I would go and try the drunken crab next time.

excerpts: it's all because of the roast crab.
it's sooooo good.
roast crab.author: Ro C.
roast crab.review: at 9pm on a saturday night this place was bustling like crazy.  standing outside the restaurant you can see most of the folks with plastic bibs around their neck.  it's all because of the roast crab.  it's sooooo good.   oh and the garlic noodles are definitely a must-have.  it seems so simple to make but there's something in that recipe that makes the garlic noodles one of their signature dishes.  the one dessert i loved was the fried banana with ice cream.  a definite treat at the end of the meal.  for big parties make sure 90% of your guests are with you otherwise the host won't let you sit at your table. service was good, staff was friendly.  it's a pretty loud atmosphere and you also get hot towels at the end of your crab meal so your fingers don't smell ;)

excerpts: the roast crab with garlic noodles are delicious.
i would rather dine here than their sister restaurant at crustacean's.
the dining room is more intimate.
gets crowded on the weekends.
service is delightful.
try their grilled jumbo prawns.
parking could be a problem.
They do have valet parking.
roast crab.author: Mika D.
roast crab.review: make sure to reserve a table. the roast crab with garlic noodles are delicious. i would rather dine here than their sister restaurant at crustacean's. the dining room is more intimate. gets crowded on the weekends. service is delightful. try their grilled jumbo prawns. parking could be a problem. They do have valet parking.

excerpts: The roast crab was DELICIOUS!!
It was really good.
I didn't enjoy it as much when the crab became cold.
It's served in a puddle of butter that started to congeal at the end of the meal.
It wasn't a pretty site.
I felt like my arteries were clogging instantly.
roast crab.author: Cynthia S.
roast crab.review: I was excited to eat here especially after finding out that they share the same owners as crustaceans. I honestly didn't know what to expect because my friends from Hawaii who were visiting suggested to go to this place. Apparently this place has a reputation even in Hawaii. I was pleasantly surprised to find this place in my own backyard. I wasn't expecting this restaurant to be in the suburbs in the outer sunset. Parking was terrible so my friends and I opted for  valet. I think it was $10. We ordered the soft shell crab and salt and pepper calamari for appetizers and  the roast  crab and garlic noodles for the entree. The soft shell crab was very good. They give you one small deep fried soft shell crab with sweet & sour dipping sauce. The salt & pepper calamari was decent. I thought it was a little too salty for my taste. It left me wanting to take a sip of H2O every time I took a bite. The roast crab was DELICIOUS!! It was really good. I didn't enjoy it as much when the crab became cold. It's served in a puddle of butter that started to congeal at the end of the meal. It wasn't a pretty site. I felt like my arteries were clogging instantly. Every one there seemed to be eating the garlic noodles. We were curious and ordered it as well. I  personally wasn't impressed. It was a pretty simple dish. I think I could have gone without it.  Overall, I give this place 4 stars due to the fact that it was expensive, the lack of parking, and the buttery greasy taste it left in my mouth for the rest of the day.

excerpts: Been a regular and eating at this Thanh Long since those $11.00 Roast Crab days in the mid-to late 80's.
The roast crab taste is constant, gotta luv it.
The service last night is not what it used to be.
Servers are in such a hurry that when they walk behind you, a tornado spins around and you know a server just came by.
They sure forgot to smile too and are no longer hospitable, accomodating  the way they used to be.
Even the manager is not friendly anymore.
All just straight business, all dollars and cents.
They have lost that "family" atmosphere and feeling we used to get from that place.
The other bad thing about them lately?
The reservation clerk.
I called after 3pm Thursday and made a reservation and who ever answered my call made me feel like I was talking to a drill sergeant.
She was in a big hurry and just way-too harsh when she speaks.
You know, the kind that shows, "no respect" to the caller/patron?
So I asked her why she's too harsh, she said she takes in some 300 phone calls a day.
I did not want to be rude
so I said, it's alright, it's ok.
I was still nice to her.

But in my mind, unless she's doing these as a volunteer for no-pay, which is out-of-the-question, it is safe to assume that she is an employee who's getting paid to answer that phone to take and cancel reservations.

So she needs to learn how to be very nice, cordial and professional, talk slowly and gently to the people who are their customers, especially the famous Roast Crab now costs $39;  the Shaken Beef is $24; and Garlic Noodles at $10 each + tax.

My bill totalled up almost $400 and I still got the feeling that they are trying to rush me out of the door after we ate the banana ala mode, which by the way had a rotten-black banana inside that thick fried flour, that is why I had to ask for another.
They all need to chill out.
The clerk needs to enroll in some telephone etiquette class real quick, otherwise, people will get upset with their piss-poor manners.
Oh BTW, does the An Family (Danny) still own and run this business
or it's been sold to those new owners?
I don't recognize anyone there anymore.
Not one familiar face anywhere.
That place is going down quite fast .
The service sucks.
It used to be nice.
roast crab.author: Jimmie D.
roast crab.review: Been a regular and eating at this Thanh Long since those $11.00 Roast Crab days in the mid-to late 80's.  The roast crab taste is constant, gotta luv it.  The service last night is not what it used to be.  Servers are in such a hurry that when they walk behind you, a tornado spins around and you know a server just came by.  They sure forgot to smile too and are no longer hospitable, accomodating  the way they used to be.  Even the manager is not friendly anymore.  All just straight business, all dollars and cents. They have lost that "family" atmosphere and feeling we used to get from that place.  The other bad thing about them lately?  The reservation clerk.  I called after 3pm Thursday and made a reservation and who ever answered my call made me feel like I was talking to a drill sergeant.  She was in a big hurry and just way-too harsh when she speaks.  You know, the kind that shows, "no respect" to the caller/patron?  So I asked her why she's too harsh, she said she takes in some 300 phone calls a day.  I did not want to be rude so I said, it's alright, it's ok.  I was still nice to her.  But in my mind, unless she's doing these as a volunteer for no-pay, which is out-of-the-question, it is safe to assume that she is an employee who's getting paid to answer that phone to take and cancel reservations.  So she needs to learn how to be very nice, cordial and professional, talk slowly and gently to the people who are their customers, especially the famous Roast Crab now costs $39;  the Shaken Beef is $24; and Garlic Noodles at $10 each + tax.  My bill totalled up almost $400 and I still got the feeling that they are trying to rush me out of the door after we ate the banana ala mode, which by the way had a rotten-black banana inside that thick fried flour, that is why I had to ask for another.  They all need to chill out.  The clerk needs to enroll in some telephone etiquette class real quick, otherwise, people will get upset with their piss-poor manners.  Oh BTW, does the An Family (Danny) still own and run this business or it's been sold to those new owners?  I don't recognize anyone there anymore.  Not one familiar face anywhere.  That place is going down quite fast .  The service sucks. It used to be nice.

excerpts: first thing you'll notice is that every single table has the exact same dishes:  roast crab and garlic noodles.
so i tried to be original and ordered roast crab and
it was still good, but i guess i'll have to go back and try the garlic noodles now.
oh, definitely make reservations ahead of time.
went on a whim and ended up waiting 1.5 hours before being seated.
roast crab.author: Eric M.
roast crab.review: kinda far out there but definitely worth going to if you're in the mood for some crab.  first thing you'll notice is that every single table has the exact same dishes:  roast crab and garlic noodles.  so i tried to be original and ordered roast crab and......................fried rice.  it was still good, but i guess i'll have to go back and try the garlic noodles now.  oh, definitely make reservations ahead of time.  went on a whim and ended up waiting 1.5 hours before being seated.

excerpts: I had the roast crab and garlic noodles, where my hubby got the tamarind version (surprisingly a little sweet).
Because getting the noodles with the roast crab was a little too much butter for me.
I should have had a side of white rice.
Oh well.
We had dessert which was really yummy, green tea creme brulee.
I think that meal fulfilled my craving for crab for a while.
On a funny note: my husband likes to crack his crab before eating it so he can wash his hands.
roast crab.author: Jasmin D.
roast crab.review: I had a craving for garlic noodles and crab so the hubby and I scooted our way to SF. We arrived at just before 5 pm and there was already a crowd waiting to get in. I had the roast crab and garlic noodles, where my hubby got the tamarind version (surprisingly a little sweet). I would normally get the drunken crab but I wasn't sure if it was okay with a little one on the way. Because getting the noodles with the roast crab was a little too much butter for me. I should have had a side of white rice. Oh well. We had dessert which was really yummy, green tea creme brulee. I think that meal fulfilled my craving for crab for a while. On a funny note: my husband likes to crack his crab before eating it so he can wash his hands. While he was in the bathroom, the table next to us, requested garlic noodles with the crab already cracked. The waiter had to tell them, that it wasn't on the menu...sorry.

excerpts: Roast Crab is SO MUCH BETTER than the Drunken Crab.
drunken crab.author: Nari C.
drunken crab.review:
Came here multiple times. LOVE this place!

My three favorites: Roast Crab, Tiger Prawns, and Garlic noodles. The Tiger Prawns already come with a bed of garlic noodles, so depending on your party size, it's bang for your buck. If you are a party of 2, I recommend one crab and one tiger prawn entree. If you are a party of 3, I recommend minimum of two crabs. 

Roast Crab is SO MUCH BETTER than the Drunken Crab. More flavorful and savory. 

The Roast Crab was $58 when I went. 

Enjoy!

excerpts: My sister did all the ordering; Drunken Crab/Tamarind Crab/Roasted Crab/Garlic Noodles/Salt & Pepper Calamari/Lemongrass Beef Skewers/Spicy Eggplant/Mango Salad/Shrimp Fried Rice/Steamed Seabass.
Garlic noodles were overcooked/soggy and didn't have enough garlic flavor.
All the portions were pretty small.
The crabs tasted average; nothing special.
PPQ
Dungeness is better in my opinion.
Glad
I got to finally try Thanh Long but not impressed with the food.
drunken crab.author: Karen L.
drunken crab.review:
Located on a corner. Looks sorta like a house from the outside. Parking was hard to find. Valet option $13. Came here for my sister's 26th birthday since we heard a lot of great things about this place. We had a party of 7; did a same day reservation. Anyway, arrived 15m early and hung out at the bar in front for a bit. Thanks bartender for the great tasting Virgin Mango Daiquiri!

We were taken upstairs to be seated. My sister did all the ordering; Drunken Crab/Tamarind Crab/Roasted Crab/Garlic Noodles/Salt & Pepper Calamari/Lemongrass Beef Skewers/Spicy Eggplant/Mango Salad/Shrimp Fried Rice/Steamed Seabass. 

All of the food was "okay." Garlic noodles were overcooked/soggy and didn't have enough garlic flavor. All the portions were pretty small. The crabs tasted average; nothing special. PPQ Dungeness is better in my opinion. Glad I got to finally try Thanh Long but not impressed with the food.

excerpts: Drunken crab simmered in that Chardonnay, sake and brandy and dipping our garlic noodles in it is
oh so good!
drunken crab.author: Valerie K.
drunken crab.review: All the way from Sacramento to get our Thanh Long fix once again!  We know the crab is excellent! Drunken crab simmered in that Chardonnay, sake and brandy and dipping our garlic noodles in it is oh so good! The succulent steamed sea bass is a must as well with that delicious ginger and citrus infused dipping sauce!  Walked in at 6pm (no reservations) and luckily was seated right away.  Since parking is a challenge here, no 5-star but the food is simply delightful!

excerpts: The drunken crab was also good, but their garlic noodles were delicious.
If you're going to order anything, just always make sure you have whatever it is that you're having with their garlic noodles.
drunken crab.author: Minh-Thao N.
drunken crab.review:
I've heard nothing but great things about the place from my friends. It's a nice little restaurant close by the beach. Not much variety on their menu, but with what they have they do really well. My girlfriend and I ordered the chicken satay and the crab won tons. The chicken satay was OK and a bit on the dry side, but the the crab won tons were great. The drunken crab was also good, but their garlic noodles were delicious. I loved the texture and the garlic taste. 

If you're going to order anything, just always make sure you have whatever it is that you're having with their garlic noodles.

excerpts: We had the drunken crab and garlic noodles and it was amazing.
We were sat, ordered and eating in less than ten minutes.
I would recommend making a reservation even if during the week.
We ate on Thursday night and it was packed.
Loved the food and when they say "garlic" that is not a game!
Great seasonings, great taste, very clean establishment and a good time all around.
Last thing, after you finish they bring out warm towels because eating crab legs is messy.
A smart plus!
drunken crab.author: Kristy T.
drunken crab.review: I don't even know how to describe his kind of food but it was AMAZING! Definitely in my top 10 places for seafood. We had the drunken crab and garlic noodles and it was amazing. We were sat, ordered and eating in less than ten minutes. I would recommend making a reservation even if during the week. We ate on Thursday night and it was packed. Loved the food and when they say "garlic" that is not a game! Great seasonings, great taste, very clean establishment and a good time all around. Last thing, after you finish they bring out warm towels because eating crab legs is messy. A smart plus!

excerpts: The drunken crab is pretty bland and not that great.
drunken crab.author: Jennifer W.
drunken crab.review:
This place is definitely not as good as PPQ and is more expensive. I would pass on this place after trying it once. 

The roast crab is the best flavor, but even that is fairly bland. The drunken crab is pretty bland and not that great. The garlic noodles have no garlic flavor; all you can taste is butter. I've never been a fan of shaken beef anywhere, but this place's was okay. The calamari was decent/good. 

Good service at this restaurant, large space, easy to find parking. Otherwise, taste-wise, price-wise, really no redeeming value.

excerpts: My gf had the drunken crab and the garlic noodles with tiger prawns.
As I start eat my crab I noticed that it wasn't clean.
The waiter took it back and brought me another one.
No Biggie.
Before I even dig in
I see it's not clean again.
Im not sure about everyone else
but when it comes to seafood it should be cleaned and cleaned good.
I looked at my girlfriends plate and her crab was clean.
I'm not sure if it was because we ordered different seasoning types of crabs but hers' was perfect.
Needless to say my first experience was pretty much ruined.
drunken crab.author: Nialah C.
drunken crab.review: This was my first time going here.I had huge expectations for this restaurant from all the rave reviews, I came here with my girlfriend for our anniversary. I heard the roasted crab was good and the garlic noodles with the tiger prawns as well so that's what I ordered. My gf had the drunken crab and the garlic noodles with tiger prawns. As I start eat my crab I noticed that it wasn't clean. The waiter took it back and brought me another one. No Biggie. Before I even dig in I see it's not clean again. Im not sure about everyone else but when it comes to seafood it should be cleaned and cleaned good. I looked at my girlfriends plate and her crab was clean. I'm not sure if it was because we ordered different seasoning types of crabs but hers' was perfect. Needless to say my first experience was pretty much ruined.

excerpts: The Drunken Crab is my favorite and I have tried them all.
This place is always packed and there is almost always a wait, but it is totally worth it!
drunken crab.author: Sarah O.
drunken crab.review: Where do I start?  Well, usually with a cocktail and then with some garlic rice and/or garlic noodles. Then it's all about the crab!  The Drunken Crab is my favorite and I have tried them all. This place is always packed and there is almost always a wait, but it is totally worth it!

excerpts: Came here with a group of four and got the shaken beef, 2 orders of garlic noodles (obvi), roast crab, and drunken crab.
More than enough to feed four hungry hippos.
The garlic noodles were perfection, the shaken beef was tender and melted in our mouths.
The garlic noodles were perfection, the shaken beef was tender and melted in our mouths.
I preferred the roast crab over the drunken crab, but only by a little.
I preferred the roast crab over the drunken crab, but only by a little.
drunken crab.author: Selena L.
drunken crab.review:
Came here with a group of four and got the shaken beef, 2 orders of garlic noodles (obvi), roast crab, and drunken crab. More than enough to feed four hungry hippos. The garlic noodles were perfection, the shaken beef was tender and melted in our mouths. I preferred the roast crab over the drunken crab, but only by a little. You really can't go wrong.

2 floors, valet parking ($12), full bar, call for reservations if you don't want to be waiting forever.

excerpts: Roast and Drunken Crab:  good amount of spices
but I feel that the crabs at another similar restaurant has bigger ones.
Still good though.
drunken crab.author: Erna M.
drunken crab.review:
First time here and we enjoyed our time.  Definitely recommend making reservations because this place gets really packed!  We were seated upstairs which was nice because it wasn't noisy like downstairs.  The staff were friendly and fast!  Very attentive in emptying out the shells from our bowls and refilling our drinks.   So as far as the food, my review is as follows:
1.  Salt & Pepper Calamari:  great!  Right amount of salt and pepper and the calamari was very tender; not chewy at all.
2.  Villager's Favorite (prawns & pork medallions):  a definite must try!  The sauce is what made this dish absolutely!  A lot of flavors but yet so simple.
3.  Roast and Drunken Crab:  good amount of spices but I feel that the crabs at another similar restaurant has bigger ones.  Still good though.
4.  Garlic Noodles:  amazing!  Probably the best garlic noodles I've eaten amongst other places here in the Bay area.
Overall gave this place 4 stars because food was good, service was great but took off a star because of parking. Although they had a valet service for $12 flat rate, street parking was a little difficult to find. But will definitely eat here again when I want my fix.

excerpts: I definitely enjoyed their Drunken Crab but was disappointed by their garlic noodles.
But I was not the only one; all the members at my table, who are all Thanh Long fans, had the same opinion.
Both the crab and garlic noodles were good but after hearing and reading rave reviews, I expected a little more.
drunken crab.author: Andrew W.
drunken crab.review: After a decade of walking past Thanh Long, I finally got to try it. I definitely enjoyed their Drunken Crab but was disappointed by their garlic noodles. But I was not the only one; all the members at my table, who are all Thanh Long fans, had the same opinion. Both the crab and garlic noodles were good but after hearing and reading rave reviews, I expected a little more.

excerpts: We got the roasted crab, which was too salty (albeit good) and drunken crab (a bit bland).
Very loud.
Could barely hear our own party speak to one another.
Pretty dark.
We were sat in the corner of the room where lighting was dim, so we had to ask for a candle for a table, which they gave to us.
Valet parking is $12,
so you're most likely better off finding street parking.
We luckily found a spot only one block away.
Hot towel was provided at the end, which was a nice touch.
Not sure if this is good or bad, but I called to see if there was space for a party of 4 for dinner, and I was told that they were full for the night.
We decided to show up anyway, and were surprisingly sat within 20 minutes!
drunken crab.author: Jonathan B K.
drunken crab.review:
In short, #NotWorthIt.

1) Very expensive. Crab was $54. We got the roasted crab, which was too salty (albeit good) and drunken crab (a bit bland). 
2) Very loud. Could barely hear our own party speak to one another.
3) Pretty dark. We were sat in the corner of the room where lighting was dim, so we had to ask for a candle for a table, which they gave to us.
4) Valet parking is $12, so you're most likely better off finding street parking. We luckily found a spot only one block away.
5) Hot towel was provided at the end, which was a nice touch.
6) Not sure if this is good or bad, but I called to see if there was space for a party of 4 for dinner, and I was told that they were full for the night. We decided to show up anyway, and were surprisingly sat within 20 minutes! Woohoo!

I realize that 2-stars might be harsh for this popular restaurant, but correlating it with "Meh. I've experienced better" is exactly how I feel. For this price point and experience, I feel as if there are many better restaurants with seafood that tastes better and is cheaper.

excerpts: we had our usual tamarind and drunken crab w garlic noodles.
Even our drinks were not as good.
Even the appetizers were just no better than your neighborhood Chinese restaurant.
Overall the food was just so so and certainly NOT worth the bill!!
But the service was excellent.
For the price, we will NOT be back.
drunken crab.author: Lifespassion B.
drunken crab.review: Ate here many times before and loved it. Not so much this time. Food not as good we had our usual tamarind and drunken crab w garlic noodles. Even our drinks were not as good. Even the appetizers were just no better than your neighborhood Chinese restaurant. Overall the food was just so so and certainly NOT worth the bill!! But the service was excellent. For the price, we will NOT be back.

excerpts:
$300 for 2 roast crab, 1 drunken crab, one prawn w/ garlic noodle, stir fry squid in tomato sauce, a side of garlic rice for $8.50....wtf...and a heineken beer.  
Roast crab tasted like butter and black pepper, the drunken crab came with a big ass bowl of soup that tasted like bland chicken stock with some green onions thrown inside.

Roast crab tasted like butter and black pepper, the drunken crab came with a big ass bowl of soup that tasted like bland chicken stock with some green onions thrown inside.
drunken crab.author: Cyrus P.
drunken crab.review:
$300 for 2 roast crab, 1 drunken crab, one prawn w/ garlic noodle, stir fry squid in tomato sauce, a side of garlic rice for $8.50....wtf...and a heineken beer.  I also ordered the mussels in ginger sauce and asked the waitress if she'll remember everything I ordered and she said "Of course!"...never got our mussels, think we paid for it to.

The garlic noodles were disgusting....over cooked...OVER COOKED...I didn't taste any fresh garlic on there.  All I tasted was butter with powdered Parmesan cheese and most likely powdered garlic.  Roast crab tasted like butter and black pepper, the drunken crab came with a big ass bowl of soup that tasted like bland chicken stock with some green onions thrown inside.

$300.......not worth it.  This place is still alive because of it's past recognition, but so sorry to say it's well past that time for this place.

excerpts: I usually order the roasted crab and drunken crab.
I preferably like the roasted crab vs the drunken crab.
I usually order one order of the jasmine rice, and dip the rice in the roasted crab sauce.
I feel that the drunken crab doesn't have too much taste to it, and its more watered down.
drunken crab.author: Tiffany K.
drunken crab.review:
I've been coming here for years and Thanh Long never changes! 

The good and workers are great and quick to get your order down and food comes out fairly quick. We always order as starts the soft shell crab and calamari , I always (its a must) order two or more orders of the garlic noodles, and two crabs if your with 3-4 people that is. 

I usually order the roasted crab and drunken crab. I preferably like the roasted crab vs the drunken crab. I usually order one order of the jasmine rice, and dip the rice in the roasted crab sauce.  I feel that the drunken crab doesn't have too much taste to it, and its more watered down. 

Also I usually order the beef cub dish, and its super good and flavorful.  The sea bass was pretty good too , although Im not a huge fan of fish it was good. 


Anyways this place gets packed quick, so I high advise to make a reservation. Parking is crazy there too, so I usaully valet so its easier but if oyu decide to find street parking good luck !

excerpts: Drunken Crab-Honestly after tasting the roast crab, the drunken crab tastes a little bland.
Roast Crab-
The best!It was so flavorful!Crab was tender and
drunken crab.author: Bella T.
drunken crab.review:
Me and my Husband were in SF for the weekend and our relatives brought us here for dinner. Its a nice and cozy family style restaurant.
Our Orders:

1. Garlic Noodles-I've read lots of reviews about it.It was tasty, but after eating it for quite sometime you'll feel that you need to stop.Probably the garlic taste?

2. Vegetarian Delight-Wasn't too impressed with it.It tasted a little bland but it had a good amount of different veggies and tofu.

3.Colossal Royal Tiger Prawns-The prawns came with garlic noodles.Prawns were flavorful and yummy.

4. Drunken Crab-Honestly after tasting the roast crab, the drunken crab tastes a little bland.

5. Roast Crab-The best!It was so flavorful!Crab was tender and you just feel like you can't stop.

Dessert we ordered fried pineapple with ice cream and it was a great ending to our dinner.Would definitely go back for the roasted crab.Service was excellent.

Best time to come is at 5:30 or maybe a little before 6pm.After that the line starts.Or better call and reserve a place.Enjoy!

excerpts:
Two of us ate 1 roasted crab, 1 tamarind crab, and 1 drunken crab along with garlic noodles.

the drunken crab came with alcohol sauce (I think it's beer) and it's kinda bland.
drunken crab.author: Steve N.
drunken crab.review:
We've heard about this restaurant for while and finally made our way there for taste test last night.  We were quite disappointed.  Definitely  were not impressed.

Two of us ate 1 roasted crab, 1 tamarind crab, and 1 drunken crab along with garlic noodles.

The tamarind and drunken crabs were cooked by boiling in water and put together with the sauce before serving so they weren't that tasty.   Tamarind sauce was water down and not tasty as stand alone sauce.  the drunken crab came with alcohol sauce (I think it's beer) and it's kinda bland. 

Roasted crab was better than the other two.  It served with traditional Vietnamese salt and crack black pepper with (I think) olive oil sauce.  Very basic Vietnamese traditional sauce.

at $55 a crab, I would say it's over rated

definitely not deserve a 2nd visit

excerpts: The toast crab and drunken crab is very good.
drunken crab.author: Michael G.
drunken crab.review: The best crab in town. The toast crab and drunken crab is very good. Not so much the tamarind crab. Why order that when roast crab is right above it on the menu. Make your dinner surf 'n turf by adding the Shaken Beef. Meat is so tender and full of flavor. Goes well with garlic noodles, roast crab and any wine.

excerpts: I recently tried the drunken crab, if I had never had the roasted crab, it would be my favorite.
Since I am in love with the roasted, drunken crab is a very respectable second.
drunken crab.author: Oddette A.
drunken crab.review:
If you are a lover of crab, then savoring on the secret recipe roasted crab at Thang Long is a must.  Any crab roasted in their oven has been privileged to be there. I have been dining there for over 20 years and I have never been disappointed. The service equals the food.  If I lived closer I'd have a table with my name on it.  Then there is the garlic noodles.  OMG!  Don't forget the salt and pepper calamari appetizer.  I recently tried the drunken crab, if I had never had the roasted crab, it would be my favorite.  Since I am in love with the roasted, drunken crab is a very respectable second.

Make reservations and use the valet parking for a stress free experience.

I love Thang Long!

excerpts: I also got the drunken crab which was delicious as well.
The crab can get pricey, but you do get what you pay for.
drunken crab.author: Amy E.
drunken crab.review: YUM.  Best place to get crab.  The crab is roasted so beautifully and has great flavor.  Garlic noodles, of course, must go with your meal as well. I also got the drunken crab which was delicious as well.  The crab can get pricey, but you do get what you pay for. I also enjoyed on of my favorite Vietnamese dishes, shaken beef (or Bo luc lac). I will definitely come back to revel in this deliciousness.

excerpts: It was so good that we decided to get the drunken crab too.
Although that one was good as well, I think I still prefer the roasted crab.
To me, it just had a better flavor.
drunken crab.author: Allison S.
drunken crab.review:
I loved this place!! Really impressed with both the crab and garlic noodles. The roasted crab was buttery and the crab meat just fell off the shell because it was so fresh. It was so good that we decided to get the drunken crab too. Although that one was good as well, I think I still prefer the roasted crab. To me, it just had a better flavor. I was apprehensive that the garlic noodles would be dry but they were moist and garlicky. Yum. We also got the grilled calamari and the filet beef. Those were okay but I would stick with the crab and noodles. I should also note that it's probably a once in a while kind of meal because it is so buttery and rich, but it's worth it!

P.S. We saw two girls each order a whole crab when we sat down... and they both packed half to go! WEAK! I could eat a whole crab myself. :)

excerpts: And the drunken crab for variety.
So right at this moment, I'm going to tell you to STOP and only order the roasted crab.
You need more reassurance?
ONLY ORDER THE ROASTED CRAB.
I did not think the drunken crab was bad but it did not hold a candle to the roasted crab!!!
The flavor in the roasted crab was perfect, strong and mouth-watering.
While the drunken crab was also tickling my palette, it definitely did not have the same sort of WOW factor that the roasted crab did, so do it.
drunken crab.author: Winè C.
drunken crab.review:
I do think Thanh Long is overrated, I think they are way more hyped up than they deserve (Then again, I guess there aren't many places I don't feel that way about), but I don't think they're bad! I think that insane line in front of it has to go and the crab should be slightly less expensive.

With all of that said, the SO took me here for my birthday dinner! (We have been together for way too long to not be eating with our hands and spraying each other with crab juices, I suppose) This crab was super hyped up by the other, making me having lower expectations (sometimes the idea of something is much better than itself). We parked two blocks away (normal SF parking problems) and entered a ridiculously hustling and bustling restaurant though there wasn't a soul outside!

We were sat quickly and immediately already knew kind of what we wanted. The roasted garlic crab, which is a must! And the drunken crab for variety. So right at this moment, I'm going to tell you to STOP and only order the roasted crab. You need more reassurance? ONLY ORDER THE ROASTED CRAB. I did not think the drunken crab was bad but it did not hold a candle to the roasted crab!!! The flavor in the roasted crab was perfect, strong and mouth-watering. While the drunken crab was also tickling my palette, it definitely did not have the same sort of WOW factor that the roasted crab did, so do it. And order two so nobody has to fork the other's hand!

It took us quite some time to wait for the crab to cool off enough to peel, then it took us awhile to peel the crab. In between all of that, both of the crabs got cold, of course! So our server warmed it up for us! As this as an option, please keep it in mind! Warm crab tastes much better than cold crab!

After highly indulging ourselves to the max, they surprised me with a birthday cake (I'm actually pretty sure the SO had to pay for it but at least they gave us the candle)! Yay!

So come! Make reservations! And be merry!

Enjoy!

excerpts: Simply put...the best drunken crab and garlic noodles in the Bay Area!
Tiger prawns are delicious as well!
Be prepared to spend some $$$!
drunken crab.author: Chris C.
drunken crab.review: Simply put...the best drunken crab and garlic noodles in the Bay Area!  Tiger prawns are delicious as well!  Be prepared to spend some $$$!

excerpts:
*DRUNKEN CRAB w/ Chardonnay, Sake, Brandy, Scallions & Black Pepper (~$38) - 4 STARS
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/z9CN58fSrA46ggyb6OnCnQ?select=ObzTM78quAF_QKol4BqGcA
If you're more of a crab purist (or an alcoholic) and like to taste it in its unadulterated form, then the Drunken Crab is the way to go.
The meat was clean tasting and you can taste all its natural sweetness.
drunken crab.author: Cherylynn N.
drunken crab.review:
R&G vs. PPQ vs. Thanh Long: Who's Reigns Supreme?

If you're a San Franciscan and/or a foodie, you probably know or have heard the TOP 3 places to go for crab in SF is R&G, PPQ, and Thanh Long. Although I've downgraded my review for both R&G and PPQ because of horrible service at our follow-up visits, as far as taste goes, in my opinion Thanh Long is at the bottom of the three.

On Sunday, 7.24.11, my friends and I came to Thanh Long for our quarterly crab dinner. It was my first time and my friends' third time here. We had reservations for 5:30 PM which I made several days prior. Thanh Long place gets packed, so reservations are highly recommended. Upon arrival we were promptly seated. 

As most Yelpers have mentioned, you can forget about looking at the menu because there are only TWO THINGS to order at Thanh Long: THE CRAB and the GARLIC NOODLES! And given the rave reviews and hype, I didn't care to order anything else. 

F O O D
For a party of three we ordered:

*ROASTED CRAB w/ An's Garlic Sauce & Spices (~$38) - 4 STARS
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/z9CN58fSrA46ggyb6OnCnQ?select=JuuVdF8Q2UIeOFAYHPHX8Q
Upon first glance, I was wondering where all the garlic was. The garlic "sauce" was more of oil infused with garlic and black pepper. Though fragrant, the garlic flavor wasn't anywhere as pronounced as PPQ's Roasted Crab and the sauce was merely oil which left a heavy feeling after dinner. The crab was fresh and perfectly roasted though which was evident in the sweet, tender, succulent meat. 

*DRUNKEN CRAB w/ Chardonnay, Sake, Brandy, Scallions & Black Pepper (~$38) - 4 STARS
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/z9CN58fSrA46ggyb6OnCnQ?select=ObzTM78quAF_QKol4BqGcA
If you're more of a crab purist (or an alcoholic) and like to taste it in its unadulterated form, then the Drunken Crab is the way to go. The meat was clean tasting and you can taste all its natural sweetness. It was lightly infused with the trio of alkies, though sake was the most prominent flavor giving it a subtle dry wine flavor.

*GARLIC NOODLES w/ Special Garlic Sauce & Spices (2 orders @ $9.50/each) - 3 STARS
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/z9CN58fSrA46ggyb6OnCnQ?select=JUXoSeXnlJljPgzqmexqAg
Garlic noodles and any solid noodle dish for that matter should be al-dente with a nice, chewy toothsome bite to it to show its freshness and proper execution. Though deliciously buttery and fragrant with lots of garlicky bits, Thanh Long's garlic noodles were choppy and mushy. 

Please note: Thanh Long uses tons of MSG to flavor their food; enough to keep me waking up in the middle of night and running to the kitchen to get a glass of water to sooth my dry throat. 

S E R V I C E
Let's just say the busboy was way more attentive than our waiter. The only thing our waiter did was take our order, bring our food and give us our bill; he never once checked on us. I wasn't surprised though as we have ran into the same service issues at R&G and PPQ and subpar service seems to be a reoccurring theme at many Asian restaurants. The only redeeming thing is our food came out less than 10 minutes after ordering. 

A M BI AN C E / D E C O R
A step above your typical Vietnamese restaurant, Thanh Long has crisp white linen tables and the waitstaff don purple mandarin collared attire. A fairly large restaurant, Thanh Long is a good option for large parties and family dinners. I noticed that a lot of people were on dates though it's very, very loud at Thanh Long.

P A R K I N G
Although I got lucky and found parking in less than 5 minutes across the street, I heard finding street parking can be very difficult in the area. Valet parking is available for $10. 

Compared to R&G (known for their Salt & Pepper Crab), R&G's crab has much more intense flavor with a spicy kick and the fried batter gives it a nice crispy texture contrast to the sweet, tender crab meat. PPQ's Roasted Crab is heavily covered in buttery garlic and each bite is like a garlic clove has exploded in your mouth which is different than Thanh Long's crab which is more subdued sitting in a wading pool of garlic infused oil and black pepper.

So, who reigns supreme? It all boils down to what flavors you're looking for. If want something deliciously salty and spicy with a crunch, R&G's Salt & Pepper is the King. However, if you want something sinfully rich with a strong BURST of garlicky flavor, than PPQ's Roasted Crab definitely trumps Thanh Long's. But don't take my word for it, you be the judge...

excerpts: Of course my companions had the Drunken crab, which even looking at, was making me sick ( I could see their boiled eyes...
gross!)
All-in-all was a good night, pricey, but worth the trip.
drunken crab.author: Lauren S.
drunken crab.review:
Thanh Long might be in the Outer Sunset of SF but it's more like Outer Space.. 

Between the ride and the parking I was just about to be thru. Thankfully I was happily satisfied by the attention given and wonderful meal prepared for me and my friends.

If you are a crab lover( which I am allergic) then this is the place for you...If not you have some wicked good alternatives. I ended up with the salt and pepper calamari, jumbo prawn wontons, and the infamous garlic noodles. Then I washed it all down with this smooth drink called a "Flying Dragon". 

Of course my companions had the Drunken crab, which even looking at, was making me sick ( I could see their boiled eyes...gross!) All-in-all was a good night, pricey, but worth the trip.

excerpts:
We ordered quite a spread:

Roasted Crab
(Sorry no pic)

Drunken Crab
(http://bit.ly/1vOrEzI)
Very flavorful, especially the Roasted Crab which I liked the best between that and the Drunken Crab.
drunken crab.author: Rodney H.
drunken crab.review:
We treated my mom at Thanh Long for Mother's Day as she had a huge craving for really good crabs.  And even though it's been more than 10 years since I've been here, their crabs are still top notch!

We arrived a little late for for our reservation but they managed to hold our table which was cool on their part considering that it was for Mother's Day.

We ordered quite a spread:

Roasted Crab
(Sorry no pic)

Drunken Crab
(http://bit.ly/1vOrEzI)

Two orders of Garlic Noodles
(http://bit.ly/1vNfkkq)

Shaken Beef
(http://bit.ly/1rYhton)

Seasonal Vegetables
(Sorry No Pic)

Bowl of rice (why not?)
(No pic needed)

And their Banana Cake for Dessert
(http://bit.ly/12nUpsi)

All in all, for 4 people it was the perfect amount of food.  Those were some of the best crabs I've had in a had.  Very flavorful, especially the Roasted Crab which I liked the best between that and the Drunken Crab.  The Garlic Noodles were OMGYUM!  I would definitely splurge on more of them for next time!  The Shaken beef was pertty good too, but I wished they had served a bigger portion.  I also tried their Pineapple Lychee Martini and it was seriously refreshing!

I'm glad that Thanh Long still hasn't lost their touch.  It's an awesome spot for any special occasion.

excerpts: *Drunken Crab (market price: $38.95) - Good.
The crab is simmered with chardonnay, sake, and brandy with scallions, chives, and pepper.
The crab tasted great dipped in the broth.
drunken crab.author: Nicole S.
drunken crab.review:
Sunday marked my third time here.  PPQ is my first choice for garlic crab, but my friend had never tried Thanh Long so we planned our dinner here.  

RESERVATIONS:
We had a reservation for 3 at 5:30pm.  Two of us arrived a couple minutes after 5:30pm and checked in, however they wouldn't seat us until the entire party was present.

FOOD:
*Roast Crab (market price: $38.95) - Okay.  The crab was roasted and marinated oil and a lot of pepper.  The menu stated garlic sauce but it seemed like oil/butter and lacked the full on garlic taste I was looking for.

*Drunken Crab (market price: $38.95) - Good.  The crab is simmered with chardonnay, sake, and brandy with scallions, chives, and pepper.  The crab tasted great dipped in the broth.  Note: all the pepper does sink to the bottom of the dish so if you're going to dip your crab meat in the broth, do so in the middle.

*Garlic Noodles ($9.95) - Okay.  The noodles were soggier than I remember and a lot less garlic. I use to prefer Thanh Long's noodles over anywhere else, however it seems like they don't put as much as they use to. 

SERVICE:
Don't expect stellar service or even any service.  Our waiter simply took our order and ignored us.  The only time he came over was when my friend flagged him down to order another bowl of garlic noodles.  In my opinion, I believe Thanh Long assumes they already have their clientele and don't put the effort into customer service.

PARKING:
$10 valet or street parking.  Be prepared to circle several times if you chose to self park.

Bottom line?  Thanh Long is overrated and more expensive than other crab venues (i.e. their shaking beef was $24).

excerpts: Drunken crab, roasted crab, coconut prawns, garlic noodles, shaken beef and a sea bass dish.
drunken crab.author: Rich N.
drunken crab.review:
We ordered a few different dishes to try out. 

Drunken crab, roasted crab, coconut prawns, garlic noodles, shaken beef and a sea bass dish. 

Atmosphere was just ok. The crowd next us was super loud quite rude. 

Food came out cold. Crab was over cooked. Mediocre at best. 

Service took a bit longer than what we expected. 

Way better crab at the kitchen in millbrae.

excerpts: I did see that I ordered the wrong drunken crab; I think they're 2 types.
Garlic Crab was on point and cocktail was tasty.
Dinner was pricy but overall experience worth it.
Treat yourself don't cheat yourself.
drunken crab.author: Giselle J.
drunken crab.review: Very nice atmosphere.  Food was nice and flavored.  I did see that I ordered the wrong drunken crab; I think they're 2 types.  Garlic Crab was on point and cocktail was tasty.  Dinner was pricy but overall experience worth it.  Treat yourself don't cheat yourself.  Make sure to try the Jasmine Garlic rice with chicken and shrimp combination ;-)

excerpts: Drunken Crab (simmered in sake/chardonnay/brandy  - anything simmered in that sauce should taste really good!
drunken crab.author: Earl G.
drunken crab.review:
Screw rice a roni this is the real San Francisco treat! 

The menu is 5 or 6 pages long but there's only two things to get here,
1. Dungeness crab and 2. garlic noodles.   (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/z9CN58fSrA46ggyb6OnCnQ?select=IK1klWeoCzzC_KrK5_T0jQ)

The garlic noodles are the best! Trust, each time I see garlic noodles on a menu, I order it. These are always duplicated but never replicated. $10 for the sweet, garlicky, buttery garlic noodle experience. I like these better than PPQ's savory garlic noodles. 

For the Dungeness crabs, there's 3 flavors, and I like how they're all meaty and prepared in such a way that you don't have to be a crab expert to extract all the meat. 

$38 per crab (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/z9CN58fSrA46ggyb6OnCnQ?select=dgRH-jCrvlRN55ilDWvvDA)

1. Roasted Crab (An fam's secret spices  -  nice garlic flavor - my favorite) 
2. Drunken Crab (simmered in sake/chardonnay/brandy  - anything simmered in that sauce should taste really good! 
3. Tamarind crab (Roma tomatoes & tamarind, seasoned with fresh dill & green onions & flambeed with cognac   -  We're always ordering 1&2  that we haven't gotten to #3 yet  

Do yourself a flavor and splurge on a crab and garlic noodle for each person for a $100 date night.  

Garlic noodles so good, you won't wanna brush your teeth!

excerpts: My favorite was the drunken crab.
drunken crab.author: Tiffany N.
drunken crab.review:
Good food, good service, and not necessarily overpriced.

Made reservations for 6 pm New Year's Eve. We got there about half an hour early, but they seated us anyways since there was room. It's a small restaurant on the corner of the street. On the outside, it doesn't look very nice but the interior is pretty upscale.  

Loved the promptness of everything. The appetizer came within ten minutes. We were bibbed and received our main course immediately after we finished our appetizer. The waiters were attentive and helpful. They also gave us New Year's calendars on our way out. 

Here's what we got:
SALT & PEPPER CALAMARI $11.95: Good appetizer. Crisp, no sauce.

ASPARAGUS SOUP WITH CRAB $7.50: My mom ordered this and enjoyed it. Hot soup is always great when the weather is cold. 

ROAST/DRUNKEN/TAMARIND CRAB: We got one of each ($41.95 per crab). My favorite was the drunken crab. The sauce actually doesn't matter unless you dip the crab meat in the sauce on the plate. 

GARLIC NOODLES $10: This was actually really good, but I wouldn't say they're to die for. It was like eating garlic bread except they were noodles, and these noodles are the same texture as the chow mein at Panda Express. They also have the less expensive option of garlic rice, fried rice, jasmine rice, or vegetables. 

LAVA CHOCOLATE CAKE $8.25: Skip it. The lava cake is mostly syrup and on the bitter side. 

FRIED BANANA A LA MODE $6.95: Skip it. It's just regular fried banana and ice cream--nothing special.

CREME BRULEE $7.50: Again, skip it. If you are dying to have dessert here, choose this one. I'm not saying the desserts are bad at Thanh Long but there are a couple dessert shops on the same street and there are better options in driving distance.

Parents also had a FLEUR DE MANGO ($9.25) with a heineken ($5) and a HANOI SUNSET ($9).

excerpts: The delicious and juicy drunken crab exceeded my expectations and I ate it all!
I love crab but don't like getting my hands all greased up unless I'm eating it in the comforts of my own home.
drunken crab.author: Consuela P.
drunken crab.review:
HOLY CRAB! BEST GARLIC NOODLES EVER!

Hubby's cousin took us here for dinner on our last trip to the Bay. I haven't eaten a dungeness crab like this before. The delicious and juicy drunken crab exceeded my expectations and I ate it all! I love crab but don't like getting my hands all greased up unless I'm eating it in the comforts of my own home. It was simply the best meal I have ever had in my life.

NOM NOM NOM NOM!!!

excerpts:
We ordered:
 roasted crab
drunken crab
garlic noodles
MUSSELS
chicken fried rice
2 cocktails
The roasted crab was better than the drunken crab.
The garlic noodles were so tasty, but I have to admit I have had other garlic noodles that were just as good as here.
The fried rice was good but boring.
drunken crab.author: Nicole A.
drunken crab.review:
My husband I read about this place on Yelp and had to try it! 

We ordered:
 roasted crab
drunken crab
garlic noodles
MUSSELS
chicken fried rice
2 cocktails
 Total was about $165

I wish I could give a better breakdown of the cost, well the crab, but I lost my receipt and didn't think to look until I thought about doing this review.  My guess is they were about 25-35 bucks each for market price.

I see the crab has been reviewed over and over so what I want to point out is that the mussels were FANTASTIC! When we talk about going back, we talk about going back for the mussels! The roasted crab was better than the drunken crab.  The garlic noodles were so tasty, but I have to admit I have had other garlic noodles that were just as good as here.  The fried rice was good but boring. 

I give this place 4 stars for excellent food and service. 1 extra star for being walking distance to the beach! Come here and get stuffed with yummy food, then walk it off at beautiful Ocean Beach.

excerpts: The highlights: Thanh Long Fish, Shaken Beef, and Drunken Crab.
The 50-50 risk:
Thanh Long Fish (red snapper) - 4/5.
Seasoned lightly to let the fish flavor show through and act as the hero of the dish.
Fished was cooked perfectly - just on the edge of being cooked / raw giving it a very smooth taste.
Shaken Beef - 4/5.
Cubes of New York strip steak cooked medium rare.
Drunken Crab - 4/5.
Cooked very well - crab meat retained its moisture.
In this case, the crab was just on the cusp of being dried out, an unfortunate followup of the perfectly cooked Drunken Crab.
drunken crab.author: Gabriel C.
drunken crab.review:
TLDR: 
The highlights: Thanh Long Fish, Shaken Beef, and Drunken Crab.
The 50-50 risk: Roast crab - risk the crab meat being overcooked.
The disappointment: Skip the stand-alone garlic noodle dish.

Thanh Long Fish (red snapper) - 4/5. Seasoned lightly to let the fish flavor show through and act as the hero of the dish. Fished was cooked perfectly - just on the edge of being cooked / raw giving it a very smooth taste. Garlic noodles included here, see review below.

Shaken Beef - 4/5. Cubes of New York strip steak cooked medium rare. Nailed the cooking method, but the seasoning was heavy handed and a tad heavy on the oil.

Drunken Crab - 4/5. Cooked very well - crab meat retained its moisture. Lightly seasoned to help the crab flavor shine.

Roast Crab - 2/5. A risk for roasting crab is overcooking, leaving the meat dry. In this case, the crab was just on the cusp of being dried out, an unfortunate followup of the perfectly cooked Drunken Crab. The seasoning was well done, so I suspect that if the crab was more moist this dish would definitely shine.

Garlic Noodles - 2/5. Although very highly rated, it was a complete miss. The dish was heavy on oil and the noodles were overcooked. Ideally, the noodles would be the hero of the dish, with a seasoning of garlic to help the noodles shine.

excerpts: fantastic crab, had a whole dungeness crab on my own in the traditional roasted crab style and shared a drunken crab.
I liked the drunken crab a bit better since the taste was closer to original crab taste
drunken crab.author: Rebecca C.
drunken crab.review:
fantastic crab, had a whole dungeness crab on my own in the traditional roasted crab style and shared a drunken crab. I liked the drunken crab a bit better since the taste was closer to original crab taste -- I'm a bit of a purist when it comes to crabs.

I don't know what the big deal is with the garlic noodles. I had it in LA at Crustacean, had it at the food truck in SF, and at Thanh Long. It's decent, nothing too special. The mystique of the recipe is hyping this dish unnecessarily. Is it suppose to be a dry version of the overgarlicky pasta from traditional Italian NYC restaurant on Carmine St.?

excerpts: We ordered the Roasted Garlic Crab, Drunken Crab, Garlic Noodles and Garlic Fried Rice.
There was not much of a difference in taste between the two crab dishes.
They were good and I think better than the Roasted Garlic Crab at PPQ
but PPQ has Peppercorn Crab, which is a stellar dish that Thanh Long does not carry on their menu.
The garlic noodles are better here than PPQ and the garlic fried rice goes very well with the crab butter sauce.
The garlic noodles are better here than PPQ and the garlic fried rice goes very well with the crab butter sauce.
drunken crab.author: Chi N.
drunken crab.review:
I haven't been back to Thanh Long in almost a decade so when my gf came to visit, I decided to take her here instead of PPQ Dungeness Island since I remembered Thanh Long being more fancy and upscale. Things have changed in the last few years as this place is not as fancy as I remembered. My gf and I were dressed up and felt a little out of place as most other diners were dressed more casual. 

We ordered the Roasted Garlic Crab, Drunken Crab, Garlic Noodles and Garlic Fried Rice. There was not much of a difference in taste between the two crab dishes. They were good and I think better than the Roasted Garlic Crab at PPQ but PPQ has Peppercorn Crab, which is a stellar dish that Thanh Long does not carry on their menu. The garlic noodles are better here than PPQ and the garlic fried rice goes very well with the crab butter sauce. 

It's pricier than PPQ. We paid $150 for all 4 dishes, including 2 glasses of wine with tip included. At PPQ, I've ordered the same amount of food with a bottle of wine for $100. Since the ambiance is not as upscale as before, I would save the few extra bucks and eat at PPQ's instead.

excerpts: Valet Parking + A Half Dozen Herbaceous Broiled Mussels atop Toast + Plastic Bibs + 1 Whole Roasted Crab with Garlic + 1 Drunken Crab with Chardonnay and Cracked Black Pepper + 1 Tangy and Dill-icious Tamarind Crab + A Heaping Pile of the Best Garlic Noodles in the City + Grubby Fingers =
THE ARRIVAL OF DUNGENESS CRAB SEASON
drunken crab.author: Amy C.
drunken crab.review: Valet Parking + A Half Dozen Herbaceous Broiled Mussels atop Toast + Plastic Bibs + 1 Whole Roasted Crab with Garlic + 1 Drunken Crab with Chardonnay and Cracked Black Pepper + 1 Tangy and Dill-icious Tamarind Crab + A Heaping Pile of the Best Garlic Noodles in the City + Grubby Fingers = THE ARRIVAL OF DUNGENESS CRAB SEASON

excerpts:
Items tried: 
Tiger prawn on garlic noodles
Drunken crab
Shaken beef

Known for their garlic noodles and crab, the place gets really busy even for late dinner.
drunken crab.author: Romella J.
drunken crab.review:
Items tried: 
Tiger prawn on garlic noodles
Drunken crab
Shaken beef

Known for their garlic noodles and crab, the place gets really busy even for late dinner. The noodles were cooked just right, not oily but garlicky. Garlic taste was not too intense. However, it got cold really fast. Also, I would recommend a strong drink to match it. 

Prawns were grilled and seasoned right. Large crab were fresh but was not as meaty. Beef was tender but well-flavored. 

Overall, I already recommended this place as a must try. 

Also same menu as Crustacean in the city.

excerpts: my only critiques are that there is a limited ways your crab can be prepared -- the original roast crab with pepper, the drunken crab, and the tamarind crab.
i would have liked to try a garlic-prepared crab.
drunken crab.author: Sabrina L.
drunken crab.review:
Had a great experience here! Make sure you come early and make reservations -- the place was already crowded at 5:30 pm on a thursday night! we had reservations for our party of 10 and were seated upstairs. service was very fast -- we started receiving our food maybe ten minutes after ordering! everything was really good, from the crabs (my uncle said the crabs are all soaked beforehand, so the shells were very soft and not at all hard to crack into!), garlic noodles, shaken beef, chicken, and vegetarian dishes. the eggplant was good but extremely oily. the ambiance of the restaurant is also very nice and more upscale than i was expecting, and they even have a valet option for your car!

my only critiques are that there is a limited ways your crab can be prepared -- the original roast crab with pepper, the drunken crab, and the tamarind crab. i would have liked to try a garlic-prepared crab. their fryer was also broken that night, so we were unable to enjoy any fried bananas :(

overall very good experience! i would love to come back!

excerpts: We did try the drunken crab once, but the roast crab wins hands down.
-The Lava cake is to DIE for!
Amazing!!!
I also tried the Irish Coffee, but meh..
drunken crab.author: Debbie T.
drunken crab.review:
I only come here for "special" occasions with the bf. So..this means:

-We share an entire bottle of sparkling wine. Yep, we'll finish the whole bottle. Champagnes are for snobs..or really pretty people who have lots of money. =[ 
-Our go to dishes: Mango Salad, Salt and Pepper Calamari, Garlic Noodles, and Roast Crab. Sure, other things look tasty on the menu, but these are so good that I refuse to waver! We did try the drunken crab once, but the roast crab wins hands down. 
-The Lava cake is to DIE for! Amazing!!! I also tried the Irish Coffee, but meh..I rather just stick with my sparkling wine and Lava Cake. 

With tip, I say our meal averages at least $150-200, depending on the bottle of wine and market price of the crab. Very expensive for cheapies like us, but every once in awhile, we like to spoil ourselves and eat ramen for the rest of the month.

excerpts: We ordered fried calamari, tea, drunken crab, and garlic noodles.
Our tea came out first, which I apparently frown upon on.
Just tea leaves in boiling water for $4.95?
Are you kidding me?
It's nothing special...
, I'd just stick with water.
Calamari was good but it didn't have any dipping sauce.
Garlic noodles is really good
but I recommend you to eat it while it's hot because when it's cold, it doesn't taste good anymore.
Finally, behold, the moment we've been waiting for.... CRAB!!!!! It's super fresh like it just got caught from the ocean.
It has a good amount of flavor in the crab as well.
I have no complaints except that I wanted more!
Eating the crab + garlic noodles = satisfying.
drunken crab.author: Arvin C.
drunken crab.review:
Came here straight from San Jose. In San Jose, it was like ~80 degrees while here was about ~60 degrees. About a 20 degree drop... Boy was I freezing! I wasn't going to do valet because I don't like strangers driving my car. I circled around the neighborhood and finally found a spot several blocks away. On the outside, it looked like a ghetto Vietnamese shack, but I was wrong. Inside looked like a high class American restaurant. We got seated promptly. No wait, no gimmick... We just sat down and got handed the menus. 

We ordered fried calamari, tea, drunken crab, and garlic noodles. Our tea came out first, which I apparently frown upon on. Just tea leaves in boiling water for $4.95? Are you kidding me? It's nothing special..., I'd just stick with water. Calamari was good but it didn't have any dipping sauce. Garlic noodles is really good but I recommend you to eat it while it's hot because when it's cold, it doesn't taste good anymore. Finally, behold, the moment we've been waiting for.... CRAB!!!!! It's super fresh like it just got caught from the ocean. It has a good amount of flavor in the crab as well. I have no complaints except that I wanted more! Eating the crab + garlic noodles = satisfying. I love it.

The service here is far superb. Your water will never be empty, your crab shell bowls will never be filled to the top, you will never have trash on your table. This is what I call service. You get a bib, generous amount of napkins,  a cracker, several forks. 

All in all, I had a great experience here. Would I be coming back here again? YES! 
This place does get pricey though so be prepared to spend about $40/person. It costs $39.99 for one crab!

excerpts: I've had the drunken crab here before too, but i think I prefer the garlicky flavor of the roast crab more.
drunken crab.author: Michelle L.
drunken crab.review:
OMG I love Thanh Long.

Came here with my friend on a Thursday around 6:00 and the place was relatively empty. However, as our dinner progressed the restaurant started filling up with people. 

We ordered:

Roast crab: SO GOOD. I don't understand how they get the garlic flavor infused into the crab meat... but whatever they do it tastes delicious. I've had the drunken crab here before too, but i think I prefer the garlicky flavor of the roast crab more.

Saigon beef: This was surprisingly good. The beef cubes were tender, and not at all chewy. The sauce it was in wasn't too heavy, which i liked, and tasted good with the garlic noodles.

Garlic noodles: Definitely need to order this with the roast crab.

Between the two of us we finished almost everything, but had some noodles and a couple crab legs leftover.

Overall had a great experience at Thanh Long, and will probably come back again.

excerpts: Drunken crab.
drunken crab.author: Justin S.
drunken crab.review:
Roasted crab.
Drunken crab.
Garlic noodles.

Some of the best crab in the city with excellent service. Parking is super easy because you must use the Valet or circle for 45 minutes looking; this is the Outer Sunset son.

Extremely messy but worth the work. From this day forward when a tourist ask, "Where can I get crab?" Thanh Long is the answer.

excerpts: We ordered the Roasted Crab, Drunken Crab, and the Tamarind Crab.
The latter was definitely my favorite for
it's very unique sweet tangy flavor.
The flavoring of the Roasted crab was somewhat more oily and not as flavorful/garlicy as the one from PPQ.
drunken crab.author: Jeanne L.
drunken crab.review:
Versus PPQ, the other dungeness crab powerhouse of SF, this place loses for both taste and price... for all dishes.

We ordered the Roasted Crab, Drunken Crab, and the Tamarind Crab.  The latter was definitely my favorite for it's very unique sweet tangy flavor. The flavoring of the Roasted crab was somewhat more oily and not as flavorful/garlicy as the one from PPQ.  (Most of all, I really missed the incredibly delicious dry flavor of the Peppercorn crab from PPQ.)

The Garlic Noodles here were on the softer side compared to PPQ, and I really prefer a nice firm al dente noodle with a bit of a chew to it.

The Colossal Royal Tiger Prawns were a huge letdown. There were .. 5 or 6 prawns only.

Vegetarian Delight was described as silken tofu sauteed with assorted vegetables and shitake mushrooms.  I know this is a Vietnamese restaurant, but I am really used to eating a Chinese version of this with a crispy-fried tofu.  The tofu was a mushy-soft texture, and the vegetable selection was meager.  The dish size overall was small.  I was not delighted.

$32 per person, group of 9 people.  It was pricey considering how unsatisfied we were for quality/quantity of food.  Sorry, this is what happens when you compare against PPQ.

http://www.yelp.com/biz/ppq-dungeness-island-san-francisco-2#hrid:yChlljno2CCweXgXWfyfpw/src:self

excerpts: My friend and I get our own plates of the mussels and split the Drunken Crab and an order of garlic noodles.
We end the night with the chocolate lava cake and leave happy as a clam.
I haven't tried anything else on the menu because I'm obsessed with what I get.
Fresh seafood, good drinks, great service.
drunken crab.author: Adriana R.
drunken crab.review: Once you have the mussels from here made with Asian pesto on a crostini, you will never be able to order mussels anywhere else. We typically start the night off with a lychee martini and the martini made with plum wine and vodka (I get it made without sweet and sour). My friend and I get our own plates of the mussels and split the Drunken Crab and an order of garlic noodles. We end the night with the chocolate lava cake and leave happy as a clam. I haven't tried anything else on the menu because I'm obsessed with what I get. Fresh seafood, good drinks, great service.

excerpts:
During my visits, I've also tried the Seabass, Drunken Crab, Tamarind Crab, Mussels, Salt & Pepper Calamari, Garlic Noodles, and the Traditional Vietnamese Salad.  
I'm still not a fan of the Drunken Crab, Tamarind Crab, or the Garlic Noodles, but all the others were pretty good.

I'm still not a fan of the Drunken Crab, Tamarind Crab, or the Garlic Noodles, but all the others were pretty good.

I'm still not a fan of the Drunken Crab, Tamarind Crab, or the Garlic Noodles, but all the others were pretty good.
drunken crab.author: Ninja H.
drunken crab.review:
Still come for my crab fix when I can't order it from Mom, but I don't know if I've just been coming too often or if the crab quality really has gone down.  Like I said, still incredibly delish but something's a lil off...idk!

I've been more than my share of times but thought my most recent trip about a week after crab season started would've been the best visit.  Sadly, it was the same crab quality as when it wasn't crab season. Hmmm...

Well, it won't sway me!  I'm still gettin down and messy in the Roasted Crab garlic butter...and a nice stiff drink!  And still ordering the Shaken Beef when my taste buds call for it.  

During my visits, I've also tried the Seabass, Drunken Crab, Tamarind Crab, Mussels, Salt & Pepper Calamari, Garlic Noodles, and the Traditional Vietnamese Salad.  I'm still not a fan of the Drunken Crab, Tamarind Crab, or the Garlic Noodles, but all the others were pretty good.

Still recommend to others, and will still continue to patronize when Mom's kitchen's out of crustacean! ;0)

excerpts: If you're coming for the first time, I'd pass on the Drunken Crab.
The roasted crab is served in a lovely pool of clarified butter (I'm guessing) and special spices.
If I'm not paying (haha), I'd add on the shaking beef and the Vietnamese salad.
I'd pass on the dessert - but if you must, try the fried ice cream.
The breading is really thick, but the vanilla ice cream is so good.
Lastly, my husband swears by the Vietnamese ice coffee.
Anyway.
Overall, a great special occasion restaurant.
Reservations highly recommended.
drunken crab.author: Lisa H.
drunken crab.review: My family loves this place. Service is always stellar and the food is such a treat. My favorite things to eat here are the roasted crab, garlic noodles, and the eggplant dish. If you're coming for the first time, I'd pass on the Drunken Crab. The roasted crab is served in a lovely pool of clarified butter (I'm guessing) and special spices. If I'm not paying (haha), I'd add on the shaking beef and the Vietnamese salad. I'd pass on the dessert - but if you must, try the fried ice cream. The breading is really thick, but the vanilla ice cream is so good. Lastly, my husband swears by the Vietnamese ice coffee. Anyway. Overall, a great special occasion restaurant. Reservations highly recommended.

excerpts: I personally prefer Roast Crab and Drunken Crab.
But all are tastier than what you would get at any restaurants in Fisherman's Wharf.
The Drunken Crab is made with Chardonnay, sake, brandy, green union, chive and black pepper.
The Roast Crab is roasted with garlic sauce and black pepper.
+ It is a fine dining restaurant with nice ambiance.
They also have a sister restaurant in SF called Crustacean.
+ The place is pricey.
But it is definitely worth the visit every once in a while for special occasions.
I discovered this place through friends about 15 years ago when I lived in the Bay Area.
drunken crab.author: Adam M.
drunken crab.review:
Pros 
+ They have a full menu. But you'll see every table order the same thing: Crab. This is THE place to go for crab and garlic noodle. They have 3 different kinds of crab: Roast, Drunken, and Tamarind. I personally prefer Roast Crab and Drunken Crab. But all are tastier than what you would get at any restaurants in Fisherman's Wharf. The Drunken Crab is made with Chardonnay, sake, brandy, green union, chive and black pepper. The Roast Crab is roasted with garlic sauce and black pepper. 
+ It is a fine dining restaurant with nice ambiance. They also have a sister restaurant in SF called Crustacean. 
+ The place is pricey. But it is definitely worth the visit every once in a while for special occasions. I discovered this place through friends about 15 years ago when I lived in the Bay Area. Now I came with my family during my visit for Thanksgiving and it has turned into an annual tradition. 

Cons
