- The service here is not what it used to be. The waitress mixed up our soup order, and was not always available when we asked for napkins, bowls and to refill the water and tea. 
- The food is good. But I kind of expect better services for the price they are charging. If you order crab, it will average $70 per person after soup and noodle and before any alcohol and dessert. 
- Street parking only, which is typical of most restaurants in San Francisco. 
- The place is super busy. The best chance to get a table is to call ahead to make reservations or get there early at 5PM.

excerpts: so we opted for the drunken crab.
I didnt have to slay any vampires
The drunken crab and noodles were great choices.
I loved them both!
The noodles had a slight kick to it that made it so delicous and our crab was soaked in this flavorful broth that made every bite juicy and scrumptious.
YUMM!
For the appetizer, we had the black pepper calamari
and that was very good too.
Im not crazy about calamari because I feel that most place over-do the batter
drunken crab.author: Jeanne L.
drunken crab.review:
Last night was my first visit to Thanh Long. My friend asked me if  he can have his birthday dinner there. After he took me to Alexander's Steakhouse his answer was hell yes to anything besides French Laundry.

We ordered their signature dishes which was the crab and garlic noodles. I know everyone said to order the roasted crab  but I felt like roasted crab and garlic noodles was garlic overload so we opted for the drunken crab. I didnt have to slay any vampires so I thought this was the right decision to make.

The drunken crab and noodles were great choices. I loved them both! The noodles had a slight kick to it that made it so delicous and our crab was soaked in this flavorful broth that made every bite juicy and scrumptious. YUMM! For the appetizer, we had the black pepper calamari  and that was very good too. Im not crazy about calamari because I feel that most place over-do the batter but it was made perfectly here. 

The service was great. The server asked us if we wanted a bib for the crab and they even tied it around our neck. He was also very nice about getting us extra napkins and hot water for my tea. What made him extra awesome was that he was honest about the dessert recommendations. 

Initially, I almost picked some sort of banana/coconut/carmel dessert (forgot name) and he told me that that one was very sweet and named a few that were good.  I went with my second choice which was the lava chocolate cake a la mode. Get it!!! Soooooo effin good!

excerpts: Drunken Crab: When we received it there was one body, but two crabs worth of claws and legs.
The pieces were pretty big too, so if your not really a crab person 2 people can share.
However, the flavor was kind of bland.
drunken crab.author: Michelle C.
drunken crab.review:
my boyfriend heard about this place from one of his co-workers, so he decided to take me. When we first drove by we thought it was close because the lights were dim and we did not see anyone in there.  

The setting was romantic, which is a nice place for and anniversary or a date.

Food: Salt and Pepper Calamari: It was delicious. They were big pieces, but my boyfriend and I finished it really quick.

Garlic noodles: They were so good, it is one of my favorite garlic noodles I have tried so far! It is a must if you come here. It even out shines the crab. 

Drunken Crab: When we received it there was one body, but two crabs worth of claws and legs. The pieces were pretty big too, so if your not really a crab person 2 people can share.  However, the flavor was kind of bland. To us it just tastes like boiled crab, but it was still delicious.

Dessert- Chocolate Lava Cake: Dessert is my favorite part of any meal. This dessert made me smile, after the first bite. The chocolate just melts in your mouth. It was so delicious! It makes my mouth water by just thinking about it.  Also, the next day my boyfriend was still thinking about how good this dessert was.

excerpts: My companion had the drunken crab which was also delectable.
We didn't talk much over dinner because our meal was so good it makes it impossible to speak intelligently.
We mostly ooo-ed and ahh-ed over the amazingly simple and delicious food.
We ended with dessert which was also delish: chocolate lava cake and creme brulee.
The service is fast and efficient.
They remove your crab shells regularily and bring you a hot towel to clean up with at the end.
It's a messy business eating a whole crab
but they make it easy and relaxed
and it is sooo worth it.
drunken crab.author: Deanna C.
drunken crab.review:
We started with the tempura coconut prawns with orange-mustard sauce. Crunchy, tangy and a great beginning to a perfect meal. 
My ginger infused vodka cocktail complimented the roast crab and garlic noodles perfectly. My companion had the drunken crab which was also delectable. We didn't talk much over dinner because our meal was so good it makes it impossible to speak intelligently. We mostly ooo-ed and ahh-ed over the amazingly simple and delicious food. 
We ended with dessert which was also delish: chocolate lava cake and creme brulee.
The service is fast and efficient. They remove your crab shells regularily and bring you a hot towel to clean up with at the end. It's a messy business eating a whole crab but they make it easy and relaxed and it is sooo worth it.

excerpts: I've had friends try the other varieties, such as the drunken crab, and it's good, but there's a reason they're FAMOUS for their roasted crab.
And frankly, I'm not one to rock the boat when it comes to sticking to what I know
drunken crab.author: Jeani L.
drunken crab.review:
I know. I know. I'm not going to say anything new. All the other reviewers before me have already pointed out the obvious. This. Place. Is. Good. I always always always get the roasted crab. I've had friends try the other varieties, such as the drunken crab, and it's good, but there's a reason they're FAMOUS for their roasted crab. And frankly, I'm not one to rock the boat when it comes to sticking to what I know won't disappoint. 

They're actually the sister restaurant to Crustacean. I believe both are owned by the same family, and it's apparent in their cuisine. The decor differs a bit. Thanh Long is just a tad less pomp and circumstance than its counterpart, but the food and service are just as good. I did recently try the shaken beef, which was absolutely delicious. Tender, juicy, and wonderfully flavorful, it's a tad sweet and perfect with rice, it would be a good alternative if you're allergic to seafood or just not in the mood for crab (for shame). 

Overall, the roasted crab and garlic noodles just can't be beat when you're eating here. I would, however, say that both dishes are drenched in oil, so you should consider that it's not the most ideal place to eat if you happen to be trying to lose weight. But if you're like me, which means either you're on a diet and you have no self control OR anything delicious does not count as something "bad for you" in your book, then seriously get your butt over there and eat to your heart's content. I mean, honestly, it's well worth it. Delicious crab, great service, AND a plastic disposable bib? Uhhhh... YES PLEASE.

excerpts: The drunken crab tasted a little bland, if you ask me.
drunken crab.author: Kristen S.
drunken crab.review:
If you ever find yourself staring at the menu, debating between the roasted and the drunk crab - definitely order the roasted.  It's much more flavorful.  The drunken crab tasted a little bland, if you ask me.

The garlic noodles were every bit as tasty as everyone says.  Worth the carb calories.

Overall I think it warrants neither the 4-star rating nor the hefty price.  It's really nothing special.  I've seen lots of Cantonese places do it much, MUCH better.

excerpts: We ordered the calamari appetizer, the roasted garlic crab, the drunken crab, the garlic noodles with roasted tiger prawns, and the garlic noodles by themselves.
Hands down, it was all about the roasted crab and the garlic noodles!
The drunken crab is good too, but I loved the flavor of the roasted garlic crab.
I'm still trying to figure out how the heck they got the flavor into the crab.
The garlic noodles were the perfect compliment to the meal.
The garlic noodles were so simple but just so flavorful without being salty.
I could taste the garlic and the buttery sauce.
I loved the flavor of the roasted tiger prawns.
drunken crab.author: Jacqueline C.
drunken crab.review:
My husband and I went to this place to celebrate a friend's birthday. I'm so glad we did!

First off, this place gets packed so do make a reservation. Don't expect to just show up and get a table. 

We ordered the calamari appetizer, the roasted garlic crab, the drunken crab, the garlic noodles with roasted tiger prawns, and the garlic noodles by themselves. Hands down, it was all about the roasted crab and the garlic noodles! The drunken crab is good too, but I loved the flavor of the roasted garlic crab. I'm still trying to figure out how the heck they got the flavor into the crab. The garlic noodles were the perfect compliment to the meal. The garlic noodles were so simple but just so flavorful without being salty. I could taste the garlic and the buttery sauce. I loved the flavor of the roasted tiger prawns. Everything was yummy! 

We finished the meal with the banana cake. It came with a little bit of vanilla ice cream and some whipped cream. We were stuffed but that didn't stop us from finishing the banana cake. 

The service was attentive, the atmosphere was way more upscale than most Vietnamese places, and the food was phenomenal. This place is a bit pricey but I will say I think it was worth every bite! I will be back here again soon!

excerpts:
Drunken Crab - this was delicious - a whole crab, dunked in a secret sauce of Chardonney... 

Roasted Crab - this was EVEN better than the Drunken Crab - amazing.
drunken crab.author: Cat G.
drunken crab.review:
My brother and sisters decided to come here for Mother's Day. I called on the Thursday before to make a reservation, made it for 5:30pm on Mother's Day. Perfect. They called on Saturday to confirm, awesome. They reminded me to make sure everyone was on time because we wouldn't be sat until our entire party was there. 

Typical of our family, one of my siblings was running late - therefore they wouldn't seat us. My Mom was mad and irritated because to her it didn't make sense because we knew what they wanted to order. After practically yelling at the hostess, they still didn't seat us - I was embarassed. The hostess remained calm and tried to explain to my Mom why they wouldn't seat us. I used to work in the restaurant industry and I know why they won't sit full parties - it puts their entire reservation schedule off track - if two people of a seven party table is late, it extends their duration at the table once the two LATE people do get there, and causes the table who will be using that table next a delay, and so forth throughout the evening. 

30 minutes after our reservation time, my late sibling and her guest arrived, I kindly let the hostess know that we were finally all there, she told me that the only table available that sits 7 is currently paying and as soon as they leave, she'd be able to sit us - this was "the best that she could do at this time." - I thanked her nicely and proceeded to apologize for my mom's reaction and that I understand why they couldn't seat us. 

5 minutes later - she came to me and said that she had another table available and we could be seated right away. While following her she told me that she appreciated my apology and to enjoy my meal. 

Food: 
Dungeness Crab Puffs - delicious - a great appetizer for a larger group, there were 6 in one serving. 

Salt & Pepper Calamari - a little too much salt on this one, still good though!  Next time we'll try the Grilled Calamari 

Shaken Beef - HOLY MOLEY DELICIOUS - Meat was SO tender and so flavorful - definitely recommend this. 

Siagon Beef - Not my favorite - the rest of my family like this but unfortunately this dish did NOT please my taste buds - I felt as though maybe the ingredients were way above my appreciation but it tasted too bitter for me. 

Drunken Crab - this was delicious - a whole crab, dunked in a secret sauce of Chardonney... 

Roasted Crab - this was EVEN better than the Drunken Crab - amazing. 

Garlic Noodles - MUST HAVE AT THE TABLE. These are the staple dish of every visit, in my opinion. 

I really like this place - I've had the Garlic Noodles before on their An The Go mobile food truck. Definitely will come back here. 

PS. Parking is a pain - but they do offer Valet for $12.00 - valet guys are funny.

excerpts: Tried the roasted crab (the original goodness), and drunken crab (very juicy), shaken beef (pretty good), mussels (plump and tasty), and the chicken satay (ok) for appetizers.
drunken crab.author: Lawrence L.
drunken crab.review:
Delicious dungeness crab served here everytime!  It's been over 10 years since I have been here, and a few things have changed: they now have valet parking, the menu has more options...  But the crab and garlic noodles are always awesome.

Tried the roasted crab (the original goodness), and drunken crab (very juicy), shaken beef (pretty good), mussels (plump and tasty), and the chicken satay (ok) for appetizers.  Ended the night off with fried ice cream, which the kids devoured!

Definitely recommend coming here to satisfy your crab cravings...

excerpts: Have to try the Drunken crab next time.
Smart to have a reservation beforehand
it gets really crowded in here.
drunken crab.author: Mandeep G.
drunken crab.review: Tiger prawns over garlic noodles was really good so was the shaken beef. All the seafood dishes tasted really fresh. Have to try the Drunken crab next time.  Smart to have a reservation beforehand it gets really crowded in here.

excerpts: Drunken crab and a garlic hangover?

Here was our order:
Drunken crab (simmered in Chardonnay, sake and brandy; scallions, chives, and cracked black pepper)
drunken crab.author: Cici T.
drunken crab.review:
Drunken crab and a garlic hangover? Yes, please!

It was a foggy summer night, the last time I came to Thanh Long for dinner. After ollaliberry picking in Pescadero and mussel hunting in Half Moon Bay, my sunkissed friends and I wanted to end the night with a bang and decided to treat ourselves to juicy, plump crab and some dressed up garlic noodles!

Here was our order:
Drunken crab (simmered in Chardonnay, sake and brandy; scallions, chives, and cracked black pepper)
Roast crab (roasted with garlic sauce and "secret" spices)
Garlic noodles (3 orders please!)
Thanh Long spicy eggplant (jumbo prawns, chicken, basil, baby corn!, shitake mushrooms, eggplant!)
Lemongrass chicken (chicken, vegetables, garlic, and chili)

Oh was it a feast! Among the five of us, we cleared our table.

Caution: The taste of garlic from the garlic noodles is potent! After your meal, brush your teeth and tongue, gargle mouthwash, and that taste and smell is not so easily ditched! Hence the garlic hangover.

excerpts: I was tempted to stray from convention and try the Tamarind crab, or the Drunken crab (cooked in white wine and olive oil
I think), but everyone kept stressing how legit the garlic roast one was.
drunken crab.author: Jo G.
drunken crab.review:
Allright, I'll be the first to admit that I exaggerate stuff and can be overly dramatic sometimes, but honestly- I think our dinner at Thanh Long was probably one of the best meals of my life.  Top 5 for sure.  

My friend kept raving about this place and how great the garlic roast crab is.  I L-O-V-E crustaceans, crab legs and lobster tails rock my world.  Garlic not so much.  I of course use garlic in cooking to enhance a dish and can appreciate its use, but you're not gonna find me eating at The Stinking Rose where that shit reeks of almost raw garlic, ew.   So, I was slightly skeptical as to whether I'd enjoy this garlic crab, and the garlic noodles that you can order as a side dish.

We walk into the restaurant, and I'm pleasantly surprised to find out it doesn't have an overbearing garlic smell to it.  Awesome.  I was tempted to stray from convention and try the Tamarind crab, or the Drunken crab (cooked in white wine and olive oil I think), but everyone kept stressing how legit the garlic roast one was.  Ok, I caved.

Boy, I've never been so happy to cave into peer pressure as I was Friday night.  The garlic roast crab was sooooooooo delicious, I went to town on that motha.  I kindof pride myself on my waspy crab-eating skills, I can pick every single morsel of meat out of a crab leg, which I did again that night.  Honestly it's a lot of crab meat so many of weaklings out there might want to follow in the footsteps of the couple next to us and "split a crab."  I don't know what "sharing" or "split" a meal means as I've never done it myself, but I hear some people don't experience the food coma afterward, so I guess try it if you want.

On to the noodles, which again sounded super dicey to me.  I envisioned half-cooked garlic which would make me vomit.  Ohhhh silly girl, silly naive Jo.  No no no no- the garlic noodles were exquisite.  They tasted faintly of garlic, and like McDonald's fries, had to have a touch of sugar in them b/c they were slightly sweet and addictive as fuck.  Score.

As a sidenote, this place is a nicer restaurant, you still get a bib but it's definitely not a hole in the wall crab joint.  With that said, I wouldn't recommend it for a first or second date, b/c most girls will squirm at the thought of cracking crab legs (which might mess up our outfits, God forbid our date's crab gets flung inadvertently into our hair), and the garlic factor too, just don't do it.  Wait till you guys have reached that comfort level where you just don't give an F and can school that crab in peace without any insecurity.

excerpts: We got the Boiled and the Drunken crab, and I wouldn't have known the crab was drunken if it weren't for the different coloring of the crab and the saltiness.
drunken crab.author: Karen L.
drunken crab.review:
I was excited to try this since people were saying how good it was, however, it's not that good.  We got the Boiled and the Drunken crab, and I wouldn't have known the crab was drunken if it weren't for the different coloring of the crab and the saltiness.  While the Shaken Beef was pretty tasty, there were only several pieces, and twice the amount of potatoes.  Garlic noodles wasn't great either.  The only great dish we had that was really good was the grilled calamari, it was delicious.
Walking away from a restaurant still hungry after a big bill is not a good thing.  Compared to PPQ, Thanh Long loses by price, taste, and quantity.  However, their setting and service is much better than PPQ.

excerpts: I did prefer the roast crab to the drunken crab, but that's mainly because I'm a big fan of garlic.
drunken crab.author: Mel L.
drunken crab.review:
My three friends and I came here for dinner and we shared two crabs, garlic noodles, coconut shrimp, Vietnamese salad and two bowls of soup all for about $45 per person.  Food came fast, was tasty, wait staff was attentive to what we needed and always made sure to clear our table.  I did prefer the roast crab to the drunken crab, but that's mainly because I'm a big fan of garlic.  The other entrees were good, but it's going to be the crab that brings me back.  

The restaurant was really big and reservations is a must.  Even at 6 pm, there was a 45 min wait.

excerpts: You got to eat them when they are warm tho 'cuz once they got soft, they turn to a hard, buttery clump of yuckness) and the drunken crab or the roasted/garlic crab.
Put your bib on, get your hands dirty, and dig in.
drunken crab.author: Vivian A.
drunken crab.review:
I think it's funny how I'm allergic to shellfish and yet I've been here three times. I guess when the time calls for toying with looking like Will Smith in "Hitch" when he had his allergic reaction, I choose to gamble my swelling odds by going here.

Being that I can't really venture out, I've always ordered/shared the same dishes: Garlic noodles (YUM! You got to eat them when they are warm tho 'cuz once they got soft, they turn to a hard, buttery clump of yuckness) and the drunken crab or the roasted/garlic crab. Put your bib on, get your hands dirty, and dig in. The crab is  bomb!

On one occasion I tried some fish, I think the halibut. The halibut was light and fluffy but the sauce that came with it was super sweet. It didn't pair well. Maybe I was just craving crab, so I stole two crab legs from my friends eating with me. Much better.

Go there, eat the crab, get messy, have fun.

excerpts: both drunken crab and toasted crab were great!
love love love them.
drunken crab.author: Wei T.
drunken crab.review:
i love the crabs!!!
both drunken crab and toasted crab were great! love love love them.
garlic noodles didn't look well, but taste great, worth a try!!
love the environment and service, nice place!

excerpts: I would think the drunken crab would be good, but darn the garlic roasted crab is THE BEST crab I have ever had!!!
By the way even during the crab season, I think the crab wasn't exactly fresh and seem to have been frozen for a long time, but what the heck it still taste great!
Price:
drunken crab.author: Lance C.
drunken crab.review:
I would think the drunken crab would be good, but darn the garlic roasted crab is THE BEST crab I have ever had!!! By the way even during the crab season, I think the crab wasn't exactly fresh and seem to have been frozen for a long time, but what the heck it still taste great! Price: umm not sure if it has to be that pricy.

-1 star for price and not seemingly fresh crab.

excerpts: Don't bother with the drunken crab.
But we're really hungry and we need another one,

can't I order the drunken crab for variety?" 
--
NO!
Order ANOTHER roasted crab!!!!
But we're really hungry and we have a large group, maybe someone in the group will like the drunken crab?
They'll like the roasted crab more!!!
drunken crab.author: R C.
drunken crab.review:
Thanh LONG is short for Me Love You LONG Time! 

"What should I order?" 
-- Order the roasted crab!!! Don't bother with the drunken crab.
"But we're really hungry and we need another one, can't I order the drunken crab for variety?" 
-- NO! Order ANOTHER roasted crab!!!!
"But we're really hungry and we have a large group, maybe someone in the group will like the drunken crab?" 
--NO! They'll like the roasted crab more!!! But if you must, order the shaken beef.

excerpts: so we split 2 crab, 1 roasted crab and 1 drunken crab.
drunken crab.author: Darien G.
drunken crab.review:
We took my wife's mother here for dinner last Saturday night for Mother's Day.  This was my first time at Thanh Long, but I have eaten at Crustacean's before which I am told is owned by the same people.  I don't know much about Vietnamese food, other than Pho so I was a bit surprised that a restaurant known for crab was a Vietnamese place.  I never knew that crab was such a staple of the Vietnamese diet, but the An's can cook the hell out of a crab!

There were 4 of us so we split 2 crab, 1 roasted crab and 1 drunken crab.  We also shared a plate of Shaken Beef, 2 plates of Garlic Noodles and 1 plate of seasonal vegetables.  Everything was very good.  The crab was messy but tasty but I especially liked the Shaken Beef.  Very sweet and tasty, similar to the Mongolian Beef at PF Chang's which I LOVE.  I even liked the garlic noodles.

The only downside was the price of the crab, $40 each!!!! Yikes.  It felt like getting robbed without a gun.  But what are you gonna do?  I guess that's the market price for crab these days.

excerpts: We had the garlic noodles, drunken crab, and the thanh long spicy eggplant.
Surprisingly, I liked the eggplant the best.
The crab and garlic noodles came out really fast, but were cold!
Disappointing!
And to top it off, the service was terrible.
Our waiter checked in on us only once during the whole meal.
I did however try the garlic noodles from the thanh long food truck and it was really good, so
I think I'll stick to the food truck.
You don't have to travel so far to get it.
drunken crab.author: Nancy H.
drunken crab.review:
This place was recommended to me, so I decided to try it. I wanted to like it, but it just didn't cut it. We had the garlic noodles, drunken crab, and the thanh long spicy eggplant. Surprisingly, I liked the eggplant the best. The crab and garlic noodles came out really fast, but were cold! Disappointing! And to top it off, the service was terrible. Our waiter checked in on us only once during the whole meal. At the end of it, we were trying to wave someone down to get the bill, but our waiter walked by us three times and completely ignored us.

I did however try the garlic noodles from the thanh long food truck and it was really good, so I think I'll stick to the food truck. You don't have to travel so far to get it.

excerpts: Drunken crab and garlic noodles!
Roasted crab was peppery.
The vanilla creme brûlée should at least have been topped with fruit.
The garlic noodles can be smelled from the next table (tasted better than when I had them at AnQi too).
I still taste a hint of it in my mouth the next day.
They only take reservations no earlier than two weeks in advance
but I was also able to get one the day before.
This corner restaurant is conveniently located next to a couple of bus stops.
drunken crab.author: Ai M.
drunken crab.review:
Drink Hanoi beer or Vietnamese iced coffee.  Drunken crab and garlic noodles!  Roasted crab was peppery.  The vanilla creme brûlée should at least have been topped with fruit. It was cold.

Get the mussels appetizer but not roasted crab.  I would order tamarind crab next time.  They didn't have any winery grape juice spritzer.  We also ordered the prawn rolls which are best with sauce.  You won't need a cup of rice unless it's for leftover crab.
   
The current market price is under $39 and a crab will feed two.  The garlic noodles can be smelled from the next table (tasted better than when I had them at AnQi too).  I still taste a hint of it in my mouth the next day. They only take reservations no earlier than two weeks in advance but I was also able to get one the day before. This corner restaurant is conveniently located next to a couple of bus stops.

excerpts: I've also had the drunken crab and it's an excellent option if you wanna skip the butter and be guiltless.
It was flavorful and easy on the stomach.
The atmosphere is nice and they even have a large dining room upstairs which I recently discovered.
Thanh Long is definitely a winner
and I'm not sure whether it's a good or bad thing that it's just down the street from my house.
drunken crab.author: Irina S.
drunken crab.review: I LOVE THIS PLACE. I've always hated to get my hands dirty, so I always avoided ordering the crab here and was never too pleased with the other options on the menu. BUT, after I decided to stop being such a prissy eater, I realized what I was missing. The crab and garlic noodles alone earn this place 5 stars. The roast crab it to die for and that's actually what I usually wanna do after the massive stomachaches I get from butter overdose, but its oh so worth it. I've also had the drunken crab and it's an excellent option if you wanna skip the butter and be guiltless. It was flavorful and easy on the stomach. The atmosphere is nice and they even have a large dining room upstairs which I recently discovered. Thanh Long is definitely a winner and I'm not sure whether it's a good or bad thing that it's just down the street from my house.

excerpts: the garlic noodles with drunken crab are incredible together!
Having one without the other is good, but putting that crab meat into those garlic noodles takes it to the next level.
Definitely lives up to my expectation.
How good they are at their specialities is the only detriment to other dishes that would  probably seem better anywhere else where they wouldn't have to stand up to that crab or garlic noodles.
The curry prawns smell really good and have a smoky curry flavor but aren't anything special.
drunken crab.author: Bella P.
drunken crab.review:
Believe the hype!
Came here for the first time recently and the garlic noodles with drunken crab are incredible together!  Having one without the other is good, but putting that crab meat into those garlic noodles takes it to the next level. Definitely lives up to my expectation.  We also had the crab puffs-so much better than any crab puff appetizer I've had at any other Asian restaurant- and the mango salad which was not why I expected but still very tasty.  I would order both again and again.  The service is warm and friendly and overall a really pleasant atmosphere.  Worth the trek to the outskirts of the Sunset.  It's getting hard to get really good food in the city without having to wait and that wasn't the case here; we were seated immediately.  

How good they are at their specialities is the only detriment to other dishes that would  probably seem better anywhere else where they wouldn't have to stand up to that crab or garlic noodles. The curry prawns smell really good and have a smoky curry flavor but aren't anything special.

excerpts: I was less impressed by the drunken crab.
It was a little on the bland side.
I was expecting a bit more flavor, but the broth was kind of dull and watery.
It could have used a lot more flavor.
drunken crab.author: Andrew W.
drunken crab.review:
This place serves some very incredible food and some very good food, but it is very pricey.  For $38 dollars, you get one crab in a variety of styles.  The best here is the roasted crab.  It is delightfully buttery and peppery.  The sauce is so good, it inspired my sister to toss her entire bowl of rice into what was essentially a whole lot of crab flavored butter.  Calories be damned.  So, this dish was good.

I was less impressed by the drunken crab.  It was a little on the bland side.  I was expecting a bit more flavor, but the broth was kind of dull and watery.  It could have used a lot more flavor.  The crab was fresh, so it wasn't all bad.

We also got the shaken beef, which is beef marinaded in a sweet, salty sauce served with vegetables.  It was very tender.  The meat was cooked perfectly.  The vegetables complimented the meat very well.  But, the fried potatoes were a bit weird.  I would get this dish again.

The other good thing here is the garlic noodles.  FYI, it tastes like it has some fish sauce or oyster sauce or crab broth in it.  So, if you are vegetarian beware.  The presentation is really poor.  They come out looking like very ordinary tan noodles.  But, the flavor is salty and sweet with a nice garlic flavor.  It is a bit more on the sweeter side than I expected.  But, it was very good.

We also had the boulliabaisse, the salmon carpaccio, the soft shell crabs, the mixed seasonal vegetables and the sea bass.  The soft shell crabs are a definite miss.  They lacked seasoning.  The batter was not that crispy.  It was a below average dish.

The boulliabaisse was a nice fish broth with vegetables floating in it and some rock shrimp that were cooked well.  It was ok.  Just think Tom Yum soup.  Nothing really special.

The salmon carpaccio was tasty.  The shallots added a nice contrast to the sweet salmon.  But, the portion was very small.

The mixed seasonal vegetables were well cooked, but ultimately they were just roasted vegetables.  Nothing special.

Finally, the sea bass was a little overcooked.  The sauce was nice and mild.  It was ok.  But, nothing special.  It came with some vegetables in a light sauce.  

I also had a mixed drink.  It was a bit on the sweet side.  FYI, the food here is not spicy, so fruity drinks do not pair well.  It is better to go with one of the dry white wines.  For a Vietnamese place, they don't use a lot of sour flavors, so the dry wine brings a little acidity to the food and makes the flavors come out.

The dessert menu was not very exciting.  Deep fried banana, chocolate molten cake.  All the standard stuff.  Nothing unusual or complicated.  We skipped it.

The service was typical for an Asian restaurant.  Not very attentive.  But, everyone was well dressed.

The atmosphere is clean and surprisingly modern inside.  Outside, it looks like a dumpy Chinese restaurant in the Sunset.  But, there are some nice silks and figurines decorating the interior of the restaurant.  This is a good place for a special occasion meal or for a date although the clientele is a bit on the older side (mid to late 40s).  So, it is not exactly hip.  But, your date will appreciate the decor and the high quality food.

A word about parking.  Come early.  Parking in the Sunset is horrible.  You might have to walk a few blocks.  Our reservations were for 6 and we had to walk 2 blocks.  If you eat around 7, be prepared for a hike.  They have valet car service.  So, you have that option.

excerpts: We got Shrimp toast, salt and pepper calamari, two drunken crab, and a couple of orders of garlic noodles.
The drunken crab are simmered in Chardonnay, Sake, Brandy and seasoned with scallions, chives and black pepper.
drunken crab.author: Mike K.
drunken crab.review:
Ok so my brother and his friend from the East Coast were in town visiting and looking for a place specific to SF. I had been to PPQ and had gotten high recommendations for Thanh Long's crab and garlic noodles. The food did not disappoint!

We got Shrimp toast, salt and pepper calamari, two drunken crab, and a couple of orders of garlic noodles. As others have mentioned I wouldn't recommend this for a first date as it's pretty messy and full of garlic!

The drunken crab are simmered in Chardonnay, Sake, Brandy and seasoned with scallions, chives and black pepper. They were absolutely delicious and went perfectly with the garlic noodles. I'd highly recommend Thanh Long. It's worth the drive and cheaper than crustacean.

excerpts: these ive tried: the drunken crab - C (somewhat bland), roasted crab - A (peppery, delicious), tamarind crab - A (sweet and tasty), garlic noodles - A (strong garlic but sooo good), seabass - A (cooked and seasoned perfectly, spring rolls - C
drunken crab.author: Dee T.
drunken crab.review:
Of course the infamous garlic noodles and tamarind crab! Enough said.  YuMMMMM

Actually here is my letter grades for these ive tried: the drunken crab - C (somewhat bland), roasted crab - A (peppery, delicious), tamarind crab - A (sweet and tasty), garlic noodles - A (strong garlic but sooo good), seabass - A (cooked and seasoned perfectly, spring rolls - C (rice paper is dry, sauce is too sweet), lemon drop w/ chambord (kinda sweet)- B....

This place is tucked away and is small but it does have a bar with good cocktail in the foyer area. Parking sucks as everywhere in SF, but value is an option at $10.  Attire is casual and most of the tables seats only 2-4 people. During the weekends, if you do not want to wait more than 30 mins, be there before the door opens or call for a reservation. It seems there is one girl who answers the phone there that does not take reservations over the phone, weird.  The servers are attentive and nice. Noise level i guess depending if there obnoxious crowds or babies, its a moderate atmosphere.

excerpts:
I tried all the other crabs on the menu and if I were to rate it based on the taste, it would go in the order that it is listed on their menu:
Roast Crab
Drunken Crab
Tamarind Crab
drunken crab.author: Heidi C.
drunken crab.review:
First off, the crab puff things they sell for appetizers is a rip off. $10 for 6 pieces? No thanks. I rather spend $10 on a whole block of cream cheese at costco and eat that to my liking. 

Anyway, ONTO THE CRAB AND GARLIC NOODLES!
For two people, we got a whole roast crab and two plates of garlic noodles. I walked out of there feeling way crappy (or crabby?) since I just probably ate the equivalent of a stick of butter. BUT it was SO incredibly worth it. 

I tried all the other crabs on the menu and if I were to rate it based on the taste, it would go in the order that it is listed on their menu:
Roast Crab
Drunken Crab
Tamarind Crab

They give you a plastic bib so you don't get crab juices on you, and you pretty much eat with your hands. Make sure to eat the garlic noodles while they're hot. Doesn't taste as good when it's cooled down.

Last time we went, the market price for a crab was about $35. 

I love Thanh Long's crab!!

(Photos uploaded)

excerpts: and I had the drunken crab.
drunken crab.author: Pudgy G.
drunken crab.review:
So I've been to PPQ on 25-26th ave and Clement and had their crab twice. It was pretty good there.

However, today was my very first time trying Thang Long, and I was really blown away. I had a three course meal with my girlfriend. We started with the fried calamari and mussels, which were delicious. I personally, like the mussels more.

Then, for our main entrees, she had the roast crab and I had the drunken crab. My crab was good, but my girlfriend's roast crab had more pepper and I thought hers tasted better.

In the end, we had the lava chocolate cake for dessert and it was SO SO GOOD to top off everything we ate that was so mouth watering.

5 stars for the food and excellent service from my waiter, Lai, who checked up on us more than once and brought out our appetizers and entrees quickly. Also 5 stars for the cook, host, and wait staff, including the bus boy. 

It should be noted that we ate here around 650-7pm, which was a little busy already. But, as soon as we finished, around 830-9pm, it was already super packed in terms of waiting to be seated.

The downside for this restaurant is that it is a bit expensive, roughly $40-50 for one person, if you just order crab (approximately $35-40) and a beverage. But, for special occasions, this place is totally worth it!

excerpts:
-Salt and NO pepper calamari, plain nasty

-The drunken crab was such a disappointment; we did not pay $36 for a frozen crab 

-Service definitely needed improvement; when you put 100 lbs of salt in all your dishes, you should just give us a pitcher of water
drunken crab.author: Kris H.
drunken crab.review:
Tamarind crab +  garlic noodles =  nirvana for the taste buds

TL would get 5 stars if i didnt have to get down n dirty with the crab with a  plastic bib around my neck.  =)


UPDATE  4/13/08-
 I'm taking away 3 stars for a recent cruddy experience @ TL.  Let's see, where do I begin:

- When I give you a birthday cake, I expect you to put the damn thing in the fridge so the mango mousse will not die a slow death.

- $1 charge per person for cake cutting; that's almost as absurd as the $2 charge at Straits

-Dry, old, crappy rice; you are a friggin' Asian restaurant, learn to make some rice

-Traditional Viet salad; there's nothing traditional about the salad.  There's no flavor and you cant even taste the fish sauce.  What's with the bitter cabbage and 0 herbs?

-Salt and NO pepper calamari, plain nasty

-The drunken crab was such a disappointment; we did not pay $36 for a frozen crab 

-Service definitely needed improvement; when you put 100 lbs of salt in all your dishes, you should just give us a pitcher of water so we don't have to remind your servers about the water every 5 minutes

-Water served in chipped/broken glasses

-The tamarind crab and garlic noodles are good but the overall experience my friends and I had recently, DEFINITELY does not warrant the original 4 stars and another visit

excerpts: Ordered the garlic noodles, garlic crab $42 drunken crab, fleur de mango, Vietnamese salad, coconut shrimp, and some soups.
Everyone else at my table seemed ok
but I got a bit of a stomach ache due to the heaviness of the garlic noodles and crab sauce.
I am a little bit confused about why the garlic noodles are such a big deal.
It is a plate full of noodles with a hint of garlic.
Pretty basic.
drunken crab.author: Kei D.
drunken crab.review: Ordered the garlic noodles, garlic crab $42 drunken crab, fleur de mango, Vietnamese salad, coconut shrimp, and some soups.  Everyone else at my table seemed ok but I got a bit of a stomach ache due to the heaviness of the garlic noodles and crab sauce.  I am a little bit confused about why the garlic noodles are such a big deal.  It is a plate full of noodles with a hint of garlic.  Pretty basic.

excerpts: i had some of the drunken crab which was good too.
drunken crab.author: Christine G.
drunken crab.review:
BIG FAN!!!

I thought to myself how good can you really make a crab taste? And after all the hype from my family, my boyfriend, cousin, his girlfriend and I ventured out to Thanh Long.

roasted crab and garlic noodles. it's all you need to silence anyone. i guarantee it. and my boyfriend doesn't compliment any food place, so for him to make it a point to say the place was good says a lot.

i had some of the drunken crab which was good too. 

i also recommend the jasmine tea afterwards. it helps take off the edge from being full.

excerpts: We tried both the roasted crab and the drunken crab.
Hands down, we all preferred the roasted crab.
Shoot, I'd even say forget the drunken crab, the roasted crab has way better flavors and seasonings!
You can decide for yourself.
The crabs were fat and juicy nonetheless.
I'm Filipino, so for anyone who needs rice, be sure to order some to soak all the yummy juices and seasonings.
You're gonna be licking your fingers!
drunken crab.author: Melissa M.
drunken crab.review:
You may experience trouble finding parking because there's only street parking, but the restaurant has a valet system if you are down to throw in an extra $10 plus tip. I say, park a block or two down and use that money for an appetizer, but that's just me.

I also strongly recommend that you phone in before you go, just to reduce your wait time. My brothers and I came on a Sunday night (8pm) and everyone who walked in after us had a 30 min wait time. Plus, there isn't much room in the waiting area besides a few chairs and the nearby bar. I do suppose that waiting helps build up your appetite because the restaurant is filled with its delicious aroma...

FOOD-
The reason we came was for the crab, which everyone has recommended. We tried both the roasted crab and the drunken crab. Hands down, we all preferred the roasted crab. Shoot, I'd even say forget the drunken crab, the roasted crab has way better flavors and seasonings! You can decide for yourself. The crabs were fat and juicy nonetheless. I'm Filipino, so for anyone who needs rice, be sure to order some to soak all the yummy juices and seasonings. You're gonna be licking your fingers! Oh and if you're wondering about the cost, the crab is at Market Price per pound.

The garlic noodles were also recommended to us by family. One order is good for 3-4 ppl, but since I was with my two big brothers we ordered two. I wasn't as crazy for the noodles probably because all my attention went to the crabs. But as it is one of the signature dishes, you should try it. If you were on a budget and had to pick between rice and noodles though, I'd honestly say go with rice.

33 beer is the perfect compliment to your crabs!

Lastly, we had the mussels and the calamari for appetizers. The calamari was lightly battered and really tasty. The mussels were exquisite!

Service was great. The waiters are always switching out the bowls for your empty shells. Also, at the end of your meal they give you hot towels for your hands, not to substitute you washing your hand but the hot towel helps with the crabby garlic smell on your hands.

HIGHLY RECOMMENDED! This is the perfect place to bring your family from out of town!

excerpts: DRunken crab was decent, price was around $40.
And when I realized this place is the same owner as Crustacean in bev.hills
, i knew why their mediocre vietnamese food was hyped up with price on steroids.
I was offended there too when we saw the prices for the type of food we were served.
But at least there, you occasionally had star sighting.
Save your appetite for someplace good, we only eat three times a day.
drunken crab.author: Mindee C.
drunken crab.review:
Went on a rainy cold day, hubby raved about their crab and garlic noodles. We were one of the first ones to arrive, i noticed a sewerlike smell in the entrance area. Went towards the back towards the kitchen, smell is gone. So sit in the back if u can.

So selectively bad interior smell.
If u want to pay $33 for a garlicky fried chowmein noodles and four grilled tiger shrimp on top, order that. Fairly decent taste, but honestly i can name three other places that would charge way less for that treatment of shrimp. DRunken crab was decent, price was around $40.  And when I realized this place is the same owner as Crustacean in bev.hills, i knew why their mediocre vietnamese food was hyped up with price on steroids. I was offended there too when we saw the prices for the type of food we were served. But at least there, you occasionally had star sighting. Save your appetite for someplace good, we only eat three times a day.

excerpts: Ordered one roast crab, one drunken crab, garlic noodles.
So excited to eat fresh Dungeness.
Except that, it wasn't very fresh.
Both crabs had that faint ammonia taste -- like they'd been sitting around for a couple of days, or maybe they'd been frozen?
Whatever the reason, this was NOT fresh crab.
Service was good, price was a little high, but not terrible.
But not fresh?
At a place renowned for crab?
I would never go here again.
drunken crab.author: Nancy S.
drunken crab.review: We went to Thanh Long 3 days into Dungeness Crab season in SF.  It has great reviews on crab.  We were seated right away -- last table, so we were grateful.  Ordered one roast crab, one drunken crab, garlic noodles.  So excited to eat fresh Dungeness.  Except that, it wasn't very fresh.  Both crabs had that faint ammonia taste -- like they'd been sitting around for a couple of days, or maybe they'd been frozen?  Whatever the reason, this was NOT fresh crab.  Service was good, price was a little high, but not terrible.  But not fresh?  At a place renowned for crab?  I would never go here again.

excerpts: The roast crab and drunken crab were great!
drunken crab.author: Wilson W.
drunken crab.review: The roast crab and drunken crab were great! Garlic noodles were very tasty as well. We tried the sea bass and that turned out to be a little dry. But their calamari appetizer is very unique and worth a try!

excerpts: - Roasted Crab (originally I planned to order the drunken crab, but the waiter asked if this was my first time here or not and told us that people recommended the roasted crab over the drunken crab).
The crab was delicious, huge, and good for both my girlfriend and I. (GF is a small eater, so probably you might wanna order 1 crab per person).
However, I did find it a bit dry.
drunken crab.author: Gordon L.
drunken crab.review:
Yelp have done it again! Great recommendation!

Came here after doing a search around my neighborhood. The place was nearby and it had crabs and garlic noodles, so we gave it a try.

Finding the place wasn't hard, but looking for a parking spot is another story! I saw them offering valet parking for $10, but I didn't think it was worth it. Found a spot (lucky) after 5 mins of circling around. Went in and the place was PACKED! They told us that we might have to wait about 30-40 mins... I was tired so I waited. 15 minutes later we got a table (lucky x2!)

Foods that we ordered:
- Grilled Calamari for starter - pretty tasty and good. A good dish to start off with. In fact, most of their starters looks good too.
- Roasted Crab (originally I planned to order the drunken crab, but the waiter asked if this was my first time here or not and told us that people recommended the roasted crab over the drunken crab). The crab was delicious, huge, and good for both my girlfriend and I. (GF is a small eater, so probably you might wanna order 1 crab per person). However, I did find it a bit dry.
- Garlic Noodles, first time eating such delicious garlic noodle! I wonder if they do take-outs? If they do, I think I would drop by from time to time and just get this to go!!! YUMMMM!!

The price was on the expensive side! My total came around 70ish to 80? I forgot... but it was well worth it in my opinion.

SUMMARY:
Pros - great food, cosy atmosphere, and some nice services!
Cons - hard to find parking, might need to make reservation since it is a small place, packed (our table were very close to the other customers), and expensive.

5 STARS in my book!

excerpts: They only have three kinds of crab: Drunken crab (white wine sauce/cooking liquid), tamarind crab, and roasted crab (We've tried both the tamarind crab and the roasted crab (butter and garlic sauce).
The tamarind crab was okay, but the tamarind sauce was good but so overpowering compared to the delicate taste of the crab meat.
You can't even taste the crab with the tamarind sauce laced throughout this dish.
It is so tangy, sweet, and sour.
drunken crab.author: Anh D.
drunken crab.review:
Roasted crab and garlic noodles. 

The garlic noodles are amazing. The sauce on them is something miraculous -- very salty and savory (defines quintessential umami). 

Crab is their specialty. You want to try a crab dish when you're here. They only have three kinds of crab: Drunken crab (white wine sauce/cooking liquid), tamarind crab, and roasted crab (We've tried both the tamarind crab and the roasted crab (butter and garlic sauce). 

The tamarind crab was okay, but the tamarind sauce was good but so overpowering compared to the delicate taste of the crab meat. You can't even taste the crab with the tamarind sauce laced throughout this dish. It is so tangy, sweet, and sour. It was good for the first few bites, but I couldn't eat much  of this. 

The roasted crab, however, was divine. Garlic and butter -- what could be better? Not much more to be said than that. The crab meat was very light and tasted fresh. Very rich, though, from the butter and garlic so definitely not something to eat too regularly. 

We also tried the shaken beef dish, and it was pretty delicious as well. Very tender, juicy, and well-seasoned beef. Juiciness/tenderness is often a factor that goes wrong in this dish at many restaurants, because if you pan-saute small cubes of meat, they often get dry and stringy. No such problem here! If you have any people in your company who don't like crab or seafood, there are many options, including the shaken beef, available for delicious dining besides crab. 

The calamari appetizer is something else that we've had here, and it's delicious as well. 

Great food, okay prices (crab dishes are all "market price"), and a great spot in the city. You will have to get valet parking unless you want to walk a couple blocks, so bring cash!

excerpts:
Must Haves:
Garlic Asian Noodles
Drunken Crab

Tried:
Shaken Beef
Roast Crab
The most stellar items on the imenu that I tried were the garlic asian noodles and the drunken crab.
The garlic asian noodles just burst with flavor.
Each bite has such wonderful garlic  and other spices that make this dish outstanding.
Dare I say, even more memorable than the crab!
The drunken crab was the better of the two.
Simmering alcohol into any food just makes it all the better in my book.
They cook the crab with chardonnay, sake, and brandy which makes it even more spectacular.
(Secret, I could have easily slurped up the sauce/juice/au jus or whatever it's called.
The shaken beef was tender, juicy, tasty, and all that jazz, but Thanh Long is famous for crab and there is a reason for that.
It is a good sized portion.
Great beef quality and very, very tasty, but I was just in the mood for MORE CRAB
The roast crab was also good, but I found it to be a little too dry.
It is less messier than the drunken crab, but you already eating crab and it is is bound to look messy.
I mean really, is there any real proper way to eat a crab in public?
I think not.
drunken crab.author: Tawny A.
drunken crab.review:
Yummy to my tummy.

Must Haves:
Garlic Asian Noodles
Drunken Crab

Tried:
Shaken Beef
Roast Crab

The most stellar items on the imenu that I tried were the garlic asian noodles and the drunken crab. The garlic asian noodles just burst with flavor. Each bite has such wonderful garlic  and other spices that make this dish outstanding. Dare I say, even more memorable than the crab! MUST EAT.

The drunken crab was the better of the two. Simmering alcohol into any food just makes it all the better in my book. They cook the crab with chardonnay, sake, and brandy which makes it even more spectacular. (Secret, I could have easily slurped up the sauce/juice/au jus or whatever it's called. Actually, I probably did).

The shaken beef was tender, juicy, tasty, and all that jazz, but Thanh Long is famous for crab and there is a reason for that. It is a good sized portion. Great beef quality and very, very tasty, but I was just in the mood for MORE CRAB PLEASE.

The roast crab was also good, but I found it to be a little too dry. It is less messier than the drunken crab, but you already eating crab and it is is bound to look messy. I mean really, is there any real proper way to eat a crab in public? I think not.

excerpts: I also tried the drunken crab.
It's alright.
I don't think I would order it again though.
drunken crab.author: Christian M.
drunken crab.review:
THE VERY BEST CRAB PLACE THAT I'VE TASTED.

There's a statement for ya off the bat, eh?  My pareng Jimmy kept telling me about this place called Thanh Long that had amazing crabs that were decked out in a nice garlic pepper sauce.  I've heard about this place for months now.  Being from San Diego, it took awhile to try it but it was definitely worth the wait.

The place seems like a hole in the wall from the outside.  The location isn't the prettiest in the world so it made me kind of skeptical of the place.  I walked in and saw a BUSY environment filled with people waiting at the door step.  We had reservations so we got seated fairly quickly.  

There's a full menu of things to order but we went simple and went straight for the crab.  At first we decided to go with some appetizers so we started off with the cheese wontons.  They're decent.  I'm not sure I'd recommend getting them.  I'd probably say just wait for the main course.  The crabs are HUGE.  We were a party of 7 so we decided to order 4 king crabs and some garlic noodles to accompany the crabs.  We went simple with our order.  We ordered two of the drunken crabs and two of the "roast' ones that featured a nice peppered garlic sauce on it.

We got our order after about 15 minutes.  Not too shabby.  Good food takes awhile so I wasn't really concerned with the timing.  I took one bite of the roast crab.  WOW.  The peppered garlic sauce is AMAZING.  I don't think I've ever tried crab THAT GOOD.  I broke off a couple of legs and began digging in.  I dipped the crab meat into the garlic sauce and felt heaven after each bite.  What makes things even better was the garlic noodles.  They're SO GOOD.  I think I had like two plates of the garlic noodles to myself!  I ate so much food.  There's also a bunch of crab fat in the head.  Just writing this review is getting me hungry.  Unfortunately, I'm back in San Diego!!!

I also tried the drunken crab.  It's alright.  I don't think I would order it again though.  I think my next trip would consist of roast crab, garlic noodles, and sapporo beer.  Keep it simple.  I'd recommend this place to anyone and EVERYONE.  

If you are in the LA area, I believe the owner of Thanh Long also owns CRUSTACEAN.  I think it's a upper scale version of Thanh Long.  Same food but higher prices.  At least there's an option in Southern Cal.  Awesome food!

excerpts: The delicious items we chose for our meal were the drunken crab, dungeness crab puffs, buddha roll, shaken beef, and of course their famous garlic noodles.
After tasting garlic we definitely wanted dessert and settled for their creme brulee which was very rich but satisfied our sweet tooth.
drunken crab.author: Emy B.
drunken crab.review:
I likey!  The food here is very yummy.  If you like crab this is the place to come have it, and be prepared to work at getting all the succulent meat out of the shells.  The delicious items we chose for our meal were the drunken crab, dungeness crab puffs, buddha roll, shaken beef, and of course their famous garlic noodles.  After tasting garlic we definitely wanted dessert and settled for their creme brulee which was very rich but satisfied our sweet tooth.  Next time we'll have to order their fried banana dessert with ice cream which we kept staring at on the other tables.

Parking is not easy to find, but they offer valet service for $10 if you get impatient.  Will definitely be back...yee!  If you're curious check out their website at anfamily.com, click on Thanh Long and download the menu.

excerpts:
For once.. I am not insecure about a review, and don't feel the need to prattle and rattle on as I am prone to....

get the Drunken crab...

simply the best seafood in the city.
drunken crab.author: Uncle Fishbits Aeneas X.
drunken crab.review:
For once.. I am not insecure about a review, and don't feel the need to prattle and rattle on as I am prone to....

get the Drunken crab...

simply the best seafood in the city.  I have never, ever eaten a whole crab like this in my life.  Unbelievable.

excerpts: The garlic noodle, drunken crab, and roasted crab were not very strong in flavor.
The calamari, though, was pretty good.
Sea bass was probably highlighter of the night!
drunken crab.author: Verdina P.
drunken crab.review: Hmmm this place is suppose to be a 3.5, but since there are no halves, i gave a 4. Food was good but not great. Its not something i'd cave for again. It wasnt bad, but just the taste is a little bit plain. The garlic noodle, drunken crab, and roasted crab were not very strong in flavor. The calamari, though, was pretty good. Sea bass was probably highlighter of the night!

excerpts: The good things about Thanh Long are the Garlic Roasted and/or the Drunken Crab, and the garlic noodles.
drunken crab.author: Danny G.
drunken crab.review:
The not -so-good things are the prices and hard-to-find-street-parking.

The good things about Thanh Long are the Garlic Roasted and/or the Drunken Crab, and the garlic noodles.

The better thing is that I think I now have their garlic noodle recipe down pat, and can make it myself at home

excerpts: : I had the drunken crab, a whole dungeness cooked in wine, pepper and spices.
The preparation was excellent.
The crab itself was only so-so.
Both of my friends had the royal tiger prawn, grilled with spices and served over noodles.
The crab was good, not great - and did not taste fresh.
The prawns garnered a similar reaction from my friends.
drunken crab.author: Jeffrey R.
drunken crab.review:
I tried Thanh Long with a couple of friends on a recent trip to San Francisco and went there with high hopes, because the place has a good reputation.

Unfortunately, I feel that the restaurant only partially lived up to that reputation. The food was okay: I had the drunken crab, a whole dungeness cooked in wine, pepper and spices. The preparation was excellent. The crab itself was only so-so.  Both of my friends had the royal tiger prawn, grilled with spices and served over noodles. The crab was good, not great - and did not taste fresh. The prawns garnered a similar reaction from my friends.Both dishes ran upwards of $35. 

The vietnam salad - vegetables and vinaigrette with peanuts and the garlic noodles were better, both really tasty, but at those prices - and on top of the cost of the entree, it is really hard to recommend the place. 

The service was good. We were seated quickly and it's good they have a valet in a neighborhood where street parking can be hard to find, but that is just another add-on to an expensive evening and what was in the balance only an adequate meal.

excerpts: Price was pretty steep for the food we ordered - shrimp toast, shaken beef, roast crab, drunken crab, and garlic noodles.
To be honest, all the food didn't stand out for the price we pay - it wasn't bad, but it wasn't that good etiher.
For the wait and price, I should have gone to somewhere else.
drunken crab.author: edgard k.
drunken crab.review: Went there since few friends raved about how good the garlic noodles. Went around dinner time without reservations and our party had to wait for about 45 minutes before being seated. No private parking lot, so parking can be hectic - but might as well go around looking for parking while dropping 1 of your party to book a spot if you don't have any reservations since you have to wait for a while anyway. Price was pretty steep for the food we ordered - shrimp toast, shaken beef, roast crab, drunken crab, and garlic noodles. To be honest, all the food didn't stand out for the price we pay - it wasn't bad, but it wasn't that good etiher. For the wait and price, I should have gone to somewhere else.

excerpts: Drunken Crab, Roasted Crab and some garlic noodles.
Go with the classics here and just enjoy the very interactive and enjoyable eating experience.
Definitely worth the trip out to the outer sunset.
Not cheap either, but just a fun, different experience.
drunken crab.author: Michael N.
drunken crab.review: Drunken Crab, Roasted Crab and some garlic noodles.  Go with the classics here and just enjoy the very interactive and enjoyable eating experience.  Definitely worth the trip out to the outer sunset.  Not cheap either, but just a fun, different experience.

excerpts: For the four of us, (in-laws, hubby and I) we ordered one Roasted Garlic Crab, one Drunken Crab, two orders of the Garlic Noodles and one shaken beef.
For dessert, we had their deep fried pineapple
a la mode - mmm, delicious.
The shaken beef was also very flavorful and tender served over pieces of lettuce covered with some dressing.
Although this place is known for their Roasted Garlic Crab, I personally favored the Drunken crab for it's more natural flavor cooked with the perfect complimenting wine.
drunken crab.author: Ivy P.
drunken crab.review:
My in-laws wanted to try this place since they heard this place makes the best garlic noodles and crab.  When we arrived, parking was hard to find, even for a Tuesday evening! Luckily we got to the restaurant early (around 6 pm) b/c by 7 pm, the place was packed with lots of customers at the door waiting to be seated.  

The ambiance of this place was really nice and dimly lit, the perfect place for a date if you're ok with getting down and dirty with some crabs.  The service here was just as good as the food - very attentive, fast and professional. 

For the four of us, (in-laws, hubby and I) we ordered one Roasted Garlic Crab, one Drunken Crab, two orders of the Garlic Noodles and one shaken beef. For dessert, we had their deep fried pineapple a la mode - mmm, delicious. The shaken beef was also very flavorful and tender served over pieces of lettuce covered with some dressing.  

For Garlic Lovers, this is the place to go.  Everything was incredibly flavorful.  Although this place is known for their Roasted Garlic Crab, I personally favored the Drunken crab for it's more natural flavor cooked with the perfect complimenting wine. I would love to know how they are able to infuse the flavors so well into the crab meat.  

Warning: the Garlic flavor lingers in the mouth (and breath) hours after you're done eating. Also, it's kind of a splurge to eat here b/c of the cost (we paid $38 per crab - seasonal price) It is more expensive to go during the non crab season.  

Final Verdict: This is a MUST TRY place if you love good flavorful crab and garlic.  It's a good thing I live so far away otherwise, we'd be making this a regular stop on my list of places to eat.

excerpts: We order 3 roasted garlic crabs and 1 drunken crab.
I would definitely recommend the roasted.
Paired with a sweet white wine was the perfect combination.
The crabs are freakishly large with market price today of $37.99.
And the service is great, they even tie a bib on for you since we are gonna get down and dirty.
The server was brutally honest when we asked which soup is good...his reply...
"actually none of the soups are good here"
drunken crab.author: gordon w.
drunken crab.review:
I finally got my fix of roasted garlic crab tonight. The four of us came to Thanh long and ordered 2 dishes of the incredibly tasty garlic noodles and we each had our own crabs. We order 3 roasted garlic crabs and 1 drunken crab. I would definitely recommend the roasted. Paired with a sweet white wine was the perfect combination. 
 
The crabs are freakishly large with market price today of $37.99. And the service is great, they even tie a bib on for you since we are gonna get down and dirty. The server was brutally honest when we asked which soup is good...his reply..."actually none of the soups are good here"  I thought that was hilarious, yet its great that he was just being honest. 

I'm so looking forward for my next Thahn Long fix! 

TIP** the roasted crabs are drenched in buttery sauce, eat fast before the butter coagulates. I would suggest when the crabs arrive at your table, stop all conversations and just eat quickly!

excerpts: Then we ordered two each of the Roast Crab, Drunken Crab and Tamarind Crab.
drunken crab.author: Dannigan P.
drunken crab.review:
I had a business dinner meeting with my colleagues and wanted to get the "Real " San Francisco experience since everyone flew in from different parts of the U.S. 

This place was recommended from a good college friend and it was the BEST recommendation ever!

The drive made me nervous since we were coming from the Sir Francis Drake and if the food wasn't excellent I would have heard about  this one for quite some time.

We ordered appetizers and all were excellent. Then we ordered two each of the Roast Crab, Drunken Crab and Tamarind Crab. 

OMG! It was a Hit with everyone and I was a hero for a day ; )

Highly reccomended and enjoy a great dining experience.

excerpts: I ordered the Drunken Crab and garlic noodles, it was delish!
drunken crab.author: Nesha P.
drunken crab.review: Came here last night for the first time and will def come back again. Their customer service is A-1 didnt have to wait no more than 5 mins to get our drinks. I ordered the Drunken Crab and garlic noodles, it was delish!

excerpts: I recommend the roast and drunken crab.
It's about $40 per crab
but it's a huge crab.
drunken crab.author: LZ T.
drunken crab.review: Love this place! The best garlic noodles ever had in the city!  I recommend the roast and drunken crab. It's about $40 per crab but it's a huge crab.

excerpts: Two things to try, the Shaky Beef and the Drunken Crab.
AWESOME!!!
(yes, three exclamation points for both)
I'm told that the garlic crab is great as well.
I've never had crab without butter, but believe me you don't need it.
Give this little quaint place a try, I know you won't regret it.
I wish I had a little beef and crab in front of me right now.
drunken crab.author: Brad S.
drunken crab.review: Two things to try, the Shaky Beef and the Drunken Crab.  AWESOME!!! (yes, three exclamation points for both)  I'm told that the garlic crab is great as well.  I've never had crab without butter, but believe me you don't need it.  Give this little quaint place a try, I know you won't regret it.  I wish I had a little beef and crab in front of me right now.

excerpts: One of my dinner companions ordered drunken crab and declared it yummy but not mind blowing.
We all tasted and commented, however, the crab was not fresh but frozen.
So that was a bit of a let down.
Yes, Dungeness are out of season locally but can be had fresh farther up the coast.
drunken crab.author: Donna H.
drunken crab.review:
I only knew Thanh Long from their short-lived take out counter in the food court of One Market Plaza in FiDi many moons ago.  I was addicted to the garlic noodles then.  I'd long heard about this legendary restaurant and just never made it out to 46th avenue until last evening. Thanh Long has a long and venerable history in San Francisco.   It almost pains me to write this review because I came away with my socks still firmly attached to my feet.  I was not blown away as others have been.  I was very sad about it, too.  I wanted to have my socks blown off.

The meal began with salt & pepper calamari and it was tasty.  The best thing we ate all evening.  The vietnamese salad was generous but lacked flavor.  It was essentially super fine shredded cabbage.  The prawns on top were boiled, tender and split.  

I ordered the Tiger Prawns over garlic noodles.  The garlic noodles were a known aspect, so I knew what to expect, they were as garlicky as I remembered.  The 4 prawns were butterflied and grilled and were tasty.  For a market price item I thought the prawns were very spendy, just a few bucks under the price of a crab.  Ouch!  

One of my dinner companions ordered drunken crab and declared it yummy but not mind blowing.  We all tasted and commented, however, the crab was not fresh but frozen.  So that was a bit of a let down.  Yes, Dungeness are out of season locally but can be had fresh farther up the coast.  If I come back to try to famous roasted crab, I'll come back when it's in season.  

My overall thoughts are this was tasty, but, a plate of garlic noodles and 4 prawns and salad set me back $60 and I came away unsatisfied.  I wanted to be blown away, I'd heard the stories and I just was not super impressed.  

The service was fine, attentive and not overwhelming.  Water was refilled and bowls were replaced quickly.  The hot towels were great and a must.

The place was also incredibly noisy.  Obviously a celebration destination, be prepared to have trouble holding a conversation.  We had no desserts.

excerpts: Roasted Crab, Drunken Crab and Garlic Prawn Noodles.
OMG.
If you're craving crab THIS IS THE PLACE TO GO.
Hands down the best place for crab in SF.
drunken crab.author: Suz L.
drunken crab.review: I normally don't leave the city or what I consider the city but Thang Long is worth the drive to the avenues.  Roasted Crab, Drunken Crab and Garlic Prawn Noodles.  OMG.  If you're craving crab THIS IS THE PLACE TO GO.  Hands down the best place for crab in SF.

excerpts: I have had both the Drunken Crab and the Garlic.
I prefer the Garlic crab the best.
However, both crabs are seasoned well and taste great.
They give you a pretty good size crab, enough to get a grown man full when you order sides, but a bit pricey.
drunken crab.author: Wes O.
drunken crab.review:
No Cameras please, cause this is going to get messy. There will be someone that will think that its cute that you are sitting there with a bib on and crab meat on your chin, but its not. This is not a first- fourth date type of place. You come here for crab when you don't care anymore, you've got him/her. 

I only come here for the crab. I have had both the Drunken Crab and the Garlic. I prefer the Garlic crab the best. However, both crabs are seasoned well and taste great. They give you a pretty good size crab, enough to get a grown man full when you order sides, but a bit pricey.

excerpts: 4 roasted crab, 1 drunken crab, 2 dishes of garlic noodles, 3 appetizers (make sure to try their mussels), fried banana desserts and some drinks later, we were in our own happy place when we were done!
Drunken crab was good, especially if you have more than 2 people, order one of each and exchange half with each other to try both flavors.
I like the saltiness of roasted crab, but drunken crab had more milder flavor to it.
I also liked the way they've cleaned the crab and chopped them in half, as it was easier for me to dig in as soon as the crab arrived on our table.
drunken crab.author: Tomomi S.
drunken crab.review:
I had Thanh Long in my Yelp bookmark for over a year and finally, I got a chance to try their famous crabs the other night. 6 of us drove up from South Bay, ready to eat-till-we-drop on their famous crabs. 

Pretty much other great reviews says it all but let me say this... WOW!!!!!! They serve some seriously tasty, finger licking crabs and seafood here. 4 roasted crab, 1 drunken crab, 2 dishes of garlic noodles, 3 appetizers (make sure to try their mussels), fried banana desserts and some drinks later, we were in our own happy place when we were done!

Roasted crabs drizzled with fabulously addictive seasoning of butter, salt, pepper, garlic was just so additively yummy. Drunken crab was good, especially if you have more than 2 people, order one of each and exchange half with each other to try both flavors. I like the saltiness of roasted crab, but drunken crab had more milder flavor to it. I also liked the way they've cleaned the crab and chopped them in half, as it was easier for me to dig in as soon as the crab arrived on our table. They'll give you a hot towel later, so don't worry about making a mess and just dig in.

All of us were in a serious food coma on our drive home. All I could think about was the steaming hot roasted crab!!! I'll definitely come back here again.

excerpts: The Drunken crab was good(but not delicious) and definitely not worth $35.
drunken crab.author: Jenny K.
drunken crab.review:
I love crab, but I avoid it most of the time because of how messy and time-consuming it is to eat.  The only thing that makes the mess and time worthwhile is if the crab is tasty and priced just right.  

Each year, the Russian River Valley Crab & Wine Festival spoils me with their unlimited quantities of crab (usually I eat around 6 or 8) and glasses of delicious wine ... all for a very modest $45.  

Thanh Long charges $35 for ONE crab.  ONE CRAB!! The Drunken crab was good(but not delicious) and definitely not worth $35.  The garlic noodles were kind of dry, the portion was small, and the chef seems to know nothing about presentation.  The drinks were tasty and pretty, but weak and overpriced.  As soon as our group of 12 were finished with dessert and presented with our unjustifiably inflated bill, the host came upstairs to ask us to leave.  Nice touch.

Now that I've been to Thanh Long, I don't have to go back.   Oh yeah ... just because a restaurant charges you an arm and a leg for a meal doesn't mean you have to dress up in your finest.  It's really not a fancy place.  It just bills you as if it were.

excerpts: I ordered a roasted crab and a drunken crab and garlic noodle.
The garlic noodle is the best part.
The roasted crab is too salty and peppery.
The drunken crab is bland.
$40 per crab.
The crab is at most slightly over one pound each.
drunken crab.author: J D.
drunken crab.review:
I went there because of a recommendation.  I am not very impressed.  It is over priced.  I ordered a roasted crab and a drunken crab and garlic noodle.  The garlic noodle is the best part.  The roasted crab is too salty and peppery.  The drunken crab is bland.  $40 per crab.  The crab is at most slightly over one pound each.  I can buy it for $6.99 per pound at 99 Ranch, and my mom's crab is more yummy.

I don't think I will go back again.

excerpts: I love the garlic roasted crab and hubs loves the drunken crab.
I've made the garlic roasted for us at home
but it never quite measures up.
There must be a secret ingredient of some sort.
Maybe the secret is those plastic bibs they give you.
(BTW, is it my imagination or have those bibs gotten smaller?
Or is it just that my belly has gotten bigger??)
Oh- and a tip for those who don't eat the crab but are dining with someone (or next to someone) who is: request a bib for yourself.
drunken crab.author: Teri T.
drunken crab.review:
If you love crab and aren't afraid of garlic, this is definitely THE place to go. As everyone else has already said, the crab and garlic noodles are the best! When dungeness is out of season, it can be pricey (I think we've paid as much as $54 once - when we were desperate) but otherwise, on price (usually about $27 - $37), it's comparable to other places while beating the pants of other places in terms of flavor.

I love the garlic roasted crab and hubs loves the drunken crab. I've made the garlic roasted for us at home but it never quite measures up. There must be a secret ingredient of some sort. Maybe the secret is those plastic bibs they give you. (BTW, is it my imagination or have those bibs gotten smaller?  Or is it just that my belly has gotten bigger??) Oh- and a tip for those who don't eat the crab but are dining with someone (or next to someone) who is: request a bib for yourself. Otherwise, beware flying crab juice, crab meat pieces, or droplets of garlic sauce. 

The garlic noodles (also impossible to duplicate at home!) are delish and there's enough in one order to share between two - unless you're with a pregnant woman and then beware any who dare approach the plate until she's finished. I don't care if it's hubs or the waiter - hands off my noodles until I'm done!

The seabass is yummy too, but not nearly as fun or as filling as the crab. It was cooked perfectly and accompanied by vegetables that complimented the flavor just right.  The shaken beef is - to me - the best beef dish on the menu. Soooo tender and flavorful!  Seasonal veggies are good too, although sometimes they taste just like the beef. Must use the same sauce or at least the same spices.

Parking is definitely the only sucky part. But as others have recommended, go during off-peak hours and it should be easier to find a spot. Otherwise, at least there's valet. Small price to pay for an hour+ of crab-eatin' heaven.

excerpts: Garlic noddle and the drunken crab is my favorite.
parking is hard to find, so I always valet my car.
I also suggest making reservations.
Talking about the food makes me hungry for come crab!!
drunken crab.author: C B.
drunken crab.review: Craving for some crab. Thanh Long is the place to go. The wait could be long at times but it is well worth it. Garlic noddle and the drunken crab is my favorite. parking is hard to find, so I always valet my car. I also suggest making reservations. Talking about the food makes me hungry for come crab!!

excerpts: so I cant comment on their drunken crab
but my roomates said that the suauce is amazing.
All in all I would come back for the garlic noodles and my friends for the drunken crab...
BUT I WOULD NOT ORDER ANYTHING ELSE.
drunken crab.author: Beach L.
drunken crab.review:
best garlic noodles I have ever had. Better than crustacean. I think there is garlic butter, and soy in them.. and somehow the flavors just mesh really well. 

Im allergic to seafood so I cant comment on their drunken crab but my roomates said that the suauce is amazing. the crab itself is good they said, but they have had fresher crab which has tasted better.

dont get the shaken beef or lemon grass beef. its one of the worst I have ever had. Their traditional salad was also not very impressive.


My friend had the orange sherbert and liked it but said you didnt get much since it came in a frozen orange. I had the fried ice cream and it was okay. I have had better though.

All in all I would come back for the garlic noodles and my friends for the drunken crab... BUT I WOULD NOT ORDER ANYTHING ELSE.

excerpts: We got the original and the drunken crab.
Both types of crab are good, but I think I prefer the Drunken Crab.
drunken crab.author: Robert L.
drunken crab.review:
