In another review, I mentioned this place as having better crab.  Then I realized that I didn't write a review on this place.

I've been here twice. The first time was by accident.  A friend was visiting the City and wanted to go to some African restaurant that was supposed to be near this place, except that we couldn't find it.  We were driving around and saw this little seafood joint and figured to just give it a try.  Obviously we're not SF natives, because apparently EVERYONE else knows about this place.

We sit down and notice that everyone is having crab, so we figure it's the specialty. We order ourselves some crab, too. We got the original and the drunken crab. 

Now, I grew up in LA. Down there, we drive to Redondo Beach, where there are sidewalk restaurants that serve fresh crab. We take mallets and crack the crab, dip it in lemon juice from fresh squeezed lemons, and eat. 

But here we are in a nice restaurant ordering crab, and the waiter asks if we want noodles. Now I'm confused. I've never eaten crabs with noodles before. So we ask, do people usually eat noodles with crab?  He says yea. So we order noodles just for kicks.

They put bibs on us, which is a nice touch. They also give us those funny little contraptions for cracking the shells.  Now I feel like Julia Roberts in Pretty Woman, when she's eating those oysters in the nice restaurant and one of the oysters flies out of the contraption.

To explain, I gotta take you back to my childhood, in Redondo Beach.  Like i explained, we got mallets to crack the shells. We don't use plates - they give us a sheet of wax paper instead.

Back to SF, I'm looking at the crab and this funny contraption, and I figure, what the hell, nobody's watching me. I stick the crab in my mouth and crack it with my teeth.  I get right to the meat and have me a good meal.  Both types of crab are good, but I think I prefer the Drunken Crab.  I never did use that funny contraption.

The second time I went there I knew what to expect.  But I still don't use that funny contraption.

excerpts: The good things about Thanh Long are the Garlic Roasted and/or the Drunken Crab, and the garlic noodles.
drunken crab.author: jen a.
drunken crab.review:
The not -so-good things are the prices and hard-to-find-street-parking.

The good things about Thanh Long are the Garlic Roasted and/or the Drunken Crab, and the garlic noodles.

The better thing is that I think I now have their garlic noodle recipe down pat, and can make it myself at home!

excerpts: $35 for Drunken crab.
My friend and I enjoyed it with a glass of wine.
Filling and scrumptious. =]
drunken crab.author: Jason C. J.
drunken crab.review:
If you're one of those people who love crab or can't stand a day without good seafood, this is the place for you. Located in the outer sunset, this place is delicious, cracking and full of surprises. I came here when my cousin worked here and all I got from the atmosphere was wow! a good place for a date (not to mention licking fingers good) 

You can be a kid here, don't forget to put on your cute little bib cuz it gets messy real quick! $35 for Drunken crab. My friend and I enjoyed it with a glass of wine. Filling and scrumptious. =]

excerpts: I ordered the drunken crab and ate the whole thing!
There was a long wait for a table
but I understand because it took me about 2 hours to finish my crab.
I suggest the drunken crab over the roast crab because I think the meat has more flavor.
drunken crab.author: Christy I.
drunken crab.review:
4.5 stars.  

I ordered the drunken crab and ate the whole thing!  There was a long wait for a table but I understand because it took me about 2 hours to finish my crab.  I suggest the drunken crab over the roast crab because I think the meat has more flavor.  I shared a plate of garlic noodles because they give generous portions.  Very delicious.  I did eat one whole crab by myself but it might be OK to share with another person as they are big portions and pricey.

Eating crab is messy.  That's why I was very happy that their service was excellent, especially with clearing the table of crab shells and providing wet towels and bibs.  The host/hostess and waiters were all very friendly and helpful.

It's better to make reservations, especially on weekends, because I had to wait about 40 minutes for a table.

excerpts: We all ordered  the drunken crab and 2 orders Garlic Noodles.
It was only about 10 minutes later and the wait staff put bibs on us and delivered all the plates/bowls necessary for our crab encounter.
Then came the crab, I have to say, it was the best crab I have ever had.
They boil there crab in an elixir of champagne, brandy with herbs.
It is so tender and delicious!
drunken crab.author: Bryan M.
drunken crab.review:
We had reservations at 8 and made it just in time. We were seated right away at a nice table. The place is pretty large with lots of seating, but definitely make a reservation as it seems to be quite busy. 

Our waiter was quick to come to the table to get us our drinks. I had a Vietnamese Beer "33", we ordered some appetizers that came out very quick. They were the Cheese Crab Puffs and the Mussels. Very good! I could have ate the mussels just for dinner, but I was there for the main course and their specialty: CRAB. We all ordered  the drunken crab and 2 orders Garlic Noodles. It was only about 10 minutes later and the wait staff put bibs on us and delivered all the plates/bowls necessary for our crab encounter. Then came the crab, I have to say, it was the best crab I have ever had. They boil there crab in an elixir of champagne, brandy with herbs. It is so tender and delicious! The Garlice Noodles are also one of a kind. 

Overall the dining experience was great and the wait staff are very good and attentive!

excerpts: There were 4 of us, so me and gf shared a plate of garlic noodles and a roasted crab, and our friends had the other plate of garlic noodles and a drunken crab.
I prefer our friends' drunken crab more since the sauce gives it more of a kick in the flavor IMO.
drunken crab.author: David C.
drunken crab.review:
Upon recommendations from friends, we all came here together for dinner, and making reservations was really the key as I cannot see how we could make it to this dinner without ever making a reservation.

Anyways, obviously we had what everybody had, garlic noodles and crab. There were 4 of us, so me and gf shared a plate of garlic noodles and a roasted crab, and our friends had the other plate of garlic noodles and a drunken crab. 

first things first, fresh crab plus garlic plus other kinds of sauces = tasty crab even. I prefer our friends' drunken crab more since the sauce gives it more of a kick in the flavor IMO. When I return, I will try that .

Now to the garlic noodles, I hope the following thing I mention will give you a good enough message - we ended up ordering a third plate to share.  Yup seriously, the way they prepared their food should be relatively simple, but the taste of these dishes totally overwhelmed me. The only complaint I will have on this plate, and others at this restaurant? If you can make the food look more colorful without sacrificing tastiness, Thanh Long, then I will come back and give you 5 stars. To me a plate with just crab and garlic or just noodles may not look so good in such an high-end, expensive Asian restaurant .....

excerpts: Order the drunken crab and garlic noodles.
drunken crab.author: Wendy B.
drunken crab.review:
Make a reservation in advance,
Show up on time,
Park yourself (drive around the block a few times)
Order the drunken crab and garlic noodles.

I would say if you are a man its acceptable to wear a nice pair of jeans and a nice shirt or sweater.  A woman could wear the same and still feel comfortable.  Then dress up from there if you want -- just wear something comfortable because its a lot of food.  You should probably wear no jewelry or take it off when dinner is served and wear short sleaves or sleaves you can keep out of your way.

Tables are close together and it is always crowded, the good news is everyone is just as messy as you are so you don't need to worry about looking like a pig.   You will walk away smelling like garlic and you will have it dripping down your arm at some point -- it isn't graceful at all.  Definitely wear the bib or you may be wearing butter stains the next time you wear your outfit.  The experience is fun and the tables are white linen.

Definitely a good time with a group of people, but again the tables are pretty tight.  Awesome service too!

excerpts: The garlic noodles and drunken crab = all you need in life.
I think my friend and I polished off 3 plates of garlic noodles, 2 drunken crabs, and 1 roasted crab.
Now that I look back on it, I don't know how we did that especially reading yelpers
say they couldnt finish one crab.
I was skinnier back then too!
HAHA.
The only explanation must be the sheer deliciousness of those dishes.
Maybe the other items on the menu are less memorable, but definitely go for their "signature" dishes.
drunken crab.author: Trish A.
drunken crab.review:
Thinking of this place and knowing I live on the other side of the country makes me shed a tear. I've only been to Thanh Long once, and it was about 2 years ago. But I can still smell and taste everything we had...


The garlic noodles and drunken crab = all you need in life. I think my friend and I polished off 3 plates of garlic noodles, 2 drunken crabs, and 1 roasted crab. Now that I look back on it, I don't know how we did that especially reading yelpers say they couldnt finish one crab. I was skinnier back then too! HAHA. The only explanation must be the sheer deliciousness of those dishes. Maybe the other items on the menu are less memorable, but definitely go for their "signature" dishes. You won't be disappointed.

 It gets a little messy and tedious, but hey! It's a fun experience. They also provide you a bib so it's all good in the hood. Also, your breath will be kickin' people in the face, so be wary when you lean in for a smooch.

excerpts: I've tried the drunken crab, its ok, but nothing compared to the roasted one.
It really is the best.
I don't mind getting all dirty and oily at all.
Some think one is enough to share with 2 or 3 people.
I can probably eat two by myself on a good day, so
drunken crab.author: Phil W.
drunken crab.review:
This is the only crab in town that I will get dirty for. Like most guys, I'm pretty lazy when it comes to eating crab. I might eat the best parts by using a fork and completely ignore the legs and claws. TL's roasted garlic crab is to die for. Even though it's really unhealthy how they soak the crabs in butter before roasting, but it really is the tastiest ones around. I've tried the drunken crab, its ok, but nothing compared to the roasted one. It really is the best. I don't mind getting all dirty and oily at all. Some think one is enough to share with 2 or 3 people. I can probably eat two by myself on a good day, so do order one for yourself and don't share. 

Also don't share the garlic noodles. It's pretty much spaghetti with garlic and butter, but for some reason, however they make it, it goes really well with the crab. I guess you need to add a little carb to the meal. I usually just get the roasted crab and the garlic noodles and I'm pretty much done. I've had friends order other dishes like fish or prawns, but those are just mediocre. 

I would have easily given it 5 stars, but the service wasn't all that great. Maybe because most of the evenings I've dined here were on weekends when it's really crowded and busy. But for the prices they charge, which are upscale restaurant prices, I expected the service to be better. Most of the servers act like they are in a pho place and weren't very friendly. Also on several occasions, they were a good 20 minutes behind schedule, so even with reservations, we had a good wait.

excerpts: The drunken crab tastes okay, but the roasted crab really is the way to go (esp. if you like butter and garlic!!).
Yum!!
I've gotten my own crab before, but I always have leftovers, so I might just go halfsies next time (to save money!).
There were 3 crazy skinny chicks at the next table sharing ONE crab -- THAT
drunken crab.author: Gray C.
drunken crab.review:
If only this wasn't so pricey (or we weren't so greedy), we'd come here a lot more often! Our out-of-town guests were deliciously happy with the meal here -- oooh, we had some awfully good grilled squid for an appetizer (we were tempted to order another one as soon as we scarfed it down)! 

The drunken crab tastes okay, but the roasted crab really is the way to go (esp. if you like butter and garlic!!). Yum!! I've gotten my own crab before, but I always have leftovers, so I might just go halfsies next time (to save money!). There were 3 crazy skinny chicks at the next table sharing ONE crab -- THAT I did not understand...if you're going to enjoy some food, ENJOY it already!!

And of course, like everyone says, the garlic noodles are awesome! You'd think they would be easy to make yourself since they seem so simple, but I'll go ahead and confirm that they aren't easy to replicate at home (hey, my eating partner had to try at least...but no success).

Dessert -- the fried banana and ice cream was very good (although a bit ridiculous to have after an already huge meal)!

Oh, and yes, reservations are very helpful -- even if you call only a couple of hours ahead. And the waitstaff are very nice -- no complaints! I'll head back as soon as my wallet recovers... Parking usually stinks in the neighborhood, but if you expect that and be patient, you will manage.

excerpts: We had the drunken crab which was good, however I think the roasted might have been a better option, the garlic noodles were very good.
drunken crab.author: Bobby B.
drunken crab.review:
I had heard great things about this place for a long time and randomly ended up there last night for the first time. I was surprised with how full the place was for a Sunday evening especially with it located so far out in the Sunset. The thing that stuck out to me over the good food was the great service we had, the staff was friendly and on top of things, when they realized that there was a better table available they offered it to us and from there were on top of our needs from the get go. 

We had the drunken crab which was good, however I think the roasted might have been a better option, the garlic noodles were very good. We started with the fried rice paper app which was the only thing that I wasn't that impressed with, not because of the taste however the price for what you get wasn't didn't impress me that much. 

I will be back to try the steak cubes and garlic rice along with the roasted crab!

excerpts: We ordered the Shrimp Toast (fabulous...you can actually taste the shrimp and its rich), Garlic Noodles (don't need to say much.. everyone knows how good it tastes), Drunken Crab (also another favorite of most patrons who come here),  and the Shaken Beef (DELICIOUS!!!
It was so tender and juicy
drunken crab.author: Linda X.
drunken crab.review:
Okay.. this is fresh off the press. I just got home from dinner at Thanh Long. I brought my bf here for his birthday dinner. We ordered the Shrimp Toast (fabulous...you can actually taste the shrimp and its rich), Garlic Noodles (don't need to say much.. everyone knows how good it tastes), Drunken Crab (also another favorite of most patrons who come here),  and the Shaken Beef (DELICIOUS!!! It was so tender and juicy and the potatoes were great). 

Last but not least... our dessert (I'm not sure how I found enough room to cram all that good food into my tummy but I did haha) Creme Brulee (flavor of the day Green Tea) which I have to admit amazed me.. I wasn't sure what to expect but it was creamy with a hint of green tea. I don't know how they managed to capture the green tea taste in this creamy dessert but they did and they did an excellent job of it as well. 

Ahhh -pats my tummy- delicious. 

**Side note: I happen to be allergic to shellfish (crab, lobster, shrimp, etc.) So needless to say even knowing I'd break out in hives it was totally worth it because now I'm sitting at home hiding from people but completely satisfied with my dinner. -big sigh-

excerpts: I've tried the drunken crab (
drunken crab.author: Nat L.
drunken crab.review:
This is an uncharacteristically short review for me.

ROASTED CRAB + GARLIC NOODLE = CRAZY DELICIOUS.
You will probably spend $50+ here.  Be forewarned but damn is it tasty.

The one thing I must warn yelpers about is know what you are getting yourself into.  The first time I went, I got a whole crab for myself.  It took me TWO hours to eat and I was in a world of hurt by the end.  By the end of the meal, the crab and noodles were cold and not so appetizing.  A friend of mine won't go back because he was so traumatized by being over stuffed.  The second time I went with my brother and a group of his friends.  There were 7 of us and we ordered 5 crabs and it was just perfect.  One more thing, remember those TWO hours?  The crabs come out incredibly quick so ere on the side of under ordering.  It's really easy to get another crab or two.  I've tried the drunken crab (yeah, it's good) and the tamarind crab (holy dill batman).  I have to say, stick with classic roasted crab.

What else is good there?  I don't know if I will ever find out.  One day hopefully.  I'll have to see what other yelpers recommend.

excerpts: 2) Drunken Crab - flavor is less intense than the roasted crab but it's still yummy.
drunken crab.author: Jen L.
drunken crab.review:
Oh Thanh Long, Thanh Long, Thanh Long! What can I say about Thanh Long? 

Well, I have been a loyal fan of Thanh Long for a Long Looooooong time...I started going there even before they had their swanky renovation...EXACTLY! I remember the good old days when their crab was still under $20 a piece and before Valet parking was available. So there!

Now about the food...Crab and Garlic Noodles are a MUST! Although they have a wide selection of food items on the menu, I can bet you a US $1 that every table you look around you would see people enjoying the Crab and Garlic Noodles. Okay, bets are off, I know there's always an exception to the rule...but I haven't personally witnessed a table that doesn't have the two things I mentioned above.

As for the Crab, you basically have 3 epicurean options (They are listed in the order of my likings - from top to bottom):

1) Roasted Crab - lots of butter and cracked pepper cooked with their secret family recipe. It's Da Bomb!

2) Drunken Crab - flavor is less intense than the roasted crab but it's still yummy.

3) Crab in Tamarind Sauce - my least favorite of all (not because there's anything wrong with it, I just LOVE the Roasted Crab the best!)

Then the Garlic Noodles...just YUMMY YUMMY! Though sometimes I just wanted to focus more on the CRAB and wanted to forego the garlic noodles...believe me, it's hard to do!

I can usually finish one whole crab by myself (it's a good size crab by the way) and perhaps TWO on a good night...it's that GOOD!

The only drawback that I have personally experienced is that after eating the crab and the garlic noodles, I'll be too full to have desserts! Though, sometimes I'd go all out and ordered the Creme Brulee and some fancy tea (with Rose buds). It was a great way to end this wonderul dining experience. 

I forgot to mention that the few appetizers I have had there were all very good. The one that really stood out was their Salmon with Capers drizzled in Olive Oil served with toasted French bread slices.  Try it! It's GOOD!

And the SERVICE was friendly and attentive.

Hope you get a chance to taste it...I can't wait to go back there myself!

excerpts: I had the Drunken crab which was not seasoned well and a little dry.
drunken crab.author: Jewls T.
drunken crab.review: This was my first time going to an Asian Seafood restaurant in SF. Make reservations if you can bc the wait can be very looong. ok lets get to the food. GARLIC NOODLES were really good! I had the Drunken crab which was not seasoned well and a little dry. ROAST CRAB was seasoned much better! I think the style of seasoning on the crab wasn't as traditional vietnamese, more or less its for anyone that likes seafood. But if you're looking for a really seasoned crab in the vietnamese style go to San Jose.

excerpts: The food more than made up for my comfort level and even a little grateful, because we ordered the drunken crab, and I'd rather not eat crab in a nice dining room.
I wanted to dig in and make a mess!
Delicious!
drunken crab.author: Cynthia C.
drunken crab.review: We were seated upstairs, I was wincing as I passed the downstairs dining room and was lead to the 'banquet room' upstairs.  Try to get a seat downstairs.  The food more than made up for my comfort level and even a little grateful, because we ordered the drunken crab, and I'd rather not eat crab in a nice dining room.  I wanted to dig in and make a mess!  Delicious!  Order the garlic noodles also.

excerpts: The spicy crab and drunken crab are ok, but the tamarind is fantastic, messy and really delicious.
I'm more partial to the deep fried spicy crab variety at PPQ Dungeness but for those that don't like the fried style, this is a great place to go.
drunken crab.author: Dana O.
drunken crab.review: Just came here with a big group and loved the roasted tamarind sweet crab. The spicy crab and drunken crab are ok, but the tamarind is fantastic, messy and really delicious. I'm more partial to the deep fried spicy crab variety at PPQ Dungeness but for those that don't like the fried style, this is a great place to go.

excerpts: BUT.. Please order the drunken crab.
The roasted crab is dry & salty.
The drunken crab is simmered w wine sake brandy green onions and garlic, mmmmm!

My favorite things to order:
Drunken crab (duh)
Shaken beef is my very favorite!
Creme brûlée (different flavors)
drunken crab.author: Cecilia M.
drunken crab.review:
Food is amazing, bottom line! Although one star off for the roast crab which is what they are famous for.. BUT.. Please order the drunken crab. The roasted crab is dry & salty. The drunken crab is simmered w wine sake brandy green onions and garlic, mmmmm! Only order the garlic noodles if you are sharing as they are so rich. Speaking of rich, its kind of a splurge, great for a date( i have had a few there).. but you will get what of pay for!! The service is top notch, we always feel welcome & apprieciated :)

My favorite things to order:
Drunken crab (duh)
Shaken beef is my very favorite!
Creme brûlée (different flavors)
Wine list is pretty decent 
Cocktail w/ mango & coconut rum
(drink 4 taste but no buzz included)

I can't stress this enough..
the shaken beef w/ a side of rice

excerpts: it's quite a bit of work b) it's a fair bit of meat c) if you order the standard roast crab and you're slow, the butter on your plate will coagulate in an unappetizing manner (the drunken crab, with a wine sauce, doesn't suffer from this problem).
But a half crab alone isn't really enough for a full meal, in my opinion, so judge your own capacity accordingly.
I think the price for a crab on the night we went (early March) was $34.
Chardonnay is supposed to be the traditional wine accompaniment for crab, and I have to say, it's quite a delicious pairing.
The house chardonnay was good value.
Would happily go back.
drunken crab.author: Liz O.
drunken crab.review:
Crowded but efficient meant that even though we had to expand our reservation, we were still seated fairly quickly.  DEFINITELY make a reservation, though, for a weekend night.  A tasty pineapple-lychee martini (heavier on the lychee than the pineapple) took the edge off the wait, and I met quite a few people just by being practically mashed into them in the waiting area.  All part of the fun.

Now for the crab: Huge, meaty, and delicious.  You should be hungry if you order one of your own because: a) it's quite a bit of work b) it's a fair bit of meat c) if you order the standard roast crab and you're slow, the butter on your plate will coagulate in an unappetizing manner (the drunken crab, with a wine sauce, doesn't suffer from this problem).  But a half crab alone isn't really enough for a full meal, in my opinion, so judge your own capacity accordingly.  I think the price for a crab on the night we went (early March) was $34.

Chardonnay is supposed to be the traditional wine accompaniment for crab, and I have to say, it's quite a delicious pairing.  The house chardonnay was good value.

Would happily go back.

excerpts: If i were an inmate on death row and was asked what would I like for my last meal the answer would be..... "DRUNKEN CRAB w/a side of Garlic noodles" would be it.
After that meal they could pop me with as many lethal injections as they wish as i would be overwhelmed with the Ecstasy which is a crab from this place to notice.
drunken crab.author: Alfredo N.
drunken crab.review:
This HANDS DOWN THE BEST PLACE FOR CRAB in the city. My GF likes to come here often and i don't complain. 

If i were an inmate on death row and was asked what would I like for my last meal the answer would be..... "DRUNKEN CRAB w/a side of Garlic noodles" would be it. After that meal they could pop me with as many lethal injections as they wish as i would be overwhelmed with the Ecstasy which is a crab from this place to notice.

excerpts: I very much enjoyed the drunken crab and garlic noodles.
I've had better
but it was very tasty.
Will have to make it back to try something different next time.
drunken crab.author: Warren W.
drunken crab.review: Had dined at the Crustacean in BH and wanted to try the original. I very much enjoyed the drunken crab and garlic noodles. I've had better but it was very tasty. Will have to make it back to try something different next time.

excerpts: get the drunken crab and garlic noodles, nothing else is good
drunken crab.author: Sophia Y.
drunken crab.review:
Expensive but worth it.

get the drunken crab and garlic noodles, nothing else is good

excerpts: Both the roasted crab and the drunken crab were delicious.
drunken crab.author: Joel A.
drunken crab.review:
I like crab, but I have to admit that I don't eat it very much. I'm not that skilled in cracking crab legs. It seems like a lot of work for a little bit of meat. When we came here for a co-worker's going away party, I decided to be a good sport and put on a bib. I was not disappointed! Both the roasted crab and the drunken crab were delicious. The seasoning on the roasted crab is perfect and it's well complemented with a side of garlic noodles.

If you're not into the seafood so much, there's this incredible beef dish on the menu. (I'm not sure what the name of it is since someone else ordered for the table.) It had chunks of tender beef and deep fried potatoes. A must!

The only other thing about this restaurant is that it's in the outer sunset. Include some extra time to find parking or take public transportation. (The N Judah runs right in front of the place.)

excerpts: We usually go for the roast and drunken crab dishes with garlic noodles.
You can never get sick of these dishes!
drunken crab.author: Darrin K.
drunken crab.review:
This place is a staple for when we have visitors in the Bay Area. It is one of the great places to introduce newcomers to Dungeness Crab. 

We usually go for the roast and drunken crab dishes with garlic noodles. You can never get sick of these dishes! The flavor is so rich, garlicky good and buttery. 

A perfect beverage accompaniment is Wyder's, a Canadian pear cider with enough acidity and effervescence to cut through all the butter. Odd that I could never find this cider when I lived in Canada.

Funny thing, we were recently in the Phoenix airport and got chatting with a touring drummer who formerly lived in SF. Before we knew it, we were talking about how good the crab is at Thanh Long. This restaurant is an SF institution, a place where great food memories are created.

excerpts: I end up ordering the Drunken Crab.
drunken crab.author: Starleigh H.
drunken crab.review:
After all the rave reviews about this place, I finally had the chance to try it for myself.  I ordered what most people go there for... the crab and garlic noodles.  

Okay, so this is how it goes down... 

I'm dressed, dolled-up, and feeling pretty fierce. So I was very hesistant to get down and dirty with some crab.  I was there on a date (UGH, I hate that word), and it was just the beginning of the night so I didn't want to have that distinctive crab smell lingering (feel me?)...  With a little bit of convincing I end up ordering the Drunken Crab.

I'm going at it!  Crab meat in my finger nails, shells flying everywhere (one landing in my hair, btw), and juices dipping down my finger tips..  It was a MESS to say the least, but it was well worth it!

So you know me, I'm all about the sauce in dishes, right? At this point, I'm dipping my crab meat in my date's plate (Thanks D, for sharing).. haha!  As much as I liked my dish, I have to say the Tamarind Crab that he ordered IS BOMB! 

I will definitely come here again... Next time, I'm going to order my own plate of the Tamarind Crab so that I don't have to share... LOL!

excerpts: I still remember the very dim-lit, very nice atmosphere, the garlic noodles and the drunken crab.
Worth every penny; and, it's obviously worth every memory.
drunken crab.author: Quintin D.
drunken crab.review:
I haven't been here in 4 years, but my friend just Tweeted this restaurant, and I had to help it.

I still remember the very dim-lit, very nice atmosphere, the garlic noodles and the drunken crab. Worth every penny; and, it's obviously worth every memory.

excerpts: We got the roasted crab (the best!), drunken crab (less flavor than the roasted one), and tamarind crab (sweet sauce).
drunken crab.author: Joy H.
drunken crab.review: From the outside, it doesn't look like much of a restaurant . . . it almost looks ghetto, but once you get inside, it's pretty big and elegant looking. They don't seat you until your whole party is present, so make sure everyone is there on time or else they may not hold your spot for long! We decided to do family style dining and share a bunch of dishes . . . however, looking around the restaurant we noticed that everyone had their own crab and it would've ended up being a little cheaper if we had done that. Duly noted! We got the roasted crab (the best!), drunken crab (less flavor than the roasted one), and tamarind crab (sweet sauce). We also go the garlic noodles (very plain but oh so tasty - drenched in garlic), shaken beef (almost more like a beef salad), stuffed calamari (unmemorable), and fried blue crab (standard fare). The crabs were the best, though pricey at $38/crab. The desserts we had included the fried ice cream, fried banana a la mode, chocolate cake, and creme brulee. I'd say to save your money on dessert and get another crab!!

excerpts: I have had a love for this place for over 10 years...and my  usual order is crab puffs, garlic noodles and the drunken crab and for pick up!!!!
.... since I live in the neighborhood.

Its so much more enjoyable than waiting in a crowded ass waiting area/walkway/bar...only to get seated at a table that is literally an inch apart from the neighboring table where you can hardly have a convesation with your party without your neighbors hearing .
so I stick with the drunken crab and garlic noodles.....
so I stick with the drunken crab and garlic noodles.....
drunken crab.author: Jenniflava R.
drunken crab.review:
I have had a love for this place for over 10 years...and my  usual order is crab puffs, garlic noodles and the drunken crab and for pick up!!!!.... since I live in the neighborhood. Its so much more enjoyable than waiting in a crowded ass waiting area/walkway/bar...only to get seated at a table that is literally an inch apart from the neighboring table where you can hardly have a convesation with your party without your neighbors hearing .  If you must make reservations its better to make it early evening (5pm-6pm or after 9:30pm) or later in the evening to avoid the prime time dinner time madness.

Ive had entrees and they weren't really that memorable so I stick with the drunken crab and garlic noodles.....

excerpts: the garlic crab and drunken crab...yum

garlic noodle...really good, but i had better
the aspargas crab soup was really refreshing
drunken crab.author: Karen H.
drunken crab.review:
i always keep forgetting to write a review for this place. it's always so packed here so make sure u make reservations. the food is good here, but i think it's over price for the small portions.

u only come here for 2 things: crab and garlic noodle. the garlic crab and drunken crab...yum
garlic noodle...really good, but i had better
the aspargas crab soup was really refreshing

excerpts: Drunken Crab is delicious, sweet, savory and good to the last drop...
drunken crab.author: Jason S.
drunken crab.review:
WOW!

We went late on a Friday and were seated straight away, no waiting! 

Hands down the best noodles I've ever had...I don't know what they do to those garlic noodles but they are fierce!

Shaken beef is to die for... juicy, tender, tasty nibblers of beef drenched in sweet goodness...music to my mouth!

Drunken Crab is delicious, sweet, savory and good to the last drop...Definitely take the bib they offer when you order the crab or you will leave smelling like a sailor.

I can't wait to go back!

excerpts: We tried the Roast Crab and the Drunken Crab.
The former was both our favorite - heavy on the garlic, quite tasty.
drunken crab.author: Thighmaster M.
drunken crab.review: If you are a crab fan. Must go. We tried the Roast Crab and the Drunken Crab. The former was both our favorite - heavy on the garlic, quite tasty. We also had the Tempura Style Coconut Prawns appetizer which was fantastic. We were out of season in May for crab (apparently crab season is only during months that have an "R" in them), but it was still fresh tasting with large pieces of meat. Too pricey for me at $35 a crab, but spouse would do it again in a heartbeat. In fact, she is arranging to get her crab fan family up there asap.

excerpts: We had the drunken crab and the roasted crab and the prawns.
The Roasted crab was the best!!!!!
The drunken crab is marinated in wine so the taste was a little too light for me.
drunken crab.author: Arlene E.
drunken crab.review: soo good!!!  We had the drunken crab and the roasted crab and the prawns. The Roasted crab was the best!!!!! The drunken crab is marinated in wine so the taste was a little too light for me. The garlic noodles!!!!!!  Yum!!!!!  couldn't stop eating it!!!  I'm probably smelt like garlic for 2 days

excerpts: The drunken crab is helta good...
drunken crab.author: Fred P.
drunken crab.review:
This place is two thumbs up in my book... I would have given this place 5 STARS but having a waiters bum on my shoulder when I eat isn't something I could write positively about. My buddy Melis feels my pain she had an arm in her face every time I had the bum. 

My family would always eat here for special occasions and I recently found out why... 

The drunken crab is helta good...

excerpts: This included 2 beers, a grape juice spritzer, the dungeness crab puffs and soft shell crab for appetizers and for dinner the drunken crab  and the villager dish (cant remember name) it had prawns and pork and lava cake with vanilla gelato dessert.
The appetizers were average, the drunken crab was lacking in flavor,
bland...
I have had better for way cheaper.
The other prawn and pork dish had so much salt, it was barely edible.
Its been 24 hours
and I am still craving water because of the salt.
The one star is for the service which was good.
The wait staff is very friendly and accomodating.
The food showed up very fast.
Probably an indication as to why the food isnt all that great or fresh tasting.
As for the decor, for a restaurant charging these prices, the decor needs an overall.
The chairs are dirty with old food stains and need a good wiping.
the carpet looks musty and towards the back where its dark, smells a bit musty.
Will never be back.
Not worth the time or money.
I have to say the dessert was amazing.
I wanted to lick my plate, thus the 2nd star.
But i didnt go for dessert
i was there for the seafood which came up short.
drunken crab.author: RoastNBoil L.
drunken crab.review: What a rip off...I have been wanting to try this place for sometime. After trying Crustaceans I was told the food is better here. My table of 2 spent $120. This included 2 beers, a grape juice spritzer, the dungeness crab puffs and soft shell crab for appetizers and for dinner the drunken crab  and the villager dish (cant remember name) it had prawns and pork and lava cake with vanilla gelato dessert. The appetizers were average, the drunken crab was lacking in flavor, bland...I have had better for way cheaper. The other prawn and pork dish had so much salt, it was barely edible. Its been 24 hours and I am still craving water because of the salt. The one star is for the service which was good. The wait staff is very friendly and accomodating. The food showed up very fast. Probably an indication as to why the food isnt all that great or fresh tasting. As for the decor, for a restaurant charging these prices, the decor needs an overall. The chairs are dirty with old food stains and need a good wiping. the carpet looks musty and towards the back where its dark, smells a bit musty. Will never be back. Not worth the time or money.I have to say the dessert was amazing. I wanted to lick my plate, thus the 2nd star. But i didnt go for dessert i was there for the seafood which came up short.

excerpts:
drunken crab
3.
drunken crab.author: Anh V.
drunken crab.review:
2.5 stars for an old family  business which has lost it's way along the years.

at first glance, i was so excited.  i had already tried crustacean which is near my place but i made a trek out here to where it all began.

the downstairs area with more natural lighting is nicer than the upstairs seating. but overall, the place is big and great for groups. 

there were naive vietnamese art on the walls, a majority of asians eating here...but as i peered closer, i had a wait-a-minute moment.

the servers were nice and quick but none spoke vietnamese.  the uniforms were not traditional as well.  but the killer was no authentic fish sauce.

highlights:
1. the spicy veg soup was better than the asian bouillabaise (lacked spice for the sour taste).
2. of course! drunken crab
3. the garlic rice was tastier than their famous noodles
4. the fried tofu and veggies is a good option for non-meat eaters.

don't order:
1. the salmon carpaccio
2. the soft shell crab - it was so small, they threw in a random extra claw

the 33 beer is a oldie but goodie beer but if you want something heavier go for the saigon beer.

despite being less authentic, it was plenty full on a sunday with happy bib wearing customers crackin' and eating crab and i was one of them.

excerpts: i prefer the drunken crab over the roast crab.
personal fave: drunken crab
drunken crab.author: Mei N.
drunken crab.review:
not as good as a remembered from years ago but it's still damn good.

of course the recommended is the crab and garlic noodles.... the garlic smell in your mouth lasts FOREVER. i brushed, listerined, brushed and listerined again... but the smell of garlic still wouldn't go away. don't let that scare you though... it's so f'ing good.

i prefer the drunken crab over the roast crab. mmm... besure to soak up the crab meat with the juices on your plate. 

we also had the saigon beef... let's just say that i think it's way overpriced. $19.95 for a few pieces of beef on top of a salad. 

and parking does get tight around that area. luckily they've got valet parking.

personal fave: drunken crab

excerpts: The drunken crab tasted like soapy dishwater to me, I guess I should have ordered the Roasted crab.
The service was great, but the silverware was dirty.
I would come back here, but the food is just too overpriced.
A lot of these dishes you can definitely order at another restaurant for half the price and will taste just as good if not better.
It's kind of funny how some of the dishes are home style type of dishes, but the names are changed to sound a lot more sophisticated so that they can charge an arm and a leg.
Overall , I give the food and service a 4 stars, but they get 3 stars for overcharging for the dishes that are home style and can be found in many Vietnamese kitchens.
drunken crab.author: carebear l.
drunken crab.review: My bf brought me here for a birthday surprise romantic dinner here.  We kind of have this unfinished business/ past history thing at this establishment. For appetizers we ordered the Thanh Long mussels, which came with little toasted crostini, the mussels were cooked really well and were not chewy at all  and the salt and pepper squid was lightly battered and not overcooked. For soups we ordered asian bouillabaisse, which was tasty, with just the perfect amount of tamarind. For entrees we ordered the steamed sea bass, which I thought was just a tad overcooked, but the sauce was good. The colossal royal tiger prawns were really nothing to brag about, but the garlic noodles.....wow they were delicious. I would come back here, just for the garlic noodles. The drunken crab tasted like soapy dishwater to me, I guess I should have ordered the Roasted crab. The service was great, but the silverware was dirty. I would come back here, but the food is just too overpriced. A lot of these dishes you can definitely order at another restaurant for half the price and will taste just as good if not better. It's kind of funny how some of the dishes are home style type of dishes, but the names are changed to sound a lot more sophisticated so that they can charge an arm and a leg. Overall , I give the food and service a 4 stars, but they get 3 stars for overcharging for the dishes that are home style and can be found in many Vietnamese kitchens. I do know I'll be back for the garlic noodles though.

excerpts: We were seated immediately and were able to order a Roasted Crab, Drunken Crab and Garlic Noodles very quickly.
drunken crab.author: Matt K.
drunken crab.review:
Wow, this place was FAST!!! We decided to get "appetizers" here before while waiting for a table at another restaurant! (I know I know, trust me, we were all THAT hungry) We were seated immediately and were able to order a Roasted Crab, Drunken Crab and Garlic Noodles very quickly. 

Honestly, we waited for about 5 minutes and had our food on the table. HOW WONDERFUL!!! I doubted it because when food comes out that quick, it usually means it was sitting there, but the crabs were done perfectly and as soon as the food hit the table, all talking stopped!

I have eaten at Crustacean and PPQ and I would put this in the middle of both of them. The crab quality was better than PPQ, more expensive, but not quite as expensive as Crustacean. Ambiance was nicer than PPQ but not quite as nice as Crustacean. Service was also better than PPQ, but definitely not as good as Crustacean.

excerpts: When you go order the Drunken Crab, Shaken Beef, and Garlic Noodles.
If you do that you cannot go wrong!
drunken crab.author: Diane B.
drunken crab.review: Love it!  Basically it is like Nike you've just got to do it.  When you go order the Drunken Crab, Shaken Beef, and Garlic Noodles.  If you do that you cannot go wrong!

excerpts: The drunken crab was really good,  one crab can barely feed two people & it was so easy to get the crab meat out since the shell was semi soft.
The moultan chocolate cake however made me smile.
Beware
I brushed my teeth about 5 times & couldn't get the garlic taste out of my mouth, also the next morning
my clothes, smelled of garlic bad, I mean really, really bad!
Thinking about sending them my dry cleaning bill.
drunken crab.author: Sarah T.
drunken crab.review: Let me see if I can count right, there was 6 of us that ate here. We called ahead & made reservations, it was really busy for a Sunday evening. They even called us to check on us when we were 15minutes late, which is great customer service. Okay appetizers the calamari was soo good enough said. I didn't like the tempura prawns since the batter had coconut shreds on them, I'm not a coconut person. Garlic noodles are perfect it's very easy to eat an order or two. The drunken crab was really good,  one crab can barely feed two people & it was so easy to get the crab meat out since the shell was semi soft.  The moultan chocolate cake however made me smile. *Beware* I brushed my teeth about 5 times & couldn't get the garlic taste out of my mouth, also the next morning my clothes, smelled of garlic bad, I mean really, really bad! Thinking about sending them my dry cleaning bill.

excerpts: It comes in a number of flavors (i.e., drunken crab etc.), but the simple "roasted" one is the best.
drunken crab.author: Mary R.
drunken crab.review:
Above and beyond for an Asian restaurant in Outer Sunset neighborhood! Truly the tastiest roasted crab I've ever tried. It comes in a number of flavors (i.e., drunken crab etc.), but the simple "roasted" one is the best. The accompanying signature dishes are superb: garlic noodles, peppered calamari and Shaken (it used to be Saigon?) beef. 
This place is cozier and better decorated than their sister restaurant on California Street ("Crustaceans" feels like a typical Fisherman Wharf place with their 80s ocean-theamed decor and glass-cube building structure). 
On a downside: over years the average size of their crab has been gradually decreasing. Still solid 5 stars.

excerpts: Love drunken crab and garlic noodles!!!
Service was good.
Very attentive.
Can't wait to go again.
drunken crab.author: K P.
drunken crab.review: Love drunken crab and garlic noodles!!! Service was good. Very attentive. Can't wait to go again.

excerpts: I have to give it up for the drunken crab and prawns as well.
drunken crab.author: Margaret P.
drunken crab.review: I haven't been here in awhile, but I LOVE this restaurant. Like the other reviews, the garlic noodles are absolutely fabulous. If there is just one thing on the menu that I can have day in and day out, it would have to be the garlic noodles. And as far as the stinkiness goes, it wouldn't matter, because my family and boyfriend would love to have that garlic smell on them too if it meant eating the garlic noodles over and over again. Okay, maybe just me! I have to give it up for the drunken crab and prawns as well.

excerpts: Against my better judgment, we also ordered the drunken crab this time and it was so--- fishy.
The waiter said the wine brings out the natural fishiness - but I could tell it wasn't the reason in this case-
it just wasn't fresh.
But they were really good about removing it from our bill without even mentioning it.
Good service
drunken crab.author: Amina B.
drunken crab.review: Stick with the roast crab and garlic noodles - everything else is usually a disappointment.  Apps are always tiny and taste so-so.  Against my better judgment, we also ordered the drunken crab this time and it was so--- fishy.  The waiter said the wine brings out the natural fishiness - but I could tell it wasn't the reason in this case- it just wasn't fresh.  But they were really good about removing it from our bill without even mentioning it.  Good service and if you order the right thing - meaning just the roast crab and garlic noodles, they are done really----well...

excerpts: order the drunken crab... muy delishio...
nothing like eating drunken crab while being drunk!
drunken crab.author: Jana A.
drunken crab.review:
used to come here for an early dinner after a cool trips to the zoo... 

order the drunken crab... muy delishio...

roasted crab is ok.... 

don't forget your garlic noodles... muy importante

their mixed drinks are great too... nothing like eating drunken crab while being drunk!

excerpts: I tried the drunken crab and garlic crab, they were not very tasty, both tasted as though it was boiled in water.
The crabs did not have much taste.
drunken crab.author: kgarfield k.
drunken crab.review: I have been to PPQ Dungeness Island and heard that this was also good.  They are two different restaurants.  Thanh Long is a fusion restaurant.  The atmosphere was more elegant but the price was higher and servings alot smaller.  I tried the drunken crab and garlic crab, they were not very tasty, both tasted as though it was boiled in water.  The crabs did not have much taste.  Their garlic noodles was better tham PPQ but I did not come here to eat garlic noodles.  In short, if you want tasty crabs then I would not come here.

excerpts: The Drunken Crab sounds like an interesting dish... will order next time perhaps?
drunken crab.author: K-Y    j i L L y.
drunken crab.review:
I've only eaten here once... will definitely come back when craving Roast Crab & Garlic Noodles -  very good.  The waaay too peppery Tamarind Crab disappointed, but the appetizers were great.  The place literally stinks & you leave smelling like stink, but I am very interested in trying other menu items.  I cannot emphasize how good the Garlic Noodles are - a must-have with every meal here from now on although I wish they would serve bigger portions.

The staff is friendly & attentive, the food is a bit overpriced & parking is a biatch (they have valet), but I can see why people love this place.  The Drunken Crab sounds like an interesting dish... will order next time perhaps?

excerpts: The drunken crab... you shouldn't put that much liquid into steaming the crab.
The crab itself has a lot of flavors that can come out naturally.
It's seriously, just a bit of cheap white wine + pepper...
35 bucks?
Chardonnay?
drunken crab.author: Toto T.
drunken crab.review:
Should be 0.5 stars.

Really nothing special.  Crab is good quality, but the recipes pretty simple - no 'secret' spice.

Garlic noodles = Noodle (boil), ground garlic (lots), parmesan cheese, a little vinegar, and sugar.  That's about it.  Would be better if you add a little sliced chilli and sautee it with the garlic to before stir frying the noodle.  Ok, all that for 9.5 bucks?  Pretty ridiculous aye.

The drunken crab... you shouldn't put that much liquid into steaming the crab.  The crab itself has a lot of flavors that can come out naturally.  It's seriously, just a bit of cheap white wine + pepper... 35 bucks?  Chardonnay?  Damn, you should use Fa Tiu instead

Lastly, we have the JUMBO tiger prawns.  Jumbo my ass.  The head is missing, and that's most probably because they are using frozen prawn, hence the head would be black rather than filled with red prawn innards.  4 pieces of tiny prawn on top of the gimmick garlic noodles... 31 bucks?  My goodness.

Refrain from coming here, the waiter is a joke also.  Have a great day.

excerpts: Between the 4 of us, we had the soft shell crab appetizer, a roast crab, a drunken crab, 2 orders of garlic noodles, and the "peasant's favorite.
The soft shell crab was tasty with the tamarind sauce, but it was a bit small for $12.
The roast crab was garlicky & buttery, with the meat juicy and fresh.
The drunken crab was unfortunately on the bland and dry side, despite its wet-sounding name.
The garlic noodles were a hit all around, and our hands got so greasy from the crab that we just ate the noodles with our hands as well.
Good thing we were seated in a back corner, far way from the disapproving eyes of polite company.
P
The pork in the "peasant's favorite" clay pot was tender and well-marinated.
Everything was tasty but on the pricey side.
Market price for crab that day was ~$40, and the small portion of pork was $17 or so.
We dropped $40 each and walked out satiated but not stuffed.
drunken crab.author: Lillian L.
drunken crab.review:
This was where I brought my bff and our respective bfs for the bachelorette party I planned for my teeth. I wanted to be able to savagely chomp into luscious limbs of crab (who needs crustacean crackers when you've got bicuspids?) while my teeth were still free of metal fetters.

Between the 4 of us, we had the soft shell crab appetizer, a roast crab, a drunken crab, 2 orders of garlic noodles, and the "peasant's favorite." The soft shell crab was tasty with the tamarind sauce, but it was a bit small for $12. The roast crab was garlicky & buttery, with the meat juicy and fresh. The drunken crab was unfortunately on the bland and dry side, despite its wet-sounding name. The garlic noodles were a hit all around, and our hands got so greasy from the crab that we just ate the noodles with our hands as well. Good thing we were seated in a back corner, far way from the disapproving eyes of polite company. =P The pork in the "peasant's favorite" clay pot was tender and well-marinated. Everything was tasty but on the pricey side. Market price for crab that day was ~$40, and the small portion of pork was $17 or so. We dropped $40 each and walked out satiated but not stuffed.

excerpts: Drunken crab was well seasoned and fragrant, but it was served cold and didn't taste as fresh as many other upscale seafood joints.
drunken crab.author: Kerry N.
drunken crab.review:
I must say, this place is completely overrated.

The meal started off well-- the seafood bouillabaisse was spot on with the perfect amount of tamarind, a good amount of heat, and a strong hit of lemongrass. Drunken crab was well seasoned and fragrant, but it was served cold and didn't taste as fresh as many other upscale seafood joints. And the garlic noodles? Think chow mein noodles served in a sauce composed primarily of garlic and butter. Not so bad, you say? Imagine that dish served *cold.* No, not tepid, not lukewarm, but a nice, clammy-handshake-with-your-near-bucket-kicking-great-uncle cold. Noodles sticking together in one fat lump with butter solidifying around them? No thanks.

excerpts: I recommend the garlic noodles and the drunken crab.
The roasted crab is good too
but tad buttery for me.
Of course it is overpriced but worth it on special occasions.
I've been to Crustacean in Beverly Hills and I still prefer this original location.
drunken crab.author: Brendan A.
drunken crab.review: I used to live around the corner from this place.  Definetly a weird location for a restaurant of this caliber.  I recommend the garlic noodles and the drunken crab.  The roasted crab is good too but tad buttery for me.  Of course it is overpriced but worth it on special occasions.  I've been to Crustacean in Beverly Hills and I still prefer this original location.

excerpts: it was wayyyyyy better than the drunken crab.
drunken crab.author: Xing L.
drunken crab.review: after the first time around we decided to try a different type of crab which was the roasted crab. it was wayyyyyy better than the drunken crab. the garlic noodle and the soft shell crab was good as usual.

excerpts: we order the roast crab and drunken crab and both were overcooked.
the seasonings were complimentary, but alone the roast would have been too salty and the drunken too sweet.
drunken crab.author: Rose J.
drunken crab.review:
i went to thanh long's sister restaurant crustacean a little tipsy, so i needed to come here for a true comparison.

sober, the food is just ok.  i love crab and i especially love their natural flavors.  we order the roast crab and drunken crab and both were overcooked.  the seasonings were complimentary, but alone the roast would have been too salty and the drunken too sweet.  the garlic noodles are flavorful and not nearly as drenched in butter as the ones at crustacean.  the 2nd time around, i'm still not a big fan, because they come out too mushy and once you finish working on the crabs, they become too clumpy.

other than that, my infused drink was great, the service was good.  it wasn't too packed even when we went on a friday night.  for most people this place is fabulous.  for me i'm taking my money to aqua where they will never overcook my seafood.

excerpts: We also got the famous roasted crab and the drunken crab.
In my opinion the roasted crab was much better with more flavoring compare to the drunken crab.
The drunken crab was ok, but there wasn't enough flavoring inside, but nonetheless it was good.
drunken crab.author: Edgar G.
drunken crab.review: I've always wanted to try this place, but never got a chance to. My sisters and I celebrated our mother's birthday here for dinner and I must say, this place is pretty damn good. We got the garlic noodles which was very tasty. We also got the famous roasted crab and the drunken crab. In my opinion the roasted crab was much better with more flavoring compare to the drunken crab. The drunken crab was ok, but there wasn't enough flavoring inside, but nonetheless it was good. We also got the mango salad which was also pretty good. I guess I expected too much from this place after hearing about it from so many people, but don't get it wrong, this place is GOOD. Oh yeah, they have some good service as well. I forgot to talk about parking... it wasn't too bad. I parked a block from the place, and there was a few spaces on 46th between Kirkham and Lawton, if that isn't too far for anybody.

excerpts: I liked the Roast Crab better than the Drunken Crab, but bother were good.
drunken crab.author: Philip T.
drunken crab.review: Excellent crab. I liked the Roast Crab better than the Drunken Crab, but bother were good. And you have to order the garlic noodles.

excerpts: The roast crab, drunken crab and garlic noodles are even more delicious than the rave reviews indicate.
The first bite of the roast crab had me sending up a prayer of gratitude to my higher power and the garlic noodles are viable addiction candidates.
The vanilla creme brulee and molten lava chocolate cake with vanilla gelato and grand marnier creme anglaise were fabulous.
If I could have eaten more, I would have!
A wonderful evening.
Parking is a beyotch though.
Valet is well worth it.
The first bite of the roast crab had me sending up a prayer of gratitude to my higher power and the garlic noodles are viable addiction candidates.
The vanilla creme brulee and molten lava chocolate cake with vanilla gelato and grand marnier creme anglaise were fabulous.
If I could have eaten more, I would have!
A wonderful evening.
Parking is a beyotch though.
Valet is well worth it.
drunken crab.author: Jim A.
drunken crab.review: My brother and his blushing new bride took me to dinner here tonight and it exceeded my expectations.  The roast crab, drunken crab and garlic noodles are even more delicious than the rave reviews indicate.  The first bite of the roast crab had me sending up a prayer of gratitude to my higher power and the garlic noodles are viable addiction candidates.  The vanilla creme brulee and molten lava chocolate cake with vanilla gelato and grand marnier creme anglaise were fabulous.  If I could have eaten more, I would have!  A wonderful evening.  Parking is a beyotch though.  Valet is well worth it.

excerpts: The noodles are some of the best I've ever had, but the Drunken Crab was decidedly bland after being treated to the rich Roast Crab dish.
drunken crab.author: Miss M.
drunken crab.review:
During a family dinner at this restaurant, my brother in law lost his wedding ring.  

Everyone's hands were greased with garlic butter from the Roast Crab specialty, so we figured it may have slipped off while eating, or when wiping clean with the supplied towels.  

We asked the staff to check their laundry, dishwasher, anything in hopes that they might find the custom made ring.  Meanwhile we were scanning the floor to see if it had rolled off the table somewhere.  

Despite the upset, we went ahead and ordered dessert.  Halfway through, a waiter walked up and delivered the ring.  Turns out they actually went through the compost to find it.  

This place was already a family favorite, but the extra special attention they devoted to our problem was enough to motivate me to sign up for Yelp, just to review them.

As far as the food, ordering off the Secret Kitchen section of the menu is key.  The noodles are some of the best I've ever had, but the Drunken Crab was decidedly bland after being treated to the rich Roast Crab dish.

excerpts: But chinese people might like their drunken crab as well as it is very tasty!
but avoid the other ones, it's a waste of money.
when we go there, we only eat the garlic noodle and the crab.
drunken crab.author: eugene z.
drunken crab.review:
This place is awesome for their roasted crab and garlic noodles. But chinese people might like their drunken crab as well as it is very tasty! but avoid the other ones, it's a waste of money. when we go there, we only eat the garlic noodle and the crab. it looks lame but we only order 2 at a time for the 4 of us because the crab gets nasty when it gets cold. 

they have the same menu at Crustaceans on polk, but I'd much rather stay where. who wants to dress up and look at payless.

excerpts: If there was one dish I had that I didn't care for, it was the drunken crab, which is a whole crab simmered in Chardonnay.
It just didn't have that fatty, garlicky goodness of the garlic crab.
And I love this 'you get the whole crab' thing.
Sometimes, you order crab somewhere and you get the legs.
Everyone knows the best part is the crab fat you scoop out from the inside of the shell, not just the wimpy-ass legs.
All in all, this is a pretty pricey place to eat in, but the meal itself is quite fun and the atmosphere is not stuffy.
I take some strange kind of perverted delight in the cracking sound of flying shells and watching grease congeal from my hands onto my 7th bottle of '33'(pretty sure that was the beer I drank).
This is just a great place to get messy, stuff your face, get drunk, and make your car smell like garlic crab for a couple of days.
It will be unpleasant for a day or two, but the meal is worth it.
drunken crab.author: Miguel G.
drunken crab.review:
Thanh Long is one of my favorite places to eat in the entire Bay Area. It's so good that it's totally worth donning that humiliating bib to eat a whole garlic crab. It's kind of a dressy place, but that all goes out the window seeing as your hands will be greasy and your good clothes are going to smell like crab anyway. The service is always good and efficient, and we've found the food to be consistent throughout the 5 years of sporadic visits. The restaurant is a bit dressy, but I've come in there with a baseball cap and never got any crap for it. 
I've only gone to this place with my family and between the four of us, we will gladly fast for a whole day in order to eat here. And let me tell you, it can get kind of ugly. I'm totally serious when I tell you our usual order; four garlic roasted crabs(one for each), 2 garlic noodles, prawn wontons, one order of shakenbeer, one order of fried rice, claypot, and an order of calamari. I didn't count white rice, but you bet your ass we eat that too. We usually start with the two orders of garlic noodles, then work our way up. I drink a lot of beers, too. I am pretty sure they are '33'. 
If there was one dish I had that I didn't care for, it was the drunken crab, which is a whole crab simmered in Chardonnay. It just didn't have that fatty, garlicky goodness of the garlic crab. And I love this 'you get the whole crab' thing. Sometimes, you order crab somewhere and you get the legs. Everyone knows the best part is the crab fat you scoop out from the inside of the shell, not just the wimpy-ass legs. 
All in all, this is a pretty pricey place to eat in, but the meal itself is quite fun and the atmosphere is not stuffy. I take some strange kind of perverted delight in the cracking sound of flying shells and watching grease congeal from my hands onto my 7th bottle of '33'(pretty sure that was the beer I drank). This is just a great place to get messy, stuff your face, get drunk, and make your car smell like garlic crab for a couple of days. It will be unpleasant for a day or two, but the meal is worth it.

excerpts: the drunken crab and garlic noodles are two of the best things i've ever put in my mouth.
their hot teas and martinis are equally pleasing.
this is definitely my version of comfort food.
drunken crab.author: rachface -.
drunken crab.review: if you love its sister restaurant "crustacean" in the city, you'll love this place a bagillion times more because the wait is shorter and the prices are lower.  a great place to eat for special occasions or whenever you have unbearable cravings for crab.  the drunken crab and garlic noodles are two of the best things i've ever put in my mouth.  their hot teas and martinis are equally pleasing.  this is definitely my version of comfort food.

excerpts: We ordered the mango salad, Dungeness crab puffs, ginger calamari, Drunken Crab, Roast Crab and the garlic rice.
so the Boyfriend and I again followed the advice of our friend and ordered some garlic rice.
In terms of food, Thanh Long gets five stars.
The Parents loved the food.
The ginger calamari was well-seasoned, not too gingery and not too salty.
It was particularly yummy with the pineapples.
The mango salad was delicious (it has shrimp and scallops as well) and the garlic rice was flavorful without being overpowering.
The mango salad was delicious (it has shrimp and scallops as well) and the garlic rice was flavorful without being overpowering.
The Dungeness crab puffs were a big hit but pricey.
It was basically a tastier version of crab rangoon.
Now for the crab: right before ordering, the Boyfriend and I faithfully checked Yelp and some had said that the Roast Crab was too salty.
The Dad isn't too fond of wine-reduction
so we tried the Roast Crab first.
It was delicious and not too salty at all.
The waiter comes over with plastic bibs and you get to cracking (well...
the Boyfriend and the Dad got to cracking and then fed the Mom and me bits and pieces).
One crab is about enough for one person to be full.
One crab is about enough to make two grown men half-full so calculate accordingly.
We ordered the Drunken Crab to mix things up and it was also good.
It tastes much more Asian in that the wine reduction really saves the flavor of the crab - it's much more crabby than the Roast crab which is more seasoned.
The Dad and the Boyfriend liked the Roast Crab a little better, though, so if you want to choose one, I'd advise the Roast Crab.
Don't worry about messy/crabby hands.
The waitstaff comes by with hot (caution: extremely hot) warm towels for you to towel off between and after crab eating.
Finally, for dessert, we ordered orange sorbet.
It's really cute - it comes in a frozen orange that's been beheaded and the lemon sorbet comes in a frozen lemon that's been beheaded!
The only reason I won't give Thanh Long is that the prices are a bit high.
The crab is market price (which meant $37.50 each crab as of June 7, 2009) and the other dishes are pricey as well.
drunken crab.author: Christine P.
drunken crab.review: The Dad loves crab so when the Parents came up for the weekend, the Boyfriend and I decided to follow a friend's advice and take them to Thanh Long. The Parents are notoriously picky about food and the Dad is particularly so when it comes to crab. It has to be fresh, can't be over-seasoned and has to be meaty. Thank goodness for Thanh Long. We ordered the mango salad, Dungeness crab puffs, ginger calamari, Drunken Crab, Roast Crab and the garlic rice. The Boyfriend and I had heard that people loved the garlic noodles but the Parents didn't like the looks of it so the Boyfriend and I again followed the advice of our friend and ordered some garlic rice. In terms of food, Thanh Long gets five stars. The Parents loved the food. The ginger calamari was well-seasoned, not too gingery and not too salty. It was particularly yummy with the pineapples. The mango salad was delicious (it has shrimp and scallops as well) and the garlic rice was flavorful without being overpowering. The Dungeness crab puffs were a big hit but pricey. It was basically a tastier version of crab rangoon. Now for the crab: right before ordering, the Boyfriend and I faithfully checked Yelp and some had said that the Roast Crab was too salty. The Dad isn't too fond of wine-reduction so we tried the Roast Crab first. It was delicious and not too salty at all. The waiter comes over with plastic bibs and you get to cracking (well...the Boyfriend and the Dad got to cracking and then fed the Mom and me bits and pieces). One crab is about enough for one person to be full. One crab is about enough to make two grown men half-full so calculate accordingly. We ordered the Drunken Crab to mix things up and it was also good. It tastes much more Asian in that the wine reduction really saves the flavor of the crab - it's much more crabby than the Roast crab which is more seasoned. The Dad and the Boyfriend liked the Roast Crab a little better, though, so if you want to choose one, I'd advise the Roast Crab. Don't worry about messy/crabby hands. The waitstaff comes by with hot (caution: extremely hot) warm towels for you to towel off between and after crab eating. Finally, for dessert, we ordered orange sorbet. It's really cute - it comes in a frozen orange that's been beheaded and the lemon sorbet comes in a frozen lemon that's been beheaded! The only reason I won't give Thanh Long is that the prices are a bit high. The crab is market price (which meant $37.50 each crab as of June 7, 2009) and the other dishes are pricey as well.

excerpts: I couldn't resist getting the Spicy Eggplant, which was perfect and scrumptious, and the bf got the Drunken Crab... a bad-ass meal!
So good!
They bib you up, strap you with shell-crackers, put a huge crab in front of you, and make you work!
drunken crab.author: Tara G.
drunken crab.review: Made it in there on a busy Sunday night, but got lucky b/c they had a seat for us at the moment.  Ordered up a bottle of Chenin Blanc and the Asian Bouillabaisse for an app... yummy, light and fruity with pineapple, shrimp, and bean sprouts.  I couldn't resist getting the Spicy Eggplant, which was perfect and scrumptious, and the bf got the Drunken Crab... a bad-ass meal!  So good!  They bib you up, strap you with shell-crackers, put a huge crab in front of you, and make you work!  The sauce it's marinaded in is a yummy Chardonnay butter deliciousness, that goes great with the garlic noodles they recommend.  It takes a while to break that sucka, but oh so worth it!  The restaurant has a nice ambiance with high ceilings, authentic art, and succulent aromas.  It comes with a high price tag but where can you get a huge hunk o crab, done up in several different ways, on any given Sunday?  A definite must for those crustacean cravings!

excerpts: so I would go and try the drunken crab next time.
drunken crab.author: Melinda C.
drunken crab.review: I'd been wanting to try this place for a long time, and at long last, I finally went this past Friday night.  What a random location for a pretty nice, high ambiance restaurant.  Per yelp recommendations, I made a reservation in advance so seating was easy.  Our table of five shared the famed roast crab ($36/crab), the garlic noodles, the jumbo prawns, spicy eggplant, salt and pepper calamari, Asian bouillabaisse, and banana cake for dessert.  The roast crab was a good size (about 2-2.5 lbs) so three of us shared one (alongside the other food).  Although pretty basic in theory, the garlic noodles were my favorite.  The roast crab was a close second - great flavor and juiciness.  Prawns weren't bad and calamari and eggplant were pretty standard (calamari was lukewarm).  Service was great, and the crowd inside was incredibly diverse (black, white, asian, everyone).  Although pricey, it's super closeby so I would go and try the drunken crab next time.

excerpts: Had the prawn which was also very good but didn't get the famous drunken crab.
Maybe next time.
Service is very friendly and food comes out fairly fast, even when it's packed.
We went at night and it was a little hard to find b/c
it looks like a little hole-in-the-wall from outside (located across the street from a 7-11!), but it actually is a pretty classy-looking restaurant inside.
drunken crab.author: Robert S.
drunken crab.review: Garlic noodles are awesome.  Had the prawn which was also very good but didn't get the famous drunken crab.  Maybe next time.  Service is very friendly and food comes out fairly fast, even when it's packed.  We went at night and it was a little hard to find b/c it looks like a little hole-in-the-wall from outside (located across the street from a 7-11!), but it actually is a pretty classy-looking restaurant inside.

excerpts: I would normally get the drunken crab
but I wasn't sure if it was okay with a little one on the way.
drunken crab.author: Jasmin D.
drunken crab.review: I had a craving for garlic noodles and crab so the hubby and I scooted our way to SF. We arrived at just before 5 pm and there was already a crowd waiting to get in. I had the roast crab and garlic noodles, where my hubby got the tamarind version (surprisingly a little sweet). I would normally get the drunken crab but I wasn't sure if it was okay with a little one on the way. Because getting the noodles with the roast crab was a little too much butter for me. I should have had a side of white rice. Oh well. We had dessert which was really yummy, green tea creme brulee. I think that meal fulfilled my craving for crab for a while. On a funny note: my husband likes to crack his crab before eating it so he can wash his hands. While he was in the bathroom, the table next to us, requested garlic noodles with the crab already cracked. The waiter had to tell them, that it wasn't on the menu...sorry.

excerpts: My sister did all the ordering; Drunken Crab/Tamarind Crab/Roasted Crab/Garlic Noodles/Salt & Pepper Calamari/Lemongrass Beef Skewers/Spicy Eggplant/Mango Salad/Shrimp Fried Rice/Steamed Seabass.
Garlic noodles were overcooked/soggy and didn't have enough garlic flavor.
All the portions were pretty small.
The crabs tasted average; nothing special.
PPQ
Dungeness is better in my opinion.
Glad
I got to finally try Thanh Long but not impressed with the food.
tamarind crab.author: Karen L.
tamarind crab.review:
Located on a corner. Looks sorta like a house from the outside. Parking was hard to find. Valet option $13. Came here for my sister's 26th birthday since we heard a lot of great things about this place. We had a party of 7; did a same day reservation. Anyway, arrived 15m early and hung out at the bar in front for a bit. Thanks bartender for the great tasting Virgin Mango Daiquiri!

We were taken upstairs to be seated. My sister did all the ordering; Drunken Crab/Tamarind Crab/Roasted Crab/Garlic Noodles/Salt & Pepper Calamari/Lemongrass Beef Skewers/Spicy Eggplant/Mango Salad/Shrimp Fried Rice/Steamed Seabass. 

All of the food was "okay." Garlic noodles were overcooked/soggy and didn't have enough garlic flavor. All the portions were pretty small. The crabs tasted average; nothing special. PPQ Dungeness is better in my opinion. Glad I got to finally try Thanh Long but not impressed with the food.

excerpts: We ordered the tamarind crab, Traditional Vietnamese Salad, garlic noodles, shaken beef.
The Traditional Vietnamese Salad was not authentic and consisted mostly of very thinly sliced cabbage drenched in a too sweet dressing.
The Vietnamese Salad or "Goi" should have more herbs.
The famous garlic noodles was not all that.
Saturate your noodles in butter and garlic powder and you will have the same thing at home.
The shaken beef was not tender and lack of sauce of a traditional "Bò lúc lc

"
And finally, the pièce de résistance, tamarind crab was a greasy mess served on a puddle of clarified butter.
I was not able to taste the tamarind.
Here again, I have had better versions at other restaurants without a "Secret Kitchen"
This was an overpriced and poorly executed Vietnamese food and it shows that hype and marketing of the "Secret Kitchen Dishes" can fool a lot of people, at least once.
tamarind crab.author: OngTayDen N.
tamarind crab.review:
For years I have read about the positive press about this place. We ordered the tamarind crab, Traditional Vietnamese Salad, garlic noodles, shaken beef.  The short review is everything was mediocre and any regular Vietnamese restaurant can do the dishes better. 

The Traditional Vietnamese Salad was not authentic and consisted mostly of very thinly sliced cabbage drenched in a too sweet dressing.  The Vietnamese Salad or "Goi" should have more herbs.
The famous garlic noodles was not all that.  Saturate your noodles in butter and garlic powder and you will have the same thing at home.
The shaken beef was not tender and lack of sauce of a traditional "Bò lúc lc"
And finally, the pièce de résistance, tamarind crab was a greasy mess served on a puddle of clarified butter. I was not able to taste the tamarind. Here again, I have had better versions at other restaurants without a "Secret Kitchen"
This was an overpriced and poorly executed Vietnamese food and it shows that hype and marketing of the "Secret Kitchen Dishes" can fool a lot of people, at least once.

excerpts: We had the Shahin beef, tamarind crab, roasted crab and grilled shrimp with garlic noodles.
We've been here several times and everything still tastes the same.
For dessert we had the molten chocolate cake and fried banana with vanilla ice cream.
I think they could of at least given us the whole banana!
tamarind crab.author: deborah y.
tamarind crab.review: Always delicious here!  We had the Shahin beef, tamarind crab, roasted crab and grilled shrimp with garlic noodles.  We've been here several times and everything still tastes the same.  For dessert we had the molten chocolate cake and fried banana with vanilla ice cream.  I think they could of at least given us the whole banana!

excerpts: Tamarind crab is red (tomato + sugar + lemon?)
tamarind crab.author: Tom L.
tamarind crab.review:
I normally don't do YELP review ...

The family and I went to Thanh Long last night. How can you go wrong with +2,000 positive YELP review?

Service was GREAT - and that was the highlight of the visit.

We ordered 2 crabs, sea bass and other foods.

The crabs seems to be pre-cooked, re-steamed and tasted completely stale. I don't think they came from Costco either since Costco's pre-cooked crabs are pretty good.

Tamarind crab is red (tomato + sugar + lemon?) sauce poured over a pre-cooked and re-steamed crab. 

Roasted crab is butter and garlic (nothing "house secret" about it) sauce poured over a pre-cooked and re-steamed crab.

The sea bass is so bad that my daughter, who is a very easy eater, commented that it was worse than "daddy's sea bass" - which I "cooked" directly out of the box from Costco.

I looked around and see diners "enjoying" their crabs. I must be seriously PUNKED.

Beware!

excerpts: ~We ordered the tamarind crab.
I think there was dill in it, but it is not the traditional vietnamese tamarind sauce.
Not very good.
~I suspect it may be overcooked.
The crab was brought out within 5 minutes of ordering, so it wasn't probably freshly cooked or boiled twice.
The meat was a bit too chewy and not so tender.
I LOVE crab and

I can eat crab all day, but it was very disappointing.
~The chocolate lava cake was delicious!
But you can't mess that up.
~Garlic
noodles were SUCH a let down.
Very boring, as in you get sick of eating it after a couple of bites.
Not enough garlic flavor, or parmesan...idk.
