Very bland.
I think they need more seasoning or toppings, like parsley.
Would not go again.
tamarind crab.author: Y T.
tamarind crab.review:
I was in SF for a seafood tour and was impressed by all the fresh seafood around the area. We then stopped by here, through word of mouth and all of the good yelp reviews but were extremely let down.

-Very expensive at 50$~ish a crab. We could buy 3 crabs for that price at the market!
~We ordered the tamarind crab. I think there was dill in it, but it is not the traditional vietnamese tamarind sauce. Not very good.
~I suspect it may be overcooked. The crab was brought out within 5 minutes of ordering, so it wasn't probably freshly cooked or boiled twice. The meat was a bit too chewy and not so tender. I LOVE crab and I can eat crab all day, but it was very disappointing.
~The chocolate lava cake was delicious! But you can't mess that up. 
~Garlic noodles were SUCH a let down. Very boring, as in you get sick of eating it after a couple of bites. Not enough garlic flavor, or parmesan...idk. Very bland. I think they need more seasoning or toppings, like parsley. Would not go again.

excerpts: My table ordered the roasted crab and tamarind crab.
Very different.
Very satisfying.
I paused for a split second to be thankful
all my hair was already tied up.
No one at my table ate their crab carapaces, so this Vietnamese gal was in heaven with five all to herself!
The tamarind crab went great with it.
tamarind crab.author: Truc N.
tamarind crab.review:
On the night of the full moon, we ventured out of the city. We drove towards the setting sun, passing many other good lookin' eateries, promised a crab coma experience...

We entered a simple door. The garlic pervaded everything. It was the kind that made you hungry, newly fried garlic that makes your mouth water. All around, people sat with plastic bibs! The group of diners to my left were happily passing around the famous noodles. The couple in front of me finished ordering and started to tie back their hair. An odd thing to do, but soon I'd fully understand.

I glanced down at the menu and inhaled the garlic permeating the air, agreeing it was worth the trip from downtown to the other side to eat at Thanh Long. My hometown, Nha Trang, was even labeled on the menu cover. :-) Then, the waiters tied a bib on me and walked away with a knowing look. We started with the salmon carpaccio and the shrimp toast. The salmon was sliced thinly enough to hold full flavor and the citrus hit was perfect. The shrimp toast was pillow goodness. The topping reminded me of the shrimp paste around sugar cane.

Then the garlic noodles! So good! Best when eaten hot, so get it on your plate then into your belly fast. The noodles were a nice chewy texture and a subtle garlic flavor that was nothing as powerful as its garlic aroma. Then again, you're hit with garlic the moment you walk in.

Then...THE CRAB! Some of the best Dungeoness crab I've ever eaten. My table ordered the roasted crab and tamarind crab. Very different. Very satisfying. I paused for a split second to be thankful all my hair was already tied up. No one at my table ate their crab carapaces, so this Vietnamese gal was in heaven with five all to herself! Then, we went garlic crazy and ordered garlic fried rice. The tamarind crab went great with it.

After all this, I had a disappointing fried banana. Others had the orange sherbet and the molten lava cake and enjoyed their desserts. My fried banana had no hint of a sugar finish...brown, white, nor palm. The banana was no where near sweet enough to carry it. 

But, I went for the crab, not the dessert. So, high ratings from me.

excerpts:
Two of us ate 1 roasted crab, 1 tamarind crab, and 1 drunken crab along with garlic noodles.

the drunken crab came with alcohol sauce (I think it's beer) and it's kinda bland.
tamarind crab.author: Steve N.
tamarind crab.review:
We've heard about this restaurant for while and finally made our way there for taste test last night.  We were quite disappointed.  Definitely  were not impressed.

Two of us ate 1 roasted crab, 1 tamarind crab, and 1 drunken crab along with garlic noodles.

The tamarind and drunken crabs were cooked by boiling in water and put together with the sauce before serving so they weren't that tasty.   Tamarind sauce was water down and not tasty as stand alone sauce.  the drunken crab came with alcohol sauce (I think it's beer) and it's kinda bland. 

Roasted crab was better than the other two.  It served with traditional Vietnamese salt and crack black pepper with (I think) olive oil sauce.  Very basic Vietnamese traditional sauce.

at $55 a crab, I would say it's over rated

definitely not deserve a 2nd visit

excerpts:
Once we were seated, we proceeded to order the following:

Roasted Crab
Tamarind Crab
Muscles with Asian Pesto
Garlic Noodles
Season Veggie Stir fry
I was really excited for the garlic noodles because everyone was raving about it
but they were not what I expected.
Best garlic noodles I've eaten so far is from "Le Vie" on Geary.
tamarind crab.author: Mai W.
tamarind crab.review:
I had high hopes for this place. It was definitely a bit over rated. 

I came here on a Saturday night and it was packed! We had reservations for dinner at 6pm and got there a bit early so we decided to have a couple of drinks at the bar right by the door. There was no room to sit. I got the the Fluer de Mango. it was delicious! The bartender gave my friend and I an extra side shot of their lychee/pineapple infused vodka. (DELICIOUS too!)

Once we were seated, we proceeded to order the following:

Roasted Crab
Tamarind Crab
Muscles with Asian Pesto
Garlic Noodles
Season Veggie Stir fry

I was really excited for the garlic noodles because everyone was raving about it but they were not what I expected. Best garlic noodles I've eaten so far is from "Le Vie" on Geary. 

The crabs were pretty decent sized but also so so. The Tamarind one was not the favorite of the table. The Roasted crab was pretty good but nothing out of the ordinary. 

Perhaps I need to give this place another try but everything seemed just mediocre.

excerpts: Not so much the tamarind crab.
tamarind crab.author: Michael G.
tamarind crab.review: The best crab in town. The toast crab and drunken crab is very good. Not so much the tamarind crab. Why order that when roast crab is right above it on the menu. Make your dinner surf 'n turf by adding the Shaken Beef. Meat is so tender and full of flavor. Goes well with garlic noodles, roast crab and any wine.

excerpts: Haven't been here in years but had a craving for Tamarind Crab and Garlic noodles...
SO YUMMY...
HIGHLY recommend the Tamarind Crab...
tamarind crab.author: Elaine Y.
tamarind crab.review:
Thanh Long DID NOT DISAPPOINT!  Haven't been here in years but had a craving for Tamarind Crab and Garlic noodles... SO YUMMY... I'm still drooling thinking about that sweet tamarind flavoring on the perfectly cooked crab... 

Because the crabs are cooked perfectly - so EASY to open and eat...

Service was awesome as they kept giving us empty bowls for the shells and of course filling up our water glasses and checking in on us...

HIGHLY recommend the Tamarind Crab... I know they have the basic with butter and garlic but seriously - where else can you get that wonderful tamarind flavor... kept dipping my crab pieces into the sauce!

LOVE this place and LOVE that their food and service is consistent... consistently AWESOME!

excerpts: Came here because i was craving the tamarind crab, but got suckered in to order the infamous roasted crab, garlic noodles, calamari, and tamarind crab.
I actually really liked the infamous roasted crab here because the seasoning on the crab really brought out the flavor.
the garlic noodles were great, I liked how they had a big portion.
The calamari was okay
, i could of got it somewhere else that would be better.
I loved the tamarind crab because i actually like tamarind.
This place was really hyped up and now i know why after trying out their food.
Make sure you come early or make reservation because this places gets packed on weekdays and weekends!
Kind of pricey for this place though.
tamarind crab.author: Johnny L.
tamarind crab.review: Came here because i was craving the tamarind crab, but got suckered in to order the infamous roasted crab, garlic noodles, calamari, and tamarind crab. I actually really liked the infamous roasted crab here because the seasoning on the crab really brought out the flavor. the garlic noodles were great, I liked how they had a big portion. The calamari was okay, i could of got it somewhere else that would be better. I loved the tamarind crab because i actually like tamarind. This place was really hyped up and now i know why after trying out their food.  Make sure you come early or make reservation because this places gets packed on weekdays and weekends! Kind of pricey for this place though.

excerpts: Tamarind crab (Roma tomatoes & tamarind, seasoned with fresh dill & green onions & flambeed with cognac   -
We're always ordering 1&2
tamarind crab.author: Earl G.
tamarind crab.review:
Screw rice a roni this is the real San Francisco treat! 

The menu is 5 or 6 pages long but there's only two things to get here,
1. Dungeness crab and 2. garlic noodles.   (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/z9CN58fSrA46ggyb6OnCnQ?select=IK1klWeoCzzC_KrK5_T0jQ)

The garlic noodles are the best! Trust, each time I see garlic noodles on a menu, I order it. These are always duplicated but never replicated. $10 for the sweet, garlicky, buttery garlic noodle experience. I like these better than PPQ's savory garlic noodles. 

For the Dungeness crabs, there's 3 flavors, and I like how they're all meaty and prepared in such a way that you don't have to be a crab expert to extract all the meat. 

$38 per crab (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/z9CN58fSrA46ggyb6OnCnQ?select=dgRH-jCrvlRN55ilDWvvDA)

1. Roasted Crab (An fam's secret spices  -  nice garlic flavor - my favorite) 
2. Drunken Crab (simmered in sake/chardonnay/brandy  - anything simmered in that sauce should taste really good! 
3. Tamarind crab (Roma tomatoes & tamarind, seasoned with fresh dill & green onions & flambeed with cognac   -  We're always ordering 1&2  that we haven't gotten to #3 yet  

Do yourself a flavor and splurge on a crab and garlic noodle for each person for a $100 date night.  

Garlic noodles so good, you won't wanna brush your teeth!

excerpts: I had the Tamarind crab here about a week ago.
OMG!
Just the right kick of pepper and sweetness from the tamarind.
The sauce was so good
tamarind crab.author: Courtney S.
tamarind crab.review:
I had the Tamarind crab here about a week ago. OMG!  Just the right kick of pepper and sweetness from the tamarind.  The sauce was so good I put some on my garlic noodles.  I didn't think it could be possible but the noodles got even better!

I love this place!  They consistently deliver on all my expectations!

excerpts: We had the coconut prawns and New Zealand mussels for appetizer, garlic noodles, roast crab, tamarind crab, and shaken beef for main course.
I remember having the coconut prawns at their home before
and I absolutely fell in love with this dish.
Crispy from the tempura, sweet from the coconut flake, a little tangy of their signature orange sauce.
It was such a balanced dish and a great start of the meal.
Onto the main dish, garlic noodles, I thought I liked it better when I ate at their house, but my boyfriend loved the noodle served at the restaurant.
It was garlicky, but a little sweet for me.
The crabs were very fresh and the color looked amazing.
Roast crab, which seem to be every Yelper's favorite, yet not me.
Tamarind crab was okay, the sauce was not thick and tangy enough for a Vietnamese like me who technically grow up eating tamarind crab every other weekend in Vietnam.
Lastly, shaken beef was perfectly medium rare, juicy and full of flavors.
tamarind crab.author: Chau V.
tamarind crab.review:
Thanh Long has been on my bookmark for quite some time now, so we couldn't miss a chance to have dinner at Thanh Long on our most recent visit to the City by the Bay.

Holy crabs!

My boyfriend's mom is a close friend of one of the daughters of the An family's and we have tried all the signature dishes at the home of the chef before, but dining at their restaurant was a different experience. If you plan to have dinner at weekend, it is essential to make reservation ahead and arrive promptly because the wait can get hectic (about 1-1:45 hours). Also, don't come like 30 minutes early for your reservation since they will make you wait until your whatever time you reserve.

We had the coconut prawns and New Zealand mussels for appetizer, garlic noodles, roast crab, tamarind crab, and shaken beef for main course. I remember having the coconut prawns at their home before and I absolutely fell in love with this dish. Crispy from the tempura, sweet from the coconut flake, a little tangy of their signature orange sauce. It was such a balanced dish and a great start of the meal. Mussels were fresh, the Asian pesto was flavorful and the crostini accompanied really well with the other two.

Onto the main dish, garlic noodles, I thought I liked it better when I ate at their house, but my boyfriend loved the noodle served at the restaurant. It was garlicky, but a little sweet for me. The crabs were very fresh and the color looked amazing. Roast crab, which seem to be every Yelper's favorite, yet not me. Tamarind crab was okay, the sauce was not thick and tangy enough for a Vietnamese like me who technically grow up eating tamarind crab every other weekend in Vietnam. Lastly, shaken beef was perfectly medium rare, juicy and full of flavors. Strange, but I would recommend this meat dish at a seafood restaurant. 

Overall, great dining experience.

excerpts: Ordered the popular roast crab and tamarind crab, garlic noodles and of course shaken beef.
The crabs are so fresh and succulent in their special herbs and sauce that we lick up every little bit of sauce and oil on the platter.
Shaken beef is so tender moist and sweet
that again we finish the salad that holds the famous beef.
Garlic noodles were the right touch to complete the meal.
Service was efficient and we were happy that the wait may be long
but after you're seated the food comes in 10 mins.
Excellent.
Overall it's pricey but so worth it.
Will be back
tamarind crab.author: Nelle L.
tamarind crab.review:
Took us 3 years and finally made the reservation for Saturday dinner. And yes reservation is a must so as not to wait for than an hour to be seated. 
Ordered the popular roast crab and tamarind crab, garlic noodles and of course shaken beef. 
The crabs are so fresh and succulent in their special herbs and sauce that we lick up every little bit of sauce and oil on the platter. 
Shaken beef is so tender moist and sweet that again we finish the salad that holds the famous beef. 
Garlic noodles were the right touch to complete the meal. 
Service was efficient and we were happy that the wait may be long but after you're seated the food comes in 10 mins. Excellent. 
Overall it's pricey but so worth it. Will be back

excerpts: ROAST/DRUNKEN/TAMARIND CRAB:
We got one of each ($41.95 per crab).
tamarind crab.author: Tiffany N.
tamarind crab.review:
Good food, good service, and not necessarily overpriced.

Made reservations for 6 pm New Year's Eve. We got there about half an hour early, but they seated us anyways since there was room. It's a small restaurant on the corner of the street. On the outside, it doesn't look very nice but the interior is pretty upscale.  

Loved the promptness of everything. The appetizer came within ten minutes. We were bibbed and received our main course immediately after we finished our appetizer. The waiters were attentive and helpful. They also gave us New Year's calendars on our way out. 

Here's what we got:
SALT & PEPPER CALAMARI $11.95: Good appetizer. Crisp, no sauce.

ASPARAGUS SOUP WITH CRAB $7.50: My mom ordered this and enjoyed it. Hot soup is always great when the weather is cold. 

ROAST/DRUNKEN/TAMARIND CRAB: We got one of each ($41.95 per crab). My favorite was the drunken crab. The sauce actually doesn't matter unless you dip the crab meat in the sauce on the plate. 

GARLIC NOODLES $10: This was actually really good, but I wouldn't say they're to die for. It was like eating garlic bread except they were noodles, and these noodles are the same texture as the chow mein at Panda Express. They also have the less expensive option of garlic rice, fried rice, jasmine rice, or vegetables. 

LAVA CHOCOLATE CAKE $8.25: Skip it. The lava cake is mostly syrup and on the bitter side. 

FRIED BANANA A LA MODE $6.95: Skip it. It's just regular fried banana and ice cream--nothing special.

CREME BRULEE $7.50: Again, skip it. If you are dying to have dessert here, choose this one. I'm not saying the desserts are bad at Thanh Long but there are a couple dessert shops on the same street and there are better options in driving distance.

Parents also had a FLEUR DE MANGO ($9.25) with a heineken ($5) and a HANOI SUNSET ($9).

excerpts: **   tamarind crab: sauce too strong can't taste crab
**   tiger prawn: 4 ok shrimp on top of garlic noodle.
Given it costs $36 I was expecting more...
tamarind crab.author: Yu-Ting H.
tamarind crab.review:
Long wait and service is merely on par... Food is above average but I don't think I'll come again b.c. the wait. We had reservation at 7:45p and they asked for everyone being here to be seated so we were there early. but were seated around 8:20p. Water came 10mins after we are seated. Food came quickly after we ordered tho.  
**** garlic noodle: tasty but it's a side food
***  roasted crab: tasty but too dry
**   tamarind crab: sauce too strong can't taste crab
**   tiger prawn: 4 ok shrimp on top of garlic noodle. Given it costs $36 I was expecting more...

excerpts: Valet Parking + A Half Dozen Herbaceous Broiled Mussels atop Toast + Plastic Bibs + 1 Whole Roasted Crab with Garlic + 1 Drunken Crab with Chardonnay and Cracked Black Pepper + 1 Tangy and Dill-icious Tamarind Crab + A Heaping Pile of the Best Garlic Noodles in the City + Grubby Fingers =
THE ARRIVAL OF DUNGENESS CRAB SEASON
tamarind crab.author: Amy C.
tamarind crab.review: Valet Parking + A Half Dozen Herbaceous Broiled Mussels atop Toast + Plastic Bibs + 1 Whole Roasted Crab with Garlic + 1 Drunken Crab with Chardonnay and Cracked Black Pepper + 1 Tangy and Dill-icious Tamarind Crab + A Heaping Pile of the Best Garlic Noodles in the City + Grubby Fingers = THE ARRIVAL OF DUNGENESS CRAB SEASON

excerpts: We also had the tamarind crab and a plate of garlic noodles.
The crab meat was good and well cooked but the sauce was really strange with ingredients that did not go so well together.
The garlic noodles were also just bleh.
For $10, I would really like more than a plain plate of spaghetti noodles with a some garlic seasonings.
I generally love garlic noodles but at least most places present the noodles with a sprig of greens or extra sauce and charge at least 1/3-1/2 less.
Really-
tamarind crab.author: Amy D.
tamarind crab.review:
We were quite excited to check out this place being huge fans of crab (and during dungeness season too)! Sadly, Thanh Long was quite disappointing with high prices and mediocre food.

We started with the mango salad with seared shrimp and scallop that ended up being the highlight of the meal. The flavors were fantastic although there could have been more scallops. The warm seafood paired with the fruit flavors of the sliced mango and raspberry vinaigrette were really fun and well worth trying!

We also had the tamarind crab and a plate of garlic noodles. The crab meat was good and well cooked but the sauce was really strange with ingredients that did not go so well together. The tamarind component of the crab did not come out strongly (this wasn't your normal tamarind sauce) and we were quite disappointed with the conflicting and unappetizing flavors of this ~$40 dish. 

The garlic noodles were also just bleh. For $10, I would really like more than a plain plate of spaghetti noodles with a some garlic seasonings. I generally love garlic noodles but at least most places present the noodles with a sprig of greens or extra sauce and charge at least 1/3-1/2 less. Really- with how expensive the food is at this place, I expect a bit more presentation if not better flavor. 

Overall, this place was mediocre to average (we count 2 stars as average). The mango salad was fantastic but the big miss on the other dishes plus the unjustified high prices brought it back down to a 1.5 stars for us.

excerpts: my only critiques are that there is a limited ways your crab can be prepared -- the original roast crab with pepper, the drunken crab, and the tamarind crab.
i would have liked to try a garlic-prepared crab.
tamarind crab.author: Sabrina L.
tamarind crab.review:
Had a great experience here! Make sure you come early and make reservations -- the place was already crowded at 5:30 pm on a thursday night! we had reservations for our party of 10 and were seated upstairs. service was very fast -- we started receiving our food maybe ten minutes after ordering! everything was really good, from the crabs (my uncle said the crabs are all soaked beforehand, so the shells were very soft and not at all hard to crack into!), garlic noodles, shaken beef, chicken, and vegetarian dishes. the eggplant was good but extremely oily. the ambiance of the restaurant is also very nice and more upscale than i was expecting, and they even have a valet option for your car!

my only critiques are that there is a limited ways your crab can be prepared -- the original roast crab with pepper, the drunken crab, and the tamarind crab. i would have liked to try a garlic-prepared crab. their fryer was also broken that night, so we were unable to enjoy any fried bananas :(

overall very good experience! i would love to come back!

excerpts: Tamarind Crab (wasn't very flavorful, but both crabs were cooked perfectly)
tamarind crab.author: Amy D.
tamarind crab.review:
Came in a group of 6 on a Saturday night, so we got to try a lot of dishes. Making reservations is definitely recommended, and parking in this area is tough- the $10 for valet is well spent. 

Ordered-
Salt & Pepper Calamari (nice and peppery, but calamari could've been a bit more crisp)
Dungeness Crab Puffs (good, but def not authentic)
Seafood Dumplings (only ok and 5 pieces- wouldn't recommend for the price)
Crispy Rice Paper Roll (too dry for me, I wouldn't order this again)
Curry Lotus Prawns (good taste but the "jumbo prawns" were teeny!)
Shaken Beef (really good flavor, imo better than at the Slanted Door and cheaper. however, they mix in potatoes pieces to trick you into thinking there is more meat)
Roast Crab (good, but wasn't super flavorful)
Tamarind Crab (wasn't very flavorful, but both crabs were cooked perfectly)
Garlic Noodles (good, but could've been more garlicky)
Fried Rice with Shrimp (your standard fried rice, I wouldn't order again)
Fried Banana & Fried Ice Cream (both were good but I like the banana a lot more)

Overall, the dinner was good, but not amazing. I actually liked the crab I ordered at Three Seasons better (taste wise). My favorite dishes were the shaken beef and garlic noodles, but this restaurant is worth a try for the crab. We paid $57pp including tax and tip, which isn't bad at all, but we didn't get that much crab.

excerpts: We ordered the Roasted Crab, Drunken Crab, and the Tamarind Crab.
The latter was definitely my favorite for
it's very unique sweet tangy flavor.
The flavoring of the Roasted crab was somewhat more oily and not as flavorful/garlicy as the one from PPQ.
tamarind crab.author: Jeanne L.
tamarind crab.review:
Versus PPQ, the other dungeness crab powerhouse of SF, this place loses for both taste and price... for all dishes.

We ordered the Roasted Crab, Drunken Crab, and the Tamarind Crab.  The latter was definitely my favorite for it's very unique sweet tangy flavor. The flavoring of the Roasted crab was somewhat more oily and not as flavorful/garlicy as the one from PPQ.  (Most of all, I really missed the incredibly delicious dry flavor of the Peppercorn crab from PPQ.)

The Garlic Noodles here were on the softer side compared to PPQ, and I really prefer a nice firm al dente noodle with a bit of a chew to it.

The Colossal Royal Tiger Prawns were a huge letdown. There were .. 5 or 6 prawns only.

Vegetarian Delight was described as silken tofu sauteed with assorted vegetables and shitake mushrooms.  I know this is a Vietnamese restaurant, but I am really used to eating a Chinese version of this with a crispy-fried tofu.  The tofu was a mushy-soft texture, and the vegetable selection was meager.  The dish size overall was small.  I was not delighted.

$32 per person, group of 9 people.  It was pricey considering how unsatisfied we were for quality/quantity of food.  Sorry, this is what happens when you compare against PPQ.

http://www.yelp.com/biz/ppq-dungeness-island-san-francisco-2#hrid:yChlljno2CCweXgXWfyfpw/src:self

excerpts: Tamarind Crab - Sauce does not taste like tamarind!
It tasted more like tomato.
It's good but it should not be called tamarind!
* Roasted Crab - Good
I'm not a fan, but
that just me.
I'd just rather go out & buy a live crab home & sauce it all up myself!
The price here is just too ridiculous.

Spent over a hundred dollars just for my boyfriend & I.

tamarind crab.review:
Interior is nice & spacious. Service is good.
Tried:

* Tamarind Crab - Sauce does not taste like tamarind! It tasted more like tomato. It's good but it should not be called tamarind!
* Roasted Crab - Good
I'm not a fan, but that just me. I'd just rather go out & buy a live crab home & sauce it all up myself! The price here is just too ridiculous. Spent over a hundred dollars just for my boyfriend & I.
FYI, Sodas are NO REFILLS

excerpts: I had the Tamarind crab for the second time here.
the first time was about 18 months ago was one of the best crabs I've ever eaten.
My crab tonight tasted as it if it had been frozen for a long time and smothered in a very sweet sauce nothing like the first time.
the meat was not plump and juicy.
it was stringy and a bit dry with little taste without the sauce.
I cook and I eat a lot of fresh Dungeness crab, and
that's not what I was served tonight.
Needless to say I'm disappointed
and I doubt  I will ever go back.
tamarind crab.author: Ramon C.
tamarind crab.review: I had the Tamarind crab for the second time here. the first time was about 18 months ago was one of the best crabs I've ever eaten.  My crab tonight tasted as it if it had been frozen for a long time and smothered in a very sweet sauce nothing like the first time. the meat was not plump and juicy. it was stringy and a bit dry with little taste without the sauce. I cook and I eat a lot of fresh Dungeness crab, and that's not what I was served tonight. Needless to say I'm disappointed and I doubt  I will ever go back.

excerpts:
During my visits, I've also tried the Seabass, Drunken Crab, Tamarind Crab, Mussels, Salt & Pepper Calamari, Garlic Noodles, and the Traditional Vietnamese Salad.  
I'm still not a fan of the Drunken Crab, Tamarind Crab, or the Garlic Noodles, but all the others were pretty good.

I'm still not a fan of the Drunken Crab, Tamarind Crab, or the Garlic Noodles, but all the others were pretty good.

I'm still not a fan of the Drunken Crab, Tamarind Crab, or the Garlic Noodles, but all the others were pretty good.
tamarind crab.author: Ninja H.
tamarind crab.review:
Still come for my crab fix when I can't order it from Mom, but I don't know if I've just been coming too often or if the crab quality really has gone down.  Like I said, still incredibly delish but something's a lil off...idk!

I've been more than my share of times but thought my most recent trip about a week after crab season started would've been the best visit.  Sadly, it was the same crab quality as when it wasn't crab season. Hmmm...

Well, it won't sway me!  I'm still gettin down and messy in the Roasted Crab garlic butter...and a nice stiff drink!  And still ordering the Shaken Beef when my taste buds call for it.  

During my visits, I've also tried the Seabass, Drunken Crab, Tamarind Crab, Mussels, Salt & Pepper Calamari, Garlic Noodles, and the Traditional Vietnamese Salad.  I'm still not a fan of the Drunken Crab, Tamarind Crab, or the Garlic Noodles, but all the others were pretty good.

Still recommend to others, and will still continue to patronize when Mom's kitchen's out of crustacean! ;0)

excerpts: My favorite is probably the Tamarind Crab.
The sauce gave it a tarty-kick which is a plus in my book.
tamarind crab.author: Shirley T.
tamarind crab.review:
I think I expected way too much from Thanh Long.  Food is decent and it is known of its garlic noodle and crab.  My favorite is probably the Tamarind Crab. The sauce gave it a tarty-kick which is a plus in my book.  The garlic noodles are good but a little oily.  I'm sure there are tons of butter in the noodles to give it that rich flavor.  The place is a bit pricier than lets say..PPQ which has great crab.  The service and decor of Thanh Long is a bit fancier than most places that serves crab this way.  Think Asian steak house without the steak but crab in its place.  

All in all, I enjoyed my dinner.  It's pricey and any other Chinese dishes there are quite small in portion size.  Each plate is probably only good for 2, maybe 3 people. It might be wise to order duplicates of the dishes if you're with a big party.

excerpts: We ordered the tamarind crab, which is cooked in tamarind and tomato with other seasonings.
The crab was perfectly cooked and the tamarind sauce with its slight sweetness complemented it perfectly.
tamarind crab.author: Al L.
tamarind crab.review:
Our friend from Chicago is in town and we had dinner at Thanh Long to satisfy her craving for crab at one her favorite restaurants in SF.

We were 15 minutes late for our reservations and were worried when we notice people waiting in front and that the restaurant was full.  The maitre d' said no problem had kept our table open, when they could have given it away.

We ordered the tamarind crab, which is cooked in tamarind and tomato with other seasonings. The crab was perfectly cooked and the tamarind sauce with its slight sweetness complemented it perfectly. We've had the roasted crab before and felt the garlic sauce was too overpowering and took away from the delicate taste of the crab.

We complemented the crab with garlic noodles and Jasmine rice.  The garlic noodles are the best as compared to other ones we've had at other Vietnamese restaurants.  Not oily with just the right amount of garlic.  Always trying to replicate it at home, but just haven't come close to it.

Finished our meal with the fried bananas topped with a large scoop of vanilla ice cream.  This was delicious as evidenced by our clean plate.  

The wait staff was attentive and filled water glasses and efficiently cleared plates and bowls.

Overall, I would rate Thanh Long 4.5 stars....the food was very good with very efficient service.

excerpts: Everyone must try the garlic noodles and the tamarind crab!
dont go here if you dont like crab! unless you are absolutely ok with being surrounded by crab.
tamarind crab.author: Megan B.
tamarind crab.review: Everyone must try the garlic noodles and the tamarind crab! dont go here if you dont like crab! unless you are absolutely ok with being surrounded by crab.

excerpts: we've ventured to try the tamarind crab once or twice
tamarind crab.author: Anjelica C.
tamarind crab.review:
roast crab. garlic noodles.

that is all you need.

sometimes we get seafood fried rice, calamari, vietnamese salad, beef skewers, etc, but the only essentials are: roast crab. garlic noodles.

we've ventured to try the tamarind crab once or twice but it's not as amazing as the roast crab. make reservations, if you can! and some days, parking can take awhile. staff is really friendly, helpful, and attentive. always a great dining experience here

excerpts: I was tempted to stray from convention and try the Tamarind crab, or the Drunken crab (cooked in white wine and olive oil
I think), but everyone kept stressing how legit the garlic roast one was.
tamarind crab.author: Jo G.
tamarind crab.review:
Allright, I'll be the first to admit that I exaggerate stuff and can be overly dramatic sometimes, but honestly- I think our dinner at Thanh Long was probably one of the best meals of my life.  Top 5 for sure.  

My friend kept raving about this place and how great the garlic roast crab is.  I L-O-V-E crustaceans, crab legs and lobster tails rock my world.  Garlic not so much.  I of course use garlic in cooking to enhance a dish and can appreciate its use, but you're not gonna find me eating at The Stinking Rose where that shit reeks of almost raw garlic, ew.   So, I was slightly skeptical as to whether I'd enjoy this garlic crab, and the garlic noodles that you can order as a side dish.

We walk into the restaurant, and I'm pleasantly surprised to find out it doesn't have an overbearing garlic smell to it.  Awesome.  I was tempted to stray from convention and try the Tamarind crab, or the Drunken crab (cooked in white wine and olive oil I think), but everyone kept stressing how legit the garlic roast one was.  Ok, I caved.

Boy, I've never been so happy to cave into peer pressure as I was Friday night.  The garlic roast crab was sooooooooo delicious, I went to town on that motha.  I kindof pride myself on my waspy crab-eating skills, I can pick every single morsel of meat out of a crab leg, which I did again that night.  Honestly it's a lot of crab meat so many of weaklings out there might want to follow in the footsteps of the couple next to us and "split a crab."  I don't know what "sharing" or "split" a meal means as I've never done it myself, but I hear some people don't experience the food coma afterward, so I guess try it if you want.

On to the noodles, which again sounded super dicey to me.  I envisioned half-cooked garlic which would make me vomit.  Ohhhh silly girl, silly naive Jo.  No no no no- the garlic noodles were exquisite.  They tasted faintly of garlic, and like McDonald's fries, had to have a touch of sugar in them b/c they were slightly sweet and addictive as fuck.  Score.

As a sidenote, this place is a nicer restaurant, you still get a bib but it's definitely not a hole in the wall crab joint.  With that said, I wouldn't recommend it for a first or second date, b/c most girls will squirm at the thought of cracking crab legs (which might mess up our outfits, God forbid our date's crab gets flung inadvertently into our hair), and the garlic factor too, just don't do it.  Wait till you guys have reached that comfort level where you just don't give an F and can school that crab in peace without any insecurity.

excerpts: I would order tamarind crab next time.
They didn't have any winery grape juice spritzer.
We also ordered the prawn rolls which are best with sauce.
You won't need a cup of rice unless it's for leftover crab.
The current market price is under $39 and a crab will feed two.
tamarind crab.author: Ai M.
tamarind crab.review:
Drink Hanoi beer or Vietnamese iced coffee.  Drunken crab and garlic noodles!  Roasted crab was peppery.  The vanilla creme brûlée should at least have been topped with fruit. It was cold.

Get the mussels appetizer but not roasted crab.  I would order tamarind crab next time.  They didn't have any winery grape juice spritzer.  We also ordered the prawn rolls which are best with sauce.  You won't need a cup of rice unless it's for leftover crab.
   
The current market price is under $39 and a crab will feed two.  The garlic noodles can be smelled from the next table (tasted better than when I had them at AnQi too).  I still taste a hint of it in my mouth the next day. They only take reservations no earlier than two weeks in advance but I was also able to get one the day before. This corner restaurant is conveniently located next to a couple of bus stops.

excerpts: Loved the Tamarind Crab the best but other dishes we ordered were lovely too.
tamarind crab.author: Lev E.
tamarind crab.review:
Yum, yum, yummy.  Loved the Tamarind Crab the best but other dishes we ordered were lovely too.

Service was nice and efficient.

Definitely will be returning again.

excerpts: Of course the infamous garlic noodles and tamarind crab!
Enough said.

these ive tried: the drunken crab - C (somewhat bland), roasted crab - A (peppery, delicious), tamarind crab - A (sweet and tasty), garlic noodles - A (strong garlic but sooo good), seabass - A (cooked and seasoned perfectly, spring rolls - C

these ive tried: the drunken crab - C (somewhat bland), roasted crab - A (peppery, delicious), tamarind crab - A (sweet and tasty), garlic noodles - A (strong garlic but sooo good), seabass - A (cooked and seasoned perfectly, spring rolls - C
tamarind crab.author: Dee T.
tamarind crab.review:
Of course the infamous garlic noodles and tamarind crab! Enough said.  YuMMMMM

Actually here is my letter grades for these ive tried: the drunken crab - C (somewhat bland), roasted crab - A (peppery, delicious), tamarind crab - A (sweet and tasty), garlic noodles - A (strong garlic but sooo good), seabass - A (cooked and seasoned perfectly, spring rolls - C (rice paper is dry, sauce is too sweet), lemon drop w/ chambord (kinda sweet)- B....

This place is tucked away and is small but it does have a bar with good cocktail in the foyer area. Parking sucks as everywhere in SF, but value is an option at $10.  Attire is casual and most of the tables seats only 2-4 people. During the weekends, if you do not want to wait more than 30 mins, be there before the door opens or call for a reservation. It seems there is one girl who answers the phone there that does not take reservations over the phone, weird.  The servers are attentive and nice. Noise level i guess depending if there obnoxious crowds or babies, its a moderate atmosphere.

excerpts:
I tried all the other crabs on the menu and if I were to rate it based on the taste, it would go in the order that it is listed on their menu:
Roast Crab
Drunken Crab
Tamarind Crab
tamarind crab.author: Heidi C.
tamarind crab.review:
First off, the crab puff things they sell for appetizers is a rip off. $10 for 6 pieces? No thanks. I rather spend $10 on a whole block of cream cheese at costco and eat that to my liking. 

Anyway, ONTO THE CRAB AND GARLIC NOODLES!
For two people, we got a whole roast crab and two plates of garlic noodles. I walked out of there feeling way crappy (or crabby?) since I just probably ate the equivalent of a stick of butter. BUT it was SO incredibly worth it. 

I tried all the other crabs on the menu and if I were to rate it based on the taste, it would go in the order that it is listed on their menu:
Roast Crab
Drunken Crab
Tamarind Crab

They give you a plastic bib so you don't get crab juices on you, and you pretty much eat with your hands. Make sure to eat the garlic noodles while they're hot. Doesn't taste as good when it's cooled down.

Last time we went, the market price for a crab was about $35. 

I love Thanh Long's crab!!

(Photos uploaded)

UPDATE  4/13/08-
 I'm taking away 3 stars for a recent cruddy experience @ TL.  Let's see, where do I begin:

- When I give you a birthday cake, I expect you to put the damn thing in the fridge so the mango mousse will not die a slow death.

- $1 charge per person for cake cutting; that's almost as absurd as the $2 charge at Straits

-Dry, old, crappy rice; you are a friggin' Asian restaurant, learn to make some rice

-Traditional Viet salad; there's nothing traditional about the salad.  There's no flavor and you cant even taste the fish sauce.  What's with the bitter cabbage and 0 herbs?

-Salt and NO pepper calamari, plain nasty

-The drunken crab was such a disappointment; we did not pay $36 for a frozen crab 

-Service definitely needed improvement; when you put 100 lbs of salt in all your dishes, you should just give us a pitcher of water so we don't have to remind your servers about the water every 5 minutes

-Water served in chipped/broken glasses

-The tamarind crab and garlic noodles are good but the overall experience my friends and I had recently, DEFINITELY does not warrant the original 4 stars and another visit

excerpts: Stick to the roasted crab instead of the tamarind crab.
The sauce on the tamarind crab is a little sweet for my taste buds.
tamarind crab.author: Laina T.
tamarind crab.review:
If you're a crab lover like I am, you'll love Thanh Long.  Skip the appetizers.  I've tried the salmon carpaccio, lemongrass chicken satay, and mango salad.  I wasn't really impressed.  Order the roasted crab and garlic noodles!!!  They're to die for.  The crab is fresh and big.  The flavor of butter and cracked pepper just explodes in your mouth.  I'm a big eater so I always have to have my own crab and another entrée.  Stick to the roasted crab instead of the tamarind crab.  The sauce on the tamarind crab is a little sweet for my taste buds.  The Thanh Long spicy eggplant is good, but nowhere near spicy.  As for dessert, don't get the bread pudding.  The orange sorbet was good and the presentation was clever.  It's a frozen orange sliced across the top with orange sorbet inside.  It's nice, light, and a good ending to any meal.  

At about $40 per crab, it's not cheap.  It's a good place for special occasions or if you just want to satisfy your craving for really good crab.  The atmosphere is casual so there's no need dress up.  Get your hands dirty and enjoy!

excerpts: They only have three kinds of crab: Drunken crab (white wine sauce/cooking liquid), tamarind crab, and roasted crab (We've tried both the tamarind crab and the roasted crab (butter and garlic sauce).
The tamarind crab was okay, but the tamarind sauce was good but so overpowering compared to the delicate taste of the crab meat.
You can't even taste the crab with the tamarind sauce laced throughout this dish.
It is so tangy, sweet, and sour.
tamarind crab.author: Anh D.
tamarind crab.review:
Roasted crab and garlic noodles. 

The garlic noodles are amazing. The sauce on them is something miraculous -- very salty and savory (defines quintessential umami). 

Crab is their specialty. You want to try a crab dish when you're here. They only have three kinds of crab: Drunken crab (white wine sauce/cooking liquid), tamarind crab, and roasted crab (We've tried both the tamarind crab and the roasted crab (butter and garlic sauce). 

The tamarind crab was okay, but the tamarind sauce was good but so overpowering compared to the delicate taste of the crab meat. You can't even taste the crab with the tamarind sauce laced throughout this dish. It is so tangy, sweet, and sour. It was good for the first few bites, but I couldn't eat much  of this. 

The roasted crab, however, was divine. Garlic and butter -- what could be better? Not much more to be said than that. The crab meat was very light and tasted fresh. Very rich, though, from the butter and garlic so definitely not something to eat too regularly. 

We also tried the shaken beef dish, and it was pretty delicious as well. Very tender, juicy, and well-seasoned beef. Juiciness/tenderness is often a factor that goes wrong in this dish at many restaurants, because if you pan-saute small cubes of meat, they often get dry and stringy. No such problem here! If you have any people in your company who don't like crab or seafood, there are many options, including the shaken beef, available for delicious dining besides crab. 

The calamari appetizer is something else that we've had here, and it's delicious as well. 

Great food, okay prices (crab dishes are all "market price"), and a great spot in the city. You will have to get valet parking unless you want to walk a couple blocks, so bring cash!

excerpts: I want to try the Tamarind Crab - "simmered in a melange of Roma tomatoes & tamarind, seasoned with fresh dill & green onions & flambeed with cognac."
tamarind crab.author: Beth W.
tamarind crab.review:
We came here for a special family celebration and it was our first time dining here as well.

The food ordered for our dinner comprised of the following:

1. Salt & Pepper Calamari - delicious except for the simple overdose of coarsely ground black pepper; will definitely tell them next time to adjust the black pepper with a lighter touch

2. Mango Salad - fresh mango fruit sauteed with bell peppers, seared scallops & shrimp over mixed greens in a raspberry vinaigrette - this would make for an excellent  meal on it's own; the raspberry vinaigrette nicely tied the various flavors together effortlessly

3. Thanh Long Spicy Eggplant - eggplant sauteed with jumbo prawns, chicken, fresh basil, baby corn, shitake mushrooms, & red chilies in a tamarind & chili-soya; I like spicy but it was on the low end of the spicy spectrum on this dinner outing though the overall flavors were good ~ will order it again but tell the server to make it spicier

4. Villager's Favorite - Pacific prawns & pork medallions simmered in a caramelized reduction of soy and herbs; I liked this dish enough that I would order it again; a nice take on a "surf and turf" with pork instead of beef for the "turf" portion

5. Shaken Beef - tender cubes of marinated New York steak flambeed in Chardonnay served with potatoes, mixed greens & cherry tomatoes; delicious in flavor with fork tender beef; the greens I could do without as it seemed more a "salad" than an entree

6. Vegetarian Delight - silken tofu sauteed with asst. vegetables & shitake mushrooms; a standout as I love tofu and veggies!

7. Roast Crab - a whole Dungeness crab roasted with An's garlic sauce & secret spices in the Secret Kitchen; regardless of what others may say, this in of itself is a delectable Dungeness crab entree!  Yes it's messy but who cares?  The flavors marry very well and our entire party enjoyed this dish.

8. Garlic Noodles - An's famous noodles made with their secret garlic sauce (perhaps the one used on the Roast Crab?) & secret spices; this noodle dish is good when hot but at room temperature or worse, cold, it's not that good (something coagulates on the noodles when it's cold...butter perhaps?)

Despite the large amounts ordered per item, we had lots of left overs (crab included) for our party of 18.  Would I go back to this spot?  You betcha!  I want to try the Tamarind Crab - "simmered in a melange of Roma tomatoes & tamarind, seasoned with fresh dill & green onions & flambeed with cognac."  The ingredients for this dish make me salivate just thinking about it.

There is a full bar in case you want a drink while you wait and/or with your meal.  Two of us ordered the Fleur de Mango - pureed fresh mango, Malibu rum, a banana rum and freshly squeezed orange juice to the mix - this was the fave drink of the evening!  
 
While parking is an issue, it's located in a neighborhood folks, get there early so that you can look for parking or just valet your car.  I would also suggest booking a reservation so that you are amongst the first seating for the evening.  Overall, the service was excellent/attentive and the food was delicious.

The name of this restaurant came about due to an error at the printer's.  It was supposed to be "Thang Long" meaning "Ascending Dragon" and also Vietnam's first capital city.  As "Thanh Long" it means "Green Dragon" ~ green representing happiness and prosperity while the dragon symbol is an ancient symbol of good luck.  I would say the An Family has enjoyed this for many years serving a legion of happy customers ~ myself being a newly minted one!

Note - The An Family also owns the Crustacean group of restaurants with a Palo Alto opening targeted for this September 2010.  I can't wait till this spot opens up!

excerpts: The tamarind crab is not sour enough.
My Chinese friend hyped about garlic noodle with the secret sauce but there is nothing unique about it + serves too cold and a bit salty.
The pepper calamari is good tho.
tamarind crab.author: Meo M.
tamarind crab.review:
I had high expectation on Thanh Long because after all, it spawned Crustacean that I have heard so much about

The service is excellent but the food is so so.   Roast crab is just ok. . The tamarind crab is not sour enough. My Chinese friend hyped about garlic noodle with the secret sauce but there is nothing unique about it + serves too cold and a bit salty.  The pepper calamari is good tho.

excerpts: The tamarind crab is also very tasty - spicy, sweet and tart with plenty of pepper.
tamarind crab.author: Vina Y.
tamarind crab.review:
The tamarind crab is also very tasty - spicy, sweet and tart with plenty of pepper.  

Thang Long Mussels with Bruschetta was delicious.

Skip the Coconut shrimp - limp and overly breaded.

excerpts: Tamarind crab and Garlic noodles are wonderful.
tamarind crab.author: Chon Q.
tamarind crab.review:
I savored every last morsel.  Tamarind crab and Garlic noodles are wonderful.  The drink is eh, and the dessert is also just ok.

It's a little pricey and parking is hard to find.  

What a wonderful dual anniversary we had with my oldest friend.

excerpts: Anyhow my husband ordered the tamarind crab--which by the way didn't taste or smell like tamarind...
tamarind crab.author: Tina T.
tamarind crab.review:
A friend of ours recommended that we try this restaurant. The place was packed and the wait time was about 30-40 minutes for two. 

I had the roasted crab (which was supposedly the world known crab). Initially I enjoyed it but after finihing half of it, I had the urge to regurgitate..too much butter and too much MSG...I was eating crab topped with butter, MSG and pepper...the crab itself..tasted just like steamed crab if you don't have buttery sauce..

Anyhow my husband ordered the tamarind crab--which by the way didn't taste or smell like tamarind...but instead there were ginger bits in the sauce.

The restaurant claims to have secret Vietnamese ingredients but Vietnamese food usually do not contain butter.

The price was overly expensive and I think I may have been ripped off...the crab was just nearly 2lbs and costs $40 a piece.

They did not even give refills for soft drinks...$2.50 for a small soft drink...In addition, you would think for such an expensive meal you would get complimentary bread or dessert or maybe free refills on sodas, but you don't... 

Their service was good with nice and polite staffs but the food was not worth the price. I wouldn't recommend this restaurant unless
you got lots of money falling from trees to spend.

Oh and did I forget to mention, for a pricey meal, there was no scenery at all...We sat upstairs in a room filled with people and with only 1-2 side windows...You would think that paying such a high priced meal you would get at least a better scenery.

Our total bill was $110 and some change, tips included.

excerpts: we had vegetable soup, soft shell crab, curry shrimp, sautee veggies, roasted crab, tamarind crab, and garlic noodles.
the vegetable soup is basically swansons with diced vegetables.the curry shrimp was spicy but the shrimp was fresh.
i liked the roasted crab better than the tamarind crab.
im not a huge fan of garlic noodles,  they can be dry but oily.
tamarind crab.author: claudia y.
tamarind crab.review:
we came here on a thursday night and all tables were full.  they dont seat you until most of your party is here.  

we had vegetable soup, soft shell crab, curry shrimp, sautee veggies, roasted crab, tamarind crab, and garlic noodles.

overall the food was decent though not exceptional.  the vegetable soup is basically swansons with diced vegetables.the curry shrimp was spicy but the shrimp was fresh.  i liked the roasted crab better than the tamarind crab.  

i think overall im not a huge fan of garlic noodles,  they can be dry but oily.

excerpts: We got the roast crab, the tamarind crab, and garlic noodles, all of which were amazing.
The vegetable of the day was sauteed green beans, also great, and the salt&pepper calamari, which was just okay.
Oh, and lychee vodka!
The only drawback is that the crab was about $42 each...
otherwise I would have gladly eaten another two.
Or four.
Or ten.
tamarind crab.author: Yaa-Lirng T.
tamarind crab.review:
So I had a bad day today. I was all worried about what I was doing with my life and sad about a friend moving away, and I had spent three hours cleaning the bathroom after my toilet had overflowed. Then I went to Thanh Long for dinner with a bunch of friends. The roast crab dish... there are no words. It was one of those rare moments in life where you just realize that every decision you've ever made leading up to this very instant has been correct.

No joke - it was so good that I noticed some meat left in one of the knuckles in the shell bowl and ended up literally picking through the trash for more meat. My friend is terrible at eating crab, so I basically had a handsome second dinner composed entirely of her scraps.

We got the roast crab, the tamarind crab, and garlic noodles, all of which were amazing. The vegetable of the day was sauteed green beans, also great, and the salt&pepper calamari, which was just okay. Oh, and lychee vodka! The only drawback is that the crab was about $42 each... otherwise I would have gladly eaten another two. Or four. Or ten. Seriously, the crab is really freaking good.

We went Sunday evening, and I had no problem street parking. I saw some other reviews about bad parking, so I offer this up as a data point.

excerpts: Then we ordered two each of the Roast Crab, Drunken Crab and Tamarind Crab.
tamarind crab.author: Dannigan P.
tamarind crab.review:
I had a business dinner meeting with my colleagues and wanted to get the "Real " San Francisco experience since everyone flew in from different parts of the U.S. 

This place was recommended from a good college friend and it was the BEST recommendation ever!

The drive made me nervous since we were coming from the Sir Francis Drake and if the food wasn't excellent I would have heard about  this one for quite some time.

We ordered appetizers and all were excellent. Then we ordered two each of the Roast Crab, Drunken Crab and Tamarind Crab. 

OMG! It was a Hit with everyone and I was a hero for a day ; )

Highly reccomended and enjoy a great dining experience.

excerpts: In addition, we ordered 3 crabs - Tamarind Crab, Drunk Crab (with chardonnay), and the Garlic Crab.
tamarind crab.author: S. V.
tamarind crab.review:
I love the Crustacean family of restaurants! I've been to Crustacean Beverly Hills (my fave restaurant), the one in SF, and finally...finally I tried Thanh Long.

This place is oh so good! We had the Crab Puffs. To sum it up best, my friend said, "I just cannot be friends with anyone who doesn't think this crab puff is good." I say touché to that! We feasted on the famous Garlic Noodles (a MUST!) and it was absolutely amazing! In addition, we ordered 3 crabs - Tamarind Crab, Drunk Crab (with chardonnay), and the Garlic Crab. Everything was absolutely delicious. 

The location could be better and I think the staff did their best to regulate the drunken patrons over at the bar, but boy they were obnoxious and loud. They would erraticly shout cuss words at each other and I totally thought they were going to start boxing each other. Doesn't make for the most romantic restaurant but I think the food makes up for it. 

When in SF, Thanh Long is a must have!

excerpts: Once we were finally seated, my friends ordered two roasted garlic crabs, one tamarind crab, a few orders of garlic noodles, and some calamari.
tamarind crab.author: Anne Y.
tamarind crab.review:
I ate hear a few weeks back and totally forgot to write a review...

There is so much hype around this place... a lot of people say it's better than PPQ, so I was all the more excited to see how it competes with the other restaurants that serve roasted crab. Well for starters, the wait was horrible. I went with a group of people on a weekend and we had reservations and we still had to wait among the huge crowd of people to be seated. And I mean, it was packed -- people were elbow to elbow by the bar waiting to be seated.

Once we were finally seated, my friends ordered two roasted garlic crabs, one tamarind crab, a few orders of garlic noodles, and some calamari.

The wait for the food was surprisingly not bad. In fact, they served our food quickly. As far as taste goes, to me it was okay. The flavors were okay, but I've had better. I was a little disappointed because I had high expectations, but it was nothing that made it too much of an upset. It was just average to me.

As soon as we finished dinner we skipped dessert and left. Since parking around this area is terrible, we conveniently had our cars valet parked. Bad idea. The wait to get our car was inconveniently long, especially because it was freezing outside. It seemed like the people working the valet parking were driving each other to and from Thanh Long to a parking garage a few blocks away and retrieving peoples' cars for them. If that was the case, I would have walked to that garage and got the car myself because there was a lot of people ahead of us waiting for their cars.

The food and service was okay, but I doubt I'd come back here.

excerpts: For entree we ordered GARLIC NOODLES and TAMARIND CRAB.

The garlic noodle was very good although it is a little pricey for the portion, and the tamarind crab with an open mind tasted very interesting, although not as a common favorite taste as the roasted crab, it was good and I do recommend it.
The reason this restaurant is missing a star in book is because the parking was hard to find on the streets, and the valet costs $10.
tamarind crab.author: Lulubear L.
tamarind crab.review:
We ordered a DUNGENESS CRAB PUFFS as a starter, it was very delicious dipped in peanut-mustard sauce. 
For entree we ordered GARLIC NOODLES and TAMARIND CRAB. The garlic noodle was very good although it is a little pricey for the portion, and the tamarind crab with an open mind tasted very interesting, although not as a common favorite taste as the roasted crab, it was good and I do recommend it. 
The reason this restaurant is missing a star in book is because the parking was hard to find on the streets, and the valet costs $10.

excerpts: had the roasted crab and tamarind crab with garlic noodles and shaken beef.
$10 garlic noodle is a money maker, oily.
nice pepper on the roasted crab.
the shaken beef is priced very high, but it's quite tasty.
such soft and nicely flavored meat mixed with potatoes and lettuce.
tamarind crab.author: Rob C.
tamarind crab.review:
probably 3.5, esp. when considering value which pushes this place down.  hmm, TL vs. PPQ vs. R&G.  all crabs approx. $35-40.  I vote for PPQ, and overall I prefer R&G type preps over butter/garlic.
the family business story is impressive.
here the crabs seem to be steamed/boiled longer, so the shell is softer?  didn't quite like the meat as much but the sauces were fine.
had the roasted crab and tamarind crab with garlic noodles and shaken beef.  $10 garlic noodle is a money maker, oily.
nice pepper on the roasted crab.
the shaken beef is priced very high, but it's quite tasty.  such soft and nicely flavored meat mixed with potatoes and lettuce.  salt and pepper calamari was too salty.

excerpts: I would highly recommend the Tamarind crab, and garlic noodles.
The garlic noodles are so good.
You might end up ordering 2 orders of them.
They have excellent mixed drinks.
If you are going to eat the crab, be mentally prepared to work hard on the crab, and get a bit messy.
Not a thing to take a date to - wait until you are married a few years and take her then.
Hard to find parking, so just pay the $10 for the valet parking.
Also, highly recommend making a reservation since the place is always packed.
If you like crab, this is your place.
tamarind crab.author: John H.
tamarind crab.review: I would highly recommend the Tamarind crab, and garlic noodles.  The garlic noodles are so good.  You might end up ordering 2 orders of them.  They have excellent mixed drinks.   If you are going to eat the crab, be mentally prepared to work hard on the crab, and get a bit messy.  Not a thing to take a date to - wait until you are married a few years and take her then.   Hard to find parking, so just pay the $10 for the valet parking.  Also, highly recommend making a reservation since the place is always packed.  If you like crab, this is your place.

excerpts: the tamarind crab and garlic noodles were fantastic.
The appetizers were good, but not great.
All in all, I would highly recommend it.
I will be back with out of town visitors.
tamarind crab.author: Daniel D.
tamarind crab.review: I absolutely love this place!!  I have only been here once for dinner and the tamarind crab and garlic noodles were fantastic. The appetizers were good, but not great. All in all, I would highly recommend it. I will be back with out of town visitors.

excerpts: One thing I usually ask with my roasted crab is a side of the tamarind sauce from the tamarind crab, which is so good
but it's just way too messy for me.
tamarind crab.author: Abby N.
tamarind crab.review:
My friends and I have an annual dinner to Thanh Long to celebrate the holidays and the opening of crab season. I CRAVE the roasted crab from Thanh Long.  I CRAVE a side order of the garlic noodles.  Yum!  Let's talk about other things on the menu that I love.  We also get the shaken beef which is delicious and we've had the calamari, which is also very good.

One thing I usually ask with my roasted crab is a side of the tamarind sauce from the tamarind crab, which is so good but it's just way too messy for me.  I drizzle the sauce on the garlic noodles and dip the roasted crab in it as well...oh boy, I'm getting hungry.

BTW, check out the small freight elevator in the kitchen.  I heard that in order to keep the recipe a secret,  they make the roasted crab in a secret kitchen and send the crab up to the restaurant level for the waitstaff to pick up.

excerpts: i was very excited to try thanh long and couldn't decide between the roast or tamarind crab
so i went with the server's suggestion that roast is better.
tamarind crab.author: Diana B.
tamarind crab.review:
i grew up on fresh crab either cooked in chinese/vietnamese restaurants or cooked at home by my dad. i was very excited to try thanh long and couldn't decide between the roast or tamarind crab so i went with the server's suggestion that roast is better. the roast crab was bland. i couldn't detect "an's special sauce" or the fresh crab taste (i think it's a frozen crab) and resorted to dipping the crab meat in the oil-butter mixture. my friend went to crustacean a few days ago and told me that they tried both and the tamarind was a lot better. she also told me that my $35 thanh long crab cost her $50 at crustacean.

i did enjoy the sea bass (the only not heavy tasting dish we ordered but it was small), mussels with asian pesto (although i was expecting a bowl of mussels rather than five) and the garlic rice. the garlic noodles and shaken beef were overcooked.

excerpts:
Recommended dishes:

Tamarind Crab 
Garlic Noodles (several plates
tamarind crab.author: Wally W.
tamarind crab.review:
Just got back from having (Chinese) New Year's dinner here, and the food was excellent. 

Recommended dishes:

Tamarind Crab 
Garlic Noodles (several plates, they come in smaller portions)

excerpts: we got three kinds of crab, my mom liked them all, but especially the tamarind crab.
tamarind crab.author: Peter K.
tamarind crab.review:
brought my mom and my aunt here for mother's day.  i brought my mom here before.  when i suggested it for mother's day her face lit up.

my mom eats like a bird.  except when we come here.  we got three kinds of crab, my mom liked them all, but especially the tamarind crab.  i was smart this time and order one garlic noodle for each person - i was not going to share.

thanh long is still mom recommended.  don't you forget it.

excerpts: We ordered both the drunken and tamarind crab, and garlic...both of which were not up to par.
tamarind crab.author: Kevin C.
tamarind crab.review:
I am re-doing my review of TL given my most current experience.  

The first time I came here was on a weekday.  They were not too busy but parking was atrocious.  Then we came here last Saturday, we found parking around the neighborhood yet they extremely busy.  Good thing we had reservations and before the dinner rush hour.  

We ordered both the drunken and tamarind crab, and garlic...both of which were not up to par.  

Food was much better during the weekday.

excerpts: My favorite one is the tamarind crab.
tamarind crab.author: Melody T.
tamarind crab.review:
My husband and me are seafood lover.  We both love the crabs dishes in Thanh Long.  

You must try out all of their crabs.  My favorite one is the tamarind crab.

Also don't miss the garlic noodle, they make it with their secret ingredient.

excerpts: We had tamarind crab.
The crab itself is pretty fresh but the overall dish is not authentic tamarind crab at all.
We could barely taste the tamarind in the sauce, it mostly had tomato sauce which is quite unexpected.
If you Google "tamarind crab" you will see this is very different than the authentic one.
The sauce is too wet for typical tamarind crab.
A tamarind crab (market price) is for $48 and it's not that huge either.
I think the restaurant is overrated because of its owners' fame and history.
tamarind crab.author: A N.
tamarind crab.review: We had tamarind crab. The crab itself is pretty fresh but the overall dish is not authentic tamarind crab at all. We could barely taste the tamarind in the sauce, it mostly had tomato sauce which is quite unexpected. If you Google "tamarind crab" you will see this is very different than the authentic one. The sauce is too wet for typical tamarind crab. The Asian bouillabaisse is not authentic either, not enough herbs, but has scallion instead, which is a little odd. Authentic dish normally doesn't have green onion. The mango salad was quite unexpected as well. Mango is not shredded but chunky instead, which might not be that big of a deal. However, the fried ice cream dessert had too much batter, very little ice cream while the ice cream is also melted quite a bit. And, it doesn't look very appealing either. It's a sort-of flatten dark looking ball rather than a nice round ball we normally see. It looks like it got overburned. The waitresses wear traditional clothes, which is kind of nice. That is about the only thing that is traditional at this restaurant. If you're looking for authentic Vietnamese food, this is not the place to go. The dishes are quite expensive too. A tamarind crab (market price) is for $48 and it's not that huge either. I think the restaurant is overrated because of its owners' fame and history.

excerpts: I didn't like the tamarind crab at all.
To me it tasted slimy and the flavor was just weird.
tamarind crab.author: Lilly M.
tamarind crab.review:
This was probably the best place we ate at while in San Francisco!

Getting here was a task since we weren't familiar with the public transportation system but thanks to a friendly native, we were pointed in the right direction!

This place was pretty far from our hotel in Union Square but well worth the trek since we had a great meal!

We ordered 2 roasted crab, 1 tamarind, 2 garlic noodles and 2 shaken beef as well as some drinks.
I think the food aside from the shaken beef was premade because our order came literally 5 min after we placed the order!  Oh well!
The roasted crab didn't have a strong garlic flavor but it was good when you dipped the meat in the melted garlic and butter that was left on the plate.  I didn't like the tamarind crab at all.  To me it tasted slimy and the flavor was just weird.  The garlic noodles were really good!  We ordered one to take back to the hotel for a late night snack and they were still good the next day after sitting in the fridge!  
OMG the shaken beef was delish!  They cooked it to perfection and the meat was so tender.  I could go there just to eat this.  

This place is definitely worth a visit if you're in San Francisco.  It's pretty pricey but totally worth it.  I'm just sad we couldn't make it to PPQ to make a comparison!

excerpts: yeah, it's good) and the tamarind crab (holy dill batman).
tamarind crab.author: Nat L.
tamarind crab.review:
This is an uncharacteristically short review for me.

ROASTED CRAB + GARLIC NOODLE = CRAZY DELICIOUS.
You will probably spend $50+ here.  Be forewarned but damn is it tasty.

The one thing I must warn yelpers about is know what you are getting yourself into.  The first time I went, I got a whole crab for myself.  It took me TWO hours to eat and I was in a world of hurt by the end.  By the end of the meal, the crab and noodles were cold and not so appetizing.  A friend of mine won't go back because he was so traumatized by being over stuffed.  The second time I went with my brother and a group of his friends.  There were 7 of us and we ordered 5 crabs and it was just perfect.  One more thing, remember those TWO hours?  The crabs come out incredibly quick so ere on the side of under ordering.  It's really easy to get another crab or two.  I've tried the drunken crab (yeah, it's good) and the tamarind crab (holy dill batman).  I have to say, stick with classic roasted crab.

What else is good there?  I don't know if I will ever find out.  One day hopefully.  I'll have to see what other yelpers recommend.

excerpts: In that time, I've decided that the Tamarind Crab / Garlic Noodles combination is pretty much damn near a perfect night out.
Enjoy.
tamarind crab.author: Chris M.
tamarind crab.review:
Over the years I've probably made the trek out to Thanh Long about 8 times or so... In that time, I've decided that the Tamarind Crab / Garlic Noodles combination is pretty much damn near a perfect night out.
Enjoy.

excerpts: Tamarind Crab and Garlic noodles...
this is soooo freakin' good....
I make this place a special evening for a small group of friends...
It definitely satisfies your crab "fix" for months...
I love it...
nothing like it...
They pour heavy on the drinks....

Did I say to try the Tamarind Crab and Garlic Noodles

Appetizer:

Did I say to try the Tamarind Crab and Garlic Noodles

Appetizer:
tamarind crab.author: Florio M.
tamarind crab.review:
Tamarind Crab and Garlic noodles... this is soooo freakin' good....
I make this place a special evening for a small group of friends...
It definitely satisfies your crab "fix" for months...
I love it... nothing like it...
They pour heavy on the drinks.... I love it

some things to recommend:
Food: Did I say to try the Tamarind Crab and Garlic Noodles

Appetizer: The salt n' peppa calamari

Drinks:  I prefer a Saphire and Tonic, but they offer a special 
Lychee Martini that is a house special blend... Offer one to the ladies... 

Dessert: you can bring your own cake....

enough said...

excerpts: As much as I liked my dish, I have to say the Tamarind Crab that he ordered IS BOMB!
Next time, I'm going to order my own plate of the Tamarind Crab so that I don't have to share...
LOL!
tamarind crab.author: Starleigh H.
tamarind crab.review:
After all the rave reviews about this place, I finally had the chance to try it for myself.  I ordered what most people go there for... the crab and garlic noodles.  

Okay, so this is how it goes down... 

I'm dressed, dolled-up, and feeling pretty fierce. So I was very hesistant to get down and dirty with some crab.  I was there on a date (UGH, I hate that word), and it was just the beginning of the night so I didn't want to have that distinctive crab smell lingering (feel me?)...  With a little bit of convincing I end up ordering the Drunken Crab.

I'm going at it!  Crab meat in my finger nails, shells flying everywhere (one landing in my hair, btw), and juices dipping down my finger tips..  It was a MESS to say the least, but it was well worth it!

So you know me, I'm all about the sauce in dishes, right? At this point, I'm dipping my crab meat in my date's plate (Thanks D, for sharing).. haha!  As much as I liked my dish, I have to say the Tamarind Crab that he ordered IS BOMB! 

I will definitely come here again... Next time, I'm going to order my own plate of the Tamarind Crab so that I don't have to share... LOL!

excerpts: We got the roasted crab (the best!), drunken crab (less flavor than the roasted one), and tamarind crab (sweet sauce).
tamarind crab.author: Joy H.
tamarind crab.review: From the outside, it doesn't look like much of a restaurant . . . it almost looks ghetto, but once you get inside, it's pretty big and elegant looking. They don't seat you until your whole party is present, so make sure everyone is there on time or else they may not hold your spot for long! We decided to do family style dining and share a bunch of dishes . . . however, looking around the restaurant we noticed that everyone had their own crab and it would've ended up being a little cheaper if we had done that. Duly noted! We got the roasted crab (the best!), drunken crab (less flavor than the roasted one), and tamarind crab (sweet sauce). We also go the garlic noodles (very plain but oh so tasty - drenched in garlic), shaken beef (almost more like a beef salad), stuffed calamari (unmemorable), and fried blue crab (standard fare). The crabs were the best, though pricey at $38/crab. The desserts we had included the fried ice cream, fried banana a la mode, chocolate cake, and creme brulee. I'd say to save your money on dessert and get another crab!!

excerpts:
Tamarind Crab~just OK. , not the flavor that was expected from the menu description 
Garlic Noodles~again, just OK.
(I really was anticipating something extraordinary with this dish because these are An's Famous Noodles and because noodles and garlic are two of my top ten favorite things of all time).
Three Desserts:
Fried Banana, Chocolate Torte, and I don't even remember the third one.
tamarind crab.author: J. Julia E.
tamarind crab.review:
If I lived nearby or was in the neighborhood already, I would definitely come back. But we drove a couple of hours to eat here and the food was good, although, not "travelling hours in a car" good. 

There were six of us (one was a child), this is what we ordered and how we felt about: 

Traditional Vietnamese Salad~ fresh, tasty, delicious vinaigrette, yet not overdressed 
Catch in Citrus~everyone enjoyed this dish (except for me; I found it too sweet for my liking) 
Thanh Long Spicy Eggplant~excellent 
Shaken Beef~EXCELLENT (I might take the drive for this dish) 
Roast Crab~We ordered two of these because these were supposed to be the star of the show, and don't get me wrong, they were good. The flavor was delicious but two days later my mom pretty much replicated the dish with lobster instead of crab so why drive the two hours, right ? 
Tamarind Crab~just OK. , not the flavor that was expected from the menu description 
Garlic Noodles~again, just OK. (I really was anticipating something extraordinary with this dish because these are An's Famous Noodles and because noodles and garlic are two of my top ten favorite things of all time). 
Three Desserts: Fried Banana, Chocolate Torte, and I don't even remember the third one. I did not try any of these ( I prefer savory over sweet), but everyone else at the table seem to like them just fine. 

Service was EXCELLENT. (I don't mean to put this in the end as an afterthought because I assure you that it's not.)

excerpts: I wasn't crazy about the Tamarind Crab.
The flavor was just off for me.
Plus it was too sticky.
tamarind crab.author: Karen B.
tamarind crab.review:
This place is a treat for me. The crab just melts in your mouth. I am allergic to shellfish, but I pack a bottle of benedryl and risk a major break out  just to eat here.  My suggestion is: order your own food. If there are 2 of you, order 2 crabs. If there are 4 of you, order 4 garlic noodles. You will not want to share, trust me. 

For the crab, I like the Roast Crab. You will be licking your fingers and slopping up the butter sauce. Just don't think about the pounds and pounds of butter it took to make the sauce it when you do it. It's just heaven...as is the garlic noodles.Garlic noodles seem like a pretty easy concept...but they don't make 'em anywhere else like they make 'em here. Like I said...get your own. I wasn't crazy about the Tamarind Crab. The flavor was just off for me. Plus it was too sticky. I don't like sticky crab. 

We tried the Shaken beef. It was ok. I guess after all the taste explosions with the crab and noodles, the shaken beef wasn't as exciting.  My BF who doesn't eat seafood really liked the beef. 

It's expensive, but if you stick with the great dishes, it is worth every cent.

excerpts: couldn't resist ordering the tamarind crab though because my parents make this at home with pure perfection.
not fair to compare a restaurant dish to a homemade dish, but thanh long would have to pack their knives and go.
tamarind crab.author: Thy N.
tamarind crab.review:
i've heard about these famous garlic noodles for years and finally made my way to thanh long to try them.

o
m
g

forget the colossal royal tiger prawns i ordered to sit atop this dish (though i'm sure they were delicious), the garlic noodles were the star of the show. this is serious garlic, people, they're not messin' around.

roasted crab lived up to the hype as well. couldn't resist ordering the tamarind crab though because my parents make this at home with pure perfection. not fair to compare a restaurant dish to a homemade dish, but thanh long would have to pack their knives and go. their tamarind was just ok.

all in all, totally worthy of the drive to this strange location. and in response to the warnings not to go here on a first date, i'd like to add: do not go here for dinner right before heading to the orpheum theatre to see wicked. oh, and don't arrive just as the lights are dimming to start the show. not only are you the annoying latecomers shuffling past people to get to your seats, you smell filthy disgusting. yeah, sorry bout that...

excerpts: I totally remember the Tamarind Crab and Garlic Noodles
and it's been over FIVE years.
UGH What I would give to go there right now (lol I will probably head over to The Crustacean)...
we had some other stuff too
but I don't remember them as vividly as the tamarind crab and garlic noodles.
You know it's good when you remember it for that long!
but I don't remember them as vividly as the tamarind crab and garlic noodles.
You know it's good when you remember it for that long!
tamarind crab.author: Tina M.
tamarind crab.review: All I have to say is *DRROOOOL* and I wish I still lived in SF. I'm 1/2 Viet and my uncle/aunt brought me here once and it's one of the best Viet restaurants I've been to (next to the now closed Golden Turtle). I totally remember the Tamarind Crab and Garlic Noodles and it's been over FIVE years. UGH What I would give to go there right now (lol I will probably head over to The Crustacean)... we had some other stuff too but I don't remember them as vividly as the tamarind crab and garlic noodles. You know it's good when you remember it for that long!

excerpts: Tamarind Crab disappointed, but the appetizers were great.
The place literally stinks & you leave smelling like stink, but I am very interested in trying other menu items.
