tamarind crab.author: K-Y    j i L L y.
tamarind crab.review:
I've only eaten here once... will definitely come back when craving Roast Crab & Garlic Noodles -  very good.  The waaay too peppery Tamarind Crab disappointed, but the appetizers were great.  The place literally stinks & you leave smelling like stink, but I am very interested in trying other menu items.  I cannot emphasize how good the Garlic Noodles are - a must-have with every meal here from now on although I wish they would serve bigger portions.

The staff is friendly & attentive, the food is a bit overpriced & parking is a biatch (they have valet), but I can see why people love this place.  The Drunken Crab sounds like an interesting dish... will order next time perhaps?

excerpts: Anyway, our party also ordered the tamarind crab, asparagus soup, shrimp toast and either the Saigon beef or the shaken beef, I can't remember.
Those were ok.
I would not order the tamarind crab or the asparagus soup again though.
The beef was super tender and delicious, but it lacks some flavor.
I would not order the tamarind crab or the asparagus soup again though.
The beef was super tender and delicious, but it lacks some flavor.
It doesn't really taste like shaken beef.
I've had the marinade better at other places, but the tenderness here beats them all!!!
I'd definitely come back here and recommend this place to my friends.
It's better than the generic Asian foods in Chinatown!
tamarind crab.author: Truc N.
tamarind crab.review: Came here the other night for dinner and I was pretty impressed.  You wouldn't expect a restaurant like this to be located in this area.  I hope all the local San Franciscans know about this place and how good it is.  I really enjoyed the garlic noodles, salmon carpaccio, and the Lychee Martini!  I could drink like 100 of those!!!  It's sooo good!  Anyway, our party also ordered the tamarind crab, asparagus soup, shrimp toast and either the Saigon beef or the shaken beef, I can't remember.  Those were ok.  I would not order the tamarind crab or the asparagus soup again though.  The beef was super tender and delicious, but it lacks some flavor.  It doesn't really taste like shaken beef.  I've had the marinade better at other places, but the tenderness here beats them all!!!  I'd definitely come back here and recommend this place to my friends.  It's better than the generic Asian foods in Chinatown!

excerpts: The following weekend, I decided to give the tamarind crab a try.
It was worse than their peppercorn crab.
It lacked seasoning.
For what its name, "tamarind", I hardly tasted the tamarind.
I even thought the sauce tasted kind of like sweet and sour sauce from chinese takeout.
The crab flesh really didn't have flavor.
Might
as well I buy cooked dungeness crab from Albertsons and dip it in sweet and sour sauce for less than 10 bucks!
tamarind crab.author: Oribel ..
tamarind crab.review:
We ate at PPQ one day before going to Thanh Long so that we could compare what's people been raving about these two places.
We ordered the peppercorn crab ($35.95) and garlic noodles ($9.50).
Compared to PPQ, in my honest opinion, Thanh Long's peppercorn crab is not as delicious as PPQ's ($34.95).
Thanh Long's garlic noodles ($9.50) taste better than PPQ's ($6.50), although is not worth the price (it is good but not something to die for).
Thanh Long's peppercorn crab is apparently soaked in butter sauce which then congealed on the plate quickly enough as the food cools down that it looks disturbing reminding us of how this will contribute to the heart disease. The crab tastes kind of bland, however, the crab comes in a whole, not cut up. One good thing about the crab is that the flesh does not stick to the shell like PPQ's crab. The crab is overpriced considering that you will get the same result if you just steam crabs at home and make butter sauce with pepper dipping.
PPQ's peppercorn crab is very delicious. I believe the crab is deep fried, then seasoned with sauteed garlic pieces, peppercorn, and spices. However, the crab is cut up, so you won't be able to see the crab in a whole, in case if the crab is missing a leg.
Thanh Long's garlic noodle is delicious however, it does not have any garlic pieces. Instead, they use garlic powder-infused oil. You can just go to Costco buy a big jar of McCormick garlic powder and buy cheap noodle at Ranch 99. $ 9.50 is overpriced.
PPQ's garlic noodle has garlic pieces in it and it's priced at reasonable $6.50.
I will not go back to Thanh Long for their peppercorn crab. I would rather spend the money for PPQ's peppercorn crab for the same amount of money (actually PPQ's is a buck cheaper - and BETTER)

The following weekend, I decided to give the tamarind crab a try. It was worse than their peppercorn crab. It lacked seasoning. For what its name, "tamarind", I hardly tasted the tamarind. I even thought the sauce tasted kind of like sweet and sour sauce from chinese takeout.
The crab flesh really didn't have flavor. Might as well I buy cooked dungeness crab from Albertsons and dip it in sweet and sour sauce for less than 10 bucks!
$5.99/lb crab with oyster sauce from Manila Oriental Market on King Dr. would even do better for the taste and the wallet.

The secret recipe - kept in the vault - Thanh Long claim really does not live up to my expectation.

excerpts: There were a lot of other things on the menu that I didn't get to try such as the Tamarind crab...
I'll definitely be coming back for those items!
tamarind crab.author: A N.
tamarind crab.review: It was my first time here and I've heard good things about their garlic noodles and crab. I have to say that I was not disappointed! We ordered the salt and pepper calamari as an appetizer and it was really good, not too salty and not too spicy. The crab and garlic were really good, very nice flavor, seasoned just right. There were a lot of other things on the menu that I didn't get to try such as the Tamarind crab...I'll definitely be coming back for those items!

excerpts: The Tamarind crab is probably my favorite.
Desert was good also.
tamarind crab.author: Samuel M.
tamarind crab.review:
I approve Thanh Long.
Appetizers are just OK for my fine palate. Crabs are a little messy for my fine dinning experience, but taste damn good. The Tamarind crab is probably my favorite.
Desert was good also.

excerpts: Plan to go back and try the tamarind crab and more mussels.
Will try take out?
tamarind crab.author: Patty J.
tamarind crab.review: I would go with the reviews and suggestions and just order their crabs (both roasted and drunken were great), garlic noodles (which were not greasy this time!) and the fantastic green mussels.  We wanted some veggies but the Buddha rolls came out cold, and the mango salad hot and somewhat lacking, and the Asian Bouillabaisse was just tomato water with some flavor and lukewarm.  Honestly only the mussels came out piping hot as most of the other foods must have  been pr-prepared and just warmed up.  It is crab season so each crab was $37, now is the best time to go!  Plan to go back and try the tamarind crab and more mussels.  Will try take out?

excerpts: We also ordered the tamarind crab and the original roasted crab.
The tamarind crab was definitely the more tasty and interesting one.
The roasted crab had disappointing flavor and was a bit dry.
We also ordered a combination noodle dish which was good.
tamarind crab.author: Mystic C.
tamarind crab.review: I don't get why people rave about this place.  Parking was really difficult.  We circled around for 15 minutes before finding a spot.  Came here with friends on a Tuesday night with an 8pm reservation.  The place was packed and we were seated within 10 minutes.  Had the salt and pepper calamari to start, which to me was the hit of the night.  Don't bother ordering the dumpling appetizer.  Yuck!  We also ordered the tamarind crab and the original roasted crab.  The tamarind crab was definitely the more tasty and interesting one.  The roasted crab had disappointing flavor and was a bit dry.  We also ordered a combination noodle dish which was good.  Passed on the garlic noodles.  Everyone else around us seemed to have it on their tables but we didn't feel that $10 was worth a small plate of noodles with garlic.  Overall we were expecting something really delicious but it sure did fall flat.  Plus, they celebrated 4 birthdays that night in a one hour time span.  Seemed not so special after the 2nd birthday song.  Won't be going back.

excerpts: My three favorites: Roast Crab, Tiger Prawns, and Garlic noodles.
The Tiger Prawns already come with a bed of garlic noodles, so depending on your party size, it's bang for your buck.
If you are a party of 2, I recommend one crab and one tiger prawn entree.
Roast Crab is SO MUCH BETTER than the Drunken Crab.
The Roast Crab was $58 when I went.
garlic noodles.author: Nari C.
garlic noodles.review:
Came here multiple times. LOVE this place!

My three favorites: Roast Crab, Tiger Prawns, and Garlic noodles. The Tiger Prawns already come with a bed of garlic noodles, so depending on your party size, it's bang for your buck. If you are a party of 2, I recommend one crab and one tiger prawn entree. If you are a party of 3, I recommend minimum of two crabs. 

Roast Crab is SO MUCH BETTER than the Drunken Crab. More flavorful and savory. 

The Roast Crab was $58 when I went. 

Enjoy!

excerpts:
* Garlic Noodles - 5/5
Best garlic noodles
I've come across.
Garlic noodles is becoming very "hyped" up and a lot of places are starting to serve them however none are as flavorful and spot on for the garlic as these.
garlic noodles.author: Marissa G.
garlic noodles.review:
I can't ever get over this place, its my absolute favorite. 

I come here often and even more often do I order take out. I absolutely love their fried salt and pepper calamari, it's hands down the best kind I've tried and trust me almost everywhere I go I order calamari. 

Parking is really hard to find, so I suggest paying valet if it hasn't changed it's about $13 and they park it a few blocks over in a lot and usually have it ready for you outside when you come out. 

*Calamari - 5/5 
SO BOMB! I can't say that enough. Its salt & pepper calamari served with onions, green onions and red chopped peppers.

*Roasted Garlic Crab - 5/5
AAAMMMMAAAZIIING. I suggest getting a crab per person, mainly because it's so good and I wouldn't want to share this with anyone. Its so flavorful and the butter sauce is a great sauce to dip the cracked crab in.

* Garlic Noodles - 5/5
Best garlic noodles I've come across. Garlic noodles is becoming very "hyped" up and a lot of places are starting to serve them however none are as flavorful and spot on for the garlic as these. 

*Garlic Toast - 5/5
You can't really go wrong with a side of garlic toast, lets just say I think garlic is my favorite flavor. 

The service is great, they're very on point when it comes to everything and get your food out quick. If I could eat here once a week I would, but for now once every 2 weeks will have to do.... UNLESSSS, I can some how magically find out how to make the calamari and noodles just like them.

excerpts: The roasted crab is unlike anything I've ever eaten before and paired with the garlic noodles, you can't go wrong.
I decided to take my mom here for Mother's Day dinner
and we were both extremely happy with that decision.
I love this place and will definitely be going back next time
I go "home" to SF for a visit
garlic noodles.author: Ayala B.
garlic noodles.review: YUMMMMMMMM! The roasted crab is unlike anything I've ever eaten before and paired with the garlic noodles, you can't go wrong. I decided to take my mom here for Mother's Day dinner and we were both extremely happy with that decision. I love this place and will definitely be going back next time I go "home" to SF for a visit

excerpts: The prawns were just okay, but luckily they came on top of a mount of delicious garlic noodles.
The eggplant was really good.
garlic noodles.author: Leana L.
garlic noodles.review:
Oh myyy. So this is what all the hype is about. I had heard about PPQ from my roommates years ago, but the whole crab debate really started when my parents heard about Thanh Long from some of their friends. We finally made it happen for Father's Day.

Location: There's two locations, one in the Sunset and one in FiDi, but they're slightly different with slightly different menus. We chose the original, even though it's a farther drive. Parking can be a bit difficult, no surprise there. They do have valet parking, though, if you choose.

Ambiance: From the outside, this place looks like nothing special, but just after entering, you can tell that this is a special occasions kind of place. There's white table cloths, the wait staff is nicely dressed, and the host at the front is very nice and polite, ensuring that we were promptly seated. They do have a very strict policy regarding honoring reservation times, but I appreciate it. It keeps things orderly and outlines the rules very clearly.

Service: Top notch. Obviously it's not some Michelin star restaurant where the waitstaff is over the top, but everyone was very pleasant. Our water glasses were never empty, our plates were cleared promptly, and they made sure we had everything we needed. I believe they automatically included tip regardless of your party size, so while some people can be turned off by that, I think it's refreshing. The staff is obviously well compensated for their services and are treated with respect -- and it shows.

Food: We ordered An's Famous Roast Crab, Thanh Long Spicy Eggplant, and Charbroiled Colossal Royal Tiger Prawns. The prawns were just okay, but luckily they came on top of a mount of delicious garlic noodles. The eggplant was really good. However, the star of the show was the roast crab. I don't know how they season it, but every little bit, including the shell was delicious! I definitely admit to sucking on the empty crab shell bits at the end because it was so good!

Price: Definitely not cheap, but also worth it for a special occasion.

Would I return? If a celebration were in order, I wouldn't say no!

excerpts: Also got garlic noodles (yum) and sautéed vegetables to lessen the guilt.
garlic noodles.author: Edie S.
garlic noodles.review:
Always, always good. We love this place so much, its synonymous for San Francisco to us. Made this reservation a month in advance, on the yelp app. Yay! Excited 30 days in advance.

All we know is we're getting the special secret roasted crab, but we never know how many. This time we got only 2 but I think we could've eaten three. Also got garlic noodles (yum) and sautéed vegetables to lessen the guilt. Great service, kept our waters refilled, and refilled our hot teapot too.

Found street parking around the corner about a block and a half away, and after all that butter, we could use the walk in the brisk, cold air! They also have valet parking next to the restaurant, if you wish.

We just left here a few hours ago, and I want to go back! Addicted!

excerpts: We ordered the roast crab, Garlic noodles and the sea bass.
The garlic noodles wasnt too garlicy this time.
The sea bass was definitely overpriced for $30.
garlic noodles.author: Donna L.
garlic noodles.review:
Took my girlfriend out for her birthday. This place never disappoints. I had the pear martini - so delicious!  Too bad the martini glass is so small. We ordered the roast crab, Garlic noodles and the sea bass. 

The crab was so delicious and fresh. All the meat
Around the body part and leg was fresh and very succulent. For $57 per crab it was pricey but worth it. The garlic noodles wasnt too garlicy this time. The sea bass was definitely overpriced for $30. It was a very small piece of fish but it was cooked perfectly. 

The meal and one martini cost $120+ for two. I'm glad it was a special occasions as I couldn't afford it otherwise.

excerpts: I often taste garlic noodles that are super oily and bland
but this was definitely not it.
It tasted very flavorful and I ate every bit of it.
Good size for 2 adults.
I'm glad we shared it and didnt get separate plates.
- my favorite - dessert!
We ordered the chocolate lava cake
and I'm so glad we did.
The brownie is baked to perfection: crispy on the ends and soft and crumbly in the inside topped with vanilla ice cream and whipped cream.
garlic noodles.author: Angel N.
garlic noodles.review:
Parking is so hard to find in this area and I also dont trust any valet. Luckily, on our 4th loop around Judah, we found a parking spot right in front of the corner store across from 711.

Wait took about 15 minutes when they said could be about 30. Theyve got chairs and a couch for you to sit and wait.

Now, the food... every single plate was delicious. This is coming from a vegan who sometimes cheats and eats seafood and dairy. We ordered the
- dungeness crab puffs for starters. Absolutely delicious. Really hot in temperate so be careful! The cheese and sweet & sour dippig sauces were phenomenal. Just the right amount of puffs (4) so we dont get too full, as well as a good amount of stuffing inside the soft shelled puffs.
- garlic noodle with prawns on top. Delicious and nicely seasoned prawns. No fishy taste. Garlic noodle has butter and "secret spices" that were great! I often taste garlic noodles that are super oily and bland but this was definitely not it. It tasted very flavorful and I ate every bit of it. Good size for 2 adults. I'm glad we shared it and didnt get separate plates.
- my favorite - dessert! We ordered the chocolate lava cake and I'm so glad we did. The brownie is baked to perfection: crispy on the ends and soft and crumbly in the inside topped with vanilla ice cream and whipped cream. I seriously took this plate from my bf and ate the whole thing myself lol

Bill came out to $88 before tip. We ordered a garlic noodle togo and it retained a great taste even when eating it the day after. Bf also ordered 2 lemonades.

Service was ok, nothing spectacular but we werent frustrated having to flag down the waitress.

Bathrooms are tucked in the back. Poor men - yall only have 1 stall and a line can form pretty quick. Us ladies have an actual bathroom with 3 stalls, one big mirror and one sink. Pretty clean.

Despite the parking being an issue and living far, I would give this place a 5 star!

excerpts: Their signature garlic noodles was not their best to put it nicely.
The food was almost bland, their Wok noodles were the tastiest part of the meal even though the chicken was alarmingly dry.
The other chicken dish we had was good until the sauce fully absorbed into the chicken.
The sauce made the chicken obtain a rather spicy taste, for a member of our party.
The waiters and bussers were very professional and courteous, nicer than our waitress by far.
I wish I could write a better review, but I feel this is a training opportunity.
The best thing about their food... desert, they have a lava cake with vanilla bean ice cream, absolutely gorgeous!
Probably the most interesting thing, was how our waitress attempted to sass us as we asked about the surcharge.
We asked about their surcharge as we are visiting and have not experienced this in any place of business we have been to.
She started stating "oh you've been charged this at many establishments before, there is a bill that was past a very long time ago.
When we asked for more information "oh just google it..." as she walked away.
Really?
So this establishment does charge a surcharge if you use your credit card.
Raising the bill by $5.41.
I don't think I will return nor will suggest this place to my friends until Thanh Long steps it up.
garlic noodles.author: Puna C.
garlic noodles.review: I came here around a year ago and had an incredible meal.  Needless to say this year, not so much!  The waitress seemed to have an attitude, or a problem with us as she was very curt.  It wasn't appreciated.  She answered our questions and left very promptly making us as the customer feel like "wow we're sorry for even asking questions". Their signature garlic noodles was not their best to put it nicely.  The food was almost bland, their Wok noodles were the tastiest part of the meal even though the chicken was alarmingly dry.  The other chicken dish we had was good until the sauce fully absorbed into the chicken.  The sauce made the chicken obtain a rather spicy taste, for a member of our party. The waiters and bussers were very professional and courteous, nicer than our waitress by far.  I wish I could write a better review, but I feel this is a training opportunity.  The best thing about their food... desert, they have a lava cake with vanilla bean ice cream, absolutely gorgeous!  Probably the most interesting thing, was how our waitress attempted to sass us as we asked about the surcharge. We asked about their surcharge as we are visiting and have not experienced this in any place of business we have been to.  She started stating "oh you've been charged this at many establishments before, there is a bill that was past a very long time ago."  When we asked for more information "oh just google it..." as she walked away.  Really?  So this establishment does charge a surcharge if you use your credit card.  Raising the bill by $5.41. I don't think I will return nor will suggest this place to my friends until Thanh Long steps it up.

excerpts: Get the garlic noodles and the garlic rice, mix those two together and prepare for the incredible flavor.
The rice tames the sweetness of the noodles.
So good!
Skip:
Hella expensive veggie side dish.
How can vegetables we the same price as your signature garlic noodles.
garlic noodles.author: Elena C.
garlic noodles.review:
I could write a lengthy review about it their crab just like everyone else. But instead I'd rather talk about their other their other dishes:
- Go-to Appetizer: Seafood dumplings. The beautiful shrimp and whitefish dumplings are served with a yummy tamarind-ginger sauce. I could just slurp that whole thing up.
- Best side: Get the garlic noodles and the garlic rice, mix those two together and prepare for the incredible flavor. The rice tames the sweetness of the noodles. So good!
- Skip: Hella expensive veggie side dish. How can vegetables we the same price as your signature garlic noodles. That's cray!

Now that you the t, get that get that roasted crab and make sure to drink plenty of water with it.

excerpts: My sister did all the ordering; Drunken Crab/Tamarind Crab/Roasted Crab/Garlic Noodles/Salt & Pepper Calamari/Lemongrass Beef Skewers/Spicy Eggplant/Mango Salad/Shrimp Fried Rice/Steamed Seabass.
Garlic noodles were overcooked/soggy and didn't have enough garlic flavor.
All the portions were pretty small.
The crabs tasted average; nothing special.
PPQ
Dungeness is better in my opinion.
Glad
I got to finally try Thanh Long but not impressed with the food.
garlic noodles.author: Karen L.
garlic noodles.review:
Located on a corner. Looks sorta like a house from the outside. Parking was hard to find. Valet option $13. Came here for my sister's 26th birthday since we heard a lot of great things about this place. We had a party of 7; did a same day reservation. Anyway, arrived 15m early and hung out at the bar in front for a bit. Thanks bartender for the great tasting Virgin Mango Daiquiri!

We were taken upstairs to be seated. My sister did all the ordering; Drunken Crab/Tamarind Crab/Roasted Crab/Garlic Noodles/Salt & Pepper Calamari/Lemongrass Beef Skewers/Spicy Eggplant/Mango Salad/Shrimp Fried Rice/Steamed Seabass. 

All of the food was "okay." Garlic noodles were overcooked/soggy and didn't have enough garlic flavor. All the portions were pretty small. The crabs tasted average; nothing special. PPQ Dungeness is better in my opinion. Glad I got to finally try Thanh Long but not impressed with the food.

excerpts: so we got the sea bass, eggplant, seafood wontons, garlic noodles and seafood rice.
Everything was great but the seafood wontons.
They were overly rubbery and the inside was tough.
The rice was dry too but everything else I'd definitely go back for, especially the eggplant.
garlic noodles.author: Hayley G.
garlic noodles.review:
Great food, awful service. 

We had a reservation and were there on time but sat about 15 min late. Then is when it got real bad. Someone sat water down but didn't say anything and then no one else came around for another 20 min. I am not exaggerating, I timed it. Then our server finally came over to take our address and decided not to use a note pad, when he repeated what we ordered he messed up twice so I was like "uh do you wanna go get a pad?" He was annoyed by this and said no he had it....... our order came and OF COURSE it was wrong. He acted like it was the kitchens fault... who knows. 

But anyway the food was great. Basically everyone gets the crab but we didn't want to spend $54 on it so we got the sea bass, eggplant, seafood wontons, garlic noodles and seafood rice. Everything was great but the seafood wontons. They were overly rubbery and the inside was tough. The rice was dry too but everything else I'd definitely go back for, especially the eggplant.

excerpts:
We ordered:
- The famous roast crab - very large, $57 each (seasonal price at the end of July), shared between 2 people and it was definitely enough
- Garlic noodles - don't know how they infuse so much garlicky goodness in!
- Calamari - a bit too chewy, verging on the side of rubbery; skippable
- Soft-shelled crab - pretty standard; small portion that only came with 1 crab; skippable
- Seasonal vegetable (green beans with mushrooms and tomatoes) - delicious

Overall, a very positive experience though I would skip the appetizers if I came again.
garlic noodles.author: Mary F.
garlic noodles.review:
Came here right as they opened at 5PM and service is very speedy.

We ordered:
- The famous roast crab - very large, $57 each (seasonal price at the end of July), shared between 2 people and it was definitely enough
- Garlic noodles - don't know how they infuse so much garlicky goodness in!
- Calamari - a bit too chewy, verging on the side of rubbery; skippable
- Soft-shelled crab - pretty standard; small portion that only came with 1 crab; skippable
- Seasonal vegetable (green beans with mushrooms and tomatoes) - delicious

Overall, a very positive experience though I would skip the appetizers if I came again.

excerpts: The fish with garlic noodles were good but nothing to say 'wow' about.
The fried ice cream was disappointing, too much dough.
garlic noodles.author: Magda C.
garlic noodles.review:
We went on a Sunday at 5pm at it was already half occupied. Nice cozy restaurant, upscale from your regular Asian place.
As for the food I would say a good 3.5 stars: seafood dumplings appetizer were tasty but too little filling.
The fish with garlic noodles were good but nothing to say 'wow' about. The fried ice cream was disappointing, too much dough.

excerpts: garlic noodles-good for two if you order a beer.
A crab is around $55, the prawn noodles around $38.
The prawn are filet with pepper on a bed of butter garlic noodles.
How could you go wrong?
Didn't eat dessert, but had 2 beers.
For three people order a second crab.
FYI be aware there is NO parking, so bus/Uber/lift is a must.
Also it's pretty close to the ocean so bring a jacket for later...
garlic noodles.author: David A.
garlic noodles.review: So this is a restaurant that focuses on two main things...crab and noodles. Super simple, order a roast crab and order prawn garlic noodles-good for two if you order a beer. A crab is around $55, the prawn noodles around $38. Not the cheapest but SO good.the roast crab is soaked in garlic butter and pepper. The prawn are filet with pepper on a bed of butter garlic noodles. How could you go wrong? Didn't eat dessert, but had 2 beers. For three people order a second crab. FYI be aware there is NO parking, so bus/Uber/lift is a must. Also it's pretty close to the ocean so bring a jacket for later...

excerpts: Their garlic noodles are also very delicious.
We also got the steak salad, and mixed veggies.
Service was excellent.
I was expecting and wetnaps
but we were handed a hot towel at the end of the meal.
Unexpected and much appreciated.
Will definitely comeback when I come to San Francisco.
garlic noodles.author: Mia A.
garlic noodles.review: I wish we could've eaten here a couple more times!!! This place is awesome! We're staying in San Francisco for the weekend and our friends recommended this place so off we go. We ordered their roasted crab and garlic crab with white wine. Each crab cost $57 I thought it's kind of expensive but once I tasted it, I felt that it's worth every penny!!! So delicious. The roasted crab in particular was very good and addicting. I could've eaten the whole thing myself! Their garlic noodles are also very delicious. We also got the steak salad, and mixed veggies. Service was excellent. I was expecting and wetnaps but we were handed a hot towel at the end of the meal. Unexpected and much appreciated. Will definitely comeback when I come to San Francisco.

excerpts: Order the Roast Crab, Garlic Noodles, Shaken beef and Mussels!
We love the Roast Crab so much we order one whole Crab per person!
garlic noodles.author: Benjamin S.
garlic noodles.review:
Our favorite Crab restaurant in San Francisco! Order the Roast Crab, Garlic Noodles, Shaken beef and Mussels!

We love the Roast Crab so much we order one whole Crab per person!

excerpts: We ordered a whole crab and garlic noodles with prawns.
The crab was just EH!
but the garlic noodles with prawns.....
WOW and YUMMMMMM!!!!
The boyfriend and I ended up ordering another plate.
Nothing will ever compare.
We will definitely make this our "go to" when in town.
garlic noodles.author: Leah A.
garlic noodles.review: My family recommended this place so my boyfriend and I decided to make this our first place to eat when visiting San Francisco. We had reservations but it didn't seem busy when we walked in. We ordered a whole crab and garlic noodles with prawns. The crab was just EH! but the garlic noodles with prawns..... WOW and YUMMMMMM!!!! The boyfriend and I ended up ordering another plate. Nothing will ever compare. We will definitely make this our "go to" when in town.

excerpts: We ordered the roasted garlic grab, calamari, and garlic noodles.
All three items were 5/5.
The garlic noodles also stood out to me because they're not heavy like other garlic noodles from restaurants.
garlic noodles.author: Joyce W.
garlic noodles.review:
We went with a party of 13 to celebrate a friend's birthday. They provided great service and accommodated us perfectly. 

The food was delicious! We ordered the roasted garlic grab, calamari, and garlic noodles. All three items were 5/5. The garlic noodles also stood out to me because they're not heavy like other garlic noodles from restaurants.

I would definitely come back here for another special occasion!

*I also highly suggest making reservations in advance if you don't want to wait during prime hours.

excerpts: Don't forget to get an order of garlic noodles.
They are the best noodles I have ever had, I tell everyone to get the noodles and crab.
My boyfriend and I also had the mussels which were out of this world.
We ate them so fast I couldn't even take a picture haha
The place is a bit pricey, but for the amount of food and flavor, it's totally worth it!
Keep up the great work Thanh Long!!!!
garlic noodles.author: Erynne M.
garlic noodles.review: Thanh Long!!!! The best crab in the city!! The crab is so fresh, full of yummy garlic and butter flavor. Don't forget to get an order of garlic noodles. They are the best noodles I have ever had, I tell everyone to get the noodles and crab. My boyfriend and I also had the mussels which were out of this world. We ate them so fast I couldn't even take a picture haha The place is a bit pricey, but for the amount of food and flavor, it's totally worth it! Keep up the great work Thanh Long!!!!

excerpts: Best garlic crab and garlic noodles ever!
Never a disappoint!!!
Service was wonderful and was on top of getting rid of the bowl with shells.
Appreciated the hot wet towels at the end to clean our hands.
garlic noodles.author: Instafamishe D.
garlic noodles.review:
Delicious! The roasted crab and garlic noodle was to die for. One crab is perfect to split with two people. Both are rich in creamy goodness. Best garlic crab and garlic noodles ever! Never a disappoint!!! 
Service was wonderful and was on top of getting rid of the bowl with shells. Appreciated the hot wet towels at the end to clean our hands.

excerpts: This time i rocked with the crab and garlic noodles and i enjoyed every minute!!.
garlic noodles.author: Eric C.
garlic noodles.review: Anniversary dinner and it didnt disappoint. My first time here i made the mistake of not getti g the crab. Not this time!! This time i rocked with the crab and garlic noodles and i enjoyed every minute!!.

excerpts: I prefer garlic noodles with lobster.
There are so many places in LA where you can get garlic butter noodles with lobster for half the price, double the quantity and even more delicious.
Yes, we're not in LA but even Perilla and Cajun House's prices are more reasonable, portions are justified and quality of food is even better.
I wouldn't come back.
garlic noodles.author: Leslie T.
garlic noodles.review:
I had heard good things about Thanh Long but was disappointed in how expensive everything was, how small the portions were and how rude the customer service was. Upon entering, I had 3 out of a party of 5 and there is a strict rule saying that parties that are more than 10 minutes late  will automatically be put on the waitlist. That's normal - totally OK with that - but there were so many open tables and so many people in the waiting area, it made me think "are all these people waiting really just partial parties?" The waiting area is super small; we were all shoulder to shoulder with each other and bumping elbows. The other 2 in our party came within the 10 minutes (we made a reservation via Yelp! but didn't get any Cash Back rewards for it like I was expecting..) and we ordered the salt and pepper calamari, mango salad, and Vietnamese salad (both salads had very little vegetables and just a lot of fluff / fruit) as appetizers. For entrees, we got colossal tiger prawns (yes they were big but only enough for 1 prawn per person o.o), Roast Crab, Thanh Long Fish and Spicy Eggplant. Portions were PUNY and off-putting... furthermore, our waiter got a little sassy with us and when I reminded him we had a birthday, he snapped back and said "Yeah, you tell your waiter which is ME and you already told me". Sheesh - didn't seem like you got it the first time so sorry for double checking... 

I prefer garlic noodles with lobster. There are so many places in LA where you can get garlic butter noodles with lobster for half the price, double the quantity and even more delicious. Yes, we're not in LA but even Perilla and Cajun House's prices are more reasonable, portions are justified and quality of food is even better. I wouldn't come back.

excerpts: The garlic noodles are another big hit, soft and garlic pungent.
Tiger prawns are butterflied and delightfully seasoned with spices.
My pork and shrimp dish was elegant and hearty.
It paired with green onions and spinach in a soy broth.
The Fried calamari was lightly battered and tender.
garlic noodles.author: Maea B.
garlic noodles.review:
First Time....but definitely NOT the last time! A simple yet complex menu with Vietnamese inspired dishes ranging from seafood, beef, chicken and pork. The main event is their roasted crabs. One giant gorgeous crustacean carefully prepared for you and brought out in a plate and served with a bib. It's a truly a beautiful sight! The garlic noodles are another big hit, soft and garlic pungent. Tiger prawns are butterflied and delightfully seasoned with spices. My pork and shrimp dish was elegant and hearty. It paired with green onions and spinach in a soy broth. The Fried calamari was lightly battered and tender. 
Next time I need to try the shaking beef and the salmon carpaccio. Save room for dessert if you can...the creme brûlée was a nice last touch on an amazing dinner! Don't forget to reserve a table through the trusty Yelp Ap! They also have valet parking.

excerpts: I come for the garlic noodles and that's it.
garlic noodles.author: Theresa D.
garlic noodles.review: Parking sucks here. If you're allergic to seafood like I am, then you may wonder why you should go. This is for all the other folks that get dragged here with their friends that can eat the tasty crab. I come for the garlic noodles and that's it.

excerpts: The Roasted Crab and Garlic Noodles never fail to impress.
My family were able to come for the first time since I've been talking about Thanh Long for many years now.
The crab has so much pepper, that at first glance, it looks to be too much.
But it's perfectly seasoned.
And the Garlic Noodles has just the right combination of garlic and sauce making it a perfect accompaniment to the Crab.
garlic noodles.author: Sandi L.
garlic noodles.review:
Fried Calamari

I still want to give them 5 Stars. The Roasted Crab and Garlic Noodles never fail to impress. My family were able to come for the first time since I've been talking about Thanh Long for many years now. The crab has so much pepper, that at first glance, it looks to be too much. But it's perfectly seasoned. And the Garlic Noodles has just the right combination of garlic and sauce making it a perfect accompaniment to the Crab.

My only complaint is that although I've had the Fried Calamari many times previously, it was no where near the same level. First of all the Salt and Pepper was well balanced. 

The key to great Fried Calamari is the balance of the squid surrounded by a light crispy crust. This squid was so thinly cut that there was little to no tasting of the squid. The moisture of the larger amount of sauted green beans, chopped red bell peppers and onions mixed with the Calamari rendered it a bit soggy. There were only about 8, maybe 9 pieces of Calamari on the dish with about a full cup of the veggies.

Too many restaurants are adding superfluous ingredients that don't really add anything, but only make it look like a generous serving.

Sadly, Thanh Long used this technique to bulk up our serving of the Calamari. They did however, give us a second plate with the same result.

P.S. The service has always been excellent and remains top notch!

excerpts: Expensive Vietnamese restaurant known for roast crab & garlic noodles!
You can't miss out on those here.
Roast Crab - A whole Dungeness crab roasted with An's garlic sauce & secret spices.
Garlic Noodles
- An's famous noodles made with our special garlic sauce & secret spices.
garlic noodles.author: Chelsea W.
garlic noodles.review:
Expensive Vietnamese restaurant known for roast crab & garlic noodles! You can't miss out on those here. This is not your typical place to get pho, in fact they don't have it!

Thanh Long is more of a seafood restaurant offering large dishes you can share family style. Most of the options run around $20, and the crabs will be around $50 each. Portions are on the smaller side. We shared 2 crabs, one serving of noodles, 3 large plates and a dessert between 4 people.

The restaurant is quite spacious and our waiter was very friendly. She helped clear our plates out since we practically overflowered our table! When I ordered I made sure to get all the popular dishes.

STARTERS 

Salt & Pepper Calamari - In a light salt and pepper batter, seasoned with scallions and red peppers. These were a great pick!

SOUPS

Vermicelli Noodle Consomme - Chicken, green onions, cilantro. The soup was clean tasting and good, the chicken was tender but I would've liked the noodles to have been the more traditional pho noodles rather than clear ones.

LARGE PLATES

Shaken Beef - Tender cubes of marinated New York steak flambeed in Chardonnay served with potatoes, mixed greens & cherry tomatoes. I'm not a beef person but this seemed good as well. Ours didn't come with potatoes though, but with onions.

Lemongrass Chicken - Slices of chicken sauteed with seasonal vegetables, garlic & chili. Pretty impressed by this one! Would order again for sure.

SECRET KITCHEN DISHES 

Roast Crab - A whole Dungeness crab roasted with An's garlic sauce & secret spices.

Garlic Noodles - An's famous noodles made with our special garlic sauce & secret spices. Super flavorful and very memorable. 

DESSERT 

Fried banana a la mode - With vanilla ice cream. For $8, the portions for the fried banana was tiny! The vanilla ice cream was way too frozen when served to us. There also was way too much whipped cream.

For the price point I would expect Thanh Long to be a more classy and upscale looking restaurant. It was great overall, but a bit on the pricier side for me. I would probably come on more special occasions.

excerpts: We ordered the tamarind crab, Traditional Vietnamese Salad, garlic noodles, shaken beef.
The Traditional Vietnamese Salad was not authentic and consisted mostly of very thinly sliced cabbage drenched in a too sweet dressing.
The Vietnamese Salad or "Goi" should have more herbs.
The famous garlic noodles was not all that.
Saturate your noodles in butter and garlic powder and you will have the same thing at home.
The shaken beef was not tender and lack of sauce of a traditional "Bò lúc lc

"
And finally, the pièce de résistance, tamarind crab was a greasy mess served on a puddle of clarified butter.
I was not able to taste the tamarind.
Here again, I have had better versions at other restaurants without a "Secret Kitchen"
This was an overpriced and poorly executed Vietnamese food and it shows that hype and marketing of the "Secret Kitchen Dishes" can fool a lot of people, at least once.
garlic noodles.author: OngTayDen N.
garlic noodles.review:
For years I have read about the positive press about this place. We ordered the tamarind crab, Traditional Vietnamese Salad, garlic noodles, shaken beef.  The short review is everything was mediocre and any regular Vietnamese restaurant can do the dishes better. 

The Traditional Vietnamese Salad was not authentic and consisted mostly of very thinly sliced cabbage drenched in a too sweet dressing.  The Vietnamese Salad or "Goi" should have more herbs.
The famous garlic noodles was not all that.  Saturate your noodles in butter and garlic powder and you will have the same thing at home.
The shaken beef was not tender and lack of sauce of a traditional "Bò lúc lc"
And finally, the pièce de résistance, tamarind crab was a greasy mess served on a puddle of clarified butter. I was not able to taste the tamarind. Here again, I have had better versions at other restaurants without a "Secret Kitchen"
This was an overpriced and poorly executed Vietnamese food and it shows that hype and marketing of the "Secret Kitchen Dishes" can fool a lot of people, at least once.

excerpts: I have heard of how good the crab was and therefore I had to order the garlic whole crab and the garlic noodles.
Well it was very good
I must say.
Crab was sweet and flavorful.
The garlic noodle was also tasty, garlicky but not too overpowering.
garlic noodles.author: Mel H.
garlic noodles.review: I have been wanting to try this restaurant since visiting San Francisco. I have heard of how good the crab was and therefore I had to order the garlic whole crab and the garlic noodles. Well it was very good I must say. Crab was sweet and flavorful. The garlic noodle was also tasty, garlicky but not too overpowering. We also ordered the combination fried rice, which was just okay. The star of the show was the crab. As far as customer service- for the most part they were very attentive. They also gave us warm wet towels at the end. The only thing was my partner did not get his coffee until almost end of our meal. We were the first ones to arrive there but I guess they were still brewing coffee. I asked for a straw but didn't get it at all but I didn't push it since they were super busy. Overall, I came there for the crab and it was delicious so no complaint there. Pricey crab though. Our total bill was way over $100 but it is fine since we are on vacation ! To top it off we tried their fried bananas with vanilla ice cream. Also yummy.

excerpts: We ordered the Roast Crab, Garlic Noodles, and the veggies!
They were all awesome!
We really enjoyed the crab and it's seasoning.
The noodles mixed with the veggies and it's sauce is a magical combination!
I wish we would've ordered another crab or something because I was still hungry.
My wife was stuffed.
garlic noodles.author: Michael T.
garlic noodles.review:
Absolutely wonderful experience! The service was amazingly quick! We had reservations at 5:15pm and arrived at 5:11pm and were immediately seated. (I suggest making reservations). 
We ordered the Roast Crab, Garlic Noodles, and the veggies! They were all awesome! We really enjoyed the crab and it's seasoning. The noodles mixed with the veggies and it's sauce is a magical combination!
I wish we would've ordered another crab or something because I was still hungry. My wife was stuffed.

excerpts: Garlic Noodles
- It tastes exactly how it sounds.
Every bite has a big garlic flavor with a touch of sweetness.
Just the walk to your table you'll notice everyone has an order of the Roast Crab and Garlic Noodles.
garlic noodles.author: Julian L.
garlic noodles.review:
Wait - Reservation

Value - ±$50 / Crab.

Dish Size: Medium

Roast Crab - Simple and straight forward. A huge grab roasted with copious amounts of butter and seasoned with salt and pepper. The meat is tender and the crab shell cracks open easily.

Garlic Noodles - It tastes exactly how it sounds. Every bite has a big garlic flavor with a touch of sweetness. My best guess is the sweetness comes from also cooking the noodles in crab juices.


You already know you're in for a delicious meal right when you open the door. An olfactory wave of butter, garlic, and seafood will flood your senses. Just the walk to your table you'll notice everyone has an order of the Roast Crab and Garlic Noodles. Thang Long keeps it simple, the dishes are straightforward and orient around shellfish. 

Thanh Long is one of those Asian restaurants that's been around the block a few times. It has a presence that feels like it stuck to it's guns and succeeded in becoming a permanent fixture in the Sunset neighborhood. There is an old school but upscale charm with Thanh Long which reminds of what people refer to as the "Golden Age" of dining. Much of the ornamentation is Vietnamese inspired, from the Lotus petal pendant lights, to the large dragon mural hanging from the wall, and who can forget the stereotypical dark red furniture. Overall, the antiquated atmosphere of Thanh Long compliments the cuisine well. 

Even though Thanh Long is a Vietnamese restaurant, the dishes we ordered did not have that signature Vietnamese flavor. Instead, the dishes are simple, straight forward, and served fast. For example, the Roast Crab is literally roasted crab with butter, salt, and pepper. In my opinion, creating a simple good tasting dish is much more difficult as their is more room for error and judgment. What Thanh Long does well is make these seemingly simple dishes taste amazing. 

Thanh Long is a bit on the pricey side as you'll probably need to order one Roast Crab per person. The food tastes great but I feel this restaurant is meant for a special or celebratory occasion.

excerpts: There garlic noodles are amazing.
garlic noodles.author: K G.
garlic noodles.review:
Really good.  Second favorite to RG lounge, the best Chinese food in SF in my opinion.  There garlic noodles are amazing.  A unique and delicious specialty. 

We also loved the garlic crab.  Well cooked, seasoned and finger licking good. 

A surprise hit was the seasonal vegetables - possibly the best thing on the table, which is saying a lot.

excerpts: They were craving for their garlic noodles.
I'm usually not a huge seafood fan, so my excitement wasn't as crazy.
We made reservations for 7 and it was so jammed packed when i arrived.
Instead we went for the tiger prawns with garlic noodles, grilled calamari, and garlic rice.
We love garlic!
The calamari was very tender
and it was actually pretty good.
The tiger prawns were juicy and so garlicy!
I can see why everyone loves the garlic noodles.
It was delicious!
garlic noodles.author: Belinda C.
garlic noodles.review:
I had friends that used to live in SF during college and moved back to Asia.  After a few years, they decided to visit and the FIRST thing they wanted to eat was at Thanh Long.  They were craving for their garlic noodles.  I'm usually not a huge seafood fan, so my excitement wasn't as crazy.  We made reservations for 7 and it was so jammed packed when i arrived.  I highly recommend making a reservation.  

For the course , we didn't get the crab.  Yes, can you believe we were the only table that didn't get crab.  Instead we went for the tiger prawns with garlic noodles, grilled calamari, and garlic rice.  We love garlic! The calamari was very tender and it was actually pretty good.   The tiger prawns were juicy and so garlicy! I can see why everyone loves the garlic noodles.  It was delicious! The garlic rice was ok, maybe because everything else had so much flavor and garlic, the rice wasn't as strong.  I enjoyed my visit here and now i'm a fan!

excerpts: I was advised to order the roasted crab with garlic noodles, which is the talk of the town in the bay area.
The other order consisted of garlic noodles and the prawns as seen in the picture attached.
garlic noodles.author: Matt B.
garlic noodles.review:
Was referred to this location by a trusted Yelper. Made a reservation and arrived 15 minutes early. They were able to seat us immediately, no questions asked.

After being seated our drinks and appetizers were placed with an Oriental lady whose name started with the letter E. The only reason I remember this is based off the receipt that I threw away after the dinner. We noticed that she was very attentive to every table except ours. The bus boys did an awesome job and helped us out more than the server did. They would refill our waters when they were around the table cleaning up our appetizers or bowls that were full of crab shells. The server filled our water maybe once and had to be asked for in order to get additional drinks.

I was advised to order the roasted crab with garlic noodles, which is the talk of the town in the bay area. The other order consisted of garlic noodles and the prawns as seen in the picture attached. The food was amazing and would give it another chance based solely on that alone.

Had it not been for the poor service, they would have actually received a tip and this place would receive a better review. Prices are what they are. Market price for Dungeness crab runs about $60 here. So look to spend around $150 for two people with an appetizer, without any alcoholic beverages.

excerpts: Those garlic noodles are awesome!
It's 4:52AM in Cincinnati
and I should not be craving garlic noodles from San Francisco .
The Red Snapper was good
but....those garlic noodles....please try this place if you're around.
garlic noodles.author: Nate B.
garlic noodles.review: OMG!!!! Those garlic noodles are awesome! It's 4:52AM in Cincinnati and I should not be craving garlic noodles from San Francisco . The Red Snapper was good but....those garlic noodles....please try this place if you're around.

excerpts: Drunken crab simmered in that Chardonnay, sake and brandy and dipping our garlic noodles in it is
oh so good!
garlic noodles.author: Valerie K.
garlic noodles.review: All the way from Sacramento to get our Thanh Long fix once again!  We know the crab is excellent! Drunken crab simmered in that Chardonnay, sake and brandy and dipping our garlic noodles in it is oh so good! The succulent steamed sea bass is a must as well with that delicious ginger and citrus infused dipping sauce!  Walked in at 6pm (no reservations) and luckily was seated right away.  Since parking is a challenge here, no 5-star but the food is simply delightful!

excerpts: We ordered the Roasted Crab, Calamari, and Garlic Noodles.
All our orders came out quicker than expected and tested very fresh.
garlic noodles.author: Brian H.
garlic noodles.review:
Decided to try this place out due to all the hype.

The service here is great, super attentive and professional, regardless of how busy it gets. 

We ordered the Roasted Crab, Calamari, and Garlic Noodles. All our orders came out quicker than expected and tested very fresh. You're expected to eat with your hands at some point and they really do provide you with all the tools for it, they tie a bib on you, provide a crab cracker and small fork, and multiple bowls to leave the shells in.

After your meal you're handed a hot towel to clean your hands (might have a bit of soap in the towels), after we received our check we were handed another hot towel which really did help to completely clean your hands.

There are only two bathrooms which can often be occupied due to people trying to wash their hands, I guess the hot towels is a attempt to be a solution for that. This type of restaurant would probably benefit from a community sink outside the bathroom like how some BBQ places have.

Although the food tasted amazing, the prices can really hurt your wallet. I would come back here again for a special occasion since the experience was really nice.

excerpts: Salt and pepper calamari, roasted crab, and garlic noodles were good.
Make reservations!
garlic noodles.author: Letitia L.
garlic noodles.review:
Great Mango Salad!  That was my favorite dish.  Salty and sweet, warm salad.  Delicious!  Unfortunately I didn't take a pic of it.
Salt and pepper calamari, roasted crab, and garlic noodles were good.
Make reservations!

excerpts: roast crab with garlic noodles.
garlic noodles.author: Lorelyn P.
garlic noodles.review:
Oh my Lordy! Why did it take so long for me to get here. Service was the best! From making reservations, to getting seated right away, to valet, to our wait staff! Great service all around! 

The prawn wontons were the best I've ever had! Highly recommend. Other than that, we had the basic dinner there. roast crab with garlic noodles. Amazingly delicious! 

Definitely worth the drive!

excerpts: Prawns with garlic noodles:  definitely could feel the garlic in this dish.
garlic noodles.author: Quynh D.
garlic noodles.review:
All of these stellar reviews have me scratching my head... I honestly wanted to love this place.  I remember coming here long ago when I was in college.  I was expecting it to be top notch but I feel this was a sub par restaurant.  First, service was seriously lacking.  I was pretty disappointed.  Read on for the low down..

Vegetable soup with dumplings: bland, boring and wished I didn't order this. Pretty bad.  

Prawns with garlic noodles:  definitely could feel the garlic in this dish.  However, noodles were overcooked and prawns were too salty.  

I didn't feel there was anything special here, it was a less than average Asian restaurant, with bad service.  I also couldn't justify spending over $50 for crab, when I could go to Crustacean and get the same thing with better ambience and service.

The food came out sporadically and it took them forever to bring out a fried rice order.  I had to ask multiple times and waited for an equally long time just for a soda.  And to top it off, the waiter forgot to put in an appetizer order (after other waiters had confirmed it was on its way).  It was like being served by the 3 stooges, that's literally what it felt like.  Everybody running around, but no one was actually doing their job.  Two thumbs down!

excerpts: I also did not think the roasted crab was worth $60... garlic noodles was pretty simple, almost too simple.
The food overall didn't hit the spot for me, I was honestly excited about this place.
Felt like I over paid for not so authentic Vietnamese food.
Our server was very on top of checking in on us.
I like the fact that they had  valet
so I don't have to circle around looking for parking...
but I had an SUV so instead of paying $13
I've had to pay $20
... that's a big difference.
Not cool...
garlic noodles.author: Trang L.
garlic noodles.review: Love that I was able to make a quick reservation over yelp. Super convenient. I thought the food was meh... not too special. If you're a fan of egg rolls (they called it crispy rice paper roll) then don't order this... I've had better. I also did not think the roasted crab was worth $60... garlic noodles was pretty simple, almost too simple. The food overall didn't hit the spot for me, I was honestly excited about this place. Felt like I over paid for not so authentic Vietnamese food. Our server was very on top of checking in on us. I like the fact that they had  valet so I don't have to circle around looking for parking... but I had an SUV so instead of paying $13 I've had to pay $20... that's a big difference. Not cool...

excerpts: Yummy Garlic Noodles are a must have and the Roasted Crab.
The bar tender makes good drinks as well.
garlic noodles.author: Asia V.
garlic noodles.review: Delicious dinner at Thanh Long last night. Even though they stay crowded, the quality of the food and service does not suffer. It was delicious. Yummy Garlic Noodles are a must have and the Roasted Crab. The bar tender makes good drinks as well.

excerpts: So over the years I've heard people rave about this place and how good it taste and "omg you have to try the crab and garlic noodles
it willChange your life".
Well I did and my life hasn't changed.
I've have much better garlic noodles and crab, at least I clean  the hair off my crab.
It was just regular roasted crab nothing special the noodles were garlic noodles I can get anywhere.
I can find a crab at Chef smelly or some other spot.
Now granted the crab was fresh but not flavorful.
It could have been we had the last reservation and they seemed to be rushing us.
We would ask for something and they say the kitchen is closing.
To make insult to injury the food came out warm.
Like it was the bottom of the pot noodles and the crab was ok with temp but not hot like it came right out of the oven.
The wait staff was telling us to tip them on the side like wtf dude.
It's included in the bill and your asking us to hand u money on the side.
Based on the service we received in general this was my first and last time.
I guess hearing about this place all my life I had really high expectations,Truly disappointed .
garlic noodles.author: kim c.
garlic noodles.review:
So over the years I've heard people rave about this place and how good it taste and "omg you have to try the crab and garlic noodles it willChange your life". Well I did and my life hasn't changed. I've have much better garlic noodles and crab, at least I clean  the hair off my crab. It was just regular roasted crab nothing special the noodles were garlic noodles I can get anywhere. I can find a crab at Chef smelly or some other spot. Now granted the crab was fresh but not flavorful. It could have been we had the last reservation and they seemed to be rushing us. We would ask for something and they say the kitchen is closing. To make insult to injury the food came out warm. Like it was the bottom of the pot noodles and the crab was ok with temp but not hot like it came right out of the oven. 
The wait staff was telling us to tip them on the side like wtf dude. It's included in the bill and your asking us to hand u money on the side. Based on the service we received in general this was my first and last time. I guess hearing about this place all my life I had really high expectations,Truly disappointed .

excerpts: The garlic noodles were able very good.
We also tried a white fish entrée and I cannot remember the name of it
but it was so good.
garlic noodles.author: Mariana V.
garlic noodles.review:
This place is definitely one of the places that you want to splurge on. 

We came here with a group of five and we did not have reservations. When we arrived, they sat us right away. However, I will say that was a lucky occurrence. We had the crab and at the time the MP for the crab was $56. It was honestly the best crab I've had in a really long time. The sauce that they use is absolutely phenomenal. The garlic noodles were able very good. We also tried a white fish entrée and I cannot remember the name of it but it was so good. It melted in your mouth and the flavors were very good. 

I definitely would go back.

excerpts: Crab and garlic noodles are a must and you won't be disappointed.
garlic noodles.author: Lillian W.
garlic noodles.review: Great food every time.  Got to make reservations otherwise you might not get seated.  Crab and garlic noodles are a must and you won't be disappointed.

excerpts: For the main courses, we got the Roast Crab and Garlic Noodles (obviously!).
Ooooh my god
the crab was so good!
The crab was so buttery
I think my heart almost gave out.
How did they make the meat inside taste
so buttery though!?
The garlic noodles were pretty bland but drenched in butter.
The menu states that the noddles were made with "secret spices"...
does that mean no spice at all because it was honestly so bland.
~ I was so full after this
but my *amazing* bf decided to get me a chocolate lava cake anyway because "we have to have cake on your birthday!"~
The lava cake was way too sweet
but I didn't mind because I was in such a good mood.
Then the check came...
This restaurant is honestly reserved for special occasions only because wow... the crab itself costed about $68
dead
I'm sorry
babe
All in all, I was blown away by the crab (and the price tag on it) but everything else was mediocre.
garlic noodles.author: Trang T.
garlic noodles.review:
*Very long overdue review*

Came here for my 22nd birthday dinner (on a Friday.) To be honest, we only picked Thanh Long because PPQ (the actual crab restaurant we wanted to try) was unexpectedly closed. Originally, we made a reservation for 6:30PM but thought we needed more time to get there/find parking so we called at 5PM and they let us change our reservation to 7PM instead. Luckily, we were able to find parking about a block down and decided to come earlier (6:45PM). The server said that we have to wait until our reservation which is totally understandable. We were seated within 10 minutes. 

 For starters, I decided to try the Mango Salad after seeing many Yelpers rave about it. It has bell peppers, scallops (couldn't find any), and shrimps (previously frozen) mixed with greens. It smelled and tasted good but was very oily! Not your typical *healthy* salad. 
For the main courses, we got the Roast Crab and Garlic Noodles (obviously!). Ooooh my god the crab was so good! The crab was so buttery I think my heart almost gave out. How did they make the meat inside taste so buttery though!? The garlic noodles were pretty bland but drenched in butter. The menu states that the noddles were made with "secret spices"... does that mean no spice at all because it was honestly so bland. 
~ I was so full after this but my *amazing* bf decided to get me a chocolate lava cake anyway because "we have to have cake on your birthday!"~
The lava cake was way too sweet but I didn't mind because I was in such a good mood. 
Then the check came...  This restaurant is honestly reserved for special occasions only because wow... the crab itself costed about $68+? *dead* I'm sorry babe 
All in all, I was blown away by the crab (and the price tag on it) but everything else was mediocre.

excerpts: He order the garlic crab and butterfly shrimp with garlic noodles.
All of our food was delicious, but if he had to pick Thang Long or Crustaceans he would pick Crustaceans.
garlic noodles.author: Keisha K.
garlic noodles.review: We came here for my boyfriend's birthday dinner. We've been to Crustaceans, so we wanted to see which one was better. I don't eat seafood, but my boyfriends does, after all it was his birthday! He order the garlic crab and butterfly shrimp with garlic noodles. All of our food was delicious, but if he had to pick Thang Long or Crustaceans he would pick Crustaceans.

excerpts: Had an absolutely amazing dinner tonight of Dungeness crab, garlic noodles, coconut prawn appetizer, and some shaken beef.
Outstanding!
Great atmosphere but don't show up without a reservation.
garlic noodles.author: Kelly R.
garlic noodles.review:
Had an absolutely amazing dinner tonight of Dungeness crab, garlic noodles, coconut prawn appetizer, and some shaken beef. Outstanding!  Great atmosphere but don't show up without a reservation. We were able to get a table for 7:45 tonight by calling mid afternoon. 

The place is huge but homey, the staff was very attentive and the service impeccable. And the crab.......to die for. What a great evening in a booming business. We thoroughly enjoyed ourselves and would love to come back.

excerpts: Their garlic noodles ($11.95) are super yummy and their crabs ($58.95 each - we ordered 2) were good.
garlic noodles.author: Jo I.
garlic noodles.review:
Dined at Thanh Long tonight.  While I enjoyed the meal, I wasn't blown away and wont be rushing back - I prefer to get my crab fix at OSSO or the Dead Fish.

Their garlic noodles ($11.95) are super yummy and their crabs ($58.95 each - we ordered 2) were good.

Dinner for two (1 garlic noodle; 2 roasted crabs) cost $170 including tax and tip.  No complaints - just not blown away.

excerpts: then the entrees were (2) garlic crabs- $60.00 about 2 pound crabs covered in garlic- fantastic and a seabags- $29.95. recommend the garlic noodles also -$12,00
The place is limited in size but excellent food.
Water glasses never not filled.
Strongly recommended
garlic noodles.author: jack d.
garlic noodles.review:
Excellent dining experience, we celebrated my daughter and her boyfriend's birthday on his recommendation. Unbelievably able to make 7pm reservations on a Saturday night, Place was packed, parking is either valet for $13.00 or residential parking on street which is crowded. The servers are busy and you have to flag them down. Wait time to be seated was about 15 minutes, very efficient staff. We started out with a Chambord Lemon Drop for me $11.00 Passion Tea Cocktail $11.00 Hand Crafted Cocktails are $11.00 and a couple of Shirley Temples- $2.25 each. Full bar with 2 bartenders. We order Salt and Pepper Calamari-$ 14.00 (DELICIOUS!) served with bell peppers and onions, Crab Puffs- $ 12.50 Prawn Wontons- $ 12.25. Chicken Satay- $ 10.95 then the entrees were (2) garlic crabs- $60.00 about 2 pound crabs covered in garlic- fantastic and a seabags- $29.95. recommend the garlic noodles also -$12,00
The place is limited in size but excellent food. Water glasses never not filled.
Strongly recommended

excerpts: I've taken family and friends here a few times because Thanh Long is synonymous with dungeness crab and garlic noodles.
This place will not dissapoint if you order the crab and garlic noodles.
garlic noodles.author: Cesar L.
garlic noodles.review:
I've taken family and friends here a few times because Thanh Long is synonymous with dungeness crab and garlic noodles.   

This place will not dissapoint if you order the crab and garlic noodles.

excerpts: We came to try the roasted crab and garlic noodles.
The garlic noodles are cooked perfectly, and are just the right amount of garlicky.
I also got a glass of wine that was reasonably priced (less than $10) for a generous pour.
garlic noodles.author: Christine G.
garlic noodles.review:
This place is amazing!! We came to try the roasted crab and garlic noodles. For me, both dishes absolutely live up to the hype! 

The crabs are somewhere in the vicinity of $50-55 each at market price, and they're enormous. One crab can easily feed two people. Omg... The flavor of the crab meat is insanely delicious; it melts in your mouth, is deliciously buttery, and the roasting adds some complexity to the flavor that makes it even more tasty. The crabs themselves have a ton of meat, especially in the giant legs and claws! It's definitely a messy, use your hands sort of thing (they provide bibs!) but that's part of the fun of the experience! 

The garlic noodles are cooked perfectly, and are just the right amount of garlicky. I also got a glass of wine that was reasonably priced (less than $10) for a generous pour. It was a decadent, satisfying meal! 

The restaurant itself doesn't look like much from the outside, but has a more upscale Asian restaurant type ambience inside. It's a huge space with two levels of seating. We were seated upstairs and received excellent service from the staff, who answered all our questions, brought the food at a good pace, helped us with bibs, refilled water often and were just generally friendly. 

When all was said and done, I didn't feel like this was all that expensive for the quality of the food and how stuffed I was (~$50/pp for a drink, crab and noodles), which was a nice bonus too!

excerpts: You can't come to Thang Long and not have a full Dungeness crab and the garlic noodles.
The main attraction was the garlic noodles and the full Dungeness crabs.
The garlic noodles, though seemingly plain, are packed with a lot of flavor and for those who love garlic, you won't be disappointed.
And while the roasted crab is the crowd favorite, we opted for the crab prepared with tamarind sauce instead.
We were very happy with our selection, even after the waiter told us the roasted crab was "the most popular.
The legs were all full of meat and the sauce was delicious, especially paired with the garlic noodles.
garlic noodles.author: Jonathan Z.
garlic noodles.review:
You can't come to Thang Long and not have a full Dungeness crab and the garlic noodles. We made reservations way ahead of time but be sure to keep them or you'll get charged per head.

We started off dinner with a few drinks. The pear martini was a very well balanced drink that had a subtle hint of pear and not an overwhelming sweet aftertaste.

We chose to sample the mango salad as an app. This was a great starter that was refreshing and as much as I LOVE onions (especially red onions), the onions in this dish were a bit overpowering. But don't let this take away from the dish as a whole. The mango salad includes chopped shrimp, bell peppers and we were pleasantly surprised to find bits of chopped scallops all tossed together in a raspberry vinaigrette.

The main attraction was the garlic noodles and the full Dungeness crabs. The garlic noodles, though seemingly plain, are packed with a lot of flavor and for those who love garlic, you won't be disappointed. And while the roasted crab is the crowd favorite, we opted for the crab prepared with tamarind sauce instead. We were very happy with our selection, even after the waiter told us the roasted crab was "the most popular." The legs were all full of meat and the sauce was delicious, especially paired with the garlic noodles. Not a morsel was spared. 

I can see why this place gets busy and I'll def be back the next time I'm up in the Bay Area. It isn't a far Uber or Lyft ride from the city. If you're considering coming by, do it. You'll be glad you did.

excerpts:
You have to eat the roasted crab and garlic noodles 
There is no better !!
Staff is really attentive 
Gets really busy so make a reservation
garlic noodles.author: Adam M.
garlic noodles.review:
You have to eat the roasted crab and garlic noodles 
There is no better !!
Staff is really attentive 
Gets really busy so make a reservation

excerpts: I travel from Los Angeles and when ever we are in the Bay area we come here great garlic noodles
garlic noodles.author: Yolande D.
garlic noodles.review: I travel from Los Angeles and when ever we are in the Bay area we come here great garlic noodles

excerpts: We got the roast crab and the garlic noodles.
The crab was so delicious with all the spices and the garlicky sauce.
For a group of two, if you are very hungry I recommend ordering one more dish because crab and noodles might not be enough.
We will definitely come back here.
garlic noodles.author: Gizem K.
garlic noodles.review: We got the roast crab and the garlic noodles. The crab was so delicious with all the spices and the garlicky sauce. For a group of two, if you are very hungry I recommend ordering one more dish because crab and noodles might not be enough. We will definitely come back here.

excerpts: Two orders of garlic noodles.
garlic noodles.author: Uncle Ernie ..
garlic noodles.review:
Parking is the reason we don't frequent Thanh Long more often.  

We had 7 pm reservations and were promptly seated when we arrived-   Thank you.  

We started with calamari and shrimp salad , both I would highly recommend.  Great flavors.  

The crab is our usual, if you look around Every table has crab shells and bibs,,,   We ordered two crabs, the shak'n beef, and spicy eggplant.  Two orders of garlic noodles.  

The beef was a bit over done and dry, but if there was any disappointment... it was all made up for with the great flavor from the CRAB and other dishes!! 

We drove 100 miles, across the bridge with traffic.  
Well worth the effort

Service (upstairs) was very nice, food came out timely, piping hot, water glasses kept full, plates cleared to keep our table in cluttered,,,  most appreciated were the hot towels for our messy hands.  

Even though I can cook "roasted crab" at home
We will be back.

excerpts: We also ordered the crab fried rice and of course the garlic noodles.
garlic noodles.author: Monica K.
garlic noodles.review:
I came back to this place again because I was hoping to have a good roasted garlic crab which I was very happy with how all the food came out. The garlic crab was good, and not dry. We also ordered the crab fried rice and of course the garlic noodles.  I think I tasted garlic in my mouth for the next 2 days, but it was worth it. 

The service was just okay, nothing stellar, but when the bill came I was shocked that my crab was almost  $60. I guess Dungeness crab gets a little pricey. Parking can be a little tough if you don't want to pay for valet.

excerpts: We got fried rice, garlic noodles, sea bass, 2 crabs, and seasonal veggies.
The crab is cooked
so perfectly it's easy to crack the shell and pull out plump whole pieces of meat.
Not buttery, but seasoned with Asian spices and black pepper.
So good!
garlic noodles.author: Darlene W.
garlic noodles.review: Came here almost 10 years ago during a trip with friends and remembered the most delicious roast crab. So I recommended it to my family on this recent trip, and the roast crab is just as good as I remember! We got fried rice, garlic noodles, sea bass, 2 crabs, and seasonal veggies. The crab is cooked so perfectly it's easy to crack the shell and pull out plump whole pieces of meat. Not buttery, but seasoned with Asian spices and black pepper. So good!

excerpts: I absolutely LOVE their Roast Crab and Garlic Noodles.
They were like the first to ever come out with the garlic noodles before other places started copying them.
It goes so well with the buttery, peppery, fingerlickin' Roast Crab!
For those who don't know, they serve you the whole crab, head and all!
You break the legs apart and just dig in with your fingers and hands.
It's soo good!
The way they cooked it has the flavor soaked throughout the crab
and you're just busy Iickin' and peelin' and eatin'!
It's definitely messy, and time consuming to eat this, but you leave feeling so happy and satisfied!
Omg
garlic noodles.author: Jazz N.
garlic noodles.review:
One of my favorite restaurants in SF! Thanh Long is the original Crustacean restaurant, also sister restaurant to Anqi in OC. Most of you may know of the popular Crustaceans restaurant; Thanh Long has the same menu with a more casual atmosphere. Crustacean is a fancier and more romantic ambience. Great for dates and special events. Here, at Thanh Long, you can dress up and bring a date or come in jeans and be ready to dig in to your food! It's always busy, so make sure to make a reservation ahead of time!

I absolutely LOVE their Roast Crab and Garlic Noodles. They were like the first to ever come out with the garlic noodles before other places started copying them. It goes so well with the buttery, peppery, fingerlickin' Roast Crab! For those who don't know, they serve you the whole crab, head and all! You break the legs apart and just dig in with your fingers and hands. It's soo good! The way they cooked it has the flavor soaked throughout the crab and you're just busy Iickin' and peelin' and eatin'! It's definitely messy, and time consuming to eat this, but you leave feeling so happy and satisfied! Omg I already want more just thinking about it! 

My other favorites are the mussels appetizer (very buttery), fried crab cheese puffs, and salt & pepper calamari (crispy). Oh, happy belly!

excerpts: From the pepper crab to the garlic noodles, we didn't have one bad plate of food.
garlic noodles.author: Minh P.
garlic noodles.review:
By far, one of my easiest recommendations for anyone. I'm not a seafood person, but the crab here is excellent. Typically, my wife and I can share one Crab, but Thanh Long had us second guessing why we didn't buy a separate crab each. From the pepper crab to the garlic noodles, we didn't have one bad plate of food. 

Be careful not to miss the spot as it's not most well labeled restaurant from outside.

excerpts: The garlic noodles are super delicious.
I could probably eat the whole plate to myself, although that would not be a good idea.
garlic noodles.author: Annie H.
garlic noodles.review: The sauce for the roast crab is everything! So good that I could have the sauce all day with anything. The second time I came here, my crab was lacking enough sauce and so I definitely remembered it to be way more flavorful the first time around. The garlic noodles are super delicious. I could probably eat the whole plate to myself, although that would not be a good idea. Also tried the combination fried rice. Didn't like it too much, for it tasted bland. But I do really love this place! Makes all that hard work for a little piece of meat worth it.

excerpts: And with those garlic noodles is just a perfect compliment!
garlic noodles.author: Kris T.
garlic noodles.review:
The garlic roasted crab here is pretty amazing. Never had crab prepared quite like this before, but the way they do it is just soooo right!  That garlic. That pepper. And with those garlic noodles is just a perfect compliment!

Minus one star because parking sucks, but I know they can't help it due to location. The restaurant was bigger than I expected - 2 stories. 

Pineapple lychee martini drink was delish! Muscles were delectable and I've had better fried shrimp eggrolls. Molten lava cake was ok.

excerpts: The drunken crab was also good, but their garlic noodles were delicious.
If you're going to order anything, just always make sure you have whatever it is that you're having with their garlic noodles.
garlic noodles.author: Minh-Thao N.
garlic noodles.review:
I've heard nothing but great things about the place from my friends. It's a nice little restaurant close by the beach. Not much variety on their menu, but with what they have they do really well. My girlfriend and I ordered the chicken satay and the crab won tons. The chicken satay was OK and a bit on the dry side, but the the crab won tons were great.
