The drunken crab was also good, but their garlic noodles were delicious. I loved the texture and the garlic taste. 

If you're going to order anything, just always make sure you have whatever it is that you're having with their garlic noodles.

excerpts: My wife and I get 2 Roast Garlic Crab, Garlic Noodles
and we split the Crab Puff appetizer.
All the dipping butter you need for your crab is right on your plate.
I swear the flavor is something special especially worth the black pepper they add to the garlic butter.
And the flavor is just not in the butter or on the shell
but it's in the meat of the crab.
garlic noodles.author: Sheri L.
garlic noodles.review:
This has been hands down my #1 Seafood spot for the last 15+ years. This place is great for a dinner date but because it's not super romantic due to the fact that they stay so busy, it also works for a small group of  friends or family. 

My number one tip make reservations! Also you can find parking if you're willing to walk a few blocks sometimes it is worth it to save that almost $20 valet parking. They open at 5 it's always easier to get in and out if you go right when they open. If not just make those reservations ahead of time. Either way, despite the crowd, once you get seated the wait for the food is never too long.

The food is definitely the highlight. I consider trying new things everytime I go. I've heard good things about the Charbroiled Colossal Royal Tiger Prawns and the Mango Salad but once I get there my old faithful selection summons my soul. My wife and I get 2 Roast Garlic Crab, Garlic Noodles and we split the Crab Puff appetizer. All the dipping butter you need for your crab is right on your plate. I swear the flavor is something special especially worth the black pepper they add to the garlic butter. And the flavor is just not in the butter or on the shell but it's in the meat of the crab. That's hard to come by.

The staff is very attentive at they keep close eye on your bowl that you place your shells in. As soon as the bowl fills up there and there to swap it out for a new one. At the end of your meal they treat you to a plate of steaming hot towels to get rid of all the excess butter on your hands. I love this place!!

excerpts: I also paired my crab with their garlic noodles which is delicious.
garlic noodles.author: Allister D.
garlic noodles.review:
This place is amazing! The restaurant is clean, service is friendly and very attentive, and the food of course is fantastic. It's one of the best meals I've had in a long time.

Shout out to Evangeline for doing an excellent job with service. She is entertaining and super friendly. 

I ordered their highly popular roast crab with garlic sauce and other spices. This is MKT Price but is basically $55. The crab is roasted to perfection with tons of flavor and loads of meat in each leg. This is a must to have! There's really no point of coming here if you don't have this. I also paired my crab with their garlic noodles which is delicious. It's buttery with garlic tones. 

I will definitely be coming back for more! The food is a huge hit! I also recommend their calamari for $11. Its salty and peppery with a good crisp.

excerpts: I also purchased the tiger prawns over garlic noodles along with the salt n pepper calamari.. the garlic noodles were good as usual but not out of this world and the tiger prawns look way better than it actually tastes which is very disappointing and the calamari was soggy which I couldn't even finish b/c soggy calamari is just as bad as a hot beer if you ask me plus no sauce was included.
At this point.. take out shouldn't be an option unless you're taking it out to the nearest dumpster.
garlic noodles.author: Asia H.
garlic noodles.review: I honestly don't recommend anyone to order take out from here I got the roasted crab which wasn't boxed with care which made my entire bag practically a swimming pool of butter. I also purchased the tiger prawns over garlic noodles along with the salt n pepper calamari.. the garlic noodles were good as usual but not out of this world and the tiger prawns look way better than it actually tastes which is very disappointing and the calamari was soggy which I couldn't even finish b/c soggy calamari is just as bad as a hot beer if you ask me plus no sauce was included. At this point.. take out shouldn't be an option unless you're taking it out to the nearest dumpster.

excerpts: Garlic noodles are a great pick for the kids.
garlic noodles.author: Valerie I.
garlic noodles.review: Never a bad meal, fresh seafood. Excellent service.  Crab is off the hook. Garlic noodles are a great pick for the kids.

excerpts: If you find yourself here I would recommend getting an order of the garlic noodles.
The noodles were definitely garlicky, but also buttery and just kind of melted in your mouth - so good.
The crab that everyone raves about is just OK - it's fresh but seasoning is bland.
garlic noodles.author: Charlie B.
garlic noodles.review: If you find yourself here I would recommend getting an order of the garlic noodles. The noodles were definitely garlicky, but also buttery and just kind of melted in your mouth - so good. The crab that everyone raves about is just OK - it's fresh but seasoning is bland. We also had lemongrass chicken and shaken beef which I also found bland. Server was OK, but the water refillers were on point!

excerpts: Crab, garlic noodles and shrimp , beef , coconut shrimp (you can skip it, not too great)
garlic noodles.author: Justin I.
garlic noodles.review: Food is awesome . Kind of a tight space upstairs . I look forward to coming here again . I got 4 dishes which was just enough for 2 people . Crab, garlic noodles and shrimp , beef , coconut shrimp (you can skip it, not too great)

excerpts: The garlic noodles with prawns on top were to die for!!
garlic noodles.author: sophia l.
garlic noodles.review: Soooo good!!! If you like seafood you gotta eat here! The garlic noodles with prawns on top were to die for!!

excerpts: I came with five other people and we ordered 3 crabs, 3 garlic noodles, and 2 imperial rolls.
The serving size was perfect!
Each couple finished their crab and we had a little garlic noodles left over to take home.
The crab was delicious--sweet and meaty!
The garlic noodles were good as well, and I loved putting the crab butter sauce all over it for that extra flavor.
garlic noodles.author: Tara A.
garlic noodles.review:
My family and I haven't been here in a while so we decided to go here for my dad's birthday! We made a reservation for 5 pm and got there a few minutes earlier. There was already a line! Luckily we were the first bigger party to get in the restaurant and my mom requested that we get the booth. (You'll see it if you go, lol) 

I came with five other people and we ordered 3 crabs, 3 garlic noodles, and 2 imperial rolls. The serving size was perfect! Each couple finished their crab and we had a little garlic noodles left over to take home. The crab was delicious--sweet and meaty! The garlic noodles were good as well, and I loved putting the crab butter sauce all over it for that extra flavor. :P The imperial rolls were yummy too. 

We also got a free dessert because it was my dad's bday! Not a bad way to celebrate.

excerpts: Dungeness crab and garlic noodles were fresh and delicious!!!
garlic noodles.author: LM D.
garlic noodles.review: Right from the start, we were offered a nice steamed towel to wipe our hands clean before we ate. Delicious food: Dungeness crab and garlic noodles were fresh and delicious!!!

excerpts: not enough garlic there garlic noodles hint garlic noodles for the price of there
appetizers they barley give u enough proration for 2 people no refills on soda really a cheap place
I've had better food for the the price of this place the only thing they have going for them
is there other than that I wouldn't recommend to come here.
garlic noodles.author: N N.
garlic noodles.review: The food was tolerable thang long is definitely overrated. not enough garlic there garlic noodles hint garlic noodles for the price of there appetizers they barley give u enough proration for 2 people no refills on soda really a cheap place I've had better food for the the price of this place the only thing they have going for them is there other than that I wouldn't recommend to come here.

excerpts: ROAST CRAB and GARLIC NOODLES.
if you ever have the chance, go to #ThanhLong do so.
garlic noodles.author: Dee d.
garlic noodles.review:
These two items will change your life and rock your world. I dream of this place and these two items. It's been 5 years and it didn't disappoint. ROAST CRAB and GARLIC NOODLES. if you ever have the chance, go to #ThanhLong do so. We also had the garlic rice and shaken beef because our friend has a severe seafood allergy. Those items were great, too.  This original location  spread to @crustacean_sf and beyond. .
.

excerpts: There were three of us and we ordered two crabs, garlic noodles, and the vietnamese salad.
garlic noodles.author: Cerise M.
garlic noodles.review:
Went here for a dinner after repeated recommendations from our friends. As soon as you enter the room you can smell the garlic goodness lingering in all corners...everyone in the room was enjoying their crab dish. There were three of us and we ordered two crabs, garlic noodles, and the vietnamese salad. 

Food was delicious and met our expectations. Crabs were very buttery/rich - the garlic noodle was a nice companion to the overall meal. Would recommend this place again for those visiting SF. It gets a bit pricey but at the same time you pay for the quality of seafood.

excerpts: We had the Shahin beef, tamarind crab, roasted crab and grilled shrimp with garlic noodles.
We've been here several times and everything still tastes the same.
For dessert we had the molten chocolate cake and fried banana with vanilla ice cream.
I think they could of at least given us the whole banana!
garlic noodles.author: deborah y.
garlic noodles.review: Always delicious here!  We had the Shahin beef, tamarind crab, roasted crab and grilled shrimp with garlic noodles.  We've been here several times and everything still tastes the same.  For dessert we had the molten chocolate cake and fried banana with vanilla ice cream.  I think they could of at least given us the whole banana!

excerpts: We had the drunken crab and garlic noodles and it was amazing.
We were sat, ordered and eating in less than ten minutes.
I would recommend making a reservation even if during the week.
We ate on Thursday night and it was packed.
Loved the food and when they say "garlic" that is not a game!
Great seasonings, great taste, very clean establishment and a good time all around.
Last thing, after you finish they bring out warm towels because eating crab legs is messy.
A smart plus!
garlic noodles.author: Kristy T.
garlic noodles.review: I don't even know how to describe his kind of food but it was AMAZING! Definitely in my top 10 places for seafood. We had the drunken crab and garlic noodles and it was amazing. We were sat, ordered and eating in less than ten minutes. I would recommend making a reservation even if during the week. We ate on Thursday night and it was packed. Loved the food and when they say "garlic" that is not a game! Great seasonings, great taste, very clean establishment and a good time all around. Last thing, after you finish they bring out warm towels because eating crab legs is messy. A smart plus!

excerpts: You MUST get the crab and garlic noodles.
You can split it between two people and it is just enough food.
The crab and garlic noodles are basically what everyone around us ordered too.
I would highly recommend it!
garlic noodles.author: Allyson L.
garlic noodles.review:
Even though wearing a bib reminds me of much younger days, it definitely is required at this place. Food can get pretty messy.

You MUST get the crab and garlic noodles. You can split it between two people and it is just enough food. The crab and garlic noodles are basically what everyone around us ordered too. I would highly recommend it!

excerpts: Yes to the drinks (pear martini was fabulous), yes to the garlic noodles, YES to the plastic bib, greasy crab and hot post dinner towels.
The prices are more than we can do often - but well worth the experience!!
garlic noodles.author: Deanna D.
garlic noodles.review: Once a year we go here to have our favorite meal of the year, the rest of the time we tamper down our longing for their roast crab! Amazing food, service and atmosphere- you will see one of the most diverse patrons in a San Francisco restaurant- young and old, dressed up, dressed down, families and friends - more racial diversity than most - you get the feeling you are in a pre-tech SF. Yes to the drinks (pear martini was fabulous), yes to the garlic noodles, YES to the plastic bib, greasy crab and hot post dinner towels. The prices are more than we can do often - but well worth the experience!!

excerpts: I love this place, best garlic noodles I ever had hands down.
The roasted garlic crab was awesome too.
Only down side was the tamarin crab was a bit lacking and too sweet for me for my case.
Overall this is about 4.5 stars for me.
If I return I will have the garlic noodle order just for myself and not share!
garlic noodles.author: John T.
garlic noodles.review: I love this place, best garlic noodles I ever had hands down. The roasted garlic crab was awesome too. Only down side was the tamarin crab was a bit lacking and too sweet for me for my case. Overall this is about 4.5 stars for me. If I return I will have the garlic noodle order just for myself and not share!

excerpts: The prawns are grilled with seasoning and it comes with the garlic noodles.
There were four pieces and they tasted so good and fresh.
The garlic noodles are so simple, yet so so good.
It was so good
we ordered two extra plates of it.
The calamari was also excellent.
It was crispy but tender and soft.
The seasoning was great and the accompanying sauce was a great companion.
The spicy eggplant was also amazing.
It had eggplant, mushrooms, chicken, and shrimp.
The sauce is sweet and spicy and goes very well with rice.
I know I've described and used amazing a lot, but it's just that good.
The staff is also super super friendly.
They were very accommodating, friendly, and knew everything we asked them.
They gave us bibs as well because the crab can get messy, which it did.
Also pro tip, make sure to have a reservation to avoid very long waits.
We went on a Saturday, and it was packed.
We had a reservation and were seated immediately.
One of the best restaurants I've been to.
garlic noodles.author: Christian A.
garlic noodles.review: This place is incredible, amazing, and mind blowing. First time coming and already know we'll be returning. We got the roast crab, the colossal royal tiger prawns, calamari, and spicy eggplant. The crab is the best crab I have ever had in my life. The seasoning was amazing and the crab itself was fresh and delicious. I think one person can eat the crab if they don't order anything else. The colossal prawns were as delicious. The prawns are grilled with seasoning and it comes with the garlic noodles. There were four pieces and they tasted so good and fresh. The garlic noodles are so simple, yet so so good. It was so good we ordered two extra plates of it. The calamari was also excellent. It was crispy but tender and soft. The seasoning was great and the accompanying sauce was a great companion. The spicy eggplant was also amazing. It had eggplant, mushrooms, chicken, and shrimp. The sauce is sweet and spicy and goes very well with rice. I know I've described and used amazing a lot, but it's just that good. The staff is also super super friendly. They were very accommodating, friendly, and knew everything we asked them. They gave us bibs as well because the crab can get messy, which it did. Also pro tip, make sure to have a reservation to avoid very long waits. We went on a Saturday, and it was packed. We had a reservation and were seated immediately. One of the best restaurants I've been to.

excerpts: Our party of four ordered three crabs, the sea bass, an order of garlic noodles and an order of garlic rice, two appetizers (mango salad and calamari) and each of the ladies had two alcoholic beverages - the only male in our party had 4.
We had two roast crabs and the one cooked with wine.
The mango salad was very good.
The mangoes were sweet and the shrimp was very fresh.
The fried garlic rice and the garlic noodles lacked a little bit of flavor however we sopped up the sauce from the roast crab to make the rice and noodles flavorful.
The fried garlic rice and the garlic noodles lacked a little bit of flavor however we sopped up the sauce from the roast crab to make the rice and noodles flavorful.
garlic noodles.author: Wendy G.
garlic noodles.review:
The food is so freaking good! I teetered between giving Thanh Long 4 stars or 5 stars. The roast crab is so expensive but so effing good!!!

We made a reservation and were seated within five minutes on a busy Saturday evening. There's a $13 valet parking setup in front of the restaurant. We utilized the service since parking in this area can be challenging. Besides it was very cold and raining. The guys in valet were friendly. They got a little behind in the evening but to be expected with the weather and with the large number of people who left the restaurant the same time we did.

Our party of four ordered three crabs, the sea bass, an order of garlic noodles and an order of garlic rice, two appetizers (mango salad and calamari) and each of the ladies had two alcoholic beverages - the only male in our party had 4.  We had two roast crabs and the one cooked with wine. Hands-down the roast crab was everyone's favorite. 

The sea bass was tender but lacked seasoning - a little salt could have helped. The bok choy on this plate was yummy. One of my friends is a country boy from Georgia and he had his first taste of bok choy at this restaurant. He fell in love with it. 

The calamari was so good the greedy ones ‍ at the table contemplated ordering a second one. The mango salad was very good. The mangoes were sweet and the shrimp was very fresh. Everything we had that evening was fresh.

The fried garlic rice and the garlic noodles lacked a little bit of flavor however we sopped up the sauce from the roast crab to make the rice and noodles flavorful. 

We didn't order dessert because one of my friends didn't wear stretchy pants and we did not want to eat dessert in front of her. 

The service was great! Staff were friendly. Our waiter was attentive. We had a great time eating and catching up with dear friends.

Review updated to fix grammatical errors (damn autocorrect).

excerpts: Crabs were not fresh and garlic noodles tasted funny.
garlic noodles.author: Martin L.
garlic noodles.review:
What happened!?!

We use to love this place. Just went there the other night and the food was noticeably different and not in a good way. Crabs were not fresh and garlic noodles tasted funny. Also the price is much higher now. 

Too bad.

excerpts: The garlic noodles were drenched in butter and absolutely decadent, and the shaking beef was fantastic as well--the filet cubes were tender and cooked a nice medium rare, and the sear and marinade on the beef imparted a nice umami flavor.
garlic noodles.author: David K.
garlic noodles.review:
Who could ever guess that in this little residential corner of the Sunset District would sit such an upscale restaurant that even offers valet parking? Thanh Long is a Vietnamese-fusion restaurant that serves refined Vietnamese and upscale seafood dishes, and I came with a group of four for dinner on a Saturday night. After a short wait, we were seated in the spacious, bright dining room by our friendly server.

It didn't take us long to decide on what classic dishes to get; the mango salad was fascinating--half cooked and half raw, it came with mango, bell peppers, and shrimp, and was a nice refreshing dish to contrast with the other heavier dishes. Of course, we got the roasted crab, which was covered in butter and seasoning and was delicious--it was surprisingly easy to peel, as the shell seemed somewhat softer than other crabs I've had. The garlic noodles were drenched in butter and absolutely decadent, and the shaking beef was fantastic as well--the filet cubes were tender and cooked a nice medium rare, and the sear and marinade on the beef imparted a nice umami flavor.

Overall, this was an extremely enjoyable meal in a lively setting with quick and friendly service. The only drawback was the high price point for the dishes--the moderately-sized crab was over $50, and you could probably get the other more typical Vietnamese dishes elsewhere for much cheaper. Still, this was a great experience and I would definitely recommend Thanh Long for a seafood splurge!

excerpts: No matter this experience is like no other, the garlic crabs along with the garlic noodles are the taste you've looked for and you deserve if you come here 5 stars easily!
garlic noodles.author: Keith W.
garlic noodles.review: Maybe im Dreaming! No matter this experience is like no other, the garlic crabs along with the garlic noodles are the taste you've looked for and you deserve if you come here 5 stars easily!

excerpts: We had the calamari, mango salad, garlic noodles, roast crab, eggplant dish and fried rice.
It was a feast!
Paired well with bottle of white wine.
Only minor hiccup is parking, no lot, I circled the block three times before parking three blocks away.
To find they offer valet for $13.
garlic noodles.author: Vee V.
garlic noodles.review: Stopped here for dinner on our first night in San Fran.  It did not disappoint. Everything was delicious and service was excellent, we were seated right away. We had the calamari, mango salad, garlic noodles, roast crab, eggplant dish and fried rice. It was a feast!  Paired well with bottle of white wine. Only minor hiccup is parking, no lot, I circled the block three times before parking three blocks away. To find they offer valet for $13.

excerpts: Also had the salt and pepper calamari appetizer, 2 orders of garlic noodles, shakin beef and villager's special.
One crab was perfect but small
, 2nd crab was skinny (light weight and the tiny meat fell away from the shell), and the 3rd crab was not fresh (meat no longer had the fresh texture, mushy).
I may have not come here the last 2yrs, but we used to get a fat plump and juicy crab...
2lbs minimum on each order.
There was no comparison with any other restaurant when it comes to crab.
Prime rib is to House of Prime Rib as Roasted Dungeness Crab is to Thanh Long.
They certainly was a huge disappointment tonight.
I use to say don't worry about price, it's worth the experience to have Thanh Long Roasted Crab if you haven't had it.
The 3 disappointing crabs we had was not worth the $170 that we paid.
Garlic noodles is still what it is, to die for.
Overprice crab was a total failure.
Sorry, but my wife, my daughter and I love crab.
Tonight was the most disappointing crab dinner we've ever had.
What was interesting is
I read other 3 star reviews saying the quality of their has fallen last few visits.
garlic noodles.author: Kmaintl L.
garlic noodles.review:
Sorry, I have to change my rating down from 5 stars from the time we first started coming here around 1976 till now 2018. Thanh Long is known for their Vietnamese Roasted Crab for the over 40yrs we've been coming here, but tonight was a big disappointment celebrating our youngest daughter's graduation dinner here. We ordered 3 roasted crab tonight for 4 adults and 2 kids. Also had the salt and pepper calamari appetizer, 2 orders of garlic noodles, shakin beef and villager's special. One crab was perfect but small, 2nd crab was skinny (light weight and the tiny meat fell away from the shell), and the 3rd crab was not fresh (meat no longer had the fresh texture, mushy). I may have not come here the last 2yrs, but we used to get a fat plump and juicy crab... 2lbs minimum on each order. There was no comparison with any other restaurant when it comes to crab. Prime rib is to House of Prime Rib as Roasted Dungeness Crab is to Thanh Long. They certainly was a huge disappointment tonight. I use to say don't worry about price, it's worth the experience to have Thanh Long Roasted Crab if you haven't had it. The 3 disappointing crabs we had was not worth the $170 that we paid. It wouldn't be even worth half as they just lossed the wow factor tonight that what made Thanh Long famous for crab.

Service was great as usual and the dishes met our expectations. Garlic noodles is still what it is, to die for. Overprice crab was a total failure. Sorry, but my wife, my daughter and I love crab. Tonight was the most disappointing crab dinner we've ever had. What was interesting is I read other 3 star reviews saying the quality of their has fallen last few visits.

excerpts: It you are Craving Crab with Garlic Noodles.
LK
No More, This is the Spot
That Never Disappoints!
Drinks Aren't Bad Either.
garlic noodles.author: Mali E.
garlic noodles.review: It you are Craving Crab with Garlic Noodles.   LK No More, This is the Spot That Never Disappoints!  Drinks Aren't Bad Either.

excerpts: Garlic crab and garlic noodles a must!
Pass on tiger prawns- 4 prawns and garlic noodles for $40 is not worth it to me.
Calamari was good.
garlic noodles.author: Jennifer N.
garlic noodles.review:
Garlic crab and garlic noodles a must! 
Pass on tiger prawns- 4 prawns and garlic noodles for $40 is not worth it to me. Calamari was good. Shaken beef is better in Houston. 
Will be back for the crab!

excerpts:
Garlic Noodles were way overcooked and overpriced ($12 for a medium-sized plate of mushy noodles seasoned with garlic salt). 
-
garlic noodles.author: jihae S.
garlic noodles.review:
Decent crab, but overall, somewhat overrated and overpriced.  $175 (w tax & tip) for 2 Roast Crab, 1 garlic noodle, 1 beer and 1 soft drink.  
-  Roast Crab was fine but greasy AF.  
-  Garlic Noodles were way overcooked and overpriced ($12 for a medium-sized plate of mushy noodles seasoned with garlic salt). 
-  All the food came out within 5 mins of ordering, and cooled off very quickly - exactly what happens when food is pre-cooked and reheated just before serving.  

For over $55 per crab, you'd think they'd serve it fresh-cooked, but they clearly care more about maintaining quick turnover on tables.  Service staff is very aggressive about clearing your plates as quickly as possible - can make for a rushed, stressful experience. 

Overall, glad we tried this SF staple, but probably won't be back.

excerpts: Garlic noodles stuck together- tasted good but again t didn't taste the way it use to.
And don't get me started on the dessert.
Fried iced cream was a big plop of dough and so was the fried banana.
Coffee wasn't great either.
Stars go to service.
Very attentive and fast.
Food came fast too.
If you really want crab - and are in the area sure go but expect to pay up!
garlic noodles.author: A. Marie L.
garlic noodles.review: Quality of this place has gone down.   The crabs tasted good but not for the price paid.  Crabs tasted precooked and warmed up for serving.  Garlic noodles stuck together- tasted good but again t didn't taste the way it use to.  And don't get me started on the dessert.  Fried iced cream was a big plop of dough and so was the fried banana.  Coffee wasn't great either.  Stars go to service.  Very attentive and fast. Food came fast too.  If you really want crab - and are in the area sure go but expect to pay up!

excerpts: They recommended 6 garlic noodles for our party of 9.
We ordered 4 and still couldn't finish everything...
garlic noodles.author: Justin N.
garlic noodles.review:
$55 for a crab yikesss. The crab itself was alright. Very big and very peppered. 6/10 for the crab alone and 9/10 for crab with butter. Not only do they  massively upcharge here but they also try to upsell you. They recommended 6 garlic noodles for our party of 9. We ordered 4 and still couldn't finish everything... They sell wine for $30 when it's $6 for the same bottle at Costco lol nice try.

2/5 service 
4/5 food 
3.5/5 water

excerpts: Had the go-to roasted crab and garlic noodles for dinner, and they did not disappoint.
Might want to ask about market prices on the crab, though!
We were charged $54 per crab!
Dang!
garlic noodles.author: Amelia S.
garlic noodles.review:
Had the go-to roasted crab and garlic noodles for dinner, and they did not disappoint.  Might want to ask about market prices on the crab, though!  We were charged $54 per crab!  Dang!
We also tried the lemongrass chicken, which was good.  The seasonal stir fried vegetables were good as well.  Tried the orange sorbet cream for dessert- skip this.  Flavor was ok but texture was so icy, as if it had been sitting in the freezer for too long.  Overall a good dining experience.

excerpts: They are infamous for their crab and garlic noodles!
And 10mins later, our appetizers are there, garlic noodles, and crab!
I love that they're fast and they cater to your needs.
They put a bib on u if you'll be eating crab, then they even give u warm wash cloths after to clean your hands.
Also they are quick to clean up after you, constanty taking the done scraps, and bringing new bowls to put the new scraps in.
We always order extra garlic noodles because we live out of town and we want to take some home with us.
The calamari is super crispy and NOT too breaded which makes it all worth getting two orders of.
garlic noodles.author: Caressa Q.
garlic noodles.review:
This is my favorite spot in SF! They are infamous for their crab and garlic noodles! Best crab in SF, hands down!

When you first roll up to this place, it's at the corner in the Sunset District. It looks like a hole in the wall joint, but the moment you walk in, it's kinda upscale. White tablecloth, cute little bar in the front, and seating everywhere from downstairs to upstairs. Never knew about their upstairs because we always stay downstairs. Its dim and crowded, but its poppin! The food here is AHHHHHMAZING!!!

I got the garlic roasted crab. The prices vary during the seasons, but the crab is usually somewhere around $50. But its huge, meaty, and tasty! Worth every penny. The galric noodles go great with it too, and that's what my family and I usually get. Our last visit, there were 8 of us and our bill was $300+! Its pricey, but for this crab, it's soooo worth it. 

The service here is FAST! Since we always know what we want, we order the minute we sit down. And 10mins later, our appetizers are there, garlic noodles, and crab! I love that they're fast and they cater to your needs. They put a bib on u if you'll be eating crab, then they even give u warm wash cloths after to clean your hands. Also they are quick to clean up after you, constanty taking the done scraps, and bringing new bowls to put the new scraps in. We always order extra garlic noodles because we live out of town and we want to take some home with us. The calamari is super crispy and NOT too breaded which makes it all worth getting two orders of. =)

This place is a MUST when visiting SF! Make sure you call ahead of time and make reservations because they get super packed and busy. You can also make reservations thru the yelp app which makes it all that MORE convenient! Enjoy this place!

P.S. Their bathrooms are small. Especially the one upstairs. 

Quality of Food: 5/5
Customer service: 5/5
Ambiance: 5/5
Cleanliness: 5/5

excerpts: The best roasted crab in SF specially if you"ll order it with garlic noodles.
Their green mussels is to die for.
Good choice of drinks, reasonable prices.
If you dont want to wait for an hour better get the reservation.
garlic noodles.author: Victoria A.
garlic noodles.review:
My favorite restaurant for over 25 years ! The best roasted crab in SF specially if you"ll order it with garlic noodles. Their green mussels is to die for. 
Good choice of drinks, reasonable prices.
If you dont want to wait for an hour better get the reservation.

excerpts: I also got the garlic noodles on the side, but would recommend skipping it if you don't want to be too full.
garlic noodles.author: Janet C.
garlic noodles.review: If you love crab, check out this place! I got the Roast Crab which was peppery and flavorful. The crab was easy to crack and the meat was tender. I also got the garlic noodles on the side, but would recommend skipping it if you don't want to be too full.

excerpts: Main course we ordered garlic noodles; best garlic noodles in any restaurant, combination fried rice; also good, and the roast crab; perfectly cooked but no taste or anything special about it at all.
I could've made a better roast crab at home.
So looks like the main dish of the night goes to their garlic noodles.
Oh we also ordered drinks but they seemed to be limited cuz she originally ordered a lychee martini
but they were out n settled for a pear martini instead which was actually good
and I ordered the berkley pilsner
but they were also out
and I settled for a sapporo.
All in all we'll definitely be back and maybe try one of the other crab dishes perhaps.
garlic noodles.author: Allen R.
garlic noodles.review: No parking but good thing they have valet. Got seated right away around 1830 on a Thursday night. Place gets really busy around 1930-2000 so good thing we got there early. For an appetizer we ordered coconut prawns; good but nothing special. Main course we ordered garlic noodles; best garlic noodles in any restaurant, combination fried rice; also good, and the roast crab; perfectly cooked but no taste or anything special about it at all. I could've made a better roast crab at home. So looks like the main dish of the night goes to their garlic noodles. Oh we also ordered drinks but they seemed to be limited cuz she originally ordered a lychee martini but they were out n settled for a pear martini instead which was actually good and I ordered the berkley pilsner but they were also out and I settled for a sapporo. All in all we'll definitely be back and maybe try one of the other crab dishes perhaps.

excerpts: On my previous visit, I received my crab way before my garlic noodles.
Uhhhhh I would like to eat my HOT crab with my HOT garlic noodles.
I don't want COLD crab with HOT garlic noodles.
Tonight after my grandma and I ordered, we literally received our food 5 minutes later.
Either the chef was able to whip up 2 roasted crabs and 2 orders of garlic noodles in under two minutes or they just reheated our food and served it to us (hmmmm).
My garlic noodles were good but not as good as I remember them being.
I've had the Tiger Prawns on garlic noodles and it was really good
I would definitely recommend this place to someone who has never experienced the infamous roasted crab and garlic noodles or just want to say they've been here.
I personally don't see myself coming back here, unless its for a special event.
I also want to mention that although they are the same family, Thanh Long is better than Crustaceans only because Crustaceans taste differently...and not in a good way.
garlic noodles.author: M. H.
garlic noodles.review:
If you know me, you know how much I LOVED Thanh Long! This use to be my go to place whenever I felt like splurging on a good meal. Three years ago I would've given this place 5 stars. But as the years went on, I'm becoming less impressed with this place. 

The last two times I've been here, the service has been subpar. On my previous visit before tonight, I had a waitress who was not very friendly and lacked social skills. I want to feel welcomed, especially if I'm paying a crap load of money on a great meal. Tonight I had a waiter who would only talk to me and would not acknowledge my grandma (can we say awkward and weird). 

On my previous visit, I received my crab way before my garlic noodles. Uhhhhh I would like to eat my HOT crab with my HOT garlic noodles. I don't want COLD crab with HOT garlic noodles. Tonight after my grandma and I ordered, we literally received our food 5 minutes later. Either the chef was able to whip up 2 roasted crabs and 2 orders of garlic noodles in under two minutes or they just reheated our food and served it to us (hmmmm). 

As far as the food, it does not excite me as much as it use to. My roasted crab was pretty good, but it lacked garlic and was more peppery and salty (and greasy af). My garlic noodles were good but not as good as I remember them being. I also want to mention that my food went cold pretty quickly (that's what happens when you reheat food...let me stop lol).

I will say there are some good appetizers like the salt and pepper calamari and the shrimp toast. I also like their fried rice and heard their mango salad is delicious as well. I've had the Tiger Prawns on garlic noodles and it was really good (it was my very first meal here).

I would definitely recommend this place to someone who has never experienced the infamous roasted crab and garlic noodles or just want to say they've been here. I personally don't see myself coming back here, unless its for a special event. I also want to mention that although they are the same family, Thanh Long is better than Crustaceans only because Crustaceans taste differently...and not in a good way.

excerpts: plus, it was $58 per person for crab!), but the items we got were good: garlic noodles (but probably a bit overpriced at about $12 for basically spaghetti with garlic oil, butter, and parmasan), eggplant entree (very delicious, and served with chicken and prawns), and salt and pepper calamari (excellent and probably more reasonably priced than the other two dishes.)
garlic noodles.author: Matthew G.
garlic noodles.review:
Good food, but a little bit of a wait (45 minutes without a reservation, at 6:00 on a Tuesday), and rather pricey.

No, we didn't order the crab (it appears we may have been the only people in the establishment who didn't? We love crab -- and their roast crab looked good -- but we were looking for Asian food, not crab per se... plus, it was $58 per person for crab!), but the items we got were good: garlic noodles (but probably a bit overpriced at about $12 for basically spaghetti with garlic oil, butter, and parmasan), eggplant entree (very delicious, and served with chicken and prawns), and salt and pepper calamari (excellent and probably more reasonably priced than the other two dishes.)

It was pretty astounding to look around and realize that basically ever other person in the room was spending $75+ per person for dinner (considering the $58 plus a drink and, in many cases, an appetizer.)

But everything we got was tasty, and the crab did look good, so if you're willing to shell out the $$$...

excerpts: In a few words, the MUST orders: GARLIC NOODLES.
- The garlic noodles were tossed in oil & garlic and you could slurp every bite.
- The crab meat was so tender & juicy.
Plus, you could order different flavors.
garlic noodles.author: Olivia S.
garlic noodles.review:
In a few words, the MUST orders: GARLIC NOODLES. ROAST CRAB. SHAKEN BEEF. SPICY EGGPLANT. Period.

All the dishes were pretty much amazing. There was sooooo much flavor!
- The garlic noodles were tossed in oil & garlic and you could slurp every bite.
- The crab meat was so tender & juicy. Plus, you could order different flavors.
- The shaken beef pretty much blew me away. Every cubed piece of meat was marinated so well that the beef melted in my mouth. And it was perfectly complimented w/ the greens & onions.
- The spicy eggplant was also well marinated. This dish was more on the oily side but all the flavor was there. It also took me by surprise that there were chunks of chicken & other veggies in the dish. Win win!

Just a few tips: Make reservations ahead of time. Service is quick. And everything is pretty much family style so be prepared to dig in & share!

excerpts: All I can say is GET THE ROAST CRAB WITH THE GARLIC NOODLES!!
it melts in your mouth and pairs extremely well with the garlic noodles.
Total bill with 2 crabs, an order of garlic noodles, mussels and shaking beef came out to $170!
Until next time
garlic noodles.author: Shelly W.
garlic noodles.review:
I never thought I could eat an entire crab by myself, that is until I came to Thanh Long! Thanh Long makes me remember why I am such a huge seafood person. 

We came here as my brother was celebrating a promotion!  Get here early though, they can get pretty busy and when I got here at 6:30, we took one of their last open tables. This is with being open for only an hour and a half on a Saturday! 

All I can say is GET THE ROAST CRAB WITH THE GARLIC NOODLES!! I ordered their mussels as a starter too since they ran out of the salmon carpaccio and they were ok. The crostini was probably the best part because it was perfectly toasted. 

Now, onto the crab ($50)....it melts in your mouth and pairs extremely well with the garlic noodles. I honestly didn't even talk during dinner because I was too busy enjoying the food. 

Service was good and fast. They also give you warm towels to wipe your hands after the meal. Total bill with 2 crabs, an order of garlic noodles, mussels and shaking beef came out to $170! Until next time

excerpts:
Garlic noodles to share
Shaken beef to share
Mussels to share.
garlic noodles.author: Lyman C.
garlic noodles.review:
It's been probably about 10 years since I've been here and 10 years is too long. 

Great place for dinner date or dinner with friends. If you tend to be loud better to be seated in the back. 

You have to order these items

Crab, of course or else why would you come here. The question becomes one per person or share?  It's easy to eat one by yourself. 

Garlic noodles to share
Shaken beef to share
Mussels to share. But you may want one order to yourself. 

Your tummy will be happy and wallet probably not so much. You will still come out happy.

excerpts: They had me at Garlic Noodles.
Figured I'd give it a try.
My sister and I were not disappointed!
We shared the egg roll appetizer, which tasted delicious and came with a savory dipping sauce.
We also ordered the Roasted Dungeness Crab and Garlic Noodles to share.
If we were hungrier we would've gotten our own crabs but sharing those dishes was filling.
The noodles were incredibly aromatic because of the garlic but not overwhelming.
The crab was wonderfully seasoned... it will definitely have you licking the seasoning off your fingertips but
garlic noodles.author: Eleanor A.
garlic noodles.review:
I heard about Thanh Long since was featured on a special on the Travel Channel. They had me at Garlic Noodles. Figured I'd give it a try. My sister and I were not disappointed! We shared the egg roll appetizer, which tasted delicious and came with a savory dipping sauce. We also ordered the Roasted Dungeness Crab and Garlic Noodles to share. If we were hungrier we would've gotten our own crabs but sharing those dishes was filling. The noodles were incredibly aromatic because of the garlic but not overwhelming. The crab was wonderfully seasoned... it will definitely have you licking the seasoning off your fingertips but everyone else does it haha!

The service was great, very attentive staff. They give you water automatically and keep coming to fill it up when they see it's about to be empty. This action alone shows their attentiveness which brought them up 10 notches for me. 

I absolutely recommend this place and will definitely come back when I make my way to the West Coast again!! :)

excerpts: Almost everything on the menu is worthwhile, but my favorite is the Tiger Prawns and Garlic noodles.
garlic noodles.author: George T.
garlic noodles.review:
In my opinion, superior to their bastion downtown ( The Crustacean ). I have eaten here since their opening, and am impressed with the constant quality of cookery, if not the provender, which seems to be, well, "seasonal".

Almost everything on the menu is worthwhile, but my favorite is the Tiger Prawns and Garlic noodles.

Expect to pay a lot, though. I sure miss the old days, when the place barely seated a dozen or so people.

excerpts: We also shared a order of the garlic rice and garlic noodles which I think were so far the best I have ever tried.
The food was absolutely yummy and the service and atmosphere was amazing
garlic noodles.author: M L.
garlic noodles.review: Made reservations online so right when we arrived, we were seated right away.  My husband and daughter enjoyed their crab and my son and I ate the steak. We also shared a order of the garlic rice and garlic noodles which I think were so far the best I have ever tried. The food was absolutely yummy and the service and atmosphere was amazing

excerpts: The garlic noodles look so bad that even cup noodles coming out of Safeway look better.
The deep fried egg roll has only 4 pieces which were cut out from 2 egg rolls.
The combo noodles look nothing better, either.
With a price 10 times higher than a nearby Chinese seafood restaurant, one would expect great presentation of food and excellent tastes.
garlic noodles.author: Ah L.
garlic noodles.review:
Thanks to so many excellent reviews and we finally decided to check it out. It is a small corner restaurant with an Asian touch to attract non-Asian, fusion food seekers who's got money to burn. 

The price is ridiculously high compared to much better view/better food restaurants nearby such as the Cliff house. The garlic noodles look so bad that even cup noodles coming out of Safeway look better.  The deep fried egg roll has only 4 pieces which were cut out from 2 egg rolls. The combo noodles look nothing better, either. With a price 10 times higher than a nearby Chinese seafood restaurant, one would expect great presentation of food and excellent tastes. Although the taste is generally good, with one tenth of the price, you can easily get equivalent food if not better. 

Service is equally low class. Servers jump out from no where collecting plates on the table without asking if you are done in an obvious attempt to get you out as fast as possible so that they can seat anther group. They just take away source plates when everyone is still working on the egg rolls. With such a high price, you would expect excellent service. But no, the service, the food portion, the food presentation, the environment, none of these can match up even a mile close to their price. 

It is also very hard to find parking around that area. Valet parking is 20 dollars for SUVs and $13 for non-SUVs.

In summary, the owner of this restaurant must think that folks living in this neighborhood are foolish rich suckers; or they must believe that they are already a Michelin 3-star celebrity. However, they are not.

excerpts: Best garlic noodles and crab
but you have to try the mussels.
It's my favorite appetizer on the menu.
I like going here instead of Crustaceans cause it's kid friendly and casual.
garlic noodles.author: Trang L.
garlic noodles.review: One of my favorite restaurants in SF. Best garlic noodles and crab but you have to try the mussels. It's my favorite appetizer on the menu. I like going here instead of Crustaceans cause it's kid friendly and casual.

excerpts: The most amazing tamarind crap and garlic noodles.
The spices were perfect!
The flavors are so good
I didn't want to chew it
I just wanted to hold the flavor in my mouth!
Service is excellent!
Highly recommended if you are ever in the city and want amazing food!
garlic noodles.author: Bliss F.
garlic noodles.review:
The most amazing tamarind crap and garlic noodles. The spices were perfect! The flavors are so good I didn't want to chew it I just wanted to hold the flavor in my mouth!
Service is excellent! Highly recommended if you are ever in the city and want amazing food!

excerpts: Religiously order the Garlic Noodles and Roasted Crab, can never go wrong
garlic noodles.author: Misses H.
garlic noodles.review:
Been coming here for over 15
Years, whether it's a birthday or a casual dinner . Religiously order the Garlic Noodles and Roasted Crab, can never go wrong

excerpts: We got the roast crab, along with garlic noodles, spicy eggplants, shaken beef, salt and pepper calamari, and catch in citrus.
The catch is citrus and shaken beef was my favorite.
The beef was very tender and juicy.
The sauce on the fish was delicious!
The sauce combination was very unique.
garlic noodles.author: Michelle T.
garlic noodles.review:
I don't understand the hype of this place. The crab seems really popular so that was a must get when my friends and I came for dinner. We got the roast crab, along with garlic noodles, spicy eggplants, shaken beef, salt and pepper calamari, and catch in citrus.

The crab was underwhelming. It tasted like it was just boiled in water. I didn't taste any garlic. 

The rest of the food we ordered was good. The catch is citrus and shaken beef was my favorite. The beef was very tender and juicy. The sauce on the fish was delicious! The sauce combination was very unique. I've never thought about using orange sauce with fish. 

I'd come back to try other stuff on their menu but will definitely opt out of their crab. If you want good crab, let me introduce you to this one restaurant on Noriega called New Hing Lung. The crab is fried with egg yolk and pumpkin. It's amazing.

excerpts: The best crab and garlic noodles, probably ever!
Sooo good.
Service is always great too.
garlic noodles.author: Leila ..
garlic noodles.review: The best crab and garlic noodles, probably ever!  Sooo good.  Service is always great too.

excerpts: I have to say my favorite thing was the garlic noodles and the villagers favorite!
The flavor was absolutely AMAZING!
We also ordered the roasted crab it was delicious.
We made a reservation and were seated within 10 mins of arriving there.
The food didn't take long to come after we ordered and the service there was really good.
It is on the pricier side
but I definitely recommend it!
garlic noodles.author: Star S.
garlic noodles.review: The food here was really delicious! I have to say my favorite thing was the garlic noodles and the villagers favorite! The flavor was absolutely AMAZING! We also ordered the roasted crab it was delicious. We made a reservation and were seated within 10 mins of arriving there. The food didn't take long to come after we ordered and the service there was really good. It is on the pricier side but I definitely recommend it!

excerpts: Garlic Noodles
- I remember this dish being really good in the past.
However, this is not as good as I remember it to be.
It was good, but not delicious.
garlic noodles.author: Ashley L.
garlic noodles.review:
This place isn't as good as I remembered it or maybe it has been too long and I forgot how it tasted.  Came here the other night with a friend of mine because I wanted Crab. 

Made a reservation for 7 and was seated right away when we go there.  The restaurant was fairly empty at that time and remains quite the same when we left (maybe because it was a Tuesday).

Ordered:

Soft Shelf Crab appetizer dish - served on a bed of tradition Vietnamese salad (which looks like shredded cabbage).  The crab was good with the tamarind-chili sauce.  The salad was very bitter.  I had like 2 bits and wasn't about to eat anymore because it was so bitter. 

Garlic Noodles - I remember this dish being really good in the past.  However, this is not as good as I remember it to be.  It was good, but not delicious.  The portion for this was pretty decent.  

Garlic Crab - we ordered one to share.  The crab legs were not cracked so the sauce they use on the crab isn't in the legs.  IMO, I thought this just tasted a little bit better than normal boiled crab with lots of butter.  Licking the spices that was stuck on the shell was pretty good, but the meat was lacking the garlic taste even when I was dipping it in the drippings.

Overall, the food here was just alright.  The service was excellent.  Our server was very attentive.  When I mentioned about the bitterness in the salad, they brought it back to the kitchen and offered us another appetizer.

excerpts: Nothing beats their garlic noodles and roasted crab.
Service is impeccable.
garlic noodles.author: Maria B.
garlic noodles.review: Thanh Long is my other love. The best. Always. Nothing beats their garlic noodles and roasted crab. Service is impeccable.

excerpts: I ordered baked mussels, garlic noodles, roasted crab, and bo luc lac.
All, I thought, were excellent.
The mussels were on point, the garlic noodles tasted off this time around but was still good.
The crab was amazing...
It is a bit dirty to eat
cause you eat with your hands and have a bib but still quite good, and the bo luc lac was loved by everyone.
Service was great and we got seated upstairs since we were a party of 9.
Just a bit bummed my parents didn't like it.
This is definitely a "special occasion" kind of place and you have to get the crab..
Always.
Just be forewarned that it's $50 per crab!
garlic noodles.author: Nyla K.
garlic noodles.review:
I was super exited to take my parents, who were visiting, to have the best roasted crab ever!  They however we're unimpressed and I was surprised at how much a crab actually cost ($50).

I ordered baked mussels, garlic noodles, roasted crab, and bo luc lac.  All, I thought, were excellent.  The mussels were on point, the garlic noodles tasted off this time around but was still good.  The crab was amazing... It is a bit dirty to eat cause you eat with your hands and have a bib but still quite good, and the bo luc lac was loved by everyone.  Service was great and we got seated upstairs since we were a party of 9.  Just a bit bummed my parents didn't like it.  This is definitely a "special occasion" kind of place and you have to get the crab.. Always.  Just be forewarned that it's $50 per crab!

excerpts: Roasted crab was magnificent- along with garlic noodles.
Every time I come to San Francisco-
I try to get to Thang Long for crab.
garlic noodles.author: Charon P.
garlic noodles.review: Roasted crab was magnificent- along with garlic noodles. Every time I come to San Francisco- I try to get to Thang Long for crab.

excerpts: Roast crab, garlic noodles, shaking beef, calamari are all delicious.
It's a little expensive
but it's worth it every once in a while.
I think we've eaten the eggplant here before
and that was cool too.
garlic noodles.author: Jonathan N.
garlic noodles.review: Took my girl out and gave her crabs. This place is fire. Roast crab, garlic noodles, shaking beef, calamari are all delicious. It's a little expensive but it's worth it every once in a while.  I think we've eaten the eggplant here before and that was cool too. Have yet to try their fried rice so I'm looking forward to that next time.

excerpts: We ordered the Roasted Crab, it was a decent size and of course not to miss are the Garlic noodles.
We also got mussels, it was delicious.
The salt and pepper squid didn't seem freshly cooked tho so you can skip that.
I would recommend you just focus on the crab and garlic noodles.
Yes the crabs are expensive, ours was $55 per crab
but it's worth it.
garlic noodles.author: Jen O.
garlic noodles.review:
This is the sister restaurant of Crustaceans. Crustaceans is one of my ultimate favorite restaurants in SF. 
The food is exactly the same, just a more casual place compared to crustaceans. 

We ordered the Roasted Crab, it was a decent size and of course not to miss are the Garlic noodles. 
We also got mussels, it was delicious. The salt and pepper squid didn't seem freshly cooked tho so you can skip that. 
The Asian bouillabaisse soup was good too. It's my favorite soup with pineapple. 

I would recommend you just focus on the crab and garlic noodles. Yes the crabs are expensive, ours was $55 per crab but it's worth it. One crab can be good for 2 people. 


Service was fast, I think everything is pre-cooked already for the day. 
For the same price I would go to Crustaceans because it's not as busy and noisy as Thanh Long. 

Valet is expensive tho.

excerpts: The "catch in citrus" and garlic noodles are the best combo ever!
garlic noodles.author: AnonX X.
garlic noodles.review: My favorite of all the An Family restaurants. Love the staff! The "catch in citrus" and garlic noodles are the best combo ever!

excerpts: Garlic Noodles:

5
Ah, the famous An's garlic noodles.
Totally worth it.
Garlicky, oily but not overly oily, and best of all the noodles were the perfect texture.
Probably the best garlic noodles I've ever had.
When I come back, I'd probably go for the garlic noodles again and order other entrees.
garlic noodles.author: Will H.
garlic noodles.review:
Finally got to go here after a couple failed attempts due to timing. Overall it was a tasty meal. 

Traditional Vietnamese Salad: 4
It lacked the other  items I was expecting in a traditional Vietnamese salad (goi) such as crispy shallots, cilantro, etc. It was basic but tasty. 

Garlic Noodles: 5
Ah, the famous An's garlic noodles. Totally worth it. Garlicky, oily but not overly oily, and best of all the noodles were the perfect texture. Probably the best garlic noodles I've ever had.

Roast Crab: 3.5
Tasty yes, and particularly liked the butter and pepper that the crab was roasted in. I just didn't think it was worth the effort and cost. When I come back, I'd probably go for the garlic noodles again and order other entrees. 

Great wine selection.

excerpts: The roast crab was delicious with the garlic noodles.
The food was great
but I thought was overpriced.
The waiter was ok, never filled my water or came by to ask me.
The place was clean but very tight space.
I'm not sure if I want to come back.
garlic noodles.author: Nini Y.
garlic noodles.review: The roast crab was delicious with the garlic noodles.  The food was great but I thought was overpriced.  The waiter was ok, never filled my water or came by to ask me.  The place was clean but very tight space.  I'm not sure if I want to come back.

excerpts: The best garlic noodles  & crab
I have ever had.
I have heard about this restaurant
but I have never gone.
My b/f took me here the for first time.
The place was packed!!!!
You have to make a reservation ahead of time.
We were seated within 15-20 min & the food came out right away upon ordering.
The service was friendly & everything we got was sooo good.
The salt & pepper calamari was the perfect appetizer & then the garlic noodles & crab came out after.
One of my favorite restaurants in SF by far.
garlic noodles.author: Nancy F.
garlic noodles.review: The best garlic noodles  & crab  I have ever had. I have heard about this restaurant but I have never gone. My b/f took me here the for first time. The place was packed!!!! You have to make a reservation ahead of time. We were seated within 15-20 min & the food came out right away upon ordering. The service was friendly & everything we got was sooo good. The salt & pepper calamari was the perfect appetizer & then the garlic noodles & crab came out after. One of my favorite restaurants in SF by far.

excerpts:
Garlic rice ($9) was better than the garlic noodles IMO. 
It also went better with the crab.
Calamari ($13) was good but under seasoned.
garlic noodles.author: Andy W.
garlic noodles.review:
Wanted to try this place for a long time. Like everyone else, I've heard lots of good things so I was really looking forward to it. Maybe I got my hopes up too high but I was underwhelmed. The outrageous prices also didn't help. One crab for $56 bucks. 4 prawns and noodles for $39. If it was mind blowing maybe it would justify the prices but my mind nor my socks were blown off.

The roasted crab ($56) was the best dish of the night. It was good, not great. 
Prawns ($39) were under seasoned compared to the crab. The noodles that came with it were ok.
Garlic rice ($9) was better than the garlic noodles IMO. It also went better with the crab.
Calamari ($13) was good but under seasoned.
Shrimp toast ($12) was the worst dish of the night. The toast wasn't toasted enough. It was really bready. Would recommend skipping this.  

There is a mandatory 18% tip for all party sizes. It doesn't bother us since we tip regardless but service might be better if it wasn't mandatory. Service was fine but for the prices they charge, I expected better. They did their job but it lacked care, warmth and friendliness. 

With the taxes and tip the bill came close to $200 for two of us. No drinks, we only had two sodas (no refills).

They do have valet for $12 but if you circle around, you might find street parking.

excerpts: Garlic noodles were great too!
The place has an old school vibe to it.
We got a bottle of wine for the table presented to us like the used to do with a napkin under the bottle and tasting for the man that ordered it before pouring all the women first then the men.
The entire experience was very classy, but be prepared to pay for it!
garlic noodles.author: Sam R.
garlic noodles.review: The whole crab was outstanding. Came with a party of 8 and every single one of us loved the crab. Garlic noodles were great too! The place has an old school vibe to it. We got a bottle of wine for the table presented to us like the used to do with a napkin under the bottle and tasting for the man that ordered it before pouring all the women first then the men. The entire experience was very classy, but be prepared to pay for it!

excerpts: The raspberry lemon drop martini, shrimp toast, chicken satay, shaken beef, garlic roasted crab, colossal shrimp with garlic noodles...
ALLL soo good!
Happy tummy, happy wife, happy life ...
Right ?!
lol !
Our waitress was so cute & sweet.
I just wanted one cocktail
garlic noodles.author: Cynthia C.
garlic noodles.review:
We had a reservation at 845pm and the host told us "don't worry just be here before 9pm" so we got to the restaurant at 855pm... And everything is amazing. The raspberry lemon drop martini, shrimp toast, chicken satay, shaken beef, garlic roasted crab, colossal shrimp with garlic noodles... ALLL soo good! Happy tummy, happy wife, happy life ... Right ?!lol !
Our waitress was so cute & sweet. I just wanted one cocktail but she was too hard to resistant to tell her no. 

Overall great experience & great food

excerpts: We ordered the roasted crab and garlic noodles.
The noodles were over cooked, did not have the chewy texture other Vietnamese restaurants in my hood serve.
The crab was drenched in butter, the spice was hard to determine.
All in all, not a great experience food wise.
There are better restaurants to experience roasted crab.
It was also expensive.
The only reason for two stars, ambience and service is decent.
Maybe we just hit a bad night, but I much prefer PPQ on Clement.
garlic noodles.author: Carole W.
garlic noodles.review:
This is a restaurant I have wanted to try for years, but I have to say it is overrated and they are living on their laurels of the past.

We started with their Traditional Vietnamese Salad, basically it was shredded cabbage, a little carrot, no cucumber as advertised and when the waitress set it down, said they were out of peanuts.  It was topped with 4 or 5 shrimp, and we couldn't taste the dressing.  If it weren't for the bowl of chili sauce would have been tasteless.  We ordered the roasted crab and garlic noodles.  The noodles were over cooked, did not have the chewy texture other Vietnamese restaurants in my hood serve.  The crab was drenched in butter, the spice was hard to determine.  All in all, not a great experience food wise.  There are better restaurants to experience roasted crab.  It was also expensive.  The only reason for two stars, ambience and service is decent.  Maybe we just hit a bad night, but I much prefer PPQ on Clement.

excerpts: The garlic noodles were awesome, but the customer service was absolutely terrible!
Out of 10 people, my meal was the last to arrive.
All I got was garlic noodles with chicken.
The boiling crab and other meal items my party ordered came up before mine.
When I say my meal was the last to arrive, I mean everybody was almost done by the time my dish got to the table.
I felt so awkward while everybody ate their meal
and I just sat around and watched them for a good 10-15 minutes.
You would think noodles and chicken would be an easier meal to prep than boiling crab.
Oh, and when I asked for a refill on my soda it took seven minutes and the waiter was doing nothing but just standing around.
garlic noodles.author: Customer P.
garlic noodles.review:
The garlic noodles were awesome, but the customer service was absolutely terrible! Out of 10 people, my meal was the last to arrive. All I got was garlic noodles with chicken. The boiling crab and other meal items my party ordered came up before mine. When I say my meal was the last to arrive, I mean everybody was almost done by the time my dish got to the table. I felt so awkward while everybody ate their meal and I just sat around and watched them for a good 10-15 minutes. You would think noodles and chicken would be an easier meal to prep than boiling crab. Oh, and when I asked for a refill on my soda it took seven minutes and the waiter was doing nothing but just standing around. Again, not a difficult task to do especially when there's not a lot of people in the restaurant. 

Would I go back to the actual restaurant, no!! Would I place an order to go, yes. 

It's sad how customer service is just terrible in this day and age.

excerpts: Parking isnt the best but out of all the garlic noodles and garlic grab
Ive tried, this is the  best.
garlic noodles.author: Tuitama'i F.
garlic noodles.review: Parking isnt the best but out of all the garlic noodles and garlic grab Ive tried, this is the  best.

excerpts: For food, my friend and I split a crab and an order of garlic noodles.
Loved the garlic noodles and flavor of the crab, but the crab was rather small for the amount we paid.
We had a crab cooking night a few months back, and that was way more satisfying and cost efficient.
garlic noodles.author: Stefanie C.
garlic noodles.review:
Ah, the coveted bougie Vietnamese spot located in the far reaches of the Outer Sunset. Honestly I wouldn't have gone out of my way to come here if I didn't live nearby. My friends and I decided that we wanted to try Thanh Long, so of course, I made reservations weeks in advance. Not sure how possible it is to walk into this restaurant and get seated that evening.

I'm so shocked by how big this restaurant is! It seems to take up the whole block with its upstairs and downstairs areas. Actually I assumed that there were just apartments on top of the restaurant. We were seated upstairs in the back corner. The red walls were rather off-putting. Took awhile for my eyes to adjust.

Our waiter was very attentive and prompt. He took our drink orders right away and answered questions about the menu. Whatever cocktail I ended up getting lacked alcohol completely. It was undetectable. Tasted like juice. My roommate's did too. Such a disappointing waste of money.

For food, my friend and I split a crab and an order of garlic noodles. Loved the garlic noodles and flavor of the crab, but the crab was rather small for the amount we paid. We had a crab cooking night a few months back, and that was way more satisfying and cost efficient. The spices were on point though.

Overall I'm glad I got to try Thanh Long, but I don't think it's a place worth putting on your San Francisco bucket list. Splurge your money on a restaurant that serves real cocktails and is more worth the portions you get. Service was great though, so I'll make that plug for them!

excerpts: This taste good with the garlic noodles too!
I put the garlic noodles in the big shell of the crab to give it more flavor.
Everything about the crab was juicy and the butter mixed with the crab is tasty.
Dessert: I got the creme brulee cheesecake which was rich, thick, and creamy.
I'd rate it 3/5.
garlic noodles.author: Vanessa L.
garlic noodles.review:
Definitely need to make a reservation for this place. Once in a lifetime I'd eat here just cause of the price and because I prefer meat over seafood. 

My coworkers and I ordered salt and pepper calamari and the shrimp toast for appetizers. The calamari I could just not get enough of!!! The mixture of the salt and pepper is just right, not too salty nor spicy. The shrimp toast I wasn't really into it, it's just a fried shrimp and I thought the pieces were really small. 
Now for the real deal, I ordered a roast crab which has the restaurant's secret spices and garlic sauce on it. It's humongous and I'm still in awe. This taste good with the garlic noodles too! I put the garlic noodles in the big shell of the crab to give it more flavor. Everything about the crab was juicy and the butter mixed with the crab is tasty. 
Dessert: I got the creme brulee cheesecake which was rich, thick, and creamy. I'd rate it 3/5. The crust is the best part though.

Service: our waiter was really slow and preferred to take care of other smaller tables. He ignored a lot of our requests and seems to not be paying attention most of the time. For dessert, he asked everybody what they wanted EXCEPT my boss... He's standing right next to him and just skipped him and forgot about him. Dumb!

excerpts: Order one (or two) sides of the garlic noodles.
garlic noodles.author: Jenny L.
garlic noodles.review:
Pricey, but delicious roasted crab.  Order one (or two) sides of the garlic noodles.  We gobbled up the first plate pretty quickly. 

I'd skip on the shaking beef.  It was weirdly sweet.  

Ambiance is good at this location.  And the bartender in the front of the restaurant is awesome.

excerpts: The roasted crab and garlic noodles should be named a San Francisco treasure.
This funky out of the way eatery is a fun place with good cocktails, a decent wine list and a diverse clientele.
garlic noodles.author: tony l.
garlic noodles.review: The roasted crab and garlic noodles should be named a San Francisco treasure. This funky out of the way eatery is a fun place with good cocktails, a decent wine list and a diverse clientele.

excerpts: The garlic noodles and the roast crab here are definitely the highlights.
Both are packed with flavor.
The coconut prawns as an appetizer was decent, but nothing special.
garlic noodles.author: Ali F.
garlic noodles.review:
The garlic noodles and the roast crab here are definitely the highlights. Both are packed with flavor. The coconut prawns as an appetizer was decent, but nothing special. However, since they charge an arm and a leg per crab, not literally lol (over $50), I'll only come here occasionally.

The place was super busy, even on a weeknight. Service was ok.

excerpts: The size of the garlic noodles has became so small.
We spent almost $100 per person, but feel so disappointed with the quality of the food.
This used to be my favorite restaurant, but I don't feel like going back there ever again.
garlic noodles.author: W L.
garlic noodles.review: We have been going to this restaurant for years. We felt the quality of the food has dropped dramatically. The crab is not fresh, and for sure doesn't match the price ($58.95 each). The crab meat was mushy and clumpy, and tastes like it has been frozen for a long time. The size of the garlic noodles has became so small.  We spent almost $100 per person, but feel so disappointed with the quality of the food. This used to be my favorite restaurant, but I don't feel like going back there ever again.

excerpts: Great food and service had the crab, garlic noodles and shrimp toast, and the chocolate lava cake with ice cream.
Carol
our server was on point
so was the food though I felt everything was coming out to fast, but
because there were hot wet towels you really felt clean after eating because of
you order the crab you have to use your hands to get the experience.
garlic noodles.author: Ahmed H.
garlic noodles.review: Great food and service had the crab, garlic noodles and shrimp toast, and the chocolate lava cake with ice cream. Carol our server was on point so was the food though I felt everything was coming out to fast, but because there were hot wet towels you really felt clean after eating because of you order the crab you have to use your hands to get the experience.

excerpts: I agree with everyone, Roasted Crab is to die for, Tiger prawns over bed of garlic noodles is excellent, Shaken Beef is delicious.
The only major disappointment is the Seasonal Veggies.
garlic noodles.author: Mike G.
garlic noodles.review:
With over 2100 reviews, there are nothing new I can add. 

I agree with everyone, Roasted Crab is to die for, Tiger prawns over bed of garlic noodles is excellent, Shaken Beef is delicious. The only major disappointment is the Seasonal Veggies. It was really bad. 

The place is packed, so make sure you get reservation, or else you have to wait for a long time.

excerpts: Yes, the garlic roasted crab and the garlic noodles are very good, and it is located in the Bay area, but the parking is horrible even with valet, and the portions served for the price you pay is why I reserve this place for special occasions.
If I was a high roller with deep pockets, I wouldn't mind, but I would visit more frequently if the prices were more reasonable - and of course I will be back...
garlic noodles.author: Wendy S.
garlic noodles.review:
I really do enjoy the food at Thanh Long, and the service at the Judah location is top notch!  The one thing that just gets me every time is the price.  Yes, the garlic roasted crab and the garlic noodles are very good, and it is located in the Bay area, but the parking is horrible even with valet, and the portions served for the price you pay is why I reserve this place for special occasions.
If I was a high roller with deep pockets, I wouldn't mind, but I would visit more frequently if the prices were more reasonable - and of course I will be back...

excerpts: We order garlic noodles on the side and the fried banana with vanilla ice cream for dessert.
garlic noodles.author: Precious Ethel P.
garlic noodles.review:
This has got to be my favorite restaurant!  I will take seafood any day than meat and this place meets my expectations continuously.  Although, they have very limited parking because it is in the city and around a residential area, they provide Valet!  I recommend valet unless you get lucky enough to park in front of the restaurant but goodluck!  Its either street parking or valet because they don't have a private lot.

When we go here, we usually dress more business casual but it totally doesn't matter, you'll get your hands dirty anyways.  The outside of the restaurant doesn't look very pleasing/fancy but the inside looks 10x better!  We ALWAYS ALWAYS make a reservation because they get very busy, especially during the weekends.  The waiting area is quite small but they have a full bar where you can sit, wait, and have a drink.  The restaurant isn't the biggest and it gets a little tight in there, but fortunately, they do have an upstairs area.

Their customer service here is perfect.  They aren't overwhelming, but they are quick to refill your water, and they're always walking around, that way if you need something they're easily accessible.  Everyone is quick, friendly, Americanized (no racial) and professional.

The food is astounding!  We start off with ordering the Salt & Pepper Calamari, sounds plain, but it's the most flavorful calamari ever.  My boyfriend and I always share 1 crab because they are HUGE with lots of meat.  There are different flavors of crab but our favorite is the Roast Crab.  We've tried the others but Roast Crab is my all-time favorite.  We order garlic noodles on the side and the fried banana with vanilla ice cream for dessert.  The traditional Vietnamese salad and mango salad is bomb, very light but good.  If you do want to order some type of meat, the Shaken beef is super tender and melts in your mouth!  EVERYTHING IS JUST DELICIOUS AND HEAVENLY.

The food is comparable to PPQ, if you've ever been there, however, Thanh Long is more expensive but you get what you pay for!  I think PPQ is more on the casual side but if you want to be a little fancier, Thanh Long is the place.

You will not walk out of here disappointed!

excerpts:
garlic noodles
And I do have to say they were nit a disappointment 
Although the other recommendation was crab no one in our group like crab but want we did
Order was delicious I would highly recommend this place  also try and made a reservation and there closed on mondays
garlic noodles.author: Tina N.
garlic noodles.review:
We were advise to go here for there garlic noodles
And I do have to say they were nit a disappointment 
Although the other recommendation was crab no one in our group like crab but want we did
Order was delicious I would highly recommend this place  also try and made a reservation and there closed on mondays

excerpts: The garlic noodles have no garlic flavor; all you can taste is butter.
garlic noodles.author: Jennifer W.
garlic noodles.review:
This place is definitely not as good as PPQ and is more expensive. I would pass on this place after trying it once. 

The roast crab is the best flavor, but even that is fairly bland. The drunken crab is pretty bland and not that great. The garlic noodles have no garlic flavor; all you can taste is butter. I've never been a fan of shaken beef anywhere, but this place's was okay. The calamari was decent/good. 

Good service at this restaurant, large space, easy to find parking. Otherwise, taste-wise, price-wise, really no redeeming value.

My gf had the drunken crab and the garlic noodles with tiger prawns.

No Biggie.
Before I even dig in

I'm not sure if it was because we ordered different seasoning types of crabs but hers' was perfect.
