I heard the roasted crab was good and the garlic noodles with the tiger prawns as well so that's what I ordered. My gf had the drunken crab and the garlic noodles with tiger prawns. As I start eat my crab I noticed that it wasn't clean. The waiter took it back and brought me another one. No Biggie. Before I even dig in I see it's not clean again. Im not sure about everyone else but when it comes to seafood it should be cleaned and cleaned good. I looked at my girlfriends plate and her crab was clean. I'm not sure if it was because we ordered different seasoning types of crabs but hers' was perfect. Needless to say my first experience was pretty much ruined.

excerpts: My friend and I enjoyed eating 2 crabs and garlic noodles.
garlic noodles.author: Peter A.
garlic noodles.review: If you are a fan of crabs, this is a right place to go. My friend and I enjoyed eating 2 crabs and garlic noodles. We think the salt and pepper calamari was dried and no flavor but was still fresh. I'll come back next time!!

excerpts: Also, the garlic noodles were pretty bad--I'd say I've tasted far better instant ramen/mi goreng with more flavor.
The garlic noodles tasted akin to pasta with garlic powder sprinkled on them.
garlic noodles.author: Astrid G.
garlic noodles.review: While the crabs itself were huge and MEATY, the amount of butter used to prepare them was sickening. You'd bite into your crab and butter/grease would literally ooze out and drip. I felt pretty uncomfortable about 3/4 into my meal and couldn't finish the rest of my crab. This is the first time I've had leftover crab because I LOVE CRAB!!!!!!! Also, the garlic noodles were pretty bad--I'd say I've tasted far better instant ramen/mi goreng with more flavor. The garlic noodles tasted akin to pasta with garlic powder sprinkled on them.

excerpts: I absolutely loved their garlic noodles and the shaken beef.
Other dishes are terrific too but they are a bit pricey (for instance the roasted crab) although if you can afford it you should go for it.
I ordered it once
and I loved
and whenever I get my bonus at work
I'll likely end up having seconds!
It doesn't get any better than this place, and I am not talking just about the roasted crab.
The chefs here know exactly what they're doing.
Every bite introduces a new flavour that you didn't recognise before.
It was tasty and worth it.
I recommend checking out Thanh Long if you're looking for an excellent evening.
garlic noodles.author: Roxanna W.
garlic noodles.review: If you're looking for a great spot for seafood with a Vietnamese flare then your best bet in the area would be Thanh Long. The restaurant decoration is absolutely gorgeous and welcoming and the staff makes you feel at home. I absolutely loved their garlic noodles and the shaken beef. Other dishes are terrific too but they are a bit pricey (for instance the roasted crab) although if you can afford it you should go for it. I ordered it once and I loved and whenever I get my bonus at work I'll likely end up having seconds! It doesn't get any better than this place, and I am not talking just about the roasted crab. The chefs here know exactly what they're doing. Every bite introduces a new flavour that you didn't recognise before. It was tasty and worth it. I recommend checking out Thanh Long if you're looking for an excellent evening.

excerpts: The garlic noodles was great the dungeon is crab excellent .
Yes I will be coming back.
garlic noodles.author: Nicey S.
garlic noodles.review: Service was good, got seated right away.  The food was delicious, great atmosphere the place is big.  The garlic noodles was great the dungeon is crab excellent . Yes I will be coming back.

excerpts: #Garlic Noodles:
This was the biggest disappointment of the night.
I was very looking forward to that as I heard so many good things about this dish from this place....
but there was like almost zero garlic taste..... like
and I'm not even exaggerating.
It did taste
garlic noodles.author: Simon C.
garlic noodles.review:
I had always been curious about Vietnamese seafood (especially crabs) cuisine - my friends talk about it, my relatives talk about it, never had a chance to try it. Finally it's my turn for a friend's bday dinner at Thanh Long, and to my surprise, it was NOT that good.

On a Wednesday night, didn't make reservations, was ready for a long line but luckily we grabbed the last 2-seat table.

#Thanh Long Mussels: B.
It came with 5 mussels and each with a piece of bread at the bottom. While the garlic and green onion smelled and tasted pretty good - it was too buttery. Way too much butter that after 3 minutes when it got a little cooler a layer of fat from the butter formed around the shell of the mussels. The mussels themselves were pretty fresh though.

#Roasted Crab: B.
This was the main dish and I had high expectation, but ended up in disappointment. Again there was a lot (not excessive this time) in the sauce, but problem was this roasted crab lacked black pepper or whatever that should have made the crab more "roasted". And if it was lack of taste on the outside already, needless to say the meat inside was pretty bland. At least the meat was fresh though.

#Garlic Noodles: B-.
This was the biggest disappointment of the night. I was very looking forward to that as I heard so many good things about this dish from this place.... but there was like almost zero garlic taste..... like 1% and I'm not even exaggerating. It did taste okay, the noodle was springy, it just shouldn't be called "garlic" noodle though.

We also got a banana foster as dessert at the end and it was alight. Service on that night was good, a little pricy for that quality of food. Not planning to come back again, but would down to try PPQ which is supposedly another good one, hopefully it will be better there.

excerpts:
get the roast crab with the garlic noodles!
Pricey ($60 for crab) but its market price and seafood is expensive so it makes sense.
Lovely meal, atmosphere and wait staff.
HIGH QUALITY dining!
garlic noodles.author: Olivia S.
garlic noodles.review:
BEST CRAB IVE HAD IN MY LIFE!!!!!
WONDERFUL!
get the roast crab with the garlic noodles!
Pricey ($60 for crab) but its market price and seafood is expensive so it makes sense.
Lovely meal, atmosphere and wait staff.
HIGH QUALITY dining!

excerpts: but I didn't like the garlic noodles also the space
could be a little bigger great hospitality!
garlic noodles.author: Lucy M.
garlic noodles.review: Very dirty place and interior was bad! The crab was normal but I didn't like the garlic noodles also the space could be a little bigger great hospitality!

excerpts: A day out showing friends around the city and topping off the day with Roasted Crab and Garlic Noodles!
I was here two weeks ago as well as yesterday.
I will always bring visitors to a place that does Crab right.
garlic noodles.author: Gina A.
garlic noodles.review: A day out showing friends around the city and topping off the day with Roasted Crab and Garlic Noodles! I was here two weeks ago as well as yesterday. I will always bring visitors to a place that does Crab right.

excerpts: We saw the restaurant on the travel channel and couldn't wait to taste the garlic noodles.
Vacationing from New Jersey this was one of the first dinner reservations we made.
The favorite was the garlic noodles.
They were extremely garlicky with a slight bite.
We would highly recommend this restaurant and wish we could bring the garlic noodles to the east coast.
garlic noodles.author: Kim S.
garlic noodles.review:
Great great great MEAL!!!!! From start to finish the service and food were awesome. We saw the restaurant on the travel channel and couldn't wait to taste the garlic noodles. Vacationing from New Jersey this was one of the first dinner reservations we made. We started with the mango salad and the Vietnamese salad. Both were flavorful and fresh. We shared entrees between the 8 of us. The favorite was the garlic noodles. They were extremely garlicky with a slight bite. We also had the lemongrass chicken which was full of flavor and slightly spicy. The red snapper was perfect  and the fried rice with chicken was moist and delicious.  For dessert we shared the creme brûlée cheesecake, fried banana and orange  sorbet which tasted like a delicious creamsicle. 
The service was as great as the food. Our server was attentive and efficient, paying attention to detail. We would highly recommend this restaurant and wish we could bring the garlic noodles to the east coast.

excerpts: Everyone loves the roasted crab and garlic noodles, without a doubt.
I love eating here with a big group of people because no one else will eat the juices/fat/meat out of their crab heads, where as I will go to town on them.
I've had meals here where I don't even order anything but garlic noodles, since I am able to completely sustain myself on everyone's discarded crab heads.
(TMI?)
There is definitely more to Thanh Long's menu than their delicious crab and garlic noodles .
You get your garlic noodles and 4 pieces of prawns, with the same garlic flavor as the crab, but cheaper.
garlic noodles.author: Ghia G.
garlic noodles.review:
I'm planning a dinner here for my mom's birthday and can't believe I never wrote a review for this place! Everyone loves the roasted crab and garlic noodles, without a doubt. I love eating here with a big group of people because no one else will eat the juices/fat/meat out of their crab heads, where as I will go to town on them. I've had meals here where I don't even order anything but garlic noodles, since I am able to completely sustain myself on everyone's discarded crab heads. (TMI?) My husband and I think one crab is more than enough to share though, when it's just the two of us.

There is definitely more to Thanh Long's menu than their delicious crab and garlic noodles . There are still a lot of other mouthwatering options on the menu for those non-crab fans (who are you!?!?), those allergic to shellfish (understandable) or those looking to save some money (those crabs are a pretty penny). 

Other menu favorites:

-Shrimp Toast: shrimp pate on crispy bread appetizer when you just can't wait to gorge
-Tiger Garlic Prawns: I think of this as a thanh-long "light" menu. You get your garlic noodles and 4 pieces of prawns, with the same garlic flavor as the crab, but cheaper. 
-Shaken Beef: tender and well-seasoned for you land lover's
-Banana Cake: I love banana cakes and they do it right here!

I've always found it easy to get a reservation here, but sometimes even with a reservations, there's a bit of a wait once you arrive. Make sure your entire party is present or they will not seat you. I prefer the atmosphere here to that of PPQ. Parking here is difficult, so I suggest arriving super early to look for street parking in the difficult to park SF neighborhood (or be ready to pay for valet).

excerpts: Roasted crab and garlic noodles!
Enough said!
garlic noodles.author: Sabrina D.
garlic noodles.review: Roasted crab and garlic noodles! Enough said! Wait, there's also the Thanh Long mussels, which are delicious and have a slight sweetness to the savory butter! We only come here for birthdays and special occasions because of the price, and let's face it, the oily artery-clogging butter. So much flavor and worth working out for in the gym every day. I just can't believe there are people on here saying PPQ is better?!?! Blasphemy! Thanh Long is known for the generations guarded secret recipe and secret kitchen within the kitchen so the recipe is only kept within the family! This place is an ultimate indulgence and you can tell by the way this place is always pack filled with people on a nightly basis and even more people waiting by the host table for their turn to be seated and bibbed for a delicious dining experience. Valet parking is about $12, $13 per car. It's always hard to find parking here, so we always do valet. My mouth is watering right now just thinking about this place!

excerpts:
**
Garlic noodles*
garlic noodles.author: Yvette B.
garlic noodles.review:
I've been here 2 times in 2 weeks! the second time I've came here I came to a realization that thanh Long has given me one of the best meals of my life. I would highly recommend this place to anyone and everyone! 
These are all items I've ordered and was not a disappointment at all! 

Fried calamari
Thanh Long mussels****
Coconut fried shrimp
Roasted crab ****
Garlic noodles****
Seafood garlic rice
Garlic rice

I have yet to explore more of the menu but just those few items was a game changer! On the plus, service is just as great as the food!

excerpts: - the garlic noodles are a must.
If they don't come in your order make sure to add on a side.
Pictures do these noodles no justice.
They are packed with so much flavor your going to have to brush your teeth 5x's after...
garlic noodles.author: Stormy B.
garlic noodles.review:
Wow! Pictures do this food no justice! The taste is life changing. Things to order when it's your first time!

- the garlic noodles are a must. If they don't come in your order make sure to add on a side. Pictures do these noodles no justice. They are packed with so much flavor your going to have to brush your teeth 5x's after... but it is worth every brush!

- shrimp - the taste is amazing cooked to perfection and easy to peel out of shell. Looks of seasoning! Comes on a plate of garlic noodle. 

- drunken crab- very good. Messy but they give you a bib. Recommend 1 crab per person. They look big but when you take the top off it's actually pretty small. I held out first time but the 2 me time coming I shared this with an order of garlic noodle and an app. I was just right but could've handled my own crab  

- appetizer I had shrimp rolls- they were okay. I would try either the shrimp toast, calamari or something else. 

Can't wait till next trip. It is a little pricy here, but the taste is well worth it.

excerpts: I spent Mother's Day weekend in the Bay Area and got to eat some Garlic noodles and Garlic crab!
Hands down the best!!
garlic noodles.author: Nanette G.
garlic noodles.review: Definitely delicious!  I spent Mother's Day weekend in the Bay Area and got to eat some Garlic noodles and Garlic crab! Hands down the best!!

excerpts: I ordered my usual roasted garlic crab with garlic noodles.
Roasted crab currently priced at $48.95.
The roasted crab is made with the family secret sauce in the "secret kitchen", which is off limits to all employees.
garlic noodles.author: Peter C.
garlic noodles.review:
Thanh Long is located in outer sunset on Judah between 46th and 47th.  This is their original location and has been here as far as I can remember.  It's conveniently located on the N-Muni line.  Parking can be difficult depending on the time of the evening, so I recommend taking Muni or an Uber.  They do offer valet service.

This is my place to go when I'm in the mood of eating crustacean; it's a lot of work and I'll overlook that for the evening.  I ordered my usual roasted garlic crab with garlic noodles.  Roasted crab currently priced at $48.95.  The roasted crab is made with the family secret sauce in the "secret kitchen", which is off limits to all employees.  The food tasted exactly how I last remember....simply fabulous!

When you do visit make a reservation as it will save the wait time and guarantee you a table.  I'm sure you will enjoy this place as much as I have.

Tip: if you want to eat the guts (yellow mustard) in the head ask your server. They normally bring it cleaned out.

excerpts: My favorite restaurant in San Francisco I highly recommend the roasted crab and garlic noodles.
The Collosal Shrimp is great too:)
You also cannot go wrong with the calamari for appetizers and the chocolate molten lava cake is delicious.
It is expensive but worth every penny
..yum cannot wait to go back!

The Collosal Shrimp is great too:) You also cannot go wrong with the calamari for appetizers and the chocolate molten lava cake is delicious.  It is expensive but worth every penny..yum cannot wait to go back!

excerpts: So we ordered a bunch of stuff to try.. their garlic noodles was good.. they give you a whole crab with different flavors to choose from.. too much work.
There was also other random dishes.
So far so goOD!

garlic noodles.review: Went with a party of 5+. So we ordered a bunch of stuff to try.. their garlic noodles was good.. they give you a whole crab with different flavors to choose from.. too much work. There was also other random dishes. So far so goOD!

excerpts: Garlic noodles are a must, even if you'll have to have a mint afterwards.
garlic noodles.author: Linh L.
garlic noodles.review:
This place is one of those "special occasion" restaurants as I would like to call it.  The whole experience: from the decor to the classy atmosphere and the excellent service, and valet parking too...you come here for a great meal when you want to celebrate a birthday, promotion, etc. or bring a special date.  It will be memorable indeed!

The roasted crab was amazing and perfectly seasoned, so much that I hope no one noticed me trying to get every morsel. Garlic noodles are a must, even if you'll have to have a mint afterwards. 

Bonus: I love reading about the history and family who started it. It adds to the special experience.

excerpts: We ordered the crab, king prawns, appetizers, and garlic noodles.
We had noodles left over and our waiter asked if we wanted to pack it up to go
we said yes
so he took our plates back to the kitchen to pack it up....
Went to work and it was lunch time
so I was excited to warm up my food and sat down ready to dig in.
As I took about 3 bites I see something dark in there and come to my surprise
it was a knot of hair..
not one strand it was like if someone took it out of a brush and placed it in there
or it had fallen on the floor and the waiter just packed it up without saying anything to anyone.
I was in complete disbelief and shock.
I literally wanted to throw up.
I decided to call the store manager and spoke to Dang Vu.
All he can do was apologize and he did take my word for it.
All he could say was I've never heard this before and only has heard of one strand but never a full knot.
He only offered to give me free drinks or noodles if I ever go back which
I highly doubt I will EVER.
My coworkers and friends raved about this place and don't get me wrong
it was good but couldn't believe what happened towards the end.
I was I would have checked it before leaving.
You just don't expect for this to happen.
Dang said he would investigate further.
I'm trying to be understanding
but I really hope he investigates.
The person that did this can really ruin your business.
They lost a customer that's for sure.
( I can't believe I recommend them all over my social media account)
Anyways, moral of the story is check your to-go food before leaving the restaurant.
I will provide photos..
WARNING you might wanna puke after viewing them.

excerpts: They are known for their crab and garlic noodles for a reason.

Parking also sucks which is expected of SF, so the closest available parking is expensive valet parking as well.

All very flavorful and well portioned.
Good wine list and bar.
garlic noodles.author: Derek C.
garlic noodles.review: First time here, but definitely a favorite for future SF visits. Had the Shaken Beef and Garlic Noodles. All very flavorful and well portioned.  Good wine list and bar.

excerpts: For six of us, we ordered 2 of each of the following, unless noted otherwise:  Salt & pepper calamari ($11.95); Soft shell crab ($12.25); Garlic toast ($3.75); Spicy eggplant w/ shrimp (19.25); Lemon grass chicken ($19.25); Saigon beef ($24.95 - one); Bo luc lac ($25.50 - one); Garlic noodles ($10.95 - three); and Roasted crab ($48.95 - market price).
Secondarily, the soft shell crab was a tad overcooked and overpriced.
Nonetheless, is tasted good:  3 Stars.
Thirdly, the garlic toast was OK.
It didn't taste that garlicky.
TL's version of garlic noodles are the best I have had.
The noodles were al dente, weren't drowned in sauce, and the amount of garlic flavor was perfect.
No wonder so many places try to copy this dish:  5+++ Stars.
Secondarily, the roasted crab was excellent.
I used the head as a bowl.
The meat was moist and wonderfully seasoned.
I'd definitely come back here, but I'd stick to the seafood and garlic noodles that are excellent.
The turf dishes are not that good.
Lastly, most of the prices are high, but I was pretty full without the chicken, eggplant and soft shell crab that we added later.
garlic noodles.author: Joe P.
garlic noodles.review:
HTF does Thanh Long open in 1971, but I never came here when I lived in the Bay?  Just ignorant, I guess.  This place started the Viet seafood craze before it became fashionable.  TL is located on Judah b/t 46th & 47th in the Outer Sunset (3 blocks from beach).  Sister restaurants are Crustacean on Polk in SF and in Beverly Hills.

For six of us, we ordered 2 of each of the following, unless noted otherwise:  Salt & pepper calamari ($11.95); Soft shell crab ($12.25); Garlic toast ($3.75); Spicy eggplant w/ shrimp (19.25); Lemon grass chicken ($19.25); Saigon beef ($24.95 - one); Bo luc lac ($25.50 - one); Garlic noodles ($10.95 - three); and Roasted crab ($48.95 - market price).

First of all, the calamari was very good.  It had excellent flavor and was not greasy.  The only downside was the price:  4 Stars.  Secondarily, the soft shell crab was a tad overcooked and overpriced.  Nonetheless, is tasted good:  3 Stars.  Thirdly, the garlic toast was OK.  It didn't taste that garlicky.  We would have been better off with the mussels served on toast:  3 Stars.

For our main courses, the spicy eggplant was very good.  The eggplant was firm and not overcooked like many restaurants.  Downsides were there wasn't much shrimp and the price:  3 Stars.  Secondarily, the chicken was colorful, but the lemongrass really didn't stand out.  It too was overpriced:  3 Stars.  Our first beef dish didn't really do anything to excite us.  The flavor was OK, but like the other dishes, it was overpriced:  3 Stars.  On the other hand, the second beef dish was tender and nicely seasoned.  The only downside was the price:  4 Stars.  

Our last two dishes, were the best.  TL's version of garlic noodles are the best I have had.  The noodles were al dente, weren't drowned in sauce, and the amount of garlic flavor was perfect.  No wonder so many places try to copy this dish:  5+++ Stars.  Secondarily, the roasted crab was excellent.  I used the head as a bowl.  The meat was moist and wonderfully seasoned.  It wasn't as good as R & G in Chinatown, but it still was one of the two best dishes of the evening:  5 Stars.

Regarding the service, it was outstanding.  Our waitress was excellent, and took very good care of us.  She didn't write any of our orders down (inc drinks), and didn't miss anything.  The food came out quickly, and we were constantly given new bowls for our crab shells:  5 Stars.  On the other hand, the ambiance was just OK.  This place is a quaint cozy place.  However, the bathroom was kinda dirty, and the valet was expensive at $12:  3 Stars.

I'd definitely come back here, but I'd stick to the seafood and garlic noodles that are excellent.  The turf dishes are not that good.  Lastly, most of the prices are high, but I was pretty full without the chicken, eggplant and soft shell crab that we added later.

excerpts: I ve been  going to Thanh Long since 1996, yesterday was the first time the garlic noodles were off in taste, when just the 2 of us we easily spend $300.
Plus on food & drinks, I don't know if there was a different cook or cook was having a bad day
but Saturday March 3, of the first ppl in the garlic noodles had no taste

excerpts: Our party of four was stuffed from: roasted crab, prawns over garlic noodles, mango salad, and shaking beef.
We then stuffed ourselves some more with dessert: fried banana with vanilla ice cream and a caramel cheesecake.
Everything was amazing, but I'm definitely still dreaming of roasted crab and garlic noodles.
I would happily live the rest of my life with garlic breath if I could eat those two items everyday.
garlic noodles.author: Matt W.
garlic noodles.review: Can't believe I've lived in this neighborhood all my life and have only just dined at Thanh Long this week. I feel like this restaurant is a San Francisco institution! It was packed on a Sunday evening, but we were seated immediately thanks to Yelp Reservations. Our party of four was stuffed from: roasted crab, prawns over garlic noodles, mango salad, and shaking beef. We then stuffed ourselves some more with dessert: fried banana with vanilla ice cream and a caramel cheesecake. Everything was amazing, but I'm definitely still dreaming of roasted crab and garlic noodles. I would happily live the rest of my life with garlic breath if I could eat those two items everyday.

excerpts: You want the best garlic noodles and whole crab in the city?
Thanh Long has it!!
Start with the salt and pepper calamari and soft shell crabs and cruise into the whole crab and garlic noodles for the main.
Eat the crab and noodles as you go, or shell all the crab and combine with the noodles and drizzle pepper butter over it all.
A bottle or two of a nice white
and you've got a great date night!!

garlic noodles.review: You want the best garlic noodles and whole crab in the city?  Thanh Long has it!!  Start with the salt and pepper calamari and soft shell crabs and cruise into the whole crab and garlic noodles for the main.  Eat the crab and noodles as you go, or shell all the crab and combine with the noodles and drizzle pepper butter over it all.  A bottle or two of a nice white and you've got a great date night!!

The proprietary prepared dungenous grab is a must try if you love dungenous crab.
I have tried to mimic the dungenous rub to no avial but will defintely advise dungie lovers to ayleast try the vra .q11

Not good.
Garlic noodles were ok.
I am not a pasta, top ramen eater, so to me the noodles were not that great.
One of my daughters had the eggplant dish which I tasted and it was good.
My other daughter had the shrimp and pork medallions, which was good.
garlic noodles.author: Nadine S.
garlic noodles.review:
Went here yesterday for my birthday dinner. I had heard about this place for years. Totally overrated and overpriced. I had the jumbo prawns and garlic noodles. Prawns were jumbo, but dry and hard. Not good. Garlic noodles were ok. I am not a pasta, top ramen eater, so to me the noodles were not that great. One of my daughters had the eggplant dish which I tasted and it was good. My other daughter had the shrimp and pork medallions, which was good. 
For starters, I had the salt and pepper calamari, which was good, but some were too salty! 
Overall, I think this small popular, two bathroom stalls, is totally, totally, overrated and overpriced.
One good thing about this place is the service was good, which should be expected at such an overpriced and overrated restaurant!!!!!!

excerpts: Loved the garlic noodles and the calamari.
Drinks were good too, like a service.
Definitely going back!
garlic noodles.author: Sabrina L.
garlic noodles.review: Pretty nice food. Well-made. Loved the garlic noodles and the calamari. Drinks were good too, like a service. Definitely going back!

excerpts: Well, usually with a cocktail and then with some garlic rice and/or garlic noodles.
Then it's all about the crab!
garlic noodles.author: Sarah O.
garlic noodles.review: Where do I start?  Well, usually with a cocktail and then with some garlic rice and/or garlic noodles. Then it's all about the crab!  The Drunken Crab is my favorite and I have tried them all. This place is always packed and there is almost always a wait, but it is totally worth it!

excerpts: We also had crab puff and garlic noodles.
garlic noodles.author: Adam L.
garlic noodles.review:
I don't understand the hype around the "roast crab". It wasn't as great as the hype makes it out to be. Also I expected a lot bigger crab for $55! The crab came out so quick, one can probably assume it was pre-made in the kitchen. First, it wasn't even hot on the inside. It appears they roast the crabs and leave the garlic oil and seasoning until its ordered. Then they pour the seasoning and oil on top of the crab to make it hot again. also the crab was 1.5 lbs or so. I can get that size crab at Ranch 99 or something for $7.99/lb. So about $12 for that same size crab that I had to pay $55 for. That seasoning isn't worth $43! 

With that said, the seasoning and taste itself was good. Just not worth the price. We also had shaken beef which was good. But again portion vs. price, not worth it. 

We also had crab puff and garlic noodles. Both of which were expensive and again portion isn't worth the price. 

So overall you get my theme here. Its not worth it to come here.

excerpts: I once again enjoyed the roasted crab and jumbo prawns with garlic noodles.
*drool
* I also ordered the rasberry lemon drop martini.
My dining experience once again did not disappoint & I was reminded as to why it is one of my hometown favs.
garlic noodles.author: Analisa K.
garlic noodles.review: One of my favorite places to eat for special occasions! I'm a homegrown San Franciscan but now live in Florida.  I recently was back home & was lucky enough to have my birthday dinner here with dear friends. I once again enjoyed the roasted crab and jumbo prawns with garlic noodles. *drool* I also ordered the rasberry lemon drop martini. My dining experience once again did not disappoint & I was reminded as to why it is one of my hometown favs.

excerpts: The garlic noodles....
oh where do I start, it seems so simple yet its probably one of the best items on the menu.
garlic noodles.author: CJ B.
garlic noodles.review:
I love this restaurant! We came here when we were in town and loved almost everything we had. The mussels are done to a perfection and the crostini adds a bit more to the dish that complements the mussels. 

The garlic noodles....oh where do I start, it seems so simple yet its probably one of the best items on the menu. It's literally a plate of noodles, nothing else on the plate, but that's pretty much all you need.

Salmon Carpaccio, you can probably skip on, it's definitely not the best but it's not terrible either. Then the shaken beef....it's not bad either but I definitely not worth $25.95 at all. The portion is rather small....we ordered that thinking we could share it but definitely not enough for more than one adult. 

I'm pretty sure there were 3 different ways you can get the crab done, make sure you get the roast crab! And get ready to get all greasy and dirty! It will be worth every bite!

excerpts: When I was young, my aunt would sometimes bring home the popular garlic noodles from this place.
I thought it to be the best garlic noodles ever actually.
But they weren't that great when I tried it again this weekend.
The noodles were a little overcooked and flavor just wasn't there.
garlic noodles.author: Derek T.
garlic noodles.review:
After all these years of living so close to Thanh Long, I've finally tried it! Sadly, it was very disappointing.

Every time I eat crab with my mom, she would always compare it to the infamous roasted crab at Thanh Long. She would always say that the crab is super fresh here. When I came here this past weekend, it tasted far from fresh. The crab was obviously frozen. Some of the meat in the smaller legs were actually kind of gross and the texture was very off. The worst part? The (frozen) crab cost me and my friend $54!!!! Seriously?!?

When I was young, my aunt would sometimes bring home the popular garlic noodles from this place. I thought it to be the best garlic noodles ever actually. But they weren't that great when I tried it again this weekend. The noodles were a little overcooked and flavor just wasn't there. I have to say the jumbo prawns on top were seasoned and cooked pretty good though.

We also ordered the shaking beef, which was just okay also. The meat was tender, but the flavor wasn't amazing or anything.

Overall, I feel like this restaurant has certainly gone down in terms of quality. Everything is overpriced, especially for what you're getting. I don't mind paying a good price as long as it's good. I would give this place one star, but the service was really good.

excerpts: You definitely need to make a reservation in advance because there are many people who come here to eat the whole salt and pepper roasted Dungeness crab and the yummy garlic noodles.
That's pretty much all we ordered plus a bowl of sautéed veggies
and we demolished it all.
After putting on some bibs, we got to work cracking open the crab and eating the juicy meat, dipping it in the butter, salt and pepper.
It was so tasty!
The crabs are large and fill up the whole plate.
The way they roast it and cook it makes the shell a little easier to crack.
You'll definitely get your fingers dirty working on the crab, but it's so worth it!
Probably not the best choice for a first date though.
I am salivating just thinking about that meal again and we will definitely be back here for more crab and garlic noodles the next time we visit SF!
A must!
garlic noodles.author: Sonya K.
garlic noodles.review: Our friends took us to eat at Thanh Long for our last meal before heading out from SF. It was absolutely amazing!!! You definitely need to make a reservation in advance because there are many people who come here to eat the whole salt and pepper roasted Dungeness crab and the yummy garlic noodles. That's pretty much all we ordered plus a bowl of sautéed veggies and we demolished it all. After putting on some bibs, we got to work cracking open the crab and eating the juicy meat, dipping it in the butter, salt and pepper. It was so tasty! The crabs are large and fill up the whole plate. The way they roast it and cook it makes the shell a little easier to crack. You'll definitely get your fingers dirty working on the crab, but it's so worth it! Probably not the best choice for a first date though. I am salivating just thinking about that meal again and we will definitely be back here for more crab and garlic noodles the next time we visit SF! A must!

excerpts: The garlic noodles was legit too.
garlic noodles.author: Theresa S.
garlic noodles.review:
Skipped my work holiday party and decided to come here with a bunch of friends instead.

Made reservations online via Open Table, so waiting wasn't an issue for us. Although parking is horrible. Ended up valeting the car instead.

Place is pretty spacious and not as stuffy as their sister restaurant, so it had a more laid back, let me use all 10 fingers instead of the tiny fork vibe. The Mister and I ordered the roasted crab & drunken crab(supposed to be spicy) and to be honest, it tasted the same. Which isn't a bad thing at all because it was good! The garlic noodles was legit too. 

The service was great! Our glass was always full with water, wine, and beer! Definitely a place I'll revisit.

excerpts: The garlic noodles are insanely good, and I have to get back asap to try the crab.
garlic noodles.author: Nicole H.
garlic noodles.review:
One of the best things I've ever ate is the eggplant dish at Thanh Long. It's something I dream about...seriously.

Everything I've ever had here has been fantastic. The garlic noodles are insanely good, and I have to get back asap to try the crab.

Highly, highly recommend!!!

excerpts: The Dungeness crabs are amazing... and don't forget the garlic noodles!
The plates are big enough to share with family, but we usually get our own crabs (we don't like sharing something this yummy).
garlic noodles.author: Maria T.
garlic noodles.review: Every time my family comes to visit, we come here. The Dungeness crabs are amazing... and don't forget the garlic noodles! The plates are big enough to share with family, but we usually get our own crabs (we don't like sharing something this yummy).

excerpts: We had the mussels for an appetizer, the roast crab, the prawns w garlic noodles, and an extra side of garlic noodles because it's our favorite hah.
garlic noodles.author: Ria A.
garlic noodles.review:
Delicious food and amazing service! 

I made a reservation for a Saturday and it was very busy. We got there and I told the host that we had a reservation. We waited less than 3 minutes and were seated. The waiter was very prompt to taking our order and our food came out quickly. After we finished our appetizer the waiter even asked us if it was ok for the chef to start cooking our main dish. I want to say that our food came out in less than 10-15 minutes. 

We had the mussels for an appetizer, the roast crab, the prawns w garlic noodles, and an extra side of garlic noodles because it's our favorite hah. Everything was amazing, no complaints and we devoured our food and left with full bellies. 

Parking is only valet and it was $20 because we drove an SUV. It was also pay before instead of after so we had to run to the 7-11 across the street to get money from the ATM. 

But otherwise, Thanh long is still one of my favorites!

excerpts: A must is the garlic noodles and crab!
The calamari was also really good
and so was the eggplant dish!
Give the lychee martini a try too if you're in the mood to drink.
Make a reservation because they are only open for dinner and fill up real quick!
The service was good, but not great, a couple of times we had to flag someone down to help us, but I would go back strictly just for the food.
Parking is also difficult, but they do have valet service.
garlic noodles.author: Dennise B.
garlic noodles.review: I've been here once before and since then I've been dreaming to go back. A must is the garlic noodles and crab! The calamari was also really good and so was the eggplant dish! Give the lychee martini a try too if you're in the mood to drink. Make a reservation because they are only open for dinner and fill up real quick! The service was good, but not great, a couple of times we had to flag someone down to help us, but I would go back strictly just for the food. Parking is also difficult, but they do have valet service.

excerpts: Garlic noodles were the best I ever had.
Roasted crab was worth the $55 price.
Also had the coconut prawns.
Very good for an appetizer.
Didn't really care of the shaken beef-
the garlic was overkill.
Would come back again for a special occasion.
Can't wait!
garlic noodles.author: Rogelia G.
garlic noodles.review: Garlic noodles were the best I ever had. Roasted crab was worth the $55 price. Also had the coconut prawns. Very good for an appetizer. Didn't really care of the shaken beef- the garlic was overkill. Would come back again for a special occasion. Can't wait!

excerpts: The garlic noodles are addictive the garlic crab was just prepared impeccably.
We will certainly return, introduce our friends to the place, and bring out of town guests!
Glad we made a reservation though the place was packed.
Now I know why
garlic noodles.author: Kathy S.
garlic noodles.review: Best meal since I have been living in California! Not only was the food incredible but the service was great!! The garlic noodles are addictive the garlic crab was just prepared impeccably. We will certainly return, introduce our friends to the place, and bring out of town guests! Glad we made a reservation though the place was packed. Now I know why

excerpts: The garlic noodles are good but not great.
The calamari was nice and fresh.
We enjoyed the whole evening.
garlic noodles.author: Wildeflower M.
garlic noodles.review: Really enjoyed the crab. We ordered all three varieties. The garlic noodles are good but not great. The calamari was nice and fresh. We enjoyed the whole evening.

excerpts: garlic noodles
- these are a bit more delicate than those you find at other restaurants.
they came out nice and warm.
garlic noodles.author: Vanessa S.
garlic noodles.review:
great food, excellent service and a nice ambiance. i'm not sure why people are complaining about the price? yes, it is pricey but isn't that a given going into this? if you're looking for a more budget option, try another place in the city.

we ordered the:
mussels - delicious! bread was toasted perfectly
calamari - fried nicely, not oily. if you think it is under seasoned...that is what the onions and such are there for.
roast crab - yum yum yum! both of our crabs came out clean and hot. everyone at the table loved the whole meal. i found a few pieces of my meat to be a bit on the salty side but i was the only one who felt that way. a table right next to us had a crab each, those lucky ones!
garlic noodles - these are a bit more delicate than those you find at other restaurants. they came out nice and warm. i liked that the noodles weren't quite as thick, personal preference.

for dessert we had:
fried ice cream - i was told this was excellent. it got gobbled up in about five minutes so i think they were being sincere. make sure to get the chocolate and whipped cream on top.
fried banana with ice cream - very good. we didn't get the chocolate or whipped cream, which we will definitely do the next time around.

excerpts: but I'll say this was a notch better -- especially their garlic noodles.
They weren't  overly garlicky and the noodles weren't overly cooked either.
garlic noodles.author: Marvin H.
garlic noodles.review:
This was my first time coming here. I've been to Crustaceans but I'll say this was a notch better -- especially their garlic noodles. They weren't  overly garlicky and the noodles weren't overly cooked either. It was chewy and flavorful goodness for sure.

Also ordered their mango salad. One thing I noticed was that the menu stated that it comes with sautéed scallops but my plate came with sautéed shrimp. Despite the incorrect order, the salad was still delicious.

Also ordered 2 whole dungeoness crabs which were delicious -- although I don't understand why they didn't give us more than 2 crab crackers to use (we had a party of 6). 

Oh beware for the valet parking -- it's $12 and street parking is very limited!

excerpts: Garlic noodles & the Roast Crab is my family favorite.
Waiters/waitress' are always on it and taking care of you.
Definitely a hidden gem in San Francisco.
garlic noodles.author: Mikayla A.
garlic noodles.review: My family has been going here since I was in elementary. I'm 20 years old now and this is the go to place for special occasions. Don't get me wrong, it's very pricey but worth it. Garlic noodles & the Roast Crab is my family favorite. Waiters/waitress' are always on it and taking care of you. Definitely a hidden gem in San Francisco.

excerpts: I was craving crab and garlic noodles, so I decided to order delivery through Postmates.
*Garlic noodles: an's famous noodles made with special garlic sauce & secret spices ($10.95)
Where was the garlic flavor?
Or any flavor at all?!
I had to pour some garlic oil from the crab onto the noodles.
I don't know what happened to the delicious crab and garlic noodles I remember having about five years ago.
Now, everything is just bland and disappointing.
garlic noodles.author: Elena N.
garlic noodles.review:
Thanh long, what happened to you?

I was craving crab and garlic noodles, so I decided to order delivery through Postmates. Got two secret kitchen dishes.

*Garlic noodles: an's famous noodles made with special garlic sauce & secret spices ($10.95)
Where was the garlic flavor? Or any flavor at all?! I had to pour some garlic oil from the crab onto the noodles. It gave it flavor, but also made the noodles oily.

*Roast crab: a whole dungeness crab roasted with an's garlic sauce & secret spices ($48.96)
Same here. Where's the garlic flavor? The oil infused a subtle hint of garlic along with some of their spices, but I remember their crab having a bolder flavor. This was like eating crab dipped in seasoned oil. Not my favorite.

I don't know what happened to the delicious crab and garlic noodles I remember having about five years ago. Now, everything is just bland and disappointing.

excerpts: Then for the main course I had to have their famous garlic roasted crab and garlic noodles on the side.
OMG simply superb.
The staff did an awesome service.
5 stars doesn't do them justice.
Definitely a must try
garlic noodles.author: Kevin W.
garlic noodles.review: This was my first time!  It was awesome. The appetizers we tried were the fried calamari and the vermicelli rolls.  The calamari was a winner. Then for the main course I had to have their famous garlic roasted crab and garlic noodles on the side. OMG simply superb. The staff did an awesome service. 5 stars doesn't do them justice. Definitely a must try

excerpts: To this day, I still have dreams of the garlic noodles.
I know the restaurant is known for its dungeness crab, which was good but the garlic noodles shined.
For a party of 3, we ordered two dungeness crabs (salt and pepper), two garlic noodles (i wish we ordered more), and a sauté vegetable dish (to try to be healthy).
The dungeness crabs were seasoned very well but the meat was not as sweet as it could be.
The garlic noodles were doused with garlic and oil.
The noodles were flavorful, moist and chewy.
If we could have ordered more, I would have ordered more garlic noodles.
garlic noodles.author: Hong L.
garlic noodles.review:
To this day, I still have dreams of the garlic noodles. I know the restaurant is known for its dungeness crab, which was good but the garlic noodles shined. 

We made reservations here (a must) and was surprisingly able to find parking nearby. For a party of 3, we ordered two dungeness crabs (salt and pepper), two garlic noodles (i wish we ordered more), and a sauté vegetable dish (to try to be healthy). The dungeness crabs were seasoned very well but the meat was not as sweet as it could be. The garlic noodles were doused with garlic and oil. The noodles were flavorful, moist and chewy. If we could have ordered more, I would have ordered more garlic noodles.

excerpts: we always order the same thing the roasted crab,garlic noodles, rock salt and pepper fried calamari appetizer.
My husband loves the desert which is a ice cream and pineapple.
Try it you'll like it!
I guarantee you will come back.
garlic noodles.author: Kerry J.
garlic noodles.review: My family and I have been coming here for over 15 years at least once a month.  it's a little bit pricey but worth it we always order the same thing the roasted crab,garlic noodles, rock salt and pepper fried calamari appetizer.My husband loves the desert which is a ice cream and pineapple. Try it you'll like it! I guarantee you will come back.

excerpts: Colossal Prawns served with garlic noodles - 4 stars.
(I'm not really a shrimp person)
Spicy eggplant with Chicken - 5 stars.
Just enough spice with a ton of flavor.
The sweet and spicy sauce was killer!
We didn't order crab since we're both not into crab really.
(And frankly, I'm lazy to eat that stuff)
We didn't have enough room for dessert
so we skipped that.
Our waitress was super nice, fast and very attentive!
We got our food in less than 10 minutes upon ordering.
I'll definitely come back here again.
For a dinner of 2, we spent about $120.
Definitely worth it!
garlic noodles.author: Anna Y.
garlic noodles.review:
My BF mentioned this place as he lives around the area. It's walking distance to his apartment. So Sunday night (before Memorial Day), we didn't feel like cooking so he asked if I wanted to try this place. I first went to Yelp for reviews and famous dishes. For 3 $$$ signs, I thought - this is pretty expensive for a seafood place but maybe worth a try since we're nearby? Best decision ever made. I made a reservation (via yelp) and got a 5:30pm dinner reservation. (Yep, we eat dinner early. LOL) When we arrived, there were a few people waiting outside. We checked in (around 5:45) and got seated right away. The place was PACKED at 5:45pm!!
I got excited as I saw people enjoying their dishes. We started with their fresh spring rolls - they were light and bite size. Good and healthy start for an appetizer since we were going to have a lot of sodium later on. Ha! We ordered some of their staple dishes: Shaken Beef - 5 stars. Colossal Prawns served with garlic noodles - 4 stars. (I'm not really a shrimp person) Spicy eggplant with Chicken - 5 stars. Just enough spice with a ton of flavor. The sweet and spicy sauce was killer! We didn't order crab since we're both not into crab really. (And frankly, I'm lazy to eat that stuff) We didn't have enough room for dessert so we skipped that. Our waitress was super nice, fast and very attentive! We got our food in less than 10 minutes upon ordering. I'll definitely come back here again. For a dinner of 2, we spent about $120. Definitely worth it!

excerpts: Then the garlic noodles!
So good!
Best when eaten hot, so get it on your plate then into your belly fast.
The noodles were a nice chewy texture and a subtle garlic flavor that was nothing as powerful as its garlic aroma.
garlic noodles.author: Truc N.
garlic noodles.review:
On the night of the full moon, we ventured out of the city. We drove towards the setting sun, passing many other good lookin' eateries, promised a crab coma experience...

We entered a simple door. The garlic pervaded everything. It was the kind that made you hungry, newly fried garlic that makes your mouth water. All around, people sat with plastic bibs! The group of diners to my left were happily passing around the famous noodles. The couple in front of me finished ordering and started to tie back their hair. An odd thing to do, but soon I'd fully understand.

I glanced down at the menu and inhaled the garlic permeating the air, agreeing it was worth the trip from downtown to the other side to eat at Thanh Long. My hometown, Nha Trang, was even labeled on the menu cover. :-) Then, the waiters tied a bib on me and walked away with a knowing look. We started with the salmon carpaccio and the shrimp toast. The salmon was sliced thinly enough to hold full flavor and the citrus hit was perfect. The shrimp toast was pillow goodness. The topping reminded me of the shrimp paste around sugar cane.

Then the garlic noodles! So good! Best when eaten hot, so get it on your plate then into your belly fast. The noodles were a nice chewy texture and a subtle garlic flavor that was nothing as powerful as its garlic aroma. Then again, you're hit with garlic the moment you walk in.

Then...THE CRAB! Some of the best Dungeoness crab I've ever eaten. My table ordered the roasted crab and tamarind crab. Very different. Very satisfying. I paused for a split second to be thankful all my hair was already tied up. No one at my table ate their crab carapaces, so this Vietnamese gal was in heaven with five all to herself! Then, we went garlic crazy and ordered garlic fried rice. The tamarind crab went great with it.

After all this, I had a disappointing fried banana. Others had the orange sherbet and the molten lava cake and enjoyed their desserts. My fried banana had no hint of a sugar finish...brown, white, nor palm. The banana was no where near sweet enough to carry it. 

But, I went for the crab, not the dessert. So, high ratings from me.

excerpts: He asked if we wanted appetizers, but we were ready for our crab and garlic noodles.
The garlic noodles was AMAZING!!
I'm in love :-)
yum yum yum.
I can't wait to be back here.
I can't wait to come back.
I'm drooling thinking about it the crab and garlic noodles...
garlic noodles.author: Y. Abigail H.
garlic noodles.review:
Yum yum yum. I long to return :-)

Came here on a Friday evening with a reservation for two. They seated us right away upstairs :) I like upstairs! Not as crowded as downstairs and I like the red walls and the dim lighting - nice ambiance!

Anyways, on to the food and service. 

Staff is very friendly!! The hostess greeted us with a smile, and made us feel so welcomed. Our waiter was also very courteous. He asked if we wanted appetizers, but we were ready for our crab and garlic noodles. So he knew to not waste our time and got us our meals pretty quickly

The crab was AMAZING!!! The garlic noodles was AMAZING!! I'm in love :-) yum yum yum. I can't wait to be back here. I can't wait to come back. I'm drooling thinking about it the crab and garlic noodles... ;-) yum:)

excerpts: We ordered crab puffs, roast crab, prawns with garlic noodles, and vegetable sauté.
Everything was delicious.
The roast crab was the best crab I've ever eaten.
garlic noodles.author: Ben S.
garlic noodles.review:
My hands have never been more buttered and I've never been more happy. 

Our server Eric was our trusted advisor from the beginning. We ordered crab puffs, roast crab, prawns with garlic noodles, and vegetable sauté. Everything was delicious. We also got a quite reasonably priced bottle of champagne to celebrate our anniversary. 

They were the best crab puffs (crab rangoon) I've ever eaten. 

The roast crab was the best crab I've ever eaten. 

We finished our meal with fried pineapple and ice cream. Amazing.

excerpts: Martinis, the garlic noodles...
YES!!
Already planning to go there again
and it's the next day...
garlic noodles.author: Ian P.
garlic noodles.review: Umm... Did that just happen?! THE BEST CRAB IVE EVER HAD!! Seriously, I'm not being overly dramatic. MY BEST. From the EXCELLENT SERVICE, to the on point Martinis, the garlic noodles...YES!! Already planning to go there again and it's the next day...

excerpts: I usually go to PPQ on clement whenever I crave for crab and garlic noodles.
I haven't been here in over 10 years and after today this is the reason why I don't come here anymore.
We ordered roasted crab and garlic noodles.
Good thing
I didn't ordered anything else
Bc I would of been more piss.
After we ordered, our food came in less than 10 min.
I was shocked bc how can they possibly cook the crab and garlic noodles so fast.
As I took the first bite of the crab I was already piss.
The crab was cold AF and had no taste.
I can make this crab better than this.
They basically had the crab pre-cooked in advance and just drizzled it with butter, salt and pepper on top and that was it.
It was so plain.
As for the garlic noodles it was probably pre cooked as well
Bc it was cold.
As I went to use the restroom I seen around 3+ chefs just standing there doing nothing.
So I'm assuming they just have a whole pot of pre cooked crab already to serve.
Food was horrible and over priced!
Roasted crab + garlic noodles =
$76 and some change.
Seriously, $58 for a cold crab with butter, salt and pepper?
No thank you.
In PPQ I can get papaya salad w/egg rolls, garlic noodles, roasted crab for the price I paid at Thanh long.
This place deserves zero stars, but there is no option for this
so I had to give it 1 star.
garlic noodles.author: Riza P.
garlic noodles.review:
Decided to try this place again. I usually go to PPQ on clement whenever I crave for crab and garlic noodles. I haven't been here in over 10 years and after today this is the reason why I don't come here anymore. We ordered roasted crab and garlic noodles. Good thing I didn't ordered anything else Bc I would of been more piss. After we ordered, our food came in less than 10 min. I was shocked bc how can they possibly cook the crab and garlic noodles so fast. As I took the first bite of the crab I was already piss. The crab was cold AF and had no taste. I can make this crab better than this. They basically had the crab pre-cooked in advance and just drizzled it with butter, salt and pepper on top and that was it. It was so plain. As for the garlic noodles it was probably pre cooked as well Bc it was cold. As I went to use the restroom I seen around 3+ chefs just standing there doing nothing. So I'm assuming they just have a whole pot of pre cooked crab already to serve. Food was horrible and over priced!  Roasted crab + garlic noodles = $76 and some change. Seriously, $58 for a cold crab with butter, salt and pepper? No thank you. You can make this yourself at home. 

I'd rather go to PPQ in clement. In PPQ I can get papaya salad w/egg rolls, garlic noodles, roasted crab for the price I paid at Thanh long.  This place deserves zero stars, but there is no option for this so I had to give it 1 star.

excerpts: The garlic noodles was oily and small portion for its price.
The waiter was pushy and two faced.
garlic noodles.author: Janita s.
garlic noodles.review: It used to be a lot better in both their food and service.  The crab was bland and soggy.   The mix vegetable was a joke.   The garlic noodles was oily and small portion for its price.  The waiter was pushy and two faced.   The only dish we like was the fried rice.

excerpts: Came here with a group of four and got the shaken beef, 2 orders of garlic noodles (obvi), roast crab, and drunken crab.
More than enough to feed four hungry hippos.
The garlic noodles were perfection, the shaken beef was tender and melted in our mouths.
The garlic noodles were perfection, the shaken beef was tender and melted in our mouths.
I preferred the roast crab over the drunken crab, but only by a little.
I preferred the roast crab over the drunken crab, but only by a little.
garlic noodles.author: Selena L.
garlic noodles.review:
Came here with a group of four and got the shaken beef, 2 orders of garlic noodles (obvi), roast crab, and drunken crab. More than enough to feed four hungry hippos. The garlic noodles were perfection, the shaken beef was tender and melted in our mouths. I preferred the roast crab over the drunken crab, but only by a little. You really can't go wrong.

2 floors, valet parking ($12), full bar, call for reservations if you don't want to be waiting forever.

excerpts: The garlic noodles were dry.
2 crabs, garlic rice, garlic noodles and salad came out to about $170.
Ouch!
My partner loved the crab and will return.
Honestly, there are other restaurants that serve really good crab, but won't cost an arm and a leg.
The restaurant was crowded, and the service was excellent.
garlic noodles.author: Rose S.
garlic noodles.review: Heard this was the best crab restaurant in town. Disappointingly, this was not the case in my opinion. The roasted crab was pretty good. The garlic noodles were dry. The garlic rice, dry; Not worth the high prices. 2 crabs, garlic rice, garlic noodles and salad came out to about $170. Ouch! My partner loved the crab and will return. Honestly, there are other restaurants that serve really good crab, but won't cost an arm and a leg. The restaurant was crowded, and the service was excellent.

excerpts: Anyway,  roast crab was really good (both times i visited) especially when paired with garlic noodles.
It was really good but too big that I couldnt finish and had to take some to go.
As for the starters, my fave is still salt & pepper calamari.
garlic noodles.author: Isabella D.
garlic noodles.review:
I've only been here twice. I would give them 4 stars but the service on my second visit wasn't really up to my liking. Our server was kinda slow and most of the time, we were left waiting for him to come back to either take our orders or bring the bill. We are a party of seven so gratuity was already included in our bill. So to me it felt like he wasn't trying anymore to service us. 
 
Anyway,  roast crab was really good (both times i visited) especially when paired with garlic noodles. It was really good but too big that I couldnt finish and had to take some to go. As for the starters, my fave is still salt & pepper calamari. The shrimp toast was okay too, but i prefer calamari. I had creme brulee cheesecake for dessert. The crust was the best part. The chocolate lava is also recommended if you're not a fan of cheesecake.

They are closed on Mondays and open for dinner time only. The restaurant gets really busy (and it's not that big). We had to make a reservation just to make sure that we can get seats and don't have to wait. We arrived on time and our table was ready when we came in. Parking is really hard to find, one of the reasons why I dont frequent this place. They have valet parking but they charge extra if you have a large size car.

excerpts: Ordered "Secret Kitchen" items of baked crab ($53.00), Jumbo black tiger prawns with garlic noodles and order of Garlic Noodles.
Took home 1/2 order of the fried rice and whole order of garlic noodles.
garlic noodles.author: Leann S.
garlic noodles.review:
First of all reservations are recommended this is a busy place.  Valet parking is $12.00 but this is a very residential area and parking is a premium.  I am currently in a wheel chair and the staff found me a place to wait out of the way  that made the time pass more pleasantly as I was not looking at everyone's belt buckle.

Nice bar menu and my husband had the Asian Martini that was very good.

Ordered "Secret Kitchen" items of baked crab ($53.00), Jumbo black tiger prawns with garlic noodles and order of Garlic Noodles.  Also ordered Fried Rice with shrimp, scallops and crab meat.  All dishes were delicious. Sure it is expensive but every once in a while you need to splurge and this is worth it.  Crab was very meaty, moist and seasoned well.  Prawns were great.

Took home 1/2 order of the fried rice and whole order of garlic noodles.  Waiter even provided suggestions on how to reheat in the microwave.

Wait staff and management are super.  Always checking back on you and cleaning away shell often.  Very hot towel is provided at end of meal and it was very nice. 

We will return and suggest this to others to tryl

excerpts: The garlic noodles and roasted crab simply just can't be replicated.
Do yourself a favor and make a reservation or be doomed to sitting uncomfortably between other surrounding tables or in the very back (the less intimate section).
I ALWAYS reserve the corner left table in the front second room.
Shaking beef and eggplant are a must in my book as well.
Wash all the food down with a bottle of Moët and repeat.
Don't forget to take an extra order or 2 of garlic noodles to go!
Bon appetit!
garlic noodles.author: N P.
garlic noodles.review: I've wined and dined at some of the finest restaurants but for one reason this place will always remain my #1 pick. The garlic noodles and roasted crab simply just can't be replicated. Do yourself a favor and make a reservation or be doomed to sitting uncomfortably between other surrounding tables or in the very back (the less intimate section). I ALWAYS reserve the corner left table in the front second room. Shaking beef and eggplant are a must in my book as well. Wash all the food down with a bottle of Moët and repeat. Don't forget to take an extra order or 2 of garlic noodles to go! Bon appetit!

excerpts: There are definitely much better garlic noodles and crab elsewhere.
garlic noodles.author: Han T.
garlic noodles.review:
Ugh wtf. This place is very over-rated. Far cry from any claim of "world famous crab".

I tried the recommended dishes on here particularly roasted crab and garlic noodle and I can say that it is very average. Even the other dishes, was mediocre.
Along with the price though this place is utterly NOT worth it. Not even worth trying.

- parking is horribly difficult. Valet at corner was $12?
- garlic noodle could be more garlic-ky and taste less like dry instant noodles.
- roasted crab is just salty. Nothing special at all by Asian seafood standards. ~$54
- very expensive for the quality, quantity, and taste.

Not recommended at all. There are definitely much better garlic noodles and crab elsewhere.

excerpts: Crab was succulent and the garlic noodles with prawns was superb!
Definitely a must visit!!
Great staff and good drinks!
Truly as S.F. treat!
garlic noodles.author: Tam O.
garlic noodles.review: This was my first time here and everything was great! Crab was succulent and the garlic noodles with prawns was superb! Definitely a must visit!! Great staff and good drinks! Truly as S.F. treat!

excerpts: so we passed on the garlic noodles
but I used to be more satisfied with my dinners here.
What changed???
I just can't seem to justify the price or the hype of this place anymore.
garlic noodles.author: Jocelle A.
garlic noodles.review:
The boyfriend and I came here on an anniversary recently (his first time, mine... not so much) and I don't know what changed but it isn't as good as I remembered it to be. It could've been that the last time I was here may have been a couple of years ago but the food just wasn't as good.

Here's what we ordered:
- roasted garlic crab: it was still yummy with great flavors but the crab didn't seem fresh, it was a bit dry
- shaking beef: dry and seriously over-peppered and too sweet. has it always been like that?
- asparagus seafood soup (of some sort): meh. nothing to write home about. 
- spring rolls: meh. I've had better and for the fraction of the cost. 
- deep fried ice cream: it was good. 

The BF isn't a big fan of overly garlic dishes like I am so we passed on the garlic noodles but I used to be more satisfied with my dinners here. What changed??? I just can't seem to justify the price or the hype of this place anymore.

excerpts: Ordered roasted crabs with garlic noodles.
Both were excellent!
garlic noodles.author: Suparna J.
garlic noodles.review:
Ordered roasted crabs with garlic noodles. Both were excellent! Crab was fresh , buttery and just right amount of pepper. 

We made a reservation , so didn't have to wait in line!!

excerpts: The garlic noodles and roasted crab where way better than my expectations.
The staff was extremely nice and helpful.
The whole establishment itself was awesome.
Do yourself a favor and uber it because you'll be way too full to drive.
garlic noodles.author: Marcus S.
garlic noodles.review: I saw this place on TV and had to try it. This was probably one of the best meals I've ever had in San Francisco. The garlic noodles and roasted crab where way better than my expectations. The staff was extremely nice and helpful. The whole establishment itself was awesome. Do yourself a favor and uber it because you'll be way too full to drive.

excerpts: We always get the garlic noodles, some wine and of course, crab.
garlic noodles.author: Kristin P.
garlic noodles.review:
I try to go to this spot everytime I visit San Francisco.  The service for me has always been a bit iffy (wait times for them to come check on us), but the food has always been great.  We always get the garlic noodles, some wine and of course, crab.  I always get the taramind crab and it's so flavorful and way more food than I can handle.  

The crabs are market price so it will not be a cheap meal, but worth it for the splurge.

excerpts: Long story short, you must order the roast crab ($45) and the garlic noodles ($11)!
Amazing crab and garlic noodles, super quick service (my water was never left empty, and the dishes came out in a flash!), a warm, well decorated ambiance, and good for groups
garlic noodles.author: Corinna T.
garlic noodles.review:
I've been here three times now, so a review is long overdue. Long story short, you must order the roast crab ($45) and the garlic noodles ($11)! I've also tried the calamari appetizer and the shaken beef entree ($23) if you're craving for more food. Both are amazing as well.

Pros: Amazing crab and garlic noodles, super quick service (my water was never left empty, and the dishes came out in a flash!), a warm, well decorated ambiance, and good for groups, although I prefer coming here in smaller parties

Cons: It isn't cheap! I've only come here for special occasions mostly. But trust me, it's well worth your while. It's also pretty dim in here, with the dark red ambiance. It gets crowded, so please do yourself a favor and make a reservation especially for big groups!! 

Overall, I've been pleased with this place consecutively the past 3 times, and I will keep coming back.

excerpts: My friends really enjoyed the garlic noodles although I don't really like them that dry.
I tend to like my noodles on the wetter/saucier side.
garlic noodles.author: Betty T.
garlic noodles.review: Honestly, the crab is a little too hyped. Everyone says the roasted crab is good but I think I enjoy good old fashioned steamed crab better. All you need is a little lemon and pepper and it will taste just as good, plus it won't break your bank. My favorite dish here is the shaken beef. The pieces of beef were the right size, tenderness, and flavorful. I'd take that over the crab anytime. My friends really enjoyed the garlic noodles although I don't really like them that dry. I tend to like my noodles on the wetter/saucier side. The salt and pepper calamari is the perfect appetizer so I would highly recommend that for sharing. Overall, good place for dinner, though on the pricier side. I'm drooling just thinking about the shaken beef.

excerpts: Even the garlic noodles is not as garlic-y than before, the crab is now as high as $55.50 from our last week's dining.
Darn!
It started $35 when my husband first tried this.
Because of the hype, looks like it is becoming so pricey!
If I have a choice, wouldn't come here anymore, even if I am a super seafood lover and addict!
I must persuade my husband not too go here in as much often.
Other than that, the customer service and ambiance is 4star; cleanliness is 5 star, they even clean baby's high chair for us to use it.
Fyi, valet is $12 for cars; SUVs and larger are $20.
garlic noodles.author: Ji V.
garlic noodles.review: Came here for the 4th time in a year now, not because I love their food, but, since this place is  husband's fave dining due to the crab.  I would say, it is not as buttery and pepper-y than the first time I tried it.   Even the garlic noodles is not as garlic-y than before, the crab is now as high as $55.50 from our last week's dining. Darn! It started $35 when my husband first tried this. Because of the hype, looks like it is becoming so pricey! If I have a choice, wouldn't come here anymore, even if I am a super seafood lover and addict! I must persuade my husband not too go here in as much often.  Other than that, the customer service and ambiance is 4star; cleanliness is 5 star, they even clean baby's high chair for us to use it. Fyi, valet is $12 for cars; SUVs and larger are $20.

excerpts: Hands down the best garlic noodles in town!
I love their roasted crabs and signature dish seabass with ginger and garlic black bean sauce.
I ask where they get their crabs and they get their supplies from Washington.
garlic noodles.author: Erzi E.
garlic noodles.review:
Hands down the best garlic noodles in town! I love their roasted crabs and signature dish seabass with ginger and garlic black bean sauce. I ask where they get their crabs and they get their supplies from Washington. I know in the recent news that the California Health Department issued a warning not to eat Dungeness crabs caught along the coastline of Oregon and southern border of Santa Barbara County because of high levels of domoic acid that causes vomiting, diarrhea, stomach cramps, and headache. 

The restaurant is only open for dinner. We just spent the day at the Palace of Fine Arts and decided to come here for dinner. We didn't have reservations and when we got there, there was already a line and it's only 5pm. Call ahead of time and make sure to put you in the books. Really popular restaurant and it stands true to its reputation.

excerpts: And my friends are raving about the garlic noodles.
We were at a friend's
that's nearby.
So put our name down and came back 45 mins later for a table of seven and got seated right away
Grilled prawn over garlic noodles
: it's good but nothing too special.
Garlic noodles
: this is very good.
Not too buttery.
But I think the garlic noodles from The Kickin Crab is better.
garlic noodles.author: Lilly W.
garlic noodles.review:
I was excited to try this out. This is supposed to be the best Viet food in SF. And my friends are raving about the garlic noodles. We were at a friend's that's nearby. So put our name down and came back 45 mins later for a table of seven and got seated right away Sat around 8pm. 

The food was definitely good. But it wasn't the best Viet food that I ever had. The crabs from PPQ is definitely better (comparing the roasted crabs). Here is the list of food that we ordered. 

Mango salad: Only okay. It's too warm for a salad. Even the lettuce felt cooked, which is weird for me. 

Steamed Sea Bass: again very general. The sea bass tasted overcooked. It wasn't very tender. The House's sea bass is 10x better. 

Spicy eggplant: this was tasty. It also had chicken and shrimp. But something you can get at every chinese restaurant. 

Roasted crab: not as good as PPQ. Very oily and not as tasty. 

French beef: the beef is very tender. Definitely one of the better dishes. The portion is not very big as it is served on a big bed of lettuce. 

Salt and pepper calamari: this was very good. It didn't have a lot of breading. 

Grilled prawn over garlic noodles: it's good but nothing too special. The prawn was big but only four pieces. 

Garlic noodles: this is very good. Not too buttery. But I think the garlic noodles from The Kickin Crab is better.

excerpts: I love love love the Roasted Crab and garlic noodles.
They are the perfect match from Heaven!
We keep coming back and always bring new family members to try this place, it never disappoint!
Great service as always.
garlic noodles.author: connie m.
garlic noodles.review:
I love love love the Roasted Crab and garlic noodles. They are the perfect match from Heaven! 
We keep coming back and always bring new family members to try this place, it never disappoint! 
Great service as always.

excerpts: Garlic noodles are a must!
Small space but can't go wrong with anything on the menu.
garlic noodles.author: Brittney H.
garlic noodles.review: Best garlic roasted crab in town. Garlic noodles are a must! Small space but can't go wrong with anything on the menu.

excerpts: I always get the garlic noodles with the roasted crab
garlic noodles.author: Crystal M.
garlic noodles.review: Great food and wonderful service! The chef was kind enough to accommodate my three year old daughter, making her prawns with butter because she likes shrimp Love that place! I always get the garlic noodles with the roasted crab

excerpts: Went to this restaurant this evening with family and had raved to them so much about the garlic crab and garlic noodles which is what they are known for to end up being extremely disappointed  Very overrated restaurant!!
The garlic noodles were a complete disappointment barely arriving luke warm the crab was decent, but very overpriced.
I felt like everything was made ahead of time for how quickly it came to the table and was barely warm.
Ordered 7 appetizers so that we could all share.
Started with the Fried Calamari which had more onion condiment then Calamari, followed by the Won Ton wrap which was just okay
Then the piece of resistance the garlic crab which was nothing spectacular and the garlic noodles which were tasteless and cold.
We then ordered desert hoping they could redeem themselves and that was a joke.
We ordered the Chocolate lava cake accompanied with a scoop of vanilla ice cream that had no lava gushing and looked like a flat dried out brownie.
The cheesecake creme brulee had no brulee.
At this point, I returned both desserts out of complete disappointment.
Five people and $398.00 later walked out hungry and will never return.
garlic noodles.author: Michelle W.
garlic noodles.review: Went to this restaurant this evening with family and had raved to them so much about the garlic crab and garlic noodles which is what they are known for to end up being extremely disappointed  Very overrated restaurant!! The garlic noodles were a complete disappointment barely arriving luke warm the crab was decent, but very overpriced. I felt like everything was made ahead of time for how quickly it came to the table and was barely warm. Ordered 7 appetizers so that we could all share. Started with the Fried Calamari which had more onion condiment then Calamari, followed by the Won Ton wrap which was just okay, then we had the Beef and Chicken Satay which sat on a huge bed of lettuce with no accompany sauce or dip but was grilled to perfection and excellent taste, followed by the Mango salad which was refreshing, but the mango could have been more ripe. The dim sum wrap which was cold to taste. Don't bother to order the garlic toast which is tasteless, dry and cold.Dinner was the butterfly shrimp and garlic noodle and the shrimp was beautifully grilled and tasteful , but the garlic noodle was tasteless and barely warm followed by the Cubed steak which again sat on an overwhelming amount of lettuce with a few potatoes and onions. The steak was sweet and would of been better left just grilled. Then the piece of resistance the garlic crab which was nothing spectacular and the garlic noodles which were tasteless and cold. We then ordered desert hoping they could redeem themselves and that was a joke. We ordered the Chocolate lava cake accompanied with a scoop of vanilla ice cream that had no lava gushing and looked like a flat dried out brownie. The cheesecake creme brulee had no brulee. At this point, I returned both desserts out of complete disappointment. Five people and $398.00 later walked out hungry and will never return.

excerpts: The garlic noodles add more to my cholesterol levels but it is a welcome addition.
garlic noodles.author: Alexander W.
garlic noodles.review:
If I am ever feelin' crabby I know where to go. Thanh Long changed my views on these crustacean arthropods. The black pepper butter is so marvelous that I bet Sebastian wouldn't mind taking a bath in it. The roasted crab's shell breaks apart easily so there is only minimal work for that succulent white meat. Oh btw, I don't even like crab that much. The garlic noodles add more to my cholesterol levels but it is a welcome addition. 

The crab shack (not really a shack) gets pretty busy, thus a reservation is recommended. Parking in the area is pretty terrible, but valet is available.

excerpts: Roast crab and garlic noodles is the only way to go when you're there.
The place was packed the whole time we were there.
garlic noodles.author: Gene D.
garlic noodles.review:
We haven't been here in ages!  Was it going to be as good as we had remembered?  Was it going to be the best we'd ever had?

Yes and Yes!  Roast crab and garlic noodles is the only way to go when you're there.  The place was packed the whole time we were there.  It can get a bit too noisy but everyone's having a great time enjoying their delicious fare.  

It's no wonder why Thanh Long has been around for so long.  Consistently great food and service.  Bravo!

excerpts: The prawns are served over a bed of garlic noodles.
These are my favorite garlic noodles to date, most other garlic noodles i've tried are dripping with oil.
However, the waiter did try to tack on an extra plate of garlic noodles onto my bill.
I called him over when I looked at the bill.
He automatically says "Oh, is it the garlic noodles?
So he knew that there was something on my bill that I didn't order.
garlic noodles.author: Jose M.
garlic noodles.review:
One of my favorite restaurants (food-wise). Im not even a huge crab person, but the flavor on the roasted crab here is amazing. We usually share 1 crab between 2 of us. I've also ordered the tiger prawns which taste great, but are a little dry. The prawns are served over a bed of garlic noodles. These are my favorite garlic noodles to date, most other garlic noodles i've tried are dripping with oil.
