Great service. However, the waiter did try to tack on an extra plate of garlic noodles onto my bill. I called him over when I looked at the bill. He automatically says "Oh, is it the garlic noodles?" So he knew that there was something on my bill that I didn't order. Of course, he removed it. 

I'm not a fan of crazy wait times or sneaky waiters, but the food quality will bring me back here whenever the chance comes.

excerpts: Perfect Garlic Noodles, Roasted Crab, Shaken Beef, Soft Shell Crab, Calamari, Imperial Rolls, and Fried Rice-I'm still craving it all even after I just had it!
I should just order like 10 orders of the Garlic noodles and tell them to put it all in one big bowl for me!
garlic noodles.author: JP P.
garlic noodles.review: Perfect Garlic Noodles, Roasted Crab, Shaken Beef, Soft Shell Crab, Calamari, Imperial Rolls, and Fried Rice-I'm still craving it all even after I just had it! I should just order like 10 orders of the Garlic noodles and tell them to put it all in one big bowl for me!

excerpts: For the 3 of us we ordered salmon carpaccio, Royal prawns, garlic noodles and 2 garlic roasted crabs.
Salmon Carpaccio:
It was served over the garlic noodles so you would think it is purely a fork and knife dish.
Garlic Noodles:
garlic noodles.author: Kate A.
garlic noodles.review:
I wish I could dig deep down and give Thanh Long 5 stars, but I just can't. 

For the 3 of us we ordered salmon carpaccio, Royal prawns, garlic noodles and 2 garlic roasted crabs. 

Salmon Carpaccio: Amazingly fresh, but the raw red onions kind of overpowered the entire dish. 

Royal Prawns: The prawns were delicious, but I didn't expect to have to peel the shell off the shrimp. It was served over the garlic noodles so you would think it is purely a fork and knife dish. 

Garlic Noodles: Tasted great the second they hit the table, but as they cooled down they did get a bit bland. 

Roasted Garlic Crab: I can not personally attest to this, as I am allergic to crab, but from what locals/patrons say it is overpriced. Keeping in mind how much crab legs cost at a restaurant makes it seem fairly priced, but I am eager to try other similar restaurants with my family. 

Service was prompt and friendly but nothing to write home about.

excerpts: He got our water and hot jasmine tea going and answered questions about our menu choices such as how much roast crab and garlic noodles to order for our party of 10, which fish was the better choice, ...
We went with 2 roasted crabs and 2 garlic noodles because Grandpa's dish of tiger prawns came with garlic noodles.
There were 4 tiger prawns in the dish.
The prawns were excellent.
There weren't enough for everybody at the table.
The garlic noodles always a hit with everybody especially the younger ones in the party.
We had to order another garlic noodles and a large bowl of steamed rice.
garlic noodles.author: Belinda L.
garlic noodles.review:
It's been 21 years since we ate at this restaurant. The occasion then was my husband asking my parents for my hand in marriage. My sister wanted to celebrate my twin daughters' 18th birthday here. My husband made the reservation. There were only 2 reservations available a 5:30 p.m. or 8:30 p.m. We took the later one because of other obligations. There was a little bit of a wait for our table when we arrived.
Alex was our server. He got our water and hot jasmine tea going and answered questions about our menu choices such as how much roast crab and garlic noodles to order for our party of 10, which fish was the better choice, ... We went with 2 roasted crabs and 2 garlic noodles because Grandpa's dish of tiger prawns came with garlic noodles. There were 4 tiger prawns in the dish. The prawns were excellent. There weren't enough for everybody at the table. The garlic noodles always a hit with everybody especially the younger ones in the party. We had to order another garlic noodles and a large bowl of steamed rice. We had the salt and pepper calamari. We ordered the lemongrass chicken for Grandma. The dish was so tasty and the vegetables so tender that the grandchildren ate a good portion of the dish. We wonder if Grandma got enough to eat. The younger twin chose the steamed sea bass. It was a very good dish leaving everybody who had a chunk of the fish wanting more. The older twin enjoyed her shaken beef. The younger twin and her father thoroughly enjoyed the roasted crab and the big chunks of meat they got out of every leg.
The twins received complimentary desserts of ice cream in recognition of their birthday. The older twin shared a fried banana a la mode with her mother. Aunt and uncle also ordered another fried banana a la mode. The older twin liked the way the banana was fried. The fried layer was not thin. The vanilla ice cream tasted very natural. Little cousin ordered the lava cake with ice cream. We'll have to come back another time to try the homemade sorbet which is on the list of foods the younger twin can have not being able to tolerate milk products.
The roast crabs cost $55 each. We probably should have ordered another dish of lemongrass chicken and steamed sea bass.
Alex and another server helped us take group pictures to commemorate the occasion. We enjoyed our dinner tremendously.

excerpts: Roasted crab and garlic noodles tasted great.
We also ordered the spicy eggplant which was okay, and crab puffs which were alright as well.
garlic noodles.author: Casey L.
garlic noodles.review: Roasted crab and garlic noodles tasted great. We also ordered the spicy eggplant which was okay, and crab puffs which were alright as well. Seafood fried rice was pretty well-made. I'd say a bit pricey, but definitely worth a visit.

excerpts: Garlic Noodles:  amazing!
Probably the best garlic noodles I've eaten amongst other places here in the Bay area.
Overall gave this place 4 stars because food was good, service was great but took off a star because of parking.
Although they had a valet service for $12 flat rate, street parking was a little difficult to find.
But will definitely eat here again when I want my fix.
garlic noodles.author: Erna M.
garlic noodles.review:
First time here and we enjoyed our time.  Definitely recommend making reservations because this place gets really packed!  We were seated upstairs which was nice because it wasn't noisy like downstairs.  The staff were friendly and fast!  Very attentive in emptying out the shells from our bowls and refilling our drinks.   So as far as the food, my review is as follows:
1.  Salt & Pepper Calamari:  great!  Right amount of salt and pepper and the calamari was very tender; not chewy at all.
2.  Villager's Favorite (prawns & pork medallions):  a definite must try!  The sauce is what made this dish absolutely!  A lot of flavors but yet so simple.
3.  Roast and Drunken Crab:  good amount of spices but I feel that the crabs at another similar restaurant has bigger ones.  Still good though.
4.  Garlic Noodles:  amazing!  Probably the best garlic noodles I've eaten amongst other places here in the Bay area.
Overall gave this place 4 stars because food was good, service was great but took off a star because of parking. Although they had a valet service for $12 flat rate, street parking was a little difficult to find. But will definitely eat here again when I want my fix.

excerpts: The roasted crab & garlic noodles with colossal prawns is just the perfect pair!
I find the ambiance upstairs to be too dark.
It must be the lighting because it did not complement the red walls.
garlic noodles.author: Maria Jeremiah M.
garlic noodles.review: The food is exceptional! Pricey but worth every penny. The mango salad balanced the flavorful mussels on Asian pesto. The roasted crab & garlic noodles with colossal prawns is just the perfect pair! I find the ambiance upstairs to be too dark. It must be the lighting because it did not complement the red walls.

excerpts: We looked at the literal thousands of reviews on yelp and finally gave up and asked the waiter.without hesitation suggested the garlic noodles and the roasted crab.
Look at all the reviews and 90% will rave of these two.
GET THEM.
The noodles in the garlic noodles were cooked perfect AL dente with heavy heavy succulent garlic, butter and lemon.
The crabs were also drizzled and soaked with rich flavor made up from garlic, butter, and lemon at the least.
garlic noodles.author: Jonathan K.
garlic noodles.review:
Friends took me out here for a weekend dinner and wow.  I dont have the words to seacribe this olace. It will blow your mind!  the best crabs i have since my childhood (Virginia Beach).

food: 5/5
We looked at the literal thousands of reviews on yelp and finally gave up and asked the waiter.without hesitation suggested the garlic noodles and the roasted crab. Look at all the reviews and 90% will rave of these two.  GET THEM.  The noodles in the garlic noodles were cooked perfect AL dente with heavy heavy succulent garlic, butter and lemon.  The crabs were also drizzled and soaked with rich flavor made up from garlic, butter, and lemon at the least. The flavors were rich yet you could still get the rich taste of crab meat. 

Decor/ambiance: 5/5
Hard to say since the food took away all my attention. The restaurant was very open with table and booth seating easily accommodating large groups. I saw a lot of family and couples there.  The atmosphere is lively and active. 

Service: 5/5
Nothing significant negative. They were quick and efficient.  Our server was kind enough to explain the menu as if it was one of those high end restaurants.  I really appreciated them taking the time to explain their recommendation admit such a busy night. 

Cost:4/5
Each crab will cost you around 40 I believe. I hear from other people that used to frequent the restaurant a long time ago that the crabs used to be 20.   But who can blame a business who adjusts according to demand?? Cost is still reasonable but expect to pay a little more than what you would expect. Not a cheap date if you plan on bringing a date but it will make for  an awesome experience and memory. 

Watch for garlic breath!!!!

Recommendations to management:
No critiques other than just to keep up the great work! Your management with staff is noticeable! I especially enjoyed the quick, efficient, and friendly service all night.

excerpts: If you want the Best Five Star Crab and Garlic noodles in the Bay !!!
This is the place to go !!!
My Personal favorite on the menu is the Tiger Prawns dinner tho !!!
garlic noodles.author: Edward O.
garlic noodles.review:
If you want the Best Five Star Crab and Garlic noodles in the Bay !!! This is the place to go !!!
My Personal favorite on the menu is the Tiger Prawns dinner tho !!!

excerpts: Garlic noodles were good but we've had better.
Appetizers were your typical spring rolls, wontons etc...
our server was so busy he couldn't remember forks, drinks or napkins
so we didn't dare ask for salt or pepper lol.
In my opinion it's a little ghetto, not because of the crowd but because of the entire environment.
Should be a little more upscale in my personal opinion.
Needless to say I won't be returning.
garlic noodles.author: James A.
garlic noodles.review:
Food - 3
Service - 3
Ambiance - 1.5

Kept hearing about this place and how great it was but it's actually not worth the drive or the wait. Luckily made reservations and got in within 5 minutes of arrival but other were waiting upwards of an hour for average food. The roasted crab was just ok, a little bland. Sea bass was decent. Garlic noodles were good but we've had better. Appetizers were your typical spring rolls, wontons etc... our server was so busy he couldn't remember forks, drinks or napkins so we didn't dare ask for salt or pepper lol. In my opinion it's a little ghetto, not because of the crowd but because of the entire environment. Should be a little more upscale in my personal opinion. Needless to say I won't be returning.

excerpts: The roasted crab with the garlic noodles are both magical.
garlic noodles.author: Sarah P.
garlic noodles.review:
Hands down best crab I've ever had - and I've been around the crab town. 

The roasted crab with the garlic noodles are both magical. The shaken beef was ok, but the crab and noodles are show stopping.

As someone who went to PPQ first, I must say, Thanh Long dominates. 

Super quick service as well!

excerpts: I got the butterfly prawns over garlic noodles.. thinking about it while I type this is making my mouth water!
If you like garlic.. omg
this is your place!
My friend got the tuna and wished she ordered my plate!
I will be back every time I come back to the bay.
garlic noodles.author: Haley B.
garlic noodles.review: Delicious delicious delicious!!!! I got the butterfly prawns over garlic noodles.. thinking about it while I type this is making my mouth water! If you like garlic.. omg this is your place! My friend got the tuna and wished she ordered my plate! I will be back every time I come back to the bay.

excerpts: But you'll enjoy the best roasted crab and garlic noodles...EVER!
The crab is truly amazing
and oh so flavorful.
The sauce that surrounds the crab is perfect over rice too.
The garlic noodles are the real deal and you definitely can't pass that up either.
It's not as saucy as PPQ's, but still one of the best bowl of garlic noodles you'll ever have.
Be prepared to shell out (heh heh) quite a bit at my favorite place for crab and garlic noodles.
garlic noodles.author: Lloyd B.
garlic noodles.review:
No pho served here. But you'll enjoy the best roasted crab and garlic noodles...EVER! The crab is truly amazing and oh so flavorful. The sauce that surrounds the crab is perfect over rice too. It's a bit pricey though with each crab coming in at almost $50, but...service is unbelievably attentive and the food comes out fast!

I'd start with the asparagus soup. Creamy with bits of crab, it was delicious.  The garlic noodles are the real deal and you definitely can't pass that up either. It's not as saucy as PPQ's, but still one of the best bowl of garlic noodles you'll ever have.

Make reservations ahead of time to avoid a serious wait. Parking is next to impossible but there's always the valet. Be prepared to shell out (heh heh) quite a bit at my favorite place for crab and garlic noodles.

excerpts: Yes the crabs were pretty good but the garlic noodles were overcooked and calamari was just meh and overly salted.
But the real reason for only 3 stars is that our party of 6 people (2 little girls + adults) incurred over $300 in bill.
Holy cow!
Very expensive for just an okay eating experience.
garlic noodles.author: Sonny H.
garlic noodles.review: It was good, but I don't know what the hype is about. Yes the crabs were pretty good but the garlic noodles were overcooked and calamari was just meh and overly salted. But the real reason for only 3 stars is that our party of 6 people (2 little girls + adults) incurred over $300 in bill. Holy cow! Very expensive for just an okay eating experience.

excerpts: The garlic noodles were okay, I mostly ate crab, crab and more crab.
Ooo
and you can dip the meat in the roasted butter pepper drippings the crab is served in.
garlic noodles.author: Myra H.
garlic noodles.review:
Roasted crab was so delicious! I'm not even a big crab person, but I love this crab. I had it a few days ago because my family and I went there and I'm craving it! I'm probably going to go back soon-It's that good! Of course with all the reviews, everyone and their mom has been here. If you haven't been here, then go and YOU WILL SEE!!!

Their calamari was ok, a bit salty, but of course, I still ate it--I mean it's calamari. The garlic noodles were okay, I mostly ate crab, crab and more crab. Ooo and you can dip the meat in the roasted butter pepper drippings the crab is served in. So good!

I also had a vietnamese iced coffee. Small--but delicious. They don't do refills on drinks. If anything, just eat the crab, it's around $55 per crab for two people. And I GUESS get a garlic noodle-you are set. A perfect dinner. And for dessert the fried banana with ice cream is a no brainer. Congrats, you've got higher cholesterol but a very happy tummy.

Valet parking is $12. Not bad.

excerpts: Garlic noodles are THE best around.
The mussel appetizer is unique and flavorful.
A must have if you enjoy mussels.
My all time favorite dish here is the shaking beef.
Soooo good and original.
Tender filet pieces mixed with roasted potatoes tossed in a salad.
It's healthy and filling.
garlic noodles.author: Rosalyn W.
garlic noodles.review:
This place is notorious for their garlic crab. Notorious for taste, not for truth. True: garlic crab is delightfully delicious. True: they charge you between $40-50 per crab but only give you the legs - no crab body included. I find that to be shady and unfortunate. However, the garlic crab is addicting. That's why this place generates so much business and no one mentions the missing body. 

Garlic noodles are THE best around. The mussel appetizer is unique and flavorful. A must have if you enjoy mussels. My all time favorite dish here is the shaking beef. Soooo good and original. Tender filet pieces mixed with roasted potatoes tossed in a salad. It's healthy and filling. If you haven't tried it, you definitely should. 

I can't give this place 5 stars even though I really want to. Simply because they charge so much for the crab and don't give you a whole crab. What is that? I've been here over 20+ times and never once have I been given an entire crab. Maybe I'm not in the special cool crab club? Or they use the crab body for other dishes on the menu? Either way, if I'm paying $40-50 per crab - I should be served just that: crab! Not just crab legs but the whole crab. I could get a whole, fresh crab at the wharf for $15. I'm no fool. Hook it up with the crab! Thank you :)

PS. Parking is atrocious. Come prepared to park a few blocks away or pay for valet. The service is outstanding and all the servers are very courteous.

excerpts: Thanh Long is/was known for their Roasted Crab & Garlic Noodles.
I use to think the food here was pretty good and decent enough for "Vietnamese food" even though I don't believe garlic noodles is authentic Vietnamese food.
We ordered soft crab, mussels, calamari, roasted crab, garlic noodles, shaken beef, and Steamed Sea Bass.
Out of the dishes we ordered mussels was passable.
The mussels was flavorful and delicious.
The garlic noodles wasn't as a good as before.
The roasted crab was still good, but not great.
When I'm craving for crab and garlic noodles, I won't be coming here unless I have to.
garlic noodles.author: Kathleen U.
garlic noodles.review:
Disappointment. Overrated.

What happened to you, Thanh Long? 
Thanh Long is/was known for their Roasted Crab & Garlic Noodles. I use to think the food here was pretty good and decent enough for "Vietnamese food" even though I don't believe garlic noodles is authentic Vietnamese food. Now, I'm just disappointed.

Recently, I went to Thanh Long for one of my friend's birthday celebration. She made reservations for 6 people and said it was super easy to make reservations. Probably, it was for a Sunday night. Back in the day, it would take awhile for reservations and if you didn't make reservations, you would have to wait for 1 hour - 2 hours to be seated. 

We ordered soft crab, mussels, calamari, roasted crab, garlic noodles, shaken beef, and Steamed Sea Bass. Out of the dishes we ordered mussels was passable. The mussels was flavorful and delicious. The garlic noodles wasn't as a good as before. The roasted crab was still good, but not great. The food seems to become just mediocre.

When I'm craving for crab and garlic noodles, I won't be coming here unless I have to.

excerpts: I knew I wanted to order the Thanh Long Mussels and An's Famous Garlic Noodles.
so we ended up ordering Tempura Style Coconut Prawns, Thanh Long Mussels, the Roast Crab and Garlic Noodles.
The Prawns were ok.
Nothing that blew me away.
The Mussels; however,  were delicious.
I would definitely order that again for an appetizer.
so we ended up ordering Tempura Style Coconut Prawns, Thanh Long Mussels, the Roast Crab and Garlic Noodles.
The Prawns were ok.
Nothing that blew me away.
The Mussels; however,  were delicious.
I would definitely order that again for an appetizer.
And the Garlic Noodles may not look like much when it arrives to your table, but once you take a bite you will not be able to stop slurping those noodles.
garlic noodles.author: Kevin G.
garlic noodles.review:
So, last week I was planning on driving to Austin, Texas for some barbecue and I get a phone call from my sister asking me what I was up to.  She asked me if I wanted to take a one day trip to San Francisco.  "Heck yea!", I told her.  I haven't been to SF in years.  Now, I had my heart set on going to House of Prime Rib but they were booked a month in advance.  But, I had remembered seeing Thanh Long featured on either the Travel or Food Channel weeks beforehand so I tried booking a reservation online.  Sadly, there was nothing available so I called the restaurant and got a reservation!

I viewed the menu online and browsed through the photos on Yelp beforehand.  I knew I wanted to order the Thanh Long Mussels and An's Famous Garlic Noodles.  I was up in the air on the Dungeness Crab because I knew it would be rather pricey.

We arrived at 5:30 that night and was promptly seated to our table.  We looked around and noticed that every table was having the crab so we asked our server what the market price was ($53.95 as of October 8th).  We figured we would not be back to SF for awhile so we ended up ordering Tempura Style Coconut Prawns, Thanh Long Mussels, the Roast Crab and Garlic Noodles.  The Prawns were ok.  Nothing that blew me away.  The Mussels; however,  were delicious.  I would definitely order that again for an appetizer.  The Roast Crab...O M G!  That was the BEST crab I have ever had!  I'm not really too sure what all the spices they use but it was heaven.  The crab meat was so tender and flavorful.  And the Garlic Noodles may not look like much when it arrives to your table, but once you take a bite you will not be able to stop slurping those noodles.  Mix it with the sauce from the crab and it tastes even better!  

The service here is top notch!  They kept checking back with us to see how everything was and constantly refilled our drinks (soda and iced tea).  I would definitely recommend and come back here for dinner.  Anyone who has rated this place below 5 stars is absolutely nuts.  Thanh Long is on point!

excerpts: Crab and garlic noodles is a must.
garlic noodles.author: Sophia R.
garlic noodles.review: Food and service was amazing. Crab and garlic noodles is a must. We also had the soft shell crab and jumbo shrimp wonton starters. Make sure to wear stretchy pants!!!! Yummmmmmy!

excerpts: One roast crab each, with that amazing crusty marinade and garlic noodles.
Decent service.
garlic noodles.author: James D.
garlic noodles.review:
Worth the mission out to the sunset. Wow, I was very impressed. One roast crab each, with that amazing crusty marinade and garlic noodles. Decent service. The meat delectable.

Great experience and I think despite being so popular its a bit of a secret.

excerpts: I definitely enjoyed their Drunken Crab but was disappointed by their garlic noodles.
But I was not the only one; all the members at my table, who are all Thanh Long fans, had the same opinion.
Both the crab and garlic noodles were good but after hearing and reading rave reviews, I expected a little more.
garlic noodles.author: Andrew W.
garlic noodles.review: After a decade of walking past Thanh Long, I finally got to try it. I definitely enjoyed their Drunken Crab but was disappointed by their garlic noodles. But I was not the only one; all the members at my table, who are all Thanh Long fans, had the same opinion. Both the crab and garlic noodles were good but after hearing and reading rave reviews, I expected a little more.

excerpts: One of my FAVORITE places 2 eat garlic crab and garlic noodles!!!!
Absolutely LOVE this place!
Thanks love 4 bringing me here
2 celebrate our 1yr journey!
garlic noodles.author: Myisha C.
garlic noodles.review: One of my FAVORITE places 2 eat garlic crab and garlic noodles!!!! Absolutely LOVE this place! Thanks love 4 bringing me here 2 celebrate our 1yr journey!

excerpts: We had roasted crab, garlic noodles, salt and pepper calamari, coconut shrimp, and egg rolls.
Best of the appetizers: salt and pepper calamari.
Generous serving and cooked perfectly.
Crab was fantastic, garlic noodles a tad over cooked but in a tasty sauce.
Service was excellent.
We'll be back!
garlic noodles.author: Babs P.
garlic noodles.review: First time we've been here. We had roasted crab, garlic noodles, salt and pepper calamari, coconut shrimp, and egg rolls. Best of the appetizers: salt and pepper calamari. Generous serving and cooked perfectly. Crab was fantastic, garlic noodles a tad over cooked but in a tasty sauce. Service was excellent. We'll be back!

excerpts: Roast Crab and Garlic Noodles.
Why order anything else?
Been here a dozen times in over a decade
and I order the same thing EVERY time.
Why?
Cause it's ALWAYS fantastic.
Unhealthy as hell, but FANTASTIC!
garlic noodles.author: Arnel L.
garlic noodles.review:
Roast Crab and Garlic Noodles.  Why order anything else? Been here a dozen times in over a decade and I order the same thing EVERY time. Why?  Cause it's ALWAYS fantastic. Unhealthy as hell, but FANTASTIC!  I've also 'sampled' the Shaken Beef, the Sea Bass, and the Saigon Beef, all of which are very good. I also think the calamari and mussel appetizers are very good.  I think the calamari could be a little more crispy, but that's just me personal preference. 

They have a full bar and my wife tells me the Lychee Martini was very good. Runs about $10 a pop!

Parking sucks in the area. Valet parking is available for $12, otherwise expect to park 1-2 blocks away, and be prepared to circle the streets looking for parking. 

Reservations are a must. They get very crowded...despite the crappy parking situation.

excerpts: Absolutely love the garlic crab and garlic noodles.
Went there tonight 2/12/17 to order to go and was very disappointed with my crab.
It looks as if it was half cleaned.
For $55 my crab should be spotless.
I won't be going back again.
garlic noodles.author: Jane D.
garlic noodles.review: I have been going to Thanh Long for yeeeeaaaarrrssss. Absolutely love the garlic crab and garlic noodles. Went there tonight 2/12/17 to order to go and was very disappointed with my crab. It looks as if it was half cleaned. For $55 my crab should be spotless. I won't be going back again.

excerpts: I came here with my little family to try their infamous garlic noodles and roast crab.
They definitely met my expectations, but what didn't meet my expectations was the customer service.
garlic noodles.author: Irene N.
garlic noodles.review:
I came here with my little family to try their infamous garlic noodles and roast crab.  They definitely met my expectations, but what didn't meet my expectations was the customer service.  Although they were friendly there were just a few things that could've improved....

1. My reservation was for 4 as in if I didn't make it they would charge me $100 ($25/ person) 1 of which happens to be a very noodle-hungry toddler.  They didn't give him his own cup of water, so I gave him mine, and you bet your ass I wasn't drinking from that cup after....with all that garlic noodle back wash! 

2. When I wanted to ask for water no one came by to check on our table, which would've given me the perfect opportunity to ask for water (yeah still on that subject.....I was thirsty).

3. After a few minutes, I finally flagged someone down to get me a glass of my own water, and a dessert menu.....a few minutes passed by and I didn't get either. So when I reminded the gentleman for the dessert menu (gave up on the water) his response was "oh yes, there are only 3 kinds.....chocolate cake, creme brulee cake, and banana" uhhh do you want to be more specific about the 3rd option?  Is it a cake? Is it served with ice cream? Or are you just going to charge me $15 for some fucking fruit?!?!?! So I said forget it, and asked for the check.

4. Oh and when the host asked us if we wanted a drink my hubby asked for a "kentucky mule" the host said they didn't have that....ok but I'm sure your bar tender can confirm that! 

Overall it was an ok experience, definitely good for take out and maybe a date with just my hubby, or maybe I came at a bad time, since they automatically charge an 18% gratuity for Father's Day they didn't feel the need to work for the tip.

excerpts: we had our usual tamarind and drunken crab w garlic noodles.
Even our drinks were not as good.
Even the appetizers were just no better than your neighborhood Chinese restaurant.
Overall the food was just so so and certainly NOT worth the bill!!
But the service was excellent.
For the price, we will NOT be back.
garlic noodles.author: Lifespassion B.
garlic noodles.review: Ate here many times before and loved it. Not so much this time. Food not as good we had our usual tamarind and drunken crab w garlic noodles. Even our drinks were not as good. Even the appetizers were just no better than your neighborhood Chinese restaurant. Overall the food was just so so and certainly NOT worth the bill!! But the service was excellent. For the price, we will NOT be back.

excerpts: This family-owned and operated gem of a place has some of the best seafood (crab, prawns and garlic noodles -
yes, please!) in the city.
I had an 8:15 p.m. reservation for a party of 10 (close friends and family).
If you're familiar with the city, then you know this place is located allllll the way in the Avenues, so it can take up to an hour to get to in rush hour traffic.
I arrived extremely late to find everyone in my party seated and waiting for me, which I appreciated, as the restaurant was pretty full.
They could've bumped my table or refused to seat my guests, but they did not.
Kudos for that.
Since it had been awhile, I wanted some of everything on the menu and my guests thankfully obliged me.
We ordered several whole roast Dungeness crabs in their special garlic seasoning.
I rarely order Dungeness crab anywhere else because not everyone cleans and cooks it properly, but at Thanh Long, it is a MUST.
It was delicious, just like I remembered!
It's also very filling with everything else.
I ended up splitting half of mine with my godsister.
The sides are a la carte, so we also ordered the garlic noodles, shrimp fried rice, garlic toast and the seasonal vegetable sauté to go with our crab.
My mom ordered her usual tiger prawns over garlic noodles.
(The four prawns come butterflied over the noodles).
She refused to let me have a taste, so I assume it was as good as she remembered, too.
garlic noodles.author: Tashi L.
garlic noodles.review:
As a Frisco native, Thanh Long has been a long-time favorite of mine for as long as I can remember. I had the pleasure of celebrating my birthday here on 5/26/15 and I am pleased to say that even though it had been over a decade since my last visit, the service and food have not changed! This family-owned and operated gem of a place has some of the best seafood (crab, prawns and garlic noodles - yes, please!) in the city.
 
I had an 8:15 p.m. reservation for a party of 10 (close friends and family). If you're familiar with the city, then you know this place is located allllll the way in the Avenues, so it can take up to an hour to get to in rush hour traffic. I arrived extremely late to find everyone in my party seated and waiting for me, which I appreciated, as the restaurant was pretty full. They could've bumped my table or refused to seat my guests, but they did not. Kudos for that.
 
Since it had been awhile, I wanted some of everything on the menu and my guests thankfully obliged me. We ordered several whole roast Dungeness crabs in their special garlic seasoning. I rarely order Dungeness crab anywhere else because not everyone cleans and cooks it properly, but at Thanh Long, it is a MUST. It was delicious, just like I remembered! It's also very filling with everything else. I ended up splitting half of mine with my godsister. The sides are a la carte, so we also ordered the garlic noodles, shrimp fried rice, garlic toast and the seasonal vegetable sauté to go with our crab. My mom ordered her usual tiger prawns over garlic noodles. (The four prawns come butterflied over the noodles). She refused to let me have a taste, so I assume it was as good as she remembered, too. For those who may not like crab or shrimp like one of my friends, the mango salad is recommended - without the scallops or shrimps, of course. As far as libations go, they have a full bar and decent cocktails. I only had Goose on the rocks with two limes, so I can't comment on the other drinks.
 
If you don't like garlic, this is not the place for you. And if you are price conscious, this is not the place for you LOL! They do accept walk-ins depending on how busy they are. The place is not huge, so just phone ahead and reserve whenever possible. Street parking is available, but the surrounding area is residential so it may be hard to come by. Valet is $12. Not bad for San Francisco.
 
For me, the only downside is living out-of-state, but I would recommend this place for special occasions.

excerpts: Before we finished our dinner we ordered 2 more roasted crabs and 2 garlic noodles to take.
Came home to find only 1 order of each.
This was very disappointing.
I had hungry kids at home and live 1.5 hours away.
garlic noodles.author: Mareny P.
garlic noodles.review: Walked in for a party of 3.  Got seated promptly.  Ordered calamari appetizer, 2 roasted crabs, and a garlic noodle.  Appetizer came out within 10 minutes.  Overall great experience, but I will stick with Crustacean as I feel the flavors there are more towards my taste buds.  Before we finished our dinner we ordered 2 more roasted crabs and 2 garlic noodles to take.  Came home to find only 1 order of each.  This was very disappointing.  I had hungry kids at home and live 1.5 hours away.

excerpts: We ordered a bunch of the crab and the garlic noodles.
Which was about $89 a person.
garlic noodles.author: Jennifer J.
garlic noodles.review:
Came here for a friend's birthday. Service wasn't that great,  the food is over priced and a bit oily.

We ordered a bunch of the crab and the garlic noodles. Which was about $89 a person. The roasted crab is served in a pool of oil and pepper and a bit over cooked, and the noodles were also super oily - which made them hard to eat.

Pretty disappointed about the seafood and crab since that was the main reason why we came here. I would rather try else where next time I want crab dinner.

excerpts: We had 2 crabs, shaken beef, colossal shrimp with garlic noodles and another garlic noodle.
2 lychee martini and two Navarro spritzer.
Check came to $280 with tips for 4 people.
The crabs were $54 each.
I haven't been here for awhile as I don't live in SF
so was a bit shocked to see the huge jump in prices.
But as they say, if you have to ask for the "market price", you shouldn't eat there.
My friends and I are here for a weekend girls trip.
They said it's the best meal they had here.
So it's worth the price.
By the way, the service was great too.
garlic noodles.author: Elaine W.
garlic noodles.review:
This Yelp reservation feature was great.  Reservation was honored and we got our seats right away.  Love it and therefore, highly recommend.
We had 2 crabs, shaken beef, colossal shrimp with garlic noodles and another garlic noodle.  2 lychee martini and two Navarro spritzer.  Check came to $280 with tips for 4 people.
The crabs were $54 each.  
I haven't been here for awhile as I don't live in SF so was a bit shocked to see the huge jump in prices.  But as they say, if you have to ask for the "market price", you shouldn't eat there.
My friends and I are here for a weekend girls trip.  They said it's the best meal they had here.
So it's worth the price.  By the way, the service was great too.

excerpts: The garlic noodles were disgusting....over cooked...OVER COOKED...
I didn't taste any fresh garlic on there.
All I tasted was butter with powdered Parmesan cheese and most likely powdered garlic.
garlic noodles.author: Cyrus P.
garlic noodles.review:
$300 for 2 roast crab, 1 drunken crab, one prawn w/ garlic noodle, stir fry squid in tomato sauce, a side of garlic rice for $8.50....wtf...and a heineken beer.  I also ordered the mussels in ginger sauce and asked the waitress if she'll remember everything I ordered and she said "Of course!"...never got our mussels, think we paid for it to.

The garlic noodles were disgusting....over cooked...OVER COOKED...I didn't taste any fresh garlic on there.  All I tasted was butter with powdered Parmesan cheese and most likely powdered garlic.  Roast crab tasted like butter and black pepper, the drunken crab came with a big ass bowl of soup that tasted like bland chicken stock with some green onions thrown inside.

$300.......not worth it.  This place is still alive because of it's past recognition, but so sorry to say it's well past that time for this place.

excerpts: I love this place, it has the best calamari and garlic noodles I've ever had.
garlic noodles.author: Foteche M.
garlic noodles.review: I love this place, it has the best calamari and garlic noodles I've ever had. I also recommend the Shrimp toast, it's only open 3 1/2 hours but and bit expensive. But it's so worth the money and the time to get down there and get that food

excerpts:
Pros:
Crabs, garlic noodles and a lot of great food surrounding it.
garlic noodles.author: Prashant S.
garlic noodles.review:
Love this place!! Absolutely fantastic on the food and service! The crabs are to die for and we also had an array of appetizers that were very good. We've been here a couple of times with large groups and have always had a fun time! Casual ambience, crowded all the time and definitely has a fun festive feel to it.

Pros:
Crabs, garlic noodles and a lot of great food surrounding it.
They accept reservations and offer valet

Cons:
Not my fav part of SF and quite a haul from everything else 
If you don't trust the valet (i normally don't), then it's a good 15-20 mins around the block looking for street parking

I'm giving it a 5 start for the food but the overall experience with parking would probably make it a 4-4.5 star. Would definitely recommend.

excerpts: Everything is so flavorful, my boyfriend got the sweet & sour crab and I got the garlic noodles with tiger prawns, they serve a good amount so we shared and still had left overs to take home.
The service was great as well, very attentive and helpful with choosing a dish.
The inside has a very romantic feel and spacious although on the outside it might seem like a hole in the wall.
Give it a chance and you won't regret it!
garlic noodles.author: Melissa L.
garlic noodles.review: This is one of the best sea food places I've been to, a must go to if you are in town. Everything is so flavorful, my boyfriend got the sweet & sour crab and I got the garlic noodles with tiger prawns, they serve a good amount so we shared and still had left overs to take home. The service was great as well, very attentive and helpful with choosing a dish. The inside has a very romantic feel and spacious although on the outside it might seem like a hole in the wall. Give it a chance and you won't regret it!

excerpts: Loved the roasted crab, garlic noodles and mussels.
garlic noodles.author: Crisgel B.
garlic noodles.review: Came here with a big group for my friend's birthday. Great experience overall and loved the food. We ordered and the food came out really quick ready for us to devour! Been wanting to eat here for forever and I'll def come back. Loved the roasted crab, garlic noodles and mussels. The shaken beef was pretty good as well. Though, I'd have to say I was a bit parched after eating everything due to the saltiness. I still recommend this place, if you can dish out on a $40-50 crab ahh!

excerpts: Came here with family for an early dinner and ordered roasted crab, fried rice, seafood dumplings, eggplant dish, chicken curry and garlic noodles.
Overall the food was just okay.
The garlic crabs were not as flavorful as I thought they would be.
My BF said he knows who makes the best one still....
Ahem.....
Anyway service was good and prompt.
Ordered also deep friend pineapple and they were good as I got a small bite of it.
I would suggest to ask for honey to go along with it.
Brings out the better flavor of the dessert.
I will probably not come back here again as the food is okay
and it could be quite pricy for the mediocre food.
Off to the next best thing...
garlic noodles.author: Claudine V.
garlic noodles.review:
The hype to get into this place made me so excited to come and try this place. 
Came here with family for an early dinner and ordered roasted crab, fried rice, seafood dumplings, eggplant dish, chicken curry and garlic noodles. 
Overall the food was just okay. The garlic crabs were not as flavorful as I thought they would be. 
My BF said he knows who makes the best one still.... Ahem.....
Anyway service was good and prompt. Ordered also deep friend pineapple and they were good as I got a small bite of it. I would suggest to ask for honey to go along with it. Brings out the better flavor of the dessert. 
I will probably not come back here again as the food is okay and it could be quite pricy for the mediocre food. 
Off to the next best thing...

excerpts: Then have the baked stone crab and garlic noodles (not to state the obvious) and finish with maybe a friend banana.
garlic noodles.author: Cho T.
garlic noodles.review:
Everything was amazing -- get the mussels to start, garlicky and buttery and absolutely delicious. Then have the baked stone crab and garlic noodles (not to state the obvious) and finish with maybe a friend banana. 

10/10 had a wonderful meal!

excerpts: , I always (its a must) order two or more orders of the garlic noodles, and two crabs if your with 3-4 people that is.
garlic noodles.author: Tiffany K.
garlic noodles.review:
I've been coming here for years and Thanh Long never changes! 

The good and workers are great and quick to get your order down and food comes out fairly quick. We always order as starts the soft shell crab and calamari , I always (its a must) order two or more orders of the garlic noodles, and two crabs if your with 3-4 people that is. 

I usually order the roasted crab and drunken crab. I preferably like the roasted crab vs the drunken crab. I usually order one order of the jasmine rice, and dip the rice in the roasted crab sauce.  I feel that the drunken crab doesn't have too much taste to it, and its more watered down. 

Also I usually order the beef cub dish, and its super good and flavorful.  The sea bass was pretty good too , although Im not a huge fan of fish it was good. 


Anyways this place gets packed quick, so I high advise to make a reservation. Parking is crazy there too, so I usaully valet so its easier but if oyu decide to find street parking good luck !

excerpts: One flavorless medium size whole crab in butter and pepper with nothing else included for $58; four prawns with garlic noodles for $38.
It's no wonder prices are not on their website or the menu.
Their garlic noodle was over cooked and had no flavor.
We should have listened to our friends who warned us about Thanh Long.
We will never step foot in that restaurant again.
Looking forward to trying PPQ.
garlic noodles.author: Gizou P.
garlic noodles.review: We went to Thanh Long last night and I was very disappointed.  The place is an absolute ripoff.  The food is subpar and greasy.  One flavorless medium size whole crab in butter and pepper with nothing else included for $58; four prawns with garlic noodles for $38.  It's no wonder prices are not on their website or the menu.  Their garlic noodle was over cooked and had no flavor.  We should have listened to our friends who warned us about Thanh Long.  We will never step foot in that restaurant again.  Looking forward to trying PPQ.

excerpts: Do not pass up the  roasted crab and garlic noodles, it was so good and so fresh.
Their fried banana with ice cream was a good way to end the night.
Definitely coming here again and more times after that!
garlic noodles.author: Glenn B.
garlic noodles.review: This place was amazing! Great customer service and were able to accommodate me with an earlier arrival than my set reservation. Do not pass up the  roasted crab and garlic noodles, it was so good and so fresh. Their fried banana with ice cream was a good way to end the night. Definitely coming here again and more times after that!

excerpts: Pricey, but the roasted crab was the best i ever had so far, great with garlic noodles, the mussels were good too!
Will be back soon to fuck up another crab lol
garlic noodles.author: Fernando E.
garlic noodles.review: Pricey, but the roasted crab was the best i ever had so far, great with garlic noodles, the mussels were good too! Will be back soon to fuck up another crab lol

excerpts: but I had the garlic noodles and prawns.
garlic noodles.author: Lesley B.
garlic noodles.review: So, I'm not a huge fan of vietnamese food, when I first walked in this place it had a bad seafood stench.  We were seated, and waiters came to our table immediately. I don't remember the official name of my dish but I had the garlic noodles and prawns. For the appetizer, we ordered the salt and pepper calamari. When I tell you this is the besttttttttttttt Vietnamese cuisine that has touched my pallet, this food was amazing. We were literally seated and served w/n 15 min. The food was piping hot and amazing. We went and 5 pm and this place was packed by 6pm. It's a definitely a must try! They also have a very large bar selection!

excerpts: It did come on a large bed of garlic noodles which I devoured.
garlic noodles.author: Mike N.
garlic noodles.review:
San Francisco, CA.

My second time here, again a good experience. First of all it is pricey, so I have accepted that. However you may find, as I have, that not all the dishes are worthy of their price. For example the long fish (red snapper) was really good, I liked the texture and seasoning. But not so gourmet that it should fetch nearly $30. It did come on a large bed of garlic noodles which I devoured.
 Mango salad is a hot salad with shrimp and it is great. 
 My friend ordered the crab which required him to wear a bib. Good thing because he attacked that crab with gusto, hands all buttered up and seeking every shred of meat. He says it was great and is a person who would know. 
 We requested an 8:00 reservation at 6:30 and it all went smooth. We had to wait about 10 minutes or so upon arrival. 
Our party was large but they accommodated us with great skill and patience, and somehow did not screw up even one thing we ordered.
Too stuffed for dessert, maybe next time.

excerpts: Not knowing how filling this meal would would be, we went ahead and ordered two roasted crabs, an order of the garlic noodles and 2 glasses of Riesling to go with it.
garlic noodles.author: Kathleene E.
garlic noodles.review:
Holy...CRAB. This place was DELICIOUS. The BF and I finally got to try this place out after numerous recommendations from friends and family. Like many other fellow Yelpers mentioned, it is not the cheapest dinner. It definitely is one of those special occasion dinners - this night, it was for the BF's birthday! We made a reservation via telephone a few days prior and it was very simple and quick. Glad we did too, because when we came in for our reservation, it was jam-packed!

We were seated immediately and our server definitely knew what she was doing. She was tentative and prompt, without being overly friendly and buggy. Not knowing how filling this meal would would be, we went ahead and ordered two roasted crabs, an order of the garlic noodles and 2 glasses of Riesling to go with it.

For me, one crab was way too much, but was able to bring the other half of mine home. For the BF, it was just right. We left so satisfied and already wanting more!

excerpts: And then you add some garlic noodles into the mix and BAM, you got yourself a happy belly.
garlic noodles.author: Kim N.
garlic noodles.review:
HOLY CRUSTACEAN. Best crab I've ever had in my life hands down. So glad to have met the love of my life here, Mr. Roasted Crab. Never again will I look at crab the same. The marination, the roast, the salivation!!! It was almost too much to withstand. And then you add some garlic noodles into the mix and BAM, you got yourself a happy belly.

Reserve or book ahead of time if you can! Place is PAAACKED. Service is friendly regardless though.

excerpts: Crab is always good, garlic noodles are delicious!
Haven't found an appetizer  that is great, but you will never go wrong with the crab for a main course.
garlic noodles.author: Jonathan B.
garlic noodles.review: Crab is always good, garlic noodles are delicious! Haven't found an appetizer  that is great, but you will never go wrong with the crab for a main course.

excerpts: Garlic Noodles-I've read lots of reviews about it.
It was tasty, but after eating it for quite sometime you'll feel that you need to stop.
3.Colossal Royal Tiger Prawns-The prawns came with garlic noodles.
garlic noodles.author: Bella T.
garlic noodles.review:
Me and my Husband were in SF for the weekend and our relatives brought us here for dinner. Its a nice and cozy family style restaurant.
Our Orders:

1. Garlic Noodles-I've read lots of reviews about it.It was tasty, but after eating it for quite sometime you'll feel that you need to stop.Probably the garlic taste?

2. Vegetarian Delight-Wasn't too impressed with it.It tasted a little bland but it had a good amount of different veggies and tofu.

3.Colossal Royal Tiger Prawns-The prawns came with garlic noodles.Prawns were flavorful and yummy.

4. Drunken Crab-Honestly after tasting the roast crab, the drunken crab tastes a little bland.

5. Roast Crab-The best!It was so flavorful!Crab was tender and you just feel like you can't stop.

Dessert we ordered fried pineapple with ice cream and it was a great ending to our dinner.Would definitely go back for the roasted crab.Service was excellent.

Best time to come is at 5:30 or maybe a little before 6pm.After that the line starts.Or better call and reserve a place.Enjoy!

excerpts: Oh my gosh.......the garlic rice is better than the garlic noodles.
The crab was sooooooooo good.
garlic noodles.author: Brooks M.
garlic noodles.review: Oh my gosh.......the garlic rice is better than the garlic noodles.  The crab was sooooooooo good.

excerpts: I actually like the garlic noodles at Xanh's in Mountain
view a lot better.
-Prawns and eggplant - was surprisingly good.
-Shrimp eggrolls - was good.
I especially liked that they used rice paper to wrap this instead of the won ton or lumpia wraps.
When I make my egg rolls, I use only rice paper.
-Fried Calamari
- It wasn't very good.
Very plain.
garlic noodles.author: No H.
garlic noodles.review:
Had dinner here with friends Saturday night.  We were lucky enough to get reservations on the same day.  

Located in Nob Hill, SF.  it's  a drive for us South Bay people but worth trying out at least once! 

Place is small, on the corner of the street with valet parking.  $12 bucks. 

Staff was friendly and the place was nice and clean.  

Food: we ordered:
-Roasted garlic butter crab - Delicious! 
-Garlic Noodles - a bit dry but still good.  I actually like the garlic noodles at Xanh's in Mountain view a lot better. 
-Prawns and eggplant - was surprisingly good. 
-Shrimp eggrolls - was good.  I especially liked that they used rice paper to wrap this instead of the won ton or lumpia wraps.  When I make my egg rolls, I use only rice paper.  
-Fried Calamari - It wasn't very good.  Very plain. No bite to the seasoning or batter. 

Will definitely go back and try other dishes.  The bill came out to about $180 for 4. Not bad. 

I just want to say the crab was my favorite.  The seasoning was just out of this world. I found myself licking my fingers in a very intimate way while eating the crab my friends were blushing.  It's that good!  I should've ordered my own crab but being that I was on a diet it wouldn't have made sense! Can't wait to go back and have a crab all to myself. 

Happy Eating!

excerpts: Crab, garlic noodles and calamari.
You can't go wrong.
Now this is a high end place so remember to bring a lot of money.
This is a perfect place for a date or birthday or any type of event.
garlic noodles.author: Ronnie S.
garlic noodles.review: Been coming here for the past 5 years. It is hands down the best crab in San Francisco. It's called the secret kitchen because nobody knows the recipe they use to sauté' the food in. Only the chefs and family know. Not even the waiters! Even when you look into their kitchen they have it walled off.  But anyways when you come in here you see the same 3 items on everyone's tables. Crab, garlic noodles and calamari. You can't go wrong. Now this is a high end place so remember to bring a lot of money. This is a perfect place for a date or birthday or any type of event.

excerpts: We had a full roasted crab with rice and garlic noodles on the side.
If they had a hotel attached, I would have gone up stairs to took a nap; I am so full and happy.
garlic noodles.author: Dew S.
garlic noodles.review:
Date Night for Us!
Checking-In from Thang Long ~

My 1st time at the restaurant. We got a table early and the minute we sat down we had 3 people waiting on us. The service is over the top and food is delicious.

We had a full roasted crab with rice and garlic noodles on the side. If they had a hotel attached, I would have gone up stairs to took a nap; I am so full and happy. I don't often give five stars but this restaurant is worth every star.

Great Date Night, we will definitely be back.

excerpts: Get the roast crab and garlic noodles.
Simple.
So so good.
garlic noodles.author: Jenann P.
garlic noodles.review:
Crab is market price. In our case about $45 each so it's not cheap.

I used to go here as a kid and remember it being the best crab ever. Fast forward 15 years and I tried the place again recently. It is delicious still! The service is good and the food comes out fast. Make sure you make a reservation and be on time though otherwise they will not seat you without your entire party present.

The crab was really peppered and buttered. My dad who is a fisherman said the crab was not fresh but I am no seafood connoisseur and I loved it.

Get the roast crab and garlic noodles. Simple. So so good.

excerpts: Garlic noodles 14.00 were good but not great...really enjoyed the seafood fried rice but for 18.00 Would have had more seafood.
If you want GREAT CRAB GO TO THE CRAB HOUSE PIER 39
garlic noodles.author: K D.
garlic noodles.review: Over rated the Crab was by far not the best I've had and it was 55.00 simply seasoned with butter and salt and pepper. Garlic noodles 14.00 were good but not great...really enjoyed the seafood fried rice but for 18.00 Would have had more seafood. If you want GREAT CRAB GO TO THE CRAB HOUSE PIER 39

excerpts: The tiger prawns comes with a bed of their garlic noodles.
Personally it wasn't the best I ever had
garlic noodles.author: Joanne L.
garlic noodles.review:
I've heard so many good things about Thanh Long so it's been on my list of places to try for a very long time. 

Called in around 8:30 on Friday night to make reservations because I knew there would probably be a wait, super last minute but worth the try! Luckily they had an opening at 9:30 so we took it. Once we arrived we immediately got seated. 

I know they're known for their crabs, but my friend and I didn't feel like getting our hands dirty so we opted for their other dishes. We had the salmon carpaccio, and dungeness crab puffs to start. Both were very yummy but the salmon carpaccio was my favorite dish of the whole night. Perfectly seasoned and very light. We then had the shaken beef and colossal royal tiger prawns. Again, both were so flavorful and good. The shaken beef was tender and the potatoes and bed of lettuce was a nice touch. The tiger prawns comes with a bed of their garlic noodles. Personally it wasn't the best I ever had but it was still good. 

Service was top notch. We ordered a bottle of wine and they were always making sure our glasses weren't empty. I'll definitely be back to try their crabs soon.

excerpts: I felt like the garlic noodles were overcooked and starchy.
I wouldnt recommend
garlic noodles.author: Kd R.
garlic noodles.review: Came from LA county to Sanfrancisco for my brothers memorial and we decided to eat here,My mother recommended it after eating here about 4 years prior.We got the food to go.I ordered the prawns on top of noodles,Got one for my girlfriend and one extra order,This came up to 140 with tax and tip.This was way too expensive and the food was soso.I felt like the garlic noodles were overcooked and starchy.I wouldnt recommend

excerpts: Garlic noodles and crab are incomparable and delicious.
garlic noodles.author: Mel L.
garlic noodles.review:
Garlic noodles and crab are incomparable and delicious. it's enough to share for 2 (if you're not on the larger side lol). 

Service is hit and miss but it's always busy at dinner so you may have to wait maybe 30 mins or so for a smaller party. They have a bar if u want to drink while u wait.

excerpts: Garlic Noodles and Crab for life.
If you go to Thanh Long and you are looking at the vast menu deciding on what to eat, well just no you really cant go wrong with any of the choices.
Pricey but worth it
the portions are large just an FYI.
garlic noodles.author: Gabbi d.
garlic noodles.review:
Garlic Noodles and Crab for life.  If you go to Thanh Long and you are looking at the vast menu deciding on what to eat, well just no you really cant go wrong with any of the choices.  Pricey but worth it the portions are large just an FYI.  Here's the thing- if you don't order the crab you're doing it wrong.

The service here is always stellar even if you come with a large group. They do not rush groups and are very attentive (busing dishes, making suggestions on what to order, etc.) with out being pushy. I recommend always making a reservation.  They have an upstairs and downstairs room but always are very busy (especially on the weekends).  Grab a seat, have a waitor place a bib on you and go to town.

excerpts: Garlic Noodles where just as good,,
garlic noodles.author: Nakia S.
garlic noodles.review:
Everything was perfect, besides the cluster seating! The food taste great, and it wasn't a very long wait to be served or to receive our food. 

The roasted GARLIC CRAB are to FALL OUT and die for. LOL finger licking Good! 
Garlic Noodles where just as good,, 

I mean the food was so Good I was full half way through but just couldn't resist eating every morsel of food on my plate.. 

I made our reservations online,it's pretty pricey but worth every penny, 

This may become one of my most visited places. 

Thanks Thanh Long for the Outstanding service and Delicious food.

excerpts: Shaken beef tender with salad, my favorite sea bass with orange sauce and of course garlic noodles and prawns and this time not the crab which I regret not ordering
garlic noodles.author: Wendy M.
garlic noodles.review: Love this place my favorite Ahn family restaurant.  Soft shell crab appetizers perfectly crispy and Buddha rolls delicious their peanut sauce is the best!  Shaken beef tender with salad, my favorite sea bass with orange sauce and of course garlic noodles and prawns and this time not the crab which I regret not ordering so I ordered another soft shell crab instead this place never disappoints

excerpts: We ordered the mussels, roasted crab, garlic noodles and shaking beef.
Lastly the garlic noodles was a good portion but again, didn't live up to the other yelp review hype...it to tasted more like garlic powder than fresh garlic.
garlic noodles.author: Mai V.
garlic noodles.review:
Living in the sunset you always pass by Thanh Long, the outside is unassuming, but the interior is very nicely decorated and clean. Service is fast and friendly. My water glass was never empty.  Ambience is good for dates and family meals alike.

We ordered the mussels, roasted crab, garlic noodles and shaking beef. 

Unfortunately for the price and the hype, I was underwhelmed.  The crab had good flavor but was dry.  The shaking beef was the right texture and was a generous portion but it was not authentic Vietnamese...but maybe it's their version and I just don't like it. Lastly the garlic noodles was a good portion but again, didn't live up to the other yelp review hype...it to tasted more like garlic powder than fresh garlic.  The portions were good except for the mussels appetizer which could have used 1 or  2 more for the price. 

I usually am happy and satisfied with anything I eat. Maybe it was just an off night. Everyone else seemed happy. For us it was a try it once, probably not come back kind of situation. For you, try it and prove me wrong?

excerpts:
Here's what our party of 5 ordered:

Garlic Noodles
(x3)- I can honestly say this is the best garlic noodles I've ever tasted, great balance of butter and garlic.
The Fan Favorites: Garlic Noodles, Garlic Roasted Crab, and Shaken Beef.
garlic noodles.author: Briana H.
garlic noodles.review:
I had the pleasure in dining at Thanh Long to celebrate my 26th birthday! It's a great restaurant and I suggest to Bookmark it on your Yelp Page. 

Thanh Long resembles the modern cajun-style Roasted Crab Restaurants such as Boiling Crab/Kickin Crab/Cajun House/Crawstation, but this may be considered as one of the Original Grandfathers in the Crab Game. The white linen, glassware, and utensils were a nice change in my crab grubbing experience. Classy, indeed. 

Here's what our party of 5 ordered:

Garlic Noodles (x3)- I can honestly say this is the best garlic noodles I've ever tasted, great balance of butter and garlic.

Garlic Roasted Crab- Delicious garlic flavor!

Drunken Roasted Crab- w/ wine sauce. It's pretty good, but I would probably just order the Garlic Roasted Crab instead.

Prawn Coconut Curry- w/ chestnuts and green beans. I wasn't very impressed with the dish and would probably pass next time.

Shaken Beef- Very tender! I enjoyed it, but it wasn't the best. I've had better.

Mango Salad w/ Shrimp- I was expecting a fresh salad with bold flavors. However, I was disappointed that the dish was warm! 


Save some money and possible disappointment and order The Fan Favorites: Garlic Noodles, Garlic Roasted Crab, and Shaken Beef.

excerpts: We had garlic noodles, roasted garlic crab, crab wontons, and shaken beef.
It was phenomenal from start to finish.
It was a bit pricey at $56/crab market price
but it didn't disappoint.
I would highly recommend it.
I will definitely go back.
garlic noodles.author: Leah R.
garlic noodles.review: We had garlic noodles, roasted garlic crab, crab wontons, and shaken beef.  It was phenomenal from start to finish.  It was a bit pricey at $56/crab market price but it didn't disappoint.  I would highly recommend it.  I will definitely go back.

excerpts: Since everyone got the Roasted Garlic Crab and the Garlic Noodles, I did too.
It does not disappoint
garlic noodles.author: Wayne S.
garlic noodles.review: Since everyone got the Roasted Garlic Crab and the Garlic Noodles, I did too. It does not disappoint

excerpts: Crab is a bit pricey, but so worth it as it tastes amazing with or without the garlic noodles.
Make sure to make reservations as this place gets super busy.
garlic noodles.author: Sean R.
garlic noodles.review: You like crab? You like garlic noodle? GO HERE! Crab is a bit pricey, but so worth it as it tastes amazing with or without the garlic noodles. Make sure to make reservations as this place gets super busy.

excerpts: We had a fabulous meal and especially enjoyed the roasted crab and garlic noodles with all the butter and seasonings!
Finger licking good!
The service was incredible, prompt, attentive, and friendly.
Kudos to our waiter, Ekawit!
A special place for special occasions!
garlic noodles.author: Denise S.
garlic noodles.review: We had a fabulous meal and especially enjoyed the roasted crab and garlic noodles with all the butter and seasonings! Finger licking good! The service was incredible, prompt, attentive, and friendly. Kudos to our waiter, Ekawit! A special place for special occasions!

excerpts: The perfect meal for two people is a crab and an order of garlic noodles, but if you're with a big eater (like I was last time), it's TWO crabs and an order of garlic noodles.
The crab is pretty much in its purest form - succulent crab that is cooked in delicious garlic and butter.
And garlic noodles to die for.
garlic noodles.author: Wendy L.
garlic noodles.review:
When it's Dungeness crab season, you'll find me at Thanh Long. By far, my favorite spot for crab. The perfect meal for two people is a crab and an order of garlic noodles, but if you're with a big eater (like I was last time), it's TWO crabs and an order of garlic noodles. The crab is pretty much in its purest form - succulent crab that is cooked in delicious garlic and butter. And garlic noodles to die for. 

I've ordered very few other things off of the menu, including the beef, but I'd much rather just eat more crab. The wine list is pretty solid which makes this an even more enjoyable meal. 

You'll come out of Thanh Long reeking of garlic, but you won't care at all because you'll feel so full and satisfied. It's not cheap - market price for crabs will run ~$40.

excerpts:
Two of us ate 1 roasted crab, 1 tamarind crab, and 1 drunken crab along with garlic noodles.

the drunken crab came with alcohol sauce (I think it's beer) and it's kinda bland.
garlic noodles.author: Steve N.
garlic noodles.review:
We've heard about this restaurant for while and finally made our way there for taste test last night.  We were quite disappointed.  Definitely  were not impressed.

Two of us ate 1 roasted crab, 1 tamarind crab, and 1 drunken crab along with garlic noodles.

The tamarind and drunken crabs were cooked by boiling in water and put together with the sauce before serving so they weren't that tasty.   Tamarind sauce was water down and not tasty as stand alone sauce.  the drunken crab came with alcohol sauce (I think it's beer) and it's kinda bland. 

Roasted crab was better than the other two.  It served with traditional Vietnamese salt and crack black pepper with (I think) olive oil sauce.  Very basic Vietnamese traditional sauce.

at $55 a crab, I would say it's over rated

definitely not deserve a 2nd visit

excerpts: I order the roasted crab, garlic noodles, and mango salad every time I dine here.
I would highly recommend dining here if you're craving some delicious crab!
garlic noodles.author: Carly Y.
garlic noodles.review: I absolutely love this restaurant. I order the roasted crab, garlic noodles, and mango salad every time I dine here. I would highly recommend dining here if you're craving some delicious crab!

excerpts: Hands down the best garlic noodles on earth!
garlic noodles.author: Michael R.
garlic noodles.review:
Hands down the best garlic noodles on earth! Worth it for that alone.

My buddy and I finished off 2 large Dungeness crabs plus 2 or 3 plates of noodles.

You'll probably have to wait even with a reservation and if you don't valet park,  you'll drive around a bit to find parking.

The decor was updated since my last trip but the food has remained amazing!

In a city with so many great restaurants and so much seafood and Vietnamese options, this stands out and is well worth the trip to 46th and Judah!

excerpts: The garlic noodles are good (we had 3 people and needed two orders) and we got two roast crab.
The crab was perfectly salty with a good amount of garlic and butter.
Bit on the pricey side but would definitely come again!
garlic noodles.author: Sara F.
garlic noodles.review: This was the first place I ever had crab and boy was it delicious! We got a reservation in advance and I'm glad we did as it was pretty busy, even on a weeknight. The garlic noodles are good (we had 3 people and needed two orders) and we got two roast crab. The crab was perfectly salty with a good amount of garlic and butter. Bit on the pricey side but would definitely come again!

excerpts: The garlic noodles and garlic crab were both excellent.
I would highly recommended this restaurant.
The service and waitstaff were also excellent
garlic noodles.author: James P.
garlic noodles.review: This lived up to the hype. The garlic noodles and garlic crab were both excellent. I would highly recommended this restaurant. The service and waitstaff were also excellent

excerpts: My boyfriend ordered the roasted crab and garlic noodles.
I ordered the Tiger prawns with garlic noodles too.
The turnaround time for the food was literally 10 minutes!!
We were so amazed!!
We scarfed down our food.
YES, THAT GOOD!
garlic noodles.author: Steffi G.
garlic noodles.review:
My boyfriend and I made reservations for Thanh Long as a celebratory dinner for my new job! We arrived an hour early for our reservation (way too excited to try the infamous roasted crab & garlic noodz). I checked in with the hostess, and surprisingly, she said she would try to seat us sooner. We went on a Saturday night so there were quite a few parties waiting to be seated. I highly recommend making reservations. 

Once we got seated, we browsed the menu... So many delicious options! Our waiter came by and gave us a few recommendations. My boyfriend ordered the roasted crab and garlic noodles. I ordered the Tiger prawns with garlic noodles too. The turnaround time for the food was literally 10 minutes!! We were so amazed!! We scarfed down our food. YES, THAT GOOD!! it's as delicious as everyone raves it is. 

Ambiance is soothing, despite the chaos in the restaurant. Mmmm!!

excerpts: The reason to come is the garlic noodles , they live up to the hype .
garlic noodles.author: Anthony S.
garlic noodles.review: You are in for a treat. The crab is awesome but expensive . The reason to come is the garlic noodles , they live up to the hype .

excerpts: As usual I ordered the roasted crab and garlic noodles (high demands) along with mussels broiled with asian pesto, served with seasoned crostini for appetizer.
garlic noodles.author: Sheena P.
garlic noodles.review:
I've gone to this place a few times.  This restaurant is bomb diggity bomb!  We were glad we only waited 30 mins to be seated since we didn't make prior reservations.  Parking is horrible, but they offer valet for $12 ;) 

As usual I ordered the roasted crab and garlic noodles (high demands) along with mussels broiled with asian pesto, served with seasoned crostini for appetizer.  Yummmmmmmy

Great food, excellent service!

excerpts:
Roasted Crab - 5
Calamari - 4
Garlic Noodles - 3
garlic noodles.author: Selena L.
garlic noodles.review:
Didn't try many other dishes but I came here only for Crab. Two people and we ordered 3 items. The bill is around $150. Parking is extremely difficult so be prepared to pay $12 for valet parking. 

Roasted Crab - 5
Calamari - 4
Garlic Noodles - 3

excerpts: Second time I've been here and the crab and garlic noodles are still to die for!
I try not to look at the prices just so I can enjoy the experience more
garlic noodles.author: Chrissy S.
garlic noodles.review:
Believe the hype! Second time I've been here and the crab and garlic noodles are still to die for!  I try not to look at the prices just so I can enjoy the experience more but it is worth it. 

Roast crab- shared with one other person 
Perfectly seasoned and I dip the crab into the butter that is on the plate. 


Garlic noodles- garlic with a hint of soy. Perfectly seasoned as well. 

Coconut shrimp- crispy shrimp with great flavor from the coconut crust 

Nice, casual atmosphere. No wait for a table because we went around 7. 

Valet parking -12 bucks, kind of expensive but parking sucks in that area 

Can't wait to go back and enjoy some more
Crab!!!

excerpts: I usually order: Garlic noodles or rice(seafood combo) (this recent time for my birthday 2/29 I had to send them back!
they were hella bland!
I was shocked-
no, not Thanh Long!! )
:( the owner fixed it himself!
I was happy.
He insisted on cooking me a new one, I told him just fixing the current one was fine.
Well, he fixed the current one AND made a new one.
garlic noodles.author: Drea W.
garlic noodles.review:
I've been coming to Thanh Long for years! I am happy they still give hot towels. I love their mussels.. mmm! I SWEAR I don't know what it is but they are bomb!! I don't like to share them lol get your own!

I usually order: Garlic noodles or rice(seafood combo) (this recent time for my birthday 2/29 I had to send them back! they were hella bland! I was shocked- no, not Thanh Long!! ) :( the owner fixed it himself! I was happy. He insisted on cooking me a new one, I told him just fixing the current one was fine. Well, he fixed the current one AND made a new one. :)

That alone is why I return to Thanh Long!

excerpts: Love the roasted salt n pepper crab & garlic noodles here.
Not as cheap as PPQ
but it's more upscale.
However, the food made us really thirsty afterwards which is usu due to the amount of msg & salt in their foods.
garlic noodles.author: Roly H.
garlic noodles.review: Love the roasted salt n pepper crab & garlic noodles here. Not as cheap as PPQ but it's more upscale. However, the food made us really thirsty afterwards which is usu due to the amount of msg & salt in their foods.

excerpts:
Once we were seated, we proceeded to order the following:

Roasted Crab
Tamarind Crab
Muscles with Asian Pesto
Garlic Noodles
Season Veggie Stir fry
I was really excited for the garlic noodles because everyone was raving about it
but they were not what I expected.
Best garlic noodles I've eaten so far is from "Le Vie" on Geary.
garlic noodles.author: Mai W.
garlic noodles.review:
I had high hopes for this place. It was definitely a bit over rated. 

I came here on a Saturday night and it was packed! We had reservations for dinner at 6pm and got there a bit early so we decided to have a couple of drinks at the bar right by the door. There was no room to sit. I got the the Fluer de Mango. it was delicious! The bartender gave my friend and I an extra side shot of their lychee/pineapple infused vodka. (DELICIOUS too!)

Once we were seated, we proceeded to order the following:

Roasted Crab
Tamarind Crab
Muscles with Asian Pesto
Garlic Noodles
Season Veggie Stir fry

I was really excited for the garlic noodles because everyone was raving about it but they were not what I expected. Best garlic noodles I've eaten so far is from "Le Vie" on Geary. 

The crabs were pretty decent sized but also so so. The Tamarind one was not the favorite of the table. The Roasted crab was pretty good but nothing out of the ordinary. 

Perhaps I need to give this place another try but everything seemed just mediocre.

excerpts:
That moment you still want garlic noodles after having a whole plate, but know it's bad for you. 
That. 
Their apps and drinks are good, don't get me wrong, but the most memorable dish at Thanh Long are those garlic noodles.

Our party did not feel much like full-on crab tonight, so we decided on some apps and a plate of garlic noodles with prawns on top.

I agree with most people that this place is pricey, so I wouldn't come here on a daily or weekly basis, but those garlic noodles make it all worth it.
garlic noodles.author: Michael C.
garlic noodles.review:
That moment you still want garlic noodles after having a whole plate, but know it's bad for you. That. Their apps and drinks are good, don't get me wrong, but the most memorable dish at Thanh Long are those garlic noodles.

Our party did not feel much like full-on crab tonight, so we decided on some apps and a plate of garlic noodles with prawns on top.

I agree with most people that this place is pricey, so I wouldn't come here on a daily or weekly basis, but those garlic noodles make it all worth it.

The food quality is undeniably good. The portions are definitely small for the price you pay, but you will generally leave satisfied if you order the from the not-so-secret Secret Menu. Of the three apps we ordered, the salt and pepper gave the best bang-for-your buck compared to portion size and price. 

Finally, service was excellent. Staff were extremely friendly, and they prepared adequately after I made a special quest via the Yelp reservation system. Made it very easy to manage.

excerpts: Panda Express was in the house, and the garlic noodles were a bit on the bland side.
Nonetheless the crab was, and still is excellent.
garlic noodles.author: Ryan Y.
garlic noodles.review: I have heard many mixed reviews.  This one is late, but I went hear with famly for my mom's birthday in June.  No doubt we came for the crab, which is pretty much earned all the 3 stars I gave them.  Crab was excellent, no question.  It was the other entrees, that did not hold up their end.  I felt like it was Panda Express was in the house, and the garlic noodles were a bit on the bland side.  Nonetheless the crab was, and still is excellent.

excerpts: However, similar to R&G lounge, it was grossly over priced and people really over hyped those garlic noodles.
Maybe as a vietnamese person I've grown up eating similar noodles so it wasn't life changing when I tried these at the restaurant.
The prawns were nicely cooked, though also very over priced.
garlic noodles.author: Vy B.
garlic noodles.review:
I'm just going to cut to the chase and agree with everyone that the salt and pepper crab is really good. However, similar to R&G lounge, it was grossly over priced and people really over hyped those garlic noodles. Maybe as a vietnamese person I've grown up eating similar noodles so it wasn't life changing when I tried these at the restaurant. The prawns were nicely cooked, though also very over priced. Shrimp toast was rich and buttery but not very crispy...which suggests they premake it and keep it in a warmer until someone orders it. 

We also ordered the garlic rice, shaking beef, and Thit kho. I would say the shaking beef was my favorite. I have no idea how they got it to be so tender but it was definitely the highlight of the night. The other items were really not that special...again, i grew up eating all these foods so I cannot say this place has blown my taste buds. 

The restaurant itself was a cute place but the service was slow. There's valet parking available but muni stops right by there.

excerpts: Always order the roasted crab and garlic noodles
no matter what.
garlic noodles.author: Gabrielle P.
garlic noodles.review:
This is such a homey, awesome restaurant!  Been here 6+ times and will continue to come back.  Always order the roasted crab and garlic noodles no matter what.  Had the shaken beef this time and it was almost (dare I say) better?  Can't wait to try a new dish every time we come back to discover new favorites.

It's a little bit of a hike out to the sunset, but totally worth it!

excerpts: Best garlic noodles and crab ever.
We came here for my birthday and seriously..this restaurant has quickly shot up to be top 10 restaurants in the Bay Area for me.
Maybe even of all time..
