We got the lemon grass beef, garlic noodles, garlic rice, and roasted crab.
The crab was sooo good..
what's in that sauce?
Butter..pepper..
OMGGG so good.
The only downside is the price.
$50 for a whole crab.
This made my wallet cry.
I didn't pay but if I did, I would have cried.
I am sad that I ate at this place
cuz now I will crave it but can't afford it to eat it on a whim.
garlic noodles.author: Stephanie W.
garlic noodles.review:
Best garlic noodles and crab ever. We came here for my birthday and seriously..this restaurant has quickly shot up to be top 10 restaurants in the Bay Area for me. Maybe even of all time.. :O 

We got the lemon grass beef, garlic noodles, garlic rice, and roasted crab. The crab was sooo good..what's in that sauce? Butter..pepper..OMGGG so good. The only downside is the price. $50 for a whole crab. This made my wallet cry. I didn't pay but if I did, I would have cried. I am sad that I ate at this place cuz now I will crave it but can't afford it to eat it on a whim. T___T

We had some leftover crabs so I ate it two days later. It was ok but definitely not as good as the first day. So I recommend eating the crab there. 

Helene an is my hero! Along with Steve Ellis, the guy that made chipotle.

excerpts: Order two crabs and garlic noodles to go , the price was $136 , about $55 a crab .
The sauce on the crab tasted like it was cooked in broth thats been used for at least few weeks .
I think time to find new spot .
garlic noodles.author: SF G.
garlic noodles.review: This place not even close to what it use to be . Order two crabs and garlic noodles to go , the price was $136 , about $55 a crab . The sauce on the crab tasted like it was cooked in broth thats been used for at least few weeks . I think time to find new spot .

excerpts: Goes well with garlic noodles, roast crab and any wine.
garlic noodles.author: Michael G.
garlic noodles.review: The best crab in town. The toast crab and drunken crab is very good. Not so much the tamarind crab. Why order that when roast crab is right above it on the menu. Make your dinner surf 'n turf by adding the Shaken Beef. Meat is so tender and full of flavor. Goes well with garlic noodles, roast crab and any wine.

excerpts: Haven't been here in years but had a craving for Tamarind Crab and Garlic noodles...
SO YUMMY...
HIGHLY recommend the Tamarind Crab...
garlic noodles.author: Elaine Y.
garlic noodles.review:
Thanh Long DID NOT DISAPPOINT!  Haven't been here in years but had a craving for Tamarind Crab and Garlic noodles... SO YUMMY... I'm still drooling thinking about that sweet tamarind flavoring on the perfectly cooked crab... 

Because the crabs are cooked perfectly - so EASY to open and eat...

Service was awesome as they kept giving us empty bowls for the shells and of course filling up our water glasses and checking in on us...

HIGHLY recommend the Tamarind Crab... I know they have the basic with butter and garlic but seriously - where else can you get that wonderful tamarind flavor... kept dipping my crab pieces into the sauce!

LOVE this place and LOVE that their food and service is consistent... consistently AWESOME!

excerpts: If you are looking for a cheaper alternative order the tiger prawns, you get 4 prawns over the garlic noodles which are a nice size but they don't compare to the crab.
garlic noodles.author: Angela D.
garlic noodles.review: Excellent garlic crab and noodles. The crab will run you about $60 including tax and the noodles are somewhere around $12. If you are looking for a cheaper alternative order the tiger prawns, you get 4 prawns over the garlic noodles which are a nice size but they don't compare to the crab. This time we visited we also ordered the salt and pepper calamari as an appetizer which was seasoned beautifully. I love this place but go home and shower after bc you will smell afterward.

excerpts: Well known for their garlic noodles and crab!
Perfect combo and always sooo good!
Love this place!
garlic noodles.author: Rob C.
garlic noodles.review:
Well known for their garlic noodles and crab! Perfect combo and always sooo good! Love this place! Simple but so much flavor! 

What's not to like about this place!!

excerpts: Order the garlic noodles.
That's all you need.
Well and alcohol.
garlic noodles.author: Mari A.
garlic noodles.review:
One of my ABSOLUTE favorite restaurants. Maybe its a nostalgic from an old time family childhood staple. Maybe its the hour long wait if you don't make a reservation or miss your reservation. Maybe it's the GINORMOUS crab or INCREDIBLY garlicky noodles that I dream about at night. Whether it's come one, come all: Top 5 All Time Favorites hands down.

So that little spiel alone should have been enough. But ill spell it out in a little more detail: 

1. Make a reservation and don't be late. It's hard to find parking keep in mind. 

2. Order the roasted crab. 

3. Order the garlic noodles. That's all you need. Well and alcohol. Duh. 

4. If you MUST order more: most dishes are 5 stars. I recommend the Shaken Beef or an order of their Fried Spring Rolls. 

5. Don't pack your own BIB. They've got you covered. 

THE END. Now do the happy dance.

excerpts: Then there is the garlic noodles.
OMG!
garlic noodles.author: Oddette A.
garlic noodles.review:
If you are a lover of crab, then savoring on the secret recipe roasted crab at Thang Long is a must.  Any crab roasted in their oven has been privileged to be there. I have been dining there for over 20 years and I have never been disappointed. The service equals the food.  If I lived closer I'd have a table with my name on it.  Then there is the garlic noodles.  OMG!  Don't forget the salt and pepper calamari appetizer.  I recently tried the drunken crab, if I had never had the roasted crab, it would be my favorite.  Since I am in love with the roasted, drunken crab is a very respectable second.

Make reservations and use the valet parking for a stress free experience.

I love Thang Long!

excerpts: During my visits to this restaurant I've always ordered their roasted garlic crab & garlic noodles.
This place never disappoints!
I'm a big GARLIC LOVER and will eat almost anything that has garlic in it!
The garlic crab is finger-lickin' good and super succulent blasting with flavor in every bite!
garlic noodles.author: Mei W.
garlic noodles.review:
Came here a couple times back in the days when my hubby first started dating, lol!

This place is always busy! There is a small bar which is great because you can always grab a drink while waiting for your table. During my visits to this restaurant I've always ordered their roasted garlic crab & garlic noodles. This place never disappoints! I'm a big GARLIC LOVER and will eat almost anything that has garlic in it! The garlic crab is finger-lickin' good and super succulent blasting with flavor in every bite! No different with the noodles, super delish with a load of garlic sizzled into the noodles. 

It's hard to find parking, but after all when is it not hard to find parking in San Francisco! If I can recall, I believe they do offer valet parking...

Come here hungry and you'll definitely leave here a happy camper!

excerpts: My partner and I have made it a tradition to come here for crab and garlic noodles once a year for either New Years or birthdays.
Delicious!!!
The price has been going up noticeably every year.
But, it is nice to have a place like this right around the corner from us to enjoy.
garlic noodles.author: Erika C.
garlic noodles.review: My partner and I have made it a tradition to come here for crab and garlic noodles once a year for either New Years or birthdays. Delicious!!! The price has been going up noticeably every year. But, it is nice to have a place like this right around the corner from us to enjoy.

excerpts: but I wouldn't mind going back some time to try their other dishes (really want to try the garlic noodles next time).
garlic noodles.author: Lily L.
garlic noodles.review:
Decent food and really fast service. 

Salt and pepper calamari
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/thanh-long-san-francisco?select=t68CRJfgQs6m9rXDVE1ILA#YObSBlVLpUxggUIv7yf9Jg
A little bit salty for my tastes but was pretty good in general. I think I was expecting too much out of this dish due to the great reviews on here. 

Roasted Crab
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/thanh-long-san-francisco?select=t68CRJfgQs6m9rXDVE1ILA#UyRe9fVncOmyicAdGrl5Ig
This was really good. One of the few non-spicy crabs I've had where you can taste the seasoning/sauce. The crab was seasoned with salt, pepper, and oil very similar to the salt and pepper calamari.

Shaken Beef
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/thanh-long-san-francisco?select=t68CRJfgQs6m9rXDVE1ILA#DDbMAZwyv_gOBXaciovKGQ
I really liked this dish, the beef was really tender and the sauce was delicious. Wasn't a huge fan of the salad/vegetables that came with the beef though. There wasn't enough sauce to flavor the vegetables.

Banana Cake with Vanilla Ice Cream
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/thanh-long-san-francisco?select=t68CRJfgQs6m9rXDVE1ILA#t68CRJfgQs6m9rXDVE1ILA
Never had banana cake before. This was pretty good. The cake was warm so went really well with the ice cream. There were slices of bananas in the cake =)

Overall the food was pretty good and the service was pretty fast. We got our first dish about five minutes after we ordered it. It was a little pricy but I wouldn't mind going back some time to try their other dishes (really want to try the garlic noodles next time).

excerpts: Soooo much love for Thanh Long's roasted crab and garlic noodles!
And my great, I mean, when we added an order of garlic noodles they came out in mere seconds!
garlic noodles.author: Robin Y.
garlic noodles.review:
Soooo much love for Thanh Long's roasted crab and garlic noodles! This is me and my family's go to place for a celebratory dinner or family gathering. 

We came on a Saturday night (probably our 4th time here) with reservations and were seated quickly in 5 minutes. The service was GREAT! And my great, I mean, when we added an order of garlic noodles they came out in mere seconds! 

As for the food: 
Appetizers:
1) fried calamari: perfect combo of salty, spicy, and chewy. Not too greasy. 
2) mango salad- MY FAVE! It's served warm, with pieces of sweet, juicy mango, and roasted shrimp. Mmmm party in my mouth! 
3) Vietnamese salad: kind of like a papaya salad. Good balance of savory and sweet, but I preferred the mango salad. 

Main courses: 
1) 4 roasted crabs ($44/crab) for 7 people. (If you are only ordering crab, 1/person is good, but if you want to sample other entrees, it's a good idea to order less) MY LOVE. Their roasted crab...mind bogglingly delicious. Eat while its hot, and the juices drip all over and the flavor permeates through to the meat, instead of most crab places that can't get it right! 
2) shaken beef- tender buttery chunks of beef with roasted potato chunks soaked in the beef drippings. Scrumptious. 
3) 2 orders of garlic noodles- the best you'll find anymore. I love that the garlic flavor is present but not overpowering, and balances the flavor of the butter. Comes out steaming hot! 
3) brown and white rice to go with the roast crab juices! 

Thanh Long is the go to place for delicious crab! Do it! It's worth the splurge! You will walk out a happier person.

excerpts: Satays are amazing, and the garlic noodles and roasted garlic crabs are so savory and meaty!
The service was also great!
Love seeing the diversity, everyone enjoying a wonderful meal!!
garlic noodles.author: Rosaly F.
garlic noodles.review: Always love coming to Thanh long. We look forward to ordering and devouring our favorite dishes. Fried spring rolls are yummy, not greasy . Satays are amazing, and the garlic noodles and roasted garlic crabs are so savory and meaty! The service was also great! Love seeing the diversity, everyone enjoying a wonderful meal!!

excerpts: Garlic noodles, of course, must go with your meal as well.
garlic noodles.author: Amy E.
garlic noodles.review: YUM.  Best place to get crab.  The crab is roasted so beautifully and has great flavor.  Garlic noodles, of course, must go with your meal as well. I also got the drunken crab which was delicious as well.  The crab can get pricey, but you do get what you pay for. I also enjoyed on of my favorite Vietnamese dishes, shaken beef (or Bo luc lac). I will definitely come back to revel in this deliciousness.

excerpts: All the reviews probably have given you the Roasted Crab and Garlic noodles rundown...
So this review is just for me to confirm those Facts.
YES, the crab is VERY tasty and just flaky and that buttery pepper oil on the platter for dipping?
Divine.
Garlic Noodles?
Garlic Noodles --
if you're like.. eeeew my breath will stink..
NO.. it won't.
Just do IT.
garlic noodles.author: Monica H.
garlic noodles.review:
How can i Not have written a review for Thanh Long yet?

I have eaten here several times in the past; have recommended this non-stop; and just recently -took my husband here for his post birthday dinner.

All the reviews probably have given you the Roasted Crab and Garlic noodles rundown...
So this review is just for me to confirm those Facts. YES, the crab is VERY tasty and just flaky and that buttery pepper oil on the platter for dipping? Divine.
Garlic Noodles? I can eat that all day errday... seriously.

WONDERFUL.

So here's a few tips to enjoy your Thanh Long experience.

1.) Be Ready to spend money. Example? One Crab last week cost about $46.
One order of crab, one garlic noodes, one order of Shaken Beef and Fried Ice Cream- one beer and a diet coke... $105.00 without the tax. That was good for two people. 

2.) One Crab can be shared by two people max... But one can easily have a crab to themselves. I mean.. It's just CRAB.

3.) Garlic Noodles -- if you're like.. eeeew my breath will stink.. NO.. it won't. Just do IT. It's more of a butter garlic taste.

4.) Make reservations.

5.) Have some cash for valet parking. Coz parking could be a pain in the residential area.

----
other than that.... enjoy your foodgasmic meal. 
Amazing and Fast service.

excerpts: Really impressed with both the crab and garlic noodles.
The roasted crab was buttery and the crab meat just fell off the shell because it was so fresh.
I was apprehensive that the garlic noodles would be dry
but they were moist and garlicky.
Yum.
garlic noodles.author: Allison S.
garlic noodles.review:
I loved this place!! Really impressed with both the crab and garlic noodles. The roasted crab was buttery and the crab meat just fell off the shell because it was so fresh. It was so good that we decided to get the drunken crab too. Although that one was good as well, I think I still prefer the roasted crab. To me, it just had a better flavor. I was apprehensive that the garlic noodles would be dry but they were moist and garlicky. Yum. We also got the grilled calamari and the filet beef. Those were okay but I would stick with the crab and noodles. I should also note that it's probably a once in a while kind of meal because it is so buttery and rich, but it's worth it!

P.S. We saw two girls each order a whole crab when we sat down... and they both packed half to go! WEAK! I could eat a whole crab myself. :)

excerpts: We only ordered one crab for 3 people, and two garlic noodles, and it ended up being so expensive!
It's way overpriced, though the garlic noodles were delicious--
garlic noodles.author: Jeanne C.
garlic noodles.review:
Expensive... one crab was $40 or so. We only ordered one crab for 3 people, and two garlic noodles, and it ended up being so expensive! It's way overpriced, though the garlic noodles were delicious--I know I can order that dish anywhere. 

I won't be making the trek way out here anymore. Not worth the price tag!

excerpts: Spicy eggplant was delicious and garlic noodles were very good and not overpowering.
Prices were pretty good.
garlic noodles.author: J R.
garlic noodles.review: Simple, tasty food with exceptional service. Spicy eggplant was delicious and garlic noodles were very good and not overpowering. Prices were pretty good.

excerpts:
Items to get:
1) crab puff
2) garlic crab
3) garlic noodles
Trust it is crack and you will sweat, reek, and smell of garlic, but well worth it.
garlic noodles.author: Mary Ann B.
garlic noodles.review:
Sweeeet victory
I prefer going here than at crustacean's for personal reasons.
Items to get:
1) crab puff
2) garlic crab
3) garlic noodles
Trust it is crack and you will sweat, reek, and smell of garlic, but well worth it.

excerpts: The secret is to order fewer crab and garlic noodles at the beginning.
As the food is consumed, order more, so the crab and noodles stay HOT.
I've been to other places that serve roasted crab and garlic noodles, but nothing beats the original!
garlic noodles.author: Nancy W.
garlic noodles.review:
Great food! Great service! They were originally going to seat our party of 6 at a table close to the busy walkway to the kitchen, but prompts moved us to a quieter table against the way upon request. The food was amazing. The secret is to order fewer crab and garlic noodles at the beginning. As the food is consumed, order more, so the crab and noodles stay HOT. 
I've been to other places that serve roasted crab and garlic noodles, but nothing beats the original!

excerpts: Love the garlic noodles!!
Sooo good.
The crab is super as well!
Love the meal and so did the rest of the group.
We will be back!!
garlic noodles.author: Jason W.
garlic noodles.review: Love the garlic noodles!! Sooo good. The crab is super as well! Love the meal and so did the rest of the group. We will be back!!

excerpts: Our waitress was really attentive and even brought us a dish of garlic noodles complimentary because one of our dishes was taking much longer to prepare
The garlic noodles are a perfect accompanying dish.
garlic noodles.author: Ruth M.
garlic noodles.review:
We came for dinner on a Saturday night with reservations and were seated right away. Our waitress was really attentive and even brought us a dish of garlic noodles complimentary because one of our dishes was taking much longer to prepare and they didn't have the Vietnamese salad available.

All in all delicious. The roast crab is definitely eye catching and comes out smelling deliciously like garlic. The garlic noodles are a perfect accompanying dish. I got the Villager's favorite, a homey dish of sumptuous pork medallions and prawns in a salty broth reduction (definitely need a side of jasmine rice to calm that saltiness!).

I would come back for some flavorful seafood. Valet parking was offered.

excerpts: We came here because of their famous garlic crab and garlic noodles and that is all we tried.
I can't say much about other menu items.
garlic noodles.author: Fred U.
garlic noodles.review:
We came here because of their famous garlic crab and garlic noodles and that is all we tried. I can't say much about other menu items. We all ordered one crab each and the bill was pretty high up there. 

At first we walk in, we smelled bad crab smell then after entering the dinning area any bad smell was covered by fragrant garlic smell. This restaurant looks small from the entrance but they have second floor dinning area so it is relatively big but since they are popular, they took many customers in and the place becomes too crowded. There is not much decor and everything looks old and not too clean. 

The garlic crab is decent sized. It is drenched in garlic butter. Sure feels like a pound of butter was used on one crab.  At first it is tasty but after going through about half a crab, I get sick of drinking so much butter. The second half was just average.  The garlic noodle is good but the portion is small for the price. $50 for a crab and $10 for garlic noodle is just over priced for their value. 

Service is good because they get a lot of tips that were mandatorily added for large group. Parking is a little difficult in the neighborhood, but you can use their valet service. 

It was the first time I visited this place but it is likely my last time because of the value of the food and entertainment factor which were lacking.

excerpts: I love the garlic noodles and roast crab!!
A must try.
I crave for it all the time when I leave.
garlic noodles.author: Melanie J.
garlic noodles.review: Every time I'm in town I can't wait to eat here! I love the garlic noodles and roast crab!! A must try. I crave for it all the time when I leave.

excerpts: Then sea bass for me and crab for my brother and garlic noodles.
Sea bass melted in my mouth!
Crab delicious too.
Service was excellent especially since he recognized my brother was a jujitsu veteran.
Bill $140 including pot of tea and fried banana dessert.
Great night and can't wait to go back with my wife.
T.J. Vacaville
garlic noodles.author: Tomi K.
garlic noodles.review: Sept 2016:  Met my brother from Camarillo there for first time. Made 7pm reservations on line (Thursday night) but decided to drive out early. Much to our surprise at 5:45 there were many tables open!  So we got seated early. Had calamari appetizers and garlic toast and a beer. Delicous!  Then sea bass for me and crab for my brother and garlic noodles. Sea bass melted in my mouth! Crab delicious too. Service was excellent especially since he recognized my brother was a jujitsu veteran. Bill $140 including pot of tea and fried banana dessert. Great night and can't wait to go back with my wife.  T.J. Vacaville

excerpts: This place has the best crab and garlic noodles, the tiger prawns are awesome too.
The atmosphere is nice and they provide great customer service.
It's out the way from everything
but well worth the drive.
Tough to find a parking spot, though.
garlic noodles.author: Natalie J.
garlic noodles.review: This place has the best crab and garlic noodles, the tiger prawns are awesome too. The atmosphere is nice and they provide great customer service. It's out the way from everything but well worth the drive. Tough to find a parking spot, though.

excerpts: Another fabulous dish is the garlic noodles.
So, a truly remarkable dining experience!
garlic noodles.author: Francisco L.
garlic noodles.review: Simply the best crab in San Francisco! The crab with tamarine sauce is unforgetable! Another fabulous dish is the garlic noodles. So, a truly remarkable dining experience!

excerpts: Get there right when it opens because once the doors unlock the people flood in, you have to order the roasted crab and garlic noodles!
garlic noodles.author: Olivia T.
garlic noodles.review: Good off this fantastic place just once a year because it's such a comitment but it's a MUST if you're in the Bay Area. Get there right when it opens because once the doors unlock the people flood in, you have to order the roasted crab and garlic noodles!

excerpts: Advertised as a secret recipe, it is apparent that some of the ingredients used is oil, black pepper, garlic, and shrimp paste...as for the remaining ingredients, I guess will remain a secret...order some rice too and mix the oil sauce from the crab fish with the rice for tasty carbs...as an excellent side dish, also order the garlic noodles.
garlic noodles.author: David J.
garlic noodles.review:
As an Asian, I have had many seafood trysts throughout North America...however, never had a tasty crab as the Roasted Crab that is served here! This signature dish is sooo flavorful that even your non-crab lovers will convert.

Advertised as a secret recipe, it is apparent that some of the ingredients used is oil, black pepper, garlic, and shrimp paste...as for the remaining ingredients, I guess will remain a secret...order some rice too and mix the oil sauce from the crab fish with the rice for tasty carbs...as an excellent side dish, also order the garlic noodles.

You must try these dishes when in SF (located in Outer Sunset - SF west side)...and be prepared to get your hands dirty as it gets messy to eat (a plastic bib is supplied by the restaurant). Price is based on market value at the time ($40-50). 

Well worth the trip and money...just don't expect fine dining, it's a casual setting...and besides, you want to be in comfortable clothing when you're digging in!

excerpts: Garlic noodles, roasted crab, tiger prawns.
I cannot say a thing about anything else because every time I go, I can't bring myself to order anything else because it's so delicious.
Parking is tough, make sure you have reservations.
We went with a big party and felt like we were accommodated well and service was good.
garlic noodles.author: bree m.
garlic noodles.review:
Garlic noodles, roasted crab, tiger prawns. I cannot say a thing about anything else because every time I go, I can't bring myself to order anything else because it's so delicious. 
Parking is tough, make sure you have reservations. We went with a big party and felt like we were accommodated well and service was good.

excerpts: Excellent one of a kind cram experience the garlic noodles are to die for and wait till you taste the calamari!
OMG!!
Enjoy
garlic noodles.author: Desana M.
garlic noodles.review: Excellent one of a kind cram experience the garlic noodles are to die for and wait till you taste the calamari! OMG!! Enjoy

excerpts: Garlic noodles are a must!!!
Looking forward to my next visit.
garlic noodles.author: Cassandra G.
garlic noodles.review: The food was amazing! It came out quickly and it was fresh. The service exceeded my expectations and the price was fair. Garlic noodles are a must!!! Looking forward to my next visit.

excerpts: Of course I ordered the Garlic Noodles and Garlic Crab.
The Garlic noodles were a tad bit dry but absolutely flavorful.
garlic noodles.author: Michelle T.
garlic noodles.review:
Normally I don't venture out to this side of town (san francisco), however I do know people in the Sunset area. 

I had this place bookmarked for a while and finally got a chance to check it out.

Of course I ordered the Garlic Noodles and Garlic Crab.

Mind you, your wallet might burst into flames when you hear the cost of said crab and the size of the crab.  But totally worth if if you want to splurge and love crab!  

The Garlic noodles were a tad bit dry but absolutely flavorful.  I would order them again because it was made very well.

The place settings caught me off guard, it was not something I was expecting from this place.  I had a great dining experience, especially due to the attentive wait staff.


They take reservations! In case you were wondering.

excerpts: I ordered the roasted Dungeness crab with garlic noodles for dinner.
The garlic noodles were on the bland side and were literally garlic + noodles with no other meat or vegetables on it.
But the main reason you come here is for the crab.
It was delicious!
The crab meat was sweet, tender, and came out beautifully in huge chunks when cracked open.
I could not get enough of it.
Pro tip: skip out on the carbs and just order the crab.
It will be worth it!
garlic noodles.author: Robin U.
garlic noodles.review: I ordered the roasted Dungeness crab with garlic noodles for dinner. The garlic noodles were on the bland side and were literally garlic + noodles with no other meat or vegetables on it. But the main reason you come here is for the crab. It was delicious! The crab meat was sweet, tender, and came out beautifully in huge chunks when cracked open. I could not get enough of it. Pro tip: skip out on the carbs and just order the crab. It will be worth it!

excerpts: We ordered crab, tiger prawns and the garlic noodles, of course.
The prawns were over cooked and super rubbery, needed to fight with a knife to cut them and the noodles were dry dry dry dry!
The crab, just meh, nothing spectacular to speak of at all.
Did I mention the super dry noodles?
Maybe it was an off day or maybe I've had  better
but I was expecting so much more from this place.
garlic noodles.author: Miss M.
garlic noodles.review:
I don't get the hype at all, the food was subpar at best.  We ordered crab, tiger prawns and the garlic noodles, of course.  The prawns were over cooked and super rubbery, needed to fight with a knife to cut them and the noodles were dry dry dry dry!  The crab, just meh, nothing spectacular to speak of at all.  Did I mention the super dry noodles? Maybe it was an off day or maybe I've had  better but I was expecting so much more from this place.  Our waiter seemed annoyed or in a bad mood, not friendly at all and gave us the sense he felt obligated to assist us.  

I felt awful because my boyfriend tried to do something new for my birthday, but it was total and complete waste of $100, such a shame.

excerpts: The crab and garlic noodles were okay.
I'm not really sure what the rave is about.
The staff was really slow.
I asked for coffee 3 times and then I just gave it.
It was pretty annoying.
Pepper Crab was on the bland side.
garlic noodles.author: Tiff W.
garlic noodles.review: I had much higher expectations of this place. The crab and garlic noodles were okay. I'm not really sure what the rave is about. The staff was really slow. I asked for coffee 3 times and then I just gave it. It was pretty annoying. Pepper Crab was on the bland side.

excerpts: The food: I ordered the Roasted Crab, garlic noodles, and salt&pepper calamari.
I would absolutely order the crab and garlic noodles again.
The calamari I could do without, it was good but not earth shattering.
The food came out quick and was piping hot.
The crab has great flavor and fresh.
For the roasted crab, garlic noodles, calamari, and a pear cider
the grand total was $85.00.
The garlic noodles are definitely enough for two people, so share greedy goblins.
You could share the crab too, but who wants to do that?!?!
garlic noodles.author: Meghan M.
garlic noodles.review:
This place has a ton of reviews already, so I will make this short and sweet.

The food: I ordered the Roasted Crab, garlic noodles, and salt&pepper calamari. I would absolutely order the crab and garlic noodles again. The calamari I could do without, it was good but not earth shattering. The food came out quick and was piping hot. The crab has great flavor and fresh. I am not a huge fan of dungenous (I prefer snow) but this was excellent.

The service: We never had to ask more than once for something, our water cups were always refilled without us having to ask, fresh bowls for our crab shells were brought out every so often and our waiter was very attentive. Out food came out in a timely fashion as well.

The ambiance: The place is quite unassuming from the outside. the downstairs is decorated a little nicer than upstairs (it kind of just looks like an added addition after the fact) But everything is clean and the tables are spaced pretty good.

Price: not for the faint of heart. For the roasted crab, garlic noodles, calamari, and a pear cider the grand total was $85.00. The garlic noodles are definitely enough for two people, so share greedy goblins. You could share the crab too, but who wants to do that?!?!

excerpts: Granted large crabs at market rates are always going to be pricey, but $9.50 for a bowl of garlic noodles (no matter how delicious) is on the extreme side of markups.
Two people sampling a couple of crab and a large bowl of garlic noodles and some drinks can easily run you over $100 including tax and tip.
garlic noodles.author: J. O.
garlic noodles.review:
Three and half stars rounded up to 4; stars deducted because of the $$$. It's a great place spot for large parties or out of town guests, but I wish the prices weren't so high. Granted large crabs at market rates are always going to be pricey, but $9.50 for a bowl of garlic noodles (no matter how delicious) is on the extreme side of markups. 

Two people sampling a couple of crab and a large bowl of garlic noodles and some drinks can easily run you over $100 including tax and tip.

excerpts: garlic crab & garlic noodles are the best..
My husband loves the tiger prawns..
Excellent everytime!
garlic noodles.author: Yana H.
garlic noodles.review: Satisfaction guaranteed!...I have never had a bad experience here...garlic crab & garlic noodles are the best..My husband loves the tiger prawns.. Excellent everytime!

excerpts: Garlic Noodles - THE BEST garlic noodles I've ever tasted, hands down.
1 order is enough for about 3-4 people.
garlic noodles.author: Michelle L.
garlic noodles.review:
It really doesn't get any better than this when it comes to crab!    I called a couple days in advance to make a 7pm reservation on a Sunday night.  They offer valet service outside the restaurant for $12.  Highly recommended since parking is a B!  There is no parking lot, only street parking in the surrounding neighborhood.

Got there 10 minutes before our reservation and they were able to seat us downstairs right away! We ordered:

*Salt and Pepper calamari - not your typical calamari at American restaurants and they don't provide any dipping sauces.  This was almost too peppered, but still delicious nonetheless.
 
*Garlic Noodles - THE BEST garlic noodles I've ever tasted, hands down.  1 order is enough for about 3-4 people.  ($10)

*Roast Crab - this is what everyone gets!  A whole crab in their special garlic sauce. They gut the inside of main body for you so the head you get is nothing but the shell. The plate is buttered for your for your dipping pleasure.  (Market price ~$40 each crab)

*Fried banana with ice cream - so delicious and really hits the spot.

The service was really fast, we never waited long for anything to come out.  They give you bowls to put your crab shells in.  They refilled our water like 5 times; they were on point with checking up on our table the whole night. And at the end of your meal, they give you hot towels to wipe all the crab guts off your hands.

I always recommend this place to anyone looking for good crab places in the city!

excerpts: We ordered the crispy fried rice paper rolls, the salt and pepper calamari, the roasted Dungeness crab, the garlic noodles and the garlic noodles with the colossal tiger prawns.
We loved the crispy fried rice paper rolls, the salt and pepper calamari was a little overdone for our taste.
We then put on our bibs and started cracking the Dungeness crab.
We loved the crispy fried rice paper rolls, the salt and pepper calamari was a little overdone for our taste.
We then put on our bibs and started cracking the Dungeness crab.
OMG - this was really good and then dug into the garlic noodles and tried the colossal tiger prawns.
Everything was really good
and now I think we'll make it a plan to come in for meals in SF more often.
garlic noodles.author: Susan C.
garlic noodles.review: I've been told by numerous parties to come and visit this place. Since I live in the San Jose area, it's not easy to go in just for dinner.  Today was the day since we had plans to be in SF for the day.  I made a reservation and showed up and was ready to go.  We ordered the crispy fried rice paper rolls, the salt and pepper calamari, the roasted Dungeness crab, the garlic noodles and the garlic noodles with the colossal tiger prawns.  We loved the crispy fried rice paper rolls, the salt and pepper calamari was a little overdone for our taste.  We then put on our bibs and started cracking the Dungeness crab.  OMG - this was really good and then dug into the garlic noodles and tried the colossal tiger prawns.  Everything was really good and now I think we'll make it a plan to come in for meals in SF more often.

excerpts: Must eat: Garlic Noodles, Shaken Beef and Crab of course!
We opted to try the crab with tamarind sauce since we have had the roasted crab before.
It was a great choice but a bit messy.
Thanks for giving us a stack of napkins!
We needed that.
Call us napkin monsters.
I looked around and it seemed like almost every table got at least the same three dishes.
The garlic noodles are sooo good!
The noodles are chewy and the perfect texture.
The garlic isn't super overpowering but very flavorful.
Simple yet so yummy!
Shaken beef was tender and delicious.
It was served on a bed of mixed greens with cooked potatoes and onions.
garlic noodles.author: Liv A.
garlic noodles.review:
It's crab season! Is Thanh Long ever not crowded? There were people all packed by the front door and outside waiting for a table yesterday evening. I don't blame them. They know where to eat! Kudos to bf for making a ressie. We were seated right away and already knew what we were going to order.

Must eat: Garlic Noodles, Shaken Beef and Crab of course! We opted to try the crab with tamarind sauce since we have had the roasted crab before. It was a great choice but a bit messy. Thanks for giving us a stack of napkins! We needed that. Call us napkin monsters. I looked around and it seemed like almost every table got at least the same three dishes. The garlic noodles are sooo good!  The noodles are chewy and the perfect texture. The garlic isn't super overpowering but very flavorful. Simple yet so yummy! Shaken beef was tender and delicious. It was served on a bed of mixed greens with cooked potatoes and onions. The tamarind sauce on the crab was a tomato based but had a hint of sweetness to balance the acidity.

The wait staff was very prompt. They kept removing our bowls of crab shells and giving us fresh bowls. Our water glasses were always full throughout our meal as well. 

Because the restaurant is crowded and the tables set very close together, it was a bit difficult to carry a conversation in normal voice level. I caught myself asking bf to repeat himself a few times and vice versa. I could literally hear what the tables next to us were saying too. 

Minus a star for the upkeep of the restroom. I went to wash my hands prior to my meal and noticed that there were paper towels and tp strewn on the floor. There was also a used wedge of lime (from a cocktail?) on the sink counter....odd. After my meal, I went to wash my hands again. The restroom was in the same condition, except with more paper towels on the floor this time. Doesn't seem like the restroom was maintained during service.

excerpts: Best garlic noodles and crabs idc
this is the legit spot.
Been coming here for years.
This place is a staple in the city of SF.
Everyone who lives in SF knows about this place ...
Not super expensive but not cheap.
Anyways just try it you won't regret it
garlic noodles.author: Colette P.
garlic noodles.review: I can't believe I haven't written a review of this place... I love thanh long.. Forever lol. Best garlic noodles and crabs idc this is the legit spot. Been coming here for years. This place is a staple in the city of SF. Everyone who lives in SF knows about this place ... Not super expensive but not cheap. Anyways just try it you won't regret it

excerpts: the real reason we came was for the garlic noodles.
i've had them from their truck, an the go, and they were amazing.
my mom first had them at crustacean, and she loved them there, too.
we were so looking forward to them that we got a side order, and we also got the prawns that came atop the noodles.
the colossal royal tiger prawns consisted of four butterflied prawns atop a pile of the aforementioned garlic noodles.
i didn't like the butterflied cut; while pretty, it was hard to get the shrimp out of the shell.
they were well-seasoned and so smoky, and i thought they were the best morsel (okay, like 4 bites) of the night.
dad was unimpressed and thought them overdone.
it was marked as mp, but there's no way that four butterflied shrimp atop a pile of garlic noodles is $38.
4 stars for the food, even if the curry lotus prawns were veryyy meh and the garlic noodles didn't quite satisfy what i was looking for.
knocked down to 3 stars because i don't care how good your shrimp are, $38 is too much for 4.
garlic noodles.author: Heather F.
garlic noodles.review:
went here with my family on a saturday night at 7pm, and was seated almost immediately. don't bother coming if you don't have reservations, because it is packed. it is pretty loud, which is fine though a bit bothersome usually; however, i was with my grandma, so that made talking to her a lot harder.

grilled calamari- so tender! the bodies were chewy but yet so tender. fabulously smoky. the creamy pb sauce yummy but nothing special. 

the shaken beef was soooo tender. and like quality beef tender, not baking soda tender. really flavorful and liked that it was cubed and easy to eat. the salad underneath with sauteed onions was yummy.

the real reason we came was for the garlic noodles. i've had them from their truck, an the go, and they were amazing. my mom first had them at crustacean, and she loved them there, too. we were so looking forward to them that we got a side order, and we also got the prawns that came atop the noodles. and they were so sad.

the separate order was kind of cold, and the noodles were somewhat hard. they tasted as if they'd be on the counter and forgotten for a while, and overall didn't seem very fresh. the ones that were underneath the shrimp were a lot better thank goodness. rich and buttery and cheesy and actually hot. they still weren't as good as when i had them last, but not sure if it's because the product wasn't as good or if my expectations were too high.

and let's talk about those shrimp. the colossal royal tiger prawns consisted of four butterflied prawns atop a pile of the aforementioned garlic noodles. i didn't like the butterflied cut; while pretty, it was hard to get the shrimp out of the shell. they were well-seasoned and so smoky, and i thought they were the best morsel (okay, like 4 bites) of the night. dad was unimpressed and thought them overdone. it was marked as mp, but there's no way that four butterflied shrimp atop a pile of garlic noodles is $38. that kind of ruined the best bite of the night thing for me.

in an attempt to insert some foliage into our lives, we got the seasonal veggies. and they were meh. but what do you get for ordering stupid things? the sauce was actually pretty good though and dad sopped it up with rice.

the curry lotus prawns were ordered because dad was still hungry. this was one big wtf. the water chestnuts were too huge (it sounds stupid but i swear), and i found myself halfheartedly plodding away at a bunch of them. the green beans tasted old and tough. the curry itself was very oddly flavored- there were a bunch of spices/herbs that i didn't recognize and didn't care for. it almost tasted medicinal to me. the coconut milk wasn't apparent, so there wasn't any creaminess to help save the curry. the shrimp was crisp and tender, and that was the only good part.

4 stars for the food, even if the curry lotus prawns were veryyy meh and the garlic noodles didn't quite satisfy what i was looking for. knocked down to 3 stars because i don't care how good your shrimp are, $38 is too much for 4.

excerpts: long wait service sucked PFchangs garlic noodles were better
garlic noodles.author: Sac M.
garlic noodles.review: OVERRATED!!! I don't eat crab and wasn't sure what to get but I wasn't impressed maybe it's what I ordered yelp photos look good tho it was packed long wait service sucked PFchangs garlic noodles were better

excerpts: The garlic noodles are bomb but the crab is aiiiiiiight!
This place can get ratchet tho since its a famous place.
garlic noodles.author: Marcus M.
garlic noodles.review: Boogi food spot. The garlic noodles are bomb but the crab is aiiiiiiight! This place can get ratchet tho since its a famous place.

excerpts:
Fair
Jumbo grilled prawns over garlic noodles.
Good.
garlic noodles.author: brian k.
garlic noodles.review:
The Iconic Vietnamese Seafood Restaurant. 

Garlic Roasted Crab and Garlic Noodle. 

Each and every table has is proudly displayed, with the eaters sporting disposable bibs and eager appetites. 

We arrived before the big rush at 5:30 on a Friday. 

Hmm...

Let's be different. 

Started with a double Kettle over w/2 limes and a Fleur de Mango. 
Waiter comes back. "Sorry, no mando'd,"
"OK. How about the lychee pineapple infused vodka?"
"Sorry. Don't have that either."
Really?
"How about a pear martini?"
Yes sir. Coming right up. 

1/2 hour into the night they don't have 2 of their signature cocktails?

On to the food. 
Wanting to be different, we order:
Mango seafood salad. EXCELLENT
Fried crab Rangoon. Fair
Jumbo grilled prawns over garlic noodles. Good. Maybe very good. 

Salad had the best dressing and good balance of ingredients.

Rangoon had no crab taste at all. 

Prawns were flavored good with good noodles, but lacked presentation. Just 4 grilled butterflied prawns on a bed of noodles. Boring. 

Dessert was a good Irish Coffee and a perfectly fried banana. 

Good food. A bit pricey for what you get, but if you want the famous crab and noodles, come on down!

excerpts: The crab and the garlic noodles were effing FANTASTIC.
I paid $60-- which included my GINORMOUS plate of grab, my huge serving of garlic noodles, tax and tip.
garlic noodles.author: Ashley J.
garlic noodles.review:
Came here with a huge group for my sorority sister's birthday-- Friday night. It was PACKED. We had reservations in advance, and were seated promptly at 8pm. I found parking down the street, which wasn't too far away. The parking is o the streets, but in this neighborhood, shouldn't take you more than a couple loops around the block to get a spot.

We ordered a couple drinks from the bar that carried over with us to the table. Out of our group of 12, we all ordered either the garlic crab or the other crab (once you see the menu, you'll see the two main ones that I'm talking about), and we all LICKED OUR FINGERS. Damn, damn, dizzamn. The crab and the garlic noodles were effing FANTASTIC. The noodles are even better the next day.

We paid a pretty penny, but it was well worth it. I paid $60-- which included my GINORMOUS plate of grab, my huge serving of garlic noodles, tax and tip. I drank only water. 

I would absolutely come back here again and again, but I'd go with the parental units so they would pick up the check lol

excerpts: so I had the red snapper with garlic noodles.
Enjoyed both as I watched my daughter dismantle the roasted crab.
garlic noodles.author: Pat C.
garlic noodles.review: I don't eat shellfish so I had the red snapper with garlic noodles. Enjoyed both as I watched my daughter dismantle the roasted crab.

excerpts: Garlic noodles were the right amount of butter and garlic.
Finished off with FBI-fried banana and ice cream was so amazing.
The fried banana was heated and the cold from the coconut ice cream was such a great combination!
All of the copy cats cannot compare.
The only thing was the sea bass my husband ordered was late and was a bit rubbery but the server gave free garlic noodle in return.
I do miss the old days when there were white tablecloths and the busboys scraping the crab and crap off your table but the heated towels still come out.
Be careful tho.
My brother kinda felt the burn of the towel.
Overall, still the best place when you're in the mood for roast crab and garlic noodles.
Note: cash only for valet parking.
garlic noodles.author: Cera-Lyn S.
garlic noodles.review: Ok now I remember why this place is still one of my all time favs! I have not been here in over 10 years and the quality and service is still the best. The roasted crab was still buttery and garlicky and the noodles. Oh. My. God. Started off at the bar and the drinks were not that strong. Reservations were easy enough over the phone but once there we still had to wait about 20 minutes. Line out the door and packed in the front like sardines. No personal space here. Ordered the appetizers: crab wontons and calamari and the shrimp salad. Everything was excellent! Roasted crab was amazing the only drawback was the body of crab was not that fat. Garlic noodles were the right amount of butter and garlic. Finished off with FBI-fried banana and ice cream was so amazing. The fried banana was heated and the cold from the coconut ice cream was such a great combination! All of the copy cats cannot compare. The only thing was the sea bass my husband ordered was late and was a bit rubbery but the server gave free garlic noodle in return. I do miss the old days when there were white tablecloths and the busboys scraping the crab and crap off your table but the heated towels still come out. Be careful tho. My brother kinda felt the burn of the towel. Overall, still the best place when you're in the mood for roast crab and garlic noodles. Note: cash only for valet parking.

excerpts: The only thing you need is a whole crab, garlic noodles, and a Coke.
I can honestly say that this the best crab & garlic noodles
I ever had in my life,
no exaggeration.
5 star crab.
5 star noodles.
garlic noodles.author: Mono L.
garlic noodles.review:
Parking is hard to find around this block. Near the beach. The only thing you need is a whole crab, garlic noodles, and a Coke. I can honestly say that this the best crab & garlic noodles I ever had in my life, no exaggeration. 5 star crab. 5 star noodles. $80+ 

Make up a birthday and get the free ice cream, it's hella good.

excerpts: Came here because i was craving the tamarind crab, but got suckered in to order the infamous roasted crab, garlic noodles, calamari, and tamarind crab.
I actually really liked the infamous roasted crab here because the seasoning on the crab really brought out the flavor.
the garlic noodles were great, I liked how they had a big portion.
The calamari was okay
, i could of got it somewhere else that would be better.
I loved the tamarind crab because i actually like tamarind.
This place was really hyped up and now i know why after trying out their food.
Make sure you come early or make reservation because this places gets packed on weekdays and weekends!
Kind of pricey for this place though.
garlic noodles.author: Johnny L.
garlic noodles.review: Came here because i was craving the tamarind crab, but got suckered in to order the infamous roasted crab, garlic noodles, calamari, and tamarind crab. I actually really liked the infamous roasted crab here because the seasoning on the crab really brought out the flavor. the garlic noodles were great, I liked how they had a big portion. The calamari was okay, i could of got it somewhere else that would be better. I loved the tamarind crab because i actually like tamarind. This place was really hyped up and now i know why after trying out their food.  Make sure you come early or make reservation because this places gets packed on weekdays and weekends! Kind of pricey for this place though.

excerpts: I ordered my favorite dish they serve- tiger prawns on a bed of garlic noodles.
I was extremely happy with the food and the service.
We got there at about 6:46 pm; I had reservations for 7pm.
We didn't get seated until exactly; but once we were the seated the service was amazing.
Our waiter listened to our orders and instructions attentively.
He revisit our table to make to we had water and ask we were having a good time.
Can't wait to go back!
garlic noodles.author: Brian B.
garlic noodles.review: The food tasted like something beyond good. I ordered my favorite dish they serve- tiger prawns on a bed of garlic noodles.  I was extremely happy with the food and the service. We got there at about 6:46 pm; I had reservations for 7pm. We didn't get seated until exactly; but once we were the seated the service was amazing. Our waiter listened to our orders and instructions attentively. He revisit our table to make to we had water and ask we were having a good time. Can't wait to go back!

excerpts: The so called famous enough garlic noodles taste like they came right out of a box and lacked flavor.
The crab at $55 was frozen not fresh and extremely salty.
There are far better places to go in the city for great crab.
The portions are small and 1 crab is not enough for two people.
Extremely disappoimte
garlic noodles.author: Mamma G.
garlic noodles.review: This place is a rip off!!  You will pay $12 to park your car and $20 for an SUV.  The inside is wide open and basically cafeteria seating.  The so called famous enough garlic noodles taste like they came right out of a box and lacked flavor.  The crab at $55 was frozen not fresh and extremely salty. There are far better places to go in the city for great crab. The portions are small and 1 crab is not enough for two people.  Extremely disappoimte

excerpts: The flavor is really nice, and my wife liked the garlic noodles.
garlic noodles.author: Chad H.
garlic noodles.review:
The most important question is: what we go back? And the answer is: no.

They charge way too much for what you get. The two of us paid $100 for the meal, and we're leaving hungry. Also, we had no alcohol. The expensive thing is the crab. They charge $50 for it and it's not very much.

The waitstaff was nice, though. The place is clean and the ambience is fine. The maître d' was not particularly warm or friendly, and when we left he didn't even look us in the eye when we said goodbye.

The crab is really great here. The flavor is really nice, and my wife liked the garlic noodles. 

The Vietnamese salad was a joke. It was a bunch of shredded cold and cold cabbage with boiled shrimp and chicken on top. It had absolutely no flavor, and I don't think I would call it a salad. It tasted more like something you would feed a rabbit. 

If you're looking for the same food but way better and half the price, go to Bodega Bistro instead. They know how to do it right.

excerpts: but i'd definitely go back for the garlic noodles
garlic noodles.author: Mandi S.
garlic noodles.review: This place is known for its crab but to be honest, i feel like i've had better. Its not bad at all, i still enjoyed it but it didn't live up to my expectation. Only reason why i'm giving it a 4/5. Other than that, the rest or the food, the service, and the over all experience was amazing. Its a bit pricy but i'd definitely go back for the garlic noodles

excerpts: Simply put...the best drunken crab and garlic noodles in the Bay Area!
Tiger prawns are delicious as well!
Be prepared to spend some $$$!
garlic noodles.author: Chris C.
garlic noodles.review: Simply put...the best drunken crab and garlic noodles in the Bay Area!  Tiger prawns are delicious as well!  Be prepared to spend some $$$!

excerpts: The garlic noodles were over rated, definitely not worth 10 dollars for a plate of plain egg noodles.
Great service and staff, very helpful with their knowledge of the menu
garlic noodles.author: Jonathan C.
garlic noodles.review: Expect a long wait if you are walking in. I waited for 90 minutes walking in at 7:30 but I'm not here to complain about that. I was expected to be blown away but maybe I was unlucky. Their Thanh long crab was good but not worth 2 hours for. The garlic noodles were over rated, definitely not worth 10 dollars for a plate of plain egg noodles. Great service and staff, very helpful with their knowledge of the menu

excerpts: The suggestion was the specialty, the crab, and an order of the garlic noodles.
I ordered both, and was a little heartbroken with disappointment.
Don't get me wrong, the food was far from terrible, but it was also far from to die for.
At best it was average.
I'm not sure if it was the hype that killed it, or really just the average meal.
I will say that the service was nice.
But eh, I can't say I'm interested in going back on future trips to the west coast.
garlic noodles.author: Dominique C.
garlic noodles.review: I realllllly wanted to like this place. When I told friends I was going to San Francisco, everyone said this is a must eat. The suggestion was the specialty, the crab, and an order of the garlic noodles. I ordered both, and was a little heartbroken with disappointment. Don't get me wrong, the food was far from terrible, but it was also far from to die for. At best it was average. I'm not sure if it was the hype that killed it, or really just the average meal. I will say that the service was nice. But eh, I can't say I'm interested in going back on future trips to the west coast.

excerpts: Gotta have the garlic roasted crab and a bowl of the garlic noodles.
garlic noodles.author: Amberlynn A.
garlic noodles.review:
Love this place! Hands down my favorite seafood restaurant.

Gotta have the garlic roasted crab and a bowl of the garlic noodles. MUST.

It gets really busy so make sure to make a reservation ahead of time.

excerpts: The entree with eggplant was outstanding; the peasant pork dish okay but wouldn't order it again; the garlic noodles have an intense garlic flavor and are good for sharing.
Other diners seemed to be having a good time wearing a plastic bib and eating the very expensive crab.
It didn't seem much like a Vietnamese restaurant
but perhaps it is a variant that I just haven't run across before.
Noisy, a fun vibe.
garlic noodles.author: Laura B.
garlic noodles.review: I'm from out of town, stayed at a nearby hotel, and saw this restaurant as my husband and I walked up the street from the muni stop. The entree with eggplant was outstanding; the peasant pork dish okay but wouldn't order it again; the garlic noodles have an intense garlic flavor and are good for sharing.  Other diners seemed to be having a good time wearing a plastic bib and eating the very expensive crab.  It didn't seem much like a Vietnamese restaurant but perhaps it is a variant that I just haven't run across before.  Noisy, a fun vibe.

excerpts: the prices are too high, the Tiger Garlic Prawns with garlic noodles is $35 a serving!
garlic noodles.author: Mr Bolo B.
garlic noodles.review:
the prices are too high, the Tiger Garlic Prawns with garlic noodles is $35 a serving! I thought that was too much for a plate of chow mein with shrimp , it's nothing fancy

the Shaken Beef [Thit Bo Luc Lac] is also over priced at $21 a plate, I just had the same thing at another vietnamese restaurant for $8

I think this place is Over-Hyped because of Diners, Drive ins & Dives

this is not a traditional Vietnamese restaurant it's mostly for Yuppies or rich people that like to waste their money

I wont be comming back anytime soon when there are so many other better places with  more reasonable prices

dont need the fancy table cloths or wine glasses

excerpts:
Kind of glad that the waiter forgot our ToGo of Colossal Prawn with Garlic Noodles - a whooping market price of $38 which was ehhh.

Price: $38 for some garlic noodles and 4 pieces of grille prawn... 
Sucks to enjoy a restaurant with rave reviews if you have a wife that can whip up Garlic noodles with fresh garlic, noodles with better texture, and without the MSG.
garlic noodles.author: Jomeo D.
garlic noodles.review:
Parking: Horrible

Service: Good. We were seated right away because we beat the dinner rush. The servers were attentive. Kind of glad that the waiter forgot our ToGo of Colossal Prawn with Garlic Noodles - a whooping market price of $38 which was ehhh.

Setting: Nicely dimmed. Our plates were both oily maybe from all the butter that they use and the sub-par washing that follow. Mine also had a piece of something stuck on it which the waiter quickly switched out for another one that was not greasy.

Food: MSG. My wife has MSG radar. After eating their garlic noodle and the appetizers, she received a massive pulsating headache. For an upscale restaurant like this... I would think they would not need to use MSG.

Price: $38 for some garlic noodles and 4 pieces of grille prawn... no....

I guess I am picky. But like their truck, their garlic noodle had heavy doses of garlic powder, butter and apparently MSG. Sucks to enjoy a restaurant with rave reviews if you have a wife that can whip up Garlic noodles with fresh garlic, noodles with better texture, and without the MSG.

Happy yelping!

excerpts: We ordered the Garlic Noodles and the Roasted Crab.
The waiters put a bib around your neck and everyone gets their own cracker and small fork.
I don't normally eat Roasted Crab
but I know this one was really good and tasty.
There was a lot of butter though, and you can see it all on the plate.
The crab was salty and delicious!
The garlic noodles were buttery but also really good.
One of the better garlic noodles that I've had.
I would come back here again for the garlic noodles.
garlic noodles.author: Paul U.
garlic noodles.review:
I live near this place and never heard about it until my friends wanted to come here. And I'm glad they wanted to come here!

This restaurant is at the corner, diagonal from the 7 Eleven. The inside is spacious, though my chair was back-to-back and touching the guy's chair behind me. We came here on a Wednesday night around 8PM and were able to sit us down as soon as we got in.

We ordered the Garlic Noodles and the Roasted Crab. The waiters put a bib around your neck and everyone gets their own cracker and small fork. I don't normally eat Roasted Crab but I know this one was really good and tasty. There was a lot of butter though, and you can see it all on the plate. The crab was salty and delicious! Tasty but the crab itself was $42.

The garlic noodles were buttery but also really good. One of the better garlic noodles that I've had. I would come back here again for the garlic noodles.

Overall, this place is a great little restaurant on Judah in the Outer Sunset. Though a little expensive, the crab is a good meal to share with one or two other people. The garlic noodle was tasty and I recommend it!

Pros:
-Tasty crab
-Great tasting garlic noodle

Cons:
-Crab is market price, so it'll be pricey

excerpts: Hits - roast crab, garlic noodles.
That's it.
garlic noodles.author: Nat N.
garlic noodles.review:
I started coming here when I lived in San Fran, and even though I don't live there anymore, I'll still make it a point to come here every time I visit the Bay area.  

By now you should know that the owners of Thanh Long are the same owners as Crustaceans, and both places have the same menus and presumptively the same recipes.  But I've tried Crustaceans in San Fran and also LA, and Crustaceans is just not as good as Thanh Long.  Not only is the food tastier at Thanh Long, but the portions are more generous.  I also like how the atmosphere at Thanh Long is more casual than Crustaceans.  

The only drawback is that it's located in the outer sunset area, which is accessible via the N Judah line, or you can drive (good luck finding parking in this neighborhood).  

Hits - roast crab, garlic noodles.  That's it.  Don't waste your time ordering anything else.  

Miss - dessert

I like to end my meal with their hot Jasmine tea.  Hot tea is always soothing after a greasy, buttery meal.

excerpts: As most Yelpers have mentioned, you can forget about looking at the menu because there are only TWO THINGS to order at Thanh Long: THE CRAB and the GARLIC NOODLES!

*GARLIC NOODLES w/ Special Garlic Sauce & Spices (2 orders @ $9.50/each) - 3 STARS
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/z9CN58fSrA46ggyb6OnCnQ?select=JUXoSeXnlJljPgzqmexqAg
Garlic noodles and any solid noodle dish for that matter should be al-dente with a nice, chewy toothsome bite to it to show its freshness and proper execution.
Though deliciously buttery and fragrant with lots of garlicky bits, Thanh Long's garlic noodles were choppy and mushy.
garlic noodles.author: Cherylynn N.
garlic noodles.review:
R&G vs. PPQ vs. Thanh Long: Who's Reigns Supreme?

If you're a San Franciscan and/or a foodie, you probably know or have heard the TOP 3 places to go for crab in SF is R&G, PPQ, and Thanh Long. Although I've downgraded my review for both R&G and PPQ because of horrible service at our follow-up visits, as far as taste goes, in my opinion Thanh Long is at the bottom of the three.

On Sunday, 7.24.11, my friends and I came to Thanh Long for our quarterly crab dinner. It was my first time and my friends' third time here. We had reservations for 5:30 PM which I made several days prior. Thanh Long place gets packed, so reservations are highly recommended. Upon arrival we were promptly seated. 

As most Yelpers have mentioned, you can forget about looking at the menu because there are only TWO THINGS to order at Thanh Long: THE CRAB and the GARLIC NOODLES! And given the rave reviews and hype, I didn't care to order anything else. 

F O O D
For a party of three we ordered:

*ROASTED CRAB w/ An's Garlic Sauce & Spices (~$38) - 4 STARS
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/z9CN58fSrA46ggyb6OnCnQ?select=JuuVdF8Q2UIeOFAYHPHX8Q
Upon first glance, I was wondering where all the garlic was. The garlic "sauce" was more of oil infused with garlic and black pepper. Though fragrant, the garlic flavor wasn't anywhere as pronounced as PPQ's Roasted Crab and the sauce was merely oil which left a heavy feeling after dinner. The crab was fresh and perfectly roasted though which was evident in the sweet, tender, succulent meat. 

*DRUNKEN CRAB w/ Chardonnay, Sake, Brandy, Scallions & Black Pepper (~$38) - 4 STARS
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/z9CN58fSrA46ggyb6OnCnQ?select=ObzTM78quAF_QKol4BqGcA
If you're more of a crab purist (or an alcoholic) and like to taste it in its unadulterated form, then the Drunken Crab is the way to go. The meat was clean tasting and you can taste all its natural sweetness. It was lightly infused with the trio of alkies, though sake was the most prominent flavor giving it a subtle dry wine flavor.

*GARLIC NOODLES w/ Special Garlic Sauce & Spices (2 orders @ $9.50/each) - 3 STARS
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/z9CN58fSrA46ggyb6OnCnQ?select=JUXoSeXnlJljPgzqmexqAg
Garlic noodles and any solid noodle dish for that matter should be al-dente with a nice, chewy toothsome bite to it to show its freshness and proper execution. Though deliciously buttery and fragrant with lots of garlicky bits, Thanh Long's garlic noodles were choppy and mushy. 

Please note: Thanh Long uses tons of MSG to flavor their food; enough to keep me waking up in the middle of night and running to the kitchen to get a glass of water to sooth my dry throat. 

S E R V I C E
Let's just say the busboy was way more attentive than our waiter. The only thing our waiter did was take our order, bring our food and give us our bill; he never once checked on us. I wasn't surprised though as we have ran into the same service issues at R&G and PPQ and subpar service seems to be a reoccurring theme at many Asian restaurants. The only redeeming thing is our food came out less than 10 minutes after ordering. 

A M BI AN C E / D E C O R
A step above your typical Vietnamese restaurant, Thanh Long has crisp white linen tables and the waitstaff don purple mandarin collared attire. A fairly large restaurant, Thanh Long is a good option for large parties and family dinners. I noticed that a lot of people were on dates though it's very, very loud at Thanh Long.

P A R K I N G
Although I got lucky and found parking in less than 5 minutes across the street, I heard finding street parking can be very difficult in the area. Valet parking is available for $10. 

Compared to R&G (known for their Salt & Pepper Crab), R&G's crab has much more intense flavor with a spicy kick and the fried batter gives it a nice crispy texture contrast to the sweet, tender crab meat. PPQ's Roasted Crab is heavily covered in buttery garlic and each bite is like a garlic clove has exploded in your mouth which is different than Thanh Long's crab which is more subdued sitting in a wading pool of garlic infused oil and black pepper.

So, who reigns supreme? It all boils down to what flavors you're looking for. If want something deliciously salty and spicy with a crunch, R&G's Salt & Pepper is the King. However, if you want something sinfully rich with a strong BURST of garlicky flavor, than PPQ's Roasted Crab definitely trumps Thanh Long's. But don't take my word for it, you be the judge...

excerpts: Colossal Royal Tiger Prawns (5/5): 4 large butterflied and perfectly grilled in the shell prawns that were served over a bed of their famously delicious garlic noodles.
Yeah this was a splurge, at almost $10 a prawn, this was expensive but very (very) good and to be served over the deservedly vaunted garlic noodles, this was a plus.
We didn't have to order the Garlic Noodles as an entree because of this, and the waiter was smart enough to understand this by ignoring our order for these Prawns PLUS a Garlic Noodle order.
The Garlic noodles had the perfect consistency of Yee Noodles, http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yi_mein, which gives them an extra nice bite and appear to absorb the flavors better.
They are also pricey.
The Garlic Noodles by themselves were $9.50 an order, which seems a bit high for lo mein noodles and garlic, but if they are
Yee noodles, they would be more fairly priced.
garlic noodles.author: Glenn H.
garlic noodles.review:
4.5 stars. Minus a half a star for the value of some of the items but overall a terrific night out.

This is a prize of a place. Comfortable setting, great service, excellent quality food and, while maybe spend-y, is worth a look.

For our New Years eve dinner there we four had reservations (needed given the size of the place) at 8 PM. We started the night with two appetizers:

1. Tempura Style Coconut Prawns (3/5). These were not so much the Japanese style tempura (corn starch batter) that you might have had but more coconut shaving encrusted large prawns. There were 5 and were good but, if I had to go again, not a must have.

2. Dungeness Crab Puffs (4/5). These were 6, small, perfectly deep fried, wonton-skin wrapped pillows of Dungeness crab filling that were so much better than the typical Crab Rangoon's that you might have had elsewhere. They came with two dipping sauces, the better one was the sweet mustard. This was a nice, if pricey, treat and a good start to the entrees. 

Four entrees:

1. Roasted Crab (4/5): this smelled wonderful as it came out and was a large, already cut up Dungeness crab, with the carapace shell. It was meaty and perfectly done with the garlic sauce. Really glad we tried this. I like crab but it isn't a must have for me. My table-mates really like it. Market price was almost $40 each.

2. Shaken Beef (5/5): very tender tasty cubes of beef (not well done, if that's important to you) that was marinated in a lightly sweet sauce, served with potato cubes that had also been marinated in the same dark sauce and grilled; all of this served over tender bay greens. Delicious! Everyone liked this dish. The Rice and Roll's Hunan Grilled Butter Beef was very comparable (and less expensive) than this dish but this was still a winning dish. And I need to mention the tender-crisp cuts of sweet Vidalia (that's my guess) onions that were served with this dish, they were great in their own right and really added dimension to the beef.

3. Seafood Combination (Scallops, prawns, Dungeness crab) Fried rice (6/5): if there was one dish that stood out from all of them, it was this dish. A simple, (even unimpressive) looking fried rice dish that just blew people away with its wok-seared taste and awesome flavors. Fried rice, yes. But extraordinary? For a mere $16 Absolutely!

4. Colossal Royal Tiger Prawns (5/5): 4 large butterflied and perfectly grilled in the shell prawns that were served over a bed of their famously delicious garlic noodles. Yeah this was a splurge, at almost $10 a prawn, this was expensive but very (very) good and to be served over the deservedly vaunted garlic noodles, this was a plus. We didn't have to order the Garlic Noodles as an entree because of this, and the waiter was smart enough to understand this by ignoring our order for these Prawns PLUS a Garlic Noodle order. The prawns did have a tendency to stick to their shells, but they were perfectly done and marinated in some fantastic sauce to make them outstanding.

The Garlic noodles had the perfect consistency of Yee Noodles, http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yi_mein, which gives them an extra nice bite and appear to absorb the flavors better. They are also pricey. The Garlic Noodles by themselves were $9.50 an order, which seems a bit high for lo mein noodles and garlic, but if they are Yee noodles, they would be more fairly priced. Everyone at the table loved these. 

Three deserts: 

Creme Brulee (3/5): this was an OK rendition of Creme Brulee, not bad but not up to the standards of the rest of the meal. Nothing really special.

Chocolate Lava Cake (5/5): Oh yeah! This chocolate delight was the size of a very small hockey puck served with a large scoop of vanilla ice cream over a pool of Grand Marnier & melted vanilla ice cream. It was pricey ($9) but oh so very wonderful to have that rich oozing chocolate goodness.

Fried Banana Fritters a la Mode. (5/5): 2 fritters (your choice of pineapple or banana) served with that same scoop of dense vanilla ice cream. Love, Love, Love this simple but wonderful desert.

It was almost a perfect amount of food for 4 with each of us full to the neck and almost giddy from the great food experience.

While the restaurant was crowded, it never seemed loud or noisy and the service was spot-on: unobtrusive, available, and very polite.

With tip we were at about $50 per person without drinks (which included one modestly iced tea for $2.50).

Loved it and would eagerly go again for a special occasion!

excerpts: The garlic noodles everyone talks about were ok.
I wasn't blown away by it.
We also shared a dumpling appetizer, and there were a total of 5 for maybe $10!
garlic noodles.author: Lynn C.
garlic noodles.review:
My boyfriend kept talking about the crabs at Thanh Long, so we put it on our must do list in San Fran. However, we were very disappointed. I wasn't impressed with the crab, considering the price. Maybe it was because the crabs weren't in season, but still, it just didn't taste fresh. The garlic noodles everyone talks about were ok. I wasn't blown away by it. We also shared a dumpling appetizer, and there were a total of 5 for maybe $10! The other fish dish we ordered was very unimpressive, to the point that I can't even remember what kind of fish it was. 

This place is so out of the way from the downtown area. Totally not worth of the trek or the money :(

excerpts: Garlic noodles were not as dramatic for me--fine, but not spectacular.
Wine and bar options are shallow, but your hands will be too messy eating crab to sip a fancy-schmancy drink anyway.
Go with people you know, since you're spending the evening eating like an otter ripping apart crab, unless you're really trying to test that first date.
Call for a reservation if you can, and be prepared for tables crammed really close together.
Take public transit, a cab or Uber, because parking is impossible.
garlic noodles.author: Alice F.
garlic noodles.review: I will dream about the roasted crab in the future, truly. It was really as good as all the reviews say. Garlic noodles were not as dramatic for me--fine, but not spectacular. Wine and bar options are shallow, but your hands will be too messy eating crab to sip a fancy-schmancy drink anyway. Go with people you know, since you're spending the evening eating like an otter ripping apart crab, unless you're really trying to test that first date. Call for a reservation if you can, and be prepared for tables crammed really close together. Take public transit, a cab or Uber, because parking is impossible.

excerpts: I ended up with the salt and pepper calamari, jumbo prawn wontons, and the infamous garlic noodles.
garlic noodles.author: Lauren S.
garlic noodles.review:
Thanh Long might be in the Outer Sunset of SF but it's more like Outer Space.. 

Between the ride and the parking I was just about to be thru. Thankfully I was happily satisfied by the attention given and wonderful meal prepared for me and my friends.

If you are a crab lover( which I am allergic) then this is the place for you...If not you have some wicked good alternatives. I ended up with the salt and pepper calamari, jumbo prawn wontons, and the infamous garlic noodles. Then I washed it all down with this smooth drink called a "Flying Dragon". 

Of course my companions had the Drunken crab, which even looking at, was making me sick ( I could see their boiled eyes...gross!) All-in-all was a good night, pricey, but worth the trip.

excerpts: they were eating Garlic Noodles and House special crabs!
it was as i have seen, yummmmmy!
garlic noodles.author: Esther C.
garlic noodles.review:
I saw this on Travel Channel. they were eating Garlic Noodles and House special crabs!
it was as i have seen, yummmmmy!

excerpts: Crab very mediocre and garlic noodles were inedible.
Only giving two stars for good customer service and a good lemon drop.
Do not waste your money.
It isn't like it used to be.
garlic noodles.author: Regina P.
garlic noodles.review: Overpriced!!! Crab very mediocre and garlic noodles were inedible.  Only giving two stars for good customer service and a good lemon drop. Do not waste your money. It isn't like it used to be.

excerpts: garlic noodles a must here
Everyone's happy!!!
garlic noodles.author: Elle S.
garlic noodles.review:
Amazing dining experience for girlfriend's 40th birthday here! Evan is spot on awesome! Chilli crab..garlic rice..garlic noodles a must here :) 
Everyone's happy!!!

excerpts: I'm going to start this review off by first stating how excited I was to be coming here after reading all the rave about the crab and garlic noodles.
I made it a point to stop by here on our trip to SF.
Aside from the reviews, I was also impressed by the story of the An family and empire.
I'm Vietnamese so of course Vietnamese food is always an excellent choice in my book.
The food here was good, but so ridiculously overhyped in my opinion.
The garlic noodles tasted bland to me with not enough garlic and the crab was tasty
but how can you ever go wrong with butter, crab, and pepper?
You can really save yourself the $$$ and buy yourself crab, steam it, and make a dipping sauce using lemon and pepper (that's a traditional way to eat it in Vietnam).
The food was good but not worth the effort or hype and our party was seriously disappointed.
To further disappoint, this place really doesn't offer authentic Vietnamese cuisine.
I personally think people need to venture to some hole in the wall Vietnamese place if they're handing out 5 star reviews to Thanh Long.
Our party of 6 ordered the salt and pepper calamari, mango salad, crab puffs, roasted crabs, rice (why is this not included for a $20 entree!!!), spicy eggplant, and garlic noodles.
We ordered two plates of garlic noodles and ended up eating only one.
We got a doggy bag for the leftovers to donate to the homeless (because why not).
garlic noodles.author: Tia D.
garlic noodles.review:
I'm going to start this review off by first stating how excited I was to be coming here after reading all the rave about the crab and garlic noodles. I made it a point to stop by here on our trip to SF. Aside from the reviews, I was also impressed by the story of the An family and empire. I'm Vietnamese so of course Vietnamese food is always an excellent choice in my book. The food here was good, but so ridiculously overhyped in my opinion. The garlic noodles tasted bland to me with not enough garlic and the crab was tasty but how can you ever go wrong with butter, crab, and pepper? You can really save yourself the $$$ and buy yourself crab, steam it, and make a dipping sauce using lemon and pepper (that's a traditional way to eat it in Vietnam). The food was good but not worth the effort or hype and our party was seriously disappointed. To further disappoint, this place really doesn't offer authentic Vietnamese cuisine. I personally think people need to venture to some hole in the wall Vietnamese place if they're handing out 5 star reviews to Thanh Long.
