At some point, I hope to try Crustacean to see if maybe the hype is limited to that brand in the An empire because Thanh Long is underwhelming and disappointing. 

Our party of 6 ordered the salt and pepper calamari, mango salad, crab puffs, roasted crabs, rice (why is this not included for a $20 entree!!!), spicy eggplant, and garlic noodles. We ordered two plates of garlic noodles and ended up eating only one. We got a doggy bag for the leftovers to donate to the homeless (because why not).

excerpts: Makes no sense to order anything else but crab and garlic noodles.
garlic noodles.author: Tess G.
garlic noodles.review: The best best crab I have ever had.  Fresh flavor; Tender crab, great spices.  Makes no sense to order anything else but crab and garlic noodles.

excerpts:
Two orders of Garlic Noodles
(http://bit.ly/1vNfkkq)

Shaken Beef
(http://bit.ly/1rYhton)

Seasonal Vegetables
(Sorry No Pic)

Bowl of rice (
The Garlic Noodles were OMGYUM!
I would definitely splurge on more of them for next time!
The Shaken beef was pertty good too, but I wished they had served a bigger portion.
garlic noodles.author: Rodney H.
garlic noodles.review:
We treated my mom at Thanh Long for Mother's Day as she had a huge craving for really good crabs.  And even though it's been more than 10 years since I've been here, their crabs are still top notch!

We arrived a little late for for our reservation but they managed to hold our table which was cool on their part considering that it was for Mother's Day.

We ordered quite a spread:

Roasted Crab
(Sorry no pic)

Drunken Crab
(http://bit.ly/1vOrEzI)

Two orders of Garlic Noodles
(http://bit.ly/1vNfkkq)

Shaken Beef
(http://bit.ly/1rYhton)

Seasonal Vegetables
(Sorry No Pic)

Bowl of rice (why not?)
(No pic needed)

And their Banana Cake for Dessert
(http://bit.ly/12nUpsi)

All in all, for 4 people it was the perfect amount of food.  Those were some of the best crabs I've had in a had.  Very flavorful, especially the Roasted Crab which I liked the best between that and the Drunken Crab.  The Garlic Noodles were OMGYUM!  I would definitely splurge on more of them for next time!  The Shaken beef was pertty good too, but I wished they had served a bigger portion.  I also tried their Pineapple Lychee Martini and it was seriously refreshing!

I'm glad that Thanh Long still hasn't lost their touch.  It's an awesome spot for any special occasion.

excerpts: Garlic Noodles!!!
garlic noodles.author: Krissy P.
garlic noodles.review:
5 Stars for 2 reasons:
Food and Service!

Food:
I will gladly be a broken record and simply suggest 2 things.

1. The CRAB!!!
2. Garlic Noodles!!!

To be honest, I haven't really ordered much else because those two thing are so darn delicious.

I've been a few of times now.
While the other things we have ordered (mostly just appetizers and desserts) were good, I can't really remember what they were, which, kind of says something in itself.  All in all though, lovely and completely solid food.

Service:
Very fast, friendly and attentive!
What more do you need?

4 Stars for a couple reasons:
Price, Ambiance, Valet.

Price:
The 2lb crab is $50 and while 2lbs sounds like a lot, that includes the shell.
Between my husband and myself, the 2lb crab is gone pretty quickly.
If I had money to burn, we would each order our own but $100 for 2 crabs is INSANE.

Ambiance:
Eh, it's just that it could use a bit of an update.  Its not terrible but a fresh coat of paint and maybe new lighting would do some good.  I guess you can sum it up by describing it as "80's".

Valet:
$12 in the Sunset? I mean, i know I might be calling them out on something silly but to charge $12 in the Outer Sunset is dumb.  That's what you pay in the super crowded part of city. 
ie Financial District, North Beach.

All said, Thanh Long is great and "Yay! I'm a fan."

excerpts: We always get the Roast crab and garlic noodles.
If the service had been just as perfect, I would have given it a fifth star.
garlic noodles.author: Elizabeth D.
garlic noodles.review: We love Thanh Long and go there whenever my Mom or guests are in town. The food is always exquisite. We always get the Roast crab and garlic noodles. If the service had been just as perfect, I would have given it a fifth star.

excerpts: I think the garlic noodles are good .
They have a slightly sweet taste .
I would like them to have a little more butter , definitely they are good. .
garlic noodles.author: Yevette C.
garlic noodles.review:
I have come here twice. First time out server was stressed and very unhelpful . Maybe he was overworked . My second time the service was excellent !! Our waitress was beyond great . If I ever go back it would be because I love a good server , and I did notice other servers provide the same experience to customers near us. 

Food:   I think the garlic noodles are good . They have a slightly sweet taste . I would like them to have a little more butter , definitely they are good. . I actually prefer them with a beef skewer when the truck serves them in Alameda.

The hype for this place is a little over the top in terms of food . I like the Dead Fish hands down when it comes to Crab. Go there you won't be upset!

I would go back if someone invited me .... But would stick with Starters only. Menu is not that extensive . Keep up the good service!!

excerpts: *Garlic Noodles ($9.95) -
Okay.
The noodles were soggier than I remember and a lot less garlic.
The only time he came over was when my friend flagged him down to order another bowl of garlic noodles.
garlic noodles.author: Nicole S.
garlic noodles.review:
Sunday marked my third time here.  PPQ is my first choice for garlic crab, but my friend had never tried Thanh Long so we planned our dinner here.  

RESERVATIONS:
We had a reservation for 3 at 5:30pm.  Two of us arrived a couple minutes after 5:30pm and checked in, however they wouldn't seat us until the entire party was present.

FOOD:
*Roast Crab (market price: $38.95) - Okay.  The crab was roasted and marinated oil and a lot of pepper.  The menu stated garlic sauce but it seemed like oil/butter and lacked the full on garlic taste I was looking for.

*Drunken Crab (market price: $38.95) - Good.  The crab is simmered with chardonnay, sake, and brandy with scallions, chives, and pepper.  The crab tasted great dipped in the broth.  Note: all the pepper does sink to the bottom of the dish so if you're going to dip your crab meat in the broth, do so in the middle.

*Garlic Noodles ($9.95) - Okay.  The noodles were soggier than I remember and a lot less garlic. I use to prefer Thanh Long's noodles over anywhere else, however it seems like they don't put as much as they use to. 

SERVICE:
Don't expect stellar service or even any service.  Our waiter simply took our order and ignored us.  The only time he came over was when my friend flagged him down to order another bowl of garlic noodles.  In my opinion, I believe Thanh Long assumes they already have their clientele and don't put the effort into customer service.

PARKING:
$10 valet or street parking.  Be prepared to circle several times if you chose to self park.

Bottom line?  Thanh Long is overrated and more expensive than other crab venues (i.e. their shaking beef was $24).

excerpts: We had the Garlic Noodles also
but it was sub-par.
garlic noodles.author: Pooky C.
garlic noodles.review:
First off this restaurant is not easy to find. The exterior of the restaurant doesn't give off a fancy vibe and the sign is so small. It's across from 7-11 and you have to use their valet parking because it is impossible to find street parking in this residential neighborhood.

Their famous Roasted Crab didn't disappoint me. The succulent crab is covered with this greasy goo and heavenly seasoning. Your fingers and face get shiny from eating this greasy goodness but you don't care because it is TASTY!

We had the Garlic Noodles also but it was sub-par. Their crab was good but side dishes are better at R&G Lounge.

This is the original location of Crustaceans restaurant chain. I heard the one in downtown is fancier but I'll probably go to R&G if I'm in downtown.

excerpts: We order 2 Garlic Noodles, fried calamari and Villagers Favorite.
Bill was $57.20, drive back to Roseville, when we opened our order, the Villagers favorite was super salty and the portion was 1 spoon worth for $19.95.
The calamari wasn't fried and for $10.95 there was only 3 small pieces.
The 2 orders of garlic noodles was just alright.
It was a total rip off.
garlic noodles.author: Teresa H.
garlic noodles.review: We went here on a Sunday, Dec.17, after a 3 hour drive from Roseville, just walk in yo check for wait time on table, because no reservations, hostess said 45 mins. So we decided to order to go. We order 2 Garlic Noodles, fried calamari and Villagers Favorite. Bill was $57.20, drive back to Roseville, when we opened our order, the Villagers favorite was super salty and the portion was 1 spoon worth for $19.95. The calamari wasn't fried and for $10.95 there was only 3 small pieces. The 2 orders of garlic noodles was just alright. It was a total rip off.

excerpts: We had a cocktail each, which were not memorable, and ordered the Traditional Vietnamese Salad, Garlic Noodles, and of course, the Roast Crab.
Everything was light and delightfully flavorful, as I had remembered.
The garlic noodles were al dente with enough garlic to invade your senses but not overpower.
Thanh Long was started by the An family 30 years ago and I consider this establishment a true classic cuisine staple of San Francisco.
garlic noodles.author: Dennis W.
garlic noodles.review:
It has been nearly 10 years since I had last dined at Thanh Long. Back then, the Roast Crab was literally pushed out of through a hatch in the wall(barely the size of the dish) and then the hatch was quickly closed as if they closely guarding a treasured family recipe(which they probably were).
The dining space has since expanded and the decor is tasteful if not somewhat pedestrian now. But that's ok, because Thanh Long is all about the roast crab for me and the droves of patrons that eagerly walk through their doors every day.
We had a cocktail each, which were not memorable, and ordered the Traditional Vietnamese Salad, Garlic Noodles, and of course, the Roast Crab.
Everything was light and delightfully flavorful, as I had remembered. The Roast Crab had a nicely weighted blend of black pepper, butter, garlic, and various other spices. The garlic noodles were al dente with enough garlic to invade your senses but not overpower.
Thanh Long was started by the An family 30 years ago and I consider this establishment a true classic cuisine staple of San Francisco.

excerpts: Between the fiance and I, we ordered two roasted crabs and a plate of roasted garlic noodles.
Cost is prohibitive.
Crabs are market rate, and went for somewhere between $35-$40 each
(I forget the precise price).
Garlic noodles are $9.
garlic noodles.author: Jeffrey C.
garlic noodles.review:
We came to Thanh Long on a hat tip from a friend. RE: BEST. CRAB. EVAR. To get my verdict, read 'til the end.

There's shady-looking valet parking available, but also a ton of neighborhood streets to try and squeeze your vehicle into. The restaurant itself is rather nice on the inside (especially comparative to the exterior). Hostess and waiter service was predictably Asian. Reservations are definitely helpful, but food comes out blazing fast.

No surprises here. Between the fiance and I, we ordered two roasted crabs and a plate of roasted garlic noodles. Cost is prohibitive. Crabs are market rate, and went for somewhere between $35-$40 each (I forget the precise price). Garlic noodles are $9.

Starting with the noodles, they were delicious. The chow mein-styled noodles were juicy and tasty with just a bare hint of the crispiness from the pan. They were flavored well, though not as overtly garlic-y as I had expected. My only qualm is that it's ONLY noodles, nothing else. Not even a green onion garnish or anything. For that price point, I thought there would be more.

As for the crab, it comes whole, and it's up to you to put in the work. For seafood lovers, one crab is optimal, but that's too much cholesterol for my book. Still the crab was delicious, with a plate dripping in black pepper butter. The best bites are those where you take a swab of black pepper direct to the tongue. It adds a bite that makes your mouth water. 

Still, we had our crab comparators. She was more of a fan of the Fisherman's Wharf in DC. I couldn't help but compare it to the spicy black pepper crab from Singapore. Thanh Long just couldn't quite measure up to those two.

In a normal market, Thanh Long is great. But in a seafood-crazed city like San Francisco, I can't help but wonder if there's not something a little bit better.

excerpts:
Points won for:

Yummy crab
Great garlic noodles

Points lost for:

-Disjointed service (dishes coming out sporadically)
-Poor presentation of food (
garlic noodles.author: Mercy B.
garlic noodles.review:
Some good dishes, but the price:quality/experience ratio is out of whack. 

Points won for:

Yummy crab
Great garlic noodles

Points lost for:

-Disjointed service (dishes coming out sporadically)
-Poor presentation of food (looked like someone had dumped our calamari on some hastily chopped onions - with bits of squid strewn all over the plate) 
-Cost

excerpts: For the two of us after said and done it totaled to well over $100 after tips including drinks and garlic noodles and dessert.
garlic noodles.author: Edwin R.
garlic noodles.review:
We've been here several times and keep forgetting to write a review.  I'll keep mine short and sassy since the 1,476 already written reviews -- I'm sure everyone knows how good this place is.  

Besides having a huge line -- and the wait is long especially if there is just the two of you, the food is delicious.  The roasted crab is just out of this world; pricey however!  For the two of us after said and done it totaled to well over $100 after tips including drinks and garlic noodles and dessert.  You do get a nicely huge plastic "bib" though!

Service considering how busy they were - good!  Not excellent but good -- and it can be improved a little especially when we had to raise our hands a few times to refill our waters.  

Would I come back - probably not anytime soon but really a good place to go for large groups and get together!  :p

excerpts: Got the Garlic Noodles, Mango Salad, and Colossal Royal Tiger Prawns that came out to be about $70 dollars total (omfg).
Mango Salad was a refreshing appetizer.
The Garlic Noodles were okay; didn't think there was anything that special about the dish.
garlic noodles.author: Mandy C.
garlic noodles.review:
Pretty much overrated and expensive Vietnamese fusion food that you can get at other place for a much cheaper price. Got the Garlic Noodles, Mango Salad, and Colossal Royal Tiger Prawns that came out to be about $70 dollars total (omfg). Maybe I just eat too much, but my friend and I were confused as to why the description of the meal said "large", because there was really nothing large about it.

Mango Salad was a refreshing appetizer. The Garlic Noodles were okay; didn't think there was anything that special about the dish. We think that the damage was mostly due to the Tiger Prawns - definitely do not recommend getting it!!!

We didn't try the infamous Crab dish, but we saw many people getting it - even a couple who ordered a crab each... So maybe that's what we should have tried instead?

excerpts: The restaurant is a little pricey but I can excuse it especially when I'm devouring their amazing garlicky buttery dungeness crabs and garlic noodles.
garlic noodles.author: Jaclyn G.
garlic noodles.review:
Our friends living in the Bay area took us here on our first day and visit to San Francisco and I thank them for that. Every single dish we ordered were all good but the star here is the dungeness crab. The restaurant is a little pricey but I can excuse it especially when I'm devouring their amazing garlicky buttery dungeness crabs and garlic noodles. 

Since I live in the east coast, I have to just dream of these dishes or scour the internet for the copy-cat recipes. I've tried making it at home and it was quite delicious but it's still not the same as the original.

excerpts: Drunken crab, roasted crab, coconut prawns, garlic noodles, shaken beef and a sea bass dish.
garlic noodles.author: Rich N.
garlic noodles.review:
We ordered a few different dishes to try out. 

Drunken crab, roasted crab, coconut prawns, garlic noodles, shaken beef and a sea bass dish. 

Atmosphere was just ok. The crowd next us was super loud quite rude. 

Food came out cold. Crab was over cooked. Mediocre at best. 

Service took a bit longer than what we expected. 

Way better crab at the kitchen in millbrae.

excerpts: Colossal prawns and garlic noodles were delicious and the bartender is awesome.
I never would have thought from looking at the outside
garlic noodles.author: Syreeta H.
garlic noodles.review: Roasted crab was amazing. Loved the Dungeness crab puffs. Colossal prawns and garlic noodles were delicious and the bartender is awesome. I never would have thought from looking at the outside

excerpts: The garlic noodles were completely unmemorable (barely tastes like anything) and the Shaken Beef was good, but both items were way way way overpriced.
garlic noodles.author: Ben C.
garlic noodles.review:
The garlic noodles were completely unmemorable (barely tastes like anything) and the Shaken Beef was good, but both items were way way way overpriced. $11 for literally a plate of just noodles and a sprinkle of garlic, plus $24 for a plate of little beef cubes over a plate of dull, frozen lettuce. 

My water glass came to me with a large brown mark on one side of the rim that my friend later explained to me was dried lipstick. The fact that nobody noticed something so obvious speaks volumes about their attention to detail in both their food and decor.

I would give this place four stars if the prices were more like $6 and $10, but at these gouging prices, I would certainly not come back or tell anyone else to.

excerpts: Anyway, 2 crabs, 2 garlic noodles later of course we had to order desert.
We had the fried bananas, fried pineapple and of course creme brulee!
Everything was delicious!
Everything that is delicious of course comes with a price.
But it's worth it from time to time.
I can't wait to come back.
garlic noodles.author: Irma R.
garlic noodles.review:
A perfect place for a date night. Our friends highly recommend this restaurant and we decided to double date. The restaurant itself is spacious and they were super busy already and it was only 6:30. The tables are pretty close together, so we got sat by the front window. Not that the restaurant can control this but the people next to us were super annoying, they were literally slurping their food. 
Anyway, 2 crabs, 2 garlic noodles later of course we had to order desert. We had the fried bananas, fried pineapple and of course creme brulee! Everything was delicious! 
Everything that is delicious of course comes with a price. But it's worth it from time to time. I can't wait to come back.

excerpts: Very good roast crab, garlic noodles.
Make a reservation.
Worth the trip to outer sunset
garlic noodles.author: Art-Suzanne R.
garlic noodles.review: Very good roast crab, garlic noodles.  Make a reservation.  Worth the trip to outer sunset

excerpts: Must order garlic noodles and the ginger ale!
You haven't lived until you eat here!!!
garlic noodles.author: Nicolle W.
garlic noodles.review: I have been coming to this restaurant since I was 7 years old!!! And it's one of my favorites!!! Thee best crab in the world hands down! Must order garlic noodles and the ginger ale! You haven't lived until you eat here!!!

excerpts: I'm loyal to this place, because I do enjoy the crab and garlic noodles, but the fact that I drove all the way from Reno Nv to take my mother out for Mother's Day and was rushed is horrible.
To top it off
I was told the bar and dessert would still be available to us
, well we couldn't get any more drinks or fried bananas when asked.
For as much as we pay I think they can do better.
garlic noodles.author: Norisha R.
garlic noodles.review: Honestly I have been coming here since I was in the 10th grade, and I'm now 32. Eating here on special holidays, or even a holiday weekend can be horrible. I had a 9:15 reservation and at 930 they rushing for me to order for myself and my other two guest that hadn't arrived yet, because the kitchen was closing. What I don't understand is if your taking reservations until 9:30pm why are you then rushing your customers to order? You should give yourself a window to serve your late bloomers as well as you served the ones that came in at 5 when you open. I'm loyal to this place, because I do enjoy the crab and garlic noodles, but the fact that I drove all the way from Reno Nv to take my mother out for Mother's Day and was rushed is horrible. To top it off I was told the bar and dessert would still be available to us, well we couldn't get any more drinks or fried bananas when asked. For as much as we pay I think they can do better.

excerpts: I will recommend this place to anyone who loves seafood, specifically crab and garlic noodles and is willing to cash out a little bit.
garlic noodles.author: Raquel F.
garlic noodles.review:
Thanh Long is waaay better and tastier than Crustacean's, although they are sister companies. I will recommend this place to anyone who loves seafood, specifically crab and garlic noodles and is willing to cash out a little bit.

My family and I go here for every birthday and anniversary. My only suggestion, well strong recommendation is MAKE RESERVATIONS! The wait is loong because everyone knows this place is AMAZING and worth every penny!

excerpts: Between the four of us, we ordered two roast crabs, two garlic noodles, and an eggplant dish.
The garlic noodles were delicious, full of lard, but delicious.
garlic noodles.author: Tina Y.
garlic noodles.review:
Why all the high marks??  This place was weird.  Luckily a friend of ours was able to secure a reservation for four the day of.  This place is very unassuming on the outside, you may walk past without even noticing it.  There were crowds upon entering, luckily our reservation time was honored.  Walking inside, I noticed that this place was much larger that it appears to be.

Between the four of us, we ordered two roast crabs, two garlic noodles, and an eggplant dish.   The garlic noodles were delicious, full of lard, but delicious.  Unfortunately, this dish must be consumed immediately, once it cools off the lard solidifies and becomes disgusting.

The Roast crab was pretty good, but I like the ones at R&L Lounge more.  

The eggplant dish was also soaked in oil, but nonetheless tasty.  This place didn't make it to my must visit every time I'm in San Francisco list.  Sorry, I personally think everything was a tad bit too greasy and cooked almost in a take out sort of fashion.  I think the demographics visiting the restaurant speaks for itself.

excerpts: Obviously since I went out of my way I had to get the crab and garlic noodles.
Everything came out within ten minutes and as I took the first bite I already knew how this meal was going to be.
The crab wasn't all that great and to be honest
I think the Boiling Crab has better sauces.
The garlic noodles did not have a unique or different flavor instead it tasted like noodles I have had before.
In the end the bill was nearly $300 between three people.
I won't be coming back to this place that is for sure after feeling as if I were robbed of both my money and time.
garlic noodles.author: Jacqueline C.
garlic noodles.review:
Overrated, Bland and Overpriced. 

So I came here because of all the times I have heard my family members talk about this place. Obviously since I went out of my way I had to get the crab and garlic noodles. Everything came out within ten minutes and as I took the first bite I already knew how this meal was going to be. The crab wasn't all that great and to be honest I think the Boiling Crab has better sauces. The garlic noodles did not have a unique or different flavor instead it tasted like noodles I have had before. In the end the bill was nearly $300 between three people. I won't be coming back to this place that is for sure after feeling as if I were robbed of both my money and time.

excerpts: Had the mussels, roasted crab, and garlic noodles.
That was plenty.
I could've eaten more but I was too full.
The service was hands down one of the best I've experienced ever!
The staff is so attentive to whatever you need.
The hot towels when you're done eating is one of the best ways I've ever tried cleaning my hands after eating crab.
The smell of seafood was definitely off of my fingers.
garlic noodles.author: Sy H.
garlic noodles.review: Had the mussels, roasted crab, and garlic noodles. That was plenty. I could've eaten more but I was too full. The service was hands down one of the best I've experienced ever! The staff is so attentive to whatever you need. The hot towels when you're done eating is one of the best ways I've ever tried cleaning my hands after eating crab. The smell of seafood was definitely off of my fingers.

excerpts: It's an easy choice for me:  Roasted Crab, Garlic Noodles and a nice glass or two of Pinot Noir.
Perfect.....
and I rarely if ever deviate from those choices.
Whatever grandma's secret is for roasting a Dungeness Crab, it's a great one and she would be hard to beat.
Can you buy this meal a little cheaper somewhere else, absolutely, but will it be as tasty....
NO WAY!!
If you want to impress someone or have an extra special dinner....
Thanh Long is the way to go!
garlic noodles.author: Larry W.
garlic noodles.review: I usually would not say that I have a favorite restaurant, but if I am visiting the Bay Area, I always make sure I have time to swing by Thanh Long for dinner.  It's an easy choice for me:  Roasted Crab, Garlic Noodles and a nice glass or two of Pinot Noir.  Perfect.....and I rarely if ever deviate from those choices.  Whatever grandma's secret is for roasting a Dungeness Crab, it's a great one and she would be hard to beat.  Can you buy this meal a little cheaper somewhere else, absolutely, but will it be as tasty....NO WAY!!  If you want to impress someone or have an extra special dinner....Thanh Long is the way to go!

excerpts: The garlic noodles are really good, never thought I could eat just noodles without the spaghetti sauce.
garlic noodles.author: Lauren-ashley B.
garlic noodles.review:
They charge u a $1 for each glass of pop that's full of ice, it's really noisy in there, I could hear the girls conversation at the table next to us talking about how many kids each of them want, quite annoying. They give you bibs for the crab which is fresh, delicious, mouthwatering and just AMAZING. The garlic noodles are really good, never thought I could eat just noodles without the spaghetti sauce. There's a first time for everything.

If I ever come back to San Fran, I'll definitely visit here.

Be prepared to park valet, it's very difficult finding a parking spot on the street, you will be driving around for at least 45 minutes trying to find one.

excerpts: Plus their garlic noodles are delish!
garlic noodles.author: Teen F.
garlic noodles.review:
Garlicky yummilicious crab! Plus their garlic noodles are delish! It's finger lickin' good peoples! 

Went here with a group of all females for my sis bday party celebration. They greeted us and sat us upstairs. (Hint: the don't take reservations; first come first serve.) And we paid for valet. Our food came out hot and yummy. We were all satisfied and left to dance the night away with our garlicky breath and hands mind you. 

Will return again and again!

excerpts: Same with garlic noodles.
garlic noodles.author: Donna D.
garlic noodles.review: Service great.  Roasted crab lives up to its reputation.  Same with garlic noodles.

excerpts: OMG -- the garlic noodles here are amazing.
How do they pack all that garlic flavor into the noodles.
garlic noodles.author: Jared G.
garlic noodles.review: OMG -- the garlic noodles here are amazing. How do they pack all that garlic flavor into the noodles.    Also, I love the roast crab.   The molten lava cake is the best dessert I've had at an Asian restaurant.

excerpts: Dungeness crab and 2. garlic noodles.
The garlic noodles are the best!
Trust, each time I see garlic noodles on a menu, I order it.
These are always duplicated but never replicated.
$10 for the sweet, garlicky, buttery garlic noodle experience.
I like these better than PPQ's savory garlic noodles.
Garlic noodles so good
, you won't wanna brush your teeth!
garlic noodles.author: Earl G.
garlic noodles.review:
Screw rice a roni this is the real San Francisco treat! 

The menu is 5 or 6 pages long but there's only two things to get here,
1. Dungeness crab and 2. garlic noodles.   (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/z9CN58fSrA46ggyb6OnCnQ?select=IK1klWeoCzzC_KrK5_T0jQ)

The garlic noodles are the best! Trust, each time I see garlic noodles on a menu, I order it. These are always duplicated but never replicated. $10 for the sweet, garlicky, buttery garlic noodle experience. I like these better than PPQ's savory garlic noodles. 

For the Dungeness crabs, there's 3 flavors, and I like how they're all meaty and prepared in such a way that you don't have to be a crab expert to extract all the meat. 

$38 per crab (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/z9CN58fSrA46ggyb6OnCnQ?select=dgRH-jCrvlRN55ilDWvvDA)

1. Roasted Crab (An fam's secret spices  -  nice garlic flavor - my favorite) 
2. Drunken Crab (simmered in sake/chardonnay/brandy  - anything simmered in that sauce should taste really good! 
3. Tamarind crab (Roma tomatoes & tamarind, seasoned with fresh dill & green onions & flambeed with cognac   -  We're always ordering 1&2  that we haven't gotten to #3 yet  

Do yourself a flavor and splurge on a crab and garlic noodle for each person for a $100 date night.  

Garlic noodles so good, you won't wanna brush your teeth!

excerpts: We loved the roast crab and garlic noodles, but the veggies were also really good.
Green beans were delicious and cooked perfectly.
garlic noodles.author: Sue R.
garlic noodles.review:
We loved the roast crab and garlic noodles, but the veggies were also really good.  Green beans were delicious and cooked perfectly.  Glad the crab season has been more successful this year.  

Started with coconut prawns which had a tasty sauce.  There was one apiece for our party of five so you will need to double order if you want more.  

It's all pricier than I remember but worth it for a special dinner, which it was.

excerpts: I get the roasted crab ,garlic noodles , fried rice and the garlic toast .
It's so good .
They definitely went up on the prices but it's all worth it .
The only thing I don't like is trying to find a good park .
Be prepared to drive around a few times or pay the valet 12.00.
garlic noodles.author: Ney E.
garlic noodles.review:
Love this place . I get the roasted crab ,garlic noodles , fried rice and the garlic toast . It's so good . They definitely went up on the prices but it's all worth it . 
The only thing I don't like is trying to find a good park . Be prepared to drive around a few times or pay the valet 12.00.

excerpts: I put some on my garlic noodles.
garlic noodles.author: Courtney S.
garlic noodles.review:
I had the Tamarind crab here about a week ago. OMG!  Just the right kick of pepper and sweetness from the tamarind.  The sauce was so good I put some on my garlic noodles.  I didn't think it could be possible but the noodles got even better!

I love this place!  They consistently deliver on all my expectations!

excerpts: Had the salt & pepper calamari (amazing), roast crab and garlic noodles.
The noodles were a tad bit on the dry side but the flavor was excellent.
Would definitely come here again.
Cons are the location and parking situation but thats the SF struggle.
Highly recommend!
garlic noodles.author: Stacey B.
garlic noodles.review: Went here last night for my birthday. Excellent service, great drinks and food was delicious. Had the salt & pepper calamari (amazing), roast crab and garlic noodles. The noodles were a tad bit on the dry side but the flavor was excellent. Would definitely come here again. Cons are the location and parking situation but thats the SF struggle. Highly recommend!

excerpts: And the first time for garlic noodles that was so WOW to me back then.
20 years later and many many new culinary experiences, the garlic noodles ain't no big thang.
You come here for the roast crab and garlic noodles,
yes
but I wanted to try something new.
We had the prawns with garlic noodles.
The prawns very overdone a bit and had too much buttery/pepper smeared over it.
garlic noodles.author: Kevin L.
garlic noodles.review:
I think the last time I was here was 6 years ago.  And this was probably the first "fancy" restaurant I went to back in high school.  And the first time for garlic noodles that was so WOW to me back then.  20 years later and many many new culinary experiences, the garlic noodles ain't no big thang.

You come here for the roast crab and garlic noodles, yes but I wanted to try something new.  So in addition, I got the mango salad and seafood dumpling.  And also the steamed sea bass entree.

Roast crab was just ok.  I prefer PPQ and the salt & pepper fried crab at R&G more.  Thanh Long's crab was flavorful but over peppered and garlic oiled at times.  The weak part was the tamale in the shell.  It seemed like it was cleaned out a bit and the crab wasn't as big as it usually is.  Maybe its not so in season now but they should still be reserving colossal size crabs for their dishes.  We had the prawns with garlic noodles.  The prawns very overdone a bit and had too much buttery/pepper smeared over it.  It was cholesterol city last night.

Mango salad too my surprise had stir fried shrimp and onions on top making the salad a bit warm and welted.

Seafood dumpling seem like it was heated in the microwave and had a dry appearance.

Both salad and dumpling came out super fast.

Sea bass was over done too and just wasn't as smooth as it should be.  Sea bass ain't suppose to taste "meaty".  I think a filet-o-fish has an even more delicate flaky texture.  I would rather had two filet-o-fish sandwiches on that big plate instead of the sea bass.

No plate presentation on anything.

Ordered a pineapple lychee martini before ordering food but it never came and the food did.  I had to ask and then they said they were all out of the infusion?  So I tried a passion tea martini which came after the entrees.  So it sat there getting warm as I started to eat and didn't feel like drinking it anymore.  It was nice when it was straight cold.  

Server who took our order never came back to ask what's up with the food.  Instead the runner asked?  Pretty whack on service.

$41.95 for the crab is totally not worth it.  I would pay 20 bucks at most.  In fact, I can make this at home and I do every time crab season starts.  Go to sunset supermarket or new may wah and get some live crabs and cook it up at home.  I could of cooked a bunch of crab for the money I spent here.

All good, it was my birthday and didn't want to cook at home and Thanh Long is about 4 minutes from my home.

excerpts: Garlic Noodles and Shaken Beef!
Other people might recommend you to go and try the Garlic Noodles from the Anh Food Truck for a better price, but it's just does not come close.
I've eaten at several places and attempted to make my own version
yet nobody comes close to Thanh Long's - Highly Recommended!
garlic noodles.author: Jan R.
garlic noodles.review:
I don't even have to look at their menu to have a great time with food while dinning here! Garlic Noodles and Shaken Beef! 

Yes, this place is known for their crabs yet I go here for these two. I prefer Thanh Long rather than Crustacean, first because of the location and next due to a better atmosphere. There is valet parking available because street parking is almost impossible during nights.

Other people might recommend you to go and try the Garlic Noodles from the Anh Food Truck for a better price, but it's just does not come close. I've eaten at several places and attempted to make my own version yet nobody comes close to Thanh Long's - Highly Recommended!

excerpts: We ordered the coconut shrimp, Thanh long fish (red snapper), tiger prawns and yummy garlic noodles, and chicken fried rice...everything was exceptional.
We frequent the city often, and this will be on our list of places to eat from now on.
garlic noodles.author: C T.
garlic noodles.review: Amazing! The food, the service, and the ambiance...it is very unsuspecting from the outside, but inside is very nice. Parking is a pain, but they do offer $12 valet service. We ordered the coconut shrimp, Thanh long fish (red snapper), tiger prawns and yummy garlic noodles, and chicken fried rice...everything was exceptional. We frequent the city often, and this will be on our list of places to eat from now on.

excerpts: We ordered the shaken beef, roast crab and garlic noodles.
I really liked the shaken beef and garlic noodles.
I really liked the shaken beef and garlic noodles.
The shaken beef was cooked nicely with lots of flavor.
The garlic noodles were great, way better than PPQ, plus it didn't dry out while we were enjoying other foods.
The roast crab was good but not good enough in my opinion.
garlic noodles.author: Mabel Y.
garlic noodles.review:
Thanh Long has received a lot of recognition and I know my friend really loves this place.

Came here last Friday night with my boyfriend for dinner, luckily I made a reservation the night before because it was quite packed after we were seated.

We ordered the shaken beef, roast crab and garlic noodles. I really liked the shaken beef and garlic noodles. The shaken beef was cooked nicely with lots of flavor. The garlic noodles were great, way better than PPQ, plus it didn't dry out while we were enjoying other foods. The roast crab was good but not good enough in my opinion. It lacked flavor and finesse.

The service was friendly and no nonsense. I'll be back!

excerpts: For the main course we ordered "family style" we went with the roasted crab, shakin beef, garlic noodles and a side of garlic butter to dip the crab in.
All items were packed with a punch full of flavor.
The portions of our order were good enough to fill us up without feeling overstuffed.
However I would not have minded leaving this place crawling out from being soo fool.
garlic noodles.author: Sione K.
garlic noodles.review: Always wanted to come to this place. So we decided to try it out on a date night regardless of the mixed review we got from our friends and family. Both the wife and I were impressed. We started with an order of the calamari as we do at every restaurant we go to and were pleased at tasteful they were even without a sauce. For the main course we ordered "family style" we went with the roasted crab, shakin beef, garlic noodles and a side of garlic butter to dip the crab in. All items were packed with a punch full of flavor. The portions of our order were good enough to fill us up without feeling overstuffed. However I would not have minded leaving this place crawling out from being soo fool.

excerpts: Roasted crab, garlic noodles, mango salad, shrimp cakes....what a great meal.
The bill came out to be around 130, def worth it.
Might have to come here once a month, you never know when it's safe to eat crabs, with these crab lifts.
garlic noodles.author: Q W.
garlic noodles.review: Since crab is safe to eat again, I had to come here! This probably the best place for crab, IMO. Roasted crab, garlic noodles, mango salad, shrimp cakes....what a great meal. The bill came out to be around 130, def worth it. Might have to come here once a month, you never know when it's safe to eat crabs, with these crab lifts.

excerpts: We always order the crab and garlic noodles
garlic noodles.author: Gerald H.
garlic noodles.review: Probably one of the best if not the best places in San Francisco to have roasted dungeness crab. The place is out of the main touristy and very similar to the other restaurant Crustaceans off Polk. Both places are terrible for parking but don't let that deter you from coming it is well worth the effort. We always order the crab and garlic noodles

excerpts: I got the thing you're supposed to order, the Roasted Crab and Garlic Noodles.
I feel like if you don't order these things, then there's not really a point in coming here.
Though expensive (~$55 for these 2 items), they were cooked to perfection and tasted amazing in combination with each other.
garlic noodles.author: Marlon T.
garlic noodles.review:
I've been wanting to try this Vietnamese place in the Sunset for the longest time and finally had my chance last week. I got the thing you're supposed to order, the Roasted Crab and Garlic Noodles. I feel like if you don't order these things, then there's not really a point in coming here. Though expensive (~$55 for these 2 items), they were cooked to perfection and tasted amazing in combination with each other. What's their secret?!

I guess the An family that owns this and many other successful restaurants in San Francisco must be living a cushy lifestyle with all that dough they're bringing it--good for them. I don't hear that many Vietnamese restaurant success stories.

Not that this means anything, but most of the patrons were African-American. I was just surprised because I never see black folks at Vietnamese restaurants. Apparently and obviously Thanh Long is different than Vietnamese Restaurant #2381801. That crab and garlic noodle dish are pretty irresistible. Thanh Long is the place to be for that.

excerpts: but...crabs and garlic noodles!
Once you have been that's all you have to say!!!
garlic noodles.author: Gloria S.
garlic noodles.review: So I know from experience one line will not make it as a review on Yelp  but...crabs and garlic noodles! Once you have been that's all you have to say!!!

excerpts: Tried the roasted prawns with garlic noodles.
Pricey but excellent.
The garlic noodles are super.
garlic noodles.author: Art L.
garlic noodles.review: Tried the roasted prawns with garlic noodles. Pricey but excellent.  The garlic noodles are super.  Seafood dumplings were good as were the wontons. Even the fried rice was excellent for those with more traditional tastes. Service was really good and friendly.  Definitely would recommend it.

excerpts: We had the coconut prawns and New Zealand mussels for appetizer, garlic noodles, roast crab, tamarind crab, and shaken beef for main course.
I remember having the coconut prawns at their home before
and I absolutely fell in love with this dish.
Crispy from the tempura, sweet from the coconut flake, a little tangy of their signature orange sauce.
It was such a balanced dish and a great start of the meal.
Onto the main dish, garlic noodles, I thought I liked it better when I ate at their house, but my boyfriend loved the noodle served at the restaurant.
It was garlicky, but a little sweet for me.
The crabs were very fresh and the color looked amazing.
Roast crab, which seem to be every Yelper's favorite, yet not me.
Tamarind crab was okay, the sauce was not thick and tangy enough for a Vietnamese like me who technically grow up eating tamarind crab every other weekend in Vietnam.
Lastly, shaken beef was perfectly medium rare, juicy and full of flavors.
garlic noodles.author: Chau V.
garlic noodles.review:
Thanh Long has been on my bookmark for quite some time now, so we couldn't miss a chance to have dinner at Thanh Long on our most recent visit to the City by the Bay.

Holy crabs!

My boyfriend's mom is a close friend of one of the daughters of the An family's and we have tried all the signature dishes at the home of the chef before, but dining at their restaurant was a different experience. If you plan to have dinner at weekend, it is essential to make reservation ahead and arrive promptly because the wait can get hectic (about 1-1:45 hours). Also, don't come like 30 minutes early for your reservation since they will make you wait until your whatever time you reserve.

We had the coconut prawns and New Zealand mussels for appetizer, garlic noodles, roast crab, tamarind crab, and shaken beef for main course. I remember having the coconut prawns at their home before and I absolutely fell in love with this dish. Crispy from the tempura, sweet from the coconut flake, a little tangy of their signature orange sauce. It was such a balanced dish and a great start of the meal. Mussels were fresh, the Asian pesto was flavorful and the crostini accompanied really well with the other two.

Onto the main dish, garlic noodles, I thought I liked it better when I ate at their house, but my boyfriend loved the noodle served at the restaurant. It was garlicky, but a little sweet for me. The crabs were very fresh and the color looked amazing. Roast crab, which seem to be every Yelper's favorite, yet not me. Tamarind crab was okay, the sauce was not thick and tangy enough for a Vietnamese like me who technically grow up eating tamarind crab every other weekend in Vietnam. Lastly, shaken beef was perfectly medium rare, juicy and full of flavors. Strange, but I would recommend this meat dish at a seafood restaurant. 

Overall, great dining experience.

excerpts: Garlic noodles I thought was a bit overcooked and mushy.
I expected more, better, an orgasmic experience but ehh
it is what it is.
I am glad that I finally got to say I've been here though.
Definitely won't see me again
, I actually like PPQ wayyyyyy more.
And oddly enough, even though it's in the Outer Sunset there's barely any street parking nearby.
Tip: go to Lincoln St and walk 2 blocks.
They also have valet parking for $12
garlic noodles.author: Tammy N.
garlic noodles.review:
All hype and overpriced

$45 for one roasted crab and $23 for Shaken Beef?!  For $45 the crab better be fresh and of course it's good because it's soaked in butter.  The shaken beef was decent but I've had better.  The mango salad was definitely different from what I was expecting.  Not really fresh and crisp but more so briefly stir fried to a savory soggy dish. Even the lettuce was warm.  Garlic noodles I thought was a bit overcooked and mushy.  I expected more, better, an orgasmic experience but ehh it is what it is.  I am glad that I finally got to say I've been here though.  Definitely won't see me again, I actually like PPQ wayyyyyy more.  And oddly enough, even though it's in the Outer Sunset there's barely any street parking nearby.  Tip: go to Lincoln St and walk 2 blocks.  They also have valet parking for $12

excerpts: Garlic noodles and pepper crab are among the best
In the city if not the best.
garlic noodles.author: Bobby S.
garlic noodles.review: This place is the sh*t. Garlic noodles and pepper crab are among the best In the city if not the best.

excerpts: We ordered salt and pepper fried calamari which was  good, Garlic noodles with prawns which was the best I have ever tried!
We wanted to order a second plate but had no rooms in our tummy to fit it..ha.
Roasted crab was finger licking good!
Also ordered for dessert, one creme brulee and fried bananas.
We spent $127 which wasn't that bad for 2 people.
We totally got our money's worth on some good tasting food.
I will differently be coming back to this place.
Make sure to make reservations!
Small place and only opens for a couple of hours during the night.
garlic noodles.author: Aida L.
garlic noodles.review: So my husband and I came to see for ourselves if this was truly the best place to eat crab and I have to admit it was! We ordered salt and pepper fried calamari which was  good, Garlic noodles with prawns which was the best I have ever tried! We wanted to order a second plate but had no rooms in our tummy to fit it..ha. Roasted crab was finger licking good! Also ordered for dessert, one creme brulee and fried bananas. We spent $127 which wasn't that bad for 2 people. We totally got our money's worth on some good tasting food. I will differently be coming back to this place. Make sure to make reservations! Small place and only opens for a couple of hours during the night.

excerpts: Crab and Garlic noodles are a must.
garlic noodles.author: carlos e.
garlic noodles.review:
The food was great as I saw it in The Travel Channel . worth the drive and will go back next time I go to the Bay area.
Crab and Garlic noodles are a must.

excerpts: Then when we placed in an order for a second plate of garlic noodles.
Again, it comes out in like 2 minutes.
No joke.
Leaves me to believe that they just have pans and pans of this food sitting there waiting to be ordered.
Fast yes.
Good yes.
Fresh-
garlic noodles.author: Michelle I.
garlic noodles.review:
I love me some roasted crab. MMM MMM 

I have one complaint and I am not sure if it is even legitimate but I have to speak my mind...

We put in our order with the waitress. Our food comes out in five minutes flat. Now, I am not one to complain about not waiting but- 5minutes? We had the salt and pepper calamari to start. It should take five minutes just to prep, no??

Then when we placed in an order for a second plate of garlic noodles. Again, it comes out in like 2 minutes. No joke. Leaves me to believe that they just have pans and pans of this food sitting there waiting to be ordered. Fast yes. Good yes. Fresh- mmm maybe not so much...

I love this place but that last trip kind of rubbed me the wrong way...

excerpts: The garlic noodles were just ok, nothing too special.
garlic noodles.author: Vince L.
garlic noodles.review:
The garlic noodles were just ok, nothing too special.  The roasted crap was WAY better than the drunken crap but both were overpriced.  

Get the shaken beef and calamari if you want somehting delicious in your mouth

excerpts: The garlic noodles was not bad but I will not order it again if ever I do come back to this place.
I will try a different flavor crab next time.
Place is clean and good service.
garlic noodles.author: Jaime R.
garlic noodles.review: It has been 15 years since I've been here. I didn't remember the roasted crab had tons of pepper on it. The roasted crab was just OK for me. If you like peppery food, this is perfect for your taste bud. The garlic noodles was not bad but I will not order it again if ever I do come back to this place. I will try a different flavor crab next time. Place is clean and good service.

excerpts: I've tried crab & garlic noodles everywhere, even out of state recommend by chefs.
None of them compare to Thanh Long's.
The service is great & attentive.
I've recommended this place to anyone I know.
garlic noodles.author: Dorcas C.
garlic noodles.review: We've been coming here since the '80s when they were a small maybe 5 table place. This is my favorite restaurant. It's worth every penny. The food is superb. I've tried crab & garlic noodles everywhere, even out of state recommend by chefs. None of them compare to Thanh Long's. The service is great & attentive. I've recommended this place to anyone I know.

excerpts: Love the garlic noodles, the mango salad and the garlic crab!!!!
Gave 4 stars because it is a bit pricey but very good.
You don't have to dress up at this location like you do at Crustaceans.
garlic noodles.author: S. W.
garlic noodles.review: Love the garlic noodles, the mango salad and the garlic crab!!!! Gave 4 stars because it is a bit pricey but very good. You don't have to dress up at this location like you do at Crustaceans.

excerpts: We came here for the roasted crab and infamous garlic noodles.
The garlic noodles were tasty but nothing overwhelming exciting.
The beef was tender and tasty, but being Viet
garlic noodles.author: Melody N.
garlic noodles.review:
Overhyped and overpriced for me.  We came here for the roasted crab and infamous garlic noodles.  We also got shaken beef.  The crab was a little dry but pretty delicious otherwise.  However, if I am going to be charged $44 for one Dungeness crab I expect it to be perfectly juicy.  The food came out a little too quickly, which made us think the crab was cooked ahead of time then reheated, which probably resulted it from being a little overcooked.  The garlic noodles were tasty but nothing overwhelming exciting.   The beef was tender and tasty, but being Viet I have had this dish at other places where they would given more beef for the same price.  

Overall disappointing, especially with all the four star reviews I saw on yelp.

excerpts: The garlic noodles and big huge crab they give you how could you go wrong!!!
garlic noodles.author: Olivia J.
garlic noodles.review: I went to this restaurant years ago for one of my birthdays, and I've always remembered how amazing the food was after years that passed. I just recently went this past Saturday with one of my friends and I wasn't let down. The food was absolutely amazing! Service was great! Waiting on the a table wasn't to bad either but hey with a good restaurant you have to expect a little wait. The garlic noodles and big huge crab they give you how could you go wrong!!!

excerpts: The pepper really added an amazing aspect as did the addition of the garlic noodles.
Location is fab as we watched the sunset on the beach before eating.
Highly recommend!
garlic noodles.author: alex g.
garlic noodles.review: Well that was definitly beyond expectation. I have never had a crab that was so full of meat and prepared with pepper, butter and garlic. The pepper really added an amazing aspect as did the addition of the garlic noodles.  Location is fab as we watched the sunset on the beach before eating. Highly recommend!

excerpts: Everything we ordered was delicious, ESPECIALLY the roasted garlic crab and the garlic noodles.
Dessert was also very good.
We all shared the chocolate lava cake and the fried bananas, each served with vanilla ice cream.
Service was superb, as well.
Will definitely be coming back!!!
garlic noodles.author: Arlene S.
garlic noodles.review: I took my family here for Easter dinner after a long day in the city. We had a great time! Everything we ordered was delicious, ESPECIALLY the roasted garlic crab and the garlic noodles. Dessert was also very good. We all shared the chocolate lava cake and the fried bananas, each served with vanilla ice cream.  Service was superb, as well. Will definitely be coming back!!!

excerpts: Ordered the popular roast crab and tamarind crab, garlic noodles and of course shaken beef.
The crabs are so fresh and succulent in their special herbs and sauce that we lick up every little bit of sauce and oil on the platter.
Shaken beef is so tender moist and sweet
that again we finish the salad that holds the famous beef.
Garlic noodles were the right touch to complete the meal.
Service was efficient and we were happy that the wait may be long
but after you're seated the food comes in 10 mins.
Excellent.
Overall it's pricey but so worth it.
Will be back
garlic noodles.author: Nelle L.
garlic noodles.review:
Took us 3 years and finally made the reservation for Saturday dinner. And yes reservation is a must so as not to wait for than an hour to be seated. 
Ordered the popular roast crab and tamarind crab, garlic noodles and of course shaken beef. 
The crabs are so fresh and succulent in their special herbs and sauce that we lick up every little bit of sauce and oil on the platter. 
Shaken beef is so tender moist and sweet that again we finish the salad that holds the famous beef. 
Garlic noodles were the right touch to complete the meal. 
Service was efficient and we were happy that the wait may be long but after you're seated the food comes in 10 mins. Excellent. 
Overall it's pricey but so worth it. Will be back

excerpts: GARLIC NOODLES $10:
This was actually really good, but I wouldn't say they're to die for.
It was like eating garlic bread except they were noodles, and these noodles are the same texture as the chow mein at Panda Express.
garlic noodles.author: Tiffany N.
garlic noodles.review:
Good food, good service, and not necessarily overpriced.

Made reservations for 6 pm New Year's Eve. We got there about half an hour early, but they seated us anyways since there was room. It's a small restaurant on the corner of the street. On the outside, it doesn't look very nice but the interior is pretty upscale.  

Loved the promptness of everything. The appetizer came within ten minutes. We were bibbed and received our main course immediately after we finished our appetizer. The waiters were attentive and helpful. They also gave us New Year's calendars on our way out. 

Here's what we got:
SALT & PEPPER CALAMARI $11.95: Good appetizer. Crisp, no sauce.

ASPARAGUS SOUP WITH CRAB $7.50: My mom ordered this and enjoyed it. Hot soup is always great when the weather is cold. 

ROAST/DRUNKEN/TAMARIND CRAB: We got one of each ($41.95 per crab). My favorite was the drunken crab. The sauce actually doesn't matter unless you dip the crab meat in the sauce on the plate. 

GARLIC NOODLES $10: This was actually really good, but I wouldn't say they're to die for. It was like eating garlic bread except they were noodles, and these noodles are the same texture as the chow mein at Panda Express. They also have the less expensive option of garlic rice, fried rice, jasmine rice, or vegetables. 

LAVA CHOCOLATE CAKE $8.25: Skip it. The lava cake is mostly syrup and on the bitter side. 

FRIED BANANA A LA MODE $6.95: Skip it. It's just regular fried banana and ice cream--nothing special.

CREME BRULEE $7.50: Again, skip it. If you are dying to have dessert here, choose this one. I'm not saying the desserts are bad at Thanh Long but there are a couple dessert shops on the same street and there are better options in driving distance.

Parents also had a FLEUR DE MANGO ($9.25) with a heineken ($5) and a HANOI SUNSET ($9).

excerpts: The garlic noodles and crab are my favorite.
You can't go wrong with most choices on the menu.
Make reservations because it's hard to get a table.
garlic noodles.author: Jeffrey L.
garlic noodles.review: This place is great. It doesn't look like much when you look inside, but the food is amazing. The garlic noodles and crab are my favorite. You can't go wrong with most choices on the menu. Make reservations because it's hard to get a table.

excerpts: For our main dishes we ordered the roast crab and the jumbo prawns with garlic noodles and the shaken beef.
The crab and prawns were really tasty.
I personally love garlic noodles
so I couldn't get enough of that!
The shaken beef was also very good and the meat was tender.
For dessert we ordered the fried banana with ice cream.
it was SOOOO GOOOD!
I hadn't had this dessert in years and it definitely was satisfying.
The service was great.
The waiter was always attentive and checking in on us, the table was never cluttered with unused plates and our water was always filled.
Over all we had a great experience.
I will definitely be coming back for seconds!!
garlic noodles.author: Gabrielle C.
garlic noodles.review: Took my mom here yesterday as a late birthday dinner and it was so good! We ordered the mussels and seafood dumpling as an appetizer. The mussels were really good. they were drizzled with olive oil that you can use to spill on the slice of bread that comes with it. The seafood dumpling was good but I could do without next time. For our main dishes we ordered the roast crab and the jumbo prawns with garlic noodles and the shaken beef. The crab and prawns were really tasty. I personally love garlic noodles so I couldn't get enough of that! The shaken beef was also very good and the meat was tender. For dessert we ordered the fried banana with ice cream. it was SOOOO GOOOD! I hadn't had this dessert in years and it definitely was satisfying. The service was great. The waiter was always attentive and checking in on us, the table was never cluttered with unused plates and our water was always filled. Over all we had a great experience. I will definitely be coming back for seconds!!

excerpts: Great service,  great food, best garlic noodles ever.
Just love this place.
The chocolate lava cake with vanilla bean gelato was simply amazing.
Would definitely recommend people to come try this place
garlic noodles.author: Stella H.
garlic noodles.review: Great service,  great food, best garlic noodles ever. Just love this place. The chocolate lava cake with vanilla bean gelato was simply amazing.  Would definitely recommend people to come try this place

excerpts: Love the Crab And Garlic noodles and its at a Reasonable price.
Went for Valentine's Day and was able to get in after the Valet said it was impossible.
Kinda Crowded so the service was lacking, but overall we enjoyed.
garlic noodles.author: Jerome P.
garlic noodles.review: Love the Crab And Garlic noodles and its at a Reasonable price. Went for Valentine's Day and was able to get in after the Valet said it was impossible. Kinda Crowded so the service was lacking, but overall we enjoyed.

excerpts: If anyone knows me and my hubby we are HUGE fans of roast garlic crab and garlic noodles.
Thanh Lang definitely knows how to make theirs, however, I still prefer the garlic noodles at PPQ.
I noticed that Thanh Long's noodles are made with sugar so they tend to give a sweeter aftertaste whereas PPQ's isn't sweet at all and has more chunks of garlic in it.
garlic noodles.author: Petra S.
garlic noodles.review:
This was my second time dining here with my hubby for a family members anniversary. If anyone knows me and my hubby we are HUGE fans of roast garlic crab and garlic noodles. Thanh Lang definitely knows how to make theirs, however, I still prefer the garlic noodles at PPQ. I noticed that Thanh Long's noodles are made with sugar so they tend to give a sweeter aftertaste whereas PPQ's isn't sweet at all and has more chunks of garlic in it. This time around they ordered the salt and pepper crab which was nicely seasoned and perfectly steamed, however, I was looking forward the the roast garlic version. 

Overall, this place is nicer for special occasions, albeit a bit pricier than the latter. They do valet your car but at $12 you would think you were downtown. We're locals so we prefer to find our own street parking and instead spend that $12 bucks on extra noodles! Before you settle on a favorite, I highly recommend trying both Thanh Long and PPQ because both have great reviews and almost equally good food. :)

excerpts: I ordered the roast crab with garlic noodles (I know, so original).
I was expecting the crab to be more bursting with flavors...
but it wasn't although it was still really good.
I just tasted a lot more black pepper than expected.
The garlic noodle was delicious, but should be eaten hot.
It's not as tasty anymore once it cools down.
It has a buttery taste and the garlic flavor wasn't overpowering at all.
garlic noodles.author: Thanh B.
garlic noodles.review:
Food: Crabs are currently $39.99 at market price. I ordered the roast crab with garlic noodles (I know, so original). I was expecting the crab to be more bursting with flavors...but it wasn't although it was still really good. I just tasted a lot more black pepper than expected. The garlic noodle was delicious, but should be eaten hot. It's not as tasty anymore once it cools down. It has a buttery taste and the garlic flavor wasn't overpowering at all. It was perfect, especially with the roasted crab. 

Service: Excellent service, including a waiter who ties on your bib for you. Water cups always stay refilled. And not with nasty, melted-down ice! Your bowls for shells and other unwanted will never be filled for they replace it very often. I was extremely satisfied.

Others/Description of the place: IT WAS HELL ON EARTH trying to find parking (not that you should resort to shady valet service unless you're really on a time crunch). I also had trouble locating which building is Thanh Long. This place for sure did not stand out to me. It was nothing special from the exterior. So I was very pleased to see just how beautiful and classy the inside of the restaurant was. They have a full bar in the front when you first walk in. And a second story for their customers. Lighting in here is quite dim which I love. It helps to create a much more intimate atmosphere. We celebrated a friend's birthday here so we dressed to impress. But it wouldn't be totally inappropriate to show up casual. I just wouldn't suggest walking up in there with like beach wears or something. 

Tips: They DO take reservations so be sure to take advantage of that and do so. It'll save yourself a lot of time and pain waiting in line, anticipating their delicious food. And if you do have reservation, be sure to arrive early. It took me about 15-20 minutes to drive EVERYWHERE  around the neighborhood, circling the block several times before finding a parking spot. NOT just a decent parking spot, just any parking spot AT ALL. It was ridiculous. The point is, don't be late for your reservation. Not only that, but make sure your whole party is on time. Not just a few of you because that wouldn't count. And no, calling them to let them know you're on your way will not help. They may stretch it by 5 minutes, but that's about it. So to my ladies and drag queens, if you're going to wear high heels...you're about to have SOOOOO much fun walking a couple of blocks to destination. Just sayin'. 

Be prepared.

excerpts: But their garlic noodles were terrible.
garlic noodles.author: Michelle R.
garlic noodles.review: Haven't been here in years because Crustaceans is closer to get to. The valet is more expensive than Crustaceans. Service is great for a casual dining experience.  Their crab may have tasted better than Crustaceans because they put alot of cracked black pepper on theirs. But their garlic noodles were terrible. The seafood combination fried rice is very good but Crustaceans doesn't serve it. Hmmmm...another 10 years can go by before I revisit again. I'll stick to Crustys!

excerpts: but when it comes to crabs and garlic noodles this place is the best I ever had
garlic noodles.author: Orlando D.
garlic noodles.review: I love Seafood I eat it pretty much all my life but when it comes to crabs and garlic noodles this place is the best I ever had

excerpts: The garlic noodles were fabulous.
The snapper was excellent - seasoned well and tender with some crust.
The sautéed.
veggies were lovely.
I would eat here again!
garlic noodles.author: Joanne S.
garlic noodles.review: Dropped in on Sunday evening - busy but got a table. The garlic noodles were fabulous. The snapper was excellent - seasoned well and tender with some crust. The sautéed. veggies were lovely. I would eat here again!

excerpts: The succulent morsels of crab meat paired perfectly with their famous garlic noodles.
I highly recommend tossing some noodles in the crab head shell and letting the noodles soak up the flavorful juices inside the head.
garlic noodles.author: Shannon S.
garlic noodles.review:
Having been to numerous crab-seafood restaurants in SF, I thought that this place had the best crab yet. The succulent morsels of crab meat paired perfectly with their famous garlic noodles. I highly recommend tossing some noodles in the crab head shell and letting the noodles soak up the flavorful juices inside the head. Service was excellent; our waiter was friendly and knowledgeable. 

Delicious.

excerpts: We got a ton of crabs, garlic noodles, salt & pepper calamari, and the shaking beef.
garlic noodles - pretty good but superrr heavy.
lots and lots of butter.
crab -
im not sure why people lovee the crab here
I thought they were lacking meat and just sitting in A TON of oil.
calamari
- i love calamari
so it's hard to mess up this one.
garlic noodles.author: Annie Z.
garlic noodles.review:
Came here for a friend's birthday last Friday. The food was just okay-- it smelled really good. We got a ton of crabs, garlic noodles, salt & pepper calamari, and the shaking beef. 

garlic noodles - pretty good but superrr heavy. lots and lots of butter. 
crab - im not sure why people lovee the crab here I thought they were lacking meat and just sitting in A TON of oil. =( 
calamari - i love calamari so it's hard to mess up this one. but a-ok describes this one pretty well too. 
shaking beef - the only good part that i liked. 

total came out to $50pp. for mediocre food I was pretty disappointed by this place. It's just a normal family-style asian place. no idea why the prices are so high. meh.

luckily, the company more than made up for the food.

excerpts: If it were me, our order would have consisted of all crab and garlic noodles.
*"Colossal" royal tiger prawns with garlic noodles -
My main chagrin about this plate was the adjective "colossal" attached to the prawns.
All the pictures I saw, they looked humongous.
I bet the picture I took even look gigantic.
Truly, it is an optical illusion.
While unexpectedly smaller they were also a smidgen on the salty side for me.
Overdosed on seasoning, the prawns sat on top of garlic noodles.
The spillover of seasoning into the garlic noodles unassumingly enhanced the noodles.
The garlic noodles are good by themselves; the extra touch of seasoning really made the whole that much better.
The main attraction is their crab and garlic noodles.
Get it, and be one of the daily 500!
garlic noodles.author: Arnold T.
garlic noodles.review:
"500 hundred crabs will be served in one night..."...yada yada yada...we being first time customers were given the usual spiel.  My mind wondered, 'are cokes refillable?'...'where are the restrooms?'...'how much is 'market price'?'...'does the waiter know I'm not really paying attention?'

Back to reality...'did he say 500 hundred crabs?'  Where do they even keep that many crabs laying around I thought.  At that point, I wasn't sure if he mentioned it already, so to save some possible embarrassment I didn't inquire about the crabs, nodded, and just asked...'where are the restrooms?' 

Parking was more difficult than I expected as street parking sucked that day.  My laziness within grew with valet parking available tempting me.  The outrageous cost of $12 bucks and the thought of someone joy riding in my valuable antique of a Corolla didn't sit well with me.  The Sunset weather by the water was its usual half dreary self.  Contrast to the outside, inside the restaurant was vibrant and warm.  Aroma of good times filled the place; passing each table we saw at least one crab on the table.  Hold those horses...part of the waiter's yada yada yada included "90% of people order the crab".  

If it were me, our order would have consisted of all crab and garlic noodles.  Due to food allergies and cholesterol consciousness at the table, a full spectrum of dishes was chosen.  

OUR ORDER:     
*Lemongrass chicken satay - These grilled chicken skewers come numbering around three or four.  This was the first item that came out and everyone was hungry.  Playing the disappearing act in a poof, I only ate a sliver of a sliver sized piece.  My taste buds do not recall anything negative.  There were no complaints either.  

*Salt & pepper calamari - One of my sister's go to dishes no matter where, when, and how.  How can you go wrong with deep fried calamari?  You can't; unless they were soggy which these were not.  Salt and pepper were abundantly prevalent throughout.  The chunks of calamari were a larger size calamari than usual.  Bigger means more calamari meat and less batter.  Less batter is typically good thing.  

*Shaken beef - Shaken, not stirred...I didn't taste the "shaken", but the cubes of meat were very tender.  Served on a bed of green and mixed in with some potato, the meat has a sharp peppery taste.  I recommend this for people with seafood allergies that come here.    
  
*Lemongrass chicken - Didn't I order something with lemongrass as an appetizer already?  I repeated "lemongrass" a couple times under my breath unsure of this when ordering.  We needed another dish for the non-seafood eaters at the table anyway.  Consisting of probably all dark meat, the chicken was very simplistically lemongrass-ed.  There were more bell peppers than I would have liked.  The noticeable echo of pepper flavor popped up again.  I wonder how much pepper this restaurant uses in a day.   

*"Colossal" royal tiger prawns with garlic noodles - My main chagrin about this plate was the adjective "colossal" attached to the prawns.  All the pictures I saw, they looked humongous.  I bet the picture I took even look gigantic.  Truly, it is an optical illusion.  While unexpectedly smaller they were also a smidgen on the salty side for me.  Overdosed on seasoning, the prawns sat on top of garlic noodles.  The spillover of seasoning into the garlic noodles unassumingly enhanced the noodles.  The garlic noodles are good by themselves; the extra touch of seasoning really made the whole that much better.  If I go again, I'll pass on this one, but was decent. 

*Roast crab - Presentation is absolutely photogenic.  I'm talking about super model level.  The crab was very meaty and a nice size.  They really saved the best for last, as this was the last entrée to be served.  Cut down the middle with all the legs intact, the shell of the crab is ornamentally placed on top of the legs.  Their "garlic sauce and secret sauce" fully cooked into the crab meat and needless to say, I started to dip some noodles in the dressing.  It was good stuff.  To nitpick, freshness rating of the crab wasn't A+, rather an A-.    
 
*Steamed rice - That's how my dad rolls.  Can't go anywhere without it.  I had to add this one or it wouldn't be a complete review.  The white rice came in a bowl and tasted...rice-like.  My dad thoroughly enjoyed it with a big smile.

Thanh Long is an Americanized Vietnamese restaurant that is versatile enough to draw even the most Asian of Asians.  If you read the articles down the hallway to the restroom, there's a feel good story behind restaurant's owners (Remember that question about where the restrooms were?  Yeah...there was a line and I had some time to read.).  The main attraction is their crab and garlic noodles.  Get it, and be one of the daily 500!

excerpts: We were a party of six and ordered appetizers, roasted crabs, garlic noodles & rice and drinks.
All that was fine up until the end where I asked the waitress to pack our leftovers to take home.
I happened to look over into the kitchen area
(we were seated upstairs) and I could see our waitress prepare our leftover garlic noodles into a plastic container, push it across the counter and it happens to fall into the garbage can.
At this point I'm hoping she does the right thing and tell us that happened.
Sadly no, that didn't happen.
She looks around to see if anyone saw her then proceeds to take the container out of the trash and places it into a bag along with our other take out container like nothing ever happened.
She comes out and hands it to me.
I'm so disgusted.
We spent decent money there and to be treated like this is appalling.
It is NOT OK to give customers food that has fallen into the trash whether it's in a container or not.
Absolutely disgusting.
She didn't even wash her hands after putting her hands into the trash can to retrieve my take out container.
I made sure to tell her that I was not taking that home because it came out of the trash can.
She didn't even apologize after I called her out on it.
I will not be coming back to this restaurant
and I will make sure I tell everyone I know not to go there either.
garlic noodles.author: Judy L.
garlic noodles.review: I have come to this establishment many times for dinner and it has always been great up until today. We were a party of six and ordered appetizers, roasted crabs, garlic noodles & rice and drinks. All that was fine up until the end where I asked the waitress to pack our leftovers to take home. I happened to look over into the kitchen area (we were seated upstairs) and I could see our waitress prepare our leftover garlic noodles into a plastic container, push it across the counter and it happens to fall into the garbage can. At this point I'm hoping she does the right thing and tell us that happened. Sadly no, that didn't happen. She looks around to see if anyone saw her then proceeds to take the container out of the trash and places it into a bag along with our other take out container like nothing ever happened. She comes out and hands it to me. I'm so disgusted. We spent decent money there and to be treated like this is appalling. It is NOT OK to give customers food that has fallen into the trash whether it's in a container or not. Absolutely disgusting. She didn't even wash her hands after putting her hands into the trash can to retrieve my take out container. I made sure to tell her that I was not taking that home because it came out of the trash can. She didn't even apologize after I called her out on it. I will not be coming back to this restaurant and I will make sure I tell everyone I know not to go there either.

excerpts: The only thing I come here for is the garlic noodles and crab.
BEST
I've ever had!
Great service and really nice atmosphere.
This place would make a perfect for date night.
garlic noodles.author: Laura T.
garlic noodles.review: The only thing I come here for is the garlic noodles and crab. BEST I've ever had! Great service and really nice atmosphere. This place would make a perfect for date night.

excerpts: Of course we had the garlic noodles and garlic crab.
It's a must have if only for the first time.
The eggplant with shrimp and chicken was a great compliment to the meal.
A solid four stars is ok.
garlic noodles.author: Ken M.
garlic noodles.review: Of course we had the garlic noodles and garlic crab. It's a must have if only for the first time. The eggplant with shrimp and chicken was a great compliment to the meal. A solid four stars is ok.

excerpts: She was smitten with the garlic noodles, roasted crab and shaken beef, so I decided to give this well-reviewed place a try.
We ordered and our garlic noodles and crab came out almost immediately.
My dining companion and I are no strangers to crab so immediately we could taste the mediocrity of the over salted $40 crab.
The garlic noodles were fine, though a bit too dry.
We thought it a bit expensive  (at $9.50) for buttered Chinese style noodles.
The shaken beef came out much later than the other two dishes, but was very tasty!
Overall, 2.5 stars for the high prices and ridiculously over hyped crab/OK garlic noodles.
The shaken beef was a saving grace, though a smidge salty.
Glad
I went to check out the hype, but will not return in a hurry.
garlic noodles.author: Angela L.
garlic noodles.review:
I came here a few weeks ago on the recommendation of my friend who has lived down the block of Thanh Long her entire life. She was smitten with the garlic noodles, roasted crab and shaken beef, so I decided to give this well-reviewed place a try. 

We were seated immediately upon entering on a Saturday night as we had a reservation, and found the ambiance charming and romantic. I did think it an odd place to dress up since you would be eating the crab with your hands and you get plastic bibs... not some place I'd prefer to have a first date or anything (though the couple next to us seemed to be doing well on theirs).
