Our waitress was nice, though not was welcoming as some of the waiters who might have been associated with the family (?). We ordered and our garlic noodles and crab came out almost immediately. My dining companion and I are no strangers to crab so immediately we could taste the mediocrity of the over salted $40 crab. The garlic noodles were fine, though a bit too dry. We thought it a bit expensive  (at $9.50) for buttered Chinese style noodles. The shaken beef came out much later than the other two dishes, but was very tasty! It was over salted, as the theme seems to be here, but the beef was very tender. 

Overall, 2.5 stars for the high prices and ridiculously over hyped crab/OK garlic noodles. The shaken beef was a saving grace, though a smidge salty. Glad I went to check out the hype, but will not return in a hurry.

excerpts: If you love crab, I'd highly recommend the roast crab and garlic noodles with the fried banana for dessert...its out of this world amazing!!!
garlic noodles.author: Stephanie K.
garlic noodles.review: Such an amazing seafood experience! Be prepared to FEAST while you're there. If you love crab, I'd highly recommend the roast crab and garlic noodles with the fried banana for dessert...its out of this world amazing!!!

excerpts: If you love garlic noodles and you have not been here: I hate you an so do the ones you love.
garlic noodles.author: Joseph C.
garlic noodles.review:
If you love crab and you have not been here: I hate you and so do the ones you love.  

If you love garlic noodles and you have not been here: I hate you an so do the ones you love.

If you go here and you do not love it: come see me and I will punch your mouth off because you know longer need it for the purposes of identifying and eating good food. 

Nor do you deserve an Internet connection to leave any ratings less than five stars.

I divorced my first wife over this restaurant.

excerpts: For entrees, I chose the garlic noodles while my partner chose the roast crab with garlic sauce.
Our friend chose the Villager's Favorite which was prawns and pork medallions cooked in a clay pot with soy and herbs.
All of us enjoyed our meals.
I think the garlic noodles were the best I've ever had.
I tasted the crab and it was great with lots of garlic flavor.
The others finished their meals but I could eat only half the noodles
so I got the remainder to take home for lunch.
The wait staff is large, but they were all busy and did well in serving a large crowd.
My only quibble is that the crab came quickly while the noodles and Villager's Favorite took a long time to arrive.
I would return again to try other dishes
garlic noodles.author: Philip C.
garlic noodles.review:
Three of us came here Sunday evening for dinner.  It was my first time, but I could smell garlic as soon as I walked in.  We did not have reservations but were seated in less than 3 minutes.
As appetizers, one of us ordered the salt and pepper calamari while my partner and I split the shrimp rolls.  All of us were delighted.  The calamari was perfectly sauteed and not rubbery at all. The shrimp rolls were fresh and the bean dip was a great addition.
For entrees, I chose the garlic noodles while my partner chose the roast crab with garlic sauce.  Our friend chose the Villager's Favorite which was prawns and pork medallions cooked in a clay pot with soy and herbs.
All of us enjoyed our meals.  I think the garlic noodles were the best I've ever had.  I tasted the crab and it was great with lots of garlic flavor.  The others finished their meals but I could eat only half the noodles so I got the remainder to take home for lunch.
The wait staff is large, but they were all busy and did well in serving a large crowd.
My only quibble is that the crab came quickly while the noodles and Villager's Favorite took a long time to arrive.
I would return again to try other dishes

excerpts: I've been meaning to come here for the garlic noodles, but I tried to save some moolah and get it sans seafood because it's only $9 without toppings!
Garlic noodles - so bland.
I guess you need to order it with shrimp or crab?
garlic noodles.author: Jess C.
garlic noodles.review:
I've been meaning to come here for the garlic noodles, but I tried to save some moolah and get it sans seafood because it's only $9 without toppings! Unfortunately the noodles were not the star of the night....

Vietnamese soup - Delicious broth, would definitely get this small bowl again even though it costs $5
Sea Bass - Very buttery and flaky, I wish there was more!
Garlic noodles - so bland. I guess you need to order it with shrimp or crab?
Lava Cake - Yum, good lava cake.

Overall, Thanh Long is definitely on the expensive side, but I would come back if I had a coupon. 4 stars for food, 2 stars for cost.

excerpts: We had the roast crab ($54), shaking beef ($26) and garlic noodles.
All the dishes were delicious.
garlic noodles.author: Minh N.
garlic noodles.review: Took my wife out to Thang Long for our anniversary. We had the roast crab ($54), shaking beef ($26) and garlic noodles. All the dishes were delicious.

excerpts: Garlic noodles, shaken beef, crab and the tiger prawns!
Must orders!
Finding parking can be kinda crappy though, but not as bad as other parts in the city.
garlic noodles.author: Michelle K.
garlic noodles.review: Garlic noodles, shaken beef, crab and the tiger prawns!  Must orders!  Finding parking can be kinda crappy though, but not as bad as other parts in the city.

excerpts: I got the garlic noodles with the roasted crab.
The only reason I'm not giving it 5 stars is because the parking is TERRIBLE!!
Like there is honestly NO parking around the establishment.
I went on a Saturday night so that could have yielded a reason.
I had to park about 7mins away & called Lyft which costed a little extra money.
Overall my experience was good, I will definitely be going back !
garlic noodles.author: Bey G.
garlic noodles.review: The Food was GREAT! Very seasoned & filling. I got the garlic noodles with the roasted crab. The only reason I'm not giving it 5 stars is because the parking is TERRIBLE!! Like there is honestly NO parking around the establishment. I went on a Saturday night so that could have yielded a reason. I had to park about 7mins away & called Lyft which costed a little extra money. Overall my experience was good, I will definitely be going back !

excerpts: I ordered the Tiger Prawns (Colossal = HUGE) served over the famous garlic noodles!
I could not stop eating, I kept going and going and going....
Def a must try!
garlic noodles.author: Carla F.
garlic noodles.review: I ordered the Tiger Prawns (Colossal = HUGE) served over the famous garlic noodles! I could not stop eating, I kept going and going and going....Def a must try!

excerpts: Garlic Noodles and Crab are always winners!
Excellent meal and great service.
garlic noodles.author: Stanley A.
garlic noodles.review: Garlic Noodles and Crab are always winners!  Excellent meal and great service.

excerpts: BEST GARLIC NOODLES EVER!
garlic noodles.author: Consuela P.
garlic noodles.review:
HOLY CRAB! BEST GARLIC NOODLES EVER!

Hubby's cousin took us here for dinner on our last trip to the Bay. I haven't eaten a dungeness crab like this before. The delicious and juicy drunken crab exceeded my expectations and I ate it all! I love crab but don't like getting my hands all greased up unless I'm eating it in the comforts of my own home. It was simply the best meal I have ever had in my life.

NOM NOM NOM NOM!!!

excerpts: I had the Thanh Long Fish - $27.50, which is a delicious pan broiled red snapper dish served with their famous garlic noodles.
The garlic noodles were good, but a little over hyped, maybe a bit on the dry mushy side perhaps.
It didn't come with any kind of a side, so I shared my garlic noodles.
We ended things with a nice creme brulee which was like $8.00.
The waitress was attentive, smiled, and didn't rush it.
Forget trying to park, just use the friendly valet service for $12.00.
Great date night, fantastic food.
Go here!
garlic noodles.author: Shane N.
garlic noodles.review: Started put with a plum martini, and a mango cocktail of some kind -$9.00 each. They were pretty sweet, maybe better as a dessert. The Dungeons Crab Puffs were AMAZING, stuffed with tons of fresh, real crab meat! - $10.50. I had the Thanh Long Fish - $27.50, which is a delicious pan broiled red snapper dish served with their famous garlic noodles. The garlic noodles were good, but a little over hyped, maybe a bit on the dry mushy side perhaps. My partner in crime had the Catch In Citrus for $25.50. It's a decadent sea bass in a grand marnier sauce. It didn't come with any kind of a side, so I shared my garlic noodles. We ended things with a nice creme brulee which was like $8.00. The waitress was attentive, smiled, and didn't rush it. Forget trying to park, just use the friendly valet service for $12.00. Great date night, fantastic food. Go here!

excerpts: The shaken beef is a delicious second entree to accompany the crab and the garlic noodles are top notch.
Everything else on the menu looked so good it was hard not to get everything.
We had some very tasty appetizers; especially the mussels which were rich and buttery.
From the moment we sat down to the minute we left, the service was top notch, fast and efficient, and never felt rushed.
This was by far one of our best meals and the best service we've had all year.
garlic noodles.author: Ian S.
garlic noodles.review:
Definitely get a reservation because this place is popular for a reason.  The crab is a must!  So absolutely delicious.  The shaken beef is a delicious second entree to accompany the crab and the garlic noodles are top notch.  Everything else on the menu looked so good it was hard not to get everything. We had some very tasty appetizers; especially the mussels which were rich and buttery. 
From the moment we sat down to the minute we left, the service was top notch, fast and efficient, and never felt rushed.  This was by far one of our best meals and the best service we've had all year.

excerpts: And the garlic noodles!
OMG!!!
I would definitely go back!!!!
Super happy tummy!
Lol!:)
garlic noodles.author: Majell V.
garlic noodles.review: Great food!!!! I love their roasted crab!!!!! And the garlic noodles! OMG!!! I would definitely go back!!!! Super happy tummy! Lol!:)

excerpts: I didn't even care for the garlic noodles.
To me, it is just noodle with alot of oil, butter and garlic.
But they are known for these two, their roasted crab and garlic noodles.
garlic noodles.author: Angela L.
garlic noodles.review:
Ok I have been here many many times and finally i will review this time.
Just to be on the safe side, I went to make reservation prior to arriving Thanh Long and to my surprise they were able to fit us in for 7:30.

I arrived 5 minutes late and still was not seated until quarter to 8.  We got a good seat.  We knew what we wanted.  I took the liberty of ordering 2 roasted crabs, one bowl of their sour-sweet soup and a plate of garlic noodle.  They brought them in a timely manner starting with appetizers.  It was ok.  I could of done this one better and more justice.  Very pricey for a small bowl of soup!

Then came to crab.................
All I can say if it is soooooooooooooooo yummy. So flavorful and just the right hint of garlic and spicy.  The crab was a pretty good size and so were the meat..  I sucked every inch of the meat in the crab.  No wonder why they are so pricey around $37 per crab and people continue to flock to this place for them. But it was well worth it.

I didn't even care for the garlic noodles.  To me, it is just noodle with alot of oil, butter and garlic.  But they are known for these two, their roasted crab and garlic noodles.  Who am I to say otherwise.

I just love love love dungeness crab so this is the only place that I find makes the best.  I am glad I came that night because it wasn't so packed but enough to make it a memorable dining experience.

excerpts: I've had better garlic noodles elsewhere?
I'll stick to La Vie.
garlic noodles.author: Sabrina M.
garlic noodles.review:
Service was great. 
Food was okay but way overpriced for what it is. 
Dare I say? I've had better garlic noodles elsewhere? 
I'll stick to La Vie.

excerpts: We also had two orders of garlic noodles.
Yummy!
They were extremely garlic-y, which I loved, but I would have liked it a little saltier.
garlic noodles.author: Angelic L.
garlic noodles.review:
Oh my... Thanh Long sure is expensive!

I came here with some family and we spent a good chunk of money. We had two crabs, one drunken and one roasted. I definitely preferred the roasted crab over the drunken one, but both were cooked well and were fresh! The crab meat didn't stick to the shells and the shells were really easy to crack. We also had two orders of garlic noodles. Yummy! They were extremely garlic-y, which I loved, but I would have liked it a little saltier. The shrimp toast and seafood fried rice were delicious!

Overall, I really enjoyed Thanh Long, but did not like what it did to my wallet. Haha...

excerpts:
The food tastes homemade, 
I loved the garlic noodles, the noodles tend to be the highlight going to Thanh Long for me.
It's absolutely delicious.
garlic noodles.author: Trinity N.
garlic noodles.review:
The food here was amazing! Such true and quality taste. The food tastes homemade, 
I loved the garlic noodles, the noodles tend to be the highlight going to Thanh Long for me. It's absolutely delicious. I also ordered the salt and pepper calamari as an appetizer, and the Dungeoness Crab as the main course. Salt and pepper calamari always has that perfect fresh crunch to it. It tastes as if it's always fresh out of the fryer. The Dungeoness crab is my favorite, but all the crabs tend to have Thanh Long's crabby, unique, yummy, smooth taste. I LOVE it! If I could afford Thanh Long every week, i'd definitely go. :)

excerpts: And you can't come here and not have the roasted crab and garlic noodles.
Definitely one of my staple restaurants.
garlic noodles.author: J'Neane V.
garlic noodles.review: When I want a treat its Thanh Long.  The drive from Oakland to the City is worth it.  The mussels are a MUST ORDER.  And you can't come here and not have the roasted crab and garlic noodles.  Definitely one of my staple restaurants.

excerpts: I didn't care for the garlic noodles too much.
garlic noodles.author: Tim F.
garlic noodles.review:
GF brought me here and I have to say that it was a very enjoyable experience.  
The Crab was very good and filling.  The sauce seemed easy enough to make and very peppery but delicious.  

I didn't care for the garlic noodles too much.  Seemed very simple.  

Overall I really enjoyed the food and the experience.  However, I agree with other reviews that the price at over $40 per crab is just too high.  If they reduced the price to $30, I'd consider eating there much more often.

excerpts: Now I realize why all of the Yelp photos are of garlic noodles and crabs - DELICIOUS!!
I wasn't happy about them charging $12 for valet, until a server put a crab bib around my neck and served up some garlic/buttery crab and those melt in your mouth noodles!!!
garlic noodles.author: Katie V.
garlic noodles.review: Now I realize why all of the Yelp photos are of garlic noodles and crabs - DELICIOUS!! I wasn't happy about them charging $12 for valet, until a server put a crab bib around my neck and served up some garlic/buttery crab and those melt in your mouth noodles!!! The Buddha rolls were great, the shaken beef was my least favorite (but it was fine), and the vegetable/tofu entree was delicious! Go early to avoid the rush, but don't go on Mondays because they're closed!

excerpts: garlic noodles and roasted crab are amazing.
Our favorite place to eat when we're in the area.
garlic noodles.author: Richard D.
garlic noodles.review: garlic noodles and roasted crab are amazing.  Our favorite place to eat when we're in the area.

excerpts:
We ordered:
 roasted crab
drunken crab
garlic noodles
MUSSELS
chicken fried rice
2 cocktails
The roasted crab was better than the drunken crab.
The garlic noodles were so tasty, but I have to admit I have had other garlic noodles that were just as good as here.
The fried rice was good but boring.
garlic noodles.author: Nicole A.
garlic noodles.review:
My husband I read about this place on Yelp and had to try it! 

We ordered:
 roasted crab
drunken crab
garlic noodles
MUSSELS
chicken fried rice
2 cocktails
 Total was about $165

I wish I could give a better breakdown of the cost, well the crab, but I lost my receipt and didn't think to look until I thought about doing this review.  My guess is they were about 25-35 bucks each for market price.

I see the crab has been reviewed over and over so what I want to point out is that the mussels were FANTASTIC! When we talk about going back, we talk about going back for the mussels! The roasted crab was better than the drunken crab.  The garlic noodles were so tasty, but I have to admit I have had other garlic noodles that were just as good as here.  The fried rice was good but boring. 

I give this place 4 stars for excellent food and service. 1 extra star for being walking distance to the beach! Come here and get stuffed with yummy food, then walk it off at beautiful Ocean Beach.

excerpts: Garlic noodles included here, see review below.
Garlic Noodles - 2/5.
Although very highly rated, it was a complete miss.
The dish was heavy on oil and the noodles were overcooked.
Ideally, the noodles would be the hero of the dish, with a seasoning of garlic to help the noodles shine.
garlic noodles.author: Gabriel C.
garlic noodles.review:
TLDR: 
The highlights: Thanh Long Fish, Shaken Beef, and Drunken Crab.
The 50-50 risk: Roast crab - risk the crab meat being overcooked.
The disappointment: Skip the stand-alone garlic noodle dish.

Thanh Long Fish (red snapper) - 4/5. Seasoned lightly to let the fish flavor show through and act as the hero of the dish. Fished was cooked perfectly - just on the edge of being cooked / raw giving it a very smooth taste. Garlic noodles included here, see review below.

Shaken Beef - 4/5. Cubes of New York strip steak cooked medium rare. Nailed the cooking method, but the seasoning was heavy handed and a tad heavy on the oil.

Drunken Crab - 4/5. Cooked very well - crab meat retained its moisture. Lightly seasoned to help the crab flavor shine.

Roast Crab - 2/5. A risk for roasting crab is overcooking, leaving the meat dry. In this case, the crab was just on the cusp of being dried out, an unfortunate followup of the perfectly cooked Drunken Crab. The seasoning was well done, so I suspect that if the crab was more moist this dish would definitely shine.

Garlic Noodles - 2/5. Although very highly rated, it was a complete miss. The dish was heavy on oil and the noodles were overcooked. Ideally, the noodles would be the hero of the dish, with a seasoning of garlic to help the noodles shine.

excerpts: The menu had what looked like so many amazing choices, but I had checked out a few Yelp reviews beforehand, and already knew I wanted to order the garlic noodles.
For an entree I ordered the Thanh Long Fish (sauteed red snapper) with garlic noodles.
The restaurant loses a star for the garlic noodles, which were sorely disappointing.
They didn't taste bad, but definitely looked like they were the leftover noodles at the end of a long day.
garlic noodles.author: Dom J.
garlic noodles.review:
I went to Thanh Long for the first time last night to celebrate a friend's birthday, and I must say that the outside doesn't do the inside's decor justice. It's a really beautiful restaurant.

The menu had what looked like so many amazing choices, but I had checked out a few Yelp reviews beforehand, and already knew I wanted to order the garlic noodles. As an appetizer, I ordered the shrimp toast, which was AMAZING (best part of the meal, even my friend commented on it, after trying a piece). The toast was a perfect blend of crispy, soft, and buttery, with chunks of shrimp integrated well.

They also had delicious plum wine.

For an entree I ordered the Thanh Long Fish (sauteed red snapper) with garlic noodles. The restaurant loses a star for the garlic noodles, which were sorely disappointing. They didn't taste bad, but definitely looked like they were the leftover noodles at the end of a long day. The fish was delicious, and a perfect compliment to the wine.

As for the service, everyone was extremely kind and accommodating. My friend and I plan to go back to try other dishes. Thumbs up, Thanh Long!

excerpts: The Garlic Noodles are to die for.
garlic noodles.author: Daniel P.
garlic noodles.review:
I am in heaven when at this restaurant.

The Garlic Noodles are to die for.  The the Garlic Roasted Crab is the best in the City.

A great date restaurant.  Never mind the Garlic and enjoy.

Excellent service and food.  Really the best place!

excerpts: All I want when I come here is the roast dungeness crab and garlic noodles!
No one else does the noodles like they do.
It is addicting and goes so well with the crab.
No need for butter with this crab, it is always perfectly seasoned and flavorful.
This is a must when I am in San Francisco!
garlic noodles.author: Jill D.
garlic noodles.review: I have been going to this restaurant since I was a kid.  Expect to spend some money here, and probably wait for a table.  All I want when I come here is the roast dungeness crab and garlic noodles!   No one else does the noodles like they do.  It is addicting and goes so well with the crab.  No need for butter with this crab, it is always perfectly seasoned and flavorful. This is a must when I am in San Francisco!

excerpts: I don't know what the big deal is with the garlic noodles.
I had it in LA at Crustacean, had it at the food truck in SF, and at Thanh Long.
It's decent, nothing too special.
The mystique of the recipe is hyping this dish unnecessarily.
Is it suppose to be a dry version of the overgarlicky pasta from traditional Italian NYC restaurant on Carmine St.?
garlic noodles.author: Rebecca C.
garlic noodles.review:
fantastic crab, had a whole dungeness crab on my own in the traditional roasted crab style and shared a drunken crab. I liked the drunken crab a bit better since the taste was closer to original crab taste -- I'm a bit of a purist when it comes to crabs.

I don't know what the big deal is with the garlic noodles. I had it in LA at Crustacean, had it at the food truck in SF, and at Thanh Long. It's decent, nothing too special. The mystique of the recipe is hyping this dish unnecessarily. Is it suppose to be a dry version of the overgarlicky pasta from traditional Italian NYC restaurant on Carmine St.?

excerpts: yes, but strictly for the crab and garlic noodles... and if i happen to just have $50 in my pocket to spend on ONE crab.
garlic noodles.author: Mae D.
garlic noodles.review:
Friendly hostess took my "dinner for 2" reservation over the phone.  We arrived half hour early and were able to be seated right away. 

Our server was courteous and upbeat. 

We regret ordering appetizers: salt and pepper calamari and the shrimp toast. 
The toast was very stale and made for a hard and chewy appetizer. and the calamari was nothing special.

The roast crab was very flavorful and we enjoyed every last piece. We shared 1 roast crab and 1 garlic noodle dish. and it was enough. we were very close to ordering a second round of food, but then just like that it hit us that we were full.  (But had we not ordered the appetizers, i honestly think we could have been satisfied ordering 2 crabs and maaaaybe 2 garlic noodle dishes)

so would i come back here? yes, but strictly for the crab and garlic noodles... and if i happen to just have $50 in my pocket to spend on ONE crab.

excerpts: Garlic noodles and roasted crab are good but nothing better than the other bay area restaurants serving almost the same dish.
garlic noodles.author: Elly G.
garlic noodles.review: We went here due to the positive reviews. I think that this restaurant  is overrated. Garlic noodles and roasted crab are good but nothing better than the other bay area restaurants serving almost the same dish. As for the shaken beef, I am not a fan of it. The beef was mixed in a bed of veggies and fried potatoes. That was $25. Service is quick and good. Crab price is $50 . It may still be worth a try for the curious ones.

excerpts: We ordered the Roasted Garlic Crab, Drunken Crab, Garlic Noodles and Garlic Fried Rice.
There was not much of a difference in taste between the two crab dishes.
They were good and I think better than the Roasted Garlic Crab at PPQ
but PPQ has Peppercorn Crab, which is a stellar dish that Thanh Long does not carry on their menu.
The garlic noodles are better here than PPQ and the garlic fried rice goes very well with the crab butter sauce.
The garlic noodles are better here than PPQ and the garlic fried rice goes very well with the crab butter sauce.
garlic noodles.author: Chi N.
garlic noodles.review:
I haven't been back to Thanh Long in almost a decade so when my gf came to visit, I decided to take her here instead of PPQ Dungeness Island since I remembered Thanh Long being more fancy and upscale. Things have changed in the last few years as this place is not as fancy as I remembered. My gf and I were dressed up and felt a little out of place as most other diners were dressed more casual. 

We ordered the Roasted Garlic Crab, Drunken Crab, Garlic Noodles and Garlic Fried Rice. There was not much of a difference in taste between the two crab dishes. They were good and I think better than the Roasted Garlic Crab at PPQ but PPQ has Peppercorn Crab, which is a stellar dish that Thanh Long does not carry on their menu. The garlic noodles are better here than PPQ and the garlic fried rice goes very well with the crab butter sauce. 

It's pricier than PPQ. We paid $150 for all 4 dishes, including 2 glasses of wine with tip included. At PPQ, I've ordered the same amount of food with a bottle of wine for $100. Since the ambiance is not as upscale as before, I would save the few extra bucks and eat at PPQ's instead.

excerpts: Valet Parking + A Half Dozen Herbaceous Broiled Mussels atop Toast + Plastic Bibs + 1 Whole Roasted Crab with Garlic + 1 Drunken Crab with Chardonnay and Cracked Black Pepper + 1 Tangy and Dill-icious Tamarind Crab + A Heaping Pile of the Best Garlic Noodles in the City + Grubby Fingers =
THE ARRIVAL OF DUNGENESS CRAB SEASON
garlic noodles.author: Amy C.
garlic noodles.review: Valet Parking + A Half Dozen Herbaceous Broiled Mussels atop Toast + Plastic Bibs + 1 Whole Roasted Crab with Garlic + 1 Drunken Crab with Chardonnay and Cracked Black Pepper + 1 Tangy and Dill-icious Tamarind Crab + A Heaping Pile of the Best Garlic Noodles in the City + Grubby Fingers = THE ARRIVAL OF DUNGENESS CRAB SEASON

excerpts: We all love those damn garlic noodles that I try and recreate at home but that roasted crab....
Simply delectable that one just simply isn't enough.
A must try.
Thang Long-
you are an SF staple.
garlic noodles.author: C. M.
garlic noodles.review:
One of my happy places. A place to come and celebrate or bring out of town guests.
We all love those damn garlic noodles that I try and recreate at home but that roasted crab.... Simply delectable that one just simply isn't enough. 
A must try. Thang Long- you are an SF staple.

excerpts: We also ordered garlic noodles and baked crab.
The garlic noodles were good but they kept breaking on us.
The baked crab was literally baked crab but they put a little butter and rub salt and pepper all of it.
I would say the portion of salt and pepper was good on it
but I was expecting a lot more since everyone was raving about it.
Overall the food was good but service was bad.
I had to ask 5 times for my soda to be refills.
I would had given it 4 star but the service is bad and that's why I give it a 3
garlic noodles.author: Julie N.
garlic noodles.review: First impression when coming to this restaurant was this is a small restaurant but packed with a lot of people. We ordered a few appetizer which was fried calamari, grilled calamari, and baked mussels. The fried Calamari was too salty but everything else was good. We also ordered garlic noodles and baked crab. The garlic noodles were good but they kept breaking on us. The baked crab was literally baked crab but they put a little butter and rub salt and pepper all of it. I would say the portion of salt and pepper was good on it but I was expecting a lot more since everyone was raving about it. Overall the food was good but service was bad. I had to ask 5 times for my soda to be refills. I would had given it 4 star but the service is bad and that's why I give it a 3

excerpts: Although I was under the weather a little bit, I was able to enjoy the garlic noodles.
If I had my appetite, I definitely would have ordered the roasted crab.
They were ordered by many of those around us, including my two dinner companions.
I did try the banana cake-
wow-
wish I could have had that one all to myself!
The place fills up quickly, and there seems to be an underlying pressure to turn over the tables which I definitely sensed as they took dishes away before I was done.
You definitely need reservations, and it is worth every penny to use valet-
it's hard to find parking anywhere.
They have a full bar, excellent food, and a nice decor.
I hope to return sometime when I'm feeling better and get that wonderful crab!
garlic noodles.author: Clare S.
garlic noodles.review: Came here with a friend for a celebratory dinner last Friday. Although I was under the weather a little bit, I was able to enjoy the garlic noodles. If I had my appetite, I definitely would have ordered the roasted crab. They were ordered by many of those around us, including my two dinner companions. I did try the banana cake- wow- wish I could have had that one all to myself! The place fills up quickly, and there seems to be an underlying pressure to turn over the tables which I definitely sensed as they took dishes away before I was done. You definitely need reservations, and it is worth every penny to use valet- it's hard to find parking anywhere. They have a full bar, excellent food, and a nice decor. I hope to return sometime when I'm feeling better and get that wonderful crab!

excerpts: Of course they are known for their crab and garlic noodles (which are delicious) but the mussels are my favorite thing on the menu.
Their house made infused vodkas are also quite a treat.
garlic noodles.author: Heather W.
garlic noodles.review: EVERYTHING is good there. I have been several times with large groups, so I have had the luxury or trying most of their dishes. The atmosphere is great for large groups. Of course they are known for their crab and garlic noodles (which are delicious) but the mussels are my favorite thing on the menu. Their house made infused vodkas are also quite a treat.

excerpts: We also had the tamarind crab and a plate of garlic noodles.
The crab meat was good and well cooked but the sauce was really strange with ingredients that did not go so well together.
The garlic noodles were also just bleh.
For $10, I would really like more than a plain plate of spaghetti noodles with a some garlic seasonings.
I generally love garlic noodles but at least most places present the noodles with a sprig of greens or extra sauce and charge at least 1/3-1/2 less.
Really-
garlic noodles.author: Amy D.
garlic noodles.review:
We were quite excited to check out this place being huge fans of crab (and during dungeness season too)! Sadly, Thanh Long was quite disappointing with high prices and mediocre food.

We started with the mango salad with seared shrimp and scallop that ended up being the highlight of the meal. The flavors were fantastic although there could have been more scallops. The warm seafood paired with the fruit flavors of the sliced mango and raspberry vinaigrette were really fun and well worth trying!

We also had the tamarind crab and a plate of garlic noodles. The crab meat was good and well cooked but the sauce was really strange with ingredients that did not go so well together. The tamarind component of the crab did not come out strongly (this wasn't your normal tamarind sauce) and we were quite disappointed with the conflicting and unappetizing flavors of this ~$40 dish. 

The garlic noodles were also just bleh. For $10, I would really like more than a plain plate of spaghetti noodles with a some garlic seasonings. I generally love garlic noodles but at least most places present the noodles with a sprig of greens or extra sauce and charge at least 1/3-1/2 less. Really- with how expensive the food is at this place, I expect a bit more presentation if not better flavor. 

Overall, this place was mediocre to average (we count 2 stars as average). The mango salad was fantastic but the big miss on the other dishes plus the unjustified high prices brought it back down to a 1.5 stars for us.

excerpts: My husband ordered the highly recommended roasted crab while I ordered their tiger prawns over their infamous garlic noodles which is just enough for a serving for two.
The roasted crab did not disappoint.
It was very flavorful especially when you hit the notes of fresh cracked pepper.
A little heavy handed on the pepper,
but I didn't mind.
Expect to fork over market value price and then some.
The garlic noodles were simple tasty yellow noodles, forgettable tiger prawns.
Our friend and his girlfriend ordered the roasted crab, garlic noodles and the shaken beef.
garlic noodles.author: Michelle T.
garlic noodles.review:
Food:  My husband ordered the highly recommended roasted crab while I ordered their tiger prawns over their infamous garlic noodles which is just enough for a serving for two.  The roasted crab did not disappoint.  It was very flavorful especially when you hit the notes of fresh cracked pepper.  A little heavy handed on the pepper, but I didn't mind.  Expect to fork over market value price and then some.  The garlic noodles were simple tasty yellow noodles, forgettable tiger prawns.  Our friend and his girlfriend ordered the roasted crab, garlic noodles and the shaken beef.  Skip the shaken beef.  Although it was tender, I've had better for a third of the price.  We had the lava chocolate cake and crème brûlée for dessert.  I would pass next time.  

Service:  It was impeccable.  Food was prompt.  Arrived within a few minutes after our order was placed.  Staff were very attentive.  

Ambiance:  Located in a quiet neighborhood.  Restaurant was dimly lit.  A lively bar and a quaint (tight) waiting area welcome guests.

excerpts: Garlic Noodles:
The GN was okay, nice hint of flavors
but I also didn't feel this was lip smacking good.
garlic noodles.author: Sunny L.
garlic noodles.review:
Thanh Long is quite an established restaurant. With lots of loyal customers, i found it difficult to eat here without reservations. Upon entering, me and my gf faced a barrage of sardines [people] in a packed waiting area. The other patrons waiting were quite rude. The bar area was big enough to fit about 5 people max. Expect to wait when coming here. Always make reservations, that's the most important tip here ever. Things we tried.

Mussel Appetizer: 9/10
Really good and delicious. 5 mussels on top of slices of french bread only but quality over quantity.

Asian Bouillabaisse - Bowl of Soup for one : 4/10
Really really sweet with a slight sour.
The taste was there but it was so sweet that it wasn't appetizing.
It was really a turn off.

Roast Crab - A whole crab: 5/10
It was expecting a good flavor to this. I was thinking about it all day actually.
It was just crab that was roasted. I felt like this could have been improved in so many small ways. It was just okay to me. Nothing special.

Garlic Noodles: 5.5/10
The GN was okay, nice hint of flavors but I also didn't feel this was lip smacking good. It could have been better.

The Service was locked down on everything. 
Water here and questions here. 
Very good good good service.

Ambiance was okay; more so, it was loud and noisy.

Overall, I would recommend this place to try but I wouldn't expect to be blown away.

Pros: Service, Mussels
COns: Improve on the items listed above. [IMO]
STars:3

excerpts: Garlic noodles with tiger prawns 36$ - Garlic noodles were soo good..
My Bf has caliac disease and can't have yellow noodles.. but he couldn't resist.
He insisted it was worth the later pain he would endure..
It was sooo good
but I wouldn't recommend getting the tiger prawns with it.
It was overpriced for what it was.
But the 16$ for reg garlic noodles will be ordered on my next visit.
garlic noodles.author: Ames A.
garlic noodles.review:
I would give this place a million stars if I could. I am a seafood steak lover.. I have found my haven. My new favorite restaurant in all of America! 

After hearing so much raving about Thanh Long and their sister resteraunt Crusteceans I finally walked in the day after Christmas. Without a reservation we waited 45 min... We were extremely hungry and boy am I glad we waited, after leaving the previous restaurant for having a 30 min wait. As we were waiting people walking out would assure us it's worth the wait.... my expectations were high. We promptly got seated and after about 35 min.
We ordered.. as the food comes out you'll start to notice everyone gets real quiet...

Roasted Crab 42$ -OMG Flavorful and deliciousness it was draped in butter and seasoning. As I was eating my body slowly floated towards heaven. My BF agreed.
Seasoned Mixed Veggies 11$ -OMG perfectly seasoned. Sooo sooo good!
Garlic noodles with tiger prawns 36$ - Garlic noodles were soo good.. My Bf has caliac disease and can't have yellow noodles.. but he couldn't resist. He insisted it was worth the later pain he would endure.. It was sooo good but I wouldn't recommend getting the tiger prawns with it. It was overpriced for what it was. But the 16$ for reg garlic noodles will be ordered on my next visit.
Seafood Fried Rice 14$ -this was the only thing that didn't wow me at the table. Wouldn't order it again. It was good, but compared to the other amazing dishes this just didn't stand out.
Banana Cake 8$ - delicious. If you have room give it a shot.. but otherwise I wouldn't order it again.

Our Bill came to 120$, service by server Eddy was incredible. I will be back shortly. There's really no mistake about that. AMAAAAZING food, great service, and do-able prices.

excerpts: Roasted crab and garlic noodles are a must.
Bring mints for after!!!
garlic noodles.author: Raven J.
garlic noodles.review: I have been eating here for the last ten years. Yes it is pricy but it is consistently delicious and definitely worth going too. If not just for a casual dinner than at least a special celebration. The seafood fried rice is delicious, seriously order it and take it for lunch the next day. Roasted crab and garlic noodles are a must. Bring mints for after!!!

excerpts: Also, don't forget to order the garlic noodles which are just superb.
You can't go wrong with the different prep methods for the crab and we always prefer to be downstairs rather than on the second floor.
Get a reservation before going just in case!
garlic noodles.author: Virginia G.
garlic noodles.review: This is an absolute favorite for when I'm in San Francisco. Located in Ocean Beach, it is a long trip from downtown, however, well worth the trip. It is most known for the crab, go during crab season and stick to this when ordering. It is messy and delicious. Also, don't forget to order the garlic noodles which are just superb. You can't go wrong with the different prep methods for the crab and we always prefer to be downstairs rather than on the second floor. Get a reservation before going just in case!

excerpts: The crab and garlic noodles are must gets as they are absolutely delicious.
The service was really good and efficient, and the ambience was perfect for friends or for a date.
While it is on the pricey side, the quality of the food definitely made up for it... would come again for sure.
garlic noodles.author: Jessica X.
garlic noodles.review: Definitely make a reservation a few days in advance as the place is popping! The crab and garlic noodles are must gets as they are absolutely delicious. The service was really good and efficient, and the ambience was perfect for friends or for a date. While it is on the pricey side, the quality of the food definitely made up for it... would come again for sure.

excerpts: We also ordered the Colossal Royal Tiger Prawns that is served over a bed of garlic noodles M/P and If I can remember correctly (I had a few too many drinks by the end of the night)
that dish came out to $32?$35?
ERF!
I say ask before you order this because if it is that much, it's totally NOT WORTH IT.
garlic noodles.author: Jan Y.
garlic noodles.review:
Omg its guud! I started off with the Thanh Long mussles which was surprisingly very tasty and flavorful.   The roast crab was amazing! cooked perfectly and the mixture of spices was phenominal, I love.     We also ordered the Colossal Royal Tiger Prawns that is served over a bed of garlic noodles M/P and If I can remember correctly (I had a few too many drinks by the end of the night)  that dish came out to $32?$35?  ERF! I say ask before you order this because if it is that much, it's totally NOT WORTH IT.  If you are going to spend that money might as well get another crab!  

Enjoy!

.

excerpts: Ordered Thanh Long's highest recommended dishes for pick-up (garlic noodles, shaken beef etc.
garlic noodles.author: Kevin G.
garlic noodles.review:
Overdue review.

Ordered Thanh Long's highest recommended dishes for pick-up (garlic noodles, shaken beef etc. Arrived and was greeted by friendly staff, namely Will, settled up and was on my way.

Got home ~10 blocks away and discovered my order had been botched (favorably in terms of item count, just not what I had originally ordered). No big deal, things happen. Contacted the restaurant more just to provide an FYI (I really didn't want to leave the house again) and Will was super apologetic, offered to make it right, and bring my [corrected] order out to my car if I came back.

I agreed, hopped back in the car and headed back over. Will was ready and outside with my order, and, included some great samplers as well (calimari and others). 

The food tasted great, no doubt. But I wholly appreciate the team there going the distance to make sure I, as a customer, was satisfied with my experience. So, kudos - and thank you. I'll be back soon.

excerpts: Roasted crab and garlic noodles.
That's all you need.
It was the best crab I ever had.
Service was great and they are quick.
I guess you have to be as there are hungry customers waiting.
garlic noodles.author: Janis G.
garlic noodles.review:
This place looks like a hole in the wall, but don't let that fool you because its a different place once you walk in.  They opened up at 5:00 and we had reservations.  The line to get in started forming and 4:45 and the place was full by the time the doors opened up.  If you have to wait, trust me...it's worth it.  

Roasted crab and garlic noodles.  That's all you need.  It was the best crab I ever had.  Service was great and they are quick.  I guess you have to be as there are hungry customers waiting.

excerpts: When I first tasted the garlic noodles, I wasn't a fan at first.
Then I realized after a couple visits after how much I love it.
Especially if you're a garlic lover like me.
You cant find noodles anywhere like that.
garlic noodles.author: DA BADDEST B.
garlic noodles.review:
I LOVE THIS PLACE!!! When I first tasted the garlic noodles, I wasn't a fan at first. Then I realized after a couple visits after how much I love it. Especially if you're a garlic lover like me. You cant find noodles anywhere like that. I'm been tracking their food truck AN THE GO to see if its coming near my town just so I can get a my Garlic Noodle fix!

My other half is a crab fan but I always get the Shanken Beef and it is TO DIE FOR!!! You pop it in your mouth and it just melts like BUTTAH! It comes with lil potato pieces over a bed of lettuce & vinaigrette and it all just works perfectly!!

The muscles appetizers is deeelish! 

The service is great. Seats us immediately, takes our orders all memorized (no pen & paper) and is always on point making sure we are okay.

excerpts: Loved the Roasted crab, garlic noodles, steamed sea bass, shrimp toast...
the dumplings were just okay
but that's not too bad considering the amount of food we had.
We came here for a birthday and the bill came to about $80 per person.
We also tried the shaking beef and the clay pot.
Service was great, food was delicious.
Our party and the birthday girl were very happy!
garlic noodles.author: Jennifer B.
garlic noodles.review:
YUMMY! 

Lives up to the hype.  Loved the Roasted crab, garlic noodles, steamed sea bass, shrimp toast...the dumplings were just okay but that's not too bad considering the amount of food we had. We came here for a birthday and the bill came to about $80 per person.  We also tried the shaking beef and the clay pot.  Service was great, food was delicious.  Our party and the birthday girl were very happy!

excerpts: As you can see from the tons of photos and reviews---order the garlic crab ($40) and garlic noodles (forgot how much)!
Most popular items.
You can request extra butter as well.
It was pretty darn good.
garlic noodles.author: Michelle H.
garlic noodles.review: As you can see from the tons of photos and reviews---order the garlic crab ($40) and garlic noodles (forgot how much)!  Most popular items.  You can request extra butter as well.  It was pretty darn good.  Their bo luc lac (shaken beef) was ~$23---ummm..it was good, but definitely not worth $23.  The most I've had for bo luc lac was around $10 (same meat).  So yeah..not worth it.   Make reservations or hope you don't have to wait too long (especially if you're with a big group)---we waited almost an hour for 4 people.  This place is packed!

excerpts: If you do see me here, you'll see a guy elbows propped and face-deep in a heaping portion of garlic noodles and shredding through crab like one ninja turtle menace.
garlic noodles.author: Nick W.
garlic noodles.review:
It's pretty rare that I make my way all the out to this neck of the woods. That being said...

If you do see me here, you'll see a guy elbows propped and face-deep in a heaping portion of garlic noodles and shredding through crab like one ninja turtle menace. I'm not ashamed to say that I dragged my noodles through the pool of butter and black pepper resting at the bottom of the roasted crab plate completely ignoring trivial matters like high cholesterol or blood pressure.

Despite An's amazing crab and noodle dual performance, I advise against the Shaken Beef. For some reason, my mind kept thinking I was eating Lay's BBQ chips.

Come here for the 1-2 crab-noodle punch and then call it a night. :)

excerpts:
Items tried: 
Tiger prawn on garlic noodles
Drunken crab
Shaken beef

Known for their garlic noodles and crab, the place gets really busy even for late dinner.
garlic noodles.author: Romella J.
garlic noodles.review:
Items tried: 
Tiger prawn on garlic noodles
Drunken crab
Shaken beef

Known for their garlic noodles and crab, the place gets really busy even for late dinner. The noodles were cooked just right, not oily but garlicky. Garlic taste was not too intense. However, it got cold really fast. Also, I would recommend a strong drink to match it. 

Prawns were grilled and seasoned right. Large crab were fresh but was not as meaty. Beef was tender but well-flavored. 

Overall, I already recommended this place as a must try. 

Also same menu as Crustacean in the city.

excerpts: everything was really good, from the crabs (my uncle said the crabs are all soaked beforehand, so the shells were very soft and not at all hard to crack into!), garlic noodles, shaken beef, chicken, and vegetarian dishes.
the eggplant was good but extremely oily.
garlic noodles.author: Sabrina L.
garlic noodles.review:
Had a great experience here! Make sure you come early and make reservations -- the place was already crowded at 5:30 pm on a thursday night! we had reservations for our party of 10 and were seated upstairs. service was very fast -- we started receiving our food maybe ten minutes after ordering! everything was really good, from the crabs (my uncle said the crabs are all soaked beforehand, so the shells were very soft and not at all hard to crack into!), garlic noodles, shaken beef, chicken, and vegetarian dishes. the eggplant was good but extremely oily. the ambiance of the restaurant is also very nice and more upscale than i was expecting, and they even have a valet option for your car!

my only critiques are that there is a limited ways your crab can be prepared -- the original roast crab with pepper, the drunken crab, and the tamarind crab. i would have liked to try a garlic-prepared crab. their fryer was also broken that night, so we were unable to enjoy any fried bananas :(

overall very good experience! i would love to come back!

excerpts:
w/ An's garlic sauce & secret spices
Shaken Beef: tender cubes of marinated NY steak flambeed in Chardonnay served w/potatoes, mixed greens & cherry tomatoes
Garlic Noodles
Thanh Long Fish:
red snapper pan-broiled w/a dill-turmeric essence & red onions served w/garlic noodles
garlic noodles.author: Kitty K.
garlic noodles.review:
I went here several years ago (I know, I'm catching up on my reviews) for a birthday. We ordered the following:

Roasted Crab: whole Dungeness crab roasted w/ An's garlic sauce & secret spices
Shaken Beef: tender cubes of marinated NY steak flambeed in Chardonnay served w/potatoes, mixed greens & cherry tomatoes
Garlic Noodles
Thanh Long Fish: red snapper pan-broiled w/a dill-turmeric essence & red onions served w/garlic noodles

The food was good, but nothing spectacular. Service was barely even there. The crab was the best tasting dish, but I've had better. Since I've gone, no real need to go back.

excerpts: The garlic noodles was nothing special and it wasn't even garlicy enough.
The appetizer mussels were ok, but it's kinda weird that you put the half shell on the piece of bread.
garlic noodles.author: Meshell C.
garlic noodles.review:
I've been here enough times to know that the quality has certainly gone WAY DOWN HILL.  For the price I'm paying for a frozen crab, I am certainly not coming back to this.  

Let's just say the place just isn't what it use to be.  I felt like I was eating at a banquet where the food feels like it just came off the assembly line, not cooked to perfection, but cooked for mass production.  The garlic noodles was nothing special and it wasn't even garlicy enough.  The appetizer mussels were ok, but it's kinda weird that you put the half shell on the piece of bread.  Not the best of presentation.  

Bottom line: I'll PASS. I DO NOT recommend.

excerpts: The best garlic noodles ever.
Atmosphere is bustling with people enjoying each others company and the meals will have you coming back for more.
You won't be disappointed...
garlic noodles.author: Judson F.
garlic noodles.review: The best garlic noodles ever. Atmosphere is bustling with people enjoying each others company and the meals will have you coming back for more. You won't be disappointed...

excerpts: The crab and garlic noodles changed his whole perspective on seafood and when I found out that Thanh Long was actually the original establishment, you bet I was excited to check this place out first.
Garlic Noodles - [http://s3yelp1-a.akamaihd.net/bphoto/QORekDXzM0tSCTw58gj9FA/l.jpg]
After taking the first bite, my mouth salivated for more!
Hands down, the best garlic noodles I've ever had.
It was so good
, I devoured the first place (which I was sharing with my girlfriend) and had to call in for seconds!
It was thattt good.
garlic noodles.author: Albert L.
garlic noodles.review:
The hype is true.

So, my boss told me that he went to Crustacean's on Polk and had a unbelievable experience there. The crab and garlic noodles changed his whole perspective on seafood and when I found out that Thanh Long was actually the original establishment, you bet I was excited to check this place out first. 

To be on the safe side, I wanted to make reservations. There wasn't any OpenTable option (damn, no points) so had to call in after 2:30PM to confirm (and reservations are a must!).

Anyways, on to the food: 

Salt & Pepper Calamari - [http://s3yelp2-a.akamaihd.net/bphoto/no1TYaWrdFk5yVshdo3Uvg/l.jpg]
I.. definitely had better, much better. This was pretty mediocre, especially since it was our first dish and there was much praise from the Rising/Green Dragon restaurant. It tasted overcooked, under seasoned (ironic how it's called Salt & Pepper calamari..), and chewy.. in a negative way. Yeah.. I still ate it anyways, but it was out of hungry (and my Chinese blood will not allow me to waste food).

Asian Bouillabaisse soup - [http://s3yelp3-a.akamaihd.net/bphoto/f0y0v-Gcch7aYUPq_G94Zg/l.jpg]
This was a very interesting item to tangle. I ordered this for my girlfriend because she was feeling under the weather. I also had some for myself and well, among all the different soups I've drank before, this one was.. unique. It had the characteristics of a tomato soup, packed with hearty pieces of shrimp, and with an overwhelming sweetness due to the chunks of pineapple. The concoction did blend well, but personally, I don't like my food sweet-tasting.

Original Roasted Crab - [http://s3yelp3-a.akamaihd.net/bphoto/Zp98Zwn0ERFIwck6PkwMCQ/l.jpg]
At last, the moment we've been waiting for! Our crab was beautiful; all buttered up and peppered to perfection! Keep in mind that TL doesn't take it easy on the butter now. All I can say is, the crab was delicious! Oh, and be prepared to get ridiculously messy!

Garlic Noodles - [http://s3yelp1-a.akamaihd.net/bphoto/QORekDXzM0tSCTw58gj9FA/l.jpg]
After taking the first bite, my mouth salivated for more! Hands down, the best garlic noodles I've ever had. It was so good, I devoured the first place (which I was sharing with my girlfriend) and had to call in for seconds! It was thattt good. Just keep in mind that you gottaaa eat it while it's still hot and fresh.

Old-fashioned Banana Cake - [http://s3yelp1-a.akamaihd.net/bphoto/KMontrvWMCv4VSkrDRBLWA/l.jpg]
It was a nice warm and chewy contrast to end our meal. It was heavy, for I was already stuffed, but still nice. I only recommend that TL consider serving coconut ice cream, rather than the standard vanilla, but that's just me.


So in the end, my boss was right. It was an impeccable service and experience! (I had all forgotten about the sub-par calamari after sinking into the crab.) All the food came within a ten minute difference from one another, our glasses were never empty, and my favorite part was the hot towel service -- very refreshing and cleansing! (How come other pig-out spots don't offer this!? A tiny paper wet-nap ain't gonna do nothing!)

FYI: the seasonal price for the roasted crab was 38.95, which is a tad more pricey than other restaurants, but well worth it.

excerpts:
[ 
-Our go to dishes: Mango Salad, Salt and Pepper Calamari, Garlic Noodles, and Roast Crab.
Sure, other things look tasty on the menu, but these are so good that I refuse to waver!
We did try the drunken crab once, but the roast crab wins hands down.
-The Lava cake is to DIE for!
Amazing!!!
I also tried the Irish Coffee, but meh..
garlic noodles.author: Debbie T.
garlic noodles.review:
I only come here for "special" occasions with the bf. So..this means:

-We share an entire bottle of sparkling wine. Yep, we'll finish the whole bottle. Champagnes are for snobs..or really pretty people who have lots of money. =[ 
-Our go to dishes: Mango Salad, Salt and Pepper Calamari, Garlic Noodles, and Roast Crab. Sure, other things look tasty on the menu, but these are so good that I refuse to waver! We did try the drunken crab once, but the roast crab wins hands down. 
-The Lava cake is to DIE for! Amazing!!! I also tried the Irish Coffee, but meh..I rather just stick with my sparkling wine and Lava Cake. 

With tip, I say our meal averages at least $150-200, depending on the bottle of wine and market price of the crab. Very expensive for cheapies like us, but every once in awhile, we like to spoil ourselves and eat ramen for the rest of the month.

excerpts: Best dungeness crab and garlic noodles!
garlic noodles.author: Allyson H.
garlic noodles.review: Best dungeness crab and garlic noodles!

excerpts: We always order the Roasted Crab (whole dungeness crab roasted with garlic butter sauce and secret spices), garlic noodles, and seasonal vegetable saute.
garlic noodles.author: G M.
garlic noodles.review:
They have great roasted crab! 

We always order the Roasted Crab (whole dungeness crab roasted with garlic butter sauce and secret spices), garlic noodles, and seasonal vegetable saute.

Unfortunately the noodles are sometimes too soft and the crab isn't always fresh.  One time I received a crab that had mushy meat. The crab was replaced but the waiter questioned me (come on, I know my crabmeat!).  Other times I've had crab on the fishy side and not sweet. This is why we always order more than one crab.

Tips: 
* Order some hot tea to counteract all the butter
* Come early to find parking or use their valet (they won't seat the party until everyone has arrived

excerpts: Great ambiance (not too loud and smells good), amazing garlic noodles (best out of the three location) really awesome servers (attentive and responsive).
The crab they serve here isn't as great as PPQ or Crustaceans but the garlic noodles definitely makes up for it.
garlic noodles.author: Moses S.
garlic noodles.review:
My wife loves vietnamese style crab. We consistently rotate between Thanh Long, Crustaceans, PPQ. 

All three have pros and cons but I am here to write about Thanh Long :). Great ambiance (not too loud and smells good), amazing garlic noodles (best out of the three location) really awesome servers (attentive and responsive). 

The crab they serve here isn't as great as PPQ or Crustaceans but the garlic noodles definitely makes up for it.

excerpts: I had the Tiger Prawns with Garlic Noodles.
I haven't really had garlic noodles before
so I can't really compare if I have had better, but
what I can say this was the best great tasting dish ever!
There were 4 prawns and jumbo sized too!
When served it is basically on a bed of noodles, a good amount of food!
Everything was perfectly cooked.
garlic noodles.author: Katrina T.
garlic noodles.review:
YUMMM. This place is like half fancy half not. It is an upscale Vietnamese restaurant. Be prepared to drop loads! 

My housemate had her birthday dinner here and I am so glad she picked this place! It was pretty packed so she made reservations. Just a heads up, the food comes out really quickly. I had the Tiger Prawns with Garlic Noodles. I haven't really had garlic noodles before so I can't really compare if I have had better, but what I can say this was the best great tasting dish ever! There were 4 prawns and jumbo sized too! When served it is basically on a bed of noodles, a good amount of food! Everything was perfectly cooked. The food wasn't too garlic-y or anything, it was a good amount. 

My friends got the shaking beef and that was tender and chewy! I wanted to try the crab but it looked to messy. Maybe next time? Guess I have to come back! I'm going to bring my parents next time since I think they would definitely love this place.

excerpts: Garlic Noodles (good, but
could've been more garlicky)
My favorite dishes were the shaken beef and garlic noodles, but this restaurant is worth a try for the crab.
We paid $57pp including tax and tip, which isn't bad at all, but we didn't get that much crab.
garlic noodles.author: Amy D.
garlic noodles.review:
Came in a group of 6 on a Saturday night, so we got to try a lot of dishes. Making reservations is definitely recommended, and parking in this area is tough- the $10 for valet is well spent. 

Ordered-
Salt & Pepper Calamari (nice and peppery, but calamari could've been a bit more crisp)
Dungeness Crab Puffs (good, but def not authentic)
Seafood Dumplings (only ok and 5 pieces- wouldn't recommend for the price)
Crispy Rice Paper Roll (too dry for me, I wouldn't order this again)
Curry Lotus Prawns (good taste but the "jumbo prawns" were teeny!)
Shaken Beef (really good flavor, imo better than at the Slanted Door and cheaper. however, they mix in potatoes pieces to trick you into thinking there is more meat)
Roast Crab (good, but wasn't super flavorful)
Tamarind Crab (wasn't very flavorful, but both crabs were cooked perfectly)
Garlic Noodles (good, but could've been more garlicky)
Fried Rice with Shrimp (your standard fried rice, I wouldn't order again)
Fried Banana & Fried Ice Cream (both were good but I like the banana a lot more)

Overall, the dinner was good, but not amazing. I actually liked the crab I ordered at Three Seasons better (taste wise). My favorite dishes were the shaken beef and garlic noodles, but this restaurant is worth a try for the crab. We paid $57pp including tax and tip, which isn't bad at all, but we didn't get that much crab.

excerpts: The must order is the Dungeness Roasted Crab and to complement it, I highly recommend the garlic noodles.
Also this time I added a seasonal sautéed vegetable dish which had green beans, mushrooms, shitake mushroom, tomatoes and onions
I hope I am not forgetting any other vegetables
but it was a great combination.
garlic noodles.author: Cheryl S.
garlic noodles.review:
I have tried all their other locations (even when they had their Vegas restaurant) and this was the last one to make my list complete.  whoohooo!
 
The food here was delish and as always will surely make your tummy happy.  The must order is the Dungeness Roasted Crab and to complement it, I highly recommend the garlic noodles. Also this time I added a seasonal sautéed vegetable dish which had green beans, mushrooms, shitake mushroom, tomatoes and onions I hope I am not forgetting any other vegetables but it was a great combination.  The three dishes were shared between my husband and I and it was just the right amount.  

Note: they will put plastic bib on you, but don't be offended yes it's a fashion no-no but it is all soooo necessary.  It does get a bit messy but that's the fun of it.  It's like an experience.  Just go with the flow.

After our wonderful meal I had to order dessert but to my disappointment (short lived) they were out of the orange sorbet so I opted for the deep fried bananas.  It wasn't as good as I was expecting maybe I am sort of biased as I really had my heart set on the orange sorbet.  Our other guests also tried the crème brulee which was good and the banana cake was interesting.  

Overall, I really enjoyed our meal and the service is excellent.  I highly recommend this place if you are wanting a great crab meal with a casual atmosphere.

excerpts: The crab and garlic noodles is a must - it would be my death row last meal.
I try other items like the calamari, and the fish.
They are good, but not like the crab and garlic noodles.
The creme brulee and signature drinks should not be missed either.
I like that it's casual in dress and atmosphere.
garlic noodles.author: Jen W.
garlic noodles.review: This is my favorite restaurant! I go here once a year as it is a bit pricey. The crab and garlic noodles is a must - it would be my death row last meal. I try other items like the calamari, and the fish. They are good, but not like the crab and garlic noodles. The creme brulee and signature drinks should not be missed either. I like that it's casual in dress and atmosphere.

excerpts: The garlic noodles are often ordered and they are good but a little goes a long way, in my opinion.
I'd say that one order of garlic noodles for every 4 people.
garlic noodles.author: Vangie G.
garlic noodles.review:
OMG.  I can't believe that I have not added my kudos for this restaurant!  If you love crab, you HAVE to come here at least once.  Although on the spendy side, I have seen many a family here with small kids which I think says a lot!  I cannot tell you how much I love the crab here....my mouth waters just thinking about it and I crave a visit whenever I am in the bay area.

My recommendation is that each person get their own crab.  The roasted crab is truthfully finger-licking good and I had made the mistake of sharing a crab with my husband the first time I ate here.  

The garlic noodles are often ordered and they are good but a little goes a long way, in my opinion.  I'd say that one order of garlic noodles for every 4 people.

Another hint if you are not big on crowds, looking for parking, and waiting a long time is to go early (when they open for dinner) or make the reservation for early in the night.

excerpts: Garlic noodles are fine and garlic rice is just as good, not sure why it doesn't get any shine.
But chicken and beef dishes?
eh.
Skip.
The five spice chicken was so blah.
And not worth the price tag.
garlic noodles.author: Augusto M.
garlic noodles.review:
$40 for a crab?! Yeah probably worth it.

Everything else? Not worth it. Garlic noodles are fine and garlic rice is just as good, not sure why it doesn't get any shine. But chicken and beef dishes? eh. Skip. The five spice chicken was so blah. And not worth the price tag.

excerpts:
What we ordered:
Garlic noodles
Crab
The garlic noodles are bomb.com.org!!!
The noodles are full of flavor.
You may want to order your own garlic noodles, because that is how good it was.
The crab was sold at market price and it was worth every penny.
We don't have crab often and this was the best crab we've had in a long time.
The crab and noodles was good enough for the both of us.
We were very happy with what we ordered.
You won't go wrong with the garlic noodles or crab.
garlic noodles.author: Roray S.
garlic noodles.review:
What we ordered:
Garlic noodles
Crab

The garlic noodles are bomb.com.org!!! The noodles are full of flavor. You may want to order your own garlic noodles, because that is how good it was. The crab was sold at market price and it was worth every penny. We don't have crab often and this was the best crab we've had in a long time. The crab and noodles was good enough for the both of us. We were very happy with what we ordered. You won't go wrong with the garlic noodles or crab. 

Service: 
I got reservations and we were seated immediately. Our waitress was very nice. She was knowledgeable about the dishes. It didn't take long for us to get our food and that was a good thing because we were hungry. 

*We recommended you get reservations.

excerpts: Garlic noodles and crabs.
garlic noodles.author: Anne Marie S.
garlic noodles.review:
Garlic noodles and crabs.

What else needs to be said. I have got to go back. It's a small little dive and arn't those the best places. It was packed beyond belief but well worth the drive. 

yummy yummy yummy

excerpts: Roast Crab and garlic noodles is a perfect combo.
garlic noodles.author: Arielle D.
garlic noodles.review: It's expensive but you get what you pay for. The food is astounding! Everything we ordered was delicious. This is my go to place in SF for delicious crab  and vietnamese food. I love seafood so I'm a fan of their roast crab, so buttery and tasty. The mixture of pepper, garlic and butter is so perfect. Roast Crab and garlic noodles is a perfect combo. The shaken beef was delicious as well. The chunks of beef were so tender. Make sure to make a reservation. The wait can get long around dinner time. Good customer service. I can't wait to go back.

excerpts: the only thing that's great was the garlic noodles.
Everything else is just blah.
My brother can make better crab than them.
$135 (not including tips) for 2 people is ridiculous!
$50 for a bland piece of crab?
that's fucking insane!
will not come or recommend this place.
garlic noodles.author: Kathy P.
garlic noodles.review: Took my mom here for her birthday. We were both very disappointed. Not sure why this place is popular. the only thing that's great was the garlic noodles. Everything else is just blah. My brother can make better crab than them. $135 (not including tips) for 2 people is ridiculous! $50 for a bland piece of crab? that's fucking insane! will not come or recommend this place.

excerpts: As far as the garlic noodles, I have to rank Crustacean's as the best, PPQ in second and Thanh Long 3rd.
garlic noodles.author: Danielle G.
garlic noodles.review:
I was finally able to knock this off my bookmarks list. We came on Jan 1 and the wait for a table of 6 was 30-45. I think if I would have had Thanh Long prior to PPQ and Crustacean I would be much more impressed. But I can't help but make comparisons. 

PPQ has the best value for the food. Thanh Long is definitely cheaper than Crustacean, but by no means a casual dining option. The roasted crab runs at market price and happened to be $40 on this particular night. 

As far as the garlic noodles, I have to rank Crustacean's as the best, PPQ in second and Thanh Long 3rd. However, that being said, all three are fantastic and worth a try.

Crustacean obviously wins in the ambiance category, but Thanh Long is a very nice, quaint place. I like that Thanh Long impresses and is appropriate from anything from a romantic date to a fun family dinner.  

Enough comparisons, let's talk about Thanh Long's food. The mango salad was a nice surprise. It was warm and I wasn't sure what to think about that, but it was good. Salt and pepper calamari was good, but kind of a dish you can find at many other restaurants. The spicy eggplant dish had good flavor and lots of vegetables. We had chicken fried rice (mostly for the baby) which was your typical chicken fried rice. The shaken beef was a definite stand out dish. It was super tender and the flavor was wonderful.

My only gripe about the crab was they didn't leave the shell with all the juices and good stuff. The shell was turned over and we had to dig around to find some fat (which of course is one of the best parts!).

By the way, skip the drinks here. They come in tiny glasses that are much overpriced. 

All in all I will probably stick with PPQ as my go to, but Thanh Long is definitely a good option for a special occasion.

excerpts: We all ordered Dungeness Crab and a side of garlic noodles and fried rice.
The food couldnt have been served fast enough, and the servers were very polite and extremely attentive.
garlic noodles.author: Gabriela L.
garlic noodles.review:
Came here this past weekend with my boyfriend and some family. It was my first time and not the last! I was really satisfied with the overall service and dishes. We all ordered Dungeness Crab and a side of garlic noodles and fried rice. The food couldnt have been served fast enough, and the servers were very polite and extremely attentive. Safe to say, this is best crab I've ever had.

The only downside are the prices. They are a bit expsensive, but everything was fully worth it! Will be coming back.

excerpts: We ordered fried calamari, tea, drunken crab, and garlic noodles.
Our tea came out first, which I apparently frown upon on.
Just tea leaves in boiling water for $4.95?
Are you kidding me?
It's nothing special...
, I'd just stick with water.
Calamari was good but it didn't have any dipping sauce.
Garlic noodles is really good
but I recommend you to eat it while it's hot because when it's cold, it doesn't taste good anymore.
Finally, behold, the moment we've been waiting for.... CRAB!!!!! It's super fresh like it just got caught from the ocean.
It has a good amount of flavor in the crab as well.
I have no complaints except that I wanted more!
Eating the crab + garlic noodles = satisfying.
garlic noodles.author: Arvin C.
garlic noodles.review:
Came here straight from San Jose. In San Jose, it was like ~80 degrees while here was about ~60 degrees. About a 20 degree drop... Boy was I freezing! I wasn't going to do valet because I don't like strangers driving my car. I circled around the neighborhood and finally found a spot several blocks away. On the outside, it looked like a ghetto Vietnamese shack, but I was wrong. Inside looked like a high class American restaurant. We got seated promptly. No wait, no gimmick... We just sat down and got handed the menus. 

We ordered fried calamari, tea, drunken crab, and garlic noodles. Our tea came out first, which I apparently frown upon on. Just tea leaves in boiling water for $4.95? Are you kidding me? It's nothing special..., I'd just stick with water. Calamari was good but it didn't have any dipping sauce. Garlic noodles is really good but I recommend you to eat it while it's hot because when it's cold, it doesn't taste good anymore. Finally, behold, the moment we've been waiting for.... CRAB!!!!! It's super fresh like it just got caught from the ocean. It has a good amount of flavor in the crab as well. I have no complaints except that I wanted more! Eating the crab + garlic noodles = satisfying. I love it.

The service here is far superb. Your water will never be empty, your crab shell bowls will never be filled to the top, you will never have trash on your table. This is what I call service. You get a bib, generous amount of napkins,  a cracker, several forks. 

All in all, I had a great experience here. Would I be coming back here again? YES! 
This place does get pricey though so be prepared to spend about $40/person. It costs $39.99 for one crab!

excerpts: The crab and garlic noodles were really delicious.
Very quick service and really good food.
garlic noodles.author: Margaret L.
garlic noodles.review: The crab and garlic noodles were really delicious. Very quick service and really good food.

excerpts: Garlic noodles were cold.
Wasn't as good as the last few times
I've been there.
garlic noodles.author: Rebecca M.
garlic noodles.review: Calamari was ok, Shaken beef and crab were good. Garlic noodles were cold. Wasn't as good as the last few times I've been there.

excerpts: We got the roasted crab as well as crab wontons, as well as garlic noodles and shaken beef.
(Why not stick with what the place is known for).
My view is that this place is definitely worth going for but best to stick with their specialities given the pricing - crab and garlic noodles.
If you want to get other things on the menu, there are cheaper equivalent options elsewhere.
garlic noodles.author: Harper B.
garlic noodles.review:
Fine - I'm hopping on the bandwagon here.

Read reviews before coming and my opinion is simple:  The prices are high, but the food is worth it - I wouldn't hesitate going again.

We got the roasted crab as well as crab wontons, as well as garlic noodles and shaken beef.  (Why not stick with what the place is known for).  All of the food was delicious, particularly the noodles and crab.

Service was prompt and friendly - no issues there.  They also had our reservation and immediately seated us upon arrival.

My view is that this place is definitely worth going for but best to stick with their specialities given the pricing - crab and garlic noodles.  If you want to get other things on the menu, there are cheaper equivalent options elsewhere.

excerpts:
We had the:

Salt and Pepper Calamari: Pretty good
Prawn Wontons: Pretty good
Garlic Noodles: Very good (egg noodles)
Villager's Favorite (Pacific prawns and pork medallions simmered in a caramelized reduction of soy and herbs): I wasn't crazy about the pork but the prawns were good and the sauce tasted amazing, especially with the garlic noodles
garlic noodles.author: Sonya Z.
garlic noodles.review:
Wow, everything on this menu is very eye catching. 

The food was good but not incredible - I would love to come back and try every single dish. 

We had the:

Salt and Pepper Calamari: Pretty good
Prawn Wontons: Pretty good
Garlic Noodles: Very good (egg noodles)
Villager's Favorite (Pacific prawns and pork medallions simmered in a caramelized reduction of soy and herbs): I wasn't crazy about the pork but the prawns were good and the sauce tasted amazing, especially with the garlic noodles

Would appreciate a slightly larger wine selection! The service is white napkin and very nice. We got seated quickly for a table of two on a Sunday night. 

There is valet parking for $12 or you can look around the neighborhood - the block the restaurant is on was packed, but we found a spot across from the 7-11 that's on the opposite corner.

excerpts: Every table was the same -- garlic noodles and roasted crab.
Then the real bomb -- the garlic noodles.
They are simple, I could totally make this at home, but OMG they are awesome!
With tip, dinner for two where we shared a mango salad, split an order of garlic noodles, and had only one crab between us with a bottle of wine was $175 with tip.
Ouch!
My wallet stings a bit.
I can buy 6 crabs this size for $50 off a boat in Pillar Point Harbor, the noodles cost next to zero and the salad was simple enough.
Honestly, this can't be a regular place at this price.
Come to think of it, the company I kept this night may have been the best part, but Ann is like that.
Bottom line:  garlic noodles with crab and sauvignon blanc
, it's all good.
Bring your big fat wallet, cuz you're gonna need it.
garlic noodles.author: Shaun H.
garlic noodles.review:
Why did it take me so long to try this place?  For a few years we have missed opportunities to try Thanh Long.  We have a friend who raves about it, but somehow we never made it.  I finally tried Thanh Long last weekend with our friend, and now I understand why she speaks so highly of this restaurant.  I am also regretting that I could have been there a few more times by now instead of just once.

Last Saturday we had a late dinner.  Driving to the restaurant my friend warned me that we would probably have to wait awhile for a table.  I don't mind waiting if the food is good.  However when we arrived we were seated immediately.  It was late, maybe 9:00PM on a Saturday, so if you can wait for a late dinner this may be the time to come.

Looking at the other tables, it was easy to see what to order.  Every table was the same -- garlic noodles and roasted crab.  We started with a mango salad, which was totally yum.  Then the real bomb -- the garlic noodles.  They are simple, I could totally make this at home, but OMG they are awesome!  We also split a roast dungeness crab, another dish that I frequently make when crab is in season, but sometimes it is nice to sit down and enjoy a good meal without having to cook it.

For the meal we ordered, the Duckhorn Sauvignon Blanc which turned out to be a PERFECT PAIRING to our food.  I was proud of myself for going past the rather large Chardonnay selection on the wine list.  I think  the buttery flavor of a California Cardonnay would have been in competition with the other flavors on the table, so I wonder why they had so many on the list?  A white with a little more acidity and fruit was just the ticket.  I had only tried Duckhorn's reds prior to this evening, but I must say the Sauvignon Blanc was remarkable and I will seek out a bottle for home next time I am serving crab.  I usually go for Voigner with shellfish, but they didn't have one to offer...why?  You are  a classy restaurant, get your wines sorted please.

I withhold the fifth star because I'm not that easy.  Thanh Long was a great meal and I will definitely take my wife here when she gets back in town, but it is really priced high.
