With tip, dinner for two where we shared a mango salad, split an order of garlic noodles, and had only one crab between us with a bottle of wine was $175 with tip.  Ouch!  My wallet stings a bit.  I can buy 6 crabs this size for $50 off a boat in Pillar Point Harbor, the noodles cost next to zero and the salad was simple enough.  Honestly, this can't be a regular place at this price.  Come to think of it, the company I kept this night may have been the best part, but Ann is like that.  I am lucky to have her as a friend.

Bottom line:  garlic noodles with crab and sauvignon blanc, it's all good.  Bring your big fat wallet, cuz you're gonna need it.

excerpts: My sister was charged over 50 dollars for crab ,and I was charged over 38 for garlic noodles with prawns.
My food tasted like they didn't clean the prawns and her crab
lack any seasoning .
I will not be back with prices that high
and you feeling that they don't value your business .
One person in our party ask if they could crack her crab and she was told " we don't do that here " very rudely .  Not worth the trip if you live outside of SF.
garlic noodles.author: Sabrina L.
garlic noodles.review: I went to this place for a birthday dinner with family.  The place is nice inside but, the parking is horrible .  They charge 12 dollars for valet and the staff aren't that friendly.  I found this place to be very average and not worth the money they charge.  My sister was charged over 50 dollars for crab ,and I was charged over 38 for garlic noodles with prawns.  My food tasted like they didn't clean the prawns and her crab lack any seasoning .  I will not be back with prices that high and you feeling that they don't value your business . One person in our party ask if they could crack her crab and she was told " we don't do that here " very rudely .  Not worth the trip if you live outside of SF.

excerpts: My friend has been a few times before and she said the roasted crab and garlic noodles were really good
and she was absolutely right.
There are so many things are the menu to choose from
but I had to go with the standbys
The garlic noodles are ridiculous.
They aren't oily at all, they are just infused with garlic from God.
garlic noodles.author: Stephanie H.
garlic noodles.review:
Wow. This is a great find. My friend and I were able to get reservations the same day for 8:15pm on a Friday night. Parking isn't great in the area so do valet.

My friend has been a few times before and she said the roasted crab and garlic noodles were really good and she was absolutely right. There are so many things are the menu to choose from but I had to go with the standbys and that's what most everyone else in the restaurant (which isn't that big) is doing.

The roasted crab was delicious, it was juicy and loaded with basic seasonings- butter and tons of black pepper. Maybe there were other ingredients, I don't know. The garlic noodles are ridiculous. They aren't oily at all, they are just infused with garlic from God. But vampires have no fear, I didn't find the garlic to be over-powering.

I plan to go back and try other things on the menu. We had the spring rolls for an appetizer which were fine, but not as memorable as the crab and noodles.

Reservations are strongly suggested.

excerpts: I also had the prawns, wait, that's being generous, one HUGE prawn split in half and grilled, served over garlic noodles.
, it's FOUR SMALL SHRIMP on a bed of garlic noodles.
With "secret spices".
garlic noodles.author: Rob C.
garlic noodles.review:
I have no idea why this place is so popular.

I went there about 10 years ago, and thought their crab expensive, about $25 for one crab, which we ordered several of and shared. I also had the prawns, wait, that's being generous, one HUGE prawn split in half and grilled, served over garlic noodles. But $25 for ONE PRAWN?!

Well I went there again against my better judgement on Saturday night and the food is not any better, but it's much more expensive. I cannot believe the pricing.

$42 for ONE CRAB. Yes, it's got some "secret spices" on it, so what? I can get better fresh crab in many Chinese restaurants for half the price. For that kind of money I expect live lobster.

$37 for FOUR SMALL SHRIMP. It's not even one huge "how did they even find a prawn this big?" prawn anymore, it's FOUR SMALL SHRIMP on a bed of garlic noodles. With "secret spices". The real secret is that they're laughing all the way to the bank getting people to pay this kind of money for something that should be $12.

The place has gone upscale, with fancy expensive mixed drinks, and better decor, but you pay for it.

Then there was the service. Constant, polite attention, but always a feeling of being rushed so they could get the next seating in. When I ordered the vegetable soup with seafood wontons (btw the best thing we had), I asked to split it with my dinner partner. Not only did the waiter forget to bring a bowl, but he brought the soup AT THE SAME TIME as all the entrees! Who does that? Who in their right mind brings soup at the same time as entrees? Someone who wants cold entrees, that's who. I asked him to bring my entree back because it was going to get cold, and he said he'd have the kitchen make another one, but he was a liar, and just put it under the lights. It was drying out when it came back.

The prawns were extremely average (and overcooked having sat under the lights while I enjoyed my soup), the crab a PITA to shell, Dungeness always is, so much work for so little meat. If you really want good crab order fresh King Crab legs from many places in Alaska and have them overnighted once crab season opens, you'll enjoy tender succulent huge sausages of meat that don't need "secret spices." Or anything, you just eat them.

I was disappointed that the prawns had shrunk, and the noodles are fine, but if you really want noodles go to a good Italian place, they do them better.

Dessert was a lemon sorbet with cream inside a hollowed out lemon. A for presentation, but they should just skip the cream. Either make ice cream or sorbet, but the mixing of the two is an unhappy marriage.

I literally have no idea why this place is popular, and how they can get away with charging what they do. The food is average at absolute best, and the pricing is ridiculous.

excerpts: I tried the roasted crab, garlic noodles, shaken beef, fried rice, and vegetarian delight.
Everything just seemed so average, nothing special.
The crab was tasty, but because the shells weren't cracked, I had to work hard to get the meat out.
The garlic noodles were kind of dry, and the shaken beef was pretty tough.
I'm glad I tried this place out, but I probably won't be eating here again.
The garlic noodles were kind of dry, and the shaken beef was pretty tough.
I'm glad I tried this place out, but I probably won't be eating here again.
garlic noodles.author: Rachel H.
garlic noodles.review: I know I'm in the minority, but I really don't get what the hype is about. I think this place is overrated. I tried the roasted crab, garlic noodles, shaken beef, fried rice, and vegetarian delight. Everything just seemed so average, nothing special. The crab was tasty, but because the shells weren't cracked, I had to work hard to get the meat out. The garlic noodles were kind of dry, and the shaken beef was pretty tough. I'm glad I tried this place out, but I probably won't be eating here again.

excerpts: The sauce it was in wasn't too heavy, which i liked, and tasted good with the garlic noodles.
Garlic noodles:
garlic noodles.author: Michelle L.
garlic noodles.review:
OMG I love Thanh Long.

Came here with my friend on a Thursday around 6:00 and the place was relatively empty. However, as our dinner progressed the restaurant started filling up with people. 

We ordered:

Roast crab: SO GOOD. I don't understand how they get the garlic flavor infused into the crab meat... but whatever they do it tastes delicious. I've had the drunken crab here before too, but i think I prefer the garlicky flavor of the roast crab more.

Saigon beef: This was surprisingly good. The beef cubes were tender, and not at all chewy. The sauce it was in wasn't too heavy, which i liked, and tasted good with the garlic noodles.

Garlic noodles: Definitely need to order this with the roast crab.

Between the two of us we finished almost everything, but had some noodles and a couple crab legs leftover.

Overall had a great experience at Thanh Long, and will probably come back again.

excerpts: Garlic noodles
: I liked these, but they have been a bit dry for me?
garlic noodles.author: Monika-Bianca T.
garlic noodles.review:
Come here please.

The food: 5/5 - As a tourist visiting with my boyfriend, this place came up as a highly recommended not only by fellow yelpers, but from friends as well. Bejeezus... so good.

Roasted dungeness crab: Simple, but fantastic. It's so meaty, and the seasoning just topped it off with every bite. You'll have lotsa of fun scouring for the meat, and every bite will motivate you to keep at the cracking,  digging, and picking for even the tiniest bits and pieces between the shell :)

Shaken beef: wowowoowwoow such incredibly soft beef that it was amazing how soft it was the next day after it had been microwaved (yup all 3 dishes for 2 people can be a bit much haha). I especially enjoyed the fact that it had been served with a side of spring mix and tomatoes + potatoes which lightened up the entire dish and kept it level in all aspects of taste. 

Garlic noodles: I liked these, but they have been a bit dry for me? Not something I'd recommend ordering as a dish on its own, but to eat betweem bites of other mains like we did during our meal :)

Cost: 4/5 - you're going to have to expect to pay a premium here for not only their food but there service as well which was some of the best service I've had while visiting SF.

The service: 5.5/5 - (that score is not a mistake, the service here is that good) With a restaurant as packed as this was, we were still greeted with a smile by the front of house and quickly granted a seat for the two of us. Afterwards we were promptly attended too by a waiter who quickly took our order of drinks while we browsed the menu. We were able to flag him down as soon as we made up our and then barely into a full conversation with my boyfriend, all 3 dishes mentioned above appeared at our table! It was also very kind of our waiter to tie the plastic bibs around our neck as well. I found that I was never out of water, and that there was always a fresh bowl to be used to discard our shells. Empty plates were taken before we knew it and it was great that they had provided a personal shell cracker for each seat at the table already. The staff here is well trained and in numbers that are able to attend to all the patrons of the restaurant while providing a delightful experience where we didn't have to "understand" how busy they were. True class.

The ambience: 4/5 - Your typical family run asian restaurant! A welcoming place for families and adults alike. Sure the place can be renovated to feel more modern (feels alittle old), but as it stands right now, it's completely fine the way it is :)

If you would like to splurge on good eats, here is the place to do it.

excerpts: Our dinner consisted of one of each of the soups, salt and pepper calamari, collasal tiger prawns over garlic noodles, lemongrass chicken, vegetarian entree, chicken fried rice, and an extra order of garlic noodles.

The salt and pepper calamari was good as well, served sizzling hot, with a good combination of salt AND pepper, but for a couple of the outlying pieces, there was definitely a lot more salt than pepper.
The main dish I liked the most was the collasal tigerl prawns over garlic noodles.
The noodles were seasoned to perfection and it got my whole family scooping for more.
The prawns were pretty good as well, although I could definitely taste the layer of butter in between those suckers.
However, I'm not too sure how to justify 4 pieces of prawn over a bed of garlic noodles for 37 bucks.
garlic noodles.author: Ada C.
garlic noodles.review:
Mixed feelings about Thanh Long, after reading all the awesome reviews about this place, I had high expectations as I made reservations for a party of 5 on a Friday night. 

Upon arrival, we were immediately greeted and seated. Customer service was pretty on point, the waiter was friendly and attentive. He memorized our order (which was quite a few items) without writing it down, but sadly forgot one of the appetizers. All good, since I'm sure we over ordered anyways.

Our dinner consisted of one of each of the soups, salt and pepper calamari, collasal tiger prawns over garlic noodles, lemongrass chicken, vegetarian entree, chicken fried rice, and an extra order of garlic noodles. Although the serving size wasn't as big as we had pictured, this was more than enough for the 5 of us, so in retrospect, the serving size was pretty decent.

Out of all the soups, we all voted that the vegetarian soup was the best. Something about the clear broth and the assorted veggies just made it more refreshing versus the creamy aspargus chowder or the chicken vermecelli soup.

The salt and pepper calamari was good as well, served sizzling hot, with a good combination of salt AND pepper, but for a couple of the outlying pieces, there was definitely a lot more salt than pepper. 

As for the entrees, it was pretty mediocre, not fabulous, but not disgusting or unedible. There was just nothing outstanding about the meal. The main dish I liked the most was the collasal tigerl prawns over garlic noodles. The noodles were seasoned to perfection and it got my whole family scooping for more. The prawns were pretty good as well, although I could definitely taste the layer of butter in between those suckers. However, I'm not too sure how to justify 4 pieces of prawn over a bed of garlic noodles for 37 bucks. Seems a little bit outrageous.. pretentious to some.

Again, like I said, the meal wasn't bad, but for the price of the dishes, I was expecting something more amazing. Overall, a good dining experience, food was pretty good, glad I tried it once, but nothing coaxing me to be back for another round.

excerpts: Garlic noodles.
garlic noodles.author: Justin S.
garlic noodles.review:
Roasted crab.
Drunken crab.
Garlic noodles.

Some of the best crab in the city with excellent service. Parking is super easy because you must use the Valet or circle for 45 minutes looking; this is the Outer Sunset son.

Extremely messy but worth the work. From this day forward when a tourist ask, "Where can I get crab?" Thanh Long is the answer.

excerpts: The garlic noodles are tasty but with crab in garlic sauce after awhile, it becomes a single monotonous note.
As someone mentioned in their review, white rice probably pairs better with the crab.
garlic noodles.author: James L.
garlic noodles.review:
If you don't normally eat crab, I can see how this place is potentially delicious to you but getting a similar quality from any Asian market in Garden Grove for cheaper makes it seem not worth getting a crab here (only doused in garlic). We also tried the stuffed calamari but it was meh.

The garlic noodles are tasty but with crab in garlic sauce after awhile, it becomes a single monotonous note. As someone mentioned in their review, white rice probably pairs better with the crab. But yes, eater beware- garlic burps to ensue.

Great service, good ambiance, but the food is not compelling enough for me to want to be a must go to spot when I'm in SF.

excerpts: The Garlic Noodles here were on the softer side compared to PPQ, and I really prefer a nice firm al dente noodle with a bit of a chew to it.
garlic noodles.author: Jeanne L.
garlic noodles.review:
Versus PPQ, the other dungeness crab powerhouse of SF, this place loses for both taste and price... for all dishes.

We ordered the Roasted Crab, Drunken Crab, and the Tamarind Crab.  The latter was definitely my favorite for it's very unique sweet tangy flavor. The flavoring of the Roasted crab was somewhat more oily and not as flavorful/garlicy as the one from PPQ.  (Most of all, I really missed the incredibly delicious dry flavor of the Peppercorn crab from PPQ.)

The Garlic Noodles here were on the softer side compared to PPQ, and I really prefer a nice firm al dente noodle with a bit of a chew to it.

The Colossal Royal Tiger Prawns were a huge letdown. There were .. 5 or 6 prawns only.

Vegetarian Delight was described as silken tofu sauteed with assorted vegetables and shitake mushrooms.  I know this is a Vietnamese restaurant, but I am really used to eating a Chinese version of this with a crispy-fried tofu.  The tofu was a mushy-soft texture, and the vegetable selection was meager.  The dish size overall was small.  I was not delighted.

$32 per person, group of 9 people.  It was pricey considering how unsatisfied we were for quality/quantity of food.  Sorry, this is what happens when you compare against PPQ.

http://www.yelp.com/biz/ppq-dungeness-island-san-francisco-2#hrid:yChlljno2CCweXgXWfyfpw/src:self

excerpts: The garlic noodles everyone raves about were boring and nothing special.
They are just noodles pan fried with some garlic.
Big Deal!
garlic noodles.author: James H.
garlic noodles.review:
The famous crab was just ok and not that memorable. The garlic noodles everyone raves about were boring and nothing special.  They are just noodles pan fried with some garlic. Big Deal!  Did I mention there were just noodles, nothing else and could barely taste any garlic.  

I also had the sea bass and although it was good, it wasn't like the best I ever had.  On a good note, the service was very good and nice that they had valet parking for $10.  I definitely won't be going back.

These people raving about it must be eating fast food during the week and then had someone treat them here on an expense account because I don't see what the big deal is.

excerpts: The garlic noodles are to die for.
I've NEVER tasted anything better!
garlic noodles.author: Ryan S.
garlic noodles.review:
If you're a crab lover and love garlic, this place is ideal for you. 

The ambiance was a steak-house feel and very clean. 

The garlic noodles are to die for. I've NEVER tasted anything better! The portion size is enough for two people and is tasty with every bite. 

The roasted dungeness crab was "OH SOOOO GOOOD!!!!!" The spices include salt, pepper, and garlic...a perfect combination for crab! The crab was mouth watering delicious! Every bite was filled with heaven (butter)...and it wasn't too "buttery" at all. The best thing I EVER TASTED in my LIFE!!!!!

excerpts: Of course I visited to there in order to eat Roasted Dungeness Crab and Garlic Noodles.
Unfortunately it was against my memory that I got it more than 20 years ago
, they had changed to those of quite disappointing.
Particularly, the Crab was not good.
Garlic Noodles was not too bad.
My memory is not surely, but I have a feeling that about the price was not much different if compared to the past time price.
I might be better to be satisfied with that taste.

Of course I visited to there in order to eat Roasted Dungeness Crab and Garlic Noodles. Unfortunately it was against my memory that I got it more than 20 years ago, they had changed to those of quite disappointing. Particularly, the Crab was not good. Garlic Noodles was not too bad.
My memory is not surely, but I have a feeling that about the price was not much different if compared to the past time price. I might be better to be satisfied with that taste.

excerpts: Their Roast Crab and Garlic Noodles are pretty darn good!
garlic noodles.author: Fenny G.
garlic noodles.review:
Their Roast Crab and Garlic Noodles are pretty darn good! 

Get your fingers greasy and messy otherwise you won't enjoy it! Lick you fingers because no body cares.

Enough said!

excerpts: It's all those damn garlic noodles!
They put crack in them, I swear!
Our party of 7 split 3 crabs and 3 plates of garlic noodles
(one is not a shellfish eater
so she got her own dish).
It was more than enough for us.
Great meal!
garlic noodles.author: Jenny C.
garlic noodles.review: This place smells glorious when you walk in. It's all those damn garlic noodles! They put crack in them, I swear! Our party of 7 split 3 crabs and 3 plates of garlic noodles (one is not a shellfish eater so she got her own dish). It was more than enough for us. Great meal!

excerpts: Mind you, this restaurant is known for their Roast Crab and Garlic Noodles and is often ordered and enjoyed together.
It's almost like a rule on their menu written in invisible ink visible only by black light.
In turn, 9 of 12 people in our party ordered this.
garlic noodles.author: Cat V.
garlic noodles.review:
Definitely coming back!

Came here for a birthday dinner; there were 12 of us.  Not only were they able to accommodate our large party, but they were able to do so with incredible ease and flair.  I was truly impressed.  

They were BUSY on this Friday night.  But delivered such excellent customer service and a memorable dining experience they truly deserve five stars.

We were seated in their dining area upstairs away from the chaos what was downstairs.  Mind you, this restaurant is known for their Roast Crab and Garlic Noodles and is often ordered and enjoyed together.  It's almost like a rule on their menu written in invisible ink visible only by black light.  In turn, 9 of 12 people in our party ordered this.  However, I along with two others heeded elsewhere on the menu.  

I ordered the Vegetarian Delight: silken tofu with veggies and shiitake mushrooms over rice.  Y-U-M-M-M!!!  I could totally throw in a few more M's but I'll spare you the eyesore.  This dish was truly a delight.  Platter presentation was exquisite but the satisfaction came with each bite.  There was adequate amount of tofu and vegetables it was just the right amount of excellence and flavor.

Be sure to call in for reservations to guarantee yourself a table as this place gets packed.

excerpts: Three roasted crabs, 3 orders of garlic noodles, 2 orders of shaken beef and a large order of FOODCOMA!?!?!?!
garlic noodles.author: Patricia G.
garlic noodles.review:
Never a disappointment, EVER.

Kept it simple for a party of 7 last night - dinner for my uncle arriving from the motherland.

Three roasted crabs, 3 orders of garlic noodles, 2 orders of shaken beef and a large order of FOODCOMA!?!?!?!  DE-FREAKING-LICIOUS.

Parking is a royal pain in the ass that's for sure and they rape you for valet ($12).... 

Worth every penny... :)

excerpts: Tiger Prawn Garlic Noodles - Probably the Best Garlic Noodles
I've had so far.
The Tiger Prawns were a great flavor.
garlic noodles.author: Tran T.
garlic noodles.review:
Interior is nice & spacious. Service is good.
Tried:
* Tiger Prawn Garlic Noodles - Probably the Best Garlic Noodles I've had so far. The Tiger Prawns were a great flavor.
* Tamarind Crab - Sauce does not taste like tamarind! It tasted more like tomato. It's good but it should not be called tamarind!
* Roasted Crab - Good
I'm not a fan, but that just me. I'd just rather go out & buy a live crab home & sauce it all up myself! The price here is just too ridiculous. Spent over a hundred dollars just for my boyfriend & I.
FYI, Sodas are NO REFILLS

excerpts: Great food (garlic crab, garlic noodles and coconut shrimp), great atmosphere & service and quick seating with a reservation.
$12 valet parking is almost a necessity due to the scarcity of public parking.
garlic noodles.author: F C.
garlic noodles.review: Great food (garlic crab, garlic noodles and coconut shrimp), great atmosphere & service and quick seating with a reservation. $12 valet parking is almost a necessity due to the scarcity of public parking.

garlic noodles.author: Nic C.
garlic noodles.review:

this is the bomb, the food and the ambiance is EXCELLENT.  The service is EXCELLENT.  Parking is not the best, but once you get inside you forget u drove around for 10-15 minutes looking for a spot, unless you valet.

excerpts: We ordered the Crab, fried rice, garlic noodles and mango salad.
The mango salad was nice.
Teased ever so gently with shrimp and thick cuts of mango.
The fried rice was delicate, delicious and just amazing.
The garlic noodles were awesome.
The next time I go to Panda and they're talking "garlic noodles," I think I'm going to just call the police.
Thanh Long's garlic noodles are by far the best I've ever had.
garlic noodles.author: Mark Darren W.
garlic noodles.review:
If you've been following my reviews you already know I don't give out 5-Stars like it's Halloween Candy.  So if a restaurant gets this rating from me, they deserve it.  Hands down, flat out, case closed, done dig-giddy dada (I know... just go with the moment).

I've heard a lot about Thanh Long and looked forward to trying it.  I got the opportunity when in the Bay area this past weekend.

I've been an advocate for "hole in the wall" restaurants over chains because 1. I think the food most of time tastes a lot better and 2. The intimacy of a small establishment caters to my "less crowd, less noise" mantra.

From the outside, Thanh Long does not look impressive.  But when you notice a flood of people going in and coming out either something illegal is happening or they have really good food.  Thanh Long has really, really, good food.

The restaurant is nicely decorated and my hats off to the bartender.  I'm not a big drinker at all.  That said, I think every person should have a signature drink.  For me, it's Drambuie.  Because it's not an average drink and only consumed by the most worldly of people (ah-em), I can tell instantly the status of a restaurant when I order it and the waiter says "huh, what's that?"  Or the bartender simply smiles and says, "I'm sorry sir, we don't have that."  He knows that you know, the sophistication of their restaurant is FOS at that point.

Thanh Long serves Drambuie.  I'm just saying.

The restaurant is small and intimate - just how I like it.  

We ordered the Crab, fried rice, garlic noodles and mango salad.

The mango salad was nice.  Teased ever so gently with shrimp and thick cuts of mango.  I didn't care for it being slightly warmed, but I didn't mind either.

The fried rice was delicate, delicious and just amazing.  The garlic noodles were awesome.  The next time I go to Panda and they're talking "garlic noodles," I think I'm going to just call the police.  Thanh Long's garlic noodles are by far the best I've ever had.

The Crab, unless you don't like getting your hands dirty, then you need to order something else.  Steamed in pepper and other seasoning with just enough of a buttery hint that I was sitting at the table licking my fingers.  Yeah, I know. No table etiquette, but at that point I didn't care.  And if you're wondering, it was so good I would have ate the shell.

I'll be going back to the Bay area in another month and I'm already making reservations for round 2 at Thanh Long.

What better way to acknowledge their food is that good.

excerpts: Don't order anything but crab and the garlic noodles.
Green Tea is delicious as well as the fried banana with ice cream.
garlic noodles.author: Hazel K.
garlic noodles.review:
Talk about yum yum yum!!!  Don't order anything but crab and the garlic noodles.  Green Tea is delicious as well as the fried banana with ice cream.  I came here with a couple of friends and was tossed into everything and had a bib tied around my neck.  

Love Love Love the cherry blossom tree paintings on the walls and the children friendly tables and chairs.  tables are mostly half booth half chair or full booth but the layout is spaced out perfectly to pull up another chair or booster seat without blocking hallways and walkways.

This restaurant is questionable from the look of it on the outside but you step into the restaurant and it takes your breath away...no joke.  The true definition of SF Ghetto Fabulous, most definitely.  Ghetto fab defined by the faded vallet signs, beautiful bar, and the bathroom: half public middle school style, half lounge/club feel.

excerpts: All my family was happy to have a rosted crab  and garlic noodles.
Service was also very good and friendly.
garlic noodles.author: Gregory F.
garlic noodles.review: Thank you for another pleasant and tasty Crab dinner. All my family was happy to have a rosted crab  and garlic noodles. Service was also very good and friendly.

excerpts: Everyone loves the garlic noodles but there are many tasty dishes.
garlic noodles.author: Mary S.
garlic noodles.review: Delicious food & cool ambiance.  Everyone loves the garlic noodles but there are many tasty dishes.  I absolutely love the shrimp toast and fried calamari!

excerpts: The garlic noodles and shrimp
O it was all so good....
garlic noodles.author: J W.
garlic noodles.review: Pricey , but damn it was good...The crab O the crab..The garlic noodles and shrimp O it was all so good....

excerpts: Garlic noodles - felt too cheezy
garlic noodles.author: Nawee S.
garlic noodles.review:
Roast crab good - tasty and not too dry. 
Shaken Beef? - the beef was perfectly cooked but the sauce made the whole dish too sweet!
Garlic noodles - felt too cheezy

excerpts: Quite a few things on the menu, but you really just come for two things -- roast crab and garlic noodles, and then maybe another order of garlic noodles.
This was my first time back in like four of five years
and what did I have last time?
Roast crab and garlic noodles.
The crab meat is excellent, very tasty, slightly sweet, perfectly cooked, and definitely great quality.
Roast crab and garlic noodles.
The crab meat is excellent, very tasty, slightly sweet, perfectly cooked, and definitely great quality.
The garlic noodles are addicting.
Room for dessert?
garlic noodles.author: Erich D.
garlic noodles.review:
Quite a few things on the menu, but you really just come for two things -- roast crab and garlic noodles, and then maybe another order of garlic noodles.  This was my first time back in like four of five years and what did I have last time?  Roast crab and garlic noodles.  The crab meat is excellent, very tasty, slightly sweet, perfectly cooked, and definitely great quality.  The garlic noodles are addicting.  Room for dessert?  Try the old fashioned banana cake, you won't regret it.

In the An Family group of restaurants this is the original joint and is just as good, if not better, than Crustacean.

excerpts: The garlic noodles are to die for.
garlic noodles.author: Anthony N.
garlic noodles.review:
Vietnamese cuisine at its finest. Thanh long is my go to restaurant when I'm in San Francisco. The garlic noodles are to die for. The shaken beef is made with filet mignon! And my all time favorite has to be the Tamrind crab! 

Definitely a great place for date night and special occasions. Parking is tough but the dining experience is well worth the patience. 

5 stars without a doubt!

excerpts: THE ROASTED CRAB AND GARLIC NOODLES ARE TO DIE FOR.
This is the original restaurant that inspired the Crustacean restaurants, one of which is in Beverly Hills, which I've been to.
Like they say, nothing is better than the original, which is why this place is better than the Crustacean restaurants.
Make sure you make a reservation.
They do have valet parking right outside the restaurant.
This place may be expensive, but it is totally worth it!
The roasted crab is simply heaven.
The head is already taken off for your consumption.
They already give you crab crackers and a bib so you can get down and dirty.
Trust me, you have to get dirty to enjoy the crab.
The crab came out in 5-10 minutes within ordering which is a definite plus.
The one negative about the place is the service.
Most of the waiters and waitresses seem extraordinarily busy, so some things may take longer like asking for a refill.
The garlic noodles are a gift from heaven.
We loved them so much that we ordered two plates and devoured them.
Make sure each person gets their own crab because once you have a bite you won't want to share haha.
The crab sits in a pool of garlic, butter, and secret seasonings and spices.
One added bonus is that they bring out a plate of warm towels to wash your hands.
This place left me in a food coma, and the servers are incredibly kind.
I cannot wait to come back!
garlic noodles.author: Michael Q.
garlic noodles.review: THIS PLACE IS A MUST IF YOU'RE IN SAN FRANCISCO. THE ROASTED CRAB AND GARLIC NOODLES ARE TO DIE FOR. This is the original restaurant that inspired the Crustacean restaurants, one of which is in Beverly Hills, which I've been to. Like they say, nothing is better than the original, which is why this place is better than the Crustacean restaurants. Make sure you make a reservation. They do have valet parking right outside the restaurant. This place may be expensive, but it is totally worth it! The roasted crab is simply heaven. The head is already taken off for your consumption. They already give you crab crackers and a bib so you can get down and dirty. Trust me, you have to get dirty to enjoy the crab. The crab came out in 5-10 minutes within ordering which is a definite plus. The one negative about the place is the service. Most of the waiters and waitresses seem extraordinarily busy, so some things may take longer like asking for a refill. The garlic noodles are a gift from heaven. We loved them so much that we ordered two plates and devoured them. Make sure each person gets their own crab because once you have a bite you won't want to share haha. The crab sits in a pool of garlic, butter, and secret seasonings and spices. One added bonus is that they bring out a plate of warm towels to wash your hands. This place left me in a food coma, and the servers are incredibly kind. I cannot wait to come back!

excerpts: Go in and go hard on the Roasted Crab and Garlic Noodles!!!
Absolutely the best (Other than Crustaceans cracked crab version).
You will be in and out in 40 minutes tops.
No dress code, just great food.
Do it, do it, do it!
WARNING:
The Garlic Noodles are on a bigger plate, not a small bowl here
so if you want to share, you could (I wouldn't) share.
garlic noodles.author: Derrick C.
garlic noodles.review: Make a reservation.  Park for $12. Go in and go hard on the Roasted Crab and Garlic Noodles!!!   Absolutely the best (Other than Crustaceans cracked crab version).  You will be in and out in 40 minutes tops.  No dress code, just great food.  Do it, do it, do it!  WARNING: The Garlic Noodles are on a bigger plate, not a small bowl here so if you want to share, you could (I wouldn't) share.

excerpts: We also ordered the colossal royal tiger prawns, served on a bed of garlic noodles.
Again, the tiger prawns were delightfully seasoned and the garlic noodles are perhaps the best I've ever had.
The roast crab and garlic noodles lived up to the hype
but if you enjoy dressing up and don't mind paying an extra ten to twenty bucks, head over to Crustacean and enjoy the delicacies there instead.
garlic noodles.author: Evonne M.
garlic noodles.review:
Went to Thanh Long for the first time with my boyfriend the Sunday before Valentine's Day. Didn't make reservations ahead of time so we waited approximately an hour before we were seated.

To our surprise, our orders came promptly. Their famous roast crab did not disappoint. The balance of tender crab meat with buttery pepper sauce is phenomenal. Crab cracker tools, big bowls for crab shells, and plastic bibs are provided for all patrons who choose to abandon all forms of etiquette and succumb to the delightfulness of the roast crab.

We also ordered the colossal royal tiger prawns, served on a bed of garlic noodles. Again, the tiger prawns were delightfully seasoned and the garlic noodles are perhaps the best I've ever had. My boyfriend succinctly describes the noodles as "starchy with a bite and not oily at all."   

Although we were pleased with the quality of the food, the atmosphere did not live up to the price of the check. We went knowing that it is casual attire so we did not expect anything fancy. However, we were seated in a table for two surrounded on all sides by people less than two feet away. As a matter of fact, the back of my chair was touching the chair of the person who sat with his back to me. We concluded that we rather pay a bit more at Crustacean for nicer ambiance.

All in all, reservation is highly recommended if you do not want to wait. The roast crab and garlic noodles lived up to the hype but if you enjoy dressing up and don't mind paying an extra ten to twenty bucks, head over to Crustacean and enjoy the delicacies there instead.

excerpts: We both ordered the roasted crab and since it was our first time there we ordered one garlic noodles and one garlic rice.
We went to town on our crab and had to take the garlic noodles and garlic rice home, but it was still tasty a day later.
Service was awesome, we made reservations and were seating right away.
The place gets packed so make reservations!
We went to town on our crab and had to take the garlic noodles and garlic rice home, but it was still tasty a day later.
Service was awesome, we made reservations and were seating right away.
The place gets packed so make reservations!
garlic noodles.author: Victoria J.
garlic noodles.review:
First time to Thanh Long was last weekend. I have to say it was delicious and I will be back. I have eaten a lot of crab in my life and their roasted crab was so freaking good. We ordered two cocktails, they were strong and me and the husband got a little buzzed from them! My husband got the lychee infused martini and it tasted very weak in comparison and was more pricey. 
We ordered calamari as an appetizer and the rings were a little chewy but was still good and the little legs were tender and delicious. We both ordered the roasted crab and since it was our first time there we ordered one garlic noodles and one garlic rice. We went to town on our crab and had to take the garlic noodles and garlic rice home, but it was still tasty a day later. Service was awesome, we made reservations and were seating right away. The place gets packed so make reservations!

excerpts: I always get the garlic noodles and roasted crab.
Always.
It's just a must have combination when coming to a place like this.
My boyfriend loves their tiger prawns which already comes with a plate of garlic noodles.
The prawns are huge and delicious.
you're own plate of garlic noodles!
You will regret it if you choose to share with someone, trust me.
And also make sure to make reservations.
If you come right when they open there may be open seating.
garlic noodles.author: Danielle L.
garlic noodles.review:
This place will always be one of my top favorite places to eat. Probably top 3. I've been here for special occasions and I've been here for a "just because I was craving for it" kind of meal. I always get the garlic noodles and roasted crab. Always. It's just a must have combination when coming to a place like this. My boyfriend loves their tiger prawns which already comes with a plate of garlic noodles. The prawns are huge and delicious. I've also tried their salt and pepper calamari which were very delicious! Maybe the best calamari ever.

Make sure you get you're own plate of garlic noodles! You will regret it if you choose to share with someone, trust me. And also make sure to make reservations. If you come right when they open there may be open seating. Since this place is so popular, I always make reservations just to be safe. 

The service of course is always great and surprisingly fast! I ordered once and went to the restroom to wash my hands and when I came back, my crab and noodles were already on the table! 

I can't wait to go back!

excerpts: My friend and I get our own plates of the mussels and split the Drunken Crab and an order of garlic noodles.
We end the night with the chocolate lava cake and leave happy as a clam.
I haven't tried anything else on the menu because I'm obsessed with what I get.
Fresh seafood, good drinks, great service.
garlic noodles.author: Adriana R.
garlic noodles.review: Once you have the mussels from here made with Asian pesto on a crostini, you will never be able to order mussels anywhere else. We typically start the night off with a lychee martini and the martini made with plum wine and vodka (I get it made without sweet and sour). My friend and I get our own plates of the mussels and split the Drunken Crab and an order of garlic noodles. We end the night with the chocolate lava cake and leave happy as a clam. I haven't tried anything else on the menu because I'm obsessed with what I get. Fresh seafood, good drinks, great service.

excerpts: So as soon as we sat down he ordered prawns wrapped in wonton,  three roasted crabs, one plate of garlic noodles (that soon later turned out into two orders), and a soda for my mom.
It was funny that he ordered all that without asking my mom and I, especially me since I was the one paying the bill.
But as high as my expectations were, I think Thanh Long meet the expectations and perhaps a little more.
One plate of Garlic Noodles is enough to feed two people.
The crabs are market price (The roasted crab was excellent).
garlic noodles.author: Lea M.
garlic noodles.review:
Why haven't I found out about this place sooner?  I took my parents out to dinner here earlier in the night and as soon as I told my dad about this place he did his own research.  Of course, when he searched Thanh Long Yelp.com popped up and he read all the reviews about the crabs.  So as soon as we sat down he ordered prawns wrapped in wonton,  three roasted crabs, one plate of garlic noodles (that soon later turned out into two orders), and a soda for my mom.  It was funny that he ordered all that without asking my mom and I, especially me since I was the one paying the bill.  But as high as my expectations were, I think Thanh Long meet the expectations and perhaps a little more.  My dad on the other hand, he's traveled the work and says that this isn't his best meal but one the top meals that he's had.  

The prawns rolled in wonton was a small appetizer for three, yet very good.  
One plate of Garlic Noodles is enough to feed two people.
The crabs are market price (The roasted crab was excellent).  And the head was taken off of the legs so that you wouldn't have to struggle with pulling the crab apart.

The service was excellent.  Our waiter had a great sense of humor and was friendly, as well as patient with us. 

It gets really busy a little after they open, so I suggest coming around the time they opened.  

I think I made my parents critics of food since the found out about yelp and read the reviews on this place.  I'm going to have to come back with my boyfriend.

excerpts: Pretty sure they used canned pineapple in their soup, chicken tasted like it came from a buffet line, garlic noodles were caked with garlic powder - What ever happened to using fresh ingredients?
service was cold, atmosphere and decor were a bit grungy.
garlic noodles.author: Tran N.
garlic noodles.review:
Overpriced for low quality food. Pretty sure they used canned pineapple in their soup, chicken tasted like it came from a buffet line, garlic noodles were caked with garlic powder - What ever happened to using fresh ingredients?
service was cold, atmosphere and decor were a bit grungy.

excerpts: Roasted crab is to die for and garlic noodles is a must w/ it the secret is the spicy eggplant and dessert is good.
garlic noodles.author: Sam F.
garlic noodles.review: Roasted crab is to die for and garlic noodles is a must w/ it the secret is the spicy eggplant and dessert is good.

excerpts: Garlic noodles, good.
Crab, good.
Buttery, good.
The food is very tasty.
I don't think one item in anything we ordered was remotely bland.
Ok back to the subject, garlic noodles and crab like every other reviews.
garlic noodles.author: Kimmy N.
garlic noodles.review:
Decor:  It is funny going to a fancy Vietnamese restaurant.  Being Vietnamese, my parents always took me to all those hole in the wall restaurant where they think $1 something tip is good.  Vietnamese parents, so silly.  Anyways fancy Vietnamese and no Fusion included.

Service:  Like any fancy restaurant.  Always tentative and good.

Taste:  Sooo tasty.  Garlic noodles, good. Crab, good.  Buttery, good.  The food is very tasty.  I don't think one item in anything we ordered was remotely bland.  No soy sauce/salt needed.

Specialty:  I am guessing because they have the crab on their restaurant, it means the roasted crab is the specialty.  Also everyone had one at a table.  Then I started thinking how do they find these crabs so consistently sized and cooked at a consistent orange.  Hmm.. Ok back to the subject, garlic noodles and crab like every other reviews.

Price: $40/person

Recommendations:  I really wanted to like the shaking beef, but after eating maybe the 3rd cube, I was like where is the rice/water/ something.  It was like that sticky sweet flavored around it.  I miss the classic grilled shaking cube beef with some good ol' orange rice. Yum.  Overall, it was very delicious and I was full.

excerpts: There is no point in looking at the menu, there are only two things you need to know about; Garlic noodles and roasted crab.
Get them, you won't be sorry.
Allow some time to find parking.
It's San Francisco, don't be surprised.
It's not cheap.
Don't whine when the bill arrives.
The food usually comes out pretty quickly, but it's not somewhere to go if you are in a rush.
Take your time and enjoy.
garlic noodles.author: Aaron L.
garlic noodles.review:
I've been coming here for years.  I was just there last night for the first time in a very long time and I was reminded how awesome this place is.  I never wanted to write a review, because I didn't want other people to know about it.  But with over 1400 reviews, I think the cat's out of the bag.  If something could get more than 5 stars, this would be it.  It really doesn't get any better than this.

There isn't much to say that hasn't been said already, so I leave you with a few tips, you can thank me later.
1. Make reservations, there can be a long wait especially on Friday and Saturday nights.
2. There is no point in looking at the menu, there are only two things you need to know about; Garlic noodles and roasted crab.  Get them, you won't be sorry.
3. Allow some time to find parking.  It's San Francisco, don't be surprised.
4. It's not cheap.  Don't whine when the bill arrives.
5. The food usually comes out pretty quickly, but it's not somewhere to go if you are in a rush.  Take your time and enjoy.

excerpts: spent 200 on 2 crabs,  1 garlic noodles , 1 fried rice,  for 2 adults and 2 kids.
It wasnt as good as i expected.
garlic noodles.author: Jill G.
garlic noodles.review: spent 200 on 2 crabs,  1 garlic noodles , 1 fried rice,  for 2 adults and 2 kids. It wasnt as good as i expected.

excerpts: Garlic noodles....how can ANYONE mess up garlic noodles?
Sub-par meal.
So surprised.
This place appears to be so popular.
garlic noodles.author: Vicky T.
garlic noodles.review: Crab was nothing special. Garlic noodles....how can ANYONE mess up garlic noodles? Sub-par meal. So surprised. This place appears to be so popular.

excerpts: The garlic noodles and Tambarind crab is AMAZING!!
That sauce is so good, it's worth getting your hands dirty for.
They also have a specialty lychee martini which tasted yummy too.
garlic noodles.author: Kay S.
garlic noodles.review:
One of my all time favorite place!! Make reservations! This place gets so packed and busy without it so just do yourself a favor. They have valet parking outside for $5 if I remember correctly. 

The garlic noodles and Tambarind crab is AMAZING!! That sauce is so good, it's worth getting your hands dirty for. They also have a specialty lychee martini which tasted yummy too.

excerpts: We ordered the famous garlic noodles and shared a crab.
I honestly don't think the garlic noodles were "spectacular", but it was GOOD.
The garlic taste from the noodles tasted very artificial, like there was a whole bunch of "garlic powder" or something in there....
You know how you eat ramen noodles or something out of the package and you put the powder stuff all over the noodles?
Well, it kinda reminded me of that, except garlic flavor + a stick of butter...very salty, overpowering garlic-y taste.
Maybe it's just me, but some people love this taste.
garlic noodles.author: AK M.
garlic noodles.review:
Went here because it was featured on Diners Drive in's & Dive's from the food network. 

We happend to be in the area so were one of the first customers for dinner at 5pm. There were already a bunch of people lined up outside before they opened. Most had reservations and we didn't but got seated right away. Parking wasn't too bad this day (Sunday).

We ordered the famous garlic noodles and shared a crab. I honestly don't think the garlic noodles were "spectacular", but it was GOOD. The garlic taste from the noodles tasted very artificial, like there was a whole bunch of "garlic powder" or something in there.... You know how you eat ramen noodles or something out of the package and you put the powder stuff all over the noodles? Well, it kinda reminded me of that, except garlic flavor + a stick of butter...very salty, overpowering garlic-y taste. Maybe it's just me, but some people love this taste. I guess it just reminded me of my broke college days. 

Also, there is a lot of BUTTER used in the food.

The crab was pretty good. cooked with a bunch of butter and garlic & salt/pepper. Then again, i'm not a huge crab eater, nor do I like having to "work" to eat my food. I don't like to get messy when eating my dinner. Why did I come here again? Oh yeah, because it got really good reviews and was featured on the food network! duh!  The service was quick and our server was efficient. Not sure if i'll come back here, but glad I tried this place =) Check it out if you're ever in the area!

excerpts: Roasted garlic crab, garlic noodles, salt and pepper calamari, garlic toast, sea bass and sautéed veggies were amazzzzing!
I can never get tired of this place.
pineapple lychee martini is a creeper but so delicious!
Can't go wrong with anything.
Only downside is the parking but that doesn't take away a star.
garlic noodles.author: Monica M.
garlic noodles.review: Love love love! We try to come here at least once a year sometimes more depending if we feel like coming into the city. Roasted garlic crab, garlic noodles, salt and pepper calamari, garlic toast, sea bass and sautéed veggies were amazzzzing! I can never get tired of this place. pineapple lychee martini is a creeper but so delicious! Can't go wrong with anything. Only downside is the parking but that doesn't take away a star.

excerpts: Something you should always order is the garlic noodles !!!!!
It's a must !!!
And u will say it again ...
ITS
A MUST!
Not a big crab person
but I do LOVE the prawns !
garlic noodles.author: Giselle J.
garlic noodles.review: LOVE THIS PLACE! It's an upscale boiling crab. Something you should always order is the garlic noodles !!!!! It's a must !!! And u will say it again ... ITS A MUST! Not a big crab person but I do LOVE the prawns !

excerpts: Roasted Crab was fantastic and the garlic noodles is of course a must try.
garlic noodles.author: Art L.
garlic noodles.review: Roasted Crab was fantastic and the garlic noodles is of course a must try. We also had the shaken beef med-rare, that was decent as well..

excerpts: Love going here for some crab and garlic noodles.
Crab is always on point and you gotta have the garlic noodles to go with the crab.
garlic noodles.author: Monique M.
garlic noodles.review:
Love going here for some crab and garlic noodles.  Very rarely to order anything else off the menu other than appetizers and desserts.  

Crab is always on point and you gotta have the garlic noodles to go with the crab. 

No complaints here!  Service is fast, gets crowded so make a reservation.

Parking is a drag unless you valet.  I'm pretty cheap so I dont mind looking around the neighborhood for parking.  Plus the walk to the car after dinner is great especially if you're stuffed.

Wish they were closer and not so deep in SF but oh well still will go back.

excerpts: This place always deliver my cravings of Garlic Noodles.
I've gone here for Mother's day with the entire family, out with friends and even casual dining.
The Roast Crab, Garlic noodles
(I don't care for the noodles with the prawns), Mussels are all fabulous.
My favorite thing to do is peel the entire crab and eat it with the noodles - amazing combo.
It's been a while since I've tried anything else, but when I did months ago,
ALL the dishes were delicious!
Their fried banana with ice cream dessert satisfies as well.
garlic noodles.author: Mimi V.
garlic noodles.review:
This place always deliver my cravings of Garlic Noodles. I've gone here for Mother's day with the entire family, out with friends and even casual dining. This place is great for all occasions! 

The Roast Crab, Garlic noodles (I don't care for the noodles with the prawns), Mussels are all fabulous. My favorite thing to do is peel the entire crab and eat it with the noodles - amazing combo. It's been a while since I've tried anything else, but when I did months ago,  ALL the dishes were delicious! Their fried banana with ice cream dessert satisfies as well. They also have a good wine selection. 

The service here is fabulous, definitely not like other Vietnamese restaurants. You also get all kinds of people in - definitely pleases all crowds.

excerpts: We then ordered two orders of soft shell crabs, an order of garlic noodles w jumbo prawns, and one roasted crab.
We had leftovers of the garlic noodles and my bf said it was the best leftovers ever!
Haha!
Bill came out to be $150 w tip.
A little pricey, but it was worth it!
I'd recommend coming early because this place gets packed and parking is hard to find.
garlic noodles.author: Quyen L.
garlic noodles.review:
I don't care so much for crab, but the bf took me here for my birthday since our friends have been raving about this place. So glad we went because this place definitely lives up to the hype!!!

Started off with two cocktails which were both very fruity and girly. We then ordered two orders of soft shell crabs, an order of garlic noodles w jumbo prawns, and one roasted crab. Everything was well seasoned and tasted superb!!!!! 

The portions is good to share between two ppl. We had leftovers of the garlic noodles and my bf said it was the best leftovers ever! Haha! Bill came out to be $150 w tip. A little pricey, but it was worth it! I'd recommend coming early because this place gets packed and parking is hard to find.

excerpts: We ended up getting the roasted crab, garlic noodles, calamari and seafood fried rice that everyone was talking about.
The food come out within 10 mins so we were happy about that.
The calamari was kind of plain
so we had to ask the waiter for chili paste.
The garlic noodles is not the best in town, it was a bit over cooked!
they could have done better.
Also the fried rice was mediocre.
Now for the main reason why we came to the restaurant, the crab.
garlic noodles.author: Dinh H.
garlic noodles.review: Couple of my friends and I went to the city to try out this restaurant because of all the good reviews. We ended up getting the roasted crab, garlic noodles, calamari and seafood fried rice that everyone was talking about. The food come out within 10 mins so we were happy about that. The calamari was kind of plain so we had to ask the waiter for chili paste. The garlic noodles is not the best in town, it was a bit over cooked! they could have done better. Also the fried rice was mediocre. Now for the main reason why we came to the restaurant, the crab. Everyone said the Roast crab is a must try and they love it. In my opinion I could have cooked it better at home. The flavor was okay but the crab was cooked well. We had to ask for salt, pepper and lemon just to dip our crab meat in because the seasoning was only on the shells so it wasn't that tasty. If they had Tabasco i would have enjoyed eating the crab more. Our tab came out to 220 dollars. Each crab was 53 bucks! Was not worth it. And also the waiter was quick on refilling our waters and getting what we need very quickly.

excerpts:
During my visits, I've also tried the Seabass, Drunken Crab, Tamarind Crab, Mussels, Salt & Pepper Calamari, Garlic Noodles, and the Traditional Vietnamese Salad.  
I'm still not a fan of the Drunken Crab, Tamarind Crab, or the Garlic Noodles, but all the others were pretty good.

I'm still not a fan of the Drunken Crab, Tamarind Crab, or the Garlic Noodles, but all the others were pretty good.

I'm still not a fan of the Drunken Crab, Tamarind Crab, or the Garlic Noodles, but all the others were pretty good.
garlic noodles.author: Ninja H.
garlic noodles.review:
Still come for my crab fix when I can't order it from Mom, but I don't know if I've just been coming too often or if the crab quality really has gone down.  Like I said, still incredibly delish but something's a lil off...idk!

I've been more than my share of times but thought my most recent trip about a week after crab season started would've been the best visit.  Sadly, it was the same crab quality as when it wasn't crab season. Hmmm...

Well, it won't sway me!  I'm still gettin down and messy in the Roasted Crab garlic butter...and a nice stiff drink!  And still ordering the Shaken Beef when my taste buds call for it.  

During my visits, I've also tried the Seabass, Drunken Crab, Tamarind Crab, Mussels, Salt & Pepper Calamari, Garlic Noodles, and the Traditional Vietnamese Salad.  I'm still not a fan of the Drunken Crab, Tamarind Crab, or the Garlic Noodles, but all the others were pretty good.

Still recommend to others, and will still continue to patronize when Mom's kitchen's out of crustacean! ;0)

excerpts: My favorite things to eat here are the roasted crab, garlic noodles, and the eggplant dish.
garlic noodles.author: Lisa H.
garlic noodles.review: My family loves this place. Service is always stellar and the food is such a treat. My favorite things to eat here are the roasted crab, garlic noodles, and the eggplant dish. If you're coming for the first time, I'd pass on the Drunken Crab. The roasted crab is served in a lovely pool of clarified butter (I'm guessing) and special spices. If I'm not paying (haha), I'd add on the shaking beef and the Vietnamese salad. I'd pass on the dessert - but if you must, try the fried ice cream. The breading is really thick, but the vanilla ice cream is so good. Lastly, my husband swears by the Vietnamese ice coffee. Anyway. Overall, a great special occasion restaurant. Reservations highly recommended.

excerpts: The garlic noodles are one of a kind!
garlic noodles.author: Mimi B.
garlic noodles.review:
I can't say anything wrong about this place. The service and food are delicious!

They give you the whole crab, so you don't feel ripped off eating here. Flavorful crab. The garlic noodles are one of a kind! Often imitated, never duplicated! 

When we make reservations, we are seated right away when we get there. 

Overall, I will be coming back. I've been here three or four times and it's always the same, never disappointed.

excerpts: Everyone just comes here for the garlic noodles and crab, right?
So that's what I got.
I went to Crustacean a lot when I was a kid, and I always heard Thanh Long was much better, so I came with high expectations.
But everything we got was greasy and salty as fuck.
I felt very shitty very quickly.
I am getting thirsty just writing this.
garlic noodles.author: Veronica L.
garlic noodles.review:
Service/parking are meh, food is even more meh.

Everyone just comes here for the garlic noodles and crab, right? So that's what I got. I went to Crustacean a lot when I was a kid, and I always heard Thanh Long was much better, so I came with high expectations. But everything we got was greasy and salty as fuck. I felt very shitty very quickly. I am getting thirsty just writing this.

excerpts: Yes, the garlic noodles are good.
In fact, that was the only thing that was good at this place.
I didn't think we could fill up on some plain noodles but we did after we had 3 orders.
We started off with some shrimp appetizer.
It was ok.
The wonton wrapping was light, golden crispy.
Nothing spectacular.
Then we ordered a crab since everyone was eating them.
It was ok....nothing special.
But the noodles....
oh those noodles.
I wouldn't wait an hour again for them
but I will have pleasant thoughts of the one time I had them to enjoy.
garlic noodles.author: Soo C.
garlic noodles.review: Ok, here's another SF place with a ridiculous line for sub par food. Yes, the garlic noodles are good. In fact, that was the only thing that was good at this place. I didn't think we could fill up on some plain noodles but we did after we had 3 orders. We started off with some shrimp appetizer. It was ok. The wonton wrapping was light, golden crispy. Nothing spectacular. Then we ordered a crab since everyone was eating them. It was ok....nothing special. But the noodles....oh those noodles. I wouldn't wait an hour again for them but I will have pleasant thoughts of the one time I had them to enjoy.

excerpts:
but their garlic noodles are delicious. 
the drunken grab was yummy, but i love all kinds of crab, prepared any which way.
ordered two orders of garlic noodles because the server couldn't really recommend anything better.

1 crab, 2 orders of garlic noodles, 1 beef for about 90$ excluding tip.
glad we made reservations because there was a lot of people waiting.
the area seems shady to me, just because i saw there were many loiterers across the street at the 7-11.
garlic noodles.author: Heejin L.
garlic noodles.review:
it's been so long since i've been to crustaceans, so i can't really compare.
but their garlic noodles are delicious. the shaken beef that everyone seems to rave about is nothing special in my opinion. i think newport seafood in LA has better french style beef.
the drunken grab was yummy, but i love all kinds of crab, prepared any which way.
ordered two orders of garlic noodles because the server couldn't really recommend anything better.

1 crab, 2 orders of garlic noodles, 1 beef for about 90$ excluding tip.
glad we made reservations because there was a lot of people waiting.
the area seems shady to me, just because i saw there were many loiterers across the street at the 7-11.

excerpts: For our meal, we ordered 2 roast crabs and 2 orders of garlic noodles.
We are a family of five - this, plus the two appetizers, were not enough for us (we went for ice cream after).

The garlic noodles (~$10 an order) were delicious but, seriously, tasted very similar to Red Crawfish's garlic noodles (a.k.a., if you want a delicious, but in a more casual setting, similar meal, perhaps think of RC as an alternative).
garlic noodles.author: Therese Jane R.
garlic noodles.review:
Went here the past weekend with my family as a treat to our parents for Christmas.  Thank God my sister made reservations because dinnertime on a saturday was packed!  People who didn't make reservation were told the wait could be up to 2 hours long.  We, however, were sat within 10 minutes of our reservation time.  

We had the salt and pepper calamari and crab puffs to start.  Both were okay (and relatively cheap, ~$10 each).  The salt and pepper calamari was good but doused in spices, which made the actual seafood flavor lessened - a quality that some might not enjoy.  It's also tossed with some veggies, which our family also happily munched on.  Not the best calamari we've ever had but also not the worst.  The crab puffs were ordered on our waiter's suggestion and they were good, too - soft on the inside with the outside perfectly golden and crunchy.  Did not try to sauce that came with it but by my mom's continuous dipping, I'm going to assume that it was good.  

For our meal, we ordered 2 roast crabs and 2 orders of garlic noodles.  We are a family of five - this, plus the two appetizers, were not enough for us (we went for ice cream after).  The garlic noodles (~$10 an order) were delicious but, seriously, tasted very similar to Red Crawfish's garlic noodles (a.k.a., if you want a delicious, but in a more casual setting, similar meal, perhaps think of RC as an alternative).  The Roast Crab was delicious and our family destroyed it within about 15 minutes.  Seriously do not remember the exact taste because we were inhaling our food.  My sister said that both dishes were a little too garlic heavy for her to have together but they were fine with me.  Each crab was about $42.  

All in all, the ambiance was great but if you like seasoned seafood and want to eat without any reservations (pun intended) you should probably visit one of the less bougie places that dot the bay area.  If you are trying to impress a significant other (or potential significant other) do not go to this place, where you're tempted to pull apart crabs with your hands and suck the meat out from the shell.

excerpts: My garlic noodles, what should be the star of the show, were bland and cold when they arrived.
The Shaken (mystery meat)
Beef was off in texture and taste, never seen texture in meat quite like this before.
Not at all what I remember about Thanh Long's.
I will not be going back.
garlic noodles.author: C B.
garlic noodles.review: Oh my gosh! This used to be one of my favorite restaurants to frequent. I recently went after a 15 year hiatus and it was not as good as I remember. My garlic noodles, what should be the star of the show, were bland and cold when they arrived. The Shaken (mystery meat) Beef was off in texture and taste, never seen texture in meat quite like this before. Not at all what I remember about Thanh Long's. I will not be going back.

excerpts:
Ordered the halibut and the garlic noodles (yes.. I am one of the rare who doesn't order crab).

The halibut was cooked very well, with good garlic noodles.

However I really never understand the craze of garlic noodles in the bay area though.
garlic noodles.author: Dan Q.
garlic noodles.review:
Ordered the halibut and the garlic noodles (yes.. I am one of the rare who doesn't order crab).

The halibut was cooked very well, with good garlic noodles.

However I really never understand the craze of garlic noodles in the bay area though.

excerpts: The first time tasting the roast crab and garlic noodles was amazing.
The third time we ordered roast crab, garlic noodles, shaken beef and mussels.
The third time we ordered roast crab, garlic noodles, shaken beef and mussels.
The garlic noodles were great as were the mussels.
The roast crab however was completely disappointing.
It tasted over cooked and very rubbery, as if it was sitting in the pot too long.
garlic noodles.author: Ren A.
garlic noodles.review: This visit was our third.  The first time tasting the roast crab and garlic noodles was amazing.  The second time we had both dishes again and splurged and got the shrimp toast appetizer.  Again an amazing meal.  The third time we ordered roast crab, garlic noodles, shaken beef and mussels.  The garlic noodles were great as were the mussels.  The roast crab however was completely disappointing.  It tasted over cooked and very rubbery, as if it was sitting in the pot too long.  While we enjoyed the mussels, it was not our first choice as they were out of the shrimp toast.  They were also out of Jasmin tea (??).  Not sure how you run out of tea.  The service was very good.  Or waiter was patient (maybe because he had to tell us they were out of items was wanted) and they cleared empty dishes quickly from the table.  The water service was prompt (maybe because we weren't drinking tea).  We want to chalk it up to going on a Tuesday night, but that's not a good excuse for running out of items or over cooked crab at market prices.

excerpts: Garlic noodles, rice paper wrap appetizer, and CRAB!
Not at all cheap but so worth it because of the great staff!
Oh yeah, they pour a good drink too.
Save room for dessert.
We honestly felt like gluttons leaving the place.
The only advice I have is get in line before they open.
I got the impression some people pre ordered but we didn't and the service was fine.
What gave me impression was some who arrived after us received their food immediately after being seated.
The crab we got was $53.00.
I know it's a deal breaker for most, but we really enjoyed the experience.
garlic noodles.author: John W.
garlic noodles.review: Loved it. Garlic noodles, rice paper wrap appetizer, and CRAB!  Not at all cheap but so worth it because of the great staff!  Oh yeah, they pour a good drink too. Save room for dessert. We honestly felt like gluttons leaving the place. The only advice I have is get in line before they open. I got the impression some people pre ordered but we didn't and the service was fine. What gave me impression was some who arrived after us received their food immediately after being seated. The crab we got was $53.00. I know it's a deal breaker for most, but we really enjoyed the experience.

excerpts: I had their famous garlic noodles and of course their roasted crab.
Food came out fairly quick!
The special spice mix really adds a kick to the crab which I thoroughly enjoyed.
The staff was wonderful, very tentative to their guests!
I've honestly never had this level of customer service.
I will be coming back to try the other dishes that they offer!
garlic noodles.author: Regine C.
garlic noodles.review: This restaurant has the best customer service! I had their famous garlic noodles and of course their roasted crab. Food came out fairly quick! The special spice mix really adds a kick to the crab which I thoroughly enjoyed. The staff was wonderful, very tentative to their guests! I've honestly never had this level of customer service. I will be coming back to try the other dishes that they offer!

excerpts: The garlic noodles and the crab is AMAZING!!!!
I must admit, it is very
expensive(our bill was $229) but it's worth it to me!
garlic noodles.author: Corey B.
garlic noodles.review: Really great place, great place for a date or hangout with friends and family! The garlic noodles and the crab is AMAZING!!!! I must admit, it is very expensive(our bill was $229) but it's worth it to me!

excerpts: We ordered their signature dishes which was the crab and garlic noodles.
I know everyone said to order the roasted crab
but I felt like roasted crab and garlic noodles was garlic overload
garlic noodles.author: Jeanne L.
garlic noodles.review:
Last night was my first visit to Thanh Long. My friend asked me if  he can have his birthday dinner there. After he took me to Alexander's Steakhouse his answer was hell yes to anything besides French Laundry.

We ordered their signature dishes which was the crab and garlic noodles. I know everyone said to order the roasted crab  but I felt like roasted crab and garlic noodles was garlic overload so we opted for the drunken crab. I didnt have to slay any vampires so I thought this was the right decision to make.

The drunken crab and noodles were great choices. I loved them both! The noodles had a slight kick to it that made it so delicous and our crab was soaked in this flavorful broth that made every bite juicy and scrumptious. YUMM! For the appetizer, we had the black pepper calamari  and that was very good too. Im not crazy about calamari because I feel that most place over-do the batter but it was made perfectly here. 

The service was great. The server asked us if we wanted a bib for the crab and they even tied it around our neck. He was also very nice about getting us extra napkins and hot water for my tea. What made him extra awesome was that he was honest about the dessert recommendations. 

Initially, I almost picked some sort of banana/coconut/carmel dessert (forgot name) and he told me that that one was very sweet and named a few that were good.  I went with my second choice which was the lava chocolate cake a la mode. Get it!!! Soooooo effin good!

excerpts:
Pros
- Garlic Noodles
- Roasted Crab
- Salt and Pepper Calamari

Cons 
- None
Some of the best garlic noodles and crab that I've ever had.
It's not cheap and it's messy but for special occasions, this place is great.
Good service and even better food.
garlic noodles.author: Andrew S.
garlic noodles.review:
Pros
- Garlic Noodles
- Roasted Crab
- Salt and Pepper Calamari

Cons 
- None
- Wait? 
- Reservations Required?

Some of the best garlic noodles and crab that I've ever had. It's not cheap and it's messy but for special occasions, this place is great. Good service and even better food.

excerpts: Yes, please believe they have yummy roasted crab and THE BEST GARLIC NOODLES!
If anyone goes without me, I beg for a to-go order of the garlic noodles!
I keep telling myself to try something different like the Shakened Beef, but I just can't bring myself to do it.
I have strayed and tried the Garlic Rice and Colossal Tiger Prawns (along with my garlic noodles) and it was just OK- something I can probably replicate at home.
garlic noodles.author: S Y.
garlic noodles.review:
100th review on the day I'm asked to join the Elite Squad! Wooohoooo! 

Yes, please believe they have yummy roasted crab and THE BEST GARLIC NOODLES! If anyone goes without me, I beg for a to-go order of the garlic noodles! I keep telling myself to try something different like the Shakened Beef, but I just can't bring myself to do it. I have strayed and tried the Garlic Rice and Colossal Tiger Prawns (along with my garlic noodles) and it was just OK- something I can probably replicate at home. 

One thing I like about this place, besides the casual dress code, is the service. It never fails that when I make a reservation, my friend is always late. I've never been told that they have to give the table to another party, in fact, I'm told I can grab a drink at the bar and wait. Once the lagger friends show- we're seated! 

Parking can be difficult, but there is valet parking! 

Warning: Everything will smell like garlic when you leave, especially the inside of your bag!

excerpts: The roasted crab was still as amazing as before...while the garlic noodles were just right.
The glass of house wine was a bit pricey....but we enjoyed the dinner and left satisfied.
For those who really enjoy good crab...this is still the place to go.
garlic noodles.author: Mark L.
garlic noodles.review:
It has been 10 years since I have visited this restaurant....and it has only gotten better.  The roasted crab was still as amazing as before...while the garlic noodles were just right.   The glass of house wine was a bit pricey....but we enjoyed the dinner and left satisfied.
For those who really enjoy good crab...this is still the place to go.

excerpts: Love me some roasted garlic crab, crab fried rice, and garlic noodles.
YUMMMMMMM.
We occasionally try some appetizers and salads and it's always yummy.
But for sure, always the crab, crab fried rice, and garlic noodles.
I am ALWAYS looking forward to the next time I get to eat here.
But for sure, always the crab, crab fried rice, and garlic noodles.
I am ALWAYS looking forward to the next time I get to eat here.
garlic noodles.author: Andrea M.
garlic noodles.review: Have I really never wrote a review on Thanh Long? I freakin LOVE thanh long. LOVE LOVE LOVE LOVE it. I am never disappointed here. Food is amazing. Love me some roasted garlic crab, crab fried rice, and garlic noodles. YUMMMMMMM. We occasionally try some appetizers and salads and it's always yummy. But for sure, always the crab, crab fried rice, and garlic noodles. I am ALWAYS looking forward to the next time I get to eat here. =)

excerpts: Get the roasted crab and garlic noodles.
Nothing else to say.
Yum!
Amazing food.
garlic noodles.author: Tracey I.
garlic noodles.review: Get the roasted crab and garlic noodles.  Nothing else to say.  Yum!  Amazing food.

excerpts: The Garlic Crab, Garlic noodles, & Shaken Beef are all AMAZING!
The crab is always perfectly drenched in buttered garlic.
The beef is so soft & tender it pretty much melts in your mouth.
A lot of places try and duplicate their noodles but whatever the "secret ingredient" is makes theirs the best garlic noodles in the Bay!
garlic noodles.author: Melanie P.
garlic noodles.review: If you like garlic & butter, you will LOVE this place!  It's definitely pricey BUT so worth it!!  The Garlic Crab, Garlic noodles, & Shaken Beef are all AMAZING!  The crab is always perfectly drenched in buttered garlic.  The beef is so soft & tender it pretty much melts in your mouth.  A lot of places try and duplicate their noodles but whatever the "secret ingredient" is makes theirs the best garlic noodles in the Bay!

excerpts: Roasted crab and garlic noodles.
garlic noodles.author: Margaret S.
garlic noodles.review:
The meal I had here was glorious. Roasted crab and garlic noodles.


GLORIOUS.

excerpts: Once seated, as suggested, we only ordered the roasted crab and garlic noodles.
These items came out SUPER fast and smelled delicious, but unfortunately for us, that was the high point of the meal.
The garlic noodles are essentially ramen noodles, unsalted, blandly seasoned with garlic and (supposedly) parmesan cheese.
Not good.
The crab was delicious, but that is because crab is naturally delicious.
The "roasted" part of the crab meant that it was doused in butter and had some parsley sprinkled on.
garlic noodles.author: Jennifer F.
garlic noodles.review:
On a recent trip to SF, this was my first stop.  This place came HIGHLY recommended by a friend and it seems the Yelp community also supports it (generally speaking). 

The bf and I had just finished driving up from San Diego, and we arrived tired, hungry, and hopeful.  Walked in around 6pm, and the wait at 25 minutes.  Ok, that's fine, we're already here and it seems like everything else on this block is closed.  So we waited.

Once seated, as suggested, we only ordered the roasted crab and garlic noodles.  These items came out SUPER fast and smelled delicious, but unfortunately for us, that was the high point of the meal. The garlic noodles are essentially ramen noodles, unsalted, blandly seasoned with garlic and (supposedly) parmesan cheese. Not good.  The crab was delicious, but that is because crab is naturally delicious. The "roasted" part of the crab meant that it was doused in butter and had some parsley sprinkled on. Really disappointing.  

For $70+ for two dishes (and some jasmine tea), I expected a MUCH better meal.

excerpts: I ordered the garlic noodles (delicious and very garlicky - must have, it's definitely famous for a reason!) and roast crab.
It was buttery and so good we each polished off our own crab in less than 10 minutes!
It was fun to dig in with our hands and my friend also ended up getting the fried ice cream dessert and Vietnamese coffee which I have to say was authentic and super strong.
I'd definitely come back when I'm in the mood to splurge!
garlic noodles.author: Lana T.
garlic noodles.review: I was introduced to this place by my friend and went there for her birthday several months ago (this is a super late review).  It was quite upscale and had nice ambiance.  The service was super fast and we stated with calamari which was crispy and perfect!  I ordered the garlic noodles (delicious and very garlicky - must have, it's definitely famous for a reason!) and roast crab.  It was buttery and so good we each polished off our own crab in less than 10 minutes!
