It was fun to dig in with our hands and my friend also ended up getting the fried ice cream dessert and Vietnamese coffee which I have to say was authentic and super strong.  I'd definitely come back when I'm in the mood to splurge!

excerpts: I tried that and two garlic noodles.
Next time we decided to eat like Kings and get two crabs and 1 garlic noodle since I can make garlic noodle at home.
This is a must try if you are a first timer!
The peppery, buttery sauce is to die for!!
garlic noodles.author: Jennifer D.
garlic noodles.review:
MAKE A RESERVATION.

Awesome service + Awesome food= Happy camper.

Been here a few times and the food is consistant. Ordered the same thing each time.

1. Thanh long mussels with garlic crostini- $12 for 5 pieces of mussel and 5 pieces of garlic crostini. 
At first I was like, uh wth, a box of mussels cost only $3.99 and a baguette is $1 and you are only going to give me five pieces of each?!?! But this stuff is off the hook, has a pesto sauce on top of the mussel. I usually take the mussel with the pesto/buttery goodness and top it on my crostini..MmMMm...a must try!!

2. Roasted crab- $37-40
Waiter usually recommends that one crab per person. First time bf and I tried that and two garlic noodles. Next time we decided to eat like Kings and get two crabs and 1 garlic noodle since I can make garlic noodle at home. This is a must try if you are a first timer! The peppery, buttery sauce is to die for!! I dip every piece of lump crab meat into the sauce, the clogged arteries will just have to understand.

3. Tamarind crab- $37- $40
OMG OMG OMG I freaking love this one. Yes, the roasted crab is good, but this one has sooooo much flavor. If you like sweet/sour stuff, this is a must try. When I ordered this, not only did I dip each piece of crab meat into the sauce, I LICKED the sauce on the shell and everything, NO SHAME AT ALL. When there was no more crab left, I even dipped my fingers in the sauce just to taste the sauce for the last time. lol

4. GARLIC NOODLES- $12
BELIEVE THE HYPE. This stuff is so addicting, I wish my plates were bottomless. Whiling stuffing my face with all this garlic and buttery goodness, I contemplate how many more plates I should order and how many more I should togo. The noodles here are like no other, you can replicate the flavor, but you can't replicate the texture due to the noodles, believe me, I have tried! Recently found out from a friend that they order their noodles specially from a private owner, so I have stopped searching.

5. Fried banana with iced cream- Always a hit. Two scoops of ice cream with two fried bananas and chocolate syrup.

Service here is awesome- You'd think that eating crab at a fancy place like this would be awkward, but they have it down to a science: Waiters are constantly changing out your garbage bowl, they put on a bib FOR YOU, and they even bring out two rounds of piping hot towels so that you can clean your hands.

I HIGHLY RECOMMEND YOU TRY THIS PLACE IF YOU GET THE CHANCE. GREAT FOR INTIMATE BIRTHDAY DINNERS/ SPECIAL OCCASIONS.

excerpts: Came here with a friend and got an order of the roasted crab, garlic noodles, and a vegetable dish.
The roasted crab was AMAZING!
Everyone says so, and it's totally true.
It was really delicious.
It was finger-licking good.
Man, just thinking about that crab makes my mouth water.
Garlic noodles were great, too!
Don't be thrown off by the appearance.
When they come out, they just look like plain noodles with nothing on them.
But MAN they were garlic-ey!!
I would NOT come here on a first date.
Garlic noodles + first date = guaranteed breath disaster.
Unless, of course, you're trying to get out of kissing someone.
Then good God, order the garlic noodles already!
garlic noodles.author: Jade R.
garlic noodles.review:
The once place in the world I wouldn't mind getting crabs from.

Came here with a friend and got an order of the roasted crab, garlic noodles, and a vegetable dish. The roasted crab was AMAZING! Everyone says so, and it's totally true. It was really delicious. It was finger-licking good. Man, just thinking about that crab makes my mouth water. It's expensive, but it's some good stuff. 

Garlic noodles were great, too! Don't be thrown off by the appearance. When they come out, they just look like plain noodles with nothing on them. But MAN they were garlic-ey!! I would NOT come here on a first date. Garlic noodles + first date = guaranteed breath disaster. Unless, of course, you're trying to get out of kissing someone. Then good God, order the garlic noodles already!

The veggies were okay. Nothing special. 

It's clear that this is one of those restaurants where you need to know what to order. Not every food on the menu is created equal. But man, the good food here is GOOD FOOD. 

Oh yeah- dessert was great, too! I got the mango cheesecake and my friend got the creme brulee. I ate both and enjoyed them both greatly :D

excerpts: The garlic noodles are good, but not as orgasmic as everyone describes it to be.
They are garlicky, but I didn't like the choice of noodles
, I'm sure there are better options out there.
Appetizers are good (stay away from dumplings, better at Kingdom of Dumpling) but expensive for the price.
Stuffed squid was surprisingly delish!
The calamari/squid was cooked perfectly, there was a crunch and not chewy at all.
garlic noodles.author: Vanessa K.
garlic noodles.review:
Definitely the roast crab any other crab is not worth your time and money. The garlic noodles are good, but not as orgasmic as everyone describes it to be. They are garlicky, but I didn't like the choice of noodles, I'm sure there are better options out there.  Appetizers are good (stay away from dumplings, better at Kingdom of Dumpling) but expensive for the price. Stuffed squid was surprisingly delish! The calamari/squid was cooked perfectly, there was a crunch and not chewy at all. Great tomato sauce flavor and the stuffing was simple yet balanced. 

Stay AWAY from the saigon beef, worse dish ever! Do go for the shaken beef.

Desserts are nothing to wow about - creme brulee, fried banana with ice cream and molten chocolate cake. Pretty standard.

excerpts: Nothing can beat the roast crab and garlic noodles...especially those garlic noodles.
They're more  like crack noodles-extremely addicting.
I love how the noodles' garlic flavor is not overpowering and just a bit sweet.
Also the texture is perfect.
As for the crab it is good, however, my dad can make it just the same.
garlic noodles.author: Stef B.
garlic noodles.review:
Thanh Long has been a family favorite of ours for awhile now. We would dine here for birthdays, graduations, anniversaries etc.

Nothing can beat the roast crab and garlic noodles...especially those garlic noodles. They're more  like crack noodles-extremely addicting. I love how the noodles' garlic flavor is not overpowering and just a bit sweet. Also the texture is perfect. As for the crab it is good, however, my dad can make it just the same. Also I recommend the salt & pepper calamari. 

I have been to another one of the Anh Family restaurants--Crustacean on Polk St but I like Thanh Long a lot better. I prefer the service, food, and ambiance. 

This is one of my top 5 favorite restaurants.

excerpts: I had garlic noodles and the roasted crab!!
The noodles were good but a bit dry.
The crab was good.
garlic noodles.author: Felicia W.
garlic noodles.review: April 18th was my first visit to Thanh Long!! My husband surprised me for our wedding anniversary. It was everything that everyone said it was.....AMAZING!! I had garlic noodles and the roasted crab!! The noodles were good but a bit dry. The crab was good. My husband hand the tiger prawns and fried rice. It was good. I loved our appitizer. It was the shrimp toast. We made a reservation and were seated right away. I do suggest arriving early. Parking is very hard. They do have valet for additional 12$. It is a bit pricey but the food is well worth it!!

excerpts: The garlic noodles was just as nice.
I am impressed for sure!!!!
garlic noodles.author: cindy w.
garlic noodles.review: The best crab I have ever eaten in my life. The roasted crab had such addictive flavors that I couldn't get enough!  The garlic noodles was just as nice.   I am impressed for sure!!!!

excerpts: The Roast Crab and the Garlic Noodles.
When served, looks beautiful.
The whole crab resting on the platter.
The garlic noodles hot and fresh where you can smell all the garlic they used.
The crab was rubbed in a pepper/garlic sauce.
When I say rubbed, I mean RUBBED.
It was smothered in it....where my first bite was SALTY UP THE WAZOO!
Was I licking ocean water?
(Therefore, I gave it the 3 stars...plus everything is totally over priced!)
The crab was delicious, but everything started tasting really salty.
The garlic noodles were good I must say.
Not something I'd crave for, but they were good.
Also....not good enough for 10$ a plate!
garlic noodles.author: Jennifer C.
garlic noodles.review:
The anterior decor does not do the interior justice. On the outside, looks pretty ghettOO, but inside it's quite elegant and bustling. The first reaction coming here and seeing people was that it is a high-class version of Boiling Crab with people in their white bibs. 
I have to say service is AWESOME. Someone is always coming to refill water, replace napkins, take away shell bowls, etc. They also dealt with me wanting pictures.

Bro's birthday so we had to try the favorites. The Roast Crab and the Garlic Noodles. When served, looks beautiful. The whole crab resting on the platter. The garlic noodles hot and fresh where you can smell all the garlic they used. 
The crab was rubbed in a pepper/garlic sauce. When I say rubbed, I mean RUBBED. It was smothered in it....where my first bite was SALTY UP THE WAZOO! Was I licking ocean water? (Therefore, I gave it the 3 stars...plus everything is totally over priced!) The crab was delicious, but everything started tasting really salty.
The garlic noodles were good I must say. Not something I'd crave for, but they were good. Also....not good enough for 10$ a plate! Dang Longs, noodles are cheap...slap on a little more!

The eggplant dish was pleasantly delicious! I think that may have been the best bet of the meal. Crisp shell on the eggplant along with chicken, shrimp, and veggies.

We also ordered the garlic bread (got half a baguette for 8$ with absolutely no garlic flavor on it...) and the spring rolls (2 rolls cut into 4 for 8$)......can I say that it is a RIP ROLL OFF!!

Anyway, it's good to try once. The second time, go to Boiling Crab please. Half the price, much satisfying food and seafood!

AIN'T GOIN TO LONG FOR A LONG TIME!

excerpts: The garlic noodles are good but a little oily.
I'm sure there are tons of butter in the noodles to give it that rich flavor.
The place is a bit pricier than lets say..
PPQ which has great crab.
The service and decor of Thanh Long is a bit fancier than most places that serves crab this way.
garlic noodles.author: Shirley T.
garlic noodles.review:
I think I expected way too much from Thanh Long.  Food is decent and it is known of its garlic noodle and crab.  My favorite is probably the Tamarind Crab. The sauce gave it a tarty-kick which is a plus in my book.  The garlic noodles are good but a little oily.  I'm sure there are tons of butter in the noodles to give it that rich flavor.  The place is a bit pricier than lets say..PPQ which has great crab.  The service and decor of Thanh Long is a bit fancier than most places that serves crab this way.  Think Asian steak house without the steak but crab in its place.  

All in all, I enjoyed my dinner.  It's pricey and any other Chinese dishes there are quite small in portion size.  Each plate is probably only good for 2, maybe 3 people. It might be wise to order duplicates of the dishes if you're with a big party.

excerpts: Roast crab + garlic noodles:
WOWOWOW!
I like wearing the bibs they give us =) makes me feel like i can dig in properly.
BRING GUM.
1 Salt and Pepper Calamari + 2 Roast Crabs + 2 Garlic Noodles + 1 Shaken Beef + 1 Fried Banana
garlic noodles.author: Samantha L.
garlic noodles.review:
My family and i made reservations for 4  for a sunday night.  As usual, it took us a while to find parking.. and had to make several rounds. But Thanh Long has a valet service right out front if you don't want to go looking for your own space. I'm not sure where they park the cars though. Down by the beach?!

The moment you walk in you smell the amazing aroma from all the highly seasoned dishes!  You may dress anywhere from casual - dressy. There really is no dress code here.

Salt and pepper calamari: definitely a lot of salt and pepper. i'm not too big of a fan of calamari but it came out nice and hot. i was really waiting for the crab though..

Roast crab + garlic noodles: WOWOWOW! I like wearing the bibs they give us =) makes me feel like i can dig in properly. BRING GUM. the garlic is strongggggg.

Fried Banana a la mode: the  vanilla bean ice cream is just sooo good with the fried banana. The banana is warm and oozing deliciousness. Get a spoonful with a little bit of ice cream and a bit of the frozen banana = heaven.

1 Salt and Pepper Calamari + 2 Roast Crabs + 2 Garlic Noodles + 1 Shaken Beef + 1 Fried Banana a la mode= $148 + tax and tip

I left so full that i fell asleep when i got home. Uh yeah, i ate that much..

excerpts: I was very stoked to meet with the garlic noodles again.
garlic noodles.author: Chanel H.
garlic noodles.review:
Growing up, this place has always been my favorite. Unfortunately, I wasn't able to come here as often as I could. In August, that was my first time in about 10 years coming back to this place. I was very stoked to meet with the garlic noodles again. ;)

Sadly, the meal gave my family and I food poisoning. We called in to complain and they said it was probably something else we ate. They were wrong; we kind of ate at this place as lunner (like lunch and dinner) so we didn't eat anything else that day. A couple more times, and they told us that other people had complained that day too and they'd figure something out.

They never did. That shows how much they care about their customers, right? Never again.

excerpts: Crab + garlic noodles = the greatest satisfaction known to mankind.
I would have writhed on the floor under the table in pleasure at the sheer deliciousness of my meal were it socially acceptable.
garlic noodles.author: Tini T.
garlic noodles.review: Crab + garlic noodles = the greatest satisfaction known to mankind. I would have writhed on the floor under the table in pleasure at the sheer deliciousness of my meal were it socially acceptable.

excerpts: The roasted garlic crab really is as good as everyone says it is and the garlic noodles really are out of this world delicious, greasy and garlicky.
The shakened beef was also really tender.
There are a couple of other restaurants that imitate their crab and garlic noodles that I've tried, they are almost as good and cheaper and more centrally located.
So those restaurants are definitely worth going  instead if you think this is too expensive or too far.
garlic noodles.author: Hana H.
garlic noodles.review:
This is the sister restaurant of the really fancy Crustacean in Beverly Hills. It serves almost the same dishes, but with much cheaper price and without the stuck up vibe like everyone is judging your table etiquette. 

The roasted garlic crab really is as good as everyone says it is and the garlic noodles really are out of this world delicious, greasy and garlicky.The shakened beef was also really tender. Never really tried anything else here. 

The environment is really not classy at all, which I don't really mind since I'm sure I don't look that classy trying to devour the meat off of the crab legs. 

There are a couple of other restaurants that imitate their crab and garlic noodles that I've tried, they are almost as good and cheaper and more centrally located. So those restaurants are definitely worth going  instead if you think this is too expensive or too far.

excerpts:
+ They serve crab and garlic noodles
+ The servers are helpful and attentive

MEH
=

CONS
- The crab, coupled with the garlic noodles are extremely salty.
- Even with a reservation, we had to wait 25 minutes to be seated.
- The level of noise is quite high and it gets crowded like no other
garlic noodles.author: Shamim I.
garlic noodles.review:
Meh. 

PROS
+ They serve crab and garlic noodles
+ The servers are helpful and attentive

MEH
= The crab can be really salty or decent. It's hit or miss.

CONS
- The crab, coupled with the garlic noodles are extremely salty. 
- Even with a reservation, we had to wait 25 minutes to be seated.
- The level of noise is quite high and it gets crowded like no other

excerpts: Between two people, we ordered Thanh Long Mussels, Roast Crab, and Garlic Noodles.
garlic noodles.author: Jenny T.
garlic noodles.review:
I love this restaurant because the food is so good!

My suggestion is to come here early for dinner (around 6pm) to find good parking and to beat the crowd. I made reservations for 2 at 6:30pm but we actually got to the restaurant about 15 minutes early. We were seated right away.

Our server was friendly and checked in on us at the right times.

Between two people, we ordered Thanh Long Mussels, Roast Crab, and Garlic Noodles. I recommend trying out all three of these dishes because they were so delicious.

I will definitely return.

excerpts: You might need a coronary bypass after going through the Thanh Long Mussels, Roast Crab, and Garlic Noodles, but it's worth every cent of your health insurance deductible if you have it.
You see the oil on the plates,  but with every bite, your senses don't register it as "just" oil.
Instead, a bite of the garlic noodles dressed with some drippings from the roast crab feels like your mouth is being coated in silken, mouth-filling luxury.
Instead, a bite of the garlic noodles dressed with some drippings from the roast crab feels like your mouth is being coated in silken, mouth-filling luxury.
garlic noodles.author: Sam W.
garlic noodles.review:
When this place was recommend to me, I was unassuming and figured, "Oh, ok, Vietnamese seafood joint...should be the usual family-style Asian restaurant."  So, we went on ahead and made reservations for the day before.  The day of, I see this sort of hideous, unassuming exterior--it looks like any generic abandoned Richmond/Sunset shop/boutique.  When we enter, it's a completely different story--dimmed lighting, modern decor, tablecloths, etc.  We are ~10 minutes late (parking was a pain in the neighborhood), yet they seat us promptly.  

The staff is friendly and helpful (they helped us pick out items for our group and make recommendations based on our party size). I order a bottle of wine that ends up being a twist-cap, but our waiter still makes the motions and lets me sample first.  When it comes time for eating, the staff helps us put on our bibs, brings extra napkins without having to be asked, and replaces our plates and bowls whenever things started to get messy.  Oh yeah, and brownie points on attentiveness--my water never goes empty.  (Sort of silly, but small gestures like these make for a good impression with me.)

The food itself, in summary, is rich and filling in the most gluttonous fashion. We had the Mango Salad (warm with a perfect hint of charred flavor), and the Traditional Vietnamese Salad (it was good, but the other dishes overshadow this one). You might need a coronary bypass after going through the Thanh Long Mussels, Roast Crab, and Garlic Noodles, but it's worth every cent of your health insurance deductible if you have it.  You see the oil on the plates,  but with every bite, your senses don't register it as "just" oil.  Instead, a bite of the garlic noodles dressed with some drippings from the roast crab feels like your mouth is being coated in silken, mouth-filling luxury.  As you swallow, you are overwhelmed with a noise in your head--that noise is your brain screaming, "MORE MORE MORE!!!"

Pure crack.

When the bill comes, we see gratuity tagged on, but it's pre-tax and pre-alcohol (as with everything else, Thanh Long gets it right).  When you divide everything up for the type of service and food we experienced here, it comes to about $40-ish per person, and worth every darn penny.  

Thanh Long, we'll definitely be back.

excerpts: Sadly, Garlic noodles and Roasted Crab (what we really came for) left much to be desired, disappointing.
garlic noodles.author: Cindy L.
garlic noodles.review: Thanh Long Mussels were perfect appetizers, succulent and buttery paired with toast. Sadly, Garlic noodles and Roasted Crab (what we really came for) left much to be desired, disappointing. We also ordered the Vegetarian Delight just to have a veggie dish, can't say much for stir fried frozen veggies. That being said, ambience was warm and welcoming and the service was excellent. As one might expect, we left with mixed feelings.

excerpts: Quick tip - Garlic roasted crab + garlic noodles =
Everyone orders the crab and garlic noodles.
Those are the most popular items on the menu.
Eating crabs are generally a lot of work but the amount of spices and garlic on it taste so good!
garlic noodles.author: Ryan R.
garlic noodles.review:
Quick tip - Garlic roasted crab + garlic noodles = $50 & bad breathe. 

This place isn't cheap, but the food is so good. I would only come here for special occasions tho for financial reasons. Everyone orders the crab and garlic noodles. Those are the most popular items on the menu. Eating crabs are generally a lot of work but the amount of spices and garlic on it taste so good!

excerpts: Roast crab and garlic noodles to die for.
The crab was little pricey but totally worth it.
the garlic noodles are delicious and not overwhelmingly garlic-y like other places.
There is usually a wait so try to get there early.
garlic noodles.author: Rory T.
garlic noodles.review: Roast crab and garlic noodles to die for. The crab was little pricey but totally worth it. the garlic noodles are delicious and not overwhelmingly garlic-y like other places. There is usually a wait so try to get there early.

excerpts: and I came to Thanh Long because we heard about their famous roast crab and garlic noodles!
And of course, for our entrees, we shared one roast crab and an order of garlic noodles (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/z9CN58fSrA46ggyb6OnCnQ?select=1bMAC3tQqYuN0JkIZRKVqQ).
And of course, for our entrees, we shared one roast crab and an order of garlic noodles (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/z9CN58fSrA46ggyb6OnCnQ?select=1bMAC3tQqYuN0JkIZRKVqQ).
To be perfectly honest, I wasn't that impressed with the roast crab.
It was definitely juicy, meaty, and big, but the flavors weren't that great.
It definitely didn't live up to all the hype.
On the other hand, the garlic noodles were to-die-for!
I'm a huge fan of garlic and the garlic noodles were sooo soft and garlicky.
I've tried garlic noodles once before and the garlic flavor wasn't as distinct as the garlic flavor in Thanh Long's garlic noodles.
I give their garlic noodles 5 stars!
I'll probably try the colossal royal tiger prawns with garlic noodles next time.
garlic noodles.author: Lien T.
garlic noodles.review:
Yep, you've guessed it...my boyfriend and I came to Thanh Long because we heard about their famous roast crab and garlic noodles!

We arrived shortly after they opened at 5pm and there was no wait. Once we were seated, we noticed the full bar and decided to order a couple of drinks to start off our night. I ordered the fleur de mango and the boyfriend ordered the Hanoi sunset (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/z9CN58fSrA46ggyb6OnCnQ?select=5AnN3N7w7JTwsWHvz8rcug). The fleur de mango was really good. The rum flavor was subtle and masked by the freshly blended orange juice and sweet mango puree. I had a sip of the Hanoi sunset and it tasted ridiculously strong. It tasted as though I was sipping on a straight shot of alcohol. My boyfriend shared the same feelings--he had to force himself to chug down the alcohol laden martini.

For appetizers, we had the chicken satay (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/z9CN58fSrA46ggyb6OnCnQ?select=XH78FALuoyCY-PemWsm18g) and salmon carpaccio (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/z9CN58fSrA46ggyb6OnCnQ?select=g2SQ3ayDT3W9Fm9seQQEVw). The chicken satay was pretty disappointing--three skewers of grilled chicken came out on a plate with no dipping sauce. The chicken was a little on the dry side and it tasted really bland. Usually when I eat chicken satay, it is always served with a side of satay peanut sauce for dipping. Oh well, the tasty salmon carpaccio made up for the disappointment. I love refreshing dishes like the salmon carpaccio, as the flavors of the simple ingredients are truly highlighted. The buttered-bread, capers, and lightly lemon-marinated salmon all combined deliciously.

And of course, for our entrees, we shared one roast crab and an order of garlic noodles (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/z9CN58fSrA46ggyb6OnCnQ?select=1bMAC3tQqYuN0JkIZRKVqQ). To be perfectly honest, I wasn't that impressed with the roast crab. It was definitely juicy, meaty, and big, but the flavors weren't that great. It definitely didn't live up to all the hype. On the other hand, the garlic noodles were to-die-for! I'm a huge fan of garlic and the garlic noodles were sooo soft and garlicky. I've tried garlic noodles once before and the garlic flavor wasn't as distinct as the garlic flavor in Thanh Long's garlic noodles. I give their garlic noodles 5 stars!

My boyfriend and I had an overall good experience. We enjoyed the intimate, but comfortable ambiance. The customer service was excellent and extremely attentive. I'll probably try the colossal royal tiger prawns with garlic noodles next time.

P.S.
Cheers to my 100th review! :D

excerpts: Garlic noodles:
They were so good, it is one of my favorite garlic noodles I have tried so far!
It is a must if you come here.
garlic noodles.author: Michelle C.
garlic noodles.review:
my boyfriend heard about this place from one of his co-workers, so he decided to take me. When we first drove by we thought it was close because the lights were dim and we did not see anyone in there.  

The setting was romantic, which is a nice place for and anniversary or a date.

Food: Salt and Pepper Calamari: It was delicious. They were big pieces, but my boyfriend and I finished it really quick.

Garlic noodles: They were so good, it is one of my favorite garlic noodles I have tried so far! It is a must if you come here. It even out shines the crab. 

Drunken Crab: When we received it there was one body, but two crabs worth of claws and legs. The pieces were pretty big too, so if your not really a crab person 2 people can share.  However, the flavor was kind of bland. To us it just tastes like boiled crab, but it was still delicious.

Dessert- Chocolate Lava Cake: Dessert is my favorite part of any meal. This dessert made me smile, after the first bite. The chocolate just melts in your mouth. It was so delicious! It makes my mouth water by just thinking about it.  Also, the next day my boyfriend was still thinking about how good this dessert was.

excerpts: My ginger infused vodka cocktail complimented the roast crab and garlic noodles perfectly.
garlic noodles.author: Deanna C.
garlic noodles.review:
We started with the tempura coconut prawns with orange-mustard sauce. Crunchy, tangy and a great beginning to a perfect meal. 
My ginger infused vodka cocktail complimented the roast crab and garlic noodles perfectly. My companion had the drunken crab which was also delectable. We didn't talk much over dinner because our meal was so good it makes it impossible to speak intelligently. We mostly ooo-ed and ahh-ed over the amazingly simple and delicious food. 
We ended with dessert which was also delish: chocolate lava cake and creme brulee.
The service is fast and efficient. They remove your crab shells regularily and bring you a hot towel to clean up with at the end. It's a messy business eating a whole crab but they make it easy and relaxed and it is sooo worth it.

excerpts: The garlic noodles were decent, but not excellent.
garlic noodles.author: John M.
garlic noodles.review:
The food was very good. Anything with the dungeness crab is exceptional. It's a bit pricey (one dungeness crab was about $40, although this fluctuates based on the market price), but well worth it in terms of good taste as well as serving size. These crabs are HUGE. It was easily like eating two lobsters. The salted calamari was exceptional as well. The garlic noodles were decent, but not excellent. Overall I'd give the food 4.5 or maybe even 5 stars. 

Our waitress took about 20 minutes to give us our check, so I kind of felt obligated to only give this restaurant a 4 star review instead of a 5 star review for that reason.

excerpts: Roast crab, and garlic noodles!
That's it....
that's all you need.
garlic noodles.author: Marvella W.
garlic noodles.review: Always a favorite.  I've been coming here with my sister ever since they've opened.  We love coming here for birthday celebrations.  Prices have doubled since they first opened.  Roast crab, and garlic noodles! That's it....that's all you need.

excerpts: Overall, the roasted crab and garlic noodles just can't be beat when you're eating here.
I would, however, say that both dishes are drenched in oil, so you should consider that it's not the most ideal place to eat if you happen to be trying to lose weight.
But if you're like me, which means either you're on a diet
and you have no self control
OR anything delicious does not count as something "bad for you" in your book, then seriously get your butt over there and eat to your heart's content.
I mean, honestly, it's well worth it.
Delicious crab, great service, AND a plastic disposable bib?
Uhhhh...
YES PLEASE.
garlic noodles.author: Jeani L.
garlic noodles.review:
I know. I know. I'm not going to say anything new. All the other reviewers before me have already pointed out the obvious. This. Place. Is. Good. I always always always get the roasted crab. I've had friends try the other varieties, such as the drunken crab, and it's good, but there's a reason they're FAMOUS for their roasted crab. And frankly, I'm not one to rock the boat when it comes to sticking to what I know won't disappoint. 

They're actually the sister restaurant to Crustacean. I believe both are owned by the same family, and it's apparent in their cuisine. The decor differs a bit. Thanh Long is just a tad less pomp and circumstance than its counterpart, but the food and service are just as good. I did recently try the shaken beef, which was absolutely delicious. Tender, juicy, and wonderfully flavorful, it's a tad sweet and perfect with rice, it would be a good alternative if you're allergic to seafood or just not in the mood for crab (for shame). 

Overall, the roasted crab and garlic noodles just can't be beat when you're eating here. I would, however, say that both dishes are drenched in oil, so you should consider that it's not the most ideal place to eat if you happen to be trying to lose weight. But if you're like me, which means either you're on a diet and you have no self control OR anything delicious does not count as something "bad for you" in your book, then seriously get your butt over there and eat to your heart's content. I mean, honestly, it's well worth it. Delicious crab, great service, AND a plastic disposable bib? Uhhhh... YES PLEASE.

excerpts: The garlic noodles here have somewhat more of a bite and stronger garlic flavor compared to PPQ Dungeness Island.
However, I have to say the crab, albeit meatier, was not nearly as flavorful.

Overall, based on pure food comparisons, PPQ Dungeness Island wins in my book purely based on the crab's flavoring, but Thanh Long may actually serve a better crab and definitely has better garlic noodles.
If you're looking for crab on a Tuesday, this is your place...
(cuz it seems everywhere else is closed!)
garlic noodles.author: Gene C.
garlic noodles.review:
I came here with a friend from out of town looking for a competitor to PPQ Dungeness Island. The restaurant is situated in a fairly residential area, but then again, I guess most restaurants in the Sunset/Richmond area qualify.  The restaurant's layout is a little interesting, as the back portion of the restaurant was walled off leaving a nook for 6 tables and gave the restaurant a closed-off feel.  The frozen cocktail my friend ordered was mostly sweet without much alcohol, disappointing even for her.

The jumbo prawn wontons are not jumbo by any account (granted, I had eaten at Anchor Oyster Bar earlier that day, so my sense of proportion may be completely skewed), and you can barely taste the pancetta at all, a very forgettable dish.  The Buddha roll, on the other hand, was like a slight variation on a traditional Vietnamese spring roll filled with tasty daikon and black mushrooms to give it a more earthy flavor.  The Dungeness crab puffs were like crab rangoons on crack, filled with delicious herb cheese and a large quantity of crab, only limited by their size.

The garlic noodles here have somewhat more of a bite and stronger garlic flavor compared to PPQ Dungeness Island. However, I have to say the crab, albeit meatier, was not nearly as flavorful.  We ordered the roast crab which, although mildly peppery and actually with a good amount of sweet meat, otherwise was not as heavily seasoned.  Strangely enough, our crab was actually a little cool by the time it got to our table.  Also, the seafood fried rice was lacking in salt.  Thankfully, they brought some chili sambal to our table upon request.  Our server was really very nice and attentive.

Overall, based on pure food comparisons, PPQ Dungeness Island wins in my book purely based on the crab's flavoring, but Thanh Long may actually serve a better crab and definitely has better garlic noodles.  If you're looking for crab on a Tuesday, this is your place... (cuz it seems everywhere else is closed!)

excerpts: The garlic noodles were every bit as tasty as everyone says.
garlic noodles.author: Kristen S.
garlic noodles.review:
If you ever find yourself staring at the menu, debating between the roasted and the drunk crab - definitely order the roasted.  It's much more flavorful.  The drunken crab tasted a little bland, if you ask me.

The garlic noodles were every bit as tasty as everyone says.  Worth the carb calories.

Overall I think it warrants neither the 4-star rating nor the hefty price.  It's really nothing special.  I've seen lots of Cantonese places do it much, MUCH better.

excerpts: We complemented the crab with garlic noodles and Jasmine rice.
The garlic noodles are the best as compared to other ones we've had at other Vietnamese restaurants.
Not oily with just the right amount of garlic.
garlic noodles.author: Al L.
garlic noodles.review:
Our friend from Chicago is in town and we had dinner at Thanh Long to satisfy her craving for crab at one her favorite restaurants in SF.

We were 15 minutes late for our reservations and were worried when we notice people waiting in front and that the restaurant was full.  The maitre d' said no problem had kept our table open, when they could have given it away.

We ordered the tamarind crab, which is cooked in tamarind and tomato with other seasonings. The crab was perfectly cooked and the tamarind sauce with its slight sweetness complemented it perfectly. We've had the roasted crab before and felt the garlic sauce was too overpowering and took away from the delicate taste of the crab.

We complemented the crab with garlic noodles and Jasmine rice.  The garlic noodles are the best as compared to other ones we've had at other Vietnamese restaurants.  Not oily with just the right amount of garlic.  Always trying to replicate it at home, but just haven't come close to it.

Finished our meal with the fried bananas topped with a large scoop of vanilla ice cream.  This was delicious as evidenced by our clean plate.  

The wait staff was attentive and filled water glasses and efficiently cleared plates and bowls.

Overall, I would rate Thanh Long 4.5 stars....the food was very good with very efficient service.

excerpts: I remember the garlic noodles & prawns were just about the best fine dining food I'd ever had.
Upon returning over the weekend, I was just about equally impressed but not quite...
I feel that the service has become a little too casual, they end of the night garlic noodles didn't seem to be of the best freshness.
But the truth is, every one else's food looked amazing and the aromas are to die for!!
I will very likely return, but I hope they consider being just a little more consistent.
Especially for infrequent visitors who have them on the mind for 12 years!
No hard feelings.
The place just needs a new fresh look and a little better service.
garlic noodles.author: Lauren M.
garlic noodles.review: This place has been on my mind to return to since 2002.  I remember the garlic noodles & prawns were just about the best fine dining food I'd ever had.  Upon returning over the weekend, I was just about equally impressed but not quite... I feel that the service has become a little too casual, they end of the night garlic noodles didn't seem to be of the best freshness.  But the truth is, every one else's food looked amazing and the aromas are to die for!!  I will very likely return, but I hope they consider being just a little more consistent.  Especially for infrequent visitors who have them on the mind for 12 years! No hard feelings.  The place just needs a new fresh look and a little better service.

excerpts: Thang Long, known for their French-inspired Vietnamese cuisine, serves some of the BEST garlic crabs and BEST garlic noodles.
* Roast Crab & Garlic Noodles: If you love overdosing on garlic and butter, you will love the crab and garlic noodles here.
garlic noodles.author: Judy C.
garlic noodles.review:
My all-time favorite San Francisco restaurant is situated right here in Outer Sunset.  Thang Long, known for their French-inspired Vietnamese cuisine, serves some of the BEST garlic crabs and BEST garlic noodles.

Once in awhile I get to splurge here, and luckily for my birthday -- my thoughtful friends brought me here to celebrate.  Together, we shared:

* Salmon Carpaccio: My favorite appetizer from Thanh Long!  The lemon-cured salmon was perfectly marinated and not at all "fishy."
* Salt & Pepper Calamari: Calamari usually all tastes the same at different restaurants.  However, here, they go easy on the batter and oil to give an overall light taste.
* Mango Salad: This is was my least favorite dish.  Warm mango slices and seafood on top of cold salad is not appetizing whatsoever. 
* Roast Crab & Garlic Noodles: If you love overdosing on garlic and butter, you will love the crab and garlic noodles here.  Their infamous secret sauce really makes Thanh Long what they are. 

Other noteworthy dishes I've tried and loved: Shrimp Toast, Shaken Beef, and Colossal Royal Tiger Prawns. 

Love, love, love.

excerpts: Crab / Garlic noodles is their business and they do it well!
Can't vouch for the crab (i'm allergic), but the garlic noodles and shaken beef are both well seasoned and delish.
I'm officially a fan of this place!
garlic noodles.author: Krystal C.
garlic noodles.review: We've been back several times since my last review.  I have to say, service never dissapoints! The staff is quick, on point and accommodating. Parking is hit or miss, but they offer valet for $12. Crab / Garlic noodles is their business and they do it well! Can't vouch for the crab (i'm allergic), but the garlic noodles and shaken beef are both well seasoned and delish. I'm officially a fan of this place!

excerpts:
Garlic noodles - delicious
Shaken beef - a bit pricey for the lack of beef
Sea Bass
garlic noodles.author: Albert L.
garlic noodles.review:
Came here for my birthday dinner with my family.  I was able to get reservations a few days in advance.  Parking wasn't as bad as people made it out to be.  I was able to find parking about 2 blocks away.  Was seated about 10 minutes after checking in with our entire party.

Ordered (main courses 2 stars)
VIetnamese Salad - fresh 
Beef Satay - nothing out of the ordinary
Roast Crab - came out cold
Garlic noodles - delicious
Shaken beef - a bit pricey for the lack of beef
Sea Bass - it had good flavor to it and was not over cooked

Desserts (5 stars)
Banana cake - delicious
Chocolate lava cake - melted in your mouth, not too heavy

When we got home, I had to drink a bottle of water because of all the MSG.  -1 star

Overall, I'm not sure we would come back here as the crab was not extraordinary.  I've had better crab in Singapore and Boiling crab.  It's pretty expensive for what it is.  It is aight and would recommend everyone to try it once.

excerpts: We ordered the calamari appetizer, the roasted garlic crab, the drunken crab, the garlic noodles with roasted tiger prawns, and the garlic noodles by themselves.
Hands down, it was all about the roasted crab and the garlic noodles!
The drunken crab is good too, but I loved the flavor of the roasted garlic crab.
I'm still trying to figure out how the heck they got the flavor into the crab.
The garlic noodles were the perfect compliment to the meal.
The garlic noodles were so simple but just so flavorful without being salty.
I could taste the garlic and the buttery sauce.
I loved the flavor of the roasted tiger prawns.
garlic noodles.author: Jacqueline C.
garlic noodles.review:
My husband and I went to this place to celebrate a friend's birthday. I'm so glad we did!

First off, this place gets packed so do make a reservation. Don't expect to just show up and get a table. 

We ordered the calamari appetizer, the roasted garlic crab, the drunken crab, the garlic noodles with roasted tiger prawns, and the garlic noodles by themselves. Hands down, it was all about the roasted crab and the garlic noodles! The drunken crab is good too, but I loved the flavor of the roasted garlic crab. I'm still trying to figure out how the heck they got the flavor into the crab. The garlic noodles were the perfect compliment to the meal. The garlic noodles were so simple but just so flavorful without being salty. I could taste the garlic and the buttery sauce. I loved the flavor of the roasted tiger prawns. Everything was yummy! 

We finished the meal with the banana cake. It came with a little bit of vanilla ice cream and some whipped cream. We were stuffed but that didn't stop us from finishing the banana cake. 

The service was attentive, the atmosphere was way more upscale than most Vietnamese places, and the food was phenomenal. This place is a bit pricey but I will say I think it was worth every bite! I will be back here again soon!

excerpts: My friend brought me here--he had previously had the garlic noodles and some crab soaked in butter, and he wanted to try the full crab.
The only reason this place gets more than one star is that my friend liked his garlic noodles again (an easy dish to make at home).
Save your money and go to one of the many better, cheaper Vietnamese restaurants in town.
garlic noodles.author: ken w.
garlic noodles.review:
Some places don't deserve their popularity. My friend brought me here--he had previously had the garlic noodles and some crab soaked in butter, and he wanted to try the full crab.

Hearing the price of $45 for the crab, my friend changed his mind and ordered the noodles again and some squid. 

The menu is tiny. Mainly a few seafood dishes and some odds and ends. I ordered the Vegetarian's Delight, and it was the most flavorless dish I can remember ordering at any restaurant for years, the worst vegetarian's delight I've had. The sauce was watery tomato juice, basically unseasoned, hardly even any salt (no salt on the tables). 

When the waiter came to ask whether everything was OK, I told him, No the dish has basically no flavor. He offered to steam the vegetables. Strange! Does this waiter know anything about food? This is the point where most waiters would offer to replace the dish, but no, this waiter seemed quite clueless. So I asked for some condiments (many Vietnamese restaurants have LOTS of different condiments). All he had was hot sauce and soy sauce, so I had to make the dish edible (barely) with those. This was a tasteless plate of 30 cents worth of ingredients, priced at $14,95, way more than I've ever paid for veggie delight. I call it Vegetarian's Despair.

As an appetizer, we had the Buddha Roll. It was small, and the "peanut sauce" was basically intensely garlicy soy sauce with a couple other ingredients. Disappointing also, though not terrible.

This place apparently just throws gobs of garlic and butter at most of their dishes, and people flock to it. Lame. Why would anyone go here when there are literally hundreds of amazing, inexpensive East Asian restaurants in SF? 

The decor has a dingy feel, with uninspired decorations. 

The only reason this place gets more than one star is that my friend liked his garlic noodles again (an easy dish to make at home). Save your money and go to one of the many better, cheaper Vietnamese restaurants in town.

excerpts: You must get the garlic crab, garlic prawns in garlic noodles.
When I don't feel like making the same garlic noodles myself, I will go to Thanh Long.
garlic noodles.author: Sandra L.
garlic noodles.review:
You must get the garlic crab, garlic prawns in garlic noodles. I've tried a bunch of other dishes but these are the two best items on the menu.

They have awesome mixed drinks. 

Beware, the bill can add up fast.

When I don't feel like making the same garlic noodles myself, I will go to Thanh Long.

excerpts: The garlic noodles were really good,but it was not worth the money (just coat noodles with garlic butter, people).
Most of the food here was really oily, so be sure to use the wet naps AND wash your hands!
garlic noodles.author: Angela C.
garlic noodles.review: Thank you, Airport Cab Driver, for making this recommendation. This place is really  expensive, but taste the crabs and the prawns and you will know why. It's a little out of the way considering my hotel was like an hour bus ride away, but was worth the trek. My friends and I easily dropped $45-50 a person ordered a few dishes to share. I loved the crab even though crab is a pain in the ass to eat. The garlic noodles were really good,but it was not worth the money (just coat noodles with garlic butter, people). Most of the food here was really oily, so be sure to use the wet naps AND wash your hands!

excerpts: The only redeeming quality of the plate were the garlic noodles everyone here is raving about.
They were flavorful, albeit slathered with garlic and sesame oil, so how can you go wrong.
garlic noodles.author: Rem K.
garlic noodles.review:
I have traveled across South East Asia multiple times and consider myself a gourmand when it comes to the cuisine of that region. The food at Thanh Long was sub-par at best, especially considering the prices. I didn't get the crab because none of the three offered preparations were authentic (Garlic, Drunken and Tamarind- westernized versions of a mash-up of a variety of SE Asian flavors) and it was mid-May, which means Dungeness crab was approaching the tail end of its season. I decided instead to try their other seafood offerings-

Soft Shell Crab- Minuscule portions, looked like the chef took absolutely not time or effort in preparing them. They would have tasted better if they were sold on a street cart by the beach and I had some sandy grit in my mouth to go along with them. Inauthentic, Maine style soft shell crab, but not meaty.

Prawn Toast- This was passable, but how can you go wrong with bread smothered with garlic and cheese with some shrimp. Probably the easiest thing to make. Again, completely inauthentic. No sesame, soy or scallion flavors. White bread and cheese? WTF? Fail.

Red Snapper- Where do I start. I expected this dish to be prepared with a whole fish wrapped in some sort of banana leaf, but it instead arrived in the form of two limp, overcooked fillets. The sauce was too thin and not flavorful, it lacked a sense of completion. The only redeeming quality of the plate were the garlic noodles everyone here is raving about. They were flavorful, albeit slathered with garlic and sesame oil, so how can you go wrong. The nature of this type of noodle preparation is to be a little soft, but these were overcooked and did not hold their texture/ collapsed on my fork.

Thanh Long- Don't do it, take your money elsewhere.

excerpts: The garlic noodles are some of the best noodles I've EVER had.
They alone are worth the visit.
I went during a very busy time but stood at the bar and all the servers were so nice!
All around a great experience.
garlic noodles.author: Lea H.
garlic noodles.review: The garlic noodles are some of the best noodles I've EVER had. They alone are worth the visit. I went during a very busy time but stood at the bar and all the servers were so nice! All around a great experience.

excerpts: Roast crab and garlic noodles.
garlic noodles.author: Yana B.
garlic noodles.review:
Roast crab and garlic noodles.

enough said.


P.S. - parking sucks so get there early. :)

excerpts: I really don't get the hype on the garlic noodles, but even after I had them at Crustacean, I just had to give it a second chance.
Next time maybe I'll do rice instead, as it goes good with the crab fat.
garlic noodles.author: Ron L.
garlic noodles.review:
It's already been said!

Crab, noodles, spicy eggplant, shaken beef, asparagus, salt pepper squid, Vietnamese salad.

I really don't get the hype on the garlic noodles, but even after I had them at Crustacean, I just had to give it a second chance.  Next time maybe I'll do rice instead, as it goes good with the crab fat.  Next time I'll also skip the squid, as it was more pepper and a bit soggy for me.

Crab does live up to the hype.  Splurge and get one for each person, and walk it off after dinner.  I'll be back for sure.

excerpts: I don't have much to add: delicious whole roast crab with excellent seasoning, and yummy garlic noodles.
The spicy eggplant dish was also a standout.
Don't be afraid to put on the bib and chow down on that succulent crab!
garlic noodles.author: Eden H.
garlic noodles.review:
I don't have much to add: delicious whole roast crab with excellent seasoning, and yummy garlic noodles. The spicy eggplant dish was also a standout. Don't be afraid to put on the bib and chow down on that succulent crab! Everyone else around you will be doing the same.

I went here for the first time last night with three other people, and it's a good thing we went early, because it ended up being packed!  A good place for groups and families.

excerpts: Get the crab and the garlic noodles and stop complaining.
You see the diners all hunched in seriousness over their meal.
It's delicious.
My kids will sit there and patiently go through the crab because it's that yummy.
Please wear the bib, your shirt will thank you.
When the waiter comes and ask whether you want parmesan on your noodles, do not say no.
garlic noodles.author: Grace C.
garlic noodles.review: My husband would always remind me when he could get the same crab for $10 back in the day. It's now...hmmm..$50?  Get the crab and the garlic noodles and stop complaining.  You see the diners all hunched in seriousness over their meal.  It's delicious.  My kids will sit there and patiently go through the crab because it's that yummy.  Please wear the bib, your shirt will thank you.  When the waiter comes and ask whether you want parmesan on your noodles, do not say no.

excerpts: My husband had the famous garlic noodles, which I tried and they were delicious as well.
My friend had the crab they are so famous for...
Which I also tried.
I have never had crab that was so savory and prepared so well-
garlic noodles.author: Vanessa F.
garlic noodles.review:
The service here was absolutely top-notch. The staff was very kind, polite, and accommodating. We came here because a friend had recommended it. I'm not as adventurous as I'd like to think I am, so this was not a place I would have naturally gravitated towards- but I am so glad we did!

The food was great. I had the Saigon Beef, which was filet mignon thinly sliced to perfection with a slice of bacon and onion wrapped up and cooked perfectly. The beef was on a bed of fresh greens, lightly grilled onions, and cherry tomatoes. My husband had the famous garlic noodles, which I tried and they were delicious as well. My friend had the crab they are so famous for... Which I also tried. I have never had crab that was so savory and prepared so well- and I am a big fan of crab. 

Overall, this place was delicious and the service was excellent. We stayed until the place closed, and no one rushed us or made us feel unwanted. Very kind people, and that matters a lot to me. If you are ever in the area and have not tried this place out, I definitely recommend it!

excerpts: They are known for their garlic noodles.
I have tried other dishes and the flavor is great.
If you don't mind spending a lot,  this place is a must try.
The place is romantic, you will walk seeing dimmed lights.
garlic noodles.author: Nancy T.
garlic noodles.review:
I have been there three times.  The first time was amazing,  everything tasted heavenly.  I recommend the roasted crab.  It's gigantic and really good.  They are known for their garlic noodles.  I have tried other dishes and the flavor is great.  If you don't mind spending a lot,  this place is a must try.  The place is romantic, you will walk seeing dimmed lights.  The service is decent.  

I want to add that.. Yes,  the food is amazing the first time, but after two or three times,  it isn't as good. I think it is over priced and parking can be difficult.

excerpts: Garlic noodles.
Not enough?

The crab is fresh and meaty while the garlic noodles are a great accompaniment to this dish; the noodles were a bit on the sticky/starchy side (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/z9CN58fSrA46ggyb6OnCnQ?select=UVMpGevOAtNkI5csC8LdpQ).
My friend even ordered an extra container of the garlic butter sauce for dipping (later taking the rest home).
The Fried Calamari appetizer came hot, but the flavor was okay... nothing spectacular (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/z9CN58fSrA46ggyb6OnCnQ?select=CLaIPDlObi1_v5ACPPQ1NA).
garlic noodles.author: Mike C.
garlic noodles.review:
Roasted Crab.  Need I say more?  Garlic noodles.  Not enough?  Shaken Beef, Fried Calamari, Banana Cake, and Fried Pineapple.  Well, as Porky Pig would say, "That's all folks!"  This is one of those "will try soon" spots for me.  My friend from the 808 chose this restaurant for a weekday dinner.  He'd been to Crustaceans, but, after a horrendous service experience, insisted on trying this, the original location.  
For me, the crab (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/z9CN58fSrA46ggyb6OnCnQ?select=XofCPzceEnZS1dKdCvP5iQ) rates a 3.5 star as I'm not a huge black pepper and butter fan.  The crab is fresh and meaty while the garlic noodles are a great accompaniment to this dish; the noodles were a bit on the sticky/starchy side (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/z9CN58fSrA46ggyb6OnCnQ?select=UVMpGevOAtNkI5csC8LdpQ).  My friend even ordered an extra container of the garlic butter sauce for dipping (later taking the rest home).  The Fried Calamari appetizer came hot, but the flavor was okay... nothing spectacular (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/z9CN58fSrA46ggyb6OnCnQ?select=CLaIPDlObi1_v5ACPPQ1NA).  The waiter recommended the Shaken Beef (stir fried Filet Mignon cubes, fried potato cubes, and onions on a bed of lettuce, garnished with halved cherry tomatoes) cooked medium, but, preferring a more tender texture, we requested medium rare (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/z9CN58fSrA46ggyb6OnCnQ?select=AJoZPi_TbmkRazShdSX5FQ).  This was my favorite of the meal.  The desserts were also okay as the Banana cake tasted like a bread pudding (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/z9CN58fSrA46ggyb6OnCnQ?select=ph8LCE3wLbB9GsbhrolD8A) while the Fried Pineapple reminded me of sweet, Fried Onion Rings (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/z9CN58fSrA46ggyb6OnCnQ?select=BiEG4_CWYHz0aYTCPqPgmg).  
My friend also had a mission of delivering two roasted crabs back to Oahu a few days later.  Asking the waiter for his advice and the reheating details, my friend successfully completed his task with flying colors.  The greeter, the waiter, and the busboy were very amicable and gave us an "at home" feeling while we were here.  The water and iced tea glasses were constantly filled and empty plates quickly removed.  Having a 6 pm reservation, we also secured a parking space 0.5 block away.  There is valet parking available for $10.00.  The food rates 3 stars in my book, but the service and atmosphere boosted it up 1 additional star.

excerpts: We ordered two roasted crabs, an order of garlic noodles, tiger prawns served over garlic noodles, two appetizers soft shell crab, some type of wonton and hot jasmine tea.

Lets break this down, the crab were good but not worth 40 bucks each, the garlic noodles were cold and lumped together almost like they microwaved them, the hot jasmine tea was not hot it was warm at best..
Grand total $167 and change.
Lets just say I was really disappointed.
garlic noodles.author: Rita A.
garlic noodles.review:
Wow I had not been here in years and the taste and quality of the food has gone downhill.  I guess once the one in beverly hills opened and they became well know catering to the decor and less on the quality of the food.  We ordered two roasted crabs, an order of garlic noodles, tiger prawns served over garlic noodles, two appetizers soft shell crab, some type of wonton and hot jasmine tea.

Lets break this down, the crab were good but not worth 40 bucks each, the garlic noodles were cold and lumped together almost like they microwaved them, the hot jasmine tea was not hot it was warm at best..  Grand total $167 and change.  Lets just say I was really disappointed.

excerpts: and a must is the garlic noodles..
they don't look impressive but wait til you taste it!!
garlic noodles.author: Ann H.
garlic noodles.review:
Still one of my all time favs and still has never disappointed!!  The Roasted dunguness crab is the only way to go!! and a must is the garlic noodles.. they don't look impressive but wait til you taste it!! Sooo gouuuddd!!

they also have a sea bass dish that is delicious.. though I do recommend the steamed over the fried. And we tried another new dish the eggplant!! so much flavor!!

excerpts: Garlic noodles...
garlic roasted or tamarind roasted crab.
I'm already salivating.
garlic noodles.author: Sameer R.
garlic noodles.review:
Garlic noodles...garlic roasted or tamarind roasted crab.  I'm already salivating.  What more needs to be said?  

Its out in the Avenues so either leave your SUV at home or take muni.

excerpts: Delicious roast crab with garlic noodles.
garlic noodles.author: Tony P.
garlic noodles.review:
Delicious roast crab with garlic noodles. Those noodles are even better when either dipped in the buttery oil left over from the crab or when covered with either the eggplant sauce or the mixed vegetables. 

This place can get very crowded so best to go during off hours.

excerpts: Everyone must try the garlic noodles and the tamarind crab!
dont go here if you dont like crab! unless you are absolutely ok with being surrounded by crab.
garlic noodles.author: Megan B.
garlic noodles.review: Everyone must try the garlic noodles and the tamarind crab! dont go here if you dont like crab! unless you are absolutely ok with being surrounded by crab.

excerpts: Garlic Noodles - MUST HAVE
AT THE TABLE.
I really like this place - I've had the Garlic Noodles before on their An The Go mobile food truck.
garlic noodles.author: Cat G.
garlic noodles.review:
My brother and sisters decided to come here for Mother's Day. I called on the Thursday before to make a reservation, made it for 5:30pm on Mother's Day. Perfect. They called on Saturday to confirm, awesome. They reminded me to make sure everyone was on time because we wouldn't be sat until our entire party was there. 

Typical of our family, one of my siblings was running late - therefore they wouldn't seat us. My Mom was mad and irritated because to her it didn't make sense because we knew what they wanted to order. After practically yelling at the hostess, they still didn't seat us - I was embarassed. The hostess remained calm and tried to explain to my Mom why they wouldn't seat us. I used to work in the restaurant industry and I know why they won't sit full parties - it puts their entire reservation schedule off track - if two people of a seven party table is late, it extends their duration at the table once the two LATE people do get there, and causes the table who will be using that table next a delay, and so forth throughout the evening. 

30 minutes after our reservation time, my late sibling and her guest arrived, I kindly let the hostess know that we were finally all there, she told me that the only table available that sits 7 is currently paying and as soon as they leave, she'd be able to sit us - this was "the best that she could do at this time." - I thanked her nicely and proceeded to apologize for my mom's reaction and that I understand why they couldn't seat us. 

5 minutes later - she came to me and said that she had another table available and we could be seated right away. While following her she told me that she appreciated my apology and to enjoy my meal. 

Food: 
Dungeness Crab Puffs - delicious - a great appetizer for a larger group, there were 6 in one serving. 

Salt & Pepper Calamari - a little too much salt on this one, still good though!  Next time we'll try the Grilled Calamari 

Shaken Beef - HOLY MOLEY DELICIOUS - Meat was SO tender and so flavorful - definitely recommend this. 

Siagon Beef - Not my favorite - the rest of my family like this but unfortunately this dish did NOT please my taste buds - I felt as though maybe the ingredients were way above my appreciation but it tasted too bitter for me. 

Drunken Crab - this was delicious - a whole crab, dunked in a secret sauce of Chardonney... 

Roasted Crab - this was EVEN better than the Drunken Crab - amazing. 

Garlic Noodles - MUST HAVE AT THE TABLE. These are the staple dish of every visit, in my opinion. 

I really like this place - I've had the Garlic Noodles before on their An The Go mobile food truck. Definitely will come back here. 

PS. Parking is a pain - but they do offer Valet for $12.00 - valet guys are funny.

excerpts: The must-try items are obviously the roast crab, garlic noodles, and shaken beef.
For some appetizers, I'd recommend the tiger prawns, mussels, and salt & pepper calamari.
garlic noodles.author: Ryan L.
garlic noodles.review: I haven't eaten here in a few years (probably like.. '09) but I must say that they have maintained their quality. I made a reservation and had to change it right beforehand and it was no problem with the staff. Everything on the menu is probably very tasty and rich in flavor. The must-try items are obviously the roast crab, garlic noodles, and shaken beef. For some appetizers, I'd recommend the tiger prawns, mussels, and salt & pepper calamari. The mango salad was good but I'm not a fan of warm/sweet salads. The service was a bit slow but other than that, I would definitely recommend you try this place out.

excerpts: We ordered the Garlic Roasted Crab with the Garlic Noodles, then not a word was said.
Crab shells were flying, mouths were slurping and fingers were being licked.
We need to go back to SF just for this.
garlic noodles.author: Neil T.
garlic noodles.review: Garlic Roasted Crab... no need to say anything else.  We ordered the Garlic Roasted Crab with the Garlic Noodles, then not a word was said.  Crab shells were flying, mouths were slurping and fingers were being licked.  We need to go back to SF just for this.

excerpts: The roasted crab and garlic noodles were great!
The soups...not so much.
garlic noodles.author: Lai-Nin W.
garlic noodles.review:
Went here a few months ago with my parents to take them out to dinner. The crab IS delicious, and the service was spectacular... Even on a busy night our waiter took good care of us.

The roasted crab and garlic noodles were great! The soups...not so much. my mom got the vegetable soup, I got some sort of chicken version- both were unfortunately bland, a bit under-seasoned.

Other than that though, if you're here for crab and noodles- you've come to the right place! Beware of parking though- esp. at the dinner hour it can get super crazy!

excerpts: But the crab and garlic noodles are always awesome.
garlic noodles.author: Lawrence L.
garlic noodles.review:
Delicious dungeness crab served here everytime!  It's been over 10 years since I have been here, and a few things have changed: they now have valet parking, the menu has more options...  But the crab and garlic noodles are always awesome.

Tried the roasted crab (the original goodness), and drunken crab (very juicy), shaken beef (pretty good), mussels (plump and tasty), and the chicken satay (ok) for appetizers.  Ended the night off with fried ice cream, which the kids devoured!

Definitely recommend coming here to satisfy your crab cravings...

excerpts: First time, it was some special occasion, ordered the crab, garlic noodles so delicious.
It was quite a mess, but my boyfriend
and I enjoy being together
Second time, I got shaken beef and garlic noodles to go.
A little pricy for a dinner, but I made it into like 2 or 3 meals.
garlic noodles.author: Nina Y.
garlic noodles.review:
So weird that I didn't review this place after the first time I came. I live right by this place.

First time, it was some special occasion, ordered the crab, garlic noodles so delicious. It was quite a mess, but my boyfriend and I enjoy being together and if it meant being messy, so be it.

Second time, I got shaken beef and garlic noodles to go. A little pricy for a dinner, but I made it into like 2 or 3 meals. Definitely really good. 

romantic ambiance with dimmed lighting, but there are still families which makes it a little more casual.

excerpts: Dungeness crab + garlic noodles + beer
garlic noodles.author: Thuan N.
garlic noodles.review:
Glorious.

Dungeness crab + garlic noodles + beer

Bib me up.

excerpts: The roasted crab and garlic noodles are what dreams are made of.
Paired with a bottle of Rombauer Chardonnay, this restaurant marries the tastiest Vietnamese food with a stellar wine list.
I'm still licking my fingers.
Luckily they have complimentary bibs!
garlic noodles.author: Robert G.
garlic noodles.review: Wow, wow, WOW!  The roasted crab and garlic noodles are what dreams are made of. Paired with a bottle of Rombauer Chardonnay, this restaurant marries the tastiest Vietnamese food with a stellar wine list. I'm still licking my fingers. Luckily they have complimentary bibs!

excerpts: I love their garlic noodles and roasted crab!
LOVE LOVE LOVE!
garlic noodles.author: linda L.
garlic noodles.review:
We came here very last minute and they were able to accommodate the two of us! 

Instead of the Pear Martini, I went with their "House Infused Pineapple and Lychee Martini" It was good, tasted like juice!

I love their garlic noodles and roasted crab! LOVE LOVE LOVE! :) It's a must every time we come to Thanh Long or Crustaceans. 

This time I had their mussels... so good! 

Will be back again! :)

Pros 
Lots of parking
No dresscode
Excellent service :)
      



NOTE* I prefer thanh long over crustacean because they don't have a dress code!

excerpts: Of course, the roasted crabs and garlic noodles were TDF...but we all know that already.
This time, it was really the fantastic service that stood out for me and my family.
garlic noodles.author: Ryan G.
garlic noodles.review: We only visit once...maybe twice a year on a special occasion, but they never fail here. Actually, yesterday was particularly our best experience.  Valet service...very nice guys, kept my jeep parked at the front where I could see from my table.  We arrived 15 mins early of our reservations, but they sat us anyway at a perfect table by the window downstairs. Service...outstanding!!!  Fantastic waitress (Carol) and team were very attentive and the food was delivered immediately!!!  Of course, the roasted crabs and garlic noodles were TDF...but we all know that already.  This time, it was really the fantastic service that stood out for me and my family.

excerpts: their garlic noodles are fantastic; so are the crab and cream cheese wontons and the desserts, but that roast crab still haunts my dreams.
garlic noodles.author: Kris G.
garlic noodles.review:
this is no mere roasted crab... this is god, speaking to us through food. 

i'm paraphrasing jason segel here, from HIMYM, and although he's speaking of the best burger in new york, i'm here to tell you about the best crab in san francisco. 

most of you know, i'm a proud maryland gal who's been cracking blue crabs over newspaper since i was 3, thank you very much. for me, crabs come by the bushel, they're served with buckets of beer and plates of hush puppies, and it's a social thing - you spend time at the table with family and friends, talking and eating delicious morsels of old bay-seasoned crab meat. 

when i came to san francisco, i was shocked and appalled at the flat discs of fish-flavored breadcrumbs that pass for crabcakes in the bay area. the dungeness crab i found in my salad louies and crab fried rice left me underwhelmed and longing for the lump crab of my hometown. i had been in SF three years, was planning to move back to DC for a new job, and had thoroughly given up hope of finding good crab in the bay area... until i went to thanh long. 

have you ever licked your hands in the middle of a nice restaurant, trying to suck every delicious drop of flavor off your fingers, not caring who saw your atrocious manners? well, if you go to thanh long, you will. 

i tried their buttery, garlicky roasted crab exactly one week before i was set to move across the country, and literally had dreams the next two nights of tender crab meat eaten with white rice by the handful. refusing to leave california without another taste, i went to sister restaurant crustacean (thanh long is closed on mondays) before hitting the airport for my cross-country flight. 

their garlic noodles are fantastic; so are the crab and cream cheese wontons and the desserts, but that roast crab still haunts my dreams. and you better believe thanh long is the first place i'm gonna go when i'm back in the bay. 

best. crab. in. san francisco.

excerpts: I'd never had crab legs before, so I followed the majority and got the roast crab and we shared a bunch of plates of the garlic noodles.
I enjoyed everything we ate and the service was good, but I can't help to think that it is a bit overpriced, I dropped $80+ when the night was done on dinner.
I would go again, but probably for special occassions.
garlic noodles.author: Candace R.
garlic noodles.review: Was invited here for a birthday dinner with a large group. We started with the calamari and dumplings, of which I enjoyed the calamari more. I'd never had crab legs before, so I followed the majority and got the roast crab and we shared a bunch of plates of the garlic noodles. I enjoyed everything we ate and the service was good, but I can't help to think that it is a bit overpriced, I dropped $80+ when the night was done on dinner. I would go again, but probably for special occassions.

excerpts: Their crab sucks..both the roasted and wine... their garlic noodles isn't dat exciting n great...
#redcrawfish is da best...
garlic noodles.author: Jay B.
garlic noodles.review: Their crab sucks..both the roasted and wine... their garlic noodles isn't dat exciting n great...#redcrawfish is da best... their garlic rice was horrible...taste like it was burnt n not garlicy... n also.. they charged to cut the bday cake n a $1 a plate...smfh so far im disappointed.

excerpts: We got seated and ordered 3 roasted crabs, garlic noodles, mussels, salmon carpaccio, and some shrimp rolls that came with a little bit of bacon.
garlic noodles.author: M W.
garlic noodles.review:
Thanh Long is a sisterly restaurant to Crustacean, located on Polk Street. 

There were 5 of us who decided to swing by on a Saturday night around 9PM. There were still people waiting in line when we got there. We got seated and ordered 3 roasted crabs, garlic noodles, mussels, salmon carpaccio, and some shrimp rolls that came with a little bit of bacon. For dessert we ordered creme brulee and also a warm chocolate cake with icecream- to die for!

The roasted crabs were fabulous. I am a huge crab fan and it totally satisfied my craving. I can eat an entire crab to myself (minus the brain). I also LOVED the mussels- definitely a must try. Customer service was excellent, as always!

excerpts: The garlic noodles were good but who could screw that up?
The atmosphere is nice and the service was good.
We never had to ask the servers anything because they were proactive and brought us everything we needed and refilled our waters.
Overall I don't think I will be returning as the roasted crab did not live up to my expectations.
garlic noodles.author: Matthew L.
garlic noodles.review: I really wanted to like this place, but the crab did not live up to my expectations. I really hoped for the flavorful garlic flavor, it was drowned in greasy oil. The garlic noodles were good but who could screw that up? The atmosphere is nice and the service was good. We never had to ask the servers anything because they were proactive and brought us everything we needed and refilled our waters. Overall I don't think I will be returning as the roasted crab did not live up to my expectations.

excerpts: Icky garlic noodles.
WHAT is the hubbub about?
They're gross.
Not a word I use much.
But I said it:
gross.
And they absolutely RUINED a crab.
I wanted decent crab, but they put, literally, about half a tablespoon of PEPPER on a CRAB.
WTF!
I'm done with this place.
Also, they screwed up my side dish order (garlic bread) and brought it as an appetizer.
So we had to order a second platter.
garlic noodles.author: Karen Z.
garlic noodles.review:
Never again. Icky garlic noodles. WHAT is the hubbub about? They're gross. Not a word I use much. But I said it: gross. And they absolutely RUINED a crab. I wanted decent crab, but they put, literally, about half a tablespoon of PEPPER on a CRAB. WTF! I'm done with this place. Also, they screwed up my side dish order (garlic bread) and brought it as an appetizer. So we had to order a second platter. The best bite of the night was the weird shrimp toast. If you're an East Coaster, this is NOT what you expect when you order shrimp toast. This was on a round baguette slice! But hey, it tasted like it should, so that worked for me. =) Interesting dessert cocktails.

Parking wasn't too bad, AND they have valet.

excerpts: My friends always brag about the garlic noodles and the roasted crab so I tried both of them.
The crab was too oily and it was too salty w
/c gave me a headache while eating.
garlic noodles.author: Grace B.
garlic noodles.review:
It was my first time yesterday 4/26/15 at Thanh Long.  My friends always brag about the garlic noodles and the roasted crab so I tried both of them.  The crab was too oily and it was too salty w/c gave me a headache while eating.  There's nothing special about the garlic noodle.

Not worth a trip to go to the city for this.

excerpts:
Tasty dishes to look out for:
Garlic noodles
Roasted crab
Fried crab wontons (6pc)

Garlic noodles and roasted crab are a good size to be shared by two.
garlic noodles.author: Ka L.
garlic noodles.review:
The seemingly small restaurant had a second floor to it! Nice ambience but more suited for family and friends gathering.

Tasty dishes to look out for:
Garlic noodles
Roasted crab
Fried crab wontons (6pc)

Garlic noodles and roasted crab are a good size to be shared by two.

May be hard to find street parking

excerpts:
garlic noodles.

garlic noodles.
garlic noodles.author: Anjelica C.
garlic noodles.review:
roast crab. garlic noodles.

that is all you need.

sometimes we get seafood fried rice, calamari, vietnamese salad, beef skewers, etc, but the only essentials are: roast crab. garlic noodles.

we've ventured to try the tamarind crab once or twice but it's not as amazing as the roast crab. make reservations, if you can! and some days, parking can take awhile. staff is really friendly, helpful, and attentive. always a great dining experience here

excerpts: Yet I remember the Roasted Garlic Crab and Garlic Noodles like it was yesterday.
The perfectly cooked crab that everyone greedily grabbed for even though there was one crab for every 3 ravenous girls...the perfect noodles that we happily slurped up...
garlic noodles.author: Em B.
garlic noodles.review:
Yeaah....this review is about 10 years too late. That was when I dined there, the fall of 1999. Yet I remember the Roasted Garlic Crab and Garlic Noodles like it was yesterday. The perfectly cooked crab that everyone greedily grabbed for even though there was one crab for every 3 ravenous girls...the perfect noodles that we happily slurped up...the sighs of bliss that echoed across the table and back again. 

I don't remember much else but walking out of the restaurant in a crab-garlic-butter-infused stupor, bits of shell scattered on my clothes and maybe in my hair even. All I cared about was that me and my belly were content.

Note: This place is expensive but worth every penny. Plus, I didn't have to foot the bill which made for an even better dining experience. Yay for me!

Recommend, recommend, REC-O-MMEND!

excerpts: Garlic noodles were good, but a bit too oily for me.
garlic noodles.author: Thy L.
garlic noodles.review:
Does anyone else think classy Vietnamese restaurant is an oxymoron? Maybe it's just me. This sounds awful, but I like my Chinese, Vietnamese and Thai food in dingy restaurants. It gives the illusion that you're actually in that country eating! :X 

Anyway, this is my second time eating this. The first time, I had it at PPQ. I ordered the roasted crab,which was tossed in garlic sauce and some kind of secret spices (according to the menu). I think my biggest problem with the idea of Asian crabs is, you cook the entire thing, shell included, how are the sauces/spices suppose to get to the meat? I end up having plain crab meat that I have to dip into the sauce. Fail! Garlic noodles were good, but a bit too oily for me.The Shaken Beef was good. It is New York steak cut into small cubes marinated in a very yummy sauce, served with the mixed greens, cherry tomatoes and potatoes. This was my favorite. Why? I didn't have to cut through cow hide to get to my meat. Plus, I love potatoes!

The restaurant was good, but I don't think I'm going to come again. I'm going to stay away from crabs unless someone takes the meat out for me :)

excerpts: This place is on my top lists for garlic noodles.
The dungeness crab is delicious and just right.
The garlic noodles is what separates this place from other places who serve garlic noodles.
I've come here just to buy the garlic noodles.
It's that good!
Me and my cousins had a seafood night and I bought 6 orders of the garlic noodles.
It's a good place to celebrate anniversaries or a birthday for 2.
