The beef was good and I recommend it to anyone who loves meat or wants to try something else at Thanh long besides the garlic noodles and crab.
Parking is hard to find.
This place is located in the sunset district.
Make reservations if you can or come by early before people start to show up.
If you want the more upscale restaurant, go and visit Crustaceans which is owned by the same owners.
It's pretty much the same menu but more on the upscale side.
garlic noodles.author: Steven O.
garlic noodles.review: Thanh Long! What can I say? This place is on my top lists for garlic noodles. The dungeness crab is delicious and just right. The garlic noodles is what separates this place from other places who serve garlic noodles. I've come here just to buy the garlic noodles. It's that good! Me and my cousins had a seafood night and I bought 6 orders of the garlic noodles. It's a good place to celebrate anniversaries or a birthday for 2. I've also tried the Shaken Beef which is tender cubes of marinated new york steak flambeed in chardonnay, served with potatoes, mixed green and cherry tomatoes. The beef was good and I recommend it to anyone who loves meat or wants to try something else at Thanh long besides the garlic noodles and crab. Parking is hard to find. This place is located in the sunset district. Make reservations if you can or come by early before people start to show up. If you want the more upscale restaurant, go and visit Crustaceans which is owned by the same owners. It's pretty much the same menu but more on the upscale side.

excerpts: Their garlic noodles are so good.
But the best thing hands down was their roasted crab.
It is what they are known for and their most popular dish.
It was to die for!
So good.
I would definantly recommend this place.
I will for sure be back asap!
garlic noodles.author: Ryan G.
garlic noodles.review: Hands down best place to get crab in the area. Their garlic noodles are so good. But the best thing hands down was their roasted crab. It is what they are known for and their most popular dish. It was to die for! So good. I would definantly recommend this place. I will for sure be back asap!

excerpts: Garlic noodles was amazing.
Roasted crabs was really good and tasty just highly priced as well as appetizers.
love food but not affordable to go regularly, maybe just special occasions.
Too bad because i can see myself coming more often if  its not so pricey.
Parking not great either expect to use valet parking.
garlic noodles.author: Rachel D.
garlic noodles.review: Great food.  Garlic noodles was amazing. Roasted crabs was really good and tasty just highly priced as well as appetizers.  love food but not affordable to go regularly, maybe just special occasions.  Too bad because i can see myself coming more often if  its not so pricey.   Parking not great either expect to use valet parking.

excerpts: We tried the garlic noodles.
Not garlicky like Gilroy Garlic festival food.
The noodles were addicting, because it's cooked in butter.
These noodles were tastier than Elephant Bar garlic noodles (but Thanh Long's garlic noodles does not come with shrimp).
garlic noodles.author: Poiuytrewq A.
garlic noodles.review:
If a chef has something good to serve, they wouldn't need to mask it with butter.
Hence, I can't honestly say much about the quality of the food. 

We tried the roasted crab, which is actually butter with crab texture. I couldn't taste the crab, because the melted lard was overbearing. It did taste good, but who doesn't like to gulp down 10 sticks of butter? 

Come to Thanh Long if you like to be served melted butter. I suppose you can ask them to "hold the butter" and see what they give you. 

We tried the garlic noodles. Not garlicky like Gilroy Garlic festival food. The noodles were addicting, because it's cooked in butter. These noodles were tastier than Elephant Bar garlic noodles (but Thanh Long's garlic noodles does not come with shrimp).

My family lived in Alaska for nine years, so maybe we have greater expectations for crab, especially since everyone said the crab was amazing. 

Decor/Ambiance:
Nice. Dimly lit, but not too dim. A good place for celebrating your uncle's birthday, or having dinner with your estranged wife. 

Staff:
Polite. They will not seat you if everyone in your party is not present.

Dessert: 
Extra star for the sorbet, which was very interesting. In terms of taste, I didn't like either the lemon or orange sorbet. Boyfriend made lemon ice cream/sorbet at home and that was way better.

Tea:
It wasn't hot. When people order hot drinks, that they're expecting a hot drink, not a warm drink that turns lukewarm in 10 minutes. 
The rose tea lacked flavor and my mother kept insisting it was old tea.

excerpts: We share garlic noodles, the shaken beef, and salt and pepper calamari.
It was a little pricey, but so worth it.
Everything was so flavorful
and I don't know...
garlic noodles.author: Patricia Q.
garlic noodles.review:
I went to dinner at Thanh Long with my boyfriend Friday night...Kind of a strange place for me to go considering that I am allergic to seafood. But hey, we made it work.

We share garlic noodles, the shaken beef, and salt and pepper calamari. It was a little pricey, but so worth it. Everything was so flavorful and I don't know...damn good? 

I think people in the know make the trek out to Thanh Long for the crabs, but the non-seafood items are great too FYI for people who are allergic to seafood like me.

Will definitely come back again whenever the boyfriend and I feel like treating ourselves after a long week of work. Great date spot, nice interior, fast service, and delicious food. Parking can be a bit of a nightmare in this area sometimes, but that pretty much goes with living in SF.

excerpts: Garlic noodles amazing.
Go already.
garlic noodles.author: JR B.
garlic noodles.review: Garlic noodle and roasted crab and everything else.  Yummy yummy yummy.  Did I say it was really really good?  It always is really really good.  Just go.  Quit reading these reviews and do yourself a favor.  Hell I am not even a big fan of crab.  This is the place to eat it.  Crab is delicious.  Garlic noodles amazing.  Go already.

excerpts: We quickly dispensed with any appetizers and went straight for the famous garlic noodles and roasted crab.
The only gripe I have is the small portion of garlic noodles.
The quality of the food warrants the price but the quantity does not.
garlic noodles.author: Art O.
garlic noodles.review:
A few weeks back, I hungout after work and planned to have dinner with a legendary Yelper at Outerlands. The wait was too long for our growing hunger and I glanced up the street. Hmm... I've never been to Thanh Long, I thought aloud. After a short debate we walked the half block to legendary Thanh Long.

We quickly dispensed with any appetizers and went straight for the famous garlic noodles and roasted crab. 

When the waiter placed the plastic bib around my neck and instantly began to salivate like Pavlov's dog. And then the noodles and crab arrived...Hot damn! Now, I can understand why they're so secretive about the recipe. Every last morsel of savory noodle and succulent crab meat was slowly consumed. The meal was so good I don't believe we uttered more than a few words and grunts of satisfaction.

For a Tuesday, the place quickly became packed and the atmosphere was comfortable. The only gripe I have is the small portion of garlic noodles. The quality of the food warrants the price but the quantity does not.

excerpts: Tiger prawns over garlic noodles was really good so was the shaken beef.
All the seafood dishes tasted really fresh.
garlic noodles.author: Mandeep G.
garlic noodles.review: Tiger prawns over garlic noodles was really good so was the shaken beef. All the seafood dishes tasted really fresh. Have to try the Drunken crab next time.  Smart to have a reservation beforehand it gets really crowded in here.

excerpts: Roasted crab and garlic noodles was thee best I had in awhile.
This will be a new tradition for all our birthdays..
garlic noodles.author: Joe B.
garlic noodles.review:
Took my family for the first time for my wife's birthday.  Roasted crab and garlic noodles was thee best I had in awhile.  This will be a new tradition for all our birthdays.. lol

Parking was a pain but it's in the city so what do you expect... You can pay 12.00 for valet tho...

excerpts: When we saw the size of the crab being served to the table next to us, we downsized our order to a single crab (roasted) and supplemented with garlic noodles and eggplant side.
The crab was so succulent - perfect!
The garlic noodles were amazing - this is a restaurant not afraid to use garlic!
Fantastic service, great ambience, and wonderful food.
garlic noodles.author: Shelley O.
garlic noodles.review: We went to Thanh Long for Dungeness crabs, plural. When we saw the size of the crab being served to the table next to us, we downsized our order to a single crab (roasted) and supplemented with garlic noodles and eggplant side. The crab was so succulent - perfect! The garlic noodles were amazing - this is a restaurant not afraid to use garlic! Fantastic service, great ambience, and wonderful food.

excerpts: We paired the crab with two orders of the garlic noodles - great combo.
garlic noodles.author: Krystine D.
garlic noodles.review:
My family was visiting from San Diego so we wanted to wanted to indulge and heard about the crab here. Fortunately, we set reservations because this place was packed!

Superior service. We were told our table would be ready by 8:30 and our name was called right on the dot. For starters, we ordered the salt and pepper calamari. The calamari was good, though I'm usually used to having some sort of dipping sauce with it. Lightly breaded. Then we ordered to the Vietnamese traditional salad, which was the perfect starter to a heavy meal; it was light and refreshing. 

As for the entree, each of us had one roast crab each. Previous reviews definitely reflected well; the roast crab is delicious. It seems as though they must marinade the crab ahead of time (probably why the restaurant doesn't open until 5) because the crab came out quickly but was still tasty. We paired the crab with two orders of the garlic noodles - great combo. The noodles are rich - garlic-y and buttery YUM - and went well with the crab.

For dessert, we had the fried banana with ice cream. Each order comes with two fried banana portions and one scoop of vanilla ice cream. Yum! 

Ultimately one of the best meals I've had since moving to the Bay. I would absolutely come here again if the budget permitted. My mom even dared to say that was the best crab she has had her whole life - now that's bold :)

Can't say enough about the service here. They were friendly, fast and extremely attentive. Awesome staff.

excerpts: The roasted crab and garlic noodles are a must have.
Also had their mussels which were a hit!!
Can't wait to go back!
garlic noodles.author: Angela D.
garlic noodles.review: Always love this place when I come here! The roasted crab and garlic noodles are a must have. Also had their mussels which were a hit!! Can't wait to go back!

excerpts: the dungeness crab makes your mouth water, the garlic noodles goes well with it, but my favorite is the SHAKEN BEEF!
it was so tender, it melts in your mouth.
garlic noodles.author: Kurt N.
garlic noodles.review: went here for my 6 year anniversary and it was great.  parking is hard to find, expensive valet parking, and the restaurant setting is not the best.  HOWEVER, the food makes up for it.  the dungeness crab makes your mouth water, the garlic noodles goes well with it, but my favorite is the SHAKEN BEEF! it was so tender, it melts in your mouth.

excerpts: I always like ordering the Roasted Crab, Garlic Noodles, Salt and Pepper Calamari and the Shaken Beef - All my Faves!
garlic noodles.author: Jennifer N.
garlic noodles.review:
This is byfar one of my top 5 places to eat!  Their dining area is simple yet classy and everything I order is always made perfect, just how I expected.

Every Birthday or get together Event held here has always been accommodated with no issues whatsoever.  The Service is always great.

I always like ordering the Roasted Crab, Garlic Noodles, Salt and Pepper Calamari and the Shaken Beef - All my Faves!  The price is worth spending because the serving is just perfect and they are all flavor filled.

Definitely Recommended!!

excerpts: The garlic noodles were alright, but nothing spectacular.
I give service 4 stars.
Our waiter was very attentive.
Ambiance 4.

We ordered
1 Roasted crab
1 garlic noodles
1 mussels app
1 spring roll app
garlic noodles.author: Zanne S.
garlic noodles.review:
We ordered the roasted crab.  It was good, but pricey and the crab was small.  The garlic noodles were alright, but nothing spectacular.  I give service 4 stars.  Our waiter was very attentive.  Ambiance 4.  Food 3-4.

We ordered
1 Roasted crab
1 garlic noodles
1 mussels app
1 spring roll app
1 soup
3 cocktails
Bill with tip was $150

I will go again so that I can try other items on the menu.

excerpts: This place is by far my favorite spot for Vietnamese crab and garlic noodles.
I will get this out of the way, it is fairly pricey.
For a party of 2 expect to pay at least 75-90 dollars for a 3 course dinner.
The garlic noodles are an absolute MUST.
In regards to the crab, I would recommend the Roasted Garlic as well as the Tamarind.
For appetizers, I did enjoy the Calamari and the Crab Puffs.
garlic noodles.author: Daniella J.
garlic noodles.review:
I really don't know where to start when it comes to Thanh Long so bare with me if my review is all over the place.  This place is by far my favorite spot for Vietnamese crab and garlic noodles.  I will get this out of the way, it is fairly pricey.  For a party of 2 expect to pay at least 75-90 dollars for a 3 course dinner.  So if you can look past being a Baller on a Budget...proceed to read :P  

Food:  MAGNIFICANT!  The garlic noodles are an absolute MUST.  In regards to the crab, I would recommend the Roasted Garlic as well as the Tamarind.  For appetizers, I did enjoy the Calamari and the Crab Puffs.  I have sampled a good variety of their appetizers and all were quite good.  

General restaurant information:  MAKE RESERVATIONS.  If you attend on a weekend, reservations fill up.  They offer valet parking for $10.00 which is nice considering parking by the Avenues can be quite difficult.  

All in all, I love this establishment.  The service is always great and I always leave very happy with the food!  Thanh Long is an SF MUST!

excerpts: After ollaliberry picking in Pescadero and mussel hunting in Half Moon Bay, my sunkissed friends and I wanted to end the night with a bang and decided to treat ourselves to juicy, plump crab and some dressed up garlic noodles!

Roast crab (roasted with garlic sauce and "secret" spices)
Garlic noodles (3 orders please!)
The taste of garlic from the garlic noodles is potent!
After your meal, brush your teeth and tongue, gargle mouthwash, and that taste and smell is not so easily ditched!
Hence the garlic hangover.
garlic noodles.author: Cici T.
garlic noodles.review:
Drunken crab and a garlic hangover? Yes, please!

It was a foggy summer night, the last time I came to Thanh Long for dinner. After ollaliberry picking in Pescadero and mussel hunting in Half Moon Bay, my sunkissed friends and I wanted to end the night with a bang and decided to treat ourselves to juicy, plump crab and some dressed up garlic noodles!

Here was our order:
Drunken crab (simmered in Chardonnay, sake and brandy; scallions, chives, and cracked black pepper)
Roast crab (roasted with garlic sauce and "secret" spices)
Garlic noodles (3 orders please!)
Thanh Long spicy eggplant (jumbo prawns, chicken, basil, baby corn!, shitake mushrooms, eggplant!)
Lemongrass chicken (chicken, vegetables, garlic, and chili)

Oh was it a feast! Among the five of us, we cleared our table.

Caution: The taste of garlic from the garlic noodles is potent! After your meal, brush your teeth and tongue, gargle mouthwash, and that taste and smell is not so easily ditched! Hence the garlic hangover.

excerpts: The crab is delicious and so are the garlic noodles!
Service is good, servers are fast.
I would definitely recommend this place.
The only downside is the parking, It doesn't have it's own parking lot, so
It took us around 15 min to get a parking space
and we still had to walk a block to get here.
garlic noodles.author: MJ J.
garlic noodles.review:
This place is nice!
The crab is delicious and so are the garlic noodles!
Service is good, servers are fast.
I would definitely recommend this place. The only downside is the parking, It doesn't have it's own parking lot, so It took us around 15 min to get a parking space and we still had to walk a block to get here.

excerpts: Along with crab and garlic noodles, we also ordered a pot of tea.
It cost $4.50 or $4.95 (somewhere along there, I forget the exact amount
garlic noodles.author: Wendy L.
garlic noodles.review:
This is why I will NEVER come here again:

Came here as a party of 3. Along with crab and garlic noodles, we also ordered a pot of tea. It cost $4.50 or $4.95 (somewhere along there, I forget the exact amount but it was definitely at least $4.50).

Our server plopped down the pot of tea and 3 cups. She didn't pour it for us. Not much service there, but that's not the reason for the low rating.

The pot of tea couldn't even fill all 3 cups. It filled 2-1/2 cups only. This was a SMALL teapot, not what you usually see when you order a pot of tea at Asian restaurants.

So we asked our server to please add hot water to the teapot. She refused. We were not asking her to replace the tea leaves. We just wanted hot water added to the teapot. She said I gave you 3 cups when we usually give 2. WHAT THE HELL? Whether she handed us 2 empty cups or 3 empty cups, it did not matter. We were still getting the same pot of tea and the same amount of tea leaves. We only wanted hot water added to it since the teapot was so small that it couldn't even fill all 3 cups. We were not asking for a fresh pot at all, just some hot water. Server refused, then walked away.

Rude service. Rude policies. Tiny teapot for a crazy price. Eat elsewhere. You'll get better service where they don't try to milk you for every nickel and dime.

excerpts: So, I was slightly skeptical as to whether I'd enjoy this garlic crab, and the garlic noodles that you can order as a side dish.
the garlic noodles were exquisite.
They tasted faintly of garlic, and like McDonald's fries, had to have a touch of sugar in them b/c they were slightly sweet and addictive as fuck.
garlic noodles.author: Jo G.
garlic noodles.review:
Allright, I'll be the first to admit that I exaggerate stuff and can be overly dramatic sometimes, but honestly- I think our dinner at Thanh Long was probably one of the best meals of my life.  Top 5 for sure.  

My friend kept raving about this place and how great the garlic roast crab is.  I L-O-V-E crustaceans, crab legs and lobster tails rock my world.  Garlic not so much.  I of course use garlic in cooking to enhance a dish and can appreciate its use, but you're not gonna find me eating at The Stinking Rose where that shit reeks of almost raw garlic, ew.   So, I was slightly skeptical as to whether I'd enjoy this garlic crab, and the garlic noodles that you can order as a side dish.

We walk into the restaurant, and I'm pleasantly surprised to find out it doesn't have an overbearing garlic smell to it.  Awesome.  I was tempted to stray from convention and try the Tamarind crab, or the Drunken crab (cooked in white wine and olive oil I think), but everyone kept stressing how legit the garlic roast one was.  Ok, I caved.

Boy, I've never been so happy to cave into peer pressure as I was Friday night.  The garlic roast crab was sooooooooo delicious, I went to town on that motha.  I kindof pride myself on my waspy crab-eating skills, I can pick every single morsel of meat out of a crab leg, which I did again that night.  Honestly it's a lot of crab meat so many of weaklings out there might want to follow in the footsteps of the couple next to us and "split a crab."  I don't know what "sharing" or "split" a meal means as I've never done it myself, but I hear some people don't experience the food coma afterward, so I guess try it if you want.

On to the noodles, which again sounded super dicey to me.  I envisioned half-cooked garlic which would make me vomit.  Ohhhh silly girl, silly naive Jo.  No no no no- the garlic noodles were exquisite.  They tasted faintly of garlic, and like McDonald's fries, had to have a touch of sugar in them b/c they were slightly sweet and addictive as fuck.  Score.

As a sidenote, this place is a nicer restaurant, you still get a bib but it's definitely not a hole in the wall crab joint.  With that said, I wouldn't recommend it for a first or second date, b/c most girls will squirm at the thought of cracking crab legs (which might mess up our outfits, God forbid our date's crab gets flung inadvertently into our hair), and the garlic factor too, just don't do it.  Wait till you guys have reached that comfort level where you just don't give an F and can school that crab in peace without any insecurity.

excerpts:
Mussels
Entree: Garlic roasted crab
Side: Garlic noodles
Dessert: Fried banana
garlic noodles.author: Rico P.
garlic noodles.review:
I have been coming to this place for quite some time now. I don't come here as often as I want to since the food here is so rich.  My usual order goes as follows:

Drink: Fleur de Mango
Appetizers: Mussels
Entree: Garlic roasted crab
Side: Garlic noodles
Dessert: Fried banana

As always the service was perfect from calling to get the reservations, the hostess, the waitress and the busboys.  All working together to make the dinner memorable.

excerpts: But be sure to get the garlic noodles!
garlic noodles.author: Raquel C.
garlic noodles.review:
My boyfriend and I came to Thanh Long to celebrate Valentine's day. We got the roasted garlic crab and trust me, this is the best crab I ever had and I'm a crab aficionado. I think it's even better than the crab at R&G lounge. My mouth is watering just thinking about the buttery goodness. YUMM! 

We also got the shaken beef but I could have done without it. I've tried better versions of the vietnamese "bo luc lac". But be sure to get the garlic noodles! The flavor reminds me of little caesar's crazy bread but still definitely tasty!

Also, make sure to make a reservation or easily you can be waiting for an hour+

excerpts: I tried the Roasted Crab, garlic noodles, crab puffs, mango shrimp salad, and fried calamari.
garlic noodles.author: Cindy C.
garlic noodles.review:
I feel like this place is all hype. I tried the Roasted Crab, garlic noodles, crab puffs, mango shrimp salad, and fried calamari. 

Roasted Crab- The crab was not really sweet and tasted kind of dry as if it was either frozen or over cooked. I understand it wasn't crab season but still doesn't excuse the dryness of it. 

Garlic noodles- The noodles were not bad.

Crab Puffs- These were probably my favorite out of all the dishes we had. It was stuffed with crab meat but the presentation was not so nice. The way they wrapped it looked like a kid had wrapped it and it was just plopped on the plate with minimal garnishes. I am only complaining because for that price..I either one, expect more food or two, nice presentation. It had neither. 

Manago shrimp salad - It really lacked flavor, the dressing needed to be more acid and salt. 

Fried calamari- Typical average fried calamari. 

Very disappointed. This place definitely is charging too much for what they are serving.

excerpts: Garlic noodles were good, and the eggplant was a favorite (for my friends, not for me).
Parking, though was a nightmare and reservations are a must.
Compared to R&G, R&G wins hands (and claws) down.
garlic noodles.author: Jenny J.
garlic noodles.review: Good, but what kept me from more stars was the absurdly small portions. The crab was I think $40 and it was tiny and just good (not awesome). The shaking beef was delicious but close to $30 and had maybe 10 chunks of meat on a bed of filler lettuce. Garlic noodles were good, and the eggplant was a favorite (for my friends, not for me). Parking, though was a nightmare and reservations are a must. Compared to R&G, R&G wins hands (and claws) down.

excerpts: Garlic noodles wasn't great either.
The only great dish we had
that was really good
garlic noodles.author: Karen L.
garlic noodles.review:
I was excited to try this since people were saying how good it was, however, it's not that good.  We got the Boiled and the Drunken crab, and I wouldn't have known the crab was drunken if it weren't for the different coloring of the crab and the saltiness.  While the Shaken Beef was pretty tasty, there were only several pieces, and twice the amount of potatoes.  Garlic noodles wasn't great either.  The only great dish we had that was really good was the grilled calamari, it was delicious.
Walking away from a restaurant still hungry after a big bill is not a good thing.  Compared to PPQ, Thanh Long loses by price, taste, and quantity.  However, their setting and service is much better than PPQ.

excerpts: Prawns and garlic noodles $41, so yes, expensive.
4 prawns butterflied
grilled garlic and butter laced,
oh so delicious.
And the noodles where the carb load I needed for race day in the morning.
I used take-out service and the service was fast and efficient.
In/out within 10 mins.
garlic noodles.author: Bill D.
garlic noodles.review: Prawns and garlic noodles $41, so yes, expensive. 4 prawns butterflied grilled garlic and butter laced, oh so delicious. And the noodles where the carb load I needed for race day in the morning. I used take-out service and the service was fast and efficient. In/out within 10 mins.

excerpts: Even the garlic noodles didn't make me do my yummy sounds.
My dad agreed with me.
garlic noodles.author: danielle l.
garlic noodles.review:
Being raised in the Sunset, my family would always eat at Thanh Long before it got all "fancy". My dad still occasionally tells the story of when I threw a temper tantrum in the middle of the restaurant while he was entertaining his boss.Then we moved to the East Bay and driving to the Sunset was just too far. I ate at Thanh Long a couple of years ago after my long hiatus and I was...disappointed. It was good but not as good as I remember. Whomp Whomp. I have had other roasted crabs that tasted just as good if not better and for less money. Even the garlic noodles didn't make me do my yummy sounds. My dad agreed with me. He said the quality has gone down over the years.

I was expecting something spectacular and amazing after being away for so long but I left saying "it's not what I remember". Don't get me wrong it was good, but not orgasmic like everyone claims it is.

excerpts: As for the garlic noodles....
they're garlic noodles.
People rant and rave about the garlic noodles this...garlic noodles that...
And how it's a secret family restaurant, but just type into Google: "how to make garlic noodles" and
you can probably find a comparable recipe.
garlic noodles.author: Lauren L.
garlic noodles.review:
Hello, mother of Crustacean restaurant (one of the popular restaurants in Beverly Hills) -- but a grungy, hole-in-the wall version of it. 

I mean....the crab is good? But I wish it were in the "great" category, especially since it's quite expensive. I have no qualms paying big bucks for a good meal, as long as it reflects the taste of the food. 

As for the garlic noodles....they're garlic noodles. People rant and rave about the garlic noodles this...garlic noodles that...And how it's a secret family restaurant, but just type into Google: "how to make garlic noodles" and you can probably find a comparable recipe. MMM. 

Overall, the food is good. Nothing that would make me want to come back another time -- especially for the $$$.

excerpts: All of my cousins that have visited the city have eaten there and have loved the garlic noodles and roast crab.
Now that I'm here in the bay, I finally got to try it
and I now know why my cousins won't  stfu about this place.
We ordered the salt and pepper calamari, thanh long mussels, roast crab, and garlic noodles.
We ordered the salt and pepper calamari, thanh long mussels, roast crab, and garlic noodles.
We later got the garlic noodles and roast crab and OMFG SOOOOO GOOD.
We later got the garlic noodles and roast crab and OMFG SOOOOO GOOD.
The garlic noodles are spaghetti noodles (or so I think)
but in a nice blend of garlic, salt, and crack.
The roast crab is even more delicious than the noodles.
It was garlicky and peppery with probably more crack.
I now understand why each table setting has crab crackers.
Who goes to Thanh Long without trying their roast crab?!?!?!?!?!
garlic noodles.author: Anna K.
garlic noodles.review:
I have been hearing about Thanh Long for several years now ever since I started flying to the bay. All of my cousins that have visited the city have eaten there and have loved the garlic noodles and roast crab. Now that I'm here in the bay, I finally got to try it and I now know why my cousins won't  stfu about this place. I can now join my cousins as we can't and won't stfu about Thanh Long.

Thanh Long is slightly far from the heart of the city, near 46th street. My friends and I were lost and almost gave up, since we were traveling from Mission. However, we finally found it and were relieved that our trek to the restaurant was over. We ordered the salt and pepper calamari, thanh long mussels, roast crab, and garlic noodles. The salt and pepper calamari was the first dish to reach our table. I didn't really enjoy the dish because the batter made some pieces taste stale while other pieces were crispy. I sat at the table thinking, OMG I hope this place gets better or else I'm going to scream at all my cousins for this shizz. The second dish we received was the thanh long mussels. It was mussels with a pesto sauce on top of a slice of buttered bread. YUMMY!!!! By this time I thought a good dish canceled out a bad and was feeling better about Thanh Long. We later got the garlic noodles and roast crab and OMFG SOOOOO GOOD. The garlic noodles are spaghetti noodles (or so I think) but in a nice blend of garlic, salt, and crack. The roast crab is even more delicious than the noodles. It was garlicky and peppery with probably more crack. I now understand why each table setting has crab crackers. Who goes to Thanh Long without trying their roast crab?!?!?!?!?! 

I probably stunk of garlic when I met up with my friend Shad and his friend Erin after dinner. But would I change my restaurant plans knowing that I would be meeting up with them? HELL NO!! SORRY!!!! I come in (garlicky) peace. =]

excerpts: Love the garlic noodles..
The seafood is great and the drinks are also amazing.
The crab is completely flavorful and the taste will make your mouth pleased
garlic noodles.author: Norell B.
garlic noodles.review: Love the garlic noodles.. The seafood is great and the drinks are also amazing. The crab is completely flavorful and the taste will make your mouth pleased

excerpts: The garlic noodles and crab were divine.
We'll be back.
garlic noodles.author: Lisette P.
garlic noodles.review: Dungeness Crab!!! There are quite a few Vietnamese places in town that do something similar but Thanh Long is definitely in first place. Great service, lots of seating, attentive waiters (like those little extras where you get the napkin put on your lap and water when your glass is empty). The garlic noodles and crab were divine. We'll be back.

excerpts: I recommend the Garlic Roasted Crab with Garlic Noodles.
Best crab I ever had and cannot find any better.
The Garlic Noddles are so tasty.
Top it off with fried banana for dessert.
garlic noodles.author: Felipe D.
garlic noodles.review: I recommend the Garlic Roasted Crab with Garlic Noodles.  Best crab I ever had and cannot find any better.  The Garlic Noddles are so tasty.  Top it off with fried banana for dessert.

excerpts: My three friends and I came here for dinner and we shared two crabs, garlic noodles, coconut shrimp, Vietnamese salad and two bowls of soup all for about $45 per person.
Food came fast, was tasty, wait staff was attentive to what we needed and always made sure to clear our table.
garlic noodles.author: Mel L.
garlic noodles.review:
My three friends and I came here for dinner and we shared two crabs, garlic noodles, coconut shrimp, Vietnamese salad and two bowls of soup all for about $45 per person.  Food came fast, was tasty, wait staff was attentive to what we needed and always made sure to clear our table.  I did prefer the roast crab to the drunken crab, but that's mainly because I'm a big fan of garlic.  The other entrees were good, but it's going to be the crab that brings me back.  

The restaurant was really big and reservations is a must.  Even at 6 pm, there was a 45 min wait.

excerpts: We went with the classic meal which was perfect for two people to share: Salt & Pepper Calamari, Roasted Crab, & Garlic Noodles.
garlic noodles.author: Marie C.
garlic noodles.review:
Visited here over 5 years ago and have dreamed of it ever since. Was positive that there was no way that it would live up to the mental hype that I've surrounded it with over time, but it was even BETTER than I remembered. 

We went with the classic meal which was perfect for two people to share: Salt & Pepper Calamari, Roasted Crab, & Garlic Noodles. Outstanding in every way.

Add in delicious drinks and great service and you've got a major winner.

excerpts: My friend was craving Thanh Long's famous roasted crab and garlic noodles.
Since it is crab season, I was in favor of her suggestion.
I visited Thanh Long more then 20 years ago.
Back then, it was a dive with cheesy decor.
It has been up graded with a full bar and frescos on the walls.
Ordered the garlic noodles too.
My companion added chili sauce to the already tasty noodles to, "give it a kick."  Great idea!
Add the crab meat and Ooooo.
Don't worry about messing up your clothes, they put on a huge plastic bib on you.
garlic noodles.author: Wayne L.
garlic noodles.review:
My friend was craving Thanh Long's famous roasted crab and garlic noodles.  Since it is crab season, I was in favor of her suggestion.  I visited Thanh Long more then 20 years ago.  Back then, it was a dive with cheesy decor.  It has been up graded with a full bar and frescos on the walls.  The restaurant is well lit and comfortable.

Once you walk in, wading through the crowd in the tiny front lobby.  tip-make reservations for two or more.  there's a full bar on the right before you walk up to the host station.  

We started off with a traditional Vietnamese salad comprising of shredded cabbage, and shrimp in a kind of sweet rice vingarette sauce.  The crab was in butter with copious amount of pepper, tasty.  Ordered the garlic noodles too.  My companion added chili sauce to the already tasty noodles to, "give it a kick."  Great idea!  Add the crab meat and Ooooo.  Don't worry about messing up your clothes, they put on a huge plastic bib on you.  They also give you hot towels to wipe your hands after eating crab.

We sipped a lemon drop with Chambord.  Good.

Dinner coupled with great company and it was a nice time and meal. 

Service was very attentive, but not intrusive.  

I would give it more stars except it was not spectacular in uniqueness.  Although I noticed there are varieties of other delectable items on the menu.  Who am I to say?  There were people still coming in at 9:30 for dinner.

excerpts: but I really wanted their garlic noodles, some girl had it for lunch at work and the smell I could not get out of my mind...
she warned me of the bad service
but I didn't know it was that bad!
This place needs to get their hospitality together.
garlic noodles.author: Tim V.
garlic noodles.review:
HORRIBLE SERVICE!!!! 2 stars for the food, it would be one if the food wasn't as good as it was. 

We walk in and it is an hour wait, we decide to go for it and they said they can call us on my cell phone. We gave a number and had a drink down the block, before you know it its been about an hour. I call and they said our name isn't on the list... I get put on hold and a different lady said she called our names but we weren't here..... I mention that we left our phone number and I never got a call. She just responds just by saying that we can be seated right when we get there. 
We get there and not one apology, and we did not get seated right away! We had to wait another 10 minutes. We finally get seated and still no apology, they were not even friendly!

We had a lot of issues with our experience, but we were not the only ones!!!! The couple next to us had to send back 2 dishes! One for not being hot and another for not having a certain side or something was missing. The couple behind us really got into it and it actually caused an argument between the two because the "laid back guy" didn't want to complain but the girl wasn't having it. Her soup was cold and he yelled at her for "ordering more of something she didn't like"... The guy though despite him not wanting to complain couldn't eat his crab for a half hour for some reason or the other. I thought it was his left over crab! When the manager went to go grab it he stopped him and said it was fine.... so he ended up eating cold crab by himself because his date left him. They brought out her soup and he just took it to go.. DRAMA!!

We had a pretty dim waiter.. I just wanted the garlic noodle with some chicken, to add meat you apparently have to order an appetizer and they just put it on top of the noodles. So the $9 noodle dish turned into a $20 dish to have 3 pieces of chicken on it... the whole place was grossly over priced (and I am talking about their non seafood dishes). 
Two people who were seated AFTER us had got their appetizer AND their meals before we got our appetizer... when the waiter brought out ONE of our dishes we asked where the appetizer was? He said he will bring it out but we said never mind since our meals will get cold so we just want to cancel the appetizer. We ended up getting the appetizer for free so that made up for it.... however we NEVER got checked up on and when it came time for dessert we were hesitant, but I was celebrating a promotion so I wanted to go for it. We almost changed our mind because it took him about 20 min to come back and take our dessert order! We order the chocolate molten cake and 20 min later we get fried bananas... The guy even repeated our order!!! He takes it back and brings out the cake... and the cake was overpriced.. it was something you buy at Safeway and microwave, only we paid about 3x as more. Smallest molten lava cake I ever had at a restaurant. 
We were their 10/5/13 got there around 8pm got seated sometime after 9 and left sometime after 10:20pm.... Dinner for two should not take that long of a process. This place sucks but I really wanted their garlic noodles, some girl had it for lunch at work and the smell I could not get out of my mind... she warned me of the bad service but I didn't know it was that bad! This place needs to get their hospitality together.

excerpts: Ordered the mango salad, garlic noodles, lemongrass chicken.
Bill came out to be $43 dollars.
My friends weren't a fan of the lemongrass because it has a strong taste, but I loved it- being a fan of lemongrass flavor all the way back from Thailand!
The garlic noodles was flavorful, but was a bit salty.
Still good and would order it!
The mango salad's dressing tasted fabulous too!
garlic noodles.author: Vivian L.
garlic noodles.review:
Finally came here last night with great company!

Ordered the mango salad, garlic noodles, lemongrass chicken. Bill came out to be $43 dollars. My friends weren't a fan of the lemongrass because it has a strong taste, but I loved it- being a fan of lemongrass flavor all the way back from Thailand! The garlic noodles was flavorful, but was a bit salty. Still good and would order it! The mango salad's dressing tasted fabulous too!

excerpts: Garlic Noodles and Roasted Crab.
Well, maybe not entirely different because we still got our garlic noodles (its a must).
garlic noodles.author: Heather P.
garlic noodles.review:
Do I even have to say it again? Garlic Noodles and Roasted Crab. mMmm.

On my last visit everyone at the table ordered that. So I decided to switch it up a bit and try something different. Well, maybe not entirely different because we still got our garlic noodles (its a must). 

Shaken Beef- It was good. I'd probably order it again if we're in a group to share. But to have it as a main dish with your noodles...i'd rather stick to the crab

Curry Lotus Prawns- I really like this one. A little spicy, but tolerable. I only wish it had more prawns. Plenty of the other stuff.

excerpts: Roasted Crab and Garlic Noodles!
2 main entrees that you abbbbsooooolutely have to order.
The succulent pieces of crab were drenched in a garlic, buttery flavor enough for 2 people to share.
Garlic noodles were just right, not too mushy and the garlic flavor was not overpowering.
Overall I would definitely return if I was ever in the mood for some great crab and garlic noodles!
garlic noodles.author: Day Z.
garlic noodles.review:
Roasted Crab and Garlic Noodles! 2 main entrees that you abbbbsooooolutely have to order.  The succulent pieces of crab were drenched in a garlic, buttery flavor enough for 2 people to share. Garlic noodles were just right, not too mushy and the garlic flavor was not overpowering.

Restaurant is a bit small, not much room for larger parties especially when you need that extra elbow space for some crab crack'n!  Looking for parking is not the greatest but they do offer valet which is a plus. Overall I would definitely return if I was ever in the mood for some great crab and garlic noodles!

excerpts: go here for the roasted crab and garlic noodles, that's it!
PPQ has a much better peppered crabs.
Garlic noodles better at Thanh long
garlic noodles.author: Albert M.
garlic noodles.review:
go here for the roasted crab and garlic noodles, that's it!
PPQ has a much better peppered crabs. Garlic noodles better at Thanh long

excerpts: Who doesn't like crab and garlic noodles??
garlic noodles.author: Rosie W.
garlic noodles.review:
Who doesn't like crab and garlic noodles?? Oh my, so delicious.

Thanh Long is located in the Sunset district, kind of tucked all the way near the 40's streets. There aren't any other big name restaurants around the area, it's kind of quiet actually. Parking shouldn't be too bad if you're worried about that.

It's really nice inside. If you've ever been to PPQ on Clement st, this places's decor doesn't even compare to that. The inside reminds of me a nice steakhouse. I first came here with a group of 6 of my coworkers and they sat us in this half circle booth table in the middle. Awesome service and they were all very attentive. 

I'm only giving it a 4 stars (which is really good btw), because the food didn't blow me away. I think it's comparable to PPQ, but the place is really nice, but it's more expensive. If you haven't been, you should definitely try!

excerpts: Being that I can't really venture out, I've always ordered/shared the same dishes: Garlic noodles (YUM!
garlic noodles.author: Vivian A.
garlic noodles.review:
I think it's funny how I'm allergic to shellfish and yet I've been here three times. I guess when the time calls for toying with looking like Will Smith in "Hitch" when he had his allergic reaction, I choose to gamble my swelling odds by going here.

Being that I can't really venture out, I've always ordered/shared the same dishes: Garlic noodles (YUM! You got to eat them when they are warm tho 'cuz once they got soft, they turn to a hard, buttery clump of yuckness) and the drunken crab or the roasted/garlic crab. Put your bib on, get your hands dirty, and dig in. The crab is  bomb!

On one occasion I tried some fish, I think the halibut. The halibut was light and fluffy but the sauce that came with it was super sweet. It didn't pair well. Maybe I was just craving crab, so I stole two crab legs from my friends eating with me. Much better.

Go there, eat the crab, get messy, have fun.

excerpts: Must try the Garlic noodles and Crab.
garlic noodles.author: Jeremy F.
garlic noodles.review:
BOMB!  Must try the Garlic noodles and Crab.

stop by - you wont be disappointed.

excerpts: Roast Garlic Crab, Garlic Noodles, Shaken Beef, nice bottle of wine, handsome date.
Garlic noodles were the perfect partner to the crab and highly recommended!
garlic noodles.author: Sarah A.
garlic noodles.review:
Roast Garlic Crab, Garlic Noodles, Shaken Beef, nice bottle of wine, handsome date. All checks!

Definitely a place to check out at some point- especially during crab season. Crab was delicious and fresh and had just the right amount of extra seasonings and flavor. Garlic noodles were the perfect partner to the crab and highly recommended!

excerpts: garlic noodles didn't look well, but taste great, worth a try!!
love the environment and service, nice place!
garlic noodles.author: Wei T.
garlic noodles.review:
i love the crabs!!!
both drunken crab and toasted crab were great! love love love them.
garlic noodles didn't look well, but taste great, worth a try!!
love the environment and service, nice place!

excerpts: Like everyone else, we ordered the: Roasted Crab and Garlic Noodles.
For some reason, I don't think we got our whole crab since it was missing a claw
but we had some extra legs to make up for that missing claw.
That tiny crab could not have been more than 2 pounds which made the $40 dollars seem pretty pricey.
And, the garlic noodles is nothing fancy.
Just noodles with lots of garlic sauce.
I thought they could have made it a bit better with some mushrooms or something.
I have definitely had better garlic noodles elsewhere.
This food is good and it is worth trying out, but not really worth the price.
garlic noodles.author: Jenn W.
garlic noodles.review: Like everyone else, we ordered the: Roasted Crab and Garlic Noodles.  For some reason, I don't think we got our whole crab since it was missing a claw but we had some extra legs to make up for that missing claw.  That tiny crab could not have been more than 2 pounds which made the $40 dollars seem pretty pricey.  And, the garlic noodles is nothing fancy.  Just noodles with lots of garlic sauce.  I thought they could have made it a bit better with some mushrooms or something.  I have definitely had better garlic noodles elsewhere.  This food is good and it is worth trying out, but not really worth the price.

excerpts: Also ordered the garlic noodles and shaken beef, both of which were just sublime.
I particularly liked the depth of flavors in the shaken beef.
This dish is complex, and oh so pleasing to the palate.
I cannot recommend this restaurant highly enough.
Amazing food, really friendly, attentive and knowledgeable service, solid wine list (always a plus for me).
One of my favorite restaurants in California.
garlic noodles.author: Orlando G.
garlic noodles.review: Came here with my wife on our anniversary.  This is the perfect place to celebrate ANYTHING, or just to come for an amazing meal anytime!!  It is a little pricey, but very much worth it.  We ordered the whole Dungeness crab in An's special pepper/garlic/butter sauce.  To DIE for.  Also ordered the garlic noodles and shaken beef, both of which were just sublime.  I particularly liked the depth of flavors in the shaken beef.  This dish is complex, and oh so pleasing to the palate.  I cannot recommend this restaurant highly enough.  Amazing food, really friendly, attentive and knowledgeable service, solid wine list (always a plus for me).  One of my favorite restaurants in California.

excerpts: Crab and Garlic noodles are must-have, no doubt, but Oh My God, try their Calamari!
garlic noodles.author: Bella B.
garlic noodles.review: This is a local area restaurant in the Sunset It does not get better than Thanh Long. This is definitely one of my favorite resteraunt ever. The best Crab you ever want to eat. Crab and Garlic noodles are must-have, no doubt, but Oh My God, try their Calamari! Their Salt And Pepper Calamari is like the best ever! Their Mango Warm Salad is great, too. I love their Sea Bass, although it isn't really different than how other restaurants prepare it. End your dinner with their House Special Orange or Lemon Sorbet. Definitely one of my favorite restaurants in San Francisco!

excerpts: oh snaps Thanh Long's garlic noodles!!!!
om nom nom nom
http://media2.px.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/Gr8HdUlQkj3BroRCbgYFTg/l
The gf and decided that roasted crab and garlic noodles sounded the best for a cheat day!
Why not stuff yourself with carbs and buttery goodness!
The roasted crab was amazing, very buttery and peppered and went well with the amazing garlic noodles.
The garlic noodles had just enough garlic flavor without being overpowering, so one order between two people was not enough.
Yes!
I just had to order a second one ;)
Thanh Long won my heart and my stomach with their amazing garlic noodles, sorry PPQ but you are my second favorite now.
garlic noodles.author: Jonathan W.
garlic noodles.review:
OMG.....I'm having a carb attack.....must have carbs!! Yes even i have carb cravings too!  oh snaps Thanh Long's garlic noodles!!!!! om nom nom nom  http://media2.px.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/Gr8HdUlQkj3BroRCbgYFTg/l
The gf and decided that roasted crab and garlic noodles sounded the best for a cheat day! Why not stuff yourself with carbs and buttery goodness! ;)  

The roasted crab was amazing, very buttery and peppered and went well with the amazing garlic noodles. The garlic noodles had just enough garlic flavor without being overpowering, so one order between two people was not enough. Yes! I just had to order a second one ;)  We also tried the Buddha roll as a started, lacking in size but excelling in taste, i would definitely recommend it. http://media1.px.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/RRbjQc-TiIc9VU9BYS-wWw/l Being a Protein fiend, i wanted more protein with our dinner so we decided to get the Saigon beef too. http://media1.px.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/td1A4gpMLMU2VIIIfjEp0g/l The beef was very tender and had marvelous flavoring to it on top of a bed of salad. Perfect! it came with veggies! ;). Thanh Long was definitely worth the 30min wait but I know next time to MAKE RESERVATIONS!!!  Also its probably best to go during crab season, it can be steep when crabs are not in season. Thanh Long won my heart and my stomach with their amazing garlic noodles, sorry PPQ but you are my second favorite now.

excerpts: Their garlic noodles and roast crab are to die for!
The servers are nice.
LONG WAIT  if you don't have a reservation.
But just the same, the food is worth the wait.
This restaurant nevers fails to impress anyone I bring along.
YUMMY FOOD!!!
garlic noodles.author: Donna B.
garlic noodles.review: Simply AMAZING!  I've been going to this restaurant since 1988. Their garlic noodles and roast crab are to die for!  The servers are nice. LONG WAIT  if you don't have a reservation. But just the same, the food is worth the wait. This restaurant nevers fails to impress anyone I bring along. YUMMY FOOD!!!

excerpts: The basic crab (watch out for that Market Price on the menu -- $39 when I was there!) and garlic noodles ($10!) are also good, and you don't come away with the overall feeling of sodden heaviness that you get at other Vietnamese crab shacks like, say, PPQ Dungeness Island.
garlic noodles.author: Daniel S.
garlic noodles.review:
FOUR STAR FOOD at five star prices.  For that, Thanh Long gets 3 stars.

You know me: I feel that good food should be priced appropriately.  Thanh Long, however -- probably due to its 40 years of operation and crowd-pleasing food -- gets pretty expensive pretty fast.  

Now, this place is not Slanted Door -- that is, it's not all bland, whitey-friendly food.  The Spicy Eggplant ($17), for example, is a fun and flavorful, without the glooptastic oiliness that afflicts similar dishes.  

The basic crab (watch out for that Market Price on the menu -- $39 when I was there!) and garlic noodles ($10!) are also good, and you don't come away with the overall feeling of sodden heaviness that you get at other Vietnamese crab shacks like, say, PPQ Dungeness Island.  Also hits: the tender Shaking Beef and the spring rolls. 

But is it worth the price?  Well, I wouldn't turn down a free meal there, but there are lots of other places to investigate for much less.  Venture forth and try them out:

http://www.yelp.com/list/dont-go-to-slanted-door-oakland

excerpts: We ordered their roasted crab and garlic noodles.
Delicious.
Very rich in flavor, so
it's not for the faint of heart.
I enjoyed the crab mostly, and was left fully satisfied.
I couldn't even finish the darn thing!
garlic noodles.author: Connie C.
garlic noodles.review:
Came here with a group of friends on a Saturday night. I'm so glad my husband called in earlier for a reservation because the place was packed. 

We ordered their roasted crab and garlic noodles. Delicious. Very rich in flavor, so it's not for the faint of heart. I enjoyed the crab mostly, and was left fully satisfied. I couldn't even finish the darn thing! Luckily we had people who wanted more. 

My husband isn't a seafood eater, so he ordered their eggplant dish. That was actually very good too. It was nice balance between crab and eggplant. He devoured the entire plate of noodles, so I'm pretty sure he left happy too.

Great place to hang out with friends. And if you love crab, definitely check this place out!

excerpts: Order the garlic noodles to go with it - all together an amazing meal.
Make a reservation - it looked pretty packed otherwise.
garlic noodles.author: Taty S.
garlic noodles.review: Went here with friends for dinner after an amazing day in Napa and I have to say, best crab ever! Tried the drunken and roasted crab, roasted crab is the way to go - the spices on it just make it that much better. Order the garlic noodles to go with it - all together an amazing meal. Make a reservation - it looked pretty packed otherwise.

excerpts: Garlic Noodles are so-so.
Its more like garlic pasta.
Not really asian or vietnamese.
garlic noodles.author: Norman P.
garlic noodles.review:
Garlic Noodles are so-so. Its more like garlic pasta. Not really asian or vietnamese. But it does go well with the crab.

The roasted crab is very peppery. I do have to say that somehow the meat stays together in more solid chunks than when I've cooked it at home. 1 crab would be good enough to share between 2 people as long as you order another main or a few appetizers.

The Shaken Beef though. Wow. So tender. Just simply the best Shaken Beef I've ever had. I'll come here again for this. And its cheaper than the crab.

Parking is a pain, so you might want to factor in/come mentally prepared to valet your car. I hate valeting my car, so I end up driving around in circles til I find a spot in this crowded residential neighborhood.

excerpts:
Stuck with the recommendations and ordered the royal tiger prawns, garlic noodles, and roasted crab. 
The prawns was on a generous bed of garlic noodles and ended up packing up our side order of garlic noodles. 

The garlic noodles were ok, wished it had a bit more garlic flavor.
garlic noodles.author: Cindy A.
garlic noodles.review:
Best crab in the city!! I've been craving fresh crab for months. I left satisfied and very happy! Stuck with the recommendations and ordered the royal tiger prawns, garlic noodles, and roasted crab. The prawns was on a generous bed of garlic noodles and ended up packing up our side order of garlic noodles. 

Tiger Prawns were butterflied/grilled and excellent! Roasted Crab was peppery and messy (your bib will actually come in handy), and so good! The garlic noodles were ok, wished it had a bit more garlic flavor. 

Service was excellent and quick. Was in/out in about an hour. Atmosphere was very busy, make sure you have reservations (although we called to change our reservation and they didn't have our original reservations). Lots of families, groups, and couples. Will be back soon!!

excerpts: Garlic Noodles were lacking.
It didn't taste anything of fresh garlic.
garlic noodles.author: Tiffany L.
garlic noodles.review:
I rarely ever Yelp because, let's face it, unless it's a meal I'd have for my last supper, or it's absolutely atrocious, I'm too darn lazy! But the mediocre, overpriced food at Thanh Long has beat out my laziness.

I used to eat at Thanh Long as a child and absolutely LOVED it. We had reservations for 4 for my brother's birthday dinner two nights ago, and needless to say, I will NEVER return! The food was comparable to a buffet in Reno. 

Garlic Noodles were lacking. It didn't taste anything of fresh garlic. Instead, the noodles were soggy and overcooked, with the flavor of garlic salt.

Mango salad was probably the only tolerable dish we had that night. The vinaigrette was light and sweet, but the portion was pretty small.

The shaken beef was a huge disappointment. The entire bottom of the plate was covered in chopped romaine lettuce, but was hidden under beef, giving the impression that the plate was full of beef. In addition, there were ample chopped potatoes sauteed to LOOK like beef. There were maybe a total of 9 piece of actual beef on the plate, for about $20-$25. 

The sea bass was absolutely bland. It was cooked with no seasoning, AT ALL. The saving grace for this dish was the accompanying sauce on the side, which had a slight sweet, citrus flavor to it. For $25, the serving of sea bass is smaller than the average portion for one person. There was ONE bok choy cut into thirds on the side of this dish. I'm pretty sure bok choy i s$0.79/lb at the supermarket. If you're gonna skimp on the portion of the fish, you could at least use more than one bok choy.

Thanh Long has always had a special place in my heart for their crab. No more. The roast crab we ordered came out lukewarm. This would've been tolerable had the crab actually had flavor. It looked like it was covered in black pepper, but had no taste at all = pre-ground black pepper. I RARELY use salt to cook, and my usual complaint when I eat out is that the food is too salty. This crab didn't have even a pinch of salt in it! They used to use so much butter in their sauce that when it cooled, the bottom of the dish would be covered in coagulated butter. Not anymore. 

I cannot remember the last time I had a meal so disappointing. PPQ on Clement is WAY better, and I will never again patron Thanh Long!

excerpts: I love the garlic noodles (which are exactly the same as what you get on their food truck)
so I got that with four prawns.
My friend got a pork and shrimp dish for around $20 (which doesn't even come with rice), and my other friend got just the garlic noodles which were around $10.
Mind you, I got the garlic noodles with prawns (4 of them) which were listed as "market price".
I figured it would be $20-25 since the noodles were around $10, but my bad for not asking!!
When we got the bill, my dish was $38!!!
That's basically $7 per prawn.
Are they out of their minds??
In addition, the drinks we ordered were just average.
I'll definitely visit their food truck again where I can get noodles and some type of meat for around $13, but I'll never go back to the restaurant!
garlic noodles.author: Kari T.
garlic noodles.review: This was my first time here in many, many years and I was super excited! I remembered it being a classy place with good food, but I was a little disappointed on this visit. The ambiance is not great. It's a little loud, a little rushed, and just not very cute inside (we were seated downstairs so not sure if upstairs is different). More importantly, the food is good but didn't wow me. I love the garlic noodles (which are exactly the same as what you get on their food truck) so I got that with four prawns. My friend got a pork and shrimp dish for around $20 (which doesn't even come with rice), and my other friend got just the garlic noodles which were around $10. Mind you, I got the garlic noodles with prawns (4 of them) which were listed as "market price". I figured it would be $20-25 since the noodles were around $10, but my bad for not asking!! When we got the bill, my dish was $38!!! That's basically $7 per prawn. Are they out of their minds?? In addition, the drinks we ordered were just average. I'll definitely visit their food truck again where I can get noodles and some type of meat for around $13, but I'll never go back to the restaurant!

excerpts: We had the roasted crab, garlic noodles, and the Asian Bouillabaisse soup.
I didn't try the soup, but I tried the roasted crab and garlic noodles which were both okay.
The crab didn't have as much flavor as I wanted it to.
The garlic noodles were too..
garlic-y?
I like Perilla's garlic noodles better.
garlic noodles.author: Joyce E.
garlic noodles.review:
I came here with family on a Saturday night. Parking is difficult! Ayiyi if the parking gods aren't with you, give yourself at least an extra 30 minutes to find parking!

This place was just alright. We had the roasted crab, garlic noodles, and the Asian Bouillabaisse soup. I didn't try the soup, but I tried the roasted crab and garlic noodles which were both okay. The crab didn't have as much flavor as I wanted it to. The garlic noodles were too.. garlic-y? I like Perilla's garlic noodles better.

The prices are ridiculous, too.

excerpts: The crab entree is about $40 (per person & prices vary by season), and the side of garlic noodles is $10.. and their both worth every penny.
garlic noodles.author: Gina D.
garlic noodles.review: I love butter, garlic, and crab..... A LOT! Maybe that's why this is one of my favorite restaurants!  Along with 99% of the other diners there, hubby & I always get 2 orders of the delicious roasted buttery, garlicky, crab and a side of buttery, garlicky noodles. There's more on the menu, but I wouldn't know... since we only order these 2 fabulous items every time. The crab entree is about $40 (per person & prices vary by season), and the side of garlic noodles is $10.. and their both worth every penny. We did try the mango salad ($12) on this last visit and it was nice to have some veggies, even though my focus was on all the butter & garlic goodness on my plate.

excerpts: Not so much of a big fan of the garlic noodles although all yelpers rave about it.
garlic noodles.author: Shirley H.
garlic noodles.review:
Came here just before my "no seafood diet", and I'm so glad I did!

Being a somewhat upscale seafood restaurant of this quality, the location really threw me off because it's in the Sunset residential district and really has nothing else interesting around but this. Also, don't forget to make reservation because it gets packed all. the. time. 

Ordered salt and pepper calamari for appetizer, nicely flavored and fried without any grease on the plate at all! 

Not so much of a big fan of the garlic noodles although all yelpers rave about it. It was a little overcooked and greasy. 

The highlight is the roast crab, which, i can say, is by far the best Dungeness crab I've had in San Francisco!! The crab is huge and fresh, cooked with the "finger-licking good" garlic sauce. The meat was juicy and tender marinated with the delicious sauce. I could finish the entire thing by myself! 

Prices are a bit high, but it definitely is an awesome place to splurge for some seafood amazingness once in a while...would be back for sure!

excerpts: Hands down best crab and garlic noodles
I've ever had.
Some tips: First and foremost never share Lol get your own roasted crab and garlic noodles or you'll regret it.
garlic noodles.author: Lydia C.
garlic noodles.review:
Where can I start!? I absolutely love this restaurant! Even though their sister restaurant is crustacean and they have similar menus i still perfer Thanh Long. Hands down best crab and garlic noodles I've ever had. Some tips: First and foremost never share Lol get your own roasted crab and garlic noodles or you'll regret it. Yes, its that great! 

Some of my recommendations

-Salt and pepper calamari
-jumbo prawn wontons
-roast crab
-garlic noodles

excerpts: Now we all know that the garlic noodles are Gewd.
We all know that the Roasted Crab is GEWD!
But what about the rest of the menu?
I have this firm belief that if you deem a restaurant a good place to eat, and I mean OHSOGOOD to eat, its menu HAS to be delicious.
Its what keeps us coming back, right?
So into my foray into the deeper regions of the menu I found:
Now coming to Thanh Long, the goto items are naturally the crab and garlic noodles, but if you accompany your meal w/
garlic noodles.author: Ed P.
garlic noodles.review:
While everyone writes and sings praise over how good the food is here, I am going to do the complete OPPOSITE!  No, not really. This place is great. The locals know it. Tourists may end up at Crustaceans (Thanh Longs' downtown SF location), instead of the original location - but one truth remains the same: the food is good.

Now we all know that the garlic noodles are Gewd. We all know that the Roasted Crab is GEWD! But what about the rest of the menu? I have this firm belief that if you deem a restaurant a good place to eat, and I mean OHSOGOOD to eat, its menu HAS to be delicious. Its what keeps us coming back, right? So into my foray into the deeper regions of the menu I found: Shaken Beef.

Now coming to Thanh Long, the goto items are naturally the crab and garlic noodles, but if you accompany your meal w/ the shaken beef...*drool. Its a prime cut of meat sautéd w/ a sauce that makes this dish DELISH. You will usually see the shaken beef dish in higher-end Vietnamese restaurants, and Thanh Long's Vietnamese influence mos def shines through with this dish. Although a bit pricey ($20 at the time of review), its a trete de force for the red meat enthusiast.

excerpts: I was told to get the crab and garlic noodles
The noodles weren't special and neither was the crab.
I never had to use warm towels so guess that was bretty cool for dirty crab fingers.
I liked the atmosphere and service - it's just the food was not special for $66.

For that price, I could have cooked creatures washed up on the beach over a oil drum fire, invited some of SF's homeless people and got $66 worth of $4 slices of toast while we laugh at people actually paying exorbitant rents just to find out when they walk out of their apartment building, they see the homeless taking a dumping.
So much for luxury.
Shit, I really should have got some homeless people some food rather than spent it here.
garlic noodles.author: J C.
garlic noodles.review: So I was dragged to this place after spending some time seeing the miserable beach sight nearby. I didn't know a thing about the place and figured I wouldn't spend more than $20. I was told to get the crab and garlic noodles The noodles weren't special and neither was the crab. I never had to use warm towels so guess that was bretty cool for dirty crab fingers. I liked the atmosphere and service - it's just the food was not special for $66. For that price, I could have cooked creatures washed up on the beach over a oil drum fire, invited some of SF's homeless people and got $66 worth of $4 slices of toast while we laugh at people actually paying exorbitant rents just to find out when they walk out of their apartment building, they see the homeless taking a dumping. So much for luxury. Shit, I really should have got some homeless people some food rather than spent it here.

excerpts: The garlic noodles are always a must-order.
garlic noodles.author: Jermaine R.
garlic noodles.review:
I love Dungeness crab. I know it's a lot of work cracking the shells, but it's just soooo satisfying when you chuck out a savory nugget of meat from a chunky claw. It's like discovering buried treasure. I've tried all three of their crab dishes: roast, drunken, and tamarind. They're all amazing, but I like the tamarind the best because it has the most flavor.

If you're not a crab fan, the other dishes are also pretty amazing. The garlic noodles are always a must-order. The coconut prawns, satays, salt pepper calamari, and shaken beef are worth trying.

Their service is spot on. If you have crab, they'll put the bib on for you and regularly take away the empty shells. The only drawbacks for this place are It's not cheap and parking is a pain. Otherwise, I'd order a 10 course crab meal and spend half a day just cracking legs.

excerpts: Roast crab and garlic noodles are a dream!
I haven't had anything but those two items, and really, that is all I want.
garlic noodles.author: Stacey D.
garlic noodles.review:
I have been there a few times.  It gets packed, so make a reservation.  The valet service outside is very accommodating too.  

Roast crab and garlic noodles are a dream! I haven't had anything but those two items, and really, that is all I want.  Call me a creature of habit with crustaceans...

Creme brule is a nice desert to end the night.  They have a great wine selection too...I might add.

Service has been great both times I have been there.  When the servers offer you a bib, don't be offended.  You will notice by looking around about everyone is wearing one.  I rip it off as soon as the last piece of crab is taken away...but those juicy suckers are messy!  Lastly, I love a restaurant that boxes the food up for you...especially messy crab.  Thank you servers!

excerpts: The garlic noodles was divine.
It isn't greasy like other places that offer garlic noodles.
It is even good as leftovers.
garlic noodles.author: Katheryn H.
garlic noodles.review:
Very authentic tasting roasted crab. Fresh, meaty, and flavorful. It's the best I've tried other than "home." It's really filling. The garlic noodles was divine. It isn't greasy like other places that offer garlic noodles. It is even good as leftovers. I always order an extra order to take home. 

The spicy eggplant dish is one of the favorites!! It has prawns and chicken in the dish, but the eggplants really stand out. The aroma of the tamarind-based sauce mixed with the smell of the fresh basil... heavenly. The texture of everything together is marvelous - the eggplant with meat with the baby corn and mushroom. I love it!!

The broiled sea bass is also tasty. You can taste the ginger, scallion and citrus infused meat when you bite into it. It tastes great with rice. 

I always enjoy my meals here. I leave satisfied. In my opinion, Thanh Long offers a better menu than its Crustacean chain, even though it supposed to be the "same".

excerpts: Garlic noodles, roasted crab, shaken beef and asparagus crab soup!
Man, I can just lick the whole crab
cause it has so much flavor!
That pepper is sooooo good!
Even brought my parents here who are really picky eaters and don't like to eat at fancy restaurants - but they love it here!
Can even take home leftovers and still it taste fresh.
When feeling in the mood for crab and garlic noodles, this is the first place that comes to mind.
garlic noodles.author: Nicole M.
garlic noodles.review: Garlic noodles, roasted crab, shaken beef and asparagus crab soup!  Man, I can just lick the whole crab cause it has so much flavor!  That pepper is sooooo good! Even brought my parents here who are really picky eaters and don't like to eat at fancy restaurants - but they love it here! Can even take home leftovers and still it taste fresh.  When feeling in the mood for crab and garlic noodles, this is the first place that comes to mind.

excerpts: This is the place to get crab and garlic noodles.
Yeah sure they have other things on their menu, but all I gotta say is crab and garlic noodles.
Crab comes swimming in buttery garlicky goodness and noodles come in heaping piles.
Worth every penny and  the lingering garlic breath
garlic noodles.author: Maiyah M.
garlic noodles.review: Oh my holy Jebus.  This is the place to get crab and garlic noodles.  Yeah sure they have other things on their menu, but all I gotta say is crab and garlic noodles.  Crab comes swimming in buttery garlicky goodness and noodles come in heaping piles.  Worth every penny and  the lingering garlic breath

excerpts: We also shared a plate of Shaken Beef, 2 plates of Garlic Noodles and 1 plate of seasonal vegetables.
Everything was very good.
The crab was messy but tasty
but I especially liked the Shaken Beef.
Very sweet and tasty, similar to the Mongolian Beef at PF Chang's which
I LOVE.
I even liked the garlic noodles.
garlic noodles.author: Darien G.
garlic noodles.review:
We took my wife's mother here for dinner last Saturday night for Mother's Day.  This was my first time at Thanh Long, but I have eaten at Crustacean's before which I am told is owned by the same people.  I don't know much about Vietnamese food, other than Pho so I was a bit surprised that a restaurant known for crab was a Vietnamese place.  I never knew that crab was such a staple of the Vietnamese diet, but the An's can cook the hell out of a crab!

There were 4 of us so we split 2 crab, 1 roasted crab and 1 drunken crab.  We also shared a plate of Shaken Beef, 2 plates of Garlic Noodles and 1 plate of seasonal vegetables.  Everything was very good.  The crab was messy but tasty but I especially liked the Shaken Beef.  Very sweet and tasty, similar to the Mongolian Beef at PF Chang's which I LOVE.  I even liked the garlic noodles.

The only downside was the price of the crab, $40 each!!!! Yikes.  It felt like getting robbed without a gun.  But what are you gonna do?  I guess that's the market price for crab these days.

excerpts: You need to order your own roasted garIic crab with a side of garlic noodles and garlic jasmine friend rice.
Prob would be my top 3 fav meals ever!
I order that just about every time.
I've also tried the tiger prawns, excellent and a beef dish, it was pretty good, but everyone pretty much comes here for the crab and garlic noodles.
Reservations are highly recommended.
I would give this place 5 stars,
BUT I hate when they seat me upstairs (so not the same ambiance as downstairs) and parking is a little rough, unless you valet.
garlic noodles.author: Angela Z.
garlic noodles.review: my FAV place for crab! You need to order your own roasted garIic crab with a side of garlic noodles and garlic jasmine friend rice. Prob would be my top 3 fav meals ever! I order that just about every time. I've also tried the tiger prawns, excellent and a beef dish, it was pretty good, but everyone pretty much comes here for the crab and garlic noodles. Reservations are highly recommended. I would give this place 5 stars, BUT I hate when they seat me upstairs (so not the same ambiance as downstairs) and parking is a little rough, unless you valet.

excerpts: In a sentence, we agree with the reviewers, go for the roasted crab & garlic noodles!!!
Amaaaaazingly deeeeelicious!!!!
garlic noodles.author: Bill N.
garlic noodles.review:
We just visited Thanh Long for the first time and look forward to returning again!

In a sentence, we agree with the reviewers, go for the roasted crab & garlic noodles!!!  Amaaaaazingly deeeeelicious!!!!  The crab at the R&G Lounge in Chinatown is very, very good but the roasted crab here is outstanding!

Skip the mango salad (a bit bland).  The shaking beef was good but not memorable.

Sticker shock.  Yes sticker shock for the crab.  ****** BUT ***** IT WAS WORTH EVERY CENT!!!  Absolutely no regret whatsoever - the product and preparation was simply incredible!  (Last word on crab pricing - because it is expensive, this may not be the best place to dine with children.)

We can't wait to try the Drunken and Tamarind crabs!!!

excerpts: Garlic for their delicious Garlic Noodles, but mainly I come here for the CRAB!
garlic noodles.author: Sonia K.
garlic noodles.review: Saw this place on Food Paradise: Garlic for their delicious Garlic Noodles, but mainly I come here for the CRAB!

excerpts: I also found myself wishing that they offered de-shelling services because the garlic noodles would have been that much more amazing if it had chunks of crab in it.
Why couldn't I have done that myself and mixed it together after, you ask?
Because my crab eating skills are so poor that I usually lose 30 percent of the meat in the shell and by the time I'm done getting the 70 percent out of the shell it is usually mangled and cold.
garlic noodles.author: Spring L.
garlic noodles.review:
I must admit that I'm a lazy person. This is unfortunate when I eat crab because after the first couple of pieces I move onto something easier to eat. Despite the raving review on their Roast Crab... I didn't find it amazing enough for me to work past the second piece. 

Instead, I found myself thankful that we ordered the Shaken Beef (of course only after I got over my outrage at the crack price of the dish.. $23 for beef wtf?!).  
I also found myself wishing that they offered de-shelling services because the garlic noodles would have been that much more amazing if it had chunks of crab in it. Why couldn't I have done that myself and mixed it together after, you ask? Because my crab eating skills are so poor that I usually lose 30 percent of the meat in the shell and by the time I'm done getting the 70 percent out of the shell it is usually mangled and cold. And at that time I feel that I deserve to eat that tiny bite of meat that I so desperately pried out of the unforgiving shell.

-____-  I once said I loved interactive dining in another review but this is my breaking point.

excerpts: I've had better garlic noodles and crabs in some other places which I'd be happy to review once I remember where they were.
garlic noodles.author: Rovie T.
garlic noodles.review:
*Overated.

*If you like the feeling of cold grease dripping on your lips(they meant to make it taste like butter) then be my guest.

*We had to send our dirty martinis back, twice (which I hate doing at any restaurant) since they cant seem to remember to skip the vermouth

I've had better garlic noodles and crabs in some other places which I'd be happy to review once I remember where they were.

excerpts: Salt & Pepper Calamari, Jumbo Prawn Wontons,  roasted crab and garlic noodles.
I mixed the crab into my garlic noodles and added some of the butter sauce from the crab....
garlic noodles.author: Judy c.
garlic noodles.review:
Everything we ordered was delicious. Salt & Pepper Calamari, Jumbo Prawn Wontons,  roasted crab and garlic noodles.  I mixed the crab into my garlic noodles and added some of the butter sauce from the crab.... To die for. 

Had an hour wait but standing at the bar trying  their chambord & sparkling wine helped the time to pass by faster. 

As soon as we were done with dinner and walking towards the front door I could see our car being brought to valet. Valet recommended $12. Parking near by is crazy. 

I think next time I will make reservations. The waiting near the bar can get a bit crowded depending on the wait of the crowd. No bar stool its so compact in with the waiting area.

excerpts: The best garlic noodles and roasted crab that you will ever get!
Service is always on point, and food is pretty quick to get to the table.
The atmosphere is nice, Make a reservation or be prepared to wait.
DELISH!!
I would wait hours to eat here.
garlic noodles.author: Sheena S.
