garlic noodles.review: The best garlic noodles and roasted crab that you will ever get! Service is always on point, and food is pretty quick to get to the table. The atmosphere is nice, Make a reservation or be prepared to wait. DELISH!!! I would wait hours to eat here.

excerpts: The garlic noodles are way WAY too basic for their price.
When you start charging such prices people come to expect much more.
garlic noodles.author: Yolanda Y.
garlic noodles.review: The service deserves five stars, but this three-star is for the value you get here. I felt like the prices they charge for the food are not justified by what you get. Forty some dollars for a crab. The garlic noodles are way WAY too basic for their price. When you start charging such prices people come to expect much more.

excerpts: the garlic noodles were raved about and i was expecting something mind blowing.
Alas!
that was not to be.
taste:
it's like eating tasty
garlic bread.-
yes, it quite literally tasted like garlic bread.
buT, texture wise, it was quite disgusting.
the noodles are way way way over cooked.

and as someone who likes their pasta well-done... if i think it's over cooked, then X_X 
garlic noodles:: it's like eating super extra soggy garlic bread.
garlic noodles.author: Amanda L.
garlic noodles.review:
So there have been umpteen people telling me about this place and i finally went. For all the hype about its seafood... well, it lived up pretty well. idk about astronomically phenomenal (i still think the crab my mom makes is the best shizz ever), but it's pretty darn good. 

the baked crab with garlic butter pepper sauce very tasty. and i like the kick that comes with dousing it pepper. but like most crab in the shell, all the sauce is on the shell so the actual crab meat, you have all the sauce on the outside so your basically dipping the crab in butter/pepper/garlic. --how can you go wrong?

the seasonal veggies were nicely done. snow peas with white button and shiitake mushrooms, cherry tomatoes, and green, white, and red onions. it was all very fresh and very yummy. 

the garlic noodles were raved about and i was expecting something mind blowing. Alas! that was not to be. 
taste: it's like eating tasty garlic bread.- yes, it quite literally tasted like garlic bread. buT, texture wise, it was quite disgusting. the noodles are way way way over cooked. and as someone who likes their pasta well-done... if i think it's over cooked, then X_X 
garlic noodles:: it's like eating super extra soggy garlic bread. 

the garlic rice wasn't anything to write home about either. there's so much garlic in everything else, you might as well get white rice since the garlic in the garlic rice is minimal. and at $7.50 for the equivalent of 1.75ricebowls!! outrage! 

fried banana a la mode was very yummy. the bananas weren't over battered or anything. nice and hot.  this dish wasn't the most aesthetically appetizing, but it was good (then again i'm partial to fried bananas, and it's a dish that is difficult to truly mess up) 

the service was really good, the waiters/servers etc were all really friendly. they're really good about changing out your shell bowls. 

over all ambiance is nice and they have a full bar.

excerpts: Even as I'm writing this review, my mouth is watering for garlic noodles with some roast crab.
I usually don't like oily noodles, but the garlic noodles were just something else.
garlic noodles.author: Roxana D.
garlic noodles.review:
You know a place is good when over a month later, you can still remember how great everything tastes.  Even as I'm writing this review, my mouth is watering for garlic noodles with some roast crab.

Here's the thing -- if you go here, prepare to open up the wallet.  Of course, you need to get the crab.  That is obvious.  It is the best crab I've ever had, hands down, no questions asked.  If you find yourself wondering if you really need the garlic noodle side -- let me just tell you: the answer is yes.  I usually don't like oily noodles, but the garlic noodles were just something else.  Totally worth the garlic breath that it might give you.  

Service was good, despite the fact that the place was pretty packed.  Ambience is nice - could be good for a date, but be ready to spend.  Also, you may not want to get so messy on a date (yup, you gotta wear the crab bib).

excerpts: I mean.. it's always a perfect combo when there's seafood, especially crab! with GARLIC NOODLES!
I definitely loved the roasted garlic crab more then the other one!
The flavor was good and definitely blended well with the garlic noodles!
garlic noodles.author: Lianne D.
garlic noodles.review:
I went here for my 21st birthday dinner with my family and this place is CRACKIN! (I also saw Nate Robinson from the GSW!) 

I mean.. it's always a perfect combo when there's seafood, especially crab! with GARLIC NOODLES! I definitely loved the roasted garlic crab more then the other one! The flavor was good and definitely blended well with the garlic noodles!

excerpts: Their garlic noodles are the PERFECT compliment.
You can be totally satisfied ordering strictly the roasted crab and garlic noodles (which I've done before) and I've seen several couples order 2 crabs to feed 2 people.
But I try to branch out and try other menu items
and I have to say
, everything else here is pretty good...
the cheese wontons are addicting, the red snapper delightful, the calamari is "ok"...
and I've never been disappointed with any of the desserts, they're all pretty good, but my favorite is the creme brulee'...
garlic noodles.author: Joraine C.
garlic noodles.review:
I LOVE LOVE LOVE LOVE LOOOOOOOVE THANH LONG.... The only downside is the price. It's easy to spend $200+ every time you dine here, (which I've done many times) but shoot, you get what you pay for and I think it's definitely worth it!! 

Their roasted crab is KILLER, flavorful but not overpowerful. 

Their garlic noodles are the PERFECT compliment. Not too garlicky, not too bland, almost like it was marinated in just the right amount of garlic with a slight sweetness to it. 

You can be totally satisfied ordering strictly the roasted crab and garlic noodles (which I've done before) and I've seen several couples order 2 crabs to feed 2 people. But I try to branch out and try other menu items and I have to say, everything else here is pretty good... the cheese wontons are addicting, the red snapper delightful, the calamari is "ok"... and I've never been disappointed with any of the desserts, they're all pretty good, but my favorite is the creme brulee'... *drooling*

I also love that the atmosphere is pretty casual. Their sister restaurant "Crustaceans" offers the same menu featuring the same delicious secrect recipes from the Anh family, but they have dress code so I prefer Thanh Long anyday!

They're always packed, and if you can't find parking, they offer valet but it's weirly located right next to residential streets so parking has never really been an issue for me. I've gone for dinner quite frequently so I would highly recommend reservations, only because I've never had to wait long before being seated. 

I've tried other competitors and have recreated their recipes at home, but truth be told, THANH LONG IS THE BEST IN WHAT THEY DO....

excerpts: Garlic noodles is yummy!
It's best to make a reservation.
Once you're seated, you don't have to wait too long for the food.
Excellent customer service.
Parking is pretty hard but valet is also an option.
garlic noodles.author: Nahleen H.
garlic noodles.review: LOVE this place! Best crab I've ever had! Garlic noodles is yummy! It's best to make a reservation. Once you're seated, you don't have to wait too long for the food. Excellent customer service. Parking is pretty hard but valet is also an option.

excerpts: and I had the Mussels, Crab (prepared Drunken style), and Garlic Noodles.
I thought all three dishes were delicious - the texture of the mussels was great and the sauce was so tasty.
The crab was also very tasty, and Drunken style usually wins.
Lastly, garlic noodles were very good, but not necessarily something you can't just make at home too.
garlic noodles.author: Tiffany K.
garlic noodles.review:
A friend took me to Thanh Long for dinner a few days ago. I didn't really know what to expect since I don't recall seeing or hearing about this place yet.

First off, there's valet right outside for $10 if you choose to use it. Restaurant decor is nice - casual yet upscale. The fare is Vietnamese, but it is more on a fusion side rather than traditional. 

While dining here, my friend and I had the Mussels, Crab (prepared Drunken style), and Garlic Noodles. I thought all three dishes were delicious - the texture of the mussels was great and the sauce was so tasty. The crab was also very tasty, and Drunken style usually wins. Lastly, garlic noodles were very good, but not necessarily something you can't just make at home too.

When I first saw the menu and saw "Secret Kitchen Menu", I thought, hmmm, this menu isn't so secret - it's all listed right here. However, my friend told me about how the family doesn't let anyone else see the recipe or how they cook the crab. Then it occurred to me that it's actually more Secret Kitchen than Secret Menu.

excerpts: Just thinking about the garlic noodles makes my mouth water.
*drool*...umm, oops.
Anyway, their crab is so good.
But to be honest, I could probably survive on their garlic noodles alone.
The bummer is that it is a little pricey.
The garlic noodles, which are basically just noodles a bunch of butter and garlic shouldn't cost ~$10/plate.
garlic noodles.author: Rylan C.
garlic noodles.review:
Just thinking about the garlic noodles makes my mouth water. *drool*...umm, oops. Anyway, their crab is so good. But to be honest, I could probably survive on their garlic noodles alone. The bummer is that it is a little pricey. The garlic noodles, which are basically just noodles a bunch of butter and garlic shouldn't cost ~$10/plate. However, I guess this is SF.

I would highly suggest this place. Most people would recommend this place during beautiful days/nights but I say you should go to this place when it's foggy so that you can always get a seat. 

I've often told my friends from the central part of the city that the Sunset and Richmond (Inner, Central, and Outer) probably has the best low-to-mid-range-priced restaurants in the city (not the Mission). This restaurant is definitely part of the reason why.

excerpts: We had the garlic noodles, drunken crab, and the thanh long spicy eggplant.
Surprisingly, I liked the eggplant the best.
The crab and garlic noodles came out really fast, but were cold!
Disappointing!
And to top it off, the service was terrible.
Our waiter checked in on us only once during the whole meal.
I did however try the garlic noodles from the thanh long food truck and it was really good, so
I think I'll stick to the food truck.
You don't have to travel so far to get it.
garlic noodles.author: Nancy H.
garlic noodles.review:
This place was recommended to me, so I decided to try it. I wanted to like it, but it just didn't cut it. We had the garlic noodles, drunken crab, and the thanh long spicy eggplant. Surprisingly, I liked the eggplant the best. The crab and garlic noodles came out really fast, but were cold! Disappointing! And to top it off, the service was terrible. Our waiter checked in on us only once during the whole meal. At the end of it, we were trying to wave someone down to get the bill, but our waiter walked by us three times and completely ignored us.

I did however try the garlic noodles from the thanh long food truck and it was really good, so I think I'll stick to the food truck. You don't have to travel so far to get it.

excerpts: Drunken crab and garlic noodles!
Roasted crab was peppery.
The vanilla creme brûlée should at least have been topped with fruit.
The garlic noodles can be smelled from the next table (tasted better than when I had them at AnQi too).
I still taste a hint of it in my mouth the next day.
They only take reservations no earlier than two weeks in advance
but I was also able to get one the day before.
This corner restaurant is conveniently located next to a couple of bus stops.
garlic noodles.author: Ai M.
garlic noodles.review:
Drink Hanoi beer or Vietnamese iced coffee.  Drunken crab and garlic noodles!  Roasted crab was peppery.  The vanilla creme brûlée should at least have been topped with fruit. It was cold.

Get the mussels appetizer but not roasted crab.  I would order tamarind crab next time.  They didn't have any winery grape juice spritzer.  We also ordered the prawn rolls which are best with sauce.  You won't need a cup of rice unless it's for leftover crab.
   
The current market price is under $39 and a crab will feed two.  The garlic noodles can be smelled from the next table (tasted better than when I had them at AnQi too).  I still taste a hint of it in my mouth the next day. They only take reservations no earlier than two weeks in advance but I was also able to get one the day before. This corner restaurant is conveniently located next to a couple of bus stops.

excerpts: For three people we ordered: two crabs, two plates of garlic noodles, and two fried banana desserts (we drank only water).
The food arrived mere minutes after we ordered!
The crab was amazingly buttery, and Thanh Long's famous "secret spices" were excellent.
The garlic noodles were delicious, too -- a great compliment to the crab.
garlic noodles.author: Allison P.
garlic noodles.review:
SO TASTY!

For three people we ordered: two crabs, two plates of garlic noodles, and two fried banana desserts (we drank only water). The food arrived mere minutes after we ordered! The crab was amazingly buttery, and Thanh Long's famous "secret spices" were excellent. The garlic noodles were delicious, too -- a great compliment to the crab. And you can never go wrong with fried bananas!

The wait staff was friendly and efficient.

It's a bit pricey for my budget (total came to about $120 w/o tip), but definitely something to try once -- you won't regret it!

excerpts: Right away, I knew were were going to order the garlic noodles and crab.
But since this was our first time here, we opted to try an app.
Had the fried salt & pepper calamari.
It was tasty!
On to our next course- the garlic noodles and the crab.
OK...so let me start by saying, I dont like to eat with my hands....like bbq ribs, shrimp with the shell, etc.....
so that means I don't crack crab, I am missing that DNA in me that allows me to properly eat food that require work with the hands...
don't ask me why, I can't figure it out.
SOOO with
that said, I dug into the garlic noodles- pretty darn good...
although, I could honestly say, I could make those bad boys at home!
garlic noodles.author: Angie I.
garlic noodles.review:
I can see why everyone loves this place.  I mean, yea...I guess everyone does since there were so many people waiting to be seated, literally people were packed in front of the door like a bunch of sardines!  INSANE!  It was like they were holding a Black Friday Sale up in there!  

Anywho, we had reservations, thank goodness so we were seated fairly quickly amongst the mass starving people crammed in the front waiting area (FYI- the waiting area is the size of a small public bathroom, uggg! so if you don't like to be near people in tight quarters, tough noogies!)

Right away, I knew were were going to order the garlic noodles and crab.  But since this was our first time here, we opted to try an app.  Had the fried salt & pepper calamari.  It was tasty!  A bit too salty, but nonetheless tasty! 

On to our next course- the garlic noodles and the crab.  OK...so let me start by saying, I dont like to eat with my hands....like bbq ribs, shrimp with the shell, etc..... so that means I don't crack crab, I am missing that DNA in me that allows me to properly eat food that require work with the hands...don't ask me why, I can't figure it out.  SOOO with that said, I dug into the garlic noodles- pretty darn good...although, I could honestly say, I could make those bad boys at home!  C'mon it was just noodles with tons of butter and garlic....easy peasy!  

For the crab....uhm.....our waitress put the bib on me!  I'm a good sport, I've never worn a bib in my adult life...but OK I can do this!....then the cracker for the crab....uhm....again, don't eat with my hands...but OK I can do this!   Stared at my crab, the bib and the cracker and decided I'd give it a GO.....and then a solid 10-15 mins or so of trying......I GAVE UP!  I was starving, no crab meat, at least not enough to fulfill my hunger, butter slapping everywhere, cracker not cracking and me just sitting there stuffing myself with the noodles hoping to get some sort of feeling of fullness in my tummy! 

FINALLY, I had to order another plate of the garlic noodles- and gave about 80% of my crab to my hubby to devour (which btw, he was doing a great job- he's a pro).   

Yea, my wonderful hubby did crack the crab for me, which is why I ate about 20% of it.....the rest went to him, cuz honestly, I was over the sight of the crab & butter after my efforts of trying to eat!

On the drive home....I really wanted to grab some In-N-Out to get the butter taste out of my mouth (from all that garlic noodle) and so I could actually eat something without going to bed hungry.  Next time....I think I'll pass on Thanh Long and opt for somewhere I can just get crab cakes- no crackin' required!

excerpts: We ordered the garlic noodles and shaken beef and lots of people say it was the best shaken beef they ever had.
The beef was very succulent and full of juice -- perfecto!
Garlic noodles are not bad, but it just goes really well with the crab.
garlic noodles.author: Emily C.
garlic noodles.review:
The food is amazing. Although the neighborhood was not great and parking was hard to find, it was definitely worth the trek out here. 

The roast crab is sublime. The crab was very well seasoned with pepper and garlic and I love how it was dunked in buttery goodness. Maybe that's what makes the crab taste so good. We ordered the garlic noodles and shaken beef and lots of people say it was the best shaken beef they ever had. The beef was very succulent and full of juice -- perfecto! Garlic noodles are not bad, but it just goes really well with the crab.

As for dessert, I highly recommend finishing off with the fried ice cream. It's pretty big so you can split it with two or three people. Basically it's ice cream encased in sweet yummy fried dough. 

I don't know if this is a great date place, because you guys will end up smelling like garlic (might kill the romance), but it's definitely a good place to go with friends!

excerpts: I'm fairly convinced that the garlic noodles are laced with some sort of drug-
I've been having withdrawals and cravings ever since.
They must infuse the noodle itself with loads of garlic, because the flavor is out of this world.
garlic noodles.author: Clarissa P.
garlic noodles.review:
After 6 years of living in the city, I finally went to Thanh Long this past weekend-

why the heck did I wait so long?!!/

The crab is freakin delishhhhhhhhhhhhh, so garlic-y and butter-y and meaty and NOM...

I'm fairly convinced that the garlic noodles are laced with some sort of drug- I've been having withdrawals and cravings ever since.  They must infuse the noodle itself with loads of garlic, because the flavor is out of this world.  There is no way those are regular noodles sauteed in garlic.

Usually 1 crab can feed two people- just make sure that at least one of you is willing to eat the head (innards) of the crab, cause that comprises a big portion of the crab and would otherwise be a waste.

I do hate the location- it's so far out of the city and the train ride takes forever.  But I would do it again in a heartbeat to get me some of that garlicky buttery goodness!

excerpts: We started with the rolls for appetizers, mango salad, then shaken beef & Colossal Royal Tiger prawns with garlic noodles.
Everything was excellent!
The service was great as well, and we even had children with us who were well cared for by the staff.
Will definitely be back!
garlic noodles.author: Steven B.
garlic noodles.review: A friend invited us to join them for dinner...this is one of the best Vietnamese restaurants in SF.  We started with the rolls for appetizers, mango salad, then shaken beef & Colossal Royal Tiger prawns with garlic noodles.  Everything was excellent!  The service was great as well, and we even had children with us who were well cared for by the staff.  Will definitely be back!

excerpts: The best thing to have here and what most people go here for; the Garlic Roasted Dungeness Crab and Garlic Noodles.
You will never find these two dishes anywhere else.
They are a must have!!!
They go together like peanut butter and jelly so you must order them together.
I don't live in San Francisco any longer but
every time I visit this is a must!!!
I cannot rave enough about these two dishes, just do yourself a favor and give it a go!
garlic noodles.author: Teresa L.
garlic noodles.review: The best thing to have here and what most people go here for; the Garlic Roasted Dungeness Crab and Garlic Noodles. You will never find these two dishes anywhere else. They are a must have!!! They go together like peanut butter and jelly so you must order them together. I don't live in San Francisco any longer but every time I visit this is a must!!! I cannot rave enough about these two dishes, just do yourself a favor and give it a go!

excerpts: both are famous for their garlic noodles and roasted crabs.
Main Dishes: Roasted Crab and Garlic Noodles.
I had really high hopes for their roasted crab and garlic noodles, but was sadly disappointed.
It was no where as good as Crustacean's.
Thanh Long's roasted crab and garlic noodles just tasted like it had been soaked in pepper.
The garlic noodles were dry and cold as well.
At Crustacean's you can actually taste the flavor of the crab and enjoy the crab and garlic noodles together and it doesn't feel like I'm choking down a mouthful of pepper.
garlic noodles.author: Olivia W.
garlic noodles.review:
Thanh Long VS. Crustacean Restaurant

I have no idea how I forgot to write a review for Thanh Long, but I'm glad I remembered. I have been to both Thanh Long and Crustaceans in San Francisco. They're both are famous for their garlic noodles and roasted crabs.

Appetizer: I ordered the muscles and FELL IN LOVE. Yes, it was THAT good. Thanh Long totally won the appetizer category. 

Main Dishes: Roasted Crab and Garlic Noodles. I had really high hopes for their roasted crab and garlic noodles, but was sadly disappointed. It was no where as good as Crustacean's. Thanh Long's roasted crab and garlic noodles just tasted like it had been soaked in pepper. The garlic noodles were dry and cold as well. At Crustacean's you can actually taste the flavor of the crab and enjoy the crab and garlic noodles together and it doesn't feel like I'm choking down a mouthful of pepper.
Crustacean's definitely won the main dish category.

Both are equally priced, both having great customer service, and both have a lovely interior. Crustacean definitely beat Thanh Long in my book. Sadly, the only thing I liked at Thanh Long was the muscles. The rest of the meal was an utter disappointment.

excerpts: Roasted Dungeness Crab and Garlic Noodles - FAVE!
garlic noodles.author: Kathy B.
garlic noodles.review: Hands Down! My all time favorite place!  I have been going here for the last 5 years and every time I went the food was always good and the service was always superb! Roasted Dungeness Crab and Garlic Noodles - FAVE!

excerpts: The garlic noodles are famous here but can be a bit salty.
Parking can be tricky in this area but they also have valet.
Thanh Long fulfills our craving for crab!
Reservations are a must for groups!
garlic noodles.author: Jennie W.
garlic noodles.review: The crab here is great!  My favorite is the tamarind one, its juicy and full of flavor.  They also have specialty cocktails that are quite tasty.  The garlic noodles are famous here but can be a bit salty.  Parking can be tricky in this area but they also have valet.  Thanh Long fulfills our craving for crab! Reservations are a must for groups!

excerpts: Garlic noodles obviously fantastic.
garlic noodles.author: Tony P.
garlic noodles.review: I think everyone else said it all.   We made a excellent decision going here.   Garlic noodles obviously fantastic.  Pepper crab, shaken beef (very unique texture).    Not many has mentioned about the dessert, so if you love banana pudding/pie try their banana desert with ice cream.  It's fabulous.  We loved it -- Unlike any other places we tried.   We ordered 3 entrees (skipped appetizers), two drinks and a dessert and two coffees.   Bill including tip was $185.  So you get the picture.   All worth it from our experience.

excerpts: Must oder roasted crab n garlic noodles everytime, salt&pepper calamari n shaken beef r delicious n yummy!
And my favor Creme brulee, i think its the best in sf for me.
of coz plus a bottle of white wine, the whole dinner is perfect!
Never get tired of these food.
garlic noodles.author: Sanly L.
garlic noodles.review:
One of my regular restaurant. Must oder roasted crab n garlic noodles everytime, salt&pepper calamari n shaken beef r delicious n yummy! And my favor Creme brulee, i think its the best in sf for me.  of coz plus a bottle of white wine, the whole dinner is perfect! 
Never get tired of these food.

excerpts: I loved the garlic noodles and felt sorry for the fellow riders on the MUNI due to the odors wafting from my mouth.
The food is always amazing and this meal was no exception.
Keep up the continued consistency and excellence of food.
garlic noodles.author: Lee U.
garlic noodles.review: The roasted crab was sweet, moist and delicious. Although the salt and pepper were plentiful it did not alter the succulent flavor of the dungeness crab. I loved the garlic noodles and felt sorry for the fellow riders on the MUNI due to the odors wafting from my mouth. The food is always amazing and this meal was no exception. Keep up the continued consistency and excellence of food.

excerpts: Garlic noodles and roasted crab are simply delightful.
The butter pepper seasoning is super messy but super yummy.
garlic noodles.author: Shad A.
garlic noodles.review: Garlic noodles and roasted crab are simply delightful.  The butter pepper seasoning is super messy but super yummy.

excerpts: Everyone ordered the garlic noodles (not greasy
but I personally think that it could use a bit more garlic flavor, and still prefer PPQ's version).
Also majority of us got the roasted crab which was AMAZING, didn't have to put in much work since the shell was soft, but not too soft which was good.
The butter/pepper sauce was delicious.
I did family style with two others and we also got the seasonal veggies and shaking beef which were both really good.
We had three people share a crab, noodles, veggies and shaking beef and it definitely worked well for us.
Waters were constantly filled and waiters were very attentive.
One flaw for the night was some of the girls ordered sodas and they refilled them, and knowing pricey restaurants.. they don't tell you they charge for a refill until you see it on the bill.
garlic noodles.author: Tiff C.
garlic noodles.review: I had my birthday dinner here with several girl friends (there was about 12 of us and two babies) they were very accommodating after my several calls and concerns about my reservation. The only downside I'd have to say is that they require you to have your whole party there before they seat you. I got lucky and was missing a few people but they still seated me. Everyone ordered the garlic noodles (not greasy but I personally think that it could use a bit more garlic flavor, and still prefer PPQ's version). Also majority of us got the roasted crab which was AMAZING, didn't have to put in much work since the shell was soft, but not too soft which was good. The butter/pepper sauce was delicious. I did family style with two others and we also got the seasonal veggies and shaking beef which were both really good. We had three people share a crab, noodles, veggies and shaking beef and it definitely worked well for us. Waters were constantly filled and waiters were very attentive. One flaw for the night was some of the girls ordered sodas and they refilled them, and knowing pricey restaurants.. they don't tell you they charge for a refill until you see it on the bill.

excerpts: The crab and garlic noodles alone earn this place 5 stars.
garlic noodles.author: Irina S.
garlic noodles.review: I LOVE THIS PLACE. I've always hated to get my hands dirty, so I always avoided ordering the crab here and was never too pleased with the other options on the menu. BUT, after I decided to stop being such a prissy eater, I realized what I was missing. The crab and garlic noodles alone earn this place 5 stars. The roast crab it to die for and that's actually what I usually wanna do after the massive stomachaches I get from butter overdose, but its oh so worth it. I've also had the drunken crab and it's an excellent option if you wanna skip the butter and be guiltless. It was flavorful and easy on the stomach. The atmosphere is nice and they even have a large dining room upstairs which I recently discovered. Thanh Long is definitely a winner and I'm not sure whether it's a good or bad thing that it's just down the street from my house.

excerpts: We had the roasted crab, garlic noodles, shaken beef, and an order of rice.
I always need my rice when I eat crab!
The food was really tasty as usual, and I left feeling very satisfied.
garlic noodles.author: Libby L.
garlic noodles.review:
I was craving some crab so my BF took me here Friday night.  It was crazy packed, and we didn't make a reservation so we waited by the bar.  I tried one of their signature cocktails that had midori in it, but it tasted like cough syup.  Blech.   The next drink I tried was their pineapple lychee vodka infusion drink and that was deleesh!!!   

A drunken urine smelling homeless man wandered in and made his way up to the bar.  He was muttering animatedly and everyone quickly scattered away from the bar to avoid him.  To my surprise, none of the staff asked him to leave.  

We had the roasted crab, garlic noodles, shaken beef, and an order of rice.  I always need my rice when I eat crab!   The food was really tasty as usual, and I left feeling very satisfied.

excerpts: The garlic noodles were something we never experienced in a noodle.
Unbelievable the texture and flavor of this simple dish.
We would be considered semi-foodies having traveled the world eating but this dish was incomparable.
How they do it
I don't have a clue but worth traveling for ($9.95).
The second recommended dish was the cubed New York Steak marinated dish.
Absolutly mouth watering and so tender.
garlic noodles.author: scott s.
garlic noodles.review:
Wandered into this very non descript in the Outer Sunset District. Nicer on the inside than the outside. Immdeiately seated (we called ahead). Very nice waiter answered all our questions and brought us some wine and martinis right away.
We ordered the "popular" items. The garlic noodles were something we never experienced in a noodle. Unbelievable the texture and flavor of this simple dish. We would be considered semi-foodies having traveled the world eating but this dish was incomparable. How they do it I don't have a clue but worth traveling for ($9.95). The second recommended dish was the cubed New York Steak marinated dish. Absolutly mouth watering and so tender. The salt and pepper calamari was very good. We had their famous baked crab which was cooked to perfection with lots of butter and an excellent black pepper unlike anything we've had. Peppery yet not hot. The crabs were very good but at $42 for a not very meaty crab I would probably not order it again...more noodles please. A great dining experience

excerpts: the garlic noodles with drunken crab are incredible together!
Having one without the other is good, but putting that crab meat into those garlic noodles takes it to the next level.
Definitely lives up to my expectation.
How good they are at their specialities is the only detriment to other dishes that would  probably seem better anywhere else where they wouldn't have to stand up to that crab or garlic noodles.
The curry prawns smell really good and have a smoky curry flavor but aren't anything special.
garlic noodles.author: Bella P.
garlic noodles.review:
Believe the hype!
Came here for the first time recently and the garlic noodles with drunken crab are incredible together!  Having one without the other is good, but putting that crab meat into those garlic noodles takes it to the next level. Definitely lives up to my expectation.  We also had the crab puffs-so much better than any crab puff appetizer I've had at any other Asian restaurant- and the mango salad which was not why I expected but still very tasty.  I would order both again and again.  The service is warm and friendly and overall a really pleasant atmosphere.  Worth the trek to the outskirts of the Sunset.  It's getting hard to get really good food in the city without having to wait and that wasn't the case here; we were seated immediately.  

How good they are at their specialities is the only detriment to other dishes that would  probably seem better anywhere else where they wouldn't have to stand up to that crab or garlic noodles. The curry prawns smell really good and have a smoky curry flavor but aren't anything special.

excerpts: We went with the fan favorites: roasted crab, and then tiger prawns over garlic noodles.
In addition we started with the Vietnamese salad.
Salad had a nice light dressing and I loved the finely shredded cabbage.
The shrimp and chicken that topped it were just okay,
neither were seasoned much.
The crab was incredible, as were the prawns.
So full of flavor!
The noodles that came with the prawns were enough to share.
We ended with the fried banana dessert which was nothing special.
If I am in the area again I will be heading to Thanh Long for crab and tiger prawns!
So worth it!
garlic noodles.author: Alison B.
garlic noodles.review: Thanh Long lived up to the hype! We made a reservation since it was Saturday night and were seated within 5 minutes of our arrival. Table service was on top of things and timely. We had a very relaxed and enjoyable dining experience. Of course the best part was the food!! We went with the fan favorites: roasted crab, and then tiger prawns over garlic noodles. In addition we started with the Vietnamese salad. Salad had a nice light dressing and I loved the finely shredded cabbage. The shrimp and chicken that topped it were just okay, neither were seasoned much. The crab was incredible, as were the prawns. So full of flavor! The noodles that came with the prawns were enough to share. We ended with the fried banana dessert which was nothing special. If I am in the area again I will be heading to Thanh Long for crab and tiger prawns! So worth it!

excerpts: While the garlic noodles didn't disagree with my taste buds,  the high price of this noodle-and-nothing-else dish violates my pocket.
garlic noodles.author: Emma P.
garlic noodles.review:
I can't figure out why this place costs so much.  The ambiance is not that good, although better than some much-less-expansive restaurants.  The place, including the utensils, need more cleaning.  The taste of some popular dishes, in my opinions, is below average. 

If you are the type who can tell whether shrimp or crab is fresh by their smell, you will be disappointed.   I ordered a roasted crab and soup with shrimps (can't recall the name of dish).  Neither were fresh.   While the garlic noodles didn't disagree with my taste buds,  the high price of this noodle-and-nothing-else dish violates my pocket.

excerpts: We had the Roast Crab and garlic noodles for our dinner.
The Crab was fantastic.
There was enough butter, garlic, and spices to fill a big gulp at 7-11.
It was oozing with flavor.
The garlic noodles which this chain of restaurant advertises as their signature dish was good.
It went well with the crab, but on it's own, probably not the most tremendous dish.
garlic noodles.author: Chad O.
garlic noodles.review:
Disclaimer: You have to love garlic, butter and pepper. But if you do, you will be impressed.

Went her for the first time and my Yelp friend MK told me this place was good, but I was blown away. As soon as you enter you will be greeted with the scent of garlic and butter. 

We started out with the Mussels and they were fantastic. I could have had 2 plates of these by myself. The Asian pesto on these mussels was delicious and you could see everyone on the table trying to scrape as much of it off onto their bread as possible.

We had the Roast Crab and garlic noodles for our dinner. The Crab was fantastic. There was enough butter, garlic, and spices to fill a big gulp at 7-11. It was oozing with flavor. The garlic noodles which this chain of restaurant advertises as their signature dish was good. It went well with the crab, but on it's own, probably not the most tremendous dish. It was primarily noodles and garlic. 

We also had the deep fried banana and pineapple.  We were all stuff't by this point but it was good.  I prefere the deep friend banana over the pineapple.    

The only bad mark is that it is a little bit expensive. It came out to over $60 a person on this trip. Even at that price, I would still recommend it.

excerpts: Get the muscles, garlic noodles and roast crab
and YES it's going to break the bank
garlic noodles.author: David L.
garlic noodles.review: Get the muscles, garlic noodles and roast crab and YES it's going to break the bank

excerpts: My all time guilty pleasures is the roasted crab and garlic noodles.
garlic noodles.author: Carol H.
garlic noodles.review:
Was here with some family today and realized we have been coming here for almost 20 years already.  Wow! Out of all of their establishments, this is still my favorite location, even if parking can be a beast, unless you valet, or just come early. You can always expect an attentive waitstaff who will give you good service.
 
My all time guilty pleasures is the roasted crab and garlic noodles.   This is a guarantee to be on point and for us, usually get individual crabs instead of sharing for left overs.

We also get the salt and pepper calamari (not as crunchy as it use to be and less flavorful, but still one of the better tasting ones out there), combo fried rice (another winner), added on mixed vegetables and the stuffed calamari (both of the sauces tasted similar but was still tasty).

excerpts: The other good thing here is the garlic noodles.
FYI, it tastes like it has some fish sauce or oyster sauce or crab broth in it.
So, if you are vegetarian beware.
The presentation is really poor.
They come out looking like very ordinary tan noodles.
But, the flavor is salty and sweet with a nice garlic flavor.
It is a bit more on the sweeter side than I expected.
garlic noodles.author: Andrew W.
garlic noodles.review:
This place serves some very incredible food and some very good food, but it is very pricey.  For $38 dollars, you get one crab in a variety of styles.  The best here is the roasted crab.  It is delightfully buttery and peppery.  The sauce is so good, it inspired my sister to toss her entire bowl of rice into what was essentially a whole lot of crab flavored butter.  Calories be damned.  So, this dish was good.

I was less impressed by the drunken crab.  It was a little on the bland side.  I was expecting a bit more flavor, but the broth was kind of dull and watery.  It could have used a lot more flavor.  The crab was fresh, so it wasn't all bad.

We also got the shaken beef, which is beef marinaded in a sweet, salty sauce served with vegetables.  It was very tender.  The meat was cooked perfectly.  The vegetables complimented the meat very well.  But, the fried potatoes were a bit weird.  I would get this dish again.

The other good thing here is the garlic noodles.  FYI, it tastes like it has some fish sauce or oyster sauce or crab broth in it.  So, if you are vegetarian beware.  The presentation is really poor.  They come out looking like very ordinary tan noodles.  But, the flavor is salty and sweet with a nice garlic flavor.  It is a bit more on the sweeter side than I expected.  But, it was very good.

We also had the boulliabaisse, the salmon carpaccio, the soft shell crabs, the mixed seasonal vegetables and the sea bass.  The soft shell crabs are a definite miss.  They lacked seasoning.  The batter was not that crispy.  It was a below average dish.

The boulliabaisse was a nice fish broth with vegetables floating in it and some rock shrimp that were cooked well.  It was ok.  Just think Tom Yum soup.  Nothing really special.

The salmon carpaccio was tasty.  The shallots added a nice contrast to the sweet salmon.  But, the portion was very small.

The mixed seasonal vegetables were well cooked, but ultimately they were just roasted vegetables.  Nothing special.

Finally, the sea bass was a little overcooked.  The sauce was nice and mild.  It was ok.  But, nothing special.  It came with some vegetables in a light sauce.  

I also had a mixed drink.  It was a bit on the sweet side.  FYI, the food here is not spicy, so fruity drinks do not pair well.  It is better to go with one of the dry white wines.  For a Vietnamese place, they don't use a lot of sour flavors, so the dry wine brings a little acidity to the food and makes the flavors come out.

The dessert menu was not very exciting.  Deep fried banana, chocolate molten cake.  All the standard stuff.  Nothing unusual or complicated.  We skipped it.

The service was typical for an Asian restaurant.  Not very attentive.  But, everyone was well dressed.

The atmosphere is clean and surprisingly modern inside.  Outside, it looks like a dumpy Chinese restaurant in the Sunset.  But, there are some nice silks and figurines decorating the interior of the restaurant.  This is a good place for a special occasion meal or for a date although the clientele is a bit on the older side (mid to late 40s).  So, it is not exactly hip.  But, your date will appreciate the decor and the high quality food.

A word about parking.  Come early.  Parking in the Sunset is horrible.  You might have to walk a few blocks.  Our reservations were for 6 and we had to walk 2 blocks.  If you eat around 7, be prepared for a hike.  They have valet car service.  So, you have that option.

excerpts: I love the druknen crab and the garlic noodles.
The garlic noodles arent always made the same, so ot really depends.
They close at 10, so if traveling have some time ahead.
They are generous for the most part.
Their seafood is pretty normal considering its seafood.
garlic noodles.author: Talia W.
garlic noodles.review: I love the druknen crab and the garlic noodles. The garlic noodles arent always made the same, so ot really depends. They close at 10, so if traveling have some time ahead. They are generous for the most part. Their seafood is pretty normal considering its seafood.

excerpts: Their garlic noodles are pretty addicting and that one crab theyre known for was pretty good, just a lot of butter.
Drinks are slightly more expensive than normal but it is SF and at a $$$ place.
Service was great and its not too loud inside.
Give it a try, but make reservations if you can
garlic noodles.author: F P.
garlic noodles.review: I'm a fan, but I'm not sure I'd try it again for a few years. It is definitely $$$ but it's pretty good food. Their garlic noodles are pretty addicting and that one crab theyre known for was pretty good, just a lot of butter. Drinks are slightly more expensive than normal but it is SF and at a $$$ place. Service was great and its not too loud inside. Give it a try, but make reservations if you can

excerpts: 4 people, we ordered 4 crabs, 2 garlic noodles (still yum), 2 appetizers (love their salmon carpaccio), 2 desserts (orange sorbet and creme brulee are yum), hot tea, and 1 round of drinks came out to $91pp, tip included.
It just seems overpriced to me.
I'm into R&G Lounge's salt & pepper crab
now - tastes so much better!
garlic noodles.author: Freckles H.
garlic noodles.review: I came here SO many times throughout the past decade (once I was able to afford it), but my last visit in Nov. was lacking. Crab was overcooked! It was probably a fluke, but I'm over it. 4 people, we ordered 4 crabs, 2 garlic noodles (still yum), 2 appetizers (love their salmon carpaccio), 2 desserts (orange sorbet and creme brulee are yum), hot tea, and 1 round of drinks came out to $91pp, tip included. It just seems overpriced to me. I'm into R&G Lounge's salt & pepper crab now - tastes so much better!

excerpts: There isn't much for me to review here as for the many trips that I've made here in the past 6 years, I've only religiously ordered roast crab and garlic noodles.
I really don't even know why they bother having anything else on the menu.
They shouldn't even have a menu at all!
I've come here with many friends who were brave enough to venture outside the roast crab garlic noodle order and all have been disappointed.

Here is what I have tasted:
-Tamarind crab: it is very saucy and sweet unlike it's roast crab brother
-Tiger shrimp prawns: equivalent market price to crab but MUCH less satisfying
garlic noodles.author: Krystal C.
garlic noodles.review:
There isn't much for me to review here as for the many trips that I've made here in the past 6 years, I've only religiously ordered roast crab and garlic noodles.  I really don't even know why they bother having anything else on the menu. They shouldn't even have a menu at all!  Simply said, it is a waste to come here to order anything else.

I've come here with many friends who were brave enough to venture outside the roast crab garlic noodle order and all have been disappointed.  Luckily for me, I stuck with my guts and have always been happy, yet got to try their mistakes.

Here is what I have tasted:
-Tamarind crab: it is very saucy and sweet unlike it's roast crab brother
-Tiger shrimp prawns: equivalent market price to crab but MUCH less satisfying

As for what others claim as equivalent restaurants to Thanh Long, here is what I have to say.

PPQ-  this place should not even be in the comparisons list.  The crab is prepared completely different than TL.  The butter tastes different, more creamy than melted.  The garlic isn't quite roasted onto the crab but more cooked and then dumped onto.

Crustaceans- as a devoted TL fan, I've only been willing to try this place out once and that one time, it was horrible.  My friends assured me it was an off thing that the crabs didn't taste the same as they say it usually does.  But my crab was burnt and not flavorful.  The building is hard to get to as you have to climb up 3 stories or take a random mini elevator.  The decor and atmosphere is trying to go for a fancy feel but seriously, it's crab- you just gotta get down and dirty with it.  You will feel more comfortable at TL.

excerpts: Love the roasted crab and garlic noodles .It
's more tasty than tracy crab in alaska.
And it's fast.
We ordered two roasted crabs and 1 garlic noodle and it costed us Usd 105 excluding gratituity.
Parking is a problem..valet is 12 usd.
Remember to make reservations.
Highly recommended when you visit san fransisco.
garlic noodles.author: Elvi W.
garlic noodles.review: Love the roasted crab and garlic noodles .It's more tasty than tracy crab in alaska. And it's fast. We ordered two roasted crabs and 1 garlic noodle and it costed us Usd 105 excluding gratituity. Parking is a problem..valet is 12 usd. Remember to make reservations. Highly recommended when you visit san fransisco.

excerpts: Ever since trying the garlic noodles on their "An The Go" food truck, I've been waiting for a chance to visit one the An family's many restaurants.
There's two in SF alone!
And you should get the crab, and the garlic noodles.
Both are absolutely fantastic, and you can choose from drunken, tamarind, or garlic roasted crab.
We went for the latter two, and decided the garlic roasted is the best.
Get one crab per person, a side of garlic noodles is good for two.
garlic noodles.author: Ross H.
garlic noodles.review:
Ever since trying the garlic noodles on their "An The Go" food truck, I've been waiting for a chance to visit one the An family's many restaurants. There's two in SF alone! Crustacean is more centrally located in the city and has similar prices, but less of a relaxed dress code (or so I hear).

I'm glad the attire here is casual, because once the bib is on your neck and the crab is on your plate, you are literally digging in. Perhaps not the best spot for a first date, as your hands will be soaked in whatever flavor you decide to get for your crab.

And you should get the crab, and the garlic noodles. Both are absolutely fantastic, and you can choose from drunken, tamarind, or garlic roasted crab. We went for the latter two, and decided the garlic roasted is the best. Get one crab per person, a side of garlic noodles is good for two.

Prepare to pay for the experience, though. As much as I loved tearing that poor crab apart, you're looking at over $50 per person before drinks. It's absolutely worth it once for the experience, but I don't know if I'll ever be able to justify going back for the price.

excerpts: I fell in love with their garlic noodles and roasted  crab a few years ago and luckily my family has somehow PERFECTED this meal at home.
So when I came back recently for a birthday dinner, every single person ordered garlic noodles and roasted crab and a bunch of appetizers.
Garlic Noodles:
Such a sad disappointment!
What happened to the garlic in garlic noodles??
You can smell it, but for some reason you can't taste it at all.
*sigh* what a tease!
For the most part, it was pretty bland, and tasted like they only used garlic powder, so there wasn't any real, fresh, authentic garlic bite to it.
garlic noodles.author: Thanh N.
garlic noodles.review:
Actually more like a 3.5... 

I fell in love with their garlic noodles and roasted  crab a few years ago and luckily my family has somehow PERFECTED this meal at home. So when I came back recently for a birthday dinner, every single person ordered garlic noodles and roasted crab and a bunch of appetizers. Sad to say, it wasn't as good as I remembered. 

Lychee Martini: for the price, probably not worth it. I was able to thoroughly enjoy it which isn't a good thing for all of you alcoholics out there, seeing as how I can easily k.o. after 1/3 a beer bottle.

Thanh Long Mussels: served on a slice of baguette with pesto sauce. this was pretty good, although I didn't appreciate how it was swimming in butter, but hey if you're going to eat at Thanh Long, the last thing you should do is count calories right?

Traditional Vietnamese Salad: i'm glad we ordered some sort of veggie dish. for the most, it was tasty but the fish sauce was overly sweet and not salty/savory enough. it really needs more of a kick that "Vietnamese vinaigrette" usually has. 

We also ordered a few more appetizers, but I can't seem to recall them, I guess they weren't too memorable in my book. Oh well!

Roasted Crab: still freakin delicious. I love how no matter what time of the year you come here, the crabs are always ginormous and fresh! 

Garlic Noodles: Such a sad disappointment! What happened to the garlic in garlic noodles?? You can smell it, but for some reason you can't taste it at all. *sigh* what a tease! For the most part, it was pretty bland, and tasted like they only used garlic powder, so there wasn't any real, fresh, authentic garlic bite to it. So, so sad. 

For dessert, we all shared a bunch, in case you go thinking my belly is some sort of bottomless pit (I wish). 

Fried Banna a la Mode: It tastes exactly what it sounds like. it was good, but nothing mind blowing.

Orange Sorbet: it was served in a frozen orange shell and was rock hard. Whatever shavings of this sorbet I manage to get before giving up, was light, and refreshing. If only it was easier to eat. 

Traditional Banana Cake a la Mode: Okay, I don't even know how to contain myself on this one. I'm not a crazy fan of bananas, but omg. This has become one of the best desserts I've ever had in my whole entire life. I dream of the day that I go back to Thanh Long just for this orgasmic worthy dessert. I might be over hyping it, but it was pretty damn good. The bananas in the cake added a nice caramelized texture, and when you eat it with a spoon of ice cream, the mixture of hot and cold, sweet and savory all just mixes in your mouth, making it a perfect ending to any meal.

So to conclude my dining experience, here's your take home message: do NOT forget to order the banana cake a la mode. or else you're just shooting yourself in the foot. Happy eating!

excerpts: Like everyone else, when I go here I just have the crab and the garlic noodles.
I was recently here this past weekend and took two girlfriends with me, as we were in San Fran on a girls trip.
My friends loved the food and raved about the crab and garlic noodles.
I definitely recommend reservations when you go here, so you don't have to wait for a table.
The place also has pretty good drinks.
I will definitely be going back when I return to the San Fran area.
garlic noodles.author: Charla W.
garlic noodles.review:
Love this place! Like everyone else, when I go here I just have the crab and the garlic noodles. 
I was recently here this past weekend and took two girlfriends with me, as we were in San Fran on a girls trip. My friends loved the food and raved about the crab and garlic noodles.
I definitely recommend reservations when you go here, so you don't have to wait for a table. 
The place also has pretty good drinks. I will definitely be going back when I return to the San Fran area.

excerpts: I hate this occasion because I'm allergic and while everyone else is smacking their mouths and raving how good the crab is, I'm stuck shoveling garlic noodles into my mouth.
garlic noodles.author: Betty N.
garlic noodles.review:
This review isn't for crab, since I can't eat it. So my sister has this thing we call her "birthday crab" because every year on her birthday she likes to come here and pig out on the crab. 

I hate this occasion because I'm allergic and while everyone else is smacking their mouths and raving how good the crab is, I'm stuck shoveling garlic noodles into my mouth. Although the noodles are good, I would much rather taste the delicious crab. 

All the other food here isn't worth the $$$. I thought I found a winner with the Shaking Beef, I was wrong. I ordered it again and it was very sweet. UGH

excerpts:
It was super fresh and flavorful and was fun to eat too
+Garlic noodles!
This is the only reason my dad chose this place, because of the rave reviews on Yelp!
Thanks guys, it really was yummy.
We ordered 3 for the table, feeding all 8 people.
+ Meat and potatoes.
Ohhhhh my gah.
I swear they marinated that meat so well.
It literally felt like it melted in my mouth.
+Fried bananas were yummy too.
The dessert portions are small so be sure to order multiples.
- Server hardly smiled.
It looked like she was tired, but she was attentive and remembered our orders.
garlic noodles.author: Steph C.
garlic noodles.review:
My family and I came here for my dad's 50th birthday. Don't be swayed by the outside of this restaurant. It looks hella shady and there's hardly any parking...but wait, what's that there? A valet? Yes! It's $10 but definitely worth it if you're running late, hungry and have cash on hand. Walking in, you're handsomely greeted by someone and the decor is lovely. Artwork, paintings, gorgeous layout. It looks like it can fit a lot of people but not in a cramped/squished way. Now, on to the food and service:

+ Crab was to die for! It was super fresh and flavorful and was fun to eat too
+Garlic noodles! This is the only reason my dad chose this place, because of the rave reviews on Yelp! Thanks guys, it really was yummy. We ordered 3 for the table, feeding all 8 people.
+ Meat and potatoes. Ohhhhh my gah. I swear they marinated that meat so well. It literally felt like it melted in my mouth. 
+Fried bananas were yummy too. The dessert portions are small so be sure to order multiples. 
- Server hardly smiled. It looked like she was tired, but she was attentive and remembered our orders. At least she was polite. 


Overall, it was a good time. My dad was happy and our belly's were full with yummy leftovers to bring home for lunch tomorrow.

excerpts:
Ordered:

Vermicilli Chicken soup (x2)
Garlic Noodles (x1)
garlic noodles.author: Mr. E.
garlic noodles.review:
I ate here with my fiancee last night for the first time.  Ate every last bite -- pretty phenomenal.

Ordered:

Vermicilli Chicken soup (x2)
Garlic Noodles (x1)
Roasted Crab (x1)
Fried banana & Vanilla Ice Cream (x1)
Espresso (x1)
Regular Coffee (x1)

All came to about $73.  

Food and Service was awesome.  I would order the same exact thing all over again.  I could write a super long review based on everything we ate but let's just save time and trust that it was awesome.  You won't regret going there.  Very few meals I have felt so satisfied from... Plan to go back very soon....

excerpts: I had been to PPQ and had gotten high recommendations for Thanh Long's crab and garlic noodles.
We got Shrimp toast, salt and pepper calamari, two drunken crab, and a couple of orders of garlic noodles.
They were absolutely delicious and went perfectly with the garlic noodles.
I'd highly recommend Thanh Long.
It's worth the drive and cheaper than crustacean.
garlic noodles.author: Mike K.
garlic noodles.review:
Ok so my brother and his friend from the East Coast were in town visiting and looking for a place specific to SF. I had been to PPQ and had gotten high recommendations for Thanh Long's crab and garlic noodles. The food did not disappoint!

We got Shrimp toast, salt and pepper calamari, two drunken crab, and a couple of orders of garlic noodles. As others have mentioned I wouldn't recommend this for a first date as it's pretty messy and full of garlic!

The drunken crab are simmered in Chardonnay, Sake, Brandy and seasoned with scallions, chives and black pepper. They were absolutely delicious and went perfectly with the garlic noodles. I'd highly recommend Thanh Long. It's worth the drive and cheaper than crustacean.

excerpts: Everyone already commented on their delicious garlic noodles w/ tiger prawns
garlic noodles.author: Jennifer P.
garlic noodles.review: Other than having to wait, this place is great. Next time I have to remember to make resevation. Everyone already commented on their delicious garlic noodles w/ tiger prawns but I personally like their shaken beef better. It was with vege salad w/ New York steak strips. It was refreshing and yummy. I also like their banana cake w/ vanilla ice cream. You will leave this place with full and satisfied belly.

excerpts: The garlic noodles were sooooooooooo good!!!
I wanted to try that big garlic crab that I kept seeing people order but I opted for the jumbo prawns over garlic noodles.
I couldn't see paying $45 for that crab and then fight to get my meat out of eat.
No thanks!
lol
The garlic noodles are a must and the food comes out fast too.
This place sits in a neighborhood on a corner but the inside is really nice.
I would definitely go back.
garlic noodles.author: Yolanda C.
garlic noodles.review: OMG!  The garlic noodles were sooooooooooo good!!!  I wanted to try that big garlic crab that I kept seeing people order but I opted for the jumbo prawns over garlic noodles.  I couldn't see paying $45 for that crab and then fight to get my meat out of eat.  No thanks!  lol  The garlic noodles are a must and the food comes out fast too.  This place sits in a neighborhood on a corner but the inside is really nice.  I would definitely go back.

excerpts: The garlic noodles are good too and definitely worth the price considering.
The crab was decent although I've had better, and cheaper.
The calamari was awesome but the lava cake was way overpriced but tasted great.
The garlic noodles are good too and definitely worth the price considering.
The crab was decent although I've had better, and cheaper.
The calamari was awesome but the lava cake was way overpriced but tasted great.
Overall it was pretty decent but pricey.
garlic noodles.author: Mike H.
garlic noodles.review:
Shaken beef was awesome. The garlic noodles are good too and definitely worth the price considering.  The crab was decent although I've had better, and cheaper. The calamari was awesome but the lava cake was way overpriced but tasted great.  Overall it was pretty decent but pricey.

Shaken beef was awesome. The garlic noodles are good too and definitely worth the price considering.  The crab was decent although I've had better, and cheaper. The calamari was awesome but the lava cake was way overpriced but tasted great.  Overall it was pretty decent but pricey.

excerpts: Of course the infamous garlic noodles and tamarind crab!
Enough said.

these ive tried: the drunken crab - C (somewhat bland), roasted crab - A (peppery, delicious), tamarind crab - A (sweet and tasty), garlic noodles - A (strong garlic but sooo good), seabass - A (cooked and seasoned perfectly, spring rolls - C

these ive tried: the drunken crab - C (somewhat bland), roasted crab - A (peppery, delicious), tamarind crab - A (sweet and tasty), garlic noodles - A (strong garlic but sooo good), seabass - A (cooked and seasoned perfectly, spring rolls - C
garlic noodles.author: Dee T.
garlic noodles.review:
Of course the infamous garlic noodles and tamarind crab! Enough said.  YuMMMMM

Actually here is my letter grades for these ive tried: the drunken crab - C (somewhat bland), roasted crab - A (peppery, delicious), tamarind crab - A (sweet and tasty), garlic noodles - A (strong garlic but sooo good), seabass - A (cooked and seasoned perfectly, spring rolls - C (rice paper is dry, sauce is too sweet), lemon drop w/ chambord (kinda sweet)- B....

This place is tucked away and is small but it does have a bar with good cocktail in the foyer area. Parking sucks as everywhere in SF, but value is an option at $10.  Attire is casual and most of the tables seats only 2-4 people. During the weekends, if you do not want to wait more than 30 mins, be there before the door opens or call for a reservation. It seems there is one girl who answers the phone there that does not take reservations over the phone, weird.  The servers are attentive and nice. Noise level i guess depending if there obnoxious crowds or babies, its a moderate atmosphere.

excerpts: Garlic noodles are delicious, but they're nothing special without the crab.
Isn't that why you came in the first place?
garlic noodles.author: Ines C.
garlic noodles.review:
On the outside, Thanh Long resembles a small, quiet family restaurant. You don't realize the bustling nature and star power of this restaurant until you enter the door.

I notice a crab (or two) on everyone's table as I walk to my seat. The room is fragrant with garlic and spices. This is the real deal, I say to my parents.

We order the salmon carpaccio and Thanh Long mussels as starter dishes. Capers give the fresh salmon a nice, salty hint. The mussels practically melt in your mouth. Mop up the remaining juices with your bread. Perfection.

Garlic noodles are delicious, but they're nothing special without the crab. Isn't that why you came in the first place? So we order one roast crab. By itself the crab is meaty and fragrant, but the sauce is the extra level. It's like instant gratification when you drizzle that over the noodles.

The flavor's slightly more subtle in comparison to Boiling Crab, of course---especially if you love the whole sha-bang---but that's where the sophistication lies. That, and the customer service makes Thanh Long worth the price and visit.

excerpts: The crab and garlic noodles are amazing.
Just be prepared when you go to sleep to have a 4 gallon jug of water.
Will will need it.
Thank me when you wake up.
garlic noodles.author: Fatty A.
garlic noodles.review: The crab and garlic noodles are amazing.  Just be prepared when you go to sleep to have a 4 gallon jug of water.  Will will need it.  Thank me when you wake up.

excerpts: Famous garlic noodles?
Please, they were sub-par at best.
garlic noodles.author: Rachel A.
garlic noodles.review:
An old friend was in town, visiting for the first time, and I really wanted to show off my neighborhood to her. My mom and brother had gone when I first moved to the neighborhood and claimed to have a good time. So, I took her here! 

We went early (around 5pm) to avoid the rush. When we got there, the restaurant was empty. However, they sat us all the way in the back, right by the entrance to the kitchen, where we were bumped and jostled by just about every waiter that walked by. Every table is open in the front, and they stick as back here at the worst one?

And really...the food was not mind-blowing. Famous garlic noodles? Please, they were sub-par at best. Or maybe they gave us the crummy, bottom-of-the-pot noodles because they thought we were too young and uneducated to appreciate good food. 

My friend is 4'10", and I'm pretty small myself. We both look VERY young, although we are in our 20's. It was clear that they thought we were just young teenagers, and not worthy of good service. It was extremely insulting. We would have tipped them very well had it not been for their obvious ageism. 

What sucks is that I live a few blocks away from this place, and would have been proud to show it off to other visitors in the future. Maybe if they didn't so blatantly stereotype and mistreat people who look young, I would have gone back. Shame on you, Thanh Long!

excerpts: The roasted crab & garlic noodles will always be the winner to me.
This place seems fine for small groups, but I'm not so sure about larger groups.
garlic noodles.author: Stella C.
garlic noodles.review:
We ate family style and got to try a little bit of everything. The roasted crab & garlic noodles will always be the winner to me. This place seems fine for small groups, but I'm not so sure about larger groups. Also, it's pretty far from the freeway, so if you don't live in the city it might be a little trek to get there.

Oh, and fried ice cream is always a bonus.

excerpts: Crab + Garlic Noodles =
CRAZY DELICIOUS
I shared a roasted crab, garlic noodles and a bowl of rice with my boyfriend.
I have tried some of the other dishes here before including prawns, fried rice and salmon, but in my opinion, the only two things worth eating at this place is the crab and garlic noodles.
One order of garlic noodles is good for two to share.
It's yummy, very rich and tasty, but needs more garlic (that may just be because I love garlic)!
The fried banana with vanilla ice cream for dessert was good, but I was a bit disappointed with the batter
The crabs are market-priced (~ $35 each) and and order of garlic noodles is $9 -- totally worth it!
garlic noodles.author: Celeste M.
garlic noodles.review:
Crab + Garlic Noodles = CRAZY DELICIOUS
Don't be crabby and make sure to wear your bib!

I have my big brother to thank for introducing me to Thanh Long.  Even though I have not eaten here as much as I would like, the past three dining experiences were all very good including last weekend's dinner with friends. I have always remembered it being very crowded for dinner so I called to make a reservation.  After everyone has arrived, we were seated promptly at the biggest booth I have ever seen. 

I shared a roasted crab, garlic noodles and a bowl of rice with my boyfriend. I have tried some of the other dishes here before including prawns, fried rice and salmon, but in my opinion, the only two things worth eating at this place is the crab and garlic noodles. If you do not eat seafood especially crab, you might not like this place. 

The whole crab is cracked open and cut into fourths so most of the work is done for you.  The crab claws are so big that it's so easy to get the meat out using the handy dandy tool, the cracker.  I really like the the garlic sauce (tons of minced garlic with butter and other spices), which is generously drizzled on the crab.  One order of garlic noodles is good for two to share.  It's yummy, very rich and tasty, but needs more garlic (that may just be because I love garlic)! The fried banana with vanilla ice cream for dessert was good, but I was a bit disappointed with the batter -- it was too thick (too much flour, I think) and was not crunchy. 

The service was quick and friendly, but I felt that they wanted us out right away after we've finished our desserts.  Everything was cleared off the table in a flash and was hoping that the waiter was going to give me another glass of coke after taking my empty glass, but he never returned with it. Oh well, I guess it was a busy night so I understand. 

Parking can be difficult, but we've been lucky to find a spot every time, plus they offer valet parking :-)!  Prices are reasonable, a bit above average depending on what you get. The crabs are market-priced (~ $35 each) and and order of garlic noodles is $9 -- totally worth it!

excerpts: The garlic noodles were dry with little taste.
garlic noodles.author: Elle L.
garlic noodles.review: OK, this place USED to be Great - now it has dwindle down to a commercial  reheat the regular dishes and serve, except for the crab! I was aghast when I ate there last nite, and to boot I could have had a better meal at McD's, at least it would have been when I ordered it! Argh! How do these people stay in business? The garlic noodles were dry with little taste. The shrimp toast was DEFINITELY reheated and served hours later....yuck! And what should be the a great prelude to the grab, coconut shrimp, was stale as a dead bug.  UH! I will never come here again. I used to frequent this place a plenty, but after last nite....it's over! You're all washed up..close shop please!

excerpts: My bf and I ordered an app, jumbo prawn wontons, one roasted crab, and garlic noodles.
We were satisfied at the end, leaving nothing to-go.
I saw the couple next to us that did order individual crabs couldn't finish their own.
All-in-all, I would say I had better, pertaining to the crab.
I was just too oily/buttery and for the price I could of bought two on my own n
made it my self, but it was v-day right?!?
The GARLIC NOODLES are ssooo good!
That would probably be the only reason to go back there.
garlic noodles.author: michelle m.
garlic noodles.review:
My bf and I came here on V-day.  No reservations, but got seated within 10 mins; they were great at accommodating everybody!!  
It was so crowded, but  man did the place look great from the lobby.  After the hostess called my name we got escorted through the beautiful restaurant, through a hallway, passing the bathroom, up a flight of stairs, and into a red-walled room filled with families and couples.  It was like they took us to the reject room.  

Anyways, the waiters were really polite and attentive.  The crabs that day were going for almost $40 a crab, ouch! My bf and I ordered an app, jumbo prawn wontons, one roasted crab, and garlic noodles.  We were satisfied at the end, leaving nothing to-go.  I saw the couple next to us that did order individual crabs couldn't finish their own.  
All-in-all, I would say I had better, pertaining to the crab.  I was just too oily/buttery and for the price I could of bought two on my own n made it my self, but it was v-day right?!? The GARLIC NOODLES are ssooo good! That would probably be the only reason to go back there.

excerpts: Anyway, ONTO THE CRAB AND GARLIC NOODLES!
For two people, we got a whole roast crab and two plates of garlic noodles.
I walked out of there feeling way crappy (or crabby?)
since I just probably ate the equivalent of a stick of butter.
Make sure to eat the garlic noodles while they're hot.
garlic noodles.author: Heidi C.
garlic noodles.review:
First off, the crab puff things they sell for appetizers is a rip off. $10 for 6 pieces? No thanks. I rather spend $10 on a whole block of cream cheese at costco and eat that to my liking. 

Anyway, ONTO THE CRAB AND GARLIC NOODLES!
For two people, we got a whole roast crab and two plates of garlic noodles. I walked out of there feeling way crappy (or crabby?) since I just probably ate the equivalent of a stick of butter. BUT it was SO incredibly worth it. 

I tried all the other crabs on the menu and if I were to rate it based on the taste, it would go in the order that it is listed on their menu:
Roast Crab
Drunken Crab
Tamarind Crab

They give you a plastic bib so you don't get crab juices on you, and you pretty much eat with your hands. Make sure to eat the garlic noodles while they're hot. Doesn't taste as good when it's cooled down.

Last time we went, the market price for a crab was about $35. 

I love Thanh Long's crab!!

(Photos uploaded)

excerpts: Order the roast crab, garlic noodles, daily veggie side, and a bottle of La Crema Chardonnay.
That is all you need.
garlic noodles.author: Leoneidas L.
garlic noodles.review:
You cannot improve on perfection.  Absolute perfection.  Order the roast crab, garlic noodles, daily veggie side, and a bottle of La Crema Chardonnay.  That is all you need.  This is a must-do in San Francisco.

Restaurateurs up and down the West coast, please pay attention to the missed opportunities to do something really special with the greater region's seafood like Thanh Long does.  Crab doesn't have to be served cold in a small plastic cup.  This place is transcendental.

excerpts: and I just can't get enough of their Garlic noodles.
What the hell makes it so special - it's so freaking bad for me
and even when I'm extremely full
I still have to gobble up every last piece.
Besides the AWESOME garlic noodles, Thanh Long is also known for their Roasted crabs.
Along with our AWESOME garlic noodles we ordered a Roasted Crab and a Roasted Crab in WIne
(I don't remember exactly what this was called
but it was flavored in a variation of liquor and wine).
Both crabs were great (especially with the Garlic noodles).
Thanh Long actually has quite a bit of dishes in their menu but i think most people come here for their crabs and garlic noodles.

Either way, if you haven't tried Thang Long then you've been living under a rock so make sure you get your @$$ over there and gobble up tons of the garlic noodles and also throw in some roasted crab while you're there!
garlic noodles.author: Danny K.
garlic noodles.review:
I've been to Thanh Long at least 20 times now and I just can't get enough of their Garlic noodles.  What the hell makes it so special - it's so freaking bad for me and even when I'm extremely full I still have to gobble up every last piece.  At least I controlled myself last night by only ordering 1 garlic noodle dish for the two of us (I use to order two Garlic noodle dishes just for me!).  

Besides the AWESOME garlic noodles, Thanh Long is also known for their Roasted crabs.  Along with our AWESOME garlic noodles we ordered a Roasted Crab and a Roasted Crab in WIne (I don't remember exactly what this was called but it was flavored in a variation of liquor and wine).  Both crabs were great (especially with the Garlic noodles).  

Thanh Long actually has quite a bit of dishes in their menu but i think most people come here for their crabs and garlic noodles.  

Service is usually very good once you are seated.  Reservations between 6-8 are hard to come by and they only open at 5PM - 10PM.  If you're going to walk in without a reservation expect at least an hour wait unless you get lucky and someone doesn't show up for their reservation.  If you don't mind, reservation after 8:30PM are pretty open.  

Either way, if you haven't tried Thang Long then you've been living under a rock so make sure you get your @$$ over there and gobble up tons of the garlic noodles and also throw in some roasted crab while you're there!

excerpts: I always order the same thing every time I go to this restaurant-mussels with crostini, roast crab, and garlic noodles...
super yummy!:)
garlic noodles.author: Berna M.
garlic noodles.review: I always order the same thing every time I go to this restaurant-mussels with crostini, roast crab, and garlic noodles... super yummy!:)

excerpts: Five spiced chicken that was overly sweet; dry beef for shaken beef that was $21.95; greasy garlic noodles for $10 and not very fresh crabs for $38 a piece.
At these prices, I would expect at least 3 stars for the food.
garlic noodles.author: Vitamin C.
garlic noodles.review:
For once, Yelp has let me down. 4 stars based on 900+ reviews???? WHAT? Well, perhaps I went to the wrong Thanh Long...

I found the dishes to be extremely overpriced. Five spiced chicken that was overly sweet; dry beef for shaken beef that was $21.95; greasy garlic noodles for $10 and not very fresh crabs for $38 a piece. At these prices, I would expect at least 3 stars for the food. I was sorely disappointed 

Service was just so-so. Thanh Long is a wannabe upscale restaurant that was not very upscale and the food was very mediocre... NEXT!

excerpts: Garlic Noodles are AMAZING.
With their Garlic Crab is a perfect combo.
garlic noodles.author: ThuZ W.
garlic noodles.review:
I love love love love this place!!

Garlic Noodles are AMAZING. With their Garlic Crab is a perfect combo.

excerpts: Garlic noodles tasted like noodles mixed with the msg seasoning in the ramen bags.
Zero fresh garlic and just wasn't very tasty.
Garlic crab was basically butter salt and pepper flavor.
No garlic to be seen again.
Had bo luc lac and it was decent, small portion.
garlic noodles.author: Hangman L.
garlic noodles.review: Food was okay but too much msg. Garlic noodles tasted like noodles mixed with the msg seasoning in the ramen bags. Zero fresh garlic and just wasn't very tasty. Garlic crab was basically butter salt and pepper flavor. No garlic to be seen again. Had bo luc lac and it was decent, small portion. Added fried rice that was decent. I paid over $10 for a sprite that i refilled twice due to the salty food. They didnt tell me that there was not free refill. Each refill was $3 in the skinny 6oz soda glass. Last time you will rip me off. As of the $50 / crab wasnt profitable enough. Greedy people.

excerpts: Game plan:  order 1 crab and 1 order of garlic noodles per person.
Do not deviate from this plan or your after dinner arrangements may be compromised.
I recommend the roasted crab and garlic noodles.
You:
Hey, how about you get the crab
and I'll get the shrimp
and we'll share.
Me:
Um, well, I thought...

"
You:  Great!
(Dinner arrives, you dig into your shrimp, while I break the crab in half.)
You: (tasting the crab)
"OMFG, this is the best crab I've had in my life!!!
Me:
Yeh, that's why I said I wanted to come here.
You:
"Aren't you gonna eat any shrimp?

"
Me: "Um, no.

"
You: (suddenly wise to the situation) "
This means we're not gonna have sex later, doesn't it?

"
Me:
"Yes.
garlic noodles.author: Sondra H.
garlic noodles.review:
Game plan:  order 1 crab and 1 order of garlic noodles per person.  Do not deviate from this plan or your after dinner arrangements may be compromised.  Example:

Me:  "I recommend the roasted crab and garlic noodles."
