You:  "Hey, how about you get the crab and I'll get the shrimp and we'll share."
Me:  "Um, well, I thought..."
You:  Great!
(Dinner arrives, you dig into your shrimp, while I break the crab in half.)
You: (tasting the crab) "OMFG, this is the best crab I've had in my life!!!"
Me:  "Yeh, that's why I said I wanted to come here."
You:  "Aren't you gonna eat any shrimp?"
Me: "Um, no."
You: (suddenly wise to the situation) "This means we're not gonna have sex later, doesn't it?"
Me:  "Yes."

BTW, check out their original menu In the back, where the restrooms are, for a good chuckle.

excerpts:
Tamarind crab +  garlic noodles =  nirvana for the taste buds

TL would get 5 stars if i didnt have to get down n dirty with the crab with a  plastic bib around my neck.

so we don't have to remind your servers about the water every 5 minutes

-Water served in chipped/broken glasses

-The tamarind crab and garlic noodles

so we don't have to remind your servers about the water every 5 minutes

-Water served in chipped/broken glasses

-The tamarind crab and garlic noodles
garlic noodles.author: Kris H.
garlic noodles.review:
Tamarind crab +  garlic noodles =  nirvana for the taste buds

TL would get 5 stars if i didnt have to get down n dirty with the crab with a  plastic bib around my neck.  =)


UPDATE  4/13/08-
 I'm taking away 3 stars for a recent cruddy experience @ TL.  Let's see, where do I begin:

- When I give you a birthday cake, I expect you to put the damn thing in the fridge so the mango mousse will not die a slow death.

- $1 charge per person for cake cutting; that's almost as absurd as the $2 charge at Straits

-Dry, old, crappy rice; you are a friggin' Asian restaurant, learn to make some rice

-Traditional Viet salad; there's nothing traditional about the salad.  There's no flavor and you cant even taste the fish sauce.  What's with the bitter cabbage and 0 herbs?

-Salt and NO pepper calamari, plain nasty

-The drunken crab was such a disappointment; we did not pay $36 for a frozen crab 

-Service definitely needed improvement; when you put 100 lbs of salt in all your dishes, you should just give us a pitcher of water so we don't have to remind your servers about the water every 5 minutes

-Water served in chipped/broken glasses

-The tamarind crab and garlic noodles are good but the overall experience my friends and I had recently, DEFINITELY does not warrant the original 4 stars and another visit

excerpts: Garlic noodles are wonderful.
The calamari was great.
The wontons were pretty good.
garlic noodles.author: Sonny W.
garlic noodles.review:
Garlic noodles are wonderful.  The calamari was great.  The wontons were pretty good.  Okay, so appetizers are wonderful....

With that, however, the main course dishes are "acceptable" but overflavored.  The eggplant seems like they just dunk it in sauce.  The shaking beef could be a bit more tender cut.  

As for the main course (crabs, of course), I was surprised to be more critical (as I've gone 3 years ago to the more "high end" looking Crustacean in the other part of the city).  Very heavy garlic and very heavy tamarind flavor fo the two types of crabs that we ordered.

But seriously, what got me was how much sodium or whatever they put in.  When I got home, all I could do was to keep downing glass after glass of H20.  

Finally, parking in the neighborhood is hell.  I was glad to drive the smaller, gas-sipping car rather than my small sport SUV.

excerpts: I always have the garlic crab, but have also tried the shaken beef salad, and garlic noodles, both of which were great.
garlic noodles.author: Bernard N.
garlic noodles.review:
Whenever I'm in San Francisco, I always make sure to visit Thanh Long, home of the best dungeness crab in the world!

Same owners as Crustaceans, Thanh Long is their first restaurant.  Located in the hood (Judah Street) with valet parking, this restaurant is always busy, and with good reason.  I always have the garlic crab, but have also tried the shaken beef salad, and garlic noodles, both of which were great.

My crab during this visit was huge.. over 2 lbs.  Must be a good crab season in the Bay Area, as all 5 crabs that we ordered were of similar size.  A little bit pricey at $38, it was well worth it!

The only rule we have at the table is NO TALKING.  If you talk (and take too much time), the butter will turn cold . .and who wants to eat great crab with cold butter, LOL.

I've been coming here for over 10 years and will continue to enjoy their crab for years to come!

excerpts: LOVE the crab and garlic noodles.
Be sure to make a reservation - earlier is better because you can also find parking.
garlic noodles.author: Lisa A.
garlic noodles.review: LOVE the crab and garlic noodles.  Be sure to make a reservation - earlier is better because you can also find parking.

excerpts: We really enjoyed our roasted crab and garlic noodles (and wine) meal here mainly because they have quite a unique recipe that is not easy to find elsewhere in the world.
garlic noodles.author: John D.
garlic noodles.review:
We really enjoyed our roasted crab and garlic noodles (and wine) meal here mainly because they have quite a unique recipe that is not easy to find elsewhere in the world. 

While it's not an inexpensive meal by any means, it's a special meal especially if you like crab (they have other dishes too though). 

The service was impeccable and we all left with smiles on our faces so we generally recommend this restaurant.

excerpts: We ordered several specialties such as the Roast Crab and Garlic Noodles.
However, I was unimpressed and it certainly did not live up to the hype.
The dishes majored in butter and garlic.
Those interested in Roast Crab should try R&G Lounge in Chinatown.
garlic noodles.author: William L.
garlic noodles.review:
I heard about Thanh Long from friends and from Yelp and decided to try it when my niece was in town.  Situated in a residential neighborhood, parking was street only or valet for $10, which I thought was a bit pricey.

I made a reservation for seven and was asked to arrive on time.  We were seated promptly.  I found a parking space one block away.

The menu offered a good selection.  We ordered several specialties such as the Roast Crab and Garlic Noodles.  However, I was unimpressed and it certainly did not live up to the hype.  The dishes majored in butter and garlic.  That taste stayed with me for the night.

The service was attentive but I doubt I will come back anytime soon.

Those interested in Roast Crab should try R&G Lounge in Chinatown.

excerpts: Order the roasted crab and garlic noodles!!!
They're to die for.
The crab is fresh and big.
The flavor of butter and cracked pepper just explodes in your mouth.
I'm a big eater
so I always have to have my own crab and another entrée.
garlic noodles.author: Laina T.
garlic noodles.review:
If you're a crab lover like I am, you'll love Thanh Long.  Skip the appetizers.  I've tried the salmon carpaccio, lemongrass chicken satay, and mango salad.  I wasn't really impressed.  Order the roasted crab and garlic noodles!!!  They're to die for.  The crab is fresh and big.  The flavor of butter and cracked pepper just explodes in your mouth.  I'm a big eater so I always have to have my own crab and another entrée.  Stick to the roasted crab instead of the tamarind crab.  The sauce on the tamarind crab is a little sweet for my taste buds.  The Thanh Long spicy eggplant is good, but nowhere near spicy.  As for dessert, don't get the bread pudding.  The orange sorbet was good and the presentation was clever.  It's a frozen orange sliced across the top with orange sorbet inside.  It's nice, light, and a good ending to any meal.  

At about $40 per crab, it's not cheap.  It's a good place for special occasions or if you just want to satisfy your craving for really good crab.  The atmosphere is casual so there's no need dress up.  Get your hands dirty and enjoy!

excerpts: The garlic noodles are amazing!
probably the best i've ever had.
The crab itself was good but a bit on the pricy side.
Also, some of the spoons that I got had food remains on them, but other than that, everything was great!
garlic noodles.author: Maggie T.
garlic noodles.review: The garlic noodles are amazing! probably the best i've ever had. The crab itself was good but a bit on the pricy side.  Also, some of the spoons that I got had food remains on them, but other than that, everything was great!

excerpts: Roasted crab, shaken beef and garlic noodles!
So good.
Pricey, but it was good.
garlic noodles.author: Cristie S.
garlic noodles.review: Roasted crab, shaken beef and garlic noodles! So good. Pricey, but it was good.

excerpts: Ordered the garlic noodles, garlic crab $42 drunken crab, fleur de mango, Vietnamese salad, coconut shrimp, and some soups.
Everyone else at my table seemed ok
but I got a bit of a stomach ache due to the heaviness of the garlic noodles and crab sauce.
I am a little bit confused about why the garlic noodles are such a big deal.
It is a plate full of noodles with a hint of garlic.
Pretty basic.
garlic noodles.author: Kei D.
garlic noodles.review: Ordered the garlic noodles, garlic crab $42 drunken crab, fleur de mango, Vietnamese salad, coconut shrimp, and some soups.  Everyone else at my table seemed ok but I got a bit of a stomach ache due to the heaviness of the garlic noodles and crab sauce.  I am a little bit confused about why the garlic noodles are such a big deal.  It is a plate full of noodles with a hint of garlic.  Pretty basic.

excerpts: We both ordered the roasted crab (suggested by our waiter, it was delicious and seasoned very well) with one side or garlic noodles (very tasty, and garlicky), and shrimp fried rice and we added chicken for a hearty side of rice (shrimp in rice are small), They were attentive, but could have come to check on us a bit more.
The warm damp folded face towels brought to us at the end of our meal was a great addition.
Small facility, polite wait staff - overall
we had a great experience and we will return.
garlic noodles.author: Starlet H.
garlic noodles.review: First time here with my boyfriend Saturday night. The place was busy (1 hour wait), we valet parked ($12) because there was no where to park. We ordered a bottle of wine at the bar while we waited to be seated. We both ordered the roasted crab (suggested by our waiter, it was delicious and seasoned very well) with one side or garlic noodles (very tasty, and garlicky), and shrimp fried rice and we added chicken for a hearty side of rice (shrimp in rice are small), They were attentive, but could have come to check on us a bit more. The warm damp folded face towels brought to us at the end of our meal was a great addition. Small facility, polite wait staff - overall we had a great experience and we will return.

excerpts:
Ordered the roasted crab, prawn with garlic noodles and shaken beef.

Garlic noodles - errr... overhyped I feel, and you don't feel too good after eating this as it really tastes like it was cooked with loads of butter and lard.

Shaken beef - not too bad but nothing spectacular.
garlic noodles.author: Rossini P.
garlic noodles.review:
Maybe I came here with too high expectations.  I actually want to give it 3.5 stars but can't figure out how to do it.

Ordered the roasted crab, prawn with garlic noodles and shaken beef.

Roasted crab - tasted plain at first but it GROWS on you.  So by the end of it, you actually want more!!!  Very good.

Garlic noodles - errr... overhyped I feel, and you don't feel too good after eating this as it really tastes like it was cooked with loads of butter and lard.

Prawns that were on top of the garlic weren't good at all.  Roasted too dry and the edges were burnt and they actually scratched my throat when I ate them.

Shaken beef - not too bad but nothing spectacular.

The restaurant was really packed.  Also, it had a sort of funky smell like carpet thats been damp and not dried for a long time...

Also was a little shocked at the bill which was over $100 when we ordered sort of the same stuff at R&G (crab, veggies, rice, beef) and it cost us both $90

On a side note, the valet guy was really nice :-)

excerpts: Garlic noodles:  good.
Get it.
Although when you get it together with the crab it competes for your time and attention and may get cold.
For me the bill came out to be about $80 for my own crab, garlic noodles, a drink, shared appetizer and shared desserts.
garlic noodles.author: Alice A.
garlic noodles.review:
How original can I be for a place that has already gotten 865 reviews?

Make a reservation.  Everyone needs to be there before being seated.

The place is pretty big and has upstairs area.  Some tables get rowdy but you don't mind because everyone is happy.

Cocktails: not bad.

Garlic noodles:  good.  Get it.  Although when you get it together with the crab it competes for your time and attention and may get cold.  It's much better eaten hot.

Salt and pepper roasted crab:  great.  Get it.   I don't know how they manage during non-crab season for the demand but in August it was still huge, meaty, and succulent.

I went with hard core friends who did not wish to share, although you could definitely do family style.  For me the bill came out to be about $80 for my own crab, garlic noodles, a drink, shared appetizer and shared desserts.

The place is a little incongruous in a residential neighborhood but is super popular.  Street parking can be challenging but they offer valet parking, apparently for $10.  Lucky you!

excerpts: Roasted Crab and Garlic noodles are the best here!
garlic noodles.author: Es S.
garlic noodles.review:
Roasted Crab and Garlic noodles are the best here! I refuse to go to other restaurants that serve the same dishes, or tries to imitate. 

It's worth the money.. and worth the drive to the city if you live 45 mins away like me.

My only complaint is that parking sucks in this area!!! Thank goodness they have Valet, but still!!! I could spend that $10 Valet fee for dessert or something.

excerpts: The garlic noodles dish always does the trick.
It's that good.
I am always amazed by the diversity of the people coming there for dinner.
It reminds me of what CA is all about.
It was busy on Friday night there and service was not the best.
We had to ask to refill glasses with water, bring more spoons, etc.
However, we will always come back if we want to taste a crab again.
garlic noodles.author: Galina F.
garlic noodles.review:
We think of this place when we want to have some great crab dishes. This time i didn't order a crab, but went with curry prawns, and was disappointed. The garlic noodles dish always does the trick. It's that good. I am always amazed by the diversity of the people coming there for dinner. It reminds me of what CA is all about.
It was busy on Friday night there and service was not the best. We had to ask to refill glasses with water, bring more spoons, etc. However, we will always come back if we want to taste a crab again.

excerpts:
Colossal Royal Tiger Prawns ~
butterflied and grilled with secret spices, served on a bed of garlic noodles

4.
garlic noodles.author: Oliver D.
garlic noodles.review:
I've heard so many good reviews on this place and had to check it out for myself! 

I'm a HUGE fan of sea food especially CRAB and I heard this place had the best roasted crab in San Francisco, so I had to get my 'YELP FACE' on and see what the hype was all about!

As I walked into the restaurant i was impressed! The exterior of Thanh  Long looks like a 'hole in a wall' establishment, but i was proven wrong. It's really cozy and professional. 

I suggest you make reservations if you decide to come with a party of 4 or more. It can get busy on the weekend.

Since this place is kinda pricey, its recommended that you skip out on the appetizers; to be honest, they are over-rated, tiny and over priced! Just get down to the nitty gritty and order the main dishes....

Here are my recommendations:

1.  Thanh Long Spicy Eggplant ~
sauteed with jumbo prawns, chicken, fresh basil, baby corn, shitake mushrooms and fiery red chillies in a tamarind and chilli-soya

2. Shaken Beef ~
tender cubes of marinated new york steak flambeed in chardonnay, served with potatoes, mixed green and cherry tomatoes

3. Colossal Royal Tiger Prawns ~
butterflied and grilled with secret spices, served on a bed of garlic noodles

4. Roast Crab ~
a whole dungeness crab roasted with thanh's garlic sauce and secret spices


NOTE: The spices used in their food are really intense, so if you don't like the after taste of garlic and spices in your mouth, then the majority of the food isn't for you.....but who doesn't like INTENSE SPICES! haha

The portion size of each dish is some what small so try to diversify your choices and order smart....


Much LOVE and eats!

excerpts: And don't forget the garlic noodles and a hearty glass of wine.
garlic noodles.author: VB L.
garlic noodles.review: This is without a doubt my favorite restaurant in the world.  I've been coming here since the place had ten little tables and everyone wore jeans.  Since then they've knocked down walls, built up and bought other restaurants throughout the country.  But Thanh Long is still the best.  Mamma Ahn herself makes sure this stays the crown jewel of the group.  If you love crab, then you'll love Thanh Long.  And don't forget the garlic noodles and a hearty glass of wine.

excerpts: I had the Fish and Garlic Noodles, Spicy Calamari, Combo Fried Rice and a glass of wine.
garlic noodles.author: Michael G.
garlic noodles.review:
Pretty good.  I didn't try the crab, because I figured they'd run out if I ordered it too.  Everyone around us seemed to be getting the crab, but the bib that they kindly put on for you is what lead me to decide on something less likely to require a clothing shield.  I had the Fish and Garlic Noodles, Spicy Calamari, Combo Fried Rice and a glass of wine.  

Service was excellent and the food was delicious.  My only complaint......parking is a pain and it was super loud in there.

I will be back for the crab though.

excerpts: I can't get enough of their garlic noodles, crab, and colossal royal tiger prawns.
Best garlic noodles
I've ever had and believe me...
garlic noodles.author: Dimps I.
garlic noodles.review:
One of my all time favorite restaurant.  I can't get enough of their garlic noodles, crab, and colossal royal tiger prawns.  On top of the that...the shaken beef and the Vietnamese salad.  Yum!  Best garlic noodles I've ever had and believe me...I've tried many.

I love you Thanh Long!

excerpts: Roasted Crab and Garlic Noodles.
All I can say is...

I took off 1 star only because I've been to PPQ several times and they actually have a dinner-for-2 deal for $52 bucks (you get spring rolls, salad, garlic noodles, roasted crab, ice cream & fried banana fritters).
But over here, we paid $115 and got 2 roasted crabs and 2 orders of garlic noodles.
Also, parking is kind of a pain.
garlic noodles.author: Jen S.
garlic noodles.review:
O
M
G

A...maze...ing!

Roasted Crab and Garlic Noodles. All I can say is... THAT was probably the BEST meal for me in 2010 by far!!

Nice little establishment. Pretty clean and contemporary. They have a full bar and excellent customer service. The food was to DIE for! OMG. I'm usually really generous with my food but I straight up told my boyfriend, NO SHARING! hahah!

I took off 1 star only because I've been to PPQ several times and they actually have a dinner-for-2 deal for $52 bucks (you get spring rolls, salad, garlic noodles, roasted crab, ice cream & fried banana fritters). But over here, we paid $115 and got 2 roasted crabs and 2 orders of garlic noodles. Also, parking is kind of a pain. At PPQ they have a parking lot nearby.

Overall - the food was still the BOMB dot com!

excerpts: Ordered one crab, (small to medium size), garlic noodles, tiger prawns with garlic noodles (4 prawns), thai ice tea (4 whisky sized glasses with a lot of ice), calamari (appetizer), budda rolls 2 roll appetizer) and the bill came out to $136.00...not including tip.
I almost fell off my chair when I saw that the tiger prawns and garlic noodles entree was $36.00.
There was nothing fancy about it...
no veggies, other protein included...just four pieces of prawns with garlic noodles.
garlic noodles.author: Suse C.
garlic noodles.review:
Food was fine, but overpriced and overrated.  Service was good too.

Ordered one crab, (small to medium size), garlic noodles, tiger prawns with garlic noodles (4 prawns), thai ice tea (4 whisky sized glasses with a lot of ice), calamari (appetizer), budda rolls 2 roll appetizer) and the bill came out to $136.00...not including tip.  I almost fell off my chair when I saw that the tiger prawns and garlic noodles entree was $36.00.  There was nothing fancy about it...no veggies, other protein included...just four pieces of prawns with garlic noodles.   Portion sizes were average at best. 

It's one of those places where you're glad you tried it once but unless you have an unlimited supply of cash to throw around, I wouldn't go there again when there are other restaurants with similar menu items at half the price.

excerpts: Garlic noodles and roast crab are legit!
Definitely worth the price and trek to the Avenues.
garlic noodles.author: Catherine C.
garlic noodles.review: Garlic noodles and roast crab are legit! Definitely worth the price and trek to the Avenues. Vietnamese salad pretty good as was the lemongrass chicken. The space is 70s chic in an unflattering way. Nice to have a full-bar though. Prices are a bit higher than I'd like to spend.

excerpts: The famous garlic noodles man.
garlic noodles.author: Kent T.
garlic noodles.review:
The famous garlic noodles man. 
However, it's a hit or miss sometimes on how good it's cook.

As for the crab, it's good but maybe not work the price if you can steam your own crab  or in my case, go and catch my own crab and steam it myself.

excerpts: I have had the salt and pepper calamari, roasted crab, the giant prawns, garlic noodles, creme brulee, and fried banana with vanilla ice cream.
Everything is delicious and the service is impeccable.
The kitchen times everything perfectly so that as soon as your done with your appetizer, you entrée arrives and so forth with the rest of the meal.
garlic noodles.author: Nga D.
garlic noodles.review:
First off, There are people who line up before this restaurant opens to eat here, you know its one hell of a restaurant when you see that.
Second, don't come here unless you have money to burn on good food.

With the above being said, this place is super super yummy. Me and my bf came here to eat on a Friday and it was packed. I have had the salt and pepper calamari, roasted crab, the giant prawns, garlic noodles, creme brulee, and fried banana with vanilla ice cream. Everything is delicious and the service is impeccable. The kitchen times everything perfectly so that as soon as your done with your appetizer, you entrée arrives and so forth with the rest of the meal. The waiters pay attention to you and constantly checks on your water, tea, etc. without being annoying. 

I would definitely come back here whenever I have garlic noodle and crab cravings :)

excerpts: Since they were famous for their garlic noodles and roasted garlic and butter crab...of course we got that!
garlic noodles.author: Sherene L.
garlic noodles.review:
WOW!  As sad as I sound, I can't wait until go back here...

This place was recommended from my aunt.  She only lived the block down from Thanh Long.  (Yay! Within walking distance of great parking...)  OMG!  If i could only use one word to describe the food here...orgasmic!  Since they were famous for their garlic noodles and roasted garlic and butter crab...of course we got that!  The waitress also recommended their salt and pepper calamari and rice rolls.  All of it was extremely delicious.  All of the dishes we ordered were full of flavor and extremely delicious.  It was like my taste buds were on a never ending high...

The atmosphere is decent.  The table seemed too close together, but maybe that just me. You can also make reservations in advance so that you don't have to wait.  Granted, I didn't pay  for the meal and the prices did seem a bit expensive, but I would highly try this place as least once before making an opinion.

excerpts: Surprisingly, though, the biggest disappointments were the restaurant specialties that have seemingly made this restaurant famous:  the roasted crab and garlic noodles.
The crab was small and mealy, and once you suck away the tasty salt and pepper sauce from the outer shell, you're left with bland, crumbly crab that did not taste fresh or well-cooked.
There was not much crab fat under the shell either.
Then the garlic noodles arrived.
My impression can be summarized as the following:  meh.
garlic noodles.author: Elaine L.
garlic noodles.review:
Seriously, I don't get it.  Is it because I am Vietnamese, or is it because I've made crab better at home myself?  To say that I was greatly, nay sorely, disappointed would be putting it lightly.  

I had heard from 2 different friends who also love food that I should try this restaurant, so I finally went with great excitement and anticipation.  I even schlepped out on a rainy, windy miserable night where I could've just sat at home eating ramen and been happy.

The dinner started off well enough with the salt and pepper calamari and the mango salad.  My fleur de mango mixed drink was decent but tasted more like banana and coconut than mango.  Boyfriend's pineapple ginger-infused vodka was better.

Surprisingly, though, the biggest disappointments were the restaurant specialties that have seemingly made this restaurant famous:  the roasted crab and garlic noodles.  The crab was small and mealy, and once you suck away the tasty salt and pepper sauce from the outer shell, you're left with bland, crumbly crab that did not taste fresh or well-cooked.  There was not much crab fat under the shell either. Perhaps they aren't sourcing their crab from a good provider.

Then the garlic noodles arrived.  My impression can be summarized as the following:  meh.  I'm pretty sure I can reproduce the same dish with some spaghetti and a lot of butter and garlic.

Boyfriend thinks that I should come back and give them a second chance because any restaurant can have an off night, but given how sad it was and given that the highlight of the meal was when said boyfriend sent a crab leg flying, barely missing the lady sitting next to us when he tried to pry it off the crab body , I'm gun shy to say the least.  His response actually was, "Well, as least it's one less leg we have to eat."  If that doesn't speak volumes, not sure what else would.

I'd rather blow all of my money on the salt and pepper crab at R&G Lounge.  I know that Andrew Zimmern spotlighted the An family on his show, but Bourdain went to R&G.  By my tally, it's Bourdain 1 versus Zimmern 0.

excerpts: To make your visit easy, simple, and delightful order the roasted crab and garlic noodles.
An order of one crab and noodles can serve two.
It's a must - don't even bother looking through the menu.
Just do it!
You'll be giving 5 NOMs!
Yes, a bit pricey, but worth the NOMs.
garlic noodles.author: romeo b.
garlic noodles.review:
So you're deciding to visit Thanh Long or not?  Deciding which crab spot to hit up?  Hopefully this will help you decide.  NOM NOM NOM NOM NOM!!!  I LOVE THANH LONG CRABS.  I GOT CRABS FROM THANG LONG - that sounds pretty nasty!  Hopefully that gets your attention.

To make your visit easy, simple, and delightful order the roasted crab and garlic noodles. An order of one crab and noodles can serve two.  It's a must - don't even bother looking through the menu.  Just do it!  You'll be giving 5 NOMs!  Yes, a bit pricey, but worth the NOMs.

excerpts:
MAJOR kudos to the An family for having those super cool top secret kitchens that produce the most ummm....amazing freakin' garlic noodles EVER.
Im so confused. 
Like really?!
How are they so good??
It just boggles my mind but any who, 
their garlic crab is also a winner.
Super fresh. 
Very well seasoned.
garlic noodles.author: Toya R.
garlic noodles.review:
Whoaaaaaa. MAJOR kudos to the An family for having those super cool top secret kitchens that produce the most ummm....amazing freakin' garlic noodles EVER.
Im so confused. 
Like really?!
How are they so good??
It just boggles my mind but any who, 
their garlic crab is also a winner.
Super fresh. Very well seasoned. 
Im also a fan of their seasonal veggies and jumbo prawn wontons. 
Their food is just great. 
The only thing I would change is their seating. OMG I would like to have dinner with my boyfriend and not the waiters ass because the tables are so close. 
Oh P.s...
The neighborhood is NOT what you expect.
Lock your doors.

excerpts: Shared the roasted crab, some garlic noodles and a few other things.
All the food was delicious and definitely want to come back.
Guess there can be a wait, but we got lucky on our timing and were able to sit right away.
garlic noodles.author: Dilly M.
garlic noodles.review: Can't believe it took me so long to get here. It lives up to the hype. Shared the roasted crab, some garlic noodles and a few other things.  All the food was delicious and definitely want to come back.  Guess there can be a wait, but we got lucky on our timing and were able to sit right away.

excerpts: $9.50 garlic noodles:  another ripoff.
Plain wheat noodle with nothing much but garlic bits.
Hints of butter, sugar and salt.
Small portion.
garlic noodles.author: Andy R.
garlic noodles.review:
Another Yelp disappointment.  Overall ripoff.  Overly hyped.  Much better deal elsewhere.  Very hard to find parking spot.  They take advantage of the situation by offering $10+ valet parking.

$37.95  Roasted crab: a ripoff with small size for the price.  Too salty and oily.  Not much left in the shell which was pre-opened.  Almost no meat in the body.  Only good news was that leg shells were soft and easy to crack.
$9.50 garlic noodles:  another ripoff.  Plain wheat noodle with nothing much but garlic bits.  Hints of butter, sugar and salt. Small portion.
$11.75 Soft shell crab appetizer: only one crab with some not so fresh cabbages with not much seasoning.
$4.95 a bottle of 33 bear: glass smelled like chlorine
$4.50 hot tea : low quality tea leaf and luke warm water

Had to get used to urine like odor when entered.  Service was responsive and fast.  But, I wouldn't come back for food.

excerpts: We had reservations (that helps b/c it gets really crowded) and my sis ordered 4 roast crabs, 2 orders of garlic noodles, steamed veggies, 2 appetizers (forgot what they were), 2 bottles of wine, and honestly, I forgot how many dessert drinks we ordered.
garlic noodles.author: Cath M.
garlic noodles.review:
We went here last Friday night to celebrate my parent's 37th wedding anniversary and it didn't disappoint. It's been ages since we've been here so it was nice to come back and have the food still taste the same...awesome!

We arrived and ordered 3 lychee martini's from the bar (bartender was really nice and friendly) but most of all, he made some rocking martini's! Wow, it made us feel warm and fuzzy right away, a good way to start your "family" dinner! =)

We had reservations (that helps b/c it gets really crowded) and my sis ordered 4 roast crabs, 2 orders of garlic noodles, steamed veggies, 2 appetizers (forgot what they were), 2 bottles of wine, and honestly, I forgot how many dessert drinks we ordered. At that time, I was having my own party, yet again.

Overall, service was great and food came out fast and steaming hot. Definitely pricey but really well worth every penny. The boy categorizes this place as really "special" occasions. I only paid $130 for my part, for a party of 6 but the boy said he saw my sis put down about $500...that's how pricey it is IF you get the same amount of food we got.

excerpts: Thanh Long broke my "Roasted Crab n' Garlic Noodles" cherry so many years ago....and for that I will always remember and love this place!!
It's been awhile since I've actually been there
garlic noodles.author: Resa N.
garlic noodles.review:
Thanh Long broke my "Roasted Crab n' Garlic Noodles" cherry so many years ago....and for that I will always remember and love this place!!  It's been awhile since I've actually been there but my taste buds for great food will never forget.  

It is a tad bit more expensive than the other competitors but then again you're paying for what you get and it's pretty much top notch!!!

excerpts: Garlic noodles had some kind of gelatin yuk in it.
Ugh.
Roasted crab didn't taste fresh.
This place is awfully overrated for the prices they charge.
garlic noodles.author: Bad News S.
garlic noodles.review: Rushed, sloppy service.   Garlic noodles had some kind of gelatin yuk in it.  Ugh.   Roasted crab didn't taste fresh.   This place is awfully overrated for the prices they charge.

excerpts: We also ordered the garlic noodles.
Although they were good, the flavor was strong and over powered the delicate crab.
Not sure I would order them again.
I recommend having some nice appetizers and the focusing on the crab for your entree.
The service was great - they paid attention to the details such as providing a bib and warm wash cloths to wipe your hands.
garlic noodles.author: Leanne G.
garlic noodles.review: Like many reviewers have already said, the crab is amazing here. The seafood dumplings are delicious, too. We also ordered the garlic noodles. Although they were good, the flavor was strong and over powered the delicate crab. Not sure I would order them again. I recommend having some nice appetizers and the focusing on the crab for your entree. The service was great - they paid attention to the details such as providing a bib and warm wash cloths to wipe your hands.

excerpts: The salad and garlic noodles are great too.
Make a reservation though no sitting area to wait.
garlic noodles.author: Don I.
garlic noodles.review: Always love the crab here..never been disappointed mmmm so yummy! The salad and garlic noodles are great too. Make a reservation though no sitting area to wait.

excerpts: We ordered the baked crab with the garlic noodles.
Which I would recommend both -- this was, by far, the best seafood I have had in this area.
The crab was meaty and the seasoning was spectacular.
My boyfriend
garlic noodles.author: Kyla G.
garlic noodles.review:
Okay.  From first glance it doesn't look like a place that you want to be eating seafood at.. don't be fooled.

When we got there, the inside was warm and cozy looking, and the staff was on top of things.

We ordered the baked crab with the garlic noodles. Which I would recommend both -- this was, by far, the best seafood I have had in this area.  The crab was meaty and the seasoning was spectacular.  My boyfriend and I had more fun cracking these crabs with our hands than any other fancy dinner.

We also ordered the mango seafood salad -- wonderful.  Along with the seafood dumplings -- another thing I would recommend.

All in all, this place was AMAZING.  I would recommend it to everyone and anyone.

excerpts: There is no competition when it comes to Thanh's crab and garlic noodles.
This is a one of a kind restaurant.
Thank you Thanh Long for the good food and the good times that my boyfriend and I have been able to share at your restaurant.
garlic noodles.author: Where's The Food B.
garlic noodles.review: We placed an order for takeout at Thanh's this past weekend for our 1 year anniversary. Thetakeout was just as good had we dined in at the restaurant. There is no competition when it comes to Thanh's crab and garlic noodles. This is a one of a kind restaurant. Thank you Thanh Long for the good food and the good times that my boyfriend and I have been able to share at your restaurant.

excerpts: Everyone told me the garlic noodles and the crab is a must..
I agree, so
my suggestion - it's a must!
The service was good but the food was better!
The shaking beef, seabass, pork was also delishhhhh...
MMM I must go back, MUST!!
garlic noodles.author: Monica S.
garlic noodles.review:
AMAZING! AMAZING!

I've wanted to try Thanh Long for the longest time but always forget it's there. This year decided I needed to review it - for my bday.. Everyone told me the garlic noodles and the crab is a must.. I agree, so my suggestion - it's a must! The service was good but the food was better! The shaking beef, seabass, pork was also delishhhhh... MMM I must go back, MUST!!

excerpts: Roast Vietnamese Pepper Crab, Garlic Noodles, and a White Wine - the best ever - consistently.
This is the original and definitive location for the dish among the Anh family empire.
garlic noodles.author: Mark Richard B.
garlic noodles.review: Roast Vietnamese Pepper Crab, Garlic Noodles, and a White Wine - the best ever - consistently. This is the original and definitive location for the dish among the Anh family empire.

excerpts: I cannot (and have no desire to) get past the garlic roast crab and garlic noodles.
It is such a treat, and consistently good.
garlic noodles.author: Linda M.
garlic noodles.review:
Normally, I like to try different things on a menu when I revisit a restaurant.  I cannot (and have no desire to) get past the garlic roast crab and garlic noodles.  It is such a treat, and consistently good.  I barely even glance at the menu when it arrives.

I like the more casual atmosphere as Thanh Long compared to her sister restaurant, Crustacean (which is better if you're looking for a romantic date restaurant but don't mind eating messy food that makes you reek of garlic.  Does that happen?).

Service is good but not excellent.  But the crab and noodles make it five stars.

excerpts: And one bite of those garlic noodles tell you that you probably just ingested a whole lot of saturated fat.. but you can't stop eating them.
Maybe all the food here is laced with crack?
garlic noodles.author: Henry W.
garlic noodles.review:
Since Thanh Long has opened I think the number of cardiac arrests have risen noticeably in SF. You look at that Garlic Butter soup that the crab is resting in and you know you probably shouldn't eat it.. but damn it smells so good and everyone is all ooh-aah'ing. And one bite of those garlic noodles tell you that you probably just ingested a whole lot of saturated fat.. but you can't stop eating them. Maybe all the food here is laced with crack? Its so darn addictive!

Food : 9/10
Service : 7/10
Ambience : 7/10

excerpts: The garlic noodles are perfect and NO they don't have a garlic sauce drenched over them.
These babies are sauteed with garlic instead of ruining the integrity of the fresh noodles.
This is seriously one of my favorite places for food...well crab and pasta.
garlic noodles.author: Michelle C.
garlic noodles.review:
All of the crab they offer here are great but my favorite is the black pepper crab. 

The garlic noodles are perfect and NO they don't have a garlic sauce drenched over them. These babies are sauteed with garlic instead of ruining the integrity of the fresh noodles. 
This is seriously one of my favorite places for food...well crab and pasta.

excerpts: Garlic Noodles, flavorful, almost overpowering but didn't, did it's job.
garlic noodles.author: Tom P.
garlic noodles.review:
Had the crab. Awesome. There was flavor in every bite of the crab and it was very meaty.

Garlic Noodles, flavorful, almost overpowering but didn't, did it's job.

Shaken Beef, it was okay, didn't like it as much as other reviews.

Eggplant/Chicken - very delicious

Sea Bass - great complimentary sauce for it

of course, a bit on the expensive side but worth it.

excerpts: So my party of 14 were seated upstairs in the larger area, everyone pretty much ordered the salt & pepper crab or tiger prawns and garlic noodles or rice.
I myself ordered the eggplant with prawns and chicken with a side of garlic noodles.
Can anyone tell me why all the crab and tiger prawn orders come out and people are chowing down and my plate is nowhere in sight?
I was furious, I asked to speak to the manager, who didn't come upstairs after 5 minutes of me waiting on him.
So I had to take it upon myself to go downstairs and asking him when and if my food was ever going to arrive.
garlic noodles.author: T.Domnic L.
garlic noodles.review:
The moment I never thought would happen, occurred on May 15, 2011at Thanh Long...HORRIFIC SERVICE.

Let's start with the way the bartender sized my friends and I up when we walked through the door at 5:30 p.m. Now I've been coming to Thanh Long since I was knee high to the crab boiling pan they have in the kitchen. That was a little annoying. Next up we asked about the Riesling by the glass and bottle, we opted for the bottle and had to inform the bartender to chill the remainder of the bottle while wait to be seated.

Inhale, exhale, I get over that. So my party of 14 were seated upstairs in the larger area, everyone pretty much ordered the salt & pepper crab or tiger prawns and garlic noodles or rice.

I myself ordered the eggplant with prawns and chicken with a side of garlic noodles.  Can anyone tell me why all the crab and tiger prawn orders come out and people are chowing down and my plate is nowhere in sight? I was furious, I asked to speak to the manager, who didn't come upstairs after 5 minutes of me waiting on him. So I had to take it upon myself to go downstairs and asking him when and if my food was ever going to arrive. At the rate service is my party will have completed their dinners before I receive mine.

10 minutes later they finally arrive with my plate and the manager says it's on him. Really, who else did he think was going to pay for my meal? In fact, I should've been given a comp to return for this horrendous service. 

Being that the gratuity was included with the bill our waiter's service was just plain God awful. 

This is hard economic times and when you go to Thanh Long you expect exceptional service. I was so annoyed I could not enjoy my meal.

excerpts: Get the crag,garlic noodles, shaken beef and Salt N Pepper Calimari.
garlic noodles.author: Ro M.
garlic noodles.review:
Great place when you wanna spend a little money and be a little fancy and have garlic on your breath and in your pores for at least 3 days.

It's a great place for a date or a birthday group outting.Get the crag,garlic noodles, shaken beef and Salt N Pepper Calimari.

Be prepared to find parking.It gets hard here sometimes.

excerpts: File this review under the "interesting" or "odd" folders at your discretion ... but I may be the only reviewer of Thanh Long who didn't have the crab or garlic noodles.
I relished every bite and look forward to returning to see about those crabs and garlic noodles.
garlic noodles.author: John Z.
garlic noodles.review:
File this review under the "interesting" or "odd" folders at your discretion ... but I may be the only reviewer of Thanh Long who didn't have the crab or garlic noodles. 

All the more reason to go back. The place is great, the meal the most memorable I've had in months.

To begin with: a full bar, which was nice for us martini-files. Began the meal with two starters:  the seafood dumplings and the shrimp toast. The dumplings: pleasant, light, delicate. More a tease than filling, but a nice tease.  The shrimp toast:  wow.  I've had countless versions as an former ny-er but this was a whole new trip. Lighter but still flavorful -- on slices of biegnet, a nice tip of the hat to the French influence of Vietnamese food.

Then the main meal: Shaken beef, tender and succulent in its not-too-sweet sauce with a surprisingly perfect compliment of potatoes. Spicy eggplant, just spicy/savory enough to let the eggplant shine through.  Seasonal vegetables: mostly sugar snap peas, lots of mushrooms, absolutely wonderful. Now mind you I don't like mushrooms as a rule but I would have been happy to scarf these down anytime. Garlic rice: just pungent enough, wonderfully textured and sticky, enhanced all the other dishes.

Yes a little on the pricey side... and valet service is ten bucks, not five (thankfully we got street parking). Service was gentle and professional.

I relished every bite and look forward to returning to see about those crabs and garlic noodles.

excerpts: On to the other dishes now,  the Garlic Noodles was so-so, it was tasty, but not all that as others have raved.
garlic noodles.author: Jennifer L.
garlic noodles.review:
My good friend kept telling me how delicious this restaurant is, and do I believe him?  YES, I do!  

However, please note that the Roast Crab deserves 5 stars.  The other dishes I ordered deserve a 4 star.  Also, since there was only 2 of us, we did not get to order a large variety as I would have liked.

What we ordered:

-Dungeness Crab Puffs
-Roast Crab
-Garlic Noodles
-Lemon Sorbet 
-Jasmine Tea

MUST-TRY!  The minute the Roast Crab came, it looked amazing.  My mouth started watering as I started to eat my first bite of the crab.  What seemed like the most simple of spices - salt, pepper, garlic, butter (of course I don't know the "secret  spices" haha), made the meat perfect, not overpowering in any spice.  It might be a challenge to crack the shell, but that's the fun of eating seafood!  

On to the other dishes now,  the Garlic Noodles was so-so, it was tasty, but not all that as others have raved.  The Dungeness Crab Puffs was good for a first try, but would not order again.  It actually tasted better without the accompanied sauce. For dessert, we tried the Lemon Sorbet, that was yummy, but I hope it really is homemade! Jasmine tea was a nice touch, but $5 for that was not worth it!

A plus for this restaurant is the customer service, all servers were attentive and provided good service.  There is even valet parking service, strange for me since I rarely see this in the Sunset neighborhood.

The only thing now is I need to go back again and try more dishes.  And, maybe it will get a 5 star.

excerpts: The garlic noodles really are amazing.
I came here with no expectations
and now I cant wait until I can go here again!
The best part is, its really not THAT expensive.
My girlfriend and I shared an appetizer, 2 drinks, 2 entrees, and a dessert.
We got out of there for under 80 bucks, and we had leftovers!
Pricier than I usually like
garlic noodles.author: Nelson S.
garlic noodles.review:
The garlic noodles really are amazing. I came here with no expectations and now I cant wait until I can go here again! The best part is, its really not THAT expensive. My girlfriend and I shared an appetizer, 2 drinks, 2 entrees, and a dessert. We got out of there for under 80 bucks, and we had leftovers! Pricier than I usually like but it was well worth it.

Great food, great ambiance, and great food!

excerpts: GARLIC NOODLES WHOOOO!~
The garlic noodles is a must have whenever I come here.
Last month, some girlfriends and I were being girly girls and went for pedicures.
Afterwards, my friend had a garlic noodle craving and immediately I thought of Thanh Long.
Thank goodness
garlic noodles.author: Jenny M.
garlic noodles.review:
GARLIC NOODLES WHOOOO!~

The garlic noodles is a must have whenever I come here. Last month, some girlfriends and I were being girly girls and went for pedicures. Afterwards, my friend had a garlic noodle craving and immediately I thought of Thanh Long. Thank goodness I made reservations, so wait time for us wasn't too long.

Aside from that, I love the mussels. It's very flavorful and buttery. Like most food though, it doesn't taste good when it gets cold.

stuffed squid - this one was interesting. it was like a meating wrapped in squid

tried some other dishes, but they weren't too memorable.
Friend who worked there treated us with cheesecake and ice cream. It was a great ending to a delishhh meal.

excerpts: The garlic noodles weren't that bad but the crabs?
garlic noodles.author: Glenn P.
garlic noodles.review:
I don't know why everyone is raving about this place.  I went here and found it to the the most over-hyped and over-priced place in the city.  The garlic noodles weren't that bad but the crabs?  Please!

This place is gonna cost you $$$$ and honestly it wasn't worth the money!

excerpts: Two of us shared a roast crab, garlic noodles, salmon carpaccio, some garlic toast (because i love carbs) and the chocolate molten cake.
the garlic noodles are perfect too.
You know how some places don't have that exact garlic flavor... this one is on point.
The salmon carpaccio was such a surprise! and a delight!
It blew our minds away how good it was.
It's kind of disgusting how we ate the chocolate molten cake
but everything was so good
we thought WHY THE HELL NOT!
AND IT WAS WORTH IT
TOO!
I will definitely order my own crab next time!
I could eat this for daysssss!
garlic noodles.author: Anna C.
garlic noodles.review:
YES. MMMM. MORE. 

LITERALLY THE ONLY WORDS/SOUNDS I MADE WHILE I WAS EATING.

Two of us shared a roast crab, garlic noodles, salmon carpaccio, some garlic toast (because i love carbs) and the chocolate molten cake. We most definitely finished every last bit of everything on our plate.  

The crab is just.. MMMMMMMMMM can't even describe. it's soooo good!!! the garlic noodles are perfect too.  You know how some places don't have that exact garlic flavor... this one is on point.  The salmon carpaccio was such a surprise! and a delight! It blew our minds away how good it was.  It's kind of disgusting how we ate the chocolate molten cake but everything was so good we thought WHY THE HELL NOT! AND IT WAS WORTH IT TOO!  I will definitely order my own crab next time! I could eat this for daysssss!

excerpts: but if you're in the mood for garlic roasted crab and garlic noodles, this is the place to go.
I have tried to make it myself (get your jumbo Dungeness crab from a local fisherman in Half Moon Bay!) and did quite well with the crab.... but the garlic noodles is one I can't seem to replicate.
It's the best and a "must order" with the garlic roasted crab.
Be prepared to have garlic oozing out of your pores through the next day!
garlic noodles.author: Agnes P.
garlic noodles.review: Pricey... but if you're in the mood for garlic roasted crab and garlic noodles, this is the place to go. I have tried to make it myself (get your jumbo Dungeness crab from a local fisherman in Half Moon Bay!) and did quite well with the crab.... but the garlic noodles is one I can't seem to replicate.  It's the best and a "must order" with the garlic roasted crab. Be prepared to have garlic oozing out of your pores through the next day!

excerpts: Their roasted crab and their garlic noodles!!
garlic noodles.author: Jenny K.
garlic noodles.review:
Oy, the two dishes I will rave about! Their roasted crab and their garlic noodles!! 

Get your own crab and be prepared to get your hands dirty. 

Mouthwash, toothpaste and floss will not help. Your breath will still smell the next day.


And I hear Danny Glover comes here occasionally with his wife.

excerpts: roasted crab and garlic noodles.
it's all you need to silence anyone.
i guarantee it.
and my boyfriend doesn't compliment any food place, so for him to make it a point to say the place was good
garlic noodles.author: Christine G.
garlic noodles.review:
BIG FAN!!!

I thought to myself how good can you really make a crab taste? And after all the hype from my family, my boyfriend, cousin, his girlfriend and I ventured out to Thanh Long.

roasted crab and garlic noodles. it's all you need to silence anyone. i guarantee it. and my boyfriend doesn't compliment any food place, so for him to make it a point to say the place was good says a lot.

i had some of the drunken crab which was good too. 

i also recommend the jasmine tea afterwards. it helps take off the edge from being full.

excerpts: The garlic noodles were also recommended to us by family.
One order is good for 3-4 ppl, but since I was with my two big brothers we ordered two.
I wasn't as crazy for the noodles probably because all my attention went to the crabs.
But as it is one of the signature dishes, you should try it.
garlic noodles.author: Melissa M.
garlic noodles.review:
You may experience trouble finding parking because there's only street parking, but the restaurant has a valet system if you are down to throw in an extra $10 plus tip. I say, park a block or two down and use that money for an appetizer, but that's just me.

I also strongly recommend that you phone in before you go, just to reduce your wait time. My brothers and I came on a Sunday night (8pm) and everyone who walked in after us had a 30 min wait time. Plus, there isn't much room in the waiting area besides a few chairs and the nearby bar. I do suppose that waiting helps build up your appetite because the restaurant is filled with its delicious aroma...

FOOD-
The reason we came was for the crab, which everyone has recommended. We tried both the roasted crab and the drunken crab. Hands down, we all preferred the roasted crab. Shoot, I'd even say forget the drunken crab, the roasted crab has way better flavors and seasonings! You can decide for yourself. The crabs were fat and juicy nonetheless. I'm Filipino, so for anyone who needs rice, be sure to order some to soak all the yummy juices and seasonings. You're gonna be licking your fingers! Oh and if you're wondering about the cost, the crab is at Market Price per pound.

The garlic noodles were also recommended to us by family. One order is good for 3-4 ppl, but since I was with my two big brothers we ordered two. I wasn't as crazy for the noodles probably because all my attention went to the crabs. But as it is one of the signature dishes, you should try it. If you were on a budget and had to pick between rice and noodles though, I'd honestly say go with rice.

33 beer is the perfect compliment to your crabs!

Lastly, we had the mussels and the calamari for appetizers. The calamari was lightly battered and really tasty. The mussels were exquisite!

Service was great. The waiters are always switching out the bowls for your empty shells. Also, at the end of your meal they give you hot towels for your hands, not to substitute you washing your hand but the hot towel helps with the crabby garlic smell on your hands.

HIGHLY RECOMMENDED! This is the perfect place to bring your family from out of town!

excerpts: Best garlic noodles ever.
Our party of 4 devoured 3 plates of these.
garlic noodles.author: Lubs Y.
garlic noodles.review:
Best garlic noodles ever. Our party of 4 devoured 3 plates of these. Along with an order of mussels, roasted crab, spicy eggplant, and saigon beef. And yet, some of us were still hungry for more!! 

Everything was delicious and I can't wait to come back!

Service was beyond exceptional...we arrived literally a minute before they stopped seating (9:45pm) and quickly put in our orders since we already decided what we had wanted on the drive up to SF from SJ. Our food came out within 10 minutes, which was perfect since we were all starving.

excerpts: I ordered the Roasted Garlic Crab with Garlic Noodles and I couldn't believe the flavors I tasted in both the crab and the noodles.
I would recommend this crab to persons with shell-fish allergies.
It's just that good.
garlic noodles.author: Sam Q.
garlic noodles.review: My evening at Thanh Long was amazing. I was skeptical from seeing the restaurant from the outside. NEVER judge a book by its cover. The restaurant was packed, and there were about 25 or so people waiting at the door. It is necessary to make reservations or you will wait a while. I had reservations and was seated within 5 minutes. I ordered the Roasted Garlic Crab with Garlic Noodles and I couldn't believe the flavors I tasted in both the crab and the noodles. I would recommend this crab to persons with shell-fish allergies. It's just that good.

excerpts: Went on a rainy cold day, hubby raved about their crab and garlic noodles.
We were one of the first ones to arrive, i noticed a sewerlike smell in the entrance area.
Went towards the back towards the kitchen, smell is gone.
garlic noodles.author: Mindee C.
garlic noodles.review:
Went on a rainy cold day, hubby raved about their crab and garlic noodles. We were one of the first ones to arrive, i noticed a sewerlike smell in the entrance area. Went towards the back towards the kitchen, smell is gone. So sit in the back if u can.

So selectively bad interior smell.
If u want to pay $33 for a garlicky fried chowmein noodles and four grilled tiger shrimp on top, order that. Fairly decent taste, but honestly i can name three other places that would charge way less for that treatment of shrimp. DRunken crab was decent, price was around $40.  And when I realized this place is the same owner as Crustacean in bev.hills, i knew why their mediocre vietnamese food was hyped up with price on steroids. I was offended there too when we saw the prices for the type of food we were served. But at least there, you occasionally had star sighting. Save your appetite for someplace good, we only eat three times a day.

excerpts: Had the famous crab and garlic noodles (just like every other person in the joint!).
It was so, so good!!!
What the heck do they put in those noodles???
Whatever it is...
damn, I love it!
Update:
Okay, so I couldn't get the garlic noodles out of my head and here's my solution
- I'm going to get my buddy to come with me and have him figure it out.
He's studying to be a chef and I figure it's a win-win situation here.
He'll get practice on figuring out ingredients
and I'll get the secret to what makes it so delicious!!!
garlic noodles.author: Lisa R.
garlic noodles.review:
Yay! Another tasty spot for Vietnamese food!!!! Too darn bad this place is like a freakin hour bus ride for me!

Had the famous crab and garlic noodles (just like every other person in the joint!). It was so, so good!!! What the heck do they put in those noodles??? Whatever it is...damn, I love it!

Update: Okay, so I couldn't get the garlic noodles out of my head and here's my solution - I'm going to get my buddy to come with me and have him figure it out. He's studying to be a chef and I figure it's a win-win situation here. He'll get practice on figuring out ingredients and I'll get the secret to what makes it so delicious!!!

excerpts: If I were on death row and I had to choose one last meal, it would be the Roast Crab and Garlic Noodles from Thanh Long.
Quite simply, it has been my absolute #1 favorite meal.
garlic noodles.author: Jose T.
garlic noodles.review:
If you are bothered by food that haunts your dreams, and gives you irresistible cravings, then Thanh Long isn't the place for you.

If I were on death row and I had to choose one last meal, it would be the Roast Crab and Garlic Noodles from Thanh Long.  Quite simply, it has been my absolute #1 favorite meal.  Nothing compares to it.  

Every single person I have recommended Thanh Long to has claimed to have their best dining experience there.  The food, especially the dishes named above and the Tiger Prawns are just undeniable.  

Eating here is worth every penny and much more.

excerpts: I also ordered the garlic noodles $10, it complements the crab very well.
Pretty much ordered a plate of garlic noodles, a whole crab, and drank water
(i'm under 21)
garlic noodles.author: Alex D.
garlic noodles.review:
Be willing to spend $60 for a dinner to remember. This place is a hidden gem in the city, but let me get straight to the point.

FOOD: Seafood is their forte, instantly feel in love with the peppered crab, it was at market price, so it depends on how much you'll be spending.  I also ordered the garlic noodles $10, it complements the crab very well. Pretty much ordered a plate of garlic noodles, a whole crab, and drank water (i'm under 21) They do serve alcohol.

Service: Our food was served pretty fast. Our waiter looked like Mayer Hawthorne, haha. The service was calm and friendly.


Parking: Valet is $10, you can park anywhere for free, but you know how SF is.

excerpts: We ordered the salt & pepper calamari, crabs and garlic noodles.
We had fried banana and fried ice cream for deserts.
Overall, the food was excellent.
Great place.
garlic noodles.author: Truong P.
garlic noodles.review:
We ordered the salt & pepper calamari, crabs and garlic noodles.  We had fried banana and fried ice cream for deserts.  Overall, the food was excellent.  Great place.  A little over priced Vietnamese food though.  

I have  been to many Vietnamese restaurants and this place was definitely expensive,  considering the location that's in.  

 Otherwise I would give this place a higher rating.

excerpts: Shaken beef, dungeonous crab, and garlic noodles are some of the things you'll be seeing on the menu.
garlic noodles.author: Linh P.
garlic noodles.review:
Thanh Long is one of my FAVORITE restaurants. Although I admit, it is a bit pricey, the quality of the food and the excellent service keeps me coming back. 

Even though the restaurant's name clearly shows that its a Vietnamese restaurant, I have to say, the food isn't quite Vietnamese. Its more Vietnamese fusion, or Vietnamese inspired. They do not serve Pho or Bun or anything like that. Shaken beef, dungeonous crab, and garlic noodles are some of the things you'll be seeing on the menu. 

The food is REALLY good, but the service that you'll be getting is TO DIE FOR. I am very picky about restaurant service, especially if I'm paying for a $100+ meal. But with this kind of service, it makes me not feel so bad spending so much money on some food. 

If youre looking for some place to take your date, or just feel like eating a nice dinner, you definately should eat here. Its casual dresss, so you dont have to worry about looking all fancy, theres a full bar, and the food is amazing. 5 stars from me.

excerpts: Ordered one roast crab, one drunken crab, garlic noodles.
So excited to eat fresh Dungeness.
Except that, it wasn't very fresh.
Both crabs had that faint ammonia taste -- like they'd been sitting around for a couple of days, or maybe they'd been frozen?
Whatever the reason, this was NOT fresh crab.
Service was good, price was a little high, but not terrible.
But not fresh?
At a place renowned for crab?
I would never go here again.
garlic noodles.author: Nancy S.
garlic noodles.review: We went to Thanh Long 3 days into Dungeness Crab season in SF.  It has great reviews on crab.  We were seated right away -- last table, so we were grateful.  Ordered one roast crab, one drunken crab, garlic noodles.  So excited to eat fresh Dungeness.  Except that, it wasn't very fresh.  Both crabs had that faint ammonia taste -- like they'd been sitting around for a couple of days, or maybe they'd been frozen?  Whatever the reason, this was NOT fresh crab.  Service was good, price was a little high, but not terrible.  But not fresh?  At a place renowned for crab?  I would never go here again.

excerpts: Garlic noodles were really good as well.
The service was great and I didn't have to wait too long for my food.
garlic noodles.author: Angel P.
garlic noodles.review: Best roasted garlic crab I've ever had! Garlic noodles were really good as well. The service was great and I didn't have to wait too long for my food.

excerpts: Garlic noodles were very tasty as well.
We tried the sea bass and that turned out to be a little dry.
But their calamari appetizer is very unique and worth a try!
garlic noodles.author: Wilson W.
garlic noodles.review: The roast crab and drunken crab were great! Garlic noodles were very tasty as well. We tried the sea bass and that turned out to be a little dry. But their calamari appetizer is very unique and worth a try!

excerpts: everyone in the restaurant was eating two things: roasted crab and garlic noodles.
given that it was just after xmas
, i thought we should eat salad ... bad plan.
garlic noodles.author: alinna s.
garlic noodles.review:
we heard about this place via check please, bay area so we went for our anniversary dinner.  it is the fanciest vietnamese restaurant i have ever been to and the waitstaff was great.  make a res -- the line is long but DAMN, they can turn tables here.

everyone in the restaurant was eating two things: roasted crab and garlic noodles.  given that it was just after xmas, i thought we should eat salad ... bad plan.  they didn't have the mango salad and the regular salad was bleah.  i will say they did not skimp on the shrimp, which was fresh, but it didn't taste like anything.

the salt and pepper calamari appetizer was the best for me.  it was salty, crispy and most excellent with lots of lemon.

as for the famed roast crab and noodles ... LET. DOWN.  it's gd crab season in california, so i cannot fathom why our crab, while large, WAS. NOT. FRESH.  i have eaten a crapton of crab in my life as a good chinese person do, and this crab had clearly been dead for some time and no amount of delicious seasoning can hide that.  as for the noodles, if you like your noodles sweet (my japanese husband did), then maybe you will be okay.  they certainly give you a lot of it for $9.95. for me, it was way too sweet and way overcooked.  i tried to save it by dipping it into the crab seasoning.  

overall, it was meh.  the portion sizes are good, but the dead crab didn't do it for me.  if it's $41.95 (it's a market price dish) at the height of dungeness crab season, i cannot stand the idea of paying God knows how much in july.  a nice experience, but i wouldn't escape 3 babies and drive an hour into the city for this.

excerpts: And the garlic noodles are to die for.
garlic noodles.author: T H.
garlic noodles.review:
When it comes to crab, I'm really spoiled.  Not only does my dad make the BEST crab ever, he cracks and peels it for me...not so much now that I'm a grown-up, but it's hard to beat homemade crab. So I've never been much of a restaurant crab fan. But I love the crab at Thanh Long...it's tasty and relatively painless to crack and peel.

And the garlic noodles are to die for.

That's pretty much all that you need to know.

excerpts: I recommend the garlic noodles and you can't go wrong with the mussels.
The mussels have a very nice flavor and are nested under a buttery piece of bread which makes for a flavorful combination.
garlic noodles.author: Eric A.
garlic noodles.review: I recommend the garlic noodles and you can't go wrong with the mussels. The mussels have a very nice flavor and are nested under a buttery piece of bread which makes for a flavorful combination.

excerpts: The place was nearby and it had crabs and garlic noodles, so we gave it a try.
- Garlic Noodles, first time eating such delicious garlic noodle!
I wonder if they do take-outs?
If they do, I think I would drop by from time to time and just get this to go!!!
garlic noodles.author: Gordon L.
garlic noodles.review:
Yelp have done it again! Great recommendation!

Came here after doing a search around my neighborhood. The place was nearby and it had crabs and garlic noodles, so we gave it a try.

Finding the place wasn't hard, but looking for a parking spot is another story! I saw them offering valet parking for $10, but I didn't think it was worth it. Found a spot (lucky) after 5 mins of circling around. Went in and the place was PACKED! They told us that we might have to wait about 30-40 mins... I was tired so I waited. 15 minutes later we got a table (lucky x2!)

Foods that we ordered:
- Grilled Calamari for starter - pretty tasty and good. A good dish to start off with. In fact, most of their starters looks good too.
- Roasted Crab (originally I planned to order the drunken crab, but the waiter asked if this was my first time here or not and told us that people recommended the roasted crab over the drunken crab). The crab was delicious, huge, and good for both my girlfriend and I. (GF is a small eater, so probably you might wanna order 1 crab per person). However, I did find it a bit dry.
- Garlic Noodles, first time eating such delicious garlic noodle! I wonder if they do take-outs? If they do, I think I would drop by from time to time and just get this to go!!! YUMMMM!!

The price was on the expensive side! My total came around 70ish to 80? I forgot... but it was well worth it in my opinion.

SUMMARY:
Pros - great food, cosy atmosphere, and some nice services!
Cons - hard to find parking, might need to make reservation since it is a small place, packed (our table were very close to the other customers), and expensive.

5 STARS in my book!

excerpts: the garlic noodles, the fried rice, the garlic bread, THE CRAB and the shank beef !
The service was the absolute best part we were in and out in about 45 minutes.
They were fast and very friendly.
Even the drinks were great.
For all my non drinkers ( like me ) you have to try their strawberry daiquiri !!
I can't say enough about them WOW !!
garlic noodles.author: Dessiray R.
garlic noodles.review: I went there for the first time last night and OMG everything we had was DELICIOUS !!....the garlic noodles, the fried rice, the garlic bread, THE CRAB and the shank beef ! The service was the absolute best part we were in and out in about 45 minutes. They were fast and very friendly. Even the drinks were great. For all my non drinkers ( like me ) you have to try their strawberry daiquiri !! I can't say enough about them WOW !!

excerpts: I got the garlic butter crab, and the garlic noodles.
The garlic noodles are a MUST.
It's sooo good, and it's a lot better than PPQ's garlic noodles.
The crab was too much for me...
I probably should have shared.
garlic noodles.author: Diane L.
garlic noodles.review:
I only came here because my friend offered to pay for me, otherwise I would never be able to pay for my meal.  A crab alone is $40.  I got the garlic butter crab, and the garlic noodles.  The garlic noodles are a MUST.  It's sooo good, and it's a lot better than PPQ's garlic noodles.  The crab was too much for me... I probably should have shared.  The garlic butter taste gets really old after a while, and not to mention it solidifies pretty fast.  

Overall, the restaurant is really nice, fancy and modern.  The service was great, and the food was really good.  We waited for about an hour to get seated... the place is really packed!  But if you're reallytight on money, go to PPQ in the Richmond if you want crab... its a lot cheaper.

excerpts: But sorry about the crab too because when I tasted the garlic noodles ...
And sorry about you, the one who I shared the crab with, as you didn't have enough patient to take out as much meat as you can and mixed it with the garlic noodles.
Because the crab is amazing but crabs are born tasting good already.
And ok, I admit roasted in this way with the secret sauce makes them much better.
But the noodles, that is all Thanh Long's work, and are incredible in texture, al dente and a bit chewy too.
And flavor; juicy, comfortably greasy and very tasty.
Add some crab meat.
garlic noodles.author: Laura A.
garlic noodles.review:
I am really sorry

About that baby. Crying inconsolably because his parents was too focus devouring their crab that I wonder if they were even listening to him. 

About the old lady; logically rejected after offering herself to take care of the baby once the mum finally clean her hands and carry him until he stops crying. This old lady already knew how good and addictive is eating those crabs. She had good intentions, she understood.

About the Dungeness crab in the Bay Area. This poor things finish their life as stars in a runway one after another over a plate carried by the servers; continuously, like in a sad crab march. Roasted, garlic-ted, buttered, spici-ted and too delicious to be pro-crab.  And also because they must be confuse about what Green dragons means, or the corresponding Vietnamese words, Thanh Long, as I bet one of the first things this crabs learn is to be afraid of them when is in fact they are a symbol of Good Luck and the reason for the owner to keep this name after a typing mistake, as she thought it was a good omen, instead the original Thang Long (in honor to Vietnam's first capital city)
 
Really sorry for myself, as crustaceans are not my favorite seafood to eat. But also because its a fact that they taste naturally good without any addition other than salt in the boiling water. And roast them with garlic and 5 spices sauce sounded like a crime to me. And also because messiness wearing white clothes sounded like a crime as well. And even more. A multi-million dollar restaurant empire, was uninviting too as superstars can be disappointing sometimes. And because to pray for a table would have decide me to turn back automatically. 

But I didn't .. And I'm so sorry .. I think? ..  about how much I enjoyed the crab. 

But sorry about the crab too because when I tasted the garlic noodles ...  I had a favorite already

And sorry about you, the one who I shared the crab with, as you didn't have enough patient to take out as much meat as you can and mixed it with the garlic noodles. Because the crab is amazing but crabs are born tasting good already. And ok, I admit roasted in this way with the secret sauce makes them much better. But the noodles, that is all Thanh Long's work, and are incredible in texture, al dente and a bit chewy too. And flavor; juicy, comfortably greasy and very tasty. Add some crab meat. An improvement of what already taste incredible.

I'm also sorry about the rest of the menu since the crabs and the noodles are everywhere. I'd love to go with a group as looks like is the only way to try more items. We still ordered the salt and pepper calamari. Very good. Lightly battered, soft texture but firm too with a hit of black pepper. 

And I am also sorry.. very very much.. as we couldn't avoid to order their Fried ice cream. A huge ball of warm, tasty, soft and light dough filled with a cold ball of creamy vanilla ice cream. Sorry because this was already too much food. But more sorry because I had space for just 2 bites. 

But If I am really sorry. Really.. is about all of you that haven't taste this crabs and the noodles, yet.

excerpts: I ALWAYS order Roasted Crab, Garlic Noodles and Salt and Pepper Calamari.
garlic noodles.author: WS P.
garlic noodles.review:
My favorite place for crab. I ALWAYS order Roasted Crab, Garlic Noodles and Salt and Pepper Calamari. Mango Salad is amazing, too. Warm saute mango chunks, shrimp, scallop and shallot on fresh greens... Yam...

Their steam Chilean Sea Bass is great, too. 

For dessert, I love the orange sorbet. A light dessert is a perfect end note for a buttery meal in this place. 

This is the restaurant I bring all my out-of-town guests to. :)

excerpts: Garlic noodles -- tasty but a little too overpoweringly garlicy
garlic noodles.author: Ashley C.
garlic noodles.review:
OK YELPERS.

i know this place got a lot of hype and because I'm vietnamese people always ask me if i've eaten here. 

So i guess i had to...

The servers are not vietnamese. hahaha. 

Obviously they try to make this place very "americanized"

Located in a primarily neighborhood area. 

The food is pretty delicious:

Dungeness blue crab wonton thingies -- i forgot what it was called but it's pretty much "crab rang goon". Crab and cream cheese in a deep fried wonton wrap. You get like 4 pieces for 10 bucks. I understand that it's probably because of the crab....I'll just say this: my mom makes better ones. NOT worth the $$$. It's good if you've never tried it, but if you have you know it's not worth it. 

Garlic noodles -- tasty but a little too overpoweringly garlicy 

Bo luc lac -- steak cubes. average.

Roasted crab is something I give props to...

Good place to go if you wanna be fancy and bruise your wallet. 

Def. can find places of similar caliber but for cheaper. 

You won't see me leading the check-ins here .

excerpts: Roasted crab and garlic noodles.
The garlic noodles are amazing.
garlic noodles.author: Anh D.
garlic noodles.review:
Roasted crab and garlic noodles. 

The garlic noodles are amazing. The sauce on them is something miraculous -- very salty and savory (defines quintessential umami). 

Crab is their specialty. You want to try a crab dish when you're here. They only have three kinds of crab: Drunken crab (white wine sauce/cooking liquid), tamarind crab, and roasted crab (We've tried both the tamarind crab and the roasted crab (butter and garlic sauce). 

The tamarind crab was okay, but the tamarind sauce was good but so overpowering compared to the delicate taste of the crab meat. You can't even taste the crab with the tamarind sauce laced throughout this dish. It is so tangy, sweet, and sour. It was good for the first few bites, but I couldn't eat much  of this. 

The roasted crab, however, was divine. Garlic and butter -- what could be better? Not much more to be said than that. The crab meat was very light and tasted fresh. Very rich, though, from the butter and garlic so definitely not something to eat too regularly. 

We also tried the shaken beef dish, and it was pretty delicious as well. Very tender, juicy, and well-seasoned beef. Juiciness/tenderness is often a factor that goes wrong in this dish at many restaurants, because if you pan-saute small cubes of meat, they often get dry and stringy. No such problem here! If you have any people in your company who don't like crab or seafood, there are many options, including the shaken beef, available for delicious dining besides crab. 

The calamari appetizer is something else that we've had here, and it's delicious as well. 

Great food, okay prices (crab dishes are all "market price"), and a great spot in the city. You will have to get valet parking unless you want to walk a couple blocks, so bring cash!

excerpts: Garlic Noodles
: I know everyone says they love the garlic noodles but people,  you have to admit they are sometimes a bit gummy and starchy.

Tastes exactly like it sounds and made sugarlump happy as a clam

Next time I'll stick to the calamari, crab, garlic noodles, and watch sugarlump eat dessert while I sip a digestif from my flask.
garlic noodles.author: Coco M.
garlic noodles.review:
Thanh long is a fun joint and satisfies my carb and roasted crab cravings. My sugarlump and I went there recently after giving the pups some serious play-time at the beach.

Sugarlump enjoyed a couple of glasses of wine. I really wanted a lychee martini (like I always get at Crustacean) which they made for me but lacked the skewered lychees aaaaaaand the alcohol :( Too bad... 
I exchanged it for a martini which wasn't half bad.

We enjoyed:

Salt & Pepper Calamari: Surprisingly good and comes tossed with spring onions which gives a hit of onion with an herbacious aftertaste

Roasted Crab: I can't hate on this dish even if it comes swimming in nectar. That's right, it's not butter, it's NECTAR.

Garlic Noodles: I know everyone says they love the garlic noodles but people,  you have to admit they are sometimes a bit gummy and starchy. Still, I always enjoy a serving with the crab.

Shaking Beef: Good not great, just good. The beef was tender but the potatoes were so charred they were unrecognizable. I'll keep enjoying this dish at Slanted Door.

Fried Banana w/ ice cream: Tastes exactly like it sounds and made sugarlump happy as a clam

Next time I'll stick to the calamari, crab, garlic noodles, and watch sugarlump eat dessert while I sip a digestif from my flask.

excerpts: We had a couple crabs, some garlic noodles and the shaken beef.
garlic noodles.author: Ryan B.
garlic noodles.review:
