I was visiting family for the week. They are new to the area and it was my first time in the city. We found Thanh Long on Yelp and went for it since it was nearby. We had a couple crabs, some garlic noodles and the shaken beef. It was all great!

I recommend it and will be a returning customer the next time I'm in the city.

excerpts: Garlic Noodles
garlic noodles.author: Beth W.
garlic noodles.review:
We came here for a special family celebration and it was our first time dining here as well.

The food ordered for our dinner comprised of the following:

1. Salt & Pepper Calamari - delicious except for the simple overdose of coarsely ground black pepper; will definitely tell them next time to adjust the black pepper with a lighter touch

2. Mango Salad - fresh mango fruit sauteed with bell peppers, seared scallops & shrimp over mixed greens in a raspberry vinaigrette - this would make for an excellent  meal on it's own; the raspberry vinaigrette nicely tied the various flavors together effortlessly

3. Thanh Long Spicy Eggplant - eggplant sauteed with jumbo prawns, chicken, fresh basil, baby corn, shitake mushrooms, & red chilies in a tamarind & chili-soya; I like spicy but it was on the low end of the spicy spectrum on this dinner outing though the overall flavors were good ~ will order it again but tell the server to make it spicier

4. Villager's Favorite - Pacific prawns & pork medallions simmered in a caramelized reduction of soy and herbs; I liked this dish enough that I would order it again; a nice take on a "surf and turf" with pork instead of beef for the "turf" portion

5. Shaken Beef - tender cubes of marinated New York steak flambeed in Chardonnay served with potatoes, mixed greens & cherry tomatoes; delicious in flavor with fork tender beef; the greens I could do without as it seemed more a "salad" than an entree

6. Vegetarian Delight - silken tofu sauteed with asst. vegetables & shitake mushrooms; a standout as I love tofu and veggies!

7. Roast Crab - a whole Dungeness crab roasted with An's garlic sauce & secret spices in the Secret Kitchen; regardless of what others may say, this in of itself is a delectable Dungeness crab entree!  Yes it's messy but who cares?  The flavors marry very well and our entire party enjoyed this dish.

8. Garlic Noodles - An's famous noodles made with their secret garlic sauce (perhaps the one used on the Roast Crab?) & secret spices; this noodle dish is good when hot but at room temperature or worse, cold, it's not that good (something coagulates on the noodles when it's cold...butter perhaps?)

Despite the large amounts ordered per item, we had lots of left overs (crab included) for our party of 18.  Would I go back to this spot?  You betcha!  I want to try the Tamarind Crab - "simmered in a melange of Roma tomatoes & tamarind, seasoned with fresh dill & green onions & flambeed with cognac."  The ingredients for this dish make me salivate just thinking about it.

There is a full bar in case you want a drink while you wait and/or with your meal.  Two of us ordered the Fleur de Mango - pureed fresh mango, Malibu rum, a banana rum and freshly squeezed orange juice to the mix - this was the fave drink of the evening!  
 
While parking is an issue, it's located in a neighborhood folks, get there early so that you can look for parking or just valet your car.  I would also suggest booking a reservation so that you are amongst the first seating for the evening.  Overall, the service was excellent/attentive and the food was delicious.

The name of this restaurant came about due to an error at the printer's.  It was supposed to be "Thang Long" meaning "Ascending Dragon" and also Vietnam's first capital city.  As "Thanh Long" it means "Green Dragon" ~ green representing happiness and prosperity while the dragon symbol is an ancient symbol of good luck.  I would say the An Family has enjoyed this for many years serving a legion of happy customers ~ myself being a newly minted one!

Note - The An Family also owns the Crustacean group of restaurants with a Palo Alto opening targeted for this September 2010.  I can't wait till this spot opens up!

excerpts: We did however share an order of the garlic noodles and seasonal vegetables.
I've never tried anything else here, but the crab, noodle, veggie combination is pretty much the definition of perfection!
garlic noodles.author: Julie C.
garlic noodles.review: My fiancé is obsessed with the roast crab here!  I usually can only eat half of it, but we each end up ordering our own - since he refuses to share!  We did however share an order of the garlic noodles and seasonal vegetables.  I've never tried anything else here, but the crab, noodle, veggie combination is pretty much the definition of perfection!

excerpts: We always get the tempura shrimp as an appetizer, we each get a roasted crab (I usually eat a little more than half of it and the boyfriend finishes the rest) and we share a plate of garlic noodles but when we are really starving we get two plates.
The tempura shrimp are some of the best I've ever eaten, the crab melts-in-your-mouth and the garlic noodles are just that,
garlic noodles but something about them are so good and very addicting!
garlic noodles.author: Katie J.
garlic noodles.review:
I love Thanh Long! I refuse to eat crab anywhere else (Well, that's a lie, I'll eat it elsewhere but I never enjoy it as much as I do when I am at Thanh Long!) 

We always get the tempura shrimp as an appetizer, we each get a roasted crab (I usually eat a little more than half of it and the boyfriend finishes the rest) and we share a plate of garlic noodles but when we are really starving we get two plates. The tempura shrimp are some of the best I've ever eaten, the crab melts-in-your-mouth and the garlic noodles are just that, garlic noodles but something about them are so good and very addicting! 

This definitely is not a first date restaurant, unless your comfortable enough to wear a bib and get down and dirrty ;) I know some people say go dressy but I see a lot of guys wearing white tees, jeans and Jordan's and some of the ladies are very casual too. We usually go in whatever we are wearing that day unless it's a special occasion then we like to dress it up a bit.

excerpts: The garlic noodles are great, but I had better at the Oakland street cart festival (those were so good and were not as greasy as Thanh's).
garlic noodles.author: Tif L.
garlic noodles.review:
I have been eating here multiple times so I am not sure if my expectations are just harder to meet but this place is good but overpriced. The garlic noodles are great, but I had better at the Oakland street cart festival (those were so good and were not as greasy as Thanh's). Service this time was meh and slow. 

I do recommend trying the beef cube dish (can't remember the exact name) as it is good and it helps fill you up since the crab doesn't (unless you want to spend another $35-40 for another crab).

excerpts: We only got take out garlic noodles but they were so very good.
They were not overly wet, they we're a  little on the dry side, stick and contained fresh garlic.
They were probably the best I have ever had.
The only reason that I gave them 4 stars instead of 5 was that we stopped by after leaving g the beach and we didn't want to dine in because we all were full of sand.
I went in and asked if I could take a menus outside to my party that was waiting in the car and they refused.
As a result we cut our order short and just ordered the noodles.
garlic noodles.author: Ramin P.
garlic noodles.review: We only got take out garlic noodles but they were so very good. They were not overly wet, they we're a  little on the dry side, stick and contained fresh garlic. They were probably the best I have ever had. The only reason that I gave them 4 stars instead of 5 was that we stopped by after leaving g the beach and we didn't want to dine in because we all were full of sand. I went in and asked if I could take a menus outside to my party that was waiting in the car and they refused. As a result we cut our order short and just ordered the noodles.

excerpts: We also ordered two garlic noodles to share ($11 each).
Honestly the noodles arn't anything to write about, even though it's one of things they are famous for.
A little dry, not a ton of garlic flavor, but
then again if you mix it with any of the dishes it seems to come alive.
The Garlic Crab we passed over, $48 for one maybe 2 pound crab, no thanks, couldn't even smell garlic when 10 of them passed by (-1 star).
garlic noodles.author: Jared P.
garlic noodles.review: Thanh Long has a great reputation, and deservedly so. My family and I recently went for Father's day. It was BUSY, I assume any holiday you want to get there early and definitely have a reservation. We got there at 5:30 and by 5:40pm when we were seated (with reservations for 6) the waiting area/bar was packed to unmovable. We were seated promptly and we had the cocktails we ordered in about 5 minutes, for 4 people that's pretty good when they are slammed. I had an Ohio Punch, this drink is like a fruit punch long island iced tea, delicious and you'll be set for the whole meal, I debated having another sincerely since it was apparently strong, good price at $8. We also ordered two garlic noodles to share ($11 each). Honestly the noodles arn't anything to write about, even though it's one of things they are famous for. A little dry, not a ton of garlic flavor, but then again if you mix it with any of the dishes it seems to come alive. The Garlic Crab we passed over, $48 for one maybe 2 pound crab, no thanks, couldn't even smell garlic when 10 of them passed by (-1 star). I ordered the Saigon Beef, it was unassuming, and amazing. The dish looked like large tater tots of beef sitting on a salad with dressing. Anything but, the savory beef roll-ups were stuffed with prosciutto and swiss cheese, cooked medium rare, and smothered in a sauce that tasted like a peppery vinaigrette. It was warm and went with the mixed salad greens surprisingly well, I would order this again, big portion too. For dessert we had their Creme Brulee to share. It was out in less than 5 minutes, golden brown, crisp top, and so creamy, it was delicious. The atmosphere was great, from the outside you think it's just a hole in the wall place, but it opens up into the huge two story restaurant that is wonderfully set up to be sound dampening. I would go back, but not for what they are famous for, just for basically everything else.

excerpts: Service was very impersonal but the roasted crab and garlic noodles were worth taking the abuse =)
may be it was just our server that night.
garlic noodles.author: DANIEL T.
garlic noodles.review: Service was very impersonal but the roasted crab and garlic noodles were worth taking the abuse =) may be it was just our server that night.

excerpts: so we decided to order 4 king crabs and some garlic noodles to accompany the crabs.
We went simple with our order.
What makes things even better was the garlic noodles.
They're SO GOOD.
I think I had like two plates of the garlic noodles to myself!
I ate so much food.
There's also a bunch of crab fat in the head.
Just writing this review is getting me hungry.
I think my next trip would consist of roast crab, garlic noodles, and sapporo beer.
Keep it simple.
garlic noodles.author: Christian M.
garlic noodles.review:
THE VERY BEST CRAB PLACE THAT I'VE TASTED.

There's a statement for ya off the bat, eh?  My pareng Jimmy kept telling me about this place called Thanh Long that had amazing crabs that were decked out in a nice garlic pepper sauce.  I've heard about this place for months now.  Being from San Diego, it took awhile to try it but it was definitely worth the wait.

The place seems like a hole in the wall from the outside.  The location isn't the prettiest in the world so it made me kind of skeptical of the place.  I walked in and saw a BUSY environment filled with people waiting at the door step.  We had reservations so we got seated fairly quickly.  

There's a full menu of things to order but we went simple and went straight for the crab.  At first we decided to go with some appetizers so we started off with the cheese wontons.  They're decent.  I'm not sure I'd recommend getting them.  I'd probably say just wait for the main course.  The crabs are HUGE.  We were a party of 7 so we decided to order 4 king crabs and some garlic noodles to accompany the crabs.  We went simple with our order.  We ordered two of the drunken crabs and two of the "roast' ones that featured a nice peppered garlic sauce on it.

We got our order after about 15 minutes.  Not too shabby.  Good food takes awhile so I wasn't really concerned with the timing.  I took one bite of the roast crab.  WOW.  The peppered garlic sauce is AMAZING.  I don't think I've ever tried crab THAT GOOD.  I broke off a couple of legs and began digging in.  I dipped the crab meat into the garlic sauce and felt heaven after each bite.  What makes things even better was the garlic noodles.  They're SO GOOD.  I think I had like two plates of the garlic noodles to myself!  I ate so much food.  There's also a bunch of crab fat in the head.  Just writing this review is getting me hungry.  Unfortunately, I'm back in San Diego!!!

I also tried the drunken crab.  It's alright.  I don't think I would order it again though.  I think my next trip would consist of roast crab, garlic noodles, and sapporo beer.  Keep it simple.  I'd recommend this place to anyone and EVERYONE.  

If you are in the LA area, I believe the owner of Thanh Long also owns CRUSTACEAN.  I think it's a upper scale version of Thanh Long.  Same food but higher prices.  At least there's an option in Southern Cal.  Awesome food!

excerpts: The delicious items we chose for our meal were the drunken crab, dungeness crab puffs, buddha roll, shaken beef, and of course their famous garlic noodles.
After tasting garlic we definitely wanted dessert and settled for their creme brulee which was very rich but satisfied our sweet tooth.
garlic noodles.author: Emy B.
garlic noodles.review:
I likey!  The food here is very yummy.  If you like crab this is the place to come have it, and be prepared to work at getting all the succulent meat out of the shells.  The delicious items we chose for our meal were the drunken crab, dungeness crab puffs, buddha roll, shaken beef, and of course their famous garlic noodles.  After tasting garlic we definitely wanted dessert and settled for their creme brulee which was very rich but satisfied our sweet tooth.  Next time we'll have to order their fried banana dessert with ice cream which we kept staring at on the other tables.

Parking is not easy to find, but they offer valet service for $10 if you get impatient.  Will definitely be back...yee!  If you're curious check out their website at anfamily.com, click on Thanh Long and download the menu.

excerpts: In fact everything we ordered was lovely ~ the fried calamari, claypot, garlic noodles...
garlic noodles.author: Cathy K.
garlic noodles.review:
I didn't realize this treasure existed in my front yard!

I've lived up the hill from this restaurant for years, and hadn't felt compelled to roll down to try it, namely since I'm a bit squeamish about eating anything that looks like the living thing.

I recently had family in town, and her friends suggested T.L. So off we went, and delighted we did.  I was surprised by how spacious this innocuous eatery is inside.  It seemed to keep going...we were lead upstairs into another room, which we were told is open on the weekends.  

Our server was super patient and accommodating considering we had 3 tots in tow.  She gave us options for the wee ones to dine on.  I even busted out the cracker and tried a couple of the crab legs.  Mmmm....tasty.  In fact everything we ordered was lovely ~ the fried calamari, claypot, garlic noodles...I especially enjoyed the spicy eggplant.

It's a bit surreal to see valet parking available in the Outer Sunset, but hey, anything that keeps folks coming out to this treasure in the fog (a.k.a Outer Sunset) is fine with me.

excerpts: I guess what reminded me back of this place is the garlic noodles..
now I just went to Perilla in the inner sunset .. where the garlic noodles were.. eh .. so
so..
but..
I did remember that the garlic noodles at Thanh Long were so so much better.
The crab isn't the only thing
this place cooks
well.. the other dishes were pretty tasty as well..

just right
Catch in citrus - very fresh tasting and delicious
garlic noodles - YUM!
Will get 2 orders next time
garlic noodles.author: Margie C.
garlic noodles.review:
This place is a busy place out in the outer sunset, known for their crabs but didn't feel like having crabs that day (I guess I was feeling lazy)...so tried some other items. ..I guess what reminded me back of this place is the garlic noodles.. now I just went to Perilla in the inner sunset .. where the garlic noodles were.. eh .. so so.. but..  I did remember that the garlic noodles at Thanh Long were so so much better.  The crab isn't the only thing this place cooks well.. the other dishes were pretty tasty as well..  next time I'll try the crab though.. 

The salt/pepper calamari - crispy / just right
Catch in citrus - very fresh tasting and delicious
garlic noodles - YUM!  Will get 2 orders next time

excerpts: We have roasted crab and garlic noodles.
The noodles would have been better with shrimp added.
Also had banana cake with chocolate syrup.
Would've given 5 stars except the waitress forgot to have the whip cream removed as I has asked.
garlic noodles.author: Akiba G.
garlic noodles.review: Food was great!  We have roasted crab and garlic noodles. The noodles would have been better with shrimp added. Also had banana cake with chocolate syrup. Would've given 5 stars except the waitress forgot to have the whip cream removed as I has asked.

excerpts: Definitely try everything on the menu not just their crab and garlic noodles.
Everything on their menu is really good.
I recommend that you make reservations or come there right when it opens.
garlic noodles.author: Regina W.
garlic noodles.review: I have been coming here since 2003. The first time I went here I was hooked. I have been to their other restaurant Crustaceans but this for some reason was better. The atmosphere was different and more warm at least in my perception. Definitely try everything on the menu not just their crab and garlic noodles. Everything on their menu is really good. I recommend that you make reservations or come there right when it opens.

excerpts: On the 4th day, God created Roasted Dungeness Crab and garlic noodles.
garlic noodles.author: L T.
garlic noodles.review:
On the 4th day, God created Roasted Dungeness Crab and garlic noodles. The end.

PS. God would frown on charging fountain drinks by the glass, small glasses.

excerpts: the garlic noodles... so delish!
I personally think it's better here than at crustacean's.
it's a lot less greasy too.
service is also a noticeable difference between the two.
one star has been taken away because parking sucks.
and yes, I dislike valeting my car
but you don't have many options when you dine here.
garlic noodles.author: Ann T.
garlic noodles.review: the garlic noodles... so delish! I personally think it's better here than at crustacean's. it's a lot less greasy too. service is also a noticeable difference between the two. one star has been taken away because parking sucks. and yes, I dislike valeting my car but you don't have many options when you dine here.

excerpts: Roasted Crab + Garlic Noodles = :-)
And the garlic noodles are money, best I ever tasted, but sure is hella freakin buttery greasy, but hecka good.
Atmosphere is nice too, small little restaurant, but made to look a little elegant.
garlic noodles.author: Patrick L.
garlic noodles.review:
Roasted Crab + Garlic Noodles = :-)

So many different types of roasted crab here... makes my mouth water just thinking about it. They have garlic roasted, tamarind infused, and a drunken one... and they are all so good. And the garlic noodles are money, best I ever tasted, but sure is hella freakin buttery greasy, but hecka good. Atmosphere is nice too, small little restaurant, but made to look a little elegant. They have a small bar in front too with a good bartender and drinks.

Place is kinda pricey but it's worth it for the food and experience.

excerpts: Like many of the other reviews have stated, the garlic noodles and crab are exceptional.
While I agree, sometimes the abundance of butter in the garlic crab is too much for my stomach to handle
so I occasionally venture off to the drunkeness crab which is in a white wine broth.
It is also fantastic.
I always make it a priority to order too many servings of garlic noodles so that I can take home a doggie-bag for later.
garlic noodles.author: Angel M.
garlic noodles.review:
BEST CRAB!  I am definitely a crab lover and am always on the hunt for it but the An Family has definitely managed to create the most flavorful crab I've ever had at a respectable price (for crab that is), very filling and therefore, captured a loyal customer.  

Like many of the other reviews have stated, the garlic noodles and crab are exceptional.  While I agree, sometimes the abundance of butter in the garlic crab is too much for my stomach to handle so I occasionally venture off to the drunkeness crab which is in a white wine broth.  It is also fantastic.  I always make it a priority to order too many servings of garlic noodles so that I can take home a doggie-bag for later.  

I've never been here where a reservation wasn't needed, it can get very, very busy.  The atmosphere is casual and not very pretty or stylish (compared to their Beverly Hill's location) but with food this good you really don't care where you're squatting.  At least I don't.

excerpts: Everyone raves about the crab and garlic noodles..
I agree so no need to talk too much about it.
Food from God...
Understood..
But what I enjoy here also is the good, quick service.
The lychee infusion drink I had.
Regressing back to infancy wearing a bib.
Forced to eat with my hands.
In the end being a greasy, garlicy mess.
What better way to spend your evening?
garlic noodles.author: Michael L.
garlic noodles.review: A coworker and I came here the other night. I thought to myself if I had visitors from out of town, this is definately a place to go. It's a unique dining experience, not an everyday meat and potatoes place. Everyone raves about the crab and garlic noodles.. I agree so no need to talk too much about it. Food from God... Understood.. But what I enjoy here also is the good, quick service. The lychee infusion drink I had. Regressing back to infancy wearing a bib. Forced to eat with my hands. In the end being a greasy, garlicy mess. What better way to spend your evening?

excerpts: The side order of garlic noodles was also delicious
I noted many other tempting entrees on their menu but, as far as I'm concerned, there's no need to include them.  :-)
The wait staff was very attentive.
The restaurant was a bit noisy, but no more than expected for a crowded room.
Reservations are a must.
The Muni Rail Bus (Line N) passes right in front of the restaurant.
garlic noodles.author: Deanna S.
garlic noodles.review:
My recent dining experience at Thanh Long in the Outer Sunset area of SF, CA, provided me with the best roast Dungeness crab ever - don't miss it!  One whole crab just for me!  The side order of garlic noodles was also delicious  I noted many other tempting entrees on their menu but, as far as I'm concerned, there's no need to include them.  :-)  The wait staff was very attentive.  The restaurant was a bit noisy, but no more than expected for a crowded room.  Reservations are a must.
The Muni Rail Bus (Line N) passes right in front of the restaurant.

excerpts: garlic noodles and roasted crab, aww yes
..be prepared to get your hands dirty
..now the hype is out like clowns wanting to rock js cause it's the "thing" to wear..its always busy..best make your reservations..
garlic noodles.author: Jhermaine S.
garlic noodles.review: let's get it crackin'.. garlic noodles and roasted crab, aww yes..be prepared to get your hands dirty..now the hype is out like clowns wanting to rock js cause it's the "thing" to wear..its always busy..best make your reservations..

excerpts: A large group of us ordered the garlic noodles, the daily vegetable, and the crab.
We tried the drunken, the roasted, and the tamarind crabs.
I would say the roasted is the best and the only one I would order if I went back, but it was a little too salty and peppery for me.
The garlic noodles are good, and I loved the fresh vegetables, but I definitely think it's a little overpriced compared to, say, PPQ's.
The decor is definitely nicer than your typical Asian restaurant, but I don't go to restaurants for their decor, so I would give this a solid 3.5 stars.
garlic noodles.author: Christine L.
garlic noodles.review: A large group of us ordered the garlic noodles, the daily vegetable, and the crab.  We tried the drunken, the roasted, and the tamarind crabs.  I would say the roasted is the best and the only one I would order if I went back, but it was a little too salty and peppery for me.  The garlic noodles are good, and I loved the fresh vegetables, but I definitely think it's a little overpriced compared to, say, PPQ's.  The decor is definitely nicer than your typical Asian restaurant, but I don't go to restaurants for their decor, so I would give this a solid 3.5 stars.

excerpts: I wanted to try this place because I passed the An-the-go food truck on the highway on the way to work and the thought of garlic noodles made me drool the rest of the day.
We called ahead for 2 on a Friday night probably 1.5 hours before we planned to get there
(it was a last minute thing), and had no trouble getting a reservation... cool!
Finding parking took awhile though.
Ordered the garlic noodles of course, and also the shaken beef.
We skipped out on the roasted crab even though everyone else around us had that because we wanted some protein...
$37 crab will have to be for another time.
Simply said, the food was awesome.
Noodles were nice and garlicky and I practically inhaled them.
Beef was probably some of the best beef I've had in quite a while served in that style.
My only complaint is that the portion sizes aren't huge but we walked away comfortably full.
Regardless, I loved the food and will be back!!
garlic noodles.author: Janey L.
garlic noodles.review:
OMG! I'll probably sound just like every other reviewer, but that's just a testament to how yummy the food is, right? 

I wanted to try this place because I passed the An-the-go food truck on the highway on the way to work and the thought of garlic noodles made me drool the rest of the day. We called ahead for 2 on a Friday night probably 1.5 hours before we planned to get there (it was a last minute thing), and had no trouble getting a reservation... cool! Finding parking took awhile though. Ambiance is pretty nice. 

Ordered the garlic noodles of course, and also the shaken beef. We skipped out on the roasted crab even though everyone else around us had that because we wanted some protein... $37 crab will have to be for another time. Simply said, the food was awesome. Noodles were nice and garlicky and I practically inhaled them. Beef was probably some of the best beef I've had in quite a while served in that style. My only complaint is that the portion sizes aren't huge but we walked away comfortably full. Regardless, I loved the food and will be back!!

excerpts: Best garlic noodles EVER.
But these garlic noodles are breath stinkin good (and addictive...)
Still made with spaghetti but the noodles have absorbed all the garlic flavor and seasonings, making it extra mouth watering good!
The fam also ordered the red snapper which was not at all overcooked and it came with more GARLIC NOODLES.
a few more times and spend your $10 on another plate of garlic noodles.
your choice.
garlic noodles.author: Bridget K.
garlic noodles.review:
Best garlic noodles EVER.  

Most other places...that shall remain nameless...taste like fake ramen packet garlic BLAH tossed with spaghetti.  But these garlic noodles are breath stinkin good (and addictive...) Still made with spaghetti but the noodles have absorbed all the garlic flavor and seasonings, making it extra mouth watering good!  
 
The roast crab was a bit on the--you won't believe me when i say this but...--too buttery/ oily side. BUT it had just the right amount of salt and pepper to give it nice little kick.  And what can i say? i LOVE crab and will do almost anything to eat it, including letting crab juice and grease drip down to my elbows!  wait...did i make that sound like a bad thing???

The fam also ordered the red snapper which was not at all overcooked and it came with more GARLIC NOODLES. 

I must admit, it's less pocket friendly than some of the other crab and garlic noodle places i've been too...but i'm willing to pay the price for quality.  And not to mention...parking is a pain in the behind.  They do, fortunately, have valet parking for $10 if you're desperate (and hungry!).  Or you can be patient and circle around the block a few more times and spend your $10 on another plate of garlic noodles.  your choice.  ( i'd choose the noodles of course!)

I would definitely come back here for more! Bibs AND white table cloth?  I can dig it.

excerpts: I thought the garlic noodles were way too salty for my liking (didn't feel it needs to have parmesan in it which is what made it too salty) and the roasted crab not as flavorful as I would have liked.
Perhaps I'm not into Vietnamese style crab?
I did really like the shrimp appetizer and the mussels.
What I do applaud them on is costumer service because we got serviced quite often by the same waiter (he even put on and tied my bib for me).
garlic noodles.author: Helen L.
garlic noodles.review: I thought the garlic noodles were way too salty for my liking (didn't feel it needs to have parmesan in it which is what made it too salty) and the roasted crab not as flavorful as I would have liked. Perhaps I'm not into Vietnamese style crab? I did really like the shrimp appetizer and the mussels. What I do applaud them on is costumer service because we got serviced quite often by the same waiter (he even put on and tied my bib for me).

excerpts: Also had the shaken beef, which is spicy and delicious and the garlic noodles -a
tasty fix for those of us who love our carbs.
Service was slow and hit or miss, even though we got there as soon as the doors open.
garlic noodles.author: Djipopo S.
garlic noodles.review: Went after hearing the rave reviews about the crab - which is good, but didn't quite live up to the hype.  Also had the shaken beef, which is spicy and delicious and the garlic noodles -a tasty fix for those of us who love our carbs.  Service was slow and hit or miss, even though we got there as soon as the doors open.

excerpts: The roast crab, garlic noodles and shrimp pate on sourdough appetizer were off the hook delicious.
It's pricey but worth it.
garlic noodles.author: Laura K.
garlic noodles.review: delicious!! The roast crab, garlic noodles and shrimp pate on sourdough appetizer were off the hook delicious. It's pricey but worth it.

excerpts: While I don't care for garlic noodles or really any fried noodles anywhere-my gf was happy.
FBI dessert was great.
We were lukewarm about the lukewarm boullabaise and paying 38.00 for a crab, but it was a good time.
Maybe five is overdoing the rating, but given recent experiences dining out I think it is fair.
garlic noodles.author: Mr G.
garlic noodles.review:
I was able to get a table without a wait two Fridays ago at 6PM. I am not sure if that is uncommon. 

Overall a great eating experience...service was prompt and efficient, bathrooms wree clean and the crab was tasty and served very hot. While I don't care for garlic noodles or really any fried noodles anywhere-my gf was happy. FBI dessert was great. We were lukewarm about the lukewarm boullabaise and paying 38.00 for a crab, but it was a good time. Maybe five is overdoing the rating, but given recent experiences dining out I think it is fair.

excerpts: The food is great here, as always Garlic Noodles and Crab
Had some for a house party and they're that awesome
garlic noodles.author: Pierre B.
garlic noodles.review:
The food is great here, as always Garlic Noodles and Crab :) Had some for a house party and they're that awesome :)

Be wary for the veggies, I don't wanna go into much detail or it can have a ripple. 

Overall, if this is one for the group, go for it, but if it's just you, be in for a lot :)

excerpts:
especially the garlic noodles!  
Instead of just sticking with the garlic roasted crab and garlic noodles, we ended up ordering a few other dishes; which racked up our bill and it wasn't even that good. 

Lucky the roasted garlic crab and garlic noodles made up for the other BAD dishes.  

If you eat here, just order the Roasted Garlic Crab and Garlic Noodles!
garlic noodles.author: Chanel L.
garlic noodles.review:
I took my family here for dinner to celebrate my daddys birthday.  They loved it,. especially the garlic noodles!  Don't make the same mistake as we did; by ordering other dishes.  

Instead of just sticking with the garlic roasted crab and garlic noodles, we ended up ordering a few other dishes; which racked up our bill and it wasn't even that good. 

Specifically : 

Shaken Beef - the beef were cubed cut and tasted rough.  Felt like I was chewing on gum.  I can't believe this dish was $20! Not worth it

Not only that, we also ordered 

Thanh long fish - it was 4-5 pieces of fish,. it tasted like frozen fish sticks! This dish was also $20.  

These two dishes were the ones that stood out to me during dinner that made me feel YUCK!! Lucky the roasted garlic crab and garlic noodles made up for the other BAD dishes.  

If you eat here, just order the Roasted Garlic Crab and Garlic Noodles!

Also, parking is tough and make sure you call in for reservations.

excerpts: We ordered the "must haves": salt 'n pepper calamari (not bad), coconut shrimp (OK), shaken beef (too sweet and oily), roasted crab (fishy and bland), garlic noodles (oily), and stir fried vegetables (not bad).
For dessert, we had the banana cake (not wow) and chocolate lava cake (nice flavor, but there was no chocolate oozing out of the center.
It was more like a round brownie.
garlic noodles.author: Irene L.
garlic noodles.review:
Highly overrated.  The food was meh and did not live up to all the glowing reviews on yelp.  We ordered the "must haves": salt 'n pepper calamari (not bad), coconut shrimp (OK), shaken beef (too sweet and oily), roasted crab (fishy and bland), garlic noodles (oily), and stir fried vegetables (not bad).  For dessert, we had the banana cake (not wow) and chocolate lava cake (nice flavor, but there was no chocolate oozing out of the center.  It was more like a round brownie.  The bill for 3 of us was $165 without alcohol.

The wait staff was wonderful however.  They were attentive, but not hovering.

excerpts: Tamarind crab and Garlic noodles are wonderful.
garlic noodles.author: Chon Q.
garlic noodles.review:
I savored every last morsel.  Tamarind crab and Garlic noodles are wonderful.  The drink is eh, and the dessert is also just ok.

It's a little pricey and parking is hard to find.  

What a wonderful dual anniversary we had with my oldest friend.

excerpts: The garlic noodles are killer.
garlic noodles.author: Eve R.
garlic noodles.review:
I love Thanh Long! Super pricey but worth the splurge every once in a while. The garlic noodles are killer. 

The ONLY negative thing I have to say about Thanh Long's is that you would think that considering the price and popularity of this place, they would update their old, small, rusty bathrooms!

excerpts: The Garlic Crab and Garlic Noodles are the truth!
Down right goodness.
The server put the plastic bib around my neck
and I'm glad I didn't take it off.
As nice as this place is, no need to be cute at the table.
The juices from the garlic and butter rolled down my arms.
garlic noodles.author: Shequita C.
garlic noodles.review:
I went here for my birthday and boi what a treat!  I've always favored the sweetness of the blue crab (yes, for the folks who know what I'm talking about, I put in work) so dungeness crab has never been my crustacean of choice.  

Thankfully, my friend ordered for me.  The Garlic Crab and Garlic Noodles are the truth!  Down right goodness.  The server put the plastic bib around my neck and I'm glad I didn't take it off.  As nice as this place is, no need to be cute at the table.  The juices from the garlic and butter rolled down my arms.  I was almost tempted to lick it up.  

Oh, and yeah...it's a little pricey.  Save up!  It's worth it.

excerpts: ROAST CRAB + GARLIC NOODLES
garlic noodles.author: AngeLin V.
garlic noodles.review:
ROAST CRAB + GARLIC NOODLES

So simple yet soooo mouth-watering delicious! They're only famously known for this combo! Don't mess with the formula or you'll want to kick yourself in the buttocks for ordering something else.

That's how I felt because I wanted to venture out and try their TEMPURA STYLE COCONUT PRAWNS. It was very "ehh". I've definitely had better. The BANANA CAKE we had for dessert was good though! It was a nice modern twist on a traditional Vietnamese dessert.

We went here last Valentine's Day and was squished in like sardines because the tiny place was packed! You'll feel like you're eating and chatting with the neighboring tables. Making a reservation and arriving early is a must! Eating crab can also get pretty messy so dress for the occasion.

Oh how I miss the taste of garlicy goodness and daydream of the moment we shall meet each other again...

excerpts: Then we ordered shaken beef with a side of jasmine rice and tiger prawns with garlic noodles.
I was going to order another side of garlic noodles, but my boyfriend told me to taste his first.
Boy, am I glad that I didn't order a side of garlic noodles.
I'm a big garlic noodles kinda gal.
Their garlic noodles weren't so bad, but it was really buttery.
I love my garlic noodles to be more of on the garlic side.
But, I've had better garlic noodles.
Their prawns, to me, personally was too salty.
But my boyfriend thought it was perfect.
The dish was 36$ bucks
and I personally wouldn't have ordered if it was 36$ bucks.
I would have gotten crab or something.
As for the shaken beef, it was 23.95$ with a side of jasmine rice 2.75 and i thought the shaken beef was perfect.
They included potatoes and they were perfectly cooked.
I loved how the beef just melted in my mouth.
From the outside, it looked like they were overcooked, but it was just right.
However, I probably wouldn't order it again
only becuase
I feel like the shaken beef was overpriced.
garlic noodles.author: Lynda L.
garlic noodles.review:
I gave this place a 4 star because the service was spectacular!  The food was fast, and everything was on point.  

However, parking was horrible.  We drove around several blocks 20-30 minutes trying to look for parking.  I've already anticipated the food to be expensive, so valet was not an option.  

From the outside, Thanh Long looked really small, but when you walk in, it was a little bigger than you have expected. However, it was still relatively small compared to other restaurants.  I thought the table arrangements were all packed together.  My boyfriend and I had one of the better tables, but we were still relatively close to the table next to us.  I felt like we had to whisper so they wouldn't eavesdrop on our conversation.  It was a really loud type of environment.  Everyone is talking among each other so you can hear constant talking in the background.  (which i didnt bother me as much)

The food came out in a quickness!  We had salt and pepper calamari for starters and I thought it was really good, but wish the portion was bigger.  My boyfriend wish there was ranch for him to dip it into (LOL-- hes a ranch lover when it comes to calamari)  Then we ordered shaken beef with a side of jasmine rice and tiger prawns with garlic noodles.  I was going to order another side of garlic noodles, but my boyfriend told me to taste his first.  Boy, am I glad that I didn't order a side of garlic noodles.  I'm a big garlic noodles kinda gal.  Their garlic noodles weren't so bad, but it was really buttery.  I love my garlic noodles to be more of on the garlic side.  But, I've had better garlic noodles.  Their prawns, to me, personally was too salty.  But my boyfriend thought it was perfect.  The dish was 36$ bucks and I personally wouldn't have ordered if it was 36$ bucks. I would have gotten crab or something.  As for the shaken beef, it was 23.95$ with a side of jasmine rice 2.75 and i thought the shaken beef was perfect.  They included potatoes and they were perfectly cooked. I loved how the beef just melted in my mouth. From the outside, it looked like they were overcooked, but it was just right.  However, I probably wouldn't order it again only becuase I feel like the shaken beef was overpriced.  

I would def come back another time, for another special occasion -- it was our anniversary yesterday-- to try the crab.

excerpts: Match the CRAB with the GARLIC NOODLES and you have a picture perfect dinner
garlic noodles.author: Rev A.
garlic noodles.review:
Never was a crab fan until I ate Thanh Long's crab.  

Thanh Long is that one restaurant that keeps me coming back and craving for. And this I don't say very often.

Match the CRAB with the GARLIC NOODLES and you have a picture perfect dinner :).  DELICIOUS!

Appetizers and desserts were nothing special though.

My favorite restaurant. Enough said.

excerpts: The garlic noodles were decent but super small portioned.
The "garlic bread" was a joke..it seemed like someone chopped up a baguette and just buttered it.
Where's the garlic?
garlic noodles.author: Joe C.
garlic noodles.review:
Thanh Long time before I come here again...

As everyone else said, nothing to look at from the outside but very nice ambience in the inside w/o being to pretentious.

Service was amazing with servers cleaning, refilling, replacing, and speaking all with a smile. 

Now...the bad part: Food.

The crab was overly salted and peppered with each bite producing a little grimace from being overpowered. The garlic noodles were decent but super small portioned. The "garlic bread" was a joke..it seemed like someone chopped up a baguette and just buttered it. Where's the garlic? The eggplant was actually the best dish which was perfectly cooked.

Price was extremely inflated for the quantity of food you get as well as not even nailing a good tasting crab.

All in all, a large disappointment. Boiling crab I will take anyday FTW.

excerpts: He had crab and garlic noodles, his older daughter had prawns and garlic noodles and I had the Saigon beef (which I really thought was great!)
We all really liked the food...
my toddler loved the crab puffs and we all liked the calamari appetizers.
Server was pretty attentive
...all in all it didn't hurt to pay the bill, it's a little pricey but its worth it.
Would definitely go back for special occasions!
garlic noodles.author: Diana D.
garlic noodles.review: It was a good experience...fathers day with our two year old. He had crab and garlic noodles, his older daughter had prawns and garlic noodles and I had the Saigon beef (which I really thought was great!) We all really liked the food...my toddler loved the crab puffs and we all liked the calamari appetizers. Server was pretty attentive...all in all it didn't hurt to pay the bill, it's a little pricey but its worth it.  Would definitely go back for special occasions!

excerpts: In the beginning...we ordered the garlic noodles and the Shaken Beef.
We weren't sure if we were ready to share a crab that night but quickly changed our minds after we saw crabs being served to surrounding tables.
We called our waiter over and asked if we could change our order and without hesitation he said it was no problem.
As he turning around to head to the kitchen...the Shaken Beef was on
it's way out!
Along with the garlic noodles, I felt like I was in butter heaven.
Both dishes were superb and hands down the best crab and garlic noodles I've ever had in my life.
We devoured every bit of it!
garlic noodles.author: Helen V.
garlic noodles.review:
My friend and I came here on a random night for dinner.  Of course we had heard about the roasted crab and garlic noodle hype so we wanted to try it for ourselves.  

In the beginning...we ordered the garlic noodles and the Shaken Beef.  We weren't sure if we were ready to share a crab that night but quickly changed our minds after we saw crabs being served to surrounding tables.  We called our waiter over and asked if we could change our order and without hesitation he said it was no problem.  As he turning around to head to the kitchen...the Shaken Beef was on it's way out!  We felt bad about switching our order at that point but he insisted it was no problem and continued his way back to the kitchen with the beef.

Ordering the crab was definitely the better choice and it wasn't too much at all.  Along with the garlic noodles, I felt like I was in butter heaven.  Both dishes were superb and hands down the best crab and garlic noodles I've ever had in my life.  We devoured every bit of it!

excerpts:
Roast crab, garlic noodles, and mixed vegetables - simply amazing. 
The roast crab melts in your mouth and the garlic noodles are seasoned perfectly.

The roast crab melts in your mouth and the garlic noodles are seasoned perfectly.
garlic noodles.author: Lindsey S.
garlic noodles.review:
This is the best meal I have ever had in my life.

That's a very serious statement but I stand by my word.  Roast crab, garlic noodles, and mixed vegetables - simply amazing. The roast crab melts in your mouth and the garlic noodles are seasoned perfectly.

Driving up to the place you will think that your GPS made a mistake - it really is in the middle of nowhere. The residential streets around are empty but then you'll see a glow of light emanating from Thanh Long's front door, and inside it will be bustling with people. 

It is pricey though, so my recommendation would be to save it for a special occasion. It will definitely make whatever you are celebrating all the more memorable :)

excerpts: I have to say, of all the garlic noodles, theirs is my favorite.
It has the best texture and is nice and moist, not too dry.
The crab IMO is over hyped.
It's just OK, not that special.
Everyone around us had a crab to themselves.
My parents and I got two crabs, and garlic noodles with jumbo shrimps.
We got the original flavor crab and the tamarind one.
I didn't enjoy the tamarind one too much, the alcohol flavor was a bit overpowering.
In comparison to american restaurants, the prices are cheap...
but I rather spend that money on a crab at R&G.
garlic noodles.author: Stine H.
garlic noodles.review:
The wait was really long, and the restaurant looked small from the entrance, but there are more tables around back. A lot of people hang out at the bar and have a few drinks while they wait for their table.

I have to say, of all the garlic noodles, theirs is my favorite. It has the best texture and is nice and moist, not too dry. The crab IMO is over hyped. It's just OK, not that special. Everyone around us had a crab to themselves. My parents and I got two crabs, and garlic noodles with jumbo shrimps. We got the original flavor crab and the tamarind one. I didn't enjoy the tamarind one too much, the alcohol flavor was a bit overpowering. In comparison to american restaurants, the prices are cheap...but I rather spend that money on a crab at R&G.

excerpts: I have never gptten anything other than their roast crab and garlic noodles, and I dont think I ever will.
The crab is cooked perfectly and the garlicly buttery goodness is perfect to dip the crab in.
nom nom nom!
My only issue with Thanh Long is the cocktails...
I have yet to be impressed by the drinks I get here.
garlic noodles.author: Evan O.
garlic noodles.review:
Yum Long is more like it!  I have never gptten anything other than their roast crab and garlic noodles, and I dont think I ever will.  The crab is cooked perfectly and the garlicly buttery goodness is perfect to dip the crab in. nom nom nom! My only issue with Thanh Long is the cocktails... I have yet to be impressed by the drinks I get here.  I think on future visits I will stick with water.

Oh yeah... dont bother with the "garlic toast" not worth it. AT ALL.

excerpts: Not to mention the bomb-ass garlic noodles and awesome giggling girl-time I got to spend with the fabulous ZT and JM.
garlic noodles.author: Cara Y.
garlic noodles.review:
Delicious, but pricey. Most likely the downturn in the seasonal crab haul is partially to blame for that. And then there's my laziness for not wanting to buy the crab at 99 Ranch, bring it home, cook it myself, and make a giant mess of my dining room table with newspaper, crab shells, and melted butter, which I'm sure is also to blame for sustaining the exorbitant price point. 

Regardless, worth the splurge, and I got 2 huge meals out of 1 crab. 

Not to mention the bomb-ass garlic noodles and awesome giggling girl-time I got to spend with the fabulous ZT and JM. 

------------- 
Market Price = Approximately $40/Crab as of this review. 

Get there early if you don't have reservations - we arrived 10-15 minutes before they opened, and there was a crowd milling about on the sidewalk waiting for the ceremonious door-unlocking to take place. And BYOB(rass knuckles), because some of their patrons are not above shoving a visibly pregnant woman into a door frame to get to the host(ess) podium before you.

excerpts: 3 Garlic noodles, one of them had the large prawns added:
The best garlic noodles I have had by far.
This is their specialty dish and what this restaurant is known for.
It was so delicous, my mouth is salvating just thinking about it.
I highly recommend this dish.
The prawns are pretty large and succulent also.
If I remembered correctly, it cost $25 more to add the prawns
garlic noodles.author: anna n.
garlic noodles.review:
On my last visit to San Francisco, I was introduced to this place by a close friend of mine. She absolutely was raving about the crab and garlic noodle here and suggested we make reservations for dinner at least one of the nights we were in SF. I must give her props because it was really good. 

A group of six of us came here and was seated at the back in a booth. The restaurant is pretty old and looks a little beat up. Decor was nothing fancy. But the food definitely made up for this flaw.

What we ordered:  
4 roasted crab: They were pretty large crabs and tasted very succulent. It was garlic-ky and buttery in taste. Your arteries were saying no..... but your tummy was definitely saying yes, give me more.  

3 Garlic noodles, one of them had the large prawns added: The best garlic noodles I have had by far. This is their specialty dish and what this restaurant is known for. It was so delicous, my mouth is salvating just thinking about it. I highly recommend this dish. The prawns are pretty large and succulent also. If I remembered correctly, it cost $25 more to add the prawns but I thought it was worth the extra cost.

Shaking beef: I thought this dish was alright. I definitely had better elsewhere. The beef was not too tender and the flavoring wasn't great. It was just an average dish. 

For dessert we ordered 4 orange sorbet that came inside a real orange. It was actually really good. Tasted tart and sweet at the same time. 

Overall it was a wonderful experience and the food was great. I would highly recommend making reservations. The night that we came, it was really busy and every table there was pretty much taken. We paid around $60 a person. A little on the pricier side but well worth it.

excerpts: I will admit the roasted crab is very good and so are the garlic noodles.
But I can get that at other restaurants....
We were a party of 6 and shared 5 dishes but it was not really enough.
Desert was decent.
garlic noodles.author: Cyril R.
garlic noodles.review:
It was just ok. I guess their rather overpriced for the amount of food and the quality of ingredient. I will admit the roasted crab is very good and so are the garlic noodles. But I can get that at other restaurants....
We were a party of 6 and shared 5 dishes but it was not really enough. Desert was decent.

excerpts: we had vegetable soup, soft shell crab, curry shrimp, sautee veggies, roasted crab, tamarind crab, and garlic noodles.
the vegetable soup is basically swansons with diced vegetables.the curry shrimp was spicy but the shrimp was fresh.
i liked the roasted crab better than the tamarind crab.
im not a huge fan of garlic noodles,  they can be dry but oily.
garlic noodles.author: claudia y.
garlic noodles.review:
we came here on a thursday night and all tables were full.  they dont seat you until most of your party is here.  

we had vegetable soup, soft shell crab, curry shrimp, sautee veggies, roasted crab, tamarind crab, and garlic noodles.

overall the food was decent though not exceptional.  the vegetable soup is basically swansons with diced vegetables.the curry shrimp was spicy but the shrimp was fresh.  i liked the roasted crab better than the tamarind crab.  

i think overall im not a huge fan of garlic noodles,  they can be dry but oily.

excerpts: THE BEST CRAB AND GARLIC NOODLES EVA!!!
garlic noodles.author: Brianne C.
garlic noodles.review:
I live in Salinas Ca, just about 2 hours way and I make the drive at least once a month. Need I say more. 

Like everyone else I must add my two cents. THE BEST CRAB AND GARLIC NOODLES EVA!!! 

P.s. make a reservation!!

excerpts: Excellent crab, garlic noodles and starters.
Just make sure your dinner companion tries the noodles as well, otherwise he/she will probably not want to get close to you.
The place is packed even mid-week, a reservation is essential.
However, even with a reservation we had to wait 20 minutes for our table.
But the food was worth the wait.
The service is friendly and quick, and the place is stylish and cozy at the same time.
Will definitely go there again when I am in SF.
garlic noodles.author: BigCitySlicker
garlic noodles.review:
In crab season a must. Excellent crab, garlic noodles and starters. Just make sure your dinner companion tries the noodles as well, otherwise he/she will probably not want to get close to you.
The place is packed even mid-week, a reservation is essential. However, even with a reservation we had to wait 20 minutes for our table. But the food was worth the wait.
The service is friendly and quick, and the place is stylish and cozy at the same time.
Will definitely go there again when I am in SF.

excerpts: The garlic noodles are to die for!!!!
Seriously they are the best I have had to date.
They are however super expensive.
But I still get them for takeout once in
a while-very tasty dish.
What's ridiculous is that they charge $40 for garlic noodles and 4 butterfly shrimp-
that is crazy.
garlic noodles.author: Emily G.
garlic noodles.review:
The garlic noodles are to die for!!!! Seriously they are the best I have had to date. They are however super expensive. $10. But I still get them for takeout once in  a while-very tasty dish. One of my all time favorites. 

What's ridiculous is that they charge $40 for garlic noodles and 4 butterfly shrimp-that is crazy. I mean 4 shrimp, that is beyond belief. 

The place is always packed and they only open at 5. Our waiter was not very friendly. I politely asked him how the garlic bread was and he replied" it's just regular garlic bread as in any other place" and I said well everyplace is different, and he rolled his eyes. He would barely ever check up on my boyfriend and me and I constantly had to flag down other waiters to get another soda. The lady at the front desk was nice though-the hostess. The chicken skewers were pretty good buy there are only three pieces of chicken, plus they were small.


Overall food is good, service could be better, and not a very good value for your buck.

excerpts:
we ordered a little too much for our own good.  for a party of 6, we had:

3 appetizers 
3 roasted crabs
2 beef dishes
5 orders of garlic noodles

Needless to say, we ordered too much.
It's definitely worth venturing out there for crab and garlic noodles!
Don't be macho and wear the bib unless you want crab pieces and shells all over your shirt.
garlic noodles.author: Carli F.
garlic noodles.review:
after a long hiatus from thanh long, i recently had dinner here with a larger group.  we ordered a little too much for our own good.  for a party of 6, we had:

3 appetizers 
3 roasted crabs
2 beef dishes
5 orders of garlic noodles

Needless to say, we ordered too much.  Thanh Long is located in an odd residential neighborhood in the Sunset.  It's definitely worth venturing out there for crab and garlic noodles!  Don't be macho and wear the bib unless you want crab pieces and shells all over your shirt.

excerpts: After reading a few yelp reviews from my blackberry, we ordered  the salt and pepper calamari, roasted/garlic crab, and garlic noodles.
Everything was DELISH.
The conversation at the table came to a complete stop because we were so engrossed in our meal.
I really wish that they would've given more calamari but the crab and garlic noodles were enough for me and my bf to share.
garlic noodles.author: Meryl P.
garlic noodles.review:
I am not a fan of crab, but Thanh Long has definitely made me a fan!  

My bf and I came here with some friends on a Saturday night and we were were seated within a few moments.  The ambiance inside is comfy and welcoming and people were dressed nicely -- so I felt a little out of place in my shorts -- so note to self and all others, don't wear shorts.  The wait staff was pretty nice and very attentive and our food came out with a quickness!

After reading a few yelp reviews from my blackberry, we ordered  the salt and pepper calamari, roasted/garlic crab, and garlic noodles.  Everything was DELISH.  The conversation at the table came to a complete stop because we were so engrossed in our meal.  I really wish that they would've given more calamari but the crab and garlic noodles were enough for me and my bf to share.  

I would definitely come back again.  I love Thanh Long!

excerpts: I love putting on my bib and going crazy on their garlic roasted crab and garlic noodles.
garlic noodles.author: Jorge S.
garlic noodles.review:
Oh my god, their grab is so buttery and garlicky, so amazing!

I love putting on my bib and going crazy on their garlic roasted crab and garlic noodles.

Do yourself a favor and call ahead and make a reservation, I noticed a buttload of walk-ins waiting ages for a table. Because I made a reservation, I probably waited about 3-4 minutes to be seated. 

A little on the pricey side ($100+ for 2), but AWESOME.

excerpts: i always order the same thing and it looks like 90% of the ppl who reviewed this place or uploaded pictures have done the same, which is roasted garlic dungeness crab and garlic noodles with tiger prawn shrimps....
its sooo good, makes you wanna slap ur mamma (no, im jk haha)
garlic noodles.author: Michael K.
garlic noodles.review:
i live 2 blocks away from this place so ive been coming here with my fambam for many years, but i was just here recently with my parents again a couple of days ago

they have valet parking here so thats always convenient
i always order the same thing and it looks like 90% of the ppl who reviewed this place or uploaded pictures have done the same, which is roasted garlic dungeness crab and garlic noodles with tiger prawn shrimps....its sooo good, makes you wanna slap ur mamma (no, im jk haha)
i also like their calamari and fried ice cream for dessert, hmmmm....

and there is a bar there too so if u wanna get ur drank on.....
buzz yoself before u stuff yoself! 

overall this place has been not only good, but also consistent thru out the years that ive known, thumbs way up!

4 stars

excerpts: The Garlic noodles were okay except for the fact they must have put a stick of butter in it.
Overall theme were peppery and cold food.
$85+ dollars for this?
No, thanks!
garlic noodles.author: Rossi K.
garlic noodles.review: Thanh Long came up Thanh short!  The roast crab tasted very peppery and were cold.  The colossal royal tiger prawns were the same as well.  Both of these dishes were most likely prep in advance for the masses.  Such a disappointment for driving all that way for this.  The Garlic noodles were okay except for the fact they must have put a stick of butter in it.  Overall theme were peppery and cold food.  $85+ dollars for this?  No, thanks!

excerpts: that I must admit - Garlic noodles.
Their garlic noodles ARE very good although you must eat it fast before the butter starts settling and all you see is globs of white chunks.
garlic noodles.author: Jannie Q.
garlic noodles.review:
This restaurant is way overrated!!   Crabs here cost at least $30 each - no matter if it is crab season or not.  You would think if they say that crabs are "market price" it would lowered during crab season, but NO!  They still charge you an arm and a leg.  The roasted crab is full of butter and oil.  You must eat fast or else be grossed out by the amount of trans fat you're inhaling.  

Valet parking is a turn-off, considering that they just park your car around the block -- taking over their neighbor's residential parking. I would hate to live around there.

One thing good that I must admit - Garlic noodles.  Their garlic noodles ARE very good although you must eat it fast before the butter starts settling and all you see is globs of white chunks.

excerpts: We had the garlic noodles, it's yummy
and I want more of it.
garlic noodles.author: Mandy D.
garlic noodles.review:
3.5 stars

I passed by here so often that I finally gave it a chance. 
We had the Dungeness Crab Puffs, not worth it for $10.50. I expected to be a bit bigger and more of it. There was only 6 dinky pieces of it. Although the cheese tasted so good inside the wonton, I wonder if there was even any crab meat in it.

We had the garlic noodles, it's yummy and I want more of it.
The stuffed calamari wasn't bad either because of the sauce.
Dessert was fried banana ice cream, I love this stuff. 

This place isn't bad overall, but it's a bit pricey for me. Service is good. It's worth a try.

excerpts: So after becoming incredibly full with the roast crab and garlic noodles and the chocolate cake, I quickly passed out in my car and slept until the next day.
garlic noodles.author: Bethtina W.
garlic noodles.review:
A year and a half ago I became allergic to all shell fish. On my birthday this past September I loaded up on Benedryl and with my epipen in hand went and ate at Thanh Long.  So after becoming incredibly full with the roast crab and garlic noodles and the chocolate cake, I quickly passed out in my car and slept until the next day. I have always loved this place and can't give it up...regardless of my allergy. 

It's the best. Everything on the menu is delicious. The wait staff are attentive, courteous, and quick. 

If you want an incredible experience this is the place to try.

excerpts: ROAST CRAB AND GARLIC NOODLES.
These should be the only things you order here.
Normally, I don't have patience to crack crab, but it's worth the labor for Thanh Long and their garlic noodles are sooo good.
It's a little pricey-
~$40 for the crab and $10 for garlic noodles, but so worth it!
I once made a mistake of ordering other dishes- don't do it!
The shaking beef was good
I guess, but everything was not worth the price.
The dessert that I've had (fried banana w/ vanilla ice cream) was just okay
too-
I've had better at cheaper restaurants.

One thing I didn't like was that I had called the night before my reservation to ask about any birthday specials since it was my bf's bday and they told me that they give one free dessert for the birthday person.
I reminded the waiter
it was my bf's bday and they put a candle on the dessert, but I was still charged?
Oh well, it was only $7, but still... principle.
Anyway, overall, a really good dining experience esp for crab lovers.
garlic noodles.author: Stephanie G.
garlic noodles.review: ROAST CRAB AND GARLIC NOODLES. These should be the only things you order here. Normally, I don't have patience to crack crab, but it's worth the labor for Thanh Long and their garlic noodles are sooo good. It's a little pricey- ~$40 for the crab and $10 for garlic noodles, but so worth it! I once made a mistake of ordering other dishes- don't do it! The shaking beef was good I guess, but everything was not worth the price. The dessert that I've had (fried banana w/ vanilla ice cream) was just okay too- I've had better at cheaper restaurants. One thing I didn't like was that I had called the night before my reservation to ask about any birthday specials since it was my bf's bday and they told me that they give one free dessert for the birthday person. I reminded the waiter it was my bf's bday and they put a candle on the dessert, but I was still charged? Oh well, it was only $7, but still... principle. Anyway, overall, a really good dining experience esp for crab lovers.

excerpts: Best crab and garlic noodles you can buy period, but be ready to fork out 70-80 per a person.
garlic noodles.author: Ken P.
garlic noodles.review:
Best crab and garlic noodles you can buy period, but be ready to fork out 70-80 per a person.

This is one of those spots you take a girl out to on a good occason, or you're just rich enough to afford such dinners.

Price doesn't justify the food enough for me.

excerpts: "shaken" beef, garlic noodles and seabass.
Crab was well cooked and tender.
Finally, the garlic noodles were also very tasty if you LOVE garlic.
garlic noodles.author: Cary L.
garlic noodles.review:
Greetings Restaurant-goers!!!  Came here for my friend's b-day dinner.  A crab specialty restaurant in the outer...OUTER sunset next to the cold, foggy beach.  A bit of a trek with many other similar places more east on Clement St.  You walk in and you will be greeted by the host (reservations are encouraged as it is a BUSY place even during the week) with a bar on the right.  It is fully stocked and we all got a glass of Oban for a pricey number.

When seated about 10 minutes after our reservation was actually for we had a great server.  Surrounded by an interesting decor we ordered as appetizers calamari and oysters.  I didn't have the oysters but the calamari was well cooked but over seasoned if you ask me.  It was peppery which I do like but way too salty.   Because I love calamari, I ate much of the order but was invited to enjoy a long period of salty tongue and 2 glasses of ice water.  For the mains, we had crab which is the specialty, "shaken" beef, garlic noodles and seabass.   Crab was well cooked and tender.  The shaken beef was cooked medium to the "T."  The seabass also tasty with the sauce it comes with but perhaps just a touch overcooked.  Finally, the garlic noodles were also very tasty if you LOVE garlic.  If garlic is only a passing notion in your home cooking you will think this is romantic disaster when it comes to post-dinner make-out sessions.

Lastly, because the portions are on the smaller side we had to order an extra dish for the 4 of us...the curry lotus prawns.  This had to be the worst of all our selections.  The shrimp were over cooked and tiny....oh whoops, weren't they called "prawns" on the menu???  In any case, the curry was bland and even if you liked it, there was barely enough curry sauce to mix into you rice like many expect in a Thai type curry house.  The veggies it comes with were....eh.  Water chestnuts were ok.  The baby corn tasted like canned baby corn.  All-in-all I'd leave this off your choices to order...

So in summary, a fancy, pricey Vietnamese crab house at the beach in SF.  A fun place to visit if you live locally and enjoy it.  Not something I'd cross town for though.  Plenty of better dining experiences / tastes closer to downtown.

excerpts: Roasted crab and garlic noodles with a pear martini is my absolute favorite combination here.
We celebrated my husbands birthday on a Saturday and 6 of us were accommodated same day!
We even showed up a little early and they were able to seat is right away.
As a native San Franciscan this is hands down one of my favorite restaurants.
Not as nice but better than Crustacians:)
garlic noodles.author: Vanessa G.
garlic noodles.review: Best hole in the wall!!! Roasted crab and garlic noodles with a pear martini is my absolute favorite combination here. We celebrated my husbands birthday on a Saturday and 6 of us were accommodated same day! We even showed up a little early and they were able to seat is right away. As a native San Franciscan this is hands down one of my favorite restaurants. Not as nice but better than Crustacians:)

excerpts: We ordered two crabs, some garlic noodles, lemon grass chicken, Salt and Pepper Calamari, and Shaken Beef.
The crabs were very flavorful and tasty!
I was eating like a savage, trying to get all the crab meat I can get!
By the end of the meal, there were crab shells all over the table..
LOL!
Eating the crabs with the garlic noodles made the meal almost perfect!
The chicken and shaken beef were also tasty.
garlic noodles.author: Anthony N.
garlic noodles.review:
Wow!! I heard so much great stuff about this place that I wanted to try it out for myself. When we first got there, the place was packed! My friends and I waited for 45 mins to get seated, but the food was worth the wait. We ordered two crabs, some garlic noodles, lemon grass chicken, Salt and Pepper Calamari, and Shaken Beef. The crabs were very flavorful and tasty! I was eating like a savage, trying to get all the crab meat I can get! By the end of the meal, there were crab shells all over the table.. LOL! Eating the crabs with the garlic noodles made the meal almost perfect! The chicken and shaken beef were also tasty. The beef was very tender. 

If you're not looking to spend a lot you should turn back now because this place is a little pricey. If you do come, I recommend making some reservations ahead of time if you don't want to wait 45+ minutes. 

If you're craving for some crab that melts in your mouth and gives you happy smile, Thanh Long is the place to be!

excerpts: Secondly, the specials are SUPER rich, butter laden Garlic Crab and their SUPER greasy carb laden Garlic Noodles.
garlic noodles.author: Rachel G.
garlic noodles.review:
A lot of the reviews I have read for Thanh Long start with lines like this:

OMG.  So much garlic!

LOL.  Don't go here on a first date!

FML.  Garlic breath ruins a blind date!

Here I am, two years in deep with the perfect, most amazing, loving, sweetest man model ever and none of that shit applies.

We are like, hey let's eat some delicious broccoli and refried beans covered in jalapenos, dijon mustard and garlic and then make sweet, sweaty, ordinary two years in deep love.

That's kind of where you need to be to enjoy Thanh Long to the fullest.  But believe me, when you get to that sweet spot, you can't imagine anything else.  

They are right.  Don't go here on a first date.  

For starters, as a lady who has had her share of first dates that do not end in relationships (hi jerks), you can't order just like a salad or a glass of water here.  That would be weird.

Secondly, the specials are SUPER rich, butter laden Garlic Crab and their SUPER greasy carb laden Garlic Noodles.  Both of which are totally greasy and fatty and hard to eat without looking like a total slob.  

Thirdly, they put bibs on you.  It's hard to rock a bib sexy.  I mean, I pull it off, of course.  But for the average person, a bib puts you on a one way train to Shortbusville.  

Fourthly, it's a lot of food.  I don't know about you, but on a date, I like to keep the food to a minimum.  Muffin tops are not an aphrodisiac -- to most.  My boyfriend is different -- he encourages them.

Fifthly, you will reek of garlic.  Amazing, delicious garlic.  And at the end of the night, a garlicky kiss is sort of a buzz kill.

Unless you're us.  Or are where we are.  Then you know that a garlic kiss at the end of the night simply means you are in an awesome relationship.  

One where you can totally say 'Ew, gross, that sounds awful" without hurting his feelings when your man suggests you have sex after dinner at Thanh Long.

excerpts: We ordered a plate of garlic noodles and roasted crab.
The garlic noodles were DELICIOUS!!!!!!!!
Perfect blend of all the ingredients - garlic, Parmesan cheese, olive oil, and whatever else they have in it.
I could have seriously eaten a whole plate to myself!
The roasted crab ----DRROOOL!
it's soooooooooo good!
Next time we'll skip the starters and dig straight into the crab and garlic noodles!
The tab does come out a bit pricey [about $90], but it's not like you eat crab everyday!
=D
(that's the only justification I can make for the prices of the dishes).
I'm craving it already!
*sigh!
garlic noodles.author: Cathe T.
garlic noodles.review:
"Oh, I've died and gone to crab heaven."

So the Bf & I got here around 430 pm, not knowing that it didn't open till 5pm...so we walked around and 15 minutes later - there was a line FORMED ALREADY!?! (I was thinking, this place must be good then!)

The outside of the restaurant isn't fancy and appears slightly run-down. The inside of the restaurant, however, isn't ghetto-looking. I would have to say its table setting is above a sit-down restaurant with and below a fine-dining restaurant. The waiters come out and place the bibs on for you and they're really quick with cleaning out finished plates, re-filling your drinks, and check-up on how everything is going. AWESOME personable staff!

We started off with two items from the "Starters" list:

1) Tempura Coconut Shrimp - it was alright. You can definitely taste the coconut shavings on there, so that was good, but i wasn't WOW'ed by the overall taste. Wasn't bad, wasn't great!

2) Dungeness crab puffs - I was disappointed...couldn't taste any CRAB in the fried wontons at all because it was overpowered by the cream cheese/mayo filling. Seriously, all you tasted was the creamy filling and crunch of the wonton. Boo! 

Now on to what REALLY MATTERS!

We ordered a plate of garlic noodles and roasted crab. The garlic noodles were DELICIOUS!!!!!!!! Perfect blend of all the ingredients - garlic, Parmesan cheese, olive oil, and whatever else they have in it. I could have seriously eaten a whole plate to myself! The roasted crab ----DRROOOL! it's soooooooooo good! These two items are a definite try if you come to the restaurant. 

Next time we'll skip the starters and dig straight into the crab and garlic noodles! The tab does come out a bit pricey [about $90], but it's not like you eat crab everyday! =D (that's the only justification I can make for the prices of the dishes). I'm craving it already! *sigh!*

excerpts: Garlic Noodles
**** Excellent!
Delightfully flavored!
garlic noodles.author: Sandra P.
garlic noodles.review:
My bf took me here for the first time on my birthday.. ONE WORD= MAGICAL!

Garlic Noodles ***** Excellent! Delightfully flavored! Not too garlicy or buttery

Shaken Beef ***** Heaven on a platter! (hope i didn't offend anyone) Right amount of spices, peppers

Salt and Pepper Calamari ***** I am very picky when it comes to calamari. I want  it fried to perfection. These are crispy breaded rings of joy! Who said $10.95 for this appetizer could not buy happiness?

The bar made delightful cocktails. Only $7.50!

Servers are courteous and always pay attention to your every need.

I'm getting hungry just thinking about it.. *sighhhhs*

Try to get reservations. This place was crowded with both small and large parties.

excerpts: Garlic Crab and garlic noodles!!!!!!!
People say "it's expensive...
" WHO CARES!
If you can fill up your car with gas then fill up your stomach with something great!
Spoil yourself at times.
I figured if I can buy a $30 tshirt then I can spend a little more and get a excellent dinner.
To many people these days are buying materialistic that are expensive but then go home and eat top ramen.
NOT ME!
I'm getting my girlfriend
and I something great to eat for dinner.
Okay enough about my rant, bottom line, get here, get here early or make reservations.
Do something.
Just get in the door and get a table.
Slap that bib on and get ready to get down!
I can't wait to go back!
garlic noodles.author: Philip O.
garlic noodles.review: Dammmmmnnnnn. Garlic Crab and garlic noodles!!!!!!! People say "it's expensive..." WHO CARES! If you can fill up your car with gas then fill up your stomach with something great! Spoil yourself at times. I figured if I can buy a $30 tshirt then I can spend a little more and get a excellent dinner. To many people these days are buying materialistic that are expensive but then go home and eat top ramen. NOT ME! I'm getting my girlfriend and I something great to eat for dinner. Okay enough about my rant, bottom line, get here, get here early or make reservations. Do something. Just get in the door and get a table. Slap that bib on and get ready to get down! I can't wait to go back!

excerpts: We got the roast crab, the tamarind crab, and garlic noodles, all of which were amazing.
The vegetable of the day was sauteed green beans, also great, and the salt&pepper calamari, which was just okay.
Oh, and lychee vodka!
The only drawback is that the crab was about $42 each...
otherwise I would have gladly eaten another two.
Or four.
Or ten.
garlic noodles.author: Yaa-Lirng T.
garlic noodles.review:
So I had a bad day today. I was all worried about what I was doing with my life and sad about a friend moving away, and I had spent three hours cleaning the bathroom after my toilet had overflowed. Then I went to Thanh Long for dinner with a bunch of friends. The roast crab dish... there are no words. It was one of those rare moments in life where you just realize that every decision you've ever made leading up to this very instant has been correct.

No joke - it was so good that I noticed some meat left in one of the knuckles in the shell bowl and ended up literally picking through the trash for more meat. My friend is terrible at eating crab, so I basically had a handsome second dinner composed entirely of her scraps.

We got the roast crab, the tamarind crab, and garlic noodles, all of which were amazing. The vegetable of the day was sauteed green beans, also great, and the salt&pepper calamari, which was just okay. Oh, and lychee vodka! The only drawback is that the crab was about $42 each... otherwise I would have gladly eaten another two. Or four. Or ten. Seriously, the crab is really freaking good.

We went Sunday evening, and I had no problem street parking. I saw some other reviews about bad parking, so I offer this up as a data point.

excerpts: Of course we ordered roasted dungeness crab (one is enough for two people), garlic noodles and shaken beef.
Needless to say, our table was loaded to the gills!!!
I'm not much of a fan for eating things with my hands, like crab, but their roasted crab is delicious!
I think they steam it first and break it apart, then bast it with their "secret" sauces and spices and roast it.
It comes to you very hot!
