They give you bibs too for those of us who are messy eaters, like me, so you won't have to worry about looking silly when you leave and go into town or something...
Or, maybe you could bring an extra shirt...
hehe...
As for the garlic noodles, well, I'm not really a fan.
I just am not a garlic person, let alone having it cooked with noodles.
Everyone else enjoyed it though.
As for the shaken beef, it was cubes of ribeye or tenderloin sautéed with onions and potatoes.
It was very good, very tender.
For desert, we ordered the lava cake which was so good.
I love chocolate and this dessert hit the spot!
I would go back again to eat crab and to enjoy the great, friendly service that we received...
garlic noodles.author: Dave F.
garlic noodles.review: Had to try this place, a bunch of people told me about it and now I can say I tried it. Of course we ordered roasted dungeness crab (one is enough for two people), garlic noodles and shaken beef. Needless to say, our table was loaded to the gills!!! I'm not much of a fan for eating things with my hands, like crab, but their roasted crab is delicious! I think they steam it first and break it apart, then bast it with their "secret" sauces and spices and roast it. It comes to you very hot! They give you bibs too for those of us who are messy eaters, like me, so you won't have to worry about looking silly when you leave and go into town or something... Or, maybe you could bring an extra shirt... hehe... As for the garlic noodles, well, I'm not really a fan. I just am not a garlic person, let alone having it cooked with noodles. Everyone else enjoyed it though. As for the shaken beef, it was cubes of ribeye or tenderloin sautéed with onions and potatoes. It was very good, very tender. For desert, we ordered the lava cake which was so good. I love chocolate and this dessert hit the spot!  I would go back again to eat crab and to enjoy the great, friendly service that we received...

excerpts: I decided to just order the famous garlic noodles
As for the garlic noodles, its not as good as what I remember having at crustaceans.
Honestly, I felt like I could make my own garlic noodle at home that taste similar.
Hmm, yea I was not too impressed.
But again, this place is famous for the crab and garlic noodles, so DO TRY.
garlic noodles.author: Roger C.
garlic noodles.review:
It was nice to actually come here. Well, I can't say too much though because my first taste of the An Family Food was at their sister restaurant Crustaceans in SF 3/4 years ago for my birthday. So it was great to finally come to the place where it sort of originally started. Thanks to my friend Edmund, as we came here to celebrate his birthday!

Note: I did not eat the crab because I was broke as a joke and market price for the crab was around 40 dollars. So I kept it light. I decided to just order the famous garlic noodles and I had also ordered the Broiled chicken which sounded delicious. However, the waitress has messed up my order and got me the Lemongrass Chicken dish. It sucked because I really wanted to try the Broiled chicken, I am not a huge fan of Lemongrass. Me, being a nice guy decided to just keep the dish because I didn't want to have the dish get thrown out and go through the trouble of making me a new one.

As for the garlic noodles, its not as good as what I remember having at crustaceans. Honestly, I felt like I could make my own garlic noodle at home that taste similar. Hmm, yea I was not too impressed. As for the Lemongrass Chicken, that was also alright. Again, I am not a fan of Lemongrass but I didn't want to have the waitress redo my order.

Overall, I give Thanh Long's 3 stars. For what I had, I did not think it was worth the 35 dollars. Again though, I didn't have the famous crab, so I guess you could say my review isn't doing much justice to Thanh Long. But again, this place is famous for the crab and garlic noodles, so DO TRY.

excerpts: ordered and attempted to eat the roasted crab and garlic noodles for take out...
garlic noodles.author: Bay Area Y.
garlic noodles.review:
ordered and attempted to eat the roasted crab and garlic noodles for take out... the noodles were tasty and always seems to be consistent however the crab priced at "market" was full of shit - literally! 

how can an establishment still be in business serving food like this? am i just too phobic when it comes to making sure my seafood is cleaned - either way it was beyond disgusting and i will not be placing a take-out or dine-in order ever again!

excerpts: The garlic noodles were very good as well, as well as the prawns.
Everything was fresh, well prepared, and tasty.
The service was really good.
We had a reservation, and were seated almost immediately.
garlic noodles.author: Jon S.
garlic noodles.review:
Good restaurant, worth the trip, but could easily be better.

The positives (certainly worth 4-5 stars):
1.  Food was very good.  We had the roasted crab which was some of the better Dungeness Crab in San Francisco.  The garlic noodles were very good as well, as well as the prawns.  Everything was fresh, well prepared, and tasty.
2.  The service was really good.  We had a reservation, and were seated almost immediately.  Everyone was friendly and attentive throughout the meal.

The negatives (worth 1-2 stars)
1.  Location.  It's far out by Ocean Beach... which is fine.  Except there were these thuggy hoodlum type kids hanging out around this neighborhood.  Certainly a little intimidating.
2.  Parking sucks.  Like enough where you might want to think twice about going here... it's worse than a lot of other Richmond/Sunset restaurants.
3.  They had a valet guy.  A very unfriendly valet.  One that makes you feel mad.  He makes you prepay and gives attitude.  The restaurant should revisit who they staff as a valet, as they are extensions of the customer experience...

excerpts: Tried the roasted crab, garlic noodles, and garlic fried rice last night with a bunch of coworkers.
To me, the crab was super fresh and good, if you don't mind the dripping oil/butter all over your hands.
Garlic noodles were perfect.
For the fried rice, I didn't care much about.
garlic noodles.author: Monica L.
garlic noodles.review:
Tried the roasted crab, garlic noodles, and garlic fried rice last night with a bunch of coworkers. To me, the crab was super fresh and good, if you don't mind the dripping oil/butter all over your hands. Garlic noodles were perfect. For the fried rice, I didn't care much about. Definitely you can share one crab with your friend. 

I think I still have garlic breath now.

excerpts:
Sea bass was also good though not amazing, and I put the sauce on everything
+ Garlic noodles were tasty
+ Sauteed veggies were
garlic noodles.author: Angel L.
garlic noodles.review:
The ambiance was great and there were some stand out dishes.

The food came out quick!
+ Shaken beef was the favorite
+/- Sea bass was also good though not amazing, and I put the sauce on everything
+ Garlic noodles were tasty
+ Sauteed veggies were fresh
- Roasted crab didn't live up to the hype or to the competition
+ Combo seafood fried rice was satisfying

Overall worth a try, and maybe we came on an off night.

The wait staff was attentive, with minor hiccups.

excerpts: For just crab and garlic noodles?
ehh, Perilla is much better and wallet friendly!
garlic noodles.author: Karen X.
garlic noodles.review: Food is tasty here, but I feel like it's too over priced. For just crab and garlic noodles? ehh, Perilla is much better and wallet friendly!

excerpts: Honestly, I'm not too impressed by their over-priced garlic noodles (for the portion and cost, it's like a 90% mark-up.)
I"ve had it at so many other places
and it's just ok
but the crab is def.
worth the trip and money.
garlic noodles.author: Yien S.
garlic noodles.review: Every time I have a craving for crab, I think of this place.  The roast crab is sooooo delicious.  Honestly, I'm not too impressed by their over-priced garlic noodles (for the portion and cost, it's like a 90% mark-up.)  I"ve had it at so many other places and it's just ok but the crab is def. worth the trip and money. The shaken beef is good as well.  The only reason why I didn't give 5 stars is because of the service.  If i'm going to spend over $100 for dinner, I expect better service than what was given to me and my bf.  The service doesn't always suck but on one particular rainy evening, I had reservations but there were plenty of empty tables so it wasn't very busy throughout dinner service.  Each time I needed the server, I had to flag him down, literally waving my hands like an idiot.  Apparently saying "excuse me" wasn't going to work.  Maybe if he wasn't too busy lifting his nose in the air, he would have heard me all four times.  Any ways, can't wait to go back for the crack crab!

excerpts: Then the scene got even more gluttonous after adding the garlic noodles and the left over pieces of the sea bass that my lady couldn't finish off.
Just a friendly reminder, make sure the wash your hands in between or else you'll have a buttery
garlic noodles.author: Nick V.
garlic noodles.review:
What can i say that hasn't already been said among the 4-5 star ratings??

Came here for Valentines Day dinner (2010) around 5pm and this is how it went down. So, i did deshelled all of my crab meat into one pile, took some steamed rice, mixed it in with the crab and cracky butter sauce and then commenced shoveling the mixture into my mouth. I think i was blanking in and out of conscientiousness as i chewed due to the hardcore party in my mouth. Then the scene got even more gluttonous after adding the garlic noodles and the left over pieces of the sea bass that my lady couldn't finish off. Just a friendly reminder, make sure the wash your hands in between or else you'll have a buttery Midas touch 

I love this place, i love the food but I'd sure hate it if i didn't make a reservation on a day like Valentines Day. Fellas need to remember to make those other wise it may compromise nookie time afterward with that waiting that you gotta do. Or at least not complain to the restaurant likes it everyone else's fault that they made theirs.

excerpts: Try the crab, prawns and of course garlic noodles.
A bit pricy, along with the need for valet parking, but the experience, food and service very good.
Only bad thing I can say is the location, which is out of the way, but guess that adds to level of anticipation and hunger until you actually get there!
garlic noodles.author: Dt T.
garlic noodles.review: Extremely tasty cuisine. Try the crab, prawns and of course garlic noodles. A bit pricy, along with the need for valet parking, but the experience, food and service very good. Only bad thing I can say is the location, which is out of the way, but guess that adds to level of anticipation and hunger until you actually get there!

excerpts:
if you share it your going to want to order another haha

Garlic noodles
Crab
Shaken beef 
Eggplant dish
garlic noodles.author: Ms.s F.
garlic noodles.review:
Love this place! My recommendations below! BTW I suggest you get your own crab and noodles lol if you share it your going to want to order another haha

Garlic noodles
Crab
Shaken beef 
Eggplant dish

excerpts: The good things about Thanh Long are the Garlic Roasted and/or the Drunken Crab, and the garlic noodles.
garlic noodles.author: Danny G.
garlic noodles.review:
The not -so-good things are the prices and hard-to-find-street-parking.

The good things about Thanh Long are the Garlic Roasted and/or the Drunken Crab, and the garlic noodles.

The better thing is that I think I now have their garlic noodle recipe down pat, and can make it myself at home

excerpts: I ordered the spicy eggplant and my girlfriend ordered the crab with a side order of garlic noodles (another essential).
garlic noodles.author: Chino S.
garlic noodles.review:
Expensive, but very delicious.

I recently took my girlfriend here for her birthday.  Thanh Long and Crustacian are two of her favorite places to eat. 

We always start off with the Mussels for an appatizer.  They're amazing.  You may find yourself ordering up another order of them, due to the delicoiusness.  I ordered the spicy eggplant and my girlfriend ordered the crab with a side order of garlic noodles (another essential).  

Both dishes were excellent.  My only disclaimer for this place is to be prepared to spend atleast a $100 and that'd be very modest.

excerpts: here's why:5 Stars for efficiency, 5 for crabs and garlic noodles, 3 for customer service
(our service person was great but host and the reservation clerk were cold but efficient), and 1 for the other entrees.
We had a table of 8 for a birthday dinner.
Ordered a bunch of apps, 3 entrees, 3 crabs, 3 garlic noodles...over $400!
Would not have been a problem if the entrees were better.
The worst offenders - a LOT of orange glop on top of a small but beautiful piece of fish
(Fish in Citrus - why would you do that to the fish?
Hold the corn-starch!)...
If you go, bring your wallet and ONLY go for the crabs and garlic noodles.
garlic noodles.author: G L.
garlic noodles.review:
I'm torn...I want to give TL 5 stars, but I can't.  TL is a two-trick pony...here's why:5 Stars for efficiency, 5 for crabs and garlic noodles, 3 for customer service (our service person was great but host and the reservation clerk were cold but efficient), and 1 for the other entrees.
We had a table of 8 for a birthday dinner.  Ordered a bunch of apps, 3 entrees, 3 crabs, 3 garlic noodles...over $400! Would not have been a problem if the entrees were better.
The worst offenders - a LOT of orange glop on top of a small but beautiful piece of fish (Fish in Citrus - why would you do that to the fish?  Hold the corn-starch!)... Vegetarian Delight - broccoli, cauliflower and tomatoes in a tomato-based liquid (really?)...
Shaken beef - delicious, but precious little of it.
If you go, bring your wallet and ONLY go for the crabs and garlic noodles.

Remember - two-trick pony.

excerpts: I was not that impressed with the garlic noodles, vegetarian delight, and the colossal shrimp.
garlic noodles.author: Jennifer H.
garlic noodles.review:
I had my birthday dinner here. The best roast crab I've ever tasted. The crab was juicy, flavorful, and tender. I was not that impressed with the garlic noodles, vegetarian delight, and the colossal shrimp. The grilled squid appetizer was excellent, crispy spring rolls too yum. 

If I were to return to this place I would order the grilled squid, crisp spring rolls and roast crab.

excerpts: The vietnam salad - vegetables and vinaigrette with peanuts and the garlic noodles were better, both really tasty, but at those prices - and on top of the cost of the entree, it is really hard to recommend the place.
garlic noodles.author: Jeffrey R.
garlic noodles.review:
I tried Thanh Long with a couple of friends on a recent trip to San Francisco and went there with high hopes, because the place has a good reputation.

Unfortunately, I feel that the restaurant only partially lived up to that reputation. The food was okay: I had the drunken crab, a whole dungeness cooked in wine, pepper and spices. The preparation was excellent. The crab itself was only so-so.  Both of my friends had the royal tiger prawn, grilled with spices and served over noodles. The crab was good, not great - and did not taste fresh. The prawns garnered a similar reaction from my friends.Both dishes ran upwards of $35. 

The vietnam salad - vegetables and vinaigrette with peanuts and the garlic noodles were better, both really tasty, but at those prices - and on top of the cost of the entree, it is really hard to recommend the place. 

The service was good. We were seated quickly and it's good they have a valet in a neighborhood where street parking can be hard to find, but that is just another add-on to an expensive evening and what was in the balance only an adequate meal.

excerpts: We ordered the roast crab and the garlic noodles (what a surprise).
Crab and noodles came out quickly drowned in butter and garlicky awesomeness.
The crab meat was very flavorful and my only regret was not getting a whole crab for myself (my wallet would not allow it).
garlic noodles.author: Andrew C.
garlic noodles.review:
I seem to get crabs every time I visit San Francisco...and it seems that I have to pay for it each time..

I heard a couple of my friends rave about this place so I wanted to give it a shot. We ordered the roast crab and the garlic noodles (what a surprise). Crab and noodles came out quickly drowned in butter and garlicky awesomeness. The crab meat was very flavorful and my only regret was not getting a whole crab for myself (my wallet would not allow it). Noodles were a good complement to the crab although they do seem pretty simple to make.

Definitely make reservations as this place gets PACKED. It is also a bit on the pricier side and I have heard of a couple places that are comparable but don't charge as much. I will have to give those a shot next time to see how they hold up to Thanh Long.

Oh and quick note: Bring gum if you decide to go to any social events after, otherwise you will be know as the garlic breathing dragon.

excerpts: Went there since few friends raved about how good the garlic noodles.
Went around dinner time without reservations and our party had to wait for about 45 minutes before being seated.

No private parking lot, so parking can be hectic - but might as well go around looking for parking while dropping 1 of your party to book a spot if you don't have any reservations since you have to wait for a while anyway.
Price was pretty steep for the food we ordered - shrimp toast, shaken beef, roast crab, drunken crab, and garlic noodles.
To be honest, all the food didn't stand out for the price we pay - it wasn't bad, but it wasn't that good etiher.
For the wait and price, I should have gone to somewhere else.
garlic noodles.author: edgard k.
garlic noodles.review: Went there since few friends raved about how good the garlic noodles. Went around dinner time without reservations and our party had to wait for about 45 minutes before being seated. No private parking lot, so parking can be hectic - but might as well go around looking for parking while dropping 1 of your party to book a spot if you don't have any reservations since you have to wait for a while anyway. Price was pretty steep for the food we ordered - shrimp toast, shaken beef, roast crab, drunken crab, and garlic noodles. To be honest, all the food didn't stand out for the price we pay - it wasn't bad, but it wasn't that good etiher. For the wait and price, I should have gone to somewhere else.

excerpts: I really enjoy the Calarmari and the Garlic Noodles, but although VERY Tasty, I'm beginning to think the Roast Crab is too expensive for what its worth.
Its about $40 per crab.
When we can get it at the store for $5.99/lb., its makes it hard to accept.
garlic noodles.author: Ping N.
garlic noodles.review: Been here a few times. I really enjoy the Calarmari and the Garlic Noodles, but although VERY Tasty, I'm beginning to think the Roast Crab is too expensive for what its worth.  Its about $40 per crab. When we can get it at the store for $5.99/lb., its makes it hard to accept.

excerpts: Fried Calamari, Roast Crab, Garlic Noodles, Chocolate Lava Cake.
garlic noodles.author: Nick C.
garlic noodles.review:
I hardly update my reviews, but this restaurant deserves it. I feel compelled to give credit to such an amazing restaurant. My first experience left me with a huge smile on my face and a stomach that was on cloud 9. My second experience left me with the same feeling...that's when you know that this place is legitimate. I hope everyone in San Francisco, gets to experience eating at this restaurant. 

Recommendations: Fried Calamari, Roast Crab, Garlic Noodles, Chocolate Lava Cake.

excerpts: Drunken Crab, Roasted Crab and some garlic noodles.
Go with the classics here and just enjoy the very interactive and enjoyable eating experience.
Definitely worth the trip out to the outer sunset.
Not cheap either, but just a fun, different experience.
garlic noodles.author: Michael N.
garlic noodles.review: Drunken Crab, Roasted Crab and some garlic noodles.  Go with the classics here and just enjoy the very interactive and enjoyable eating experience.  Definitely worth the trip out to the outer sunset.  Not cheap either, but just a fun, different experience.

excerpts: Best Garlic Noodles in the bay area.
Great deal~!
garlic noodles.author: Annie H.
garlic noodles.review: Best Garlic Noodles in the bay area. Great deal~!

excerpts: I really love the garlic noodles and the crab is delicious
but I can find crab cooked the same way for way cheaper
so that's why only three stars.
garlic noodles.author: Song C.
garlic noodles.review: Don't get me wrong, I do love Thanh Long - they are good at what they do. This is a really nice place for a special dinner.  I really love the garlic noodles and the crab is delicious but I can find crab cooked the same way for way cheaper so that's why only three stars.

excerpts: We shared the garlic noodles, which definitely had a ton of garlic & maybe a bit too salty.
I would have been ok skipping desert, but we tried the fried bananas, which were quite boring.
Service was great...attentive & not rushed...we were also seated quickly.
Overall--worth a try
and we would go back.
garlic noodles.author: Tanya N.
garlic noodles.review:
We live the neighborhood, walked by many times and decided to try it out on New Year's Eve. When we walked in, we were pleasantly surprised by the atmosphere--very open, warm, and full bar.
The infused vodka martinis were unique and pretty good.
The prawn wanton appetizer was just ok-the pancetta was a bit overpowering. We each ordered an entree--the steamed sea bass was the perfect portion size & prepared well. The roast crab was delicious, but maybe a bit overpriced at $38. We shared the garlic noodles, which definitely had a ton of garlic & maybe a bit too salty. I would have been ok skipping desert, but we tried the fried bananas, which were quite boring.
Service was great...attentive & not rushed...we were also seated quickly.
Overall--worth a try and we would go back.

excerpts: The garlic noodles were tastey
I don't come for the crab or garlic noodles.
i come for the beef.
garlic noodles.author: Jennifer Q.
garlic noodles.review:
It's been awhile, maybe a year since i've been here. I'll do an update when i come back.

The roasted crab was eh. My dad makes it a lot better, but my sister likes it enough here to buy it sometimes. It's pretty pricey. I remember having garlic rice and it was a little dry but good. The garlic noodles were tastey but i've had better.

Now, what makes me want to come back here? The beef. The fricking shaken beef. Now THAT is some good stuff. I don't come for the crab or garlic noodles. i come for the beef.

excerpts: Really good garlic noodles and great crab though a bit pricey
garlic noodles.author: Pablo H.
garlic noodles.review: Really good garlic noodles and great crab though a bit pricey

excerpts: That's the only dish Thanh Long is known for plus the "to-die-for" garlic noodles.
I have not seen anyone order anything else from the menu, and you won't need to!
garlic noodles.author: Milz T.
garlic noodles.review:
This review is long overdue....

If only I can afford going to this restaurant everyday!  Vietnamese crab... you make life precious... :-)  

Yes, it's super expensive but it's totally worth every penny. You're paying for real quality here... not many seafood restaurants, even in the Wharf, can cook the crab like these people can. That's the only dish Thanh Long is known for plus the "to-die-for" garlic noodles. I have not seen anyone order anything else from the menu, and you won't need to! You will be beyond content with just crab and noodles!

And the service is even great... the waiters actually tie the bib around your neck for you before you get your crab. I never have to complain.

Even though I say in a lot of my other reviews that you must try all the places, I am absolutely serious about this one!  Put this on your priority list!!

excerpts: My in-laws wanted to try this place since they heard this place makes the best garlic noodles and crab.
When we arrived, parking was hard to find, even for a Tuesday evening!
Luckily we got to the restaurant early (around 6 pm)
b/c by 7 pm
For the four of us, (in-laws, hubby and I) we ordered one Roasted Garlic Crab, one Drunken Crab, two orders of the Garlic Noodles and one shaken beef.
For dessert, we had their deep fried pineapple
a la mode - mmm, delicious.
garlic noodles.author: Ivy P.
garlic noodles.review:
My in-laws wanted to try this place since they heard this place makes the best garlic noodles and crab.  When we arrived, parking was hard to find, even for a Tuesday evening! Luckily we got to the restaurant early (around 6 pm) b/c by 7 pm, the place was packed with lots of customers at the door waiting to be seated.  

The ambiance of this place was really nice and dimly lit, the perfect place for a date if you're ok with getting down and dirty with some crabs.  The service here was just as good as the food - very attentive, fast and professional. 

For the four of us, (in-laws, hubby and I) we ordered one Roasted Garlic Crab, one Drunken Crab, two orders of the Garlic Noodles and one shaken beef. For dessert, we had their deep fried pineapple a la mode - mmm, delicious. The shaken beef was also very flavorful and tender served over pieces of lettuce covered with some dressing.  

For Garlic Lovers, this is the place to go.  Everything was incredibly flavorful.  Although this place is known for their Roasted Garlic Crab, I personally favored the Drunken crab for it's more natural flavor cooked with the perfect complimenting wine. I would love to know how they are able to infuse the flavors so well into the crab meat.  

Warning: the Garlic flavor lingers in the mouth (and breath) hours after you're done eating. Also, it's kind of a splurge to eat here b/c of the cost (we paid $38 per crab - seasonal price) It is more expensive to go during the non crab season.  

Final Verdict: This is a MUST TRY place if you love good flavorful crab and garlic.  It's a good thing I live so far away otherwise, we'd be making this a regular stop on my list of places to eat.

excerpts: Nothing special about the garlic noodles tho they claim its made of secret stuff (that I can make at home).
Yes, I cook.
garlic noodles.author: Trynh K.
garlic noodles.review: Can't say that it was the best crab ever, it was ok...butter galore.  The shaken beef was however better than most restaurants.  Nothing special about the garlic noodles tho they claim its made of secret stuff (that I can make at home).  Yes, I cook.

excerpts: We ordered 2 Roasted Dungeness Crab, 1 Steam Sea Bass, Villager's Favorite, 2 orders of Garlic Noodles, Grilled Calamari and the Buddha Roll.
The Buddha Roll was average.
On top of all that, our "smart" waiter gave us the crab, without our garlic noodles.
And lastly, the garlic noodles.
Average.
It came out cold.
garlic noodles.author: F S.
garlic noodles.review:
This is not my first time at Thanh Long.  My first experience dated back to 2001.  Back then, I was hooked and would have given it 5 stars and more if I could.  I have been back to Thanh Long many times through the years and brought many of friends and family.  But, my last two times have been a disappointment which is what led me to write this review.

We ordered 2 Roasted Dungeness Crab, 1 Steam Sea Bass, Villager's Favorite, 2 orders of Garlic Noodles, Grilled Calamari and the Buddha Roll.  

The best dish from this selection was the Villager's Favorite, sadly.  The sauce was not salty and a perfect balance of black pepper and fish sauce.  The meat and the shrimp came out very tender.

The Buddha Roll was average.  The roll was poorly rolled and fell apart the moment we touched it.

The Roasted Crab came out too quickly.  We barely wiped our lips from the appetizers (10 minutes max), then out came the crabs.  Okay-- my first reaction was wow, they really want to turn their tables around.  Then my second reaction was these crabs were pre-roasted.  Then I wanted to hurt someone.  We did not drive all the way to the outer sunset for frozen crab!!!!  On top of all that, our "smart" waiter gave us the crab, without our garlic noodles.  So the fool had us eating the crab without any complementing food.

And lastly, the garlic noodles.  Average.  It came out cold.  Usually, these noodles do no retain heat, so I do not expect it too be hot, however cold is unacceptable.  

If Thanh Long is dishing out fast-food version of their food and service, they should dish out those same prices, so expectations will be lowered.  It will be a long time until I would try or recommend T.L.

excerpts: All i ever order from here is the crab & garlic noodles its one of the best.
hands down
garlic noodles.author: Pretty P.
garlic noodles.review: The inside doesn't do any justice but the Food here is good. Hardly any parking but so worth trying to find one & if not just give up & valet. Must have reservations else good luck! All i ever order from here is the crab & garlic noodles its one of the best. hands down

excerpts: I also ordered the red snapper "Thang Long Fish" dish and an extra plate of garlic noodles.
The crab was really good.
They obviously manage their crab selection very carefully.
All the crabs were fat 2.5lb and very juicy, a sign that they bought the freshest and the best available.
Since I've had great crabs for most of my life, I can say that the crab was solidly above average.
Their garlic butter sauce that generously covers the crab is the defining difference.
As for the garlic noodles, I suppose the experience of having hot butter-covered noodles for the first time is close to orgasmic.
But, I've had and made my share of them, so their garlic noodles were rather underwhelming.
The noodles themselves weren't fresh or tasty.
There wasn't enough fresh garlic mixed in to deliver them from mediocrity.
For $20, I got two unseasoned and deep fried fillets and a side of garlic noodles.
Based on the menu, I thought I would be experiencing some of their unique seasonings and culinary expertise with fish.
Unfortunately, the fish was no more exciting than what I could get at Red Lobster.
If you want to try the garlic noodles, just sneak a bite from somebody in your party.
I can't comment on any of their other dishes.
However, we did try several dessert items, including fried ice cream.
None of them were very good.
The fried ice cream came with a thick graceless coat of fried dough.
The orange sorbet came in a kitschy hollowed-out orange peel.
garlic noodles.author: Michael C.
garlic noodles.review:
Just went there on Saturday night on the recommendation of a friend.  We had 9 in our group, but with our reservation, there was no waiting.  They had valet parking for $10, which is a real saving grace.  Of course, I managed to find street parking down the block.  The place really doesn't look like much on the outside.  I honestly thought it was just some hole in the wall.  But when we got in, we saw all the excited and probably very hungry diners.  For decor and cleanliness, I'd rate it 3 stars.

We all ordered the roasted crab.  Several had to have a whole crab each, but I split mine as I wanted to try other dishes.  I also ordered the red snapper "Thang Long Fish" dish and an extra plate of garlic noodles.  The crab was really good.  They obviously manage their crab selection very carefully.  All the crabs were fat 2.5lb and very juicy, a sign that they bought the freshest and the best available.  Since I've had great crabs for most of my life, I can say that the crab was solidly above average.  Their garlic butter sauce that generously covers the crab is the defining difference.  It's not something you'd want to eat more than twice a month, but it sure feels good. 

The only downside is the price.  $37 for one crab (current market price) and no sides is pretty steep.  I've done my own roasting in the oven many times and it's just as good.  I guess I can try soaking it with sauteed garlic in butter too.  Since crabs are in season now, I can probably replicate the crab for $7-9.  

As for the garlic noodles, I suppose the experience of having hot butter-covered noodles for the first time is close to orgasmic.  But, I've had and made my share of them, so their garlic noodles were rather underwhelming.  The noodles themselves weren't fresh or tasty.  There wasn't enough fresh garlic mixed in to deliver them from mediocrity.  For $10 a plate of unadorned noodles, I'd expected to be freshly made and tossed.  

The "Thang Long Fish" was equally bland and underwhelming.  For $20, I got two unseasoned and deep fried fillets and a side of garlic noodles.  Based on the menu, I thought I would be experiencing some of their unique seasonings and culinary expertise with fish.  Unfortunately, the fish was no more exciting than what I could get at Red Lobster.  About the best I can say is at least the fish wasn't dry.

So, if you must come, stick with the crab and just the crab.  If you want to try the garlic noodles, just sneak a bite from somebody in your party.  I can't comment on any of their other dishes.  However, we did try several dessert items, including fried ice cream.  None of them were very good.  The fried ice cream came with a thick graceless coat of fried dough.  The orange sorbet came in a kitschy hollowed-out orange peel.  It was frozen solid so getting even tiny spoonfuls was a predicament.

For their good crabs, I'd give them 5 stars, but with all the other short-comings, I can only manage to muster up 4 stars.

excerpts: The four of us came to Thanh long and ordered 2 dishes of the incredibly tasty garlic noodles and we each had our own crabs.
garlic noodles.author: gordon w.
garlic noodles.review:
I finally got my fix of roasted garlic crab tonight. The four of us came to Thanh long and ordered 2 dishes of the incredibly tasty garlic noodles and we each had our own crabs. We order 3 roasted garlic crabs and 1 drunken crab. I would definitely recommend the roasted. Paired with a sweet white wine was the perfect combination. 
 
The crabs are freakishly large with market price today of $37.99. And the service is great, they even tie a bib on for you since we are gonna get down and dirty. The server was brutally honest when we asked which soup is good...his reply..."actually none of the soups are good here"  I thought that was hilarious, yet its great that he was just being honest. 

I'm so looking forward for my next Thahn Long fix! 

TIP** the roasted crabs are drenched in buttery sauce, eat fast before the butter coagulates. I would suggest when the crabs arrive at your table, stop all conversations and just eat quickly!

excerpts: We ordered the salmon carpaccio, roasted crab and garlic noodles.
- Salmon Carpaccio: pretty good portions, came very thinly sliced on bread.
- Garlic Noodles:
delicious, but be prepared to have garlic breath for the rest of the night and into the next day.
garlic noodles.author: Alvina W.
garlic noodles.review:
HO.LY GARLIC!

Came here with a friend for my second dinner of the night.  Yes, fatty double booked for the evening.

We ordered the salmon carpaccio, roasted crab and garlic noodles.
- Salmon Carpaccio: pretty good portions, came very thinly sliced on bread.  If you're trying to save room, I would maybe skip out on this.

- Roasted crab: I suppose this is what the bibs are for (if you've never been here before, everyone gets a bib put on them).  It was good, but overly salty.

- Garlic Noodles: delicious, but be prepared to have garlic breath for the rest of the night and into the next day.  well worth it.

Tips: CALL ahead (we made reservations for 8:15 and didn't get seated for another 10-15 min. later); pray to the parking gods because parking is horrible; ask for moist towels to clean your hands (I didn't know this was an option until I saw the table next to us request it).

excerpts: The garlic noodles and crab was very good.
But like I said, if you want crab, go to Art's Crab Shak where you get more
garlic noodles.author: Mayana P.
garlic noodles.review:
From what I can recall, this place tasted just as good as Crustaceans but that's probably because they're sister restaurants, huh? The garlic noodles and crab was very good. But like I said, if you want crab, go to Art's Crab Shak where you get more and it's tastier. 

Thanh Long is in the middle of no where and not in the best of neighborhoods. If you're looking for a cab to drive by so you can wave them down, good luck! Service was efficient but not friendly. The people that work here are stuck up and full of themselves.

excerpts: I did have the Garlic Noodles.
Amazing.
I had the Shrimp too.
Amazing.
I don't think there is a bad thing on the menu.
I am definitely coming back to Thanh Long when I am back in town.
Parking wasn't bad compared to the other restaurants we visited in SF.
garlic noodles.author: Dennis L.
garlic noodles.review: The only reason I didn't get the recommended Roasted Crab was because I had the Crab at R&G the day before.  I really regretted it after seeing the table to the right and left eating it.  I did have the Garlic Noodles.  Amazing.  I had the Shrimp too.  Amazing.  I don't think there is a bad thing on the menu.  I am definitely coming back to Thanh Long when I am back in town.  Parking wasn't bad compared to the other restaurants we visited in SF.

excerpts: We had the requisite and excellent garlic noodles and roast crab.
We decided to split a couple of appetizers, rather than getting a second crab or more noodles.
garlic noodles.author: John R.
garlic noodles.review:
We came here for my birthday dinner and had a great experience...as have so many others!

We had the requisite and excellent garlic noodles and roast crab.  We decided to split a couple of appetizers, rather than getting a second crab or more noodles.  The seafood dumplings were fine but really forgettable.  Their version of shrimp toast was good, but too pricey for the serving size.  Next time we'll go for the extra crab!

And if you like wine with your dinner, try a riesling --- we had a delicious Alsatian riesling and it went great with the food!

excerpts: The garlic noodles are indescribable and the seafood combination rice is mouth watering.
Their other restaurant is Crustaceans, but Thanh Long is better IMO and the atmosphere is more laid back and enjoyable.
Just go already!
garlic noodles.author: Jeff M.
garlic noodles.review: This is probably my favorite restaurant in SF!  You cannot beat their garlic crab..sorry PPQ, but you really suck compared to here :P  The garlic noodles are indescribable and the seafood combination rice is mouth watering.  Their other restaurant is Crustaceans, but Thanh Long is better IMO and the atmosphere is more laid back and enjoyable.  Just go already!

excerpts: Garlic roasted crab with a side of garlic noodles and garlic shrimp.
garlic noodles.author: Michelle N.
garlic noodles.review:
Garlic roasted crab with a side of garlic noodles and garlic shrimp.
Good eating!!!!!!! 

OK, you only get 4 pieces of shrimp at mkt price, which was $33.00 when I was there, but yummy, Oh, did I say it was Yummy!

excerpts: Crab, garlic noodles and a big cocktail, perfect.
My family and I try to eat here whenever they are in town visiting.
garlic noodles.author: Joe F.
garlic noodles.review:
Fantastic. Mind blasting. Amazing. Now its not quite as good as my mom makes it, but its pretty darn close! Crab, garlic noodles and a big cocktail, perfect. My family and I try to eat here whenever they are in town visiting. Been eating here since I was 10 or 12.

Definately call in advance as this place is usually packed to the gills.

excerpts: Hands down the best garlic noodles I ever had..
roasted crab was delicious
..what a wonderful combination!!!
garlic noodles.author: Wina B.
garlic noodles.review: Hands down the best garlic noodles I ever had..roasted crab was delicious ..what a wonderful combination!!!

excerpts: If you like Crustaceans you will like Thanh Long - same owners minus the dress code - best crab and garlic noodles I've ever had....
just found out they have locations in Bev Hills and apparently in Vegas.
Will be an a must next time
I'm hittin the strip.
They comped two deserts and an expresso.....
that's service.
garlic noodles.author: Robert G.
garlic noodles.review: If you like Crustaceans you will like Thanh Long - same owners minus the dress code - best crab and garlic noodles I've ever had....just found out they have locations in Bev Hills and apparently in Vegas. Will be an a must next time I'm hittin the strip. They comped two deserts and an expresso.....that's service.

excerpts: I ordered vietnamese salad, vietnamese soup, and garlic noodles.
garlic noodles.author: Cindy O.
garlic noodles.review: I have wanted to try this restaurant for years. We have gone to its sister restaurant (Crustacean) many times and I had heard that Thanh Long was a more casual restaurant with the same food as Crustacean. Thanh Long is my new favorite restaurant in SF.  I ordered vietnamese salad, vietnamese soup, and garlic noodles. Everyone else in my party ordered the roast crab.The food was so good. So many interesting flavors in the soup.  I also like that this restaurant is in a neighborhood so you don't have to go through downtown traffic to get there. If arriving from the south exit at Skyline Blvd toward Pacifica and then go down the Great Hwy (hwy 1) to Judah and 46th. They have valet parking.

excerpts: The garlic noodles are interesting to say the least -- every time I get them they are cold, so I don't know if they are supposed to be that way.
The noodles are slightly sweet and no as garlicy as the crab... it just seems out of place to me as I am eating fresh hot crab with cold noodles.
The crab and garlic noodles themselves are equally priced between the two, but PPQ offers a set menu which makes it more reasonable.
The crab is different as it doesn't have much flavor itself, but the garlic butter sauce is WAY BETTER!
There's garlic chunks in the sauce, making it all the more rich and savory.
However, the garlic noodles are not as good.
But hey, you're here for the crab!
garlic noodles.author: Debbie L.
garlic noodles.review:
This place is delicious, but I give it 4 stars since I think PPQ Dungeness Island is better. 

I've been here 5+ times in the last 3 years... first couple times were delicious! I'd never had butter garlic crab elsewhere and the flavor was just too good! I'm guessing they steam the crab with salt, pepper, and garlic infused butter (as there's always glops of salt on top making some bites super salty). The sauce the crab comes in is just butter infused with garlic (I have yet to see garlic chunks anywhere...) which is good for dipping, but I think the crab itself has enough flavor. The garlic noodles are interesting to say the least -- every time I get them they are cold, so I don't know if they are supposed to be that way. The noodles are slightly sweet and no as garlicy as the crab... it just seems out of place to me as I am eating fresh hot crab with cold noodles. I've also had their garlic rice (obviously not as novel), which I like better than the noodles, probably just because it's warm and hence doesn't have a temperature difference with the star of the show. 

Their vegetables are delicious! I didn't think I'd be ordering veggies at a seafood restaurant, but their string beans are cooked and seasoned perfectly with seasonable vegetables and a variety of mushrooms (yum!).

The most recent time I came the crab was not fresh - we were charged $40/crab (yes I know it's seasonal) and the flesh was not fresh. One person in our party even ended up with diarrhea the next day =/

Service is horrible... waitresses never come around. The place is ALWAYS crowded, and even when we had a reservation we had to wait 30 minutes (what is up with that?!) 

PPQ vs Thanh Long
So I find PPQ better and more price worthy. At PPQ you can get a full 4 course meal (appetizer, crab, noodles, dessert) for about $60. The crab and garlic noodles themselves are equally priced between the two, but PPQ offers a set menu which makes it more reasonable. The crab is different as it doesn't have much flavor itself, but the garlic butter sauce is WAY BETTER! There's garlic chunks in the sauce, making it all the more rich and savory. However, the garlic noodles are not as good. But hey, you're here for the crab!

excerpts:
AND I LOVE GARLIC NOODLES.

My boyfriend, my son, and I had an order of the Roasted Crab, Garlic Noodles, Shrimp Fried Rice, Salt and Pepper Calamari, and Chicken Satay.

and I've had better Garlic Noodles at home.
garlic noodles.author: S. B.
garlic noodles.review:
I went there for the first time last night and I must say I was super excited.  The only other restaurant I've been to like this was PPQ's, and I've only been there one time.

I LOVE CRAB AND I LOVE GARLIC NOODLES.

Based on my experience at PPQ's, I ordered what I knew to be good or what I thought would be awesome.  My boyfriend, my son, and I had an order of the Roasted Crab, Garlic Noodles, Shrimp Fried Rice, Salt and Pepper Calamari, and Chicken Satay.

Roasted Crab= OKAY
Garlic Noodles= OKAY
Shrimp Fried Rice=GOOD...simple and not greasy
Chicken Satay= OKAY, talk about charbroiled (for my 2yr old)
Salt and Pepper Calamari= GREAT

Don't get me wrong I still got down with the crab and noodles, but my tastebuds were so much more excited at PPQ's.  Honestly, in my opinion, so much better at PPQ's and I've had better Garlic Noodles at home.  

I wouldn't choose to come back unless I got invited to go there again.

excerpts: The roasted crab is great for most but too oily/buttery/salty for others, as is the garlic noodles.
I've been to Crustaceans too
but it didn't leave an impression as Thanh Long did.
The overall service was average to above average, the food above average to really good.
I prefer to have my dungeness steamed plain, you can't taste the crab nearly as much with their roasted crab.
Did anyone feel a real tingly sensation on the tongue after eating?
Any MSG detectors out there?
I don't have an issue with MSG when it's done well like here.
Worth a return visit.
garlic noodles.author: Imemine S.
garlic noodles.review:
As with any type of review you can't take everything at face value.  The roasted crab is great for most but too oily/buttery/salty for others, as is the garlic noodles.  I've been to Crustaceans too but it didn't leave an impression as Thanh Long did.  The overall service was average to above average, the food above average to really good.  I prefer to have my dungeness steamed plain, you can't taste the crab nearly as much with their roasted crab.
Did anyone feel a real tingly sensation on the tongue after eating?  Any MSG detectors out there?  I don't have an issue with MSG when it's done well like here.  Worth a return visit.

excerpts: a little pricey but delicious garlic noodles & amazing crab.
Street parking can be annoying but not terrible.
garlic noodles.author: Cynthia D.
garlic noodles.review: a little pricey but delicious garlic noodles & amazing crab. Street parking can be annoying but not terrible.

excerpts: When a restaurant calls themselves "Home of the An's Famous Garlic Noodles", I would expect it to be mindblowingly amazingly awesome.
It wasn't.
garlic noodles.author: Connie C.
garlic noodles.review:
If this place wasn't so darn expensive, I would upgrade them to 4 stars. Don't get me wrong, the food is delicious, just not sure it was $45 per person delicious especially since we only had 1 appetizer and 2 entrees.

Food: 
-Roasted Crab: By far the best dish of the night. Crab was fresh and perfectly cooked. Seasoning was peppery and buttery. I can definitely see why people rave about this crab. It is finger-licking good.
-Garlic Noodles: Their famous egg noodles with special garlic sauce. Simple dish. Tasty, but not drool-worthy. When a restaurant calls themselves "Home of the An's Famous Garlic Noodles", I would expect it to be mindblowingly amazingly awesome. It wasn't.  
-Seafood Dumplings: Pricey, flavorless and disappointing.

Wait: I came here with a friend on a Saturday night without reservations. We were told the wait would be 45 minutes. It turned out to be just 15 minutes. Score! 

Atmosphere: Looks a little dumpy on the outside, but great ambiance and fancy Asian-inspired decor on the inside. It is a bit crowded, lots of families and groups so it is noisy, but manageable.

Service: Friendly, attentive, efficient. No complaints.

excerpts: This took place a few years ago, so forgive my clouded memory, but I do remember ordering the colossal royal tiger prawns with garlic noodles and roast crab.
I actually remember informing the couple at the table next to us that the weird, green mushy stuff in the shell is actually the best part.
They were about to throw it away!
If I ruled the culinary world, the number one rule would be to NEVER discard of heads and guts of seafood and poultry.
Anyway, the crab was cooked perfectly and moist on the inside.
Somehow, they were able to get the roasted garlic essence to seep all the way through the crab without overcooking it.
Astounding.
The tiger prawns were good as well, but not as memorable as the crab.
The garlic noodles are also inimitable, even by me...for now.
My boyfriend and I have mastered our own version of roasted garlic crab based on our experiences at An-owned restaurants.
We'll actually be making it this weekend!
Nevertheless, true roasted garlic crab lies in the restaurants of An.
garlic noodles.author: Priscilla V.
garlic noodles.review: Thanh Long was the setting of another spontaneous adventure in the city for us. It is essentially Crustacean's with a more casual environment. This took place a few years ago, so forgive my clouded memory, but I do remember ordering the colossal royal tiger prawns with garlic noodles and roast crab. I actually remember informing the couple at the table next to us that the weird, green mushy stuff in the shell is actually the best part. They were about to throw it away! If I ruled the culinary world, the number one rule would be to NEVER discard of heads and guts of seafood and poultry. Anyway, the crab was cooked perfectly and moist on the inside. Somehow, they were able to get the roasted garlic essence to seep all the way through the crab without overcooking it. Astounding. The tiger prawns were good as well, but not as memorable as the crab. The garlic noodles are also inimitable, even by me...for now. My boyfriend and I have mastered our own version of roasted garlic crab based on our experiences at An-owned restaurants. We'll actually be making it this weekend! Nevertheless, true roasted garlic crab lies in the restaurants of An.

excerpts: The garlic noodles are cooked perfect.
Their just the right amount of garlic.
The roasted crab was cooked perfect and full of flavor.
I can't wait to go back.
garlic noodles.author: Tim R.
garlic noodles.review: This place is worth the hype.  I've been wanting to try this restaurant for a while now and finally got to it.  I'm upset I waited so long.  The garlic noodles are cooked perfect.  Their just the right amount of garlic. The roasted crab was cooked perfect and full of flavor.  I can't wait to go back.

excerpts:
They are known for their garlic noodles and dungeonous crab here and that is all I go here to eat. 

The garlic noodles is just enough garlic not over drenched and not super buttery oily.
garlic noodles.author: Tam T.
garlic noodles.review:
This is a high end Vietnamese cuisine restaurant. It's a modern restaurant with a hint of a classic Vietnamese tradition. They are known for their garlic noodles and dungeonous crab here and that is all I go here to eat. 

The garlic noodles is just enough garlic not over drenched and not super buttery oily. 

And the crab is pricey but it's seasoned and marinated with perfection.

Seafood lovers must try!

excerpts: Recommendations, roasted crab, garlic noodles, lemon grass chicken.
garlic noodles.author: Tommy M.
garlic noodles.review:
Lets cut all the bs and get to what you need to know.

1. You basically have to valet your car bc there's no parking anywhere.  $12.
2. They accept reservations so use it, it wasn't too busy but my family of 8 were sat the instant we were greeted.
3. Place looks crappy on the outside, classy in the inside.
4. This place aint cheap.  For appetizers, think 4 skewers of chicken satay for about $12 and their dinner plates range front $20-40.  Crab, market price. 
5. Portions suck, its quite pricey so your like ok hope portions are good.  Its prob about 1/2 to 3/4 of what you'd be expecting.  Think I'm lying..... lol nope
6.  Service was good, and food tasted great.
7.  Recommendations, roasted crab, garlic noodles, lemon grass chicken.
8.  Bill: 2Roasted dung crabs, 2Garlic noodle, 1Garlic noodle with prawns, 1Lemon grass chicken, 1shaken beef, 1chicken fried rice, 3steam rice, 1chicken satay, 2 beers, 1assorted vegetable, 1small fish dish.  $342 Grat included. 

Overall this place has mediocre service and great food, but not going to lie, Imo its overpriced.  Example, Shaken beef, $25,  literally 12 pieces of med sized cut beef and some mixed veggies, no sides.  Lets just say the garlic noodle and rice is what got most of us full and our kid sister was sleeping so it was really only 7 of us eating.

excerpts: We had Calamari appetizer , a beef veggie appetizer, garlic crab , garlic noodles, and fried rice.
Total cost for 2 people was $108 including tips.
First the Calamari was the best I have ever had
and I have had Calamari many many times as a appetizer.
Then the crab was huge and extremely tasty with loads of garlic sauce in butter.
The garlic noodles were perfect as well as the fried rice.
Everything was perfect except we brought our own sour dough bread for they do not serve it here.
The bread is perfect for sopping up the juices of the crab.
Would I eat here again, absolutely.
The garlic noodles were perfect as well as the fried rice.
Everything was perfect except we brought our own sour dough bread for they do not serve it here.
The bread is perfect for sopping up the juices of the crab.
Would I eat here again, absolutely.
garlic noodles.author: Bernadette S.
garlic noodles.review: Went to Thanh Long last night with a group of 10. We had Calamari appetizer , a beef veggie appetizer, garlic crab , garlic noodles, and fried rice. Total cost for 2 people was $108 including tips. First the Calamari was the best I have ever had and I have had Calamari many many times as a appetizer. Then the crab was huge and extremely tasty with loads of garlic sauce in butter. The garlic noodles were perfect as well as the fried rice. Everything was perfect except we brought our own sour dough bread for they do not serve it here. The bread is perfect for sopping up the juices of the crab. Would I eat here again, absolutely.

excerpts: The highlight was the garlic noodles with 4 U15 Shrimp at "Market Price
" You have no idea they are charging 35.00 $%#%&*56 dollars!
Are you kidding me??
Cheesy noodles with powered garlic 4 overcooked with 4 shrimp???
garlic noodles.author: donna n.
garlic noodles.review:
As a 16 year resident of SF I can't believe this restaurant is resting on some type of laurels.  I have been in the wine and food business for 16 years.  I am happy to spend money on great food and drink!  This is the worst experience I have ever had in  SF!!  There are so many lame things about this restaurant I'm not where to start.  First ordering garlic bread with the famous noodles consisted of frozen Cisco Bread with no spice, similar to wonder bread.  Calamari just wrong.  The highlight was the garlic noodles with 4 U15 Shrimp at "Market Price" You have no idea they are charging 35.00 $%#%&*56 dollars!  Are you kidding me??  Cheesy noodles with powered garlic 4 overcooked with 4 shrimp???  I am happy to spend  money on great food and wine but this is clearly the worst!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

HEADS UP EVERYONE, I DONT CARE IF THEY HAVE SEVERAL RESTAURANTS.  THEY CLEARLY SUCK!!!!!!!!   

LOCAL GIRL

Donna

excerpts: Roasted crab and garlic noodles... that is IT!!!!
garlic noodles.author: Sandy B.
garlic noodles.review:
Roasted crab and garlic noodles... that is IT!!!!

btw, everyone should get their own crab... cause its just that good... and I ain't sharin'!!

excerpts: For dinner we ordered roasted crab and garlic noodles.
I was in pure heaven after eating my meal.
Once our server helped us put on our bibs so we didn't get too dirty from digging into those juicy crabs we knew we were in for an adventurous ride.
The crab was steaming hot, juicy, garlic, buttery, and finger licking good.
If you weren't paying attention you would have thought I was talking about chicken
but alas you are definitely mistaken.
The garlic noodles were cooked to its absolute perfection...
buttery, garlicky.
And the noodles weren't all mushy like when you overcook noodles
and it just sticks everywhere and to anything.
These noodles had the right amount of garlic and butter to compliment the dripping wet and juicy crab we were munching on.
Are you turned on yet?
I'm craving garlic noodles.
Yum!
garlic noodles.author: Mia D.
garlic noodles.review:
First things first...I couldn't believe I could fall so much in live with dinner entrees than how much I was in love with my then boyfriend. I mean come on...I would have given up the boyfriend for these delectable dishes... 

We came here for my then bf's frat bro. Parking wasn't bad but then again I wasn't driving. There was a ton of people at this place which was to be expected. Another thing to expect is to be sandwiched at your table like a can of sardines. You can't wait to taste your entrees but are aching to get out because there's no respect for personal space. 

Anyway, we ordered cocktails of course but they were pretty pricey and honestly not that good. I think I should have just opted to drink my water instead. Oh well live and learn. We ordered the infamous calamari for appetizers which had just the right amount of batter on it so as to not lose its flavor with the typical dipping sauce accompaniment. For dinner we ordered roasted crab and garlic noodles. I was in pure heaven after eating my meal. Once our server helped us put on our bibs so we didn't get too dirty from digging into those juicy crabs we knew we were in for an adventurous ride. The crab was steaming hot, juicy, garlic, buttery, and finger licking good. If you weren't paying attention you would have thought I was talking about chicken but alas you are definitely mistaken. The garlic noodles were cooked to its absolute perfection...buttery, garlicky.  And the noodles weren't all mushy like when you overcook noodles and it just sticks everywhere and to anything. These noodles had the right amount of garlic and butter to compliment the dripping wet and juicy crab we were munching on.  Are you turned on yet? Haha. 

Now if that wasn't enough for you loosen your belt buckle a couple notches...well we ordered the fried banana with ice cream. This dessert was simply a perfect ending. The batter was light and crisp. The banana was hot and sweet. The ice cream was a great addition but maybe some chocolate for dipping would have been good too. I do love my chocolate after all. 

I could have literally died and gone to heaven after all that I had eaten. The dessert just topped off everything and I believe I had reached nirvana eating my meal...if that was even at all possible. 

I would definitely come back. I hope they have modified their set up though so we don't feel like a bunch of sardines waiting for someone to open the can so we could all jump out to freedom. 

The wait staff was nice. Reservations are recommended. Cocktails are so so. Parking is okay. Food is divine. Great atmosphere and great people. 

I want to go back already. I'm craving garlic noodles. Yum!

excerpts: Awesome crab and garlic noodles!
ago)..two of us shared 2 orders of garlic noodles, one roasted crab, the mango salad, two beers which came out to be about $120
garlic noodles.author: A. A.
garlic noodles.review:
Awesome crab and garlic noodles! 

The last time I went there (a few weeks ago)..two of us shared 2 orders of garlic noodles, one roasted crab, the mango salad, two beers which came out to be about $120

excerpts: I ordered the Drunken Crab and garlic noodles, it was delish!
garlic noodles.author: Nesha P.
garlic noodles.review: Came here last night for the first time and will def come back again. Their customer service is A-1 didnt have to wait no more than 5 mins to get our drinks. I ordered the Drunken Crab and garlic noodles, it was delish!

excerpts: BTW, $10 for the pretty ordinary garlic noodles is simply highway robbery. unless there are unique aphrodisiac properties that I have missed.
garlic noodles.author: Sempro S.
garlic noodles.review:
In the popular imagination, PPQ and Thanh Long / Crustacean are the great rivals for the crab crown of San Francisco. Both have outstanding crab, but I give PPQ the edge for authenticity. There is something vaguely Cheesecake Factory about TL that unsettles me. For me, crab is the ultimate comfort food, enjoyed in an unpretentious environment. Spare me the dark woods, mood lighting, European wait staff and mostly out-of-town guests.

BTW, $10 for the pretty ordinary garlic noodles is simply highway robbery. unless there are unique aphrodisiac properties that I have missed. =)

All in all, I found this place good but not worth the distant trek to the Sunset.

excerpts: Ahh, roasted crab and garlic noodles and garlic rice!
Well, not bad.
Thanh Long is a dining experience, but not a culinary experience.

The place is packed, everyone is having a good time at what feels like a dining hall, you get your plastic bib, hot towels to wipe your hands, crab shell crackers, crab picks, very fast and friendly service, and a big bill.
It is definitely fun though.
garlic noodles.author: Bo P.
garlic noodles.review: Ahh, roasted crab and garlic noodles and garlic rice!  Well, not bad.    Thanh Long is a dining experience, but not a culinary experience.  The place is packed, everyone is having a good time at what feels like a dining hall, you get your plastic bib, hot towels to wipe your hands, crab shell crackers, crab picks, very fast and friendly service, and a big bill. It is definitely fun though.

excerpts: The garlic noodles were great
but i felt like it would have been a lot better if they just threw in some of those yummy crab juices.
Definitely requires reservations if arriving after 5:45pm on weekends.
I did however get seated immediately without a reservation when I got there at
garlic noodles.author: Kym L.
garlic noodles.review:
Greaaaat roast crabs! The garlic noodles were great but i felt like it would have been a lot better if they just threw in some of those yummy crab juices. Definitely requires reservations if arriving after 5:45pm on weekends. I did however get seated immediately without a reservation when I got there at 5:15pm (80% of the restaurant was occupied by then though)

The salt and pepper calamari appetizer was divine as well! Will definitely be back here soon

excerpts: Other than that, the food (my usual - "roasted crab with garlic noodles") has always been consistently good!
garlic noodles.author: Anne H.
garlic noodles.review: This is always my alternative whenever Crustaceans is completely booked.  I've been here a few times with friends and the food has always been consistent.  However, I guess I'm pretty biased because I fell in love with Crustaceans FIRST, (although they're sister-restaurants).  My only gripe about this place is that each time I've been here with friends, we've always been seated upstairs, which is fine because it was always during the busy dinner time, but I wasn't too comfortable sitting so close to other parties on the second floor. The tables were too close together...So close, that I had to squeeze between tables, rubbed elbows/arms with complete strangers sitting at the table next to us, just to get to the restrooms.  But I'm hoping this only happens during their busy rush.  Now, I'm going to be nice and just say that the restrooms were below my standards as far as cleanliness, but again, that's in comparison to Crustaceans' restroom.  Regardless, I would love to see improvements in their restrooms. Other than that, the food (my usual - "roasted crab with garlic noodles") has always been consistently good!

excerpts: The boy and I drove waaaay the heck out to 46th and Judah one evening to fill our bellies with freshly buttered seafood and garlic noodles.
The boy ordered a whole crab with garlic noodles and I had the Colossal Royal Tiger Prawns served on a bed of..
you guessed it- more garlic noodles.
We thoroughly enjoyed our carb/ butter/ protein filled meal.
garlic noodles.author: Elaine T.
garlic noodles.review:
The boy and I drove waaaay the heck out to 46th and Judah one evening to fill our bellies with freshly buttered seafood and garlic noodles. Yum. 

Being that I am reviewer #626, you might guess that we were served some pretty amazing food. We shared a Soft Shell Crab starter, which was very fresh and juicy- not quite as fantastic as the same starter at House, but still very good. The boy ordered a whole crab with garlic noodles and I had the Colossal Royal Tiger Prawns served on a bed of.. you guessed it- more garlic noodles. We thoroughly enjoyed our carb/ butter/ protein filled meal. I never thought I'd find myself eyeing some lettuce garnish carelessly left on a plate from the table next to us..

The crab was bathed in steaming butter- what looked like perfection, if I were a fan of crab meat, which I am not. I am also not a fan of lobster. And I don't drink. I am the ultimate cheap date, but despair not; what I refuse in seafood and wine, I more than make up in desserts and starters!! 

I am, however, a SUPERfan of shrimp. Especially tiger prawns. Yummy yum yum. As for my order, I'd have to say that the 'Colossal' in the menu name might be a little misleading- they are Jumbo prawns at best. The prawns are splayed open when served, but if you put them back together (like I did) just to gauge their actual size: I'd say they were Jumbo, not Colossal. Size aside, the meat was tender and moist. So, so good.

Side comment on valet parking:
Not sure where exactly they took the car once we handed over the keys, but we ended up waiting like fifteen minutes with no line when we were leaving. Seriously- we made a quick trip across the street to the liquor store because they were taking so damn long. Really makes me question where they take the cars. Back home to the An Family garage, perhaps? I'm sure they can fit a few dozen cars on their property with all the money Crustaceans rakes in.

excerpts: We ordered the garlic crab and the garlic noodles.
I've never had garlic noodles before, but I was pleasantly suprised at how good it tasted.
They are very buttery and greasy though, so I'm not sure how healthy it is.
The crab was finger licking good.
garlic noodles.author: Philip J.
garlic noodles.review:
My wife and I went here on a friday night around 8:30pm and the place was very packed.  We had a reservation for 8:30, but they still had us wait 15 minutes for a table.

We ordered the garlic crab and the garlic noodles.  I've never had garlic noodles before, but I was pleasantly suprised at how good it tasted. They are very buttery and greasy though, so I'm not sure how healthy it is. The crab was finger licking good. I don't think that I've had better crab anywhere else.

The food came after about 5 minutes. So when it gets busy I'm pretty sure the crabs aren't made to order, but prepared in advance.

The table they sat us at was really small and very close to the surrounding patrons tables. It felt very awkward to be sitting so close to other couples. If you are wanting to have a private conversation with your significant other, you might want to choose somewhere else.

This is not really the best place for a quiet romantic night out. The noise level was high, mainly because of the fellow patrons. I found myself having to raise my voice quite a lot to converse with my wife.

This is a great place to bring a group of friends who don't mind getting their hands dirty.

The mood lighting was medium. Nothing special.

The restrooms are something to note. The mens restroom was just a toilet and a stall combo. They seemed to keep it clean, but  only one person could be in there at a time.

The servers were excellent. They were very attentive.

Overall, I give this place 4 stars out of five.

Nice work thanh long!

excerpts: The garlic noodles...
Need I say more?!
Currently residing in Honolulu and I have yet to find a place that is comparable to Thanh Long!
garlic noodles.author: Kris O.
garlic noodles.review:
The garlic noodles... Need I say more?! Currently residing in Honolulu and I have yet to find a place that is comparable to Thanh Long! Then again, it doesn't compare to any other restaurant! 

The crab is excellent and worth the $$$. Place is small and highly recommend making reservations.

excerpts: The best garlic noodles ever had in the city!
garlic noodles.author: LZ T.
garlic noodles.review: Love this place! The best garlic noodles ever had in the city!  I recommend the roast and drunken crab. It's about $40 per crab but it's a huge crab.

excerpts: Roasted pepper crab was smacking, fully flavorful deep inside the crab, garlic noodles are simply delicious. .
garlic noodles.author: Keeping It Real G.
garlic noodles.review: Roasted pepper crab was smacking, fully flavorful deep inside the crab, garlic noodles are simply delicious. .

excerpts: Garlic noodles.
tasty!
but they use garlic powder.
garlic noodles.author: Judy N.
garlic noodles.review:
dungeness Crab... So good! tons of flavor... I was the last to arrive at our dinner party (traffic and what-not...) and when I got there, they ordered more food, and my friends visiting still had room in their bellies to eat more when I arrived. (had room or the food was so good they had to eat more of it... same same... right? haha) 

Garlic noodles. tasty! but they use garlic powder. I think i can do this at home. 

Saigon beef salad. Yum! it's like the beef rolled up around an onion and grilled. yum. clean salad, with tons of flavor. :)

excerpts: Def would recommend it over Thanh Long, though this place does have better garlic noodles...
garlic noodles.author: Juliana C.
garlic noodles.review: Went to PPQ again last week and I gotta say, the crab tasted much fresher, was meatier, and overall was way more delicious! Def would recommend it over Thanh Long, though this place does have better garlic noodles...

excerpts: This is the best crab and garlic noodles I have ever tasted.
I limit my excursions here to once a year as all is swimming in delicious butter.
garlic noodles.author: Carolyn H.
garlic noodles.review: This is the best crab and garlic noodles I have ever tasted.  I limit my excursions here to once a year as all is swimming in delicious butter.

excerpts: I was addicted to the garlic noodles then.
I'd long heard about this legendary restaurant and just never made it out to 46th avenue until last evening.
Thanh Long has a long and venerable history in San Francisco.
It almost pains me to write this review because I came away with my socks still firmly attached to my feet.
I was not blown away as others have been.
I was very sad about it, too.
I ordered the Tiger Prawns over garlic noodles.
The garlic noodles were a known aspect, so I knew what to expect, they were as garlicky as I remembered.
The 4 prawns were butterflied and grilled and were tasty.
For a market price item I thought the prawns were very spendy, just a few bucks under the price of a crab.
My overall thoughts are this was tasty, but, a plate of garlic noodles and 4 prawns and salad set me back $60 and I came away unsatisfied.
I wanted to be blown away, I'd heard the stories
garlic noodles.author: Donna H.
garlic noodles.review:
I only knew Thanh Long from their short-lived take out counter in the food court of One Market Plaza in FiDi many moons ago.  I was addicted to the garlic noodles then.  I'd long heard about this legendary restaurant and just never made it out to 46th avenue until last evening. Thanh Long has a long and venerable history in San Francisco.   It almost pains me to write this review because I came away with my socks still firmly attached to my feet.  I was not blown away as others have been.  I was very sad about it, too.  I wanted to have my socks blown off.

The meal began with salt & pepper calamari and it was tasty.  The best thing we ate all evening.  The vietnamese salad was generous but lacked flavor.  It was essentially super fine shredded cabbage.  The prawns on top were boiled, tender and split.  

I ordered the Tiger Prawns over garlic noodles.  The garlic noodles were a known aspect, so I knew what to expect, they were as garlicky as I remembered.  The 4 prawns were butterflied and grilled and were tasty.  For a market price item I thought the prawns were very spendy, just a few bucks under the price of a crab.  Ouch!  

One of my dinner companions ordered drunken crab and declared it yummy but not mind blowing.  We all tasted and commented, however, the crab was not fresh but frozen.  So that was a bit of a let down.  Yes, Dungeness are out of season locally but can be had fresh farther up the coast.  If I come back to try to famous roasted crab, I'll come back when it's in season.  

My overall thoughts are this was tasty, but, a plate of garlic noodles and 4 prawns and salad set me back $60 and I came away unsatisfied.  I wanted to be blown away, I'd heard the stories and I just was not super impressed.  

The service was fine, attentive and not overwhelming.  Water was refilled and bowls were replaced quickly.  The hot towels were great and a must.

The place was also incredibly noisy.  Obviously a celebration destination, be prepared to have trouble holding a conversation.  We had no desserts.

excerpts: I wouldn't run home to granny about the garlic noodles and the crab and everything else is way over-priced.
I don't know what it is
but I leave here so energized.
It might be the cheap plastic bibs (diapers not included) they wrap around your neck, but I think they lace the crab with whatever Whitney & Bobby are smoking.
garlic noodles.author: Jen Y.
garlic noodles.review:
Thanh Long, me love you long time. 

Okay I can't say I love you long time since I only discovered you a couple months ago, but I am pretty fond of you.  Food is good. I wouldn't run home to granny about the garlic noodles and the crab and everything else is way over-priced. I don't know what it is but I leave here so energized. It might be the cheap plastic bibs (diapers not included) they wrap around your neck, but I think they lace the crab with whatever Whitney & Bobby are smoking. That's probably why they have a "Secret Kitchen".  

Service is outstanding and they don't laugh when they see you acting like a caveman trying get the last piece of crab meat out of one of the annoying crab crevasse, joint, elbow or orifice.
 
Mr. Long, I'm in like with you and this is the best way to describe my feelings. http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zBFaNkvrp0g

excerpts: Roasted Crab and Garlic Noodles are to die for!
The Chambord lemon drop is a yummy.
garlic noodles.author: Dionne M.
garlic noodles.review:
Roasted Crab and Garlic Noodles are to die for!  The Chambord lemon drop is a yummy.  The fried rice and tiger prawns are good too.  

The street parking sucks so we always valet park (these boys really work for the $10.00 fee).  The ambience is more casual than Crustacean (their sister restaurant), perfect for small parties or family gatherings.

I have been dining here for 20 years and the food is always consistent.  We took some out of town family members and one of them said "I think this was the best meal I have ever had!"  

Reservations are a must, unless you want to wait an hour or more.

excerpts: That said, I enjoy garlic noodles, crab and expensive cocktails
so I quite like coming here if we are already in the neighborhood.
garlic noodles.author: Poppy C.
garlic noodles.review: So if you're gonna be snooty this isn't the place for you.  It's kind of like an independant asian themed Red Lobster but with crab.  That said, I enjoy garlic noodles, crab and expensive cocktails so I quite like coming here if we are already in the neighborhood.

excerpts: Amazing roasted crab, garlic noodles and garlic rice.
Wow I must do again.
garlic noodles.author: Dwight S.
garlic noodles.review: OMG! Amazing roasted crab, garlic noodles and garlic rice. Wow I must do again.

excerpts: We had the garlic noodles and garlic rice to go with it!
garlic noodles.author: Cindy D.
garlic noodles.review:
Service was good. 

I had the crab in wine sauce and it was delicious! We had the garlic noodles and garlic rice to go with it! That was delicious as well!

We had two drinks, apple martini and champagne cocktail. That gave us a good buzz!

I feel like they're overrated, but I'd still go back.

excerpts: Ok, the crab was good and the garlic noodles were hella good, but I just felt like I was getting ripped off.
I have NO problem shelling out the big bucks for a great meal, but for me the crab just wasn't quite worth it.
garlic noodles.author: Katie S.
garlic noodles.review:
Maybe my expectations were too high...  Ok, the crab was good and the garlic noodles were hella good, but I just felt like I was getting ripped off.   I have NO problem shelling out the big bucks for a great meal, but for me the crab just wasn't quite worth it.   It is cheaper than Crustacean, it's sister restaurant, but I still felt it was too expensive for that it was...

Parking was really tricky.  I had to walk through a group of punk kids that were hanging out at the bus stop outside as I left.  Luckily, my crazy garlic breath probably warded them and any vampires away.

excerpts: What we ordered was the roasted crab, garlic noodles, salt and pepper calamari, fried banana with ice cream & mango&strawberry parfait.
Mhmm....
everything there was delicious.
Roasted crab
; it was delicious but at the same time it was a little bit salty.
Garlic noodles; that was mucho good!
Salt and pepper calamari; yummmmmm.
Okay so for dessert, I ordered the fried banana with ice cream and my boyfriend ordered the mango&strawberry parfait.
Lol what was funny was that my boyfriend ordered the parfait
but he thought it was actual parfait where it has flakes and
all that
but it was like a smoothie with some rum!
Haha.
Anyways, they didn't even check our ID's and I guess they assumed we were 21 lol which was great haha.
Pricing wise, it's kinda expensive but the crabs were market price which was $39 ish, garlic noodles were around $10, salt and pepper calamari was like maybe $8?
Overall it was great service, delicious food
and I definitely would love to go back there!!!
Pricing wise, it's kinda expensive but the crabs were market price which was $39 ish, garlic noodles were around $10, salt and pepper calamari was like maybe $8?
Overall it was great service, delicious food
and I definitely would love to go back there!!!
garlic noodles.author: Monica W.
