garlic noodles.review: Oh man....this restaurant is AWESOME! :) I've been here in the past but I don't really remember but anyways, my boyfriend and I went to eat here last night for our early 3 years anniversary. We had reservation at 7:30 and we didn't even have to wait which was good. What we ordered was the roasted crab, garlic noodles, salt and pepper calamari, fried banana with ice cream & mango&strawberry parfait. Mhmm....everything there was delicious. Roasted crab; it was delicious but at the same time it was a little bit salty. Garlic noodles; that was mucho good! Salt and pepper calamari; yummmmmm. Okay so for dessert, I ordered the fried banana with ice cream and my boyfriend ordered the mango&strawberry parfait. Lol what was funny was that my boyfriend ordered the parfait but he thought it was actual parfait where it has flakes and all that but it was like a smoothie with some rum! Haha. Anyways, they didn't even check our ID's and I guess they assumed we were 21 lol which was great haha. Pricing wise, it's kinda expensive but the crabs were market price which was $39 ish, garlic noodles were around $10, salt and pepper calamari was like maybe $8? Overall it was great service, delicious food and I definitely would love to go back there!!! :)

excerpts: (don't make the mistake of getting anything else) and these are the roasted crab and garlic noodles.
garlic noodles.author: Joey C.
garlic noodles.review:
One of the "hidden treasures" only savvy locals know about, Thanh Long is located far from the usual hotspots in San Francisco (it's actually in a pretty dead spot, if I may say), parking is horrendously difficult to come by and the restaurant interior itself is more or less rundown. 

There are really only two things worth ordering on the menu (don't make the mistake of getting anything else) and these are the roasted crab and garlic noodles. However, these two dishes are more than worth all the trouble. 

Simply put, Thanh Long's crabs are the best in the whole Bay Area. Hence, if you a liking for crustacean fare, this is one place you cannot miss. You'll leave with your mouth throbbing with a peppery aftertaste. Utterly delicious!

(As an aside, don't make the error of simply going to Crustacean- Thanh Long's more upscale incarnation. It may be in a nicer part of town, but it's significantly more expensive and less delectable.)

excerpts: We had the whole roasted crab, shrimp, mussels, calamari, beef, and GARLIC NOODLES!!!
Hands down, the best garlic noodles I've ever had.
My other favorite was the crab.
I don't know what more I can say than
this place was simply delish.
WELL
DONE THANH LONG!
I will be making my way out to see you again soon.
garlic noodles.author: Noneya B.
garlic noodles.review: Wow, this place is AMAZING - I can't believe I've never eaten here before. We had the whole roasted crab, shrimp, mussels, calamari, beef, and GARLIC NOODLES!!!  Hands down, the best garlic noodles I've ever had. My other favorite was the crab.  I don't know what more I can say than this place was simply delish. WELL DONE THANH LONG!  I will be making my way out to see you again soon.

excerpts: The Garlic noodles are the best.
Traveled all over and haven't found anything comparable.
They are excellent!
garlic noodles.author: Darryl P.
garlic noodles.review: The Garlic noodles are the best. Traveled all over and haven't found anything comparable. They are excellent!

excerpts: OMG the garlic noodles were delicious.
Honestly, just get the crab & garlic noodles.
You'll regret it if you don't because they're so damn good
garlic noodles.author: linda t.
garlic noodles.review:
OMG the garlic noodles were delicious. The roast crab was like crack. I loved it. You will definitely drop a pretty penny but it's worth it. Honestly, just get the crab & garlic noodles. You'll regret it if you don't because they're so damn good :)

The service is great - super fast turnout for food & amazing date-like ambiance. You will get messy, don't wear white (even though they give you a bib). You will smell like garlic for a few days - it will be wonderful. Make reservations.

excerpts: But there are two reasons to come here, the garlic noodles and the roast crab.
The garlic noodles were nice as well.
garlic noodles.author: David D.
garlic noodles.review:
Thanh Long has a menu.  A pretty extensive one.  But there are two reasons to come here, the garlic noodles and the roast crab.  Making a meal of anything else here would be like doing chicken at a steakhouse.  

Yes we did get a few additional things.  An appetizer of salt and pepper calamari was a bit rubbery but nicely spiced and was OK.   The Vietnamese salad was mainly cabbage with some stray shrimp and strange tasting chicken that was best forgotten.  Likewise the Mango salad composed of tasteless mango and some stray shrimp.  The scallops described on the menu as being in the salad were undetectable.  Also best forgotten were mains of stringy steamed sea bass and shaken beef marinated to the point where the beef had lost texture and taste.  

The saving graces here were the roasted whole crab, which had obviously been done in garlic and some pepper.  Not a wondrous dish but fresh crab that was properly prepared.  The garlic noodles were nice as well.  Nothing remarkable about this plate, just noodles with oodles of garlic.   

So come.  Get your fix of crab and noodles.  Avoid the rest of the menu and you will do well for yourself.

excerpts: (SF native) strongly suggested I have the roasted crab and garlic noodles, so I didn't argue.
I guess I should say something about the garlic noodles.
The al dente, gnocchi like flavor was delicious, and if I haven't formed such a meaningful relationship with the crab, I probably could say more.
I finished up with an orange cream sorbet served in an orange shell.
Hints of  rose?
lavender?
I'm not sure
, I was still garlicking over the crab.
Also finished with a green oolong since they were out of the rose tea.
garlic noodles.author: Trish K.
garlic noodles.review:
OH.MY.GOD. I have died and gone to heaven.

I'm from NC. I'm here in SF on a business trip and my boss (SF native) strongly suggested I have the roasted crab and garlic noodles, so I didn't argue. Apps included calamari, mussels and salmon carpaccio. Awesome calamari - hot, crispy and a hint of heat in the seasoning. The mussels were a bit tough but seasoned well and served with piping hot, crispy crostini. The carpaccio was amazing - perfectly sliced with capers and a hint of lemon.

But let's talk about this freaking amazing roasted crab. 

They tell me it's locally caught Dungeness. Holy cow. This East Coast chick obviously doesn't know how good Dungeness can be. After the obligatory plastic bib was tied on, they brought me the crab. HUGE. FRESH. Smothered in a pepper garlic seasoning that made me lick my fingers, in public, numerous times. I laid waste to this beautiful creature in about 30 minutes. The staff was awesome - exchanged my shell bowl numerous times and did not comment on all of the bits of shell that were flying off my plate. Seriously, that's how good it was. 

I guess I should say something about the garlic noodles. The al dente, gnocchi like flavor was delicious, and if I haven't formed such a meaningful relationship with the crab, I probably could say more.
I finished up with an orange cream sorbet served in an orange shell. Hints of  rose? lavender? I'm not sure, I was still garlicking over the crab. 
Also finished with a green oolong since they were out of the rose tea. Only "boo" I have to this dining experience.

Thank you Thanh Long and the An family. This is one of the best meals I've ever had.

excerpts: And then the garlic noodles---greasy, gooey, and overgarlicky, not to mention salty to the extreme.
Worst crab dish ever.
Just barely above the stuff sold as walkaway crab salads on Fisherman's Wharf.
Yes.
THAT BAD.
And way more expensive.
Never coming back, no matter what.
And also no longer trusting the two who shilled for this misbegotten ripoff.
This kind of reminds me of the overrated crap that Cecilia Chang was putting out with her Mandarin Restaurant for so many decades.
garlic noodles.author: Bailey L.
garlic noodles.review: Thanh Long is  a textbook example of mass hysteria and the power of good PR and a positive press. We came here on the advice of an Inner Sunset resident who generally is spot on regarding restaurant recs.  Cutting to the chase, the roasted crab was a grossly overpriced simpleminded roasted/baked whole crab drowned in butter.  This is supposed to be something special?  REALLY?????  And then the garlic noodles---greasy, gooey, and overgarlicky, not to mention salty to the extreme.  Worst crab dish ever.  Just barely above the stuff sold as walkaway crab salads on Fisherman's Wharf.  Yes.  THAT BAD. And way more expensive.    Never coming back, no matter what.  And also no longer trusting the two who shilled for this misbegotten ripoff.  This kind of reminds me of the overrated crap that Cecilia Chang was putting out with her Mandarin Restaurant for so many decades.

excerpts: 1 Garlic Noodles $9.95.
This was the most ridiculous waste of money.
It is literally, a giant plate of greasy spaghetti covered in a butter-like substance with sugar and powdered garlic.
It was so greasy that I could not even finish half of it.
I have no clue how people eat a whole plate of this stuff, let alone with their greasy seafood on top.
Yuck.
Not to mention, should this really cost 10$?
garlic noodles.author: Erika B.
garlic noodles.review:
This place is disgusting. 

1 Buddha Roll $7.95. This was the only OK thing we ordered. Descent, but only 2 rolls. 

1 Garlic Noodles $9.95. This was the most ridiculous waste of money. It is literally, a giant plate of greasy spaghetti covered in a butter-like substance with sugar and powdered garlic. It was so greasy that I could not even finish half of it. I have no clue how people eat a whole plate of this stuff, let alone with their greasy seafood on top. Yuck. Not to mention, should this really cost 10$? Not worth it, at all. 

1 Colossal Tiger Prawns $34.95. The shrimp were splayed in half to make them look larger than they actually were and served on top of a giant bed of greasy garlic spaghetti. The shrimp themselves, were also covered in greasy butter stuff. They tasted OK, but also were very oily. 

1 Vegetarian Delight $14.95. This was possibly the last mistake we made: ordering vegetables at this grease-hole. This was inedible. They came covered in a sauce which reminded both of us of Chief Boyardee tomato sauce. Gross. We did not eat any of it, and they did not even ask if any thing was wrong with the food. This place sucks. 

We will NOT be returning, and would never recommend this to anyone. The only remaining thing I can add is that we did NOT order the crab (their specialty); this must be god-awful amazing, because otherwise I have no idea how anyone eats here. Yuck.

excerpts:
Must try (stuff your face):

roast crab

GARLIC NOODLES

huzzah.
garlic noodles.author: AC M.
garlic noodles.review:
Must try (stuff your face):

roast crab

GARLIC NOODLES

huzzah.

excerpts: The garlic noodles and spring rolls are awesome.
I'm not a big crab person, but I love this place nonetheless!
The service is superb.
The only catch here is that it's pretty pricey, so if you're dining with friends, be sure to warn them!
Great place for a special occasion.
garlic noodles.author: Bernadette W.
garlic noodles.review: I love the fact that this restaurant is a hidden treasure in the lower sunset. The garlic noodles and spring rolls are awesome. I'm not a big crab person, but I love this place nonetheless! The service is superb. The only catch here is that it's pretty pricey, so if you're dining with friends, be sure to warn them! Great place for a special occasion.

excerpts: However, if you know and have tasted real Asian food before, this place is an elaborated rip- off..they were advertised for their "garlic noodles" dish.. on television.
It tasted no better than egg noodles with oil, fried garlic, and garlic powder...
yup..nothing else..
you ordered a fish right..?
It must be soo good and big...
it's 25 bucks!. .When
the fish came..
it's a 3x1 inch cut piece of dried flavorless meat, decorated with two pieces of  itsy bitsy bok choy...
Everything else on their menu is basically dipped in oil..
So...if you have had REAL Asian food(or if you are Asian)....
just Chinese take out alone, would beat this place into pieces...
(I'm Vietnamese...and share the same nationality as the owners of this place...
sorry to be mean..
but it's only moral to announce my opinion and let others know of what to avoid before donating to the wrong organization).
garlic noodles.author: GoodThoughtz F.
garlic noodles.review: So this place gets advertised on television...It's supposed to be sooo great...However, if you know and have tasted real Asian food before, this place is an elaborated rip- off..they were advertised for their "garlic noodles" dish.. on television. It tasted no better than egg noodles with oil, fried garlic, and garlic powder...yup..nothing else..you ordered a fish right..? It must be soo good and big...it's 25 bucks!. .When the fish came..it's a 3x1 inch cut piece of dried flavorless meat, decorated with two pieces of  itsy bitsy bok choy...Everything else on their menu is basically dipped in oil..So...if you have had REAL Asian food(or if you are Asian)....just Chinese take out alone, would beat this place into pieces...(I'm Vietnamese...and share the same nationality as the owners of this place...sorry to be mean..but it's only moral to announce my opinion and let others know of what to avoid before donating to the wrong organization).

excerpts: Cant beat their garlic noodles, shaken beef and garlic crabs.
Delish!
garlic noodles.author: Kent P.
garlic noodles.review: Cant beat their garlic noodles, shaken beef and garlic crabs. Delish!

excerpts: I like to get a bowl of garlic noodles.
garlic noodles.author: Jackilyn B.
garlic noodles.review:
Thanh Long (and Crustacean's) are the best restaurants to go to if you are a crab fiend!  

For starters, I usually get grilled calamari and a cocktail!  Their roasted crab is a good size and comes to your table piping hot with melted butter spilled all over it--finger lickin good!
To accompany my crab (yes I said MY crab because I order my own!) I like to get a bowl of garlic noodles. 

I've had my birthday here before and we occupied a whole section of the restaurant. They handled my party of about 30 people very well. 

I come here often and will continue to come here often. Someone once recommended this other restaurant to me because "it is cheaper and tastes just like Thanh Long"----ok, yes it is significantly cheaper, but NO it does not taste anything like TL! We will leave the restaurant name out to spare them! 

Anyway, HIGHLY recommend this place, gO gO gO! After writing this review, I think I'll head there tonight too...

excerpts: We feasted on the famous Garlic Noodles (a MUST!)
and it was absolutely amazing!
garlic noodles.author: S. V.
garlic noodles.review:
I love the Crustacean family of restaurants! I've been to Crustacean Beverly Hills (my fave restaurant), the one in SF, and finally...finally I tried Thanh Long.

This place is oh so good! We had the Crab Puffs. To sum it up best, my friend said, "I just cannot be friends with anyone who doesn't think this crab puff is good." I say touché to that! We feasted on the famous Garlic Noodles (a MUST!) and it was absolutely amazing! In addition, we ordered 3 crabs - Tamarind Crab, Drunk Crab (with chardonnay), and the Garlic Crab. Everything was absolutely delicious. 

The location could be better and I think the staff did their best to regulate the drunken patrons over at the bar, but boy they were obnoxious and loud. They would erraticly shout cuss words at each other and I totally thought they were going to start boxing each other. Doesn't make for the most romantic restaurant but I think the food makes up for it. 

When in SF, Thanh Long is a must have!

excerpts: I reccomend ordering the mussels for an appetizer and the roasted crab and garlic noodles as your main course.
Keep up the good work!
garlic noodles.author: Mika M.
garlic noodles.review: I was first introduced to this restaurant by a friend a few years ago. My family and I have been religiously eating here for our birthdays. The atmosphere and customer service is spot on just like the food. I reccomend ordering the mussels for an appetizer and the roasted crab and garlic noodles as your main course. Keep up the good work!

excerpts: Also, with all the hype about how good the garlic noodles were, I was expecting it to blow my mind!
Did it?
Nope...
No blowing my mind...
No wind in my hair...
Heck, not even a slight breeze!
The noodles were salty, mushy, and lacked real garlic.
I felt like they could have used some real garlic and not just some store bought garlic salt.
garlic noodles.author: Yen H.
garlic noodles.review:
What can I say...I just didn't care too much for the food. I've had Crustacean before and they basically serve the same food. However, this place is not nearly as good as the experience I had at Crustacean. 

The food was bleh...The crab was very salty...AND I LOVE salty food! But this was way too salty, even for me. I was disappointed since crab is my favorite food in the whole world! 

Also, with all the hype about how good the garlic noodles were, I was expecting it to blow my mind! Did it? Nope...No blowing my mind...No wind in my hair...Heck, not even a slight breeze! The noodles were salty, mushy, and lacked real garlic. I felt like they could have used some real garlic and not just some store bought garlic salt. I was so sad that I had to pay for this meal when I pretty much could have made it myself...

The only thing I actually liked at this place were the mussels with pesto sauce.

Service was not bad. Although it wasn't as good as Crustacean's service, but it was decent. 

I felt sooooo bad dragging  my brother and mom all the way to this place only to turn out to be a total dissapointment. I wanted to like this place since I enjoyed my dining experience at it's sister restaurant at Crustacean. I'm gunna have to taste Crustacean a 2nd time to confirm that I really still love it.

excerpts: We always get the roast crab, garlic noodles and seasonal veggies.
We have been known to drive all the way from Sacramento for the evening JUST to eat here.
Probably my favorite restaurant ever!
garlic noodles.author: Andrea A.
garlic noodles.review:
This place has the BEST roast crab I've ever had.  My husband and I discovered this place when he lived in the sunset a couple of years ago and we absolutely love it.  
We always get the roast crab, garlic noodles and seasonal veggies.  
We have been known to drive all the way from Sacramento for the evening JUST to eat here.  Probably my favorite restaurant ever!

excerpts: The garlic noodles are out of this world.
I don't know what they do to them
but it's magical.
I can't comment on many more dishes since I always get the crab and garlic noodles
:D
garlic noodles.author: Alisa M.
garlic noodles.review:
This place is pretty pricey and there's usually a wait.
I go here on special occasions, usually once a year. 
(during crab season)
Amazing vietnamese marinated crab!!  I recommend everyone gets their own crab, but they run about $36 each or so... just the crab, no sides included.
The garlic noodles are out of this world.  I don't know what they do to them but it's magical.
You will be in a food coma for sure but it will be worth it!

I can't comment on many more dishes since I always get the crab and garlic noodles :D

excerpts: And garlic noodles?
Yeah, they're good, but really not so tough to make.
garlic noodles.author: April Y.
garlic noodles.review:
My friends love this place, but I will never return.  My family cooks crab at home.  We bring those live suckers home and watch them die.  (Well, I don't because it makes me sad, but not so sad that I won't eat them.)  

Judging by the quality of the crab meat, Thanh Long served us crabs that were dead and not very fresh.  It appears the only purpose of the crab seasoning was an attempt to mask the stench of dead crab.  And garlic noodles?  Yeah, they're good, but really not so tough to make.  Way overpriced for the inferior quality of food.  

As for my friends that like to eat here?  These are the same ones that can't tell the difference between chicken and pork.

excerpts: Roasted crab + garlic noodles = the best.
But, r. crab + garlic noodles make up for the rest.
garlic noodles.author: Kanani P.
garlic noodles.review:
Roasted crab + garlic noodles = the best.

appetizers = not that good

service = friendly but not that good, either.

But, r. crab + garlic noodles make up for the rest.

excerpts: The Garlic Noodles are fantastic!
They had a perfect balance of garlic, not too much, not too little, and very flavorful.
We shared a plate for two, but secretly I could've scarffed the whole plate down myself...hahah!
We had a salad (forgot which one) but it had an amazing raspberry vinaigrette, very, very delicious.
And of course we ordered the Roasted Crab....to die for.
Hands down the best crab I've ever had!
Seasoned with pepper and cooked to perfection...
I can't even verbalize it, you just have to try this!
garlic noodles.author: Araceli E.
garlic noodles.review:
I had the pleasure of being treated to this last Sunday....pure heaven I tell you! Cozy little place with good ambiance and great service.

The Garlic Noodles are fantastic! They had a perfect balance of garlic, not too much, not too little, and very flavorful. We shared a plate for two, but secretly I could've scarffed the whole plate down myself...hahah!
We had a salad (forgot which one) but it had an amazing raspberry vinaigrette, very, very delicious.
And of course we ordered the Roasted Crab....to die for. Hands down the best crab I've ever had! Seasoned with pepper and cooked to perfection...I can't even verbalize it, you just have to try this!
We also had the Steamed Sea Bass and it was wonderful too, but it just didn't hold a candle to the Roasted Crab...sorry little Sea Bass, you were out-shined!
Had dessert too (hey, we had an appetitie...for destruction..lol), banana cake something with ice-cream, topped off with a Lace Latte...perfect way to end dinner.

Pricey but worth it, nice way to treat a lady to a spontaneous and romantic dinner after hanging out at Ocean Beach....LOVED IT. Only missing one star because the place is small and there isn't much privacy.

excerpts: And time and time again, I order the same thing: roasted crab and  garlic noodles.
Can't.
Go.
Wrong.
If you're one of those happy-go-lucky food snobs such as I and love, and I mean...LOVE....food that is rich and infused with artery-clogging butter
garlic noodles.author: Blenda L.
garlic noodles.review:
I've been here so many times, I think they should just engrave my name in one of their chairs in my honor.

Anytime I have friends or family visit from out of town, Thanh Long is on the top of my list of places to take them. And time and time again, I order the same thing: roasted crab and  garlic noodles. Can't. Go. Wrong. If you're one of those happy-go-lucky food snobs such as I and love, and I mean...LOVE....food that is rich and infused with artery-clogging butter (NO REGRETS HERE!), these two dishes are going to be your BFF. 

As for the ambiance - absolutely love it. You would have never guessed it was so lovely and quaint inside. The clientele is usually very well dressed. But what better way to class it up than to roll up your sleeves, put on a lobster bib, and start licking away at your fingers? 

Now...off to finding another sucker...er, I mean friend/family member to drop for a visit....

excerpts: The garlic noodles are my favorite.
garlic noodles.author: Tram N.
garlic noodles.review:
I never thought a Vietnamese restaurant can be of elegance.. not to offend anyone or put down on my own but I was super impressed w/ the atmosphere and service.  The hostess was in an ao dai.. the staff was very accomodating, customer-servicy, and fast.  

The garlic noodles are my favorite.  We ordered fried rice (I think it costs around $7) but when it came out, it looked bland and discolored but the taste was powerful.  My husband ordered the tamirand crab.. nothing like anywhere..

This place has my full recommendation!

excerpts: LOVE LOVE LOVE their ROASTED CRAB w/ GARLIC NOODLES!
I felt bad cause my gfs had to pay a lot for tip+tax when they just ordered garlic noodles $9.50...
garlic noodles.author: Rose P.
garlic noodles.review:
LOVE LOVE LOVE their ROASTED CRAB w/ GARLIC NOODLES! 

I celebrated my quarter of a century last weekend and thank goodness i made reservations! When we left the restaurant @9, their were lots of people still waiting. The service is amazing too! Our food was served within 15 minutes after we placed our orders. 

Roasted Crab $40+Garlic Noodles $10=$ 50+T.T.~$60 
We had a party of 8 and 4 people ordered the r.c. and the rest ordered just noodles.  I felt bad cause my gfs had to pay a lot for tip+tax when they just ordered garlic noodles $9.50...OH WELL! 

Our tab came out to $347 cause they already added the 18% gratuity. Expensive! But what do you expect! it's seafood and the service is great! so that's why i am giving them -1 star!

excerpts: Same with their Garlic Noodles.
More slip and great texture.
garlic noodles.author: Alyson C.
garlic noodles.review:
Might as well write the 700th review which echoes what everyone else says. Mind you, this was a heavenly meal - and not just cause I didn't eat for 5 days straight before I came here... (don't ask why I fasted). 

I was an avid PPQ follower when it came to my Roasted Crab and Garlic Noodle combo, but oohhweeee... Thanh Long was something else.

The spices on the outside of the crab was way too delicious that I found myself sucking those spices forever and ever... the peppery and garlicky goodness was pure bliss. PPQ's spices is butter, butter and more butter, lumpy and quickly congeals (blech)... which, although deliciously delightful, it's supremely evil on my curves. 

Anyway, long story short, PPQ serves a bigger crab, but Thanh Long's is the tastiest! Same with their Garlic Noodles. More slip and great texture.

excerpts: I have tried to make the garlic noodles at home
and it was an epic fail.
garlic noodles.author: kate b.
garlic noodles.review:
The garlic noodle is to die for, and so is the crab. yumyum! Nice ambiance.  The wait is a bit long but who cares totally worth it.

I have tried to make the garlic noodles at home and it was an epic fail.  It just cannot be replicated.

Would come back for sure!

excerpts: Garlic roasted crab, garlic noodles and fried banana...
= yummy!!
Whole roasted crab with garlic, pepper and butter.
Sooooo good.
Pricey, but good!
garlic noodles.author: Russell T.
garlic noodles.review:
Love this place. Garlic roasted crab, garlic noodles and fried banana... = yummy!!
Whole roasted crab with garlic, pepper and butter. Sooooo good. Pricey, but good!

excerpts: I ordered the roasted crab and garlic noodles.
This place is small and had dim lighting.
It was a pretty comfy atmosphere, but crowded.
The crab was very tasty and yummy!
But this place was expensive, well it's always expensive since it's seafood.
I was lucky that this a treat for all my hard work throughout the year
so I didn't have to pay
I was so full from the crab that I had to take most of the garlic noodles home!
I can't believe I could actually down a whole crab by myself, HAHAHA.
I rest my case.
garlic noodles.author: Alice Z.
garlic noodles.review:
I ate here a while back, sometime last year. I came here with people from work, it was the end of the program and the coordinators chose this place to eat. I have NEVER heard or seen this place before. Damn, little did I know, this place was AMAZING! 

I ordered the roasted crab and garlic noodles. This place is small and had dim lighting. It was a pretty comfy atmosphere, but crowded. The crab was very tasty and yummy! But this place was expensive, well it's always expensive since it's seafood. I was lucky that this a treat for all my hard work throughout the year so I didn't have to pay [:

I was so full from the crab that I had to take most of the garlic noodles home! I can't believe I could actually down a whole crab by myself, HAHAHA. I rest my case.

excerpts: the shrimp toast was okay I would have rather spent the money that I did on those on more garlic noodles.
garlic noodles.author: Katie M.
garlic noodles.review:
Best garlic noodle ever!
omg its soo good. totally worth the $10. a must order.

Roasted crab it was good but it wasn't as good as the hype that my friend built  up for me.

royal prawns were pretty good. I liked it more than the crab.

the mussels were really good too, my friend liked it so much she ordered another plate right away.

the shrimp toast was okay I would have rather spent the money that I did on those on more garlic noodles.

The wait can be really long without reservations so call ahead. Service was good.

excerpts: I love the crab and garlic noodles from Thanh Long's it is so good, its a  little pricey
but for this yumminess it is totally worth it!!
garlic noodles.author: Toya B.
garlic noodles.review: I love the crab and garlic noodles from Thanh Long's it is so good, its a  little pricey but for this yumminess it is totally worth it!!

excerpts: Also you have to try the Garlic noodles ...
garlic noodles.author: star w.
garlic noodles.review: Ha! You mean to tell me as long as I have had a Yelp account I have never ever wrote a review on Thann Long..WOW ok were do I start! This place will nock you on your back and off your feet. It is soo good melts in your mouth literally. Dam I want some right now. This is a really good place to take a loved one this weekend. Something about the food that makes me want to go home and get it on!!!!! ::))P The crab OMG is so firrgin good, the shang beef is good to..they dont put alot and yes the potatoes will through you off thinking its meat but its not::)) Also you have to try the Garlic noodles ...Hella bomb the shrimp fried rice is good to! Good luck Ill be there again real soon...Cant wait Excited!!! They are a little pricy so make sure all credit cards work or stop at a Bank!

excerpts: The crab was fresh and tasty, and the garlic noodles were great too!
I had never had Vietnamese cheesy/garlic noodles before (a French influence possibly), but they were definitely good.
However, don't forget to bring some mints of some sort cause
garlic noodles.author: Nadiyah S.
garlic noodles.review:
Yummmmm!!!!

This place is great!  Garlic lovers, here is the place to eat.  I had the roasted crab which was excellent.  The crab was fresh and tasty, and the garlic noodles were great too!  I had never had Vietnamese cheesy/garlic noodles before (a French influence possibly), but they were definitely good.   However, don't forget to bring some mints of some sort cause wow...there are is definitely a lot of noodles in that garlic..or was it the other way around =p

But back to the rest of the food...the service is great, the veggie side dishes are great as well.  I also tasted the prawns, which were cooked well.  I wasn't a fan of their calamari that night.  I like mine a little more tender.  But for those looking for the dish to get at this place, I would definitely recommend the crab!

excerpts: The Roasted crab is smothered with butter, garlic, and pepper and those Garlic noodles are a great blend of garlic and butter.
garlic noodles.author: Jacqueline S.
garlic noodles.review:
I have never in my life tasted Crab better than the Roasted Crab at thahn Longs.  I like it soo much that I used to try and get someone to go with me every month!

The Roasted crab is smothered with butter, garlic, and pepper and those Garlic noodles are a great blend of garlic and butter.

Service is always very friendly and efficient and the wait is only about 15 minutes tops.

excerpts: OK I finally made it here after I had heard so many good things about it...  finally got to try the Roast Crab and their famous Garlic noodles...
Everybody raves about the Garlic noodles, and they were pretty darn good but to tell you the truth, all it is is just a plate of plain noodles, skinny like spaghetti noodles with nothing else!
Maybe if there was chicken or some kind of vegetable with it
I would have found it more appealing
and I'd be raving about it.
I did find that the Roast crab was amazing however!
One of the best crab dishes I have EVER had.
It is however also the messiest crab I have ever eaten.
Even messier than a crab feed.
haha
The entire crab is drenched in garlic butter sauce so your hands and face are guaranteed to be slippery and completely messy with all the goodness.
You have to crack the crab yourself
so be sure to wear the provided bib or else you'll get sauce or pieces of crab all over you.
I ate one and a half crabs which took me a good hour to crack and eat.
And it was totally worth it.
If you love crab and garlic, the Roast crab and Garlic noodles are totally worth it!!
If you love crab and garlic, the Roast crab and Garlic noodles are totally worth it!!
garlic noodles.author: Dean S.
garlic noodles.review:
OK I finally made it here after I had heard so many good things about it...  finally got to try the Roast Crab and their famous Garlic noodles...  Everybody raves about the Garlic noodles, and they were pretty darn good but to tell you the truth, all it is is just a plate of plain noodles, skinny like spaghetti noodles with nothing else!  Maybe if there was chicken or some kind of vegetable with it I would have found it more appealing and I'd be raving about it.  
I did find that the Roast crab was amazing however!  One of the best crab dishes I have EVER had.  It is however also the messiest crab I have ever eaten.  Even messier than a crab feed. haha  The entire crab is drenched in garlic butter sauce so your hands and face are guaranteed to be slippery and completely messy with all the goodness.  You have to crack the crab yourself so be sure to wear the provided bib or else you'll get sauce or pieces of crab all over you.  I ate one and a half crabs which took me a good hour to crack and eat.  And it was totally worth it.  We also had the garlic toast, which was ok, it was just small thin pieces of sourdough bread toast with garlic butter. ha! so much garlic and butter in this restaurant your breath will be kickin' it for days!!  We also had the mango salad or something like that and it was ok too.  Parking sucks around this restaurant so just suck it up and pay the valet in front of the restaurant.  If you love crab and garlic, the Roast crab and Garlic noodles are totally worth it!!

excerpts: Garlic noodles = noodles (more like spaghetti) and garlic butter.
Unless they're using organic noodles and imported butter, they're making a huge profit on this.
I'm not saying the food is bad, which is why it gets 3 stars.
garlic noodles.author: Anthony L.
garlic noodles.review:
When you advertise yourself as a Vietnamese restaurant, I would expect to have some authenticity. No one speaks Vietnamese here and menus are all in English (my poor parents had to translate from the English their own native dishes, not that there were many).   

I don't get what the hype is all about. Paying $35+ for a crab drenched in garlic butter/oil? Garlic noodles = noodles (more like spaghetti) and garlic butter. Unless they're using organic noodles and imported butter, they're making a huge profit on this. I'm not saying the food is bad, which is why it gets 3 stars. But there's no way I'm paying that much for such simple dishes. 

Save your money. Buy a live $10 crab from your local Asian market, marinate with minced garlic and butter and roast it yourself in the oven. Their secret ingredients are probably a mix of common Asian spices. 

If you're used to eating real Asian crab dishes (i.e. Chinese ginger & scallion, Singapore black pepper) with stronger spices, you will not be impressed. However, if you've been eating Western style steamed/boiled with lemon and butter, this might be something you'll like.  

Props to the An Family for creating such a "valued" franchise.

excerpts: Once we were finally seated, my friends ordered two roasted garlic crabs, one tamarind crab, a few orders of garlic noodles, and some calamari.
garlic noodles.author: Anne Y.
garlic noodles.review:
I ate hear a few weeks back and totally forgot to write a review...

There is so much hype around this place... a lot of people say it's better than PPQ, so I was all the more excited to see how it competes with the other restaurants that serve roasted crab. Well for starters, the wait was horrible. I went with a group of people on a weekend and we had reservations and we still had to wait among the huge crowd of people to be seated. And I mean, it was packed -- people were elbow to elbow by the bar waiting to be seated.

Once we were finally seated, my friends ordered two roasted garlic crabs, one tamarind crab, a few orders of garlic noodles, and some calamari.

The wait for the food was surprisingly not bad. In fact, they served our food quickly. As far as taste goes, to me it was okay. The flavors were okay, but I've had better. I was a little disappointed because I had high expectations, but it was nothing that made it too much of an upset. It was just average to me.

As soon as we finished dinner we skipped dessert and left. Since parking around this area is terrible, we conveniently had our cars valet parked. Bad idea. The wait to get our car was inconveniently long, especially because it was freezing outside. It seemed like the people working the valet parking were driving each other to and from Thanh Long to a parking garage a few blocks away and retrieving peoples' cars for them. If that was the case, I would have walked to that garage and got the car myself because there was a lot of people ahead of us waiting for their cars.

The food and service was okay, but I doubt I'd come back here.

excerpts: As always their garlic noodles coupled with their shrimps were just deliciously mouth-watering, that it was the first to go.
We started with their mango salad followed by their lemongrass chicken, eggplant dish, and of course as mentioned - garlic noodles w/ grilled shrimps.
The entire dining experience was excellent despite one of my co-workers getting served tepid coffee.
It was immediately dealt with by our server
so no harm was done.
Next time, we're going for their specialty which is their crab dinner.
Highly recommended.
garlic noodles.author: Chad B.
garlic noodles.review:
It has been several years since I last dined at this restaurant. We went here to celebrate a mini retirement party and we definitely had a one fantastic dinner. As always their garlic noodles coupled with their shrimps were just deliciously mouth-watering, that it was the first to go. We started with their mango salad followed by their lemongrass chicken, eggplant dish, and of course as mentioned - garlic noodles w/ grilled shrimps. The entire dining experience was excellent despite one of my co-workers getting served tepid coffee. It was immediately dealt with by our server so no harm was done.
Next time, we're going for their specialty which is their crab dinner. Highly recommended.

excerpts: Especially the DUNGENESS CRABS and the GARLIC NOODLES!
Make sure you leave room for the BEST GARLIC NOODLES EVER!
All we can say is you need to try these garlic noodles to truly understand how good it is.
garlic noodles.author: Stephanie C.
garlic noodles.review:
My girlfriend and I have tried many restaurants in the bay area, and when we think of seafood restaurants this place is right up there with the best we've ever had.

The atmosphere is surprisingly nice and the service is also good. What makes this place unforgettable however is the FOOD!

Especially the DUNGENESS CRABS and the GARLIC NOODLES!

The dungeness crabs were roasted and came in a pepper butter sauce, and all that flavor from the sauce you can taste in the meat. They give you the entire crab, shell and all. You will probably need one person with a very large appetite to finish a crab.

 BUT! Make sure you leave room for the BEST GARLIC NOODLES EVER! All we can say is you need to try these garlic noodles to truly understand how good it is. These noodles are pan-fried with this garlic butter sauce, and it just comes out delicious!

Make sure you try this place! Make reservations ahead of time because IT WILL BE BUSY! But it is well worth it!

excerpts: We ordered the roasted crab, garlic noodles and vegetables.
Everything was perfect.
The best part was probably the server coming over to personally tie a bib around each of our necks.
(Cute!)
It was an utter mess, but so delicious and satisfying.
I will be going back for sure.
garlic noodles.author: Michelle T.
garlic noodles.review: All I can say is, WOW!!! After seeing all the reviews I just had to try the crab. Luckily we got there at a decent time (6:30pm) so were seated right away. We ordered the roasted crab, garlic noodles and vegetables.  Everything was perfect.  The best part was probably the server coming over to personally tie a bib around each of our necks. (Cute!) It was an utter mess, but so delicious and satisfying. I will be going back for sure.

excerpts: Garlic noodles and Shaken Beef.
AND Roasted crab?
Come on, even my grandma loved it
and she's a picky eater.
Great date place, nicely lit, intimate feel.
Best place to dine in the Sunset.
garlic noodles.author: Rosavida C.
garlic noodles.review:
Consumer beware: You're breath'll be kickin'.

But, it's worth it. Garlic noodles and Shaken Beef. AND Roasted crab? Come on, even my grandma loved it and she's a picky eater. 
Great date place, nicely lit, intimate feel. Best place to dine in the Sunset.

excerpts: For entree we ordered GARLIC NOODLES and TAMARIND CRAB.

The garlic noodle was very good although it is a little pricey for the portion, and the tamarind crab with an open mind tasted very interesting, although not as a common favorite taste as the roasted crab, it was good and I do recommend it.
The reason this restaurant is missing a star in book is because the parking was hard to find on the streets, and the valet costs $10.
garlic noodles.author: Lulubear L.
garlic noodles.review:
We ordered a DUNGENESS CRAB PUFFS as a starter, it was very delicious dipped in peanut-mustard sauce. 
For entree we ordered GARLIC NOODLES and TAMARIND CRAB. The garlic noodle was very good although it is a little pricey for the portion, and the tamarind crab with an open mind tasted very interesting, although not as a common favorite taste as the roasted crab, it was good and I do recommend it. 
The reason this restaurant is missing a star in book is because the parking was hard to find on the streets, and the valet costs $10.

excerpts: The food was good and we ordered 2 crabs, 3 garlic noodles (so good!!!!!!!), a mango salad, and a shaken beef.
my favorite came out to be the garlic noodles, although the beef was good too.
I think I'd come back only for special occasions.
We paid $245+tax total.
garlic noodles.author: Junming G.
garlic noodles.review: I went here on my birthday and we were seated on the 2nd floor. The food was good and we ordered 2 crabs, 3 garlic noodles (so good!!!!!!!), a mango salad, and a shaken beef. my favorite came out to be the garlic noodles, although the beef was good too. I think I'd come back only for special occasions. We paid $245+tax total.

excerpts: had the roasted crab and tamarind crab with garlic noodles and shaken beef.
$10 garlic noodle is a money maker, oily.
nice pepper on the roasted crab.
the shaken beef is priced very high, but it's quite tasty.
such soft and nicely flavored meat mixed with potatoes and lettuce.
garlic noodles.author: Rob C.
garlic noodles.review:
probably 3.5, esp. when considering value which pushes this place down.  hmm, TL vs. PPQ vs. R&G.  all crabs approx. $35-40.  I vote for PPQ, and overall I prefer R&G type preps over butter/garlic.
the family business story is impressive.
here the crabs seem to be steamed/boiled longer, so the shell is softer?  didn't quite like the meat as much but the sauces were fine.
had the roasted crab and tamarind crab with garlic noodles and shaken beef.  $10 garlic noodle is a money maker, oily.
nice pepper on the roasted crab.
the shaken beef is priced very high, but it's quite tasty.  such soft and nicely flavored meat mixed with potatoes and lettuce.  salt and pepper calamari was too salty.

excerpts: The garlic noodles were also quite incredible, now I am very biased on this because anything with enough garlic to kill a small animal gets a few extra points in my book, but this was never overpowering, and was a perfect accompaniment to the crab.
garlic noodles.author: Matthew L.
garlic noodles.review:
Now it has been a while since I've been here but that should speak of how much of an impression this place made on me. 

The crab was moist and tender, and as someone who regularly makes cioppino I have to admire the flavor they were able to impart to the meat. The garlic noodles were also quite incredible, now I am very biased on this because anything with enough garlic to kill a small animal gets a few extra points in my book, but this was never overpowering, and was a perfect accompaniment to the crab. 

Now the part that has left biggest memory for me is the fried ice cream, one because it was absolutely amazing how you could tempura batter and fry ice cream and still manage to serve it before it has melted, and two because my family has since taken to replicating this particular recipe. Although our modifications have left it more like an ice cream filled churro than the light and delicious dessert served here.

excerpts: Oooh, and the garlic noodles, yummy:)
garlic noodles.author: Noelle M.
garlic noodles.review: The best Dungeness Crab I have ever had! Oooh, and the garlic noodles, yummy:)

excerpts: If you're a fan of garlic noodles and a lover of roasted crab then this is the place to be!
For appetizers get the mussels it is to die for yummy.
The roasted crab is so delicious that you've got to pair it with the garlic noodles.
garlic noodles.author: Junel L.
garlic noodles.review:
Before going to the restaurant make sure you make reservations because if you don't you'll be waiting forever to get seated. The minute my friend and I got there, the place was so packed to the point where it was impossible to hear my friend talk. So thank goodness we made reservations because we were seated immediately. They deserve 5 stars

If you're a fan of garlic noodles and a lover of roasted crab then this is the place to be! For appetizers get the mussels it is to die for yummy. 
The roasted crab is so delicious that you've got to pair it with the garlic noodles.

excerpts: Best place for the roasted crab and garlic noodles.
It is not as expensive as its sister restaurant Crustacean.
The other items on the menu were not memorable.
Don't go to a steak house and order the fish.
Come here for the crab and garlic noodles and you won't be disappointed.

garlic noodles.review:
Best place for the roasted crab and garlic noodles.  It is not as expensive as its sister restaurant Crustacean.  The other items on the menu were not memorable.  Don't go to a steak house and order the fish.  Come here for the crab and garlic noodles and you won't be disappointed.

excerpts: We ordered 2 roasted garlic crabs, the chef's special butterflied shrimp with garlic noodles and garlic rice.
This was our Christmas Eve dinner.
Wow.
WoW. wOw.
WOW...
It was soooooooooo damn good!!!
The crab was amazing.
The shrimp?
Amazing.
The noodles?
WAY better than PPQ.
and the garlic rice??
I made stir fried rice with the shrimp, garlic rice and crab.
Wow....
garlic noodles.author: Jen D.
garlic noodles.review:
What restaurants can you always guarantee to be opened during holidays like Christmas? Asian ones of course! Eugy and I knew we were getting crab for dinner, but we also wanted Texas style bbq. After calling 3 Bay Area rib shacks and them all being closed, we had to settle for just crab. But when it comes to Thanh Long, it's really not settling, cause their food is AMAZING... 

About 6 months ago, Eugy took me to PPQ. I've never been a huge crab fan, but he loves it so much so I agreed to go. To be honest, it was good, probably the best crab I've had (which isn't saying much since I haven't had too much), but when I tried Thanh Long, my opinion changed. 

We ordered 2 roasted garlic crabs, the chef's special butterflied shrimp with garlic noodles and garlic rice. This was our Christmas Eve dinner. Wow. WoW. wOw. WOW... It was soooooooooo damn good!!! The crab was amazing. The shrimp? Amazing. The noodles? WAY better than PPQ. and the garlic rice?? DAMN! 

And you know how to tell if the food is really good? Save the leftovers and make something with them the next day. I made stir fried rice with the shrimp, garlic rice and crab. Wow.... It was awesome. 

I can't wait to go back!!!

excerpts: I love going to this place especially for their Garlic noodles and Roasted crab.
Their martinis are flavorful too.
Service is excellent, my waiter always has a friendly smile and has good recommendations.and
I like how they always clean up after each course.
A bit pricy for just going out to dinner but
if your visiting or finding a reason to celebrate something, this is a good place to go.
garlic noodles.author: Grace P.
garlic noodles.review: I love going to this place especially for their Garlic noodles and Roasted crab.  Their martinis are flavorful too.  Service is excellent, my waiter always has a friendly smile and has good recommendations.and I like how they always clean up after each course. A bit pricy for just going out to dinner but if your visiting or finding a reason to celebrate something, this is a good place to go.

excerpts: As suggested, we ordered two roasted crabs and two orders of garlic noodles.
We also took the advise of waiting until we put a significant dent in the crabs before we ordered the garlic noodles, to ensure that they stayed hot while we ate.
Both the roasted crab and the garlic noodles were out of this world and nothing like I have ever tasted in my life.
This is an expensive restaurant, but it is WELL worth it.
garlic noodles.author: Tamy S.
garlic noodles.review:
This place is no joke.  I was visiting SF from Miami w/my boyfriend.  I saw this restaurant on yelp, and based on the favorable reviews, we dropped in to check it out.  As suggested, we ordered two roasted crabs and two orders of garlic noodles.  We also took the advise of waiting until we put a significant dent in the crabs before we ordered the garlic noodles, to ensure that they stayed hot while we ate.  

Both the roasted crab and the garlic noodles were out of this world and nothing like I have ever tasted in my life.  This is an expensive restaurant, but it is WELL worth it.  I would spend my last penny here, it's that good.  

We were stuffed with the amount of food we ordered, but if I ever have the fortune of returning I wouldn't change a thing.

I am drooling just thinking about it!!!!!!

excerpts: Whatever you order, be sure to order the garlic noodles on the side and then get one TO GO for lunch the next day.
garlic noodles.author: Shawn S.
garlic noodles.review:
Same food as it's fancier counterpart, Crustacians, just a little more low key. You aren't required to have a shirt with a collar, but I wouldn't come in work out clothes, either.

Whatever you order, be sure to order the garlic noodles on the side and then get one TO GO for lunch the next day. It's worth the ten bucks. 

Service is wonderful and be sure to make reservations! Street parking is shady, but they do have a vallet parking system (where they park your car on the street anyways).

A pricey meal, but completely worth it.

excerpts: I swear they make the best roasted crab and garlic noodles in SF!
We went to ppq dungeness Island today and omg!
I regretted going there so bad.
This place is hands down the best!
plain and simple.
garlic noodles.author: zoey x.
garlic noodles.review: I swear they make the best roasted crab and garlic noodles in SF! We went to ppq dungeness Island today and omg! I regretted going there so bad. This place is hands down the best! plain and simple.

excerpts: The garlic noodles is a MUST!
The crab was also delicious.
Food is great, but a little on the pricy side.
garlic noodles.author: Linh H.
garlic noodles.review: Great food! The garlic noodles is a MUST! The crab was also delicious.  Food is great, but a little on the pricy side.

excerpts: Garlic crab was just good but the garlic noodles were DELICIOUS!
Ended with the lovely fried banana and pineapple ice cream.
garlic noodles.author: Ann W.
garlic noodles.review: Expected the salmon capriccio to have a bite but it was sweet in flavor. Spicy eggplant was delicious but also very sweet in flavor, we wanted spicy. Garlic crab was just good but the garlic noodles were DELICIOUS! Ended with the lovely fried banana and pineapple ice cream.

excerpts: The garlic noodles were good but they were just straight up garlic butter and noodles & that's NASTY.I have to admit that the mussels were the only thing tasty.
garlic noodles.author: Cyndi C.
garlic noodles.review:
Does this joint have any vegetables?
EVERYTHING is drenched in butter, I thought I was going to throw up. The garlic noodles were good but they were just straight up garlic butter and noodles & that's NASTY.I have to admit that the mussels were the only thing tasty.

excerpts: So I was really excited to try to this place since I love garlic noodles and you can't go wrong with crab.
I was surprised to see this place located on the far end of Judah practically near the water.. a bit random
Crab & garlic noodles:   With our bibs on and ready for some messy eating I would warn people not to come here on a blind date as you have horrible breath afterward and it is MESSY.
The roasted crab was good and definitely had a lot of flavor
but when I think of all the times I've had crab - I think that grabbing fresh crab from a market down near LA tasted slightly better.
The crab meat was a solid 4 but it could have been just a tad bigger/juicier.
Yes I'm going to be a crab nazi/food critic since I can be on yelp
The garlic noodles were very tasty and more on the soft/sticky side than I anticipated
garlic noodles.author: T M.
garlic noodles.review:
So I was really excited to try to this place since I love garlic noodles and you can't go wrong with crab.    I was surprised to see this place located on the far end of Judah practically near the water.. a bit random but they definitely seem to have a loyal following.    

FOOD:
we ordered the salt and pepper calamari and spring rolls.   Calamari was good - light crispy batter and fresh squid - but it could have been seasoned a tad more.  The spring rolls were good - but SMALL - they only gave you a few pieces and I've had my fair share of big, cheap, good spring rolls so although this place was fancier, they could have been a bit more generous with that appetizer.

onto the main event.. Crab & garlic noodles:   With our bibs on and ready for some messy eating I would warn people not to come here on a blind date as you have horrible breath afterward and it is MESSY.   The roasted crab was good and definitely had a lot of flavor but when I think of all the times I've had crab - I think that grabbing fresh crab from a market down near LA tasted slightly better.  The crab meat was a solid 4 but it could have been just a tad bigger/juicier.  Yes I'm going to be a crab nazi/food critic since I can be on yelp ;)  The garlic noodles were very tasty and more on the soft/sticky side than I anticipated but I liked them.

Dessert:  FRIED BANANA - yum yum yum.  can't go wrong.

DECOR:  nice but kind of weird in the back near the bathrooms where they have these bright colored walls.. to me it looked a little tacky but the rest of the restaurant looked nice.

overall - yummy, garlicky dining experience.   ii'll have to try the shaking beef next time!

excerpts: The food was delicious from the spring rolls to the calamari, but the garlic noodles were perfect with the regular order of roasted crab.
garlic noodles.author: Katie G.
garlic noodles.review:
I heard so much about this place that I was more excited about dining here than the date itself. This place did not disappoint. The food was delicious from the spring rolls to the calamari, but the garlic noodles were perfect with the regular order of roasted crab. 

The service was very attentive. The drinks kept coming, just enough that I wasn't so uncomfortable about getting back into the dating scene. Maybe not the best place to go on a first date if either party expects a goodnight kiss, unless the someone doesn't mind garlic breath. Or... it is a great place to go in order to avoid giving or receiving a kiss. Either way, thanks J for the great conversation and company.

excerpts: It's all about the crab and garlic noodles!
Excellent food, great service, and good ambiance.
It get's very busy though, so get a reservation.
This place has a great reputation and it lives up to it.
However it can be anywhere between expensive and REALLY expensive depending on drinks and appetizers.
garlic noodles.author: Scott P.
garlic noodles.review: It's all about the crab and garlic noodles!  Excellent food, great service, and good ambiance.  It get's very busy though, so get a reservation.  This place has a great reputation and it lives up to it.  However it can be anywhere between expensive and REALLY expensive depending on drinks and appetizers.

excerpts: This is one of my FAVE restaurants just because I LOVE LOVE LOVE the roasted garlic crab & garlic noodles.
Who doesn't?
They also have really good calamari.
My girls ate the mussels on one occasion and they were in love with 'em.
Any other appetizers weren't so impressive.
but yes regardless, I love my crab & garlic noodles so that is a MUST to order when you go here!
garlic noodles.author: Dijonne M.
garlic noodles.review:
This is one of my FAVE restaurants just because I LOVE LOVE LOVE the roasted garlic crab & garlic noodles. Who doesn't? They also have really good calamari. My girls ate the mussels on one occasion and they were in love with 'em. Any other appetizers weren't so impressive. I've eaten here quite a few times and the only unfortunate thing is the service isn't always up to par. 

My hubby took me and our daughter here for Mother's day just last week and though our waiter was really nice, his service was very disappointing. I found myself without water a couple times which is REALLY bad on my checklist. He also didn't check on us much during our meal. I even noticed a couple who had gotten seated way after us, got their food (which was exactly the same thing we ordered) before us! OK but yes regardless, I love my crab & garlic noodles so that is a MUST to order when you go here!

excerpts: It's always a treat when our family can get in to Thanh Long for the crab and garlic noodles.
They are to die for...
would recommend if getting the multiple crabs order them 1-2 at a time, this way they stay piping hot!
We ordered 5 crabs for 4 adults and we couldn't eat them fast enough and the fourth and fifth ones got cold.
Street parking a bit challenging in the outer Sunset...they do have valet parking for a price.
Save your money and circle the block a few times!
garlic noodles.author: M L.
garlic noodles.review: It's always a treat when our family can get in to Thanh Long for the crab and garlic noodles.  They are to die for...would recommend if getting the multiple crabs order them 1-2 at a time, this way they stay piping hot!  We ordered 5 crabs for 4 adults and we couldn't eat them fast enough and the fourth and fifth ones got cold.  Street parking a bit challenging in the outer Sunset...they do have valet parking for a price.  Save your money and circle the block a few times!

excerpts: We also ordered a serving of the garlic noodles everyone on yelp keeps raving about.
The crab was finger lickin good, literally.
I didn't even need the moist towellete at the end haha.
Midway through our crab, we had finished the garlic noodles and we had to order another.
garlic noodles.author: Dennis L.
garlic noodles.review:
If I was a crab, I would want the honor of being cooked at thanh long. The first time I was here we ordered the garlic roasted crab. They charge each crab by market price which I think means that they buy the crabs market fresh daily. We also ordered a serving of the garlic noodles everyone on yelp keeps raving about. The crab was finger lickin good, literally. I didn't even need the moist towellete at the end haha. Midway through our crab, we had finished the garlic noodles and we had to order another.

Nom nom nom

Tip: Try not sitting upstairs. I felt neglected by the wait staff the last time I sat at a table up there.

excerpts: We had several dishes along with their famous Roasted Crab and Garlic noodles.
I would have to say that the Roasted crab was very good but the Garlic Noodles is out of this world!
I would go back just for the Garlic Noodles alone!
garlic noodles.author: D F.
garlic noodles.review:
This place was highly recommended by all my friends that live in the Bay Area so I had to see what the hype was all about. 

I decided to take my sister and her family to Thanh Long to celebrate her birthday. My first impression when I arrived was that the building look somewhat old and run down from the outside. That changes completely when you enter the restaurant. It's really nice inside. 

Now the food..... 
We had several dishes along with their famous Roasted Crab and Garlic noodles. I would have to say that the Roasted crab was very good but the Garlic Noodles is out of this world! I would go back just for the Garlic Noodles alone! 

Overall, it was a great dining experience. The service was good and the food was great. I do agree with others fellow Yelp reviewers that the Roasted Crab at $40 a pop is a little overpriced but it is definitely good so the price is somewhat justified.

excerpts: Garlic Noodles.
garlic noodles.author: Vince H.
garlic noodles.review:
I came here for the first time because I had a friend in town who wanted some seafood. Instead of taking him to Fisherman's wharf, we decided to do something different. We are so glad we came here. There's nothing like the bone breaking sound of crab while wearing a plastic bib. 

Furthermore, the service is impeccable. I shall return!

Things to get:

The Roast Crab is absolutely delectable. I'm not sure what the "secret spices" are, but mixed with the garlic, I was tempted to eat everything down to the shell.

Garlic Noodles. There is a reason why everybody talks about it. 

Shaken Beef. Yummy.

Soft Shell Crab. Yes, we couldn't get enough crab

Tip: We had a good ole time ordering drinks. Let me tell you, they are VERY heavy handed with their vodka.

excerpts: 4 roasted crab, 1 drunken crab, 2 dishes of garlic noodles, 3 appetizers (make sure to try their mussels), fried banana desserts and some drinks later, we were in our own happy place when we were done!
Drunken crab was good, especially if you have more than 2 people, order one of each and exchange half with each other to try both flavors.
I like the saltiness of roasted crab, but drunken crab had more milder flavor to it.
I also liked the way they've cleaned the crab and chopped them in half, as it was easier for me to dig in as soon as the crab arrived on our table.
garlic noodles.author: Tomomi S.
garlic noodles.review:
I had Thanh Long in my Yelp bookmark for over a year and finally, I got a chance to try their famous crabs the other night. 6 of us drove up from South Bay, ready to eat-till-we-drop on their famous crabs. 

Pretty much other great reviews says it all but let me say this... WOW!!!!!! They serve some seriously tasty, finger licking crabs and seafood here. 4 roasted crab, 1 drunken crab, 2 dishes of garlic noodles, 3 appetizers (make sure to try their mussels), fried banana desserts and some drinks later, we were in our own happy place when we were done!

Roasted crabs drizzled with fabulously addictive seasoning of butter, salt, pepper, garlic was just so additively yummy. Drunken crab was good, especially if you have more than 2 people, order one of each and exchange half with each other to try both flavors. I like the saltiness of roasted crab, but drunken crab had more milder flavor to it. I also liked the way they've cleaned the crab and chopped them in half, as it was easier for me to dig in as soon as the crab arrived on our table. They'll give you a hot towel later, so don't worry about making a mess and just dig in.

All of us were in a serious food coma on our drive home. All I could think about was the steaming hot roasted crab!!! I'll definitely come back here again.

excerpts: I always get the garlic noodles when i come here.
The staff are nice and helpful.
garlic noodles.author: Anthony V.
garlic noodles.review: Best crab you will ever eat. I always get the garlic noodles when i come here. The staff are nice and helpful.

excerpts: Order it with the garlic noodles.
My favorite appetizer is the mussels -- be sure to drip any remaining sauce onto the crisp rounds of bread.
The crab puffs are always a hit as well.
Order the Navarro Gewurztraminer
garlic noodles.author: Steve B.
garlic noodles.review:
This is my desert island restaurant -- my muse -- my favorite place to get one of life's best foods.  Keep your cioppino, your sourdough bread, and your Irish coffee.  In San Francisco, where dungeness crab is the ultimate local delicacy, the An Family restaurants Crustacean and Thanh Long are the best places in town.

I have taken customers and colleagues, girlfriends and drinking buddies -- they all love Thanh Long.  This is my Cheers, and I am Norm -- because hostesses Jennifer and Lhanh always know my name when I call.

The main event here is the Roast Crab, the best thing on the menu and the best crab in San Francisco.  Dripping with butter and seasoned to perfection, it is absolutely magical.  Order it with the garlic noodles.  My favorite appetizer is the mussels -- be sure to drip any remaining sauce onto the crisp rounds of bread.  The crab puffs are always a hit as well.  Order the Navarro Gewurztraminer -- it's light and crisp with a touch of sweetness and is absolutely perfect with the rich, buttery crab.

This is not a first date restaurant or a restaurant for high maintenance customers.  After all, you're going to wear a plastic bib, get messy, and want to lick your fingers.  (Hmm... maybe it is a good place for a first date.)  But for the true crab lover, or for anyone who just wants the ultimate in San Francisco food, this is the place.

Crustacean and Thanh Long have almost exactly the same menu.  Crustacean is more centrally located and a little more hip (or cheesy, depending on your perspective).  Thanh Long has more neighborhood charm and is my favorite, but I live in that part of town so I'm biased.  Either way, the food is the same and you can't go wrong.

excerpts: , it's their whole roasted Dungeness crabs and garlic noodles that get me motivated!
One crab is easily enough for a party of two; however if you're a garlic noodle fanatic like myself (and Thanh Long's really are the best)
I'd make the jump and order your own plate.
garlic noodles.author: Taylor E.
garlic noodles.review:
I'm going to go out on a limb here and vote Thanh Long the best restaurant in the Sunset. 

Including valet parking in it's repertoire (making it the only place in the Sunset to do so!) may be reason enough for some to make a visit Thanh Long. Living mere blocks away (and the fact that it is the Sunset, where parking is generally abundant), it's their whole roasted Dungeness crabs and garlic noodles that get me motivated! One crab is easily enough for a party of two; however if you're a garlic noodle fanatic like myself (and Thanh Long's really are the best) I'd make the jump and order your own plate. I've seen friendships fall apart over less.

The cocktails and appetizers are somewhat lackluster but don't let this deter you. I find that Vietnamese beer goes best with my crab bib and appetizers take up precious crab and noodle living space. In my humble opinion it's best to keep it simple, especially when dining at a specialty spot such as Thanh Long.

Roll up your sleeves, avoid on first dates (some may think eating with your hands and having butter stream down your arms is sensual, I think not), and enjoy :)

excerpts: 4 star for the crab and garlic noodles only!
We ordered 2 crabs (1 garlic butter, 1 tamarinde)  along with 2 orders of the garlic noodles and it was SOOOO good!
The garlic noodles wasn't as greasy as the ones I've had at Crustaceans
garlic noodles.author: Tina D.
garlic noodles.review:
4 star for the crab and garlic noodles only!

After going to Crustaceans for so long, I decided to give Thanh Long a try and see which place I like better.

We ordered 2 crabs (1 garlic butter, 1 tamarinde)  along with 2 orders of the garlic noodles and it was SOOOO good!  I prefer the garlic butter crab over the tamarinde crab as it was more flavorful and didn't leave that bittersweet tamarind aftertaste.

The garlic noodles wasn't as greasy as the ones I've had at Crustaceans so it works better for me!

We also decided to order the shaken beef which many folks raved about but boy was I dissappointed! 

The steak  was so bland and over cooked...for $23 bucks you would think they'd use mixed baby greens for a more upscale touch but instead they used chopped head lettuce!  Not my cup of tea there...and definitely not worth the money.

As for the drinks, they recommended lychee martini's and that was dissappointing too...tasted like sugar water. 

Sevice was okay, nothing impressive.  Overall, I was able to quench my cravings for the crab and garlic noodes,  and probably won't try anything else nexttime around.

excerpts: While there were a variety of items to consume and choose from here, practically everyone ordered the signature items, which is the buttery garlic pepper roasted dungeoness crab, perhaps the garlic tiger prawns, the signature garlic noodles of course, and perhaps end with a banana flambe / fried banana with ice cream.
The crab while was within season, was way too greasy (too much butter and a tad bit salty), and the garlic noodles were very messy (the delicate balance and flavors that were once there are gone).
garlic noodles.author: Ken K.
garlic noodles.review:
The story of this family and its business certainly is quite a marvel. From the restaurant's humble beginnings to a much larger empire and perhaps a mini conglomerate, their story certainly represents the budding entrepreneur's desire and passion to map and live out the American Dream.

I had fond memories coming here during the early 90s, when this place was IT. Way before Yelp, Chowhound, and arguably Slanted Door, this was definitely an SF favorite and one of the greatest Vietnamese/fusion restaurants.

Back then the neighborhood where Thanh Long is located wasn't a place overun by thugs and crime like it is these days, although the pain in the ass parking problems were somewhat there and I'm sure has not improved today.

This restaurant was at the time much smaller and less decorative than it is now, which gave this place a bit of a mom and pop feel, in addition to being a restaurant in a primarily residential area. Most kids who dined here at the time with their parents would rush over across the street to the 7-Eleven and play some coin-op games while their parents stood around like hapless sheep, waiting for their names to be called. So thanks mom & dad, for sticking around while me and my brother were wasting away our life in front of a coin-op machine for upwards of 30 mins each!

While there were a variety of items to consume and choose from here, practically everyone ordered the signature items, which is the buttery garlic pepper roasted dungeoness crab, perhaps the garlic tiger prawns, the signature garlic noodles of course, and perhaps end with a banana flambe / fried banana with ice cream. There was never a need to mess around and try something else.

As seemingly romantic this place may seem to bring a date to impress, the idea of wearing bibs and getting your hands greased up with more grease juice flying across the table as you break open an arm or a leg (of the crab of course, not some thug ass off the street, try holding a lead pipe, Glock or Sig Sauer after your hands are all buttered up), and getting said butter garlic pepper grease all over your chin like a Dirty Gomez, is not slick (no pun intended) or smart by any means.

I have to say that ever since SF's Crustacean opened, I've been witnessing a steady decline in overall quality and dining experience here as the decor and ambience upgraded (they have since added a much larger alcohol bar too for your frou frou drunken needs), both of which have been rather inconsistent. Although I have not been back in some years, the last visit circa 2001/2002 here just did not hit the spot. The crab while was within season, was way too greasy (too much butter and a tad bit salty), and the garlic noodles were very messy (the delicate balance and flavors that were once there are gone). Perhaps the chefs have moved on to the bigger side of the businesses/empire, I don't know.

If I remember correctly, the dress code is not as drastically enforced here as it is at Crustacean. Which is a good thing because if "you be dressed to fly like P Diddly Doo, and wanna go clubbing afterwards, then getting some butter grease pepper garlic stains on your $5000 jacket won't make you look so cool when you whip out your Tec 9 or Glock Glock to bust a cap at the thug or his set o' wheel(s) across the street"

excerpts: Yeah, this place is pricy, and I've heard the crab is frozen, but the roast crab and garlic noodles is such an utterly blissrful marriage made in heaven that that's all that really matters to me when the cravings hit.
garlic noodles.author: Sharman G.
garlic noodles.review: Yeah, this place is pricy, and I've heard the crab is frozen, but the roast crab and garlic noodles is such an utterly blissrful marriage made in heaven that that's all that really matters to me when the cravings hit.

excerpts: garlic noodles are ridiculously overpriced...and shaken beef and pork medallions were pretty good.
garlic noodles.author: Adrienne C.
garlic noodles.review:
It's ok - essentially it's Crustaceans in the Outer Sunset, but with less butter. The crab is pretty good but small (liked the Drunken versus the Roasted version)...garlic noodles are ridiculously overpriced...and shaken beef and pork medallions were pretty good.

Overall, I really don't see how this place can justify the price with its food - it's abs ridics...

excerpts: You have to order the Garlic Noodles as well.
I like to share the noodles-
garlic noodles.author: Jason S.
garlic noodles.review:
Thanh Long- The best dungeness Crap and one of the largest you will ever have.  These bad boys look like King Crabs!  I've been going here for 7-8 yrs now.  Everyone wants to compare it to Crustacheans but Thanh Long on Judah has it's own taste.

The fried Calamari are always good to start out.  Has litte bits of Thai peppers chopped in with the salt and pepper.. mmmm.

You must get your own Garlic Roasted Crab!  Huge and full of garlic and butter.  I usually ask for butter and vinegar on the side to dip the crab meat.  Don't take your time to much  or the butter will get goey and hard haaaa!  

You have to order the Garlic Noodles as well.  I like to share the noodles- it's a pretty big portion.

It's a little pricey usually around $35 per crab.

Perfect for a special occassion.

It's dark inside but in a causual/dressy way.  Most people are dressed up but you can pretty  much come as you like.  I wouldnt wear shorts or anything but jeans and nice shirt would be ok. 

Parking is a pain.  You either have to park far away on the streets or they have vallet. 

If you know the City, I would pass dessert there and drive down a few blocks for your own dessert.

excerpts: This is the secret location for us residents out in the Outside Lands to find Crab and the famous garlic noodles.
garlic noodles.author: Infodiva B.
garlic noodles.review:
Sssssssssh! This is the secret location for us residents out in the Outside Lands to find Crab and the famous garlic noodles.

Yeah parking sucks. There is no parking garage. I have it timed. Come at the offpeak hours.

This is where I take the parents instead of dealing with the traffic and craziness of the Polk Street location. Yes, The same family owns Crustacean. The secret family recipes can be consumed here!

Mangia!

excerpts: As the garlic noodles will reak havoc on your breathe for 24 hours.
We had the Roasted Crab and it was good.
It wasnt spectacular but it was good.
A bit pricey at $36 each
garlic noodles.author: Tu D.
garlic noodles.review:
I came here with a group of 5 to celebrate a cousin's birthday. MAKE RESERVATIONS!!!! Or else you will be enjoying the company of the personality-less bartender for 45 minutes. On to the food. 

I must say, the garlic noodle is something I have never had before. Its soo delicious that you know it cant be good for you. I think our table order 5 plates of garlic noodle. Beware!!!! As the garlic noodles will reak havoc on your breathe for 24 hours. 
We had the Roasted Crab and it was good. It wasnt spectacular but it was good. A bit pricey at $36 each but overall it was a nice experience. 

I give this place 4 stars because its one where you only come back for special occassions. The food is pricey and you dont get much for what you pay. Service was good. The waiter even put the bib on for me. LOL!

excerpts:
"
Doctor: "Yes, this patient was suffering from a severe case of RCOS (Roasted Crab Overdose Syndrome), from repeated exposure to crab and garlic noodles at Thanh Long"
Nurse:
"RCOS again?
That's the 3rd one we've lost today!

"
Doctor:
garlic noodles.author: Chris H.
garlic noodles.review:
Nurse: "Dr., he's not going to make it!"
Doctor: "Bullsh*t, crank it up to 300 and try it again!  CLEAR!"
Whrrr BZZZT THUNK
Nurse: "Still no pulse, I think we lost him"
Doctor: "Dammit!  It never gets easier!!!"
Nurse: "My God, look at his arteries, it looks like they're coated with clarified butter!"
Doctor: "Yes, this patient was suffering from a severe case of RCOS (Roasted Crab Overdose Syndrome), from repeated exposure to crab and garlic noodles at Thanh Long"
Nurse:  "RCOS again?  That's the 3rd one we've lost today!"
Doctor:  "It's a serious epidemic, considering how frickin' delicious the roast crab at Thanh Long is.  Look, this guy still has his plastic bib in his back pocket, he must have been a serious addict."
Nurse:  "I remember the good old days when all we had to deal with was heroin ODs."
Doctor:  "It's a serious problem.  Now let's clear down, i'm late for my 7:30 reservation at Thanh Long"

excerpts: Delicious roasted crab and garlic noodles never disappoint.
The crab and garlic noodles are so good, that my periodic craving for them has driven me to learn how to make the dishes myself.
garlic noodles.author: Courtney Y.
garlic noodles.review:
