Delicious roasted crab and garlic noodles never disappoint.  However, the price, the wait, and the lack of parking deter me from coming here very often.

The rest of the menu is decent, but nothing outstanding.

The crab and garlic noodles are so good, that my periodic craving for them has driven me to learn how to make the dishes myself.  For a third of the price, I can have my own buttery garlicky crab and noodle feast in the comfort of my own home while watching tv in my underwear.   

Thank you Thanh Long, for forcing me to become a better cook.

excerpts: Their roasted crab and garlic noodles is a fan favorite.
Almost every person that comes into this restaurant orders these two items.
I've been coming to thanh long since I was a kid and still come back here for those special occasions and date night.
The only thing I can say about this restaurant is that overtime it seems that the food gets more buttery.
Not very good for people that have sensitive stomachs.
The crab and garlic noodles are definitely drenched heavily with butter.
garlic noodles.author: Crystal S.
garlic noodles.review:
When I feel like eating good, this place definitely comes into mind. Their roasted crab and garlic noodles is a fan favorite. Almost every person that comes into this restaurant orders these two items. I've been coming to thanh long since I was a kid and still come back here for those special occasions and date night. The only thing I can say about this restaurant is that overtime it seems that the food gets more buttery. Not very good for people that have sensitive stomachs. The crab and garlic noodles are definitely drenched heavily with butter.

The decor and the ambiance of the restaurant is elegant fine dining. It does get pretty loud in there so conversation does not sit on just whispers. Sometimes I find myself yelling a bit so the person across from me can hear me. A lot of bustling and moving with the waiters and everyone seems to celebrate their special occasions so you'll be hearing the birthday song at least once every time you eat there... haha.

All in all I like this restaurant. Great cocktails, great food and their waiters make effort in providing great costumer service. If you are a visitor of SF... you should definitely check out this spot. And if you live in the city... can't believe you haven't tried it yet!

excerpts: Garlic noodles are amaaaaazing.
However, they are a bit pricey.
The food was good, don't get me wrong, but it just wasn't worth it to me.
One crab was $40.
I probably could have bought one myself and made it just was good for less than $10.
Customer service was alright and ambiance was really nice.
The place looked bad from the outside but the inside sure surprised me.
Probably wouldn't go again just because the price wasn't worth it to me.
garlic noodles.author: Sana T.
garlic noodles.review: Garlic noodles are amaaaaazing. However, they are a bit pricey. The food was good, don't get me wrong, but it just wasn't worth it to me. One crab was $40. I probably could have bought one myself and made it just was good for less than $10. Customer service was alright and ambiance was really nice. The place looked bad from the outside but the inside sure surprised me. Probably wouldn't go again just because the price wasn't worth it to me.

excerpts: Of course the crab & garlic noodles is obligatory here.
Don't bother with the appetizers or wine; they're uninspiring and you'll need to put that money towards the "Market Price" anyway ($35.95 in my case).
I was half-convinced
the crab couldn't possibly live up to the hype, but it truly was an experience (the crab was huge too, plenty for the wife and I to split, especially with the noodles).
The tamarind sauce, while delicious, made things very slippery-sticky, and I thought my hands would never be clean again--until they brought out those blessed hot towels.
Dessert menu was impressive too, with plenty of "family recipes"; we went with the banana cake and weren't disappointed.
garlic noodles.author: Wes M.
garlic noodles.review:
Aside from the landmark Cliff House and Beach Chalet, Thanh Long is by far the most Yelped restaurant anywhere near Ocean Beach.  Then again, at 36 years old and counting, and with a backstory worthy of legend (see their website), it's something of a landmark itself.  The place filled up fast even on a Tuesday, with a very eclectic crowd that, not surprisingly, included a lot of birthdays (hey, you can't afford to eat this stuff every day).  Major props on those green walls with the painted trees--I shall certainly nick that idea for my house...if I ever own one.

Of course the crab & garlic noodles is obligatory here.  Don't bother with the appetizers or wine; they're uninspiring and you'll need to put that money towards the "Market Price" anyway ($35.95 in my case).  I was half-convinced the crab couldn't possibly live up to the hype, but it truly was an experience (the crab was huge too, plenty for the wife and I to split, especially with the noodles).  The tamarind sauce, while delicious, made things very slippery-sticky, and I thought my hands would never be clean again--until they brought out those blessed hot towels.  Dessert menu was impressive too, with plenty of "family recipes"; we went with the banana cake and weren't disappointed.

excerpts: The roast crab, shaken beef, and garlic noodles have a ton of flavor.
If you usually eat white rice every meal and you think that the garlic noodles can serve as the main carb dish, you're wrong.
Don't think twice.
garlic noodles.author: Evs K.
garlic noodles.review:
The roast crab, shaken beef, and garlic noodles have a ton of flavor. If you usually eat white rice every meal and you think that the garlic noodles can serve as the main carb dish, you're wrong. Don't think twice. Order the white rice even though it's outrageously expensive.

Dishes are on the saltier side. Every time I eat here, I come out dying of thirst. Other than that, the food is good.

excerpts: BEST GARLIC NOODLES! and the crab too of course!
everything else is just ok.
Service is excellent the handful of times that I've been here.
garlic noodles.author: Cecilia B.
garlic noodles.review: BEST GARLIC NOODLES! and the crab too of course! everything else is just ok. Service is excellent the handful of times that I've been here.

excerpts: The Garlic noodles are really superb.
These are the signature dishes that everyone goes for.
But the Tiger Prawns severed over Garlic Noodles area also incredible.
Not cheap but not over the top expensive.
Get there early and hungry!!
I highly recommend this place!
garlic noodles.author: Andrew R.
garlic noodles.review:
This is a place that you have to come early and be ready to fight for a parking spot. The area is really tough to park in but.... WORTH the hassle.
The Garlic Crab is so good. Umm, I'm salivating just remembering as I type. The Garlic noodles are really superb. These are the signature dishes that everyone goes for. But the Tiger Prawns severed over Garlic Noodles area also incredible.
Not cheap but not over the top expensive.  Get there early and hungry!!
I highly recommend this place!

excerpts: While the crab is the star of the show, the garlic noodles are definitely a scene stealer.
Appetizers and dessert are also great.
I'm a fan of the buddha rolls and deep fried banana with ice cream.
I'd definitely recommend going with a group so you can enjoy a larger variety of what Thanh long has to offer!
garlic noodles.author: Jessica S.
garlic noodles.review:
I'm going to steal Dennis L.'s line because I completely agree: "If i were a crab, i would be honored to be cooked at thanh long." So true. Thanh long is a delicious treat and every time I go (to both Thanh long and it's sister restaurant Crustacean on Polk), I look forward to meeting and devouring my delicious little crab. 

Thanh long is one of my favorite restaurants in the city. I prefer it to Crustacean because it's less formal, which lends itself to a more cozy atmosphere. Since it's a popular spot and a smaller space, you'll need reservations before you go but it's well worth it. Thanh long's specialty is their garlic roast crab, which is simply seasoned but DELICIOUS giving you a perfectly indulgent savory experience. The crab is always fresh and you have everything you need to get down to business: crab crackers, a miniature fork, bib and hot towel to clean up your filth when you're done. While the crab is the star of the show, the garlic noodles are definitely a scene stealer. Appetizers and dessert are also great. I'm a fan of the buddha rolls and deep fried banana with ice cream. I'd definitely recommend going with a group so you can enjoy a larger variety of what Thanh long has to offer!

excerpts: It can get pretty pricey with the garlic noodles
but it's definitely worth a try at least once.
One of the articles on the wall said that it was so good it will make you cry
and although I wouldn't describe it to that extent, I'd say it's a pretty accurate statement.
If you are going to go here for the first time, just do it big and get the crab.
If you don't, you'll just look around jealously at the other patrons wearing bibs and cracking shells and wish that you had been a true foodie and ordered it as well!
(It's true!
That's what happened when I was too cheap and ordered fish at Crustacean instead!).
After you've experienced the amazingness that is garlic + crab, you can feel free to explore the other items on the menu in consequent visits!
Honestly...just do it!
garlic noodles.author: Christina L.
garlic noodles.review: Roasted Crab = AMAZING. It can get pretty pricey with the garlic noodles but it's definitely worth a try at least once. One of the articles on the wall said that it was so good it will make you cry and although I wouldn't describe it to that extent, I'd say it's a pretty accurate statement. If you are going to go here for the first time, just do it big and get the crab. If you don't, you'll just look around jealously at the other patrons wearing bibs and cracking shells and wish that you had been a true foodie and ordered it as well! (It's true! That's what happened when I was too cheap and ordered fish at Crustacean instead!). After you've experienced the amazingness that is garlic + crab, you can feel free to explore the other items on the menu in consequent visits! Honestly...just do it!

excerpts: If I could live on garlic noodles and crab, I would be a happy man!
The Roast Crab and Garlic Noodles is the way to go.
Hands down, the best.
Even better than at Crustacean... maybe it is the more "authentic" atmosphere.
Appetizers are ok, but nothing to write home about and really not needed if everyone has their own crab - more than enough food.
One order of garlic noodles per 2 people is sufficient.
garlic noodles.author: Jason C.
garlic noodles.review:
If I could live on garlic noodles and crab, I would be a happy man! 

We've been coming to Thanh Long for over 10 years. It is really the reason we come back to SF. The location is great in that it is out of the "city" and a nice Muni ride on the N train. 

Ambiance - very warm and inviting. Nice lighting. It is best to have a booth for the coziness, but a table up front by the windows is perfect as well.

Drinks - full bar. Great Long Islands and decent prices on cocktails, which is nice considering some of the food prices. Wine corkage - $15/bottle.

Food - OH YUM! We've learned how to pare back and just stick to the basics. The Roast Crab and Garlic Noodles is the way to go. Hands down, the best. Even better than at Crustacean... maybe it is the more "authentic" atmosphere. Appetizers are ok, but nothing to write home about and really not needed if everyone has their own crab - more than enough food. One order of garlic noodles per 2 people is sufficient. The Vietnamese salad is great though, and the dressing is nice and light.

Thanh Long is a unique experience. Others may think it is overpriced, but the flavors are just magnificent. There are other places that serve garlic crab, but I'm hesitant to try it since this is my little special place. I'd hate to ruin that... Make a reservation!! If you have last minute plans, it may be hard to get a table, but for us out-of-towners, we call a couple weeks in advance to guarantee our spot. Sure beats waiting 1 hour+ for a table.

excerpts: Truth be told of this long standing eating establishment of the An Family, owner of the Crustacean Restaurant line, Thanh Long is the birthplace of the famous coveted GARLIC NOODLES & ROASTED CRABS (the 2 most ordered dishes).
AN'S FAMOUS GARLIC NOODLES
garlic noodles.author: Noreena M.
garlic noodles.review:
"The food must have been amazing, for you girls to venture all the waaaay out here in Outer Sunset!", our taxi driver commented after directing him to take us back to our hotel @ The Embarcadero.

Truth be told of this long standing eating establishment of the An Family, owner of the Crustacean Restaurant line, Thanh Long is the birthplace of the famous coveted GARLIC NOODLES & ROASTED CRABS (the 2 most ordered dishes).

My friend and I started at the bar while we were waiting for our reserved table.  Fyi, the place gets packed, and be sure to wait at least 30 minutes...even if you have a reservation.  At the bar, I ordered the PASSION MARTINI, and my friend a bottle of beer.  As we were both seated, old lush me, ordered another cocktail.  This time, a glass of LYCHEE PINEAPPLE MARTINI...oooooh super yummy!  

For appetizers, we both decided on the TEMPURA PRAWNS W/ COCONUT FLAKES, & LEMONGRASS BEEF SATAY W/ PEANUT DIPPING SAUCE.  Both were sooooo good and appetizing!

Our main dishes consisted of:
SIZZLING CLAYPOT OF FISH & VEGETABLES (brothy, light, and comforting)

WHOLE ROASTED DUNGENESS CRAB W/ AN'S GARLIC SAUCE & SECRET SPICES (ate it with our hands and fully enjoyed it!)

AN'S FAMOUS GARLIC NOODLES W/ SECRET GARLIC SAUCE (the "secret garlic sauce" is C-R-A-C-K!)

For dessert, we opted for the FRIED VANILLA ICE CREAM, and the BANANA CAKE.  Both were scrumptious! 

And to retort to our taxi driver..."Yes!  The food was FANTASTIC!  I would drive there again and back, in no time!"

excerpts: Famous for their crab & garlic noodles... it definitely lived up to all the hype, it's worth going back for a special occasion!
But please make sure not to be "light-weight" or a self conscious eater, eat that crab!
:p
If you go on a Friday night, make sure to make reservations.
garlic noodles.author: Mel E.
garlic noodles.review: Famous for their crab & garlic noodles... it definitely lived up to all the hype, it's worth going back for a special occasion! But please make sure not to be "light-weight" or a self conscious eater, eat that crab! :p If you go on a Friday night, make sure to make reservations.

excerpts: 2 plates of garlic noodles, 2 crabs, and an order of vegetables appear.
Holy this is some good shit.
The garlic noodles are devoured; I tear the crab asunder; a hail of crab parts descends upon the table.
garlic noodles.author: Jeff T.
garlic noodles.review:
7:55. Shit. I'm late meeting one of my best buds from back east. Why the hell does everyone drive so slow in San Francisco? Parking in Sunset isn't exactly fun either.

8:15. Walk in. Find Chris and girlfriend already seated. Chris looks like he's already downed 2 or 3 beers. 

8:20. Still waiting on one more person. I'm starving. A quick call indicates we should just go ahead and order. Chris does all the ordering since I am too lazy to look at the menu. Roy joins us shortly after.

8:30. Like magic the food appears. An entire deep fried crab in which I actually have to ask if I can eat the whole thing. Tasty but leaves me craving for more.

8:35. 2 plates of garlic noodles, 2 crabs, and an order of vegetables appear. Holy this is some good shit. You Yelpers weren't kidding.

8:40. I declare war on the crustaceans before me. I proceed to tear through the crab like a ravenous vulture. The garlic noodles are devoured; I tear the crab asunder; a hail of crab parts descends upon the table.

8:45. Worn from battle I emerge victorious! A razed field of cracked and torn shells is all I leave in my wake.

excerpts: You just can't go wrong with their roasted crab & garlic noodles.
Seriously, they should just throw their menu out.
No need for any other choices.
garlic noodles.author: Catherine W.
garlic noodles.review: Same menu as Crustaceans, but this spot is not as easy on the eyes. If I had a choice, I'd go to Crustaceans. But you can't lose here either. You just can't go wrong with their roasted crab & garlic noodles. Seriously, they should just throw their menu out. No need for any other choices.

excerpts: but in actuality all we needed was the crab and garlic noodles
- I guess we got too excited.
The crab is completely infused with flavor and quite juicy compared to your typical dry unflavored crab meat elsewhere.
The garlic noodle is quite tasty!
The only negative thing I would say is that the crab AND garlic noodles together can get a bit overwhelmingly oily in the throat.
There's a pretty good selection of wine as well - don't waste your time on a glass, get a bottle.
The food is a bit pricey but well worth it.
garlic noodles.author: Nancy P.
garlic noodles.review:
For being the mother of Crustacean, this takes the cake.  

My BF and I went and ordered a feast here but in actuality all we needed was the crab and garlic noodles - I guess we got too excited.  The crab is completely infused with flavor and quite juicy compared to your typical dry unflavored crab meat elsewhere.  The garlic noodle is quite tasty!  The only negative thing I would say is that the crab AND garlic noodles together can get a bit overwhelmingly oily in the throat.  There's a pretty good selection of wine as well - don't waste your time on a glass, get a bottle.  The food is a bit pricey but well worth it.

excerpts: My fiancee and I split a Roast Crab with a side of garlic noodles.
The crab is huge.
My man is a big eater and even he was satisfied.
The noodles are incredible.
A perfect balance of garlic, butter, just plain and simple.
Its a little pricey but its high quality food.
I have had crab in many places in this city and its usually overcooked and stuck inside the shell.
Thanh Long and their spices are cooked just right.
Maybe one day I will stray from the usual and try the other crab choices but for now I'm set.
Call for a reservation, this place fills up very quickly.
garlic noodles.author: Bri R.
garlic noodles.review: Best place in the city for crab, hands down!! Their Roast Crab is to die for. Its just garlic, salt, pepper and butter. I used to visit the Crustaceans in Bev Hill when I lived in LA all the time (all owned by the An Family) and Thanh Long is even better. We started with the Coconut Prawns. Very fresh and the sauce was delicious. My fiancee and I split a Roast Crab with a side of garlic noodles. The crab is huge. My man is a big eater and even he was satisfied. The noodles are incredible. A perfect balance of garlic, butter, just plain and simple. Its a little pricey but its high quality food. I have had crab in many places in this city and its usually overcooked and stuck inside the shell. Thanh Long and their spices are cooked just right. Maybe one day I will stray from the usual and try the other crab choices but for now I'm set. Call for a reservation, this place fills up very quickly.

excerpts:
We kept it simple, three plates down the middle:
tempura coconut prawns (meh, just alright),
garlic noodles (
garlic noodles.author: Tony L.
garlic noodles.review:
The wait was short and the garlic strong.
That pretty much describes our dinner at Thanh Long.
Since the oil spill was threatening crab season,
my girlfriend and I had enough reason
to dine on dungeness crab before it was spoiled.

We got there for reservations at seven,
right across the street from 7-11.
The first thing you'll notice as you pass through the door
is the decor, it's more than you'd expect from the get go
(since the Outer Sunset is kinda ghetto);

hues of tranquil turquoise, melancholy yellow
grace the walls with murals that recall
fishing villages in rural Viet Nam.
The seating is upholstered in a deep royal purple
and the tables are set rather formal.

"Welcome to Thanh Long, how can I help you?"
"Hi! Tony L., reservations for two."
It was a relief to get out of the rain.  And to our surprise
every table was packed with people --
bibbed, shell crackers in hand -- feasting on crab.

We kept it simple, three plates down the middle:
tempura coconut prawns (meh, just alright),
garlic noodles (those were outa' sight),
and lastly a stab at the world famous roasted crab,
(Like J.J. said, "DY-NO-MITE!").

There's nothing like sweet, tender crabmeat.
Leg after leg, each like a packed powder keg,
crackling with an explosion of flavor.  My only caveat
was my girlfriend's mojito.
That, unlike the crab, was a little bland.

Our waiter great, his service attentive,
and the time between dishes was unrelenting.
And so the wait was short and the garlic strong.
That pretty much describes our dinner at Thanh Long --
it's a restaurant that I'm recommending.

excerpts: Like most people, I came here for the crap and garlic noodles.
We were seated and served in no time.
garlic noodles.author: Jamie Y.
garlic noodles.review:
Like most people, I came here for the crap and garlic noodles.  We were seated and served in no time.  (I mean, seriously, cooking crab with a shitload of oil and garlic isn't terribly labor intensive; nor is cooking noodles with a shitload of oil and garlic).

I devoured my crab and ate some more crab off the plate across from me.  I ate lots of what might be the oiliest noodles ever.  The basic cooking philosophy seems to be oil+garlic=delicious.  They're not incorrect, but it was a bit overkill and I felt like ass when the meal was done.  Choosing this meal as what I ate before a red-eye flight was clearly not a wise decision.

excerpts: The garlic noodles left something to be desired.
Eh, I was expecting better.
I'll take my brother's crab over this any day.
garlic noodles.author: Christine P.
garlic noodles.review: The crab we got was pretty skinny. Call me a Pinay but I prefer my crab with lemon or vinegar instead of swimming in butter. The garlic noodles left something to be desired. Eh, I was expecting better. I'll take my brother's crab over this any day.

excerpts: Garlic noodles very good!
Be prepared to spend!
this place cost an arm and a leg!
garlic noodles.author: Eric V.
garlic noodles.review: Man, this place is GOOD! The garlic crab is AWESOME! Garlic noodles very good! Be prepared to spend! this place cost an arm and a leg!

excerpts: Never order Prawns over garlic noodles, basically four (4) medium sliced shrimps for $36.
Overpriced and dry.
We ordered  2 Roasted crabs and they were not fresh.
(slightly mushy)
garlic noodles.author: Nestor T.
garlic noodles.review: Never order Prawns over garlic noodles, basically four (4) medium sliced shrimps for $36. Overpriced and dry. We ordered  2 Roasted crabs and they were not fresh. (slightly mushy) Shaken beef was excellent. PPQs roasted crabs are fresher and larger, but their pho is not so good.   Parking's very difficult.

excerpts: The garlic noodles were kind of dry, the portion was small, and the chef seems to know nothing about presentation.
The drinks were tasty and pretty, but weak and overpriced.
As soon as our group of 12 were finished with dessert and presented with our unjustifiably inflated bill, the host came upstairs to ask us to leave.
garlic noodles.author: Jenny K.
garlic noodles.review:
I love crab, but I avoid it most of the time because of how messy and time-consuming it is to eat.  The only thing that makes the mess and time worthwhile is if the crab is tasty and priced just right.  

Each year, the Russian River Valley Crab & Wine Festival spoils me with their unlimited quantities of crab (usually I eat around 6 or 8) and glasses of delicious wine ... all for a very modest $45.  

Thanh Long charges $35 for ONE crab.  ONE CRAB!! The Drunken crab was good(but not delicious) and definitely not worth $35.  The garlic noodles were kind of dry, the portion was small, and the chef seems to know nothing about presentation.  The drinks were tasty and pretty, but weak and overpriced.  As soon as our group of 12 were finished with dessert and presented with our unjustifiably inflated bill, the host came upstairs to ask us to leave.  Nice touch.

Now that I've been to Thanh Long, I don't have to go back.   Oh yeah ... just because a restaurant charges you an arm and a leg for a meal doesn't mean you have to dress up in your finest.  It's really not a fancy place.  It just bills you as if it were.

excerpts: The garlic noodles were not al dente and WAY salty
garlic noodles.author: Mona N.
garlic noodles.review:
DISASTER !!
 
I used to be SUCH a fan of Thanh Long when the interior was a rickity wicker MESS with sticky tables, and no elbow room. Since they 1. renovated and 2. spawned the upscale counterparts (been to the Bev. Hills and SF Crustaceans... the only memorable thing was the aquarium walk way from the entrance into the dining hall in the BH location) I heard both Crustacean and Thanh Long went downhill but decided to give it a few tries before reaching any sort of conclusions. 

Two of my recent Thanh Long visits were average / below average but  during the most recent dinner:

1. The bartender (some dude with braided long hair) was rude, dismissive, and a jerk!! I've NEVER been treated this way at a bar. EVER. And I've lived in NYC, one of the most pretentious and snobby cities in the world as well as Tokyo, where a lot of the places are 10 times busier =(

2. The appetizer was below average. 10 dollars for seafood dumplings with mushy, sticky, thick skin and icky dipping sauce = DO NOT WANT! I've had frozen shu mai that tasted better. No joke.

2.The server spilled our beers on us and instead of immediately bringing napkins and or hot towels for our clothes, he disappeared towards the bar to clean himself up. We sat there covered in beer for a while before the hostess finally brought us extra linens =/ When he came back with extra napkins (5 min. too late) he didn't even apologize for spilling and said "I have slippery fingers haha" Um hello? This IS a fine dining establishment, correct? Am I mistaken to expect WAY more professional service?

3. The crabs were fresh and meaty but WAY too salty

4. The garlic noodles were not al dente and WAY salty  =(

I was with a first time Thanh Long-er who seemed to enjoy his food but I was NOT happy. I almost complained but didn't want to ruin my date's dinner.

I will never dine here again. Frankly, I'd rather go to a Chinese supermarket, pick up fresh crab, and season it myself.

note: I gave it two stars because zero is not possible. The 2nd star is for sentimental reasons. I frequented Thanh Long before it blew up and have quite fond memories of that place. I may be ultra picky, know what I want with high expectations, but I have feelings too !! =)

excerpts:
Grade: A-

Love the Dungeness Crab with garlic noodles!!
garlic noodles.author: Lisa N.
garlic noodles.review:
Grade: A-

Love the Dungeness Crab with garlic noodles!! Our cousins took us to Thanh Long and we had a great time. Thanh Long is a sister restaurant to Crustaceans. Food is pretty pricey and they probably use a lot of butter, but our entrees were delicious!  Will definitely go again when I am in the mood for crab.

We paid about ~$120/person.

Husband ordered the sea bass, and it was good (not extraordinary). He liked my entree better (as he always does).

excerpts: I ordered Crab with extra pepper and garlic noodles.......
For take out..........
garlic noodles.author: Cin H.
garlic noodles.review:
An out-of- town friend took me here last week. ( Thanks Luan!!) 

Not only was I embarrassed that he beat  me to it..... but that I had not even heard of this place and its in MY hood!!! I even said out loud, "oh this must be new" so sure of myself that I haven't been out of the loop. I was waaaay presumptuous. A lady who stood by me rolled her eyes and smirked thinking, " oh you don't know about crab."

And she's right, I don't. Well, I shouldn't say that. As a child, every Thursday was seafood night at my house. And every Thursday we had fresh crab, crawfish, and mussels all in one seating. Needless to say, I passed my seafood enthrallment at the age of ten. " Geez, loooooobster again!!!",  I would say. 

So as an adult, I don't skip and click my heels at the thought of going to a seafood restaurant (I get more excited eating spam because to me ,its more exotic).

But the Crab from Thanh Long had won me over. A Week after my first visit I was CRAVING. I ordered Crab with extra pepper and garlic noodles....... For take out.......... For one. 

As my room mate snidely said " woooow, thats pretty decadent of you..."

I replied,  " Well, yeah.... I'm worth it. "

***** ( sidenote: The price of the crackers = $5)******

excerpts: I had tiger prawns and garlic noodles
while everyone else had the crab and garlic noodles, they all said it was delicious and even ordered one to go home with.
I'll have the crab next time.
garlic noodles.author: Victoria B.
garlic noodles.review: I would give 3.5 but i decided to round up. We came a small group for my brothers birthday and well it was good. It was actually better than okay but not spectular. I would go again. I had tiger prawns and garlic noodles while everyone else had the crab and garlic noodles, they all said it was delicious and even ordered one to go home with. I'll have the crab next time.

excerpts: All I can say is that every table had an order of the garlic noodles and garlic CRAB!
It was great.
My friend and I tried to share but ended up ordering a crab for each person.
I was a little disappointed with the service.
We had to ask multiple times to get our water and iced tea refilled.
Food was brought super fast, within 5 minutes.
Seems to me like they have the crab constantly cooking since every single table orders it.
garlic noodles.author: S A.
garlic noodles.review: All I can say is that every table had an order of the garlic noodles and garlic CRAB!  It was great.  My friend and I tried to share but ended up ordering a crab for each person.  I was a little disappointed with the service.  We had to ask multiple times to get our water and iced tea refilled.  Food was brought super fast, within 5 minutes.  Seems to me like they have the crab constantly cooking since every single table orders it.

excerpts: Then our crab and garlic noodles arrived on the scene and it went downhill from there.
The "secret" spices on both?
Come on - garlic salt on the noodles?
That's no secret and the crab had so much pepper on the outside
I felt like a crab at the end.
The crab itself was over-cooked and under flavored.
And, to top it off, the crab was $45!!!
This was one of the worst dining experiences I've ever had in this City.
We will never be back.
It's become a tourist trap but, tourists, do yourself a favor and go to Fisherman's Wharf.
garlic noodles.author: Karen G.
garlic noodles.review: This place is overrated and overpriced. My husband and I ventured out on a Saturday night for our long-awaited visit to Thanh Long. What a waste of time! Let's start with the service - I've never felt so rushed in my life. My husband was still eating the appetizer when the waiter practically took the plate and fork right out of his hand! Then our crab and garlic noodles arrived on the scene and it went downhill from there. The "secret" spices on both? Come on - garlic salt on the noodles? That's no secret and the crab had so much pepper on the outside I felt like a crab at the end. The crab itself was over-cooked and under flavored. And, to top it off, the crab was $45!!! This was one of the worst dining experiences I've ever had in this City. We will never be back. It's become a tourist trap but, tourists, do yourself a favor and go to Fisherman's Wharf.

excerpts: The garlic noodles and roasted crab are Yummy!
The funny thing is i don't really like crab, but i inhaled the whole thing!
even the fatty part in the body of the crab.
when i was done my hands were completely covered in butter, that i tried to lick off!
The garlic noodles were the best thing next to sex.
garlic noodles.author: Chrisjan Y.
garlic noodles.review:
Wow!!! The garlic noodles and roasted crab are Yummy! The funny thing is i don't really like crab, but i inhaled the whole thing! even the fatty part in the body of the crab. when i was done my hands were completely covered in butter, that i tried to lick off! The garlic noodles were the best thing next to sex. I almost ordered an order togo until my girl called me fat!

The fried banana was great too! Next time i'm gonna order the tiger prawns and calamari!

I can't wait to come back.

excerpts: The garlic noodles too are soooooo good.
I know so many places that have tried to duplicate these recipes and never get it right.
This place is always crowded so make reservations.
Crustaceans is the same food, less crowded, bigger and more airy but for some reason I'm more drawn here...better vibe for me not sure why.
garlic noodles.author: Charla M.
garlic noodles.review: This is my favorite restaurant in the city...their crab is so amazingly delicious!!! The flavor is so intense and unique.  The garlic noodles too are soooooo good.  I know so many places that have tried to duplicate these recipes and never get it right. This place is always crowded so make reservations.  Crustaceans is the same food, less crowded, bigger and more airy but for some reason I'm more drawn here...better vibe for me not sure why.

excerpts:
The must orders are: 
Garlic Roasted and Garlic Noodles -
garlic noodles.author: Hebert J.
garlic noodles.review:
It's pricey but well worth every penny 
The must orders are: 
Garlic Roasted and Garlic Noodles - are very orgasmic 
Tender Beef with onion inside - is very tender and flavorful 

The external structure of the restaurant looks dilapidated but the inside is actually a semi-fancy restaurant. Good luck with parking.

excerpts: The garlic noodles.
garlic noodles.author: Minnie L.
garlic noodles.review:
Boyfriend took me here for a belated v-day dinner.  Now I understood why he told me to dress down! But worth it for the crab.  More on that in a little bit.  Food was great, other things took points off.

Pros:  The crab.  The garlic noodles.  My favorite of the evening was actually the fried banana and ice cream.

Our server was really good.  He came by enough to clear stuff away, but didn't hover and check on us overly much.  

Cons:  Parking is horrible.  We sucked it up and paid for the valet.  

Our reservation got "mysteriously" pushed back by half an hour, so we ended up waiting half an hour for a table.  Their waiting area up front is pretty small, and it was extremely crowded.  

When we were finally given a table, we were pretty packed in with all the other diners, and it definitely isn't a cozy, romantic restaurant.   Every time I said something to my boyfriend, I had to talk loudly so he could hear me.

Perhaps I'm not used to all that grease which coated their famous roasted crab, but I ended up getting really sick after eating it.  But since boyfriend didn't, and it was the same crab, I'm not blaming the restaurant.

Bottom line: I'd come here again if I'm eating in a big group.  But seriously need to give my boyfriend a better idea of where to take me for a valentine's day dinner.

excerpts: When looking for food near by we ran into Thanh Long and, on the recommendation of their garlic noodles, decided to have a bite to eat.
Service was fantastic.
We were seated quickly, even without a reservation.
We ordered crab puffs as an app, with garlic noodles and shaken beef as mains.
Presentation of the beef was pretty weak.
As Tina D. notes they serve it with chopped head lettuce, not something worthy of the $23 charge.
Pretty lame.
I was also surprised that both mains were rich with garlic, not just the garlic noodles; I like garlic quite a bit
but it felt like they were hiding their food with the amount they used.
Garlic is one of those ingredients that is easy to overuse because it tastes so good at first.
It's like eating cookies
, the first couple bites taste great then after some point you start to have a stomach ache from eating too many.
Well after all that butter and garlic
garlic noodles.author: Nate A.
garlic noodles.review:
Last night we ended up in the outer sunset on an adventure.  When looking for food near by we ran into Thanh Long and, on the recommendation of their garlic noodles, decided to have a bite to eat.  Service was fantastic.  We were seated quickly, even without a reservation.  Our waiter was spot on, didn't unnecessarily interrupt us, took our order promptly and returned with our app quickly.

The food was good but spectacularly overpriced. We ordered crab puffs as an app, with garlic noodles and shaken beef as mains.  Presentation of the beef was pretty weak.  As Tina D. notes they serve it with chopped head lettuce, not something worthy of the $23 charge.  Pretty lame.  I was also surprised that both mains were rich with garlic, not just the garlic noodles; I like garlic quite a bit but it felt like they were hiding their food with the amount they used.  Garlic is one of those ingredients that is easy to overuse because it tastes so good at first.  It's like eating cookies, the first couple bites taste great then after some point you start to have a stomach ache from eating too many.  Well after all that butter and garlic I ended up leaving with Thanh Long with a stomach ache.

Total dinner without drinks was $45. Ouch.  I was torn between giving Long 3 or 4 stars but ultimately they loose a star for food quality which was good but not sublime and they loose a star for not living up to my subjective quality / price metric.  That doesn't mean it's not a good restaurant, it is, with outstanding service and tasty food; just don't expect an enlightening meal.  (disclaimer: I didn't have any seafood aside from the crab puffs, perhaps the real reason to go to Thanh Long)

excerpts: I haven't been here in a bit but the last time I ate here of course u ordered the Roasted Crab and Garlic Noodles.
Absolutely delicious!
The tables are a bit close together but the ambience is nice.
A little pricey but worth it!
Highly recommend it!
garlic noodles.author: Frank Z.
garlic noodles.review: I haven't been here in a bit but the last time I ate here of course u ordered the Roasted Crab and Garlic Noodles. Absolutely delicious! The tables are a bit close together but the ambience is nice. A little pricey but worth it! Highly recommend it!

excerpts: While visiting SF, I read somewhere (i think it was in the frommer's book) about the roasted crabs and garlic noodles.
I knew I had to check it out and was not disappointed.
garlic noodles.author: Jin C.
garlic noodles.review: While visiting SF, I read somewhere (i think it was in the frommer's book) about the roasted crabs and garlic noodles.  I knew I had to check it out and was not disappointed.

excerpts: Next, we chose the Roast Crab and Garlic Noodles from the "Secret Kitchen Dishes", which for anyone who's ever visited Thanh Long, can clearly see that almost every table has ordered.
Haha!
"Secret"...
yeah.
Everyone knows these are the two destination items of this restaurant!
garlic noodles.author: Dave W.
garlic noodles.review:
It's been a few years since my last visit to Thanh Long.  But the food and service of last night's visit were as good as ever!

A fantastic meal starting with a couple of  tasty Passion Teas (carefully, these sneak up on you!), the super fresh Salmon Carpaccio, and a unique-tasting dish of Thanh Long Mussels.   The toasted French baguette crostini for the latter two dishes was a perfect textural pairing.

Next, we chose the Roast Crab and Garlic Noodles from the "Secret Kitchen Dishes", which for anyone who's ever visited Thanh Long, can clearly see that almost every table has ordered.  Haha!  "Secret"...  yeah.  Everyone knows these are the two destination items of this restaurant!  These two complimenting dishes bring me back again and again. 

Attentive service, mouth-watering dishes prepared consistently to perfection.  All in all, another great dining experience!

excerpts: Roasted crab and garlic noodles the bestest.
Don't bother trying other dishes
garlic noodles.author: Duke A.
garlic noodles.review: Roasted crab and garlic noodles the bestest. Don't bother trying other dishes

excerpts: The garlic noodles were great though, not overly greasy and great garlic flavor and portion.
garlic noodles.author: Dorothy F.
garlic noodles.review:
Long been a fan of their sister restaurant Crustaceans so I was eager to see what the differences were, if any, between the two places.  

Turns out there's quite a few.  

Thanh long is vey, very crowded and the waiting area is cramped to say the least.  It's also very loud and chaotic.  Feels more like a neighborhood eating joint with the cramped tables and noisy atmosphere.  

The service was kinda lacking.  I think the amount of patrons coming in and out ( and yes you do feel rushed) makes it hard for the servers to give you the same level of attentiveness you'd get at Crustanceans.  

As for the crab, somewhat disappointing.  It was still good but right off the bat I noticed mine was room temperature.  Unlike Crustaceans at Thanh Long the crab comes out of the kitchen in record time.   All night servers came out literally by the second, with the roast crab.  With as fast as they were bringing it out, it's easy to assume they were cooked before you ordered it. 

The garlic noodles were great though, not overly greasy and great garlic flavor and portion.  I also liked their shrimp toast, as an appetizer but the calamari was forgettable.  

The main disappointment was in their dessert selection.  I was undecided and the waitress suggested I try the fried banana, which of course every other Asian restaurant offers.  At Thanh Long was probably the worst (and I've never had a fried banana I didn't like).  The banana- to-dough ratio was waaayyy off.  Too much dough.  I ate more of the ice cream because I could barely eat two bites of the fried banana.  

Now that I've tried it there, I won't be going back.  Not a horrible experience but dims in comparison to Crustaceans.

excerpts: They are no competition to Thanh Long's roasted crab and garlic noodles.
Even Snoop will call this place the ShizNitz!
garlic noodles.author: Miles G.
garlic noodles.review:
PPQ ain't got nothing on this restaurant! They are no competition to Thanh Long's roasted crab and garlic noodles. Even Snoop will call this place the ShizNitz! I'm sure he likes his seafood.

Order their salt and pepper fried calamari to start. It is one of the best I've ever had, and I'm an expert in fried anything. It's garnished with red bell peppers and julienne cut scallions. Mouth watering for sure.

I would recommend paying for corkage by bringing your own bottle(s) of wine and skip their cocktails all together. I'm okay with small but strong, but not small and weak cocktails. Not cool.

excerpts: The garlic noodles are wonderful as well.
garlic noodles.author: Gina Y.
garlic noodles.review: This is a nice place to celebrate a friend's birthday. Of course, you will need to make a reservation. If not, you will need to wait in line. I like the roasted crab with the garlic butter. You'll definitely get your hands dirty. The garlic noodles are wonderful as well.

excerpts: The best crab and garlic noodles you'll find anywhere.
garlic noodles.author: Christopher B.
garlic noodles.review:
The best crab and garlic noodles you'll find anywhere. Period.

For the price, I'd prefer a little more ambiance, but the food is great.

excerpts: I have to say that I like PPQ's crab better, but Thanh Long's garlic noodles take the cake.
garlic noodles.author: Vivian W.
garlic noodles.review:
Thanh Long is very good.  I have to say that I like PPQ's crab better, but Thanh Long's garlic noodles take the cake.  

If I couldn't make it to PPQ, I definitely wouldn't mind going to Thanh Long instead!

excerpts: I was going to say I miss you and your garlic noodles.
But then I remembered...
I'm in LA.
Of course, I had the garlic noodles, as was suggested by everyone, and it lived up to my expectations.
Unfortunately it was extremely crowded, and hard to get through everywhere.
garlic noodles.author: Ags P.
garlic noodles.review:
Ahhhh Thanh Long, I miss you.  I was going to say I miss you and your garlic noodles.  But then I remembered...I'm in LA.  There's Crustaceans, and they have it there as well.  

The first time I had something from the An family was at Thanh Long.  Of course, I had the garlic noodles, as was suggested by everyone, and it lived up to my expectations.  Unfortunately it was extremely crowded, and hard to get through everywhere.  I digress.  

I miss the ambiance of Thanh Long, I don't miss the company that I was with. hehe.

excerpts: Everyone suggested the roast crab and garlic noodles, but I was feeling too lazy to work for my food
so I ordered the tiger prawns.
My food was great...the prawns were seasoned well and the garlic noodles did not disappoint.
A few of my friends got the roast crab and I got a piece and...
HELLO!
I am definitely getting that next time I visit here.
I think I could eat garlic noodles every day of my life.
garlic noodles.author: Ruben P.
garlic noodles.review:
I went here for a friend's birthday and loved it.  Everyone suggested the roast crab and garlic noodles, but I was feeling too lazy to work for my food so I ordered the tiger prawns.  My food was great...the prawns were seasoned well and the garlic noodles did not disappoint.

A few of my friends got the roast crab and I got a piece and...HELLO!  I am definitely getting that next time I visit here.  Also, the beef items on the menu were very good according to other friends.

I plan on visiting here again very soon.  I think I could eat garlic noodles every day of my life.

excerpts: Secondly, the Garlic Noodles is not as garlicky anymore and the portion has become a lot smaller.
It's $9.50 an order for crissakes...
the least they can do is give you a more generous portion.
I downgraded my review by 1 star because although I would still go back and still enjoy the Roast Crab and Garlic Noodles, it is not the same as when I wrote my first review in 2007.
garlic noodles.author: MJ A.
garlic noodles.review:
It's been 3 years since my first Yelp review and a lot has happened in 3 years.

For one, since San Francisco's ban on trans fats, the Roasted Crab at Thanh Long does not coagulate any more.  Hmmm, coincidence?  Nonetheless, it's all good.

Secondly, the Garlic Noodles is not as garlicky anymore and the portion has become a lot smaller.  It's $9.50 an order for crissakes... the least they can do is give you a more generous portion.  Aside from the butter and spices, it's only noodles so why skimp?

I downgraded my review by 1 star because although I would still go back and still enjoy the Roast Crab and Garlic Noodles, it is not the same as when I wrote my first review in 2007.

excerpts: Garlic noodles are the best I have ever had
and I even got an extra order to take home.
Obviously I got one of the crabs and it was really good.
I feel over priced but for sf near the ocean
what do you expect.
otherwise food is good
garlic noodles.author: Delo J.
garlic noodles.review: Garlic noodles are the best I have ever had and I even got an extra order to take home. Obviously I got one of the crabs and it was really good. I feel over priced but for sf near the ocean what do you expect. otherwise food is good

excerpts: Thanh Long is known for their garlic noodles and roasted crab.
The noodles were the highlight of the meal.
Well-flavored, but after just a few bites, the dish is over.
$10 for a sparse plate.
At an asian market, I imagine you could purchase dozens of packages of noodles for $10.
garlic noodles.author: Kadie C.
garlic noodles.review:
Thanh Long is known for their garlic noodles and roasted crab. The noodles were the highlight of the meal. Well-flavored, but after just a few bites, the dish is over. $10 for a sparse plate. At an asian market, I imagine you could purchase dozens of packages of noodles for $10. The crab was delicious, the second highlight of the meal, making it worth the trip. 

Aside from those two dishes, my friends and I ordered two appetizers and the lotus shrimp curry dish. I don't remember which appetizers we ordered, but I do remember them arriving in tiny portions. The lotus shrimp dish was the most disappointing of them all. It is listed as a shrimp dish on the menu, however, shrimp is not the selling point. The dish comes with about 4-5 pieces of shrimp, and the majority of the dish consists of lotus root and other veggies in a meager, bland curry sauce. This dish was $16. 

The service was fine, though not great or special. Thanh Long is overpriced for the quality of the food and the portions. The dishes are lacking in size and in flavor. It's a restaurant that thinks it's fancy, but it's not. I would not go out of my way to return. I'm better off at PPQ.

excerpts: The garlic noodles look so heavy which makes it all the more scrumptious.
I think no matter which type of crab u get u can't go wrong.
The lychee martini is a nice light touch to the heavy meal and the Fried banana for dessert is a must!
garlic noodles.author: Nette A.
garlic noodles.review:
I love me some crab! 

I prefer to go to Crustaceans because its easier to get to which is better for me because I hate stop lights and stop signs! But Thanh long is still really really good! I love the Garlic crab its smothered with drawn butter and Garlic it looks like its gonna clog ur arteries but I can't resist! The garlic noodles look so heavy which makes it all the more scrumptious. I think no matter which type of crab u get u can't go wrong. The lychee martini is a nice light touch to the heavy meal and the Fried banana for dessert is a must!

excerpts: The garlic crab with the garlic noodles is my favorite combination.
Dinner is messy and pricey but very much worth it.
garlic noodles.author: No B.
garlic noodles.review: I have only one check in here, BUT I've been eating here for years.  I LOVE this place.  The garlic crab with the garlic noodles is my favorite combination.  Dinner is messy and pricey but very much worth it.

excerpts: Garlic noodles = spaghetti soaked in garlic butter =
DIY = save $30 (or however much they charge)
garlic noodles.author: JaM W.
garlic noodles.review:
I don't see how this place can have an average of four stars.
The parking situation sucks and the food is overrated. Since when is Vietnamese food worth the prices they charge?

Garlic noodles = spaghetti soaked in garlic butter =DIY = save $30 (or however much they charge)

excerpts: I have yet to find another restaurant that compares to the taste of the crabs and garlic noodles.
garlic noodles.author: Stella K.
garlic noodles.review:
Thanh Long is a definite favorite of mine.  You get all the high class flavor in a neighborhood restaurant without the stuffiness or dress codes.  I have yet to find another restaurant that compares to the taste of the crabs and garlic noodles.  There have been many that try, but most fall short.

It's a Birthday tradition for me.  Even on Sept. 11, 2001, Thanh Long was open to help celebrate with the few of us who had birthdays.

My tip - There are few places where I must have a glass of wine with my meal.  Thanh Long is one of those places.  Get a glass or bottle of their sweet German Reisling with your crab.  Mmmm, it's perfect.

excerpts: Oh and of course the Garlic Noodles!
The crab was delicious!!
Finished the whole crab by myself..mmmm!!
The Garlic Noodles were great, but came out lukewarm.
garlic noodles.author: Elizabeth W.
garlic noodles.review:
My first review!

I would say 4.5 stars, but I guess they don't let you give half!

My bf took me here for my birthday with two of my very good friends. It was a surprise dinner and he said it's something I wanted to eat, but haven't had for a while.  When we passed the restaurant to find parking, the only restaurant I saw was 'Thanh Long' and I thought it looked kind of rundown.  At first I was disappointed cuz I thought my bf was taking me to eat steak, but then he told me this place is known for their crab. So I was like oh ok, whew! When we walked into the restaurant it was actually very nice (next time I won't be too quick to judge). 

My bf had made reservations so we were seated right away. The food came out pretty quick too! Don't know if that's a good thing though, but it was probably less than 7 minutes.  I had ordered the Roasted Garlic Crab and my bf a Stuffed Calamari dish. Oh and of course the Garlic Noodles! The crab was delicious!! Finished the whole crab by myself..mmmm!! The Stuffed Calamari was not that great - wouldn't recommend it. The Garlic Noodles were great, but came out lukewarm. So that's where the minus half star comes from.  

I would definitely come here again!!

excerpts: Garlic Noodles...mmmm!
I don't eat crab but everyone else at our table got crab and they DEVOURED it.
I also got the eggplant dish without the meat and it was good, but not as good as the garlic noodles.
garlic noodles.author: Erin P.
garlic noodles.review: Garlic Noodles...mmmm!  I don't eat crab but everyone else at our table got crab and they DEVOURED it.  I also got the eggplant dish without the meat and it was good, but not as good as the garlic noodles.

excerpts: The garlic crab and garlic noodles are straight scrumptious!
My favorite appetizers are the crab puffs.
Yummy yummy yummy YUM!!
garlic noodles.author: Gorgeous P.
garlic noodles.review: This is my absolute most favorite restaurant! The garlic crab and garlic noodles are straight scrumptious! My favorite appetizers are the crab puffs. Yummy yummy yummy YUM!!

excerpts: 3 of us ordered, 2 crabs and 2 orders of garlic noodles.
Forget everything else, we went straight for the rich stuff.
garlic noodles.author: Kimi N.
garlic noodles.review:
Where to take an out-of-town food lover up for something, very SF and somewhat exotic? THANH LONG.

Not your typical foodie joint, but complete with fine dining-esque servers and full bar, this place is great for one reason -- the garlic crab and noodles. You can get dungeoness crab many places but the way they make this one is unique and DELISH. 3 of us ordered, 2 crabs and 2 orders of garlic noodles. Forget everything else, we went straight for the rich stuff.

excerpts: Then our two orders of crab with garlic noodles and an order of shaken beef showed up....
we 4 split all the dishes and were STUFFED!!
plus we all had 2 drinks each (beer and rum drinks)
The bill was $200; about $150 less than we were prepared to pay for 4 people for a crab meal!
Everyone was pleasant, fast and efficient ... will be back to work on the rest of the menu!!
garlic noodles.author: Ange W.
garlic noodles.review: My husband & I went on a double date to this wonderful gem of a restaurant. I was skeptical due to some of the Yelp reviews stating that service sucked, prices were high and so on.... but to my delightful surprise, we were completely taken care of and had a wonderful night. My husbands brother went before and said for 2 he spend $150... so we were prepared. We got there at 6, our friends were there early so they stopped in at the bar where Peter took excellent care of them offering them samples of his concoctions (which they loved). When my husband and I got there we just paid the $12 for valet and were done with it!! Still cheaper than a ticket or towing!! When we went in we were seated right away with our friends (we did have a reservation). They were prompt and courteous. We ordered a started dish of fried calamari... I don't eat calamari but I did this night!! it was AWESOME! cooked PERFECT!! Then our two orders of crab with garlic noodles and an order of shaken beef showed up.... we 4 split all the dishes and were STUFFED!! plus we all had 2 drinks each (beer and rum drinks) The bill was $200; about $150 less than we were prepared to pay for 4 people for a crab meal! Everyone was pleasant, fast and efficient ... will be back to work on the rest of the menu!!

excerpts: As everyone else has already said, the crab and garlic noodles are the best!

The garlic noodles (also impossible to duplicate at home!) are delish and there's enough in one order to share between two - unless you're with a pregnant woman and then beware any who dare approach the plate until she's finished.
garlic noodles.author: Teri T.
garlic noodles.review:
If you love crab and aren't afraid of garlic, this is definitely THE place to go. As everyone else has already said, the crab and garlic noodles are the best! When dungeness is out of season, it can be pricey (I think we've paid as much as $54 once - when we were desperate) but otherwise, on price (usually about $27 - $37), it's comparable to other places while beating the pants of other places in terms of flavor.

I love the garlic roasted crab and hubs loves the drunken crab. I've made the garlic roasted for us at home but it never quite measures up. There must be a secret ingredient of some sort. Maybe the secret is those plastic bibs they give you. (BTW, is it my imagination or have those bibs gotten smaller?  Or is it just that my belly has gotten bigger??) Oh- and a tip for those who don't eat the crab but are dining with someone (or next to someone) who is: request a bib for yourself. Otherwise, beware flying crab juice, crab meat pieces, or droplets of garlic sauce. 

The garlic noodles (also impossible to duplicate at home!) are delish and there's enough in one order to share between two - unless you're with a pregnant woman and then beware any who dare approach the plate until she's finished. I don't care if it's hubs or the waiter - hands off my noodles until I'm done!

The seabass is yummy too, but not nearly as fun or as filling as the crab. It was cooked perfectly and accompanied by vegetables that complimented the flavor just right.  The shaken beef is - to me - the best beef dish on the menu. Soooo tender and flavorful!  Seasonal veggies are good too, although sometimes they taste just like the beef. Must use the same sauce or at least the same spices.

Parking is definitely the only sucky part. But as others have recommended, go during off-peak hours and it should be easier to find a spot. Otherwise, at least there's valet. Small price to pay for an hour+ of crab-eatin' heaven.

excerpts: Thanh Long has fantastic food--everyone is right about the crab and the garlic noodles!
Compared to other great restaurants in the area though, I think it's a little bit overpriced (otherwise it'd be 5 starts).
One VERY pleasant surprise: it has the best classy-ish bar that I know of in the outer sunset!
garlic noodles.author: Billy S.
garlic noodles.review: Thanh Long has fantastic food--everyone is right about the crab and the garlic noodles! Compared to other great restaurants in the area though, I think it's a little bit overpriced (otherwise it'd be 5 starts). One VERY pleasant surprise: it has the best classy-ish bar that I know of in the outer sunset!

excerpts: ABOUT the GARLIC NOODLES and ROASTED CRAB!!!
And you just don't give a hoot how you look when eating that crab...
Cause man, I TEAR that UP!!!
I wonder how Jerry Rice looks like when he eats...
cause you know he be going there too...
garlic noodles.author: May C.
garlic noodles.review:
You've GOTSTA be a Garlic lover in order to enjoy this place...cause IT'S ALLLLL ABOUT the GARLIC NOODLES and ROASTED CRAB!!! And you just don't give a hoot how you look when eating that crab... Cause man, I TEAR that UP!!! I wonder how Jerry Rice looks like when he eats...cause you know he be going there too... Haha...

Kinda random how it's in a neighborhood. It almost makes you wanna say... "Are we lost?!?!".. "Am I going the right way?!?!".."Is Yahoo maps trippin' again?!?!"....But lo and behold, you see a tiny lit up restaurant on the corner...Thanh Longs....

Service is great. They put on the bibs for you as well as cleaning your table with that lil scraper thingy. Thought that was cool.

Man, I wanna go here again..

excerpts: We ordered the garlic noodles, but neither of us were able to gravitate away from our yummy crab so we had to take the noodles to go.
It was still good as a leftover.
We each ordered our own roasted crab.
garlic noodles.author: Somala A.
garlic noodles.review:
Finally, my bf took me to eat crab here.  I kept telling him how good it was.  We were supposed to go to Crustacean's but they didn't open until 5, so we came to Thanh Long's which opens at 4:30.  It was the perfect dinner to eat before the 49ers game we were attending.  

The crab was sooo yummy.  We ordered the garlic noodles, but neither of us were able to gravitate away from our yummy crab so we had to take the noodles to go.  It was still good as a leftover.  We each ordered our own roasted crab. I ordered a side of white rice with mine because I can't eat salt&pepper crab w/o rice.  

If you want to valet park, they charge $8.  There is limited street parking, but we didn't have a problem since we got there so early.  Expect to spend about $100 for dinner (if u get your own crab).

The wait staff was very attentive and our service was great!

excerpts: It's the Garlic Noodles, that sets apart from the rest or maybe thats what makes it Special.
I'll drive the distance just for you.
All that just for your Garlic Noodle!
garlic noodles.author: Rick W.
garlic noodles.review:
Thanh Long!! I've Long For Yoooouuu.........

This Big...Yes, This Big. Do U see it? Do U feel it?! My Loneliness is Killing me...

Famous for its Crabs. BUT!! It's the Garlic Noodles, that sets apart from the rest or maybe thats what makes it Special. I'll drive the distance just for you. All that just for your Garlic Noodle! Need I say more?! 

Thanh Long, when's the last time we saw each other? Wasn't I delicate enough? Didn't I treat you with extra care and attention? Wasn't I focused enough, I had my eyes all on you and never left you even though Jessica Biel walked past with a wink at our direction..

My hard earned 50 ones are worthed pennies spent on you. U're the reason I left my heart in San Francisco.

Can I call you when I'm in Town?

excerpts: The crab and garlic noodles are delicious and the service was great!
Best garlic noodles
I've ever had
and I swear nowhere comes close to this place.
It is pricey but the ambiance and the food pays for itself.
garlic noodles.author: Candace N.
garlic noodles.review: Absolutely love this place!! The crab and garlic noodles are delicious and the service was great! Best garlic noodles I've ever had and I swear nowhere comes close to this place. It is pricey but the ambiance and the food pays for itself.

excerpts: My group's mission was to have just the Roasted Crabs and the Garlic Noodles and that was all that we wanted.
Our server was quick to get our orders in, we ordered one Crab each (yes, I can eat a whole Crab!).
We didn't have to wait too long before our server came back to place our Crab bibs on us
and we know that the hot Roasted Crabs will soon-be-a-coming.
Our crabs came to us piping hot and not overly drenched in the buttery-garlicy sauce...
oh looks soooo delish!
We dove right into our Crabs and there was nothing but the sound of cracking Crabs coming from our table for awhile.
Before we know it we had a mount of cracked Crab shells in front of us and we found ourselves licking our fingers clean from the buttery-garlicy sauce...
garlic noodles.author: Miriam O.
garlic noodles.review:
Haven't been here in many years and I wanted to see if it's as good as I remember it to be.  I went with a couple of friends for an early dinner at 5:00 pm on a Sunday evening.  We were about 15 min. early and so were about 10 other people waiting in front on the restaurant to open.  When the doors opened, we were all seated quickly.  My group's mission was to have just the Roasted Crabs and the Garlic Noodles and that was all that we wanted.  Our server was quick to get our orders in, we ordered one Crab each (yes, I can eat a whole Crab!).  We didn't have to wait too long before our server came back to place our Crab bibs on us and we know that the hot Roasted Crabs will soon-be-a-coming.  Our crabs came to us piping hot and not overly drenched in the buttery-garlicy sauce... oh looks soooo delish!  We dove right into our Crabs and there was nothing but the sound of cracking Crabs coming from our table for awhile.  Before we know it we had a mount of cracked Crab shells in front of us and we found ourselves licking our fingers clean from the buttery-garlicy sauce... oh sooo delish!

Overall:  It's a little pricey for Asian cuisine, but worth it for "Crabs Done Right".  I can easily steam up some crabs at home, but why not indulge sometimes. The service was excellent and what I can see from the other tables, everyone was enjoying their meals with or without the Crabs!

Enjoy!

excerpts: I would highly recommend the Tamarind crab, and garlic noodles.
The garlic noodles are so good.
You might end up ordering 2 orders of them.
They have excellent mixed drinks.
If you are going to eat the crab, be mentally prepared to work hard on the crab, and get a bit messy.
Not a thing to take a date to - wait until you are married a few years and take her then.
Hard to find parking, so just pay the $10 for the valet parking.
Also, highly recommend making a reservation since the place is always packed.
If you like crab, this is your place.
garlic noodles.author: John H.
garlic noodles.review: I would highly recommend the Tamarind crab, and garlic noodles.  The garlic noodles are so good.  You might end up ordering 2 orders of them.  They have excellent mixed drinks.   If you are going to eat the crab, be mentally prepared to work hard on the crab, and get a bit messy.  Not a thing to take a date to - wait until you are married a few years and take her then.   Hard to find parking, so just pay the $10 for the valet parking.  Also, highly recommend making a reservation since the place is always packed.  If you like crab, this is your place.

excerpts: Roasted Crab and garlic noodles are must haves.
I really like the calamari too..
the one with breading
I am forgetting what it is called on the menu.
Pina Colada's are tasty and old fashioned banana cake...
OH MY GOD sooo good !
Super classy, nice place and not impossible to get a table.
Parking can be a little tough but its really not too bad and they have valet
so there u go.
I usually go during the week when its really alot easier.
Also this was supposedly Mac Dre's favorite restaurant so that makes it extra cool lol
garlic noodles.author: Aisha F.
garlic noodles.review: This place is bomb..... whenever I'm celebrating a special occasion this is my go to place. Roasted Crab and garlic noodles are must haves. I really like the calamari too.. the one with breading I am forgetting what it is called on the menu. Pina Colada's are tasty and old fashioned banana cake... OH MY GOD sooo good ! Super classy, nice place and not impossible to get a table. Parking can be a little tough but its really not too bad and they have valet so there u go. I usually go during the week when its really alot easier. Also this was supposedly Mac Dre's favorite restaurant so that makes it extra cool lol

excerpts: the tamarind crab and garlic noodles were fantastic.
The appetizers were good, but not great.
All in all, I would highly recommend it.
I will be back with out of town visitors.
garlic noodles.author: Daniel D.
garlic noodles.review: I absolutely love this place!!  I have only been here once for dinner and the tamarind crab and garlic noodles were fantastic. The appetizers were good, but not great. All in all, I would highly recommend it. I will be back with out of town visitors.

excerpts: We ordered a roasted crab, two plates of garlic noodles, eggplant, garlic rice (more like white fried rice with a hint of garlic), crab puff appetizer, salt and pepper calamari (yum), and a vegetarian garlic dish.
We also got the banana cake and creme brulee for dessert.
Came out to be about $25pp, 8 of us (one didn't make it).
garlic noodles.author: qirk z.
garlic noodles.review:
Made reservations early in the week, 5ppl, 7pm, Sunday.

Thur, changed reservations to 7ppl, 7pm, Sunday; "oh no problem, we'll make the change".

Sunday 2pm, changed reservations to 9ppl, 7pm, today; "oh no problem, we'll make the change, thanks for calling".

Sunday 5pm, changed reservations to 9ppl, 6pm, today; 'oh sure, we'll make the change, see you soon".

Arrive at 6pm, found parking just around the corner, place was still empty (maybe three groups of diners), we get seated upstairs. I've eaten here before, but never upstairs. We were the second large party upstairs.

By the time we finished eating, maybe 8pm? Both upstairs and downstairs was packed.

We ordered a roasted crab, two plates of garlic noodles, eggplant, garlic rice (more like white fried rice with a hint of garlic), crab puff appetizer, salt and pepper calamari (yum), and a vegetarian garlic dish. We also got the banana cake and creme brulee for dessert. Came out to be about $25pp, 8 of us (one didn't make it).

excerpts: The raves about the roasted crab and the garlic noodles are redundant, like you can go wrong with roast crab awash in butter or garlic anything.
garlic noodles.author: Ed H.
garlic noodles.review:
The raves about the roasted crab and the garlic noodles are redundant, like you can go wrong with roast crab awash in butter or garlic anything.

And I'd totally take a first date here, if I can't score a second date after rockin' the plastic bib, well, it was never meant to be.

Last time I was there, I ordered the mussels with an "Asian" pesto.  It was served with toasted slices of baguette.  The flavors, textures, aromas, even appearance just came together, for that eye-widening, grin inducing experience.

Try it, if you don't like it, save it for me. :p

excerpts: I also had the Garlic Noodles
garlic noodles.author: steve a.
garlic noodles.review:
Great Place, Good Food and the Roast garlic Crab OMG! I would have eaten the shell if i could. This place was Finger licking Good. I also had the Garlic Noodles They were delicious but dry. 

The Reason i left out the star is service was nothing special it was just regular. The Price Yikes averaged out to $75.00 Per person. 

I would come back here but only when i am in the area and in the mood for it.

excerpts: Their salt & pepper crab and garlic noodles are to die for!
The price is well worth it, best if you made reservations beforehand and took the Muni otherwise parking might be pretty tricky
and you'll be late for your reservation
like I was
but they knew reservations can run late so they were nice about it and the waiters were very polite.
garlic noodles.author: Tony T.
garlic noodles.review: Their salt & pepper crab and garlic noodles are to die for!  The price is well worth it, best if you made reservations beforehand and took the Muni otherwise parking might be pretty tricky and you'll be late for your reservation like I was but they knew reservations can run late so they were nice about it and the waiters were very polite.

excerpts: The BEST crab and garlic noodles in the whole Bay Area, or even the whole state.
You will taste and smell and reek of garlic for 24 hours
but you will be SO satisfied after eating here.
It's always been packed every time I've been here, and I can see why.
After eating here I am a stinky happy satisfied person who dreams of the next meal to be had at this establishment.
If you love garlic and love a whole crab and love REAL food, go here.
It's worth it, I swear!
garlic noodles.author: J Jay D.
garlic noodles.review: The BEST crab and garlic noodles in the whole Bay Area, or even the whole state. You will taste and smell and reek of garlic for 24 hours but you will be SO satisfied after eating here. It's always been packed every time I've been here, and I can see why. After eating here I am a stinky happy satisfied person who dreams of the next meal to be had at this establishment. If you love garlic and love a whole crab and love REAL food, go here. It's worth it, I swear!

excerpts: My sea bass was loaded with sodium (MSG?) as were our garlic noodles.
garlic noodles.author: Risk D.
garlic noodles.review:
When the sea-level rises and everything west of 44th SF migrates underwater (thank you global warming), I will not shed a tear for Thanh Long.

My sea bass was loaded with sodium (MSG?) as were our garlic noodles. That unfortunate allocation aside, this entree was entirely forgettable.

My abysmal rating of Thanh Long is a response to the service: throughout our meal I flash-backed to my High School hockey games. I'm sure that every member of Thanh Long's staff took their turns at hip-checking my chair. I wasn't obtusely positioned in their foot-path so I have to conclude that this was some subtle form of intimidation: 30% or we'll be waiting for you at your car. Although, they're already waiting for you at your car because there is no parking in this 'hood and valet is $9. 

So if you enjoy full-contact sports and the challenge of getting food into your mouth before it is knocked off your fork, Thanh Long will surely provide you with the fun-filled evening that you crave.

excerpts: Speaking from my egocentric, self-centered, but definitely correct opinion - get the roasted crab and the garlic noodles.
garlic noodles.author: J D.
garlic noodles.review:
Speaking from my egocentric, self-centered, but definitely correct opinion - get the roasted crab and the garlic noodles.

you'll thank me later.

excerpts: The Best Crab & Garlic Noodles in the Bay Area.
garlic noodles.author: Michelle M.
garlic noodles.review: I wish they had one of these in the East Bay! Dannnnnnnnnnnnnggggggggggggg! The Best Crab & Garlic Noodles in the Bay Area.

excerpts: The garlic noodles are buttery and full of garlic.
garlic noodles.author: Peter G.
garlic noodles.review:
Oh my gosh so good! The roasted crab is unbelievable.  The garlic noodles are buttery and full of garlic.  I'll be returning often.

Great for dates too!

-1 star because its over priced

excerpts: Garlic noodles were amazing!
garlic noodles.author: Michelle F.
garlic noodles.review: Awesome service from Carol, nice ambiance and great food. Garlic noodles were amazing!

excerpts: tiger butterfly prawns were so good i ate the shell, garlic noodles are a big deal to me going to these places , this is a cousin company to crustacean so my high expectations were well served through service , appetizers the drinks & entrees (yes )
garlic noodles.author: Marceliano J.
garlic noodles.review: tiger butterfly prawns were so good i ate the shell, garlic noodles are a big deal to me going to these places , this is a cousin company to crustacean so my high expectations were well served through service , appetizers the drinks & entrees (yes )

excerpts: Wifey: "I only had a small bit of the garlic noodles, and just one bite of the garlic crab...
garlic noodles.author: Gracie-C Y.
garlic noodles.review:
The noxious aroma of garlic hit me like a boxer's right hook.
Wifey came home from a dinner meeting with colleagues and didn't even have to tell me where she went.

Wifey: "I only had a small bit of the garlic noodles, and just one bite of the garlic crab..."

Me:  "Then why do you smell like Gilroy in the middle of fucking garlic season?"

Now I love garlic.  Especially roasted garlic when the cloves are buttery soft and spreadable.  I could eat the stuff all day.  But the smell of cooked and raw garlic during food preparation is vastly different from the acrid, putrid odor of garlic-breath.  I almost passed out.

The food here is good.  For some reason, I think it's a bit better than at Crustacean (Thanh Long's sequel restaurant in the city).  Prices are on the high end of the spectrum for vietnamese restaurants.  Parking is definitely easier out on Judah next to the ocean.  I'll let other Yelpers describe the food in gory detail.

That night, I made wifey brush her teeth twice and chased it with a double serving of Listermint.  This only knocked down the intensity down from a 9 to a 7.  Little did I know that garlic has a way of hiding in the background and seeping out from your pores.  We went to bed that night and I remember sleeping poorly.  Wifey left early for work, allowing me an extra hour of snoozing.  When I awoke, I felt slightly ill, but didn't notice anything too out of place.  I left the bedroom to brush my teeth and get pretty for work.
As I walked back into the bedroom, the smell of garlic nearly doubled me over!  Holy shit!  I began to choke and my eyes started to water.  Did the military launch a nerve gas attack in my house?  Even our dog refused to enter the room.

Garlic is strong stuff.  My wifey and garlic is a lethal combination.

excerpts: Garlic Noodles were okay.
garlic noodles.author: Thai N.
garlic noodles.review:
Friendly staff, nice decor. 

Garlic Noodles were okay.  I don't know what's the fuss about.

The bass were okay 

The Crab on the other hand was pretty good. We had the roasted garlic crab.

excerpts: Naturally, we had the roast crab & garlic noodles.
They were cooked well, and stood up to what all the other reviews suggest.
We also had the salt/pepper calamari for an app, and it was really tasty.
garlic noodles.author: Heather M.
garlic noodles.review:
It's such a bustling urban scene, with people spilling out onto the corner and hour long waits on Saturday night -- and it's in the outer Sunset?! What?!

This place is a lot of fun and the food, bartenders, and wait staff are top notch.

Naturally, we had the roast crab & garlic noodles. They were cooked well, and stood up to what all the other reviews suggest. We also had the salt/pepper calamari for an app, and it was really tasty. The batter is light, and I like that a lot.

Anytime I need a vibrant, tipsy, eat-with-my-hands kind of night, this is the place.

excerpts: depending on if the person I'm with wants to share), garlic noodles, side of rice... and for dessert- the fried ice cream.
garlic noodles.author: Rosemarie d.
garlic noodles.review:
I LOVE thanh long.... even if I feel like I can feel the butter seeping through my pores. 

Just a nice little (or so you think) hole in the wall in some random residential area... I like the fact that despite being pricey, it's surprisingly casual. The hostess (been the same girl since I started coming here several years ago) is  VERY nice and doesn't give me attitude when I'm running late. I've actually never seen her throw attitude at a guest (maybe I'm just lucky though). I don't even look @ the menu. I get a garlic roasted crab (to share... or not... depending on if the person I'm with wants to share), garlic noodles, side of rice... and for dessert- the fried ice cream.  I've never changed it up because I was immediately satisfied with my order. 

I've introduced this place to several friends and they feel the same way. 

I even prefer this over their other restaurant, Crustaceans (though, at Crustaceans they crack the crab for you - not sure if Thanh Long does or not)... Crustaceans had a more "stiff" atmosphere... I prefer to eat in comfort.

excerpts: I CRAVE a side order of the garlic noodles.
Yum
