!  Let's talk about other things on the menu that I love.
I drizzle the sauce on the garlic noodles and dip the roasted crab in it as well...
garlic noodles.author: Abby N.
garlic noodles.review:
My friends and I have an annual dinner to Thanh Long to celebrate the holidays and the opening of crab season. I CRAVE the roasted crab from Thanh Long.  I CRAVE a side order of the garlic noodles.  Yum!  Let's talk about other things on the menu that I love.  We also get the shaken beef which is delicious and we've had the calamari, which is also very good.

One thing I usually ask with my roasted crab is a side of the tamarind sauce from the tamarind crab, which is so good but it's just way too messy for me.  I drizzle the sauce on the garlic noodles and dip the roasted crab in it as well...oh boy, I'm getting hungry.

BTW, check out the small freight elevator in the kitchen.  I heard that in order to keep the recipe a secret,  they make the roasted crab in a secret kitchen and send the crab up to the restaurant level for the waitstaff to pick up.

excerpts: After hearing countless stories of how great their crab and garlic noodles were, I decided to try this restaurant for my birthday.
The garlic noodles were to die for.
I'm a huge fan of garlic noodles and those were the best I've had by far.
The garlic crab was also amazing.
We ordered three orders of crab for our party and it was more then plenty.
Definitely a place to eat for a special occasion, will come back again!
garlic noodles.author: marisa o.
garlic noodles.review: After hearing countless stories of how great their crab and garlic noodles were, I decided to try this restaurant for my birthday. The garlic noodles were to die for. I'm a huge fan of garlic noodles and those were the best I've had by far. The garlic crab was also amazing. We ordered three orders of crab for our party and it was more then plenty. Definitely a place to eat for a special occasion, will come back again!

excerpts: I've had better garlic noodles elsewhere for less $.
Number 3: Overpriced.
Number 4: Overrated.
Number 5:
I've had better, fresher, bigger crab elsewhere for less $.
Number 6:
Boy, oh boy.

The crowd!
Number 7: Shaking beef was nice.
Number 8:
Pineapple Lychee martini was deeeelishhhhh.
garlic noodles.author: nic t.
garlic noodles.review:
Number 1: Overrated... Don't get me wrong, the food's decent. But nothing to write home about.
Number 2: I've had better garlic noodles elsewhere for less $.
Number 3: Overpriced.
Number 4: Overrated.
Number 5: I've had better, fresher, bigger crab elsewhere for less $.
Number 6: Boy, oh boy. The crowd!
Number 7: Shaking beef was nice.
Number 8: Pineapple Lychee martini was deeeelishhhhh. 1 star bonus.

... and I've forgotten everything else that I was going to say. :)

excerpts: A side of garlic noodles and a couple awesome lychee martinis
and you're guaranteed a good time.
A hint: one crab is probably good enough for 2 people unless you can eat like a horse.
And they're not cheap.
We saw lots of diners attempting one crab each and ending up crabatonic.
The only smudge on our experience was a baby at the next table who decided to wail through most of dinner.
garlic noodles.author: Michel F.
garlic noodles.review: We kicked off dungeness crab season here the other night and were not disappointed! The drunken-dungeness is awesome; perfectly cooked and succulent. A side of garlic noodles and a couple awesome lychee martinis and you're guaranteed a good time. A hint: one crab is probably good enough for 2 people unless you can eat like a horse. And they're not cheap. We saw lots of diners attempting one crab each and ending up crabatonic. The only smudge on our experience was a baby at the next table who decided to wail through most of dinner.

excerpts: They are known for their dungeness crab and garlic noodles.
There was no disappointment here.
I also had the beef tar tar (raw beef) which was good and my date had a leeche martini which was also had a unique taste which she enjoyed.
Reservations are recommended due to the large number of people eating here.
The restaurant is more of a fine dining restaurant
but I did not come dressed up.
I did not feel out of place.
The best place to eat is upstairs near the windows due to the quiet ambiance.
Downstairs gets really loud and noisy.
I would only eat downstairs if I came with a group of friends.
Price wise it was an expensive restaurant but worth the price.
garlic noodles.author: Pete N.
garlic noodles.review:
This place has great food and great service. They are known for their dungeness crab and garlic noodles. There was no disappointment here. I also had the beef tar tar (raw beef) which was good and my date had a leeche martini which was also had a unique taste which she enjoyed. 
Reservations are recommended due to the large number of people eating here. The restaurant is more of a fine dining restaurant but I did not come dressed up. I did not feel out of place. 
The best place to eat is upstairs near the windows due to the quiet ambiance. Downstairs gets really loud and noisy. I would only eat downstairs if I came with a group of friends. Price wise it was an expensive restaurant but worth the price.

excerpts: Garlic Noodles were superb!
garlic noodles.author: Carrie-C N.
garlic noodles.review:
After such hype, I expected a tasty garlic roasted crab...but instead I got a dead one.  I mean, the crabs were supposed to be dead when served, but not dead before cooked.  The crab meat tasted old, as if it came out of the freezer, and I didn't enjoy it one bit.  I made the bf finish it.  I don't think he liked it much...but hey, someone gotta eat it!

Garlic Noodles were superb!  I really got to find the recipe for it....

The extra star is for Lychee Vodka infusion.  Yummy stuff, but no kick at all.

excerpts: Of course you come here for the Garlic Noodles and the Salt/Pepper Crab.
garlic noodles.author: Eric L.
garlic noodles.review:
This establishment has so much history which makes you appreciate it that much more.  

Of course you come here for the Garlic Noodles and the Salt/Pepper Crab.  You will not go wrong with that order.  

Do note that it can be overwhelming after a while and you will be extremely thirsty.

excerpts: We ordered the roasted crab and garlic noodles.
Both delicious and our waitress was sweet and attentive.
Bonus points
bc she let us know that the garlic noodles should be eaten ASAP since the butter congeals as it gets cold.
The crab is delish with the seasoning seeping into the actual crab meat.
garlic noodles.author: Diep N.
garlic noodles.review:
OMG thinking about their crab makes me drool. So when i first arrived here with a gf, I was a bit perplex... No offense but the Sunset District and fine dining are not interwined in my mind. Once you walk in, its a different experience. I especially love the murals of the ladies of vietnam with their respective ethnic clothing. I also loved the lighting --which is a stark contrast to the total darkness of their sister restaurant crustacean. We ordered the roasted crab and garlic noodles. Both delicious and our waitress was sweet and attentive. Bonus points bc she let us know that the garlic noodles should be eaten ASAP since the butter congeals as it gets cold. The crab is delish with the seasoning seeping into the actual crab meat. The garlic flavor is there but not overpowering and I love that you can still taste the natural saltiness of the crab. 

Next time, I will venture and order the sea bass which looked equally appealing.

excerpts: best garlic noodles I have ever had.
Better than crustacean.
All in all I would come back for the garlic noodles and my friends for the drunken crab...
BUT I WOULD NOT ORDER ANYTHING ELSE.
garlic noodles.author: Beach L.
garlic noodles.review:
best garlic noodles I have ever had. Better than crustacean. I think there is garlic butter, and soy in them.. and somehow the flavors just mesh really well. 

Im allergic to seafood so I cant comment on their drunken crab but my roomates said that the suauce is amazing. the crab itself is good they said, but they have had fresher crab which has tasted better.

dont get the shaken beef or lemon grass beef. its one of the worst I have ever had. Their traditional salad was also not very impressive.


My friend had the orange sherbert and liked it but said you didnt get much since it came in a frozen orange. I had the fried ice cream and it was okay. I have had better though.

All in all I would come back for the garlic noodles and my friends for the drunken crab... BUT I WOULD NOT ORDER ANYTHING ELSE.

excerpts: Garlic Roasted Crab, Garlic Noodles, Spring Chicken, Wine - Expensive.
Realizing you just had the best crab ( and some how noodles so good
garlic noodles.author: Kris O.
garlic noodles.review:
Wait? A bit long.  Service - Server name Evan - great service.  Garlic Roasted Crab, Garlic Noodles, Spring Chicken, Wine - Expensive.  Realizing you just had the best crab ( and some how noodles so good all I can say is WHOAH) - Priceless.

EAT HERE

excerpts: Thanh Lomg is one of the best place to have garlic noodles and their roasted crab.
I couldn't believe that I was able to have a whole crab to myself.
It was that DAMN good.
garlic noodles.author: Shana W.
garlic noodles.review:
OMG!!!! Thanh Lomg is one of the best place to have garlic noodles and their roasted crab.  I couldn't believe that I was able to have a whole crab to myself.  It was that DAMN good.  My cholestrol level goes sky high when I'm here, but I don't give a damn cause it's really good.  

If you're willing to spend the money, Thanh Ling is the place to be.

excerpts: Recommended - crab (any one), garlic noodles, shaken beef.
I can't wait to come back to SF just so I eat here again.
garlic noodles.author: D Z.
garlic noodles.review:
I cannot rate this place high enough. Every item we got was so tasty.
Recommended - crab (any one), garlic noodles, shaken beef.
I can't wait to come back to SF just so I eat here again.

excerpts: the garlic noodles and shaken beef were overcooked.
garlic noodles.author: Diana B.
garlic noodles.review:
i grew up on fresh crab either cooked in chinese/vietnamese restaurants or cooked at home by my dad. i was very excited to try thanh long and couldn't decide between the roast or tamarind crab so i went with the server's suggestion that roast is better. the roast crab was bland. i couldn't detect "an's special sauce" or the fresh crab taste (i think it's a frozen crab) and resorted to dipping the crab meat in the oil-butter mixture. my friend went to crustacean a few days ago and told me that they tried both and the tamarind was a lot better. she also told me that my $35 thanh long crab cost her $50 at crustacean.

i did enjoy the sea bass (the only not heavy tasting dish we ordered but it was small), mussels with asian pesto (although i was expecting a bowl of mussels rather than five) and the garlic rice. the garlic noodles and shaken beef were overcooked.

excerpts: Save your money for dessert or more garlic noodles!

So delicious, the market price that evening was $30.75

Tiger Prawns and Garlic Noodles: I also really enjoyed this dish, the prawns were butterflied beautifully and the garlic noodles were light and so robust in garlic flavor!
We also ordered another side of garlic noodles, since there that good.
and now I need to learn how to make garlic noodles since a trip to Thanh Long
garlic noodles.author: Wen C.
garlic noodles.review:
Came here last night for a pleasant Sunday night supper. Like my cousin stated, "Thanh Long's crab is the shit!"

This is the original location where it all began,  parking can be tricky so expect to come early or pull over curbside for vallet ($10)

I highly recommend making reservations in advance, the place normally gets pretty packed from what I hear, and my cousins and I arrives at  6:30 and it was nearly a full-house.

We were seated upstairs, which I believe is catered to bigger parties since larger tables were set up here. We were sat in the smaller table but I would of preferred to have been seated on the first floor, the overrall ambiance was nicer.

Here is what we ordered/shared

Appetizers

Spring Roll- Just a regular Viet style spring roll, the portion was real tiny though, I'd opt on ordering this because it's $9.75. Save your money for dessert or more garlic noodles!

Crab puffs- Light airy, wontons with crab filling inside, they were good but I'm not sure worth $10.75, the portions were tiny again.

Main Courses:
Roasted Crab with Garlic- So delicious, the market price that evening was $30.75

Tiger Prawns and Garlic Noodles: I also really enjoyed this dish, the prawns were butterflied beautifully and the garlic noodles were light and so robust in garlic flavor! YUMMMM! Market Price that evening: $30.75

We also ordered another side of garlic noodles, since there that good.

Service was great, adequate and to the point.

A meal enough for 3 petite asian girls came out to be $109 that's including a glass of their pure grape juice.

I'm a fan and now I need to learn how to make garlic noodles since a trip to Thanh Long is rather lengthy since i live in San Jose.

P.S. you can wear a dorky plastic bib by your liking.

excerpts: Now i can die: that roast  crab with their secret infused butter and black pepper concoction and garlic noodles is just too perfect.
This place has this down to an exacting science.
Very pleased.
garlic noodles.author: Tom K.
garlic noodles.review: Now i can die: that roast  crab with their secret infused butter and black pepper concoction and garlic noodles is just too perfect.  This place has this down to an exacting science.  Very pleased.

excerpts: The good things about Thanh Long are the Garlic Roasted and/or the Drunken Crab, and the garlic noodles.
garlic noodles.author: jen a.
garlic noodles.review:
The not -so-good things are the prices and hard-to-find-street-parking.

The good things about Thanh Long are the Garlic Roasted and/or the Drunken Crab, and the garlic noodles.

The better thing is that I think I now have their garlic noodle recipe down pat, and can make it myself at home!

excerpts: Roasted Crab and Garlic Noodles - tasty tasty!
Don't forget the crab dumpling appetizers.
Expect long long wait times and horrible parking (unless you want to Valet).
The service is decent, although you would expect more out of a place like this.
When all is said and done, Thanh Long is still worth the wait.
garlic noodles.author: Tony L.
garlic noodles.review:
Roasted Crab and Garlic Noodles - tasty tasty! Don't forget the crab dumpling appetizers. Expect long long wait times and horrible parking (unless you want to Valet). The service is decent, although you would expect more out of a place like this. When all is said and done, Thanh Long is still worth the wait. Good food!

If you guys like this place, you might want to try PPQ Dungeonous Island also - not quite as good, but roughly 1/2 to 2/3's the price.

excerpts: I'm hardly intimidated by oil slicks on my plate; in fact, I'm sometimes a fan; but those garlic noodles are greeeea-zyyyy!
garlic noodles.author: Michele W.
garlic noodles.review:
I am clearly in the minority, but I'd like to say, "Don't believe the hype".  Garlic crab is not that difficult to pull off, and Thanh Long is no bargain.   I'm hardly intimidated by oil slicks on my plate; in fact, I'm sometimes a fan; but those garlic noodles are greeeea-zyyyy!  

I'd rather pick up a live one at an Asian Market (only dummies buy them already cooked at Whole Paycheck at an exponential markup), and plunge it into a pot of boiling water at home.

excerpts: Thanh Long is substantially better -- based on the crab, the garlic noodles, and the service.
garlic noodles.author: S J.
garlic noodles.review:
I admit that I had always thought PPQ and Thanh Long were more or less the same.  This was until I had them back to back.  Thanh Long is substantially better -- based on the crab, the garlic noodles, and the service.  

That said, Thanh Long's apps leave much to be desired.  But the crab comes out so quickly, so don't even bother with them anyway.

Moreover, Thanh Long is just as tasty than sister restaurant Crustacean but much cheaper.  Go Thanh Long!

excerpts: Some of the best crab you can ask for, and the garlic noodles top it off real nicely.
A bit busy, a bit messy, a bit crowded, but that goes out the window once you eat.
Check out their appetizers as well.
Oh, and wear the plastic bib!
garlic noodles.author: Barrett I.
garlic noodles.review: You really wouldn't expect a restaurant like this hidden out in the Sunset district but it's there. Some of the best crab you can ask for, and the garlic noodles top it off real nicely. A bit busy, a bit messy, a bit crowded, but that goes out the window once you eat. Check out their appetizers as well. Oh, and wear the plastic bib!

excerpts:
Recommended dishes:

Tamarind Crab 
Garlic Noodles (several plates
garlic noodles.author: Wally W.
garlic noodles.review:
Just got back from having (Chinese) New Year's dinner here, and the food was excellent. 

Recommended dishes:

Tamarind Crab 
Garlic Noodles (several plates, they come in smaller portions)

excerpts: The crab was good and the garlic noodles were okay too...
garlic noodles.author: Alan T.
garlic noodles.review:
I give it three stars.  The crab was good and the garlic noodles were okay too...

i'm not sure this place deserves all the hype it gets but i guess if you compare it to other restaurants this place is good b/c other comparable places are just bad.

excerpts: The garlic noodles were well, uh..boring.
I know that they're all the rage (or used to be)
garlic noodles.author: Christopher C.
garlic noodles.review:
I've been here before many moons ago.  But, I think this place has lost it's magic.  It's allure...it's draw.  The only thing that was good was the Roast Crab.  The garlic noodles were well, uh..boring.  I know that they're all the rage (or used to be) but they were just boring.

After cleaning up then looking at the coagulated butter on the crab plate, made me think, "holy $hit..that's what's gonna happen to my arteries".

Go here only for crab and that's that.  Way too much money for what you get.  But, do it every decade or so.

excerpts:
I'll cut to the chase:
We had the same thing everyone else has--garlic noodles and roasted crab.
I was hoping the noodles would be a little lighter but they were very sticky and thick.
They tasted good and had a field of garlic on them.
The crab was your typical dungeness crab
and it was covered in butter, garlic and black pepper.
garlic noodles.author: Tesia J.
garlic noodles.review:
Even though I realize that I was expecting TOO MUCH b/c of the hype...I STILL feel like this place is pretty over rated.  The food was good, I don't disagree...but it was FAR FROM "5 Star-GREAT"! 

My BF and I couldn't wait to get here b/c EVERYONE we knew (practically) loves this place.  

We get there and it had a nice atmosphere, the waitstaff was nice, the bartenders were nice, (although I had a Pear Martini that really needed some more alcohol in it to cut the taste of the flavored liqueur.)  and although we still had to wait about 15 minutes with reservations, we were very open to a great experience.

I'll cut to the chase:
We had the same thing everyone else has--garlic noodles and roasted crab.  I was hoping the noodles would be a little lighter but they were very sticky and thick.  They tasted good and had a field of garlic on them.  The crab was your typical dungeness crab and it was covered in butter, garlic and black pepper.  It was also good.

The problem I had was similar to what another poster mentioned.  It was SOOOOOO much garlic that I started to feel a bit nautious after a while.  I ended up taking a doggie bag and even in the car on the way home the smell was making me ill.  I immediately came home and washed myself up and brushed my teeth and used mouthwash.  It was TOO MUCH I TELL YA'!!!!

I didn't eat my leftovers for about 3 days.  It was really good leftovers though.

I have to say that for what it was...some noodles and a dungeness crab that you can get from Safeway...it was WWWWWWAAAAYYYYYYYYYY THE FUCK OVER PRICED!!!!  I would never go there again....but I'm glad I did this time.

Also, I may just be a tad bit spoiled cuz the BF and I make Alaskan King Crab legs at home all the time when they are in season and the meat in those crabs is much sweeter than in the dungeness crab...OMG I kept thinking that if they had used Alaskan King Crabs, I would DEFINITELY go back!!!

excerpts: Roasted Garlic Crab and Garlic Noodles....
enough said!
I love everything about this place from the food and decor to the experience of wearing a plastic bib.
garlic noodles.author: Shannon E.
garlic noodles.review:
Roasted Garlic Crab and Garlic Noodles....enough said!  I love everything about this place from the food and decor to the experience of wearing a plastic bib.  This last time we had to wait quite a while for a table since we didn't have reservations (definitely make reservations if you plan to go on the weekend), but it was well worth the wait.  

We also got seated upstairs, which was a lot quieter and more conducive to having a conversation...although I have to admit there isn't much opportunity for conversation when you've got crab in your mouth.  If you're a crab lover and you haven't been here or to its successor Crustaceans, you are missing out!

excerpts: Roast Crab & Garlic Noodles, what else?
Just make sure you eat it quick before the butter coagulates.
garlic noodles.author: Arlene C.
garlic noodles.review:
Remodeled many years ago, they can fit more folks in, so they can afford to take credit cards and pay the banks their percentages now (yeah, like they couldn't before)...don't miss the days when the bf would have to pack. They were 'hit' a couple days after we came one time. With the cost at about $60/person even back then, those robbers made out. 
Roast Crab & Garlic Noodles, what else? Just make sure you eat it quick before the butter coagulates.

excerpts: Since there was so much hype with these Garlic Noodles, had to try.
garlic noodles.author: Anne K.
garlic noodles.review:
This review is solely based on a take-out order.  Since there was so much hype with these Garlic Noodles, had to try.

My take: pretty good. Not as I expected, maybe because I was anticipating more.  I also ordered their salt and pepper calamari.  To my suprise, it wasn't as good either.  A bit overpriced for the amount given.

OH WELL...

excerpts:
, CUA RANG MUOI (minus all the frickin' butter) aka "Secret" Roast Crab or NUI TOI, aka "Secret Garlic Noodles"

Clever gimmick...clever marketing...but seems shady.
garlic noodles.author: Minty O.
garlic noodles.review:
GOOD capitalization off the "secret family recipes"... the food is good, delicious... expensive though... and Viet food shouldn't be...

but it's as "secret" as anyone's grandama's secret recipe for oatmeal cookies or your "secret" ingredient to your own spaghetti sauce...

I loved the food and highly recommend it if you live near by, but i made the trek from south san jose (had friends that highly recommended it) and enjoyed the food and company, but with gas being $4.00+ a gallon, I'd rather make my own, CUA RANG MUOI (minus all the frickin' butter) aka "Secret" Roast Crab or NUI TOI, aka "Secret Garlic Noodles"

Clever gimmick...clever marketing...but seems shady.

Other delicious dishes we tried were the Sea Bass with a pineapple-ginger dipping sauce. Could have done without the fake grill marks; and Salt and pepper calamari....the actual salted and peppered parts were tasty. Unevenly salted and peppered, obviously.

Again, I recommend it if you live nearby...would i go back? Probably not. 

I guess I'm quite particular when it comes to Viet food...because I do a lot of the cooking of it myself...haha sorry if i sound snotty.

excerpts: Roast crab is large (enough for 2 servings) and so's the garlic noodles (2 servings).
Both were HIGH-GLOSS with tons of butter and bold flavor.
The noodles were a little overcooked, starchy, and a tad on the sweet side.
BUT, it was strangely satisfying.
garlic noodles.author: Bibi B.
garlic noodles.review:
Roast crab is large (enough for 2 servings) and so's the garlic noodles (2 servings). Both were HIGH-GLOSS with tons of butter and bold flavor. The noodles were a little overcooked, starchy, and a tad on the sweet side. BUT, it was strangely satisfying. I can't really justify spending 10 bucks on a plate of noodles, but after all it's part of the TL custom.

We were so hungry when we got there we quickly ordered a plate of calamari. The waiter disappeared into the kitchen and came right back out, which means it's been made and waiting for orders. Sure enough, the temp was warm but not hot as I like it, freshly fried, so I won't be ordering it again.

Another disappointment is the Viet. Iced Coffee. It came pre-made and pre-mixed. A corner that I wished they didn't cut. I like the old school drip-drip-drip on the white layer of condensed milk with a separate glass of crushed ice. I know they're trying to be efficient, but some things just lose their charm when sped up.

The place is jumping and they're turning tables out like mad. The service is fast and friendly, but I just couldn't give it a 4-star. I remember enjoying myself a lot more when I had my first crab there years ago when it wasn't running like a machine.

excerpts: Following your strict yelp directions, I had only the roast crab and garlic noodles.
The noodles have heroin in them.
I know this, because I couldn't stop eating them, and seriously considered ordering extra to take home - for breakfast, for lunch, for a midnight snack, no matter, just to have more.
I sat through the meal next to my husband, simply repeating '
oh my god,
oh my god,
If my children complain, I will sell them for garlic noodles.
garlic noodles.author: Christina R.
garlic noodles.review:
Oh, yelpers, you've done it again.  Since I ate at Thanh Long for the first time on Tuesday this week, I find myself questioning the meaningless existance I led before - husband, children, work, world travel - all such a waste, when I had walked the earth, and not eaten at Thanh Long.

I had read the reviews on yelp, and could see the enthusiasm and delight in the food, but it gives no indication of the delights that await you here.  Following your strict yelp directions, I had only the roast crab and garlic noodles. The noodles have heroin in them. I know this, because I couldn't stop eating them, and seriously considered ordering extra to take home - for breakfast, for lunch, for a midnight snack, no matter, just to have more.  I sat through the meal next to my husband, simply repeating 'oh my god, oh my god, oh my god' throughout the meal as I delved deeper and deeper into crab and noodles.  

I'm trying to drag myself out of the reverie it induced to tell you factual things: The crab was $35, the noodles $10, the cocktails were good, the wine was good, it wasn't cheap; it was absolutely worth it.  I will go again. If my children complain, I will sell them for garlic noodles.

excerpts: Can't go wrong with the roasted crab and garlic noodles.
Flossed, brushes and swished for 2 mins.
Woke up with garlic breath anyways but well worth it.
A little perturbed about the bathrooms in regards to Bourdain's Kitchen confidential.
garlic noodles.author: L. N.
garlic noodles.review: Reviews are accurate. Can't go wrong with the roasted crab and garlic noodles. Flossed, brushes and swished for 2 mins. Woke up with garlic breath anyways but well worth it. A little perturbed about the bathrooms in regards to Bourdain's Kitchen confidential.

excerpts: Garlic noodles, crab, and calamari!
The garlic noodles are a must have with the crab.
We usually order the tamarind and roasted crab.
I personally prefer the roasted crab, but the tamarind is good too.
garlic noodles.author: Eegnam A.
garlic noodles.review:
Garlic noodles, crab, and calamari!

Get ready to get your hands dirty for this one!  The garlic noodles are a must have with the crab.  We usually order the tamarind and roasted crab.  I personally prefer the roasted crab, but the tamarind is good too.  Mix the sauce in with your noodles!

My husband is allergic to the crab shells so he cannot enjoy the goodness.  Instead he orders the salt and pepper calamari with rice.  The calamari is very flavorful and the perfect appetizer!

excerpts: I shared a plate of garlic noodles because they give generous portions.
Very delicious.
garlic noodles.author: Christy I.
garlic noodles.review:
4.5 stars.  

I ordered the drunken crab and ate the whole thing!  There was a long wait for a table but I understand because it took me about 2 hours to finish my crab.  I suggest the drunken crab over the roast crab because I think the meat has more flavor.  I shared a plate of garlic noodles because they give generous portions.  Very delicious.  I did eat one whole crab by myself but it might be OK to share with another person as they are big portions and pricey.

Eating crab is messy.  That's why I was very happy that their service was excellent, especially with clearing the table of crab shells and providing wet towels and bibs.  The host/hostess and waiters were all very friendly and helpful.

It's better to make reservations, especially on weekends, because I had to wait about 40 minutes for a table.

excerpts: Since this was our first time here, we took the bartender's advice and ordered the Salt & Pepper Calamari $10.95, Garlic Noodles $9.95, Roast Crab $35.95, and Banana Pudding cake with hazlenut gelato $7.95.
The crab was fresh and very well seasoned.
The garlic noodles were super yummy.
garlic noodles.author: Tom Y.
garlic noodles.review:
This is one of the best seafood restaurants I have dined in.  The food is comparable, if not a teeny bit better than the crab in Redondo Beach.

Since this was our first time here, we took the bartender's advice and ordered the Salt & Pepper Calamari $10.95, Garlic Noodles $9.95, Roast Crab $35.95, and Banana Pudding cake with hazlenut gelato $7.95.  The crab was fresh and very well seasoned.  The garlic noodles were super yummy.  Although I think the crab is just a bit pricey, I am extremely satisfied.

4 stars.  I'll have to tell my other friends about this place.  

**I can make these noodles easy.  Just take some egg noodles, throw in LOTS of garlic, some oil, and charge my friends 10 bucks.

[edit]
After some consideration, I have decided to downgrade the rating to 4 stars.

excerpts: I love this garlic noodles and the crab is to die for!
It is pretty pricey but once in a while it is well worth it.
garlic noodles.author: Linda W.
garlic noodles.review:
I love this garlic noodles and the crab is to die for! It is pretty pricey but once in a while it is well worth it. (; 

Cannot wait to visit this place again. I recommend making reservations esp. for the weekends. It was quite packed.

excerpts: Order the roasted crab and garlic noodles with your favorite beverage.
garlic noodles.author: Matthew N.
garlic noodles.review:
DON'T EVEN LOOK AT THE MENU. 

Order the roasted crab and garlic noodles with your favorite beverage. 

My all time favorite dinner in my all time favorite city.

excerpts: The garlic noodles were pretty tasty too and the service I have to say was also very good.
garlic noodles.author: Mimi L.
garlic noodles.review:
This place was pretty good. It was my first time here, we were gonna go to PPQ but they were closed.

The roasted crab was really good, it was a lil bit on the oily side but still very good. The garlic noodles were pretty tasty too and the service I have to say was also very good. 

I would defintely visist this establishment again.

excerpts: The crab is outstanding and the garlic noodles are thee BEST!
I wish they were closer to the East Bay!
garlic noodles.author: Risa D.
garlic noodles.review: I love this place!!! I have never had a bad experience EVER!!! The crab is outstanding and the garlic noodles are thee BEST! I wish they were closer to the East Bay!

excerpts: We all ordered  the drunken crab and 2 orders Garlic Noodles.
It was only about 10 minutes later and the wait staff put bibs on us and delivered all the plates/bowls necessary for our crab encounter.
Then came the crab, I have to say, it was the best crab I have ever had.
They boil there crab in an elixir of champagne, brandy with herbs.
It is so tender and delicious!
garlic noodles.author: Bryan M.
garlic noodles.review:
We had reservations at 8 and made it just in time. We were seated right away at a nice table. The place is pretty large with lots of seating, but definitely make a reservation as it seems to be quite busy. 

Our waiter was quick to come to the table to get us our drinks. I had a Vietnamese Beer "33", we ordered some appetizers that came out very quick. They were the Cheese Crab Puffs and the Mussels. Very good! I could have ate the mussels just for dinner, but I was there for the main course and their specialty: CRAB. We all ordered  the drunken crab and 2 orders Garlic Noodles. It was only about 10 minutes later and the wait staff put bibs on us and delivered all the plates/bowls necessary for our crab encounter. Then came the crab, I have to say, it was the best crab I have ever had. They boil there crab in an elixir of champagne, brandy with herbs. It is so tender and delicious! The Garlice Noodles are also one of a kind. 

Overall the dining experience was great and the wait staff are very good and attentive!

excerpts: You have not lived until you have tried the Roast Crab and garlic noodles.
garlic noodles.author: Gabriel B.
garlic noodles.review:
You have not lived until you have tried the Roast Crab and garlic noodles. Even if you skip everything else, in fact I suggest you do to make more room. 

If you had a last meal, make this the one.

excerpts: the garlic noodles are too die for.
i recommend ordering a plate of garlic noodles plus an entree so you can top the entree onto the noodles.
garlic noodles.author: Carol Y.
garlic noodles.review:
the garlic noodles are too die for. 

I'm not a big fan of crab but it seems all my friends enjoyed their garlic crab. i recommend ordering a plate of garlic noodles plus an entree so you can top the entree onto the noodles. the eggplant is good and also the villagers' favorites.

ps. beware of the parking. i circled around for at least 10 mins until i found a spot.

excerpts: We ordered garlic noodles, crab, and sea bass
and it was all enough to share for 4 people.
It's a pricey restaurant, but it's definitely worth the money.
Very tasty.
It's funny they have some utensil to clean up after the table.
garlic noodles.author: Gerard Y.
garlic noodles.review: I felt under-dressed at first since I was rockin an Ecko shirt, khakis, and Nike Dunks, but everyone else was wearing casual for the most part. We ordered garlic noodles, crab, and sea bass and it was all enough to share for 4 people. It's a pricey restaurant, but it's definitely worth the money. Very tasty. It's funny they have some utensil to clean up after the table.

excerpts: Anyways, obviously we had what everybody had, garlic noodles and crab.
There were 4 of us, so me and gf shared a plate of garlic noodles and a roasted crab, and our friends had the other plate of garlic noodles and a drunken crab.
Now to the garlic noodles, I hope the following thing I mention will give you a good enough message - we ended up ordering a third plate to share.
Yup seriously, the way they prepared their food should be relatively simple, but the taste of these dishes totally overwhelmed me.
The only complaint I will have on this plate, and others at this restaurant?
If you can make the food look more colorful without sacrificing tastiness, Thanh Long, then I will come back and give you 5 stars.
To me a plate with just crab and garlic or just noodles may not look so good in such an high-end, expensive Asian restaurant .....
garlic noodles.author: David C.
garlic noodles.review:
Upon recommendations from friends, we all came here together for dinner, and making reservations was really the key as I cannot see how we could make it to this dinner without ever making a reservation.

Anyways, obviously we had what everybody had, garlic noodles and crab. There were 4 of us, so me and gf shared a plate of garlic noodles and a roasted crab, and our friends had the other plate of garlic noodles and a drunken crab. 

first things first, fresh crab plus garlic plus other kinds of sauces = tasty crab even. I prefer our friends' drunken crab more since the sauce gives it more of a kick in the flavor IMO. When I return, I will try that .

Now to the garlic noodles, I hope the following thing I mention will give you a good enough message - we ended up ordering a third plate to share.  Yup seriously, the way they prepared their food should be relatively simple, but the taste of these dishes totally overwhelmed me. The only complaint I will have on this plate, and others at this restaurant? If you can make the food look more colorful without sacrificing tastiness, Thanh Long, then I will come back and give you 5 stars. To me a plate with just crab and garlic or just noodles may not look so good in such an high-end, expensive Asian restaurant .....

excerpts: As per other yelpers' reviews, my group of 5 tried the garlic noodles, the roast crab in secret sauce, the shaken beef, and Thanh Long fish.
We were all big fans of the garlic noodles and roast crab, of course, and my friends really enjoyed the shaken beef too.
We were all big fans of the garlic noodles and roast crab, of course, and my friends really enjoyed the shaken beef too.
We were all big fans of the garlic noodles and roast crab, of course, and my friends really enjoyed the shaken beef too.
The fish was bland by comparison to the rest, but was still decent and a great deal since we got more garlic noodles alongside the order.
One of my girlfriends was overwhelmed with the amount of butter in the noodles and crab, and had to lay off after a while... which meant more for us!
Yum
garlic noodles.author: Tina J.
garlic noodles.review:
As per other yelpers' reviews, my group of 5 tried the garlic noodles, the roast crab in secret sauce, the shaken beef, and Thanh Long fish. 

All dishes were amazing.  We were all big fans of the garlic noodles and roast crab, of course, and my friends really enjoyed the shaken beef too. The fish was bland by comparison to the rest, but was still decent and a great deal since we got more garlic noodles alongside the order.  One of my girlfriends was overwhelmed with the amount of butter in the noodles and crab, and had to lay off after a while... which meant more for us!  Yum :D

I'd love to come back for another special occasion. It was a fairly loud atmosphere but also a nice, refined setting for older family members to join if need be. Finding street parking was a pain (3 blocks away) for 5 separate cars, but still worth the drive to the City and the $120 tab.

excerpts: We had the roast crab (of course!), colossal royal tiger prawns over garlic noodles, shaken beef (YUM!), grilled calamari, and the seafood combination fried rice.
I was looking forward to having leftovers of this feast, but we cleaned our plates.
Haha.
garlic noodles.author: Jenn C.
garlic noodles.review:
LOVE this place! It's not cheap, but it's so worth it to splurge once in a while.

We had the roast crab (of course!), colossal royal tiger prawns over garlic noodles, shaken beef (YUM!), grilled calamari, and the seafood combination fried rice. I was looking forward to having leftovers of this feast, but we cleaned our plates. Haha. Oh my god that was the best dinner I've had in a while.

We made reservations for a Saturday night. I'd suggest doing that since it gets pretty packed here.

excerpts: Two words: garlic noodles.
garlic noodles.author: Amy S.
garlic noodles.review:
Two words: garlic noodles.

If you  have any leftovers, take them to work and pop 'em in the microwave for a few minutes for all to smell.  Your office will thank you for it!

The crab here is great, too!

excerpts: and I was served cold garlic noodles and cold crab.
Not to mention our waiter and waitress were horrible.
I still plan on visiting Thanh Long but
no time in the near future.
garlic noodles.author: Joe B.
garlic noodles.review: I visit Thanh Long at least once every other month and the service and food has been excellent each time. I recently ate at Thanh Long and I was served cold garlic noodles and cold crab. Not to mention our waiter and waitress were horrible. I still plan on visiting Thanh Long but no time in the near future. :(

excerpts: But on a typical day, if you look around the restaurant, nearly every customer is ordering Roasted Crab and Garlic Noodles.
garlic noodles.author: Tetsu N.
garlic noodles.review:
With so many reviews, there really isn't much to add.  But on a typical day, if you look around the restaurant, nearly every customer is ordering Roasted Crab and Garlic Noodles.  I can attest to the excellent quality of these two dishes.

One small note to add, though:  Both dishes are buttery and rich, so eat here when you're hungry, and eat the crab first, since taking too long to eat the crab will cool the buttery sauce, not a good site.

If you want to walk a bit, you can find parking pretty easily, but the easiest is to just use valet parking.

excerpts: Garlic Noodles are amazing...
salmon ciopinno was out of this world!!!!
Garlic Lemon Herb Crab was the best I have ever had
and I didn't think that was possible with all the amazing crab in the city.
Especially with the warf being so famous for it.
This is a small yet very nice Vietnamese restaurant in the Sunset.
Best Vietnamese restaurant, not known for its PHO, in the City.
garlic noodles.author: Rob L.
garlic noodles.review: Pricey but owe so worth every penny!!! Garlic Noodles are amazing...salmon ciopinno was out of this world!!!! Garlic Lemon Herb Crab was the best I have ever had and I didn't think that was possible with all the amazing crab in the city. Especially with the warf being so famous for it. This is a small yet very nice Vietnamese restaurant in the Sunset. Best Vietnamese restaurant, not known for its PHO, in the City.

excerpts: Everyone raves about the garlic noodles
but I thought it was just OK
, I definitely had much better at other places.
garlic noodles.author: Peter L.
garlic noodles.review: Famous for their butter roasted crab. When you need a bib to eat crab, you know you're in business. The crab was very good, I had the original butter roasted and the tamarind roasted, both were great. If you had Boiling Crab before, this is not as rich as the sauce in BC. Everyone raves about the garlic noodles but I thought it was just OK, I definitely had much better at other places. The Shaken Beef, on the other hand, was very delicious, tender, and flavorful. Reservations for this place are high recommended and I find it bit expensive, but that's all things seafood. At least it was fresh.

excerpts: We ordered the Buddha Roll (vegetarian spring roll), Garlic Toast, Roast Crab, Garlic Noodles, and the Thanh Long Spicy Eggplant.
The Buddha Roll had good flavors but one order of it is just one roll cut into 4 pieces and for $7.50 is so not worth it!
The Garlic Toast was also a rip off.
It was just half a baguette like the ones you get at Lucky's/Safeway, smothered with butter with hardly any garlic.
You could easily make your own garlic bread at home that tastes a whole lot better for half the price.
Their famous Roast Crab was alright.
The crab was a decent size with a good amount of meat, but they could have gone a bit lighter on the seasoning.
I don't know if we got a bad batch but the crab was a bit too salty.
It definitely tasted better when paired with simple plain white rice.
The Garlic Noodles were quite tasty and scrumptious, but the portion was small.
The best dish by far was the Thanh Long Spicy Eggplant.
The eggplant was cooked to perfection...
the outside with just the right amount of crunch, with a soft inside.
It went really with the prawns, chicken, and mushrooms that were mixed in with it.
garlic noodles.author: Karen C.
garlic noodles.review:
Came here with family to celebrate my husband's birthday. When we walked by the restaurant it did look pretty run down and ghetto at first glance but whatever was cookin' smelled absolutely delicious =)

Upon entering, I felt like I had been transported into another place. I guess it's true when they say "don't judge a book by it's cover." The inside was clean, beautifully decorated, filled with lots of people, and had great ambiance. Their service was amazing...exceeded all expectations. We had about 4 different servers which made everything flow very nicely. Our orders were taken promptly and properly, plates cleared instantly, and our water glasses were always filled without us having to ask. They were all really nice and polite.

We ordered the Buddha Roll (vegetarian spring roll), Garlic Toast, Roast Crab, Garlic Noodles, and the Thanh Long Spicy Eggplant. The Buddha Roll had good flavors but one order of it is just one roll cut into 4 pieces and for $7.50 is so not worth it! The Garlic Toast was also a rip off. It was just half a baguette like the ones you get at Lucky's/Safeway, smothered with butter with hardly any garlic. You could easily make your own garlic bread at home that tastes a whole lot better for half the price. Their famous Roast Crab was alright. The crab was a decent size with a good amount of meat, but they could have gone a bit lighter on the seasoning. I don't know if we got a bad batch but the crab was a bit too salty. It definitely tasted better when paired with simple plain white rice. The Garlic Noodles were quite tasty and scrumptious, but the portion was small. The best dish by far was the Thanh Long Spicy Eggplant. The eggplant was cooked to perfection...the outside with just the right amount of crunch, with a soft inside. It went really with the prawns, chicken, and mushrooms that were mixed in with it. The portion was small too and it definitely left me with wanting more!

Overall this place is just okay. The decor and service was awesome but the food was just okay in terms of taste, portions, and price. Very overpriced for the amount you get. It was about $40/person for us but I felt like I ate $20 worth of food. I would agree with some of the other reviewers that Boiling Crab is better for the price and value.

excerpts: Dive into an order of garlic crab and add on the side order of garlic noodles.
You can taste the freshness of the pepper and garlic spices as you lick the sauce off your fingers.
The garlic noodles are so gooood "you'll find yourself searching for the recipe online when you get home" and pair pleasingly well with the crab.
Finish the meal with the fried banana and vanilla ice cream.
garlic noodles.author: Cathy L.
garlic noodles.review:
Yummy yummy I got Thanh Long in my tummy..

Start off your meal with the mango salad with scallops.  Dive into an order of garlic crab and add on the side order of garlic noodles.  You can taste the freshness of the pepper and garlic spices as you lick the sauce off your fingers.  The garlic noodles are so gooood "you'll find yourself searching for the recipe online when you get home" and pair pleasingly well with the crab.  Finish the meal with the fried banana and vanilla ice cream.  The food is sooo delicious you wouldn't want to share!

Do make reservations in advance so that you can be seated promptly upon arrival.  Do pay the $10 valet parking cause it's worth it.

excerpts: , the garlic noodles are delicious (in a top-ramen sort of way).
garlic noodles.author: Nathan W.
garlic noodles.review:
I think the "Meh. I've experienced better." rating is perfect for Thanh Long.

I've had the good fortune of enjoying dinner at Crustacean in Beverly Hills, which was totally worth the price - great atmoshpere, service, and beautiful food.

Thanh Long is just okay. They should address a few deficiencies:

1) They use margarine, and if you ask for butter, you get margarine (they don't use real butter)
2) I don't like to crack open crab, they wouldn't remove the meat from the creature for me (in Beverly Hills I paid $8.00 extra for this luxury - worth every penny) - no reason given
3) Valet auctioned off keys to each table while people were dining so they could go home at 9:00, I almost asked for my $10 valet fee back - but then I remembered I could just let you know about this
4) For my sister's 30th birthday, they didn't do anything nice for her - no special touch, complimentary dessert - just a lukewarm "do you want us to sing?" - when we ordered dessert, my sister had to ask for a candle

We are experienced diners, we tip well, and drink wine. Our tab was $300 for three (including tip).

The crab was good, the shrimp was okay, the garlic noodles are delicious (in a top-ramen sort of way).

Meh. I've had better.

excerpts: Order the drunken crab and garlic noodles.
garlic noodles.author: Wendy B.
garlic noodles.review:
Make a reservation in advance,
Show up on time,
Park yourself (drive around the block a few times)
Order the drunken crab and garlic noodles.

I would say if you are a man its acceptable to wear a nice pair of jeans and a nice shirt or sweater.  A woman could wear the same and still feel comfortable.  Then dress up from there if you want -- just wear something comfortable because its a lot of food.  You should probably wear no jewelry or take it off when dinner is served and wear short sleaves or sleaves you can keep out of your way.

Tables are close together and it is always crowded, the good news is everyone is just as messy as you are so you don't need to worry about looking like a pig.   You will walk away smelling like garlic and you will have it dripping down your arm at some point -- it isn't graceful at all.  Definitely wear the bib or you may be wearing butter stains the next time you wear your outfit.  The experience is fun and the tables are white linen.

Definitely a good time with a group of people, but again the tables are pretty tight.  Awesome service too!

excerpts: Like everyone else, we ordered Roasted Garlic Crab ($36), Tiger Prawns with Garlic Noodles ($32), Spicy Calamari w/ Pineapple and Tomatoes ($13), Fruit Juice Cooler (non-alcoholic, $3), and Mango de Fleur (alcoholic, $8.50), Fried Banana with Hazelnut Gelato ($7).
I would recommend the Roasted Crab, but not the Tiger Prawns w/ Garlic Noodles.
There were only 4 prawns with that price it's not worth it.
Spicy calamari wasn't impressive because we were expecting it to be fried, but turned out to be just stir-fried.
Mango de Fleur was good, but I didn't taste much of alcohol in it.
It's too pricy for $8.50, since it was in a flute.
I would definitely recommend juice cooler.
Fried banana was ordinary, but the hazelnut gelato didn't click for me.
garlic noodles.author: MT D.
garlic noodles.review:
So the last time I was here was approximately 10 years ago. I remember how good it was, but I don't quite remember how good it was.

It was our anniversary and we decided for a seafood restaurant since I LOVE SEAFOOD! Like everyone else, we ordered Roasted Garlic Crab ($36), Tiger Prawns with Garlic Noodles ($32), Spicy Calamari w/ Pineapple and Tomatoes ($13), Fruit Juice Cooler (non-alcoholic, $3), and Mango de Fleur (alcoholic, $8.50), Fried Banana with Hazelnut Gelato ($7). Our total was about $100 for 2. 

I would recommend the Roasted Crab, but not the Tiger Prawns w/ Garlic Noodles. There were only 4 prawns with that price it's not worth it. Spicy calamari wasn't impressive because we were expecting it to be fried, but turned out to be just stir-fried. Mango de Fleur was good, but I didn't taste much of alcohol in it. It's too pricy for $8.50, since it was in a flute. I would definitely recommend juice cooler. Fried banana was ordinary, but the hazelnut gelato didn't click for me. It tasted almost too thick. 

Overall it was a good experience! I would highly recommend to eat at this restaurant.

excerpts: Garlic noodles is a little bit too sweet for my Asian taste buds.
garlic noodles.author: Sarah H.
garlic noodles.review:
After reading all the good reviews on yelp, I've decided to pay Thanh Long a visit.  Crab was average.  Garlic noodles is a little bit too sweet for my Asian taste buds.  

I've had better crabs and better noodles.  So three stars.

excerpts: I'm not really a fan of the garlic noodles.
I'll eat it
but it's not something I'd rave about.
The roasted crab however is a definitely buy.
They don't just give you the legs but the whole crab.
I likes!
The crab is pricey ( of course)I
think we paid $38 to 35
but
garlic noodles.author: Blue S.
garlic noodles.review:
I'm not really a fan of the garlic noodles.  I'll eat it but it's not something I'd rave about.  The roasted crab however is a definitely buy.  They don't just give you the legs but the whole crab.  I likes!  The crab is pricey ( of course)I think we paid $38 to 35 but oh well. 

Parking can be a pain so just use their valet $10.  When you're done eating you'll definitely forget you even paid the $10.  You'll just be happy that you don't have to walk a mile to your car cause someone will do it for you.

excerpts: Garlic noodles were good, but I think eating so much of it made me feel really sick.
I forced myself to drink, but washed it down with delicious crab meat and garlic noodles.
garlic noodles.author: Dolores L.
garlic noodles.review:
I am a lazy eater, so I almost got the tiger prawns, but thanks to yelpers, I went with the crab. I was a little sad that I had to pry through the crab to get the delicious meat, but I will say this: it was definitely worth it. The roasted crab is delicious. I was ashamed when I had to get my friend to help me rip off two of the crab legs. Please don't laugh at me. 

Garlic noodles were good, but I think eating so much of it made me feel really sick. It's rather greasy, so be ready for that. 

I also got a Hanoi Sunset cocktail. It wasn't that great. It was overly laden with alcohol, unless you're into that. I forced myself to drink, but washed it down with delicious crab meat and garlic noodles. YAY!

It's on the pricey side. It was about $40 per crab, but it's definitely worth a try.

excerpts: The garlic noodles and drunken crab = all you need in life.
I think my friend and I polished off 3 plates of garlic noodles, 2 drunken crabs, and 1 roasted crab.
Now that I look back on it, I don't know how we did that especially reading yelpers
say they couldnt finish one crab.
I was skinnier back then too!
HAHA.
The only explanation must be the sheer deliciousness of those dishes.
Maybe the other items on the menu are less memorable, but definitely go for their "signature" dishes.
garlic noodles.author: Trish A.
garlic noodles.review:
Thinking of this place and knowing I live on the other side of the country makes me shed a tear. I've only been to Thanh Long once, and it was about 2 years ago. But I can still smell and taste everything we had...


The garlic noodles and drunken crab = all you need in life. I think my friend and I polished off 3 plates of garlic noodles, 2 drunken crabs, and 1 roasted crab. Now that I look back on it, I don't know how we did that especially reading yelpers say they couldnt finish one crab. I was skinnier back then too! HAHA. The only explanation must be the sheer deliciousness of those dishes. Maybe the other items on the menu are less memorable, but definitely go for their "signature" dishes. You won't be disappointed.

 It gets a little messy and tedious, but hey! It's a fun experience. They also provide you a bib so it's all good in the hood. Also, your breath will be kickin' people in the face, so be wary when you lean in for a smooch.

excerpts: Roast duck, garlic noodles, and crab wontons are all delicious!
I would definitely go back again.
garlic noodles.author: Natalie G.
garlic noodles.review: Although I wouldn't suggest taking a first date here, this place does have pretty delicious crab. As you probably already know, crab is difficult to eat, so just be prepared to get your hands dirty. Luckily, they kindly supply you with bibs, extra napkins, and warm hand towels to fight the mess. Roast duck, garlic noodles, and crab wontons are all delicious! I would definitely go back again.

excerpts: Also don't share the garlic noodles.
It's pretty much spaghetti with garlic and butter, but for some reason, however they make it, it goes really well with the crab.
I guess you need to add a little carb to the meal.
I usually just get the roasted crab and the garlic noodles
and I'm pretty much done.
garlic noodles.author: Phil W.
garlic noodles.review:
This is the only crab in town that I will get dirty for. Like most guys, I'm pretty lazy when it comes to eating crab. I might eat the best parts by using a fork and completely ignore the legs and claws. TL's roasted garlic crab is to die for. Even though it's really unhealthy how they soak the crabs in butter before roasting, but it really is the tastiest ones around. I've tried the drunken crab, its ok, but nothing compared to the roasted one. It really is the best. I don't mind getting all dirty and oily at all. Some think one is enough to share with 2 or 3 people. I can probably eat two by myself on a good day, so do order one for yourself and don't share. 

Also don't share the garlic noodles. It's pretty much spaghetti with garlic and butter, but for some reason, however they make it, it goes really well with the crab. I guess you need to add a little carb to the meal. I usually just get the roasted crab and the garlic noodles and I'm pretty much done. I've had friends order other dishes like fish or prawns, but those are just mediocre. 

I would have easily given it 5 stars, but the service wasn't all that great. Maybe because most of the evenings I've dined here were on weekends when it's really crowded and busy. But for the prices they charge, which are upscale restaurant prices, I expected the service to be better. Most of the servers act like they are in a pho place and weren't very friendly. Also on several occasions, they were a good 20 minutes behind schedule, so even with reservations, we had a good wait.

excerpts: And of course, like everyone says, the garlic noodles are awesome!
You'd think they would be easy to make yourself since they seem so simple, but I'll go ahead and confirm that they aren't easy to replicate at home
garlic noodles.author: Gray C.
garlic noodles.review:
If only this wasn't so pricey (or we weren't so greedy), we'd come here a lot more often! Our out-of-town guests were deliciously happy with the meal here -- oooh, we had some awfully good grilled squid for an appetizer (we were tempted to order another one as soon as we scarfed it down)! 

The drunken crab tastes okay, but the roasted crab really is the way to go (esp. if you like butter and garlic!!). Yum!! I've gotten my own crab before, but I always have leftovers, so I might just go halfsies next time (to save money!). There were 3 crazy skinny chicks at the next table sharing ONE crab -- THAT I did not understand...if you're going to enjoy some food, ENJOY it already!!

And of course, like everyone says, the garlic noodles are awesome! You'd think they would be easy to make yourself since they seem so simple, but I'll go ahead and confirm that they aren't easy to replicate at home (hey, my eating partner had to try at least...but no success).

Dessert -- the fried banana and ice cream was very good (although a bit ridiculous to have after an already huge meal)!

Oh, and yes, reservations are very helpful -- even if you call only a couple of hours ahead. And the waitstaff are very nice -- no complaints! I'll head back as soon as my wallet recovers... Parking usually stinks in the neighborhood, but if you expect that and be patient, you will manage.

excerpts: Most definitely, I will concur with the majority here:  the roast crab with garlic noodles is a must when you go to Thanh
Long
...if you don't know how or are too burnt out in the kitchen to cook crab yourself (simple recipe, really).
garlic noodles.author: Ric S.
garlic noodles.review:
Most definitely, I will concur with the majority here:  the roast crab with garlic noodles is a must when you go to Thanh Long  ...if you don't know how or are too burnt out in the kitchen to cook crab yourself (simple recipe, really).  The service is excellent, there's a full bar, and our fried bananas with the Tahitian vanilla ice cream was the perfect climax (nice with a cup of coffee and a snifter of Sambucca). 

All in all, a nice getaway.

excerpts: Been here three times and every time I had the garlic crab and garlic noodles.
The food is always consistent and the service has never been bad.
Bf had his grad party here
and it was amazing.
We all had our own crab, shared bowls and bowls of noodles, and enjoyed rich, tasty desserts.
Parking is a pain but honestly, I don't mind.
garlic noodles.author: Tammy L.
garlic noodles.review:
I have no complaints for this place.

Been here three times and every time I had the garlic crab and garlic noodles.  The food is always consistent and the service has never been bad.  Bf had his grad party here and it was amazing.  We all had our own crab, shared bowls and bowls of noodles, and enjoyed rich, tasty desserts.  Parking is a pain but honestly, I don't mind.

excerpts: The garlic noodles and shrimp are really, really good.
That being said, this places is OVERPRICED!!!
Such a rip off.
My friend treated us and ended up paying almost $200 bucks for 3 of us.
I've never gone to a bigger rip-off restaurant.
And it's not even worth it!!
i felt so bad, especially since i didn't have that much of the crab and what i did have was so-so.
Save your money and go to a good buffet if you want crab because $50 for crab and no sides is ridick.
Don't waste your money.
garlic noodles.author: Hanan H.
garlic noodles.review: The garlic noodles and shrimp are really, really good. That being said, this places is OVERPRICED!!! Such a rip off. My friend treated us and ended up paying almost $200 bucks for 3 of us. I've never gone to a bigger rip-off restaurant. And it's not even worth it!! i felt so bad, especially since i didn't have that much of the crab and what i did have was so-so. Save your money and go to a good buffet if you want crab because $50 for crab and no sides is ridick. Don't waste your money.

excerpts: The roasted crab and garlic noodles.
The order came out quick.
The crab was so big that I didn't know where to start.
Customer service is good as they kept filling cups with water and replacing bowls.
I would definitely come back here again.
garlic noodles.author: A L.
garlic noodles.review: I kept hearing many things about this place.  Better than PPQ and the wait isn't as long as it's sister restaurant on Polk St, or so  I heard.  I came here for dinner with two of my friends and we ordered the staples.  The roasted crab and garlic noodles.  The order came out quick.  The crab was so big that I didn't know where to start.  Customer service is good as they kept filling cups with water and replacing bowls.  I would definitely come back here again.

excerpts: Best garlic butter roasted crabs, combined with garlic noodles.
Makes my trip to San Fran worth it.
We try to make it every summer.
But crabs are not fat in the summer time.
garlic noodles.author: Ne D.
garlic noodles.review: Best garlic butter roasted crabs, combined with garlic noodles. Makes my trip to San Fran worth it.  We try to make it every summer. But crabs are not fat in the summer time.

excerpts: The six of us ordered 5 roasted crabs and 4 plates of garlic noodles.
We were served our entrees super quick!
I was surprised how fast the turnaround was.
The garlic noodles were an awesome side dish.
garlic noodles.author: Maka Nani C.
garlic noodles.review:
Thanh Long. Shut Yo Mouth!!!!

My best est friend in the whole world took me here to celebrate my 31st birthday. She asked me a week before Christmas what I wanted for my birthday and I said "Thanh Long." People always rant and rave about this place so I wanted to see what they were going on about..

Upon entering, I was greeted by a an ocean of people. Which is expected for a Saturday night. Thank God we had a reservation! We were seated immediately. My heart palpitated with anticipation as the menu was placed in front of me. I glanced over the menu out of curiosity. Of course, I knew what I was ordering but I thought I'd give it a once over. I was especially curious about the prices. GOOD LORD this place is expensive!

Granted. My friend was treating but WOW! The six of us ordered 5 roasted crabs and 4 plates of garlic noodles. We were served our entrees super quick!  I was surprised how fast the turnaround was. Usually one can experience a wait of 20 minutes plus at other restaurants.

However, our waiter failed to bring us our drinks in a timely manner. I also had to ask for glasses of water twice. I assume water would have been placed before us as we were seated. That was just a minute blunder of the evening. Otherwise, the service was excellent. As we shelled our crab into the designated shell bowl they were picked up and emptied promptly. 

Usually I am a very "neat" eater, but I tore through that crab boy! The garlic noodles were an awesome side dish. So all in all the food and service was great. 

I found out later that my friend had paid $60 per crab. The crabbing season is a bit slow at the moment. So, price wise this place was extremely expensive! But I guess you get what you pay for right?!

excerpts: listen to the crowd, garlic noodles are
garlic noodles.author: Karisa L.
garlic noodles.review:
I LOOOOOOOOOOVE this place...if you're a crab lover this is the place to go.  Its the same menu at crustaceans except without the posh interior (no dinner jacket required).  I've ordered all the differenct crabs and my favorite is still the roasted crab.  listen to the crowd, garlic noodles are a definite must have.  

come prepared, two crabs an order of noodles and an appetizer can easily set you back $100 bucks...oh and eat fast...the crab isnt as good once it gets cold!!!

YUM!

excerpts: I love the crab, calamari and garlic noodles.
It's a little pricey
but it's worth it.
garlic noodles.author: Y B.
garlic noodles.review: Ditto.  I love the crab, calamari and garlic noodles.  It's a little pricey but it's worth it.

excerpts: Only the garlic noodles were delish.
garlic noodles.author: Jane M.
garlic noodles.review:
I suppose this place USED to be great and is now coasting (downhill, fast) on its old reputation. The crab was cold and the butter had partially congealed. The crabmeat was dry. Only the garlic noodles were delish.

It was great to see so many Asians AND African Americans dining--don't see that often. Too bad the food isn't better!

excerpts: I had a stir-fry dish and he had the fresh halibut (not 100% sure), and we both split the garlic noodles.
All of it was good all the way around.
garlic noodles.author: Brad C.
garlic noodles.review:
A friend and I were craving seafood, and ended up at Thanh Long. We saw these amazing roasted crabs whizzing by ever few minutes, but neither one of us felt like having crab. (I am definitely going to go back and try it though!)

I had a stir-fry dish and he had the fresh halibut (not 100% sure), and we both split the garlic noodles. All of it was good all the way around. Not outstanding, but I will go back.

Clean atmosphere, happy service...

excerpts: Garlic noodles are to die for.
Creme Brulee is one of the best I've had.
garlic noodles.author: Leo V.
garlic noodles.review:
OK let me start off by saying that the food gets FIVE STARS

I have been going to Thanh Long since before they remodeled the Judah St location. It used to be an old diner style setup with linoleum tile and mint green paint on the walls. They had simple tables and chairs. Back then they were relatively unknown, it was more a local place than the bay area famous and now expanded multi location family run business. (If you didn't know, the kids run the Crustacean's chain, with locations in SF, Beverly Hills and Las Vegas).

One day my friends and I had decided to go to Thahn Long's for dinner. Much to our horror they were boarded up and a sign said "closed for remodeling". It was really sad! We were so looking forward to the best damn crab on earth! 

Nearly a year later they re-opened and to astonishment Thanh Long has become a very fancy place. They even had a dress code! Which they have done away with...which I think was a bad idea. The food is awesome, not one bad thing on the menu. But from time to time when I go there. I feel like I'm surrounded by the entourage of a ghetto rap star. People come in wearing track suits, shorts and sports jerseys or just jeans and a tshirt. Which really makes things awkward considering everyone else is dress casual, business attire or suit and tie/dress. Thanh Long has definitely become an upscale restaurant. I think it's kind of a shame that they don't require a dress code anymore. 


OK back to the food. 

I like to take friends and family to Thanh Long's who have never been before. I make sure that their first time they get the roasted crab....an ENTIRE roasted crab for themselves. I often see a table of four people get only ONE CRAB for all four of them! WHAT'S WRONG WITH YOU!!! 

When you go to Thanh Long you HAVE TO GET ONE CRAB for each person. You will ALWAYS....ALWAYS want more. 

I've been several time in recent memory where I've been sat next to other tables of two and been just put to SHAME! When you go to Thanh Long for crab you usually want to eat it in a relatively short period of time so the juices don't cool down and harden on the plate. I usually make it ....but in the last few times I've been....I've seen younger smaller asian girls and even older asian women eat an ENTIRE crab for themselves in 20 minutes! Talk about jaw dropping shame and humiliation HAHAHAHAHA They just SCARFED the crab.....and they had DESSERT and were done and paid the bill in under an hour. That folks are SKILLS!

Garlic noodles are to die for. Creme Brulee is one of the best I've had. I've had Creme Brulee in Paris and it wasn't as good.

I've been to Crustaceans here in SF....the food is good but the recipe is slightly different. I prefer the original Thanh Long. Though parking is a nightmare.

I highly suggest after eating at Thanh Long you make a trip to the 7-11 across the street for mints and/or gum.

excerpts: The garlic noodles and roasted crab are just to die for but being over 800 miles away now has me yearning to return to the bay area for another round of gluttony.
(and sunlight).
Yes, I am jealous of you locals.
Enjoy!
garlic noodles.author: Jeff D.
garlic noodles.review:
Well, every accolade that can be bestowed upon a restaurant already appears in the previous 501 reviews that came before this one.

The garlic noodles and roasted crab are just to die for but being over 800 miles away now has me yearning to return to the bay area for another round of gluttony. (and sunlight).   Yes, I am jealous of you locals.  Enjoy!

excerpts: The garlic noodles and garlic rice was amazing.
Make sure you make reservations because it was packed.
I don't think I'd get anything else on the menu besides what I've already mentioned.
garlic noodles.author: Monique M.
garlic noodles.review: I came here for the first time for my boyfriends birthday dinner on a Thursday night. The crab was really good. I would say better than The Boiling Crab in San Jose. The garlic noodles and garlic rice was amazing. Make sure you make reservations because it was packed. I don't think I'd get anything else on the menu besides what I've already mentioned.

excerpts: We went for the garlic roasted crab but I fell in LOVE with their garlic noodles .
You cannot go wrong with either one.
My mouth is watering just thinking about it...
God I can almost taste the damn thing!!!!
They must use MSG..cause damn!!!
garlic noodles.author: Poncho M.
garlic noodles.review:
"Brah...the Garlic Friggin Noodles are Da Kine"

We went for the garlic roasted crab but I fell in LOVE with their garlic noodles .  You cannot go wrong with either one.  My mouth is watering just thinking about it...God I can almost taste the damn thing!!!!  They must use MSG..cause damn!!! j/k

Be forewarned the little crustacean is a bit pricey so go if you like crab.  

My wife thought it was good but she's not a crab lover like I am... she's "different" hahaahaha.

Place is busy and crowded...they have a main dining area in the front of house and an upstairs dining area.....

Located in the OUTER OUTER sunset....close to the water so the crabs can just crawl to the restaurants....I guess....;-)

excerpts: I would have to say the crab and the garlic noodles are mediocre.
garlic noodles.author: Henry L.
garlic noodles.review:
I believe this place to be the same owner(s) as that of Crustacean's Restaurant.

I read the Yelp reviews and must say that the Shaken beef made of New York Steak is definitely a hit! The aroma draws you in and the flavor is just intense! These are the most tender morsels you will ever bite into and the pepper-flavored marinade equates this dish close to perfection.

I would have to say the crab and the garlic noodles are mediocre. The other crab restaurants of its calibre (i.e. PPQ) make better crabs for less $$$. 

Also, I came here twice because the first time I had a great experience. My advice is not to go a second time because the second time never tastes as good as the first time at these crab restaurants.

excerpts: The garlic noodles are delicious!
and the roasted crab is my Fave!
finger licking good... but the atmosphere is more fancy
so have manners lolz
but DIG in!
garlic noodles.author: Vicky N.
garlic noodles.review: LOVE this place! they have VIP valet parking, VERY busy, BUT worth the wait! I suggest making a reservation ahead of time. and this place is run by the same people of Crustaceans also located in SF but in the downtown district. BUT this place is WAY better, i think it might be the chefs...  The garlic noodles are delicious! and the roasted crab is my Fave! finger licking good... but the atmosphere is more fancy so have manners lolz but DIG in!

excerpts: We had the drunken crab which was good, however I think the roasted might have been a better option, the garlic noodles were very good.
garlic noodles.author: Bobby B.
garlic noodles.review:
I had heard great things about this place for a long time and randomly ended up there last night for the first time. I was surprised with how full the place was for a Sunday evening especially with it located so far out in the Sunset. The thing that stuck out to me over the good food was the great service we had, the staff was friendly and on top of things, when they realized that there was a better table available they offered it to us and from there were on top of our needs from the get go. 

We had the drunken crab which was good, however I think the roasted might have been a better option, the garlic noodles were very good. We started with the fried rice paper app which was the only thing that I wasn't that impressed with, not because of the taste however the price for what you get wasn't didn't impress me that much. 

I will be back to try the steak cubes and garlic rice along with the roasted crab!

excerpts: Highly recommend the roast crab and garlic noodles.!!!
garlic noodles.author: Eddie S.
garlic noodles.review: Went for a special birthday and it was soooo good! Highly recommend the roast crab and garlic noodles.!!!

excerpts: I've been there several times and always get the crab (duh) and garlic noodles.
Only once was I disappointed when the crab wasn't as fresh as my previous visits.
With crab season coming, I will definitely pay another visit.
Skip the mixed drinks...too foo foo for me.
garlic noodles.author: Ray C.
garlic noodles.review: I've been there several times and always get the crab (duh) and garlic noodles. Only once was I disappointed when the crab wasn't as fresh as my previous visits. With crab season coming, I will definitely pay another visit. Skip the mixed drinks...too foo foo for me.

excerpts: My mother and I opted to share the roasted crab and garlic noodles, since a friend had recommended them.
So.
Amazing.
Just go to try this
and you'll be forever amazed!
You won't want crab prepared any other way.
I will say it's a heart attack on a plate, but after I thanked my friend and told him I might die of heart disease he rightly pointed out that, "that is the feeling.. food to die for.
" Enjoy because you only live once!
garlic noodles.author: Ashley S.
garlic noodles.review: Came here with my mom and sister a week ago. The location is a little odd to get to but everything else is awesome about this place! We were pleasantly surprised by the service.. some of the best I've had in a long time. We were sat quickly upon arrival and as we walked upstairs to our table I got a look at everyone's plates along the way and knew right away I had chosen an excellent place! My sister ordered the chicken consomme soup which I tried.. it was delicious! My mother and I opted to share the roasted crab and garlic noodles, since a friend had recommended them. So. Amazing. Just go to try this and you'll be forever amazed! You won't want crab prepared any other way. I will say it's a heart attack on a plate, but after I thanked my friend and told him I might die of heart disease he rightly pointed out that, "that is the feeling.. food to die for." Enjoy because you only live once!

excerpts: Make sure you order some Garlic Noodles and steamed rice if you are Filipino.
We seem to always end up at the clamshell booth, which sometimes feels like a fishbowl, but I don't mind.
I want to take a nap after this meal.
garlic noodles.author: Angie N.
garlic noodles.review: Sit down with a cocktail and get right down to the Roasted Dungeness Crab.  Maybe order a veg side dish if you want to be good.  Make sure you order some Garlic Noodles and steamed rice if you are Filipino.  We seem to always end up at the clamshell booth, which sometimes feels like a fishbowl, but I don't mind.  I want to take a nap after this meal.

excerpts: This place is known for their Roasted Garlic Butter Crab and Garlic Noodles.
Their crab is very garlicky and buttery.
garlic noodles.author: Steve T.
garlic noodles.review:
This place is known for their Roasted Garlic Butter Crab and Garlic Noodles. Their crab is very garlicky and buttery. After every couple pieces i break off, i can't help but lick the flavors off my fingertips. 

The food is delicious, but a tad bit overpriced. 

Parking is very difficult, after a lap or 2 if you still can't find parking, don't waste your time. Just pay the $10 for parking. On fridays and weekends, reservations might be better if you don't want to wait as long for a table.

excerpts:
Here are some of the things we must get when we're here:

~ garlic crab
~ garlic noodles (drools)
~ tiger prawns
~ vanilla bean gelato

 moving to LA wouldn't be so bad as Thanh Long, Beverly Hills is only a few miles away.
garlic noodles.author: foodi e.
garlic noodles.review:
