Hands down, one of my favorite places to eat! Food is delicious & service  is efficient. The "secret kitchen" adds a certain mystique to the whole dining experience. Wait 'till I get my hands on that garlic noodle recipe.  Here are some of the things we must get when we're here:

~ garlic crab
~ garlic noodles (drools)
~ tiger prawns
~ vanilla bean gelato

 moving to LA wouldn't be so bad as Thanh Long, Beverly Hills is only a few miles away.

excerpts: After hearing all the praise for the roasted crab and garlic noodles, I decided I had to try it out.
To be honest, I was not at all impressed after my meal.
Yes, the crab is indeed fresh and was cooked fine.
But, I wasn't satisfied or impressed with the butter/garlic seasoning.
The roasted crab was nothing special and certainly not worth the price.
The garlic noodles were also mediocre...seemed more or less like typical spaghetti noodles tossed with crushed garlic, oil, and salt.
For all the hype this restaurant gets, the food to me was 2.5/3 stars at best.
I will say that service was fine though.
But all in all, I was not pleased with this restaurant and will not be going back.
garlic noodles.author: C K.
garlic noodles.review: After hearing all the praise for the roasted crab and garlic noodles, I decided I had to try it out. To be honest, I was not at all impressed after my meal. Yes, the crab is indeed fresh and was cooked fine. But, I wasn't satisfied or impressed with the butter/garlic seasoning. The roasted crab was nothing special and certainly not worth the price. The garlic noodles were also mediocre...seemed more or less like typical spaghetti noodles tossed with crushed garlic, oil, and salt. For all the hype this restaurant gets, the food to me was 2.5/3 stars at best. I will say that service was fine though. But all in all, I was not pleased with this restaurant and will not be going back.

excerpts: Their garlic noodles are the best.
A simple meal of those noodles with beer would be perfect.
Thanh Long gets four stars (from a base of three) for their garlic noodles.
garlic noodles.author: Amanibhavam K.
garlic noodles.review:
Their garlic noodles are the best.  A simple meal of those noodles with beer would be perfect.  Whatever else I order would be a complement to the noodles.

I didn't like their crab, and thought their other Vietnamese dishes were OK.  

Thanh Long gets four stars (from a base of three) for their garlic noodles.

excerpts: The roasted Crab it is delicious, and the garlic noodles are a Must Have.
I went there for my B-Day and everyone loved it, kids and adults, the service it's so good and friendly and the food its so good.
garlic noodles.author: Jessica R.
garlic noodles.review: The roasted Crab it is delicious, and the garlic noodles are a Must Have. I went there for my B-Day and everyone loved it, kids and adults, the service it's so good and friendly and the food its so good.

excerpts: and I were craving garlic noodles, so we yelped this place up, saw the pictures of crab
and we was like HELL YEAHHHH!
When we got their it doesn't really look fancy from the outside, but when we went in we were like
"Aw dammnnnn this place is CLASSSSYY
" But anyways we got seated and ordered the roasted crab and garlic noodles.
Man were the portions PERFECT.
We split the crab and my goodness you could really taste the flavor of the crab, just one tiny detail (they use a shitload of butter) which is probably why it tastes....
DIIIIIIIVINEEE!
We came on a Wednesday around 6, and thank goodness there wasn't a line, but it filled up quick when we were about done.
We even had leftovers of the noodles (weakkkkksauce) heh.
BUT this place is so delicious
, I'd come every damn day if I could!
And our service was legitttt he was very attentive and refilled our waters rather quickly.
GAH
I'm so in love.
garlic noodles.author: Fiona W.
garlic noodles.review: I AM SO IN LOVEEEEEEEEEE WITH A PLACE CALLED THANH LONG!!!! So my best and I were craving garlic noodles, so we yelped this place up, saw the pictures of crab and we was like HELL YEAHHHH! When we got their it doesn't really look fancy from the outside, but when we went in we were like "Aw dammnnnn this place is CLASSSSYY" But anyways we got seated and ordered the roasted crab and garlic noodles. Man were the portions PERFECT. We split the crab and my goodness you could really taste the flavor of the crab, just one tiny detail (they use a shitload of butter) which is probably why it tastes.... DIIIIIIIVINEEE! We came on a Wednesday around 6, and thank goodness there wasn't a line, but it filled up quick when we were about done. We even had leftovers of the noodles (weakkkkksauce) heh. BUT this place is so delicious, I'd come every damn day if I could! And our service was legitttt he was very attentive and refilled our waters rather quickly. GAH I'm so in love.

excerpts: Went here for my boyfriend's Birthday mainly because I had been looking for a good excuse to try out the original Vietnamese roast crab and garlic noodles.
I love the version at PPQ Dungeness Island
so I figured I would love Thanh Long.
I asked our waitress if we could have an order of the garlic noodles without cheese.
She tersely replied that all the noodles were pre-made and could not be adjusted.
I am confused - are the noodles made in a factory in Iowa and then shipped to Thanh Long to be re-heated?
Is it possible that Thanh Long makes a bath tub full of cheesy garlic noodles at 4:30 in the afternoon for their entire dinner service?
Surely at some point in the evening the chef's must make a new batch of noodles.
Well turns out eating roast crab without garlic noodles really is not the same experience.
Given the high prices we were paying and the fact that we were celebrating a Birthday
I was shocked that this simple request could not be met.
Turns out I was not missing much all those times I ate at PPQ instead of going to Thanh Long.
Well turns out eating roast crab without garlic noodles really is not the same experience.
Given the high prices we were paying and the fact that we were celebrating a Birthday
I was shocked that this simple request could not be met.
Turns out I was not missing much all those times I ate at PPQ instead of going to Thanh Long.
garlic noodles.author: Dana H.
garlic noodles.review:
Went here for my boyfriend's Birthday mainly because I had been looking for a good excuse to try out the original Vietnamese roast crab and garlic noodles.  I love the version at PPQ Dungeness Island so I figured I would love Thanh Long.  Boy was I wrong.  

The crab itself was actually quite tasty but when I went to try the noodles I noticed what looked like cheese on top.  I was fairly surprised to see such a thing since we were in a Vietnamese restaurant, so I asked the waitress to be sure.  Our waitress confirmed my suspicions.  Since I really don't like cheese I asked our waitress if we could have an order of the garlic noodles without cheese.  She tersely replied that all the noodles were pre-made and could not be adjusted.  I am confused - are the noodles made in a factory in Iowa and then shipped to Thanh Long to be re-heated?  Is it possible that Thanh Long makes a bath tub full of cheesy garlic noodles at 4:30 in the afternoon for their entire dinner service?  Surely at some point in the evening the chef's must make a new batch of noodles.  Evidently not because our waitress made it very clear that there was no way possible to have an order of noodles without cheese.  

Well turns out eating roast crab without garlic noodles really is not the same experience.  Given the high prices we were paying and the fact that we were celebrating a Birthday I was shocked that this simple request could not be met.  Turns out I was not missing much all those times I ate at PPQ instead of going to Thanh Long.

excerpts: We ordered 2 roasted crab, 1 tamarind, 2 garlic noodles and 2 shaken beef as well as some drinks.
I think the food aside from the shaken beef was premade because our order came literally 5 min after we placed the order!
Oh well!
The roasted crab didn't have a strong garlic flavor but it was good when you dipped the meat in the melted garlic and butter that was left on the plate.
The garlic noodles were really good!
We ordered one to take back to the hotel for a late night snack and they were still good the next day after sitting in the fridge!
OMG the shaken beef was delish!
They cooked it to perfection and the meat was so tender.
garlic noodles.author: Lilly M.
garlic noodles.review:
This was probably the best place we ate at while in San Francisco!

Getting here was a task since we weren't familiar with the public transportation system but thanks to a friendly native, we were pointed in the right direction!

This place was pretty far from our hotel in Union Square but well worth the trek since we had a great meal!

We ordered 2 roasted crab, 1 tamarind, 2 garlic noodles and 2 shaken beef as well as some drinks.
I think the food aside from the shaken beef was premade because our order came literally 5 min after we placed the order!  Oh well!
The roasted crab didn't have a strong garlic flavor but it was good when you dipped the meat in the melted garlic and butter that was left on the plate.  I didn't like the tamarind crab at all.  To me it tasted slimy and the flavor was just weird.  The garlic noodles were really good!  We ordered one to take back to the hotel for a late night snack and they were still good the next day after sitting in the fridge!  
OMG the shaken beef was delish!  They cooked it to perfection and the meat was so tender.  I could go there just to eat this.  

This place is definitely worth a visit if you're in San Francisco.  It's pretty pricey but totally worth it.  I'm just sad we couldn't make it to PPQ to make a comparison!

excerpts: We ordered the garlic noodles roasted crab and calamari.
They were all delicious!
Awesome service, and great food!
The price was steep but well worth it.
For dinner for 2, we both had a dungeness crab, noodles, appetizer, water we spent $140.
garlic noodles.author: Stephanie D.
garlic noodles.review: I went here not to long ago for my birthday. I originally had planned to go to PPQs and they were closed. Although, I was disappointed I was thrilled that it gave me the opportunity to try THANH LONG. I first called to see if there was a wait and they said after 7pm it gets tight. At the time I called to check they told me there was no wait. In fact when we got there we were immediately seated. The customer service was absolutely perfect. We never had to worry about our glasses going half empty because they constantly refilled our glass. We ordered the garlic noodles roasted crab and calamari. They were all delicious! Awesome service, and great food! The price was steep but well worth it. For dinner for 2, we both had a dungeness crab, noodles, appetizer, water we spent $140.

excerpts: And the Garlic noodles were excellent as well.
Wait staff was very friendly as well.
garlic noodles.author: Thomas B.
garlic noodles.review: Went for the first time with friends to celebrate their anniversary. By far the best Garlic Roasted Crab I've ever eaten. And the Garlic noodles were excellent as well. Wait staff was very friendly as well.

excerpts: I think people come here for 2 things... garlic roasted crab and garlic noodles.
garlic noodles.author: Vy R.
garlic noodles.review:
I think people come here for 2 things... garlic roasted crab and garlic noodles. Just make sure you eat fast, cuz there's soooo much butter, if you don't it'll solidify. 

This place is a nice treat every once in awhile. Eating too much of this will give you a heart attack, but it might be worth it. :)

excerpts: We ordered the Shrimp Toast (fabulous...you can actually taste the shrimp and its rich), Garlic Noodles (don't need to say much.. everyone knows how good it tastes), Drunken Crab (also another favorite of most patrons who come here),  and the Shaken Beef (DELICIOUS!!!
It was so tender and juicy
garlic noodles.author: Linda X.
garlic noodles.review:
Okay.. this is fresh off the press. I just got home from dinner at Thanh Long. I brought my bf here for his birthday dinner. We ordered the Shrimp Toast (fabulous...you can actually taste the shrimp and its rich), Garlic Noodles (don't need to say much.. everyone knows how good it tastes), Drunken Crab (also another favorite of most patrons who come here),  and the Shaken Beef (DELICIOUS!!! It was so tender and juicy and the potatoes were great). 

Last but not least... our dessert (I'm not sure how I found enough room to cram all that good food into my tummy but I did haha) Creme Brulee (flavor of the day Green Tea) which I have to admit amazed me.. I wasn't sure what to expect but it was creamy with a hint of green tea. I don't know how they managed to capture the green tea taste in this creamy dessert but they did and they did an excellent job of it as well. 

Ahhh -pats my tummy- delicious. 

**Side note: I happen to be allergic to shellfish (crab, lobster, shrimp, etc.) So needless to say even knowing I'd break out in hives it was totally worth it because now I'm sitting at home hiding from people but completely satisfied with my dinner. -big sigh-

excerpts: Garlic noodles - yum.
garlic noodles.author: YL L.
garlic noodles.review:
My first time trying Thanh Long.  I thought it was decent.  I was pregnant when I tried it, so don't know if my pregnancy taste buds are kinda whack or what....

Sea bass - I love sea bass, but I'd take the baked sea bass you get at a Chinese restaurant over Thanh Long's.  Flavor was just okay. If I go back, I wouldn't order it again.

I can't remember if we ordered the Saigon Beef or the Shaken Beef, but it was pretty tasty.  I'd order it again.

Roasted crab was just okay.  Maybe because I had heard so many good things about it, my expectations were raised. I was a bit disappointed.  Husband just thought it was okay as well, though that didn't stop him for eating most of it.

Garlic noodles - yum. I would definitely order this again.

Fried pineapple with ice cream - Mmmm. A nice change from the fried banana.

excerpts: Wasn't feeling the garlic noodles that everybody RAVE about but nonetheless a good place for crab, could've did without the priceyness though!!!
garlic noodles.author: Chaz'a B.
garlic noodles.review: CRAB was seasoned just like I like it!!!  Wasn't feeling the garlic noodles that everybody RAVE about but nonetheless a good place for crab, could've did without the priceyness though!!!

excerpts: Don't forget those garlic noodles.
garlic noodles.author: Jay S.
garlic noodles.review: Roasted crab is as yummy as ever.  Don't forget those garlic noodles.  The stuffed calamari is pretty darn good too.  We usually have a few other dishes, other than just crab, for variety.  Good service too.

excerpts: A friend and I ordered the lemongrass chicken and garlic noodles to share.
They both had great flavor.
The garlic noodles especially were a surprise.
I was expecting an overpowering garlic spice
but they had all the flavor and none of the bite some garlic dishes can have.
garlic noodles.author: Amy C.
garlic noodles.review: I love garlic and they are doing it right. A friend and I ordered the lemongrass chicken and garlic noodles to share. They both had great flavor. The garlic noodles especially were a surprise. I was expecting an overpowering garlic spice but they had all the flavor and none of the bite some garlic dishes can have.

excerpts: You can try other dishes, but you MUST include the Roast Crab and Garlic noodles.
garlic noodles.author: Young P.
garlic noodles.review:
Thanh Long is good place to eat. I love Seafood and stuffing my face, so this place feels like home.

You can try other dishes, but you MUST include the Roast Crab and Garlic noodles. I tried a couple of appetizers, but only remembered the crab and noodles. 

I decided to subtract a star because Thanh Long is a bit pricey $$$. Plus, I wish the bibs were more colorful (you can look my profile picture to compare... thats what a real bib looks like!)

excerpts: This is a place you should just avoid and erase from your memory if you are on a diet because there is no avoiding the roasted crab and garlic noodles once you're in the door!
Buttery Peppery Garlic? check.
Freshest Crab possible?
check.
Best Garlic Noodles on planet earth?
check!
It just felt wrong to wear a bib and indulge in garlic noodles right down the street from Rodeo Dr.
Now, when I go with a group, we tend to order the Garlic Roast Crab, Garlic Noodles, Fried Rice, Daily Vegetable, and maybe some calamari or something little to start.
We may feel sick when we leave, but it's like a hangover after a great night of partying....
TOTALLY worth it.
garlic noodles.author: Amanda C.
garlic noodles.review:
This is a place you should just avoid and erase from your memory if you are on a diet because there is no avoiding the roasted crab and garlic noodles once you're in the door! Buttery Peppery Garlic? check. Freshest Crab possible? check. Best Garlic Noodles on planet earth? check! Oh how I love this place!

I too have been to Crustacean in Beverly Hills and this is just way better. It is the most authentic, unpretentious, "strap on a crab bib and get to it" kind of place. It just felt wrong to wear a bib and indulge in garlic noodles right down the street from Rodeo Dr. 

When I was a young'un and didn't like crab (we all grow up some time), I would get the chicken curry here and that is also delicious. Now, when I go with a group, we tend to order the Garlic Roast Crab, Garlic Noodles, Fried Rice, Daily Vegetable, and maybe some calamari or something little to start. We may feel sick when we leave, but it's like a hangover after a great night of partying.... TOTALLY worth it.

excerpts: Their world famous roast crab definitely lives up to the hype and it goes really well with the garlic noodles
but you have to be able to get a little messy because you have to crack open the crabs yourself.
The yummy buttery goodness of the roasted crab is absolutely bad for your cholesterol, but at least your stomach would be super happy =]!
However, it's a bit pricey.
One crab would costs about 40 bucks depending on the season, so I would recommend that you share with someone
so it doesn't make such a  big hole in your wallet.
garlic noodles.author: Kristin C.
garlic noodles.review:
I absolutely love the food here.  Their world famous roast crab definitely lives up to the hype and it goes really well with the garlic noodles but you have to be able to get a little messy because you have to crack open the crabs yourself.  The yummy buttery goodness of the roasted crab is absolutely bad for your cholesterol, but at least your stomach would be super happy =]!  However, it's a bit pricey.  One crab would costs about 40 bucks depending on the season, so I would recommend that you share with someone so it doesn't make such a  big hole in your wallet.  But then again, the food is so good that you really wouldn't want to share with anyone.  

The customer service here was really good.  The waiters were really friendly but not to the point that you're annoyed of them.  The wait for the food was pretty decent, about 30-40 minutes.  Also before the meal they put on a bib for us and after they gave us nice and warm towels to clean up our hands and faces from eating the crabs like the savages we were.  

The restaurant is fairly small and it gets pretty busy here sometimes so it's best to make a reservation before you come.  And parking anywhere in San Francisco sucks, but there's valet parking right next to the restaurant and it's pretty cheap, around 5 bucks or so.  However, my car reeked of the smell of cigarettes when it was returned, so that was unfortunate, but that isn't the restaurant's fault.  Other than that, highly recommended if you are willing to pay the price.

excerpts: We also ordered the garlic noodles, it reminded me more of a garlicky chow mein
but it was still good nonetheless and considering the bill afterwards
, it was well worth it because the food was just that good.
I would give their service a 9 out of 10 and the food a 10 out of 10.
Thanh Longs knows what their doing.
garlic noodles.author: Michael R.
garlic noodles.review: My dad goes here ALL the time, I mean ALL the time. Whenever he wants to go somewhere nice and casual, but a place where you can dress up for and have some awesome food.....its always here. I've only been there once and it was for my birthday but the food was unforgettable. We ordered a bunch of dishes because there was a large group of us but me and my dad both got the roasted crab and let me tell you, it was sssssooooooooooo damn good. I think there secret is for one, the fresh seafood and for two, I think they use grey sea salt in the dish, I'm not sure, but maybe.  We also ordered the garlic noodles, it reminded me more of a garlicky chow mein but it was still good nonetheless and considering the bill afterwards, it was well worth it because the food was just that good.  I would give their service a 9 out of 10 and the food a 10 out of 10. Thanh Longs knows what their doing.

excerpts: Complement it with the garlic noodles and you'll feel like a queen/king.
Price: Expensive but absolutely WORTH it.
garlic noodles.author: Seema H.
garlic noodles.review:
This place is a jewel. The dungeness crab w/ An's garlic sauce and secret spices is the best dish I have ever had. Complement it with the garlic noodles and you'll feel like a queen/king. 

Price: Expensive but absolutely WORTH it.

excerpts: The garlic noodles, sure, are delectable, but a restaurant cannot be judged by side dishes.
garlic noodles.author: Baochi N.
garlic noodles.review:
Every member of my Vietnamese family knows that I am a sucker for crab - I could eat it all day and served in various ways. That's why I was ecstatic to learn about Thanh Long and its famous signature crab dishes. 

While I liked the modest interior and servers wearing traditional Vietnamese tunics, my first indication that Thang Long might disappoint was the menu's statement that Thanh Long is related to Crustacean - a place that fails to meet my standards for a decent Vietnamese restaurant. 

The reality is that the An family establishments serve inauthentic Vietnamese food, which wouldn't be a bad thing if the food was pleasingly innovative. As it stands, the roasted crab in salt and pepper butter is nice but certainly nothing to write home to Vietnam about. The garlic noodles, sure, are delectable, but a restaurant cannot be judged by side dishes. The traditional cabbage salad tasted far from traditional with a watered down fish sauce vinagrette.

The only authentic and quite delicious thing I had were the fried bananas with ice cream. That was quite a treat.

excerpts: Crab and Garlic Noodles are a MUST!
Although they have a wide selection of food items on the menu, I can bet you a US $1 that every table you look around you would see people enjoying the Crab and Garlic Noodles.
Okay, bets are off, I know there's always an exception to the rule...
Then the Garlic Noodles...just YUMMY YUMMY!
Though sometimes I just wanted to focus more on the CRAB and wanted to forego the garlic noodles...believe me, it's hard to do!
The only drawback that I have personally experienced is that after eating the crab and the garlic noodles, I'll be too full to have desserts!
Though, sometimes I'd go all out and ordered the Creme Brulee and some fancy tea (with Rose buds).
garlic noodles.author: Jen L.
garlic noodles.review:
Oh Thanh Long, Thanh Long, Thanh Long! What can I say about Thanh Long? 

Well, I have been a loyal fan of Thanh Long for a Long Looooooong time...I started going there even before they had their swanky renovation...EXACTLY! I remember the good old days when their crab was still under $20 a piece and before Valet parking was available. So there!

Now about the food...Crab and Garlic Noodles are a MUST! Although they have a wide selection of food items on the menu, I can bet you a US $1 that every table you look around you would see people enjoying the Crab and Garlic Noodles. Okay, bets are off, I know there's always an exception to the rule...but I haven't personally witnessed a table that doesn't have the two things I mentioned above.

As for the Crab, you basically have 3 epicurean options (They are listed in the order of my likings - from top to bottom):

1) Roasted Crab - lots of butter and cracked pepper cooked with their secret family recipe. It's Da Bomb!

2) Drunken Crab - flavor is less intense than the roasted crab but it's still yummy.

3) Crab in Tamarind Sauce - my least favorite of all (not because there's anything wrong with it, I just LOVE the Roasted Crab the best!)

Then the Garlic Noodles...just YUMMY YUMMY! Though sometimes I just wanted to focus more on the CRAB and wanted to forego the garlic noodles...believe me, it's hard to do!

I can usually finish one whole crab by myself (it's a good size crab by the way) and perhaps TWO on a good night...it's that GOOD!

The only drawback that I have personally experienced is that after eating the crab and the garlic noodles, I'll be too full to have desserts! Though, sometimes I'd go all out and ordered the Creme Brulee and some fancy tea (with Rose buds). It was a great way to end this wonderul dining experience. 

I forgot to mention that the few appetizers I have had there were all very good. The one that really stood out was their Salmon with Capers drizzled in Olive Oil served with toasted French bread slices.  Try it! It's GOOD!

And the SERVICE was friendly and attentive.

Hope you get a chance to taste it...I can't wait to go back there myself!

excerpts: the garlic noodles are to die for!!
but one thing that took a star off of my rating is the price.
This place ends up being no less then $75 a person everytime we go.
If it came out to about $40 a person, i would go once a week!!
garlic noodles.author: Arthur S.
garlic noodles.review: This place is amazing! There is absolutely nothing i can say that i didn't like here. The crab is flawless. its cooked to perfection. the garlic noodles are to die for!! but one thing that took a star off of my rating is the price. This place ends up being no less then $75 a person everytime we go. If it came out to about $40 a person, i would go once a week!!

excerpts: Best crab and garlic noodles ever----My wife
garlic noodles.author: fiyodor m.
garlic noodles.review: Best crab and garlic noodles ever----My wife and I really enjoyed the food and you must try the grilled calamari!!!

excerpts: The roasted buttery crab and garlic noodles are perfect.
I ate here last night and I already can't wait to return(despite the scary neighborhood).
garlic noodles.author: Faye S.
garlic noodles.review:
The roasted buttery crab and garlic noodles are perfect. I ate here last night and I already can't wait to return(despite the scary neighborhood). One of my favorites was the mango salad. So fresh and delicious! Their sauteed veggies were good, wine & liquor selection extensive enough and priced  right. I ordered their Latte and Lace coffee drink for dessert and it was fab. I normally hate liquor-laced coffee but this was fantastic. 
This is a great casual restaurant for a tasty dinner. Leave your designer anything at home if you plan to wait outside. A mugging might ruin your appetite.

excerpts: their garlic noodles deliver a really snappy punch so be prepared!
garlic noodles.author: Amy L.
garlic noodles.review:
Definitely one of the best Vietnamese restaurants I've been to. The roast crab was delectable.  The other selections of dishes should please just about anyone.  (Yes, there are dishes with peanuts/nuts in them so be sure to ask before ordering if you're allergic.)  Save some room for dessert too!

p.s. their garlic noodles deliver a really snappy punch so be prepared!

Times visited: 1

excerpts:
along with roasted crab, we had:
- garlic noodles (a must
garlic noodles.author: Vanae W.
garlic noodles.review:
you have to order the roasted crab! it was sooo damn good. finger-lickin' good. it was marinated with pepper and garlic.

we had a feast (it was only 2 of us). along with roasted crab, we had:
- garlic noodles (a must, it's not oily which is what i like)
- sea bass (a bit bland, but the sauce made it great)
- calamari (not the best, but pretty good)

the parking is blah, but they have valet (which is helpful)

if anyone of my friends are in town, i'll take them here and then go to the beach across the street! great way to start or end the evening.

excerpts: Roasted crab and garlic noodles to die for.
Advice from an expert crab dissector don't forget the butta.
garlic noodles.author: Marie G.
garlic noodles.review:
Paid a visit on a Saturday night and thought we were going to seated shoulder to shoulder... come to find there's an upstairs room for larger parties (10-15). Whoa! I've never seen so many crackers in one room. 

Roasted crab and garlic noodles to die for. Advice from an expert crab dissector don't forget the butta. TIME TO GET CRACKIN! 

Parking is harsh, either try to get there 30 minutes before your reservation (full bar while you wait) or valet for $9.

A more relaxed ambiance and dress code than Crustaceans.

excerpts: the garlic noodles...ummm good!
garlic noodles.author: Noah K.
garlic noodles.review:
Delicious roast crab in garlic..ummm good!
the garlic noodles...ummm good!

I am not sure what everyone else has hen they come here, but me, 
the crab sure is ummmmm good!

could be pricey, but hey it's dining in SF.

excerpts: I get the Roasted Crab, Tiger Prawns with garlic noodles, calamari, Thanh long mussels, and a side of Jasmine rice..
by then
I'm stuffed but cant pass up dessert..
Chocolate LAva cake with hazelnut gelato ice cream!!
garlic noodles.author: Shirl C.
garlic noodles.review:
When ever I want crab I have to go to Thanh Long! Um mm oh so good! I get the Roasted Crab, Tiger Prawns with garlic noodles, calamari, Thanh long mussels, and a side of Jasmine rice.. by then I'm stuffed but cant pass up dessert..  Chocolate LAva cake with hazelnut gelato ice cream!! Umm Umm good!

8/9/09 Watch out Thanh long! Jasmine Gardens Wok Roasted Crab is ummm ummmm GOOOOD! its more flavorful and affordable! for all you crab lovers its a must to try! 
JASMINE GARDEN 708 14TH STREET @ CHURCH SF

excerpts: Don't forget the garlic noodles and shrimp fried rice.
This place won't disappoint.
garlic noodles.author: B c.
garlic noodles.review: I LOVE LOVE LOVE the roasted crab here!  It's not cheap but ohhh so good!  They have a full bar and great cocktails.  Don't forget the garlic noodles and shrimp fried rice.  This place won't disappoint.

excerpts: I'm hooked on the garlic noodles.
I have never found another place that can make these noodles like Thanh Long can.
The garlic crab was just okay for me, but my boyfriend LOVED IT.
I'm more of a saucier type of crab person,
so I need alot of flavor and seasoning.
I'd come here again, but it really does make your wallet empty fast, if you catch my drift.
garlic noodles.author: Nancy Y.
garlic noodles.review: I'm hooked on the garlic noodles. I have never found another place that can make these noodles like Thanh Long can. The garlic crab was just okay for me, but my boyfriend LOVED IT. I'm more of a saucier type of crab person, so I need alot of flavor and seasoning. I'd come here again, but it really does make your wallet empty fast, if you catch my drift.

excerpts: The crab and the garlic noodles are to die for, I love this place,
If you like crab this is the place for you.
garlic noodles.author: Moises M.
garlic noodles.review: Wow is all i have to say. The crab and the garlic noodles are to die for, I love this place, If you like crab this is the place for you.

excerpts: garlic noodles were good.
garlic noodles.author: Mai G.
garlic noodles.review:
parking is harder than the wait inside the restaurant.

crabs were good but EXPENSIVE. garlic noodles were good. 

everything else...average.

too much hype for something not too great

excerpts: GARLIC NOODLES were really good!
garlic noodles.author: Jewls T.
garlic noodles.review: This was my first time going to an Asian Seafood restaurant in SF. Make reservations if you can bc the wait can be very looong. ok lets get to the food. GARLIC NOODLES were really good! I had the Drunken crab which was not seasoned well and a little dry. ROAST CRAB was seasoned much better! I think the style of seasoning on the crab wasn't as traditional vietnamese, more or less its for anyone that likes seafood. But if you're looking for a really seasoned crab in the vietnamese style go to San Jose.

excerpts: Order the garlic noodles also.
garlic noodles.author: Cynthia C.
garlic noodles.review: We were seated upstairs, I was wincing as I passed the downstairs dining room and was lead to the 'banquet room' upstairs.  Try to get a seat downstairs.  The food more than made up for my comfort level and even a little grateful, because we ordered the drunken crab, and I'd rather not eat crab in a nice dining room.  I wanted to dig in and make a mess!  Delicious!  Order the garlic noodles also.

excerpts: Of course the specialties are garlic noodles and the crab.
Haven't been in a long time.
garlic noodles.author: Josh L.
garlic noodles.review: Great place.  Crowded and well known, but still feels local.  Of course the specialties are garlic noodles and the crab.  Haven't been in a long time.

excerpts: Next time I have to try the garlic noodles they looked so good.
Staff was friendly and seated us pretty quick, best to have a reservation or you will be waiting for a long time to be seated.
It's hard to find a park on the street but they do have valet parking for $10.
This restaurant is a must try and I would come back again!
garlic noodles.author: Nichole H.
garlic noodles.review: Best Roasted Garlic crab I ever had! Would totally come back to this restaurant. Next time I have to try the garlic noodles they looked so good. Staff was friendly and seated us pretty quick, best to have a reservation or you will be waiting for a long time to be seated. It's hard to find a park on the street but they do have valet parking for $10. This restaurant is a must try and I would come back again!

excerpts: Great portions - the garlic noodles I've had at Crustacean come in a smaller bowl.
Try the roast crab and garlic noodles.
You won't be disappointed!
garlic noodles.author: Reid Y.
garlic noodles.review:
The An Family owns three of these seafood beauties in SF - The Crustacean, La Vie, and Thanh Long.  In my opinion, this one is the best.

1) A lively atmosphere - Crustacean is too quiet and dark and La Vie is too small.
2) Great portions - the garlic noodles I've had at Crustacean come in a smaller bowl.
3) Easier parking - you're pretty much guaranteed to valet if you go to any of the other restaurants, but you can find parking around the Sunset area when you come here.

Anyway, I think if you've found this review, 300+ reviews might be too much to read.  So what are you waiting for?  Try the roast crab and garlic noodles.  You won't be disappointed!

excerpts: Had the lemongrass chicken and garlic noodles.
Both were very good.
Shared the two dishes between a friend and myself.
Plenty of food for a light dinner.
Maybe not the best choice for right before a plane ride.
Garlic!!!
(Totally worth it)
garlic noodles.author: Sarah C.
garlic noodles.review: Yum! Had the lemongrass chicken and garlic noodles. Both were very good. Shared the two dishes between a friend and myself.  Plenty of food for a light dinner. Maybe not the best choice for right before a plane ride. Garlic!!! (Totally worth it)

excerpts: REJOICE - Thanh Long's garlic noodles pack quite the hard punch of garlic to your taste buds.
The consistency is like thicker ramen, and the flavor that permeates through the noodles is ROASTED GARLIC GOODNESS.
garlic noodles.author: Maian T.
garlic noodles.review:
Garlic lovers REJOICE - Thanh Long's garlic noodles pack quite the hard punch of garlic to your taste buds. The consistency is like thicker ramen, and the flavor that permeates through the noodles is ROASTED GARLIC GOODNESS. Mushy, pungent, noodle love at first bite. 

The only other thing we ordered was the roasted crab and chocolate cake. I must say the butter in the roasted crab is too heavy for my taste, because I'm used to my Vietnamese mom's way of prepping crab plain with lime, salt and pepper dipping sauce. The next time I come I will definitely get the crab steamed with chardonnay, sake, mirin, and green onions instead! The chocolate cake is good but the generous scoop of vanilla gelato made it fantastic. 

I would suggest coming here early, right at 4:30 as we did because our service was friendly, speedy, and attentive. I hear they get super packed starting at 6.

excerpts: This is the place to go for whole roast crab and garlic noodles - their prawns aren't bad either (the hubby hates crab, so when we go, he orders prawns and he says they're good...
I often dream of the garlic noodles because they are so delicious (anybody know the secret to the recipe?
I want in!!!)
garlic noodles.author: Amy T.
garlic noodles.review:
This is the place to go for whole roast crab and garlic noodles - their prawns aren't bad either (the hubby hates crab, so when we go, he orders prawns and he says they're good...I haven't actually tried them myself).

It's always packed with people and I've never eaten anything other than the crab and noodles, but it is SO GOOD and while it is expensive, I think it's worth it for a splurge every once in a while....

I often dream of the garlic noodles because they are so delicious (anybody know the secret to the recipe? I want in!!!)

excerpts: You can't go wrong with the roast crab and garlic noodles.
Brought the kids last couple of times and they tore it up.
garlic noodles.author: Sangorama s.
garlic noodles.review:
Date: June 2007 (last time)
Who: 2 adults, 2 kids
Bill: ~$100

I eat here every single visit to the Bay Area. You can't go wrong with the roast crab and garlic noodles. Brought the kids last couple of times and they tore it up. We add a bowl of jasmine rice usually b/c it mellows out the mouth a bit.

I crack crabs like a mofo so I can typically keep the wife's plate full with crab while taking some bites myself but was tough to keep all 3 fed. We usually order 2 crabs and ask they wait on bringing the second out until we're 3/4 done with the first. that way we have hot crab the whole meal. You don't really want to see what happens when the dish cools down.

Don't forget dessert. Home made orange and lemon sorbet made and put back in the original shell. Delicious - the orange has some cream in there that makes it so yummy. Fried pineapple and bananas - you can't' go wrong. The flavored vodkas are kinda neat too.

One of the few places you can see people of every race/color/age enjoying a meal.

excerpts: Garlic Noodles are the best but not good if you take them home.
Roasted Crab is amazing!
Portion is good for two people thought.
garlic noodles.author: Cb M.
garlic noodles.review:
Great place to go to for a date or dinner with friends...even family dinner (small family) because its quite pricey.

Garlic Noodles are the best but not good if you take them home. Roasted Crab is amazing! Portion is good for two people thought. 
Shaken Beef is always my favorite thing there. Ambience is nice. Bar is too expensive but have some exotic martini's.

excerpts: Only order the garlic noodles if you are sharing as they are so rich.
Speaking of rich, its kind of a splurge, great for a date( i have had a few there).. but you will get what of pay for!!
garlic noodles.author: Cecilia M.
garlic noodles.review:
Food is amazing, bottom line! Although one star off for the roast crab which is what they are famous for.. BUT.. Please order the drunken crab. The roasted crab is dry & salty. The drunken crab is simmered w wine sake brandy green onions and garlic, mmmmm! Only order the garlic noodles if you are sharing as they are so rich. Speaking of rich, its kind of a splurge, great for a date( i have had a few there).. but you will get what of pay for!! The service is top notch, we always feel welcome & apprieciated :)

My favorite things to order:
Drunken crab (duh)
Shaken beef is my very favorite!
Creme brûlée (different flavors)
Wine list is pretty decent 
Cocktail w/ mango & coconut rum
(drink 4 taste but no buzz included)

I can't stress this enough..
the shaken beef w/ a side of rice

excerpts: In that time, I've decided that the Tamarind Crab / Garlic Noodles combination is pretty much damn near a perfect night out.
Enjoy.
garlic noodles.author: Chris M.
garlic noodles.review:
Over the years I've probably made the trek out to Thanh Long about 8 times or so... In that time, I've decided that the Tamarind Crab / Garlic Noodles combination is pretty much damn near a perfect night out.
Enjoy.

excerpts: Garlic Crab and Garlic Noodles are a MUST!
Their Vietnamese Seafood Soup, in a light sweet broth is WONDERFUL too!
Appetizers have been delicious..
I don;t
think I've had anything here
I didn;t like!
Can be a bit pricey but so worth it.
If you are not a garlic fan, do not go here.
garlic noodles.author: Christine C.
garlic noodles.review:
This place is awesome! The heading says reservations required but I have just walked in before. Depending on the time, you may have to wait  a little while but I've always gotten seated. They make some delicious fruit infused vodka that is wonderful to sip on while waiting at their bar. The wait area is small and can get quite crowded. Garlic Crab and Garlic Noodles are a MUST! Their Vietnamese Seafood Soup, in a light sweet broth is WONDERFUL too! Appetizers have been delicious.. I don;t think I've had anything here I didn;t like! Can be a bit pricey but so worth it. If you are not a garlic fan, do not go here. Garlic is a staple.. and it is fabulous!

6/9/07: One update.. last time I was here I ordered the Shrimp Toast for an appetizer. It wasn't bad but I wouldn;t get it again. I just wasn;t thrilled with it..hmmmm, maybe too much breading, not enough shrimp?

excerpts: The garlic noodles (as always) are killer.
I was quite full after eating half of them, but they were so delicious that they just magically jumped into my mouth until they were all gone.
garlic noodles.author: Maren P.
garlic noodles.review: Finally made it over to Thanh Long after being a loyal Crustacean visitor for a while. Crustacean is walking distance for me, so the trek over to the Sunset wasn't ideal, but it was well worth it. The food is amazing and the atmosphere is comfortable and relaxed. No wait at all for a table for 2. The garlic noodles (as always) are killer. I was quite full after eating half of them, but they were so delicious that they just magically jumped into my mouth until they were all gone. Steamed Sea Bass was light and buttery with a delicious citrus sauce. Roasted crab was luscious as usual. Definitely worth the drive (and quest for parking although they do offer valet) if you want a more casual atmosphere.

excerpts:
Garlic Noodles - salty and garlic goodness
3)
garlic noodles.author: Angela T.
garlic noodles.review:
MY FAVORITE CRAB PLACE EVER!! ok, ok it's a bit pricey, but its worth it! the food here is insane - order as follows:

1) Garlic Roasted Crab - huge crab in a fountain of garlickey butter...mmMmMMmMMm
2) Garlic Noodles - salty and garlic goodness
3) Shaken Beef - the most TENDER, delicious beef you'll get with a bunch of yummy tidbits on the side (like the potatoes and cherry tomatoes)
4) Cream Cheese Crab Puffs - holy moly, cheesey crabby melt in your mouth heavenly dream in a crispy shell. only gripe i got about this, is that they only give you 6 pieces when i can eat like 25!! 

I usually hate eating crab in public bc its so messy, but here, I'll suck my freaking fingers dry. I swear to it.

excerpts: Make sure you order the garlic noodles as well... i can get the whole plate to myself!
garlic noodles.author: Brian P.
garlic noodles.review:
OMG HOW MUCH I MISS YOU!!! The roasted crab is seriously heavenly.. drenched in butter and garlic.. the cute little bibs! make sure you wear it.. or else you'll make a mess. Make sure you order the garlic noodles as well... i can get the whole plate to myself! 

If thanh longs prices were as reasonable as PPQ i would be come here to eat more often.. pretty pricey.. and you can't really come here as a group, more of a romantic date kind of place. They do have valet parking available which is a plus because it's hard to find parking here!

excerpts:
Garlic noodles
Garlic noodles
Garlic noodles
Garlic noodles
Best Garlic Noodles that i've had in San Francisco so far.
The other must order is fried calamari then the crab.
garlic noodles.author: Eric Y.
garlic noodles.review:
Garlic noodles
Garlic noodles
Garlic noodles
Garlic noodles
x10000000000000000000000000

Best Garlic Noodles that i've had in San Francisco so far. The other must order is fried calamari then the crab. it's all about the crab when you come here.

the place isn't a formal restaurant as most people would think it is. you wouldn't feel like a alien when you walk in with jeans and a t-shirt. they serve everyone. The main problem to this place is that it is hard to find parking @ night. very hard. 

for dessert, they have fried ice cream which is also very delicious. 
definitely a place to go if you want some seafood (crab) and you want to impress your girl

excerpts: By far my favorite place to eat garlic roasted crab and the garlic noodles are my favorites.
Give this place a try and you will not be dissapointed.
garlic noodles.author: Nancy F.
garlic noodles.review: By far my favorite place to eat garlic roasted crab and the garlic noodles are my favorites. Give this place a try and you will not be dissapointed.

excerpts: The garlic noodles are simple, delightful, and a perfect pairing for any of the dishes
garlic noodles.author: Jerome, Jerome T.
garlic noodles.review:
Ok, so here is the down-low on this place:

Soft shell crab was enh - not so great, just decent

----------------

The garlic noodles are simple, delightful, and a perfect pairing for any of the dishes 

The roast crab is one of the most memorable dishes

Beyond the two above dishes, there really isn't a reason to go to this place except for the drinks

Havanah Cafe dessert drink is killer good - almost like drinking with Castro and Ho Chi Minh on summer's night

the bibs are classic, but not for me ...

excerpts: Make sure to get an order of garlic noodles - but remember it comes with every crab as well.
garlic noodles.author: Nicholas H.
garlic noodles.review: One of the best places in San Francisco for crab! It is at the end of Judah, by Java Beach. Make sure to get an order of garlic noodles - but remember it comes with every crab as well. The Salt and Pepper calamari rocks! Valet park and save yourself the headache.  It is a little pricey so make sure someone else is paying.

excerpts: We also had the garlic noodles as they were highly recommended - simple, garlicky, and complemented the crab perfectly in a strange unexpected duet.
garlic noodles.author: david l.
garlic noodles.review: Oh crabbie crabbie crabs!  So so tasty, roasted with salt, pepper, and swimming in a vat of clarified butter.  A whole dining room full of people sucking on shells for good reason.  We also had the garlic noodles as they were highly recommended - simple, garlicky, and complemented the crab perfectly in a strange unexpected duet.  The "Shaken Beef" was super tender and flavorful, but a little too sweet for my taste.  Salt * pepper calamari was perfect with a light batter coating and quick fry with bell pepper and scallion slices.  Crab ravioli was pretty much the age old bastardized crab rangoon, so not worth the calories there.  Fried ice cream was sent back b/c the shell was undercooked and the ice cream half melted; happily replaced with the choco lava cake.

excerpts: Garlic Noodles.
I'm sure I've tried some of the appetizers but all I can remember is crab and garlic noodles.
I do remember the appetizers being good though.
I wouldn't give this place five stars because of how difficult parking can be (not their fault) and the one time I went there
and I remember having just an okay experience because the crab was sorta cold.
Other than that, bring on those noodles.
garlic noodles.author: Chris C.
garlic noodles.review:
Garlic Noodles.  Crab.

I've been to Crustacian.  I'd still rather come here for the same thing.  First of all, it's just closer for me since I'm in the Sunset but also because I won't have to don a tie to get in.  I don't mind the family loud atmosphere.  I'm there for the good eats.

I'm sure I've tried some of the appetizers but all I can remember is crab and garlic noodles.  I do remember the appetizers being good though.  I wouldn't give this place five stars because of how difficult parking can be (not their fault) and the one time I went there and I remember having just an okay experience because the crab was sorta cold.  Other than that, bring on those noodles.

excerpts: Yes, I ordered the garlic noodles.
They were really quite good, but $34.95 plus $9.50 good?
I've also decided I've figured out how to make the garlic noodles at home.
The people at the table next to me said "Good luck.
We've been trying for years.
garlic noodles.author: Gordon E.
garlic noodles.review:
Yes, I ordered the roast crab.  Yes, I ordered the garlic noodles.  They were really quite good, but $34.95 plus $9.50 good?  Not so sure.

My friends went against advice and ordered the red snapper, which turned out to be better than my crab, and an eggplant dish which was good, not great.

The drinks from the bar were astoundingly good.  We even tipped the bartender $10 on the way out.  

I've also decided I've figured out how to make the garlic noodles at home.  The people at the table next to me said "Good luck.  We've been trying for years."

excerpts: Anyhow, we get seated and we ordered three appetizers, three crabs, and two garlic noodles.
We got the mussels, a veggie dish, and i forgot the third appetizer, but they were all pretty good.
Small portions though.
Then came the crabs.
We got the regular roasted one and two others ( i can't remember which ones).
We all agreed that the regular roasted one was the best.
garlic noodles.author: Seri T.
garlic noodles.review:
We waited about 45 mins to get a table for 6 on a friday night. We had made reservations and one of us was there at the time, but they wouldn't save the table until all of us got there. Fair enough. We ended up going to a bar a block down to kill some time. Forgot what they were called, but they had cheap drinks even with premium vodka! $19 for 2 greyhound w/ mandarin, 2 vodka tonic w/ stoli, and one long island. 

Anyhow, we get seated and we ordered three appetizers, three crabs, and two garlic noodles. We got the mussels, a veggie dish, and i forgot the third appetizer, but they were all pretty good. Small portions though. Then came the crabs. We got the regular roasted one and two others ( i can't remember which ones). We all agreed that the regular roasted one was the best. We also all agreed that you could get better ones for cheaper at other places.

The noodles were super garlic-y and good, but I don't see why there's so much hype about them. We also had a bottle of riesling ($25?), which was very good. 

So... overall, the crabs were good, the noodles were good, but they weren't THAT good considering the price. The bill came to about $45/person including tip.

excerpts: If i were an inmate on death row and was asked what would I like for my last meal the answer would be..... "DRUNKEN CRAB w/a side of Garlic noodles" would be it.
After that meal they could pop me with as many lethal injections as they wish as i would be overwhelmed with the Ecstasy which is a crab from this place to notice.
garlic noodles.author: Alfredo N.
garlic noodles.review:
This HANDS DOWN THE BEST PLACE FOR CRAB in the city. My GF likes to come here often and i don't complain. 

If i were an inmate on death row and was asked what would I like for my last meal the answer would be..... "DRUNKEN CRAB w/a side of Garlic noodles" would be it. After that meal they could pop me with as many lethal injections as they wish as i would be overwhelmed with the Ecstasy which is a crab from this place to notice.

excerpts: With no expectation whatsoever, we ordered exactly as we were told, "mango salad, garlic noodles, and a roasted crab, please."
The mango salad came out first.
I didn't know what to expect, I've never actually had mango in my salad.
But boy was it amazing!
(It might actually be the best salad I've ever had!)
Immediately following were the garlic noodles.
I must admit, I wasn't exactly thrilled to see a slab of green noodles, but it was surprisingly quite tasty.
It definitely complemented the roasted crab-which by far was the best dish there!
Everything about the meal was perfect!
garlic noodles.author: Siu L.
garlic noodles.review:
I absolutely love, love, love this place.  I can still remember my first time at Thanh Long.  With no expectation whatsoever, we ordered exactly as we were told, "mango salad, garlic noodles, and a roasted crab, please."  The mango salad came out first.  I didn't know what to expect, I've never actually had mango in my salad.  But boy was it amazing!  (It might actually be the best salad I've ever had!)  Immediately following were the garlic noodles.  I must admit, I wasn't exactly thrilled to see a slab of green noodles, but it was surprisingly quite tasty.  It definitely complemented the roasted crab-which by far was the best dish there!  Everything about the meal was perfect!  Nice decor, good customer service, and most importantly, delicious food!  

SIDE NOTE:  I wouldn't recommend having a first date here because you really have to get hands-on with the crab.  Then there's the garlic breath from the noodles.  I'm not sure that'll be the best first impression.  At least not for the girls.  haha...

excerpts: The garlic noodles weren't that great, I don't get the hype over them.
Not very good service either.
Overeall, way overpriced meal!
garlic noodles.author: Krystal N.
garlic noodles.review:
I heard that they wear traditional Vietnamese clothes here, so I expected a cool, hip, clean place. Alas...I was wrong. Me and my boyfriend came here and our table was so cramped in a corner. They put a bib type thing on you because you're most likely get to get down and dirty while eating here. The place itself is actually kind of dirty..

The food was just okay. We got a crab each! Yes...one crab for one person! The garlic noodles weren't that great, I don't get the hype over them. Not very good service either. Overeall, way overpriced meal!

excerpts: The heck with it, go for the bucket kicker all together and order the garlic noodles too b/c
garlic noodles.author: Jeannie C.
garlic noodles.review:
The roast crab is artery clogging good...literally.  Believe it when at the end of your meal you see a nice solid pool of congealed buttery goodness on your plate.  The heck with it, go for the bucket kicker all together and order the garlic noodles too b/c it's really that good.

$40 for one crab is pretty pricey but it's pretty filling and good enough for 2 along w/ the noodles.

excerpts: For the four of us, we ordered rice rolls, 2 roasted crab, prawns on garlic noodles and shaken beef.
The Shaken Beef was tender, with perfect pieces of roasted potatoes and caramelized onion on a bed of lettuce and cherry tomatoes.
The prawns on garlic noodles - heavenly.
Four pieces of succulent roasted prawns on their signature garlic noodles, which are strangely addicting (but give you kicking breath afterward).
garlic noodles.author: Deb I.
garlic noodles.review:
We were starving after a full day of sun and wine. We glanced quickly at the menu and decided to order everything the restaurant was famous for. For the four of us, we ordered rice rolls, 2 roasted crab, prawns on garlic noodles and shaken beef.

The rice rolls were teeny-tiny and not particularly great. 

The Shaken Beef was tender, with perfect pieces of roasted potatoes and caramelized onion on a bed of lettuce and cherry tomatoes. It tasted so good we even ate the wilted bed of lettuce so we could get the last drops of beef juice.

The crab was ok - given that this is their signature dish, I have to say that I expected more. The roasted crab is basically a very large crab swimming in oil, salt and pepper. 

The prawns on garlic noodles - heavenly. Four pieces of succulent roasted prawns on their signature garlic noodles, which are strangely addicting (but give you kicking breath afterward).

Then we got the bill. The crab and prawns are listed as "market" price and in our hunger, we forgot to ask what the market price was. We were charged $72 for two crabs and $32 for the prawns. The price for the crabs seemed reasonable given the size of the crabs (one was perfect for two people), but the prawns - 4 prawns for $32?? Still, the prawns WERE awfully good....

The one other thing to note is that Thanh Long is deeeeep in the Sunset district. Pretty far to go, especially when Crustacean is much more central.

excerpts: Shaken beef was very good but the garlic noodles was NO Where near crustaceans.
garlic noodles.author: Cynthia S.
garlic noodles.review:
I came here with my mom thinking crustaceans was so good that this place should be good too.  Nah the food is NOT up to par at all.  Shaken beef was very good but the garlic noodles was NO Where near crustaceans.  

The service was decent but definitely not superb but at least the atmosphere is much more casual compared to crustacean's and I much prefer a more relaxed atmosphere when I need to go through some shells.

excerpts: You must get the garlic noodles and/or garlic rice.
Heck, get them both.
The crab is very fresh, made perfectly.
Don't bother looking for parking--either take the muni or pay for the valet or you'll drive around and around in circles.
garlic noodles.author: Joyce L.
garlic noodles.review:
Ok so this place is expensive and it's freaking almost to Hawaii, BUT it is so yummy and so worth the drive. You must get the garlic noodles and/or garlic rice. Heck, get them both. The crab is very fresh, made perfectly. 
Don't bother looking for parking--either take the muni or pay for the valet or you'll drive around and around in circles.

excerpts: Although I always want to try everything, I am a creature of habit and always order one of three things complimented with their top secret and wonderful garlic noodles.
Usually it's the roasted or drunken dungeness crab or
garlic noodles.author: Norm P.
garlic noodles.review:
I've been coming here every couple years since I was a kid.  And even now I can only go here once in a blue moon.  Prices are skyrocket high...   but well worth it...  Last time I went there, the market prices for dungeness was around $35, but I'm sure they're up even more now.  I don't want to discourage anyone cause of the price, because it's money well worth spent.  It's not an everyday place but a special occasion place that I wouldn't want to tire out my taste buds.

There's an extensive menu of Vietnamese cuisine, but the stand outs for me at least are the crab.  Although I always want to try everything, I am a creature of habit and always order one of three things complimented with their top secret and wonderful garlic noodles.  Usually it's the roasted or drunken dungeness crab or if I don't feel like going to work and getting messy, the tiger prawns.   

The spices and sauces used are like the top secret ingredients of the An Family, and trying to decipher the taste in proportions and identifiying the 'secret' is near impossible.  I can taste the salt, pepper, butter and a whole lot of garlic, but what put's it over the top, I don't know...  It'll forever be a mystery to me, but a truly delicious one...

excerpts: GARLIC NOODLES.
they were good.
except i think in the future, i will order the noodles after getting the crab.
b/c you dig into the crab and the noodles get cold.
my one thing, i thought the noodles were alil bit too sweet.
garlic noodles.author: cat k.
garlic noodles.review:
YUMMY goodness.
alil bit pricey. but the food was yum.

this was our first time there on the suggestion of some friends.

got the sea bass, which was nicely done, the ginger sauce lightened up the heavy oily fish quite well.

the ROAST CRAB. o, it was delicious. nice and messy. i love being able to get down into it.

GARLIC NOODLES. they were good. except i think in the future, i will order the noodles after getting the crab. b/c you dig into the crab and the noodles get cold. my one thing, i thought the noodles were alil bit too sweet. but still good.

going to try a slightly cheaper place...before coming back. this new discovery is definately going to create a dent in my wallet.

excerpts: Thanh Long is still the best at roasted crab and garlic noodles.
The sauteed veggies were a hit at our table as well.
After 15 years of coming here, I can't say that I have ever seen anyone order anything else in this place.
Early dinners are optimal time to go.
garlic noodles.author: RaShonda J.
garlic noodles.review:
Thanh Long is still the best at roasted crab and garlic noodles. The sauteed veggies were a hit at our table as well. After 15 years of coming here, I can't say that I have ever seen anyone order anything else in this place. Early dinners are optimal time to go. Weekends are standing-room only.

The bar offers a wide variety of delicious drinks and some special house blends as well.  Downside is parking is a beast in this area so close to the beach. Valet is an option for $10 bucks.

excerpts: Of course we ordered the roast crab and the garlic noodles but the crab was very small and must have been quite fresh a few days earlier.
That crab which most restaurants would hesitate to charge more than $20 for was $42 dollars at Than Long.
A lychee martini for $11.50 was served in a small glass and was all lychee but very little vodka.
All in all, my girlfriend and I felt like we had been "taken".
For a ride that is.
garlic noodles.author: Steven A.
garlic noodles.review: Than Long is a classic case of a restaurant "resting on its laurels". I ate there regularly in the 80's and 90's and had not been there since the remodel. Now the prices have tripled and the quality of the food is mediocre at best. Of course we ordered the roast crab and the garlic noodles but the crab was very small and must have been quite fresh a few days earlier. That crab which most restaurants would hesitate to charge more than $20 for was $42 dollars at Than Long.  A lychee martini for $11.50 was served in a small glass and was all lychee but very little vodka. All in all, my girlfriend and I felt like we had been "taken". For a ride that is.

excerpts: Had the recommended Roasted Crab and side of Garlic Noodles.
It was amazing and couldn't stop licking my fingers.
garlic noodles.author: Travis H.
garlic noodles.review: This is now a must visit every time I'm in town.  Had the recommended Roasted Crab and side of Garlic Noodles.  It was amazing and couldn't stop licking my fingers.

excerpts: I very much enjoyed the drunken crab and garlic noodles.
I've had better
but it was very tasty.
Will have to make it back to try something different next time.
garlic noodles.author: Warren W.
garlic noodles.review: Had dined at the Crustacean in BH and wanted to try the original. I very much enjoyed the drunken crab and garlic noodles. I've had better but it was very tasty. Will have to make it back to try something different next time.

excerpts: Would also recommend ordering the garlic noodles.
garlic noodles.author: Greg B.
garlic noodles.review: Fantastic dungeness crab here! My woman introduced me to this place a few months back; it's definitely a hidden treasure. Would also recommend ordering the garlic noodles.

excerpts: Next, roast crab and garlic noodles.
garlic noodles.author: Kimberly-Alexis N.
garlic noodles.review:
Love, love, love this place...  I eat here once a month, need I say more?! :P  The food is fantastic!  Thanh Long Mussels to start with freshly toasted baguette crostini.  Next, roast crab and garlic noodles.  Lastly, fried bananas with choice of ice cream (usually vanilla).  

Oh, BTW...  Did I mention that this is one of my favorite restaurants?!

excerpts: I always get roasted crab & garlic noodles.
Cannot believe the crab was $43.00 per crab.
I'm going to find a new place to get roasted crab.
Way over priced and on a side not, the restroom needs to be remolded.
Dark, poor lighting, the counter is always wet because the faucet is too short, just not clean as you would expect for such a high price restaurant.
garlic noodles.author: Aniyah M.
garlic noodles.review: I have been going to Thanh Long for years. I always get roasted crab & garlic noodles.  Cannot believe the crab was $43.00 per crab. I'm going to find a new place to get roasted crab. Way over priced and on a side not, the restroom needs to be remolded. Dark, poor lighting, the counter is always wet because the faucet is too short, just not clean as you would expect for such a high price restaurant.

excerpts: i would highly  recommended Garlic Noodles and Roasted Crab but prepare to pay $$$.
garlic noodles.author: Sasitorn O.
garlic noodles.review:
I cerebrated my HBD here with my bf and friends,the food was awesome.
 i would highly  recommended Garlic Noodles and Roasted Crab but prepare to pay $$$.

excerpts: Order the garlic noodles & you'll be coming back for more.
garlic noodles.author: Joey S.
garlic noodles.review: The absolute best roasted dungeness crab anywhere! Order the garlic noodles & you'll be coming back for more.

excerpts:
Garlic noodles
Garlic roasted dungeness crab
Cold beer

Perfection....
garlic noodles.author: Michael W.
garlic noodles.review:
Garlic noodles
Garlic roasted dungeness crab
Cold beer

Perfection....

excerpts: The Crab is a must-have, accompanied with a heaping plate of garlic noodles.
But have you tried the Sea Bass?
Fresh, Flaky, buttery goodness and doesnt taste fishy at all.
garlic noodles.author: Duane R.
garlic noodles.review: Yea Yea Yea... The Crab is a must-have, accompanied with a heaping plate of garlic noodles. But have you tried the Sea Bass? Fresh, Flaky, buttery goodness and doesnt taste fishy at all.

excerpts: The best Vietnamese Roast Crab & Garlic Noodles in town.
Sounds like a small niche?
Well, this place compares very well against Crustaceans on California St. and is WAY better than PPQ on Clement.
Great spot for a date - super yum.
garlic noodles.author: insipidphishie P.
garlic noodles.review:
A little out of the way, but man once you get there...

The best Vietnamese Roast Crab & Garlic Noodles in town. Sounds like a small niche? Well, this place compares very well against Crustaceans on California St. and is WAY better than PPQ on Clement. Great spot for a date - super yum.

excerpts: get the drunken crab and garlic noodles, nothing else is good
garlic noodles.author: Sophia Y.
garlic noodles.review:
Expensive but worth it.

get the drunken crab and garlic noodles, nothing else is good

excerpts: The secret recipe garlic crab is out of this world and the garlic noodles are just as spectacular.
Parking is a challenge, take advantage of the valet.
The food and service are spectacular, this is a must visit in the city.
garlic noodles.author: Jonathon J.
garlic noodles.review: Oh my!  If you like garlic and crab, this is the place for you.  The secret recipe garlic crab is out of this world and the garlic noodles are just as spectacular. Parking is a challenge, take advantage of the valet.  The food and service are spectacular, this is a must visit in the city.

excerpts:
The memory of the lovely, chewy garlic noodles and crackling crab has long staying power - five years ago was the first time, thought about it all the time, and then finally again a couple weeks ago.  

This second time I took my mom there - we had a great time, split a house crab and plate of garlic noodles.
garlic noodles.author: FoodieGal I.
garlic noodles.review:
The memory of the lovely, chewy garlic noodles and crackling crab has long staying power - five years ago was the first time, thought about it all the time, and then finally again a couple weeks ago.  

Why did it take me so long to go back?  Well, it's pricey and way out there.  This second time I took my mom there - we had a great time, split a house crab and plate of garlic noodles.  

Good for special occasions.

Definitely yes to reservations and hit up the valet.  I was extremely lucky to park across the street but in the future, I'll circle once and then take the valet.  No need to upset the stomach prior to eating.

excerpts: The garlic noodles was $9.50 which I really liked.
The flavor was strong, better than the garlic noodle at PPQ's.
garlic noodles.author: Jboogie L.
garlic noodles.review:
We came here late at night upon my friend's arrival from NYC wanting to eat "CRABS".  We wanted to go to PPQ Dungeoness but it was closed that evening for CNY.  I suggested Thanh Long because I have yet to still eat here.  The food service was quick. It was last call for our table.  The Roasted crab was $36 which was small compared to the crab served at PPQ.  The garlic noodles was $9.50 which I really liked.  The flavor was strong, better than the garlic noodle at PPQ's.  The seabass claypot was really good too.  

If you are looking for a reasonable meal, check out PPQ first on Clement and 24th.  The crab here was too small and not as good tasting as PPQ's.

excerpts: Roast Crab and garlic noodles are the best.
Sure, Crustacean (same family of restaurants) serve the same food, but Thanh Long is more casual.
I've never strayed from the crab and garlic noodles, so not sure how the other food is.
It would be foolish to go and NOT order crab and garlic noodles!
garlic noodles.author: Jennifer K.
garlic noodles.review:
Roast Crab and garlic noodles are the best.  Sure, Crustacean (same family of restaurants) serve the same food, but Thanh Long is more casual.  I want to eat my crab while wearing jeans and a t shirt!

I've never strayed from the crab and garlic noodles, so not sure how the other food is.  

It would be foolish to go and NOT order crab and garlic noodles!

excerpts: my friend and i shared the the colossal royal tiger prawns over the bed of garlic noodles, mmm mmm mmm!!!
garlic noodles.author: Goldie J.
garlic noodles.review:
my friend and i shared the the colossal royal tiger prawns over the bed of garlic noodles, mmm mmm mmm!!!  and the roast crab bathed in garlic and buttah.  how do you say "delicious!" in vietnamese?  at first i didn't think it would feed two people, but the claws had a lot of meat.  i couldn't understand how my friends hands were so clean when mine were so very dirty.  it was a lot of work, but definitely worth it.  

i took an asian seafood cooking class a couple years ago where the instructor gave us the garlic noodle recipe for what he called 'that overpriced crab place."  i have yet to try it, but i must do it soon!

the meal ended with the fried pineapple a la mode.  we chose the tahitian vanilla gelato for the ice cream.  this was fantasic, although it was very small with a tiny piece of pineapple.  my friend and i just stared at it, and then looked at each other, then looked back on the pineapple before we busted out laughing...  overall, a great meal!!

excerpts: Tamarind Crab and Garlic noodles...
this is soooo freakin' good....
I make this place a special evening for a small group of friends...
It definitely satisfies your crab "fix" for months...
I love it...
nothing like it...
They pour heavy on the drinks....

Did I say to try the Tamarind Crab and Garlic Noodles

Appetizer:

Did I say to try the Tamarind Crab and Garlic Noodles

Appetizer:
garlic noodles.author: Florio M.
garlic noodles.review:
Tamarind Crab and Garlic noodles... this is soooo freakin' good....
I make this place a special evening for a small group of friends...
It definitely satisfies your crab "fix" for months...
I love it... nothing like it...
They pour heavy on the drinks.... I love it

some things to recommend:
Food: Did I say to try the Tamarind Crab and Garlic Noodles

Appetizer: The salt n' peppa calamari

Drinks:  I prefer a Saphire and Tonic, but they offer a special 
Lychee Martini that is a house special blend... Offer one to the ladies... 

Dessert: you can bring your own cake....

enough said...

excerpts: The seasoning on the roasted crab is perfect and it's well complemented with a side of garlic noodles.
garlic noodles.author: Joel A.
garlic noodles.review:
I like crab, but I have to admit that I don't eat it very much. I'm not that skilled in cracking crab legs. It seems like a lot of work for a little bit of meat. When we came here for a co-worker's going away party, I decided to be a good sport and put on a bib. I was not disappointed! Both the roasted crab and the drunken crab were delicious. The seasoning on the roasted crab is perfect and it's well complemented with a side of garlic noodles.

If you're not into the seafood so much, there's this incredible beef dish on the menu. (I'm not sure what the name of it is since someone else ordered for the table.) It had chunks of tender beef and deep fried potatoes. A must!

The only other thing about this restaurant is that it's in the outer sunset. Include some extra time to find parking or take public transportation. (The N Judah runs right in front of the place.)

excerpts: First time I visited, I didn't even look at the menu and ordered garlic noodles, roasted crab and said thank you.
I have heard so much from Yelp about this place, I had to stop by when I had the opportunity.
It is a bit out of the way, but boy this was definitely worth it!
My crab went "snap" "crackle" and "pop", and a big chunk of crab meat came out and went right o my salivating mouth.
Hmmmm..... good.
Their garlic noodle was simply delicious.
Simple, yet perfectly seasoned
, oh sooooo good.
garlic noodles.author: YJ H.
garlic noodles.review:
First time I visited, I didn't even look at the menu and ordered garlic noodles, roasted crab and said thank you.  I have heard so much from Yelp about this place, I had to stop by when I had the opportunity.  It is a bit out of the way, but boy this was definitely worth it!  My crab went "snap" "crackle" and "pop", and a big chunk of crab meat came out and went right o my salivating mouth.   Hmmmm..... good.  Their garlic noodle was simply delicious.  Simple, yet perfectly seasoned, oh sooooo good.  One of my nephew ate 2 plates of their mussel appetizer, but I did get a chance to taste one, and that was also delicious.

Overall, excellent place, albeit little pricey.  Highly recommended.

Bon Appetit

excerpts: Their garlic noodles are a carb lovers dream.
I could eat them for days.
Their crab was pricey, but worth it.
I had a drink called Asian passion or something to that extent
it was a martini that tasted like plum juice, very good.
It made me want to drink more, but I had to save room for the food.
garlic noodles.author: Myrel F.
garlic noodles.review:
Their garlic noodles are a carb lovers dream. I could eat them for days. Their crab was pricey, but worth it.  I had a drink called Asian passion or something to that extent it was a martini that tasted like plum juice, very good. It made me want to drink more, but I had to save room for the food. I also recommend when going here that you try their steamed vegetables. 

I've never been to the Crustacean in the city, city, but I heard that this location is a lot better because there's more parking and less people.

excerpts: The roasted crab and the garlic noodles are to die for.
The service was pretty good too.
The only negative thing was he parking.
However, that won't keep me from going back :P
garlic noodles.author: Ghiz S.
garlic noodles.review:
This place is a must go if you are in San Francisco. The roasted crab and the garlic noodles are to die for. The service was pretty good too. 
 The only negative thing was he parking. However, that won't keep me from going back :P

excerpts: We had an awesome roast crab feast with oodles of garlic noodles and delicious greens!
The mussels and calamari appetizers were great as well.
YUM to the 10th power!
garlic noodles.author: Jenny H.
garlic noodles.review:
The OG location will always be better! Maybe the 'mom' hangs out here more? hehe. 

Celebrated my '21st' birthday here with my family and I couldn't be more satisfied. We had an awesome roast crab feast with oodles of garlic noodles and delicious greens! The mussels and calamari appetizers were great as well. YUM to the 10th power! Our wonderful server was the best and was always available to our needs. 

Thanks to the valet dudes for making parking easier especially on a Friday night...it's $10 but it's hassle-free.

excerpts: And the crab with garlic noodles...
garlic noodles.author: Jiajia C.
garlic noodles.review:
Hmmmm.  People call this place rich men's PPQ.  Since I was taken here for a work function, I can't really factor  "value" into this review.  The food, however, was purely 5 stars.

The various appetizers, such as fried calamari, grilled mussels, and even soups, as we sampled two different kinds: The tamarind based shrimp soup and the velvety crab egg drop soup, were all very delicious.  And the crab with garlic noodles...  Yumo speechless.  

Wrapping up with fried banana and ice cream and a cup of espresso...  It was absolutely the most decadent dinner I have had since...  well my steak dinner a week ago.  Yikes.  Salad and water from now on.

excerpts: GARLIC NOODLES!
After reading the reviews about their garlic noodles, my boyfriend and I definitely had to try it.
Thanks for the suggestion because it was delicious.
It was so good that I tried making it the day after
We also ordered their crabs for our anniversary and it was also yummy but the garlic noodles are the best.
It's a must have!
garlic noodles.author: Mimi L.
garlic noodles.review:
Whoa whoa whoa! GARLIC NOODLES!

After reading the reviews about their garlic noodles, my boyfriend and I definitely had to try it. Thanks for the suggestion because it was delicious. It was so good that I tried making it the day after but I failed miserably. 

We also ordered their crabs for our anniversary and it was also yummy but the garlic noodles are the best. It's a must have!

excerpts: This place is the bomb if you're craving roasted crab and garlic noodles...
I've only been here once
but it's almost the same as Crustacean's restaurant but a lil bit more kick back
cause you don't have to wear collared shirts and a blouse...
everyone there orders
the typical "Roasted Crab & Garlic Noodles" - the must-have.
garlic noodles.author: Jen V.
garlic noodles.review:
This place is the bomb if you're craving roasted crab and garlic noodles...  I've only been here once but it's almost the same as Crustacean's restaurant but a lil bit more kick back cause you don't have to wear collared shirts and a blouse... everyone there orders the typical "Roasted Crab & Garlic Noodles" - the must-have. 

The only thing is that  you spend an arm & leg there... i mean, it's a lil more relaxed than Crustacean's but you get to go there whenever you want, dressed however you like and order drinks at the bar...  my experience was good however, I would like more parking spots.
