excerpts: I never had garlic noodles (how can that be, you ask?).
Everything just tasted SO good.
I have had tastier roasted crab, more flavorful garlic noodles, and paid a lot less for said tastier crab and garlic noodles.
garlic noodles.author: Sandy Y.
garlic noodles.review:
I loved this place when I first visited 6 years ago. Back then, I was a roasted crab novice. I never had garlic noodles (how can that be, you ask?). Everything just tasted SO good. I was a Thanh Long fan. 

Fast forward 6 years later, with a much more refined and experienced palate. For some reason, Thanh Long has lost its shine. I have had tastier roasted crab, more flavorful garlic noodles, and paid a lot less for said tastier crab and garlic noodles. 

Enough said.

excerpts: We usually go for the roast and drunken crab dishes with garlic noodles.
You can never get sick of these dishes!
garlic noodles.author: Darrin K.
garlic noodles.review:
This place is a staple for when we have visitors in the Bay Area. It is one of the great places to introduce newcomers to Dungeness Crab. 

We usually go for the roast and drunken crab dishes with garlic noodles. You can never get sick of these dishes! The flavor is so rich, garlicky good and buttery. 

A perfect beverage accompaniment is Wyder's, a Canadian pear cider with enough acidity and effervescence to cut through all the butter. Odd that I could never find this cider when I lived in Canada.

Funny thing, we were recently in the Phoenix airport and got chatting with a touring drummer who formerly lived in SF. Before we knew it, we were talking about how good the crab is at Thanh Long. This restaurant is an SF institution, a place where great food memories are created.

excerpts: Of course we had to order the roasted crab and garlic noodles
(I'm a huge fan of garlic noodles, so we had to each get our own order).
It was delicious.
We spent about $140 (inc. tax & tip) for 2 appetizers, crab, 2 orders of garlic noodles, and dessert.
garlic noodles.author: Ring K.
garlic noodles.review:
Hopefully my heart will still be pumping by the time I'm done with this review...

We had reservations at 6:30 on a Sunday night and we were seated immediately.  

We started off with Thanh Long mussels in Asian pesto sauce with bread.  The bread was buttery and the sauce was oily (since it's pesto), but it was pretty good.  We also had the Soft Shell Crab.  This was just deep fried soft shell crab with a tamarind-chili sauce on the side.

Of course we had to order the roasted crab and garlic noodles (I'm a huge fan of garlic noodles, so we had to each get our own order).  It was delicious.  The crab was drenched in butter and garlic and black pepper.  

We finished with Grandma An's Banana Bread Pudding.  This was delicious.  The bread pudding is more like a slice of super soft bread pudding with lots of bananas, but that paired with the hazelnut ice cream was a nice finish to our fattening meal.  We spent about $140 (inc. tax & tip) for 2 appetizers, crab, 2 orders of garlic noodles, and dessert.

excerpts: Roast Crab w/ Garlic Noodles and Garlic Fried Rice.
Eat the crab while it is hot and talk before and after dinner.
Dress code here is not like Crustacean
so I am sure they do well.
garlic noodles.author: David F.
garlic noodles.review:
The original Crustacean restaurant I have been here 2 times but used to frequent Crustacean Restaurant before I moved to San Jose.  Now that I am back in the San Francisco area I am definitely going to enjoy a few more stops here.

Roast Crab w/ Garlic Noodles and Garlic Fried Rice.  Eat the crab while it is hot and talk before and after dinner.  Dress code here is not like Crustacean so I am sure they do well.

excerpts: I ordered what most people go there for... the crab and garlic noodles.
garlic noodles.author: Starleigh H.
garlic noodles.review:
After all the rave reviews about this place, I finally had the chance to try it for myself.  I ordered what most people go there for... the crab and garlic noodles.  

Okay, so this is how it goes down... 

I'm dressed, dolled-up, and feeling pretty fierce. So I was very hesistant to get down and dirty with some crab.  I was there on a date (UGH, I hate that word), and it was just the beginning of the night so I didn't want to have that distinctive crab smell lingering (feel me?)...  With a little bit of convincing I end up ordering the Drunken Crab.

I'm going at it!  Crab meat in my finger nails, shells flying everywhere (one landing in my hair, btw), and juices dipping down my finger tips..  It was a MESS to say the least, but it was well worth it!

So you know me, I'm all about the sauce in dishes, right? At this point, I'm dipping my crab meat in my date's plate (Thanks D, for sharing).. haha!  As much as I liked my dish, I have to say the Tamarind Crab that he ordered IS BOMB! 

I will definitely come here again... Next time, I'm going to order my own plate of the Tamarind Crab so that I don't have to share... LOL!

excerpts: The garlic noodles were yummy like usual.
garlic noodles.author: Michelle S.
garlic noodles.review:
Went here for the first time.  Maybe it was an off night because the roasted crab was just okay.  I expected just a little bit more flavor...I thought the garlic sauce was more oily than flavorful....of course still edible...it is crab!  The garlic noodles were yummy like usual.  The shaken beef was very tender.  We got our food surprisingly fast!...which was great cause I was starving!  I thought the chicken fried rice was just okay...again, a little on the greasy side than flavorful.  We also ordered the chicken satay and the mussels which were a hit.  

I would come back again, but it always sucks to go to a restaurant for your first time, expecting a certain quality with the crab and to be disappointed.  I've been to Crustaceans a few times and they've always stayed quite consistent...just thought I'd try their sister restaurant this time.

excerpts: I still remember the very dim-lit, very nice atmosphere, the garlic noodles and the drunken crab.
Worth every penny; and, it's obviously worth every memory.
garlic noodles.author: Quintin D.
garlic noodles.review:
I haven't been here in 4 years, but my friend just Tweeted this restaurant, and I had to help it.

I still remember the very dim-lit, very nice atmosphere, the garlic noodles and the drunken crab. Worth every penny; and, it's obviously worth every memory.

excerpts: Roast Crab & Garlic Noodles!
We go here once a year for special occasions!
It is a beautiful restaurant inside and you will not be disappointed with the food.
Be sure to go with an empty stomach, because you won't stop eating until you have completely finished the last bite.
garlic noodles.author: Janice B.
garlic noodles.review: Roast Crab & Garlic Noodles!  We go here once a year for special occasions!  It is a beautiful restaurant inside and you will not be disappointed with the food.   Be sure to go with an empty stomach, because you won't stop eating until you have completely finished the last bite.

excerpts: We ordered the Salt & Pepper Calamari, 2 roasted crabs, 2 garlic noodles, the Vegetarian Delight, the Villager's Favorite, and our drinks.
As we were giving him our orders, we asked for his recommendation.
All he gave us was a uninterested look, shrug, and "ehhh, they are good.
Way to be proud of your restaurant, buddy!
However, I was impressed how he took our orders without writing them down... until, he can back when he forgot our order.
It was a busy evening for them that night.
For me it's a make it or break it moment for a restaurant.
If managed correctly, it is great, you enjoy a great meal without a worry in the world.
However for me, this was not the case.

Our waiter forgot to bring us bibs & scrap bowls to eat our crab, he came with our drinks after we finished our dinner, he did not refill our water, he did not offer warm towelettes to clean our hands and he did not offer us the dessert menu.
I guess the waiter "made up" for it by saying the Salt & Pepper Calamari was on the house.
garlic noodles.author: Pamela P.
garlic noodles.review:
Hands down, they have good food. However, if you are going to charge me that much for the items on the menu, you better provide me with exceptionally great service. I'm just saying. 

After hearing rave reviews of this place, I had very high expectations going in. I went on a busy Saturday evening for a birthday dinner. We were seated in their upstairs dining room. Our waiter was a 30-something Asian man. Giving us a moment to look through the menu, he came back to take our orders. We ordered the Salt & Pepper Calamari, 2 roasted crabs, 2 garlic noodles, the Vegetarian Delight, the Villager's Favorite, and our drinks. As we were giving him our orders, we asked for his recommendation. All he gave us was a uninterested look, shrug, and "ehhh, they are good." Way to be proud of your restaurant, buddy! However, I was impressed how he took our orders without writing them down... until, he can back when he forgot our order. -_- It was a busy evening for them that night. For me it's a make it or break it moment for a restaurant. If managed correctly, it is great, you enjoy a great meal without a worry in the world. However for me, this was not the case. Our waiter forgot to bring us bibs & scrap bowls to eat our crab, he came with our drinks after we finished our dinner, he did not refill our water, he did not offer warm towelettes to clean our hands and he did not offer us the dessert menu. I guess the waiter "made up" for it by saying the Salt & Pepper Calamari was on the house. I could have passed on the over-salted and over-peppered calamari rings. 

The good. The roasted crab and garlic were delicious! The crab meat fell right out of the shell. It was a good size crab too. Very tasty.

excerpts: Garlic crab and garlic noodles.
That's all you need to order.
garlic noodles.author: alexander s.
garlic noodles.review:
Holy.  Crap.  

Garlic crab and garlic noodles. That's all you need to order.

excerpts: The best garlic noodles
but you have to pay alot for it.
garlic noodles.author: Martha N.
garlic noodles.review:
The best crab on earth but you have to pay alot for it.
The best garlic noodles but you have to pay alot for it.

excerpts: oh wait the GARLIC NOODLES!!!
garlic noodles.author: rae m.
garlic noodles.review: GARLIC ROASTED CRAB!!!! What else is there to say...oh wait the GARLIC NOODLES!!! For a simple appetizer I suggest the salt and pepper calamari and dessert is the fried banana. If you're on a date and both of you are hungry I suggest a crab for each, but one is definitely enough.

excerpts: We also go the garlic noodles (very plain
garlic noodles.author: Joy H.
garlic noodles.review: From the outside, it doesn't look like much of a restaurant . . . it almost looks ghetto, but once you get inside, it's pretty big and elegant looking. They don't seat you until your whole party is present, so make sure everyone is there on time or else they may not hold your spot for long! We decided to do family style dining and share a bunch of dishes . . . however, looking around the restaurant we noticed that everyone had their own crab and it would've ended up being a little cheaper if we had done that. Duly noted! We got the roasted crab (the best!), drunken crab (less flavor than the roasted one), and tamarind crab (sweet sauce). We also go the garlic noodles (very plain but oh so tasty - drenched in garlic), shaken beef (almost more like a beef salad), stuffed calamari (unmemorable), and fried blue crab (standard fare). The crabs were the best, though pricey at $38/crab. The desserts we had included the fried ice cream, fried banana a la mode, chocolate cake, and creme brulee. I'd say to save your money on dessert and get another crab!!

excerpts: The sizzling beef, garlic crab, and garlic noodles are very good.
It's not good enough for me to make the drive myself!
Luckily I have nice friends who willingly drive me here to eat from time to time.
garlic noodles.author: Julienne P.
garlic noodles.review: The sizzling beef, garlic crab, and garlic noodles are very good.  It's not good enough for me to make the drive myself! Luckily I have nice friends who willingly drive me here to eat from time to time.

excerpts: The Roast Crab and Garlic Noodles comes highly recommended from friends that have nothing but good praises.
The food speaks for itself.
It would have got 5 stars if the price was more on the cheaper side.
garlic noodles.author: Eddie I.
garlic noodles.review: The Roast Crab and Garlic Noodles comes highly recommended from friends that have nothing but good praises. The food speaks for itself. It would have got 5 stars if the price was more on the cheaper side.

excerpts: along with the garlic noodles, it was lovely!!!
garlic noodles.author: Lani S.
garlic noodles.review: finally had the priviledge to woof down a crab with all that butter and garlic pepper.  along with the garlic noodles, it was lovely!!!

excerpts: I have had a love for this place for over 10 years...and my  usual order is crab puffs, garlic noodles and the drunken crab and for pick up!!!!
.... since I live in the neighborhood.

Its so much more enjoyable than waiting in a crowded ass waiting area/walkway/bar...only to get seated at a table that is literally an inch apart from the neighboring table where you can hardly have a convesation with your party without your neighbors hearing .
so I stick with the drunken crab and garlic noodles.....
so I stick with the drunken crab and garlic noodles.....
garlic noodles.author: Jenniflava R.
garlic noodles.review:
I have had a love for this place for over 10 years...and my  usual order is crab puffs, garlic noodles and the drunken crab and for pick up!!!!.... since I live in the neighborhood. Its so much more enjoyable than waiting in a crowded ass waiting area/walkway/bar...only to get seated at a table that is literally an inch apart from the neighboring table where you can hardly have a convesation with your party without your neighbors hearing .  If you must make reservations its better to make it early evening (5pm-6pm or after 9:30pm) or later in the evening to avoid the prime time dinner time madness.

Ive had entrees and they weren't really that memorable so I stick with the drunken crab and garlic noodles.....

excerpts:
GARLIC NOODLES!!!
You've never had them like this before...so simple, so good.
garlic noodles.author: Stephanie B.
garlic noodles.review:
GARLIC NOODLES!!!
You've never had them like this before...so simple, so good.
I always get the Thanh Long Fish and let it melt in my mouth savoring the perfect texture and dill spices. Everyone else goes there for the King Crab...which looks good if I wasn't religiously against eating things with legs. My boyfriend likes the Clay pot, the spicy eggplant, and taking a piece of my fish ;). We usually start out with a Buddha Roll and several side orders of noodles to take home. It's great after a long day in the park. Go for an early dinner to beat the reservation line. Or make a reservation and plan to have a drink at the cute little bar while you wait to be seated. This place is hot. 

According to our friends from LA this restaurant spawned a series of chain restaurants called Crustacean and those ones have a dress code and less flavor.

excerpts: garlic noodles are tasty.
garlic noodles.author: Rob T.
garlic noodles.review:
Food is 4 stars. The $10 (!!) garlic noodles are tasty. The $8 (!!) garlic rice also isn't bad. The crab (market price $36!! when I went) is also good, if you don't mind working on your food. If you are too lazy to de-shell your own crab, then these dishes aren't for you.

The actual dining experience is also good. They have laid out the restaurant such that diners are protected from the people waiting to be seated. My huge peeve is when a long of line of waiters starts to encroach into diners' territory, bumping into your chairs, staring at your food, drowning out your conversation, etc. Thanh Long does not have this problem.

However, over-pricedness (well, maybe not really, but I'm cheap) and terrible parking makes it 3 stars. They are right off the N-Judah, so take that if you can.

excerpts: This is the best place for garlic crab, garlic noodles ans so forth!
garlic noodles.author: Shirley H.
garlic noodles.review:
This is the best place for garlic crab, garlic noodles ans so forth!

I've been here more than 4 times even tho its kind of pricey, but well worth it!!! they get you full and it tastes so damn good!!!  Must must try the hazelnut icecream!!! something about it! MmMMm....just thinking about this place makes me drool! The next time i go, i will definitely try other things on the menu....but defintely the best place to go for crabs.

excerpts: we ordered a roast crab and also garlic noodles (yummy)!!
The place was packed on a Tuesday night!!
crazy!!
Totally recommend people to make reservation in advance!
I'm for sure going back there soon!
garlic noodles.author: JenJen W.
garlic noodles.review: This place was so awesome! they have the best crabs ever!! we ordered a roast crab and also garlic noodles (yummy)!! The place was packed on a Tuesday night!! crazy!! Totally recommend people to make reservation in advance!  I'm for sure going back there soon!

excerpts: We ordered salt and pepper calamari for an appetizer, got shaking beef, sea bass, garlic noodles, and roasted crab.
Then came the garlic noodles - which was served along with the shaking beef and sea bass.
The noodles were outstanding - perfectly cooked and seasoned, tons of garlic (almost too much for my taste) and full of flavor.
The shaking beef was extremely "Americanized", if you will, being entirely too sweet for my palate, but it was good beef and went nicely with the noodles.
Sea bass, in my opinion, is a hard fish to mess up as it basically tastes great however
you cook it as long as it's not overdone.
It does, however, need to be dressed up to really make the flavor stand out, or it risks being a bland fish.
While there was nothing wrong with how they cooked it - -  it was one of the few times
I thought sea bass to be boring.
garlic noodles.author: Grace K.
garlic noodles.review:
I have heard about Thanh Long forever, but had never been until this night.  I knew they were a sister restaurant to Crustacean, but I have never been there either - though I have eaten their crab.

This restaurant is known for their "roasted crab" - and on this evening, Rob and I ordered an exorbitant amount of food.  As I gawked at what he was ordering, he said, "Well we will reheat the leftovers for tomorrow."

Made perfect sense to me!

First, we ordered a bottle of Duckhorn Sauvignon Blanc ($50).  We thought it'd pair nicely with all the dishes, and it did.  

We ordered salt and pepper calamari for an appetizer, got shaking beef, sea bass, garlic noodles, and roasted crab.

I thought the calamari was excellent - lightly breaded, fried perfectly and while it's a deep-fried item, you don't feel like a hog eating this up.  Then came the garlic noodles - which was served along with the shaking beef and sea bass.  The noodles were outstanding - perfectly cooked and seasoned, tons of garlic (almost too much for my taste) and full of flavor.  The shaking beef was extremely "Americanized", if you will, being entirely too sweet for my palate, but it was good beef and went nicely with the noodles.  Sea bass, in my opinion, is a hard fish to mess up as it basically tastes great however you cook it as long as it's not overdone.  It does, however, need to be dressed up to really make the flavor stand out, or it risks being a bland fish.  While there was nothing wrong with how they cooked it - -  it was one of the few times I thought sea bass to be boring.  It needed a kick of some sort - desperately.

The crab arrives - and we dug right in.  The flavor was good, and it was served piping hot in a soup which consisted basically of butter.  Can't ask for more.  The crab itself was covered in pepper.  To say one will have to get messy is an understatement.  

Having said that - I don't consider this to be any better than Crustacean's crab.  Furthermore, perhaps because I have gone crabbing myself and had the freshest Dungeoness Crab one would eat straight out of the ocean and steamed alive on the spot - - it never crossed my mind that this was "THE BEST" I have had.  Very good - yes.  The best - - not quite!

It almost embarrasses me to report that not only did we finish every single thing we ordered - we hemmed and hawed over whether we should order one more crab.  After a few minutes, we did, and therein lied our mistake - - we waited too long to order and got fuller by the minute.  We ate about one leg each off the crab and packed the rest for home.  Well, at least we did have leftovers, like we intended.

Service was what was exceptional at this restaurant.  In particular, I am referring to our server - a young man who was the epitome of polite, attentive, friendly but professional all at the same time.  The few times we asked for anything - he got it immediately, and the rest of the time, we never needed a thing because he took such good care of us.  I was also impressed when he didn't bat an eye at how much food we ordered.

Yes, we ordered dessert.  (Don't forget, it's Rob and Grace here...)  Initially, Rob declined dessert but seriously, how does one refuse this:

"FRIED BANANA A LA MODE"?

We ordered that and two Vietnamese Iced Coffees - - both were OUTSTANDING and a perfect grand finale to a gluttonous feast.

The meal was not cheap by any means - but it was a lot of food and we left happy.  The total bill closed in on $300 by the time we tipped.  

We had some plans to check out a few bars after dinner, making it a full date night.  The food comas that followed the meal prevented any outings and we headed straight home.  

In summary, Thanh Long is worth trying at least once.  While the ambiance is not "romantic" by any means, it's not grungy either.  It's ideal for a Sunday night family dinner (if you have reservations) or dinner with close friends.  It's nice for a casual date, but not quite up to "impress the socks off" level, if you know what I mean.  But with great service and good food, not to mention a pretty nice wine list, I am declaring that Thanh Long makes it onto my date list on Yelp.

excerpts: Garlic noodles, GOOD!
garlic noodles.author: Dee L.
garlic noodles.review:
Absolutely my favorite restaurant!!!  Garlic noodles, GOOD! Roast Crab, GOOD! Shaken beef, GOOD! Mussels, OMG SO GOOD!!!!!  Need I say more?

Make sure to go earlier because looking for parking can be a pain.  Enjoy!

excerpts: The roasted crab and garlic noodles are too die for.
If you go, get there early or make reservations.
They are always crowded and you could wait up to an hour to be seated.
garlic noodles.author: Cecilia J.
garlic noodles.review: The roasted crab and garlic noodles are too die for.  If you go, get there early or make reservations.  They are always crowded and you could wait up to an hour to be seated.

excerpts: I ordered 2 orders of their garlic noodles and roasted crab to go for a Valentines day lunch and normally I don't like whole crab because it skimps on the meat, but these two had more than enough!
A bit on the pricey side, but well worth every penny.
garlic noodles.author: RoseMichelle M.
garlic noodles.review: I ordered 2 orders of their garlic noodles and roasted crab to go for a Valentines day lunch and normally I don't like whole crab because it skimps on the meat, but these two had more than enough! A bit on the pricey side, but well worth every penny.

excerpts: Their roast crab and garlic noodles are to die for!
garlic noodles.author: bobo f.
garlic noodles.review: Oh my god! Their roast crab and garlic noodles are to die for!

excerpts: Paired with another one of their signature dishes, the Garlic Noodles, it makes for one yummy but messy meal.
Don't turn down the bib.
They give that to you for a reason.
garlic noodles.author: Jackie I.
garlic noodles.review:
First things first: It's out in the Boonies. We're talking smell-the-ocean right by the beach Boonies. If you happen to be early for your reservation, there's no where to kill time except for the 7-11. Gross.

I will forgive all of that because the crab is one of the best things I have ever had in this city. Their signature roast crab is huge. I can't imagine eating one by myself. Paired with another one of their signature dishes, the Garlic Noodles, it makes for one yummy but messy meal. Don't turn down the bib. They give that to you for a reason.

excerpts: The garlic noodles did a good job of filling up my belly after finishing my snack of crustacean innards.
garlic noodles.author: Kris O.
garlic noodles.review:
It's very messy business hollowing out crab as many of you know, and being something of a slob on top of that, my crab shell cracking resulted in a buttery garlicky crab shelly explosion that left no one within 20 feet of me butter-free. After the mushroom cloud cleared, there at ground zero was perhaps a handful of crab meat for all my effort.

The garlic noodles did a good job of filling up my belly after finishing my snack of crustacean innards.

Parking was tough for us so we ended up having to valet the car. The service was commendable, the roast crab (which seemed to be what 90% of people there ordered) was good. "Market Price" at the time was $36 dollars/crab. (ouch)

excerpts: On the plus side, the garlic noodles were tasty enough...but not as good as the memories.
garlic noodles.author: Leah B.
garlic noodles.review:
Ah, you know that feeling of been slightly ripped off? You hate to admit it, but thank god for the honest Yelpers here who confirmed: the high price of the crab ($35...yikes) drenched in 60's-old butter, crab that didn't seem entirely fresh (yikes again), and just an all-around unhealthy experience. On the plus side, the garlic noodles were tasty enough...but not as good as the memories. 

Perhaps we'll come back in another 12 years...and then, perhaps not.

excerpts: Just went back for the second time last night and OMG the crab and garlic noodles were so goooood.
I'm usually not much of a crab eater, but damn this place rocks!
garlic noodles.author: Moxie C.
garlic noodles.review:
Just went back for the second time last night and OMG the crab and garlic noodles were so goooood. I'm usually not much of a crab eater, but damn this place rocks! Just thinking about the food makes me salivate!! 

Btw, a lot of people tell me that PPQ is the cheaper and equally as good as Thanh Long, but I beg to differ.

excerpts: i couldn't forget the taste of the food from the bomb-ass GARLIC NOODLES and to the DUNGANESE CRAB drenched in butter and garlic...
Oh!
heaven!
garlic noodles.author: Chris S.
garlic noodles.review:
OMG! this place is the best...i'd give them more than 5 stars but 5 stars is the max...this place is sooo great they deserve all the stars you can see up in the sky...they really do! 

On a DIET, CAUTION: don't even get near this place...

so i was up in Frisco, when my cousin that lives up there takes us to dinner at Thanh Long. they offer valet since parking is kinda hard. 

I didn't expect much out of the place. I thought it was just gonna be another place that serves regular asian cuisine...its more like their food is droplets of goodness from heaven...this reataurant is REMARKABLE...it was the highlight of my trip to Frisco...i couldn't forget the taste of the food from the bomb-ass GARLIC NOODLES and to the DUNGANESE CRAB drenched in butter and garlic...Oh! heaven! and fried banana fritters drizzled with a light caramel sauce with ice cream.

my meal was so GREAT that it got messy eating the crab...yummy
anyways i found out that they also own Crustesean's( not sure on the spelling) where they have one in Frisco and one in Beverly Hills, so i think i gotta plan a trip to Beverly Hills soon!

excerpts: If you have any more piggy left in you also get the garlic noodles.
garlic noodles.author: Mark K.
garlic noodles.review:
Hey good food fans, I'm one of you and I'm going to keep this short and sweet:

Roasted crab-get it and be prepared to eat THE BEST WHOLE CRAB EVER.  (They tie the bib for you too)

If you have any more piggy left in you also get the garlic noodles.


For the price AND awesome taste/texture, you can't beat it.  Superb.

YES this place gets 5 stars JUST FOR THOSE 2 DISHES.  I sh*t you not. Try it if you don't believe me.

You will seriously love me for it. Don't forget the creme brulee.

excerpts: This place is renown for several dishes which you will see raved over again and again in the reviews (garlic noodles, roasted crab, mango salad).
This is a destination neighborhood restaurant that has been around for years and has a very loyal following.
Their formula and Crustaceans (the An's family other more famous francise) is simple: not a large menu, consistently good food and a very attentive staff.
Yes, the legendary garlic noodles are everything they live up to
and yes, this place is not cheap, especially if you have the crab at market prices.
I do love bringing people here from out of town, so they can experience what the other 95% of the City is about.

Word of advice though, parking can be a pain and there really isn't any other places around here to investigate (Ocean Beach and Golden Gate Park is just a few blocks away, but hardly the places you want to go to in the dark) since this is mostly a residential area.
garlic noodles.author: Elkabong D.
garlic noodles.review:
This place is renown for several dishes which you will see raved over again and again in the reviews (garlic noodles, roasted crab, mango salad). This is a destination neighborhood restaurant that has been around for years and has a very loyal following. Their formula and Crustaceans (the An's family other more famous francise) is simple: not a large menu, consistently good food and a very attentive staff. You never feel rushed here and they can accommodate large groups, although this is not a place to go if you have claustrophobia or want an intimate quiet setting.

Yes, the legendary garlic noodles are everything they live up to and yes, this place is not cheap, especially if you have the crab at market prices. I do love bringing people here from out of town, so they can experience what the other 95% of the City is about. Word of advice though, parking can be a pain and there really isn't any other places around here to investigate (Ocean Beach and Golden Gate Park is just a few blocks away, but hardly the places you want to go to in the dark) since this is mostly a residential area.

excerpts: My husband ordered the Shangi Beef & I ordered the Prawns with garlic noodles.
They were both delicious !
I would not only go back
I would recommend to all my friends.
Good choice, good food & good service
garlic noodles.author: Vienna S.
garlic noodles.review: My friends invited my husband & I to try Thanh Long. I looked it up on Yelp and read the reviews. First I used the valet which I highly recommend. My friend parked 3 blocks away. My friends ordered the famous crab. My husband ordered the Shangi Beef & I ordered the Prawns with garlic noodles. They were both delicious ! I would not only go back I would recommend to all my friends. Good choice, good food & good service

excerpts: Way out in the avenues, is a true find for great crab and garlic noodles.
Opened in 1971 by the same folks who later opened Crustacean, great service and food abound (if you like seafood).
A bit pricey, so save your pennies!
garlic noodles.author: David G.
garlic noodles.review: Way out in the avenues, is a true find for great crab and garlic noodles. Opened in 1971 by the same folks who later opened Crustacean, great service and food abound (if you like seafood). A bit pricey, so save your pennies!

excerpts: Garlic Noodles
: This is always a winner, except for this day.
The noodles used to be flavorful, tasty and long.
The noodles we got were shorter than usual (or cut up) and the flavor was not evenly distributed.
It's like the noodles weren't mixed thoroughly and the sauce was missing something.
Never in my wildest dreams would I expect them to mess up their signature Garlic Noodles.
garlic noodles.author: Stella M.
garlic noodles.review:
What happened to this place??? I've definitely experienced better at this place.

For years our family and friends enjoyed coming here. We have our regular dishes that we always order and have never been let down...year after year.

Recently, we came for dinner mid-week, anticipating the same great experience and meal we usually get but had  a very rude awakening. 

First, we witnessed the male host/manager (whom we never seen before) treat a customer very rudely. A pregnant lady had let the male host know that they had a reservation and provided the name. He looked up the name and asked if she had a reservation, she said "yes". And he asked again, she said the name, he affirmed the name and asked AGAIN if they had a reservation. She again replied "yes". It was so bizarre that I was tempted to intervene and maybe help the host understand that she said "yes, she has a reservation". We were at the bar and could clearly hear him asking the same question over and over. And she was clearly saying yes they have a reservation under the name he said. Then he told her to wait until her husband showed up. WTF. Strange that he didn't just seat them. The place was not crowded nor was there anyone waiting to be seated. He definitely lacked basic customer service skills. And the owner should be ashamed that their host yelled a pregnant lady who was just wanting to be seated. 

That was them. Now us...
Service was decent. It was not busy at all so we got our food quickly.
We ordered our usual appetizers: mussels and the shrimp toast. Mussels were great. The Shrimp Toast was garbage. Toast was not toasted and the shrimp was like rubber. 

Main course: Roasted crabs for everyone. The crabs were dry and the flavor was slightly off. All of us felt the same disappointment with our crab. Not the juicy succulent crabs they used to have. Could it be it was out of season? But that never affected the quality of their crabs in past years.

Garlic Noodles: This is always a winner, except for this day. The noodles used to be flavorful, tasty and long. The noodles we got were shorter than usual (or cut up) and the flavor was not evenly distributed. It's like the noodles weren't mixed thoroughly and the sauce was missing something. Never in my wildest dreams would I expect them to mess up their signature Garlic Noodles. Another WTF moment. 

It was a night of disappointments. I'm so sorry we had come out of our way to go here for dinner. The front was as poorly managed as the kitchen. Hopefully they bring back the former GM or change the one there last night. This place used to be a special place for us but I am hesitant to go back any time soon.

excerpts: I've been here many times and the last time I went, their garlic noodles have changed.
The food was served really fast but it feels like their garlic noodle is re-stirred fried/microwaved out of the fridge before serving to us.
Why?
Because as I worked inside the noodle, it is cold.
garlic noodles.author: Monic S.
garlic noodles.review:
This place is well-known for their garlic noodle and crab.
Make you make reservation as it gets really full at dinner time.

The restaurant is 2-floor, slightly dimly lighted, big crowds waiting in line, and very very noisy. So if you're looking for something romantic, this is not a place to go.

I've been here many times and the last time I went, their garlic noodles have changed. The food was served really fast but it feels like their garlic noodle is re-stirred fried/microwaved out of the fridge before serving to us. Why? Because as I worked inside the noodle, it is cold. Cold as if it just came out of the fridge.

I don't know what has happened to Thanh Long, might be due to keeping up with the large number of customers. But nonetheless, the taste has not change.

Service: ok
Food: very good (garlic noodle & crab, the rest are ok/good)
Ambiance: slightly above average.
Parking: very hard

excerpts: Garlic noodles are a little greasy but good taste.
Prices are a litle high but
food worth it.
Parking sucks thought
garlic noodles.author: Cesar H.
garlic noodles.review: Delicious Crab and I love the meat cubes. Garlic noodles are a little greasy but good taste.  Prices are a litle high but food worth it. Parking sucks thought

excerpts:
Tamarind Crab~just OK. , not the flavor that was expected from the menu description 
Garlic Noodles~again, just OK.
(I really was anticipating something extraordinary with this dish because these are An's Famous Noodles and because noodles and garlic are two of my top ten favorite things of all time).
Three Desserts:
Fried Banana, Chocolate Torte, and I don't even remember the third one.
garlic noodles.author: J. Julia E.
garlic noodles.review:
If I lived nearby or was in the neighborhood already, I would definitely come back. But we drove a couple of hours to eat here and the food was good, although, not "travelling hours in a car" good. 

There were six of us (one was a child), this is what we ordered and how we felt about: 

Traditional Vietnamese Salad~ fresh, tasty, delicious vinaigrette, yet not overdressed 
Catch in Citrus~everyone enjoyed this dish (except for me; I found it too sweet for my liking) 
Thanh Long Spicy Eggplant~excellent 
Shaken Beef~EXCELLENT (I might take the drive for this dish) 
Roast Crab~We ordered two of these because these were supposed to be the star of the show, and don't get me wrong, they were good. The flavor was delicious but two days later my mom pretty much replicated the dish with lobster instead of crab so why drive the two hours, right ? 
Tamarind Crab~just OK. , not the flavor that was expected from the menu description 
Garlic Noodles~again, just OK. (I really was anticipating something extraordinary with this dish because these are An's Famous Noodles and because noodles and garlic are two of my top ten favorite things of all time). 
Three Desserts: Fried Banana, Chocolate Torte, and I don't even remember the third one. I did not try any of these ( I prefer savory over sweet), but everyone else at the table seem to like them just fine. 

Service was EXCELLENT. (I don't mean to put this in the end as an afterthought because I assure you that it's not.)

excerpts: yes the garlic noodles were great, but this restaurant is disgustingly overprised for what it offers especially in a location that is so off the beaten path.
over-rated is what i say.
boo...
garlic noodles.author: Ingrid Y.
garlic noodles.review:
i'm offended by the high rating this restaurant has.  mussels that tasted fishy, crab that literally was mushy, overcooked.  dumplings that were worse than frozen packaged dumplings (btw, 5 measly pieces for 10 bucks).  the decor has not been updated since god knows when, and it's totally milking its historical reputation.  
to be honest, i'm very disappointed and would not recommend anyone to go there.  yes the garlic noodles were great, but this restaurant is disgustingly overprised for what it offers especially in a location that is so off the beaten path.  over-rated is what i say.  boo...

excerpts: The five page menu is wasted as the Garlic Crab and Garlic Noodles are food ambrosia.
garlic noodles.author: Rick N.
garlic noodles.review: The five page menu is wasted as the Garlic Crab and Garlic Noodles are food ambrosia.

excerpts: Garlic noodles, oh garlic noodles, how I miss Thanh Long's garlic noodles.
Now that i live in Socal, I order garlic noodles
anytime I see them in a hopeless quest to find a substitute for Thanh Long's
but I'm sorely disappointed every time.
There is a Crustacean in Beverly Hills down here
but it's too far to make it out there with kids in tow.
Oh well, at least I have the memory of Thanh Long to keep my quest for garlic noodles going on down here.
Oh, btw their crab is freaking amazing too.
garlic noodles.author: Tony K.
garlic noodles.review: Garlic noodles, oh garlic noodles, how I miss Thanh Long's garlic noodles.  Now that i live in Socal, I order garlic noodles anytime I see them in a hopeless quest to find a substitute for Thanh Long's but I'm sorely disappointed every time.  There is a Crustacean in Beverly Hills down here but it's too far to make it out there with kids in tow.  Oh well, at least I have the memory of Thanh Long to keep my quest for garlic noodles going on down here.  Oh, btw their crab is freaking amazing too.

excerpts: What tops this place off though in my opinion is the garlic noodles.
It is by far the best garlic noodles I have ever tasted.
You have to come to this place at least once because it is absolutely worth it!!!
garlic noodles.author: pak n.
garlic noodles.review: This is absolutely the best Crab place in the Bay Area. Their roasted crab is absolutely delicious. The crab is cooked perfectly every time I have frequented this place with the right amount of pepper and butter. What tops this place off though in my opinion is the garlic noodles. It is by far the best garlic noodles I have ever tasted. You have to come to this place at least once because it is absolutely worth it!!!

excerpts: Roast Crab and Garlic noodles are soooo good.
Im baffled at how much flavor is in those noodles.
Everything on the menu is very tasty.
Yes its expensive and not good for you but once in a while shouldnt be too bad.
Dont eat the Roast Crab too slow because the butter starts solidifying.
garlic noodles.author: Roger C.
garlic noodles.review:
Roast Crab and Garlic noodles are soooo good. Im baffled at how much flavor is in those noodles. Everything on the menu is very tasty. Yes its expensive and not good for you but once in a while shouldnt be too bad. Dont eat the Roast Crab too slow because the butter starts solidifying. Then you'll realize that this is the same thing happening to your arteries.

The neighborhood is a bit ghetto. So weird to have a nice restaurant that's across the street from 7-11. But this is definitely one of my favorite restaurants.

excerpts: I don't know what they do to those garlic noodles
garlic noodles.author: Jason S.
garlic noodles.review:
WOW!

We went late on a Friday and were seated straight away, no waiting! 

Hands down the best noodles I've ever had...I don't know what they do to those garlic noodles but they are fierce!

Shaken beef is to die for... juicy, tender, tasty nibblers of beef drenched in sweet goodness...music to my mouth!

Drunken Crab is delicious, sweet, savory and good to the last drop...Definitely take the bib they offer when you order the crab or you will leave smelling like a sailor.

I can't wait to go back!

excerpts: If there are 4 of you, order 4 garlic noodles.
It's just heaven...as is the garlic noodles.
Garlic noodles seem like a pretty easy concept...but they don't make 'em anywhere else like they make 'em here.
Like I said...get your own.
garlic noodles.author: Karen B.
garlic noodles.review:
This place is a treat for me. The crab just melts in your mouth. I am allergic to shellfish, but I pack a bottle of benedryl and risk a major break out  just to eat here.  My suggestion is: order your own food. If there are 2 of you, order 2 crabs. If there are 4 of you, order 4 garlic noodles. You will not want to share, trust me. 

For the crab, I like the Roast Crab. You will be licking your fingers and slopping up the butter sauce. Just don't think about the pounds and pounds of butter it took to make the sauce it when you do it. It's just heaven...as is the garlic noodles.Garlic noodles seem like a pretty easy concept...but they don't make 'em anywhere else like they make 'em here. Like I said...get your own. I wasn't crazy about the Tamarind Crab. The flavor was just off for me. Plus it was too sticky. I don't like sticky crab. 

We tried the Shaken beef. It was ok. I guess after all the taste explosions with the crab and noodles, the shaken beef wasn't as exciting.  My BF who doesn't eat seafood really liked the beef. 

It's expensive, but if you stick with the great dishes, it is worth every cent.

excerpts: Just get the roasted crab and garlic noodles
.. perfection.
Their sides are delicious too.
I have been going here for many, many years and the quality of service and food has never wavered.
garlic noodles.author: rocky b.
garlic noodles.review:
No comparison.  This is the best crab I have had in the city.  I have tried many as I love crab and every time I try a new place, not even comparable.  Just get the roasted crab and garlic noodles.. perfection.  Their sides are delicious too.  I have been going here for many, many years and the quality of service and food has never wavered.  I have brought many friends and family, to only be invited by them soon after to go again.

My favorite crab restaurant ever.  Highly recommend it.

excerpts: Oh by the way did I mention the garlic noodles.
garlic noodles.author: Arthur C.
garlic noodles.review:
Even though the food is a bit pricy

the food is definitly worth it the roasted garlic crab is mouthwatering the side dish of garlic noodle can not compare that to anything I've ever eaten just that it's really really really good. their saigon beef is also good, haven't really tried anything else cuz everytime I go back I always want to order the same thing. Oh by the way did I mention the garlic noodles.

excerpts: My girlfriend and I went to this place for our date night and we had plans on taking pictures of the roasted crab, Garlic noodles and the fried banana with ice cream but by the time we remembered to pull out the camera phone our food was gone...
I think that if i didn't stay on a diet because of easy weight gain I would spend more time at this place.
garlic noodles.author: DANNY B.
garlic noodles.review: This place and Crustations can not be beat... My girlfriend and I went to this place for our date night and we had plans on taking pictures of the roasted crab, Garlic noodles and the fried banana with ice cream but by the time we remembered to pull out the camera phone our food was gone... I think that if i didn't stay on a diet because of easy weight gain I would spend more time at this place.

excerpts: You MUST get the Roasted Crab and Garlic Noodles.
garlic noodles.author: J. L.
garlic noodles.review:
You MUST get the Roasted Crab and Garlic Noodles.  For four people we also ordered the grilled squid starter which was surprisingly good (5 cooked just right with some peanut sauce), Shaken Beef (TASTEY!), and garlic rice.  This was perfect for 4 people (unless you are four giant guys, you might want to order more).

Highly recommend making reservations.  

Valet, or street parking which may take a few circles around the block.

excerpts: My wife and I ordered the roast crab and garlic noodles, and just devoured it.
We emerged from our feeding frenzy, shells flying, peppery butter everywhere, and deliriously settled up exactly half an hour later.
Believe the hype.
garlic noodles.author: Ben R.
garlic noodles.review: My wife and I ordered the roast crab and garlic noodles, and just devoured it.  We emerged from our feeding frenzy, shells flying, peppery butter everywhere, and deliriously settled up exactly half an hour later.  Believe the hype.

excerpts: The garlic noodles!!!!!!
couldn't stop eating it!!!
I'm probably smelt like garlic for 2 days
garlic noodles.author: Arlene E.
garlic noodles.review: soo good!!!  We had the drunken crab and the roasted crab and the prawns. The Roasted crab was the best!!!!! The drunken crab is marinated in wine so the taste was a little too light for me. The garlic noodles!!!!!!  Yum!!!!!  couldn't stop eating it!!!  I'm probably smelt like garlic for 2 days

excerpts: their roasted dungeness crab and garlic noodles is the bomb!!!
make sure you get some hot sauce on the side with garlic noodles, adds a little something!
garlic noodles.author: Abe P.
garlic noodles.review:
love it!

their roasted dungeness crab and garlic noodles is the bomb!!! make sure you get some hot sauce on the side with garlic noodles, adds a little something! gotta get your hands messy for the crab, but its finger lickin' good!

it's pricey, i won't lie...but totally worth it. 

wait can be long but totally worth it. they provide valet parking, but if you're lucky you can find street parking close by.

excerpts: The crab and garlic noodles was not as oily as PPQ's
but I like the noodles at PPQ more.
We had the goi ga salad which is good but pretty basic, not very unique.
garlic noodles.author: Quynh N.
garlic noodles.review: Ambiance is nice, looks like a residence on the outside but inside is clean and roomy, but it is noisy. The food is decent, everything tastes clean. The crab and garlic noodles was not as oily as PPQ's but I like the noodles at PPQ more. We had the goi ga salad which is good but pretty basic, not very unique. Shaken beef was quite tasty! Next time I think I will just stick with PPQ and save a bit of money.

excerpts: Just walk in, tell them you don't need a menu, all you want is the roasted garlic crab, garlic noodles, and a order of the crab puffs!
Can't go wrong, your wiinning everytime.
And if you eat there as much as me and my buddies do, they'll already know what time it is when u walk in and start callin you by your first name!!!!
garlic noodles.author: Tone K.
garlic noodles.review: Thanh Long is a must for all crab lovers! Just walk in, tell them you don't need a menu, all you want is the roasted garlic crab, garlic noodles, and a order of the crab puffs! Can't go wrong, your wiinning everytime. And if you eat there as much as me and my buddies do, they'll already know what time it is when u walk in and start callin you by your first name!!!!

excerpts:
The crab is pricey (like not mentioned in the menu) and parking sucky so...make reservations AND take the N Judah
Garlic noodles rock with crab.
The upstairs area is kinda crowded but a great first date place ; )
garlic noodles.author: Maggie D.
garlic noodles.review:
The crab is pricey (like not mentioned in the menu) and parking sucky so...make reservations AND take the N Judah
Garlic noodles rock with crab. The upstairs area is kinda crowded but a great first date place ; )

excerpts: Recommendations: Roasted Crab and Tiger Prawns on a bed of Garlic Noodles
garlic noodles.author: Michael C.
garlic noodles.review:
Original and sister restaurant of Crustacean in the city, but if you don't feel like dressin' up all the way and are looking for a somewhat more casual dining, then Thanh Long is a good alternative to go to than Crustacean.  

Recommendations: Roasted Crab and Tiger Prawns on a bed of Garlic Noodles

excerpts: Garlic Noodles....
garlic noodles.author: Michael J.
garlic noodles.review:
mmmm.....Crab....Garlic Noodles....

My favorite place to eat in San Francisco (BY FAR!!!).  You have to try this place.  The food is AMAZING!  Every time I leave there, I have a smile on my face.  

**NOTE:  Try the Eggplant Entree.  It has chicken, prawns, red/yellow bell pepper, and this awesome brown sauce.  Put it over your rice!  NICE!

excerpts: Go for the crab, but stay for the garlic noodles!
I could have gave this place 5 stars,
BUT the crab prices are insane haha.
I seriously could come back for the garlic noodles alone.
garlic noodles.author: Winston F.
garlic noodles.review: Go for the crab, but stay for the garlic noodles!  I could have gave this place 5 stars, BUT the crab prices are insane haha.  I seriously could come back for the garlic noodles alone.

excerpts: The Roast Crab and Garlic noodles are fantastic.
Just as good as at Crustaceans.
My wife said the crab was smaller at Than Longs
but I couldn't tell.
Besides Crabs are not all the same size.
Great meal
....service was OK...could be better
but the food is GREAT!
garlic noodles.author: Jeff R.
garlic noodles.review: Went to Than Long for our 1st wedding anniversary. The Roast Crab and Garlic noodles are fantastic. Just as good as at Crustaceans. My wife said the crab was smaller at Than Longs but I couldn't tell. Besides Crabs are not all the same size. Great meal....service was OK...could be better but the food is GREAT!

excerpts: There aren't words in any language in this world to describe just how fantastic the crab and the garlic noodles are.
*droooooooooooooool
garlic noodles.author: grace n.
garlic noodles.review: Oh good God. There aren't words in any language in this world to describe just how fantastic the crab and the garlic noodles are.  *droooooooooooooool*

excerpts: We ordered what most people recommend "Roast Crab" and "Garlic Noodles".
Ladies don't forget to bring a hair tie if you hair is long because it can get messy... not to worry about your clothes because they put a bib around your neck.

The garlic noodles taste weird, perhaps because it's not fresh (reheat-in-a-microwave taste) we probably had the leftover noodles from the night before, and for $9.50 it's not worth ordering the second visit.
But then again it sort of compliments the Crab, which I must admit is one of the best crabs I've ever tried.
It's so big and juicy oozing with butter garlic sauce I couldn't care less about making a mess.
The menu says market price, we paid about $37.
It would seem a lot, but if you're ordering for two it's enough.
garlic noodles.author: Chris H.
garlic noodles.review: After reading reviews about how good this place is, my friend and I decided to pay Thanh Long a visit. Parking was real easy since we came early, about 5:00 on a weekend. The restaurant was more than half full with happy eaters from a large family celebrating someones birthday to couples and tourists. The seats are comfortable with new clean table cloths. We ordered what most people recommend "Roast Crab" and "Garlic Noodles". Ladies don't forget to bring a hair tie if you hair is long because it can get messy... not to worry about your clothes because they put a bib around your neck. The garlic noodles taste weird, perhaps because it's not fresh (reheat-in-a-microwave taste) we probably had the leftover noodles from the night before, and for $9.50 it's not worth ordering the second visit. But then again it sort of compliments the Crab, which I must admit is one of the best crabs I've ever tried. It's so big and juicy oozing with butter garlic sauce I couldn't care less about making a mess. The menu says market price, we paid about $37. It would seem a lot, but if you're ordering for two it's enough.

excerpts: We all got the roasted crab and garlic noodles.
The services was fast and friendly.
Apparently they where more than prepared to serve the roasted crab because it did not even take more than 15 min to get our food.
The butter special sauce the crab was laying in was awesome!!
And the noodles were great!
I want to go back for sure.
The service was very friendly and fast.
The food was great!
And when you are waiting in line at a place before the doors open, you know you are in the right place!
garlic noodles.author: greg e.
garlic noodles.review: This place is fantastic! I have never heard about the place. My best friend's sister is a foody or foodie....whatever....and she says she's always wanted to try this place. I did not know what to expect at all. We got there before opening and there was already a line at the door. When we where seated we all decided to get the same thing (there was 4 of us). We all got the roasted crab and garlic noodles. The services was fast and friendly. Apparently they where more than prepared to serve the roasted crab because it did not even take more than 15 min to get our food. The butter special sauce the crab was laying in was awesome!! And the noodles were great! I want to go back for sure. The service was very friendly and fast. The food was great!  And when you are waiting in line at a place before the doors open, you know you are in the right place!

excerpts: Roasted Crab and garlic noodles!
Heaven on a plate.
I went there with my fabulous sisters and had the best meal I have ever had.
I have heard the rumors, I had read the reviews, but was not totally convinced that Thanh Long had perfection on a plate.
I am now.
You have to go try Thanh Long when your in SF.
It is the place to go.
The service was outstanding.
The staff was helpful, sincere, and friendly.
I can say without a doubt my family and I will always have dinner here when we are in the city.
garlic noodles.author: jennifer a.
garlic noodles.review: Roasted Crab and garlic noodles!  Heaven on a plate.  I went there with my fabulous sisters and had the best meal I have ever had.  I have heard the rumors, I had read the reviews, but was not totally convinced that Thanh Long had perfection on a plate.  I am now.  You have to go try Thanh Long when your in SF.  It is the place to go.  The service was outstanding.  The staff was helpful, sincere, and friendly.  I can say without a doubt my family and I will always have dinner here when we are in the city.

excerpts: everyone seems to come here for the roasted crab and garlic noodles, so of course thats what we ordered, not my first time here but still the same deal.
garlic noodles.author: Jay R.
garlic noodles.review:
06.19.12 with 3 others

service here was good, make sure you make reservations when you go. 

everyone seems to come here for the roasted crab and garlic noodles, so of course thats what we ordered, not my first time here but still the same deal. expensive crab about $40 for about 2 pounds worth, good flavor and cooked well. 

we also tried stuffed calamari it was only okay. and we got the shaking beef which I've had before which was good.

excerpts:
the tamarind is very good.   

and don't forget a couple orders of the garlic noodles.
garlic noodles.author: ellie s.
garlic noodles.review:
DELICIOUS!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  the roasted crab is amazing, but if you are feeling a bit more sloppy, get one of the marinated versions.  the tamarind is very good.   

and don't forget a couple orders of the garlic noodles.  so potent, but oh so yummy.  just beware,  terrible choice if you have to meet anyone important for the next several days, i guarantee garlic will still be oozing from your pores.

excerpts: TL is known for its varieties of dungeness crab (peppered is best, IMO), but it's the garlic noodles that are 2 die 4.
It appears simple and I've tried to duplicate it at home but just not the same.
It has lots of garlic and subtle sweetness and then maybe an eggy coating.
Not sure how they do it
garlic noodles.author: Alex T.
garlic noodles.review:
TL is 2 blocks from my home which makes it real convenient. Even if it weren't so close, a trip to TL is worth it, as would agree many others. There's not much going on out here in the Avenues but people seem to travel very far. There's even valet parking, which is kinda ridiculous if you knew the neighborhood. 

TL is known for its varieties of dungeness crab (peppered is best, IMO), but it's the garlic noodles that are 2 die 4. It appears simple and I've tried to duplicate it at home but just not the same. It has lots of garlic and subtle sweetness and then maybe an eggy coating. Not sure how they do it but it's pretty perfect. 

It's a moderately pricey place, although not compared to fancier downtown restaurants. Some people get dressed up, and some others casual. It's good for large parties. Reservations recommended.

excerpts: GARLIC NOODLES
HERE
garlic noodles.author: Marc E.
garlic noodles.review:
GARLIC NOODLES HERE I COME! 

The drunken crabs were awesome and the Salmon Carpaccio is to die for! There are some items that I was interested in, but didn't get the chance to try em'...oh well, maybe next time!

Good luck with parking!

excerpts: Everyone has already reviewed the garlic noodles and crab so it won't be mentioned here again (except, mmm!) ...
garlic noodles.author: Christina P.
garlic noodles.review:
Everything here is absolutely perfect. Everyone has already reviewed the garlic noodles and crab so it won't be mentioned here again (except, mmm!) ...

I will say don't skip the dessert, which is what I generally do at restaurants. The banana cake here is ESPECIALLY to die for; however you can't go wrong with whatever you order. :)

excerpts: We were told this is the authentic place to get crab and garlic noodles: less touristy than the Crab House on Pier 39, cheaper and better than its sister Crustacean Restaurant.
We made a reservation at 8 PM on a Sunday evening and waited maybe 10 min.
Plastic bibs are given to diners.
We ordered what they're famous for: the roasted crab and garlic noodles.
We also ordered shaking beef.
The roasted crab is a huge dungeness crab seasoned very little (salt and pepper) as all fresh seafood should be.
The garlic noodles seemed like spaghetti sautéed with minced garlic and butter and then coated with garlic powder.
Super garlicky as in my breath was reeking well into the night even after brushing my teeth, but us Asians love garlic
so we don't care.
The shaking beef was very tender and marbled--perhaps ribeye--and flavored well enough so that you didn't need the dipping sauce of salt, pepper, and lemon juice.
Everything was really good, and had it not been my second dinner, I would've eaten much more.
The dinner was expensive though--each crab was $40.
But we were on vacation, and when we vacation, we vacation big.
Like celebrities.
garlic noodles.author: Christine H.
garlic noodles.review: We were told this is the authentic place to get crab and garlic noodles: less touristy than the Crab House on Pier 39, cheaper and better than its sister Crustacean Restaurant.  We made a reservation at 8 PM on a Sunday evening and waited maybe 10 min.  Plastic bibs are given to diners.  We ordered what they're famous for: the roasted crab and garlic noodles.  We also ordered shaking beef.  The roasted crab is a huge dungeness crab seasoned very little (salt and pepper) as all fresh seafood should be.  The garlic noodles seemed like spaghetti sautéed with minced garlic and butter and then coated with garlic powder.  Super garlicky as in my breath was reeking well into the night even after brushing my teeth, but us Asians love garlic so we don't care.  The shaking beef was very tender and marbled--perhaps ribeye--and flavored well enough so that you didn't need the dipping sauce of salt, pepper, and lemon juice.  Everything was really good, and had it not been my second dinner, I would've eaten much more.  The dinner was expensive though--each crab was $40.  But we were on vacation, and when we vacation, we vacation big.  Like celebrities.

excerpts: ARE THAT GOOD!), seasonal vegetables and of course, the garlic noodles.
garlic noodles.author: A C.
garlic noodles.review:
Their food is awesome!!!  Definitely a place you can go to just relax and enjoy good food with friends and family.  We live an hour away, but we always bring our out of town guests.  It's a must and a real treat!  Favorites include the roasted crab, the mussel/appetizer dish (we usually order at least 3 of those --THEY ARE THAT GOOD!), seasonal vegetables and of course, the garlic noodles. 

Our friends from Vancouver who we have brought there, to this day... 5 years later.. STILL TALK ABOUT IT!

excerpts: The crab is freakin delicious here and the simple but extremely tasty garlic noodles are the two must haves at this restaurant.
I know this is what everyone says
garlic noodles.author: Elle C.
garlic noodles.review:
The crab is freakin delicious here and the simple but extremely tasty garlic noodles are the two must haves at this restaurant.  I know this is what everyone says but I just felt like I needed to reinforce the fact as I a have been craving some lately.

A few things to note:

1.) Parking is ridiculous here.  If you see a spot a few blocks away, take it or else you'll be wishing you took it 5 minutes later when you're circling around for another 15 minutes. (unless you're an extremely lucky person, then lucky you)

2.) There can be a long wait so try to get dinner a little earlier especially if it's a Friday or Saturday.

excerpts: the garlic noodles are a perfect side dish too...
the texture is dry just the way i like it.
i do like eat while it's fresh.
garlic noodles.author: Kay V.
garlic noodles.review:
i am usually not known for attacking a whole crab with my bare & dainty fingers...but  yes i did it! although my goal was to eat the whole crab, i was insanely full from eating half of it. 

the garlic noodles are a perfect side dish too...the texture is dry just the way i like it. i do like eat while it's fresh. next time i'm eating my roast crab with a side of white rice. there's soooo much butter & garlic left over, it would've been a treat to drizzle that over some rice.

you get a hot towel at the end of dinner to wipe off your greasy mess from your hands (& face too). the handy plastic bib they provided is a must. make sure your neighbor wears one too even if they don't eat crab. only suggestion is to provide a hot towel before dinner too.

parking was a headache...street parking (but hey, this is san francisco). but it looks like they have valet service...not really advertised well if so.

excerpts: All their crabs are amazing...however while the garlic noodles were delish they were a little on the dry side.
While the exterior may look displeasing the inner atmosphere and the service is great!
garlic noodles.author: Jennifer C.
garlic noodles.review: All their crabs are amazing...however while the garlic noodles were delish they were a little on the dry side.  While the exterior may look displeasing the inner atmosphere and the service is great!

excerpts: We also ordered the roasted crab and garlic noodles.. and just like the mussels it was so good!
I really can't wait til i come back to this place..
next time i'll order a drink!
Really good service here
oh and of course good food!
I'll be back soon!
garlic noodles.author: Heather C.
garlic noodles.review: Its soooo packed here! I came on Saturday and boy was it packed me and the boyfriend got a table upstairs.. (thank god) we ordered the thanh long mussels which came with crostini.. and omg.. it was so good! =P We also ordered the roasted crab and garlic noodles.. and just like the mussels it was so good! I really can't wait til i come back to this place..next time i'll order a drink! =) Really good service here oh and of course good food! I'll be back soon!

excerpts: I got the garlic noodles ($10) because that's a must!
It was REALLY good, but very oily and fatty.
The roasted garlic crab wasn't that great for ($37)
I rather eat my bf parent's crab
but I gotta say it did have a lot of meat and
when you use a small fork it makes you feel like your eating more?
haha
I think I would only come back for the garlic noodles.
Everything else isn't  worth that much.
I feel like I was paying more for the atmosphere, but yes garlic noodles is a MUST!
garlic noodles.author: Alice H.
garlic noodles.review: This place is pretty expensive. A friend of mine recommended me to try it and said it's worth the price. Parking is hard to find...then again it's SF right. It's located in the corner. The outside was whatever, but the inside looks really nice and upscale. We got seated right away and the table that we got was so tiny. What I didn't' like was that we were literally right next to other people because the place is too tight & needs more room. Anyways, the waiter was very friendly. I got the garlic noodles ($10) because that's a must! It was REALLY good, but very oily and fatty. The roasted garlic crab wasn't that great for ($37) I rather eat my bf parent's crab but I gotta say it did have a lot of meat and when you use a small fork it makes you feel like your eating more? haha Lastly, we tried the shaken beef which had a lot of flavor and the meat was tender. I like how there was salad on the bottom which goes well together. I think it was way over priced because I'd rather eat at the one at Tasty garden, but it was all for the experience and since I was there I might as well try all the good stuff. I think I would only come back for the garlic noodles. Everything else isn't  worth that much. I feel like I was paying more for the atmosphere, but yes garlic noodles is a MUST! (:

excerpts: roasted crab is amazing, salt and pepper calamari, and garlic noodles.
I went here last night with my bf
and now I totally have a food hangover!
Well priced, be aware you will consume a lot of butter!
garlic noodles.author: Rebecca W.
garlic noodles.review: SO GOOD!  roasted crab is amazing, salt and pepper calamari, and garlic noodles.  I went here last night with my bf and now I totally have a food hangover!  Well priced, be aware you will consume a lot of butter!

excerpts: I can't resist the garlic noodles and shaken beef.
Maybe the satay and jasmine rice with a pineapple lychee martini.
If this hasn't sparked your taste buds go in and see all of the other amazing entree they have to offer.
Don't forget the fried banana or the molten chocolate grand mariner desert.
Makes me hungry just thinking about it!!!!!!!!!
garlic noodles.author: Kris M.
garlic noodles.review: If you haven't been here you are missing out.... I can't resist the garlic noodles and shaken beef. Maybe the satay and jasmine rice with a pineapple lychee martini. If this hasn't sparked your taste buds go in and see all of the other amazing entree they have to offer. Don't forget the fried banana or the molten chocolate grand mariner desert. Makes me hungry just thinking about it!!!!!!!!!

excerpts: But the food - rather the roasted garlic crab and garlic noodles are as good as ever.
I have never ordered anything else, I don't
I ever will.
It's so darn good!
Over the years, we have "mastered" the way WE like to eat the crab.
We order one and split it between the two of us and as we're finishing it, we order our second crab.
It stays hotter and the butter
(there is a lot of it) doesn't start to harden as it cools off.
Hard to say which is better - the crab or the garlic noodles.
If you want the real thing from the original secret kitchen, this is the location.
For those who want the ambience and fancier setting, go to Crustaceans in the city, I heard its just as good although I have never been.
garlic noodles.author: Grover G.
garlic noodles.review: I liked this place better before it got the fancy re-do a number of years ago.  But the food - rather the roasted garlic crab and garlic noodles are as good as ever.  I have never ordered anything else, I don't I ever will.  It's so darn good!  Over the years, we have "mastered" the way WE like to eat the crab.  We order one and split it between the two of us and as we're finishing it, we order our second crab.  It stays hotter and the butter (there is a lot of it) doesn't start to harden as it cools off.  Hard to say which is better - the crab or the garlic noodles.  If you want the real thing from the original secret kitchen, this is the location.  For those who want the ambience and fancier setting, go to Crustaceans in the city, I heard its just as good although I have never been.

excerpts: garlic noodles.
sea bass.
SO GOOD.
like, purposely get it under my fingernails good b/c i want to savor it later even though most of society would consider me one unhygienic b*tch good.
...the shaken beef and the garlic noodles were amazing.
- - my leftover noodles, which would've been my lunch today, were quickly eaten as soon as i got home.
garlic noodles.author: Ting A.
garlic noodles.review:
there are only a few times where i can get away w/drool hanging from my mouth:
- as an infant
- as a dentist's patient w/novacaine
- while i'm sleeping
- while i'm in the presence of someone like johnny depp
- while i'm sleeping w/johnny depp
- and when i dine at places like thanh long.

hanlong bay breeze cocktail:  included vodka, a raspberry liquer,  and another ingredient which slips my mind.  this delicious concoction had a pleasant aftertaste that i couldn't quite put my finger on.
  
mussels appetizer:  broiled w/asian pesto and served w/seasoned crostini.  wow.  i wanted to roll around in this mussely goodness.  the pesto didn't overpower the dish which was good, and the crostini was a nice touch.

entrees:  shaken beef, served w/potatoes, mixed greens, and cherry tomatoes.  garlic noodles.  sea bass.  SO GOOD.  like, purposely get it under my fingernails good b/c i want to savor it later even though most of society would consider me one unhygienic b*tch good.  ...the shaken beef and the garlic noodles were amazing.  - - my leftover noodles, which would've been my lunch today, were quickly eaten as soon as i got home.  hah.

the waitstaff was very friendly and accommodating.  good thing we ate dinner early b/c there was a line as we exited.

i'll definitely try the crab next time.

The platter of eggplant, chicken, and bell peppers was very good and shaking beef was very tasteful.

Its decor is fancy but you know that the dining experience is still very casual. If you're craving garlic crab but don't want to pay a lot and want to dine at a more casual place, Thanh Long is a great second choice.

excerpts: For dinner, we stuck with the garlic crab and garlic noodles.
Yes, the crab was amazing - amazing flavor and really meaty crabs.
The noodles I was totally disappointed in.
Imagine spaghetti noodles doused in a stick of butter with tons of garlic salt...and overcooked.
Definitely order a bowl of rice to subdue some of the flavor.
Overall, well worth the trip but DO NOT PLAN TO GO OUT AFTERWARDS.
We made this mistake and literally had girls at the club running away from us b/c the stench was too much!
garlic noodles.author: Elisa K.
garlic noodles.review: During a weekend trip to SF, my lovely friends took me Thanh Long. Wow, they were raving about it all weekend so I could not wait. We started the night with some cocktails - definitely go for the lychee martini. I know, totally cheese, but well worth it. For dinner, we stuck with the garlic crab and garlic noodles. Yes, the crab was amazing - amazing flavor and really meaty crabs. The noodles I was totally disappointed in. Imagine spaghetti noodles doused in a stick of butter with tons of garlic salt...and overcooked. Definitely order a bowl of rice to subdue some of the flavor. Overall, well worth the trip but DO NOT PLAN TO GO OUT AFTERWARDS. We made this mistake and literally had girls at the club running away from us b/c the stench was too much!

excerpts: so when he said he wanted to get some garlic noodles, i kept pestering him 'where'...

just wished the portion was bigger.

garlic noodles - yummm! just wished the portion was bigger.
garlic rice - garlicky, just the way i like it
shaking beef - hella good! i wished they put more potatoes tho.. beef was kinda salty but it was still good

definitely a place i would go again.. but parking here is soooooo bad..  and the valet is pretty bank.. especially since the food is kinda expensive.

sister site of Crustaceans, save $$ go here instead if your not on a 1st date.
garlic noodles.author: Art G.
garlic noodles.review: Garlic noodles and roasted crab (seasonal price). That's all to get here. tried the calarmari, not much of a fan of this dish. sister site of Crustaceans, save $$ go here instead if your not on a 1st date.

excerpts: The garlic noodles were good, but extremely oily.
garlic noodles.author: Richard F.
garlic noodles.review: Good place, but nothing spectacular.  I think this place is owned by the same people that own Crustacean Restaurant.  Not as expensive as Crustacean, but I still think this place is overpriced.  The garlic noodles were good, but extremely oily.  The fried rice was completely bland.  Good service.  If you're in the general area, it's a okay place, but not worth a special trip to the outer Sunset.

excerpts: The garlic noodles are to die for, along with the crab and some fried banana, makes up for an awesome dining experience.
garlic noodles.author: B F.
garlic noodles.review:
Love this place, one of my favorite restaurants in the city.

The garlic noodles are to die for, along with the crab and some fried banana, makes up for an awesome dining experience.

Appetizers are awesome as well, and you can't really go wrong w/ anything on the menu.

Parking is one downside to this location, but regardless, I will still be coming back for the irresistible noodles/crab.
