excerpts: The garlic noodles and roasted crab here is second to none!
I admit that I'm a bit on the "prissy" side when it comes to using my hands and getting dirty while eating.
But to truly enjoy this meal, I won't hesitate to roll up my sleeves, slap on a bib, and let the crab shells fly and the juices drip.
A friend took me here several years ago
and I'm so glad that she did.
garlic noodles.author: L H.
garlic noodles.review: The garlic noodles and roasted crab here is second to none!  I admit that I'm a bit on the "prissy" side when it comes to using my hands and getting dirty while eating.  But to truly enjoy this meal, I won't hesitate to roll up my sleeves, slap on a bib, and let the crab shells fly and the juices drip.  A friend took me here several years ago and I'm so glad that she did.

excerpts: Servings are large, two can share a plate of Garlic Noodles.
Come a little early to find parking.
garlic noodles.author: Leen D.
garlic noodles.review: Great food, fast and friendly service. Servings are large, two can share a plate of Garlic Noodles. Come a little early to find parking.

excerpts: The garlic noodles are delicious but you could see a puddle of butter at the bottom of its plate once your done.
The decor is nice but you can tell the place has been around for some time.
Its sister restaurant Crustacean's definitely has better ambiance.
Thanh Long is more of a family gathering type of place.
Their lava cake is absolutely yummy!!
That definitely tipped the scale to a worthy dining experience for me.
The only thing is that they have a $1 cake-cutting fee which put me off a bit.
Either just include it in the price of the cake, or take it away altogether.
garlic noodles.author: jean j.
garlic noodles.review:
I'm not a fan of seafood but i definitely am willing to take a few bites of their roasted crab which is smothered in garlic, salt, and butter (lots of it). my husband ordered the roast crab while i had the shaken beef which is pretty good, although i can see the oil on the bed of lettuce it sits on. The garlic noodles are delicious but you could see a puddle of butter at the bottom of its plate once your done.
The decor is nice but you can tell the place has been around for some time. Its sister restaurant Crustacean's definitely has better ambiance. Thanh Long is more of a family gathering type of place.
Their lava cake is absolutely yummy!! That definitely tipped the scale to a worthy dining experience for me. The only thing is that they have a $1 cake-cutting fee which put me off a bit. Either just include it in the price of the cake, or take it away altogether.

excerpts: The garlic butter crab is a must have along with the garlic noodles.
Its hard to find parking here so i would suggest the valet.
I've been coming to this place for years and they have always been very consistent with the food.
Great service and Delicious food!
garlic noodles.author: billy l.
garlic noodles.review: If you love eating crab as much as i do you will surely enjoy this place. The garlic butter crab is a must have along with the garlic noodles. Its hard to find parking here so i would suggest the valet. I've been coming to this place for years and they have always been very consistent with the food. Great service and Delicious food!

excerpts: Garlic Noodles (2 orders at $9.50 ea) - Garlicky and delicious!
This was my parents first time here and they loved the crab, and garlic noodles.
They did say it was a bit oily, but c'mon, roasted crab and garlic noodles anywhere is a bit oily.
But here's a good sign.
As they left, they took some business cards.
garlic noodles.author: Daniel M.
garlic noodles.review:
I've been here before and I thought it was great (and still do!), but after eating at Crustaceans, Thanh Long only gets 4 stars...

Took my parents and Anhie T. here for Chinese New Years dinner, and reservations were made at 8.30, but at 7.15 we were able to move it up to 7.45 with no problems.  We got there, and it was pretty empty...with maybe 20 diners at about 5-6 different tables.  Barren compared to when Anhie T. and I came about 2 yrs ago.  We were seated immediately, and looked over the menu, and ordered the following:

Crispy Rice Paper Roll ($7.50) - your standard Vietnamese Egg Roll.  But here you get once egg roll cut into four pieces.
Thanh Long Mussells ($10.95) - five mussells served with five slices of thin garlic bread.  This dish was delicious.
Steamed Sea Bass ($24.95) - sea bass was flaky, moist, and really good.  The sauce was sweet and gingery.
Stuffed Calamari ($15.95) - lots of calamari stuffed with minced meat in a tomato based sauce.  Parents didn't like it so much, but I thought it was okay.
Shaken Beef ($20.95) - very flavorful, and a dish that everyone loved.  The beef was tender and potatoes were flavorful.
Garlic Noodles (2 orders at $9.50 ea) - Garlicky and delicious! 
Roast Crab (I think it was $38) - really good crab...but compared to Crustaceans, it's not the same.  Not as flavorful, but still very, very good nonetheless. 
Creme Brulee (2 orders) - My dad and Anhie T. thought this was the best dessert dish.
Banana Cake - I liked this dish and everyone else didn't like it.  Served with a scoop of Vanilla ice cream, a dallop of whip cream, this cake seemed to be made out of only bananas.  Anhie T. said it was bland.  I disagree.
Hot Chocolate Cake - served with Vanilla ice cream...this was good.  Really rich though.
Coke (2 glasses) - served from their bar in a tall, slim glass.  No free refills.

Total bill with tax + tip came out to $218.

This was my parents first time here and they loved the crab, and garlic noodles.  They did say it was a bit oily, but c'mon, roasted crab and garlic noodles anywhere is a bit oily.  But here's a good sign.  As they left, they took some business cards.  That means they liked their food and they'll be back...probably with some family friends!

Depending on my the mood (and thickness of the wallet), I would come back.  

But other substitutions are very comparable:  PPQ is cheaper and quality isn't far behind, while Crustacean is a tad more expensive, but swankier....

Tip 'o the day:  Avoid the valet parking outside.  Parking isn't too difficult in the Sunset.  And even if you had to walk one block after dinner, it may clear up your arteries after all the butter used in cooking the crab!

excerpts: The garlic noodles are good, but I'm not waiting an hour for garlic noodles.

garlic noodles.review: Obscenely long waits, too crowded, and overpriced.   The garlic noodles are good, but I'm not waiting an hour for garlic noodles.

I can not WAIT to go back.

I'm already salivating just writing this review.
Do yourself a favor and try this spot for yourself.
You will not regret.

garlic noodles.review: too expensive. Overrated, wasn't too impressed by the food. Garlic noodles were too greasy.

excerpts: I always have the crab, garlic noodles and fried bananas, These were my all time
favorites hands down--DELICIOUS!
However, I was so disappointed this time I will never return.
So sad!
Don't get me wrong the crab was amazing!
The garlic noodles were not.
Very disappointing!
I used to order a plate for myself and a plate to go, but they have gone down hill.
The fried bananas had a really thick batter and the bananas seemed to be picked green right off the tree-kind of chewy and earthy tasting.
They added whipped cream and chocolate sauce to the dish and destroyed it.
garlic noodles.author: Rainey M.
garlic noodles.review: This used to be one of my favorite places to eat. I would eat here several times a year, but haven't been here is about four years until this week. The roasted crab-still amazing. Not so much anything else.  I always have the crab, garlic noodles and fried bananas, These were my all time favorites hands down--DELICIOUS! However, I was so disappointed this time I will never return. So sad!  Don't get me wrong the crab was amazing! The garlic noodles were not. Very disappointing! I used to order a plate for myself and a plate to go, but they have gone down hill. The fried bananas had a really thick batter and the bananas seemed to be picked green right off the tree-kind of chewy and earthy tasting. They added whipped cream and chocolate sauce to the dish and destroyed it. Also, we ordered the salt and pepper calamari and it was so overcooked we didn't touch it after the initial taste. After 25 years of enjoying great meals here, I'd done. I won't return.

excerpts: the BEST roasted crab and garlic noodles ever.  have a reservation esp on weekends\holidays
.. wish it could be a little cheaper, but the food is great!
garlic noodles.author: Cheryl M.
garlic noodles.review: the BEST roasted crab and garlic noodles ever.  have a reservation esp on weekends\holidays.. wish it could be a little cheaper, but the food is great!

excerpts: The garlic noodles are tasty and I can't get enough of them especially when paired with crab.

The portions are great and worth the price.
The only thing that is tough most of the time is finding parking.

garlic noodles.review: It is the perfect place for a date if you don't mind cracking crab but I've also gone in large groups and they are very happy to accommodate. The garlic noodles are tasty and I can't get enough of them especially when paired with crab. I've tried several other dishes here as well and I was just as pleased. The portions are great and worth the price. The only thing that is tough most of the time is finding parking.

excerpts: order the roast crab and the garlic noodles.
that's all you really need to know.

i'm sure the other things on the menu are tasty (the salt and pepper calamari are a favorite if we come w/ friends), but you can't come all the way out here and not have the roast crab AND garlic noodles.

i'm sure the other things on the menu are tasty (the salt and pepper calamari are a favorite if we come w/ friends), but you can't come all the way out here and not have the roast crab AND garlic noodles.
the few times i've been with her, she's refused to share a large dungeness roast crab w/ anyone.
garlic noodles.author: Carol O.
garlic noodles.review:
order the roast crab and the garlic noodles.  that's all you really need to know.  i'm sure the other things on the menu are tasty (the salt and pepper calamari are a favorite if we come w/ friends), but you can't come all the way out here and not have the roast crab AND garlic noodles.

i prefer thanh long over crustacean for the slightly more relaxed atmosphere, especially bc i don't like to feel like i have to get dressed up if i'm going to be licking butter & garlic off my fingers at dinner.

my best friend from So Cal swears that the only reason she really comes up here to visit me is because she wants to eat at thanh long.  matter of fact, the few times i've been with her, she's refused to share a large dungeness roast crab w/ anyone.  what a punk!

parking is terrible.  i used to live two blocks away and parking was still bad but it is definitely worth it.

excerpts: (i ferget, i think the market price was $35.95 and garlic noodles for $9.50)...
the calamari ($9.75) wasn't all that
, it was just ok.
the garlic noodles are SO MUCH better here
and it's actually very good.
, i got sick of SF, been there, done that... don't ferget, get the f-in crab and the garlic noodles, k?
Me; for sure.
*convo continues
we also shared their $7.95 grandma an's homemade old banana cake which is pretty much warm cake dipped in coconut milk, rim layered bananas w/vanilla ice cream.
i wouldn't really order this again because it was a lil bit too much... and omg
, i'm sucha dessert fanatic...
garlic noodles.author: Jennifer S.
garlic noodles.review:
WOW! i'm stuffed... see oinky? not a 2 star... =DD

the An family has never failed to please the locals, whether it be crustacean (in beverly hills/sf) or thanh long (being the first that opened).

who would've thought? i thought all the foodie joints were all on irving / noriega, but judah? oh wells, i ain't complaining...  

probably one of the very best. Btwn PPQ & TL, I'd come here. I've pretty much ordered the same thing, roasted signature crab (i ferget, i think the market price was $35.95 and garlic noodles for $9.50)... the calamari ($9.75) wasn't all that, it was just ok. the garlic noodles are SO MUCH better here and it's actually very good. PPQ was a bit TOO oily... 

so one of my closest guy friends who USED to live in SF, who UNFORTUNATELY NO LONGER LIVES HERE, swore to me that this was one of his favorite joints... wondering what to eat, I call him up... here goes our conversation...

Me: hey, what's that one place you wanted me to try?
JL: which one? there's so many.
Me: the crab place.
JL: Oh, Thanh long.
Me: what should I get, or what do you recommend again?
JL: (with his sarcastic tone).. Uh.... Hel~lo? It's a crab place, so get the friggin crab you moron!
Me: uh yea, ok, thanks.
JL: hahahha, yea. its hella good... you won't regret it.
Me: thanx...
JL: aww man, you make me wanna go back just for that crab...i used to go there every other week, other than the few places in the marina i told ya about.
Me: well, it's your fault for moving out to the east coast...
JL: yea, i got sick of SF, been there, done that... don't ferget, get the f-in crab and the garlic noodles, k?
Me; for sure.
*convo continues*
  
we also shared their $7.95 grandma an's homemade old banana cake which is pretty much warm cake dipped in coconut milk, rim layered bananas w/vanilla ice cream. i wouldn't really order this again because it was a lil bit too much... and omg, i'm sucha dessert fanatic... there were others to choose from, but how could you resist that *homemade touch*... 

the line was just outta control, waiting 40 mins, with or without ressies... secret is, parkings pretty difficult, so get one person to put the name down while the other finds parking, so by the time you GET a decent parking spot, you're good to go!

there were at least, AT LEAST* 5-6 birthdays going on... and the crowd wasnt really strictly with asians..there were all sorts of people, big, small, yellow, purple, you name it. fun, friendly environment... 

this place = NOT CRAZY GOOD, BUT GOOD GOOD, but prepare to wear that bib and go crazy!! rawr!!

D
