excerpts: Garlic noodles =
Noodle (boil), ground garlic (lots), parmesan cheese, a little vinegar, and sugar.
That's about it.
Would be better if you add a little sliced chilli and sautee it with the garlic to before stir frying the noodle.
Ok, all that for 9.5 bucks?
4 pieces of tiny prawn on top of the gimmick garlic noodles... 31 bucks?
garlic noodles.author: Toto T.
garlic noodles.review:
Should be 0.5 stars.

Really nothing special.  Crab is good quality, but the recipes pretty simple - no 'secret' spice.

Garlic noodles = Noodle (boil), ground garlic (lots), parmesan cheese, a little vinegar, and sugar.  That's about it.  Would be better if you add a little sliced chilli and sautee it with the garlic to before stir frying the noodle.  Ok, all that for 9.5 bucks?  Pretty ridiculous aye.

The drunken crab... you shouldn't put that much liquid into steaming the crab.  The crab itself has a lot of flavors that can come out naturally.  It's seriously, just a bit of cheap white wine + pepper... 35 bucks?  Chardonnay?  Damn, you should use Fa Tiu instead

Lastly, we have the JUMBO tiger prawns.  Jumbo my ass.  The head is missing, and that's most probably because they are using frozen prawn, hence the head would be black rather than filled with red prawn innards.  4 pieces of tiny prawn on top of the gimmick garlic noodles... 31 bucks?  My goodness.

Refrain from coming here, the waiter is a joke also.  Have a great day.

excerpts: Garlic noodles and roasted crab!
everything else is just as good.... but haven't tried ALL of it yet!

garlic noodles.review: little bit out of they way, but worth the drive!  Garlic noodles and roasted crab!  everything else is just as good.... but haven't tried ALL of it yet!

excerpts: Of course, I had the Crab and Garlic noodles.

On a 10 scale of garlicy-ness, the noodles were 10/10.

excerpts: garlic noodles were good, but not $10 good.
portions were absolutely tiny for something so simple to make.
but considering the pricing again, i would at least expect to see a little more attractiveness to the display of food.
like a mint or parsley for decoration on the noodles, rather than noodles slapped on a plate.
definitely not coming back.
garlic noodles.author: jon a.
garlic noodles.review: had just eaten here and i think its ok. everyone seems to say this place is to die for when it comes to crabs. and i can honestly say that i wasnt blown away, nor astonished. im no crab expert, but i do know how exquisite seafood tastes like. and sadly, this wasnt it. for $40 a crab, i was quite disappointed. the crab was not live crab, considering the price. it was a little bland, whereas fresh steamed crab with no seasoning at higher end buffets seemed to have more taste. garlic noodles were good, but not $10 good. portions were absolutely tiny for something so simple to make. but considering the pricing again, i would at least expect to see a little more attractiveness to the display of food. like a mint or parsley for decoration on the noodles, rather than noodles slapped on a plate. definitely not coming back.

excerpts: Just something about garlic noodles and crab.
We excitedly ordered the seafood dumplings to start, garlic noodles and roasted crab as the main entrees, and the molten lava chocolate cake w/ "gelato" as dessert.
- garlic noodles - were every bit as garlicky and oily as other reviewers as presented.
What they haven't mentioned was that it's presented as a dull lifeless dish.
Looks like chowmein with nothing on it, on a drab white plate as if it was prepared in bulk.
Tasted like it too.
garlic noodles.author: Peter H.
garlic noodles.review:
I actually hadn't heard that much about this place prior to going. Just something about garlic noodles and crab.

We excitedly ordered the seafood dumplings to start, garlic noodles and roasted crab as the main entrees, and the molten lava chocolate cake w/ "gelato" as dessert.

- seafood dumplings - were terrible. Mushy, overcooked. Something you would imagine a college student boiling frozen dumplings and putting out. One order has five pieces. Garnished with carrot slices and a dipping sauce.

- garlic noodles - were every bit as garlicky and oily as other reviewers as presented. What they haven't mentioned was that it's presented as a dull lifeless dish. Looks like chowmein with nothing on it, on a drab white plate as if it was prepared in bulk. Tasted like it too. One plate will serve two.

- roasted crab - I don't know if it was just our crab, but this thing was looked like it was rolled in black pepper. Sure, the description says salt and pepper, but this was ridiculous. I think the top of the pepper shaker fell off? Once you got past that, the crab was moist and succulent with garlic and butter. Again, one order will serve two.

- molten lava chocolate cake - Everyone knows that dessert is the last thing you remember about a meal, because it's the last thing served. The menu mentioned "molten lava chocolate cake" with "gelato". For one, there was no gelato. Vanilla ice cream was served. The waiter did not bother mention that until after it was served. Secondly, there was no "molten lava" anything. The cook must have taken the no-bake approach with a cold cake cup, hollowed out, and poured cold chocolate syrup into the hollow. This is a total disservice to the restaurant/menu.

excerpts: roast crab and garlic noodles seem to be the main specialty here and for good reason.
food was really good.
service was excellent.
from the outside the place looks like crap but once you go in it's alright.
parking might be impossible.
make sure you put down a reservation b/c this place gets packed.
heads up: this place is a bit on the pricier side.

garlic noodles.review: roast crab and garlic noodles seem to be the main specialty here and for good reason. food was really good. service was excellent. from the outside the place looks like crap but once you go in it's alright. parking might be impossible. make sure you put down a reservation b/c this place gets packed. heads up: this place is a bit on the pricier side.

excerpts: Had to get the crab and the garlic noodles based on reviews
and I was so happy I did
, it was brilliant!
The crab was delectable and as you pick through the meat and the crab meat falls into the garlic noodles the combo is mind blowing!

I thought the noodles looked less than stellar but at first wiff and taste they were more than stellar, and I am always a fan of a good excuse to wear a bid, lick my fingers, and suck crab meat out of its shell!
I hope everyone I know goes here
I have told many people and some have!
It is amazing!

I thought the noodles looked less than stellar but at first wiff and taste they were more than stellar, and I am always a fan of a good excuse to wear a bid, lick my fingers, and suck crab meat out of its shell! excerpts: The best friggin roasted crab and garlic noodles ever.
The same recipes as Crustacean
but I prefer the lower key and less stuffy location at Thanh Long.
garlic noodles.author: Jim C.
garlic noodles.review: The best friggin roasted crab and garlic noodles ever. The same recipes as Crustacean but I prefer the lower key and less stuffy location at Thanh Long.

excerpts: Between the 4 of us, we had the soft shell crab appetizer, a roast crab, a drunken crab, 2 orders of garlic noodles, and the "peasant's favorite.
The soft shell crab was tasty with the tamarind sauce, but it was a bit small for $12.
The roast crab was garlicky & buttery, with the meat juicy and fresh.
The drunken crab was unfortunately on the bland and dry side, despite its wet-sounding name.
The garlic noodles were a hit all around, and our hands got so greasy from the crab that we just ate the noodles with our hands as well.
Good thing we were seated in a back corner, far way from the disapproving eyes of polite company.
P
The pork in the "peasant's favorite" clay pot was tender and well-marinated.
Everything was tasty but on the pricey side.
Market price for crab that day was ~$40, and the small portion of pork was $17 or so.
We dropped $40 each and walked out satiated but not stuffed.
garlic noodles.author: Lillian L.
garlic noodles.review:
This was where I brought my bff and our respective bfs for the bachelorette party I planned for my teeth. I wanted to be able to savagely chomp into luscious limbs of crab (who needs crustacean crackers when you've got bicuspids?) while my teeth were still free of metal fetters.

Between the 4 of us, we had the soft shell crab appetizer, a roast crab, a drunken crab, 2 orders of garlic noodles, and the "peasant's favorite." The soft shell crab was tasty with the tamarind sauce, but it was a bit small for $12. The roast crab was garlicky & buttery, with the meat juicy and fresh. The drunken crab was unfortunately on the bland and dry side, despite its wet-sounding name. The garlic noodles were a hit all around, and our hands got so greasy from the crab that we just ate the noodles with our hands as well. Good thing we were seated in a back corner, far way from the disapproving eyes of polite company. =P The pork in the "peasant's favorite" clay pot was tender and well-marinated. Everything was tasty but on the pricey side. Market price for crab that day was ~$40, and the small portion of pork was $17 or so. We dropped $40 each and walked out satiated but not stuffed.

excerpts: And the garlic noodles?
Think chow mein noodles served in a sauce composed primarily of garlic and butter.
Not so bad, you say?
Imagine that dish served *cold.
No, not tepid, not lukewarm, but a nice, clammy-handshake-with-your-near-bucket-kicking-great-uncle cold.
Noodles sticking together in one fat lump with butter solidifying around them?
No thanks.
garlic noodles.author: Kerry N.
garlic noodles.review:
I must say, this place is completely overrated.

The meal started off well-- the seafood bouillabaisse was spot on with the perfect amount of tamarind, a good amount of heat, and a strong hit of lemongrass. Drunken crab was well seasoned and fragrant, but it was served cold and didn't taste as fresh as many other upscale seafood joints. And the garlic noodles? Think chow mein noodles served in a sauce composed primarily of garlic and butter. Not so bad, you say? Imagine that dish served *cold.* No, not tepid, not lukewarm, but a nice, clammy-handshake-with-your-near-bucket-kicking-great-uncle cold. Noodles sticking together in one fat lump with butter solidifying around them? No thanks.

excerpts: But ohh the garlic noodles were so good!!

I love this place.  Because of the early problems that stunted the crab season, I have not been here since early 2007.  Thus, my review may not be the most up-to-date but from the several times that I came here, I also enjoyed the food.  

Typically, I order my own crab and share a plate of garlic noodles.  That's pretty much enough to fill me up.  I love crab and Thanh Long cooks it in a unique manner.  The atmosphere is fairly casual but you can dress up.  However, you may regret that after you start digging into the crab.  

Come for the crab and noodles.  You will not regret it!

excerpts: Over 15 years ago, this was the first time I had tried the famous garlic noodles, and I still remember the day.
Although a bit on the pricey side for noodles, its definitely worth trying.
Make sure you order plenty for the table because it will get eaten up quickly.
I also usually order the beef dish, its tender and tasty.
Like I said, the food is very flavorful.
Unfortunately I am not a crab-eater and prefer my meat already pulled.
Despite that, I've order several of the crab dishes (garlic and drunken) before.
These crabs are Gi-normous!
Its difficult to find giant sized crabs in the super market.
They also have  a nice selection of alcoholic drinks to go along with the atmosphere.
The service is exceptional and very accommodating.
Make reservations since it gets busy at peak hours/holidays.
garlic noodles.author: S F.
garlic noodles.review: This place is a gem in the Outer Sunset District.  I've been there off and on over the years, the food has always been very flavorful.  Many people rave about the butter garlic noodle.  Over 15 years ago, this was the first time I had tried the famous garlic noodles, and I still remember the day.  Although a bit on the pricey side for noodles, its definitely worth trying.  Make sure you order plenty for the table because it will get eaten up quickly.  I also usually order the beef dish, its tender and tasty.  Like I said, the food is very flavorful.  Unfortunately I am not a crab-eater and prefer my meat already pulled.  Despite that, I've order several of the crab dishes (garlic and drunken) before.  These crabs are Gi-normous!  Its difficult to find giant sized crabs in the super market.  They also have  a nice selection of alcoholic drinks to go along with the atmosphere.  The service is exceptional and very accommodating.   Make reservations since it gets busy at peak hours/holidays.

garlic noodles.review: This place is overrated. Although they offer great variety of seafood, I find that most of their entree was bland and simple. I do love the garlic noodles though but as far as everything else, portions are not worth the price.

excerpts: We ordered the crab, the stuffed calamari, and garlic noodles.
The food was good but the calarmari stuffing was too salty.

You should only eat in strict moderation.
I would not recommend frequenting this restaurant more than once a year.

excerpts: but i must say that the butter roasted crab and garlic noodles by far are the best items on their menu....
the best ive ever had period..and ive been all over the US getting my epicurian feasts while in business its just theirs is better..
it just is.
If youre a crab/seafood lover like me, you definitely cannot miss Than Long.
Ive been here about 7 times within the past year and ive never had a bad experience yet.
5 judochops in my book!
garlic noodles.author: Dustin G.
garlic noodles.review: I love seafood...eating here is a must especially if you are close the GGpark and Ocean Beach area. Parking sucks due to the limited spots on the street. Valet is available though for a fee. Very trendy bar/restaurant in the heart of tourist city..If youve been to Crustaceans then the food here is very similar..(The same owners!) Definitely not a shorts and flip flops joint. The building decor are done very sf like and not the typical vietnamese restaurant flair that you would see in downtown..two floors with a long bar well stocked downstairs. I hate to be part of the collective but i must say that the butter roasted crab and garlic noodles by far are the best items on their menu....the best ive ever had period..and ive been all over the US getting my epicurian feasts while in business its just theirs is better..it just is.  If youre a crab/seafood lover like me, you definitely cannot miss Than Long. Ive been here about 7 times within the past year and ive never had a bad experience yet. 5 judochops in my book! (:

excerpts: Pair it with the garlic noodles and, oh, my friends, you have heaven.

Salty, buttery, delicious goodness!!  The roasted crab here is redonkulous.  It is literally finger-licking good.  Thank goodness for the bib that they give you, because you will not be able to stop yourself from going to town on the crab.  Pair it with the garlic noodles and, oh, my friends, you have heaven.

Make sure to make reservations if you go on the weekends though, otherwise you will be in for a long wait, and will be subjected to the amazing aromas while you wait.

garlic noodles.review: If you like garlic give your self the garlic one two punch at Thanh Long.  Garlic noodles and Garlic Roasted crab are all I have to say.  Yummy.

excerpts: There are two things on this menu that you must order if you come here - The roast crab and garlic noodles.
Everything else on the menu pales in comparison to these items.
I have been here a couple times
and I've enjoyed it more and more with each visit.
I can definitely say that I've never had any garlic noodles that has even comes close to Thanh Long's garlic noodles.
Although you will pay the price because you will still wake up with your breath still smelling like garlic!
The price for a whole crab is also not bad compared to other places in the city.
The one thing I love about this place is that they cook the crab in simple flavors.
Nothing that will take away from the original flavor of the crabs but ingredients that will only enhance it.
Five stars for Thanh Long!
I will be coming back here for a very long time.

Not as visually enticing inside as its clone Crustacean on California, but has a more laid-back vibe (you better reserve ahead of time though, unless you want to freeze in the Ocean Beach cold), although parking is somewhat of a hassle so just pony up and valet to save 15 minutes of your life.

excerpts: garlic noodles (9.50) -
it was okay
garlic noodles.author: Edith L.
garlic noodles.review:
one star for atmosphere
one star for service
one star for effort

we had the calamari for appetizer (10.95) - it was good but nothing to brag about.  

roasted crab (35.95) - it was just a crab soaked in oil and pepper...PPQ was sooo much better...it had actual garlic taste on the crab...thanh long none of the garlic taste at all....

garlic noodles (9.50) - it was okay but again not enough garlic taste and portions is kind of small....

we only came here because PPQ was closed on Tuesday and we will probably not go back.  However, their service was excellent and the atmosphere nice. and I gave them a star because they really tried.

excerpts: Ambiance is very nice, but IMHO, the food is great  but  it comes in 2nd to PPQ...not as addicting and plus, they don't have a combo for 2 for $50 like PPQ has, so you end up spending a little more for the rolls, crab, garlic noodles and dessert.
garlic noodles.author: Valerie P.
garlic noodles.review: Ambiance is very nice, but IMHO, the food is great  but  it comes in 2nd to PPQ...not as addicting and plus, they don't have a combo for 2 for $50 like PPQ has, so you end up spending a little more for the rolls, crab, garlic noodles and dessert.

excerpts: I would give this 2.5 stars, but had to go with three solely based on the garlic noodles.
I heard great things about this place, but was thoroughly disappointed after going.
I've been to Crustacean many times and this place doesn't hold a candle.
Why drive out to the boonies of SF to get a second rate Crustacean experience I say - same darn crab and noodles.
We ordered the "colossal shrimp" in addition to the crab and they were nothing close to colossal.
When I hear the word colossal I expect something prehistorically large.
These were big, jumbo, large or full-size - definitely not COLOSSAL, gigantic, enormous or giant.
I actually wrote them an email with some alternatives to the word colossal, because it was so misleading.
garlic noodles.author: Mike C.
garlic noodles.review: I would give this 2.5 stars, but had to go with three solely based on the garlic noodles. I heard great things about this place, but was thoroughly disappointed after going. I've been to Crustacean many times and this place doesn't hold a candle. Why drive out to the boonies of SF to get a second rate Crustacean experience I say - same darn crab and noodles. We ordered the "colossal shrimp" in addition to the crab and they were nothing close to colossal. When I hear the word colossal I expect something prehistorically large. These were big, jumbo, large or full-size - definitely not COLOSSAL, gigantic, enormous or giant. I actually wrote them an email with some alternatives to the word colossal, because it was so misleading.

excerpts: I recommend the garlic noodles and the drunken crab.
The roasted crab is good too
but tad buttery for me.
Of course it is overpriced but worth it on special occasions.
I've been to Crustacean in Beverly Hills and I still prefer this original location.
garlic noodles.author: Brendan A.
garlic noodles.review: I used to live around the corner from this place.  Definetly a weird location for a restaurant of this caliber.  I recommend the garlic noodles and the drunken crab.  The roasted crab is good too but tad buttery for me.  Of course it is overpriced but worth it on special occasions.  I've been to Crustacean in Beverly Hills and I still prefer this original location.

excerpts: Their garlic noodles are to die for, and I would love to see them open a booth at the non-garlicky Gilroy Garlic Festival.
They've got my vote!
garlic noodles.author: Vera D.
garlic noodles.review: I've never gotten a chance to eat at Thanh Long but for the second year in a row, I've gone to Asian Pacific Islander Health Forum's Food For Thought and Thanh Long is one of the contributin restaurant sponsors.  Their garlic noodles are to die for, and I would love to see them open a booth at the non-garlicky Gilroy Garlic Festival.  They've got my vote!

excerpts: i ordered the prawns on a bed of garlic noodles.
EEEKKK!
ok prawns were good but the garlic noodles.
seriously this place has THE BEST garlic noodles.
mmmm garlic noodles.
i would eat em all night if they didn't give me dragon breath for days...
garlic noodles.author: Bobbie L.
garlic noodles.review:
went to thanh long for din last night. haven't gone there in yearsss.. but i love the new remodel! its so fancy!!

the food is delicious!! mmmmm believe it or not... (and i'm sure you believe it...) i am too lazy to bother with eating crab. plus i had a really bad paper cut on my finger. my family loves the crab. i ordered the prawns on a bed of garlic noodles. EEEKKK! ok prawns were good but the garlic noodles. seriously this place has THE BEST garlic noodles.

i like this place better than crustacean... you should mos' def' check it out. mmmm garlic noodles. i would eat em all night if they didn't give me dragon breath for days...

excerpts: Garlic noodles are good, but nothing spectacular.
Is it just me, or does no one else realize that the crab is cooked in what appears to be lard or shortening!
Haven't anyone noticed that the pool of "butter" turns solid once the plate cools down.
garlic noodles.author: H G.
garlic noodles.review: What can I say that hasn't been said.  Crab taste delicious!  Garlic noodles are good, but nothing spectacular.  Is it just me, or does no one else realize that the crab is cooked in what appears to be lard or shortening!  Haven't anyone noticed that the pool of "butter" turns solid once the plate cools down.

excerpts: We ordered garlic crab, tiger prawns, shaking beef, mango salad, crab wontons, calamari, and of course the garlic noodles.
This time around, the food came out hot and the garlic noodles definitely tasted MUCH better.
The seafood mango salad was tasty, the shanking beef was very flavorful and the drinks & service was great.
garlic noodles.author: Linda L.
garlic noodles.review:
Update: 4/4/09 2.5 stars so, I'm rounding up.

Just had dinner here again this weekend. Since I live so close by, I had to give this place another try  and I want to beleive that it can do better. The food did improve, but just marginally.

We ordered garlic crab, tiger prawns, shaking beef, mango salad, crab wontons, calamari, and of course the garlic noodles. This time around, the food came out hot and the garlic noodles definitely tasted MUCH better. The seafood mango salad was tasty, the shanking beef was very flavorful and the drinks & service was great. 

Most of the food was overall pretty good, except for the crab. This place used to be known for their crab, so I am still disappointed that the crab majorly sucked. You can tell that it was frozen because there was some blue/green frost-bite to the crab meat when you removed the shell. Also, even though the crab was doused in butter and salt & pepper, the meat was very dry and bland. 

I would go here again, but I would order anything but the crab.

excerpts: We always order the same things...roasted crab, garlic noodles, garlic rice, and beef steak cubes or whatever you call it.
oh and appetizers are their salt & pepper calamari.
Damn I'm hungry now.
Love this place.
garlic noodles.author: Suzie T.
garlic noodles.review: I love their food!!! Crustaceans crab taste a lot fresher but Thanh Long's crab is still yummmmmmy!!! And their other entrees seem to taste better than Crustaceans. We always order the same things...roasted crab, garlic noodles, garlic rice, and beef steak cubes or whatever you call it. oh and appetizers are their salt & pepper calamari. Damn I'm hungry now. Love this place.

excerpts: Like everyone else, garlic noodles & crab.
A friend won a free dinner and limo ride, they're totally going to thanh long for free, I will probably be eating leftovers, I am quite jealous.
garlic noodles.author: Niki M.
garlic noodles.review: Like everyone else, garlic noodles & crab. A friend won a free dinner and limo ride, they're totally going to thanh long for free, I will probably be eating leftovers, I am quite jealous.

excerpts: The crab was overprice but the garlic noodles are YUMmmmmm although it is a little greasy.
garlic noodles.author: Ervinna L.
garlic noodles.review: The crab was overprice but the garlic noodles are YUMmmmmm although it is a little greasy.

excerpts: The crabs and the garlic noodles hit the right spot every time.
Also, try the mussles in asian pesto sauce!
YUM!
However, I can only takes doses of this place quarterly since it's soooo greasy.
In fact, I need to detox myself after dining there tonight!
garlic noodles.author: Jeannie L.
garlic noodles.review: The crabs and the garlic noodles hit the right spot every time.  Also, try the mussles in asian pesto sauce!  YUM!  However, I can only takes doses of this place quarterly since it's soooo greasy. In fact, I need to detox myself after dining there tonight!

excerpts: Garlic noodles were a hit and so were the yummy prawns.
The drinks were great as well.
It would be nice if the restaurant had more space.
It's quite a small area.
garlic noodles.author: Maricel B.
garlic noodles.review: If you don't factor in the wait time, this place isn't too bad. Garlic noodles were a hit and so were the yummy prawns. The drinks were great as well. It would be nice if the restaurant had more space. It's quite a small area.

excerpts:
So this is what I remember from the night's festivities, once the food coma wore off:
Salmon carpaccio, the Buddha roll, the prawn bouillabaisse, garlic noodles, the roast crab, tiger prawns and the steamed sea bass.
In a word, YUM.
Come hungry though, because you will want to indulge in all kinds of different flavors, and the menu is versatile enough to do so.

I got my salt from the yummy carpaccio, "fresh" from the spring roll-esque Buddha roll, tang from the bouillabaisse (though I will say I did not expect such a seemingly random selection of different veggies/fruit to taste good together...
I was kinda like, "um...why are there tomatoes and pineapple together to complement my seafood soup?
but it was actually pretty enjoyable), bitter (in a good way, though my breath was banging after all the garlic!)
from the noodles, and boredom from the main entrees.
the sea bass and the crab...
i guess i just wanted more flavor?
garlic noodles.author: Danielle D.
garlic noodles.review:
When my girls and I go out to eat, we EAT.
So this is what I remember from the night's festivities, once the food coma wore off:
Salmon carpaccio, the Buddha roll, the prawn bouillabaisse, garlic noodles, the roast crab, tiger prawns and the steamed sea bass. In a word, YUM. Come hungry though, because you will want to indulge in all kinds of different flavors, and the menu is versatile enough to do so. I got my salt from the yummy carpaccio, "fresh" from the spring roll-esque Buddha roll, tang from the bouillabaisse (though I will say I did not expect such a seemingly random selection of different veggies/fruit to taste good together...I was kinda like, "um...why are there tomatoes and pineapple together to complement my seafood soup?" but it was actually pretty enjoyable), bitter (in a good way, though my breath was banging after all the garlic!) from the noodles, and boredom from the main entrees. the sea bass and the crab...i guess i just wanted more flavor?... i ended up switching entrees with a friend though, and enjoyed her tiger prawns and a dish i don't recall for sure, but it was definitely chicken with veggies (now looking at the menu it must have been the lemongrass chicken), and it was like the comfort food I needed to end the meal in a happy place. 
I would head back though, and repeat my starters again, though the next time, I would probably try the drunken beef or crab to appeal my palate, which I tend to ignore in favor of the "safer" stuff.
Very good service as well, which always adds to the meal!

excerpts: But then again, it's that good - always get the Garlic Noodles ($10) and the Roasted Crab (MP: ~$35).
I've tried almost all of their appetizers and the ones I like are the Deep Fried Calamari ($9) and the Fried Rolls ($7.5) -
this place can be rather unhealthy.
For dessert, we definitely go for the Deep Fried Ice Cream as well.
I don't bother with the entrees because that's pointless fodder.
It gets messy so it might not be good for a first date, but definitely a fun one for the future - if you don't mind minimizing conversation and having garlic marinated into your epidermis.
Service is very nice and pretty fast, despite always being full and busy.
Wanted to give it 5 stars, but couldn't because the menu never changes.
garlic noodles.author: Tsubasa O.
garlic noodles.review:
If I want good crab, there's no other place besides Thanh Long. That being said, I always end up getting the same thing, and coming here over 8 years, it's starting to get a little bit dull on the selection.  But then again, it's that good - always get the Garlic Noodles ($10) and the Roasted Crab (MP: ~$35). I've tried almost all of their appetizers and the ones I like are the Deep Fried Calamari ($9) and the Fried Rolls ($7.5) - this place can be rather unhealthy. For dessert, we definitely go for the Deep Fried Ice Cream as well. I don't bother with the entrees because that's pointless fodder. It gets messy so it might not be good for a first date, but definitely a fun one for the future - if you don't mind minimizing conversation and having garlic marinated into your epidermis.  Service is very nice and pretty fast, despite always being full and busy. Wanted to give it 5 stars, but couldn't because the menu never changes. I give it 4.5 stars.

Reservations are a must and parking is a big time pain; valet parking is worth it, and as of yesterday it was $10.

excerpts: The garlic noodles everyone raves about are deserving of the high praise and the generous portion should be split by two.
This a must to compliment any entree.
If the halibut is available do not miss this is the most delectable morsel...
The food at Thanh Long is worthy of making it a destination.
garlic noodles.author: susea c.
garlic noodles.review: The garlic noodles everyone raves about are deserving of the high praise and the generous portion should be split by two. This a must to compliment any entree. If the halibut is available do not miss this is the most delectable morsel... The food at Thanh Long is worthy of making it a destination.

excerpts: I have been eating here since 2000 and love the crab and garlic noodles.
I stopped looking at the menu after my second time, all I order is the garlic crab, garlic noodles, and white rice.
I don't know what sauce they use
but OMG!
it is SOoooooo good
and I never get tired of it .
There is a lot of garlic in it though so bring mints, just kidding it won't help.
I used to look forward to the service because years ago it was consistently really good.
I still get good servers, but last Valentines day the waiter was a dick.
ON VALENTINE'S DAY.
whatever I just did not tip him as much, and I tip pretty good
cuz I've been a waitress and appreciate how hard they work.
Overall I love this place and will keep coming.
The dessert is really really good, too.
garlic noodles.author: Summer T.
garlic noodles.review: I have been eating here since 2000 and love the crab and garlic noodles.  I stopped looking at the menu after my second time, all I order is the garlic crab, garlic noodles, and white rice.  I don't know what sauce they use but OMG! it is SOoooooo good and I never get tired of it . There is a lot of garlic in it though so bring mints, just kidding it won't help.  I used to look forward to the service because years ago it was consistently really good.  I still get good servers, but last Valentines day the waiter was a dick.  ON VALENTINE'S DAY.  whatever I just did not tip him as much, and I tip pretty good cuz I've been a waitress and appreciate how hard they work.  Overall I love this place and will keep coming.  The dessert is really really good, too.

excerpts: I got the roast crab and garlic noodles, and it was so wonderful.
I also had some kind of lychee cocktail that was so refreshing and light.
Oh yeah
the servers were the best .....
Oh if only they  had a location in the East bay.
garlic noodles.author: nik e.
garlic noodles.review: I LOVE me some crab!!!! I got the roast crab and garlic noodles, and it was so wonderful. I also had some kind of lychee cocktail that was so refreshing and light. Oh yeah the servers were the best ..... Oh if only they  had a location in the East bay.

excerpts: I went here with my husband while vacationing to San Fran and we ordered the typical roasted crab and garlic noodles and both were amazing.
When they laid down our plates we immediately started eating
and I do not think we spoke until 30 minutes later.
I love, love, love crab
and I was pushing myself to finish an entire crab on my own and wish that I could have eaten more of the noodles.

Unless you are mentally prepared to cram yourself silly with mass amounts of crab I would suggest splitting one crab and the garlic noodles and maybe order something else to give a diversity to all of the garlicky flavor.
After we were full of crab and had butter dripping down our arms I almost felt drunk of garlic and butter
HAHA seriously.
It was our favorite dinner during our trip and would recommend!
garlic noodles.author: Jaclyn H.
garlic noodles.review: Can't really say anything else that has not already been said.  This place is delicious!! I went here with my husband while vacationing to San Fran and we ordered the typical roasted crab and garlic noodles and both were amazing. When they laid down our plates we immediately started eating and I do not think we spoke until 30 minutes later.  I love, love, love crab and I was pushing myself to finish an entire crab on my own and wish that I could have eaten more of the noodles.  Unless you are mentally prepared to cram yourself silly with mass amounts of crab I would suggest splitting one crab and the garlic noodles and maybe order something else to give a diversity to all of the garlicky flavor. After we were full of crab and had butter dripping down our arms I almost felt drunk of garlic and butter HAHA seriously.  It was our favorite dinner during our trip and would recommend!

excerpts: Take the N Judah all the way to the end (or valet) and there it is... the best crab and garlic noodles of your life.
Amazing.
garlic noodles.author: simple g.
garlic noodles.review: Take the N Judah all the way to the end (or valet) and there it is... the best crab and garlic noodles of your life.   Amazing.

excerpts: when i go there i always order the roasted crab and garlic noodles.
Just for myself...
NO SHARING ALLOWED!!
haha
Wash that down with a lychee martini
and you are set to walk to your car which is parked 3 blocks away...
garlic noodles.author: Cherry L.
garlic noodles.review: oh man can you say YUM!?!  Excellent!! when i go there i always order the roasted crab and garlic noodles.  Just for myself... NO SHARING ALLOWED!!  haha Wash that down with a lychee martini and you are set to walk to your car which is parked 3 blocks away...

excerpts: The spicy salty calamari, garlic noodles x 2, sea bass, roasted crab x 2, tender beef and coconut shrimp.
For the price, the portions are too small.
The sea bass was a disappointment as the fish was overcooked and chewy.
For garlic noodles at $10.50 ea and nothing else in it?
Too much to pay.
The bill totaled about $215 and that is without tip.
Would I come back?
Not sure as parking wasn't convenient either.
For those who don't mind, you can pay for valet which is $10.
One thing that I did like about this place is that we had reservations and they were busy when we got there.
They honored it on time.
That's rare!
garlic noodles.author: m c.
garlic noodles.review: Friends took us here.  Had the roasted crab. Yummy.  The spicy salty calamari, garlic noodles x 2, sea bass, roasted crab x 2, tender beef and coconut shrimp.  For the price, the portions are too small.  The sea bass was a disappointment as the fish was overcooked and chewy.  For garlic noodles at $10.50 ea and nothing else in it?  Too much to pay.  The bill totaled about $215 and that is without tip.  Would I come back?  Not sure as parking wasn't convenient either.  For those who don't mind, you can pay for valet which is $10. One thing that I did like about this place is that we had reservations and they were busy when we got there.  They honored it on time.  That's rare!

excerpts: I told her to try the garlic noodles with prawns at thanh longs and she loved it.
I remember the place being dim and crowded inside.
I hear voices the garlic noodles and prawns are calling my name.
I plan on going back soon with the wife.
garlic noodles.author: Freddy B.
garlic noodles.review: It's been awhile since I been back to Thanh Long. My daughter asked me a couple of weeks ago when she was in the sf area where would be a good place to get a bite to eat on a friday night.  I told her to try the garlic noodles with prawns at thanh longs and she loved it. I remember the place being dim and crowded inside.  I hear voices the garlic noodles and prawns are calling my name. I plan on going back soon with the wife.

excerpts: They're garlic noodles and roast crab are to die for!
And they're fried banana with mango or vanilla ice cream
is delicious!
I highly suggest this restaurant.
Kinda on the pricey side, that's why my boyfriend and I only come here to celebrate anniversaries or birthdays.
MMM
I'm craving for some RIGHT NOW!
garlic noodles.author: Stephanie G.
garlic noodles.review: My FAVORITE restaurant!  Food and service are great!  They're garlic noodles and roast crab are to die for!  And they're fried banana with mango or vanilla ice cream is delicious!  I highly suggest this restaurant.  Kinda on the pricey side, that's why my boyfriend and I only come here to celebrate anniversaries or birthdays.  MMM I'm craving for some RIGHT NOW!

excerpts: I know the An Family is the owner for both and they're supposed to have the same garlic noodles and same crab but for some reason, Crustacean just tastes so much better for as well as have a nicer ambiance.
Despite the neighborhood, I prefer Crustacean
garlic noodles.author: Lauren S.
garlic noodles.review: I don't know why I like CRUSTECEAN better.  I know the An Family is the owner for both and they're supposed to have the same garlic noodles and same crab but for some reason, Crustacean just tastes so much better for as well as have a nicer ambiance.  Despite the neighborhood, I prefer Crustacean

excerpts: No one can beat the garlic noodles and roasted crab..
Not the most healthiest meal
but oh,sooo good...
Be prepared to bring extra breath mints for after...
garlic noodles.author: Trish P.
garlic noodles.review: No one can beat the garlic noodles and roasted crab.. Not the most healthiest meal but oh,sooo good... Be prepared to bring extra breath mints for after...

excerpts: All you need to order is the crab and garlic noodles and you'll be in heaven.
At least, I am always in heaven when I order these two items off the menu.
Then again, maybe I'm biased because I love crab!
It's a bit on the pricey side, about $35 for a big ole crab.
You can split an order of garlic noodles if you are with a friend, but I tend to get selfish and get my own noodles even though I can't ever finish it all by myself.
garlic noodles.author: stacy k.
garlic noodles.review: All you need to order is the crab and garlic noodles and you'll be in heaven. At least, I am always in heaven when I order these two items off the menu. Then again, maybe I'm biased because I love crab! It's a bit on the pricey side, about $35 for a big ole crab. You can split an order of garlic noodles if you are with a friend, but I tend to get selfish and get my own noodles even though I can't ever finish it all by myself.

excerpts: Garlic crab, garlic noodles and this saucy eggplant dish recommended by the waitress.
All de-lish!
I remember when Thanh Long was this dumpy, hole-in-the-wall place with a line out the door.
Now it's upscale but still crowded.
The food is great, then and now.
The only caveat is, eat your crab and noodles fast - once it all cools and congeals, it's not attractive!
Otherwise, it's SO YUM!
garlic noodles.author: L W.
garlic noodles.review: Garlic crab, garlic noodles and this saucy eggplant dish recommended by the waitress.  All de-lish!  I remember when Thanh Long was this dumpy, hole-in-the-wall place with a line out the door.  Now it's upscale but still crowded.  The food is great, then and now.  The only caveat is, eat your crab and noodles fast - once it all cools and congeals, it's not attractive!  Otherwise, it's SO YUM!

excerpts: i love to have roast crab and garlic noodles with hot sauce.
god.
it was awesome taste.
just melt in my mouth. so delicious~~
garlic noodles.author: Jane K.
garlic noodles.review:
i love to have roast crab and garlic noodles with hot sauce.
god. it was awesome taste. just melt in my mouth. so delicious~~

excerpts: They are famous for their garlic butter crab and garlic noodles.
They definitely go hand in hand.
And if I had my choice, would have ordered a whole crab for myself.
I couldn't believe how many people flocked all the way out there for this crab.
Definitely worth the trip!
garlic noodles.author: Josephine H.
garlic noodles.review: I had never heard of this place until recently but learned the spin off sister restaurant is Crustracean, which is right in my backyard. We decided to trek all the way out to the original and good thing we made reservations! This place was beyond packed. They are famous for their garlic butter crab and garlic noodles. They definitely go hand in hand. And if I had my choice, would have ordered a whole crab for myself. I couldn't believe how many people flocked all the way out there for this crab. Definitely worth the trip!

excerpts: The garlic noodles indeed have some crack-like attributes, as noted by other yelpers.
The Vietnamese salad we had was fresh and tasty, but I suspect de-chile'd for the largely non-Asian clientele, and therefore not as good as it could have been.
Sea Bass was also outstanding, buttery and perfect, with a lovely ginger fruit sauce accompanying it.
Bo Luc Lac
The crab and garlic noodles are what really make it, though.
garlic noodles.author: Jes H.
garlic noodles.review: The roasted crab is pretty much insanely delicious, but pricey.  The garlic noodles indeed have some crack-like attributes, as noted by other yelpers.  The Vietnamese salad we had was fresh and tasty, but I suspect de-chile'd for the largely non-Asian clientele, and therefore not as good as it could have been.  Sea Bass was also outstanding, buttery and perfect, with a lovely ginger fruit sauce accompanying it.  Bo Luc Lac (Shaken Beef) is only okay - Slanted Door and even Bodega Bistro do it better.  The crab and garlic noodles are what really make it, though.

excerpts: but I just have two words: GARLIC NOODLES.
Only THE best garlic noodles ever- if you don't know, now you know.
Oh and the seafood is pretty good too.
A nice option for when you want to splurge on a nice dinner.
And once you've had those garlic noodles, you will want to come back for more.
It's just not the same anywhere else.
garlic noodles.author: Ivy P.
garlic noodles.review: Ok, so parking sucks, and it's pretty damn pricy but I just have two words: GARLIC NOODLES. Only THE best garlic noodles ever- if you don't know, now you know. Oh and the seafood is pretty good too. A nice option for when you want to splurge on a nice dinner. And once you've had those garlic noodles, you will want to come back for more. It's just not the same anywhere else.

excerpts: Yummy Garlic Noodles and Roasted Crab!!
garlic noodles.author: A W.
garlic noodles.review: Yummy Garlic Noodles and Roasted Crab!! Also had the mussels and salmon carpaccio appetizers and that was great also. Everything was really good here, including the service - attentive, but not annoying. If you order anything with shells, i.e. mussels or the crab, they put some bowls on the table for you to put the shells in and they change or take away the bowls on such a consistent basis that we never had a bowl full of shells on our table. Loved it & would definitely return.

excerpts: the garlic noodles are flavorful and not nearly as drenched in butter as the ones at crustacean.
garlic noodles.author: Rose J.
garlic noodles.review:
i went to thanh long's sister restaurant crustacean a little tipsy, so i needed to come here for a true comparison.

sober, the food is just ok.  i love crab and i especially love their natural flavors.  we order the roast crab and drunken crab and both were overcooked.  the seasonings were complimentary, but alone the roast would have been too salty and the drunken too sweet.  the garlic noodles are flavorful and not nearly as drenched in butter as the ones at crustacean.  the 2nd time around, i'm still not a big fan, because they come out too mushy and once you finish working on the crabs, they become too clumpy.

other than that, my infused drink was great, the service was good.  it wasn't too packed even when we went on a friday night.  for most people this place is fabulous.  for me i'm taking my money to aqua where they will never overcook my seafood.

excerpts: Roasted crab and garlic noodles.
YUMMM!
!!!! Try making reservations first otherwise you'll be stuck waiting in their cramped waiting area.
Also, come early because parking is terrible unless you're willing to pay for valet.
garlic noodles.author: Holly P.
garlic noodles.review: I LOOOOOVE THIS PLACE! My boyfriend and I usually pig out on a crab each but lately I got him to share one. Roasted crab and garlic noodles. YUMMM!!!!! Try making reservations first otherwise you'll be stuck waiting in their cramped waiting area. Also, come early because parking is terrible unless you're willing to pay for valet.

excerpts: The garlic noodles weren't as good as I expected, I read a lot of reviews and got recommendations but it just wasn't great.
The crab was bad, it wasn't even fresh.
The only thing that was good was the steak cubes, can't remember which dish it was.
I would rather go PPQ...
garlic noodles.author: Kygia B.
garlic noodles.review: I took my parents out for my dad's birthday.. First off, we couldn't find the restaurant because it doesn't even like one from the outside... parking was very difficult. Anyways, the restaurant inside was pretty nice and the service was alright.. But this place is not compared to PPQ Dungeness. The garlic noodles weren't as good as I expected, I read a lot of reviews and got recommendations but it just wasn't great. The crab was bad, it wasn't even fresh. The only thing that was good was the steak cubes, can't remember which dish it was. I would rather go PPQ...

excerpts: yummy crab and noodle.those two are a must and the garlic noodles is not on the menu but you could order it.

we even asked for vinegar dip (filipino thing) it's pricey & a little crowded! 
best crustaceans is in beverly hills!!!
beautiful there!
but if youre just up for the food and not the atmosphere then any of their restaurants will do!
garlic noodles.author: emily p.
garlic noodles.review:
yummy crab and noodle.those two are a must and the garlic noodles is not on the menu but you could order it. we even asked for vinegar dip (filipino thing) it's pricey & a little crowded! 
best crustaceans is in beverly hills!!! beautiful there! but if youre just up for the food and not the atmosphere then any of their restaurants will do!

excerpts: [one of] my last meal(s) on earth: CRAB WITH GARLIC NOODLES
as for the garlic noodles, i think PPQ's taste better.
we also ordered these appetizers: shrimp rolls (they were really good.
you only get like 5 or 6), crab puffs (they were good too!!
but i couldnt really taste any crab.
AND you have to buy garlic noodles?!
i can just go to PPQ and get a dinner-for-2 special!
for $50 you get one crab, garlic noodles, dessert, a salad, and egg rolls!
now thats a fucking deal!
but  i really like this place.
their food is very tasty and their service is great.
i'll definately be back.
garlic noodles.author: B B.
garlic noodles.review:
[one of] my last meal(s) on earth: CRAB WITH GARLIC NOODLES

so i'm getting my wisdom teeth pulled out tomorow. and this actually feels like one of my last meals on earth. i am NOT looking forward to eating soft foods for one week! but i AM looking forward to the vicodin! hahah. jk. i love crab so i knew i had to eat it before my wisdom teeth extraction.  i made sure i stuffed myself the whole night. i ate as if i were a starving child from a third world country! i made sure i ate EVERYTHING we ordered! actually, i lied. we ordered dessert and i couldnt finish it all. i left some fried bananas and mango sorbet. i bet those starving children would be throwing rocks at me if they heard me say that.

the crab here was off the heezay!!!  i loved it! we had the roasted crab. i think it actually taste better than PPQ. as for the garlic noodles, i think PPQ's taste better. we also ordered these appetizers: shrimp rolls (they were really good. you only get like 5 or 6), crab puffs (they were good too!! but i couldnt really taste any crab. all i tasted was cream cheese), and soft shell crab (YUM! i just wish they gave us more). all of the appetizers  were really good.  but for $10 a pop,  fuck that! i better be getting some big ass portions!! the appetizers were a bit overpriced for what it was. we also had  salad. i think it was the vietnamese salad. the salad was just 'okay.' and lastly, dessert! we ordered the fried banana w/ mango sorbet. the mango sorbet was delicious! the fried banana had too much breading.

if thanh long had a dinner special, i'd be here every week. i think i'd rather go to PPQ where its cheaper. c'mon, broke people cant afford this place! one crab was frickin $35.00!! shiiiiiiiiiet, thats hella expensive! AND you have to buy garlic noodles?! i can just go to PPQ and get a dinner-for-2 special! for $50 you get one crab, garlic noodles, dessert, a salad, and egg rolls! now thats a fucking deal! but  i really like this place. their food is very tasty and their service is great. i'll definately be back.

excerpts: We got the garlic noodles which was very tasty.
garlic noodles.author: Edgar G.
garlic noodles.review: I've always wanted to try this place, but never got a chance to. My sisters and I celebrated our mother's birthday here for dinner and I must say, this place is pretty damn good. We got the garlic noodles which was very tasty. We also got the famous roasted crab and the drunken crab. In my opinion the roasted crab was much better with more flavoring compare to the drunken crab. The drunken crab was ok, but there wasn't enough flavoring inside, but nonetheless it was good. We also got the mango salad which was also pretty good. I guess I expected too much from this place after hearing about it from so many people, but don't get it wrong, this place is GOOD. Oh yeah, they have some good service as well. I forgot to talk about parking... it wasn't too bad. I parked a block from the place, and there was a few spaces on 46th between Kirkham and Lawton, if that isn't too far for anybody.

excerpts: Garlic noodles not so great (too soft and a bit tasteless).
garlic noodles.author: Alice A.
garlic noodles.review:
My low rating is driven by the price:  this place is way overpriced for what it's worth.  An order of roasted crab (1 crab with no sides) was almost $40.  The shrimp and noodles were also almost $40.  

The service was great.  The crab was pretty darn good.  Garlic noodles not so great (too soft and a bit tasteless).

excerpts: The crab and the garlic noodles were delicious .
Even tho not the most healthy thing to eat.
I was very hungry.
The service was good the place was packed!
Alot of people like this restaurant
and it's a fav on their list.
It's a fav on my list too.
The point is I recommend thanh long.
garlic noodles.author: Hector W.
garlic noodles.review: I enjoyed this place alot. After work went with some co workers. The crab and the garlic noodles were delicious . Even tho not the most healthy thing to eat. I was very hungry. The service was good the place was packed! Alot of people like this restaurant and it's a fav on their list. It's a fav on my list too. The point is I recommend thanh long.

excerpts: Five stars for the roasted crab and garlic noodles only!
garlic noodles.author: Jim L.
garlic noodles.review:
Five stars for the roasted crab and garlic noodles only!

The rest of the menu is for those who just tag along and are not eating the roasted crab...too bad for them. This is the best crab I have had bar none, but almost everything else sucks. I said almost...the drinks are good and strong and the bartender is cool.

excerpts: The best damn garlic noodles and dungeness crab anywhere.
You will want to make love to your food.
No other place compares.
garlic noodles.author: Elaine T.
garlic noodles.review: Have been coming here for years with my family since I was a little girl. The best damn garlic noodles and dungeness crab anywhere. You will want to make love to your food. No other place compares.

excerpts: the garlic noodles here are pretty good as well.
they have high standards here and the staff here is very friendly as well.
garlic noodles.author: Art N.
garlic noodles.review: best place to get quality crab. i would have to say this is the best place in the the bay area to eat fresh quality crab. the garlic noodles here are pretty good as well. they have high standards here and the staff here is very friendly as well.

excerpts: I really enjoyed the garlic noodles, salmon carpaccio, and the Lychee Martini!
I could drink like 100 of those!!!
It's sooo good!
garlic noodles.author: Truc N.
garlic noodles.review: Came here the other night for dinner and I was pretty impressed.  You wouldn't expect a restaurant like this to be located in this area.  I hope all the local San Franciscans know about this place and how good it is.  I really enjoyed the garlic noodles, salmon carpaccio, and the Lychee Martini!  I could drink like 100 of those!!!  It's sooo good!  Anyway, our party also ordered the tamarind crab, asparagus soup, shrimp toast and either the Saigon beef or the shaken beef, I can't remember.  Those were ok.  I would not order the tamarind crab or the asparagus soup again though.  The beef was super tender and delicious, but it lacks some flavor.  It doesn't really taste like shaken beef.  I've had the marinade better at other places, but the tenderness here beats them all!!!  I'd definitely come back here and recommend this place to my friends.  It's better than the generic Asian foods in Chinatown!

excerpts: Garlic noodles and crab.
So f'in good
, it's like no other SF crab experience.

It's messy and you'll smell funny afterwards so make sure if you go on a date that you both enjoy all of the garlic together, otherwise you might have to sit far away from each other on the ride home.
Been a few times and it seems to be getting more expensive than I remebered.
garlic noodles.author: Gucci M.
garlic noodles.review: Garlic noodles and crab.  So f'in good, it's like no other SF crab experience.  It's messy and you'll smell funny afterwards so make sure if you go on a date that you both enjoy all of the garlic together, otherwise you might have to sit far away from each other on the ride home.  Been a few times and it seems to be getting more expensive than I remebered.

excerpts: so go there and order two things: the crab and the garlic noodles.
you cant go wrong with these two items!
garlic noodles.author: Bren L.
garlic noodles.review: i was hesitant about paying $$$ for vietnamease food here but after my second visit, it is confirmed that this is worth the extra buckaroos. The service is not the best but the food makes up for it. the spring roll is good (but i can easily get it for a few bucks in chinatown) but the garlic noodle is to die for!!!!!  oh yeah, the crab! the crab is oh sooo yummmy.  so go there and order two things: the crab and the garlic noodles.  you cant go wrong with these two items!

excerpts: "Roast crab and garlic noodles with prawns please."
That's pretty much all you need to know when you place your order.
Depending on the number in your dining party, order crab accordingly.
Note to self: hold off on ordering the maximum amount of crab you want all at one time.
garlic noodles.author: Carrie K.
garlic noodles.review:
First thing you say when waiter arrives to your table..."Roast crab and garlic noodles with prawns please."  That's pretty much all you need to know when you place your order.  Depending on the number in your dining party, order crab accordingly.  Note to self: hold off on ordering the maximum amount of crab you want all at one time.  Ordering the roast crab one at a time saves the "extra" crab from getting cold and the butter to congeal.  Trust me, you don't want your crab to get the chills and the butter to coagulate...not too appetizing when that happens.
For appetizers, or if you're not into the whole garlic thing, try the Saigon beef!...excellent.  Think mini pieces of tender filet mignon and yummy mixed micro salad with caramelized onions and cherry tomatoes all in one plate.  I don't remember what the sauce is made of, but you've gotta try it!  The salmon carpacchio is very good also...thinly sliced salmon with capers served with sliced toasted baguette.
Yes, the portions of the appetizers (and pretty much the whole menu) are small and prices are high, but you get what you pay for...pretty darn good tasting food.
If you still have room for desert after all the crab and noodles, you've got to try the home made banana cake and chocolate cake...oh my!!  The banana cake has got to be my favorite...big chunks of banana and the cake almost has the texture of bread pudding.  The chocolate cake is rich and creamy.  Both are served with ice cream (French vanilla) and some type of vanilla cream sauce I believe.  I don't really pay attention to the sauce because the cake itself is SO good!!
Parking is difficult to locate, hence the valet parking located on 46th for those who don't want to circle the blocks for more than 10 minutes.  I've found parking within a block of Thanh Long on 45, 46, Judah, Irving and Kirkham during dinner hours...no biggie.  And my secret to not waiting for a table...the perfect time to go there is 6:30pm...any later, and you're in deep trouble trying to fight through the masses of people sitting/standing in the waiting area...uh yah, 30+ people standing in a 10 ft by 10 ft space can make for a very aggravating experience.

excerpts: And you have to order the garlic noodles.
garlic noodles.author: Philip T.
garlic noodles.review: Excellent crab. I liked the Roast Crab better than the Drunken Crab, but bother were good. And you have to order the garlic noodles.

excerpts: The roast crab just isnt the same as before... and is definitely overpriced... i prefer the way my mom makes garlic noodles now...
i definitely think this place is overrated.
My parents haven't been here in years and they dont plan on coming back anytime soon
garlic noodles.author: Anthony V.
garlic noodles.review: The roast crab just isnt the same as before... and is definitely overpriced... i prefer the way my mom makes garlic noodles now... i definitely think this place is overrated. My parents haven't been here in years and they dont plan on coming back anytime soon

excerpts: I had the infamous crab, garlic noodles, grilled shrimp, salmon appetizer, crab filled wontons, and soft shell crab.
I will definitely be back.
garlic noodles.author: amber p.
garlic noodles.review: Yummy!!   What a great seafood place.  It was challenging to get here, but it was well worth it.  We had reservations for 10 people and although the place was jammed packed, with a wait, they had our table ready and waiting.  Once we were seated, food and drinks were served very quickly.  Service was excellent and the food was just delicious, every single bite.  I had the infamous crab, garlic noodles, grilled shrimp, salmon appetizer, crab filled wontons, and soft shell crab. I will definitely be back.

excerpts: the garlic noodles are a must have.
the appetizers were not really anything to cheer about and the other food is a little overpriced.
garlic noodles.author: r t.
garlic noodles.review:
everything you heard about this place is true! yes, everything! 

i could eat here everyday. i'd smell like garlic but you'll learn to live with it and like it. 

if you can get a table. reservations should probably be required. once you get past the huge crowd in the waiting area, and i mean packed shoulder-to-shoulder-am-i-in-a-nightclub-crowd, the actual restaurant is very nice. the waiters are professionally dressed, and the service is quick.

the roasted crab is the best! flavorful, hot, and ready to eat. the garlic noodles are a must have. the appetizers were not really anything to cheer about and the other food is a little overpriced. for $30 you can get a tiny piece of sea bass. 

extra stars for free ice cream on my birthday!

excerpts: I still like my fresh crab meat best with a little garlic vinegar with rice, but the garlic noodles here make me re-think my preferences.
A little pricey, but it fits the quality.
Make reservations.
Come on an empty stomach!
yummmmmmmmmmmmmm
garlic noodles.author: Maris D.
garlic noodles.review: Best garlic noods and dungeness crab I have ever ingested. I still like my fresh crab meat best with a little garlic vinegar with rice, but the garlic noodles here make me re-think my preferences. A little pricey, but it fits the quality. Make reservations. Come on an empty stomach! yummmmmmmmmmmmmm

excerpts: Many go for the "special crab" and the garlic noodles.
I think it's all over-rated.
If you want good vietnamese cuisine, brace yourself for SF's tenderloin, or make the hike down to San Jose and exit Tully Road.
There you'll definitely get your bang for you buck!
garlic noodles.author: BrasilPo P.
garlic noodles.review: It horrifies me to know that people are willing to pay so much for food that I've grown up eating for a third of the price. The place is way too crowded, and the service is compromised because of it. Many go for the "special crab" and the garlic noodles. I think it's all over-rated. If you want good vietnamese cuisine, brace yourself for SF's tenderloin, or make the hike down to San Jose and exit Tully Road. There you'll definitely get your bang for you buck!

excerpts: All I have to say is try the garlic noodles!
Yes, the crab is very good but the garlic noodles are probably the best thing on the menu!
garlic noodles.author: M. E.
garlic noodles.review: All I have to say is try the garlic noodles!  Yes, the crab is very good but the garlic noodles are probably the best thing on the menu!

excerpts: I ordered: garlic noodles, dungeness crab in An's garlic sauce, Colossal Royal Tiger Prawns w/ more garlic noodles, lemongrass chicken fry dish, and a sea bass dish.
The garlic noodles were very good, but again very oily and heavy.
The lemongrass chicken is nothing special.
garlic noodles.author: edie t.
garlic noodles.review:
cleanliness: 5/5
food quality: 4/5
service: 4/5 
cost: unknown
other: parking is horrible. I spent 15 minutes looking for a resonable space until finally i parked 5 blocks away

I came here for a birthday dinner (party of 6) on a Saturday night. It was my first time here and heard positive reviews from friends/family. I'm not a big seafood person, but I'll eat it if i have to.

I ordered: garlic noodles, dungeness crab in An's garlic sauce, Colossal Royal Tiger Prawns w/ more garlic noodles, lemongrass chicken fry dish, and a sea bass dish.

I did not get to try to seabass dish so no review on that. The dungeness crab was pretty good. It was very oily and garlicy. the meat was good and the portions were well sized. The garlic noodles were very good, but again very oily and heavy. Not  garlicy to the point where you are hesitant to speak, but still you should have a mint or something to be considerate of others.

The lemongrass chicken is nothing special. It was like a chicken fry dish that you could find at most decent chinese restaurants.

The service was okay. Dishes were brought out promptly and served hot. The supporting staff could have done a better job of refreshing our shell bowls and refilling our beverages (needed a beverage to clear the oil from all the dishes).

I would probably come here again if someone wanted to, but since i'm not a big crab eater I wouldn't actively seek any seafood places. The prices were up there and it is a very busy and loud environment. if you are looking for a place to celebrate a graduation or a small birthday party this place was good. 

They take reservations, but will not seat you until your entire party arrives so tell your friends/family to be on time. Be sure to allow plenty of time to park or bring some walking shoes. Valet is available, but i opted not to use it. 

there is also a cake cutting fee of $1 per person

excerpts: You MUST get the garlic noodles.
I'd say get a few orders since it's their 2nd best thing after the crab.
I've tried a few other dishes on their menu that wasn't crab
and they were not so good.
I'd stick to just crab and garlic noodles.
Parking is pretty easy if you don't mind walking around the outer sunset, but it's not bad at all.
Excellent place to take a date or even a small group like family!
garlic noodles.author: Allan T.
garlic noodles.review: So I gotta tell ya I HATE eating crab but this place is one of the only places I'd crave to go to.  Excellent crab that can be prepared in a few different ways.  I prefer just butter and other salts.  You MUST get the garlic noodles.  I'd say get a few orders since it's their 2nd best thing after the crab.  I've tried a few other dishes on their menu that wasn't crab and they were not so good.  I'd stick to just crab and garlic noodles.  Parking is pretty easy if you don't mind walking around the outer sunset, but it's not bad at all.  Excellent place to take a date or even a small group like family!

excerpts: Ordered rosted crab and garlic noodles.
Great food and service!
But I still think it's too pricy $$$$ for this place and food.
Valet parking $9.
garlic noodles.author: Igor K.
garlic noodles.review: Ordered rosted crab and garlic noodles. Great food and service! But I still think it's too pricy $$$$ for this place and food. Valet parking $9.

excerpts: and I ordered, the crab(I forget which one), garlic noodles, 1 starter, a dessert, and tea; 100 bucks.
I wasn't even full!
The price reflected that of a 'high end' restaurant; this is not a high end restaurant.
garlic noodles.author: Conrad C.
garlic noodles.review: Don't get me wrong, the food is pretty good. But I'm giving this place 3 stars because the parking sucks and they seriously need to drop their prices.  Last time I was there a friend and I ordered, the crab(I forget which one), garlic noodles, 1 starter, a dessert, and tea; 100 bucks. I wasn't even full! The price reflected that of a 'high end' restaurant; this is not a high end restaurant.

excerpts: I order the roast crab and garlic noodles.
garlic noodles.author: Marjorie P.
garlic noodles.review:
This has to be one of my favorite restaurants ever!

Everytime I go there (probably about three times a year) I order the roast crab and garlic noodles.  I've tried other things, but these dishes are my fave!

The noodles cost about $10 and the crab goes for about 40 bucks each- a little steep compared to PPQ's or other similar places, but I personally taste the difference at Thanh Long's.  To me, it's more authentic.  Yeah, your breath smells like garlic the next morning, but it's so worth it. 

I usually go around 4pm, right when they open.  There's usually street parking at that time.  If you go around 7 or 8 you'll probably have to pay for valet parking.

excerpts: I love the house dishes ( garlic noodles and roast crab).
You must come to this restaurant and treat yourself to the most exquisite food in all of SF!!!
garlic noodles.author: Ramon M.
garlic noodles.review: The abosulte best in Vietnamese cuisine. I love the house dishes ( garlic noodles and roast crab). You must come to this restaurant and treat yourself to the most exquisite food in all of SF!!!

excerpts: He'll order the shaking beef, I'll order a whole crab and we'll share a plate of garlic noodles and kissface like Lady & the Tramp.
Parking can be difficult in this area, but there's always valet.
Don't forget to order some garlic noodles to go.
I know it probably costs pennies to make, but until I can crack the ingredient code, I'm gladly paying up.
garlic noodles.author: Mel S.
garlic noodles.review: When I've been a good girl, my seafood loathing husband will break down and take me to this place. He'll order the shaking beef, I'll order a whole crab and we'll share a plate of garlic noodles and kissface like Lady & the Tramp. Parking can be difficult in this area, but there's always valet. Don't forget to order some garlic noodles to go. I know it probably costs pennies to make, but until I can crack the ingredient code, I'm gladly paying up.

excerpts: I LOVE the garlic noodles!
You have to starve yourself for the whole week before come.
I can only imagine how many calories you can consume!
Even the dessert is yummy!
They can accomodate large groups as well.
garlic noodles.author: Jenn S.
garlic noodles.review: OMG. This is one of our favorite places to go eat when we're in the bay. =) The hubby craves the garlic crab. I LOVE the garlic noodles! You have to starve yourself for the whole week before come. I can only imagine how many calories you can consume! Even the dessert is yummy! They can accomodate large groups as well.

excerpts: The roasted crab, garlic noodles with tiger prawns, saigon beef, and seafood dumplings and some sauteed veggies would be my choice of a great dinner for 2.
garlic noodles.author: Marcus Y.
garlic noodles.review: Went there for my 10th Anniversary. I always loved this place MUCH better than Crustaceans on Polk. I think the atmosphere/decor/people/service makes it better.......the only downside is trying to find parking. The roasted crab, garlic noodles with tiger prawns, saigon beef, and seafood dumplings and some sauteed veggies would be my choice of a great dinner for 2.

excerpts: The roast crab, drunken crab and garlic noodles are even more delicious than the rave reviews indicate.
The first bite of the roast crab had me sending up a prayer of gratitude to my higher power and the garlic noodles are viable addiction candidates.
The vanilla creme brulee and molten lava chocolate cake with vanilla gelato and grand marnier creme anglaise were fabulous.
If I could have eaten more, I would have!
A wonderful evening.
Parking is a beyotch though.
Valet is well worth it.

If I could have eaten more, I would have!
A wonderful evening.

garlic noodles.author: Jim A.
garlic noodles.review: My brother and his blushing new bride took me to dinner here tonight and it exceeded my expectations.  The roast crab, drunken crab and garlic noodles are even more delicious than the rave reviews indicate.  The first bite of the roast crab had me sending up a prayer of gratitude to my higher power and the garlic noodles are viable addiction candidates.  The vanilla creme brulee and molten lava chocolate cake with vanilla gelato and grand marnier creme anglaise were fabulous.  If I could have eaten more, I would have!  A wonderful evening.  Parking is a beyotch though.  Valet is well worth it.

excerpts: My fiance ordered their roasted crab with garlic noodles and I had their eggplant dish.
After all the hype about their crab and garlic noodles, I sadly disappointed.
The crab was salty and the noodles were okay.
The eggplant dish was a little better.
The only con is that the chicken and shrimp were a little too dry, but the vegetables were great.
garlic noodles.author: MIchelle L.
garlic noodles.review: My fiance ordered their roasted crab with garlic noodles and I had their eggplant dish.  After all the hype about their crab and garlic noodles, I sadly disappointed.  The crab was salty and the noodles were okay.  The eggplant dish was a little better.  The only con is that the chicken and shrimp were a little too dry, but the vegetables were great.

excerpts: Mmmmm...garlic noodles and roasted crab!
We chose to come here instead of crustacean because they don't have a dress code.
I'm all for fine dining, but who wants to dress up when you've got crab juice all over you.
At first my husband
and I decided to split a plate of garlic noodles, but when I took a bite, we immediately ordered another plate.
The service was excellent, and the crab was very good, not amazing but very good.
I thought it was a little dry.
But the garlic noodles.....mmmmmm.
garlic noodles.author: M J.
garlic noodles.review: Mmmmm...garlic noodles and roasted crab!  We chose to come here instead of crustacean because they don't have a dress code.  I'm all for fine dining, but who wants to dress up when you've got crab juice all over you.  At first my husband and I decided to split a plate of garlic noodles, but when I took a bite, we immediately ordered another plate.  The service was excellent, and the crab was very good, not amazing but very good.  I thought it was a little dry.  But the garlic noodles.....mmmmmm.

excerpts: Garlic noodles are fantastic, the seafood dumpling can't be beat and the eggplant with chicken and shrimp is quite tasty.
They get a well deserved 5 stars from me.
garlic noodles.author: Allan G.
garlic noodles.review: This place is amazing. They do have incredible crab but the rest of the menu is pretty fantastic as well. Garlic noodles are fantastic, the seafood dumpling can't be beat and the eggplant with chicken and shrimp is quite tasty. They get a well deserved 5 stars from me.

excerpts: We ordered the peppercorn crab ($35.95) and garlic noodles ($9.50).
Compared to PPQ, in my honest opinion, Thanh Long's peppercorn crab is not as delicious as PPQ's ($34.95).
Thanh Long's garlic noodles ($9.50) taste better than PPQ's ($6.50), although is not worth the price (it is good but not something to die for).

Thanh Long's peppercorn crab is apparently soaked in butter sauce which then congealed on the plate quickly enough as the food cools down that it looks disturbing reminding us of how this will contribute to the heart disease.
The crab tastes kind of bland, however, the crab comes in a whole, not cut up.
One good thing about the crab is that the flesh does not stick to the shell like PPQ's crab.
The crab is overpriced considering that you will get the same result if you just steam crabs at home and make butter sauce with pepper dipping.
PPQ's peppercorn crab is very delicious.
I believe the crab is deep fried, then seasoned with sauteed garlic pieces, peppercorn, and spices.
However, the crab is cut up, so you won't be able to see the crab in a whole, in case if the crab is missing a leg.
Thanh Long's garlic noodle is delicious however, it does not have any garlic pieces.
Instead, they use garlic powder-infused oil.
You can just go to Costco buy a big jar of McCormick garlic powder and buy cheap noodle at Ranch 99.
$ 9.50 is overpriced.
PPQ's garlic noodle has garlic pieces in it
and it's priced at reasonable $6.50.
I will not go back to Thanh Long for their peppercorn crab.
I would rather spend the money for PPQ's peppercorn crab for the same amount of money
garlic noodles.author: Oribel ..
garlic noodles.review:
We ate at PPQ one day before going to Thanh Long so that we could compare what's people been raving about these two places.
We ordered the peppercorn crab ($35.95) and garlic noodles ($9.50).
Compared to PPQ, in my honest opinion, Thanh Long's peppercorn crab is not as delicious as PPQ's ($34.95).
Thanh Long's garlic noodles ($9.50) taste better than PPQ's ($6.50), although is not worth the price (it is good but not something to die for).
Thanh Long's peppercorn crab is apparently soaked in butter sauce which then congealed on the plate quickly enough as the food cools down that it looks disturbing reminding us of how this will contribute to the heart disease. The crab tastes kind of bland, however, the crab comes in a whole, not cut up. One good thing about the crab is that the flesh does not stick to the shell like PPQ's crab. The crab is overpriced considering that you will get the same result if you just steam crabs at home and make butter sauce with pepper dipping.
PPQ's peppercorn crab is very delicious. I believe the crab is deep fried, then seasoned with sauteed garlic pieces, peppercorn, and spices. However, the crab is cut up, so you won't be able to see the crab in a whole, in case if the crab is missing a leg.
Thanh Long's garlic noodle is delicious however, it does not have any garlic pieces. Instead, they use garlic powder-infused oil. You can just go to Costco buy a big jar of McCormick garlic powder and buy cheap noodle at Ranch 99. $ 9.50 is overpriced.
PPQ's garlic noodle has garlic pieces in it and it's priced at reasonable $6.50.
I will not go back to Thanh Long for their peppercorn crab. I would rather spend the money for PPQ's peppercorn crab for the same amount of money (actually PPQ's is a buck cheaper - and BETTER)

The following weekend, I decided to give the tamarind crab a try. It was worse than their peppercorn crab. It lacked seasoning. For what its name, "tamarind", I hardly tasted the tamarind. I even thought the sauce tasted kind of like sweet and sour sauce from chinese takeout.
The crab flesh really didn't have flavor. Might as well I buy cooked dungeness crab from Albertsons and dip it in sweet and sour sauce for less than 10 bucks!
$5.99/lb crab with oyster sauce from Manila Oriental Market on King Dr. would even do better for the taste and the wallet.

The secret recipe - kept in the vault - Thanh Long claim really does not live up to my expectation.

excerpts: the course...roasted garlic crab which you finish to the last drop smothered in that peppery garlic sauce paired with white rice eaten filipino style with your hands or garlic noodles that add even more richness to your crab....if you have the chance to take a sip, order a La Crema Chardonnay which adds a buttery flavor making your meal complete....
garlic noodles.author: Carissa Noelle G.
garlic noodles.review:
