i grew up in this restaurant- from when it started as hole in the wall with hour long waits and now has become a new city on its own...although the crab long wait to crawl into your mouth....you have to try the chicken or crab WHITE asparagus soup which is sweet to the taste, and the crispy spicy and sweet vermicelli rolls and then on the main the course...roasted garlic crab which you finish to the last drop smothered in that peppery garlic sauce paired with white rice eaten filipino style with your hands or garlic noodles that add even more richness to your crab....if you have the chance to take a sip, order a La Crema Chardonnay which adds a buttery flavor making your meal complete....

you cant leave without trying fried banana with vanilla ice cream...yes i do leave lots of room before i come to make sure i am getting everything worth my money and time...

this place is a fun laid back spot, if you want upscale try crustaceans, but you wont get a better experience than at thank long....service is always on top, but it gets really busy here so make reservations, and parking can also be a pain, but you will need the walk after a long meal....

san francisco is the place to be....

excerpts: I went with a friend for dinner and we split a huge, delicious roasted crab and an order of garlic noodles.
We also had the beer recommended by the server.
I'm giving 4 stars because it was a little too bright for me, and in general didn't exactly exude ambiance.
But the service and the food were really good!
The garlic noodles REALLY are good as wonderful as everyone says... as is the crab!
YUMMY!
Definitely a not to be missed SF dining experience.
garlic noodles.author: J O.
garlic noodles.review: This was amazing.  I went with a friend for dinner and we split a huge, delicious roasted crab and an order of garlic noodles.  We also had the beer recommended by the server.  I'm giving 4 stars because it was a little too bright for me, and in general didn't exactly exude ambiance.  But the service and the food were really good!  The garlic noodles REALLY are good as wonderful as everyone says... as is the crab!  YUMMY!  Definitely a not to be missed SF dining experience.

excerpts: The garlic noodles also very tasty.
Don't have a bad thing to say about this place besides the fact that it can be very tight and too close for comfort to the table next to you.
They pack you in!!
garlic noodles.author: Elle l.
garlic noodles.review: Crab puff appetizers are amazing!! After we finished one, we ordered a second!! The garlic noodles also very tasty. Don't have a bad thing to say about this place besides the fact that it can be very tight and too close for comfort to the table next to you. They pack you in!!

excerpts: Entree: Roasted Crab and Garlic Noodles.

(Large enough portion for two)
3.
Dessert:
garlic noodles.author: Violet N.
garlic noodles.review:
I've been going to Thanh Long for as long as I can remember. Over 5 years for sure and because of my frequent visits, majority of the staff knows my name and most of them know exactly what I'd usually order... scary I know, but I love it.

I'm giving Thanh Long 5 stars because I feel that the overall experience is great. With a casual atmosphere, cozy modern Asian decor, a wide variety of French/Vietnamese inspired dishes and an amazing friendly staff, it is always a joy to come here. 

Must Haves: 
1. Appetizers - Thanh Long Mussels
2. Entree: Roasted Crab and Garlic Noodles. 
    (Large enough portion for two)
3. Dessert: Vanilla Creme Brulee

Pros: This place might look small, but it can seat a ton of people so if you are looking for a great place to host your birthday dinner or celebration dinner, they can accommodate you. Make sure you make reservations at least a month ahead of time.

Cons: Parking is horrible, but that's because everyone wants to eat here. To save yourself from wanting to hit every car that is already parked with the bat that is in your trunk because you're annoyed from circling around for the 500th time... Park valet. Make sure you tip the valet guys good because these guys are outside in the cold, for who knows how long, to park your car while you're inside the warm restaurant ready to eat some amazing crab. Another con would probably be that the bar area is extremely small and since it's pretty much combined with the waiting area, being as crowded as it is, you'll feel like you're in a packed dance club trying to get a drink.  Better to wait outside.

Advice: Make sure you have a reservation, especially during weekends and holidays. It's just for convenience because you don't want to go to the restaurant with a group of people or a date after it took you about an hour or so to find parking and then find out that you would have to wait another hour and half before you get sat. Walk-ins do exist and if you do decide to go that route, you'll probably be waiting around for quite awhile drooling as you watch other people enjoy their meal.

Major Advice: If you don't like getting your hands dirty, you'd probably want to skip this restaurant. This place is known for their roasted crab and with that being said people... you eat crab with your freaking hands!! So for you dainty girls who are scared to get dirty... this place isn't for you! Eating the crab here is the whole fun experience because you can be in a nice restaurant and still be able to get down and dirty without feeling embarrassed. If you decide to come to this restaurant to dine on anything else but the crab... than you should just choose another freaking restaurant. By you doing that, it's like you deciding to go to a burger joint to order a salad... What the heck!? Don't get me wrong, all of their other dishes are great, but you have to at least order the crab... any crab. If you've already tasted the crab and came back to try the other dishes... please do so because they're just as delicious.

excerpts: I always order the roast crab and garlic noodles
and I'm always soooooo satisfied!!!!!!
YUM!
YUM!
YUM!
I'm so spoiled living so close to this place, but if I didn't I would drive to Thanh Long from anywhere just to eat there!!!!!!
garlic noodles.author: M R.
garlic noodles.review: I just ate there again last night (been going for years now).....I always order the roast crab and garlic noodles and I'm always soooooo satisfied!!!!!! YUM! YUM! YUM! I'm so spoiled living so close to this place, but if I didn't I would drive to Thanh Long from anywhere just to eat there!!!!!!

excerpts: The crab n garlic noodles are yummy.
After the meal i feel like i drank a gallon of butter though.
But its still yummy.
garlic noodles.author: Avery H.
garlic noodles.review: The crab n garlic noodles are yummy. After the meal i feel like i drank a gallon of butter though. But its still yummy.

excerpts: and I've heard good things about their garlic noodles and crab.
I have to say that I was not disappointed!
garlic noodles.author: A N.
garlic noodles.review: It was my first time here and I've heard good things about their garlic noodles and crab. I have to say that I was not disappointed! We ordered the salt and pepper calamari as an appetizer and it was really good, not too salty and not too spicy. The crab and garlic were really good, very nice flavor, seasoned just right. There were a lot of other things on the menu that I didn't get to try such as the Tamarind crab...I'll definitely be coming back for those items!

excerpts: We ordered the garlic noodles and crab which are probably the most popular items on the menu.
Well...let's just say I walked out of the restaurant trying to figure out why I just dined at this restaurant.
The crab was OK!
Nothing special about it.
I've experienced better quality and taste elsewhere and as for the noodles, not my favorite.
This restaurant was a recommendation
and I guess I expected a lot more.
I suppose the experienced chef took that night off!
garlic noodles.author: Suzette R.
garlic noodles.review: When I dined at Thahn Long, I wasn't too impressed with my meal! We ordered the garlic noodles and crab which are probably the most popular items on the menu. Well...let's just say I walked out of the restaurant trying to figure out why I just dined at this restaurant. The crab was OK! Nothing special about it. I've experienced better quality and taste elsewhere and as for the noodles, not my favorite. This restaurant was a recommendation and I guess I expected a lot more. I suppose the experienced chef took that night off!

excerpts:
Garlic noodles. 
Nummy, most definitely.
But paying $33 for 4 prawns (yes, only 4) and a plate of garlic noodles?
garlic noodles.author: R M.
garlic noodles.review:
Garlic noodles. Nummy, most definitely.
But paying $33 for 4 prawns (yes, only 4) and a plate of garlic noodles?

Bah!

excerpts: But the roasted crab was small, the sauce was just not that special and the garlic noodles?
It reminded my husband of thick top ramen.
Fried.
Seriously, this was it?
We noticed EVERYONE ordering the same thing--roasted crab, plates of the fried top ramen and wondered, WTF?
It's just not worth it.
We felt completely ripped off.
I'd passed by this place a bunch of times and my husband saw this reviewed on "Check Please".
We were dismayed that this place is so highly recommended.
We're completely baffled why so many people think the crab is so excellent, when we've had so much better--up the street, mind you--for much less.
Also, my husband was completely turned off when a waiter put a bib on him without asking.
I thought it was just weird,
why the bib anyway?
Isn't that for the crabs that you have to smash yourself with a mallet?
garlic noodles.author: elizabeth G.
garlic noodles.review:
One star because we will never go here again, and won't recommend this place. Nice enough service, but absolutely not worth the price they are charging. I'm with one reviewer who said she has no problem shelling out big bucks for a good meal--neither do my husband and I, when we want to go somewhere nice with our little one after a heavy week. But the roasted crab was small, the sauce was just not that special and the garlic noodles? It reminded my husband of thick top ramen. Fried. Seriously, this was it? We noticed EVERYONE ordering the same thing--roasted crab, plates of the fried top ramen and wondered, WTF? 
It's just not worth it. We felt completely ripped off. I'd passed by this place a bunch of times and my husband saw this reviewed on "Check Please". We were dismayed that this place is so highly recommended. We're completely baffled why so many people think the crab is so excellent, when we've had so much better--up the street, mind you--for much less. 
Also, my husband was completely turned off when a waiter put a bib on him without asking. I thought it was just weird, why the bib anyway? Isn't that for the crabs that you have to smash yourself with a mallet? Or because we're drooling idiots for spending money here? 

And, why do they give you cloth napkins, then a bunch of paper napkins? What a waste. My husband didn't leave a tip, then on second thought, I went back in and left a tip since it's not the server's fault. I told the hostess we were disappointed with the meal, and she took the tip, mumbled sorry, and that was it. Well, they obviously don't care, the place was packed as we were leaving, and they won't be going out of business anytime soon. What a shame.

excerpts: This place is awesome for their roasted crab and garlic noodles.
garlic noodles.author: eugene z.
garlic noodles.review:
This place is awesome for their roasted crab and garlic noodles. But chinese people might like their drunken crab as well as it is very tasty! but avoid the other ones, it's a waste of money. when we go there, we only eat the garlic noodle and the crab. it looks lame but we only order 2 at a time for the 4 of us because the crab gets nasty when it gets cold. 

they have the same menu at Crustaceans on polk, but I'd much rather stay where. who wants to dress up and look at payless.

excerpts: Garlic Crab, garlic noodles.....hmmmmmm good!
garlic noodles.author: Tod V.
garlic noodles.review:
Went there for our annual crab night out.....and as always it was great! This place is hidden back in sunset but if you are looking for the best crab in the area this is your place.  Valet is also a big plus!

Garlic Crab, garlic noodles.....hmmmmmm good!

excerpts: But their fillet mignon dish served on lettuce with a tasty sauce, butterfly tiger prawn served with garlic noodles ($31.95), and soft shell crab were so delicious!
garlic noodles.author: Alan K.
garlic noodles.review:
We should've ordered the roasted crab! Every table had it, and they were sooo huge! And they looked so delicious.

But their fillet mignon dish served on lettuce with a tasty sauce, butterfly tiger prawn served with garlic noodles ($31.95), and soft shell crab were so delicious! My girlfriend and I felt totally satisfied.

Their lava cake with vanilla gelato is a MUST. perfectly proportioned. 

100 bucks out the door is pretty pricey, but I LOVED it. So good. Would definitely come back with some friends.

excerpts: - what other dishes besides crab and garlic noodles should I try?
Been coming here for 5 years, everything else I try is disappointing, is there another hit somewhere on the menu?)
garlic noodles.author: Pink P.
garlic noodles.review: I'm a regular and would like to share a tip - the key to finding parking is going on a weekday (except Friday) and early, say at 5 PM (they open right at 4.30 PM).  You don't even have to reserve a table, and you will find a parking spot pretty quickly.  Every time you are moping around on a weekday and you have skipped lunch and want to grab an early dinner, think of Thanh Long! (Can someone else share a tip - what other dishes besides crab and garlic noodles should I try? Been coming here for 5 years, everything else I try is disappointing, is there another hit somewhere on the menu?)

excerpts: Everyone rants and raves about the garlic noodles
but I'm not sure what is so special about them.
It tastes like it has lots of butter and garlic powder in it.
There are much better places where you can get the same size crab and a whole meal option instead of ordering a la carte at this place.
Service is good at this restaurant
but I still think it's too expensive for the portions you get.
garlic noodles.author: daniel j.
garlic noodles.review: For all the hype of this place, I think my expectations were very high going to this place.  The crab here is good quality and tasty but that's obviously because of the sauce.  But really, the times that I have visited this restaurant, the crab has been small and the market price high.  Everyone rants and raves about the garlic noodles but I'm not sure what is so special about them.  It tastes like it has lots of butter and garlic powder in it.  There are much better places where you can get the same size crab and a whole meal option instead of ordering a la carte at this place.  Service is good at this restaurant but I still think it's too expensive for the portions you get.

excerpts: The garlic noodles and the roasted crab were both too buttery.
The waiters were pleasant.
The ambiance of the dining room was nice, but the bathroom was hilarious, did they forget about that part?
It was particularly unsanitary.
Makes me wonder about the kitchen.
garlic noodles.author: Big e.
garlic noodles.review: The garlic noodles and the roasted crab were both too buttery.  The waiters were pleasant.  The ambiance of the dining room was nice, but the bathroom was hilarious, did they forget about that part?  It was particularly unsanitary.  Makes me wonder about the kitchen.

excerpts: the BEST garlic crab and  garlic noodles you will ever eat!!
If you like crab you have to try this place!!!!
garlic noodles.author: Kelly S.
garlic noodles.review: the BEST garlic crab and  garlic noodles you will ever eat!! If you like crab you have to try this place!!!!

excerpts: Holy garlic Noodles, I love me some crab but got seconds on the garlic noodles to go because my my friend that said he didn't want ANY noodles, ate more than half of them, cuz there so good!
I have to say the crab was OK nothing amazing and mouthwatering as the last time I was here, maybe because we had a late dinner, I don't know.
The place was packed, I had called about 45 Min's ahead of time to make reservation and waited literally half a nans second to be seated!
Great service just for that, but everything else came out almost as fast, we had the salt & pepper calamari appetizer thought it was good
my friend really loved it, then after being enticed by the Shaken Beef description we ended up with that and a whole roasted Crab w/ GARLIC NOODLES!!
I think I could eat 2 orders everyday for the rest of my life, which would be slightly shortened from the oil clogging my arteries, but maybe worth it!!
The bottle of wine we shared was also damn good, dont ask me the name, I was to tipsy to remember, good thing I live in the hood!!
garlic noodles.author: Courtney D.
garlic noodles.review: Holy garlic Noodles, I love me some crab but got seconds on the garlic noodles to go because my my friend that said he didn't want ANY noodles, ate more than half of them, cuz there so good! I have to say the crab was OK nothing amazing and mouthwatering as the last time I was here, maybe because we had a late dinner, I don't know. The place was packed, I had called about 45 Min's ahead of time to make reservation and waited literally half a nans second to be seated! Great service just for that, but everything else came out almost as fast, we had the salt & pepper calamari appetizer thought it was good my friend really loved it, then after being enticed by the Shaken Beef description we ended up with that and a whole roasted Crab w/ GARLIC NOODLES!! I think I could eat 2 orders everyday for the rest of my life, which would be slightly shortened from the oil clogging my arteries, but maybe worth it!! The bottle of wine we shared was also damn good, dont ask me the name, I was to tipsy to remember, good thing I live in the hood!!

excerpts: Aside from the garlic noodles and shaken beef (which I give both 5s), everything is over-priced.
Even with my dissatisfaction with this place, I continue to come back because you can't really get better garlic noodles or beef anywhere else.
garlic noodles.author: Sally Trung N.
garlic noodles.review:
Aside from the garlic noodles and shaken beef (which I give both 5s), everything is over-priced.  I've had much better crab for 1/3 the price and the portions for the appetizers and soup are ridicously small.  

Even with my dissatisfaction with this place, I continue to come back because you can't really get better garlic noodles or beef anywhere else.

excerpts: Garlic noodles and Roasted Crab!!!
My wife and I haven't been here in 11 years and we still think they're awesome.
It's always worth flying 2000 miles just to have some heart clogging Roasted Crab drenched in garlic and butter.
YUM!
We can't wait to go back and clog our arteries even further.
garlic noodles.author: James P.
garlic noodles.review: AAAAHHHH!! Garlic noodles and Roasted Crab!!! My wife and I haven't been here in 11 years and we still think they're awesome. It's always worth flying 2000 miles just to have some heart clogging Roasted Crab drenched in garlic and butter. YUM! We can't wait to go back and clog our arteries even further.

excerpts: The garlic noodles were to die for but a little overpriced.
Overall above average restaurant with a killer garlic noodle dish....
garlic noodles.author: David N.
garlic noodles.review: Thanh Long has been established since 1971.  I recently had a chance to revisit this place to have their roasted crab.  The wait staff was average but not outstanding.  The crab was above average not the best I tasted.  For my taste, I think the crab I had at the Crab Zone in Stockton out of all places was better.  The garlic noodles were to die for but a little overpriced.  Overall above average restaurant with a killer garlic noodle dish....

excerpts: We also ordered the garlic noodles as it really goes well with the crabs.
garlic noodles.author: Tom S.
garlic noodles.review: They have pretty good peppercorn crabs here, but not as good as PPQ.  We also ordered the garlic noodles as it really goes well with the crabs.

excerpts: oh, and definitely have the garlic noodles, which i regret to say, i can no longer eat thanks to my allergist.
garlic noodles.author: Elizabeth O.
garlic noodles.review:
i have eaten at thanh long since i was a child, which is one of the benefits of growing up near the sunset. as a kid, my siblings and i would enjoy their noodles (of course) and delicious fried rice. we're not talking about greasy msg-ridden fried rice, this is the real thing, hot off the wok. 

i went here recently for father's day, and had buddha rolls with tofu and veggies, which was delish with a sweet dipping sauce, chicken skewers that were marinated in a light sweet/salty sauce, and the ultimate part of the meal: ROASTED CRAB. amazing. like, unbelievable. people who think they don't like crab are converted when they eat here. really.

if you enjoy seafood-this the the place, and it's worth the trek out to the middle of nowhere and the price for such fresh seafood.

oh, and definitely have the garlic noodles, which i regret to say, i can no longer eat thanks to my allergist. so, until they use brown rice noodles, i have to longingly watch others as they enjoy them.

also, 5 stars for energy, ambiance, and the phenomenal diversity of people! it's great.

excerpts: The garlic noodles are the best and all the seafood is really fresh.
The cocktails are really yummy
and so is the fried banana desert.
Parking kinda sucks.
garlic noodles.author: Lena F.
garlic noodles.review: Omg, if you love seafood, this is the place for you. The garlic noodles are the best and all the seafood is really fresh. The cocktails are really yummy and so is the fried banana desert. Parking kinda sucks.

excerpts: Awesome garlic noodles and roasted crabs!
Sorry, no sharing, one order per person :)~   Just no parking, there's valet, but I'd rather find a spot down the block
so I/we can walk to and fro, just for exercising off all the food we stuffed ourselves with there...
garlic noodles.author: JJ N.
garlic noodles.review: Awesome garlic noodles and roasted crabs!  Sorry, no sharing, one order per person :)~   Just no parking, there's valet, but I'd rather find a spot down the block so I/we can walk to and fro, just for exercising off all the food we stuffed ourselves with there... :)

excerpts: Roast crab, garlic noodles and champagne are all you need.
Well, all I need...to enjoy the best that this place has to offer.
Superb attentive staff and your dishes are delivered so quick it's astounding.
You find yourself trying to figure out how it's all done when you know you should just sit back and enjoy that this place exists.
I even love the location away from all the scene and hustle.
People in here are friendly, chatty and happy to be there which make the experience that much better.
I don't have many tips, but know how to demolish a crab and be prepared to get messy, bibs are provided.
And, for people on dates...make sure your date doesn't eat just a salad.
That's not fun for anyone.
Pricey but well worth it and don't forget the desserts.
garlic noodles.author: William R.
garlic noodles.review: OMF! This place has the greatest delivery of crab ever. Secret kitchen style! And it really is a secret, the closest I got to any info was this past weekend when I sat next to their former food supplier rep and asked her what the secret was. She said they wouldn't tell her. As well they shouldn't. This place shows that hard work and industry secrets are a key to success, as well as great customer service. Roast crab, garlic noodles and champagne are all you need. Well, all I need...to enjoy the best that this place has to offer. Superb attentive staff and your dishes are delivered so quick it's astounding. You find yourself trying to figure out how it's all done when you know you should just sit back and enjoy that this place exists. I even love the location away from all the scene and hustle. People in here are friendly, chatty and happy to be there which make the experience that much better. I don't have many tips, but know how to demolish a crab and be prepared to get messy, bibs are provided. And, for people on dates...make sure your date doesn't eat just a salad. That's not fun for anyone. Pricey but well worth it and don't forget the desserts.

excerpts: The garlic noodles are to die for!
garlic noodles.author: Jennifer D.
garlic noodles.review: This place is soooooooo good! Best crab I have EVER had! The garlic noodles are to die for!

excerpts: The garlic noodles were incredibly tasty.
I'm already craving it.
I had this lychee martini type drink.
I don't drink much, but this one had more of the lychee fruity flavor more than the alcohol taste, so I liked it a lot.
I made reservations same day, got there on time, was seated right away.
Service was good.
Too bad they don't have one closer to me.
But for good food, it's worth the drive.
I'll definitely return!
garlic noodles.author: Little one C.
garlic noodles.review: Now I see why everyone raves about this place.  I'm so glad my friend suggested trying this place for dinner.  I've always heard good things about their sister restaurant Crustacean, but never got around to trying it.  The roasted crab was one of the BEST crab I ever had.  The meat was very tender and flavorful, love the garlic butter!  The garlic noodles were incredibly tasty.  I'm already craving it.  I had this lychee martini type drink.  I don't drink much, but this one had more of the lychee fruity flavor more than the alcohol taste, so I liked it a lot.  I made reservations same day, got there on time, was seated right away.  Service was good.  Too bad they don't have one closer to me.  But for good food, it's worth the drive.  I'll definitely return!

excerpts: they charge too much for garlic noodles.
the bathrooms are very bad stinky needs to be updated for the amount they charge for food they really needs to remodel the bathrooms !!!!!!!!!!!!
service slow and not friendly enough for the $$$ they charge.
very disappointed
and I've heard from many other people saying the same.
garlic noodles.author: joe s.
garlic noodles.review:
food ok they charge too much for garlic noodles. the bathrooms are very bad stinky needs to be updated for the amount they charge for food they really needs to remodel the bathrooms !!!!!!!!!!!! 
service slow and not friendly enough for the $$$ they charge. very disappointed and I've heard from many other people saying the same.

excerpts: I came by here to get a roasted crab and an order of garlic noodles to go.
I got a dead crab and my garlic noodles turned out to be a ball of garlic handball.
I understand that getting food to go is not as good as eating it at the resturant, but , I live 1 minute away.
Let those corpses out the kitchen cause everyone knows the secrect recipe anyways, it's only drown the crab in butter and pepper
then stuff it in the oven, opps, did I spill the beans???
Even if you import some more "New" old ladies to do the slave labor, still not coming back.
I know you have an endless supply of women to work here, cause those massage girls can't keep their looks too long.
The waitress might say to you, honey, you shower now.
garlic noodles.author: Michael C.
garlic noodles.review: This place used to be really really good because they had a secrect recipe from Vietnam, old ladies locked up inside the kitchen, even the waiters had to get their orders through a peep hole, nobody gets in the kitchen, no joke!!! That's how they guard their secrect. That was 20 to 30 years ago, how old are these old ladies now???? I came by here to get a roasted crab and an order of garlic noodles to go. I got a dead crab and my garlic noodles turned out to be a ball of garlic handball. I understand that getting food to go is not as good as eating it at the resturant, but , I live 1 minute away. Let those corpses out the kitchen cause everyone knows the secrect recipe anyways, it's only drown the crab in butter and pepper then stuff it in the oven, opps, did I spill the beans???  Even if you import some more "New" old ladies to do the slave labor, still not coming back.  I know you have an endless supply of women to work here, cause those massage girls can't keep their looks too long. The waitress might say to you, honey, you shower now.

excerpts: The best part about the whole meal was eating garlic noodles, I would go back there just for that.
Its pretty messy so not a place to make a first impression (i.e. First date).
garlic noodles.author: Ronnie L.
garlic noodles.review: For someone who doesn't like crab very much, Thanh Long has a very flavorful selection.  The best part about the whole meal was eating garlic noodles, I would go back there just for that.  Its pretty messy so not a place to make a first impression (i.e. First date).

excerpts: The garlic noodles were garlicky enough... and the roast crab was pretty decent, but other than that, I really do not understand why people rave about this place.
garlic noodles.author: Evelyn L.
garlic noodles.review:
We had reservations and yet, we were made to wait. 

The garlic noodles were garlicky enough... and the roast crab was pretty decent, but other than that, I really do not understand why people rave about this place. Seriously.

The mango salad was kinda bland, totally un-Vietnamese... romaine lettuce with bits of mango and shrimp. I could have tossed it myself at home. The dungeness crab puffs were filled with mayonaise that you can't really taste any crab meat and they weren't 'puffy". They were basically mayonnaise wrapped in wanton skins.

The only saving grace was the molten chocolate cake, but served without much flair. The vanilla ice-cream served on the side weren't scoped out properly, it came out all mushed up with the whipped cream. So, I understand that Asians don't do desserts well, but a little imagination on presentation won't hurt. Afterall, we do eat with our eyes first, don't we?

Nothing much to talk about.  And, it burned a little hole in my wallet.  For that money, I could have a very decent meal at The Slanted Door and have no complains whatsoever. Or, perhaps a few meals at Vung Tau in San Jose. ;-)

A big disappointment.

excerpts: Roast crab and garlic noodles were fantastic.
They hook you up with a bib...a sign of a good meal to come.
Get the fried ice cream b/c it cuts right through that garlic.
A little spendy
but you get what you pay for.
garlic noodles.author: dizzle d.
garlic noodles.review: This place is a gem.  If there's a wait, grab a cocktail at the bar.  Coconut shrimp appetizer with dipping sauce started us on the right track.  Roast crab and garlic noodles were fantastic.  They hook you up with a bib...a sign of a good meal to come.  Get the fried ice cream b/c it cuts right through that garlic.  A little spendy but you get what you pay for.

excerpts: I'm totally serious when I tell you our usual order; four garlic roasted crabs(one for each), 2 garlic noodles, prawn wontons, one order of shakenbeer, one order of fried rice, claypot, and an order of calamari.
I didn't count white rice, but you bet your ass we eat that too.
We usually start with the two orders of garlic noodles, then work our way up.
I drink a lot of beers, too.
I am pretty sure they are '33'.
garlic noodles.author: Miguel G.
garlic noodles.review:
Thanh Long is one of my favorite places to eat in the entire Bay Area. It's so good that it's totally worth donning that humiliating bib to eat a whole garlic crab. It's kind of a dressy place, but that all goes out the window seeing as your hands will be greasy and your good clothes are going to smell like crab anyway. The service is always good and efficient, and we've found the food to be consistent throughout the 5 years of sporadic visits. The restaurant is a bit dressy, but I've come in there with a baseball cap and never got any crap for it. 
I've only gone to this place with my family and between the four of us, we will gladly fast for a whole day in order to eat here. And let me tell you, it can get kind of ugly. I'm totally serious when I tell you our usual order; four garlic roasted crabs(one for each), 2 garlic noodles, prawn wontons, one order of shakenbeer, one order of fried rice, claypot, and an order of calamari. I didn't count white rice, but you bet your ass we eat that too. We usually start with the two orders of garlic noodles, then work our way up. I drink a lot of beers, too. I am pretty sure they are '33'. 
If there was one dish I had that I didn't care for, it was the drunken crab, which is a whole crab simmered in Chardonnay. It just didn't have that fatty, garlicky goodness of the garlic crab. And I love this 'you get the whole crab' thing. Sometimes, you order crab somewhere and you get the legs. Everyone knows the best part is the crab fat you scoop out from the inside of the shell, not just the wimpy-ass legs. 
All in all, this is a pretty pricey place to eat in, but the meal itself is quite fun and the atmosphere is not stuffy. I take some strange kind of perverted delight in the cracking sound of flying shells and watching grease congeal from my hands onto my 7th bottle of '33'(pretty sure that was the beer I drank). This is just a great place to get messy, stuff your face, get drunk, and make your car smell like garlic crab for a couple of days. It will be unpleasant for a day or two, but the meal is worth it.

excerpts: You must get crab and garlic noodles.
garlic noodles.author: M N.
garlic noodles.review:
I love this place!
You're in for a surprise when you walk in the door. The location is pretty much middle of nowhere SF. It's very dimly lit outside, but inside is where all the happening is! This place really feels like a loudly whispered secret. It's pricey, but I think well worth it! You must get crab and garlic noodles.

excerpts: Of course we had garlic crab and garlic noodles, but we had prawn rolls for appetizers, which were heavenly and i had fried bananas with ice cream for dessert...
WOW....
im happy the girl seated on my left
recommended it to me.
Our server was so nice as well, excellent service i forgot her name
but she had blonde hair and a very genuine smile..
plus she wasn't one of the annoying servers who comes back every 1minute.
Oh..the german reisling that she served me was amazing...just amazing... loved everything from start to finish.
would recommend this place to everybody!
garlic noodles.author: jo t.
garlic noodles.review: i've eaten in crustaceans before and i've loved the place to death. So, last friday we decided to try out thanh long...Goodness, it tastes even better than what i expected. Of course we had garlic crab and garlic noodles, but we had prawn rolls for appetizers, which were heavenly and i had fried bananas with ice cream for dessert...WOW.... im happy the girl seated on my left recommended it to me. Our server was so nice as well, excellent service i forgot her name but she had blonde hair and a very genuine smile..plus she wasn't one of the annoying servers who comes back every 1minute. Oh..the german reisling that she served me was amazing...just amazing... loved everything from start to finish. would recommend this place to everybody! =)

excerpts: Everyone raved about the Garlic Noodles, so of course we had to try them.
That and the crab.
I guess I wasn't too impressed with the Garlic Noodles since they were so oily or rather too buttery.
I guess, I was a bit disappointed.
The crab was good but wasn't  "oh, my god..." gotta have more.
garlic noodles.author: Gigi G.
garlic noodles.review:
I guess after hearing so many great things about this place, from so many people, my expectations were high.  I had lived in the sunset all my life and when Thang Long came to the sunset, I never went.  After many years, my hubby and I decided to go.  

It was a lot bigger than I thought since from the outside, it looks like such a small place.  Looks are definetly deceiving.  Parking is horrible, valet service was much needed in this place, which they provide.  

Everyone raved about the Garlic Noodles, so of course we had to try them.  That and the crab.  I guess I wasn't too impressed with the Garlic Noodles since they were so oily or rather too buttery.  I guess, I was a bit disappointed.  The crab was good but wasn't  "oh, my god..." gotta have more.  It was a bit to buttery as well.

Mind you, they may have changed a bit since I did go about 2 years ago.  But I just wanted to give you my two cents.

Maybe I'll give this place another try.

excerpts: Garlic Noodles and Roasted Crab is all you need.
Tastes good but way over priced
garlic noodles.author: Felix T.
garlic noodles.review: Garlic Noodles and Roasted Crab is all you need. Tastes good but way over priced

excerpts: Crab and Tiger Prawns with garlic noodles.
we dont even need menus.
it was a bit crowded on a saturday night but well worth the wait.
We could not be any happier with the food.
This is one of those places where they do not have the prices on the best food
but it does not matter.
It did cost us about $37 per crab but well worth every pennie.
I can't wait to go back.
garlic noodles.author: Ashley H.
garlic noodles.review: wow. this place is soo amazing. we usually go to crustacean on vanness but we came here because it is a little more laid back. The food is soo good. Crab and Tiger Prawns with garlic noodles. we dont even need menus. it was a bit crowded on a saturday night but well worth the wait. We could not be any happier with the food. This is one of those places where they do not have the prices on the best food but it does not matter. It did cost us about $37 per crab but well worth every pennie. I can't wait to go back.

excerpts: When I eat at this place the only two things I need to order is Garlic Roasted Crab and Garlic noodles these are the only things you need!!!!
The crab is cooked in butter and pepper and all this other stuff mannnn i'm getting hungry just writing this.
For all the people that haven't tried this place
yet I say you put this on your agenda.!
yaaaadddddddiiiidaaaaaa
garlic noodles.author: jeremy d.
garlic noodles.review: Thanh Longs is probably the best place in San Francisco to eat crab.  Prices are so so but you get what you pay for. When I eat at this place the only two things I need to order is Garlic Roasted Crab and Garlic noodles these are the only things you need!!!! The crab is cooked in butter and pepper and all this other stuff mannnn i'm getting hungry just writing this. For all the people that haven't tried this place yet I say you put this on your agenda.! yaaaadddddddiiiidaaaaaa

excerpts: Of course knowing that it's famous for the roasted crab, garlic noodles and colossal prawns, that's what I ordered.
I was thoroughly satisfied and stuffed.
I felt guilty for not having any veggies to aid in digesting the buttery garlicky goodness, but my experience was finger lickin' good.
They say the crab comes from Monterey and Alaska, so expect the bill to be pricey.
Other entrees are affordably priced but there is only one vegetarian dish.
They give hot hand towels and provide your table with enough napkins and waste bowls.
On top of that you get to wear a bib!
Didn't see any Vietnamese people working there though, and I thought it was family owned.
Remember, if you're on a date, the funkness of your breath may last til dawn.
garlic noodles.author: Kim G.
garlic noodles.review: The restaurant is spacious, with an upstairs level. You'll have to wait a bit on a Saturday night even if you've made a reservation. People keep hearing about this place and it is packed! Of course knowing that it's famous for the roasted crab, garlic noodles and colossal prawns, that's what I ordered. I was thoroughly satisfied and stuffed. I felt guilty for not having any veggies to aid in digesting the buttery garlicky goodness, but my experience was finger lickin' good. They say the crab comes from Monterey and Alaska, so expect the bill to be pricey. Other entrees are affordably priced but there is only one vegetarian dish. They give hot hand towels and provide your table with enough napkins and waste bowls. On top of that you get to wear a bib! Didn't see any Vietnamese people working there though, and I thought it was family owned. Remember, if you're on a date, the funkness of your breath may last til dawn.

excerpts: The garlic noodle that they sell separate for $9.95 was plain garlic noodles that is more than 2x what you'd pay for in other restaurants, it seems.
The mussels were ok, and basically tasted like Escargot in a French restaurant.
The food at Sunflower in the Mission is better, and less than 1/2 the price here, so if you like the food here, which everyone seems to from reading these reviews, you should try that.
garlic noodles.author: Henry S.
garlic noodles.review: I too drove way out there to try out this restaurant after reading all the great reviews on this restaurant as it sounded like a super seafood restaurant, and I am a big seafood lover.  However, the roasted crab was understatingly disappointing.  The taste was good but the crab wasn't very fresh.  They serve so many crabs a day that I am not sure how they can be not fresh.  Everything else was soaked in butter and oil.  Dishes were overpriced.  This deep-fried crab wonton dish we had was $10.75 that would have cost about half that much in many other Chinese restaurants.  It was pretty much a wonton with cheese in it and had no hint of crab meat that was supposed to be in it.  The garlic noodle that they sell separate for $9.95 was plain garlic noodles that is more than 2x what you'd pay for in other restaurants, it seems.  The mussels were ok, and basically tasted like Escargot in a French restaurant.  The food at Sunflower in the Mission is better, and less than 1/2 the price here, so if you like the food here, which everyone seems to from reading these reviews, you should try that.

excerpts: and the garlic noodles are insane.
place gets crowded on the weekend so buckle up.
garlic noodles.author: andy j.
garlic noodles.review: some of the best crab i have had in my life. and the garlic noodles are insane. place gets crowded on the weekend so buckle up.

excerpts: the roast crab and garlic noodles are yummy.
we also got the coconut shrimp which were pretty good but not stellar.
service was decent too.
i guess we came on a slow night because i didn't have trouble parking or getting seated.
definitely more convenient than crustaceans, and also a more casual feel.
garlic noodles.author: spiff e.
garlic noodles.review: what they say is true: the roast crab and garlic noodles are yummy.  we also got the coconut shrimp which were pretty good but not stellar.  service was decent too.  i guess we came on a slow night because i didn't have trouble parking or getting seated.  definitely more convenient than crustaceans, and also a more casual feel.

excerpts: i died and went to heaven eating the garlic noodles and roast crab.
garlic noodles.author: Michelle K.
garlic noodles.review: i died and went to heaven eating the garlic noodles and roast crab.

excerpts: If you love crab come here and also you have got to try the garlic noodles, the best!!!
garlic noodles.author: Francis J.
garlic noodles.review: If you love crab come here and also you have got to try the garlic noodles, the best!!!

excerpts: I've been wanting to go here because I've heard so many good things about their crab and garlic noodles.
I'm a big fan of anything with garlic....not so much a big fan of crab (mainly because it's so much work just to gather all the meat).
First off, parking was a bitch....took us a lil over 30 minutes to even find a spot.

We were with a couple of friends who have been there before (well actually they've been to Crustacean before which I hear has the exact same menu), so we basically followed their lead on what to order.
We all shared an order of the calamari...which was good but nothing extraordinary.
And then me and the hubs split a Roast Crab, order of Garlic Noodles and an order of the Shaken Beef.
The Crab was delicious although I didn't eat much of it....
I let my hubby have most of it.
Loved the Garlic Noodles but the hubby wasn't as excited about it as I was.
He thought it was kinda plain...as in it was just noodles....
no veggies mixed in.
As for the beef dish, I wouldn't order it again.
It wasn't all that bad but just not my cup of tea.
Overall, I enjoyed my dinner
BUT I did think it was overpriced.
garlic noodles.author: BrElla4eva H.
garlic noodles.review: I've been wanting to go here because I've heard so many good things about their crab and garlic noodles. I'm a big fan of anything with garlic....not so much a big fan of crab (mainly because it's so much work just to gather all the meat). First off, parking was a bitch....took us a lil over 30 minutes to even find a spot. We were with a couple of friends who have been there before (well actually they've been to Crustacean before which I hear has the exact same menu), so we basically followed their lead on what to order. We all shared an order of the calamari...which was good but nothing extraordinary. And then me and the hubs split a Roast Crab, order of Garlic Noodles and an order of the Shaken Beef. The Crab was delicious although I didn't eat much of it....I let my hubby have most of it. Loved the Garlic Noodles but the hubby wasn't as excited about it as I was. He thought it was kinda plain...as in it was just noodles....no veggies mixed in. As for the beef dish, I wouldn't order it again. It wasn't all that bad but just not my cup of tea. Overall, I enjoyed my dinner BUT I did think it was overpriced.

excerpts: Of course if you are eating here, you have to get Garlic Noodles..and Roast Crab.
garlic noodles.author: Jennifer H.
garlic noodles.review: The crab was so fresh and there was so much crabmeat in one crab that it was enough for 2! Of course if you are eating here, you have to get Garlic Noodles..and Roast Crab. We also had Calamari for appetizer( 2 thumbs up) and Shaken Beef ( I did not like it and sent it back) The Shaken Beef had too much licorice/star anise flavor for my taste but the beef was really tender and cooked nicely. You can tell they used high quality cuts of beef because it kind of melts in your mouth it's so tender. Maybe good for old people or babies with no teeth... yes! it's THAT tender. Just wish the seasoning was a little different. Oh yea.. I almost forgot about the drink i had.. I had a mango blended drink and it came in a tiny champaine glass. I can't say that I will be back anytime soon because of the prices.. but it was definately worth it to try it for a special occasion! I had the best crab ever here..Mmmmm..

excerpts: garlic noodles are a must-have as well...but the real surprise here is that pretty much everything else i've tried is fantastic, like the salt and pepper calamari, and the tender beef cubes.
perhaps my favorite thing about this place though is served at the bar: the pineapple/lychee-infused vodka martinis.
you can't even taste the booze.
dangerous!
garlic noodles.author: dusty d.
garlic noodles.review: thanh long has some of the best crab in the city. garlic noodles are a must-have as well...but the real surprise here is that pretty much everything else i've tried is fantastic, like the salt and pepper calamari, and the tender beef cubes. perhaps my favorite thing about this place though is served at the bar: the pineapple/lychee-infused vodka martinis. you can't even taste the booze. dangerous!

excerpts: Can never go wrong with their salmon carpaccio, roasted crab and garlic noodles.
I heard ppq crab is good too but never got a chance to try them.
Their dessert is terrible though, i tried their creme brulee and fried banana and they are not up to standard
garlic noodles.author: fourevindo h.
garlic noodles.review: Can never go wrong with their salmon carpaccio, roasted crab and garlic noodles. I heard ppq crab is good too but never got a chance to try them. Their dessert is terrible though, i tried their creme brulee and fried banana and they are not up to standard

excerpts: the drunken crab and garlic noodles are two of the best things i've ever put in my mouth.
their hot teas and martinis are equally pleasing.
this is definitely my version of comfort food.
garlic noodles.author: rachface -.
garlic noodles.review: if you love its sister restaurant "crustacean" in the city, you'll love this place a bagillion times more because the wait is shorter and the prices are lower.  a great place to eat for special occasions or whenever you have unbearable cravings for crab.  the drunken crab and garlic noodles are two of the best things i've ever put in my mouth.  their hot teas and martinis are equally pleasing.  this is definitely my version of comfort food.

excerpts: I just recently ate here and the garlic noodles and roasted crab are just as delicious as they were 5 years ago.
Service and environment are excellent as well.
It's well worth the wait.
garlic noodles.author: Jim C.
garlic noodles.review: Excellent as always.  I just recently ate here and the garlic noodles and roasted crab are just as delicious as they were 5 years ago.  Service and environment are excellent as well.  It's well worth the wait.

excerpts: The Boyfriend and I had heard that people loved the garlic noodles but the Parents didn't like the looks of it
garlic noodles.author: Christine P.
garlic noodles.review: The Dad loves crab so when the Parents came up for the weekend, the Boyfriend and I decided to follow a friend's advice and take them to Thanh Long. The Parents are notoriously picky about food and the Dad is particularly so when it comes to crab. It has to be fresh, can't be over-seasoned and has to be meaty. Thank goodness for Thanh Long. We ordered the mango salad, Dungeness crab puffs, ginger calamari, Drunken Crab, Roast Crab and the garlic rice. The Boyfriend and I had heard that people loved the garlic noodles but the Parents didn't like the looks of it so the Boyfriend and I again followed the advice of our friend and ordered some garlic rice. In terms of food, Thanh Long gets five stars. The Parents loved the food. The ginger calamari was well-seasoned, not too gingery and not too salty. It was particularly yummy with the pineapples. The mango salad was delicious (it has shrimp and scallops as well) and the garlic rice was flavorful without being overpowering. The Dungeness crab puffs were a big hit but pricey. It was basically a tastier version of crab rangoon. Now for the crab: right before ordering, the Boyfriend and I faithfully checked Yelp and some had said that the Roast Crab was too salty. The Dad isn't too fond of wine-reduction so we tried the Roast Crab first. It was delicious and not too salty at all. The waiter comes over with plastic bibs and you get to cracking (well...the Boyfriend and the Dad got to cracking and then fed the Mom and me bits and pieces). One crab is about enough for one person to be full. One crab is about enough to make two grown men half-full so calculate accordingly. We ordered the Drunken Crab to mix things up and it was also good. It tastes much more Asian in that the wine reduction really saves the flavor of the crab - it's much more crabby than the Roast crab which is more seasoned. The Dad and the Boyfriend liked the Roast Crab a little better, though, so if you want to choose one, I'd advise the Roast Crab. Don't worry about messy/crabby hands. The waitstaff comes by with hot (caution: extremely hot) warm towels for you to towel off between and after crab eating. Finally, for dessert, we ordered orange sorbet. It's really cute - it comes in a frozen orange that's been beheaded and the lemon sorbet comes in a frozen lemon that's been beheaded! The only reason I won't give Thanh Long is that the prices are a bit high. The crab is market price (which meant $37.50 each crab as of June 7, 2009) and the other dishes are pricey as well.

excerpts: Took my old man for his b-day here...the roast crab was great, and the garlic noodles great...it was a great night to remember.
Great service, great food, great company.
Who could ask for more.
It's a bit on the pricy side, but it's not like we go here every week.
An indulgence every so often is necessary, and this is a great place to indulge yourself at.
garlic noodles.author: Ian L.
garlic noodles.review: Took my old man for his b-day here...the roast crab was great, and the garlic noodles great...it was a great night to remember.  Great service, great food, great company.  Who could ask for more.  It's a bit on the pricy side, but it's not like we go here every week.  An indulgence every so often is necessary, and this is a great place to indulge yourself at.

excerpts: When visiting, you must must must order the following dishes in order to ensure a fully satisfying meal: the roast crab, garlic noodles and shaken beef (extremely tender,flavorful beef cubes served over a bed of salad, cherry tomatoes, onions and cubed potatoes).
Follow those instructions and you'll thank me!
garlic noodles.author: Liss E.
garlic noodles.review: I've been a patron of this restaurant for at least 15 years. My parents used to take me to its sister restaurant Crustacean. When we discovered that there was a less expensive/casual sister restaurant, we tried it out and were hooked. Service is great, decor very mellow and quite romantic. All of their desserts are delicious so you won't be disappointed by any choice you make! My personal favorite is the lava cake. It's pretty rich so if sweet isn't your thing then pass on this. But the ice cream paired with it just makes it perfect! When visiting, you must must must order the following dishes in order to ensure a fully satisfying meal: the roast crab, garlic noodles and shaken beef (extremely tender,flavorful beef cubes served over a bed of salad, cherry tomatoes, onions and cubed potatoes). Follow those instructions and you'll thank me!

excerpts: Super delicious roasted garlic crab and garlic noodles.
I can eat those all day.
Of course, you will feel a little fat afterward because it's a bit greasy.
But man, it is definitely worth it!
But pricey.
garlic noodles.author: Jonah P.
garlic noodles.review: If you like crab;  if you like garlic.  if you like to pay high prices.  This place is for you!  Super delicious roasted garlic crab and garlic noodles.  I can eat those all day.  Of course, you will feel a little fat afterward because it's a bit greasy.  But man, it is definitely worth it!  But pricey.

excerpts: I am giving it 3 stars because the food was okay (Garlic Noodles and roasted crab) and the Vietnamese coffee is to die for.
garlic noodles.author: Jack T.
garlic noodles.review: Besides being clean and getting same day reservations Thanh Long is not quite like it's sister restaurant Crustaceans. The service was not great, had to ask for everything, from water to napkins to forks....well they did offer Bibs. I am giving it 3 stars because the food was okay (Garlic Noodles and roasted crab) and the Vietnamese coffee is to die for.

excerpts: We decided to order the Chicken Satay, Roasted Crab, Garlic Noodles, and Shaken Beef.
I'd have to say out of all four of the things we ordered, the Chicken Satay was my least favorite.
But the crab was yummy.
I loved the garlic noodles, even though they were SUPER garlic-y.
And the shaken beef was very good.
We even decided to have dessert and split the Fried Ice Cream and the Fried Pineapple with Ice Cream.
We only picked the fried pineapple because we'd never had it before, but I think we could skip it next time.
They only give you one pineapple ring and it's not that spectacular.
I'd stay with the Fried Banana.
So to round it up, still a solid 4 stars
and I'd definitely go back.
garlic noodles.author: Kris L.
garlic noodles.review: Visited Thanh Long again last night with Hue L. & our NYF (non-yelper friend) after three years.  We made reservations for a Saturday night at 8:00pm.  It was still totally packed, but we didn't have to wait at all because, as I said, we made reservations.  The vibe is pretty laid back here.  I mean, it really has to be when everyone is wearing a white plastic bib around their necks.  We decided to order the Chicken Satay, Roasted Crab, Garlic Noodles, and Shaken Beef.  I'd have to say out of all four of the things we ordered, the Chicken Satay was my least favorite.  But the crab was yummy.  I loved the garlic noodles, even though they were SUPER garlic-y.  And the shaken beef was very good.  We even decided to have dessert and split the Fried Ice Cream and the Fried Pineapple with Ice Cream.  We only picked the fried pineapple because we'd never had it before, but I think we could skip it next time.  They only give you one pineapple ring and it's not that spectacular.  I'd stay with the Fried Banana.  So to round it up, still a solid 4 stars and I'd definitely go back.

excerpts: The sauce it's marinaded in is a yummy Chardonnay butter deliciousness, that goes great with the garlic noodles they recommend.
It takes a while to break that sucka, but oh so worth it!
The restaurant has a nice ambiance with high ceilings, authentic art, and succulent aromas.
It comes with a high price tag but where can you get a huge hunk o crab, done up in several different ways, on any given Sunday?
A definite must for those crustacean cravings!
garlic noodles.author: Tara G.
garlic noodles.review: Made it in there on a busy Sunday night, but got lucky b/c they had a seat for us at the moment.  Ordered up a bottle of Chenin Blanc and the Asian Bouillabaisse for an app... yummy, light and fruity with pineapple, shrimp, and bean sprouts.  I couldn't resist getting the Spicy Eggplant, which was perfect and scrumptious, and the bf got the Drunken Crab... a bad-ass meal!  So good!  They bib you up, strap you with shell-crackers, put a huge crab in front of you, and make you work!  The sauce it's marinaded in is a yummy Chardonnay butter deliciousness, that goes great with the garlic noodles they recommend.  It takes a while to break that sucka, but oh so worth it!  The restaurant has a nice ambiance with high ceilings, authentic art, and succulent aromas.  It comes with a high price tag but where can you get a huge hunk o crab, done up in several different ways, on any given Sunday?  A definite must for those crustacean cravings!

excerpts: We also ordered the garlic noodles... which in my opinion is pretty overrated, although unique.
After the very garlic-y meal, we had the fried banana with ice cream, and the fried hazelnut ice cream.
I felt both were tasty, but nothing extraordinary.
All in all-
I say that the experience was good, I am glad I tried this place out.
However, I probably will not be returning for quite a while.
One reason why-
I was really thirsty for the rest of the night, I brushed my teeth and tongue twice, and my mouth still felt icky.
garlic noodles.author: Orie M.
garlic noodles.review: I am torn between giving this place a 3 or a 4... I think I perhaps had too high of an expectation after reading all the rave reviews. I did enjoy the experience of watching all my friends eat crabs with their hands wearing bibs. The appetizers were pretty good- we had the fried calamari (very good!), the mussels (also good), and some eggroll looking thing (not as good as the other dishes). We ordered three crabs for the six of us, which was plenty, and we got to try out the different flavors. We also ordered the garlic noodles... which in my opinion is pretty overrated, although unique. After the very garlic-y meal, we had the fried banana with ice cream, and the fried hazelnut ice cream. I felt both were tasty, but nothing extraordinary. All in all- I say that the experience was good, I am glad I tried this place out. However, I probably will not be returning for quite a while. One reason why- I was really thirsty for the rest of the night, I brushed my teeth and tongue twice, and my mouth still felt icky.

excerpts: roasted crab and garlic noodles (one for there and one take home) is the only thing I order there.
Its delicious!
garlic noodles.author: Bobo C.
garlic noodles.review: roasted crab and garlic noodles (one for there and one take home) is the only thing I order there. Its delicious!

excerpts: Our table of five shared the famed roast crab ($36/crab), the garlic noodles, the jumbo prawns, spicy eggplant, salt and pepper calamari, Asian bouillabaisse, and banana cake for dessert.
The roast crab was a good size (about 2-2.5 lbs) so three of us shared one (alongside the other food).
Although pretty basic in theory, the garlic noodles were my favorite.
The roast crab was a close second - great flavor and juiciness.
Prawns weren't bad and calamari and eggplant were pretty standard (calamari was lukewarm).
Service was great, and the crowd inside was incredibly diverse (black, white, asian, everyone).
Although pricey, it's super closeby
garlic noodles.author: Melinda C.
garlic noodles.review: I'd been wanting to try this place for a long time, and at long last, I finally went this past Friday night.  What a random location for a pretty nice, high ambiance restaurant.  Per yelp recommendations, I made a reservation in advance so seating was easy.  Our table of five shared the famed roast crab ($36/crab), the garlic noodles, the jumbo prawns, spicy eggplant, salt and pepper calamari, Asian bouillabaisse, and banana cake for dessert.  The roast crab was a good size (about 2-2.5 lbs) so three of us shared one (alongside the other food).  Although pretty basic in theory, the garlic noodles were my favorite.  The roast crab was a close second - great flavor and juiciness.  Prawns weren't bad and calamari and eggplant were pretty standard (calamari was lukewarm).  Service was great, and the crowd inside was incredibly diverse (black, white, asian, everyone).  Although pricey, it's super closeby so I would go and try the drunken crab next time.

excerpts: oh and the garlic noodles are definitely a must-have.
it seems so simple to make
but there's something in that recipe that makes the garlic noodles one of their signature dishes.
the one dessert i loved was the fried banana with ice cream.
a definite treat at the end of the meal.
for big parties make sure 90% of your guests are with you
otherwise the host won't let you sit at your table.
service was good, staff was friendly.
it's a pretty loud atmosphere and you also get hot towels at the end of your crab meal so your fingers don't smell ;)
garlic noodles.author: Ro C.
garlic noodles.review: at 9pm on a saturday night this place was bustling like crazy.  standing outside the restaurant you can see most of the folks with plastic bibs around their neck.  it's all because of the roast crab.  it's sooooo good.   oh and the garlic noodles are definitely a must-have.  it seems so simple to make but there's something in that recipe that makes the garlic noodles one of their signature dishes.  the one dessert i loved was the fried banana with ice cream.  a definite treat at the end of the meal.  for big parties make sure 90% of your guests are with you otherwise the host won't let you sit at your table. service was good, staff was friendly.  it's a pretty loud atmosphere and you also get hot towels at the end of your crab meal so your fingers don't smell ;)

excerpts: We were ready to go from there and went onto order the Asian bouillabaisse soup, Fresh tiger prawns on a bed of garlic noodles, Roasted crab & an additional order of garlic noodles.
The soup came out in no time and was served at a perfect temperature.
Soon after we finished our soup our entrees were making their way to us.
Every plate delish as always.
For a treat we shared a creme brulee to calm the garliciness in our systems.
I can't express how much more enjoyable our dinner was because of Eric.
These are the people that keep the customers coming back.
See yah soon Thanh Long.
I have a feeling we'll be back sooner than we even know!!
garlic noodles.author: Stephanie D.
garlic noodles.review: Finally had a chance recently to revisit an original fave of mine, Thanh Long.  Came here this past Saturday to celebrate yet another bday.  Arrived around 8pm, a bit of a line for valet then we were in.  We were told it would be about a 25 min wait.  Not so bad about 20 mins into the wait the people after us were told it would be a 45 min wait.  We had the bar handy and were in no hurry.  We finally were shown to our table after the crowded waiting area almost spilled out even more out the door.  Eric our server for the night was on top of his game from his first visit to our table ready to take our beverage order.  In a quick minute he was back with our tea and water.  We were ready to go from there and went onto order the Asian bouillabaisse soup, Fresh tiger prawns on a bed of garlic noodles, Roasted crab & an additional order of garlic noodles.  The soup came out in no time and was served at a perfect temperature.  Soon after we finished our soup our entrees were making their way to us.  Every plate delish as always.  For a treat we shared a creme brulee to calm the garliciness in our systems.  I can't express how much more enjoyable our dinner was because of Eric.  These are the people that keep the customers coming back.  See yah soon Thanh Long.  I have a feeling we'll be back sooner than we even know!!

excerpts: the roast crab with garlic noodles are delicious.
i would rather dine here than their sister restaurant at crustacean's.
the dining room is more intimate.
gets crowded on the weekends.
service is delightful.
try their grilled jumbo prawns.
parking could be a problem.
They do have valet parking.
garlic noodles.author: Mika D.
garlic noodles.review: make sure to reserve a table. the roast crab with garlic noodles are delicious. i would rather dine here than their sister restaurant at crustacean's. the dining room is more intimate. gets crowded on the weekends. service is delightful. try their grilled jumbo prawns. parking could be a problem. They do have valet parking.

excerpts: Everyone there is for one reason: get there fingers dirty with crab and suck down plates of garlic noodles.
A great guys night out.
Take a couple of your best buds and eat like kings.
Also be ready to pay like kings.
We had 3 guys
3 crabs 2 bottles of wine and total was around $240 with tip.
Waiter suggested a great white wine.
I was to busy stuffing my face with crab and noodles to catch the name on the bottle.
After the meal we asked the hostess about the history of the restaurant and discovered the most awesome story of all time about there kitchen.
Shady on the details
but it is something like this.....
Thanh Long was started back in the 70's by woman that lives down the street.
Coolest part about the story is the kitchen.
It is called the secret kitchen.
only members of the family can go in and out of the kitchen.
garlic noodles.author: John S.
garlic noodles.review: Pretty much the most awesome restaurant in San Francisco. Get reservations. We got there at 9:00 pm and the place was jammed. Everyone there is for one reason: get there fingers dirty with crab and suck down plates of garlic noodles. A great guys night out. Take a couple of your best buds and eat like kings. Also be ready to pay like kings. We had 3 guys  3 crabs 2 bottles of wine and total was around $240 with tip. Waiter suggested a great white wine. I was to busy stuffing my face with crab and noodles to catch the name on the bottle. After the meal we asked the hostess about the history of the restaurant and discovered the most awesome story of all time about there kitchen. Shady on the details but it is something like this.....Thanh Long was started back in the 70's by woman that lives down the street. Coolest part about the story is the kitchen. It is called the secret kitchen. only members of the family can go in and out of the kitchen.

excerpts: We all ordered the Bo Luc Lac (Lemon Shakened Beef) which was delicious btw, and of course the garlic noodles (which was gone in 2 minutes) and of course the main dish, which they're famously known for..the CRAB!
I didn't really think the crab was all that...the crabs didn't taste very fresh which was a total disappointment in my book.
garlic noodles.author: Janet T.
garlic noodles.review: The first restaurant for the An Family...once it became really popular..they went on to open up their high end restaurant called Crustacean in Nob Hill. Thanh Long is OK, not as highly regarded in my book..Looks like a typical hole in the wall..and its really hard to find because they're nestled in a quiet neighborhood in the outskirts of SF. We came with a large party and had to wait for 30 mins to get seated (even with a reservation). We all ordered the Bo Luc Lac (Lemon Shakened Beef) which was delicious btw, and of course the garlic noodles (which was gone in 2 minutes) and of course the main dish, which they're famously known for..the CRAB! I didn't really think the crab was all that...the crabs didn't taste very fresh which was a total disappointment in my book.

excerpts: Garlic noodles are awesome.
garlic noodles.author: Robert S.
garlic noodles.review: Garlic noodles are awesome.  Had the prawn which was also very good but didn't get the famous drunken crab.  Maybe next time.  Service is very friendly and food comes out fairly fast, even when it's packed.  We went at night and it was a little hard to find b/c it looks like a little hole-in-the-wall from outside (located across the street from a 7-11!), but it actually is a pretty classy-looking restaurant inside.

excerpts: the garlic noodles and roasted crab are the BEST.
i haven't really eaten much of anything else since i love these two things so much.
the calamari appetizer is pretty good, and the mussels are my FAVE.
the veggie side (usually is snowpeas) is pretty darn good too.
after eating here for 7 or more years, i finally tried the mango seafood salad.
it's pretty good!
the seafood is warm though, so if you get it to go, the salad gets kind of mushy.
unfortunately, the prices are a bit on the higher side (but still cheaper than it's sister restaurant Crustaceans!!)
so this place is more like a once a month or every other month place.
anyway, if you haven't been here, you definitely have to try.
it's so good i ate here
2x a week (despite the prices) for a whole summer.
garlic noodles.author: Cheryl L.
garlic noodles.review:
i heart Thanh Long!  i think they know me by name, or at least by my phone number since i've eaten here so many times.  the garlic noodles and roasted crab are the BEST.  i haven't really eaten much of anything else since i love these two things so much.  the calamari appetizer is pretty good, and the mussels are my FAVE.  the veggie side (usually is snowpeas) is pretty darn good too.  after eating here for 7 or more years, i finally tried the mango seafood salad.  it's pretty good!  the seafood is warm though, so if you get it to go, the salad gets kind of mushy.  unfortunately, the prices are a bit on the higher side (but still cheaper than it's sister restaurant Crustaceans!!) so this place is more like a once a month or every other month place.  anyway, if you haven't been here, you definitely have to try.  it's so good i ate here 2x a week (despite the prices) for a whole summer.  :D

Oh yeah, minus one star for the difficulty of parking, long waits (MAKE A RESERVATION!), and because my addiction to Thanh Long singlehandedly caused me to be broke until Christmas.

excerpts: and so huge i could not finish it...we also had the garlic noodles which was very tasty as well but also
very dry...

i asked for a side of butter for the crab, but they seemed to give me the oil or oily butter that was cook with the crab that had no butter taste to it at all...that was the only dissapoinment because i always enjoy my crab more with that melted buttery taste to accompany it but lacked that butter flavor =
(..i would def come back, but i definately need to ask for some real melted butter with my crab
garlic noodles.author: Jenny G.
garlic noodles.review: so i came here with my grilfriend about a week ago for my birthday...i must say it was a very huge crab...i had the roasted crab which was good and so huge i could not finish it...we also had the garlic noodles which was very tasty as well but also  very dry...i asked for a side of butter for the crab, but they seemed to give me the oil or oily butter that was cook with the crab that had no butter taste to it at all...that was the only dissapoinment because i always enjoy my crab more with that melted buttery taste to accompany it but lacked that butter flavor =(..i would def come back, but i definately need to ask for some real melted butter with my crab

excerpts: Roasted crab and garlic noodles are the best I've had in San Francisco.
Much better than PPQ.
It can get very crowded on weekends so be prepared to wait!
garlic noodles.author: Abhik P.
garlic noodles.review: Roasted crab and garlic noodles are the best I've had in San Francisco. Much better than PPQ. It can get very crowded on weekends so be prepared to wait!

excerpts: Yes the garlic noodles were good, but let me tell you they were extremely garlic-y.
I drank about a pitcher of water or so on my own.
I had the butterfly shrimp with garlic noodles which ended up being over $30 - totally not worth it.
The crab is hard work just to have a nice dinner..
many people favor the sauce but it's just a fatty, greasy, buttery sauce that if you know how to cook - can do it at home with fresh crab.
Don't get me wrong, it's not a horrible restaurant, just not for me!
It was a great experience.. there was good service and it was a memorable evening as I went home with a stomach ache for the next couple of days..
Won't be going back anytime soon..
But indeed, it was quite flavorful..
garlic noodles.author: Rochelle F.
garlic noodles.review: The restaurant was nice and the food was tasty, however I think that it's a little over-rated and over-priced for some of the dishes. The food was flavorful and there wasn't a ton of variety but it was a nice experience and I don't think that I will ever go back. Yes the garlic noodles were good, but let me tell you they were extremely garlic-y. I drank about a pitcher of water or so on my own. I had the butterfly shrimp with garlic noodles which ended up being over $30 - totally not worth it. The crab is hard work just to have a nice dinner.. many people favor the sauce but it's just a fatty, greasy, buttery sauce that if you know how to cook - can do it at home with fresh crab. Don't get me wrong, it's not a horrible restaurant, just not for me! It was a great experience.. there was good service and it was a memorable evening as I went home with a stomach ache for the next couple of days.. Won't be going back anytime soon.. But indeed, it was quite flavorful..

excerpts: We ordered the soft shell crab and salt and pepper calamari for appetizers and  the roast  crab and garlic noodles for the entree.
The soft shell crab was very good.
They give you one small deep fried soft shell crab with sweet & sour dipping sauce.
The salt & pepper calamari was decent.
I thought it was a little too salty for my taste.
It left me wanting to take a sip of H2O every time I took a bite.
Every one there seemed to be eating the garlic noodles.
We were curious and ordered it as well.
I  personally wasn't impressed.
It was a pretty simple dish.
I think I could have gone without it.
Overall, I give this place 4 stars due to the fact that it was expensive, the lack of parking, and the buttery greasy taste it left in my mouth for the rest of the day.
garlic noodles.author: Cynthia S.
garlic noodles.review: I was excited to eat here especially after finding out that they share the same owners as crustaceans. I honestly didn't know what to expect because my friends from Hawaii who were visiting suggested to go to this place. Apparently this place has a reputation even in Hawaii. I was pleasantly surprised to find this place in my own backyard. I wasn't expecting this restaurant to be in the suburbs in the outer sunset. Parking was terrible so my friends and I opted for  valet. I think it was $10. We ordered the soft shell crab and salt and pepper calamari for appetizers and  the roast  crab and garlic noodles for the entree. The soft shell crab was very good. They give you one small deep fried soft shell crab with sweet & sour dipping sauce. The salt & pepper calamari was decent. I thought it was a little too salty for my taste. It left me wanting to take a sip of H2O every time I took a bite. The roast crab was DELICIOUS!! It was really good. I didn't enjoy it as much when the crab became cold. It's served in a puddle of butter that started to congeal at the end of the meal. It wasn't a pretty site. I felt like my arteries were clogging instantly. Every one there seemed to be eating the garlic noodles. We were curious and ordered it as well. I  personally wasn't impressed. It was a pretty simple dish. I think I could have gone without it.  Overall, I give this place 4 stars due to the fact that it was expensive, the lack of parking, and the buttery greasy taste it left in my mouth for the rest of the day.

excerpts: So she needs to learn how to be very nice, cordial and professional, talk slowly and gently to the people who are their customers, especially the famous Roast Crab now costs $39;  the Shaken Beef is $24; and Garlic Noodles at $10 each + tax.

My bill totalled up almost $400 and I still got the feeling that they are trying to rush me out of the door after we ate the banana ala mode, which by the way had a rotten-black banana inside that thick fried flour, that is why I had to ask for another.
They all need to chill out.
The clerk needs to enroll in some telephone etiquette class real quick, otherwise, people will get upset with their piss-poor manners.
Oh BTW, does the An Family (Danny) still own and run this business
or it's been sold to those new owners?
I don't recognize anyone there anymore.
Not one familiar face anywhere.
That place is going down quite fast .
The service sucks.
It used to be nice.
garlic noodles.author: Jimmie D.
garlic noodles.review: Been a regular and eating at this Thanh Long since those $11.00 Roast Crab days in the mid-to late 80's.  The roast crab taste is constant, gotta luv it.  The service last night is not what it used to be.  Servers are in such a hurry that when they walk behind you, a tornado spins around and you know a server just came by.  They sure forgot to smile too and are no longer hospitable, accomodating  the way they used to be.  Even the manager is not friendly anymore.  All just straight business, all dollars and cents. They have lost that "family" atmosphere and feeling we used to get from that place.  The other bad thing about them lately?  The reservation clerk.  I called after 3pm Thursday and made a reservation and who ever answered my call made me feel like I was talking to a drill sergeant.  She was in a big hurry and just way-too harsh when she speaks.  You know, the kind that shows, "no respect" to the caller/patron?  So I asked her why she's too harsh, she said she takes in some 300 phone calls a day.  I did not want to be rude so I said, it's alright, it's ok.  I was still nice to her.
