But in my mind, unless she's doing these as a volunteer for no-pay, which is out-of-the-question, it is safe to assume that she is an employee who's getting paid to answer that phone to take and cancel reservations.  So she needs to learn how to be very nice, cordial and professional, talk slowly and gently to the people who are their customers, especially the famous Roast Crab now costs $39;  the Shaken Beef is $24; and Garlic Noodles at $10 each + tax.  My bill totalled up almost $400 and I still got the feeling that they are trying to rush me out of the door after we ate the banana ala mode, which by the way had a rotten-black banana inside that thick fried flour, that is why I had to ask for another.  They all need to chill out.  The clerk needs to enroll in some telephone etiquette class real quick, otherwise, people will get upset with their piss-poor manners.  Oh BTW, does the An Family (Danny) still own and run this business or it's been sold to those new owners?  I don't recognize anyone there anymore.  Not one familiar face anywhere.  That place is going down quite fast .  The service sucks. It used to be nice.

excerpts: The Thanh Long fish comes with An's garlic noodles, my first bite almost made me really mad that I had gone so long through life without tasting this.
Seriously, it was one of the best things I've ever tasted, I couldn't believe it.
Don't go without getting roasted crab and garlic noodles!
garlic noodles.author: Kathleen Y.
garlic noodles.review: This was our first time here, on a Friday night around 9pm. It was about 3/4 full, our waiter was almost overly friendly, but that's ok. We ordered the Rice Paper Rolls as an appetizer, the Thanh Long fish and the roasted crab. I would skip the Rice Paper Rolls next time, they were good but not great. The Thanh Long fish comes with An's garlic noodles, my first bite almost made me really mad that I had gone so long through life without tasting this. Seriously, it was one of the best things I've ever tasted, I couldn't believe it. The Thanh Long fish was also good, it had delicate Vietnamese flavors, very tasty. Of course, the roasted crab was amazing! Sweet, butter, salty, peppery and all in the right amounts.  I liked the two helpings of steaming hot towels they brought for the finger cleanup after eating the crab. I also had a really good Brandy Alexander as my dessert. One downside was they were completely out of the three Vietnamese beers on their drink menu. This is going to be a new restaurant for us to take out-of-town guests. Don't go without getting roasted crab and garlic noodles!

excerpts: No other place is better than here for roasted crab and garlic noodles!
I like this place even better than it's sister restaurant, Crustacean, because of it's lively atmosphere and no dress code.
garlic noodles.author: Helen V.
garlic noodles.review: No other place is better than here for roasted crab and garlic noodles!  I like this place even better than it's sister restaurant, Crustacean, because of it's lively atmosphere and no dress code.

excerpts: garlic noodles and garlic roasted crab are the staple items of this restaurant and it's what I order all the time.
noodles are sometimes lumped together.
garlic noodles.author: Will I A m.
garlic noodles.review: garlic noodles and garlic roasted crab are the staple items of this restaurant and it's what I order all the time.  noodles are sometimes lumped together.

excerpts: the crab and garlic noodles.
the thing to do here is to order one crab at a time and share.
eat it while its hot and then order the 2nd one afterwards, its so awesome when its hot.
garlic noodles.author: Peter L.
garlic noodles.review: this is the famous crab place in sunset.  its damn pricy though.  but, the best crab place ive ever been to in the US.  i still like the spicy  pepper crab i had in singapore.  that was the bomb.  been here 3 times and each time we pretty much order the same thing.  the crab and garlic noodles.  the thing to do here is to order one crab at a time and share.  eat it while its hot and then order the 2nd one afterwards, its so awesome when its hot.

excerpts: just be sure to get garlic noodles.
everything is totally worth the price too.
service is pretty good and so is the ambiance.
garlic noodles.author: Kelly D.
garlic noodles.review: garlic roasted crab is awesome. just be sure to get garlic noodles. everything is totally worth the price too. service is pretty good and so is the ambiance.

excerpts: I would go with the reviews and suggestions and just order their crabs (both roasted and drunken were great), garlic noodles (which were not greasy this time!) and the fantastic green mussels.
garlic noodles.author: Patty J.
garlic noodles.review: I would go with the reviews and suggestions and just order their crabs (both roasted and drunken were great), garlic noodles (which were not greasy this time!) and the fantastic green mussels.  We wanted some veggies but the Buddha rolls came out cold, and the mango salad hot and somewhat lacking, and the Asian Bouillabaisse was just tomato water with some flavor and lukewarm.  Honestly only the mussels came out piping hot as most of the other foods must have  been pr-prepared and just warmed up.  It is crab season so each crab was $37, now is the best time to go!  Plan to go back and try the tamarind crab and more mussels.  Will try take out?

excerpts: get the garlic noodles, a green vegetable, one of the crabs and a bottle of riesling.
divine.
garlic noodles.author: oona m.
garlic noodles.review: than long is a fun destination for family events- assuming your family is as large and loud as mine. get the garlic noodles, a green vegetable, one of the crabs and a bottle of riesling. divine.

excerpts: Garlic crab and garlic noodles - never tried anything else.
A little pricey for outer sunset.
garlic noodles.author: Ilya L.
garlic noodles.review: Love this place. We go here once a year. Garlic crab and garlic noodles - never tried anything else. A little pricey for outer sunset.

excerpts: Passed on the garlic noodles.
Everyone else around us seemed to have it on their tables
but we didn't feel that $10 was worth a small plate of noodles with garlic.
Overall we were expecting something really delicious
but it sure did fall flat.
Plus, they celebrated 4 birthdays that night in a one hour time span.
Seemed not so special after the 2nd birthday song.
Won't be going back.
garlic noodles.author: Mystic C.
garlic noodles.review: I don't get why people rave about this place.  Parking was really difficult.  We circled around for 15 minutes before finding a spot.  Came here with friends on a Tuesday night with an 8pm reservation.  The place was packed and we were seated within 10 minutes.  Had the salt and pepper calamari to start, which to me was the hit of the night.  Don't bother ordering the dumpling appetizer.  Yuck!  We also ordered the tamarind crab and the original roasted crab.  The tamarind crab was definitely the more tasty and interesting one.  The roasted crab had disappointing flavor and was a bit dry.  We also ordered a combination noodle dish which was good.  Passed on the garlic noodles.  Everyone else around us seemed to have it on their tables but we didn't feel that $10 was worth a small plate of noodles with garlic.  Overall we were expecting something really delicious but it sure did fall flat.  Plus, they celebrated 4 birthdays that night in a one hour time span.  Seemed not so special after the 2nd birthday song.  Won't be going back.

excerpts: Garlic noodles were really good, but I'm not sure if I would like to pay so much for the crabs.
garlic noodles.author: sor j.
garlic noodles.review: Garlic noodles were really good, but I'm not sure if I would like to pay so much for the crabs.

excerpts: first thing you'll notice is that every single table has the exact same dishes:  roast crab and garlic noodles.
so i tried to be original and ordered roast crab and
it was still good, but i guess i'll have to go back and try the garlic noodles now.
oh, definitely make reservations ahead of time.
went on a whim and ended up waiting 1.5 hours before being seated.
garlic noodles.author: Eric M.
garlic noodles.review: kinda far out there but definitely worth going to if you're in the mood for some crab.  first thing you'll notice is that every single table has the exact same dishes:  roast crab and garlic noodles.  so i tried to be original and ordered roast crab and......................fried rice.  it was still good, but i guess i'll have to go back and try the garlic noodles now.  oh, definitely make reservations ahead of time.  went on a whim and ended up waiting 1.5 hours before being seated.

excerpts: going back this weekend for the roasted crabs and garlic noodles.. can't wait!
garlic noodles.author: jason l.
garlic noodles.review: simply "amazing". going back this weekend for the roasted crabs and garlic noodles.. can't wait!

excerpts: The crabs and garlic noodles are delicious!
If you like crabs, I recommend this place.
The place is a bit too crowded.
We had a reservation for 2 but still had to wait about half an hour.
Parking is a major problem, but then it's a problem at most places in SF.
Service is decent for such a noisy place.
garlic noodles.author: Bebe L.
garlic noodles.review: The crabs and garlic noodles are delicious! If you like crabs, I recommend this place.  The place is a bit too crowded. We had a reservation for 2 but still had to wait about half an hour. Parking is a major problem, but then it's a problem at most places in SF.  Service is decent for such a noisy place.

excerpts: Garlic noodles and roasted crab are delicious, like most have already said.
The people sitting at the next table seemed to really enjoy the garlic noodles too because they had 5 orders of it - for freakin 2 people!
That's a whole lotta carbs!
The only thing is that the noodles & crab came out super duper fast, it just made me think of how long the food must have been prepared in advance and sitting in the back kitchen.
But I guess it wasnt so bad because I was starving!
garlic noodles.author: S M.
garlic noodles.review: Garlic noodles and roasted crab are delicious, like most have already said.  The people sitting at the next table seemed to really enjoy the garlic noodles too because they had 5 orders of it - for freakin 2 people! That's a whole lotta carbs! The only thing is that the noodles & crab came out super duper fast, it just made me think of how long the food must have been prepared in advance and sitting in the back kitchen.  But I guess it wasnt so bad because I was starving!

excerpts: The garlic noodles were excellent but the roasted crabs started to taste salty after a while.
I usually enjoy eating crab but after finishing half of the crab I felt like I was just eating salt.
Its a place you want to try once but
next time I spend a bill I would like stop eating because I am fool not because I am sick of eating what is on my plate.
garlic noodles.author: Vince L.
garlic noodles.review: Started off with the fried crab wontons which were not so good. We had to give this a place try because most of our friends were talking about how good it was. The garlic noodles were excellent but the roasted crabs started to taste salty after a while. I usually enjoy eating crab but after finishing half of the crab I felt like I was just eating salt. Its a place you want to try once but next time I spend a bill I would like stop eating because I am fool not because I am sick of eating what is on my plate.

excerpts: Garlic noodles, and the crab are to die for!!
Must order- even if that's the only thing you order there.
You won't regret it at all!
garlic noodles.author: Rachel P.
garlic noodles.review: I LOVE IT HERE! It is a pricey restaurant, but the food is delicious!!! Garlic noodles, and the crab are to die for!! Must order- even if that's the only thing you order there. You won't regret it at all! If your pockets are in the mood for spending you should also try the Saigon Beef, which is Filet Mignon over mixed greens. They've got plenty other great things on the menu.  Parking is not so good in the area- arrive early if you had reservations or anything.

excerpts: Make sure to try the garlic noodles and the roasted crab.
garlic noodles.author: Bob H.
garlic noodles.review: You've got to try to get there but it's a great restaurant. Make reservations. Make sure to try the garlic noodles and the roasted crab.

excerpts: we ordered the roasted crab special, the garlic noodles, shaken beef, and two deserts (deep fried ice cream and molten lava cake)
sooo... it was definately not AMAZING, but it was pretty damn good!
i guess what i'm trying to say is that i really wouldnt go out of my way next time just to go there, however if im in the neighborhood, then absolutely!
the crab was delicious!
you're served a whole dungeness crab roasted in a POOL of olive oil, garlic salt and black pepper!
im almost certain my arteries are a bit clogged!
the garlic noodles are not so much of a huge deal as they are made out to be.
theyre just pretty much spaghetti noodles fried in oil and garlic salt.
boyfriend describes them as tasting like "garlic bread sticks
" i did not try the shaken beef itself
but i did try the sauteed veggies accompanying it
and it was amazing! perfectly carmelized and deliciously sweet!
yummy!
the deserts were on another level!
they were out of this world!
molten lava cake was moist and rich!
ice cream was silky and smooth!!!
the entire meal came out to $95.
its a fair price i suppose, considering the size of the crab and the rest of the meals we ordered!
the service was super quick!
we were in and
although there was a gang of people waiting, we were seated in just 10 minutes and served our meal probably another 10 minutes after ordering!
the wait staff was not very talkative but thats alright.
they were competent, thats all that matters!
P
garlic noodles.author: Sandy P.
garlic noodles.review: the boyfriend knows what a huge fan of crab i am so when he heard about thanh long, he knew he HAD to take me! last weekend, we made the trip from sacramento to san fransisco to see what all the fuss was about! we ordered the roasted crab special, the garlic noodles, shaken beef, and two deserts (deep fried ice cream and molten lava cake) sooo... it was definately not AMAZING, but it was pretty damn good! i guess what i'm trying to say is that i really wouldnt go out of my way next time just to go there, however if im in the neighborhood, then absolutely! the crab was delicious! you're served a whole dungeness crab roasted in a POOL of olive oil, garlic salt and black pepper! im almost certain my arteries are a bit clogged! the garlic noodles are not so much of a huge deal as they are made out to be. theyre just pretty much spaghetti noodles fried in oil and garlic salt. boyfriend describes them as tasting like "garlic bread sticks" i did not try the shaken beef itself but i did try the sauteed veggies accompanying it and it was amazing! perfectly carmelized and deliciously sweet! yummy! the deserts were on another level! they were out of this world! molten lava cake was moist and rich! ice cream was silky and smooth!!! the entire meal came out to $95. its a fair price i suppose, considering the size of the crab and the rest of the meals we ordered! the service was super quick! we were in and although there was a gang of people waiting, we were seated in just 10 minutes and served our meal probably another 10 minutes after ordering! the wait staff was not very talkative but thats alright. they were competent, thats all that matters! =P

excerpts: The crab here is awesome as is the Garlic Noodles.
One of the best in the bay.
Definitely great for family and friend gatherings.
Why 4 out of 5 stars?
Not the easiest to get parking and the place itself is dated looking...
garlic noodles.author: A Y.
garlic noodles.review: OH YEAH, I love crab!  This one is a no brainer!  The crab here is awesome as is the Garlic Noodles.  One of the best in the bay.  Definitely great for family and friend gatherings.  Why 4 out of 5 stars?  Not the easiest to get parking and the place itself is dated looking...

excerpts: entrees: roasted crab (yummy - almost ate a whole crab by myself!), garlic noodles (kinda bland, not enough garlic), shaken beef (ok at best, much better at slanted door), seasonal vegetable saute (good, firm string beans), steamed rice (rice is rice).
for dessert, we had chocolate cake and fried pineapple, i think.
i don't have a sweet tooth
garlic noodles.author: sandra l.
garlic noodles.review:
i love crab. i love garlic. i love noodles. but, i didn't love thanh long. it was good but not great. i still prefer PPQ's food any day. 

for appetizers, we had the seafood dumplings (nothing special or fancy) and jumbo prawns wonton (good). entrees: roasted crab (yummy - almost ate a whole crab by myself!), garlic noodles (kinda bland, not enough garlic), shaken beef (ok at best, much better at slanted door), seasonal vegetable saute (good, firm string beans), steamed rice (rice is rice). for dessert, we had chocolate cake and fried pineapple, i think. i don't have a sweet tooth so desserts will always just be ok for me.  

oh, the bathroom was gross! they need to clean it more often. yuck. 

the service was excellent. very attentive. the ambiance was cute...not fancy like the sister restaurant crustaceans of course but still nice.

excerpts: garlic noodles and crab, that is all you need.
Pricey for crab and noodles, but damn worth it from time to time.
garlic noodles.author: DT l.
garlic noodles.review: Owned by same owners of Crustaceans....garlic noodles and crab, that is all you need. Pricey for crab and noodles, but damn worth it from time to time.

excerpts: I had a craving for garlic noodles and crab so the hubby and I scooted our way to SF.
We arrived at just before 5 pm and there was already a crowd waiting to get in.
I had the roast crab and garlic noodles, where my hubby got the tamarind version (surprisingly a little sweet).
While he was in the bathroom, the table next to us, requested garlic noodles with the crab already cracked.
The waiter had to tell them, that it wasn't on the menu...sorry.
garlic noodles.author: Jasmin D.
garlic noodles.review: I had a craving for garlic noodles and crab so the hubby and I scooted our way to SF. We arrived at just before 5 pm and there was already a crowd waiting to get in. I had the roast crab and garlic noodles, where my hubby got the tamarind version (surprisingly a little sweet). I would normally get the drunken crab but I wasn't sure if it was okay with a little one on the way. Because getting the noodles with the roast crab was a little too much butter for me. I should have had a side of white rice. Oh well. We had dessert which was really yummy, green tea creme brulee. I think that meal fulfilled my craving for crab for a while. On a funny note: my husband likes to crack his crab before eating it so he can wash his hands. While he was in the bathroom, the table next to us, requested garlic noodles with the crab already cracked. The waiter had to tell them, that it wasn't on the menu...sorry.

excerpts: I understand that this restaurant was the first to do this type of style, but another restaurant PPQ Dungeness Island Vietnamese Cuisine on Clement makes a better tasting Crab and Garlic Noodles.
We ordered the Sea Bass and it was quite small for the price.
I felt it was small enough to be an appetizer rather than an entree.
If you are looking for a great place to eat Crabs and Garlic noodles, try PPQ Dungeness Island Vietnamese Cuisine.
garlic noodles.author: Long T.
garlic noodles.review: We went there because we heard the crab was really good. Reserve a table when you go. We made the mistake of not reserving a table, and when you are out near that restaurant, there aren't many options to eat that I knew about in that neighborhood. While waiting for our table, I read the description about the owner and the food. Its suppose to be Vietnamese influenced, but I could only find one item that was Vietnamese-like and that was the crab with tamarind sauce. I understand that this restaurant was the first to do this type of style, but another restaurant PPQ Dungeness Island Vietnamese Cuisine on Clement makes a better tasting Crab and Garlic Noodles. We ordered the Sea Bass and it was quite small for the price. I felt it was small enough to be an appetizer rather than an entree. If you are looking for a great place to eat Crabs and Garlic noodles, try PPQ Dungeness Island Vietnamese Cuisine.

excerpts: mmm... only opening the menu to take a quick glance, i already knew what i wanted and was anxious to get my order of the garlic noodles in.
my bf, who was a thanh long first timer, read over the menu and decided to order the garlic noodles i always rave about and an order of the salt & pepper fried calamari appetizer.
when i come here, i'm usually set on ordering the garlic noodles and the garlic roasted crab.
the fried calamari was good though.
dining at thanh long is a must-try if you like crab, noodles and especially garlic.
the food is not so healthy, but oh so deeelicious!
garlic noodles.author: Joy C.
garlic noodles.review: i was sooo excited when my bf told me that he made reservations for us plus one to have dinner at thanh long.  i mentioned to him that it's difficult to find parking around there, considering it's in the sunset, so we might as well save time and gas and just go straight to valet.  of course, he decides that he wants to take a chance and look.  we ended up going to valet, just as i had suggested.  we got to the restaurant a bit early for our 7pm reservations.  you could smell garlic in the air before you even step into the place.  mmm... only opening the menu to take a quick glance, i already knew what i wanted and was anxious to get my order of the garlic noodles in.  my bf, who was a thanh long first timer, read over the menu and decided to order the garlic noodles i always rave about and an order of the salt & pepper fried calamari appetizer.  when i come here, i'm usually set on ordering the garlic noodles and the garlic roasted crab.  the fried calamari was good though.  dining at thanh long is a must-try if you like crab, noodles and especially garlic.  the food is not so healthy, but oh so deeelicious!  =)

excerpts: Then last weekend I went in there with my boyfriend, and we ordered their Salt and Pepper calamari, garlic noodles and roasted crab...
my
oh my, it was
REALLY good!
And their bartender, Peter was very nice and friendly.
He made my drink (Pinacolada) just the way I like it.
I would definitely come back again in this restaurant...
Now I know why this place is always packed.... their servings are so good!
And not only that, I like the fact that after eating crabs the waiters/servers would give you a HOT (and I mean REALLY hot) damp towel to wipe your hands...
I strongly recommend anyone to go to this place and try it themselves, it's worth the long line of waiting although they make up by serving your food faster and efficiently.
garlic noodles.author: Christina Z.
garlic noodles.review: I LOVE THIS PLACE!!!  Ok, so I'd pass by this place EVERY DAY before and after I go to work and when I would get home (which is around 8:30pm) the place is already busy and packed with people (especially on the weekends).  So I tried it with a friend, Wendy to celebrate our birthdays and I ordered their Mango Salad and let me tell you.. it was HEAVENLY!!! I normally don't eat scallops but theirs was THE BOMB! it was DELICIOUS! I LOVE their dessert as well, their chocolate dessert was rich and creamy... mmm, yummy! Then last weekend I went in there with my boyfriend, and we ordered their Salt and Pepper calamari, garlic noodles and roasted crab... my oh my, it was REALLY good!  And their bartender, Peter was very nice and friendly.  He made my drink (Pinacolada) just the way I like it. :-D  I would definitely come back again in this restaurant... Now I know why this place is always packed.... their servings are so good! And not only that, I like the fact that after eating crabs the waiters/servers would give you a HOT (and I mean REALLY hot) damp towel to wipe your hands... I strongly recommend anyone to go to this place and try it themselves, it's worth the long line of waiting although they make up by serving your food faster and efficiently.

excerpts: yummy crab and garlic noodles...ummmm...and the eggplant is good too.
garlic noodles.author: JENELLE E.
garlic noodles.review: yummy crab and garlic noodles...ummmm...and the eggplant is good too.

excerpts: Of course we ordered the garlic noodles.
One for order each person and when they were brought to the table just before the crab our friend said that perhaps we ordered too much !
Little did she know.
Once the waitress came over with our plastic bibs we knew what was coming.
Our friend had never had the crack it yourself kinda crab and was in for quite a shock when the waitress brough over three huge ~ like 3 lbs huge - crabs to our table.
The top shell was polished and is really for show as we pulled them off and gave them to the waitress before diving into some of the meatiest crabs that you'll ever have.
Once the crab was on our table it got quiet, real quiet as we each took the task of getting into that sweet crab meat.
Our friend had no problem cracking into those thick legs and before long was totally immersed in the picking out the meat.
One bite into the garlic noodles did it for her as we all agreed that it was totally unique.

My wife and I have tried to find a similer place , like PPQ, but when all is said and done Thanh Long is still the high water mark when it comes to roasted crab in San Francisco or anywhere else for that matter.
The glow of a great meal stays with you long after you've paid the check.
And you can't say that for most resturants.
garlic noodles.author: Nick C.
garlic noodles.review: First things first. If you don't like Dungenous Crab then skip this place.  If you love Dungenous Crab then please step inside.  This place is simply the best place to get roasted crab in the world.  Much has been said about the priciness of the food, however, at market prices your looking at $36 bucks a crab.  Don't let the sticker shock keep you away because this place serves up some mighty huge crabs that will keep you quite full.  My wife and I brought a friend who wanted to explore the menu a bit during our last outing.  After being seated at a nice table in the upstairs area we had a couple of Grey Goose martinis before settling into the menu.  These were great drinks at $8.50 each.  Our friend wanted to try some appitizers so we went for the roasted mussels, the Salt and Pepper Calimari, and  fried prawns  and a couple of salads; the papaya and the Vietnamese house salad.  These were all good, however, on our next visit we agreed  that we would just go with the Vietnamese salad to get our palettes ready for the crab.  Of course we ordered the garlic noodles. One for order each person and when they were brought to the table just before the crab our friend said that perhaps we ordered too much !   Little did she know. Once the waitress came over with our plastic bibs we knew what was coming. Our friend had never had the crack it yourself kinda crab and was in for quite a shock when the waitress brough over three huge ~ like 3 lbs huge - crabs to our table.  The top shell was polished and is really for show as we pulled them off and gave them to the waitress before diving into some of the meatiest crabs that you'll ever have.  Once the crab was on our table it got quiet, real quiet as we each took the task of getting into that sweet crab meat.  Our friend had no problem cracking into those thick legs and before long was totally immersed in the picking out the meat. One bite into the garlic noodles did it for her as we all agreed that it was totally unique.  My wife and I have tried to find a similer place , like PPQ, but when all is said and done Thanh Long is still the high water mark when it comes to roasted crab in San Francisco or anywhere else for that matter.  The glow of a great meal stays with you long after you've paid the check.  And you can't say that for most resturants.

excerpts: 2 orders of garlic roasted crab and some garlic noodles and you're good to go!
this place is definitely worth the drive and the money.
reservations are a good idea but if you gotta wait, the bartender makes some pretty good cocktails.
garlic noodles.author: Twilight F.
garlic noodles.review: 2 orders of garlic roasted crab and some garlic noodles and you're good to go!  this place is definitely worth the drive and the money.  reservations are a good idea but if you gotta wait, the bartender makes some pretty good cocktails.

excerpts: We always order the Roasted Crab (whole dungeness crab roasted with garlic butter sauce and secret spices), garlic noodles, and seasonal vegetable saute.
seasonal vegetable saute.author: G M.
seasonal vegetable saute.review:
They have great roasted crab! 

We always order the Roasted Crab (whole dungeness crab roasted with garlic butter sauce and secret spices), garlic noodles, and seasonal vegetable saute.

Unfortunately the noodles are sometimes too soft and the crab isn't always fresh.  One time I received a crab that had mushy meat. The crab was replaced but the waiter questioned me (come on, I know my crabmeat!).  Other times I've had crab on the fishy side and not sweet. This is why we always order more than one crab.

Tips: 
* Order some hot tea to counteract all the butter
* Come early to find parking or use their valet (they won't seat the party until everyone has arrived

excerpts: entrees: roasted crab (yummy - almost ate a whole crab by myself!), garlic noodles (kinda bland, not enough garlic), shaken beef (ok at best, much better at slanted door), seasonal vegetable saute (good, firm string beans), steamed rice (rice is rice).
for dessert, we had chocolate cake and fried pineapple, i think.
i don't have a sweet tooth
seasonal vegetable saute.author: sandra l.
seasonal vegetable saute.review:
i love crab. i love garlic. i love noodles. but, i didn't love thanh long. it was good but not great. i still prefer PPQ's food any day. 

for appetizers, we had the seafood dumplings (nothing special or fancy) and jumbo prawns wonton (good). entrees: roasted crab (yummy - almost ate a whole crab by myself!), garlic noodles (kinda bland, not enough garlic), shaken beef (ok at best, much better at slanted door), seasonal vegetable saute (good, firm string beans), steamed rice (rice is rice). for dessert, we had chocolate cake and fried pineapple, i think. i don't have a sweet tooth so desserts will always just be ok for me.  

oh, the bathroom was gross! they need to clean it more often. yuck. 

the service was excellent. very attentive. the ambiance was cute...not fancy like the sister restaurant crustaceans of course but still nice.

excerpts: Get the garlic noodles and the garlic rice, mix those two together and prepare for the incredible flavor.
The rice tames the sweetness of the noodles.
So good!
Skip:
Hella expensive veggie side dish.
How can vegetables we the same price as your signature garlic noodles.
garlic rice.author: Elena C.
garlic rice.review:
I could write a lengthy review about it their crab just like everyone else. But instead I'd rather talk about their other their other dishes:
- Go-to Appetizer: Seafood dumplings. The beautiful shrimp and whitefish dumplings are served with a yummy tamarind-ginger sauce. I could just slurp that whole thing up.
- Best side: Get the garlic noodles and the garlic rice, mix those two together and prepare for the incredible flavor. The rice tames the sweetness of the noodles. So good!
- Skip: Hella expensive veggie side dish. How can vegetables we the same price as your signature garlic noodles. That's cray!

Now that you the t, get that get that roasted crab and make sure to drink plenty of water with it.

excerpts: Instead we went for the tiger prawns with garlic noodles, grilled calamari, and garlic rice.
We love garlic!
The calamari was very tender
and it was actually pretty good.
The tiger prawns were juicy and so garlicy!
The garlic rice was ok, maybe because everything else had so much flavor and garlic, the rice wasn't as strong.
I enjoyed my visit here
and now i'm a fan!
garlic rice.author: Belinda C.
garlic rice.review:
I had friends that used to live in SF during college and moved back to Asia.  After a few years, they decided to visit and the FIRST thing they wanted to eat was at Thanh Long.  They were craving for their garlic noodles.  I'm usually not a huge seafood fan, so my excitement wasn't as crazy.  We made reservations for 7 and it was so jammed packed when i arrived.  I highly recommend making a reservation.  

For the course , we didn't get the crab.  Yes, can you believe we were the only table that didn't get crab.  Instead we went for the tiger prawns with garlic noodles, grilled calamari, and garlic rice.  We love garlic! The calamari was very tender and it was actually pretty good.   The tiger prawns were juicy and so garlicy! I can see why everyone loves the garlic noodles.  It was delicious! The garlic rice was ok, maybe because everything else had so much flavor and garlic, the rice wasn't as strong.  I enjoyed my visit here and now i'm a fan!

excerpts: The crab was so flavorful and with the garlic rice... omg bring me back to San Francisco ASAP!
garlic rice.author: Lindsey C.
garlic rice.review: Amazing. Everything was so good! My parents come here regularly and rave about the roasted crab. It did not disappoint. The crab was so flavorful and with the garlic rice... omg bring me back to San Francisco ASAP!

excerpts: All the dishes were very good here, including the shaken beef and their famous garlic rice.
Nice vibe, excellent service.
If you're in San Fran, you should check it out.
garlic rice.author: Eddie C.
garlic rice.review: The dungeness crab is huge and well worth the hefty price. You get quite a lot of crab meat out of it. All the dishes were very good here, including the shaken beef and their famous garlic rice. Nice vibe, excellent service. If you're in San Fran, you should check it out.

excerpts: Garlic rice with a hint of garlic.
garlic rice.author: Helen L.
garlic rice.review: Service was wonderful and attentive, friendly.  Roasted crab was a 2 lb about 58.00 was juicy and done perfectly.  You've got your bib, crab paraphernalia-cracker and small fork, big bowl for crab shells.  Garlic noodle was thin noodles.  Garlic rice with a hint of garlic.  Mango salad full of mango and dressing not over powering.  Next to me they had calamari that looked delicious.  Got a parking space a block away but my friend circled 15 min.  Go to mango medley two blocks down for chinese dessert to finish off a perfect night.  I tried to do yelp reservation with credit card but it didnt work.  My friend called in her reservation without credit card.  Also, there is a sign that said if you don't show up within 15 min your reservation will be canceled.  Dont know if they will enforce this rule.  There were plenty of seats on a week night. There is a nice bar and all kinds of concoction drinks appear.

excerpts: We also had the garlic rice and shaken beef because our friend has a severe seafood allergy.
Those items were great, too.

This original location  spread to @crustacean_sf and beyond. .
