excerpts: Our party of four ordered three crabs, the sea bass, an order of garlic noodles and an order of garlic rice, two appetizers (mango salad and calamari) and each of the ladies had two alcoholic beverages - the only male in our party had 4.
We had two roast crabs and the one cooked with wine.
The mango salad was very good.
The mangoes were sweet and the shrimp was very fresh.
The fried garlic rice and the garlic noodles lacked a little bit of flavor however we sopped up the sauce from the roast crab to make the rice and noodles flavorful.
The fried garlic rice and the garlic noodles lacked a little bit of flavor however we sopped up the sauce from the roast crab to make the rice and noodles flavorful.
garlic rice.author: Wendy G.
garlic rice.review:
The food is so freaking good! I teetered between giving Thanh Long 4 stars or 5 stars. The roast crab is so expensive but so effing good!!!

We made a reservation and were seated within five minutes on a busy Saturday evening. There's a $13 valet parking setup in front of the restaurant. We utilized the service since parking in this area can be challenging. Besides it was very cold and raining. The guys in valet were friendly. They got a little behind in the evening but to be expected with the weather and with the large number of people who left the restaurant the same time we did.

Our party of four ordered three crabs, the sea bass, an order of garlic noodles and an order of garlic rice, two appetizers (mango salad and calamari) and each of the ladies had two alcoholic beverages - the only male in our party had 4.  We had two roast crabs and the one cooked with wine. Hands-down the roast crab was everyone's favorite. 

The sea bass was tender but lacked seasoning - a little salt could have helped. The bok choy on this plate was yummy. One of my friends is a country boy from Georgia and he had his first taste of bok choy at this restaurant. He fell in love with it. 

The calamari was so good the greedy ones ‍ at the table contemplated ordering a second one. The mango salad was very good. The mangoes were sweet and the shrimp was very fresh. Everything we had that evening was fresh.

The fried garlic rice and the garlic noodles lacked a little bit of flavor however we sopped up the sauce from the roast crab to make the rice and noodles flavorful. 

We didn't order dessert because one of my friends didn't wear stretchy pants and we did not want to eat dessert in front of her. 

The service was great! Staff were friendly. Our waiter was attentive. We had a great time eating and catching up with dear friends.

Review updated to fix grammatical errors (damn autocorrect).

excerpts: We also shared a order of the garlic rice and garlic noodles which I think were so far the best I have ever tried.
The food was absolutely yummy and the service and atmosphere was amazing
garlic rice.author: M L.
garlic rice.review: Made reservations online so right when we arrived, we were seated right away.  My husband and daughter enjoyed their crab and my son and I ate the steak. We also shared a order of the garlic rice and garlic noodles which I think were so far the best I have ever tried. The food was absolutely yummy and the service and atmosphere was amazing

excerpts:
Roasted garlic crab as good as it gets,
Shaken beef, prawns , garlic rice ,
Fried pineapple with ice cream.
garlic rice.author: Gayle G.
garlic rice.review:
I made reservations using Open table so much better
than the old way of waiting for the restaurant to open.
The only problem was we were seated on the second
floor: very noisy. Food was as good as always,
but we couldn't have a conversation.
   Roasted garlic crab as good as it gets,
Shaken beef, prawns , garlic rice ,
Fried pineapple with ice cream.

excerpts:
Garlic rice ($9) was better than the garlic noodles IMO. 
It also went better with the crab.
Calamari ($13) was good but under seasoned.
garlic rice.author: Andy W.
garlic rice.review:
Wanted to try this place for a long time. Like everyone else, I've heard lots of good things so I was really looking forward to it. Maybe I got my hopes up too high but I was underwhelmed. The outrageous prices also didn't help. One crab for $56 bucks. 4 prawns and noodles for $39. If it was mind blowing maybe it would justify the prices but my mind nor my socks were blown off.

The roasted crab ($56) was the best dish of the night. It was good, not great. 
Prawns ($39) were under seasoned compared to the crab. The noodles that came with it were ok.
Garlic rice ($9) was better than the garlic noodles IMO. It also went better with the crab.
Calamari ($13) was good but under seasoned.
Shrimp toast ($12) was the worst dish of the night. The toast wasn't toasted enough. It was really bready. Would recommend skipping this.  

There is a mandatory 18% tip for all party sizes. It doesn't bother us since we tip regardless but service might be better if it wasn't mandatory. Service was fine but for the prices they charge, I expected better. They did their job but it lacked care, warmth and friendliness. 

With the taxes and tip the bill came close to $200 for two of us. No drinks, we only had two sodas (no refills).

They do have valet for $12 but if you circle around, you might find street parking.

excerpts:
Seafood garlic rice
Garlic rice
garlic rice.author: Yvette B.
garlic rice.review:
I've been here 2 times in 2 weeks! the second time I've came here I came to a realization that thanh Long has given me one of the best meals of my life. I would highly recommend this place to anyone and everyone! 
These are all items I've ordered and was not a disappointment at all! 

Fried calamari
Thanh Long mussels****
Coconut fried shrimp
Roasted crab ****
Garlic noodles****
Seafood garlic rice
Garlic rice

I have yet to explore more of the menu but just those few items was a game changer! On the plus, service is just as great as the food!

excerpts: We also ordered the calamari and of course the garlic noodle both were delicious but the side that stole the show was the garlic rice we had to get a second order.
I can't wait to visit this place again.
I suggest you make a reservation and get there early parking is Terri or
but that's my only complaint.
Also the service was excellent.
garlic rice.author: Trina D.
garlic rice.review: What else can be said if you like crab this is the place to go. We also ordered the calamari and of course the garlic noodle both were delicious but the side that stole the show was the garlic rice we had to get a second order. I can't wait to visit this place again. I suggest you make a reservation and get there early parking is Terri or but that's my only complaint. Also the service was excellent.

excerpts: Well, usually with a cocktail and then with some garlic rice and/or garlic noodles.
Then it's all about the crab!
garlic rice.author: Sarah O.
garlic rice.review: Where do I start?  Well, usually with a cocktail and then with some garlic rice and/or garlic noodles. Then it's all about the crab!  The Drunken Crab is my favorite and I have tried them all. This place is always packed and there is almost always a wait, but it is totally worth it!

excerpts: The garlic rice, dry; Not worth the high prices.
2 crabs, garlic rice, garlic noodles and salad came out to about $170.
Ouch!
My partner loved the crab and will return.
Honestly, there are other restaurants that serve really good crab, but won't cost an arm and a leg.
The restaurant was crowded, and the service was excellent.
garlic rice.author: Rose S.
garlic rice.review: Heard this was the best crab restaurant in town. Disappointingly, this was not the case in my opinion. The roasted crab was pretty good. The garlic noodles were dry. The garlic rice, dry; Not worth the high prices. 2 crabs, garlic rice, garlic noodles and salad came out to about $170. Ouch! My partner loved the crab and will return. Honestly, there are other restaurants that serve really good crab, but won't cost an arm and a leg. The restaurant was crowded, and the service was excellent.

excerpts: The sides: garlic noodle and garlic rice is also very good.
garlic rice.author: Phat T.
garlic rice.review:
This place can get very packed, please plan ahead.

If you love Asian / Vietnamese style crab this is a place to check-out.  The crabs are packed with flavor.  I have tried all the variation in flavors and they are all solid, it really comes down to personal preference.  The sides: garlic noodle and garlic rice is also very good.  They compliment the crabs very well.

They do have very good service.  The only downside I see is that the bill can be quite hefty.  However, you are paying for seafood, so keep that in mind.

excerpts:
$300 for 2 roast crab, 1 drunken crab, one prawn w/ garlic noodle, stir fry squid in tomato sauce, a side of garlic rice for $8.50....wtf...and a heineken beer.  
Roast crab tasted like butter and black pepper, the drunken crab came with a big ass bowl of soup that tasted like bland chicken stock with some green onions thrown inside.

Roast crab tasted like butter and black pepper, the drunken crab came with a big ass bowl of soup that tasted like bland chicken stock with some green onions thrown inside.
garlic rice.author: Cyrus P.
garlic rice.review:
$300 for 2 roast crab, 1 drunken crab, one prawn w/ garlic noodle, stir fry squid in tomato sauce, a side of garlic rice for $8.50....wtf...and a heineken beer.  I also ordered the mussels in ginger sauce and asked the waitress if she'll remember everything I ordered and she said "Of course!"...never got our mussels, think we paid for it to.

The garlic noodles were disgusting....over cooked...OVER COOKED...I didn't taste any fresh garlic on there.  All I tasted was butter with powdered Parmesan cheese and most likely powdered garlic.  Roast crab tasted like butter and black pepper, the drunken crab came with a big ass bowl of soup that tasted like bland chicken stock with some green onions thrown inside.

$300.......not worth it.  This place is still alive because of it's past recognition, but so sorry to say it's well past that time for this place.

excerpts: Oh my gosh.......the garlic rice is better than the garlic noodles.
The crab was sooooooooo good.
garlic rice.author: Brooks M.
garlic rice.review: Oh my gosh.......the garlic rice is better than the garlic noodles.  The crab was sooooooooo good.

excerpts: They premade everything in the restaurant so garlic rice that we ordered (the waitress came out with it like a minute after our final word on the order dropped) along w the crab that definitely was not fresh and had frozen crab attributes had to be sent back.
garlic rice.author: Al L.
garlic rice.review:
They premade everything in the restaurant so garlic rice that we ordered (the waitress came out with it like a minute after our final word on the order dropped) along w the crab that definitely was not fresh and had frozen crab attributes had to be sent back. We also ordered lemongrass chicken and the taste was so bland, as if they half made the dish and didnt take cooking it seriously.

Very disappointed by the hype and also with the fact that their roasted crab was charged 52.95$ and was not fresh at all. The restaurant overcharges a premium for a frozen crab ... .. .. I will unfortunately not be coming back and would be spreading the word of my experience here.

excerpts: We also ordered the garlic rice, shaking beef, and Thit kho.
I would say the shaking beef was my favorite.
I have no idea how they got it to be so tender
but it was definitely the highlight of the night.
The other items were really not that special...
again, i grew up eating all these foods
garlic rice.author: Vy B.
garlic rice.review:
I'm just going to cut to the chase and agree with everyone that the salt and pepper crab is really good. However, similar to R&G lounge, it was grossly over priced and people really over hyped those garlic noodles. Maybe as a vietnamese person I've grown up eating similar noodles so it wasn't life changing when I tried these at the restaurant. The prawns were nicely cooked, though also very over priced. Shrimp toast was rich and buttery but not very crispy...which suggests they premake it and keep it in a warmer until someone orders it. 

We also ordered the garlic rice, shaking beef, and Thit kho. I would say the shaking beef was my favorite. I have no idea how they got it to be so tender but it was definitely the highlight of the night. The other items were really not that special...again, i grew up eating all these foods so I cannot say this place has blown my taste buds. 

The restaurant itself was a cute place but the service was slow. There's valet parking available but muni stops right by there.

excerpts: We got the lemon grass beef, garlic noodles, garlic rice, and roasted crab.
The crab was sooo good..
what's in that sauce?
Butter..pepper..
OMGGG so good.
The only downside is the price.
$50 for a whole crab.
This made my wallet cry.
I didn't pay but if I did, I would have cried.
I am sad that I ate at this place
cuz now I will crave it but can't afford it to eat it on a whim.
garlic rice.author: Stephanie W.
garlic rice.review:
Best garlic noodles and crab ever. We came here for my birthday and seriously..this restaurant has quickly shot up to be top 10 restaurants in the Bay Area for me. Maybe even of all time.. :O 

We got the lemon grass beef, garlic noodles, garlic rice, and roasted crab. The crab was sooo good..what's in that sauce? Butter..pepper..OMGGG so good. The only downside is the price. $50 for a whole crab. This made my wallet cry. I didn't pay but if I did, I would have cried. I am sad that I ate at this place cuz now I will crave it but can't afford it to eat it on a whim. T___T

We had some leftover crabs so I ate it two days later. It was ok but definitely not as good as the first day. So I recommend eating the crab there. 

Helene an is my hero! Along with Steve Ellis, the guy that made chipotle.

excerpts: We ordered salt & pepper calamari, garlic rice and roast crab.
Everything   tasted so good.
Specially the roast crab.
I havent found any other restaurant that can compete with their roast crab.
The service is awesome.
Our waiter was very attentive.
A bit pricey buy worth it!
garlic rice.author: Ro A.
garlic rice.review: DELICIOUS!!!! We ordered salt & pepper calamari, garlic rice and roast crab. Everything   tasted so good. Specially the roast crab. I havent found any other restaurant that can compete with their roast crab. The service is awesome. Our waiter was very attentive. A bit pricey buy worth it!

excerpts: Loved the garlic rice and the garlic crab.
Ate the whole thing by myself.
Yeeeeee.
Definitely make a reservation and be on time.
They're not afraid to give your spot to someone else.
It's that busy and yes it's that good.
garlic rice.author: Deepika S.
garlic rice.review: Came for my bday. Loved the garlic rice and the garlic crab. Ate the whole thing by myself. Yeeeeee. Definitely make a reservation and be on time. They're not afraid to give your spot to someone else. It's that busy and yes it's that good.

excerpts: garlic rice..
garlic rice.author: Elle S.
garlic rice.review:
Amazing dining experience for girlfriend's 40th birthday here! Evan is spot on awesome! Chilli crab..garlic rice..garlic noodles a must here :) 
Everyone's happy!!!

excerpts: Make sure to try the Jasmine Garlic rice with chicken and shrimp combination
garlic rice.author: Giselle J.
garlic rice.review: Very nice atmosphere.  Food was nice and flavored.  I did see that I ordered the wrong drunken crab; I think they're 2 types.  Garlic Crab was on point and cocktail was tasty.  Dinner was pricy but overall experience worth it.  Treat yourself don't cheat yourself.  Make sure to try the Jasmine Garlic rice with chicken and shrimp combination ;-)

excerpts: They also have the less expensive option of garlic rice, fried rice, jasmine rice, or vegetables.
garlic rice.author: Tiffany N.
garlic rice.review:
Good food, good service, and not necessarily overpriced.

Made reservations for 6 pm New Year's Eve. We got there about half an hour early, but they seated us anyways since there was room. It's a small restaurant on the corner of the street. On the outside, it doesn't look very nice but the interior is pretty upscale.  

Loved the promptness of everything. The appetizer came within ten minutes. We were bibbed and received our main course immediately after we finished our appetizer. The waiters were attentive and helpful. They also gave us New Year's calendars on our way out. 

Here's what we got:
SALT & PEPPER CALAMARI $11.95: Good appetizer. Crisp, no sauce.

ASPARAGUS SOUP WITH CRAB $7.50: My mom ordered this and enjoyed it. Hot soup is always great when the weather is cold. 

ROAST/DRUNKEN/TAMARIND CRAB: We got one of each ($41.95 per crab). My favorite was the drunken crab. The sauce actually doesn't matter unless you dip the crab meat in the sauce on the plate. 

GARLIC NOODLES $10: This was actually really good, but I wouldn't say they're to die for. It was like eating garlic bread except they were noodles, and these noodles are the same texture as the chow mein at Panda Express. They also have the less expensive option of garlic rice, fried rice, jasmine rice, or vegetables. 

LAVA CHOCOLATE CAKE $8.25: Skip it. The lava cake is mostly syrup and on the bitter side. 

FRIED BANANA A LA MODE $6.95: Skip it. It's just regular fried banana and ice cream--nothing special.

CREME BRULEE $7.50: Again, skip it. If you are dying to have dessert here, choose this one. I'm not saying the desserts are bad at Thanh Long but there are a couple dessert shops on the same street and there are better options in driving distance.

Parents also had a FLEUR DE MANGO ($9.25) with a heineken ($5) and a HANOI SUNSET ($9).

excerpts: This is the 2nd visit here to this  restaurant and again everything was delicious from the garlic noodled, garlic rice and beef screwers and of course the rubbed roasted crab the only reason 4 stars vs 5 was the size of crab was definitely smaller than last but won't stop me from coming back !
garlic rice.author: Nancie M.
garlic rice.review: This is the 2nd visit here to this  restaurant and again everything was delicious from the garlic noodled, garlic rice and beef screwers and of course the rubbed roasted crab the only reason 4 stars vs 5 was the size of crab was definitely smaller than last but won't stop me from coming back !

excerpts: Garlic noodles are fine and garlic rice is just as good, not sure why it doesn't get any shine.
But chicken and beef dishes?
eh.
Skip.
The five spice chicken was so blah.
And not worth the price tag.
garlic rice.author: Augusto M.
garlic rice.review:
$40 for a crab?! Yeah probably worth it.

Everything else? Not worth it. Garlic noodles are fine and garlic rice is just as good, not sure why it doesn't get any shine. But chicken and beef dishes? eh. Skip. The five spice chicken was so blah. And not worth the price tag.

excerpts: We both ordered the roasted crab and since it was our first time there we ordered one garlic noodles and one garlic rice.
We went to town on our crab and had to take the garlic noodles and garlic rice home, but it was still tasty a day later.
Service was awesome, we made reservations and were seating right away.
The place gets packed so make reservations!
We went to town on our crab and had to take the garlic noodles and garlic rice home, but it was still tasty a day later.
Service was awesome, we made reservations and were seating right away.
The place gets packed so make reservations!
garlic rice.author: Victoria J.
garlic rice.review:
First time to Thanh Long was last weekend. I have to say it was delicious and I will be back. I have eaten a lot of crab in my life and their roasted crab was so freaking good. We ordered two cocktails, they were strong and me and the husband got a little buzzed from them! My husband got the lychee infused martini and it tasted very weak in comparison and was more pricey. 
We ordered calamari as an appetizer and the rings were a little chewy but was still good and the little legs were tender and delicious. We both ordered the roasted crab and since it was our first time there we ordered one garlic noodles and one garlic rice. We went to town on our crab and had to take the garlic noodles and garlic rice home, but it was still tasty a day later. Service was awesome, we made reservations and were seating right away. The place gets packed so make reservations!

excerpts: I have strayed and tried the Garlic Rice and Colossal Tiger Prawns (along with my garlic noodles) and it was just OK- something I can probably replicate at home.
garlic rice.author: S Y.
garlic rice.review:
100th review on the day I'm asked to join the Elite Squad! Wooohoooo! 

Yes, please believe they have yummy roasted crab and THE BEST GARLIC NOODLES! If anyone goes without me, I beg for a to-go order of the garlic noodles! I keep telling myself to try something different like the Shakened Beef, but I just can't bring myself to do it. I have strayed and tried the Garlic Rice and Colossal Tiger Prawns (along with my garlic noodles) and it was just OK- something I can probably replicate at home. 

One thing I like about this place, besides the casual dress code, is the service. It never fails that when I make a reservation, my friend is always late. I've never been told that they have to give the table to another party, in fact, I'm told I can grab a drink at the bar and wait. Once the lagger friends show- we're seated! 

Parking can be difficult, but there is valet parking! 

Warning: Everything will smell like garlic when you leave, especially the inside of your bag!

excerpts: their garlic rice was horrible...taste like it was burnt n
not garlicy...
n also.. they charged to cut the bday cake n a $1 a plate...smfh so far im disappointed.
garlic rice.author: Jay B.
garlic rice.review: Their crab sucks..both the roasted and wine... their garlic noodles isn't dat exciting n great...#redcrawfish is da best... their garlic rice was horrible...taste like it was burnt n not garlicy... n also.. they charged to cut the bday cake n a $1 a plate...smfh so far im disappointed.

excerpts: We ordered the roasted crab and garlic rice.
I love salt, garlic and butter...
So this was perfect for me!
garlic rice.author: Iris N.
garlic rice.review:
Food was great, service was so so. 

We ordered the roasted crab and garlic rice. I love salt, garlic and butter... So this was perfect for me! I'll be back soon! 

Make reservations.. It helps. No wait time is fantastic.

Service was okay, we had one very happy waiter and another that showed no emotion. But the biggest down fall, is that our drinks were never replenished and once we got our food we pretty much felt ignored. 

The crab was good enough to get me back, I shouldn't need too much attentions from the wait staff since I will be busy eating.

excerpts: All in all, I give the crab the edge over the garlic rice and prawns.
Crab gets 5 stars!
OBTW, I didn't physically eat at the restaurant, but my wife did!
She brought all my food to go after she had a wonderful dinner with her aunt and her sister.
Gotta love family!
garlic rice.author: Tre M.
garlic rice.review: Great food, I had the garlic and butter crab (lots of crab!) and the garlic butter rice with large prawns. What's great is that I was able to get shrimp in my garlic butter rice (in addition) which would only come with the large prawns, and without the added shrimp. This places food is amazing, delicious, well seasoned, and something that I look forward to eating again soon! All in all, I give the crab the edge over the garlic rice and prawns. Crab gets 5 stars! OBTW, I didn't physically eat at the restaurant, but my wife did! She brought all my food to go after she had a wonderful dinner with her aunt and her sister. Gotta love family!

excerpts: 8$ bucks for side of garlic rice.
No magic, no Bruce buffer announcing it's time...prepare to spend, for decent food.
garlic rice.author: Ricardo L.
garlic rice.review: Love the food but definitely on the expensive side for outer sunset. 8$ bucks for side of garlic rice. No magic, no Bruce buffer announcing it's time...prepare to spend, for decent food.

excerpts: They not only have the best crab but their calamari and garlic rice are sooo goood too!
If you love seafood and chinese food then this is place for you
and I would definitely recommend it.
You get a whole crab that has been seasoned with something so delicious my taste buds are watering as I'm writing this.
It can be a bit pricey
but like I said for the whole crab
it's definitely worth it!
This place can get pretty crowded so make a reservation!
garlic rice.author: Alyssa W.
garlic rice.review: This has literally got to be the best crab I have ever eaten! I went there with my family of 8 on a pretty busy night (but every night here is crowded) luckily we made a reservation and didn't have to wait long at all. While we waited we ordered drinks at their bar. Their long island iced teas are the bomb!!! We ended up getting a table upstairs in the corner which was perfect for our big group. They not only have the best crab but their calamari and garlic rice are sooo goood too! If you love seafood and chinese food then this is place for you and I would definitely recommend it. You get a whole crab that has been seasoned with something so delicious my taste buds are watering as I'm writing this. It can be a bit pricey but like I said for the whole crab it's definitely worth it! This place can get pretty crowded so make a reservation!

excerpts: the garlic rice wasn't anything to write home about either.
there's so much garlic in everything else, you might as well get white rice since the garlic in the garlic rice is minimal.
and at $7.50 for the equivalent of 1.75ricebowls!!
garlic rice.author: Amanda L.
garlic rice.review:
So there have been umpteen people telling me about this place and i finally went. For all the hype about its seafood... well, it lived up pretty well. idk about astronomically phenomenal (i still think the crab my mom makes is the best shizz ever), but it's pretty darn good. 

the baked crab with garlic butter pepper sauce very tasty. and i like the kick that comes with dousing it pepper. but like most crab in the shell, all the sauce is on the shell so the actual crab meat, you have all the sauce on the outside so your basically dipping the crab in butter/pepper/garlic. --how can you go wrong?

the seasonal veggies were nicely done. snow peas with white button and shiitake mushrooms, cherry tomatoes, and green, white, and red onions. it was all very fresh and very yummy. 

the garlic noodles were raved about and i was expecting something mind blowing. Alas! that was not to be. 
taste: it's like eating tasty garlic bread.- yes, it quite literally tasted like garlic bread. buT, texture wise, it was quite disgusting. the noodles are way way way over cooked. and as someone who likes their pasta well-done... if i think it's over cooked, then X_X 
garlic noodles:: it's like eating super extra soggy garlic bread. 

the garlic rice wasn't anything to write home about either. there's so much garlic in everything else, you might as well get white rice since the garlic in the garlic rice is minimal. and at $7.50 for the equivalent of 1.75ricebowls!! outrage! 

fried banana a la mode was very yummy. the bananas weren't over battered or anything. nice and hot.  this dish wasn't the most aesthetically appetizing, but it was good (then again i'm partial to fried bananas, and it's a dish that is difficult to truly mess up) 

the service was really good, the waiters/servers etc were all really friendly. they're really good about changing out your shell bowls. 

over all ambiance is nice and they have a full bar.

excerpts: Garlic rice: just pungent enough, wonderfully textured and sticky, enhanced all the other dishes.
garlic rice.author: John Z.
garlic rice.review:
File this review under the "interesting" or "odd" folders at your discretion ... but I may be the only reviewer of Thanh Long who didn't have the crab or garlic noodles. 

All the more reason to go back. The place is great, the meal the most memorable I've had in months.

To begin with: a full bar, which was nice for us martini-files. Began the meal with two starters:  the seafood dumplings and the shrimp toast. The dumplings: pleasant, light, delicate. More a tease than filling, but a nice tease.  The shrimp toast:  wow.  I've had countless versions as an former ny-er but this was a whole new trip. Lighter but still flavorful -- on slices of biegnet, a nice tip of the hat to the French influence of Vietnamese food.

Then the main meal: Shaken beef, tender and succulent in its not-too-sweet sauce with a surprisingly perfect compliment of potatoes. Spicy eggplant, just spicy/savory enough to let the eggplant shine through.  Seasonal vegetables: mostly sugar snap peas, lots of mushrooms, absolutely wonderful. Now mind you I don't like mushrooms as a rule but I would have been happy to scarf these down anytime. Garlic rice: just pungent enough, wonderfully textured and sticky, enhanced all the other dishes.

Yes a little on the pricey side... and valet service is ten bucks, not five (thankfully we got street parking). Service was gentle and professional.

I relished every bite and look forward to returning to see about those crabs and garlic noodles.

excerpts: The garlic rice!
OMG!
even items on the menu that seem a little scary come to the table still a little scary
but once u taste them, WOW!
I didn't get to try the crab b/c
it is so expensive
but there's no doubt I will be back for me.
Maybe a fancy date !
garlic rice.author: Tia J.
garlic rice.review: AMAZING! went here for a friends birthday celebration. Prices are quite high there's no doubt but the food was worth it. The garlic rice! OMG! even items on the menu that seem a little scary come to the table still a little scary but once u taste them, WOW!  I didn't get to try the crab b/c it is so expensive but there's no doubt I will be back for me. Maybe a fancy date !

excerpts: I remember having garlic rice and it was a little dry but good.
garlic rice.author: Jennifer Q.
garlic rice.review:
It's been awhile, maybe a year since i've been here. I'll do an update when i come back.

The roasted crab was eh. My dad makes it a lot better, but my sister likes it enough here to buy it sometimes. It's pretty pricey. I remember having garlic rice and it was a little dry but good. The garlic noodles were tastey but i've had better.

Now, what makes me want to come back here? The beef. The fricking shaken beef. Now THAT is some good stuff. I don't come for the crab or garlic noodles. i come for the beef.

excerpts: I've also had their garlic rice (obviously not as novel), which I like better than the noodles, probably just because it's warm and hence doesn't have a temperature difference with the star of the show.
garlic rice.author: Debbie L.
garlic rice.review:
This place is delicious, but I give it 4 stars since I think PPQ Dungeness Island is better. 

I've been here 5+ times in the last 3 years... first couple times were delicious! I'd never had butter garlic crab elsewhere and the flavor was just too good! I'm guessing they steam the crab with salt, pepper, and garlic infused butter (as there's always glops of salt on top making some bites super salty). The sauce the crab comes in is just butter infused with garlic (I have yet to see garlic chunks anywhere...) which is good for dipping, but I think the crab itself has enough flavor. The garlic noodles are interesting to say the least -- every time I get them they are cold, so I don't know if they are supposed to be that way. The noodles are slightly sweet and no as garlicy as the crab... it just seems out of place to me as I am eating fresh hot crab with cold noodles. I've also had their garlic rice (obviously not as novel), which I like better than the noodles, probably just because it's warm and hence doesn't have a temperature difference with the star of the show. 

Their vegetables are delicious! I didn't think I'd be ordering veggies at a seafood restaurant, but their string beans are cooked and seasoned perfectly with seasonable vegetables and a variety of mushrooms (yum!).

The most recent time I came the crab was not fresh - we were charged $40/crab (yes I know it's seasonal) and the flesh was not fresh. One person in our party even ended up with diarrhea the next day =/

Service is horrible... waitresses never come around. The place is ALWAYS crowded, and even when we had a reservation we had to wait 30 minutes (what is up with that?!) 

PPQ vs Thanh Long
So I find PPQ better and more price worthy. At PPQ you can get a full 4 course meal (appetizer, crab, noodles, dessert) for about $60. The crab and garlic noodles themselves are equally priced between the two, but PPQ offers a set menu which makes it more reasonable. The crab is different as it doesn't have much flavor itself, but the garlic butter sauce is WAY BETTER! There's garlic chunks in the sauce, making it all the more rich and savory. However, the garlic noodles are not as good. But hey, you're here for the crab!

excerpts: Ahh, roasted crab and garlic noodles and garlic rice!
Well, not bad.
Thanh Long is a dining experience, but not a culinary experience.

The place is packed, everyone is having a good time at what feels like a dining hall, you get your plastic bib, hot towels to wipe your hands, crab shell crackers, crab picks, very fast and friendly service, and a big bill.
It is definitely fun though.
garlic rice.author: Bo P.
garlic rice.review: Ahh, roasted crab and garlic noodles and garlic rice!  Well, not bad.    Thanh Long is a dining experience, but not a culinary experience.  The place is packed, everyone is having a good time at what feels like a dining hall, you get your plastic bib, hot towels to wipe your hands, crab shell crackers, crab picks, very fast and friendly service, and a big bill. It is definitely fun though.

excerpts: I've devoured and enjoyed their Garlic Roasted Crab and Garlic Rice.
That's right Garlic Rice!
garlic rice.author: Arbel D.
garlic rice.review:
3 times I've been here (1 with Yelp) and 3 times I've devoured and enjoyed their Garlic Roasted Crab and Garlic Rice. That's right Garlic Rice! Although they are more known for the Noodles, it's the rice that keeps me happy, the noodles are an excellent alternatives.

Shaken beef: for those not into crab or seafood this is really good alternative. the cubes are always tender and the flavor really pairs well the rice or noodles

Broiled chicken: not as good as the shaken beef with the chicken a bit harder to chew on (almost jerky like). flavor wise it was pretty good even without the rice or noodles.

dessert: foregoing the chocolate molten cake which is a favorite, i tried something different and chose the deep-fried ice cream.  glad i did, because it was very very good. I expected a globe of breading that was so thick and so hard. Instead it was a light breading, like tempura yet the ice cream was not completely melted. with a drizzle of chocolate and whip cream and paired with vietnamese ice coffee it was a good way to end the dinner

the only bad was the seating location, our party ended up below the air vents, so a constant blast of cool air was making me a bit chilly

if you're don't mind splurging a bit for the family, Thanh Long is excellent place to go

excerpts: Amazing roasted crab, garlic noodles and garlic rice.
Wow I must do again.
garlic rice.author: Dwight S.
garlic rice.review: OMG! Amazing roasted crab, garlic noodles and garlic rice. Wow I must do again.

excerpts: We had the garlic noodles and garlic rice to go with it!
garlic rice.author: Cindy D.
garlic rice.review:
Service was good. 

I had the crab in wine sauce and it was delicious! We had the garlic noodles and garlic rice to go with it! That was delicious as well!

We had two drinks, apple martini and champagne cocktail. That gave us a good buzz!

I feel like they're overrated, but I'd still go back.

excerpts: We ordered 2 roasted garlic crabs, the chef's special butterflied shrimp with garlic noodles and garlic rice.
This was our Christmas Eve dinner.
Wow.
WoW. wOw.
WOW...
It was soooooooooo damn good!!!
The crab was amazing.
The shrimp?
Amazing.
The noodles?
WAY better than PPQ.
and the garlic rice??
I made stir fried rice with the shrimp, garlic rice and crab.
Wow....
garlic rice.author: Jen D.
garlic rice.review:
What restaurants can you always guarantee to be opened during holidays like Christmas? Asian ones of course! Eugy and I knew we were getting crab for dinner, but we also wanted Texas style bbq. After calling 3 Bay Area rib shacks and them all being closed, we had to settle for just crab. But when it comes to Thanh Long, it's really not settling, cause their food is AMAZING... 

About 6 months ago, Eugy took me to PPQ. I've never been a huge crab fan, but he loves it so much so I agreed to go. To be honest, it was good, probably the best crab I've had (which isn't saying much since I haven't had too much), but when I tried Thanh Long, my opinion changed. 

We ordered 2 roasted garlic crabs, the chef's special butterflied shrimp with garlic noodles and garlic rice. This was our Christmas Eve dinner. Wow. WoW. wOw. WOW... It was soooooooooo damn good!!! The crab was amazing. The shrimp? Amazing. The noodles? WAY better than PPQ. and the garlic rice?? DAMN! 

And you know how to tell if the food is really good? Save the leftovers and make something with them the next day. I made stir fried rice with the shrimp, garlic rice and crab. Wow.... It was awesome. 

I can't wait to go back!!!

excerpts: We ordered a roasted crab, two plates of garlic noodles, eggplant, garlic rice (more like white fried rice with a hint of garlic), crab puff appetizer, salt and pepper calamari (yum), and a vegetarian garlic dish.
We also got the banana cake and creme brulee for dessert.
Came out to be about $25pp, 8 of us (one didn't make it).
garlic rice.author: qirk z.
garlic rice.review:
Made reservations early in the week, 5ppl, 7pm, Sunday.

Thur, changed reservations to 7ppl, 7pm, Sunday; "oh no problem, we'll make the change".

Sunday 2pm, changed reservations to 9ppl, 7pm, today; "oh no problem, we'll make the change, thanks for calling".

Sunday 5pm, changed reservations to 9ppl, 6pm, today; 'oh sure, we'll make the change, see you soon".

Arrive at 6pm, found parking just around the corner, place was still empty (maybe three groups of diners), we get seated upstairs. I've eaten here before, but never upstairs. We were the second large party upstairs.

By the time we finished eating, maybe 8pm? Both upstairs and downstairs was packed.

We ordered a roasted crab, two plates of garlic noodles, eggplant, garlic rice (more like white fried rice with a hint of garlic), crab puff appetizer, salt and pepper calamari (yum), and a vegetarian garlic dish. We also got the banana cake and creme brulee for dessert. Came out to be about $25pp, 8 of us (one didn't make it).

excerpts: i did enjoy the sea bass (the only not heavy tasting dish we ordered but it was small), mussels with asian pesto (although i was expecting a bowl of mussels rather than five) and the garlic rice.
garlic rice.author: Diana B.
garlic rice.review:
i grew up on fresh crab either cooked in chinese/vietnamese restaurants or cooked at home by my dad. i was very excited to try thanh long and couldn't decide between the roast or tamarind crab so i went with the server's suggestion that roast is better. the roast crab was bland. i couldn't detect "an's special sauce" or the fresh crab taste (i think it's a frozen crab) and resorted to dipping the crab meat in the oil-butter mixture. my friend went to crustacean a few days ago and told me that they tried both and the tamarind was a lot better. she also told me that my $35 thanh long crab cost her $50 at crustacean.

i did enjoy the sea bass (the only not heavy tasting dish we ordered but it was small), mussels with asian pesto (although i was expecting a bowl of mussels rather than five) and the garlic rice. the garlic noodles and shaken beef were overcooked.

excerpts: The garlic noodles and garlic rice was amazing.
Make sure you make reservations because it was packed.
I don't think I'd get anything else on the menu besides what I've already mentioned.
garlic rice.author: Monique M.
garlic rice.review: I came here for the first time for my boyfriends birthday dinner on a Thursday night. The crab was really good. I would say better than The Boiling Crab in San Jose. The garlic noodles and garlic rice was amazing. Make sure you make reservations because it was packed. I don't think I'd get anything else on the menu besides what I've already mentioned.

excerpts: I will be back to try the steak cubes and garlic rice along with the roasted crab!
garlic rice.author: Bobby B.
garlic rice.review:
I had heard great things about this place for a long time and randomly ended up there last night for the first time. I was surprised with how full the place was for a Sunday evening especially with it located so far out in the Sunset. The thing that stuck out to me over the good food was the great service we had, the staff was friendly and on top of things, when they realized that there was a better table available they offered it to us and from there were on top of our needs from the get go. 

We had the drunken crab which was good, however I think the roasted might have been a better option, the garlic noodles were very good. We started with the fried rice paper app which was the only thing that I wasn't that impressed with, not because of the taste however the price for what you get wasn't didn't impress me that much. 

I will be back to try the steak cubes and garlic rice along with the roasted crab!

excerpts: You must get the garlic noodles and/or garlic rice.
Heck, get them both.
The crab is very fresh, made perfectly.
Don't bother looking for parking--either take the muni or pay for the valet or you'll drive around and around in circles.
garlic rice.author: Joyce L.
garlic rice.review:
Ok so this place is expensive and it's freaking almost to Hawaii, BUT it is so yummy and so worth the drive. You must get the garlic noodles and/or garlic rice. Heck, get them both. The crab is very fresh, made perfectly. 
Don't bother looking for parking--either take the muni or pay for the valet or you'll drive around and around in circles.

excerpts: garlic rice also isn't bad.
The crab (market price $36!!
when I went) is also good, if you don't mind working on your food.
garlic rice.author: Rob T.
garlic rice.review:
Food is 4 stars. The $10 (!!) garlic noodles are tasty. The $8 (!!) garlic rice also isn't bad. The crab (market price $36!! when I went) is also good, if you don't mind working on your food. If you are too lazy to de-shell your own crab, then these dishes aren't for you.

The actual dining experience is also good. They have laid out the restaurant such that diners are protected from the people waiting to be seated. My huge peeve is when a long of line of waiters starts to encroach into diners' territory, bumping into your chairs, staring at your food, drowning out your conversation, etc. Thanh Long does not have this problem.

However, over-pricedness (well, maybe not really, but I'm cheap) and terrible parking makes it 3 stars. They are right off the N-Judah, so take that if you can.

excerpts: For four people we also ordered the grilled squid starter which was surprisingly good (5 cooked just right with some peanut sauce), Shaken Beef (TASTEY!), and garlic rice.
garlic rice.author: J. L.
garlic rice.review:
You MUST get the Roasted Crab and Garlic Noodles.  For four people we also ordered the grilled squid starter which was surprisingly good (5 cooked just right with some peanut sauce), Shaken Beef (TASTEY!), and garlic rice.  This was perfect for 4 people (unless you are four giant guys, you might want to order more).

Highly recommend making reservations.  

Valet, or street parking which may take a few circles around the block.

excerpts: It didn't taste very fresh and the portions on the garlic rice was so small for $7.95.
The service was quick and the male bus boys gave the best service.
Turned off by the male host, not even a good evening or have a nice meal.
Just "name?"
Big turn off.
Will not go back for along time because there are so many restaurants out there to try and would go back to PPQ if I wanted roasted crab.
garlic rice.author: Kim F.
garlic rice.review: The crab is always good but not worth the price of $37.50 for one crab. It didn't taste very fresh and the portions on the garlic rice was so small for $7.95. The service was quick and the male bus boys gave the best service. Turned off by the male host, not even a good evening or have a nice meal. Just "name?" Big turn off. Will not go back for along time because there are so many restaurants out there to try and would go back to PPQ if I wanted roasted crab.

excerpts:
garlic rice - garlicky, just the way i like it
shaking beef - hella good!
i wished they put more potatoes tho.. beef was kinda salty
garlic rice.author: JUDY L.
garlic rice.review:
my friend brought me here for the first time.. i've always heard good things so when he said he wanted to get some garlic noodles, i kept pestering him 'where'... my eyes light up as soon as he said thanh long..

we ordered:
roasted crab - mmmmmm. i usually try not to eat too much seafood because i think im slightly allergic but shoot i hella stuffed my face..
garlic noodles - yummm! just wished the portion was bigger.
garlic rice - garlicky, just the way i like it
shaking beef - hella good! i wished they put more potatoes tho.. beef was kinda salty but it was still good

definitely a place i would go again.. but parking here is soooooo bad..  and the valet is pretty bank.. especially since the food is kinda expensive.

excerpts:
the garlic rice was tastier than their famous noodles
4.
garlic rice.author: Anh V.
garlic rice.review:
2.5 stars for an old family  business which has lost it's way along the years.

at first glance, i was so excited.  i had already tried crustacean which is near my place but i made a trek out here to where it all began.

the downstairs area with more natural lighting is nicer than the upstairs seating. but overall, the place is big and great for groups. 

there were naive vietnamese art on the walls, a majority of asians eating here...but as i peered closer, i had a wait-a-minute moment.

the servers were nice and quick but none spoke vietnamese.  the uniforms were not traditional as well.  but the killer was no authentic fish sauce.

highlights:
1. the spicy veg soup was better than the asian bouillabaise (lacked spice for the sour taste).
2. of course! drunken crab
3. the garlic rice was tastier than their famous noodles
4. the fried tofu and veggies is a good option for non-meat eaters.

don't order:
1. the salmon carpaccio
2. the soft shell crab - it was so small, they threw in a random extra claw

the 33 beer is a oldie but goodie beer but if you want something heavier go for the saigon beer.

despite being less authentic, it was plenty full on a sunday with happy bib wearing customers crackin' and eating crab and i was one of them.

excerpts: We always order the same things...roasted crab, garlic noodles, garlic rice, and beef steak cubes or whatever you call it.
oh and appetizers are their salt & pepper calamari.
Damn I'm hungry now.
Love this place.
garlic rice.author: Suzie T.
garlic rice.review: I love their food!!! Crustaceans crab taste a lot fresher but Thanh Long's crab is still yummmmmmy!!! And their other entrees seem to taste better than Crustaceans. We always order the same things...roasted crab, garlic noodles, garlic rice, and beef steak cubes or whatever you call it. oh and appetizers are their salt & pepper calamari. Damn I'm hungry now. Love this place.

excerpts: We ordered the mango salad, Dungeness crab puffs, ginger calamari, Drunken Crab, Roast Crab and the garlic rice.
so the Boyfriend and I again followed the advice of our friend and ordered some garlic rice.
In terms of food, Thanh Long gets five stars.
The Parents loved the food.
The ginger calamari was well-seasoned, not too gingery and not too salty.
It was particularly yummy with the pineapples.
The mango salad was delicious (it has shrimp and scallops as well) and the garlic rice was flavorful without being overpowering.
The mango salad was delicious (it has shrimp and scallops as well) and the garlic rice was flavorful without being overpowering.
The Dungeness crab puffs were a big hit but pricey.
It was basically a tastier version of crab rangoon.
Now for the crab: right before ordering, the Boyfriend and I faithfully checked Yelp and some had said that the Roast Crab was too salty.
The Dad isn't too fond of wine-reduction
so we tried the Roast Crab first.
It was delicious and not too salty at all.
The waiter comes over with plastic bibs and you get to cracking (well...
the Boyfriend and the Dad got to cracking and then fed the Mom and me bits and pieces).
One crab is about enough for one person to be full.
One crab is about enough to make two grown men half-full so calculate accordingly.
We ordered the Drunken Crab to mix things up and it was also good.
It tastes much more Asian in that the wine reduction really saves the flavor of the crab - it's much more crabby than the Roast crab which is more seasoned.
The Dad and the Boyfriend liked the Roast Crab a little better, though, so if you want to choose one, I'd advise the Roast Crab.
Don't worry about messy/crabby hands.
The waitstaff comes by with hot (caution: extremely hot) warm towels for you to towel off between and after crab eating.
Finally, for dessert, we ordered orange sorbet.
It's really cute - it comes in a frozen orange that's been beheaded and the lemon sorbet comes in a frozen lemon that's been beheaded!
The only reason I won't give Thanh Long is that the prices are a bit high.
The crab is market price (which meant $37.50 each crab as of June 7, 2009) and the other dishes are pricey as well.
garlic rice.author: Christine P.
garlic rice.review: The Dad loves crab so when the Parents came up for the weekend, the Boyfriend and I decided to follow a friend's advice and take them to Thanh Long. The Parents are notoriously picky about food and the Dad is particularly so when it comes to crab. It has to be fresh, can't be over-seasoned and has to be meaty. Thank goodness for Thanh Long. We ordered the mango salad, Dungeness crab puffs, ginger calamari, Drunken Crab, Roast Crab and the garlic rice. The Boyfriend and I had heard that people loved the garlic noodles but the Parents didn't like the looks of it so the Boyfriend and I again followed the advice of our friend and ordered some garlic rice. In terms of food, Thanh Long gets five stars. The Parents loved the food. The ginger calamari was well-seasoned, not too gingery and not too salty. It was particularly yummy with the pineapples. The mango salad was delicious (it has shrimp and scallops as well) and the garlic rice was flavorful without being overpowering. The Dungeness crab puffs were a big hit but pricey. It was basically a tastier version of crab rangoon. Now for the crab: right before ordering, the Boyfriend and I faithfully checked Yelp and some had said that the Roast Crab was too salty. The Dad isn't too fond of wine-reduction so we tried the Roast Crab first. It was delicious and not too salty at all. The waiter comes over with plastic bibs and you get to cracking (well...the Boyfriend and the Dad got to cracking and then fed the Mom and me bits and pieces). One crab is about enough for one person to be full. One crab is about enough to make two grown men half-full so calculate accordingly. We ordered the Drunken Crab to mix things up and it was also good. It tastes much more Asian in that the wine reduction really saves the flavor of the crab - it's much more crabby than the Roast crab which is more seasoned. The Dad and the Boyfriend liked the Roast Crab a little better, though, so if you want to choose one, I'd advise the Roast Crab. Don't worry about messy/crabby hands. The waitstaff comes by with hot (caution: extremely hot) warm towels for you to towel off between and after crab eating. Finally, for dessert, we ordered orange sorbet. It's really cute - it comes in a frozen orange that's been beheaded and the lemon sorbet comes in a frozen lemon that's been beheaded! The only reason I won't give Thanh Long is that the prices are a bit high. The crab is market price (which meant $37.50 each crab as of June 7, 2009) and the other dishes are pricey as well.

excerpts: Fried rice was fried rice.
fried rice.author: Kathy T.
fried rice.review:
My boyfriend took my parents and I to eat here because he had to share how amazing this place is. Was the food amazing? YES! Was it very expensive? Why yes. Was it worth it? YES! Will I go here every weekend? Nope, because I ain't balling like that. 

Valet parking is offered for $13, and they park it on the street right out front (sometimes along the sidewalk, sometimes smack dap in the street with your emergency lights on) I'm not too comfortable with that so we tried to find parking. It was 5 blocks away and it was freezing cold. Let's just say, parking isn't easy to find. 

Reservations. I made a reservations through yelp. It was easy and convenient and I got seated right away. If you know you're coming here, make the reservation. Only downside is you must put a card down, if you're over 15 minutes late, they charge you and if you don't cancel within 24 hours they charge you $10 for each person you reserved. Only beneficial if you know you're coming FOR SURE. 

Food. 
-Oven roasted crab: 5/5
A whole crab drenched in butter, garlic, salt and pepper. Amazing! I love dipping my crab into the buttery sauce. As of 9/15/18 one crab goes for the price of $62. My boyfriend doesn't eat crab so my parents and I shared two thinking that was enough, we ended up adding another crab. So if you're coming and wanna really indulge, get a crab per person. 

-Shaken beef: 3/5
Being Vietnamese, shaken beef is one of my favorite and this didn't really meet up to my standards. It was good and flavorful but they added diced potatoes. In my opinion if i'm paying $25 I would expect more than 9-10 small diced pieces of meat, and I would prefer meat than diced potatoes. 

-Garlic noodles: 5/5
Very flavorful and delicious. Great to pair with the crab. 

-Fried rice: 3/5
It was good, but nothing special. Fried rice was fried rice. 

-Fried bananas with vanilla ice cream: 4/5
Great way to end your meal. Fried banana topped with ice cream and a hit of chocolate sauce. 

Service: 5/5
We got our food super quick. We had a server, and we had people stop by the table to fill up our water constantly and change our crab shell bowls. Let's just say my water cup was always full and my crab shell bowl didn't reach half way full. And I love after we finished cracking our crab and have oily butter fingers they handed out hot towels to clean our hands. MY FAVORITE PART.

excerpts: My sister did all the ordering; Drunken Crab/Tamarind Crab/Roasted Crab/Garlic Noodles/Salt & Pepper Calamari/Lemongrass Beef Skewers/Spicy Eggplant/Mango Salad/Shrimp Fried Rice/Steamed Seabass.
Garlic noodles were overcooked/soggy and didn't have enough garlic flavor.
All the portions were pretty small.
The crabs tasted average; nothing special.
PPQ
Dungeness is better in my opinion.
Glad
I got to finally try Thanh Long but not impressed with the food.
fried rice.author: Karen L.
fried rice.review:
Located on a corner. Looks sorta like a house from the outside. Parking was hard to find. Valet option $13. Came here for my sister's 26th birthday since we heard a lot of great things about this place. We had a party of 7; did a same day reservation. Anyway, arrived 15m early and hung out at the bar in front for a bit. Thanks bartender for the great tasting Virgin Mango Daiquiri!

We were taken upstairs to be seated. My sister did all the ordering; Drunken Crab/Tamarind Crab/Roasted Crab/Garlic Noodles/Salt & Pepper Calamari/Lemongrass Beef Skewers/Spicy Eggplant/Mango Salad/Shrimp Fried Rice/Steamed Seabass. 

All of the food was "okay." Garlic noodles were overcooked/soggy and didn't have enough garlic flavor. All the portions were pretty small. The crabs tasted average; nothing special. PPQ Dungeness is better in my opinion. Glad I got to finally try Thanh Long but not impressed with the food.

excerpts: We also ordered the combination fried rice, which was just okay.
The star of the show was the crab.
As far as customer service- for the most part they were very attentive.
They also gave us warm wet towels at the end.
The only thing was my partner did not get his coffee until almost end of our meal.
We were the first ones to arrive there
but I guess they were still brewing coffee.
I asked for a straw but didn't get it at all
but I didn't push it since they were super busy.
Overall, I came there for the crab and it was delicious so no complaint there.
Pricey crab though.
Our total bill was way over $100 but it is fine since we are on vacation !
To top it off we tried their fried bananas with vanilla ice cream.
Also yummy.
fried rice.author: Mel H.
fried rice.review: I have been wanting to try this restaurant since visiting San Francisco. I have heard of how good the crab was and therefore I had to order the garlic whole crab and the garlic noodles. Well it was very good I must say. Crab was sweet and flavorful. The garlic noodle was also tasty, garlicky but not too overpowering. We also ordered the combination fried rice, which was just okay. The star of the show was the crab. As far as customer service- for the most part they were very attentive. They also gave us warm wet towels at the end. The only thing was my partner did not get his coffee until almost end of our meal. We were the first ones to arrive there but I guess they were still brewing coffee. I asked for a straw but didn't get it at all but I didn't push it since they were super busy. Overall, I came there for the crab and it was delicious so no complaint there. Pricey crab though. Our total bill was way over $100 but it is fine since we are on vacation ! To top it off we tried their fried bananas with vanilla ice cream. Also yummy.

excerpts: The food came out sporadically and it took them forever to bring out a fried rice order.
I had to ask multiple times and waited for an equally long time just for a soda.
And to top it off, the waiter forgot to put in an appetizer order (after other waiters had confirmed it was on its way).
It was like being served by the 3 stooges
, that's literally what it felt like.
Everybody running around, but no one was actually doing their job.
Two thumbs down!
fried rice.author: Quynh D.
fried rice.review:
All of these stellar reviews have me scratching my head... I honestly wanted to love this place.  I remember coming here long ago when I was in college.  I was expecting it to be top notch but I feel this was a sub par restaurant.  First, service was seriously lacking.  I was pretty disappointed.  Read on for the low down..

Vegetable soup with dumplings: bland, boring and wished I didn't order this. Pretty bad.  

Prawns with garlic noodles:  definitely could feel the garlic in this dish.  However, noodles were overcooked and prawns were too salty.  

I didn't feel there was anything special here, it was a less than average Asian restaurant, with bad service.  I also couldn't justify spending over $50 for crab, when I could go to Crustacean and get the same thing with better ambience and service.

The food came out sporadically and it took them forever to bring out a fried rice order.  I had to ask multiple times and waited for an equally long time just for a soda.  And to top it off, the waiter forgot to put in an appetizer order (after other waiters had confirmed it was on its way).  It was like being served by the 3 stooges, that's literally what it felt like.  Everybody running around, but no one was actually doing their job.  Two thumbs down!

excerpts: We also ordered the crab fried rice and of course the garlic noodles.
fried rice.author: Monica K.
fried rice.review:
I came back to this place again because I was hoping to have a good roasted garlic crab which I was very happy with how all the food came out. The garlic crab was good, and not dry. We also ordered the crab fried rice and of course the garlic noodles.  I think I tasted garlic in my mouth for the next 2 days, but it was worth it. 

The service was just okay, nothing stellar, but when the bill came I was shocked that my crab was almost  $60. I guess Dungeness crab gets a little pricey. Parking can be a little tough if you don't want to pay for valet.

excerpts: We got fried rice, garlic noodles, sea bass, 2 crabs, and seasonal veggies.
The crab is cooked
so perfectly it's easy to crack the shell and pull out plump whole pieces of meat.
Not buttery, but seasoned with Asian spices and black pepper.
So good!
fried rice.author: Darlene W.
fried rice.review: Came here almost 10 years ago during a trip with friends and remembered the most delicious roast crab. So I recommended it to my family on this recent trip, and the roast crab is just as good as I remember! We got fried rice, garlic noodles, sea bass, 2 crabs, and seasonal veggies. The crab is cooked so perfectly it's easy to crack the shell and pull out plump whole pieces of meat. Not buttery, but seasoned with Asian spices and black pepper. So good!

excerpts:
Fried rice had the right amount of moist, mussels were amazing   was delicious but removed the best part :( emptied out the body 
Definitely coming back
fried rice.author: C G.
fried rice.review:
Fried rice had the right amount of moist, mussels were amazing   was delicious but removed the best part :( emptied out the body 
Definitely coming back

excerpts: Also tried the combination fried rice.
Didn't like it too much, for it tasted bland.
But I do really love this place!
Makes all that hard work for a little piece of meat worth it.
fried rice.author: Annie H.
fried rice.review: The sauce for the roast crab is everything! So good that I could have the sauce all day with anything. The second time I came here, my crab was lacking enough sauce and so I definitely remembered it to be way more flavorful the first time around. The garlic noodles are super delicious. I could probably eat the whole plate to myself, although that would not be a good idea. Also tried the combination fried rice. Didn't like it too much, for it tasted bland. But I do really love this place! Makes all that hard work for a little piece of meat worth it.

excerpts: I finished my crab and the garlic fried rice and happily licked my fingers with no shame afterwards.
The second thing that blew me away - the service, impeccable.
Never had to wave our waiter down for plates to be cleared, waters to be refilled, checks to be brought.

But the one thing that they did that has NEVER happened anywhere I've ever dined at before... a waiter who was walking by noticed our table was a bit wobbly and without hesitation, excused himself to get to the lower legs of the table and fixed it for us before carrying on with his duties.
fried rice.author: Nam N.
fried rice.review:
When you yelp a spot and find over 2000 reviews at a solid 4 stars, it's a sign that maybe people who come here know what they are talking about.  We did so and was not disappointed.  Two instances in which Thanh Long blew me away... the first was food, clean and flavorful in every dish and bite.  The most mentioned item in all reviews and neighboring tables was the garlic roasted crab, so of course I had to opted for it.  Albeit, $59.95 for a Dungeness crab is steep - like nearly unreasonably expensive, $40-45 would have been reasonable.  However it was quite delicious.  Each bite was full of crab meat and an abundance of flavor, my fingers were dripping with garlic butter and black pepper sauce.  I finished my crab and the garlic fried rice and happily licked my fingers with no shame afterwards.  
The second thing that blew me away - the service, impeccable.  Never had to wave our waiter down for plates to be cleared, waters to be refilled, checks to be brought.  But the one thing that they did that has NEVER happened anywhere I've ever dined at before... a waiter who was walking by noticed our table was a bit wobbly and without hesitation, excused himself to get to the lower legs of the table and fixed it for us before carrying on with his duties.  I know it's not a serious gesture but the attention to detail and the willingness to care for it really blows my mind.

Overall - I like the place.  Expensive for what it is, but an experience that is worth the try if you're a Dungeness crab lover!

excerpts: We had the calamari, mango salad, garlic noodles, roast crab, eggplant dish and fried rice.
It was a feast!
Paired well with bottle of white wine.
Only minor hiccup is parking, no lot, I circled the block three times before parking three blocks away.
To find they offer valet for $13.
fried rice.author: Vee V.
fried rice.review: Stopped here for dinner on our first night in San Fran.  It did not disappoint. Everything was delicious and service was excellent, we were seated right away. We had the calamari, mango salad, garlic noodles, roast crab, eggplant dish and fried rice. It was a feast!  Paired well with bottle of white wine. Only minor hiccup is parking, no lot, I circled the block three times before parking three blocks away. To find they offer valet for $13.

excerpts: We ordered Calamari, Mango Salad, Chicken fried Rice, Saigon Beef & Lemongrass Chicken.
The food was delicious, perfectly seasoned, fresh ingredients, meat was juicy and tender!
The only suggestion I have is the calamari was good, but a little dry.
I like having some sort of sauce with my calamari.
fried rice.author: Laila A.
fried rice.review:
I was in SF and a friend of mines raved about this spot. So I decided to check it out. 

The outside of the restaurant looks like a hole in the wall but once inside the ambiance of the restaurant is classy but casual at the same time. Nice dim lights, small bar and plenty of privacy. The parking in SF is a bi%#h, and we drove around a couple times before we decided to valet our car. The valet cost $12 (a little pricey, but that's SF for you) and the guy who did the valet was not the most pleasant person. Once inside, we were greeted by the host and the manager. They were busy with large parties but we were only a party of 3 and were sat right away. The server brought water out and gave us a chance to look over the menu. 

We ordered Calamari, Mango Salad, Chicken fried Rice, Saigon Beef & Lemongrass Chicken. 
The food was delicious, perfectly seasoned, fresh ingredients, meat was juicy and tender! The only suggestion I have is the calamari was good, but a little dry. I like having some sort of sauce with my calamari. Besides that, everything was A+. 

If you are in the SF area, u have to check this place out. They will not disappoint!

excerpts: Main course we ordered garlic noodles; best garlic noodles in any restaurant, combination fried rice; also good, and the roast crab; perfectly cooked but no taste or anything special about it at all.
I could've made a better roast crab at home.
So looks like the main dish of the night goes to their garlic noodles.
Oh we also ordered drinks but they seemed to be limited cuz she originally ordered a lychee martini
but they were out n settled for a pear martini instead which was actually good
and I ordered the berkley pilsner
but they were also out
and I settled for a sapporo.
All in all we'll definitely be back and maybe try one of the other crab dishes perhaps.
fried rice.author: Allen R.
fried rice.review: No parking but good thing they have valet. Got seated right away around 1830 on a Thursday night. Place gets really busy around 1930-2000 so good thing we got there early. For an appetizer we ordered coconut prawns; good but nothing special. Main course we ordered garlic noodles; best garlic noodles in any restaurant, combination fried rice; also good, and the roast crab; perfectly cooked but no taste or anything special about it at all. I could've made a better roast crab at home. So looks like the main dish of the night goes to their garlic noodles. Oh we also ordered drinks but they seemed to be limited cuz she originally ordered a lychee martini but they were out n settled for a pear martini instead which was actually good and I ordered the berkley pilsner but they were also out and I settled for a sapporo. All in all we'll definitely be back and maybe try one of the other crab dishes perhaps.

excerpts: I also like their fried rice and heard their mango salad is delicious as well.
fried rice.author: M. H.
fried rice.review:
If you know me, you know how much I LOVED Thanh Long! This use to be my go to place whenever I felt like splurging on a good meal. Three years ago I would've given this place 5 stars. But as the years went on, I'm becoming less impressed with this place. 

The last two times I've been here, the service has been subpar. On my previous visit before tonight, I had a waitress who was not very friendly and lacked social skills. I want to feel welcomed, especially if I'm paying a crap load of money on a great meal. Tonight I had a waiter who would only talk to me and would not acknowledge my grandma (can we say awkward and weird). 

On my previous visit, I received my crab way before my garlic noodles. Uhhhhh I would like to eat my HOT crab with my HOT garlic noodles. I don't want COLD crab with HOT garlic noodles. Tonight after my grandma and I ordered, we literally received our food 5 minutes later. Either the chef was able to whip up 2 roasted crabs and 2 orders of garlic noodles in under two minutes or they just reheated our food and served it to us (hmmmm). 

As far as the food, it does not excite me as much as it use to. My roasted crab was pretty good, but it lacked garlic and was more peppery and salty (and greasy af). My garlic noodles were good but not as good as I remember them being. I also want to mention that my food went cold pretty quickly (that's what happens when you reheat food...let me stop lol).

I will say there are some good appetizers like the salt and pepper calamari and the shrimp toast. I also like their fried rice and heard their mango salad is delicious as well. I've had the Tiger Prawns on garlic noodles and it was really good (it was my very first meal here).

I would definitely recommend this place to someone who has never experienced the infamous roasted crab and garlic noodles or just want to say they've been here. I personally don't see myself coming back here, unless its for a special event. I also want to mention that although they are the same family, Thanh Long is better than Crustaceans only because Crustaceans taste differently...and not in a good way.

excerpts: Have yet to try their fried rice
so I'm looking forward to that next time.
fried rice.author: Jonathan N.
fried rice.review: Took my girl out and gave her crabs. This place is fire. Roast crab, garlic noodles, shaking beef, calamari are all delicious. It's a little expensive but it's worth it every once in a while.  I think we've eaten the eggplant here before and that was cool too. Have yet to try their fried rice so I'm looking forward to that next time.

excerpts: I also like the Seafood Fried Rice cause they put some real crab in it, but next time I might just get 2 orders of the Garlic Noodle.
It's that good!!!
