excerpts: They also have the less expensive option of garlic rice, fried rice, jasmine rice, or vegetables.
fried rice.author: Tiffany N.
fried rice.review:
Good food, good service, and not necessarily overpriced.

Made reservations for 6 pm New Year's Eve. We got there about half an hour early, but they seated us anyways since there was room. It's a small restaurant on the corner of the street. On the outside, it doesn't look very nice but the interior is pretty upscale.  

Loved the promptness of everything. The appetizer came within ten minutes. We were bibbed and received our main course immediately after we finished our appetizer. The waiters were attentive and helpful. They also gave us New Year's calendars on our way out. 

Here's what we got:
SALT & PEPPER CALAMARI $11.95: Good appetizer. Crisp, no sauce.

ASPARAGUS SOUP WITH CRAB $7.50: My mom ordered this and enjoyed it. Hot soup is always great when the weather is cold. 

ROAST/DRUNKEN/TAMARIND CRAB: We got one of each ($41.95 per crab). My favorite was the drunken crab. The sauce actually doesn't matter unless you dip the crab meat in the sauce on the plate. 

GARLIC NOODLES $10: This was actually really good, but I wouldn't say they're to die for. It was like eating garlic bread except they were noodles, and these noodles are the same texture as the chow mein at Panda Express. They also have the less expensive option of garlic rice, fried rice, jasmine rice, or vegetables. 

LAVA CHOCOLATE CAKE $8.25: Skip it. The lava cake is mostly syrup and on the bitter side. 

FRIED BANANA A LA MODE $6.95: Skip it. It's just regular fried banana and ice cream--nothing special.

CREME BRULEE $7.50: Again, skip it. If you are dying to have dessert here, choose this one. I'm not saying the desserts are bad at Thanh Long but there are a couple dessert shops on the same street and there are better options in driving distance.

Parents also had a FLEUR DE MANGO ($9.25) with a heineken ($5) and a HANOI SUNSET ($9).

excerpts: The seafood combination fried rice is very good but Crustaceans doesn't serve it.
Hmmmm...another 10 years can go by before I revisit again.
I'll stick to Crustys!
fried rice.author: Michelle R.
fried rice.review: Haven't been here in years because Crustaceans is closer to get to. The valet is more expensive than Crustaceans. Service is great for a casual dining experience.  Their crab may have tasted better than Crustaceans because they put alot of cracked black pepper on theirs. But their garlic noodles were terrible. The seafood combination fried rice is very good but Crustaceans doesn't serve it. Hmmmm...another 10 years can go by before I revisit again. I'll stick to Crustys!

excerpts: The shrimp toast and seafood fried rice were delicious!
fried rice.author: Angelic L.
fried rice.review:
Oh my... Thanh Long sure is expensive!

I came here with some family and we spent a good chunk of money. We had two crabs, one drunken and one roasted. I definitely preferred the roasted crab over the drunken one, but both were cooked well and were fresh! The crab meat didn't stick to the shells and the shells were really easy to crack. We also had two orders of garlic noodles. Yummy! They were extremely garlic-y, which I loved, but I would have liked it a little saltier. The shrimp toast and seafood fried rice were delicious!

Overall, I really enjoyed Thanh Long, but did not like what it did to my wallet. Haha...

excerpts:
We ordered:
 roasted crab
drunken crab
garlic noodles
MUSSELS
chicken fried rice
2 cocktails
The roasted crab was better than the drunken crab.
The garlic noodles were so tasty, but I have to admit I have had other garlic noodles that were just as good as here.
The fried rice was good but boring.
fried rice.author: Nicole A.
fried rice.review:
My husband I read about this place on Yelp and had to try it! 

We ordered:
 roasted crab
drunken crab
garlic noodles
MUSSELS
chicken fried rice
2 cocktails
 Total was about $165

I wish I could give a better breakdown of the cost, well the crab, but I lost my receipt and didn't think to look until I thought about doing this review.  My guess is they were about 25-35 bucks each for market price.

I see the crab has been reviewed over and over so what I want to point out is that the mussels were FANTASTIC! When we talk about going back, we talk about going back for the mussels! The roasted crab was better than the drunken crab.  The garlic noodles were so tasty, but I have to admit I have had other garlic noodles that were just as good as here.  The fried rice was good but boring. 

I give this place 4 stars for excellent food and service. 1 extra star for being walking distance to the beach! Come here and get stuffed with yummy food, then walk it off at beautiful Ocean Beach.

excerpts: We ordered the Roasted Garlic Crab, Drunken Crab, Garlic Noodles and Garlic Fried Rice.
There was not much of a difference in taste between the two crab dishes.
They were good and I think better than the Roasted Garlic Crab at PPQ
but PPQ has Peppercorn Crab, which is a stellar dish that Thanh Long does not carry on their menu.
The garlic noodles are better here than PPQ and the garlic fried rice goes very well with the crab butter sauce.
The garlic noodles are better here than PPQ and the garlic fried rice goes very well with the crab butter sauce.
fried rice.author: Chi N.
fried rice.review:
I haven't been back to Thanh Long in almost a decade so when my gf came to visit, I decided to take her here instead of PPQ Dungeness Island since I remembered Thanh Long being more fancy and upscale. Things have changed in the last few years as this place is not as fancy as I remembered. My gf and I were dressed up and felt a little out of place as most other diners were dressed more casual. 

We ordered the Roasted Garlic Crab, Drunken Crab, Garlic Noodles and Garlic Fried Rice. There was not much of a difference in taste between the two crab dishes. They were good and I think better than the Roasted Garlic Crab at PPQ but PPQ has Peppercorn Crab, which is a stellar dish that Thanh Long does not carry on their menu. The garlic noodles are better here than PPQ and the garlic fried rice goes very well with the crab butter sauce. 

It's pricier than PPQ. We paid $150 for all 4 dishes, including 2 glasses of wine with tip included. At PPQ, I've ordered the same amount of food with a bottle of wine for $100. Since the ambiance is not as upscale as before, I would save the few extra bucks and eat at PPQ's instead.

excerpts: Seafood Fried Rice 14$ -this was the only thing that didn't wow me at the table.
Wouldn't order it again.
It was good, but compared to the other amazing dishes this just didn't stand out.
Banana Cake 8$ - delicious.
fried rice.author: Ames A.
fried rice.review:
I would give this place a million stars if I could. I am a seafood steak lover.. I have found my haven. My new favorite restaurant in all of America! 

After hearing so much raving about Thanh Long and their sister resteraunt Crusteceans I finally walked in the day after Christmas. Without a reservation we waited 45 min... We were extremely hungry and boy am I glad we waited, after leaving the previous restaurant for having a 30 min wait. As we were waiting people walking out would assure us it's worth the wait.... my expectations were high. We promptly got seated and after about 35 min.
We ordered.. as the food comes out you'll start to notice everyone gets real quiet...

Roasted Crab 42$ -OMG Flavorful and deliciousness it was draped in butter and seasoning. As I was eating my body slowly floated towards heaven. My BF agreed.
Seasoned Mixed Veggies 11$ -OMG perfectly seasoned. Sooo sooo good!
Garlic noodles with tiger prawns 36$ - Garlic noodles were soo good.. My Bf has caliac disease and can't have yellow noodles.. but he couldn't resist. He insisted it was worth the later pain he would endure.. It was sooo good but I wouldn't recommend getting the tiger prawns with it. It was overpriced for what it was. But the 16$ for reg garlic noodles will be ordered on my next visit.
Seafood Fried Rice 14$ -this was the only thing that didn't wow me at the table. Wouldn't order it again. It was good, but compared to the other amazing dishes this just didn't stand out.
Banana Cake 8$ - delicious. If you have room give it a shot.. but otherwise I wouldn't order it again.

Our Bill came to 120$, service by server Eddy was incredible. I will be back shortly. There's really no mistake about that. AMAAAAZING food, great service, and do-able prices.

excerpts: The seafood fried rice is delicious, seriously order it and take it for lunch the next day.
fried rice.author: Raven J.
fried rice.review: I have been eating here for the last ten years. Yes it is pricy but it is consistently delicious and definitely worth going too. If not just for a casual dinner than at least a special celebration. The seafood fried rice is delicious, seriously order it and take it for lunch the next day. Roasted crab and garlic noodles are a must. Bring mints for after!!!

excerpts: Fried Rice with Shrimp (your standard fried rice, I wouldn't order again)
Fried Banana & Fried Ice Cream (both were good
fried rice.author: Amy D.
fried rice.review:
Came in a group of 6 on a Saturday night, so we got to try a lot of dishes. Making reservations is definitely recommended, and parking in this area is tough- the $10 for valet is well spent. 

Ordered-
Salt & Pepper Calamari (nice and peppery, but calamari could've been a bit more crisp)
Dungeness Crab Puffs (good, but def not authentic)
Seafood Dumplings (only ok and 5 pieces- wouldn't recommend for the price)
Crispy Rice Paper Roll (too dry for me, I wouldn't order this again)
Curry Lotus Prawns (good taste but the "jumbo prawns" were teeny!)
Shaken Beef (really good flavor, imo better than at the Slanted Door and cheaper. however, they mix in potatoes pieces to trick you into thinking there is more meat)
Roast Crab (good, but wasn't super flavorful)
Tamarind Crab (wasn't very flavorful, but both crabs were cooked perfectly)
Garlic Noodles (good, but could've been more garlicky)
Fried Rice with Shrimp (your standard fried rice, I wouldn't order again)
Fried Banana & Fried Ice Cream (both were good but I like the banana a lot more)

Overall, the dinner was good, but not amazing. I actually liked the crab I ordered at Three Seasons better (taste wise). My favorite dishes were the shaken beef and garlic noodles, but this restaurant is worth a try for the crab. We paid $57pp including tax and tip, which isn't bad at all, but we didn't get that much crab.

excerpts: We had chicken fried rice (mostly for the baby) which was your typical chicken fried rice.
fried rice.author: Danielle G.
fried rice.review:
I was finally able to knock this off my bookmarks list. We came on Jan 1 and the wait for a table of 6 was 30-45. I think if I would have had Thanh Long prior to PPQ and Crustacean I would be much more impressed. But I can't help but make comparisons. 

PPQ has the best value for the food. Thanh Long is definitely cheaper than Crustacean, but by no means a casual dining option. The roasted crab runs at market price and happened to be $40 on this particular night. 

As far as the garlic noodles, I have to rank Crustacean's as the best, PPQ in second and Thanh Long 3rd. However, that being said, all three are fantastic and worth a try.

Crustacean obviously wins in the ambiance category, but Thanh Long is a very nice, quaint place. I like that Thanh Long impresses and is appropriate from anything from a romantic date to a fun family dinner.  

Enough comparisons, let's talk about Thanh Long's food. The mango salad was a nice surprise. It was warm and I wasn't sure what to think about that, but it was good. Salt and pepper calamari was good, but kind of a dish you can find at many other restaurants. The spicy eggplant dish had good flavor and lots of vegetables. We had chicken fried rice (mostly for the baby) which was your typical chicken fried rice. The shaken beef was a definite stand out dish. It was super tender and the flavor was wonderful.

My only gripe about the crab was they didn't leave the shell with all the juices and good stuff. The shell was turned over and we had to dig around to find some fat (which of course is one of the best parts!).

By the way, skip the drinks here. They come in tiny glasses that are much overpriced. 

All in all I will probably stick with PPQ as my go to, but Thanh Long is definitely a good option for a special occasion.

excerpts: We all ordered Dungeness Crab and a side of garlic noodles and fried rice.
The food couldnt have been served fast enough, and the servers were very polite and extremely attentive.
fried rice.author: Gabriela L.
fried rice.review:
Came here this past weekend with my boyfriend and some family. It was my first time and not the last! I was really satisfied with the overall service and dishes. We all ordered Dungeness Crab and a side of garlic noodles and fried rice. The food couldnt have been served fast enough, and the servers were very polite and extremely attentive. Safe to say, this is best crab I've ever had.

The only downside are the prices. They are a bit expsensive, but everything was fully worth it! Will be coming back.

excerpts: I tried the roasted crab, garlic noodles, shaken beef, fried rice, and vegetarian delight.
Everything just seemed so average, nothing special.
The crab was tasty, but because the shells weren't cracked, I had to work hard to get the meat out.
The garlic noodles were kind of dry, and the shaken beef was pretty tough.
I'm glad I tried this place out, but I probably won't be eating here again.
The garlic noodles were kind of dry, and the shaken beef was pretty tough.
I'm glad I tried this place out, but I probably won't be eating here again.
fried rice.author: Rachel H.
fried rice.review: I know I'm in the minority, but I really don't get what the hype is about. I think this place is overrated. I tried the roasted crab, garlic noodles, shaken beef, fried rice, and vegetarian delight. Everything just seemed so average, nothing special. The crab was tasty, but because the shells weren't cracked, I had to work hard to get the meat out. The garlic noodles were kind of dry, and the shaken beef was pretty tough. I'm glad I tried this place out, but I probably won't be eating here again.

excerpts: Our dinner consisted of one of each of the soups, salt and pepper calamari, collasal tiger prawns over garlic noodles, lemongrass chicken, vegetarian entree, chicken fried rice, and an extra order of garlic noodles.

The salt and pepper calamari was good as well, served sizzling hot, with a good combination of salt AND pepper, but for a couple of the outlying pieces, there was definitely a lot more salt than pepper.
The main dish I liked the most was the collasal tigerl prawns over garlic noodles.
The noodles were seasoned to perfection and it got my whole family scooping for more.
The prawns were pretty good as well, although I could definitely taste the layer of butter in between those suckers.
However, I'm not too sure how to justify 4 pieces of prawn over a bed of garlic noodles for 37 bucks.
fried rice.author: Ada C.
fried rice.review:
Mixed feelings about Thanh Long, after reading all the awesome reviews about this place, I had high expectations as I made reservations for a party of 5 on a Friday night. 

Upon arrival, we were immediately greeted and seated. Customer service was pretty on point, the waiter was friendly and attentive. He memorized our order (which was quite a few items) without writing it down, but sadly forgot one of the appetizers. All good, since I'm sure we over ordered anyways.

Our dinner consisted of one of each of the soups, salt and pepper calamari, collasal tiger prawns over garlic noodles, lemongrass chicken, vegetarian entree, chicken fried rice, and an extra order of garlic noodles. Although the serving size wasn't as big as we had pictured, this was more than enough for the 5 of us, so in retrospect, the serving size was pretty decent.

Out of all the soups, we all voted that the vegetarian soup was the best. Something about the clear broth and the assorted veggies just made it more refreshing versus the creamy aspargus chowder or the chicken vermecelli soup.

The salt and pepper calamari was good as well, served sizzling hot, with a good combination of salt AND pepper, but for a couple of the outlying pieces, there was definitely a lot more salt than pepper. 

As for the entrees, it was pretty mediocre, not fabulous, but not disgusting or unedible. There was just nothing outstanding about the meal. The main dish I liked the most was the collasal tigerl prawns over garlic noodles. The noodles were seasoned to perfection and it got my whole family scooping for more. The prawns were pretty good as well, although I could definitely taste the layer of butter in between those suckers. However, I'm not too sure how to justify 4 pieces of prawn over a bed of garlic noodles for 37 bucks. Seems a little bit outrageous.. pretentious to some.

Again, like I said, the meal wasn't bad, but for the price of the dishes, I was expecting something more amazing. Overall, a good dining experience, food was pretty good, glad I tried it once, but nothing coaxing me to be back for another round.

excerpts: We ordered the Crab, fried rice, garlic noodles and mango salad.
The mango salad was nice.
Teased ever so gently with shrimp and thick cuts of mango.
The fried rice was delicate, delicious and just amazing.
The garlic noodles were awesome.
The next time I go to Panda and they're talking "garlic noodles," I think I'm going to just call the police.
Thanh Long's garlic noodles are by far the best I've ever had.
fried rice.author: Mark Darren W.
fried rice.review:
If you've been following my reviews you already know I don't give out 5-Stars like it's Halloween Candy.  So if a restaurant gets this rating from me, they deserve it.  Hands down, flat out, case closed, done dig-giddy dada (I know... just go with the moment).

I've heard a lot about Thanh Long and looked forward to trying it.  I got the opportunity when in the Bay area this past weekend.

I've been an advocate for "hole in the wall" restaurants over chains because 1. I think the food most of time tastes a lot better and 2. The intimacy of a small establishment caters to my "less crowd, less noise" mantra.

From the outside, Thanh Long does not look impressive.  But when you notice a flood of people going in and coming out either something illegal is happening or they have really good food.  Thanh Long has really, really, good food.

The restaurant is nicely decorated and my hats off to the bartender.  I'm not a big drinker at all.  That said, I think every person should have a signature drink.  For me, it's Drambuie.  Because it's not an average drink and only consumed by the most worldly of people (ah-em), I can tell instantly the status of a restaurant when I order it and the waiter says "huh, what's that?"  Or the bartender simply smiles and says, "I'm sorry sir, we don't have that."  He knows that you know, the sophistication of their restaurant is FOS at that point.

Thanh Long serves Drambuie.  I'm just saying.

The restaurant is small and intimate - just how I like it.  

We ordered the Crab, fried rice, garlic noodles and mango salad.

The mango salad was nice.  Teased ever so gently with shrimp and thick cuts of mango.  I didn't care for it being slightly warmed, but I didn't mind either.

The fried rice was delicate, delicious and just amazing.  The garlic noodles were awesome.  The next time I go to Panda and they're talking "garlic noodles," I think I'm going to just call the police.  Thanh Long's garlic noodles are by far the best I've ever had.

The Crab, unless you don't like getting your hands dirty, then you need to order something else.  Steamed in pepper and other seasoning with just enough of a buttery hint that I was sitting at the table licking my fingers.  Yeah, I know. No table etiquette, but at that point I didn't care.  And if you're wondering, it was so good I would have ate the shell.

I'll be going back to the Bay area in another month and I'm already making reservations for round 2 at Thanh Long.

What better way to acknowledge their food is that good.

excerpts: spent 200 on 2 crabs,  1 garlic noodles , 1 fried rice,  for 2 adults and 2 kids.
It wasnt as good as i expected.
fried rice.author: Jill G.
fried rice.review: spent 200 on 2 crabs,  1 garlic noodles , 1 fried rice,  for 2 adults and 2 kids. It wasnt as good as i expected.

excerpts: We ended up getting the roasted crab, garlic noodles, calamari and seafood fried rice that everyone was talking about.
The food come out within 10 mins so we were happy about that.
The calamari was kind of plain
so we had to ask the waiter for chili paste.
The garlic noodles is not the best in town, it was a bit over cooked!
they could have done better.
Also the fried rice was mediocre.
Now for the main reason why we came to the restaurant, the crab.
fried rice.author: Dinh H.
fried rice.review: Couple of my friends and I went to the city to try out this restaurant because of all the good reviews. We ended up getting the roasted crab, garlic noodles, calamari and seafood fried rice that everyone was talking about. The food come out within 10 mins so we were happy about that. The calamari was kind of plain so we had to ask the waiter for chili paste. The garlic noodles is not the best in town, it was a bit over cooked! they could have done better. Also the fried rice was mediocre. Now for the main reason why we came to the restaurant, the crab. Everyone said the Roast crab is a must try and they love it. In my opinion I could have cooked it better at home. The flavor was okay but the crab was cooked well. We had to ask for salt, pepper and lemon just to dip our crab meat in because the seasoning was only on the shells so it wasn't that tasty. If they had Tabasco i would have enjoyed eating the crab more. Our tab came out to 220 dollars. Each crab was 53 bucks! Was not worth it. And also the waiter was quick on refilling our waters and getting what we need very quickly.

excerpts: Love me some roasted garlic crab, crab fried rice, and garlic noodles.
YUMMMMMMM.
We occasionally try some appetizers and salads and it's always yummy.
But for sure, always the crab, crab fried rice, and garlic noodles.
I am ALWAYS looking forward to the next time I get to eat here.
But for sure, always the crab, crab fried rice, and garlic noodles.
I am ALWAYS looking forward to the next time I get to eat here.
fried rice.author: Andrea M.
fried rice.review: Have I really never wrote a review on Thanh Long? I freakin LOVE thanh long. LOVE LOVE LOVE LOVE it. I am never disappointed here. Food is amazing. Love me some roasted garlic crab, crab fried rice, and garlic noodles. YUMMMMMMM. We occasionally try some appetizers and salads and it's always yummy. But for sure, always the crab, crab fried rice, and garlic noodles. I am ALWAYS looking forward to the next time I get to eat here. =)

excerpts: My husband hand the tiger prawns and fried rice.
It was good.
I loved our appitizer.
fried rice.author: Felicia W.
fried rice.review: April 18th was my first visit to Thanh Long!! My husband surprised me for our wedding anniversary. It was everything that everyone said it was.....AMAZING!! I had garlic noodles and the roasted crab!! The noodles were good but a bit dry. The crab was good. My husband hand the tiger prawns and fried rice. It was good. I loved our appitizer. It was the shrimp toast. We made a reservation and were seated right away. I do suggest arriving early. Parking is very hard. They do have valet for additional 12$. It is a bit pricey but the food is well worth it!!

excerpts: Also, the seafood fried rice was lacking in salt.
Thankfully, they brought some chili sambal to our table upon request.
fried rice.author: Gene C.
fried rice.review:
I came here with a friend from out of town looking for a competitor to PPQ Dungeness Island. The restaurant is situated in a fairly residential area, but then again, I guess most restaurants in the Sunset/Richmond area qualify.  The restaurant's layout is a little interesting, as the back portion of the restaurant was walled off leaving a nook for 6 tables and gave the restaurant a closed-off feel.  The frozen cocktail my friend ordered was mostly sweet without much alcohol, disappointing even for her.

The jumbo prawn wontons are not jumbo by any account (granted, I had eaten at Anchor Oyster Bar earlier that day, so my sense of proportion may be completely skewed), and you can barely taste the pancetta at all, a very forgettable dish.  The Buddha roll, on the other hand, was like a slight variation on a traditional Vietnamese spring roll filled with tasty daikon and black mushrooms to give it a more earthy flavor.  The Dungeness crab puffs were like crab rangoons on crack, filled with delicious herb cheese and a large quantity of crab, only limited by their size.

The garlic noodles here have somewhat more of a bite and stronger garlic flavor compared to PPQ Dungeness Island. However, I have to say the crab, albeit meatier, was not nearly as flavorful.  We ordered the roast crab which, although mildly peppery and actually with a good amount of sweet meat, otherwise was not as heavily seasoned.  Strangely enough, our crab was actually a little cool by the time it got to our table.  Also, the seafood fried rice was lacking in salt.  Thankfully, they brought some chili sambal to our table upon request.  Our server was really very nice and attentive.

Overall, based on pure food comparisons, PPQ Dungeness Island wins in my book purely based on the crab's flavoring, but Thanh Long may actually serve a better crab and definitely has better garlic noodles.  If you're looking for crab on a Tuesday, this is your place... (cuz it seems everywhere else is closed!)

excerpts: the dungeness crab i found in my salad louies and crab fried rice left me underwhelmed and longing for the lump crab of my hometown.
fried rice.author: Kris G.
fried rice.review:
this is no mere roasted crab... this is god, speaking to us through food. 

i'm paraphrasing jason segel here, from HIMYM, and although he's speaking of the best burger in new york, i'm here to tell you about the best crab in san francisco. 

most of you know, i'm a proud maryland gal who's been cracking blue crabs over newspaper since i was 3, thank you very much. for me, crabs come by the bushel, they're served with buckets of beer and plates of hush puppies, and it's a social thing - you spend time at the table with family and friends, talking and eating delicious morsels of old bay-seasoned crab meat. 

when i came to san francisco, i was shocked and appalled at the flat discs of fish-flavored breadcrumbs that pass for crabcakes in the bay area. the dungeness crab i found in my salad louies and crab fried rice left me underwhelmed and longing for the lump crab of my hometown. i had been in SF three years, was planning to move back to DC for a new job, and had thoroughly given up hope of finding good crab in the bay area... until i went to thanh long. 

have you ever licked your hands in the middle of a nice restaurant, trying to suck every delicious drop of flavor off your fingers, not caring who saw your atrocious manners? well, if you go to thanh long, you will. 

i tried their buttery, garlicky roasted crab exactly one week before i was set to move across the country, and literally had dreams the next two nights of tender crab meat eaten with white rice by the handful. refusing to leave california without another taste, i went to sister restaurant crustacean (thanh long is closed on mondays) before hitting the airport for my cross-country flight. 

their garlic noodles are fantastic; so are the crab and cream cheese wontons and the desserts, but that roast crab still haunts my dreams. and you better believe thanh long is the first place i'm gonna go when i'm back in the bay. 

best. crab. in. san francisco.

excerpts: sometimes we get seafood fried rice, calamari, vietnamese salad, beef skewers, etc, but the only essentials are: roast crab.
fried rice.author: Anjelica C.
fried rice.review:
roast crab. garlic noodles.

that is all you need.

sometimes we get seafood fried rice, calamari, vietnamese salad, beef skewers, etc, but the only essentials are: roast crab. garlic noodles.

we've ventured to try the tamarind crab once or twice but it's not as amazing as the roast crab. make reservations, if you can! and some days, parking can take awhile. staff is really friendly, helpful, and attentive. always a great dining experience here

excerpts: And since not everyone in my family is as big of a fan of crab as I am, we also ordered a combo fried rice and their shaken beef.
The rice knocked it out of the park; the shaken beef - not so much.
fried rice.author: Roxane W.
fried rice.review:
Thanh Long was a great experience for my family and I. Yes, it's pricey. At $38 per crab, you have to be prepared to spend a large sum - but I think it's worth it. Luckily, we made reservations. I would recommend you do the same.. The front area was constantly packed during our meal.  We shared the salmon carpaccio to start, which was delicious. The spring rolls were good too, but nothing special. 

The waiter was kind enough to let us know that we could easily share crab (instead of ordering one per person) and share the noodles. Both were very, very good. Definitely the best items on their menu. And since not everyone in my family is as big of a fan of crab as I am, we also ordered a combo fried rice and their shaken beef.  The rice knocked it out of the park; the shaken beef - not so much. It was a bit rubbery and much too sweet.

Overall, a great experience at a high cost.

excerpts: My son enjoyed their fried rice.
fried rice.author: Ashley S.
fried rice.review:
My sister insisted we try this place while in San Fran, and boy am I glad I did! This place is something that I will forever recommend to anyone who will be visiting this area. The dungeons crab was crazy good! The secret sauce was the best part. Their garlic noodle was soo tasty. It wasnt overwhelming. My son enjoyed their fried rice. 

Their service was great and the restaurant was nice and clean. It was a long drive from San Mateo to here, but well worth it! Can't wait to go back. Next time we will also try crustations, which I believe is owned by the same people.

excerpts: We also get the salt and pepper calamari (not as crunchy as it use to be and less flavorful, but still one of the better tasting ones out there), combo fried rice (another winner), added on mixed vegetables and the stuffed calamari (both of the sauces tasted similar but was still tasty).
fried rice.author: Carol H.
fried rice.review:
Was here with some family today and realized we have been coming here for almost 20 years already.  Wow! Out of all of their establishments, this is still my favorite location, even if parking can be a beast, unless you valet, or just come early. You can always expect an attentive waitstaff who will give you good service.
 
My all time guilty pleasures is the roasted crab and garlic noodles.   This is a guarantee to be on point and for us, usually get individual crabs instead of sharing for left overs.

We also get the salt and pepper calamari (not as crunchy as it use to be and less flavorful, but still one of the better tasting ones out there), combo fried rice (another winner), added on mixed vegetables and the stuffed calamari (both of the sauces tasted similar but was still tasty).

excerpts: My favorites include the roasted dungeness crab (market price), seafood fried rice, pancetta wrapped butterfly prawns, fried calamari, seafood dumplings, and fried bananas with ice cream.
fried rice.author: V F.
fried rice.review:
Thanh Long has been my favorite restaurant for too many years to remember. So much so, they could easily find my name in the reservation system just by telling them my first name.

Over the years, the portions have gotten a lot smaller and the quality of ingredients has slowly gone down hill also. It's probably due to the economy, but I feel for the prices they charge, you should get what you pay for.

I have heard great things about a competitor restaurant in the area so I'm thinking I may have to try it the next time just to see how they stack up.

If you have never been, I think its something you should experience once. My favorites include the roasted dungeness crab (market price), seafood fried rice, pancetta wrapped butterfly prawns, fried calamari, seafood dumplings, and fried bananas with ice cream.

Plan to spend about $150 for two people (depending on what you order and whether you consume alcohol).

Great, expedient service and reasonably priced valet parking. Good for a special occasion.

excerpts: My family and I enjoy eating at Thanh Long, we start off with crab puffs ,shrimp toast and the house fried rice, then we finish out with a crab and garlic noddles...
we love the atmosphere ,customer service and cleanliness....
We go back and forward to Thanh Long and their sister restaurant...
we visit at least 20 times a year and never disappointed...
fried rice.author: Shannon H.
fried rice.review:
My family and I enjoy eating at Thanh Long, we start off with crab puffs ,shrimp toast and the house fried rice, then we finish out with a crab and garlic noddles...we love the atmosphere ,customer service and cleanliness....We go back and forward to Thanh Long and their sister restaurant...we visit at least 20 times a year and never disappointed...We drive from Tracy to San Francisco and it's worth the drive....

Enjoyable

excerpts: I have tried some of the other dishes here before including prawns, fried rice and salmon, but in my opinion, the only two things worth eating at this place is the crab and garlic noodles.
fried rice.author: Celeste M.
fried rice.review:
Crab + Garlic Noodles = CRAZY DELICIOUS
Don't be crabby and make sure to wear your bib!

I have my big brother to thank for introducing me to Thanh Long.  Even though I have not eaten here as much as I would like, the past three dining experiences were all very good including last weekend's dinner with friends. I have always remembered it being very crowded for dinner so I called to make a reservation.  After everyone has arrived, we were seated promptly at the biggest booth I have ever seen. 

I shared a roasted crab, garlic noodles and a bowl of rice with my boyfriend. I have tried some of the other dishes here before including prawns, fried rice and salmon, but in my opinion, the only two things worth eating at this place is the crab and garlic noodles. If you do not eat seafood especially crab, you might not like this place. 

The whole crab is cracked open and cut into fourths so most of the work is done for you.  The crab claws are so big that it's so easy to get the meat out using the handy dandy tool, the cracker.  I really like the the garlic sauce (tons of minced garlic with butter and other spices), which is generously drizzled on the crab.  One order of garlic noodles is good for two to share.  It's yummy, very rich and tasty, but needs more garlic (that may just be because I love garlic)! The fried banana with vanilla ice cream for dessert was good, but I was a bit disappointed with the batter -- it was too thick (too much flour, I think) and was not crunchy. 

The service was quick and friendly, but I felt that they wanted us out right away after we've finished our desserts.  Everything was cleared off the table in a flash and was hoping that the waiter was going to give me another glass of coke after taking my empty glass, but he never returned with it. Oh well, I guess it was a busy night so I understand. 

Parking can be difficult, but we've been lucky to find a spot every time, plus they offer valet parking :-)!  Prices are reasonable, a bit above average depending on what you get. The crabs are market-priced (~ $35 each) and and order of garlic noodles is $9 -- totally worth it!

excerpts: Added fried rice that was decent.
I paid over $10 for a sprite that i refilled twice due to the salty food.
They didnt tell me that there was not free refill.
Each refill was $3 in the skinny 6oz soda glass.
Last time you will rip me off.
As of the $50 / crab wasnt profitable enough.
Greedy people.
fried rice.author: Hangman L.
fried rice.review: Food was okay but too much msg. Garlic noodles tasted like noodles mixed with the msg seasoning in the ramen bags. Zero fresh garlic and just wasn't very tasty. Garlic crab was basically butter salt and pepper flavor. No garlic to be seen again. Had bo luc lac and it was decent, small portion. Added fried rice that was decent. I paid over $10 for a sprite that i refilled twice due to the salty food. They didnt tell me that there was not free refill. Each refill was $3 in the skinny 6oz soda glass. Last time you will rip me off. As of the $50 / crab wasnt profitable enough. Greedy people.

excerpts: We both ordered the roasted crab (suggested by our waiter, it was delicious and seasoned very well) with one side or garlic noodles (very tasty, and garlicky), and shrimp fried rice and we added chicken for a hearty side of rice (shrimp in rice are small), They were attentive, but could have come to check on us a bit more.
The warm damp folded face towels brought to us at the end of our meal was a great addition.
Small facility, polite wait staff - overall
we had a great experience and we will return.
fried rice.author: Starlet H.
fried rice.review: First time here with my boyfriend Saturday night. The place was busy (1 hour wait), we valet parked ($12) because there was no where to park. We ordered a bottle of wine at the bar while we waited to be seated. We both ordered the roasted crab (suggested by our waiter, it was delicious and seasoned very well) with one side or garlic noodles (very tasty, and garlicky), and shrimp fried rice and we added chicken for a hearty side of rice (shrimp in rice are small), They were attentive, but could have come to check on us a bit more. The warm damp folded face towels brought to us at the end of our meal was a great addition. Small facility, polite wait staff - overall we had a great experience and we will return.

excerpts: I had the Fish and Garlic Noodles, Spicy Calamari, Combo Fried Rice and a glass of wine.
fried rice.author: Michael G.
fried rice.review:
Pretty good.  I didn't try the crab, because I figured they'd run out if I ordered it too.  Everyone around us seemed to be getting the crab, but the bib that they kindly put on for you is what lead me to decide on something less likely to require a clothing shield.  I had the Fish and Garlic Noodles, Spicy Calamari, Combo Fried Rice and a glass of wine.  

Service was excellent and the food was delicious.  My only complaint......parking is a pain and it was super loud in there.

I will be back for the crab though.

excerpts: the garlic noodles, the fried rice, the garlic bread, THE CRAB and the shank beef !
The service was the absolute best part we were in and out in about 45 minutes.
They were fast and very friendly.
Even the drinks were great.
For all my non drinkers ( like me ) you have to try their strawberry daiquiri !!
I can't say enough about them WOW !!
fried rice.author: Dessiray R.
fried rice.review: I went there for the first time last night and OMG everything we had was DELICIOUS !!....the garlic noodles, the fried rice, the garlic bread, THE CRAB and the shank beef ! The service was the absolute best part we were in and out in about 45 minutes. They were fast and very friendly. Even the drinks were great. For all my non drinkers ( like me ) you have to try their strawberry daiquiri !! I can't say enough about them WOW !!

excerpts: I ordered my usual shrimp fried rice no onions & a roast crab.
my crab came 1st.
full of guts.
NOT cleaned @ all i asked the server to take it back when he brought my rice to the table which was slightly burned SMH.
I've been going to that place for @ least 8 or 9 yrs now.
i was highly disappointed. & to top it all off the valet scuffed the bumper of my car & didn't say a word....
Gonna b a while
b4 i return..
Gonna have to go to Crustaceans for a few yrs now...
fried rice.author: Bee L.
fried rice.review: This is my FAVORITE restaurant. unfortunately i had the worst experience EVER 6/23/12. I had 6:15 reservations we were promptly seated. Our server (blonde lady with a thick accent) approached the table. asked what we wanted to drink. didn't welcome us or introduce herself. asked my date all the questions. So i asked for a new server. We were moved upstairs to a cold corner. I ordered my usual shrimp fried rice no onions & a roast crab. my crab came 1st. full of guts. NOT cleaned @ all i asked the server to take it back when he brought my rice to the table which was slightly burned SMH. I've been going to that place for @ least 8 or 9 yrs now. i was highly disappointed. & to top it all off the valet scuffed the bumper of my car & didn't say a word.... Gonna b a while b4 i return.. Gonna have to go to Crustaceans for a few yrs now...

excerpts: Tried the roasted crab, garlic noodles, and garlic fried rice last night with a bunch of coworkers.
To me, the crab was super fresh and good, if you don't mind the dripping oil/butter all over your hands.
Garlic noodles were perfect.
For the fried rice, I didn't care much about.
fried rice.author: Monica L.
fried rice.review:
Tried the roasted crab, garlic noodles, and garlic fried rice last night with a bunch of coworkers. To me, the crab was super fresh and good, if you don't mind the dripping oil/butter all over your hands. Garlic noodles were perfect. For the fried rice, I didn't care much about. Definitely you can share one crab with your friend. 

I think I still have garlic breath now.

excerpts:
fresh
- Roasted crab didn't live up to the hype or to the competition
+ Combo seafood fried rice was satisfying

Overall worth a try, and maybe we came on an off night.
fried rice.author: Angel L.
fried rice.review:
The ambiance was great and there were some stand out dishes.

The food came out quick!
+ Shaken beef was the favorite
+/- Sea bass was also good though not amazing, and I put the sauce on everything
+ Garlic noodles were tasty
+ Sauteed veggies were fresh
- Roasted crab didn't live up to the hype or to the competition
+ Combo seafood fried rice was satisfying

Overall worth a try, and maybe we came on an off night.

The wait staff was attentive, with minor hiccups.

excerpts: My boyfriend, my son, and I had an order of the Roasted Crab, Garlic Noodles, Shrimp Fried Rice, Salt and Pepper Calamari, and Chicken Satay.

Garlic Noodles= OKAY
Shrimp Fried Rice
=GOOD...simple and not greasy
Chicken Satay=
fried rice.author: S. B.
fried rice.review:
I went there for the first time last night and I must say I was super excited.  The only other restaurant I've been to like this was PPQ's, and I've only been there one time.

I LOVE CRAB AND I LOVE GARLIC NOODLES.

Based on my experience at PPQ's, I ordered what I knew to be good or what I thought would be awesome.  My boyfriend, my son, and I had an order of the Roasted Crab, Garlic Noodles, Shrimp Fried Rice, Salt and Pepper Calamari, and Chicken Satay.

Roasted Crab= OKAY
Garlic Noodles= OKAY
Shrimp Fried Rice=GOOD...simple and not greasy
Chicken Satay= OKAY, talk about charbroiled (for my 2yr old)
Salt and Pepper Calamari= GREAT

Don't get me wrong I still got down with the crab and noodles, but my tastebuds were so much more excited at PPQ's.  Honestly, in my opinion, so much better at PPQ's and I've had better Garlic Noodles at home.  

I wouldn't choose to come back unless I got invited to go there again.

excerpts: Bill: 2Roasted dung crabs, 2Garlic noodle, 1Garlic noodle with prawns, 1Lemon grass chicken, 1shaken beef, 1chicken fried rice, 3steam rice, 1chicken satay, 2 beers, 1assorted vegetable, 1small fish dish.
fried rice.author: Tommy M.
fried rice.review:
Lets cut all the bs and get to what you need to know.

1. You basically have to valet your car bc there's no parking anywhere.  $12.
2. They accept reservations so use it, it wasn't too busy but my family of 8 were sat the instant we were greeted.
3. Place looks crappy on the outside, classy in the inside.
4. This place aint cheap.  For appetizers, think 4 skewers of chicken satay for about $12 and their dinner plates range front $20-40.  Crab, market price. 
5. Portions suck, its quite pricey so your like ok hope portions are good.  Its prob about 1/2 to 3/4 of what you'd be expecting.  Think I'm lying..... lol nope
6.  Service was good, and food tasted great.
7.  Recommendations, roasted crab, garlic noodles, lemon grass chicken.
8.  Bill: 2Roasted dung crabs, 2Garlic noodle, 1Garlic noodle with prawns, 1Lemon grass chicken, 1shaken beef, 1chicken fried rice, 3steam rice, 1chicken satay, 2 beers, 1assorted vegetable, 1small fish dish.  $342 Grat included. 

Overall this place has mediocre service and great food, but not going to lie, Imo its overpriced.  Example, Shaken beef, $25,  literally 12 pieces of med sized cut beef and some mixed veggies, no sides.  Lets just say the garlic noodle and rice is what got most of us full and our kid sister was sleeping so it was really only 7 of us eating.

excerpts: We had Calamari appetizer , a beef veggie appetizer, garlic crab , garlic noodles, and fried rice.
Total cost for 2 people was $108 including tips.
First the Calamari was the best I have ever had
and I have had Calamari many many times as a appetizer.
Then the crab was huge and extremely tasty with loads of garlic sauce in butter.
The garlic noodles were perfect as well as the fried rice.
Everything was perfect except we brought our own sour dough bread for they do not serve it here.
The bread is perfect for sopping up the juices of the crab.
Would I eat here again, absolutely.
The garlic noodles were perfect as well as the fried rice.
Everything was perfect except we brought our own sour dough bread for they do not serve it here.
The bread is perfect for sopping up the juices of the crab.
Would I eat here again, absolutely.
fried rice.author: Bernadette S.
fried rice.review: Went to Thanh Long last night with a group of 10. We had Calamari appetizer , a beef veggie appetizer, garlic crab , garlic noodles, and fried rice. Total cost for 2 people was $108 including tips. First the Calamari was the best I have ever had and I have had Calamari many many times as a appetizer. Then the crab was huge and extremely tasty with loads of garlic sauce in butter. The garlic noodles were perfect as well as the fried rice. Everything was perfect except we brought our own sour dough bread for they do not serve it here. The bread is perfect for sopping up the juices of the crab. Would I eat here again, absolutely.

excerpts: The fried rice and tiger prawns are good too.
fried rice.author: Dionne M.
fried rice.review:
Roasted Crab and Garlic Noodles are to die for!  The Chambord lemon drop is a yummy.  The fried rice and tiger prawns are good too.  

The street parking sucks so we always valet park (these boys really work for the $10.00 fee).  The ambience is more casual than Crustacean (their sister restaurant), perfect for small parties or family gatherings.

I have been dining here for 20 years and the food is always consistent.  We took some out of town family members and one of them said "I think this was the best meal I have ever had!"  

Reservations are a must, unless you want to wait an hour or more.

excerpts: We ordered fried rice (I think it costs around $7) but when it came out, it looked bland and discolored but the taste was powerful.
fried rice.author: Tram N.
fried rice.review:
I never thought a Vietnamese restaurant can be of elegance.. not to offend anyone or put down on my own but I was super impressed w/ the atmosphere and service.  The hostess was in an ao dai.. the staff was very accomodating, customer-servicy, and fast.  

The garlic noodles are my favorite.  We ordered fried rice (I think it costs around $7) but when it came out, it looked bland and discolored but the taste was powerful.  My husband ordered the tamirand crab.. nothing like anywhere..

This place has my full recommendation!

excerpts: Hella bomb the shrimp fried rice is good to!
Good luck
Ill be there again real soon...
Cant wait Excited!!!
They are a little pricy so make sure all credit cards work or stop at a Bank!
fried rice.author: star w.
fried rice.review: Ha! You mean to tell me as long as I have had a Yelp account I have never ever wrote a review on Thann Long..WOW ok were do I start! This place will nock you on your back and off your feet. It is soo good melts in your mouth literally. Dam I want some right now. This is a really good place to take a loved one this weekend. Something about the food that makes me want to go home and get it on!!!!! ::))P The crab OMG is so firrgin good, the shang beef is good to..they dont put alot and yes the potatoes will through you off thinking its meat but its not::)) Also you have to try the Garlic noodles ...Hella bomb the shrimp fried rice is good to! Good luck Ill be there again real soon...Cant wait Excited!!! They are a little pricy so make sure all credit cards work or stop at a Bank!

excerpts: I made stir fried rice with the shrimp, garlic rice and crab.
Wow....
fried rice.author: Jen D.
fried rice.review:
What restaurants can you always guarantee to be opened during holidays like Christmas? Asian ones of course! Eugy and I knew we were getting crab for dinner, but we also wanted Texas style bbq. After calling 3 Bay Area rib shacks and them all being closed, we had to settle for just crab. But when it comes to Thanh Long, it's really not settling, cause their food is AMAZING... 

About 6 months ago, Eugy took me to PPQ. I've never been a huge crab fan, but he loves it so much so I agreed to go. To be honest, it was good, probably the best crab I've had (which isn't saying much since I haven't had too much), but when I tried Thanh Long, my opinion changed. 

We ordered 2 roasted garlic crabs, the chef's special butterflied shrimp with garlic noodles and garlic rice. This was our Christmas Eve dinner. Wow. WoW. wOw. WOW... It was soooooooooo damn good!!! The crab was amazing. The shrimp? Amazing. The noodles? WAY better than PPQ. and the garlic rice?? DAMN! 

And you know how to tell if the food is really good? Save the leftovers and make something with them the next day. I made stir fried rice with the shrimp, garlic rice and crab. Wow.... It was awesome. 

I can't wait to go back!!!

excerpts: We ordered a roasted crab, two plates of garlic noodles, eggplant, garlic rice (more like white fried rice with a hint of garlic), crab puff appetizer, salt and pepper calamari (yum), and a vegetarian garlic dish.
We also got the banana cake and creme brulee for dessert.
Came out to be about $25pp, 8 of us (one didn't make it).
fried rice.author: qirk z.
fried rice.review:
Made reservations early in the week, 5ppl, 7pm, Sunday.

Thur, changed reservations to 7ppl, 7pm, Sunday; "oh no problem, we'll make the change".

Sunday 2pm, changed reservations to 9ppl, 7pm, today; "oh no problem, we'll make the change, thanks for calling".

Sunday 5pm, changed reservations to 9ppl, 6pm, today; 'oh sure, we'll make the change, see you soon".

Arrive at 6pm, found parking just around the corner, place was still empty (maybe three groups of diners), we get seated upstairs. I've eaten here before, but never upstairs. We were the second large party upstairs.

By the time we finished eating, maybe 8pm? Both upstairs and downstairs was packed.

We ordered a roasted crab, two plates of garlic noodles, eggplant, garlic rice (more like white fried rice with a hint of garlic), crab puff appetizer, salt and pepper calamari (yum), and a vegetarian garlic dish. We also got the banana cake and creme brulee for dessert. Came out to be about $25pp, 8 of us (one didn't make it).

excerpts: We had the roast crab (of course!), colossal royal tiger prawns over garlic noodles, shaken beef (YUM!), grilled calamari, and the seafood combination fried rice.
I was looking forward to having leftovers of this feast, but we cleaned our plates.
Haha.
fried rice.author: Jenn C.
fried rice.review:
LOVE this place! It's not cheap, but it's so worth it to splurge once in a while.

We had the roast crab (of course!), colossal royal tiger prawns over garlic noodles, shaken beef (YUM!), grilled calamari, and the seafood combination fried rice. I was looking forward to having leftovers of this feast, but we cleaned our plates. Haha. Oh my god that was the best dinner I've had in a while.

We made reservations for a Saturday night. I'd suggest doing that since it gets pretty packed here.

excerpts: We started with the fried rice paper app which was the only thing that I wasn't that impressed with, not because of the taste
fried rice.author: Bobby B.
fried rice.review:
I had heard great things about this place for a long time and randomly ended up there last night for the first time. I was surprised with how full the place was for a Sunday evening especially with it located so far out in the Sunset. The thing that stuck out to me over the good food was the great service we had, the staff was friendly and on top of things, when they realized that there was a better table available they offered it to us and from there were on top of our needs from the get go. 

We had the drunken crab which was good, however I think the roasted might have been a better option, the garlic noodles were very good. We started with the fried rice paper app which was the only thing that I wasn't that impressed with, not because of the taste however the price for what you get wasn't didn't impress me that much. 

I will be back to try the steak cubes and garlic rice along with the roasted crab!

excerpts: Now, when I go with a group, we tend to order the Garlic Roast Crab, Garlic Noodles, Fried Rice, Daily Vegetable, and maybe some calamari or something little to start.
We may feel sick when we leave, but it's like a hangover after a great night of partying....
TOTALLY worth it.
fried rice.author: Amanda C.
fried rice.review:
This is a place you should just avoid and erase from your memory if you are on a diet because there is no avoiding the roasted crab and garlic noodles once you're in the door! Buttery Peppery Garlic? check. Freshest Crab possible? check. Best Garlic Noodles on planet earth? check! Oh how I love this place!

I too have been to Crustacean in Beverly Hills and this is just way better. It is the most authentic, unpretentious, "strap on a crab bib and get to it" kind of place. It just felt wrong to wear a bib and indulge in garlic noodles right down the street from Rodeo Dr. 

When I was a young'un and didn't like crab (we all grow up some time), I would get the chicken curry here and that is also delicious. Now, when I go with a group, we tend to order the Garlic Roast Crab, Garlic Noodles, Fried Rice, Daily Vegetable, and maybe some calamari or something little to start. We may feel sick when we leave, but it's like a hangover after a great night of partying.... TOTALLY worth it.

excerpts: Don't forget the garlic noodles and shrimp fried rice.
This place won't disappoint.
fried rice.author: B c.
fried rice.review: I LOVE LOVE LOVE the roasted crab here!  It's not cheap but ohhh so good!  They have a full bar and great cocktails.  Don't forget the garlic noodles and shrimp fried rice.  This place won't disappoint.

excerpts: Roast Crab w/ Garlic Noodles and Garlic Fried Rice.
Eat the crab while it is hot and talk before and after dinner.
Dress code here is not like Crustacean
so I am sure they do well.
fried rice.author: David F.
fried rice.review:
The original Crustacean restaurant I have been here 2 times but used to frequent Crustacean Restaurant before I moved to San Jose.  Now that I am back in the San Francisco area I am definitely going to enjoy a few more stops here.

Roast Crab w/ Garlic Noodles and Garlic Fried Rice.  Eat the crab while it is hot and talk before and after dinner.  Dress code here is not like Crustacean so I am sure they do well.

excerpts: I thought the chicken fried rice was just okay...
again, a little on the greasy side than flavorful.
fried rice.author: Michelle S.
fried rice.review:
Went here for the first time.  Maybe it was an off night because the roasted crab was just okay.  I expected just a little bit more flavor...I thought the garlic sauce was more oily than flavorful....of course still edible...it is crab!  The garlic noodles were yummy like usual.  The shaken beef was very tender.  We got our food surprisingly fast!...which was great cause I was starving!  I thought the chicken fried rice was just okay...again, a little on the greasy side than flavorful.  We also ordered the chicken satay and the mussels which were a hit.  

I would come back again, but it always sucks to go to a restaurant for your first time, expecting a certain quality with the crab and to be disappointed.  I've been to Crustaceans a few times and they've always stayed quite consistent...just thought I'd try their sister restaurant this time.

excerpts: The fried rice was completely bland.
Good service.
If you're in the general area, it's a okay place, but not worth a special trip to the outer Sunset.
fried rice.author: Richard F.
fried rice.review: Good place, but nothing spectacular.  I think this place is owned by the same people that own Crustacean Restaurant.  Not as expensive as Crustacean, but I still think this place is overpriced.  The garlic noodles were good, but extremely oily.  The fried rice was completely bland.  Good service.  If you're in the general area, it's a okay place, but not worth a special trip to the outer Sunset.

excerpts: The garlic noodles are overrated, but the chicken fried rice was pretty good.
The rest of the dishes are good/ok, but the reason to come is the garlic crab!
fried rice.author: eric a.
fried rice.review: Finally, a place on yelp as advertised. The roats/garlic crab is phenomenal, and I don't where else I could get a similar dish as good, although it is very expensive. The garlic noodles are overrated, but the chicken fried rice was pretty good. The rest of the dishes are good/ok, but the reason to come is the garlic crab!

excerpts: The seafood combination fried rice did, though.
The scallops, crab, and shrimp were flavorful, yet it wasn't too overpowering.
The Thanh Long red snapper was fresh and seasoned perfectly.
The Villager's favorite however, was overly seasoned.
I tasted the marinade more than the shrimp and pork medallions themselves.
I would come back more often if the prices were slightly lower.
I would give this 3 1/2 stars overall.
It's also a good kid-friendly alternative to Crustacean.
fried rice.author: Celeste A.
fried rice.review: Being long time patron of Crustaceans, we had high expectations of Thanh Long.  We ordered to go and actually stepped outside of our crab/lobster comfort zone and tried other menu items. Except of course for the crab puffs and garlic noodles.  One just cannot go to an An Family restaurant without ordering the garlic noodles at the very least.  I would give them an A- for the puffs and noodles.  Perhaps it was the missing ambiance, but the garlic noodles just didn't make me go mmm this time.  The seafood combination fried rice did, though.  The scallops, crab, and shrimp were flavorful, yet it wasn't too overpowering.  The Thanh Long red snapper was fresh and seasoned perfectly.  The Villager's favorite however, was overly seasoned.  I tasted the marinade more than the shrimp and pork medallions themselves.  I would come back more often if the prices were slightly lower.  I would give this 3 1/2 stars overall.  It's also a good kid-friendly alternative to Crustacean.

excerpts: We also had two orders of garlic noodle and one chicken garlic fried rice.
With the exception of the fried rice, everything was really good!
The rice wasn't necessarily bad, it just wasn't as flavorful as everything else.
The garlic noodle is as good as it gets.
Gosh - just writing this review is making me crave that stuff.
Between Crustaceans and Thanh Long, I would probably say Crustaceans crab is more flavorful but Thanh Long will do just fine.
The service at Thanh Long was really good.
Our waitress was attentive and I felt like we were her only table because she paid so much attention.
One thing I do want to point out is that they add gratuity automatically for parties of 6 or more.
We fell in that category.
My only minor issue is that they add the gratuity after tax
so we ended up tipping on the tax.
fried rice.author: Jess C.
fried rice.review:
In search of a less fancy Crustaceans, we ended up going to Thanh Long to celebrate one of our friends birthday.  We played it safe and ordered their secret recipe favorites along with some appetizers.

We went with: coconut prawns, mussels, and salt & pepper calamari for the appetizers.  For our main entree, we stuck with three crabs:  two roasted and one drunken.  We also had two orders of garlic noodle and one chicken garlic fried rice.  With the exception of the fried rice, everything was really good!  The rice wasn't necessarily bad, it just wasn't as flavorful as everything else.  The garlic noodle is as good as it gets.  Gosh - just writing this review is making me crave that stuff.   Between Crustaceans and Thanh Long, I would probably say Crustaceans crab is more flavorful but Thanh Long will do just fine.  The service at Thanh Long was really good.  Our waitress was attentive and I felt like we were her only table because she paid so much attention.  One thing I do want to point out is that they add gratuity automatically for parties of 6 or more.  We fell in that category.  My only minor issue is that they add the gratuity after tax so we ended up tipping on the tax.  Essentially the waitress left with a little over 20%, which since she was really nice, deserved anyway so it wasn't a big deal.

We spent a reasonable amount - a little over $50 a person for 6 people.  It won't be the last time I dine here.  I recommend going here and having an appetite only for shellfish and carbs.

excerpts: as a kid, my siblings and i would enjoy their noodles (of course) and delicious fried rice.
we're not talking about greasy msg-ridden fried rice, this is the real thing, hot off the wok.
fried rice.author: Elizabeth O.
fried rice.review:
i have eaten at thanh long since i was a child, which is one of the benefits of growing up near the sunset. as a kid, my siblings and i would enjoy their noodles (of course) and delicious fried rice. we're not talking about greasy msg-ridden fried rice, this is the real thing, hot off the wok. 

i went here recently for father's day, and had buddha rolls with tofu and veggies, which was delish with a sweet dipping sauce, chicken skewers that were marinated in a light sweet/salty sauce, and the ultimate part of the meal: ROASTED CRAB. amazing. like, unbelievable. people who think they don't like crab are converted when they eat here. really.

if you enjoy seafood-this the the place, and it's worth the trek out to the middle of nowhere and the price for such fresh seafood.

oh, and definitely have the garlic noodles, which i regret to say, i can no longer eat thanks to my allergist. so, until they use brown rice noodles, i have to longingly watch others as they enjoy them.

also, 5 stars for energy, ambiance, and the phenomenal diversity of people! it's great.

excerpts: I'm totally serious when I tell you our usual order; four garlic roasted crabs(one for each), 2 garlic noodles, prawn wontons, one order of shakenbeer, one order of fried rice, claypot, and an order of calamari.
I didn't count white rice, but you bet your ass we eat that too.
We usually start with the two orders of garlic noodles, then work our way up.
I drink a lot of beers, too.
I am pretty sure they are '33'.
fried rice.author: Miguel G.
fried rice.review:
Thanh Long is one of my favorite places to eat in the entire Bay Area. It's so good that it's totally worth donning that humiliating bib to eat a whole garlic crab. It's kind of a dressy place, but that all goes out the window seeing as your hands will be greasy and your good clothes are going to smell like crab anyway. The service is always good and efficient, and we've found the food to be consistent throughout the 5 years of sporadic visits. The restaurant is a bit dressy, but I've come in there with a baseball cap and never got any crap for it. 
I've only gone to this place with my family and between the four of us, we will gladly fast for a whole day in order to eat here. And let me tell you, it can get kind of ugly. I'm totally serious when I tell you our usual order; four garlic roasted crabs(one for each), 2 garlic noodles, prawn wontons, one order of shakenbeer, one order of fried rice, claypot, and an order of calamari. I didn't count white rice, but you bet your ass we eat that too. We usually start with the two orders of garlic noodles, then work our way up. I drink a lot of beers, too. I am pretty sure they are '33'. 
If there was one dish I had that I didn't care for, it was the drunken crab, which is a whole crab simmered in Chardonnay. It just didn't have that fatty, garlicky goodness of the garlic crab. And I love this 'you get the whole crab' thing. Sometimes, you order crab somewhere and you get the legs. Everyone knows the best part is the crab fat you scoop out from the inside of the shell, not just the wimpy-ass legs. 
All in all, this is a pretty pricey place to eat in, but the meal itself is quite fun and the atmosphere is not stuffy. I take some strange kind of perverted delight in the cracking sound of flying shells and watching grease congeal from my hands onto my 7th bottle of '33'(pretty sure that was the beer I drank). This is just a great place to get messy, stuff your face, get drunk, and make your car smell like garlic crab for a couple of days. It will be unpleasant for a day or two, but the meal is worth it.

fried rice.author: Eric M.
fried rice.review: kinda far out there but definitely worth going to if you're in the mood for some crab.  first thing you'll notice is that every single table has the exact same dishes:  roast crab and garlic noodles.  so i tried to be original and ordered roast crab and......................fried rice.  it was still good, but i guess i'll have to go back and try the garlic noodles now.  oh, definitely make reservations ahead of time.  went on a whim and ended up waiting 1.5 hours before being seated.

excerpts: *Garlic Toast - 5/5
You can't really go wrong with a side of garlic toast, lets
garlic toast.author: Marissa G.
garlic toast.review:
I can't ever get over this place, its my absolute favorite. 

I come here often and even more often do I order take out. I absolutely love their fried salt and pepper calamari, it's hands down the best kind I've tried and trust me almost everywhere I go I order calamari. 

Parking is really hard to find, so I suggest paying valet if it hasn't changed it's about $13 and they park it a few blocks over in a lot and usually have it ready for you outside when you come out. 

*Calamari - 5/5 
SO BOMB! I can't say that enough. Its salt & pepper calamari served with onions, green onions and red chopped peppers.

*Roasted Garlic Crab - 5/5
AAAMMMMAAAZIIING. I suggest getting a crab per person, mainly because it's so good and I wouldn't want to share this with anyone. Its so flavorful and the butter sauce is a great sauce to dip the cracked crab in.

* Garlic Noodles - 5/5
Best garlic noodles I've come across. Garlic noodles is becoming very "hyped" up and a lot of places are starting to serve them however none are as flavorful and spot on for the garlic as these. 

*Garlic Toast - 5/5
You can't really go wrong with a side of garlic toast, lets just say I think garlic is my favorite flavor. 

The service is great, they're very on point when it comes to everything and get your food out quick. If I could eat here once a week I would, but for now once every 2 weeks will have to do.... UNLESSSS, I can some how magically find out how to make the calamari and noodles just like them.

excerpts: For six of us, we ordered 2 of each of the following, unless noted otherwise:  Salt & pepper calamari ($11.95); Soft shell crab ($12.25); Garlic toast ($3.75); Spicy eggplant w/ shrimp (19.25); Lemon grass chicken ($19.25); Saigon beef ($24.95 - one); Bo luc lac ($25.50 - one); Garlic noodles ($10.95 - three); and Roasted crab ($48.95 - market price).
Secondarily, the soft shell crab was a tad overcooked and overpriced.
Nonetheless, is tasted good:  3 Stars.
Thirdly, the garlic toast was OK.
It didn't taste that garlicky.
TL's version of garlic noodles are the best I have had.
The noodles were al dente, weren't drowned in sauce, and the amount of garlic flavor was perfect.
No wonder so many places try to copy this dish:  5+++ Stars.
Secondarily, the roasted crab was excellent.
I used the head as a bowl.
The meat was moist and wonderfully seasoned.
I'd definitely come back here, but I'd stick to the seafood and garlic noodles that are excellent.
The turf dishes are not that good.
Lastly, most of the prices are high, but I was pretty full without the chicken, eggplant and soft shell crab that we added later.
garlic toast.author: Joe P.
garlic toast.review:
HTF does Thanh Long open in 1971, but I never came here when I lived in the Bay?  Just ignorant, I guess.  This place started the Viet seafood craze before it became fashionable.  TL is located on Judah b/t 46th & 47th in the Outer Sunset (3 blocks from beach).  Sister restaurants are Crustacean on Polk in SF and in Beverly Hills.

For six of us, we ordered 2 of each of the following, unless noted otherwise:  Salt & pepper calamari ($11.95); Soft shell crab ($12.25); Garlic toast ($3.75); Spicy eggplant w/ shrimp (19.25); Lemon grass chicken ($19.25); Saigon beef ($24.95 - one); Bo luc lac ($25.50 - one); Garlic noodles ($10.95 - three); and Roasted crab ($48.95 - market price).

First of all, the calamari was very good.  It had excellent flavor and was not greasy.  The only downside was the price:  4 Stars.  Secondarily, the soft shell crab was a tad overcooked and overpriced.  Nonetheless, is tasted good:  3 Stars.  Thirdly, the garlic toast was OK.  It didn't taste that garlicky.  We would have been better off with the mussels served on toast:  3 Stars.

For our main courses, the spicy eggplant was very good.  The eggplant was firm and not overcooked like many restaurants.  Downsides were there wasn't much shrimp and the price:  3 Stars.  Secondarily, the chicken was colorful, but the lemongrass really didn't stand out.  It too was overpriced:  3 Stars.  Our first beef dish didn't really do anything to excite us.  The flavor was OK, but like the other dishes, it was overpriced:  3 Stars.  On the other hand, the second beef dish was tender and nicely seasoned.  The only downside was the price:  4 Stars.  

Our last two dishes, were the best.  TL's version of garlic noodles are the best I have had.  The noodles were al dente, weren't drowned in sauce, and the amount of garlic flavor was perfect.  No wonder so many places try to copy this dish:  5+++ Stars.  Secondarily, the roasted crab was excellent.  I used the head as a bowl.  The meat was moist and wonderfully seasoned.  It wasn't as good as R & G in Chinatown, but it still was one of the two best dishes of the evening:  5 Stars.

Regarding the service, it was outstanding.  Our waitress was excellent, and took very good care of us.  She didn't write any of our orders down (inc drinks), and didn't miss anything.  The food came out quickly, and we were constantly given new bowls for our crab shells:  5 Stars.  On the other hand, the ambiance was just OK.  This place is a quaint cozy place.  However, the bathroom was kinda dirty, and the valet was expensive at $12:  3 Stars.

I'd definitely come back here, but I'd stick to the seafood and garlic noodles that are excellent.  The turf dishes are not that good.  Lastly, most of the prices are high, but I was pretty full without the chicken, eggplant and soft shell crab that we added later.

excerpts: Don't bother to order the garlic toast which is tasteless, dry and cold.
Dinner was the butterfly shrimp and garlic noodle and the shrimp was beautifully grilled and tasteful , but the garlic noodle was tasteless and barely warm
followed by the Cubed steak which again sat on an overwhelming amount of lettuce with a few potatoes and onions.
The steak was sweet and would of been better left just grilled.
garlic toast.author: Michelle W.
garlic toast.review: Went to this restaurant this evening with family and had raved to them so much about the garlic crab and garlic noodles which is what they are known for to end up being extremely disappointed  Very overrated restaurant!! The garlic noodles were a complete disappointment barely arriving luke warm the crab was decent, but very overpriced. I felt like everything was made ahead of time for how quickly it came to the table and was barely warm. Ordered 7 appetizers so that we could all share. Started with the Fried Calamari which had more onion condiment then Calamari, followed by the Won Ton wrap which was just okay, then we had the Beef and Chicken Satay which sat on a huge bed of lettuce with no accompany sauce or dip but was grilled to perfection and excellent taste, followed by the Mango salad which was refreshing, but the mango could have been more ripe. The dim sum wrap which was cold to taste. Don't bother to order the garlic toast which is tasteless, dry and cold.Dinner was the butterfly shrimp and garlic noodle and the shrimp was beautifully grilled and tasteful , but the garlic noodle was tasteless and barely warm followed by the Cubed steak which again sat on an overwhelming amount of lettuce with a few potatoes and onions. The steak was sweet and would of been better left just grilled. Then the piece of resistance the garlic crab which was nothing spectacular and the garlic noodles which were tasteless and cold. We then ordered desert hoping they could redeem themselves and that was a joke. We ordered the Chocolate lava cake accompanied with a scoop of vanilla ice cream that had no lava gushing and looked like a flat dried out brownie. The cheesecake creme brulee had no brulee. At this point, I returned both desserts out of complete disappointment. Five people and $398.00 later walked out hungry and will never return.

excerpts: The sides are a la carte, so we also ordered the garlic noodles, shrimp fried rice, garlic toast and the seasonal vegetable sauté to go with our crab.
garlic toast.author: Tashi L.
garlic toast.review:
As a Frisco native, Thanh Long has been a long-time favorite of mine for as long as I can remember. I had the pleasure of celebrating my birthday here on 5/26/15 and I am pleased to say that even though it had been over a decade since my last visit, the service and food have not changed! This family-owned and operated gem of a place has some of the best seafood (crab, prawns and garlic noodles - yes, please!) in the city.
 
I had an 8:15 p.m. reservation for a party of 10 (close friends and family). If you're familiar with the city, then you know this place is located allllll the way in the Avenues, so it can take up to an hour to get to in rush hour traffic. I arrived extremely late to find everyone in my party seated and waiting for me, which I appreciated, as the restaurant was pretty full. They could've bumped my table or refused to seat my guests, but they did not. Kudos for that.
 
Since it had been awhile, I wanted some of everything on the menu and my guests thankfully obliged me. We ordered several whole roast Dungeness crabs in their special garlic seasoning. I rarely order Dungeness crab anywhere else because not everyone cleans and cooks it properly, but at Thanh Long, it is a MUST. It was delicious, just like I remembered! It's also very filling with everything else. I ended up splitting half of mine with my godsister. The sides are a la carte, so we also ordered the garlic noodles, shrimp fried rice, garlic toast and the seasonal vegetable sauté to go with our crab. My mom ordered her usual tiger prawns over garlic noodles. (The four prawns come butterflied over the noodles). She refused to let me have a taste, so I assume it was as good as she remembered, too. For those who may not like crab or shrimp like one of my friends, the mango salad is recommended - without the scallops or shrimps, of course. As far as libations go, they have a full bar and decent cocktails. I only had Goose on the rocks with two limes, so I can't comment on the other drinks.
 
If you don't like garlic, this is not the place for you. And if you are price conscious, this is not the place for you LOL! They do accept walk-ins depending on how busy they are. The place is not huge, so just phone ahead and reserve whenever possible. Street parking is available, but the surrounding area is residential so it may be hard to come by. Valet is $12. Not bad for San Francisco.
 
For me, the only downside is living out-of-state, but I would recommend this place for special occasions.

excerpts: Had calamari appetizers and garlic toast and a beer.
Delicous!
garlic toast.author: Tomi K.
garlic toast.review: Sept 2016:  Met my brother from Camarillo there for first time. Made 7pm reservations on line (Thursday night) but decided to drive out early. Much to our surprise at 5:45 there were many tables open!  So we got seated early. Had calamari appetizers and garlic toast and a beer. Delicous!  Then sea bass for me and crab for my brother and garlic noodles. Sea bass melted in my mouth! Crab delicious too. Service was excellent especially since he recognized my brother was a jujitsu veteran. Bill $140 including pot of tea and fried banana dessert. Great night and can't wait to go back with my wife.  T.J. Vacaville

excerpts: I get the roasted crab ,garlic noodles , fried rice and the garlic toast .
It's so good .
They definitely went up on the prices but it's all worth it .
The only thing I don't like is trying to find a good park .
Be prepared to drive around a few times or pay the valet 12.00.
garlic toast.author: Ney E.
garlic toast.review:
