The only thing I don't like is trying to find a good park . Be prepared to drive around a few times or pay the valet 12.00.

excerpts: Roasted garlic crab, garlic noodles, salt and pepper calamari, garlic toast, sea bass and sautéed veggies were amazzzzing!
I can never get tired of this place.
pineapple lychee martini is a creeper but so delicious!
Can't go wrong with anything.
Only downside is the parking but that doesn't take away a star.
garlic toast.author: Monica M.
garlic toast.review: Love love love! We try to come here at least once a year sometimes more depending if we feel like coming into the city. Roasted garlic crab, garlic noodles, salt and pepper calamari, garlic toast, sea bass and sautéed veggies were amazzzzing! I can never get tired of this place. pineapple lychee martini is a creeper but so delicious! Can't go wrong with anything. Only downside is the parking but that doesn't take away a star.

excerpts: Two of us shared a roast crab, garlic noodles, salmon carpaccio, some garlic toast (because i love carbs) and the chocolate molten cake.
the garlic noodles are perfect too.
You know how some places don't have that exact garlic flavor... this one is on point.
The salmon carpaccio was such a surprise! and a delight!
It blew our minds away how good it was.
It's kind of disgusting how we ate the chocolate molten cake
but everything was so good
we thought WHY THE HELL NOT!
AND IT WAS WORTH IT
TOO!
I will definitely order my own crab next time!
I could eat this for daysssss!
garlic toast.author: Anna C.
garlic toast.review:
YES. MMMM. MORE. 

LITERALLY THE ONLY WORDS/SOUNDS I MADE WHILE I WAS EATING.

Two of us shared a roast crab, garlic noodles, salmon carpaccio, some garlic toast (because i love carbs) and the chocolate molten cake. We most definitely finished every last bit of everything on our plate.  

The crab is just.. MMMMMMMMMM can't even describe. it's soooo good!!! the garlic noodles are perfect too.  You know how some places don't have that exact garlic flavor... this one is on point.  The salmon carpaccio was such a surprise! and a delight! It blew our minds away how good it was.  It's kind of disgusting how we ate the chocolate molten cake but everything was so good we thought WHY THE HELL NOT! AND IT WAS WORTH IT TOO!  I will definitely order my own crab next time! I could eat this for daysssss!

excerpts: Oh yeah... dont bother with the "garlic toast" not worth it.
AT ALL.
garlic toast.author: Evan O.
garlic toast.review:
Yum Long is more like it!  I have never gptten anything other than their roast crab and garlic noodles, and I dont think I ever will.  The crab is cooked perfectly and the garlicly buttery goodness is perfect to dip the crab in. nom nom nom! My only issue with Thanh Long is the cocktails... I have yet to be impressed by the drinks I get here.  I think on future visits I will stick with water.

Oh yeah... dont bother with the "garlic toast" not worth it. AT ALL.

excerpts: We also had the garlic toast, which was ok, it was just small thin pieces of sourdough bread toast with garlic butter.
ha!
so much garlic and butter in this restaurant your breath will be kickin' it for days!!
garlic toast.author: Dean S.
garlic toast.review:
OK I finally made it here after I had heard so many good things about it...  finally got to try the Roast Crab and their famous Garlic noodles...  Everybody raves about the Garlic noodles, and they were pretty darn good but to tell you the truth, all it is is just a plate of plain noodles, skinny like spaghetti noodles with nothing else!  Maybe if there was chicken or some kind of vegetable with it I would have found it more appealing and I'd be raving about it.  
I did find that the Roast crab was amazing however!  One of the best crab dishes I have EVER had.  It is however also the messiest crab I have ever eaten.  Even messier than a crab feed. haha  The entire crab is drenched in garlic butter sauce so your hands and face are guaranteed to be slippery and completely messy with all the goodness.  You have to crack the crab yourself so be sure to wear the provided bib or else you'll get sauce or pieces of crab all over you.  I ate one and a half crabs which took me a good hour to crack and eat.  And it was totally worth it.  We also had the garlic toast, which was ok, it was just small thin pieces of sourdough bread toast with garlic butter. ha! so much garlic and butter in this restaurant your breath will be kickin' it for days!!  We also had the mango salad or something like that and it was ok too.  Parking sucks around this restaurant so just suck it up and pay the valet in front of the restaurant.  If you love crab and garlic, the Roast crab and Garlic noodles are totally worth it!!

excerpts: We ordered the Buddha Roll (vegetarian spring roll), Garlic Toast, Roast Crab, Garlic Noodles, and the Thanh Long Spicy Eggplant.
The Buddha Roll had good flavors but one order of it is just one roll cut into 4 pieces and for $7.50 is so not worth it!
The Garlic Toast was also a rip off.
It was just half a baguette like the ones you get at Lucky's/Safeway, smothered with butter with hardly any garlic.
You could easily make your own garlic bread at home that tastes a whole lot better for half the price.
Their famous Roast Crab was alright.
The crab was a decent size with a good amount of meat, but they could have gone a bit lighter on the seasoning.
I don't know if we got a bad batch but the crab was a bit too salty.
It definitely tasted better when paired with simple plain white rice.
The Garlic Noodles were quite tasty and scrumptious, but the portion was small.
The best dish by far was the Thanh Long Spicy Eggplant.
The eggplant was cooked to perfection...
the outside with just the right amount of crunch, with a soft inside.
It went really with the prawns, chicken, and mushrooms that were mixed in with it.
garlic toast.author: Karen C.
garlic toast.review:
Came here with family to celebrate my husband's birthday. When we walked by the restaurant it did look pretty run down and ghetto at first glance but whatever was cookin' smelled absolutely delicious =)

Upon entering, I felt like I had been transported into another place. I guess it's true when they say "don't judge a book by it's cover." The inside was clean, beautifully decorated, filled with lots of people, and had great ambiance. Their service was amazing...exceeded all expectations. We had about 4 different servers which made everything flow very nicely. Our orders were taken promptly and properly, plates cleared instantly, and our water glasses were always filled without us having to ask. They were all really nice and polite.

We ordered the Buddha Roll (vegetarian spring roll), Garlic Toast, Roast Crab, Garlic Noodles, and the Thanh Long Spicy Eggplant. The Buddha Roll had good flavors but one order of it is just one roll cut into 4 pieces and for $7.50 is so not worth it! The Garlic Toast was also a rip off. It was just half a baguette like the ones you get at Lucky's/Safeway, smothered with butter with hardly any garlic. You could easily make your own garlic bread at home that tastes a whole lot better for half the price. Their famous Roast Crab was alright. The crab was a decent size with a good amount of meat, but they could have gone a bit lighter on the seasoning. I don't know if we got a bad batch but the crab was a bit too salty. It definitely tasted better when paired with simple plain white rice. The Garlic Noodles were quite tasty and scrumptious, but the portion was small. The best dish by far was the Thanh Long Spicy Eggplant. The eggplant was cooked to perfection...the outside with just the right amount of crunch, with a soft inside. It went really with the prawns, chicken, and mushrooms that were mixed in with it. The portion was small too and it definitely left me with wanting more!

Overall this place is just okay. The decor and service was awesome but the food was just okay in terms of taste, portions, and price. Very overpriced for the amount you get. It was about $40/person for us but I felt like I ate $20 worth of food. I would agree with some of the other reviewers that Boiling Crab is better for the price and value.
